reviews.review: It was OK!. We missed the morning walk as it left walk promptly at 11 am, however the afternoon walk left late! We found our walk was very slow, but that would depend on who else was in the group. It would have been helpful to be given a list of places you will visit at the beginning of the tour as we felt we were just wondering around.

Energetic and Happy Free Walking Tour. By far one of the most exciting experience in Hong Kong. It was easy to find the tour guide in front of the Clock Tower at the time mentioned. We had an amazing tour experience with a local guide, with a lot of historic information and great way to feel the city. We have tried the local food in an interesting street shop. For sure I recommend!!

Fantastic walking tour. We joined one of the HK Free walking tours and it was great! Mathew Choi was our guide, he was personable, knowledgable and made the tour interesting. We met at the Clock Tower and walked through Tsim Sha Tsui. He shared the history of the area, from the British colonial times to recent history in such an interesting manner. We walked from the clock tower, to the Avenue of Stars, learned about the history of the Peninsula hotel, walked through a market, and learned about the economic and history of Hong Kong. It was fantastic and highly recommend!

Great introduction to Kowloon. My mom and I went on a walking tour of Kowloon, guided by Sheila, our first morning in Hong Kong. It was a great way to get acquainted with Kowloon and we even made a stop for some delicious street food. I highly recommend using this company for a walking tour.
Great tour. Joined this walking tour on Oct 5th with Alla. Learned some history while exploring another part of the city. Would recommend to any visitor.

Great intro to HK. Surprised by how much we enjoyed this 3 hr walking tour around HK. Our guide was Alla, she was very personable, entertaining and informative. A bit of fun, mixed in with some history. The tour is free although we felt a tip was well deserved. Thanks for a fun couple hours. Can recommend.

Great Tour!. We did the free walking tour around Kowloon with Sheila. She was an excellent guide who was very funny and informative. We learned a lot about Hong Kong and would highly recommend doing this tour!

Great HK Intro!. Sheri was our guide and she did a great job telling us about HK. Amazingly energetic! Learned a lot of background and interesting things about HK that I could take with me as I walked around later alone. It was low key and entertaining, which is exactly what I was looking for.

Interesting and fun. Our guide was Sheila and she is energetic with a good sense of humor. She explained to us some big tbings of Hong Kong and some smaller points of interest that you would otherwise have missed. Many thanks Sheila!

Cool first encounter with the city. We walked around Kowloon and saw some cool places, tried street food and saw a local marketplace. Sheila, our guide, was great – cheerful, full of historical info. Highly recommended!

Excellent walking tour of Hong Kong!. An excellent free walking tour to get yourself orientated in Hong Kong. The tour take you around Kowloon only however the area is really large with lots to see :-) Thank you HK free walking guides!

Didn't showed up. There was no one at the point they give on the internet. We went there 3 times, 3 times disappointed. Even people signed in on the website and still there was no one. So make sure there is a tour or just walk by, but don't plan your hole day for it

Great way to get to know Hong Kong better!. I think Free Walking Tours given by locals are always the best way to experience a city/country. This tour was no exception! I think the tour was a great mix of history, current customs and monuments/attractions, and I love that we got to know a very busy neighborhood in Hong Kong, Tsim Sha Tsui. Alla was a great guide, enthusiastic and open about any questions we had and our preferences. If I would recommend one point of improvement, it would be to speak more about the current state of Hong Kong in terms of politics and recent history, as well as what the locals feel about it, as I think this is quite important to help a foreigner understand the city and its people. It will also be great to see you expand and start to have tours in other parts of town!

Amazing way to know some history about HK. Went on the HK Free Walk with Alla. There are two walks a day, opted for 11am. Started at Clock tower on Victoria harbour in TST area. Did a 2.5 hr walk around this area (<5kms covered) but got to know finer details about many of HK buildings, historical significance, etc. Recommend it to get context about things around you in HK.

Great tour. We did the tour with Tiffany, she was great at explaining everything and knew loads about the history of the area. The tour visited some historical sites, stopped for sampling street food & drink, and gave us some ideas of where to return. Overall we were very happy with the tour.

Excellent and educational!. I did the HK Free Walk just to pass by time as I've visited the territory tons of times. If it's your first time in Hong Kong, you'll learn quite a lot about the TST area, and some of the basics of HK history.

Excellent insight into life in HK. Tiffany was our guide and did a great job of getting us acquainted with local culture and gave some excellent tips on what to do and see in the 4 days we were in HK.Thank you Tiffany!

Job well done!! . We did an 11 o'clock tour with Alla last week. The tour was a great introduction to to the Kowloon area of Hong Kong. She shared history, current culture and we saw many of the local sites. We were even able to find our way back to the chocolate egg shop several days later. Thanks for sharing your city with us!!

The best introduction to Hong Kong! . We did the 2pm tour with Sheila. The group were easy to find at the meeting point! Its great that they have started a Hong Kong free walk, its a great introduction to the city, you walk around and get familiar with the busy streets while also seeing some sights and learning some of Hong Kong's history. The walk follows the same pattern as other cities free walk's, but i did like the addition of the folder with photos for us to see, to help with some explanations. Not had that on any other free walk we have done! Nice touch. The group was a varied mixture of old and young, Sheila was quite a speedy walker but as she said, most Hong Kongers do everything fast! Highly recommend this tour, we tipped $100 (£10) which is about our standard for the free walks, although it is "free" they are giving up their time to show you their home and paid tours are four times as much. Thank-you Sheila!
Nice and entertaining tour!. Good tour around the TST area with interesting facts and stories, including a stop for a street food snack and a much needed drink.

Great way to start your HK trip. The tour is perfect to get to know a bit more about HK, its history and also to get some fun facts. It has the perfect balance between walking around and stopping at places of interest. Our guide Cassie was very funny and helpful with answering all our questions. Totally recommended!

Good but rushed. Cassie did a good job but when we've done other tours the guide allows for stops to taste food/drink/explore for 10-15 minutes along the route. This was gogogo. Also hard to hear with our big group of 20 & loud traffic noise, a microphone would help.
Great experience. If you want to get to know as much as possible about HK in 2 - 3 hours, free walking tour is definitely the choice number one :)

Great tour, even in the ridiculous rain. Gabriel was an engaging and informative tour guide. We learned a lot of the history of HK and he shared many interesting spots, trying to ensure that we were as dry as possible despite the heaviest rain throughout the walk. He even gave us rain macs as, even though we are British, we arrived without umbrellas. Good luck for your final year at Leicester Gabriel; your apprentices we're learning well on our walk too!

HK Free Walk with Tiffany. I went in late August of 2016 with Tiffany Lam and it was really cool. For a new company that started late last year in 2015, it's pretty well organized. It's like the Apple iPhone of tours, where stops are clean, comfortable, and information is presented in an attractive way. It's also a great place to meet friends and other solo travelers that become friends. Tiffany was so sweet, energetic, and great as a tour guide. It is free, but run on tips, but there is no pressure whatsoever. After the first few stops, everyone was starting to melt from the Hong Kong heat and humidity, but Tiffany was still running like an energizer bunny. She revived us by bringing us to a really delicious local fruit juice stand. I really enjoyed her sharing the local knowledge of food stalls and stands with us since it's something that's difficult to research on your own. All in all, a great way to spend a few hours and make some new friends if you're going to walk around anyways.

Great introduction to an awesome city. Our guide for the tour was Alla- she was really knowledge and showed genuine interest in her City. She was friendly and answered everyone's questions. We were still recovering from food poisoning when we did the tour and she included a rest break half way through! You find out about a lot of the main attractions and also the history of the city. There's also a chance to try some local food. It was a large group and at times was a little difficult to hear- prehaps the company should provide guides with a small microphone.
Great intro to the city. This is a GREAT introduction to Hong Kong. Tiffany, our guide, gave an excellent intro to the city. It was a very hot day but we all persevered and had a nice time.
👍. I really recommend this tour - Alla was great, she even let me use her umbrella when it started to rain!

Unique Experienc. Delicacy Tour. One of my best & unusual experiences ever. I won't spoil the surprise, but a strong drink before any meal is a good idea. You won't forget the night. Another wonderfully organised & informative tour by Michael. Enjoy
Great free walking tour. Loved our guide Tiffany. She was super smiley and full of stories. This was a great free walking tour, recommended if you want to check out the TST area.

So worth it!. Tiffany was our guide, and she was great! She even took the time to involve my children in the discussions and sightseeing. Tiffany was knowledgeable and shared interesting facts about the Tsim Sha Tsui area. She took her time and didn't rush us at all. Well worth it!!

Free walking tour around Tsim Sha Tsui. It was easy to meet up with the tour at the Clock Tower. Our tour guide was Gabrielle. He spoke clear English. The tour lasted just under 3 hours. It felt as if it should been a bit longer. The time was well spent. We covered the key elements of Tsim Sha Tsui, the southern most area of Kowloon. Given the cost, one cannot complain. My reaction to the tour was that I did not feel that I had sufficient context for area we saw relative to the rest of Kowloon or Hong Kong as a whole.

Interesting free walking tour in Tsim Sha Tsui area. Very good free walking tour around Tsim Sha Tsui in Hong Kong with local Gabriel.The tour is absolutely for free but you can give some cash to the guide.

Awesome tour. Gabriel and Esther were our tour guide during the HK walking tour. They shared a lot of information regarding the history of Hongkong and introduced me and the rest to street foods. Both of the guide were enthusiastic and energetic. Overall, I enjoyed it a lot!
HK free walking tour . Alla was our guide for the day. Super lovely, open to any questions and comments, local info, concerned to make it interesting for everyone good experience :)

Great way to see the city. Tiffany was a great tour guide. Spoke clearly and answered any questions we had. Showed us some speciality foods and places we wouldn't of even known about without the tour. Tour took about 3hrs and we covered a lot distance while on the tour. Donations were welcome but the tour is free!! Definitely recommend this free tour!!
Great walk. Alla was my tour guide and it was great, she was enthusiastic and knew a lot. Good introduction about the city.
Worth the walk. Walked around Kowloon with Gabriel. He provided more historical details than our bus tour guide. Worth the 2.5hrs walk.

Great insight into the city!. Went on a tour with Alla and had a fab time! She was an absolute wealth of knowledge, from the city's history to the current socio-political situation to the best spot for a snack, she was able to answer any and all our questions :)

Discovering kowloon. We had difficulty finding a tour that wasn't outrageously expensive. This walk was just what we needed to get a first idea of Hong Kong . It is unpretentious, low key and led by Alla who knew her stuff and transmitted her enthusiasm. A bit too much unnecessary walking midway but overall very satisfactory.There were only seven of us in the group. It's worth more people supporting it and the two or three of you who set this up should produce another tour or two quickly.But well done!
Perfect local advice!. Gabriel was a super nice walking tour, showed us some typical food and some nice places. Definitely recommended!
Brilliant. Just had the walking tour and it was brilliant! Very well informed and also gave us a chance to taste some of the local cuisine! I would definitely recommend it!

Fantastic free tour!. I went on a walking tour with Gabriel. I learned so much about Hong Kong's area, saw some of the main sights in the area and got to see the less touristy side of HK by wandering through the markets and having some street food if you liked. Gabriel was a great guide and I liked the small group size. Make sure you have comfy shoes as it's about a 2.5 hour long tour with a few short breaks.
Good walk. I came at 2pm group. Although we were only 2 person guide took us on a tour. I learned interesting things about architecture. And it is based on tips, so you can pay as you think is worth.

CMPonce. We had Alla as our guide. She was pleasant and informative. I enjoyed listening to her and seeing the excitement in her that carried over to her presentation. A nice way to experience some of the normally overlooked. We walked a a nice pace, no one got lost no one seemed pushed. My group had a nice blend of folks from all over the world. I loved walking through the local market on Haiphong Road and the insights while gazing across Victoria Harbor. I recommend and will look for these tours elsewhere when I travel.

Great To Have In HK. A good way to explore the area and get information. Unfortunately the talking was a bit to long for my liking, it was a hot day and took about half an hour of info before we really got moving. Would recommend but just not for me.

Free Walk HK. I only had 12 hours in Hong Kong on a flight layover, so this tour was a good introduction to some of the main sights and the history of the city. Gabriel was a really informative guide and very helpful with tips about all areas of Hong Kong, not just those covered by the tour. I'm very happy that these free tours, so common in European cities, are now being introduced in Asia.

Awesome tour, amazing Guide!!. Our guide Alla went out of her way to entertain our sons who loved this tour even in a boiling Hong Kong! She made us taste local food and we got to see places where she went as a kid, as well as amazing skyline! She told us about Feng Shui and we got to know some amazing stuff we would've not known otherwise! She's so kind and always try to keep people focus on things with questions! After the tour she still was always available if we needed something! Hong Kong is an awesome city, yet, it can be even more amazing with a tour like this one and a guide like Alla!!

A lovely tour of TST area. Having been on many free walking tours in cities in Europe, I was pleased to see that Hong Kong offered this as many other places in Asia do not! A big thank you to Alla for being such a friendly, lovely and informative guide for the area. I would definitely recommend this walking tour to others!
a very good way to explore the city. a very good way to explore the city. I saw so many things which I shouldnt had if I went on my own.If you have the opportunity to go on this walk : do it!
Awesome Walking Tour. The tour with Tiffany was simply amazing. We learned a lot about Hong Kong & had so much fun. Joining the free walk in HK really is a must-do acitivity. Thanks!

Free or not?. I joined HK Free Walk via the meetup.com website. As well, I've joined other free and paid things via meetup, including other free walks.This one was rather average in my experience. Most of the time was spent walking, with some spiels in between. The biggest peeve I had about this was that though they describe themselves as a free walk, the guide mentioned in the beginning and at the end that if guests enjoyed the walk, that it would be nice if they gave a tip to support the walk. If you include this fact in the description in the meetup, that would be fine. Otherwise, I think it is a bit deceptive to spring it up on people.

Great tour of the TST area. Just come back from a tour with Alla, our friendly and enthusiastic tour guide. The group was small and it was a hot day but Alla found shade whenever possible. Great chance to learn from someone who calls Hong Kong home, learnt a lot more than on any of the other paid tours. Would be great if this tour was offered in other areas too as I really enjoyed it. Make sure to tip generously.

Informative and fun tour. Tiffany was a fantastic tour guide. The tour was very informative and gave us a great overview of the area, the history and the culture. Even though it was an extremely hot day, it was still worth the 2.5 hours to enjoy the sites.

Great Way to See the Real Kowloon. We took this walking tour to delve a bit more deeply into the real Hong Kong, and it didn't disappoint. Our lovely Tour Guide Alla was very informative and opened our eyes to many things we would never have known or seen if wandering around on our own... She even stopped off to show us how to buy delicious street food or where to go and eat locally... As it got unbearably hot during the day she catered to us poor sufferers of the humidity and helped us by showing us how to travel from point to point using the underground railway system.A great tour with a very enthusiastic and knowledgeable local who loves her city.

See Hong Kong from a local's view. We had Gabriel, a lovely local Hong Kong lad who took us around TST, Hong Kong. He showed us what people in Hong Kong view their city - quirky and cute to some extent, in my opinion.What will improve this walk for me is a deeper historical insight to the places we were shown and stories that normally known.

Great way to experience Tsim Sha Tsui. Even though it was really hot, Matthew provided us with a great tour. He was very knowledgeable, entertaining and motivated. Also he gave us information about good places to eat and so and generally answered all our questions :)The tour is a great way to explore the Tsim Sha Tsui area.

Tiffany was a great guide. It was boiling hot the day of our tour and sometimes it was difficult to focus on all the commentary. Tiffany really knows the area of Kowloon and gave such a positive portrayal of people. We learned a lot about changing attitudes, politics, social status, history, commerce and the feng shui architecture of the skyline skyscrapers. The street food stop was a welcome interlude and we enjoyed the pineapple buns and the mango mochi! The walking pace was fast, but I think if anyone would have required a slower pace, she would have adjusted the tempo. Overall, a great tour for the cost of a generous tip! We had paid $400 for a private 4 hour tour the day before and we actually enjoyed Tiffany more!

Nice tour of Kowloon area. Even though it was a rainy day it was a good tour, with a very helpful guide. Worth doing to orientate yourself to the city and history. Would be great if they included some of Hong Kong island as well.

A Nice Sampling of History. This 2-3 hr walk through the dense,historically rich Tsim Sha Tsui district is an enjoyable experience with guides that are enthusiastic about their town. Patient and eager to answer questions, we enjoyed hearing of the history behind several of the more famous buildings in the area. A street food stop added a little local color to the walk, as well as a mid-day snack.

Informative and Fantastic tour!. July 1, 2016. My partner and I went of this walking tour with Tiffany our guide. It must have been the hottest day or the most humid of both. Nonetheless it was the best way to really experience HK. The tour gave us a very good historical view of Tsim Sha Tsui. It was fun. I would recommend this tour to anyone. I would like to know if HK Free Walk would consider handing out umbrellas with logos on the tour for use. As not everyone had an umbrella to deal with the heat and the blazing sun. Thank you once again.

Great walking tour. Our guide Tiffany was late and we were all getting worried that she wasn't going to show, but once she did she did a great job. She was friendly, chatty and knows her stuff. It rained on and off and was very hot, but that's HK. We really appreciated the stop for street food and loved her recommendations. My only complaint is that Tiffany walked very fast, which was fine for us, but could be hard for some to keep up and it would be easy to lose her in HK's crowded streets. She also speaks quite softly and could be difficult to hear. Over all, very good and would highly recommend.

Great tour. Our tour guide Cassie was great. She shared a lot of interesting information and we enjoyed a fantastic afternoon. Esther who is studying to be a guide joined us also. It was hotter than hot but where possible we stood/sat in the shade and we also had a break where you could buy some of the "street food" or iced teas. Would highly recommend doing the tour and doing it early in your visit. You'll see so many sites on Kowloon and you won't need to go back and see them again... It is time well spent.

Best value ever!. Our walking tour was as enjoyable, as informative and as interesting as it was hot! And, boy, was it hot! Lol! Alla was friendly and considerate and well versed as our guide on the day. We met others from all over the world in our group. It was a really good thing to do early in our stay as it gave us direction and a basic knowledge of the city. Highly recommended! Thank you, Alla, frim The Aussies!

Great experience . Great walking tour. Very well organized and the information that she passed was important to know a little bit more about Hong Kong. The guide was very was very democratic and always asked us if we would like doing that way or the other. It was very hot but she tried to give information in the shadow.

Great experience! . We read previous reviews about the HK free walking tour and were curious. We didn't expect too much since similar paid tours were over $100 each. However, the tour was a pleasant surprise! Cassie was a well informed, enthusiastic and entertaining, tour guide. She not only showed us the top spots around town but had tons of interesting facts to share along the way! Thanks for a great morning :)

Wonderful walking tour. I had the best tour with Tiffany, who was kind, helpful, and taught me a ton about Hong Kong, Kowloon, and Tsim Sha Tsui in the 2.5 hour tour.I arrived by myself and only had one other person on the tour, which made it feel like a private tour. It was really helpful to not only see many attractions but also hear of the history and local narrative. It was so fun and gave me a starting point of more places to explore for the rest of my stay in Kowloon.And it is a free tour (though I highly recommend a generous tip - it's worthwhile) so the value is unbeatable. Well worth the time -- I highly recommend!!

Perfect walking tour!. The walk was very interesting and entertaining, Matthew is a really great guide, he is knowledgeable,attentive and fun! I highly recommend the tour (and I would prioritize it over other expensive food tours from other agencies..)

Make sure you do this walk!. I did this free walk with Tiffany on my first day in Hong Kong. Only three of us turned up so it was like walking around Kowloon with friends. The walk covered a great mix of heritage and history, culture,local stories, street food and tips for other places to visit in a fast paced 2.5 hours. My tips are to make sure you wear comfortable shoes and put sunscreen on even if it is cloudy! Highly recommended! It is a great way to get to know TST area.

Interesting and fun walking tour. it was a great walking tour we did with Matthew, albeit the somewhat rainy afternoon.He showed us lots of interesting places , he was full of information of Hong Kong and its colorful past and present history. Thank you Matthew you are a great guide, full of knowledge and patience with our questions. Remember to bring some tips for the guides as I believe they are all volunteers, they certainly deserve it.
HK fee tour. Excellent tour!! Matthiew was an amazing guide. We shared his personal experience and the history of Hong Kong! You have to join this tour.

Nice walking tour!. Nice walking tour with Tiffany, she was very well prepared and walked us around TST explaining HK history, HK life, stories and showing us the main touristic attraction in the area. I love to partecipate in walking tours everywhere I go as they show a more personal point of view, Tiffany was very nice in sharing everything she knew and engaging with us all the time. Tip: bring a hat or an umbrell and sunscreen for the sun as you'll walk a lot, and very fast, and stop mostly under the sun!

Excellent free walk. We had a fun and informative walk with Cassie. She kept a good pace and the places visited were diverse and interesting. A highlight was the street food and drinks she introduced us to, but no pressure to buy if you didn't want to. It was a surprise when she told frightening tales about Chungking mansions where we were staying! A good tour with a friendly guide.

HK Free Walk Tour. I joined the free walking tour in Hong Kong on 20.05.2016. Unfortunately it was a rainy day, so nobody except me showed up, and it became a private walking tour with Tiffany. She is a great guide, very knowledgable. She has great stories to tell about Hong Kong's history and culture. Her tips about the city are also very valuable (where to eat street food, where to exchange money, etc.) I am glad that I have booked this tour.
Super. Our guide was Tiffany and we had only about 5 of us in the tour. It was a great way to look at HongKong Guide was bubbly, cheerful and full of anecdotes

Not to be missed!. This walking tour was fantastic! I have been on a number of tours throughout Europe and this is definitely one for the top of the list! Tiffany was super engaging and knowledgeable (although sometimes a little bit of a speedy walker). Learnt a lot about the history of Hong Kong and the spots to go in the TST area. Highly recommend.

Great tour. Tiffany did a great job! I was very excited about this tour cause HK is extremely beautiful and culturally rich city. She showed everything I wanted to see and told us a lot of cool stories about Kowloon main spots. Definitely recommend to take this tour!

Very nice free walking tour of Tsim Cha Tsui area of HK. Our guide was Vivian, who was a cheerful as she was knowledgeable about the area and its history. It's free, but you should give a nice tip (100 HK$ per person is reasonable). Reserve in advance and you will not be disappointed.

Amazing . I went today and our tourguide was Vivian, she is amazing. She is funny, nice and has so much information. She answered every question perfectly and took us around Tsim Sha Tsui, teaching us the history of buildings, the neighbourhood and Hong Kong. I do recommend this tour for everyone who is curious about Hong Kong

Informative, fun, great way to meet people!. We had a great time on our HK Free Walk. We have been attending free walking tours in various cities and they have all been great. Do this tour early on in your stay in Hong Kong to learn great history, fun facts and all of the best local spots to visit, eat and drink at. I would recommend this to anyone.

You won't regret it!. Learned about Feng Shui war between two buildings, met a famous cat, heard a ghost story and got my picture taken with Bruce Lee. Top that with some history, great guide and nice group: I had a great time
MUST DO in HK!. Great tour through Tsim Sha Tsui. Very imformative, funny and offered great insights in Hong Kong's culture and history.
Great, despite the weather. A terrific way to see Hong Kong. Even though the day was cool and rainy, our guide Tiffany kept us informed and entertained. Top notch and highly recommended.

very informative and good tour around central blocks. A very worth tour to join, recommend to join if you would like to see a lot snd not get in a short while. Tifanny was an excellent guide giving us information snout Hong Kong and tips about where to go and how to manage but we also get to see a few famous areas. She had respect of our needs and waited until our arrival even a slight delay and asked us for things that were option.Would appreciate though some info about Hong kong inhabitants and there way of living in order to capture a little about the lifestyle of Hong Kong people compared to rest of Chinese.
Great tour. Kay was our guide. She is friendly and informative. Definitely recommend. She pointed out the history and different foods and shops.
Informative Free tour. Short tour with lot of historic information. Liked the insider information about food and travelling.

Great tour. Great tour walking around the city! The guide was great and its a really fun way to know hong kong a little bit better! She also tells you about places you cant miss and food you have to try!

informative fun!. We have never been to Hong Kong before and have enjoyed many walking tours in European cities. We were delighted to have the opportunity to join Tiffany on a tour of Hong Kong. She was knowledgable and informative. We were able to get a taste of Hong Kong- somewhat literally after experiencing the outdoor food market but also learn where we would like to explore on our own!!Defintely recommend
Amazing!. Loved this tour. Tiffany was awesome. Highly recommend!! Very knowledgable tour guide and helpful with recommendations about HK.

A day exploring the Fragrant Harbour . Excellent tour and history of the harbours surrounding sights. Tiffany is a great host and guide able to share her knowledge and experience of Hong Kong's past and present.

Enjoyable and educational tour. Took the whole family on this tour and it was perfect for everyone of us. From adults to younger children, it was full of cool information about HK and especially TST area. We've lived here 9 months and learned quite a lot.

Learnt a lot. Great walk to do on the first day to get your bearings in TST. Learnt a lot. Tiffany was interesting and funny. My only recommendation was that the walk went for approximately 3 hours and could he half this time.
Fantastic free walk tour!!. This tour is a must. Very nice tour, you can see the main parts of kawloon and the guide are very well prepared.

Great walk around downtown HK. The guide Tiffany was really informative and told us about the older and recent history of Hong Kong, and showed the major sights. The tour is good for those who don't know where to start in Hong Kong, especially solo travelers, backpackers, and those on a budget.

Despite the rain, a great informative walk. Went on the Tour with Esther and Cassie on the 10.4.16, and it was teeeming with rain, but with ugly plastic ponchos we got to see lots around TST. We also had a wheelchair for our son who had a fractured foot and we were able to see everything despite this problem. The walk catered for our children as well as adults, with the Garden of Stars, Creme Bro and the street food being favourites. This walk gave us so many pointers we were able to easily find various shops and stalls that we had seen on the walk later that day.We had a great time and would highly recommend giving this a try, and dont forget to give a donation to keep this service carrying on.

Tour with Tiffany. Tiffany was a fantastic tour guide! Not only did she relay historical and factual information about our surroundings, she was also extremely helpful in answering all the questions I had. I immensely enjoyed the tour and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Hong Kong for the first time.
Great! Highly recommended. Excellent info, nice walk and great people to explore KwoolonLooking forward to have another tour to explore HK island too...

Great tour. I was looking for something to do Sunday afternoon. This was just right. Takes two to three hours and hits most of the high points of Hong Kong. Tour focuses more on Kowloon. Cassie was a great tour guide, very knowledgeable.

The best way to start your vacation in Hong Kong. I was fortunate to find a flyer for this tour at my hostel. I always enjoy walking tours to get a feel for a place. Sheila was an expert, providing our small group with local knowledge of not only the tourist spots but other places we might be interested in during our 3-4 hour-ish excursion. There was a lot of walking and sight seeing. But I appreciated the little trivia and fun facts Sheila provided in addition to the obvious historical context. She was very friendly and excited to answer any questions we had in our small 4 person group. During our walk we even stopped by some street stalls for some snacks. After the tour I definitely felt more comfortable and adventurous during my time in Hong Kong.You just need your walking shoes and a camera then you're good to go. This tour is a must for anyone who's in Hong Kong for the first time.
Great orientation. Good walking tour. I would definitely recommend same on arrival to city. It's great orientation and the guide is super nice and helpful!!!

it's the best start for your HK journey. I absolutely recommend HK free walk to everybody. It doesn't matter how old you are, everybody will enjoy this short walk, which lasts about three hours!!! The local guide will show you places, where you would never come and never try. My own advice is to start your HK trip with free walk, because the guide can provide you with useful information and you can ask him/her so many silly questions. Our guide was Tiffany, she is really cool and funny. Guys, I wish you all the best and please don't stop that great idea!!!

A Good Start in Tsim Sha Tsui Hong Kong. We had the pleasure of being guided by Cassie (HK Free Walk).The tour was very informative and very enjoyable. It was our first day in Hong Kong, It gave us important information and we learned many interesting things about the city. We highly recommend considering this tour to experience while in Hong Kong.

Great tour of Hong Kong. We enjoyed a very nice tour with my colleague (we are visiting Hong Kong on a business trip). Even though total there were only 3 people - our nice guide lady still made the entire tour (almost 3 hours). It was very informative and also fun, a lot of facts that I was not aware of. Also good lesson in Hong Kong history. And needless to say - we saw a lot which otherwise would not have been possible to find on our own, and especially in such short period of time. Lots of good suggestions, tips how to make Hong Kong experience even better. I would truly recommend this, really a must if you are first time in Hong Kong.

Awesome introduction to Hong Kong!. This was a great opportunity to learn about Hong Kong. It is amazing how there is so much to see and learn within a small neighborhood. Tiffany was an awesome guide! Do it at the beginning of your trip so you can take advantage of all her knowledge and advice. She can answer any and all questions and make you feel at ease in the city.

Excellent tour guide and route. My friend Aisling and I found this free walking tour when searching Google for things to do, once I went onto their facebook, the reviews spoke for themselves. We reserved 2 places for the 11am tour the next day, pleasantly surprised how easy and efficient the process was. We easily found Tiffany and our group. Tiffany was so friendly, welcoming, full of interesting facts and stories and talked of Hong Kong's development and history with great pride and love. There was a great sense of fun and you felt that you could ask any questions. We were shown the most delicious and cheap street food..she recommended the fish balls which were beautiful! I really gained an understanding of this incredible city which I would not have gained with the short amount of time we had without the HK free walk!

Great overview of HK. Tiffany provided an excellent introduction to HK and the sights in Kowloon. In about 3 hours of walking the streets of Kowloon we heard about the history, saw the key sights and experienced an afternoon soaking in the culture. She pointed out the highlights, introduced us to some safe street food, walked us thru a local food market and answered all our questions in perfect English. Great start to our tour and cruise thru SE Asia.

Nice to meet you Hong Kong!. If it's your first day in Hong Kong and you are just at the start of your exploration - go for a walk with these guys and you'll have a great introduction to the city and a very fun and pleasant time!I very much liked my guide Cathy(sorry if spelled wrong) and I very much enjoyed her company during the walk. We managed to see many things in these ~2.5 h, had a fun snack stop and noted many places for further visiting.Just be sure to come 10 min in advance, as TST is a very crowded area and it will be hard to find the group if late.

Walk with Cassie. We absolutely loved the guided walk that Cassie led around Hong Kong. She was a great guide and showed us a heap of places we probably would never have seen otherwise. She was very knowledgeable and lots of fun. We highly recommend this walking tour
Great to get started in HK. Great tour in the TST part of HK. Tiffany was a really nice tour guide and gave us a lot interesting insights and background info. I would recommend it to everybody!

HK free walks helps you to understand a complicated city. I ha the pleasure to do the walk with Tiffany. She is great! The fact that she grew up in the Netherlands enabled her even more to put things in perspective and to understand Hong Kong much better. She explained basics around history, showed us classic tourist spots in Kowloon but also hidden gems including nice street food and what else you should order when hungry again. I can very much reckoned the HK free walks (at least with lovely Tiffany!). Thanks a lot!

Fantastic walking tour!. Tiffany was a wonderful guide and gave us a helpful insight into the city. This is the perfect way to find your bearings and learn about the rich culture and heritage of HK. The tour lasted around 3 hours and was very detailed but fast paced which kept everything interesting. Tiffany was very knowledgeable and helpful!

A great introduction. Our guide was Meikee and she was fun and friendly. The information was interesting and she had some great little tips about other sightseeing in Hong Kong so do this early on to take advantage. The street food was cool and the 1881 building was beautiful. Too bad the clock tower is covered up. Remember to tip these guys as that is the only money they get as they are volunteers. Thanks Meikee very much.

Great walking tour!. Tiffany led our tour and she did a great job showing us around Hong Kong. it's a great way to get oriented on the first day in a new city. She is informative, positive and energetic, and all of this in spite of the fact it was raining the whole time on our walking tour.

Informative introduction . Having done a few walking tours in other countries before, I sought out one to do in Hong Kong and found this tour through Google.The tour was led by Tiffany and was a great introduction to the TST area.Would recommend this to other travellers :)

So much fun. I stumbled upon this free walking tour. We vwere a small group and that made it felt like a few friends walking around HK and chatting while learning some facts about this beautiful city. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone going to HK

Great way to see Hong Kong. Tiffany was great!! She was fun and informative and ensured that everyone in our group could hear her and answered any questions which were fired at her! The walk was a good distance and having done many free walking tours all over the world this tour did not disappoint!

Very good free tour. Took the tour with Tiffany,very nice person with very good english. The tour is about 3 hours in Kowloon,and even if walking distance is not too long we saw quite a lot of places (unfortunately most of them had maintainance works going on,but thats not tour fault :)Interesting stories about the city and street food break as well.Very recommended!

Great Tour of the TST Area. Had a great time on the tour! We walked around the Tsim Sha Tsui neighborhood to different areas that I wouldn't have found on my own. The food at the street food stop was delicious (would highly recommend the steamed bbq pork bun and mango mochi). My guide was informative and did very well given the size of the tour (we have about 12-15 people in our group). She also gave me great directions / suggestions for other places, including the K11 mall (I loved my guide's backpack and went to the mall immediately after to buy one for myself)!

Informative and fun!. I had a great time on the HK Free Tour with guide Tiffany. For a budget traveller, this was an awesome option for me. The tour takes you all around the TST and you get a very good sense of the history and culture of Hong Kong. We stopped for a street food tasting halfway through (you pay for your own, of course) but it was great getting to learn a little more about HK Street food. Tiffany had a lot of great suggestions for what else to see/do/eat in HK. I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting!
Ron. Thoroughly enjoyed a couple of hours walking and absorbing the history of HK and some breathtaking views of the skyline. Tiffany was absolutely fantastic!

Great Info and Knowledgeable Guide. Even though I had been to Hong Kong before, this was the first time I stayed in Kowloon, and I only had one free day to explore the TST area. This tour was perfect - it was long enough to give me a feel for the area, but left time for me to explore on my own. Tiffany did an amazing job of pointing out interesting historical facts about the buildings and neighborhoods, while giving us a feel for what life is like in TST now. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to learn more about Kowloon.

Great Tour, Very Informative. This is a great tour! I learned so many new things about Hong Kong that I did not know before. Tour guide, Tiffany, was very engaging and informative. Highly recommend this tour for anyone wanting to know more Hong Kong history.
Interesting tour. Nice tour, I would definitively join again if they provide additional routes. Useful even if you have been there for a few weeks already.

Interesting. Thanks Tiffany for a very interesting walking of TST area. Although I have been in Hong Kong for 6 months, I am still discovering new sides to it. I will definitely recommend my visitors to take this walk with your group. I really liked the part when you took us to eat some street food. It was great to walk through the wet market- maybe a little more time could be spent here. I found the information about the Timeball and typhoon warning system interesting too.

Cool walking tour in Kowloon. Tiffany was great at showing us the Kowloon side of Hong Kong, great & fun anecdotes and good immersion into the city. I was surprised to learn they had only started a few months ago, as it was so good! A must-do.
Fun walking introduction to Hong Kong. Great introduction to the TST area in Hong Kong on my first day. Tiffany was a great guide, with lots of interesting details I would have never noticed/learned.
Fun tour of the city.. Tour was interesting and fun. She helped us pick out and enjoy really good street food! I recommend to couples, individuals and families.

Charming intro the HK neighbourhood. This walk tour is worth the time spent if you are interested to know the history around hong kong and specifically the Tsim Sha Tsui area. The guide is knowledgable and friendly. I would recommend this tour if one is considering it.

No show. We were at least 6 people hoping to do this tour on Saturday morning, including 2 who actually had reserved online. At 11:30, we had to accept that nobody from HK Free Walk would show up. A proper lack of reliability from them that resulted in a proper waste of time for us!

Best way to explore Hong Kong!. Great tour! Good guides who know a lot about the city and will show you some interesting and fun places in HK. The tour takes about 2,5 hours, which is perfect. The guide was really friendly and we could stop any moment to take some pictures or even buy a snack on the way. Definitely make use of this tour!

Best way to find about Kowloon. If you want to find all about Kowloon this is the way to do it.Big Bus tours are fine for Hong Kong Island, but for Kowloon this is far better.Tiffany our guide was really knowledgeable and fun and gave us a real insight into the people and history of Kowloon.As it was a walking tour you explored places you just wouldn't get to on a bus and it so much enhanced your appreciation of the city.She also stops at a fabulous street food stall for some local delicacies.Not to be missed!!

The first thing you have to do in HK!!!. We had an amazing 2,5-hour tour with our guide Tiffany. She walked us through the main spots, told us about the culture and other curious aspects of this fantastic piece of land! Although they have just begun operation (started last Nov if I am not mistaken) they really seem to know what they are doing. 100% recommended!!!
Mr. Good tour. Excellent guide Tiffany. Easy to find starting point. Try the custard buns! 2.5 hours about right. Nice views of harbour.

Do it!. This is a great tour to do when you first get to Hong Kong.My guide was Tiffany and she was amazing, she knows a lot of facts about the city and Hong Kong history.Really nice experience.Thanks!

Worth every dollar and more. Found this tour through TripAdvisor during our first visit to Hong Kong. I've never done a walking tour before so gave this one a shot and I'd have to agree with the all the other positive reviews. This was an excellent way to see the Tsim Sha Tsui area with a friendly local guide (Tiffany) who spoke perfect English, on a 3 hour walking tour at a comfortable pace. So thank you Tiffany for showing us around on our first day in Hong Kong and providing all the interesting, funny and useful facts about Hong Kong and its people.

Great experience!!. We did the tour and had an amazing time. Learnt a lot about Hong Kong and visited relevant places of the city. Tiffany the tour guide was very helpful and fun. Her english was excellent.We would recommend it.Thanks very much for your help!!

Well spent time. . If you are in the region and don't know what to do. This tour is perfect. A roughly 3 hour walk around central Hong-Kong. Good and funny facts about the history and recent events. The tour is still just a few months old and will probably just get better. But already worth its while. Even though we had bad luck with the weather and a lot of stuff where under renovation we had a good time. It's for free but worth a good tip in the end.

Great!. Did a great tour with Tiffany. Perfect for an introduction to the city and some nice history and background on Hong Kong. Walking was easy and really enjoyed the street food she showed us. Recommend it if it is your first time to Hong Kong.

Great info, fun time, great food. Had a great time with Tiffany, showed us around Kowloon, tried some street food that we probably would not have tried on our own! Would have actually liked a little slower pace and a longer tour, 4 hours instead of 3, just moved a little too fast while trying to talk and listen, would have liked a little more time for more pictures. But still enjoyed it, and of course saw many of the same places Tiffany took us to over the next few days, so were much more comfortable with Kowloon after our tour.I like the concept of a free tour, which as we all know, nothing is free, but the part I like is that you pay at the end based on your experience and what you think the tour was worth to you, instead of paying a high fixed price at the beginning and then maybe being disappointed. And I think your tour guide works harder this way since they have to do a good job for you to earn their living.I highly recommend this!

Awesome walking tour!. This was a great way to see the sights! We learned so much from Tiffany and she was a great guide. We discovered places we wouldn't have found on our own and learned so much about the area. Highly recommended!

A great way to explore the city! :). I spent a great afternoon with Tiffany, my guide exploring hongkong's TST area. Though i've been to hongkong a few times, this tour led me to several hidden gems and places i didnt know about :) the highlight for me were the stories on hk's history, funny fengshui anecdotes and yummy food. They're not too be missed! Thanks for the tour, Tiffany!

A Dutch girl in Hong Kong. Tiffany is a Dutch girl with Hong Kong roots! I did really learn a lot of things with her tour that wouldn't have been able to do it by myself! We had fun, she had a lot of patience with us, specially waiting for us to take pictures and she gave us very good tips of the city. Tiffany gracias por tu maravilloso tour. Todo nos gusto, especialmente las historias que nos contaste sobre la ciudad, aquellas pequeñas anecdotas. Gracias por el tip de ver el skyline desde el Sheraton. Así lo hicimos y nos encanto. Gracias!

Great tour!. I was in business in Hong Kong and this excellent tour was a great use of a few hours I had in a beautiful sunny day in Hong Kong! Sheila, our guide was friendly, knowledgeable, funny, very acquainted with the local culture and professional as a guide. I thoroughly enjoyed the trip exposing a few local gems that I would have missed otherwise.

New View of Hong Kong. We spotted this on TA, having done great tip based tours in Paris and Berlin. This is a new tour and was fantastic - it had only been going a few months so no doubt it will get even better as they focus more on local food and hidden gems. Gave us a great tip to visit one of the small islands which we wouldn't have thought of and enjoyed greatly. Thanks
Great Tour!. An amazing tour! Very knowledgeable and fun! Tiffany our guide was great. Everyone should go on this tour. Tsim sha tsui clock tower was a great start!

Absolutely great. I did the tour on my last day in hongkong and even though i have been there for 4 days i saw many new places and learnt a lot about hongkong. Tifany the tour guide was very knowledgeable. We were only three people so it was like a private tour. We were walking about 2.5 hours around the harbour and in the tsim sha tsui area, tifany explained new things to us about the harbour, skyline, food and the history of hongkong.

Winter walking tour in Hong Kong. Very nice walking tour. Vivian and Meikee provided lots of information about interesting facts of Hong Kong, history, food, things to do, etc. It was cool and funny. The 3 hours walk flew quickly. I would recommend this tour to anybody who wants to know the city from people who actually live there.
Very interesting walking tour . I like free walking tours in general. The hk tour was very interesting as you get to know more info behind the scenes. Thumbs up

Excellent and cheap way to see many Hong Kong sights in a short time. I've done about 25 "free" (tips-based) walking tours, mostly in Europe, so I was thrilled to find a new one on my visit to Hong Kong. It was a chilly and rainy Monday and it turned out that I was the only one to show up for the early (11am) tour, but Sheila (the guide) cheerfully went ahead with the tour with as much enthusiasm as you'd expect for a large crowd on a perfect day. So it was a private tour in my case and I was extremely impressed with both the tour and my guide. We went to many "hidden" sights that I'd never have found on my own, and it was very fun and well paced. I was a bit self conscious having a private guide like this, but Sheila carried on like a seasoned pro. I was surprised to find that they'd only been running this tour for a few months now, and I will recommend it to anyone coming to Hong Kong.

free walking tour in hong kong. I booked a free walking tour prior to going to Hong Kong. The 3 of us arrived in the rain and Tiffany our tour guide was there. We saw quite a few landmarks, learnt a fair bit of history, had some street food (so yummy), saw where the locals ate and tried to keep up in the down pour. Noting deterred our tour guide and her enthusiasm rubbed off. The tour was from 9.30am12.30pm. It was great thanks Tiffany.

Worth a tour to have a deeper understanding of HK and culture. After taking many free walking tours in Europe I was excited, when came to know about such kind of tour exist in HK as well. Our tour guide Vivian was super enthusiastic about her place. She is well informed about the history and culture of the place and loves to share it around. Must recommended on your first day of visit and special thanks to the people who conduct this. They go extra mile to help the travelers see there culture and country

tour of kowloon. Vivian led an action packed, well paced, three hour tour for us on Jan 23 2016. It was great and captured all the essentials of kowloon and the origins of hong kong, leaving you knowing where to go next. She even stopped for us to sample local food which was wonderful. She was always ready to answer questions on anything about life in hong kong, it was educational all around. On this tour we also had Mickey helping her and that added for even more dialogue on life in the city. The tour was on one of the coldest days in recent memory for hong kong but they both persevered and we all had an awesome time Thanks so much. Michael Flatt

Best way to learn more about a town. My guide Tiffany was great. Informative tour without being too detailed. Answered all the questions I had. Tour shows some hidden places and provides tips on places to eat and things to visit for free.

Perfect Private Tour. I really enjoyed the walk with Tiffany! I was the only one so that it was really a private tour! Learned a lot about the history and other things! I had also a lot of other questions that i get good answers to! I can recommend that tour to everyone!

Excellent tour. I had a great tour with Vivianne as my tour guide. I was the only one that attended, which was probably because the weather was a bit misty and had some occasional showers. However, that was probably to my advantage. As I could ask all the questions I wanted and my guide were fully capable of giving me answers about local cuisine, politics, movie industry, education and other things. She was a lovely guide and took me to see some of the main attractions in Tsim Sha Tsui as well as giving local tips on where and what to eat. I would recommend the tour to anyone.

Fun Tour. The Dutchie, Ms. Tiffany Lam is very sweet and personable. She tablet with additional pics of many of the buildings in case the weather is poor or the view is not good. She is still learning and I recommend learning with her.

Good tour . Went to the tour with a group of people from my hostel and found it quite interesting, went to some places we had already been too as expected but Tiffany took us to many others that we hadn't yet been too. She was a good guide, knowledgable about the city and gave good advice for things we should do. Felt it was a little longer than it needed to be but was overall a well spent 3 hours.

Interesting tour of the city. Myself and my fellow hostal mates met Tiffany for the walking tour. She was friendly, knowledgeable and entertaining throughout the tour. Great way to learn a little more about the city, it's history and culture. Would recommend!

A walking tour with friends. I know this walking tour from couchsurfing, and make reservation not because it is free, but just curious. Did not expect much.I showed up at the Clock Tower and met Tiffany Lam with the green umbrella. She is the guide for that day.There are other participants : one person from Manila and three from Spain.Tiffany is talkative, smart, always smile, and so friendly.Other participants are friendly and nice as well.Feels like I'm in a small group of friends.It was my second visit to Hongkong. Frankly I did not fancy in Hongkong before; too dense, and too urban.However Tiffany has changed my feeling about Hongkong; as she can show me the soul of Hongkong: from historical spots, local cultures, local food, tips, and others knowledges.And there was a roles palying too: as if we actors from a film.I start fall in love this city :)From 2 days visit to Hongkong yesterday, this walking tours is the most delight activity and rewarding as well.I hope Tiffany and her friends can develop other walking tour rutes and make this programme can reach theirs goal, and give them profesioanal benefit as well.Good luck. See you in again!
Really nice tour!!!. The tour was really nice and we got really good tips from our guide!!!!! She was also super nice!!!! We totally recommend this trip in order to get local details of Hong Kong!!!

To see the city. This is one of the best way to see a city. Sheila was my guide and she showed me around both the well known and the not so well known sights of the city, which I love to discover. Her English is very good and the content of the tour was perfect. She was super friendly and obviously loves showing people around her city.

Good free walking tour. I did the tour with Sheila, she was really nice and answered all our questions! We discovered some areas where we would have never been without her. Also tasting some street food was really cool and the photos on the iPad as well. I can highly recommend this tour!
Great experience!!. We really enjoyed the tour with Sheila and King! They are very passionate, friendly and interesting! They gave us lots of good tips! I recommend it to anyone arriving in HK!

A must if you're visiting Hong Kong!!. Excellent tour of Hong Kong. Small groups make it very personal. Sheila and King were very passionate throughout, giving us useful tips of whatelse to visit during our stay. If you're visiting Hong Kong you should definitely look them up!
Solid free walk. Excellent tour around Kowloon with great, motivated guides. Saw a lot of cool places and learned a lot!

How cool!. We didn't really know what to expect when we walked up to the Clock Tower at 10:50 am on Friday. We didn't know what the tour would be like and hoped we wouldn't be the only two there. Turned out there were a very friendly and approachable guide waiting with the green umbrella mentioned on the website as well as four other friendly and interested tourists. The tour was great. Our guide, Tiffany, was very knowledgeable, the tour was extensive and very informational, and Tiffany carried a tour ipad with relevant pictures and information. It is a lot of walking, but you see a lot of Kowloon. There is historical information, an opportunity to stop and try some street food with advice from your guide, current information of what is fun to do, and more. I recommend this to anyone just getting to Hong Kong or even if you've been for a little while. Oh, and it's free, but leave a good tip because it's certainly worth it!

Free but worthwile. I only had one day in Hongkong on a stopover from Auckland to Frankfurt. This was the only tour I could find on a Sunday and it even was free. Best of all, I was the only participant but my guide Vivian didn't mind. She answered all my questions, I got a very individual introduction to Hongkong and it was more like a friend showing me her town than a commercial tour. Highly recommended, be generous with your tip to make this new project a success.
fun tour and funny tour guide!. even as someone who has visited HK for 5 or 6 times, i learned and discovered a lot about kowloon on this tour! fun!

A great way to see the city. We saw a brochure for this free walking tour in our hostel and decided to give it a go. We really enjoyed the tour and loved how we got to see a bunch of different things we wouldn't have known about otherwise. Although we only covered a relatively small area of the city, we saw and learnt about a lot. Tiffany, our guide for the morning, was very well informed and friendly.This was definitely one of my favourite things we did in Hong Kong.

Worth doing this tour. We really enjoyed discovering parts of Kowloon Island that we would not have known to visit. The guide was well informed and responded well to questions.We suggest that the guide have photos on theiPad already set up in order rather than spending a while searching for them.Also, ask less questions about what is on the tour because we do not know the answers- that is why we are on the tour!

Great tour, lovely staff. Join them!. We took this tour in the afternoon today and were lucky enough to have Tiffany as our private guide since no one else joined the tour. This is by the way not due to the quality of the tour but simply because they are so new that few people know about this. I'm very sure their tours will get more traction soon and more people joining them on the walks. Anyways - our tour was great from start till end. Tiffany was lovely and did tell us a lot of interesting stuff about the city, also a bit about Hong Kongers' culture, history and traditions. We have been on several free walking tours before (in Australia and some South American countries) and can say, that his HK tour was amongst the ones we liked the most. So give it a try and join them!

The best way to spend 3 hours in HK. First i was surprised that in HK you can find a free walking tour.I was 1 week in HK and this tour is one of my better memories. The girls are very positive and active.Everything was very interesting, we tasted some local street food.Also girls recommended me the strong bitter tea:) It was good and healthy but realy bitter) I heard a lot of interesting info about HK.So i recomend to everybody take a part in this tour, it is the best way to spend 2-3 hours in HK

Best spontanious idea.... I had spare time till i got my room and was badly jetlaged so i decided to go on this tour. I even had a private tour with Sheila. Was really great. She has a big knowledge. I recommend it to everybody who hasn't been in hk. Thanks for the great time.

A nice introduction to HK. Sheila is working hard to put together a nice tour after having been inspired by free walks when having traveled abroad herself. I find this admirable and know that the walk will continue to grow over time. The staff is friendly, personable and takes pride in welcoming you to HK.

Great walking tour. Perfect to start your HK experience!. This walk is great to learn about Hong Kong's history, the buildings, food and so much more.Sheila took her time to guide us through Tsim Sha Tsui and showed us many spots that even locals might not know.The atmosphere was like between friends.I highly recommend this tour to anyone for a great start into an authentic HK experience!

Best activity you could do in Hong Kong. I decided to go on a HK Free Walk to give it a try and see what a guide could tell about Hong Kong... and thanks to Vivian, my guide, it ended up being the most satisfactory experience of my trip.If I could have any complain it would be that even after a 3h tour I wanted it to continue.I took the tour on my first morning in Hong Kong and it improved my experience in this amazing city. They are young people and they live in Hong Kong. They have made a research of they own city to tell us the little details that make the history of the city amazing and interesting. And they do it with a good sense of humour.They are relatively new on this, but that only means that they will improve! And the feeling that they loved the city and wanted to transmit it to us, tourist, was great.I highly recommend this tour to anyone travelling to Hong Kong.

Walking tour around HK!. The tour guide was professional. My family and I enjoyed the tour tremedously. Lots of fun facts and history!I will highly recommend it to everyone visiting HK!Keep up the good work Sheila!

Experience Hong Kong with Lorena. We spent a great day experiencing Hong Kong and Kowloon with Lorena. She showed us the city's diversity from day to day living through to the tourist attractions. Lorena has great insights to the culture and practices of the populace, giving you the benefits to enjoy the city like a local. Great communications before the tour, allowing a customized experience meeting your desires.

Guided tour with Lorena. My Hong Kong experience would not have been the same without Lorena. It was one of the best private guided tour I have ever had. I was in Hong Kong for a few days only for business and my time was very limited. Lorena went above and beyond herself to ensure that I could see and do as much as possible in the day tour. Most importantly not only she is very knowledgeable about the city, but she makes sure that you have the REAL experience of Hong Kong. She will bring you to unusual places, off the beaten track, and tell you all interesting stories on how the local live. You can tell the difference between someone who is doing their job and someone who is passionate about it. Well, she definitely falls in the second category.You will not regret it!!! Fantastic tour.

the best!!. I just found Lorena through TripAdvisor. The tour was exactly what I was hoping for -- a walking exploration of several non-tourist neighborhoods. She had ideas for places to go to see what daily life was like in Hong Kong, mixed in with a few must-see areas for tourists as well. And she had really good information and knowledge about all aspects of Hong Kong. She designed the day around what I was hoping to do -- it could not have gone better. Highly recommend Lorena!!

Fantastic 4 hour tour with Lorena. We had a wonderful tour of Hong Kong and Kowloon with Lorena. She was warm, professional, knowledgeable and very attentive to our interests. We could not believe how much ground we were able to cover in just four hours. We particularly loved her attention to the architectural details and culture. And very importantly, she introduced us to several means of public transportation allowing us to get around the city ourselves post tour. She also helped us select other venues we should see on our own. We truly enjoyed every moment with Lorena and consider this tour a fantastic value. We would highly recommend to anyone

LORENA = The best you can get in Hong Kong. Background: Two 60ish women visiting Hong Kong for the first time.To Do List: See Hong Kong -- 'Old Hong Kong' from the perspective of a local.We had booked two full-day tours with two different guides. Our Day 1 guide did take us everywhere. However, we felt rushed and exhausted. Day 2: We met a smiling, lovely young woman named Lorena. She asked us what we had seen so far, and what we wanted to see with her. We explained, that we had been exhausted from our first tour, and really wanted a slower pace. We also told her that we wanted to see the bird market as well as someplace green (we had just come from Japan, and the concrete and skyscrapers left us wanting a garden). She definitely listened -- our pace was not rushed. She took us to a gem -- the Nan Lian Gardens. Beautiful, serene, fascinating! We spent quite a while there, at our request. Then on to interesting markets, views of Hong Kong from the tops of tall buildings, and a great lunch at a local restaurant.By the end of the tour we wanted to take Lorena home with us! She's got it all - a terrific personality, the ability to listen, excellent knowledge of Hong Kong. And she followed up with us the day after the tour with suggestions of additional things to do!
Educational. Kind and knowledgeable guide. Lorena was very enthusiastic and informative about Hong Kong. Amazing experience and would recommend to everyone if you do not know the city well.

Had a great 4 hour walking tour of Hong Kong with Lorena.. Lorena is very knowledgable and a great guide for Hong Kong.Lorena allowed us to choose what we wanted to see and experience duirng our short stay in Hong Kong.

Good tour but our guide read a lot from her phone . The actual tour was great and we saw many different things that we could not have otherwise explored in detail. However it bothered me that our tour guide was reading facts and information from her phone rather than knowing the information herself.

Comprehensive, Flexible, Friendly, Informative and Kind. We had an unbelievable day with Lorena. We only had one full day to explore Hong Kong and made the most of it. Do yourself a favor and hire Lorena to show you HK like a local! Great for families and couples too!

Fantastic tour!. What a great 8 hour tour...it was a perfect mix of temples, shopping, and food...Lorena is quite knowledgeable about Hong Kong, and as the tour was during Chinese New Year, she explained the traditions and stories behind it. She will cater the tour to whatever you wish or offer up an itinerary if you want as well. Highly recommend this tour!

A very good day. We had a full day tour with Lorena on New Year Eve, she showed us a lot on Hong Kong in a day & was very informative with excellent knowledge of the area considering she originates from South America rather than being a local. We were very pleased with the quality of the tour & would recommend Lorena to others visiting Hong Kong.

Lorena made our Hong Kong Experience Wonderful. Lorena gave an 8 hour walking tour for our group of 4. She was incredibly easy to work with scheduling the trip. She was flexible to come meet us at a restaurant in Hong Kong before beginning our tour. I don't think I would have been able to have as good an experience and see as much of the city if it hadn't been for Lorena. She showed us all the good spots and was great company to work with.

Lorena was well prepared.. Lorena was well prepared and took the time to listen to what we wanted to see and do. She was knowledgeable and friendly. We normally prefer a car and driver along with our guide. Her tours use public transportation and that worked out fine. She is a rule follower and will provide an interesting and safe tour.

Great tour guide. We had a long layover in Hong Kong and wanted an overall tour in 4-6 hours. Lorena F. Met us at the scheduled time and place. She was very pleasant and knowledgable. She listened and understood what we needed and wanted from our tour. She knew where to take us, how to get around efficiently, showed us many interesting sights. In a few hours we got history and flavor and understanding of Hong Kong. Lorena F. Was a real find and we highly recommend her.

Great Tour. While on a business trip I decided to take the opportunity to see HKG.The day tour was absolutely what I was looking for. I experienced HKG as a local, traveling by train, bus , boat and a lot of walking. My stay was short but I can say that Lorena filled each moment with interesting facts during our time together (temples, shops, bird and flower district, restaurants and best of all TOP OF THE PEAK).Lorena's enthusiasm in her work is very apparent which made my experience even better.

One day to experience Hong Kong . I was visiting Hong Kong for business and only had one day to explore. Lucky for me that AmericanExpress scheduled my tour with Lorena!!! I had a few things in mind based on minimal research and said I wanted to see those and experience the real Hong Kong. Lorena was a joy from the first moment. A completely lovely, genuine, knowledgeable, enthusiastic person and I was so excited to spend the day with her! It was like spending the day with a friend of a friend who I hadn't met yet, but liked immediately. We went to the sites I had suggested, but with complete flexibility and adding on some great other sites I hadn't thought of. She brought new ideas and gave me an amazing tour. She was flexible, easy going, pleasant, interesting, and obviously enjoys providing tours and interacting with people. I spent the entire day with her and could not have been happier. Her enthusiasm, knowledge, and incredible personality made the trip so much better. Not only was I able to see what I wanted to see in Hong Kong and the way I wanted to, but I enjoyed spending time with Lorena as my guide. I highly recommend her for your trip.
great tour in short time. i stopped by HG for 10 hrs and Lorena gave me very nice tour within this time i saw many places e.g. park ,business district,temple..etcthanks for good time i had

Great tour on short notice. My son and I had a short stopover in HK and Lorena gave us a great tour. She planned the itinerary and spent 6 hours with us. We went to temples, parks, shops and the business district. It was a great time. Lorena's knowledge of wine was an added bonus!

Great Walking and Food Tour. We went with Maggie our first day in Hong Kong to explore some really fun areas close to Central HK and try local food. Everything from booking to the actual tour and Maggie's easiness in adjusting the tour slightly when we were hungry was perfect.

Must-do in Hong Kong!. Wow! What a fantastic tour! I set the tour up prior to our trip using email and paypal with Ski, the owner. She sent us a ton of information before we left and sent a picture and bio of our guide, Maggie, and gave us a meeting time/place. We got there a few minutes early and Maggie was already there and ready to start our tour. Maggie was born and raised in Hong Kong and spoke English like it was her first language. She taught us so much, took us to some great places that we would have never experienced on our own, and gave us some awesome food adventures! We had specifically requested to have a tour of "the real Hong Kong", wanted to get outside of the touristy areas and we wanted to learn about the food and culture - Maggie did not disappoint and it was actually far better than I could have anticipated. It was great to do this early in our trip, because we had so much more knowledge about the culture and knew a few customs and words. We used a few things that we learned when we were interacting with some other locals and they loved it! They can tailor the tour any way you would like - whether you want to stick to the touristy areas or if you want to dive into the culture and sights far off the tourist track. I think that this is a must-do tour in the beginning of your visit to Hong Kong.

Great way to see and experience Hong Kong. First off . . . Ski is amazing. Her knowledge if everything we visited and all the questions we asked was impressive. We took the private walking tour. I have to say the highlight was the Dim sum, DELICIOUS!!! The story of the building structure of the HSB and China bank building(s) is fascinating. Can't say enough about how educational and interesting this tour is. Well worth the time and cost.

Very informative. Our tour guide was Maggie and she was extremely informative to the point that we learned many facets of the Hong Kong history culture religion and lifestyle of the Hong Kong people. The tour was primarily walking and we saw many unique areas in old Hong Kong as well western Hong Kong. We definitely saw many hole in the wall restaurants shops and is interesting points of interest. We thoroughly enjoyed our four hour we were totally immersed into the Hong Kong culture.

Personalized walking tour during long layover in Hong Kong. Our Guide - Ski - was friendly knowledgeable and a lot of fun! We had a long layover on our way to Shanghai, so we took to fast train downtown from the airport and spent the day seeing Hong Kong on foot. Great Dim Sum and an overview of the city, and then we were escorted back o the fast train for our continuing flight. Thank you Ski! We really enjoyed our time with you.

The Highlight of Hong Kong!. We had the best time on our tour with Maggie! She is very well spoken, intelligent, and full of energy. Because it was our first time in Hong Kong, Maggie provided a great overview of the city, and then we started walking. We learned about many sights, the metro system, and worship traditions. As is often the case in the summer, we did have some rain during our tour, but Maggie was a real pro, and knew how to navigate the city so we could still have a completely enjoyable day.I recommend this tour highly as the beginning of your visit in Hong Kong because after a day with Maggie, we felt extremely comfortable navigating other parts of the city on our own. We took several tours on our recent trip to Southeast Asia, and this was by far the best.

Highlight of Hong Kong. My husband and I were recently in Hong Kong and booked a food tour with Ski. It turned out to contain great food but so much more. Ski's intimate knowledge of the city gives her the ability to bring you to great "foodie" spots we would never have been able to find by ourselves while intertwining these stops with history lessons and a glimpse into the real life of Hong Kong.We highly recommend this tour. We can easily state it was one of the highlights of our trip to Asia.

Perfect Tour for a First Timer. You can't go wrong booking this tour, Ski's easy manner and friendly demeanor instantly melts away any "blind date" apprehensions you might have. Coming off a two week, four city trip through mainland China with 4 different private guides, I had a fresh perspective on this important issue. Having an engaging guide makes all the difference and hitting it off right away with Ski sealed the deal. Her Big Foot Tour was just the right thing for us, it led us around Hong Kong island with a lighthearted, yet informative walk. The 4 hours rushed by as she miraculously wove us through new and old sights, back streets and busy corners. Unless you have gobs of time to wander the streets, this tour packaged a wonderful array of sights into a compact 4 hours. If you are a first time visitor like me with only one full day to explore Hong Kong; I can't imagine a much better value. Ski effortlessly modified things for our group, even helping rendezvous with my adult son in the middle of the tour. A quick stop here (local tea/coffee), a memorable lunch stop there (authentic local dim sum), and as we finished she hailed a cab to send us up to the peak. Ski "made our day" in Hong Kong and contributed to a memorable finish to our big trip.Additional credit goes out to the pre-planning leading up to our big day. Her email responses were always prompt and provided straight forward answers to all that was asked. I had no problems in finding our start point, she provided useful advice on other things we should try to do and her well-written website post on finding the best view of Hong Kong on the peak was spot on !
