(Don't bother with the Peak Tower, take her advice and walk to her suggested "Secret Spot" ~ now that's a million dollar view)

AMAZING . A great tour with a host that was extremely knowledgable who was able to give great insight to history and culture of Hong Kong island. Although our day was wet Ski was able to guide us to some fascinating and interesting areas. Some of the food stops were great along with the interesting markets. Well worth the effort.

FABULOUS TOUR OF THE CITY. My Husband and I spent two days in Hong Kong to finish our amazing Anniversary Trip to Singapore and Thailand. On the first day we did our own thing and although very enjoyable, we visited Stanley and walked around the City, I am so glad I had prebooked my Tour with Ski on the second day. Ski's tour was extremely informative and interesting and I saw the real Hong Kong rather than just the main Tourist spots. Ski was lovely and is a fountain of knowledge regarding the history and culture of the City. well worth it and highly recommended.

Great cultural experience!. Even in the stifling July humidity, Ski was able to immerse us in the history and culture of Hong Kong. I have visited this city many times for business but this was my first real glimpse at the city the locals call home. Ski has a wonderful, natural enthusiasm for her job which makes the four hour tour seem to go quickly and effortlessly. Taking us to "non-tourist" locations, full of interesting tales and characters. Cannot recommend Big Foot enough.

Great tour! . We had a wonderful walking tour with Maggie. We spent four hours roaming the streets of Hong Kong and learning about the culture. She answered all of our questions and taught us many new things that made the remainder of our trip more pleasurable, Thank you MaggieFritz, Leah and Lauren (USA)

Best 4 hours, ever!. I have visited HK before and also read a lot about HK (culture, history, etc) but the city really came to life during my 4 hour private tour with Maggie. I learned so much about history and culture, things that will stay with me for my whole life. The best part was I did not feel like I was on a tour, but on a long stroll with an old, dear friend. Maggie is the phenomenal- so knowledgeable and easy to talk to. Ski was so responsive and made booking very easy. I cannot recommend this enough, whether this is your first time or you have been to HK many times before, do not pass this up!!!!!

Honeymoon . Thanks Ski! Our tour was brilliant, we got an inside view of the city and appreciated everything much more with someone there to ask questions who had an in-depth knowledge of Hong Kong. Our tour was customised to our interests and we learnt a lot about food (and ate some- AWESOME!) , politics and honkies! We saw some really amazing views we wouldn't have seen otherwise. This was exceptional value for money; if you're looking for a tour of Hong Kong, trust me, choose Big Foot. Because the tour catered so well to our needs, when we return to Hong Kong we will definitely use this service again to learn more.Cheers Ski, Marie-Claire & Ian from Scotland.

If you visit Hong Kong you must do this tour. . When visiting any city for the first time it is difficult to know where to start and what to see, well for Hong Kong the solution is simple. Book a Big Foot Tour and you won't be disappointed. We booked a private tour ( great value ) which was tailored to what our interests and goals were and our guide Ski delivered a tour that was fun, informative, relaxed and interesting. As it was our 25th wedding anniversary we wanted to book a nice restaurant during our stay and Ski helped with some fantastic recommendations as well as offering great advice about the Octopus card. Great tour, great guide, great value. Go book it.

Great overview of central Hong Kong. Maggie was a great guide - she met us at our hotel and really helped us get our bearings on our first day in Hong Kong, including having patience while we had issues getting out cash for the MTR from the ATM! She gave us a great overview of Central and Western areas and even had dim sum lunch with us to explain the process. She additionally provided more recommendations for our second day in the city. Our favorite experience was Man Mo temple. There was a lot of walking obviously, so not sure if I would recommend to families with small children or those with difficulty walking.

Excellent start to our holiday. We were on our second trip to Hong Kong as a group of four female friends. we decided to do a tour to understand a bit more about the local ways. So we booked a tour with Big Foot. It turned out this was one of the highlights of our trip. The Big Foot walking tour with Ski was really excellent! Her level of knowledge was very high and her sense of humour and fun made the trip very easy and relaxed. She had taken into account our interests and tailored the tour to cover them. At the end she even took the time to ask what else we wanted to do in Hong Kong and marked where we could find these things on a map.Make sure you visit the coffee tea and Hong Kong style french toast place - yum! As was the dimsum lunch too.I would highly recommend a walking tour with Ski!

Interesting, entertaining and filling!. We booked a private food tasting walking tour for our honeymoon with Ski and the experience was fantastic from start to finish.Ski was helpful and responsive by email, making the booking process very straightforward and offering additional advice on things we might like to see whilst in Hong Kong.The tour itself was fantastic, Ski is such an interesting and well-informed guide. As well as the amazing food we sampled, in places we would never have found by ourselves, we really felt we were getting an insight into a hidden Hong Kong that visitors would not normally see or hear about.In terms of the food, the roast goose was a hit, as was the barbecue pork - come with an open mind and an empty stomach and you'll not be disappointed! We also loved the Hong Kong French Toast, a naughty and delicious treat!A lovely day with a brilliant guide - should we come back to Hong Kong we'll definitely look into a different tour with Big Foot!

Adventures with Maggie . Big foot tours We found Bigfoot via trip advisor, and we are so pleased we decided to book with them. It's a private tours for 4 hours. From the start the communication I had with Ski was impeccable. Ski was very helpful and fast to respond. I had many questions which she answered.It was easy to pay over PayPal and quick. Ski emailed us over the confirmation with maps on where to meet and who our tour guide would be, including a photo. We had the lovely Maggie. We felt so relaxed with Maggie, Maggie was so natural, super passionate about her job and her knowledge about Hong Kong and surrounding areas has know bounds. I love to find out about people and their families, Maggie was very open and answered all my silly questions. My great grandfather is fromHong Kong, so to me it was so very important to learn about the past and the growth of Hong Kong. At the end of our tour we ended with some tasty Dimsum. So yummy. We covered the old and new parts, the worlds biggest escalator, paper shops, medicine shops and local delicacies. Thank you Maggie and Ski for our wonderful tour of Hong Kong

You will LOVE this amazing tour...book it!. Wow! I can't say enough about our wonderful tour with Ski. We were in Hong Kong for 48 hours and I was looking on Trip Advisor to see how we could see the best of the city in such a short time. I found Ski, contacted her via email and easily set it all up from home. We knew we were going up to Victoria's Peak on our own and she even had great advice on how to do that...she also advised us on buying an octopus card which turned out to be so worthwhile! You buy it at a subway station and can use it for all kinds of transportation...including the tram up the Peak |(bypassing ticket lines) and the Star Ferry which is a must....it made it so easy to get around the city...just scan the card! At the end of our trip , we went back to a subway station and got what we didn't use refunded...for a very small fee....it was great....and we knew about it because of Ski. I had read on Trip Advisor that she tailored the trip to you and we really liked that aspect....so whatever you are interested in, she will gear it to that. We like learning about history and culture and she had so many interesting stories about the city...we learned a lot ! Buildings or places that we never would have really noticed came alive with Ski and places we would have noticed became a more enriched experience with her stories and insights...​fascinating. Our tour was the food tour...OMG...the food was amazing!...and at these little local places that yes, we probably could have found on our own but would have taken us much much longer...and she made it so easy...she knows right where to go...can get a table easily even when it looks full and most importantly knows exactly what to order::).,,...everything she ordered for us was delicious....try the goose!...and I am still dreaming about the egg tarts.,...served warm they just melt in your mouth....I only wish I would have had room for another one! You can even pay for this with your octopus card :)Ski knows Hong Kong and loves it....through her eyes we also fell in love with this extraordinary city. She is a wonderful ambassador and Hong Kong is lucky to have her.We spent three weeks in China with 48 hours in Hong Kong and Ski was definitely a highlight of those memorable three weeks.I'm jealous that you have the chance to explore this amazing city with her.Take her tour and you'll know exactly what we mean :)

A must. Such a great experience from the very start. Ski made the building of the tour and booking process so easy. Maggie was our guide who was fantastic. Her knowledge was great and we felt like we were being shown around by a friend.

Stop searching and book Big Foot Tour. It does not get any better than this!. Sky was our personal guide through Hong Kong for a day. She is an amazing resource in a city that is incredible but at times overwhelming. She gave us insider knowledge of the why/what/how of Hong Kong. Our day with her was fun, interactive, and interesting. We did and ate a bit of everything. She is incredibly personable and will guide you to an unforgettable day through one of the coolest cities in the world. I can't wait to go back and have her guide us again. Especially through the food. ;-)

The Best Way to See Hong Kong. This was such a great tour. Over 4 hours our guide, Maggie, took us all over Hong Kong Island. We saw major sites, sites off the beaten path, and Maggie provided tons of background and explanation into the culture of the city. We loved it.The tour was also a fantastic start to our trip. Maggie gave us a list of things to do during our visit based on our interests and they were all great recommendations. She also gave us some tips for getting around the city easier and less expensively.I highly recommend this tour and will definitely use Big Foot Tours the next time we are in Hong Kong.

Maggie & Ski Were Great!. We only had one day in Hong Kong, and are so glad we picked Big Foot Tours to help guide us through the city! Ski was so helpful in getting the tour organized/booked, and Maggie was a wonderful guide for our actual visit. She was so friendly, informative, and flexible. I would recommend this company to anyone who's looking for a great, custom walking tour!

The best walking tour in Hong Kong. Visiting Hong Kong for the first time we decided to do a walking tour. After researching various options we decided upon the Big Foot Walking Tours mainly because of the excellent reviews and feedback from my sisters colleague at work. Booking was efficient and hassle free. We decided to leave the itinerary to Ski and we were not disappointed. Ski met us in the lobby of our hotel at 9am and we spent one of the most interesting, informative days of our holiday walking around Hong Kong. Ski was extremely knowledgable and lovely company. With Hong Kong being so different with regards the culture and beliefs we would not have even scratched the surface or even known what we were looking at if we hadn't done this tour. We were travelling from Hong Kong, to stay in Singapore and then Oman and everyone one has said that this tour was the highlight of our holiday. Ski THANK YOU for a truly wonderful and memorable day.
Wonderful Experience. We had a private tour with Ski and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. She was extremely knowledgable and pleasant. Highly recommend.

Top notch tour. My wife and I like to do food tours wherever we travel. This is one of the best and the most informative tours we ever had. Ski was wonderful, answering all our questions. If you are curious about HK cuisine, do not hesitate. An amazing experience.

Great tour!. I did a private tour with Ski and can only recommend it! Saw a lot of interesting places, learnt a lot about Hongkong culture and history. Ski knows a lot about it and can give really a good insight. Time just flew by!

Brilliant!. Firstly from the moment you book the personal communication and advice is great. We did the 4 hour tour with Maggie who was knowledgeable, interesting and really friendly.This is the only way to see the real Hong Kong and learn about the culture and sample the local delicacies. At the end Maggie even helped us get a taxi so we could get the quick route to Victoria Peak.Excellent - just book it - you won't regret having your own personal guide!

An AMAZING Food Tour with Ski. My friend and I were fortunate enough to spend 4 wonderful hours with Ski on her private Food Tour. I highly recommend the shrimp won ton noodle soup although every place we went the food was interesting and delicious. It was my first trip to Hong Kong so I asked that we also have an overview of the history and culture and Ski was happy to provide.We really felt we were getting a behind the scenes view of Hong Kong, going to restaurants, and neighborhoods that the locals would be familiar with. There was a lot of walking involved which we enjoyed but Ski will work with you to create the best itinerary.Ski was fantastic from my first email query to her. Not only did she answer my questions quickly and thoroughly she also provided off tour suggestions. I doubt we would have discovered the "secret path" on Victoria Peak without her guidance. It was wonderful! Fantastic views without the crowds. I highly recommend Ski and Big Foot Tours.

A must do!. I came across this website on TripAdvisor and after reading the excellent reviews, decided to book one. The communication with Ski was excellent and incredibly organised. Within hours of my query, I had made a booking of a private walking tour with Maggie, had her photo, a photo of the meeting place, a print out of the address in Chinese to pass to the taxi driver and very clear instructions in case we wanted to use public transport! Beforehand, I also mentioned to Ski what we were interested in and Maggie did not disappoint!We met with Maggie at the agreed place and immediately warmed to her. Maggie is full of knowledge, is interesting / interested and with a fab sense of humour! We went of the beaten track, around markets, into temples and to a Chinese restaurant where we were the only foreigners! We loved it!Sadly our time went too quickly but Maggie was even kind enough to put us on a bus so that we could go up to the peak. I would definitely recommend a tour and Maggie too!

Fantastic way to experience Hong Kong. We did this four hour food tour with Ski and can recommend it highly. Ski is knowledgeable and interesting. The tour is tailored to suit your interests and tastes. Ski has lots of interesting anecdotes about Hong Kong and takes you to places that you might otherwise miss. We enjoyed the food in places we would have been a bit intimidated by. At the end of the tour Ski provided a map showing the main things we visited. We used the map to retrace our steps to the places we found most interesting.Cannot recommend this highly enough, thank you Ski!

Great tour away from the tourist traps. Our guide, Maggie, met us as arranged & provided a tour that only a local could provide. We enjoyed seeing old HK, introduced to their unique "HK coffee" - coffee + tea + milk!, & a very tasty dim sum for lunch where we were about the only white faces there.We walked for some hours but it was leisurely & not tiring. Highly recommended.

A brilliant morning. We had a morning walking tour with the ever delightful Ski, she lived up to all my expectations having chosen this tour because of the reviews. It was a delight to spend 4 hours in ski's company, it felt as if you were on a walk with an old friend . We had lots of laughs especially at my husbands difficulty with even the thought of snake soup. We started off in statue square, I must say before I go on , from the minute I contacted ski I found the whole operation very professional , email arrived on time, I had clear directions and photographs of where to meet. These were invaluable given that we had just arrived in Hong Kong about 12 hours earlier . We were taken on a very informative tour which was lots of fun , the perfect combination. We went to places that we would never had been to if we had not taken this tour. We went to local eateries for French toast hong Kong style and then for some local dim sum. We covered the famous buildings, mid elevations, longest escalator in the world soho and a temple along with all the history associated with these places. I cannot recommend Ski highly enough, I always try to get a walking tour when I visit a new city as they are usually so informative and this did not disappoint. Thanks again Ski for putting up with 2 old idiot is we had a ball!Finally I meant to add that when we were leaving ski gave us lots of tips of where to visit and directions, next tip was taking the taxi up to Victoria peak. We really appreciated this when we took the tram down and saw the lines queueing to go up. Thanks ski we will recommend you to our friends who are coming out later in the year

Wonderful Way to See Hong Kong. Two couples spent a one half day with Maggie, and found the day to be well worth the time and money. Ski was great arranging the tour from home, and Maggie did not disappoint. We took local transportation and walked throughout the city. The local perspective was helpful to better understand what makes Hong Kong tick. We went to market places, places of worship and various landmarks and neighborhoods. We ended with an awesome dim sum lunch. Do book this tour at the beginning of your stay in Hong Kong.

Great day with Maggie. WOW! This is one of the best tours we have done. High level of professionalism from first contact with Ski as well as the day of the tour with Maggie. Maggie was extremely knowledgeable, great communicator and helpful. We saw/experienced things that we would not found on our own. We had our 4yr old with us, who was carried much of the walk, but Maggie really made an effort to include her in the experience.

Persounal tour of Hong Kong with Maggie.. Maggie was an excellent and informative guide who spoke excellent English. She was able to escort us to places we would never have found ourselves and, to be the only "western" faces in the restaurant we visited for lunch demonstrated how well the locals rated the place. Thank-you again for arranging such a fantastic day.

Ski is WONDERFUL!. MUST DO! Our guide, Ski, was a perfect fit for my husband and myself. First of a ll, she met us in the lobby of our hotel - so convenient for us! She has an extensive knowledge of Hong Kong history, quaint neighborhoods, and FOODs that we fell in love with. The speciality coffee/tea drink and coconut jam French toast was delightful. And the local dim sum restaurant she took us too was the best experience. She showed us how to order ( a real trick to that) and what to order! The temple experience was also great, as Ski explained so much about what was going on as we went inside. If in Hong Kong, ask for Ski; you cannot go wrong!

Exceptional Walking Tour. Can't say enough good things about our tour with Maggie. Our tour started at our hotel which was a short walk to the Metro. The Metro ride was only 2 stops to begin our tour. We started our tour in a public park. Anyone can point out buildings, Maggie told us about the history, gave us insight about the culture, and did it with humor and expertise. Maggie speaks excellent english and was comfortable answering our questions. She was also attentive to how we were doing on our walk. At one point she offered to take us to a local tea house for a break. What a treat to sit with locals and have a local drink of tea, coffee and milk. Don't be put off by the description, I can't do it justice. Suffice it to say, it was delicious. She ordered the local version of French Toast as well. It was great. We wound our way through local streets, saw a local produce market, fish and meat vendors. One of my favorites was a local herbalist. We watched as "medicines" were portioned, ground and prepared for locals. We visited the Man Mao Temple and watched as people lit incense and made offerings for a good and healthy year. The tour ended at a local Dim Sum shop where she ordered a delicious lunch we all shared. This was a great tour, and I would not hesitate to give it 5 Stars. Don't miss it for a real Hong Kong experience

Walking Tour. We recently participated in a Walking Tour with the charming Ski. She is very knowledgeable and has a charming personality. We were a four travelers and she adjusted the tour to meet all of our needs. The tour was most enjoyable and informative.

Fantastic insight into Hong Kong. We had a great tour with Maggie. Her historical perspective and tour of the off the beaten track places was fabulous. It culminated with our lunch at a local Dim Sum restaurant. Thank you Ski and Maggie!

Amazing, informative tour around Hong Kong. We had a tour around Hong Kong with Maggie who was brilliant. I only wish I knew as much about where I live as Maggie did about Hong Kong it was so informative and Maggie was full of helpful information to use for the rest of our stay such as Vegetarian restaurants. As others have said we were blown away by such a great 4hrs around Hong Kong and the advice about taking a tram to the peak and the train back down was priceless when you see the queues at the bottom of the hill.We had a four hour tour of the city including statue square, mid level escalator, SoHo, mid levels residential area, Hollywood Road, Man Mo Temple, Cat Street Market and the dried seafood and medicine market. I also had the chance to try some unusual foods such as snake:-)We so enjoyed this tour and Maggies company, its worth every penny and would not hesitate to recommend Big Foot Tours.

A day out with Ski!. This tour was a great way to get to know Hong Kong!Ski's explanation of not only the sights of HK but also her knowledge of the social history and the customs of the Chinese people was a real education. The tour of the various shops selling traditional Chinese medicines and remedies was a real eye-opener. We also had a most interesting visit to a temple where Ski was able to explain the ways in which Chinese people carry out the detail of their faith.If your time in Hong Kong is limited then this tour will give you a lot of bang for your buck!

A great introduction to Hong Kong. Ski was a joy to deal with when booking our tour from the UK before arriving in Hong Kong and as she was unable to show us around personally we were shown around by Maggie. The preparation before the tour was excellent for a first time visitor including a photo of our guide and very comprehensive meeting point instructions for which we were very grateful. We had a four hour tour of the city including statue square, mid level escalator, SoHo, mid levels residential area, Hollywood Road, Man Mo Temple, Cat Street Market and the dried seafood and medicine market. We stopped for lunch along the way and had great, cheap dim sum. Maggie was a great guide with excellent knowledge of Hong Kong. She was good humoured and a pleasure to spend a few hours with. She left us with a map and happily marked out the other sites we wanted to see along with details of the route we followed so we could back track if we wanted to. Her advice about arriving at The Peak terminus at 8.30am was a God send. I found Big Foot's details through Trip Advisor and I'm pleased to say the reviews were very accurate.

Big Foot Private Tour with Ski...like travelling the streets of HK with a friend!. My family of three booked a private tour of Hong Kong through Big Foot Tours and it was FANTASTIC!!! First, Ski thank you. Our tour with you was one of the highlights of our time spent in Hong Kong. You really did make us feel like we were walking the streets of Hong Kong with an old friend. Ski took us to great places that we would never have discovered on our own like the first tea-coffee house and winding up many stories to find an awesome busy authentic dim sum restaurant. We covered so much ground in the time spent on the tour. We found that the streets of Hong Kong were not the easiest to navigate on our own, even with a GPS because of all of the walkways above ground level so it was nice being on a tour where we didn't have to waste time trying to find things. Being on the Big Foot Tour with Ski was an extremely efficient way to see the sights and she will customize the tour to include anything you want. It seemed like at every corner Ski was pointing out new and interesting things that would have gone unnoticed if we were wondering around on our own. She really provided us with a local insight to the city. Ski was entertaining, engaging ,knowledgeable plus she had a very comfortable ease that made her fun to spend time with. Even my teenage son says her tour was impressive so if you can keep his attention for hours that is a huge endorsement! Our time on the tour went by so fast. Ski walked us back to our hotel, highlighted on a map all of the sights we saw and then she even gave us directions and helped us plan out what we should see and do for the rest of the day. Awesome!!! I did book our tour months in advance just to make sure I didn't miss out. Emails were all answered super quick and planning and booking were easily done. I would definitely recommend booking a tour with Big Foot Tour. I wish we had more time to do the food tour as well. Next time!

Private Half Day Tour w/ Maggie. We had a half day long tour with Maggie! She spoke great English and was extremely knowledgeable about the history and couture of Hong Kong (she was born here). She took us all around and accommodated us in anyway we wanted such as bathroom breaks, helping us order food, stopping and spending more time at certain places; we never felt rushed. Additionally, we never did anything I would call "touristy" outside of briefly visiting one temple, which is necessary to understand Hong Kong couture. In the end, she was amazing and a must and I can confidently say, I walked away with a better understanding of Hong Kong..

See Hong Kong through the eyes of a true Resident. Wei, our guide with Big Foot was thorough, professional and at the same time provided us with a personal insight into the history, culture and religions of the Hong Kong Area. She met us promptly, provided us with maps so we could come back to areas we wanted to revisit and most of all provided us with true insight into the real life of a Hong Konger! I especially loved the fact the she told us little stories that made the area come to life for us. He knowledge of the history and culture of Hong Kong was amazing. She is one hard working tour guide. It is a walking tour so be prepared to put some miles on your shoes but you take lots of rest breaks so it a very doable tour for most folks!

Excellent tour with Maggie. My wife and I just got back from a cruise to SE Asia. We booked a tour with Ski months in advance and the process was very easy. On the day of the tour Maggie met us at the assigned spot and we began a fantastic day walking through the streets of Hong Kong. Her in depth knowledge and personality made it a wonderful day. We ate local foods, went where the larger tours can't because of their size, and thoroughly enjoyed the day. I can't recommend Bigfoot and Maggie in particular enough. Thanks!

Absolutely fabulous day out!. We booked this four hour tour with Ski as part of a brief day-and-a-half layover in Hong Kong on our way to New Zealand, and we are so glad that we did. It elevated our visit from an enjoyable but aimless visit to something so much more, and ensured that we experienced a different (more genuine?) Hong Kong away from the beaten tourist track. Ski is a natural at what she does - knowledgeable, funny, engaging, informative, and very easy going - and time just flew by. The sights, sounds, smells, food (so much food!), history, anecdotes, and more, that we were treated to during our tour really enhanced our enjoyment and understanding of Hong Kong.So much has already been said by previous 5-star reviewers about how superlatively excellent these tours are, and we don't feel the need to repeat previous praise other than to say that we agree wholeheartedly. Her tours are deservedly popular and it is advisable to book well in advance. Communication beforehand was clear and swift, and Ski gives you plenty of opportunity to tailor the tour to your own interests, should you wish to do so, as well as providing lots of useful tourist information about Hong Kong before your visit. Easily one of the best tours we have had the pleasure of going on anywhere in the world, and one that we will repeat without hesitation if we visit Hong Kong again. Highly recommended!唔該

Great Tour. All arranged by email quick and easy communications, payment in advance using PayPal was quick and easy. Met by Central MTR at 10:00 and had a great day walking in Central with Ski. Stopped for lunch at a traditional push cart Dim Sum in a restaurant where we 2 western tourists were the attraction. Ski was very informative and good to be with; so much to see but never really felt rushed. Very good and value for money.

Excellent Tour!. We just had a brief two days in Hong Kong. We picked a private 4-hour tour with Big Foot Tour because the company seemed most in sync with the flexible-away from the hoards-type tour we wanted. We were not disappointed. Our tour guide Maggie was great, open, direct, fun to be with, and very honest and informative about Hong Kong today. She took us away from the shopping malls and into the neighborhoods where the residents shopped and ate. We really got a sense of the city that we could never have achieved on our own. Our time with Maggie was definitely the highlight of our visit!

Best. Tour. Ever.. Book early and do not miss this tour. Ski is one of the best guides I've ever had and I've toured most of Europe and parts of Asia! Even before we left for HK, Ski was a big help planning the tour sites, recommending restaurants for us to try. She responded to every email quickly and professionally. For example, when I asked her to recommend a dim sum place she immediately suggested we include dim sum in our tour so she could take us to a place where tourists would never go on their own. When I finally met her, I felt like we were already friends!We did a private walking tour that explored many of the better known sites of HK as well as the hidden gems. Ski is friendly, funny, informative and a complete pleasure to tour around with. She showed us so much and gave us so much interesting information I didn't want the tour to end. At dim sum, we tried a sponge cake dessert that I had never tasted before but immediately loved. Ski offered to send me her recipe for this cake. By the time we returned to our hotel, the recipe had been emailed to me. Now that's impressive! In summary (in case you missed it above) we all LOVED this tour and we loved Ski. You will not be disappointed. Ski has earned every one of her "Excellent" reviews.

Great Private Tour. Maggie was a wonderful, informative and charming guide. She took us to parts of Hong Kong that showed us how ordinary people lived. We loved the fruit, vegetable, and dried fish markets. We also loved learning about Hong Kong's architecturally stunning buildings and the stories behind them.

Worth the money. Wonderful tour. During the tour we visited 5 places to see and eat a variety of Chinese dishes. The walking tour guides you through markets and other interesting places including a tram ride. Most of these place you would never find yourself and it would be a missed opportunity. Jess did an excellent job and can highly recommend the tour.

DON'T MISS OUT - TAKE THE TOUR!!!!!. On our recent first visit to Hong Kong we took note of the reviews on Tripadvisor and booked this tour for our first day. What an excellent decision that was - we had a fab tour with Ski who took us to parts of Hong Kong we would never have visited on our own. From our first point of contact with Ski the service she and Big Foot provided were second to none. She took note of where we had planned to visit and then arranged our tour to compliment that. Great insight into Hong Kong life and good advice on other places to visit and directions to get there. Don't panic about the walking part it was all at our own pace. I strongly recommend you take the tour don't miss out on a friendly fab day!!!! Ski thanks for a great day - we found the tailor and now the proud owner of a made to measure suit. Still haven't tried the "hangover" cure but will keep it in mind!!

Fantastic day. Had a four hour tour with our guide Maggie . She was very informative and professional. She took us around all the backstreets of hong kong and to places normal tourists would see. Maggie told us all about the history of hong kong as well as the chineese culture. This trip is a must do if your visiting hong kong .

private walking tour of Hong Kong Island. I highly recommend this walking tour with Ski. Most importantly my mother and I found the four hour walking tour most enjoyable and informative. This tour is tailor made to your wants and is very personal and fun. There was structure to the tour but, to some extent, the itinerary and the content of the conversation was led by our interests. Restaurants were suggested and all those tested were excellent. Ski also suggested other things to do during our stay in Hong Kong. A very intelligent and likeable guide with a wealth of information as well as a keen social conscience. I would suggest taking this tour early on in your visit to Hong Kong. All directions and correspondence from Ski was first rate.

Definite highlight of our trip to Hong Kong. Ask for Maggie - she was fabulous!!! Such an informative interesting tour - the time just flew by! I have done tours in other cities and this was by far the best tour. A definite must for first time and return visitors!

great opportunity in HK. We did the Big-Foot-Tour with our children (10 + 12) in October.It’s a great opportunity to get an insight into Hong Kong’s culture.Maggie our tour-guide picked out the right mix of architecture, temple and food - the time flew by (even for the children ;-)).We really enjoyed our Big-Foot-Tour and it´s a good choice to discover HK and we would recommend booking with them.

Amazing Day in Hong Kong. Upon the advise of other TripAdvisor contributors, we scheduled a tour in Hong Kong. Ski could not personally take us but set us up to meet Maggie at our hotel. We had made this request and she accommodated us. We then hopped on the subway to Central Station. Our education about the city and the people began immediately upon her prompt arrival. We ended our tour at a small Noodle Shop which was a real treat. Thanks to Maggie and Ski for making the start of our holiday a great day.

Big Foot Hong Kong Walking toug with Maggie. I highly recommend this company if you are interested in doing a walking tour in Hong Kong. Maggie was our guide and she did an excellent job! My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the sights and information she shared with us. She was a professional with a good sense of humor - accommodated our every need and was also very flexible when we wanted to go a little off track. She made our trip memorable.

Fantastic tour, must do!. Ski is a great guide, she met us as agreed even though we were a little late, nothing was too much trouble. The tour was centred around food so we visited 3 out of the way restaurants which we would never have found.This is walking based tour involving MTR so be prepared for walking up hills!Thanks Ski!

Fabulous four hour food/history/social/architectural tour with Ski.. Highly recommend this tour. Ski gave us a taste of Hong Kong that we would not have otherwise experienced - local food, interesting historical sites, local architecture and social issues and a temple visit, made for a wonderful day.
Great tour of Hong Kong. We had only one fully day in Hong Kong. Ski was able to show us all the best stuff in Hong Kong. Very informative.

The BEST thing to do in Hong Kong. This half day tour is the best thing we did on our trip to Hong Kong. My husband and I only had a few days to spend in Hong Kong and after doing some research and reading the previous reviews this tour was at the top of my list and I can say it absolutely did not disappoint. My husband and I usually steer clear from any type of tour but we loved it! Ski was so welcoming and knowledgeable there wasn't a question that we asked her that she could not answer. Ski let us go at our own pace and customised the day completely around what we wanted to see and try. I felt Ski definately went above and beyond what was expected and her tour definitely deserves its top spot.

Highly recommended Food tour. We had an excellent half a day food tour with Ski. The service was great and everything was personalized to our level of adventure. We wanted to try some of the local dishes and must do places to eat. It’s always a good sign when you end being the attraction for being the only white people in the packed restaurants. Ski was very careful to make sure we got to try food we might like and let us set the pace. There were so many highlights, but probably the best one was getting to try the century egg in a congee dish and actually liking it. I am sure I would not like it by itself. Ski also has a wealth of knowledge about some of the history and places to see, so we ended up getting much more than we bargained for. This is must do trip.

Private walking tour with Ski. Ski the founder of Big Foot Walking Tours took myself, a 70 year old and my 2 daughters on a 4 hour walking tour of Hong Kong on Tuesday 29th Sept 2015. We just loved every minute of the very informative and exciting walk. Ski took us to heaps of places we would never have found ourselves, she makes the tour very interesting and lots of fun. She organised a Dim Sum lunch for us with all the locals which was great, plus visits to a fish market, a meat market and fresh fruit and veg market. We also visited a temple, a lovely park, a very bare children's playground, the huge escalator to Soho, etc. etc. The walk does involve quite a lot of steps, but it really is the only way to see the real Hong Kong and experience the local life. Well done Ski and many thanks for a very enjoyable tour.

A personalised and interesting tour. This is a walking tour with lots of options. We toured around Kowloon looking at housing and the fascinating markets. Our guide gave us lots of good tips for the rest of our trip too - including getting an Octopus card to use that day which covered our public transport needs for the rest of the trip. They were knowledgeable, flexible and friendly. Highly recommended.

Great morning eating and exploring Hong Kong. I had read the great reviews on Trip Advisor and loved the idea of being able to customise a food tour so contacted Big Foot. Ski replied quickly letting me know it was too early to book in and that she would email me in June with availability. I was impressed that on exactly 1 June I had an email from her suggesting a date and time and providing pricing info and ideas for the tour. We went back and forth over a few emails to sort out our food likes and dislikes. Ski provided clear instructions and photos of our meeting place.During the tour we walked around sampling various Hong Kong specialties including roast goose, roast pork, noodles, stocking tea, French toast, dumplings plus more. When we were full we mixed up the eating with some sight seeing around central, mid-levels and Chinatown. Ski gave us some real insights into the city and the people of Hong Kong plus helpful tips for the rest of our trip.Thanks Ski for a fun and informative morning!

Good introductory tour of Hong Kong. We spent a very good afternoon with Maggie seeing some of the important sights in Hong Kong.We mixed sights with food , although I wish we had done a more focussed food tour.Maggie was very knowledgeable and pleasant to spend an afternoon with despite it being quite hot and humid.

French toast for lunch in Hong Kong?. We tried booking two tours with Ski based on Trip Advisor reviews. She was booked for first tour but we just finished our private food tour with Ski herself! We were so lucky! Ski was personable, caring and knowledgeable. She moved us around the island sharing history, architecture, food and life style effortlessly. We stopped at places we never could have found on our own sharing Hong Kong favorites like the yummiest French toast ever (sorry Ski I forgot the Chinese name already)along with a tea/coffee and evaporated milk mixture that Starbucks needs to add to their product list. Ski was so patient with our Group as husband had hip replacement and moves at own speed... But Ski moved around to talk with each of us /allowing us to ask all sorts of crazy questions but which she could answer with facts and personal answers. I wish we had done this tour on the front end of our trip as would have gone back to a few of the areas to shop. I understand now why she is rated so high/just a great person to spend 4 hours with...book early!

This is hands down the best thing you can do in Hong Kong. My husband found this tour on Trip Advisor and we decided to do a Private Walking tour because we wanted to do things on our own terms. Ski was our tour guide and met us promptly in our hotel lobby because we were not yet ready to venture out onto the subway system on our own!Ski was very friendly and kind and we immediately left for the subway. She helped us buy our Octopus cards and explained how they worked beyond just the metro (ferry, 7-11, Starbucks, etc.). Our tour took us many miles all over Hong Kong Island. I expected it to be your average walking tour, but Ski really impressed. We learned about history, architecture, feng shui, culinary traditions, religion, education practices and lots of other thing we would have otherwise not have learned without her.Our tour was long. I recommend good walking shoes and an open mind. However, if you book a private tour you can totally customize it however you please. Ski is very flexible. Ours was truly a local tour of Hong Kong.She even followed up with us after the trip with additional recommendations for restaurants and things to do. I cannot recommend this enough.

Wonderful 1 day tour of Hong Kong. I only had a day to see Hong Kong, and I sure am glad I asked Ski to be my personal tour guide for the day. She took me to one of the best hole in the wall places for a late breakfast, where locals come to get chicken noodle soup, toast, milk tea and egg tarts. Followed by a thorough immersion into the culture and history of Hong Kong island with plenty of stories thrown in. We had Dim Sum for lunch at one of the few local shops that still has push carts going around with food, and had more than enough to eat. After the tour she even gave me a map with very clear directions on what I can do for the rest of the day visiting Kowloon island and Victoria Peak at night, including directions to the secret spot (definitely the highlight of the trip!). Ski was worth every penny as there was no way I could have seen, done, or learned as much about Hong Kong in the short time I had without her.

Great overview of culture and city. My father and I toured Hong Kong with Ski on a recent business trip. We were very impressed with her knowledge and sweet personality. I will definitely book another tour on my next visit to Hong Kong. We enjoyed the tour very much!

The real Hong Kong. My wife, 15 year old daughter and I spent 4 yours with Ski who showed us "the real Hong Kong" with out being hassled to buy anything. Nothing was to much trouble for Ski who was knowlegeable, informative and exceptionally well organised. She answered any questions we had and believe me we asked some!!!Ski is a caring person who is building a great business and we will use her again when we visit Hong Kong again which is the best recommendation I can give. Thankyou Ski. See you again

Do This as the First Tour of Hong Kong. Reading others reviews, I booked Ski about 3 months in advance of knowing that my group of friends would like an overview of HK and what we should see. Ski was AWESOME. A couple of people had been to Kong Kong before for business but not as tourists. Her directions/instructions were fantastic. I'm pretty thorough (read: pretty anal) so I did my research about the MTR and the ease about getting around HK. To save time and maximize our time with Ski, I opted to meet her the financial district. She sent us the directions with photos of where to meet and what symbols to look for (everything is in English and I shamefully only learned about two words in Cantonese because English was so widely used in Hong Kong). I totally recommend buying the Octopus card upon arrival. I think we spent 150 HKD and we never had to add more money and we used the MTR and ferries quite often (we were only there for a week). But back to the tour, since we didn't have a preference of where to go, I asked for a general overview of Hong Kong.Overall, wonderful - we went to have a bite to eat at Lan Fong Yuen (a place we would probably not venture on our own), walked through the Chinese medicine place (I can't remember what it was called, but very interesting remedies for various maladies), had lunch at a dim sum place, visited one of the oldest temples. I have only hit on the major points, but throughout the tour, she talked about culture and lifestyle of Hong Kong, the people, and some history. Once we were done, she had great recommendations of going to Victoria Peak (but take a taxi since the tram lines would be super long and we weren't missing much on the trams), how to get to other areas of interest (flower market, bird market, lady's market), and also a map that showed us where we went and if we needed to retrace our steps for any reasons. Ski also offered that we could text/email her if we had any further questions!Knowing what I know now, I would have booked for an additional tour on the Kowloon side (I'm assuming that Ski offers that tour!). We ended up walking to various sites on our own, but with someone who has the local knowledge, I know our group would have appreciated her knowledge.Totally recommend - and as others have said, do Ski's tour at the beginning of the trip!

Great intro to HK. My partner and I had a four-hour tour on our first full day in Hong Kong and it was great. We booked based on other Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. Our guide Maggie was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. She gave us a great taste of the history and meaning behind much of Central and Sheung Wan. The cultural and historical aspects were interesting without being dry, and Maggie's familiarity with the area led us to places we otherwise would have walked past.Highly recommended!

A superb introductory tour of Hong Kong. We began our short visit to Hong Kong with a Big Foot food tour. Our guide, Ski herself, was knowledgeable, witty and good company. She looked after us from our meeting at the HSBC building until putting us into a taxi for Victoria Peak four hours later. As well as introducing us to a range of Chinese foods, the dim sum restaurant being the highlight, she provided a flow of relevant information on Hong Kong and its history. Before our tour began she advised us to get Octopus cards for the metro and afterwards she emailed us her recommendations on Chinese restaurants. We loved our visit to Hong Kong and Ski's tour set just the right tone with which to begin it.

Fantastic Tour of HK. I have been late to write this review but I often think about how great it was and have often recommended the tour with the Big Foot Crew. It's a great combination of learning about HK life from street food, local religion and restaurants.

Excellent Tour. Ski gave us a private exceptional 4 hour tour of Hong Kong Island on the 06 Aug 15, which suited my wife and I perfectly. She was punctual, very intelligent, easy to talk to and above all very informative and knowledgeable about Hong Kong and Chinese culture (even the 100 day old eggs). The advantage of this tour was Ski took us into places to eat and drink, that neither my wife or I as westerners would have ever ventured into, the experience was truly magical. I would strongly suggest any travellers to Hong Kong to take a Big Foot tour. Once the tour was over the assistance did not stop there and she suggested things for us to do over the remaining 3 days. From our first contact with Ski back in May 15, the information provided was brilliant and some of the information provided about the MRT and Octopus card was invaluable. Thank you Ski, best regards Colin & Nikki

A Personalized, Real, and Insightful Tour. My husband I and I arranged a tour with Ski this June and it was a true highlight of our trip! While going on our walk with Ski we were taken to places we would have never come past on our own. Throughout the walk we felt as if were with a friend, getting to know their city. Ski is very knowledgeable of Hong Kong's culture and history. It is because of this true knowledge that it is so easy for her to show and tell Hong Kong with great conversation (instead of rattling off facts as some other tour may do). With her help we were able to experience restaurants that we would have missed and get real experiences with delicious food! Ski also gave us tips for future sightseeing and entertainment. I highly recommend this tour. It will allow you to see places beyond what's on the Top Lists and guidebooks. Ski is your ticket to a piece of the real Hong Kong :)

First class tour of Hong Kong. My fiancé and I were recommended to book a tour on Big Foot Tours. I could not thank my friend enough for the recommendation. Our tour guide, Joe, was one of the best tour guides we’ve ever had. He took us around the Central and Western districts and taught us some history and about everyday life in Hong Kong. We had the opportunity to see the community where Joe grew up and try some of the local food. I recommend trying everything because it is all delicious! Joe went above and beyond expectations by dropping us off at the ferry at the end of the tour so we could go over to the Kowloon side AND gave us a map with all of the locations we visited for us to remember everything. And to top it off, we received a call the next morning from Ski Yeo (the owner of Big Foot Tours) just to make sure our tour met our satisfaction. Lauren and I want to say thank you again to Ski and Joe for a great Hong Kong experience!

Real Look with Ski from Big Foot!. Tip Top! Can't agree more with the rest of the reviews! If you are looking to avoid tourist traps and get a sincere real look into the daily lives of Hong Kong, book with Ski from Big Foot! Wunderful experience, welcoming, we are very satisfied customers!Kate & Pieter

Awesome insider look into Hong Kong!. This tour is absolutely fantastic! We are so glad that we booked this tour. Having done other tours in other cities, Big Foot Tour tops the list! We were very lucky to get Ski the owner as our personal guide. Her attention to details is amazing with stories and humour that got us going throughout the summer heat.Thanks, Ski!

Excellent trip. We did a food tour with Ski and it was excellent, informative and a good laugh. We had a great time, well worth the booking as we were only in Hong Kong for a few days and managed to experience the non Tourist eateries and attractions.

Big Foot 4 Hour Private Walking Tour. We have been to Hong Kong a couple of times before but never done a walking tour. Our guide Ski gave us a fascinating insight into life here. We were able to tailor the walk to whatever we were interested in. I booked the tour online beforehand and paid upfront which was all very straightforward. Ski also gave us useful advice re the Octopus Card system before we arrived which made our life much easier. She was quick to reply to my emails and after the tour when I sent her another request for more information she answered immediately. We would highly recommend Big Foot Tours.

Absolutely brilliant - you have to do this !. We were only in Hong Kong for a few days but managed to get a food tour booked in with Ski herself and it was one of best things we did !!! Not only is Ski a lovely, funny, knowledgeable lady, but she also really takes on board your personal interests and wishes when planning the route and places to take you. I can honestly say I wouldn't have been brave enough to go into any of the places she took us without her but they were all really tasty and fresh and felt like we closer to another side of Hong Kong not always available to visitors.

Great way to experience Hong Kong . Had a half day food/cultural tour of Hong Kong with Joe. He meet us in the lobby of our hotel and off we went. He took us to the markets and restaurants we wouldn't have gone too without a local. Very informative, friendly, and easy to relate to as my wife and I were around the same age as him. If you want a tour guide who's passionate about his city and culture book a tour with Joe and Big Foot Tours.

The Highlight of Our Hong Kong Visit. Ski was our tour guide and she was the best. Friendly, funny, very clear in her descriptions and a good listener as far as what we wanted to see. She delivered on all levels. She even gave us a map and advice for our plans after her tour and the following day. She was so knowledgeable and had just the right mix. I highly recommend Big Foot Tours. My husband and I both agree and tell all our friends it was the highlight of our Hong Kong stay. Definitely use Big Foot Tours.

Great Guide. I had been to Hong Kong, on business, before, but never got to experience the city as we did with Ski. She was knowledgeable, passionate, and customized the tour based on what we wanted to see and experience. Definitely would recommend for both new, and returning, visitors to Hong Kong.

Fantastic . The walk with Joe was a highlight of my trip and really enhanced the rest of my time in Hong Kong - I noticed and appreciated so much more of what was around me. And it was delicious! The time and care put into planning our route was obvious and I also appreciated the way Joe adapted as he got a better sense of my interests (and as I acknowledged the limits of my stomach). The folks at Big Foot were a pleasure to work with - they were recommended to me by a close friend and I've already recommended them to a work colleague. Can't get much higher praise than that, I don't think.

Excellent tour to get you up close and personal with the everyday Hong Kong. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our 4 hour walking tour with Joe. It gave us insight into the daily life of people who live there. Joe took us to a restaurant and Tea House we would not have tried on our own. He knew many people and places of interest. We had gone on the Big Bus tour the previous day and saw all the "check list" places ... like Victoria Peak, Stanley Market and Aberdeen Bay. They were terrific to see but on their own you don't get a true sense of Hong Kong life. The Big Foot tour with Joe filled in that space wonderfully. I strongly suggest you do both.... well worth the time and money!!

Best way to discover Hong Kong!. We booked this tour having seen it was so highly rated on TripAdvisor. We therefore had rather high expectations and we were not disappointed. Ski was extremely helpful before we had booked it and replied swiftly to all of our queries. This tour would probably be best at the beginning of any stay in Hong Kong. We were unable to do so but Ski had very helpfully suggested a number of places for us to visit beforehand that wouldn't be covered on our tour.Our tour was with Ski who is a lovely, friendly person. It was a four hour tour (not tiring) during which we saw and learned a lot. Ski provided us with a great detail of interesting information and was able to take us to places that we could not have found with a guide book. We found the whole tour fascinating and enjoyable. It was great to have such a personal experience which gave us a real insight into the history and culture of Hong Kong. We would highly recommend this tour. Thanks Ski!

Best Tour Ever. I highly recommend this tour. My daughter and I went on a walking tour led by Joe. He expanded our knowledge and understanding of the Chinese and Hong Kong cultures and practices. His comments and recommendations positively impacted the rest of our stay in Hong Kong. Big Foot is by far the best tour I have ever been on and definitely worth the cost.

A worthy number 1. So pleased to see this small business number one on trip advisor.So deserved. The communication from Ski is perfect. Joe, our tour guide was so enthusiastic and knowledgeable. Learning from Joe easily doubled our enjoyment of our trip. Without this tour we would had seen but not understood. Outstanding.

Well Informed , friendly guide showing us the unusual and interesting. This was a wonderful way to see the real Hong Kong. I booked the tour on line and received immediate confirmations plus details on the suggested itinery and where to meet up. Could not have asked for better information. We booked a private tour as we had our two ten year old grandsons with us. Our guide Joe kept us all absolutely engaged and the boys came back with a good overall appreciation of the historical, cultural and political history. Joe shared with them not only his knowledge but glimpses into his own childhood growing up in the area. While we had visited Hong Kong many times dating back to 1968 we too discovered new and fascinating areas of Central. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending Big Foot tours and Joe to anyone one visiting Hong Kongsho wants to go past the usual shopping experience. Joe also knows the best places for dumplings a real plus for the boys.

A great way to experience the real Hong Kong.. My wife and I had the pleasure of spending four hours with Ski on her Big Foot walking tour. We booked the tour prior to leaving home and Ski made everything so easy. We met Ski at a pre-arranged location which was easy to get to via MTR. Ski is lovely and we felt really relaxed in her company. She has a wealth of knowledge about the culture and history of Hong Kong and shed new light on the architecture of the city. The walking was relatively easy and Ski made sure we moved at a comfortable pace. We enjoyed a morning tea of "Coffeetea" and HK style french toast thats made with Kaya (Coconut Jam). We enjoyed this so much Ski went out of her way to take us to a supermarket so we could buy our own Kaya to bring home. It was fascinating to visit different areas and get an insight into each. The Dim Sum restaurant for lunch with the locals was also a highlight. I could go on and on.... Ski gave us an appreciation of Hong Kong that we would not otherwise have gained. It gave us more confidence to get out and explore. Our advice would be to do this tour early in your visit. Ski will give you some handy tips and advise on must do attractions while in HK. It will enhance the remainder of your stay. Thanks again Ski and we look forward to seeing you on our next visit to Hong Kong.

It's all about you!. This was our best experience in Hong Kong. It was our first trip to Hong Kong and the size of the city can be overwhelming. Big Foot Tours changed this by taking an exciting, busy city into a personal experience that won't be forgotten. The booking was easily done online and prior to departing on our vacation we received all the details we needed. Pictures of the location and of our tour guide Joe, were sent to our email address without even being requested. In addition, tips were given to us on how best (time and cost) to get to our meeting place from our hotel. The tour lasted 4 hours and was tailored to us. It included interesting information about past and present Hong Kong, that were tied into the areas we were walking through. The style of the tour was relaxed and was adjusted upon our request and interest. While we could have wondered through the streets of Hong Kong, doing so without a guide would have not been nearly as enjoyable. Thanks Big Foot Tour and Joe for making our trip so memorable.

HK on Foot is a Must with Big Foot Tours. My husband and I had the pleasure of a customized Big Foot four-hour walking tour of Hong Kong on a recent trip to China. We booked the trip with the help of the owner, Ski, who responded promptly and very helpfully to my various emails. She suggested routes off the beaten track, as well as restaurants and other attractions. Our guide was Joe, a lovely young man who was both informative and interesting. Given time constraints, we met him a few hours after we landed in HK from NY, and it turned out that our walk was a great way not only to get acclimated to HK, but also to push off jet lag until evening and get more quickly into the local time zone. He gave us a fabulous introduction to the various neighborhoods of HK island, and provided really fascinating background on history, the local political situation and the culture. We learned a lot we otherwise would never have known. Can't recommend this tour highly enough.

Under the Hong Kong Island Skies with Ski. My husband Gayden and I were recently visiting Hong Kong island and booked a 4 hour tour with Ski of Big Foot Tours. She provided everything we wanted and more for our first day in Hong Kong. I always like to get an overview of a new area with some history and culture and top sites to visit, shopping and eating tips, and understanding of how to navigate transportation systems. Ski was attentive to all of my individual requests to see temples and learn more about Chinese medicine. She provided a thorough and fascinating tour of the Central area on Hong Kong Island.We also visited a wonderful traditional coffee and tea shop for snacks and a fabulous dim sum restaurant for lunch.I would highly recommend Big Foot Tours and especially Ski to anyone visiting Hong Kong for the first time and for the twenty first time.She is full of intriguing facts and quite knowledgeable and professional.

Hong Kong under the skin. we have recently spent 4 pleasant hours in the company of Ski, who gave us more information in that time than we would have got from any guide book.As we only had a couple of days in HK we wanted to experience and gain information on everything that we should do in that time. Ski did not disappoint, we learnt more than just where the standard tourist spots were. I would certainly recommend Big Foot to anyone that intends to travel to HK and wants to cram everything in. Thanks Ski for helping to make our trip so much more than the ordinary.

More than just a history of food (be open to what Joe teaches you!). I booked this tour for myself, then ended up having a few friends join. Speaking personally, I thought it was an excellent tour, although it wasn't as food focused as I had originally thought (not a bad thing from my perspective).Joe provided A LOT of history, background and personal reflections on his thoughts on the current state of Hong Kong. I found it to be interesting and insightful, but my companions were hoping for a tour that explained more food history than political. Again, that's just preference. The food places he brought us to I thought were wonderful, as was the ability to see so many different parts of the city on foot. We ate everything from congee to BBQ pork, authentic pork knuckle soups (not for the faint of heart) and he tried repeatedly to find us an open egg tart place. Since they were all closed, he recommended one in the market for the next day which was THE BEST EGG TART IN THE WORLD!Anyways all in all great experience. Just want to note that you get a lot of history, and personal reflections, along with the food tours. I would say it is actually more history and current state of affairs information than it is food (but you still eat a lot and are very full). A little different than what I was originally looking for, but actually a nice surprise.

Highlight of our Hong Kong trip.. Joe is amazing. Everything was beyond our expectations.He had asked us if we were interested in Hong Kong's history and culture while we were going through different food places -- we said yes but were worried we might get bored from it. Turns out Joe told us a lot of stories & facts in very interesting ways. We were impressed by his knowledge and memory. Anyway, this is the highlight of our Hong Kong trip. Also, it was our 1st food tour out of the many cities that we have traveled to. We loved it and plan to do food tours more often while traveling in the future.

Outstanding experience. This was our first trip to Hong Kong after several visits to other parts of Asia. We would highly recommend this tour to first timers or those wanting to see more of daily life in Hong Kong, Joe is a great guide providing historical backgrounds and insights. Overall a great experience.

The best tour we have ever had and we have had many.. The best tour we have ever had and we have had many. I especially appreciate Joe's energy, and intellectual curiosity. We really got a feel for Hong Kong history, daily life and culture. We loved that we saw so many things we would never have been able to see by ourselves. In particular, having Joe take us into the Dim Sum place, the tofu place and the Conge place was just what we were looking for: the opportunity to sample Hong Kong foods that are favoured by locals. We would never have found them and even if we had, our time there would have been more stress than fun as we would have been spending a lot of energy dealing with the culture and language barriers instead of appreciating the food and the people. I also appreciate that Joe was not only able to accommodate our particular interests but he was also able to stay with his own agenda to educate us about daily life in Hong Kong. I wish we had "Joe Clark" on the rest of our trip.

What a fantastic insight. We had visited Hong Kong 23 years ago and were keen to learn what is different now in Hong Kong. Joe was an excellent guide, any question we asked Joe he would give us a real understanding of all the issues facing Hong Kong over the coming years.Hong Kong has become even busier so experiencing the new transportation methods and working out how people live in those highrise buildings was very interesting. The markets and the food on the streets is Hong Kong and Joe urged us to try places that we wouldn't have done without his knowledge, which was a really enjoyable experience.I would highly recommend Big Foot Tours - a really great way to start a visit to Hong Kong.

Great tour. Joe was a fantastic tour guide. We've lived in HK for 10 years and my inlaws have travelled to HK regularly for 40 years. On the tour we followed a well trodden path but to our surprise we discovered the fascinating history of central and western district along with some great food and drinks we have forever overlooked. I would highly recommend this tour to HK incumbents and tourists alike. There is a lot to learn from a passionate and well versed guide like Joe who shapes the tour to your needs and wants across the 4 hour journey through the back streets of HK.

Wonderful tour!!. Stayed in HK on a 3 day stopover en route to Australia and chose Ski based on existing Trip Advisor reviews.What a great choice.We had the most comprehensive tour of the city...Ski is just an amazing guide,she took us to places where most tourists wouldn't dream to visit. An introduction to authentic Chinese food was fascinating.We had a great time and felt that after just a few hours we had made a real friend.If you are in HK and want an in-depth,informative,enjoyable and friendly tour then look no further....you will not be disappointed.Ann & Andy

Brilliant way to start the trip!. When travelling to somewhere new we always like to try and do a walking tour to get the lie of the land and our bearings. After much googling of reviews and walking tour companies we could not find one more highly recommended than Big Foot Tours. The communication with Ski to set up our tour was excellent - he and Joe (our guide) ensured that we had everything we needed to start our tour! We selected a Private tour which was very reasonably priced. Payment was easily done and was very secure. Communication was excellent - all our questions were answered before we even asked them and we got some great tips on how to set ourselves up for our days in Hong Kong.On the day of the tour we met our guide Joe at Chater Gardens at Central. It was an easy place to meet and we luckily scored a gorgeous warm day! Joe found us easily and was really pleasant and friendly! Being our age it was fantastic to talk to someone who had similar interests and Joe really did a fantastic job of personalising the tour to what we were interested in. The time just flew by and we loved seeing some local eating spots and how real locals live, trying some local food (try the tea and toast!!), and seeing things from a different point of view! Joe had a great historical knowledge, a charming accent (having lived in the UK), and was really engaging and interesting to chat to! When our tour concluded Joe kindly went through the map with us of where we had gone, pointed out some great things we could do (which we did over the next few days!) and helped us find the bus to get to the Peak so we could continue our sightseeing. We really can't recommend Big Foot enough. If you want to experience the REAL Hong Kong with lovely interesting people then Big Foot is the way to go. We have recommended to our family and friends and hope to come back and see a different side of things another time! Thanks Big Foot and Joe!.

Perfect way to start your stay in Hong Kong. Based on the recommendation of family members, we booked a tour with Big Foot for the first morning of our short stay in Hong Kong. Fresh off the plane, Joe met us in our hotel lobby and immediately had us aquatinted with the area and the MTR system. Joe was a fantastic guide - he used our interests to tailor a tour that suited us perfectly. While we had both been to Hong Kong before, the tour gave us insights into the people and culture that we would have never known ourselves. Joe also showed us many hidden gems, pointing out areas that we otherwise would have walked straight past. Taking the tour at the beginning of our stay, Joe also provided us with some recommendations for things to do and places to visit/eat at for the remainder of our trip. We also found ourselves returning to the areas we visited with Joe as we'd enjoyed them on the tour. I'd highly recommend the tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong, as not only does it enable you to make the most out of your stay, you'll also learn a lot from a friendly and knowledgeable guide.

Fantastic introduction to Hong Kong.. We booked out tour with Ski for our first morning in Hong Kong, so it really was our introduction to the city and people. From the moment we met Ski it was obvious this was going to be a success. We started with an introduction to Feng sui as demonstrated by some of the downtown bank architecture, and as we walked and explored different areas, more of the superstitions and beliefs of the Chinese people were explained. This included a trip to a temple where we learned about attitudes to ancestors and fortune telling. We tried a 50/50 coffee/tea mix drink and sampled Dim Sum. Probably should not have eaten such a substantial breakfast so we could eat more. We enjoyed seeing the preserved foods and hearing about their use in Chinese medicine. Loved seeing the wet markets (I wish we could get our meat and fish that fresh) and declined the preserved eggs. Perhaps my palate is not as adventurous as I thought. We road on the longest escalator, walked through different neighborhoods, saw a school and learned about the education system and tutoring. The four hours passed very quickly and it was amazing to see where we had been on a map afterwards. Ski provided useful suggestions and maps for things to do while in Hong Kong and was extremely helpful.I would recommend anyone to arrange a tour with Ski. It is an excellent introduction to Kong Kong and she will customize the tour to one's interests as be as specific or eclectic as desired.

Great experience for foodies. Joe was our guide and he was brilliant. He caught the train from Kowloon meeting Joe at Central railway station. Everything went very smoothly from the start with our walking tour kicking off with some HK history. My friends and I are all very interested in food so we were keen to experience how the locals eat. Joe listened to us and really delivered with our 4 hours together just flying. We were surprised as our tour was coming to an end as to how far we had walked and the number of food stops we had made. To save time walking back to Central Joe accompanied us on a double decker tram and then we only had a short walk to catch the Star Ferry back to Kowloon. We had an awesome time and can't wait to visit HK again and do another Big Foot tour.
Perfect taste of Hong Kong. We only had a short visit to Hong Kong and I am so glad we booked the sightseeing with Joe and Big Foot Tour. It was perfect in every aspect!

Brilliant. Walk, listen, learn and eat!. This was my second tour with Joe, but the first for my sister, who used to live in HK 30+ years ago, when she was a Wren in the Royal Navy. I'd asked for a tour which might emphasise to big sis how much the place has changed, since those days of empire. Joe and Ski pointed out that I might be re-hearing the same stuff, but I wasn't at all concerned, as a) my memory is shot, and b) there was so much more to learn from my first trip about 2 years ago.Since then, of course, there have been the demonstrations, and as we asked, Joe wasn't shy in expressing his views. Anyway, the tour was a mighty success for my sister, and for me.I can't recommend it more highly. Joe's antecedents, (half Hong Kong and half UK) gives him an excellent foot in both camps, and to hear him switch from regular English when talking to us, and then to Cantonese when talking to restaurant owners etc, was a joy to behold. His is a wonderful talent, a gift, and I hope he uses it wisely in the future. I know there are ex-pats doing walking tours, but this is entirely different, and so much the better for it. Just the two of us - really personal and private. Really good stuff.Next time, Joe, my wife and I will do a food tour with you....

Hong Kong with a local. From the moment Joe met us in our hotel lobby till it was time for him to send us back to our hotel we were immersed in Hong Kong.We learned so much in the 4 hour tour.When Joe gave us the map at the end we realized how far we had travelled and how much of Hong Kong we had experienced.We used the Star Ferry, the escalator and tram to get around.The highlight was the traditional Dim Sung meal we had with Joe picking out all the courses and giving us a lesson in the use of chop sticks much to the delight of the staff.The markets were so interesting.We got to see where Joe played as a small child.Our only regret is that the tour ended too soon.We were not tired!We were given suggestions to see places on our own and they were spot on.We hope Joe will do us the favour of visiting our village some day and showing him around!We have resident mountain sheep which is the sign of the year this year!Don't hesitate to book this company when in Hong Kong!

Joe gave an excellent tour- very informative and interesting.. We learned so much. Joe has spoken English and Mandarin all his life, and has lived in hong kong almost his entire life, so he was easy to understand. He knows the city's history very well. We definitely recommend this tour!

Walking tour of Hong Kong island- central and western districts. My husband and I did a walking tour with Joe. It was an amazing tour. The tour started with an informative history lesson about Hong Kong. He then took us to areas of the city that are off the beaten path. Where the locals live and shop. He was extremely knowledgeable and more than willing to answer questions and take us to places we wanted to see. We tried local cuisine especially foods specific to Hong Kong. It is a full four hours and about a 5 k walk. It is probably the best tour we have been on and we have done many. Joe was fabulous.

Walking Discovery with a 4 year old during Chinese New Year 2015. First of all, I would like to thank Ski for the prompt responses to my emails. I was not sure if I wanted to do the tour because I have a 4 year old boy - and those that have kids understand my concern. I asked her if she had anything that would peak his interest such as dragons, traditions for the New Year holiday or any interesting historical landmarks. She put together a sample itinerary of what would best suit our needs. I was still hesitant on some of her suggestions yet she assured me that it would be enjoyable - and she was right!Our tour guide was Joe and he met us at our hotel in the Mongkok area (highly suggested if you are into all the markets). We then took the subway all the way to Central and he was very engaging from the very start. He didn't bore us with facts - he told us about his daily life in Hong Kong and his concerns. He also showed us the parts of the city which were significant to the historical aspect of Hong Kong.We walked down a high-end street sort of like Beverly Hills and then turned off into a side street - you would have never found this on your own. It was like another world hidden within the majestic Hong Kong. It was a very crowded market with food stalls, vegetables, meat and fish and people getting ready for the Chinese New Year. We saw turnips being peeled and he told us turnips were a symbol of luck and that we would be eating some later. We stopped off at a small restaurant for traditional Hong Kong meal of rice congee and pork and my son had a random lesson in Chinese from a man sharing a table with us. After eating, we walked some more and visited the mid-level escalators and then visited Joe's old school. I appreciated this part because he was being very interactive with my son and even took him to a typical Hong Kong playground.
