My son was interested in all of Joe's stories and Joe did not seem annoyed or irritated at the amount of questions! We also visited the Man Mo Temple and this history was intriguing and we bought some incense. My son also paid his respects in the temple and Joe told him about all the hanging red papers and wishes to ancestors. After the temple, we walked to a restaurant to have typical Dim Sum. The food and service was great because Joe could communicate for us and get us every dish we desired from dumplings to pork.Even after the tour, Joe gave us a map and pointed us in the right direction for other places to explore. We had only signed up for a half day tour and it was well worth it. His direction led us to the Cat Street Market where a Chinese Man decided to spend 40 minutes teaching my son how to write Chinese Characters for the New Year Signs!Do this tour. You will get much more out of Hong Kong even if you believe you have done all your research. It is best to see it from the eye of a Local and find the hidden gems! Thanks so much Joe and we hope you are able to visit Texas one day - don't hesitate to contact us!

Private tours is a perfect way. I enjoyed spending a day in Hong Kong. I took a taxi from the airport into Hong Kong central, and spent the whole day walking around, exploring, having fun and seeing things. I think having someone to help you know where to look, and to explain what you're looking at is invaluable

A perfect way to see Central!. We met Ski in the morning to enjoy a walking tour the city. What a treat! She mixed the perfect amount of history with cultural folklore. She took us to the greatest eateries--a traditional breakfast, Hong Kong style coffee, and then dim sum lunch. We loved going to the "local" spots and Ski even made sure to meet my dietary restrictions! We hit the world's largest escalator at precisely the right time, watching the change from down to up. We have friends living in HK and we told them all about the tour and they have plans to meet with Ski too! Highly recommend!

Backstreet insights and dumplings. Ski is an amazing young woman with a rich insight into local culture and beliefs, making the walking tour through the backstreets of Hong Kong Island absolutely fascinating. Discovering local food delicacies along the way made us feel like locals. The dumpling restaurant is somewhere the average person would never know about without a guide, so we are glad to have experienced some genuine local fare:) We engaged in great discussions on many topics and Ski was able to share cultural perspectives, so that we now have a better understanding of how many think, believe and live in Hong Kong. A great tour led by a competent guide who demonstrates understanding, intelligence and humour. Well worth the money and time.Bruce and Marion M (Australia)

So informative and exciting. My guide Joe was the perfect host and knew so much about Hong Kong it blew my socks off. He showed me bits of HK that other tourists dont get to see and explained things that other tourists dont get to know. Fascinating 4hrs. Highly recommend. You wont be disappointed

Snake Soup Tastes Like Chicken!. Joe is one of those "people" people that instantly make you feel comfortable. We took the food tour our last day in the city, thinking we had already explored pretty well on our own, mainly just looking for some unique food experiences. My goodness, were we wrong! Joe took my son and I to areas we had never come close to visiting and also to areas within a block of our hotel that we never had a clue existed! As for the food, my son is an "adventurous" eater, to say the least, and Joe cheerfully fed him snake soup, amazing "toast", plucked lids off of any number of bamboo dim sum baskets looking for just the right thing. The whole day was fantastic and one of the highlights of our trip!

Great introduction to a great city. This walk is a perfect way to see and understand a Hong Kong that you don't come in contact with as an ordinary tourist. Ski did an excellent job by taking us to streets and places we surely would have missed on our own while all the time telling us interesting facts and stories about the city and its people, culture, history, architecture etc. The walk lasted for a bit more than four hours including tea and lunch breaks at places we never would've found and probably never would've dared go in to. However, with Ski's help we got to taste several unique Hong Kong delicacies. This tour made our Hong Kong visit so much better and Big Foot really deserves its top rating.

Now i understand the real hong kong. We normally do the bus tour in any city we visit, but decided to do something different for a change.What a great decision that was as we spent four hours learning about Hong Kong by listening to Joe. He is intelligent, has worldly experience beyond his years and a passion to get us to understand his home town and the way people live.We really wanted to see behind the scenes on Hong Kong island. We saw the wet markets, travelled part of the longest escalator, visited areas that are expat oases and cursed neighbourhoods. We tasted foods and drinks that were such a surprise- milk tea and toast with coconut jam and golden syrup. A bag of freshly made char siu honey bbq pork was astonishing. Learning about various religious groups and some of the supersticions was truly fascinating.After 3 hours plus of walking, back to where we started on the tram.Joe summarised what we had seen, gave us tips of other areas to visit and what to see there and where to eat- every suggestion on the money.The whole experience was way beyond our expectations and i can only urge you to enjoy the same if you are in Hong Kong

This tour is something you must do. Don't come to Hong Kong without booking this tour. We decided to book this tour because of the fantastic ratings we saw on trip advisor- so we expected it to be good - but it was amazing. Ski showed us the Hong Kong behind the glitz and glamour - giving us amazing information about history, architecture, culture, customs, food and more. We were very thankful we did this tour at the start of our holiday as the information helped us for the whole trip. Thanks Ski we will never forget this tour.

Best part of the trip. I cannot express enough how lucky I am to have come across Big Foot Tours on Trip Advisor! Traveling in Hong Kong for business with a couple of free days, I was able to book Joe for an afternoon tour. Joe is so knowledgeable and brilliant and I felt as if I was exploring the city with an old friend. I would definitely recommend going more of the local route- forget the Peak (see it, but on your own) - Joe takes you on an authentic adventure through back roads and less visited parts of the city. He lets you truly experience Hong Kong from the markets (I even got to try a cough drop at the medicine market) to the local restaurants (try the goose and the toast it was so yummy!) while giving you a history lesson at every turn. Big Foot Tours was so helpful and super flexible in making this a trip to remember. You can give guidelines of what you do and do not want to see, and leave the rest up to Joe and you will not be disappointed. Ever since I got back to the states, I haven't stopped raving about the adventure with Joe and am already planning my next trip for more ecploring. Joe gave me a map at the end of the tour with all the places we stopped at, which was a perfect souvenir! Joe even gave me pointers for the next leg of my trip to Cambodia. I never leave reviews, but in the chance this can sway someone to book a tour with Big Foot and have a life changing experience, I had to post about my experience. Thank you again Joe and Ski and if you ever make it to New York, please let me return the favor of being your tour guide!

See the real Hong Kong. Big Foot tours does a brilliant job of showing you Hong Kong, there is nothing touristy about it. We did a 4 hour walking tour which took us to HK island via the subway, and did an4!hour foodie tour the next day! Joe ask us what we were interested in, he knew his history and took us places we would have never gone, and we ate things that I know I would have never eaten. It was a great private tour and if I ever make it back to HK they will be my 1st call!

Big Foot's Joe the LEGEND!!!. When visiting HK; if you don't book Big Foot Tours you haven't experienced HK. Myself and husband met with Joe for a tour of indigenous HK. Joe left it with us to choose how we wanted our tour to go. Joe is fascinating and schooled us both, for which we will forever be grateful. Joe was a really friendly and educated person. PLEASE don't have Big Foot Tour taking you to tourist attractions like The Peak or Big Buddha, this is a waste!Joe started our tour within the financial district to where it all began! He started with HK's history of the opium wars and Britain's 99 year lease. We then walked into street markets, fashion districts and high/low density areas. Joe took us to local restaurants where we sampled PROPER tea and toast and dim sum. The dim sum restaurant Joe took us to will forever stay with me as a life experience, dim sum was serviced using old school steam trollies.The booking process was easy and Ski was really helpful and accommodating. The team is helpful in meeting you at your hotel or Central's MTR station.Big Foot Tour is not only a education but a life experience. Go and meet Joe and be schooled Hong Kong style, worth every penny!!!!!!!Big Foot Tour - THANK YOU

Wonderful tour with Joe. My family and I were visiting HK for the first time and I thought it would be a great idea to book a tour through Big Foot as I had read some fantastic reviews. We were not disappointed. Our tour guide Joe was fantastic. We learnt a lot in a few hours about HK's unique culture, its food and its people. It would have been impossible to have seen and experience the things we did with Joe if we were on our own. Joe was intelligent, knowledgable and a pleasure to spend a few hours with.

Great day with Joe!. My family passed through Hong Kong on the way to Thailand for Christmas and New Years. We arranged a tour with Joe for 22 December. Everything was fantastic from the first email to Ski. We planned a walk through the city focused on history, culture, and food. We saw things we never could have on our own. Joe was very accommodating (we had our nine year old son with us and he absolutely loved it). We look forward to our next visit to Hong Kong so we can see more of the city with Joe and Ski. Thanks!

Great introduction to HK. Our tour was with Joe and was a great way to spend four hours on our first day in HK. From tasting the local food & drink (congee, tea and toast - HK styles, roast goose, bbq pork, local chrysanthemum and honey tea and a custard tart to finish) to learning about both historical and current issues affecting HK. The information that Joe shared with us was interesting and of use to us.I would highly recommend the private tour to anyone who is new to HK. Joe was a fantastic host who I would not hesitate in recommending.

Great personalized food trip. We had been in Hong Kong before, so we wanted to try less famous foods and areas. They quickly understood and gave us a nice itinerary. Joe met us at our hotel and together we took the MTR to Sham Shui Po for the start of our trip. We went to a lot of interesting places, like a communal eating hall with great congee, into a family tofu restaurant and had some milk tea ina hidden market under a bridge. It was a great experience, and the food was excellent. Joe is also a great and interesting guide, and we had a lot of nice discussions. He has a lot of knowledge of this city and it's history. At the end of the trip he gave us a recap, and also some suggestions for the rest of our time in Hong Kong. If you're interested in food and the city, I can wholeheartedly recommend booking a trip with these guys. Beginners and experienced HK travelers both will have a great time, I'm sure.

Not to be missed!. My husband and I are relatively well-traveled for Americans in their early 30's, so when I say Joe offers a walking tour that is not to be missed, trust me. We did the Central/Western districts itinerary that was suggested in Ski's email and met Joe exactly on time at a spot easy to find. The tour flew by because we had such a fabulous time. We talked about topics of personal interest as well as interesting parts of Hong Kong culture we wouldn't know to ask about. I wish we could have adopted him for the rest of the week!You'll want to schedule this tour for early in your trip as you'll get lots of suggestions for things to do during the rest of your visit. I would list the highlights, but really it's the entire day. Come hungry as there are lots of opportunities to stop and grab a bite! Joe will draw out the route on your city map you can revisit some of the spots or and he'll mark other suggestions so you have an easy time finding them.
Excellent walking tour. Our guide, Joe, was a thoughtful, well-spoken young man who gave us a great introduction to the Central and Western districts of HK Island. Highly recommended!

Highly recommended if you want to see Hong Kong beyond the shops. I highly recommend this tour if you want to see Hong Kong beyond the shops. We have been to Hong Kong several times on stop overs but this time I felt I really got to see and experience a small bit of the real thing. We were travelling with our teenage sons so decided a food tour might be a way to keep their interest whilst learning something about the city. Joe was absolutely fabulous and managed to engage the boys. He combined history, culture and food to give us a better understanding of what it is like to live in the city. We tried lots of things we would never have tried on our own and the four hours past too quickly. Ski was also fantastic with the arrangements and the instructions she sent before hand were spot on. Thank you both for a great experience!

Amazing Hong Kong. A city's character is discovered when the right person reveals it for you. When I contacted Big Foot Tour for a guide to take us for a walking tour, Ski was extremely prompt and informative when dealing with queries via email. With her detailed instructions, my husband and I had no problems meeting up with Joe, our guide, at the MTR station. We started at 3.30pm and in the next four hours, had a fantastic trip through parts of Central HK and west of it, chock-full of information and details. For example, we never noticed until Joe pointed it out, that there were so many branches of a particular jewellery chain on ONE street alone, to cater for the stream of wealthy mainland Chinese coming into HK. We were shown an area of low-rise buildings which was surrounded by expensive high-rise condominiums but which is apparently shunned by the developers because of a plague that had raged through the area and left many dead decades ago. Just by walking, we were shown the glitzy touristy part of HK, the brilliantly planned Mid-Level escalators, where the expensive high rise residences are, and also visited the places where the man in the street lived and ate. Food in HK is glorious and in the course of walking, we also grabbed some local milk tea, herbal tea and snacks to sustain us. Joe is a storehouse of information and we had an insightful conversation with him on what the Occupy movement was about. His little nuggets of this and that was what made the trip memorable for us. And to finish off the tour (it was dinner time by then) he led us to a little restaurant called Yat Lok for roast goose rice and when we ate, we were in seventh heaven. The Big Foot team ought to be congratulated for doing their job so well. Highly recommended.

We loved seeing this side of Hong Kong.... a small tea shop for a tea and toast breakfast, a walk though a local market, a street-side Taoist shrine, a very special workman's-style lunch in a "wet market" (we were the only tourists in sight...). Joe was excellent in both his choices of things to see and his willingness to share his in-depth knowledge. He was a pleasure to be with.Plus, Ski was prompt and clear in providing information before the tour to avoid and confusion / mishaps. And, Joe was great in adjusting to a last minute change (we decided to have him meet us at our hotel instead f a train station...). They run a first-rate operation. If you visit Hong Kong - do this tour!Hayrose

Our first tour was so good, we booked another!. My husband and I have had private tours all over the world, but our tours with Joe of Big Foot Tour were the best we ever had. During our first half-day tour, we visited central (including the now-removed protest site), the mid levels and Soho. Joe showed us so much that we wouldn't have otherwise seen, while explaining Hong Kong's history and local customs. We learned so much and had such an enjoyable time, that after our tour I immediately e-mailed Ski to see if we could book with Joe again.For our second half-day, Joe showed us several locations in Kowloon. There is no way that we would have gone to several of the places (like the wet market and a tofu restaurant) un-escorted by a local, so it was great having Joe show us around.In addition to the tours, Joe gave us lots of recommendations for restaurants, shopping and other places to see. He also provided maps showing us where we had gone during the tours. I would also like to mention that after our second tour, I e-mailed Joe asking about a shop location. He quickly replied with the location, shop name and a Google map. Awesome!!Thank you to Joe and Ski for such a wonderful time in Hong Kong!

Excellent and enjoyable tour by Joe. We took a half day tour of Central and Western districts with Joe on 1st December 2014. We received detailed instructions on the meeting point and the communication and booking system prior to the tour was good. Joe was informative and very engaging and knowledgable about Hong Kong and other travel destinations. Joe offered us the opportunity to look around one of the protest sites which we were interested in. After this we moved on through central visiting a food market and stopped for tea and toast. We explored the mid level escalators and a temple before a dim sum break. After lunch we visited some dried medicine shops to give us an understanding of how people in Hong Kong live. We ended with a a tram ride back to Central. Throughout the tour Joe answered our many questions and volunteered lots of information. He is very engaging and you feel like you are being shown around the city by one of your mates. If you do one tour in Hong Kong make sure it is this one, it will really help to get to know the city and plan the rest of your trip. Would certainly book another if we are back in Hong Kong.

Enjoyable and Informative. My husband and I joined Ski for a half day tour of Central, the mid levels and "Chinatown". We had been to Hong Kong several times before but only for short stopovers and had not really explored beyond the shopping districts. This walking tour is great for seeing another side of Hong Kong away from the malls and the crush of the Nathan Road area. For those who have not been to Hong Kong before it would also give you more confidence to visit these areas by yourself. I would certainly love to revisit the great dim sum restaurant we went to for lunch! Ski was a very good guide, giving us lots of information about the different areas we went to, Chinese and more distinctly Hong Kong life and culture. She answered our questions and was very easy to converse with. If we go back to Hong Kong I would certainly book a tour of another area with Big Foot.

Hong Kong Highlight. I daresay that Joe's expert guidance through parts of Hong Kong Island was the highlight of our week's vacation. Joe's insight into Hong Kong's history and culture are amazing, and he is funny and wise beyond his years! If I ever come back, I'll be sure to book additional time to be guided through other parts of the city.One advice: book early, book for the beginning of your trip to HK, you'll profit no end from the information Big Foot Tours can provide!

Excellent Tour by Joe. Joe provided an excellent walking tour that covered Central and Western Hong Kong areas. We covered a lot of territory and Joe easily adjusted the tour for a tea house stop for tea and toast, as well as a stop for dim sum. Tell him what you are interested in and he will take care of the rest. I can't say enough about this 4 plus hour tour through Hong Kong. It was certainly the highlight of our trip. Recommend you book this tour early in your visit so you can take advantage of the insiders knowledge you will gain. We revisited a couple of the places from the tour where we could relax and enjoy a little longer. Don't be afraid to bring a backpack with water, and be sure to comfortably dress for the weather, and wear comfortable walking shoes. I recommend this tour to all!

Hong Kong on foot, first class experience. Our group of 4 met Joe for a half day walking tour of Central and surrounding areas including the protest site. As others have mentioned Joe is very knowledgeable and was able to inform us of all aspects of life for the young and not so young in Hong Kong. We visited some local street food shops for 'morning tea' & lunch. The arrangements were easy to make prior to our arrival and Ski sent confirmation & details of the meeting location well in advance of our arrival in HK from Sydney. The Big Foot walking tour saved us time in trying to locate these sites ourselves and more importantly the inside knowledge of Joe was invaluable. great job !

A great way to see Hong Kong with a local expert. We enjoyed a half day tour in Hong Kong on day 2 of a 4 day visit to this fantastic city.The communication with Big Foot Tours was very easy to determine which tour was best for us. We book a half day group walking tour approx 10am til 3pm. Jo was our tour guide.Jo was a very pleasant young man who knows Hong Kong inside out. He understood the history and the culture and made every effort to get this across to all the guests in an engaging way.On our visit, the recent protest site was still in place- so many of the roads were closed. Jo knew all about the issues facing many of the young protesters and we spent the 1st hour learning about his experiences of the protest as we walked through the protest site itself. His passion for Hong Kong was clear and it was very interesting to hear his thoughts about this complex issue.After we visited the site the planned tour got under way & Jo took us to see many sights on Hong Kong- both old & new. The walk was based around the Island - not Kowloon etc. As a group we experienced the Hong Kong way of life - visiting the tea shops and other street food areas. The walk was not too demanding - but we are a fit couple. I would guess that anyone who is able to walk a few miles on foot would be able to cope with the low demands of the walk. Jo always made sure we were engaged & was happy to answer any questions- as well as make sure we were all ok with water/restrooms etc.After we had completed the tour Jo gave us some more ideas of where to visit on our trip. Overall I fully recommend the walking tour, great value for money & a great way to get your bearings for future days/visits. When we go to Hong Kong again & we will - I hope Big Foot will still be around to show us more sights.

Best Decision We Made. We hired Big Foot Tours for a one day to tour of Hong Kong because of the reviews we read on Trip Advisor. Best decision we made the entire trip to Southeast Asia! Ski Yeo, the owner of Big Foot, was our tugged and she was fabulous. She was (and is) organized, thorough and extremely knowledgeable. She listened to what it was we wanted to see, and organized our day accordingly. One of her greatest assets is her flexibility to deal with the unique desires of her clients. When we expressed an interest of seeing the protrest site, she was more than willing to make an adjustment, and off we went. Her English is excellent and she has a wonderful sense of humor. One of our party had mobility issues and Ski did a excellent job of assisting her to deal with the challenges of walking around the streets of Hong Kong. You can't go wrong by hiring Ski Yeo and Big Foot Tours in Hong Kong. Dan, Columbia, MD USA

A great way to get a deeper look into Hong Kong. My wife, son and I had a fantastic private walking tour with our guide Joe. We saw parts of Hong Kong life that we might not have seen if we went with a more 'traditional tour', we tried some fantastic local foods and got an excellent idea of what Hong Kong is like for its current residents especially under the rule of Beijing. Our tour of the peaceful protest site around Admiralty was fabulous.Joe easily adjusted our tour due to us having a 6 month old son with us, he was also able to help us put together a small itinerary of other places that we would enjoy seeing for the handful of days we had left in HK.Ski was also fantastic in making sure things ran smoothly up until our tour and I found everything simple, easy and helpful.If you get a chance don't jump on an open-top bus, put on a pair of shoes and head out on a tour with Joe and see the real Hong Kong!

Big Foot Private Tour of Hong Kong. My friend and I decided to book Joe for a four hour private tour of Hong Kong Island after reading all the good reviews on Trip advisor, and boy was it excellent. Joe met us promptly and was delightful. We were interested in the culture and history of the Island, so Joe adapted the tour to our interests , I was totally amazed the depth of Joes knowledge and he delivered the history in a very interesting and eloquent way.. I think it was the best four hours of our six days in Hong Kong, and as for the lunch we had, brilliant!!!! Thank you so much Big Foot Tours and in particular Joe. Big Foot Tours is a must if you are interested in exploring the Island.

Our Big Foot Tour With Joe. We were fortunate to have booked a Private Tour of Hong Kong with Big Foot Tour during our 1st visit to this amazing city. Joe was our guide of the Central and Western District on Oct14, 2014. Ski Yeo was most helpful to addressing all our questions during the planning phase prior to our visit. Joe, as well, was most helpful in devising an itinerary which suited our interests. He was spot on! We visited areas we never would have been able to adequately navigate on our own....even right smack in the middle of the Mong Kok (peaceful) demonstration area. We gained great knowledge from Joe and saw such interesting venues. Now we have a better understanding as to why HK is such a popular tourist destination....one to definately return to (and hopefully another touring area with Joe!).

The best tour ...ever. We had Big Foot Tours take us around Central Hong Kong on a mostly food tour . It was the best tour we have ever taken . And we travel internationally 4 or more times and always do one or more tours in a city we are not framiliar with .  Other than Hong Kong is a very interesting and diverse city, what really made the tour was our guide! Joe was extremlly knoldegeable about HK , its foods , medicines, culture and being totally fulent in both languages was invalueable . Book with Big Foot and consider yourself very luckly if Joe is your guide. Bill

Best thing we did in Hong Kong. We enjoyed every minute of this tour. Contact beforehand was clear and accurate with excellent instructions of where to meet Joe. We were happy to follow the itinerary that Joe had prepared but he was more than happy to adapt this is we had any particular preferences. We started with a visit to the protest area and a passionate account of why the demonstrations were taking place and a brief history of Hong Kong then had a structured experience of typical Hong Kong food from breakfast through to main meal with snacks as well. We were encouraged to sample many things and visit eating establishments we would never had dared try on our own and found that we liked most things - especially the eggy bread with coconut Jam! This truly was the highlight of our stay in Hong Kong and would recommend it to anyone, thanks Joe.

The best decision we made in Hong Kong!. If it wasn't for Joe and the Big Foot walking tour that he took us on we would never have found out as much as we did about the absolutely incredible culture that Hong Kong has. I am so glad that this was the first thing we did in Hong Kong.Joe took us through the protest site and was very open to discuss the politics and answer all of our questions regarding the protests and how Hong Kong's political system works. This was really interesting!Along with walking us through most of Hong Kong island Joe generously gave us suggestions for sightseeing, places to eat and places to shop for the rest of our trip. He also wrote down a great list of phonetically spelt out Cantonese words and phrases for day-to-day things and to help us at the Ladies' Markets!

Hong Kong Tour Co. Big Foot tours provided us with an outstanding 4 hr tour of this dynamic city! And although we hd visited before, we learned far more of everyday life by those living here than ever before! This had been our stated preference when responding to the company's request for what we were seeking. Well traveled tourist sites was Not what we wanted. The company stayed in touch with us in a prompt manner, efficient in setting up a meeting place etc. Joe, our guide, a well educated young man who showed such enthusiasm in both describing and showing various aspects of his native city, and also his willingness to answer questions. We finished our tour with a greater understanding of this city and its challenges and opportunities. Thank You Trip Advisor for having Big Foot Tours referenced on your website.

Outstanding! Do this first!!. I was nervous and skeptical about booking a tour but all of us (a 3 generation group) love the tour and we are so happy we booked with Ski! Even my wife who is an extremely harsh critic had high praises saying that Ski's the best guide she ever had. Drawing on a wealth of knowledge with a wonderful sense of humour, you will truly have missed Hong Kong if you don't see it with Ski. She open our eyes, minds and taste buds to an amazing Hong Kong experience so much that we fell in love with Hong Kong and even extended our stay. We'll always remember this!Our tip: What beats getting shown around by the founder? Ask for Ski and you can trust her to bring you to all the local places!... and did i say that it was super fun?Thanks again Ski!

Great fun with excellent local knowledge & insights. We have just returned from a short break in Hong Kong where we enjoyed a Private Walking Tour with Joe. He covered lots of topics from Hong Kong history, the cultural side of Hong Kong, gastronomic insights, and even a tour of the current protest site (at our request) with his insights as a local young person. We completed our tour with a lunch stop for Yum Cha! I certainly recommend the tour as an introduction and orientation to Hong Kong and love the flexibility to adjust to individual interests. i would certainly consider taking the tour again when I next return.

Big Foot Walking Food Tour- small group. Dear Travellers,our casual websearch hunting for a walking tour introduced us to Big Foot. Our email enquiry was responded to immediately, welcoming and with a package of useful information and explanation. Months later, when we had dates Ski provided more detail and a secure method of payment. Maps and meeting place details were provided with some good tips regarding transport in Hong Kong and likely meals costs. We met Joe, all as planned and easy to find. Our Brief to them was to walk the back streets and learn about the Hong Kong Chinese food tastes and traditions. This was our first visit to Hong Kong. We had arrived the night before ( end of September 2014) so this was a good introduction to Hong Kong and helped us make the most of the rest of our stay before heading north.Together we walked from Central westward on Hong Kong Island. All easy going. Joe knows his food. He also structured the walk to follow from breakfast through lunch to dessert. We shared so that we could try a wider range of food and not over eat. The congee, goose, teas and tarts were just a part of it, we skipped dinner that night. It was about four hours with Joe, from 3:00 pm. We walked many kilometres, enjoying a fun, educational experience, saw great spaces and places while we smelt and tasted our way through the old streets.We were told Big Foot will tailor your walking tour to your interests.Wear sensible shoes!This young enterprise anticipates and communicates very well. They have a formula that works, is open to refinement and ongoing success. The tour was great! thanks Joe ( and Ski).It was a pleasure meeting you Joe.Katie & Mark NSW Australia

Can't recommend highly enough!!. In short-JUST GO!!!-it will be the highlight of your Hong Kong trip...it's off the beaten track...a real taste and insight into Hong Kong life!!We booked this tour on the back of its trip advisor ratings and I honestly can't rate it highly enough.Joe our tour guide was excellent. He spoke better English than we do, was really well spoken and was very intelligent. We asked the poor guy so many questions and he was able to answer everything! We saw parts of the city, Hong Kong culture and life that you would NEVER see from a bus or walking around yourself.This wasn't a tour where you go from one tourist site to the other...this showed us the real Hong Kong and we got to sample food and see things that really had us coming away from the tour feeling like we had learned so much! We met a friend who's lived in Hong Kong for several years and we were able to tell him loads of interesting stuff that he had never heard etc! This tour takes you off the beaten track and gives you the real Hong Kong on a plate. Thanks to joe our guide who was absolutely fantastic-can't say enough good things about him...just wish I knew half of what he knows about my own home town!!Just go...you won't regret it!

Highlight of HK Visit . Our guide Joe gave us a fantastic tour of the real HK on 28th October, even a trip down to the protest site which was a thrill to see and hear the history of same!! Overall, this was a really great 4 hours of culture, history, exercise, food & humour and I would highly recommend doing the general tour.. Walking through the streets and seeing the real HK was a highlight of our trip!! Thanks Joe & Big Foot Tours!

Best tour we've been on. We did a 4 hour walking tour in Hong Kong with Joe of Big Foot Tours, and it was outstanding. We have done tours all over the world, and this was the best one we've ever taken. Joe blended the history of Hong Kong with the current events, showed us the unique districts within the Island side of the city, and customized the tour to our request to include the food markets of the city as well. By keeping the tour at a brisk pace, we covered a huge amount of the city, from the Admiralty, to Soho, Central, Mid-levels, etc. You will feel like you know the city, and have an understanding of its people, after the tour. Joe also gave us great tips for after the tour on how to do the peak quickly, and to walk the Lugard Rd, which was much more serene than the touristy peak building itself. Can't recommend this company, and Joe in particular, highly enough.

Hong Kong Food Tour. We would like to thank Big Foot Tours for such a wonderful experience. Before we arrived in Hong Kong were given sound advise regarding the purchase of a Octopus card and accurate meeting arrangements for the tour. Joe was very relaxed which suited our style of touring and not only did we have a insight into local foods we learnt more about HK in 4 hours with him than we would have learnt in 1 week by ourselves. The food tasting was fantastic as Joe opened doors to us that would be difficult to find as a mainstream tourist. The fact that we experienced eating as the locals do was a major feature of this tour. Highly recommended!!Greg and Jenny

Best thing to do in Hong Kong! Ski is awesome!. I took the tour with Ski with my wife and a few friends. We had booked it before arriving and the info provided was great. The tour started in the morning with stops for some great food and coffee drinks. During the tour Ski provided local knowledge and facts. Even after the tour ski emailed us with info for us to see things while in Hong Kong. We have been on a lot of tours in other countries and this is by far the best. Ski has a passion for people and Hong kong.I can not recommend this tour and ski high enough.Thanks Ski

Thank you, Ski!. We booked a 6 hour tour with Ski last week and it was fantastic! She gave us an enthusiastic feel for the city and tailored the pace and the content to meet our expectations. Although we didn't give Ski too much guidance, she seemed to have a great intuitive feel for what we would enjoy seeing. We were fortunate to be with Ski the first day of our travels in Hong Kong, and she not only gave us a great tour, but helped us to plan the rest of our time in the city, even following up with emails over the next few days to suggest restaurants and other attractions. Thank you, Ski!

Best day out. Ski made our visit to Hong Kong unforgettable. She took us to all the places we had requested on our itinerary and many more she thought we would enjoy. She gave us an informative, full day tour of Hong Kong island taking us along routes we would never have discovered for ourselves. She was well prepared with maps, pictures & great anecdotes & is charming, patient, funny and thoughtful - the perfect guide. We loved every minute of her company. Many thanks Ski- you're the best ! John especially wants to thank you for letting him know what Hong Kong's most famous bird is.

Culinary tour Honk Kong-Big foot. I can honestly say that this tour was the highlight of my trip mostly thanks to our wonderful guide Joe who was very interesting, attentive and informative! i was mesmerized by his stories about the history and culture of honk Kong. He took us to all of the right places and fulfilled both of my parents and my wishes.I Highly recommend big foot tour and especially Joe ,he is sharp ,interesting and his English is super good which is very important.

Big Foot Tour Hong Kong #1. Partner and I booked morning tour with Ski. Asked for 10am start - not a problem. We had a fantastic time and would highly recommend. We wanted to experience some of the "real" HK. Headed up the Mid Levels Escalator, brunch at Lan Fong Yuen, backstreets, laneways, various markets, local school, temple, gardens, local Dim Sum restaurant for lunch - Brilliant! Would never have found it ourselves - or be able to order. Flexible route depending on what you're interested in. Loads of local/colonial history. Wanted to end tour at Star Ferry for trip across harbour - not a problem. Easy to organise online. Great value. Ski is very friendly, enthusiastic guide. Would do it again if opportunity arises. Thank you!

An absolute must do when in Hong Kong!. I read so many good things about Big Foot Tours and decided that this was something that we, a family of 5 with three children aged 6 to 11, had to do when we were in Hong Kong for three days in October. And I am extremely happy that we did this the first full day we had because with the help of our guide, Joe, we were able to plan a trip where we experienced Hong Kong behind all the luxury shopping - the food, the culture and surprises such as a little beach on Lamma Island. We did a 4 hour tour with Joe, and I really don't think that what I write here will do our tour justice because it was just so fantastic and one of the VERY BEST tours I have been on. The meeting point was so easy to get to and our guide, Joe was punctual, accommodating, so patient with our two boys and even got our rather quiet daughter having a bit of a chat and he was able to direct the history and stories of Hong Kong to my husband and I as well as to the kids even trying to show our youngest the lions he so wanted to see; he also didn't mind when our 6 year old went to hold his hand as we crossed the road - a testament to his patience. We learnt so much about Hong Kong from its humble beginnings as a fishing village to this teaming metropolis it is now. Joe also gave us an insight into Taoism and showed us a beautiful temple in which multiple religions worshipped and prayed as well as taking us to two wonderful places to eat, now of which we revisited as the Hong Kong "Tea and Toast" was just too delicious not to have again. At the end of our walk, which came way to quickly, Joe was prepared with maps to show us just how far we'd walked and then, as mentioned before, also gave us some other maps and directions to spending a day at Lamma Island, which was also fantastic. We all were so very happy with this tour and would recommend it to anybody and everyone! When we travel back to Hong Kong, we will definitely be talking to Big Foot Walking Tours and organising another one, it was worth every cent! A very BIG THANK YOU to Joe and to Ski for this wonderful time spent in Hong Kong.

Great tour. We did a 4 hour walking tour with Joe during a 12 hour stopover (on our way home to NZ). He was very knowledgeable and gave us great insight into the history of Hon Kong and how it came to be what it is today. He took us through the central city and through the old/original markets. We visited 3 traditional eateries and these were amazing. We really enjoyed Joe's commentary and his contemporary perspective of the city. A perfect way to spend a stopover and an appreciation of Hong Kong and its people.

Great overview of the city. We had one full day in Hong Kong and chose to spend it with Joe through Big Foot Tours. He was incredibly knowledgeable and took us all over the city...we felt like we didn't miss anything. This isn't a "touristy" tour, as it's less about seeing main attractions and more about getting a feel for the history and culture of the city, as well as how the locals live. We absolutely loved it. Thanks Joe for the great day!

SIMPLY THE BEST - Ski Yeo & Big Foot Tours Hong Kong. My ideal day in a city does not always reflect my husband's. I love to wander and explore - lanes and shops and eateries. My husband likes the day to have a definite beginning AND end - a plan...On a recent (children free) break in Hong Kong I pondered how to keep both of us content. Enter Big Foot Walking Tours. As mentioned in other reviews; this company is absolutely fabulous. Ski Yeo was efficient and professional from the first point of contact. I mentioned some thoughts on were we might like to go for our four hour private tour - she took care of the rest. We arranged to meet in our Hotel Foyer; she had my husband interested and following along as soon as we set off. Ski is skilled at adapting the pace according to the client - by osmosis she detected if more time was needed at one point rather than another. Time flew by - I have to say this is definitely the BEST day tour I have ever booked. I will return with my kids next time. Do yourself a holiday favour - even if you think you know Hong Kong book Big Foot Tours - you will get a behind the scenes look at one of the worlds most fascinating city's. I will not give away our itinerary - just a taste - we ate, discussed history, found unique laneways, met locals and shopped. Highly recommended!

Big Foot Walking tour of Hong Kong. This past July we did a 4 hour private walking tour of Hong Kong with Big Foot. I did it with my two daughters, 26 and 24. It was such a great introduction to the "inside" life of Hong Kong today as well as the cultural and historical perspective on the city. Joe, was raised in Hong Kong and did a great job of taking us around and adjusting the tour to our interests. His english was excellent and he offered us great recommendations on restaurants and shops that we took advantage of later on our trip. It was one of the best things we did in Hong Kong, having never been here before.

Fun and alternate way to learn about Hong Kong. Traveling with our 11 and 13 yr old I always look for ways we can all participate fully in new places. Big Foot Tours was a perfect start to our 5 days in HK with Joe taking us on a 4 hour journey throughout some of the inner workings of the city. Having grown up there Joe was full of great facts and anecdotes that we all could engage with and was fun to experience some of the older ways of HK. Kids loved it and so did we. Make this part of your trip definitely!

Hong Kong - walk and talk. The walking tour was fabulous. Ski is very engaging and knowledgeable about Hong Kong's history and sights. We travelled along some very interesting streets selling all manner of exotic dried foods and medicines. The dim sum lunch had some of the tastiest dumplings I have ever eaten. We are still raving about what we saw and what we learned. Would thoroughly recommend this.

A must do!. I recently visited Hong Kong with my 2 teenage daughters ( 14yrs and 19yrs) and booked in with Joe for a 4 hour walking tour. Booking was a pleasure - easy and prompt! Our guide Joe was enthusiastic, interesting and very open to catering the tour to whatever we wanted to do. We all loved it which is not always easy to do when you are catering to different age groups. He gave a wonderful insight to the history, culture and way of life of Hong Kong and introduced us to food and traditions that we would never have experienced on our own . He also took us to his favourite yum cha restaurant for lunch which was great! He then gave us great tips on what to do for the rest of our stay.Couldn't recommend Joe and Big Foot Tours highly enough.

Must do in Hong Kong. To start, just do it!!! This walking tour was fabulous. Learned so many things I would never have found out myself. Taken to some phenomenal places, even to a dim sum restaurant (we did a private tour) where we were the only Western people. Ski is extremely knowledgable and makes the tour really interesting, 4 hours flies by, unfortunately. Lots of photos taken and kilometres walked. You will never regret doing this tour with Ski, she is fabulous.

Best tour ever. We made a brief stopover in Hong Kong recently and managed to fit in a Big Foot Tour. It was the best decision we made. Joe was a brilliant guide and gave me, and my two teenage sons, a wonderful insight into Hong Kong life. The history and culture of the city is fascinating and is far more interesting than the many luxury shopping malls. Whether you are there on a stopover, or a longer stay, I would highly recommend you book this tour.

Big Foot -Great Experience!. Can thoroughly recommend The Big Foot Hong Kong walking tour. Our guide Joe began with some interesting general historic background to set the scene. Then we were off through alley ways and up escalators to all kinds of fascinating places. A humorous and lively commentary gave us all a true insight into the lives and routines of the many people populating the Island. We stopped regularly to sample exotic cuisine, such as you might otherwise overlook -or even perhaps avoid. All questions were answered with great enthusiasm, and a real in-depth knowledge such as only a true 'native' would know. The East-West fusion is more pervasive than you may realise -helps so much to have it pointed out. The tour made so much more of this great city accessible to us, -food, drink, shopping and local customs and habits. Chinese medicine shops, markets, gardens, weird food stalls, we did it all and more. The 'Five Flower Tea' was something special, that you may never otherwise try. We were so impressed and delighted, we booked a tour of Kowloon on the spot. Kowloon is very much the other side of town, the most populated place on earth, and equally fascinating on another level entirely. More great food and drink...Another truly memorable experience. On both occasions, at the end of the walk, maps of our journey were supplied to us for future reference. We would have done more tours, but ran short of time. Thanks so much to Joe and the Big Feet.

Great introduction to the city. We did a Big Foot Tour with Joe at the start of our vacation and it was a great start to the stay. Our family of 4 (kids aged 10 and 13) took a walking tour with Joe on the date of our arrival in Hong Kong. Unfortunately it was basically pouring rain for most of our tour - but we still had a great time. Joe took us around the Central district, including some great stops for food. He was able to manage the tour in spite of the weather, and was very accommodating and engaging with our kids. The time flew by, which was incredible considering the conditions, and we all came away with much more knowledge of Hong Kong that we had prior to the tour. Joe's background and "insider's" perspective were very interesting, and he was able to compare Hong Kong to Taiwan - where we had just spent 10 days with family. Ski was also very easy to work with for scheduling - everything went very smoothly. I would highly recommend Big Foot Tours when you visit Hong Kong - it's a great way to really see the city.

Definitely do this walking tour.. In planning our walking tour with our guide Ski, we exchanged email messages several times before we left Australia. Ski was very helpful with suggestions about HK in general, also really friendly and prompt in replying. We chose a 4 hr tour and covered a lot of distance and such interesting places. We did not feel too rushed or too slow at all, Ski made it so the pace was just perfect for our group, stopping when we wanted to take photos, have a drink, or find a loo, as it was a very hot and humid day. Ski's knowledge about HK history, culture, politics, economy, religion, transport, shopping etc etc was amazing. She answered all our questions and encouraged us to email in the future if we think of something else to ask. She had photos in her back pack to help us "see" some aspects of HK life that are not accessible to tourists. There were no communication issues as Ski speaks perfect English and Cantonese as well, so she could order some of the local favourite foods for us to try in little local meal places which are out of the main tourist areas. Wonderful ! What a great tour. Well worth the money. Thank you Ski, we loved meeting you and learning from you. Jenni, Don, Jill and Dennis.

Excellent tour with Big Foot. My wife, son and I booked a tour with Big Foot when we visited in August this year. Joe met us promptly at 10am in Central as agreed, and we began our trip through Central, mid-level, and Sheung Wan. Joe is a very engaging guy, very knowledgable about Hong Kong's history and what the future potentially holds for Hong Kong. These tours are tailored to an individual's interests and requirements, something that Joe made clear from the beginning of the tour. As food was high on our agenda, Joe made sure that this topic was included throughout the four hours we spent with him. We stopped at a Dim Sum restaurant at lunchtime, packed to the ceiling with locals (always a good sign). Joe asked our preferences, suggested a couple that we would never have tried, and ordered on our behalf. I had a couple of dishes I had not tasted in years, and I was in heaven (turnip cake and small ribs in black bean sauce). The dishes Joe suggested were very tasty too! We peeked into shops selling some very strange products, saw sights that we would have walked past normally, and came away from the tour appreciating Hong Kong a lot more from the experience. If you do one thing while in Hong Kong, do this tour!! Do it early on your visit and it will create a great foundation for the rest of your stay.

Walk around hong kong with a friend. We met Ski promptly on time outside central station, where she introduced herself and started off by describing some of the buildings which had a lot of history and cultural meaning behind that we wouldnt have even noticed. We walked off the beaten track and were taken to local eateries to sample some of the local food and drinks. Ski was very knowledgeable and friendly, she made it seem like we were being taken around by a friend which was a lovely experience and highly recommend it. Thanks again Ski from Tom and Nicole!

Amazing walking tour through HK. Booking this tour has been one of my best decisions while traveling alone in Hong Kong. Joe has been such a great, informative, sympathetic guide and we had a wonderful time exploring the city. Tasty food, historical buildings, high life quarters, but also "just" the normal day-to-day life in Hong Kong, which Joe has given me a glimpse of during our 4-h-tour, have left an enduring impression on me. The tour, and also the booking beforehand, had been very well organized and I felt super pampered :-) .Thanks to the whole team for this awesome experience!

Would repeat next time I visit HK. I had looked into doing a walking tour as I think that’s the coolest way to learn about a city and stumbled upon Big Foot tours. We were on our honeymoon and had booked the private food tour, with Joe as our guide. While a private tour in the pricier side of things, it was certainly worth it. Four hours flew by like 20 minutes and we learned a good deal about Hong Kong life and culture while enjoying some of Hong Kong’s very memorable signature foods as we walked. Planning with Ski was easy and straightforward and Joe was awesome throughout and has a wealth of knowledge to share on every aspect of this great city. Can’t recommend these guys enough.

Must do. It was a nice day spent, I would suggest doing in the first day at Hong Kong to get immersed in Hong Kong way of living and to do 8 hours of tour because its worth and rich everything that you learn, Joe was very flexible with the intinerary and could talk about everything i asked, culture, politics, etc. You make the schedule when its going to stop, what to visit. Thank you so much for the Attention Joe and Ski, hope you guys keep the good work ! Brunno Bezerra.

Do not miss this tour. I suggest you do this excellent tour in the beggining of your Hong Kong experience. Joe is a young and very well informed guide, and you can see that he really likes what he is doing.Beside all the food we gladly taste, Joe gave us a lot of insight regarding the history, architecture, highlights, social life and culture in Hong Kong. This helped us a lot in the next days that we visit the city.Do not miss this tour.

Highlight of our trip to Hong Kong. We experienced a great day with Joe, his knowledge and passion for Hong Kong was fabulous. After visiting Hong Kong a number of times it was great to experience something different, we can't wait to back a re visit some of the great places we saw. We would definitely recommend this tour to anybody who is looking for something to do that is not ordinary, but extraordinary!

Great Tour & Wonderful Tour Guide. We had been to HKG a few times before and thought this walking tour would be worth a try. We were not disappointed ! Ski was very responsive in making the arrangements beforehand. She then did an excellent job in showing us around Hong Kong. She has a wonderful personality and her personable approach made us feel that we had a "friend" in Hong Kong. Keep up the great work !

An Experience of a Lifetime!. We only had one day to spend in Hong Kong and wanted to see as much as possible, so decided to book a private tour. We had no idea what to expect, but what we got from Ski and Big Foot Tours was so much more than we could possibly have imagined. Ski was wonderfully helpful from the minute we first contacted her, our meeting with our guide, Joe was effortless and our tour was absolutely amazing. As we had never been to Hong Kong before, we asked that Joe plan the itinerary. He did just that, giving us an interesting and enthusiastic history of the city as he did so. I truly feel that we saw things that we would never have seen on any other tour. Joe also went above and beyond by helping us plan the rest of our day and evening. His advice saved us a great deal of time and money! I thank you both, Ski and Joe for your professionalism, enthusiasm and friendship! We hope to visit again. All the Best, Janice and Brian, Toronto Ontario

BEST day in Hong Kong. Absolutely blown away! BEST tour by far, you must not miss! Our walking tour was guided by Joe. Joe was a fantastic guide and very informative. We learnt so much about Hong Kong way of life and it's history. Walking the streets was absolutely amazing. We had no idea what we should or would see on the day and so left it to Joe to guide us around. Could not believe one minute we were looking at modern Hong Kong glitz & glamour and then just around the corner the streetscape changes into old world Hong Kong. Very hard to describe which was our favourite part of the tour, was it Graham street, the tram ride, ghost / medicine st, mid levels etc.... we would never have known what we were looking at if it had not been for this tour. Absolutely amazing, highly recommend. This is a one of a kind tour and an absolute must if you want the real thing. Even when the tour was completed, Joe took the time to give advice and ideas for the remainder of our holiday, with maps & directions..... Thank you Joe for being our guide and to Ski for all her helpful advice prior to us arriving in Hong Kong. We wish you the best and hope to see you again for the street food tour!!Linda & Peter Queensland, Australia

Special tour BEYOND a tour. Dear Ski, I guess this is the best way to thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your recent tour with us. So many positive comments have been made on you and Big Foot Tour on TripAdvisor and we absolutely concur with them. We learnt so much about Hong Kong from you and both Jack and I agree that this is a tour beyond a tour. Your generosity was clearly evident when you went out of your way to ensure we had a great experience in Hong Kong, not just during the tour, but on our own too. Your patience with us and your constant enthusiasm under the sweltering heat and humidity was commendable. Ski, you are a true gem and it is definitely a great pleasure for us to spend a day touring with you. We wish you all the best for Big Foot Tour and we would always highly recommend your tours to anyone.If you are reading this, we highly recommend Big Foot Tour. Ski (the owner) and her team provide an incredible Hong Kong experience. We are a family of 5 (ages 64, 52, 24, 12, 7), with varied paces, interests and temperaments. Having travelled much and been on many tours, this is the most refreshing and inspiring experience that we had. This is not a tour that brings you from one tourist attraction to another. Instead, it is well-aligned with real life in Hong Kong and having a genuine interaction with a local. This is a special experience that you can't miss

Highly recommend when in Hong Kong. This was our first visit to Hong Kong and we only had a short period of time, so we thought a food and culture tour would be a great introduction. This certainly proved to be the case! Joe our guide was extremely knowlegeable on all aspects relating to the food, culture and life in Hong Kong. We were given a glimpse of what life would be like in Hong Kong and we walked away with a greater understanding and respect for the people and food of Hong Kong. Joe was clearly very passionate about his home and heritage and this transpired into a wonderful experience on the tour. The food was also delicious and we visited places that we would never have visited on our own. We would definitely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

If you are in Hong Kong, a "Big Foot" tour is a must!. My family of six (kids aged 17, 15, 13 and 9) just returned home from touring China, Hong Kong, Australia, and Fiji. At each of our stops we took a "commercial" tour booked through a traditional travel agency and then did a local walking tour. My family's tour with Big Foot (Joe) was hands down the best tour we had during our trip, and it might have been the best tour I've had in any city in any of my travels.I do have to say this is a walking tour and does require some stamina, my kids are used to this kind of activity and can routinely walk five plus miles, I would contact Big Foot ahead of time if you plan on taking kids younger than 13.If you plan on going to Hong Kong and you are interested in more than a bus tour hitting the highlights, a Big Foot walking tour is a must!

Joe's Food Tour - Brilliant!. I have just returned from Hong Kong and a small group of us (aged from 35years to 75 years) did a food tour with Joe. I have been to Hong Kong many times before and was never really interested in doing a tour previously. A friend suggested I book a tour with Big Foot. Joe is such an impressive and personable person. He took us to the wet markets and fresh food markets - this was a totally fascinating experience. I also got to try all different types of food and got an insight into the world of a local - that I would never normally get to experience. I would absolutely recommend this tour - worth every cent. My advice would be to book this tour at the start of your trip as Joe gave us so many useful tips that were helpful for us for the rest of our stay in Hong Kong. 11/10!!!

Fantastic Experience!. I have traveled to Hong Kong several times, and booked my 2nd tour with Ski in August 2014. I was traveling with my daughter this time (it was her first time in Hong Kong) and we visited the Wong Tai Sin Sik Sik Yuen Temple, Nan Lian Garden & Chilin Nunnery, Mido Cafe and the Temple Street markets. This was a perfect walking tour that would not have been as interesting doing on our own, because Ski provided quite a bit of information about the history of these sights that you simply cannot obtain from a travel book! With respect to our meal at the Mido Cafe - which was fantastic and inexpensive - we would not have known to order the delicious dishes that we did! Ski is a terrific tour guide and I would highly recommend her for anyone and any activity in Hong Kong. She is so pleasant, very flexible in terms of accommodating needs, and extremely knowledgeable about the sights, history and culture of Hong Kong. I look forward to booking another tour with Ski on my next visit to Hong Kong.

Outstanding Experience . My family and I spent two nights in Hong Kong on the last leg of our summer trip to Asia. Although I had been to Hong Kong twice before, my wife and three children had never been. Based on the amazing reviews on TripAdvisor, I contacted Ski and arranged a half day walking tour that highlighted the culture of this amazing city. From my 10 year-old to my two teenagers to us adults, we were all extremely pleased with our experience with BigFoot. Ski was intelligent, engaging, and responded to our interests. She took us to some establishments we would never have found on our own to try local delicacies. We got a great overview of daily life in the city too. We also learned a lot about the history and architecture of the city. We are a very well traveled group and have a lot of experience with private walking tours, and we were impressed indeed. I know that Ski can cater to a variety of Interests and emphasize various aspects of the city, depending on her clients' interests. You will not go wrong seeing this amazing city with BigFoot.

A must do activity. This was by far not our first trip to H.K, so we wanted something with a more local feeling.We could not have chosen better for this is a small business that offers a very personal touch to exactly what you are after or mention to them you may be interested in. we left the option as to 'what to do' totally in their hands. You will eat and drink but this is not a foodie tour just a good honest local feel to central area of HK. If you need a toilet stop just mention for they know the area so well.So not disappointed booking for we ended up revisiting several locations shown to us, using what was shown as a bearings for where else to go that we wanted. After this tour felt very safe walking or taking 'ding 'ding and tram from Admiralty to Western district and from the Peak to the ferry.It is a walking tour but not a hard one and will be at your own pace. Remember that HK is not flat though.It was such fun and the information and background history was passed in a way that made everything so vibrant and it came alive - HK is certainly alive and to be shown it with passion was more than we expected.Do not normally do tours but this really impressed

Fantastic. Three years later I find myself on my 2nd visit to HK and again I booked a Big Foot tour. My 2nd tour experience with Ski. Travelling with my daughter it was her first time in Hong Kong. So the tour had to cater for us both. Our four hour walking tour was informative and gave a wonderful insight into city life and HongKong culture. Excellent tour, one I would highly recommend.

Fantastic, it put us in a great mood. Our tour guide for the day was Joe. Hong Kong was the last stop of our month long holiday. My family and I were jet lagged and pretty grumpy before the tour. Joe managed to put us in a great mood very quickly.We walked around Hong Kong, learning some basic history and eating some delicious local cuisine. I would recommend this to anyone that is travelling to Hong Kong, it was a terrific experience.

A Highlight Of Our Holiday. I booked this tour based on trip advisor reviews and we were delighted with our tour. We decided to take the tour on our first day in Hong Kong and it was a good decision. Our guide Joe was excellent and kept us all interested and kept the whole family engaged. We were taken to places that we would never have visited and learnt things about the culture that we would never have known. It really set us up for a great holiday.

Best private tour we have had!. I had been to Hong Kong on business before so was not expecting much from the tour. I was travelling with the family and they had not been there before. Joe took us on a well paced tour of this amazing city. I was surprised at how informative this tour was and also very enjoyable.

Best thing I did in Hong Kong. Joe was ill and unable to conduct our tour, so we were lucky to have Ski, the founder of Big Foot Tours. The tour was the very best thing I did the entire week I was in Hong Kong. Ski is so knowledgeable about the city, and took us to places off the beaten path. She is the only person who talked about the architecture, the history of the area, the folklore, politics, and traditions, the food, and how the Hong Kong people live. The tour was fascinating, and Ski was delightful. Without that tour, I would have been left with the impression of Hong Kong as a big, bustling city with no soul, but Ski showed us the soul of the city and people. I highly recommend this trip, but suggest you have good walking shoes!

Great tour of Hong Kong! . We took a 4-hour tour with Joe, he showed us some typical places away from the touristy stuff, and explained us HK's history, the local culture and showed us a great place to have dim sums. Jo speaks a perfect English so there is no problem to understand him, he his passionate about HK and shares his passion with you! A great way to discover HK :)

Great trip. Fantastic trip with Joe. Picked this tour based on previous reviews and they were all correct. Thoroughly recommend you do this tour. Thanks Joe for the advice about taking the bus up to the Peak - the queue at the base was horrendous. Evan and Tricia France

Had a great tour with Joe!. We had a private walking tour with Joe and it was amazing! I can't even begin to explain how much we were able to do on this 4 hour tour. We learned so much about the history, culture, politics, food, and got to see a lot of the city. Joe was able to answer all of our questions, and encouraged us to try some foods that we would not have tried on our own. It definitely felt like walking around Hong Kong with a friend that knows all the great places to take visitors. Throughout the tour he got to know us a little more and picked up on things we liked and would incorporate that into the tour - he also took us to an amazing dim sum place that we never would have found on our own. When the tour came to an end, Joe had some maps for us and drew out some routes and recommendations for other places to see in the city and it totally set us up for some adventures for the remainder of our stay, we made it to almost all of his recommendations and had a blast! He also mapped out everywhere we had been on our tour in case we wanted to go back to anything. Looking back I don't know how we would have been able to do so much during our short stay without Joe's help.Be sure to wear comfortable walking shoes, and don't hesitate to mention when you want to stop somewhere for water, take a photo, grab some food, etc.

Hong Kong Highlight!. Having booked a random spare of the moment to trip to Hong Kong without knowing anything about the place, decided it would be best to research a walking tour. The number 1 recommended tour on Trip Advisor was Big Foot. There is a reason they are number 1. They are BRILLIANT! Ski was only given 24 hours notice to organise a tour for my mum and I in a short amount of time, she was beyond efficient and helpful. An absolute pleasure to deal with and so so so professional! Then there was the walking tour.. This is when Joe steps in and rescues our Hong Kong experience by showing us just how much more there is to HK than high end shopping. Can honestly say that he made the trip for us! Was truly a pleasure to be in his company with his passion for HK and not to mention his knowledge. An absolute gentleman and extremely worldly. Fell in love with Soho, and got a real taste for the real HK. Have so much more respect and understanding now for the local ways of life. Was an extremely humbling experience. The goose was incredible Joe, and thanks for letting me shop along the way! Legend. My advice: you would be crazy not to book this walking tour!! Book it as early as you can on your trip, as it changes the way you look at HK!

Perfect Tour!. We immensely enjoyed our tour with Ski (the owner of Big Foot tour). She created a tour content that was interesting,well diversified and well balanced in regards to many aspects of the city. She gave us great information about the people, its values, its way of life, history, food, feng shui, georgraphical aspects of Hong Kong but also made us experience fun discoveries through it. We feel she gave us a great introduction to the city and it made us fall in love with Hong Kong. We took this tour upon arrival in Hong Kong and we think it was great timing as it opened our eyes to this fabulous city right from the start. Ski has a great personality: she is dynamic, patient, intelligent, efficient and shares her contagious love and interesting perspective of her adopted city (she is from Singapore). Great Tour and Great Tour Guide!

Our boys loved this Hong Kong walking tour.. Our private walking tour with Big Foot was just what we wanted. Joe took us off the beaten track to explore Chinese medicine shops, funeral shops, shrines, street markets and the mid levels. We sampled some great local food and took time out in the Hollywood Road reflexology park. Joe is very knowledgable on Hong Kong society, history, food, politics and real estate. The boys talked sport and loved seeing Joe's old primary school and the urban playground where he spent his childhood. We covered a lot of ground in four hours - the boys (nine and 13) had no trouble keeping up but did sleep very well that night! We highly recommend this tour whether you are new to Hong Kong or think you know the country well - I am sure you will discover something you didn't know before.

Best city tour we have done. My wife and I spent half a day dong a walking tour of Hong Kong with Joe of Big Foot Walking Tours. We travel a lot, and I would say that Joe's tour was probably the best city tour we have ever been on. Joe is from Hong Kong and studied at a university in the UK. He worked for several years in Beijing. Joe took us all over Hong Kong including his childhood neighborhood for a behind the scenes look at culture, local foods, and history. Joe's experience in both Hong Kong and the PRC adds a lot to the tour as he can explain the similarities and differences between the two. Joe pointed out many things that we would have simply walked past. We enjoyed sharing "congee" (breakfast soup) and Dim Sum with Joe while he explained the food and how it is eaten. Had we known how great the half-day would be, we would have booked a longer tour with Joe. Fantastic time while learning so much about Hong Kong and China.

Best way to get a handle on HK. Was the best tour I have ever done. I did it solo. Joe was my tour guide and he was so knowledgeable and a lot of fun. I had been able to let them know my interests and the tour was made to measure for me. He met me at my hotel at 15:30 and the walking tour ran for 4 hours. We started off on the MRT for a trip from Kowloon to HK Island. Had a short history of HK and an insight into it's latest happenings ( being that central had a sit in with the pro-democracy group) I was able to ask as many question as I liked as I am interested in politics and Joe was well informed of both sides views. we then set off to view the city from a local view point. We stopped at a small stall to have a milk tea (a specialty drink and very popular with Hongkongers) Then on to a bakery to taste some egg tarts, they were so good warm and sweet. Visited next the Man Mo temple where Joe explained about the belief system in HK, there are many religions represented on the island. Next was a haunted area, or so thought by the Chinese. It was an area where there had been the plague with many deaths during past centuries. He then took me to a reflexology garden I love this type of stuff so had to have a go trying to walk on the stones in my sock feet, it was amazing such a great feeling, loved it. On to an area where there were many Chinese herbal medicine shops and Ghost shops where they sell replica's of every day things that the departed may need in the next life, so interesting. I then tried some herbal tea for health. It was then time for dinner and Joe took me to a very small Chinese restaurant for the best BBQ pork I have ever tasted. A tram trip took us to Central to catch the MTR back to Kowloon and my final destination the Temple Street Night Market. This was where Joe and I parted company after a most enjoyable and informative tour. I was given a map of all the places I had visited and some recommendations for the rest of my stay which proved very useful. This is a tour company I highly recommend and I would use them again they were very reasonably priced.

Must do tour of Hong Kong!. The Big Foot walking tour of Hong Kong is a must for anyone who wants a good introduction to the city. Joe is a great guide and has a wealth of information about everything to do with living in Hong Kong. He really shows you the diversity of this amazing city, and keeps the tour fun and exciting. I would definitely recommend this tour for anyone visiting Hong Kong, whether a first time or frequent visitor as Big Foot Tours will custom tailor the tour to your requirements.

A must-do experience. Joe is an amazing and knowledgable guide who adapted the tour to suit our young family. The way he engaged with our boys (aged 6 & 10) was great while still providing info to the adults.Tour shows behind the scenes of HK and helped us to familiarise with how to get around HK, history and culture. Highly recommend this tour and thank you Joe for being such an excellent host.

"Memorable introduction to Hong Kong". We only had 1 day in Hong Kong so our 4 hour walking tour with Ski of Big Foot Tours was just perfect. Ski showed us the real Hong Kong & we learnt so much. Her knowledge of the people, their culture & history is extensive & she explains it in a very interesting way. We tasted their food, visited a temple, were shown Soho & the Mid Level Escalator, and lots of very interesting places. Would highly recommend Big Foot Tours to anyone who wants to see how the Hong Kong people live. Thank you Ski for making our short visit such a memorable one.SuZanne & Merv - NZ

Don't miss this!!!. This was the highlight of our HK trip. We did a food tour with Joe, it was so much more than a food tour. He was able to encompass history, politics, Chinese medicine and food all into one. The tour was very customized to our needs and Joe continue to customize it as the day went along. He was such a wealth of information, get Joe to be your tour guide!You can read more about our tour here: http://meanderman.wordpress.com/2014/05/14/the-belly-of-hong-kong/

Fantastic introduction to this vibrant City. My elderly mother and I booked a tour for the afternoon that we arrived in HK. Joe met us at our hotel in Kowloon and showed us how to get to the closest MRT station and organised for us to buy an Octopus Card. We then traveled by train to Central where our walking tour began.Joe was a wealth of information about the history and culture of Hong Kong. We visited places we might have otherwise missed and having a personalized commentary along the way meant we learnt so much more than had we wandered around by ourselves. He is so passionate about the place he calls home and very willing to help visitors understand what life is like in HK.We took a trip on the Mid Level Escalator, visited eclectic Soho and enjoyed a quick spot of shopping, were amazed by the tower of the mid levels residential area and enjoyed tea and toast Hong Kong style in a local eatery. Joe explained lots of traditions as we wandered the through the narrow street markets.At our request Joe left us at the Star Ferry terminal after providing a map showing all the places we had been and giving us lots of tips on what else to do during our few days in HK.We would thoroughly recommend booking a tour through Big Foot Tours at the beginning of your visit to HK the money spent is well worth it.

HK from the inside out!. Our four hour tour with Joe provided us with fantastic and extensive insight into this cosmopolitan city. We covered history, food, political life, transportation, local life, culture, customs and just absorbed the city. Do not hesitate to book at least a four house tour, longer if you can. It was the a wonderful finishing touch to our tour of China and HK before headed back to the States.

My favorite part of HK. You THINK you know HK, until you meet Joe. My husband grew up in HK (13 years) and I visited frequently as a kid, but I've never seen the side of HK that Joe showed us during our 4 hour walking tour around Central. Booking the tour was easy and Joe was very responsive. On the day of the tour, we met at the agreed upon spot and Joe showed up right on time. Our group consisted of 4 people, husband and I plus our 2 friends who have never been to HK before. Joe did a good job introducing HK through the eyes of the average HK resident. Nothing was off topic, he answered all of our inquiries from religion to politics, to of course, food. He proved to be knowledgable across various subjects, and was a champ in dealing with 4 new yorker's never ending sarcastic remarks.
