Honestly, the 4 hours flew by.Bottom Line: No matter who you are, what interests you have of HK or is looking to get out of the tour, even if you don't yet know what that may even be, you are in good hands with Joe. Easy going, extremely flexible, great attitude, and hard working. Thanks Joe for a great time. (I'll be impressing some folks here in Chinatown, NYC by cleaning the dim sum bowls!)

Awesome experience. Guide was soo informative. We only had 3 days in Hong Kong and booked a 4 hour walking tour of hong kong on the first day. We covered everything. Food,history,religion, went to markets and temples. Our guide Joe was soo informative and had done his homework where we were concerned being able to compare different aspects of hong kong with Australia (where we are from). If we had known what it was going to be like we would have booked him the next day as well.Certainly well worth it and thoroughly recommend it!

Joe is the best!. Wow! Seriously, this was such a great tour! Joe is fantastic. What I liked so much was that it felt like a chat rather than a planned, canned tour. Joe was really genuine and we learned SO much about HK and its history. He is super personable and so knowledgeable about HK. I felt like I really got to know HK in a way that I wouldn't have just walking around by myself. I am so glad we did it. This was one of the best parts of our HK/China tour. I couldn't recommend this tour highly enough!

Really great tour. Joe was our amazing host on this delightful food tour. He was incredibly informative, energetic and gave us a really good look at the "back streets" where the locals shop and eat, and places that we would never have found on our own. The dumplings were to die for, and all in all well worth doing this tour. Plus he gave us some handy hints for shopping, which led us to some really great places that we wouldn't have otherwise found. Thanks Joe & Ski, fantastic tour.

Go to Ski & Big Foot Tour!!!!. We just had the most amazing time with Ski on her Big Foot Tour! If you love an inspiring walk which goes off the beaten path and find out Hong Kong local secrets , this is DA TOUR to do! Highly recommended!

First time in Hong Kong was a winner!. Having one full day to spend in HK, I wanted to make the most of the time. Fortunately, My choice of Big Foot tours was the right decision. Joe met me precisely on time and answered all of my questions in perfect English. The information, sights, and pace were just right. I highly recommend Big Foot tours for an "up close and personal" look at what makes this city so special.

Great four hour walking tour. Thanks to Joe we had an awesome visit to Hong Kong. History, architecture, landmarks, markets, restaurant recommendations and a local's insights into life in this city. A great tour, thanks Joe for looking after us and for showing us so much we would have missed had it not been for Big Foot Tours!

Great food tour in Hong Kong. My husband and I went on a tour of the central and western district with Joe. We had a great time. Joe's english was perfect having spent several years living in the Uk. He was informative and approachable, we felt like there were no questions 'out of bounds' and he answered them all really thoroughly. The food choices were really good, a very diverse and balanced mixture and all really tasty. This was a great introduction to the local food and area and Joe gave us recommendations for the rest of our holiday. We were very full when we'd finished so don't eat breakfast before you go ! the pace of the trip was relaxed and we had plenty of stops to eat. I would absolutely recommend this tour, it's really good value for money and great fun.
Great Tour. We had Joe as our tour guide and he was very knowledgeable about the city and amended the tour to our interests and likes - great way to see Hong Kong and to learn about local life.

The Real Hong Kong Between the Raindrops. We were fortunate enough to spend our day in Hong Kong being guided by Ski Yeo. Ski met us at the ferry dock and we were off to a great day seeing and experiencing things we never would have on our own seeing behind the facades of the impressive skyline. Ski is a fountain of knowledge sharing constantly verbally and with pictures of things we did not know existed. We had a snack in a favorite local place and lunch in a multi-level restaurant where we were the only tourists. Ski ordered for us as well as supervising the "sterilizing" of our utensils and chop sticks. One of the members of our group had a problem going down escalators and Ski did not miss a beat directing the rest of us and walking down steps with the other.From my first correspondence with Ski (which included a photo of the Clock Tower and the location in Chinese where we were to meet) to the end of our tour I could not have been more pleased with the decision to tour with this amazing young woman. Even the rain did not slow us down!

Customizable tour!. Joe was fantastic, and I really loved that he came with a plan for our tour but we had the freedom to decide what we were interested in seeing and eating. Ski did a great job communicating with us before the tour to get an idea of our interests and give us directions for where to meet. The tour itself was very personal and was so interesting just to talk to a local for a couple hours and learn about Hong Kong from someone who truly knows the place. Also really appreciated that Joe sat down to review our tour route at the end and point out some great places to visit during the rest of our stay in all areas of Hong Kong. Highly recommend!

See some real Hong Kong. We decided to book this tour at the last minute and it couldn't have been easier. My wife and 16 year old son would support that this was one of the best experiences in Hong Kong. Joe was an absolutely fantastic guide. He is very knowledgeable and completely flexible about how much time you spend in each area. We learned about some of the interesting British and Chinese history, saw how the markets worked, learned what is really inside some of the dried ingredients in the soup shops and the crazy Chinese medicine shops. It was great to try some local food and restaurants that we wouldn't have done on our own. Thanks to Joe, I found a Belgian bar in Soho that served my favorite brew on tap! I've never been able to have it that way before. He also provided great recommendations for meals and other must do's in our remaining days in Hong Kong. We could have easily spent the entire day with Joe. You must give this a try!

Brilliant tour. Must do. Joe our guide was brilliant. From meeting in Central to going to the old markets to see how locals know fish is fresh to a tasty dim sum restaurant our 4 hours flew in. The knowledge that Joe had was amazing, as well as his ability to demonstrate how history is still alive in Hong Kong. Showing us the mid levels and explaining the significance of second story shops was something as Europeans we would never have thought of. Joe also got us into eating BBQ pork bao and dim sum. This is a great way to see Hong Kong and we will use them again when we return.

Absolutely worth it! A GREAT way to start your visit. Everything about our experience with Big Foot Tours was great. Reservations were easy and email responses were prompt. But the best part without a doubt is the tour.Joe met us at the lobby of our hotel. He was animated, knowledgeable, enthusiastic and very attentive to our interests and needs. We covered a lot of ground and had a chance to try some local snacks (Hong Kong tea with milk, BBQ pork). Growing up in the area, Joe was able to pass on to us a wonderful appreciation for the neighborhoods and character of Hong Kong. I would 100% recommend this to anyone interested in learning about and experiencing this city.

Best part of our Hong Kong visit!. We LOVED our tour with Joe. In our four hours together, we learned more than we expected about the history and culture of Hong Kong. Joe is a brilliant and delightful guide who tailored the walk to our specific interests. We saw the old and the new, we shopped for antiques and sampled local food at the market, and at the end of the tour, Joe gave us a map detaling our walk. We were amazed by how much ground we'd covered in one afternoon! It was as if we took the most fun graduate course ever in Hong Kong past and present. There's no better way to enjoy Hong Kong than to book a tour with Big Foot! Jo-sun! (Thank you!)

A must do in Hong Kong. Thoroughly recommended! Initial emails with Ski were very prompt and the tour itself was great, Joe is a great guide and really gives you a feel for Hong Kong - we visited in April as part of a cruise of Asia and so glad we found Big Foot Tours in Hong Kong. Joe is very flexible and will cater to your interests. If you've not researched your trip or decided what you want to see, let Joe just show you around and suggest some places. We went to some really interesting places, tasted some local food (delicious) and the time just flew by as we chatted with Joe. We have been on many walking tours but this is up there with the best. Thanks Joe for a great day!

Simply put.... THE BEST!!!!!. My apologies to Joe and Ski for the delay in posting, but Big Foot Tours is in a league of their own. To say I'm a detail orientated person would be an understatement so when I travel I typically have every minute of our trip planned out knowing which sites we're going to, in what order, the transportation between sites, etc. Having said that, I STRONGLY recommend booking with Big Foot Tours (for at least 2 days if you can), showing up and letting Joe run the show. Yes, he'll show you some of the fantastic sites HK has to offer, but learning about the culture and history through the lives of every day Hong Kongers is the highlight and something everyone should experience. Joe's energy, knowledge, love for life and sharing HK with tourists is infectious and he's the type of guy you'd open your home to if he ever traveled to your home country. Big Foot Tours helped us absolutely fall in love with Hong Kong and we plan on being back in the next few tours and will book Big Foot Tours once again to explore the new territories and get to know HK that much better. Thank you Ski and Joe, you two are amazing!

Great tour!! A must when you visit HK!!. We had an amazing time with Joe in HK this week! He showed us around the coty in a local way! We walked all over HK island and learned lots of really interesting things!! His english is great (difficult to find) and really friendly!! A must if you go to HK!!

Best tour ever. We went on a tour of HK with Joe - what a brilliant experience ! Joe is full of information about HK which he imparts with enthusiasm, humour and charm. He brought us to the heart of the real HK - to local traders , restaurants and homes - loved very aspect of the tour - best time and money we spent. Could not reccomend it highly enough.

So Much in so Little Time. We've traveled all over the world and Ski has far surpassed any guide we have ever known. She takes pride in her company, knows her mission and shares her charm & wit with you as if she's known you forever. That is one of the best things about her! I highly recommend Big Foot Tours. We booked last minute so were only able to spend one day with Big Foot Tours and it was everything and more that we had hoped for. I suggest you book with BFT for 2 or 3 days and throw in a couple of evening tours. Wish we could have. Thanks Ski!!!!

Гонконг глазами иностранца. Можно написать емко и по-существу , такие отзывы всегда полезны,но не вдохновляют, не рождают желания и фантазий. Поэтому напишу, как чувствую. Поездка в Гонконг планировалась за месяц до вылета. Тщательно изучив все возможные отзывы об этом далеком городе? острове? государстве ? в тот момент это было совершенно не понятно, но определенный план « Что увидеть в первую очередь» был составлен. Перемещаться самостоятельно от достопримечательности к достопримечательности было не интересно, и не из-за лени, просто хотелось не посмотреть, а увидеть этот город. Ну а как это возможно за 3 дня и с с путеводителем? Совершенно неожиданно , мониторя отзывы о достопримечательностях Гонконга, наткнулась на BIG FOOT TOUR. Коллеги-советчики писали об открытиях , которые совершили,гуляя по городу с гидами-гонконгцами. Сидящий в недрах страх начинать переписку на английском был подавлен , и уже на следующий день я получила приветливое письмо из Гонконга с вопросами о наших пожеланиях по темам экскурсии, наших интересах и времени ее проведения. Буквально через день все детали были согласованы и, тур забронирован! Ski прислала подробные инструкции, как добраться до места встречи на метро и даже фотографию нашего гида Joe. Гордость от самостоятельно планируемого путешествия переполняла меня, но также переполнял и страх , как к такой самодеятельности отнесется мой супруг. Естественно, на идею пешеходной экскурсии по нетуристическим местам в незнакомом неевропейском городе, забронированной на неизвестном ему сайте, оплаченной по неизвестному ему PayPal, он смотрел скептически. Так или иначе, преодолев джетлег, и попытки мужа избежать экскурсии и поездки на метро, мы добрались до места встречи. Joe оказался симпатичным молодым гонконгцем, говорившим на великолепном британском английском. Маршрут, которым он нас провел никогда не мог быть сформирован самостоятельно! Это было невероятно интересно! Путешественники не обманули, действительно , детали жизни современного Гонконга: быт, кухня, традиции, религия , которые нам открылись из его рассказа были удивительными и непохожими ни на что! Несколько лет назад я провела 3 месяца в Токио и 3 месяца в Сеуле- и до сих пор практически ничего не знаю об этих городах-только личные наблюдения, а здесь за 4 часа наши наблюдения и знания Joe соединились и вылились в вострог от чудесного города! Муж, испытывая Joe на прочность, задавал каверзные вопросы по истории города и всегда получал исчерпывающие ответы с датами и процентами)))Было ощущение, что мы приехали в гости , и нас заботливо знакомят с городом и его традицией. Не буду раскрывать секреты тура, чтоб вам было интересно, скажу только что это было здорово! Мы обошли огромную часть Гонконга, пообедали в настоящем!!( ни одного туриста)ресторане, с самыми вкусными Димсамами проехались на всех видах транспорта и получили от Joe незаменимые рекомендации по нашему самостоятельному маршруту на следующий день.В следующий раз, надеюсь, будем исследовать Новые территории Гонконга тоже вместе. Большое спасибо Joe, сейчас рассматривая фотографии Гонконга, я знаю что ты где-то там и улыбаюсь тебе с другого конца света.A trip to Hong Kong I planned a month before departure . After monitoring of all the possible reviews about this city ? island? Country ? at that time it wasn’t clear. But a plan " What to see in the first place " was made . Move around the city on our own from one attractions to another was not interesting for me and not because of laziness , I just wanted not to see the city but discover it. Well, how is it possible for 3 days and with a guide-book ?  Quite unexpectedly, I monitored reviews of attractions in Hong Kong , came across BIGFOOTTOUR. Tripadvisers wrote about the discoveries they have made from the following city tours. I was really scare to start conversation in English but did it! And the next day I received a welcoming letter from Hong Kong with questions about our wishes, our interests and time of the meeting. Just the next day all the details have been agreed and the tour was booked ! Ski sent detailed instructions on how to get to the venue on the subway , and even a picture of our guide Joe. Pride of the planned journey filled me , but also I felt fear if my husband will like this idea. The idea of a walking tour on non-tourist places in an unfamiliar non-European city , booked on an unknown site , paid through an unknown for him PayPal.. he looked skeptical. Anyway , breaking jetleg and husbands attempts to avoid tour itself and also subway, we got to the venue. Joe turned out pretty young Hong Kong sitizen , who spoke on the magnificent British English. Route , which he suggested we could never do independently ! It was incredibly exciting! Travelers are not deceived , indeed, details of of modern Hong Kong life , cuisine, traditions, religion , that he told us were amazing and unlike anything! Several years ago I spent 3 months in Tokyo and 3 months in Seoul , I still know almost nothing about these cities only personal observations , and here 4 hours of observation and knowledge incorporated and resulted in the lovely feeling of the town! Husband, was testing Joe for strength, asking tricky questions on the history of the city and have always received satisfactory answers with dates and percentages ))) I had a feeling that we came to our friend and now carefully exploring the city and its tradition with him . I will not reveal the secrets of the tour, so it would be more interesting for you, I can only say that it was great! We walked a huge part of Hong Kong , had lunch at real!! ( Not a tourist ) restaurant with the most delicious Dim Sum in my life, ride on all types of transport and received by Joe essential recommendations for our next day in Honkong. Next time , I hope, will explore new territories in Hong Kong together . Many thanks to Joe, now looking at our photos from Hong Kong, I sitting on the other end of the world I know you're somewhere there and wish you all the best!

Best tour we've ever had!. Wow what a fantastic time we had with Joe! We learnt all about the history and how local people live today. Joe is an incredibly articulate and well educated young man who is very knowledgable about this city. Would highly recommend this tour to anyone!

Loved this tour!!. With only two days to explore HK we were fortunate to book a private tour with Ski. As owner/guide Ski was able to share the culture, religion, history and food of Hong Kong with us first-timers. She was articulate, informed and interesting. It was definitely a highlight of our SE Asia tour. We would highly recommend this tour if you are physically able to walk for four hours. Great value for the money.

Include this as part of any sight seeing you do in Hong Kong. We have had 3 days in HK and we did the peak tram, and hop on bus stuff and self navigated a bit , but if you want to get under the skin of the city a little you need a local guide. Joe was excellent and we took more from the 4 hrs with him than anything else we did. At 1600 hkd for the tour I felt it was good value and you should definitely do this, simply wandering around with a guide book is not the same....believe me I did that too.We learnt about the past , present , what it's like to live and work here etc.

DO NOT MISS THIS!. We are very lucky to have Ski as our guide for our students. Our second experience with Big Foot Tour and with certainty, another great one! The whole tour cannot be better as it was perfectly pitched to a diverse group of young teens! Our students are still raving about the tour as a highlight of their trip in Hong Kong. Thank you, Ski! We look forward to our next collaboration!

We love Joe and highly recommend!. Joe is a great young man. At 25 years old, he artfully managed to bond with two parents in their 40s and two kids, 9 and 12. He was equally versed discussing the philosophy of Taoism and playing with the shop cats with the kids. His tour was terrific and combined the must see parts of the local HK scene with the personal aspects that he brought to his neighborhood and his childhood haunts. We also love to "meet the locals" on all of our travels and we believe that Joe set the bar higher in this category. He is clearly a local kid through and through and knew all of the shopkeepers and the best angles to take with each. He was very honest about the good and the bad that he sees in HK today and presented a compelling memory for all of us. Thank you Joe!

Simply excellent. I did this private walking tour last year with my Mother & sister. On my return to Hong Kong with my 15yr old son I just had to do it again because I knew my son would thoroughly enjoy meeting Joe and all he had to show him. It was the highlight again for our week in Hong Kong. I cannot recommend this company and this young man, Joe, highly enough. You will see a totally different side to Hong Kong and the stories are just wonderful. The places he took us to on Hong Kong island were extremely interesting. Joe is a wonderful guide, but also an impressive young man. My son thought he was brilliant and talked about the tour for days afterwards. It was definitely the highlight for him. Joe is extremely flexible and will show you whatever you want. If you are unsure what to see then he is a wealth of knowledge and will decide for you, where to take you. An absolute must for anybody wanting to see the real Hong Kong.

Fabulous Overview of Hong Kong. I took a 4-hour tour with Big Foot Tour on my first day arriving in Hong Kong for a work trip, and couldn't have been more pleased--all of these good reviews are well deserved! I found this tour to be the perfect thing to do at the start of my short trip, as the rest of my time in HK was colored by the tips and stories that I learned from my tour guide, Joe. Joe helped me by an Octopus card that I used for transportation the rest of my time there, took me on the metro and the tram, taught me about history and how one can commute by escalator, introduced me to black sesame dessert soup and five-flower tea and warm egg tarts, and showed me a neighborhood little park with a reflexology area that I visited most mornings for the rest of my trip. He took time after the tour to draw on a map all the places we had been and gave me other recommendations of places to try. Joe truly showed me the city through the eyes of a local, and packed so much into four hours that I actually feel like I was in Hong Kong longer than I was. I would recommend this tour company to anyone, and especially anyone who is only in HK for a short time like I was, and wants to make the most of it. Thanks Joe and Ski--it was truly a pleasure!

World Class Tour. highly recommended! having done a private tour in each country that I visited, big foot tour surely tops the list especially since our current guide in China pales way too much in comparison! Ski is an amazing guide and the reviews on Tripadvisor speaks for her tours (she is the owner, by the way and gets booked out way too fast, so ask for her early as we wished we had her for the whole trip!) and her efforts to make sure my group of 5 is well taken care of in every aspect. In fact, i was quite cynical at first to find a tour that has so many good reviews but now i know why and i agree with all the awesome reviews posted for them wholeheartedlyOnce you do a big foot tour, you won't do other tours or find other tours as awesome! Way to go!

Walking Tour of Hong Kong Island (Central & Western areas). We had amazing tour! Joe gave us the perfect amount historical facts to bring to life an already colorful city. The tour was fascinating, relevant and educational. It held the attention of two teenagers (16-13). I love the personal stories...I now know how to pick out a perfectly fresh fish! Joe seemed wise beyond his years and his enthusiasm for Hong Kong made us excited to learn more. The tour was worth every penny and when we come back we will choose a new part of the city to explore with Big Foot Tours. I would highly recommend this company!

Everything we wanted and more.. We had read all the reviews on trip advisor and can absolutely say this tour is worth every penny. Joe was our tour guide and he made the tour relevant, fascinating and educational, even for our 8 year old. He is worldly beyond his years and his enthusiasm for Hong Kong Island was energising and leaving us to want to explore more. We were so unsure about what to see and we were glad to leave the itinerary to Joe and Ski. I would come back and do another tour with Big Foot in a heart beat. Thank you Joe, we thoroughly enjoyed it.

Guided tour of Hong Kong Island. Eight of us took this 4 hour walking tour. Our tour guide, Joe, was charming, friendly and extremely knowledgeable. The tour brought us throughout the central and western regions of the island and gave us an excellent understanding of the inside of Hong Kong. I would heartily recommend this company.

A Fabulous Day in Hong Kong. We arranged a six-hour tour with Ski Yeo of Big Foot Tours upon the recommendation of a friend. A great day!!! We started by meeting her in Hong Kong (we were staying in Kowloon), following directions she had emailed us, using the subway system. Perfect instructions. We spent the day walking Hong Kong and then Kowloon at a leisurely pace, stopping frequently for a snack at one of the many shops. Lunch was in a dim sung restaurant. A really local place. My wife and I are in our early 70's and though we were tired after six hours of walking, Ski kept it at a pace that was comfortable. I would highly recommend this tour; we saw many off the beaten path sites. It wa a fabulous day.

This is the best way to see and learn about Hong Kong!. We had a private 4 hour family tour with Joe and it was by far the highlight of our recent visit to Hong Kong. Joe gave us a true inside look at local life in Hong Kong. We ate street food and had a traditional dim sum lunch, visited several really interesting areas of the city including some from Joe's own childhood and learned much about the fascinating history of this culture along the way. Joe kept our whole family (ages 12-49) entertained with stories, fun facts and answers to some of our really silly questions. We went back to many of the places Joe showed us and to others he suggested - all were great (though not the same without our new "friend"). Joe was so good that we tried to hire him again the following day to visit the New Territories but he was already booked. Make sure you arrange for one of these tours before you arrive - he and Ski are in great demand and we can certainly understand why!

What most travelers never see in Hong Kong. If you want the single most informative tour of any city you could possibly have, look no further than Joe of Big Foot Tours. Joe, because of his own travels, has not only a locals understanding of Hong Kong (having grown up there) but also a travelers view, having spent time abroad in England. As a result, his tour provides a very up close and in-person view of the real Hong Knog, but delivered in a way that is easy to understand for a first time visitor. His explanations -- both verbal and physical - of the city made for a wonderful experience for our family of four (including a teen age girl and pre-teen son). We got to see the way locals really shop in markets, the way the eat (amazing dim sum!!!), and the way they live. Even ex-pat residents were asking us for his information, as we got to see parts of Hong Kong they never exeprience. Five stars from some experienced travelers!!!

Thank you Joe. This was a great way to know the city, the people and start our short vacation. Joe was an excellent and considerate host. The pace was perfect for us (my daughter was 4 months pregnant) and best of all he left us with maps and suggestions for the rest of our visit, which was really useful. Joe and Ski have since been in contact to ensure we were happy and it feels more like we've made a friend in Hong Kong than that we bought a service.

Very enjoyable and informative tour. We had a brilliant 4 hour tour with Joe in March 2014. Joe was an excellent guide with a wealth of knowledge on Hong Kong. The 4 hours went so quick and we covered various areas in the central and sheung wan districts. Joe conducted the tour very professionally and included food and drinks stops along with offering us tips for the rest of our stay. We would definitely recommend this tour is done at the start of your stay. The whole experience was just so enjoyable and fascinating it is certainly one of the best ways to explore Hong Kong. It certainly gave us the confidence to explore wider areas of Hong Kong. At the end of the tour Joe gave us a map and recapped on what we had done and seen. This information proved to be very useful for the rest of our stay. Thank you Joe, we will remember our time with you on this tour.

Must Do in HK. We had a wonderful 4-hour tour of Central and Western HK with Ski during our first visit to the city. I can't say enough great things about both Ski as a guide as well as the tour itself and the company overall - the professionalism of the booking process, customer service, etc. really stood out to me. This is a best-in-class operation and you can tell that a lot of effort and pride goes into the business and the way in which they interact with their customers. I gave Ski some pretty general ideas of what we wanted to see and do and she arranged an entire afternoon itinerary totally customized for us! She also went above and beyond after our tour and followed up by sending us additional links and information about topics we had been interested in for the remainder of our time in HK.Ski showed us sides to the city that we would never have found ourselves so we were able to see HK in a whole new light - and this tour really made our trip. We got to experience the "real" HK as the locals do - not just sightseeing. Having Ski's insight the entire way added an entirely new dimension to our experience as visitors to this amazing city!Yes, it won't cost you much to wander around on your own with a guidebook but spending the time with Ski and Big Foot is worth every penny, I promise! Ski is a wealth of knowledge about the history and culture of HK and is also just such a delight to spend an afternoon with. By the end of the day we felt that we had made a friend! Of our whole time in HK this was by far our favorite activity. Hope you enjoy it too!

We had an excellent day out with Big Foot Tour, don't even think about it you have to do it.. I would highly recommend this tour even if you have been to Hong Kong before, Ski was so energetic and passionate about this way cool place. We went to and experienced food and places we would have never know or ate. ( I'm still dreaming of the waffles and teaofee, and I can still taste and crave those Egg Tarts. Don't miss out on this Amazing tour!!!CheersJohn

Amazing day tour!!. We had an 8-hour combination tour: sightseeing + food. 8 hours had passed very quickly, as Joe made the tour very interesting and exciting. He also was very flexible and could tailor the tour to our interests. Moreover, I can say that there might be loads of tours offered by various companies, however Big Foot offers not just a tour, but THE tour guide - Joe, who highlights the whole trip to HK. If it wasnt for Joe, I am not sure whether me and my friend would get as much pleasure and joy from our tour.We will be coming back with more friends to HK soon, and will definitely book a tour with a Big Foot.I will for sure recommend Big Foot to all my friends and you guys as well.

Big Foot Walking Tours with Joe a must do when visiting HK !. We did a Big Foot Walking Tour on our recent stay in HK.Joe our guide was a very personable young man with a wealth of knowledge about HK both past and present.The tour was not just great fun but Joe also gave us a real insight into the every day life of of the city and it's many wonderful secret places that only the locals would know about .Joe is an amazing young tour guide and I would recommend every one , whether it's your first visit to HK , or you have been there many times before to book a tour with him. His enthusiasm,love for his city and in depth knowledge ,will I guarantee make the tour one of the highlights of your stay !

Best travel decision we have ever made!. We did the four hour walking tour with Ski Yeo on our first day in Hong Kong and it was the best travel decision we have ever made. Not only was our time with her informative and fun but her suggestions for what to see and do for the next three days was invaluable. We followed every one and had a wonderful time. She taught us how to use the public transportation system using the octopus pass which allowed us to see and do so much economically. I highly recommend her tour for anyone visiting Hong Kong!

Ski Yeo was a wonderful tour guide. . Booked this tour based on trip advisor reviews and again we were not disappointed! Ski was friendly, relaxed and made sure to show us and tell us as much about Hong Kong and it's culture in 4 hours as she could. We really enjoyed the experiences. She is passionate and it will rub off on you. Great tour. Small bit on the expensive side but we thoroughly enjoyed every minute. Great way to see some real Hong Kong! Martina and James Ireland

Big Foot Tours was interesting and flexible!. My husband and I reserved with Ski, the owner of Big Foot Tours, in Hong Kong. We were referred to Big Foot Tours by a friend from Denver. Ski is great and took us to places we never would have seen in Hong Kong. Our tour was personalized by our desire to see more cultural and historic places in Hong Kong. Ski is very personable and is willing to prepare your tour to whatever you are interested in seeing in Hong Kong; shopping, markets, history, culture, etc. Big Foot Tours is affordable and worth every cent we paid. We highly recommend that you contact Ski and she will respond quickly and efficiently directly to you. So glad we did this!Big Chief Mountain, Colorado

Great Tour with Joe. I booked a tour with Big Foot Tours based on all the wonderful reviews on trip advisor. I filled out the enquiry form on big foot tours website & Ski contacted me to arrange the booking which was a very easy process.I booked the tour for myself & my friend as it was our 1st visit to HK & we wanted to make the most of our time & see as much as we could.Joe met us at an exit of the Central MTR station. He brought us out of the bustling part of the city through food markets, soho & mid level escalators, even a through a park that had a reflexology section, we tried some congee & milk tea which was very nice. We were able to learn a lot about the history of HK, traditions & superstitions. We would not have experienced any of this had we not gone on the tour. The pace of the tour is really good aswell, we walked along at our own pace never felt under pressure or pushed for time. At the end of the tour Joe gave us a map of HK drawing out the route we had taken and marked all the places we had visited on the tour along with some shopping centres & other points of interest which we found really helpful throughout the rest of our trip. We couldn't believe how much we had covered in the 4 hours.Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Big Foot Tour to you all, just book it you won't be disappointed!!Thanks again Joe & Ski, we had a great time & I would certainly book another tour with you guys :)

Greatest tour ever!!!. I was a little hesitant about booking a tour and I'm sure some of you reading this are as well but I am telling you this was the best decision ever. If you are thinking about booking then DO IT! The booking was easy and quick. JOE is awesome. He not only told us about the history of Hong Kong and the transitions but also about the food, the architecture, the people, the culture and everything in between. We were only able to spend 4 hours with Joe but totally worth every minute. We covered a lot of the city and saw so many things without Joe you would walk on by. I love the milk tea, the food vendors, the soup shop, the escalator, the fish guy(hearts & bladders) and my favorite of all the little custards! (Warm from the oven and SOOO good, I could have eaten 50). Joe was even kind enough to spend time with us asking what else we were doing in the city so he could help with recommendations. We went to the dim sum restaurant he recommended-Awesome. He also recommended a place to buy Jade -another good find. The map he made for us also helped us go back to some things we wanted to revisit. Also don't be afraid of the MTR from a country girl from Colorado if I can do it anyone can, Joe helped with that too. I can't say enough good things about Joe and Ski for this awesome experience! If I ever return to Hong Kong I will book this tour in a heart beat!

Incredible informative tour. Big Foot Tour of Hong Kong was one of the most informative tours we have ever had, and we have traveled to many countries of the world. Our guide, Joe, walked us through multiple neighborhoods, starting at the harbor and showed us how Hong Kong developed educating us to its history, cultures, architecture, and ethnicities. Anyone who travels to Hong Kong must take this tour, you will come back with a wealth of knowledge and understanding.

Second Tour with Big Foot Tour. I have been on a walking tour with Ski of Big Foot Tour before and written a review about it. It was great as many of us agree here on Trip Advisor and so when I was visiting Hong Kong & Macau again for a short holiday with a friend and we decided to go on a Food Tour this time again with Big Foot Tour. This time Joe showed us around Sham Shui Po food markets where we sampled the street delicacies of the REAL Hong Kong. Joe is not only very knowledgeable about Hong Kong and its culture but also very patient to absorb the guests (us) own little questions & stories about culture. The tour progressed totally at our own pace and we never felt tired or rushed during the entire trip(this is very helpful). There were some street food which is considered extremely exotic in the western world which we got to sample and enjoyed it thoroughly. Every stop for a food sample has been researched well and was fit in with the time you start and stop your tour. The tour started in the morning so we started with a classic Cantonese breakfast and moved on until lunch. At no time were we forced /coerced into eating any /all of the (lovely) food. So there was no stress at all. We then moved on to Mong Kok for some street food closer towards lunch time and after the trip was over, we conveniently shopped around the markets in the afternoon. At the end of the trip Joe encouraged us to explore some more areas of interest on our own if we wished. We liked this part also (even though we wished we had continued for the rest of the day with Joe) as we have noticed that Big Foot Tour always encourage guests to find out more about Hong Kong on their own. Thanks to Joe and Ski for arranging this trip. I would highly recommend this tour for first timers and also returning guests who have been to Hong Kong before. Try Big Foot Tour once and you will become their fan. A great memorable tour is guaranteed.

Food Tour. It was an incredible and awesome experience that I enjoyed very much and would definitely want to book again and recommend to others. I was totally put at ease when I had some hesitation about eating some foods and I know I tasted things I never would have otherwise. The information provided about Hong Kong was great and I really did see and learn a lot that day. Very knowledgeable, personable and terrific guides! I hope to be able to go on another tour in the future.

Amazing experience- a must. We just spent an afternoon with Joe on a walking tour. He was fantastic and gave us a very in depth and eye opening view of Hong Kong. From its markets and superstitions to the history and culture of the people. It left us wishing we had more time to spend with him and in Hong Kong.

Don't miss this tour. I booked this tour based on tripadvisor reviews and I am glad I did!! Booking this tour was quick and easy. Ski was very helpful in answering my questions through email. I had a private tour and my guide, Joe, was fantastic!!!! It was great learning about Hong Kong's history and how it has transformed over the years. The great thing about this tour is that they really do take you outside of the typical tourist areas. This is a tour that you MUST DO while in Hong Kong. Thanks for the great tour Joe!

Amazing experience!. Joe Clark did a fantastic job in our four hour walking tour of Hong Kong. We had already spent some days in the city, and had even toured with another guide several days before. Nonetheless, Joe helped us see the city, its people and culture, with new eyes. Architecture, food, daily routines, history, urban development, health and medicine - Joe touched on all of these topics and more, leaving us with the sense that we had glimpsed the city from the perspective of an insider. We are in our fifties, and Joe is youthful, but the age gap in no way inhibited our interaction. Joe was polite, helpful, funny, and simply a genuinely nice person. We have employed tour guides in a number of countries, including some highly credentialed ones (university professors, for example), and none have been more knowledgeable, nor enjoyable, than Joe. This was a delightful experience, and I recommend Bigfoot and Joe to any HK visitor.

Ski is excellent, a must in HK. My wife and I arrived in HK at 0615 on a Saturday and spent 4 hours with Ski (Big Foot walking tour) from 10 until 2pm. She was excellent and gave us a real insight into the culture, history, food and infrastructure, transport of the City.It's a must to get an early overview and Ski delivered, she was enthusiastic and knowledgable and friendly, thanks Ski!

Great tour with Joe. My friend, my 10 year old son and I did a private walking tour today with Joe. It was great! Perfectly pitched to give a real understanding of what life is really like for expats and locals in Hong Kong. We learned a lot, tested out some reflexlogy, chinese medicine and some tasty treats like chicken feet, roast pork, custard tarts and pork buns. This was a wonderful way to learn in a fun way about history and what we were looking at all around us. A must do when in Hong Kong! Highly recommend with children of this age who want fun but more than Disneyland.

A must do. We decided to take a private tour for the first time and were so glad we did. The guide Joe was very helpful and showed us all sorts of things we wouldn't of ever seen. He obviously knows lots of people so you also get the interaction with the locals. You must try to get a tour at the beginning of your stay as it leaves you with plenty of ideas of things to do for the rest. Excellent!

Best Walking Tour in Hong Kong. We had a great time in Hong Kong on this tour. Ski is a terrific guide who knows Hong Kong inside out. Hong Kong is a spectacular city, with a fascinating history, Ski was able to answer any questions, no matter how sensitive, in a very professional mannerCant recommend this tour eneogh.It is a walking tour, a level of fitness is required, but not that difficult. Most of the uphill can be done on the worlds longest elevator

Was the best part of our HK Trip. I followed everybody's suggestion to do it on the first day and no regrets. I'm happy we committed to this as we were tempted to sleep our first day away. Our guide was Joe and he was very good and knowledgeable. He really knows his stuff. I highly recommend this tour. All worth it. Also would like to thank Ski for the suggestions. Very helpful indeed.

See beneath Hong Kong's shiny veneer. Just wanted to thank Joe for a fantastic experience on the day and Big Foot for a professional booking experience throughout. We booked a private walking tour for our first day in Hong Kong (my first trip) and it proved an excellent way to set the tone for an experience in Hong Kong that penetrated beneath Hong Kong's shiny veneer of luxury stores, restaurants and high rise light shows. Joe took us to places outside the typical tourist areas including a wet market, community kitchen, housing estates, etc. We learned many interesting things about Hong Kong culture and its changing influences and challenges over history to the present time. Sorting out our Octopus cards for the subway was an added bonus which kept us mobile all week. Would happily recommend Big Foot to anyone visiting Hong Kong and even to expats living there who might not have seen this side of the city. Thanks again Joe.

THE ORIGINAL AND BEST!. My wife and I spent 10 days in Hong Kong and decided to include a walking tour as part of our holiday. We selected Big Foot because of the outstanding reviews on TripAdvisor and because we wanted a tour for just the two of us. I did contact several other firms that offered tours but none of them came close to Big Foot either in cost or in providing what we wanted to do (and not what they thought we should do). The booking process was really simple and straightforward. Ski was very prompt in answering my questions and included all our preferences in the itinerary that she planned for us.The four-hour walking tour that Ski took us on was excellent in all respects! Not strenuous in any way as it was more of a wander through the streets of old Hong Kong. It provided an excellent level of detail and included several things that we would never have done on our own. Make sure you try the iced 50/50 and a piece of French toast with coconut jam - highly recommended!! If Starbuck's sold this drink they would make an even bigger fortune.We have been home now for several days but our enthusiasm for Big Foot Tours, and Ski in particular, has not diminished one iota. I can only reiterate what all the reviews of Big Foot Tours say - excellent, best ever, great, etc, etc. I can honestly say that there was nothing either of us did not enjoy; even the mundane necessities such as clean toilets were planned into the tour.Ski is the founder of Big Foot Tours and her enthusiasm for her job was very refreshing to see. Her profession is an accountant but she hates being in an office so decided to start Big Foot Tours - the very first of its kind in Hong Kong. She is extremely personable and excellent company. Overall we had an outstanding tour that will remain a cherished memory for ever. I have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this tour in the strongest possible terms.

The best tour I have ever been on. A colleague and I booked this tour on our day off in Hong Kong. Ski was wonderful and sent me a photo of Joe so I knew whom I was looking for. I sent her a specific itinerary that indicated what I wanted to do and they followed that to a "T". Joe was amazing. I am in no way a history buff, nor do I care about architecture but the way Joe speaks makes everything interesting. We had been in Hong Kong for a couple of days and had walked around the markets and buildings. After being educated by Joe, we now went back to these areas with new eyes. We knew exactly what we were looking at. Joe brought us to medicinal shops and explained everything. He even took us to a medicinal tea spot and I had some tea for a headache. Joe is an expert because he grew up here. He showed us the famous Graham Street Wet Market and explained to us how his grandma would pick out fish, why the hearts are still beating, what to look for when purchasing meat, etc. Joe explained the history and evolution of the streets in a way which was so fascinating. Joe took his time with us and we never felt rushed. In fact our tour went a little over and he was so gracious with his time. Another highlight was the local dim sum joint Joe took us too. The only sad part is when I tried to book again for the following day, they were booked up for the following 3 days! From what I understand, this operation is just Ski and Joe. I am planning on going back to Hong Kong and I will be booking them again. Thank you Ski and Joe!!!! This was honestly the best tour I have ever been on. Looking forward to having another.

Excellent walking tour. Our family spent 4 highly entertaining hours with Joe. His passion and knowledge about this vibrant city made the tour the highlight of our time in Hong Kong and we visited places we would never have found on our own.He also gave us great advice for the rest of our time in Hong Kong as well.Highly recommended.

Thanks For A Great Tour. My wife and I had a wonderful experience with Ski, a walking tour of Central HK with a stop for classic Hong Kong milk tea and a wonderful dim sum lunch. We highly recommend Ski and Big Foot as a way to get to know Hong Kong history, culture and just plain fun facts. Well worth it.

Phenomenal! Take one on your first day in HK!. My wife and I took a tour with Ski on our first day in Hong Kong only because the day we wanted (our last day in HK) was fully booked. Talk about happy accidents - the tour was incredible and helped us see Hong Kong in a new, fuller way for the rest of our visit. Ski taught us not only about the history and food of HK - the tour we thought we were getting - but also about the social elements of the society in a way that helped us gain a better understanding of Hong Kong and the people who live there. (Who knew you can sue someone in HK for ruining their feng shui?) The rest of our trip was so much more satisfying and rewarding - and it was all because of what we learned on Ski's tour. Ski even introduced us to kaya - a coconut spread popular in SE Asia - and then emailed us later to tell us where we could find some to take home! We were in SE Asia for 17 days, and I'm not sure we were happier with anything we did in that time than we were with our Big Foot Tour in HK. A great value and a great experience.

Eat like a Local - walking tour. We vistited Hongong for the first time and we wanted to experience local food. Thanks to our guide Ski we had the chance to experience local food in small businesses and we got some really interesting information about history and present time. We also received very helpful information on going around in the city in the email exchange before our arrival. Thanks very much for this. This tour was a real blast and we decided on the same day to do another tour in Kowloon but unfortunately Ski was not able to make it because of an already busy schedule.. which speaks for itself. We really want to say thank your for the time spent with us and we certainly would do this again.

AMAZING!!. We took Big Foot Tour on our first day in Hong Kong and was the best introduction we could ever have!Joe was our guide and after a brief talk about our main interests, he took us (me and 2 teenagers) through the most amazing walk around HK!Culture, religion, history, interesting facts about HK and food, Joe covered so many topics that the hours flew and seemed minutes! He showed us the streets markets, we tried fruits, delicious tea, and many of Joe’s picks, while walking and talking through HK streets. We saw the impresive stairs system people uses every day to go to work, how they live and even the reduced spaces every office occupies. We visited a playground were we tryed reflexology, and observed the people just hanging out after work.When at the end we saw the map and realized how many blocks we had walked we were shocked! So many different neighborhoods and every one with their special and unique characteristicsIt was amazing to see HK through Joe’s eyes, it was awakening for us!

Great walk with Joe. Thanks Joe and Big Foot Walking Tours…. private tour for 4 adults. Joe did a great job of providing history and back story on many areas in the Central, upper levels, Sheung Wan area. Joe was enthusiastic and very knowledgeable. A good host. Thank you.

Joe is Awesome!. We (3 adults) had an amazing tour with Joe. We had completed the hop-on bus tour so we had a general feel for the major sights in Hong Kong. Joe showed us so much more. It started with a review of feng shui in the architecture of the big buildings - then moved through the background behind the Brits and the Chinese - then covered everything from breakfast foods to his childhood playground to the reason big buildings don't exist in one area. As I said, it was awesome! The best thing we did in Hing Kong! Thanks Joe!

Exiting tour. It was our first visit to Hong Kong. Joe meat us in our hotel lobby and in next 4 hours make us fall in love with this fascinating city. We saw real Hong Kong behind all the glitter of Tiffanies and Cartiers. We will be back.

Fantastic tour!. Before going on a cruise out of Hong Kong, we did a half day with Joe, we enjoyed it enormously! We could see exactly what we wanted and get answers to all our questions! Would definitely recommend this tour to anybody going to Hong Kong! Worth every dime!

Perfect first day orientation!. Wanting to experience Hong Kong, my buddy and I arrived on an early morning flight from Jakarta after an extended scuba holiday in Eastern Indonesia. We chose Big Foot Tours based on TripAdvisor reviews and thoroughly delighted with this first-day orientation. As it was just two of us we were able to cover a lot of ground, perhaps 4 km total including walking and use of an iconic double-decker street trolley, through several districts including the financial center, the street market, Soho, Cat Street, past local food markets and more.Our personal guide, Joe, was outstanding. Humorous, knowledgeable, insightful and attentive to our interests. He also directed us to local food providers for sampling traditional dishes and, at the end of out tour, recommended applicable areas for the shopping we wanted to do during our stay including camera, jade and art purveyors.We couldn't have been happier with Joe and our guided tour, pleased that his instructions for our initial meeting place were clear and uncomplicated. I highly recommend this tour service to anyone! Thanks, Joe.

A Must Do. Big Foot Tour was definitely one of the highlights of our trip which also included stops in Beijing, Shanghai, Macau, and Singapore. It allowed us to explore Hong Kong in a very in-depth and personal way.  Our guide was Joe. He asks you ahead of time if you’re into historical and cultural information so as not to impose with stuff you’re not into (We were, and he had a wealth of info). He took us to awesome local spots that you wouldn't otherwise be able to look up and read about. Everything seemed to be in perfect moderation. For instance, the tour lasted roughly 4 hours. Visually, it felt like we've been exploring all day but our legs weren't tired at all. Nor did we feel uncomfortably full even though we had a lot to eat, including but limited to: Congi, BBQ meats, fish balls, ball shaped waffles, turtle jelly, iced coffee, poppy dessert (forgot the name), egg tart, five flower tea and more. Each of those was at a different place! Upon request, he even found a spot with snake soup, which wasn't seasonal at the time.Joe was super nice and accommodating. He spent some time with us after the tour and gave us more suggestions for our remaining days and outlined them on a map. Lastly, It was our favorite city from the trip in large part because of this tour. I highly recommend this group and Joe in particular.Some info for comparison - We were 26 and 27 on our honeymoon and we live in a big city in the US (but recommend it for anyone).

The best of our travels!. Thanks to Big Foot Tour, in particular Ski, for the beautiful HK experience. I booked tow tours, one with joe and one with ski. Both guides are terrific and without any hesitation both worthy of top 5-star ratings! (more stars if it was even possible!). But if we have to choose, myself and my wife preferred Ski's style more.Joe has a highly infectious energy and shared a lot on his life growing up in Hong Kong. Cool stuff, we learnt from him and it set out modd upbeat for the rest of the trip!Ski has an ability to preempt what we wanted and the tour went seamlessly well centring all around us. More than just sharing, she engages and we felt naturally comfortable opening up to her. A great listener she is and we bonded very well, ended up feeling like she is our daughter. Extremely humble lady (with amazing accmoplishments in her life that she didn't even mentioned if not for us asking), definitely an interesting charcter to know.This is an absolutely brillant tour from booking to exceptional local knlowledge to wonderful guides. Go big foot tour!

My 2nd bigfoot tour - perfection as always. This was my second tour with bigfoot, my first with Ski and this time with Joe. This is an incredibly slick operation, from the time of booking it became apparent that Ski had recorded all the details of my previous tour and was able to advise what to see next. She recalled from a brief conversation on our first tour the details of my allergies and had briefed Joe on them before he met me! I was amazed and very impressed.Joe is a gifted guide, he has an exceptional knowledge of the history, culture, lifestyle and perspective of the Hong Kong people, and is skilled at sharing this fascinating place with his guests.5 stars. If you want to see HK, you must book Ski and Joe.My advice is to consult with them early, as they are incredibly generous in sharing their local knowledge in planning your whole trip to HK.

Great tour with variety. Joe gave our family a great tour covering a wide range from architecture (dragon holes) to fishes beating hearts in traditional markets. All of our family recommend him. Very memorable tour from a well informed young man. It was easily the best of 4 tours we had elsewhere on our trip. Out lunch with the construction workers was well worth the time.

proud to do a big foot tour!. without big foot tour, i would not have learn so much about hong kong and the tips to get the max out of my trip. ask for Ski, the founder to show me around as i like dealing with owners directly and the assurance of quality. i got an experience totally suited for my interests and was money very well spent. highly recommended!

Another great experience with Big Foot. I have just used Big Foot tours for the second time and the experience was just as good as the last time. Joe is a great guide. Friendly and very knowledgeable, providing a great opportunity to see local sites and eat local foods. Taking a personalised tour is terrific value- personal attention and at times and pace to suit you. They remembered the last tour I went on and based on that provided suggestions for my second tour - this time out to the New Territories - Fanling and Tai Po Market. Another great experience and we have already planned an itinerary that suits me for next time.

A must do!. We did 2 tours with Joe. We did a walking tour of Hong Kong Island and a food tour of Kowloon. Both were outstanding! Joe was definitely what made these tours. He gave a very deep and knowledgeable insight into Hong Kong. He always gave a passionate and honest view if everything he showed us. He knew all the locals and gave us a very good idea of what is like to live and grow up in Hong Kong. It was not a 'typical' tour as Joe didn't take us to all the 'touristy' locations rather he took us to where the locals are. On the food tour he still gave us lots of local history and insight, as well as taking us to some fantastic food places. I am from a Cantonese background and the places he took us were authentic and fantastic. If you are going to Hong Kong you have to do a tour with Big Foot!!!!!

Inspirational!. so much good stuff had been said of big foot tour and i totally agree! to add on, this tour has totally changed how im going to travel going forth, from being a tourist to a traveller! never a fan of tours but i thought initially it would be good to have one as it was my first visit to hong kong and i don't speak the language. i turned up for the walk expecting probably to be bored halfway through the walk. i was wrong! my guide is the founder, ski and the tour is inspirational! instead of focusing on tourist attractions that you can find on guidebooks or easily go on your own, there are plenty of chances in the tour to learn about real local life. you see a different hong kong, one that is seen only by the people living there. ski engages every one in the tour and so this doesn't feel like those typical cookie cutter tours that i have been on. i've booked another tour with another highly rated tour guide in hong kong and the experience was totally different. ski is so much more entertaining, fun and informative. her tours are also way cheaper even though they are first on the tripadvisor! Great job, ski and big foot tour! well organized and totally value for money!

Foodie Delight.. We met Joe near hk old british government house for the start of our foodie tour to save some time for More Eating. Joe was a very friendly and charming dude. Also very informative about hk local history and as passionate as my partner and i about many things from gaming to certain foods.The tour was fantastic! The food, the life in hk, history, architecture, everything!If you only have time for just 1 tour in hk And you love local food... Big Foot and Joe! Highly highly recommended.

Brilliant Food Tour. We took a Big Foot Food Tour with Joe as our guide during our recent holiday and as all the reviews say - it was a brilliant thing to do. I've lived in Hong Kong previously, and on this trip had been back three times on holiday with my partner and so we wanted to do something 'different'. The food tour proved to be just the ticket as Joe took us to many places we'd not been to before and talked with us about Hong Kong past, present and future. Joe is happy to talk about anything Hong Kong (not just food related) and was easy to relate to as he'd been to university in Sheffield. We recommended the tour to friends and family still in Hong Kong and would definitely recommend it for any one else going to Hong Kong.

Perfect Intro to Hong Kong. We arranged a Big Foot private tour of Hong Kong Island (Central area) as our introduction to HK. Having never been to HK before, this looked like a good way to start and it certainly was - Ski met us at our hotel all as planned (in fact a few minutes early) and then took us to the local MTR station - set us up with Octopus cards (we were staying for two weeks, so these are pretty well essential and save carrying too much cash and collecting all that loose change as you normally do). We caught the MTR to Central and commenced the tour proper which included many sights of new and old Hong Kong and an expert commentary along the way. We had a Dim Sum lunch at a "real" Chinese style restaurant - forget the white napkins etc., but you need an open mind about this - not the cleanest establishment, but the food was great and the price even better.We saw lots of interesting places and people on the tour and had absolutely no complaints at all. You do need to let Ski know your preferences and she is very clear on this at the time of booking. There is also a lot of walking - so be prepared - no silly shoes and remember your water bottle.As a family of four, this tour represented excellent value and we thoroughly recommend it for anyone visiting HK and wishing to see perhaps a different side of the city.As a footnote - Ski also gave us a number of tips - do's and don'ts in HK which helped too including a referral to a local tailor (Moda Republic - covered under a separate TA review) - all greatly received.Thanks Ski for our perfect introduction to Hong Kong.

Great tour for folks who "don't do tours"!. This is the third tour in the existence of our marriage (25+ years) that my husband truly enjoyed. Joe, our guide, could not have been better. He took us through parts of the Central & Western districts that we never knew existed. We went through the Mid Levels & the Escalator System, Man Ho Temple, the Cat Street Market and more. It was tough, cuz we had been to Hong Kong before. And my husband had been many times in previous years. What we enjoy most while traveling is learning the true culture & customs of the people, a little history, the food of local eateries, the local markets. And that is exactly where Joe took us. He is a smart guy with a wide range of knowledge of HK history, food, culture; speaks the best English - having been born & raised in Hong Kong and educated in Great Britain; and has a passion for food. I could wax praises forever. The true test result is my husband (the guy who doesn't do tours) loved it!

M & M Trip 2013. Its all been said before, about this tour! It was brilliant as far as we are concerned! If you want to know more about Hong Kong and taste food that locals eat, then this is the tour to do!!!Mary and I enjoyed every minute, we were taken round by Joe, it was more like walking round with a friend than a guide.If I say more it will be repeating what others have said before me.Thank you Joe, as we said on the day it was GREAT!M & M York

Best tour ever! Worth every penny. We did a walking food tour around Hong Kong island. Our tour guide was Joe and his knowledge was second to none. We learnt so much and saw parts of the city that we would never have found otherwise. The food was delicious and often strange at times!! Joe was very keen on adapting the tour to suit us and it felt very personalised. Would recommend this company to anyone. I have travelled all over but rarely leave a review but felt compelled to on this occasion.

Looking at Cities an Alternative Way. Our family spent three weeks going around the world. At each stop (Hong Kong, Dubai, Istanbul, Rome, Dublin and others) we wanted to line up alternative tours of cities. The first of these tours was Big Foot Tour's Hong Kong Private Walking Tour. Ski, the manager (and I think one of the owners) set us up with Joe. He met us at our hotel. He was well educated, polite, engaging, and wanting to mold the tour to our interests. Our interests were political history and tea. He centered the tour on Hong Kong Island and took us from the heart of the financial/political areas to the working class streets, into the multi generational tea shops in about 4 hours. His range of topics were from architecture and city planning, the history of how the British took root on the island, the relationship between mainland China and Hong Kong, the rituals with teas, life of working class families, current wealth discrepancies, and more. He engaged our 14 year old at every turn--not always an easy thing to do. There was no administrative hic-ups--payment was accepted and easy. Joe provided us a map of the places we went so that we could return the next day if we wished--and we did. Big Foot Tours' was the standard by which we judged all other tours during that three week trip which just ended yesterday. We did a similar tour in Istanbul with Circle Istanbul. However, payment was a hassle, there was no map at the end of the tour of the places we had gone. Although the tour guide was knowledgable and helpful, he sometimes seemed to get tired and out of focus. At the end of that tour there was a dinner as part of the fee paid by our family and another couple. Drinks, if any, were to be paid out of pocket by the us. We decided to split a bottle of red wine, asked about the price, discussed the price, and ordered the bottle. After the bottle's contents were consumed, we found that the prices was six times hire than what was discussed. Hopefully this was simply an error by everyone, we did feel that our tour guide should have looked out for our benefit since he was the translator. This would not have happened with Joe at Big Foot Tour. Our family recommends Big Foot Tour. It is a great way to understand Hong Kong. Chace

Thank you so much, Ski!. This was our first trip to Hong Kong. We always like to take a walking tour with local guides to get orientated in cities with little time to figure things out for ones self. How delighted we were to find, at No. 1 in Hong Kong, this tour, probably the highest rate thing I've ever seen on TA. I did the usual homework to establish BigFoot is run by just Ski and Joe and is therefore not a large impersonal corporate tour company only interested in collecting tourist dollars. We looked to book this tour too early during 2013, but we had constant communication from Ski advising when a tour for early January would be bookable and she re contacted us via email just as soon as available. She even sent us a picture of herself so we could indentify her in the hotel lobby.The payment process was easy via Paypal. Ski met us promptly at our hotel, she was everything that all other reviews portrayed, friendly, knowledgeable, speaking and understanding very clear and concise English. We learned so many interesting facts about HK, information not possible to pick up on without her. Whilst we have only been in this very different country to home for one day, we now feel we know our way around and how it all works. We really didn't want Ski to leave us when the tour was over.Thank you so much, Ski, for making our trip to Hong Kong!

A crash course on a great world city.... With only a few days in Hong Kong I chose a walking tour to give us a feeling for this great city. There were two of us and Mr. Big Foot himself, who shares his real name with a Canadian Prime Minister and could likely become a capable politician himself. We were met at our hotel and between the walking, subway rides, escalator trips and famous ferry crossing of the harbour visited all the sites we'd requested (Hong Kong has some remarkable architecture), learned all about it's history, viewed temples, drank milk tea, saw the dried foods streets, learned about the umbrella man and totally enjoyed the entire 6 hours we'd planned for. We learned to watch for dragons, saw the ancient streets that once divided the English from their Chinese citizens, discussed the turnover of authority all the while being explained the details of city life today. Our guide was knowledgable and amusing, with lots of enthusiasm for the city he grew up in and knows exceptionally well. Great fun!

Just brilliant!. My husband & I recently had an amazing 4+ hour tour with Joe and can only 100% endorse everything said in the other excellent reviews. We learnt more than you can imagine about life on Hong Kong Island including its history, food and culture. Joe is so passionate about his homeland which makes for an immensely interesting and fun tour. You won't be disappointed!

Wonderful and Informative Walk!. My wife and I had a wonderful experience touring parts of Hong Kong Island for 4+ hours with Joe. He's a young guy, but very knowledgeable and passionate about his city and really tries to impart that to the visitor. He's poised beyond his years and lots of fun to be around. He's very open to tailoring the tour to your interests and can talk with knowledge about seemingly everything! I always question whether these tours are worth the expense, but I've come to know that they definitely are worth it. You very simply see, do and eat things that you just would not know about or understand to the same extent without a local person. It very definitely enhances your trip greatly! Thanks, Joe!

Not a tour fan. At the time I'm writing this review Big Foot have 404 glowing reviews on Trip Advisor from many different people from different continents, different age groups, some were having hangover while on the tour, some had tired little kids in their group but still everyone loved this tour. I concur with the crowd wisdom this time and would like to recommend Joe for his exceptional professionalism.

Fantastic behind the scenes look at Hong Kong life. Our Big Foot tour with Joe was one of the highlights of our week long visit to Hong Kong ( 2 adults, three children - 11,14,16). Engaging and informative Joe took us on a walking tour of Central and Sheung Wan and opened our eyes to a side of HK beyond shopping malls and bright lights. From history, architecture and religion to food,local customs and reflexology in a local park, Joe's breadth of knowledge was amazing and his personality totally engaging. We parted ways at the end of the tour after a fantastic dim sum meal with Joe, a list of shopping and food tips and feeling like we knew so much more about Hong Kong. Not to be missed!

An fantastic experience for anyone visiting Hong Kong. While this was my first trip to Hong Kong, my partner (who is Chinese by decent) had been a number of times and was obviously quite familiar with the various aspects of life in Hong Kong. Nevertheless, we both found this tour extremely interesting and enjoyable. After doing this tour, we really felt like we had made the most of our short time in Hong Kong. The tour really opened our eyes to life in Hong Kong; I can't recommend it highly enough. Our guide, joe, was really knowledgeable and his passion for, and familiarity with, Hong Kong were obvious from the start. This knowledge allowed him to be very flexible with regard to where he took us in the tour. I really feel like this tour was tailored to our interests

A must do tour with Joe. We were spending 3 days in HK, one of them with Joe, touring the city.Joe is great , informative , pleasant , full of nice story s and tips.If you have the time take Joe for few hours he will show you HK. You will not regret it.D.S.

Like she was part of our family.... Smart, Funny, Passionate, Personable - all words to describe Ski. And her great personality with a dedication to her passion for all things hong kong create an amazing combination for anyone visiting this beautiful city. We really only had a short stay in HK and the day with Ski really got us "in" on everything we wanted to and needed to see. And it was all done with a smile. Ski was a part of our family for the day and we couldn't have had a more enjoyable experience. We were able to customize our tour with her to cater to all of our personal tastes and she managed to make all of us happy.

Couldn't have been any better . we could not have been happier about our day with Ski. Simply put, she was wonderful--knowledgable, friendly, and really fun to hang out with. We were a group of 6 with different interests and every single one of us had a fantastic time. Ski even have us tips for activities in the days we weren't with her. Ski made us love Hong Kong and her!

Best walking tour with Ski. Our group of 6 had the best time walking around Hong Kong with Ski. She was informative, patient, helpful, and very sweet when dealing with our group! She showed us a great mix of can't miss sights as well as local hot spots including a delicious dim sum meal that we will remember forever. I cannot recommend Ski highly enough!

An Amazing Day of Food and Culture.. We shared an amazing day exploring the streets of Hong Kong with Big Foot Tours. Joe our guide led us around the hidden streets we otherwise would have missed and took us to some great places to sample things like snake soup, bbq pork, egg tarts and fantastic dim sum, those pork buns were to die for. It was so interesting to be able to learn about the history and culture of the city from someone who is from there and it felt more like walking around the city with a friend rather than a guide. The experience was extra special as It was a private tour and we didn't have to wait for a big group before moving to the next location. We would say that if you are looking for a tour whilst visiting Hong Kong, make sure you book with Big Foot Tours, you really wont be disappointed.

Not to be missed. Joe was friendly, informative and extremely interesting. Our 4 hrs with him was the highlight of our trip and the thing we most talked about upon returning. It was a side of Hong Kong we would not have been able to discover on our own. You would be crazy not to do a Big Foot tour.

When East meets West in Hong Kong. Having travelled to Hong Kong a few times, all we did was go around shopping in the malls and the usual tourist spots. As we have already done that, we wanted to learn more about hong kong in a different perspective and also learn the local culture.My brother searched on TripAdvisor for tours we could take and Big Foot Tour was #1 on search. Our tour guide was Joe. He really did a good job explaining history of Hong Kong to us and the meaning of the buildings, i.e the hsbc headquarter building , the Lippo building and the butcher's knife. It was really amusing as he told us the story and history of the buildings as well as the British council building. Next he brought us to the more traditional side of Hong Kong. The wet market. He showed us how the locals bought fish and meet and how they looked for the fish with the beating heart. We learned so much and it is really different to how we do our meat shopping back home. We then moved on to the western side of Hong Kong. It was a great experience. It really is amazing how ghosts and superstitions can affect the people and business in that one road.He was really professional when telling us the folk stories with his own wit and humour. My daughter said it was really an eye opener for her as she has always thought Hong Kong as a commercial city with tall skyscrapers and bright lights. But now, Hong Kong to her is a beautiful country with beautiful history and culture. 4 hours passed by really quickly. Joe was good enough to give us a map on what we could do the next day. We'd like to thank Joe for guiding us with passion and helping us understand Hong Kong in a better perspective.

Big Foot Walking Tour with Joe. We first spotted the Big foot walking tours on trip advisor and they came highly recommended.We were in the city a couple of days prior to going on the walking tour and we got a good feel for Hong Kong and what it had to offer. Prior to meeting up with Joe i felt we had seen a lot but we were both wrong. Joe was a fantastic guide he was very friendly and full of knowledge. We were interested in the history of Hong Kong and we were also interested in hot spots for food and a general look around. From start to finish the tour was amazing from the history of Hong Kong and how it was developed. To eating stinky tofu, bbq pork which was amazing and eating far too many egg tarts and being introduced to snake soup which was very tasty thought it would be a shame not to try it!Joe was very helpful in marking a route plan of where we had been and what we had seen on the tour which made it easier to explore further the next day. Also Joe gave us a business card and said whilst we were in HK if we had any questions do not hesitate to call him which i though was very genuine and professional.I couldn't recommend the tour enough if any of my family or friends were planning on going to Hong Kong in the future i wouldn't hesitate to promote the tour highly.10 out of 10!!

more than 5 stars!. Can't find a fault! Took the tour with high expectations after reading all the reviews and the tour EXCEEDED my high expectation! I never wrote a review before but I felt that this review is definitely necessary to show my appreciation and support for my experience!!My guide is Ski and she is.... here goes... an entertaining walking encyclopedia of hong kong coupled with lots of passion, friendly, enthusiam, extremely service orientated, funny, polite, humble, fun, fun and more fun and always looking out for every single one in the group!WOW! I can go on and on and on! What a great experience that totally changed my perception of having a "tour"! all tours should be done this way! if you are looking for a great time and orientation to see the real Hong Kong and feel like you are hanging out with a friend, go for Ski's Big Foot Tour! Once you experience it yourself, you will know what they mean. I left my itinerary entirely in their hands after telling them my general interests and I was blown away by what was planned.
