I also like how there was no compulsory "shopping" stops that i often experience in other tours. Thanks Ski! It's amazing to be led by the founder of Big Foot and I will always highly recommend you to anyone!

Awesome Guide...a MUST tour!. My mum, sister and I visited Hong Kong and pre-booked a private tour with Big Foot Tour and were lucky to get Ski as our guide...Ski you are fantastic! We loved our Hong Kong Island 4 hour walking tour, we learnt so much and saw things we would never have found in a travel book. You have so much knowledge about the history and culture of this busy city and your energy was infectious. The pace of the walk was great for all, especially my mum who's in her 70's and your personal attention to her specifically was wonderful. Ski also mapped out our walk at the end of the tour and made notes of other interests we mentioned for the rest of our stay. I hugely recommend Big Foot Tour for anyone visiting Hong Kong and will do it again on my return...best tour ever!

Highest Rating Possible!!. After two days of touring with Ski, my wife and I both feel that she deserves the highest possible rating. Her english is excellent and her demeanour is fantastic. Extremely pleased that we selected her to provide us with walking tours of Hong Kong. Absolutely worth her fee! 5*****++

Hong Kong Skiing!. We had an amazing walking tour with Ski Yeo, she met us at the time and place after getting instructions from her. She has an enormous love for the area which showed in her enthusiasm.We learnt about the important buildings and their feng shue (apologies for the spelling). We visited a local cafe and shops in the old town and saw a huge variety of unbelievable items for sale. Even saw the world famous umbrella repair shop. One of the highlights was lunch, dim sum in a place we would not have found on our own, a real treat.One of the best parts of our 5 days in Hong Kong and a must do for any visitors who want to see and hear about the real city.

Best Tour Ever!. Have always been wanting to book a tour with Big Foot on my maiden trip to Hong Kong with the great number of reviews. Pre-booked a month or so in advance and got lucky as I managed to get Ski, the owner herself to bring me on her tour!! As one of the person who introduced the concept of touring with a friend in Hong Kong, what really impressed me was her ability to remained so interested/passionate about sharing Hong Kong after so many years. She engages while delivering tons of information/background on the history and culture of Hong Kong. Of course, there are tons of little secret spots and details that one would totally miss had she not pointed it out but i shall not spill the beans here.Well worth it and if you haven't gone on a tour with Big Foot, you haven't gone to Hong Kong!

Big Foot, mix and match tour!. There are so many intricacies in and around any city and Hong Kong is no exception. It's the subtleties that you don't get to see or experience alone, and all the stories behind where everything is from. Joe was fantastic tour guide, and now I know about dragons sweeping across the county, with koalas hanging on the sides of buildings and dagger like buildings directed at certain structures. You will never know if Joe never tells!Food was fantastic, and the congee place was close to where I stayed, so I was there pretty much everyday! (If you have a hang over, BEST place to go for fast reliable delicious cure).I have to go and try to wet markets.

So Interesting!. My friend and I booked a four hour tour the morning after we arrived in Hong Kong. We had a day and a half stopover between San Francisco and Hanoi. We had both been to HK twice before and once for a week, so we had done all of the classic tourist attractions and wanted something different. Reading reviews on TripAdvisor led me to Big Foot Tours. I contacted them with my request. It worked out perfectly. Joe met us at our hotel and took us by subway to the Sham Shui Po district where we spent most of our time. It is described as where the local people eat, live and shop. We learned so much from Joe. As others have said, he is knowledgeable, easy to understand and such an enthusiastic person, you can't help but be caught up in his feelings for his City. We toured a factory converted to an art center, a public housing project, the Pak Tai temple, various shopping streets dedicated to particular items, like fabric and ribbons. A highlight was the Pei Ho wet market where we had lunch in the communal food hall. Throughout, Joe gave us cultural, historical and social information that we would never have gotten walking along on our own. He also left us with information about what to do for the rest of our day before returning to the hotel to collapse. It was money well spent and I don't hesitate to recommend Joe to anyone. We are both women in our 60's and he was very careful to walk at our pace and keep track of us crossing the streets! And to address our interests and questions. Information that he provided also informed our trip to Vietnam and Cambodia, so it was doubly helpful.Next time, I want to take one of his food tours!

Highlight of our visit. Our personal tour of Hong Kong with BigFoot was the highlight of our five-day trip to Hong Kong. Not only did it help us appreciate the city as we enjoyed the rest of our visit, it was a welcome respite from all the shiny shopping centres, restaurants and retail bling. My husband and I booked from Australia and were taken around by Joe on the afternoon of our first day. I would really recommend doing the tour earlier in your visit as it gives you great background about the city if you are not already familiar with it. Memorable aspects include Joe's explanation of HK history and colonial era, the feng shui of the HSBC centre and the bullet holes in the bronze lion status out the front from the time of the Japanese occupationn. We visited the back streets of Central and Joe explained the wet markets and trading stalls. We also spent time in Man Mo Temple and Joe was also able to explain the significance of the deities, incense coils and fortune sticks. All this would have been a mystery to us without his explanations. A perfect finish was a meal of roast goose, char siu and rice; and a silky custard tart. Joe then recommended we finish our trip on a Ding Ding tram back to our hotel and told us how to get on/pay/get off. Joe also left us with a map of other sights to see in our remaining time which we carried with us and referred to for the rest of the week. I would highly recommend the tour - it may seem a little pricey for just two people but we certainly thought it worthwhile!!!

5 Star History, Culture and Food Tour.. Our Big Foot Tour guide, Joe, speaks perfect English, with a slight British accent. Since I have a hearing problem, that fact was important for me. Joe has the perfect background, with an English father and a Chinese mother, to explain the history and culture of this former British possessionWe met Joe near the Hong Kong Central subway station,(to save travel time), however Joe will meet you at your Hotel. Our tour was almost 5 hours and worth every penny. Read prior reviews for more details.

Get to Know (a piece of) The City!. My fiance and I only had a short amount of time in Hong Kong between job interviews in the area, and we are so happy we spent that time with Joe of Big Foot Tours, getting to know more about Hong Kong -- albeit a small portion, given that the city is relatively massive -- than we would have otherwise. I've spent a lot of time "getting to know" cities on my own, wandering aimlessly and discovering a lot of questions that are difficult to answer without a local's knowledge. While that's also a fun way to explore, I may now be a convert to the private walking tour. I feel like I have a glimpse into the soul of the city now, and some insights into its many dichotomies (British/Chinese, historical/modern, superstitious/scientific, etc., etc.) that, again, only a local could provide. Dealing with Ski to book the tour was pleasant and easy, and Joe himself was exceedingly professional but also lots of fun. I did a lot of shopping around, and Big Foot definitely offers the best prices. After taking the tour, I have a hard time believing they don't also offer the best experience -- a rare combination.

Outstanding guide and tour. We spent 4 hours with Joe for a history and culture tour of Hong Kong. A special treat was that Joe is bilingual and bicultural, Chinese/English. He was far easier to understand than many guides we had in Asia. We are in our late 60s and mid-70s, in pretty good physical shape, so we enjoyed the pace of the walking tour though Hong Kong's busy streets, from the Statue Square area through the mid-level escalators and the old part of Hong Kong. Joe's perspectives were wonderful, especially his way of relating the architecture and culture with Feng Shui and superstition combining with the most modern and technologically superb buildings. We enjoyed our lunch at a traditional dim sum restaurant. Joe is a real foodie, who explained shopping and the culture of the food. It was an enriching tour, and highly recommended.

Definite must. So glad we ended up booking a private tour instead of the general tour. Our tour guide Joe was da bomb. For 4 hours, he taught us more about the nooks and crannies of Hong Kong, then we have ever known about this great city. My brother and I were born in HK but moved to the states young. So to learn about this great city again the right way was such a treat. We traveled all over Hong Kong island. For four hours, Joe walked us through literally a day in the life of a Hong konger. From the fresh outdoor markets, street food, mom and pop shops, and historical sites, the tour covered every thing we wanted to know. It was very laid back and honestly just fun. Worth every penny. A private tour will run you about $2000 HK.

Best value in Hong Kong. My wife and I did the four hour private tour with Joe and enjoyed every minute of it. We arrived at the rendezvous point almost 30 minutes late, but Joe was there waiting. Joe was the perfect guide, well traveled, English educated, and enjoying life. His energy and enthusiasm for everything Hong Kong was contagious. It was amazing the amount of information and entertainment he packed into the four hours. We enjoyed everything about the tour, the history, the politics, the culture, the food, and a hint of understanding of what it is to be a Hong Kong resident. Joe was entirely open to any question and willing to steer the conversation or tour any direction we cared. It did leave me wanting to explore the remainder of Hong Kong and will book again on our next trip to Hong Kong. I liked that Joe provided a map at the tour end of where we had been and advice on other areas we might visit based on our interests. Great experience!

The best way to get to know Hong Kong.. A lot can be learned from food. A street food tour is an opportunity to learn how to navigate the city off the beaten tracks and eat like a local. I think its important to appreciate the cultural and lifestyle aspects of any city. Our guide Joe provided an informative perspective of Hong Kong life as we wandered through the city. He explained architecture, political and religious aspects of Hong Kong. In addition to consuming a range of food from a traditional breakfast, lunch options, tea and street snacks, I observed a part of HK culture that I do not thing I would have discovered on my own. Navigating local food venues and markets confidently. Understanding the process were invaluable. This is a tour that should be done at the beginning of your trip so that you can take advantage of what you learned.

personalised, enthusiastic, great. We had an excellent walk through the HKG island with our guide Joe. He was full of energy, knowledge and interesting information about the city, its history, habits,... The mix of encyclopedical, anecdotical and personal information that we got was just perfect. Since we are interested in food, Joe took as to a few places that we actually liked so much that we repeated visit to them the next day (thanks to a detailed personal tour map that Joe drew for us).This was one of three tours that we did in HKG and if I would have to recommend only one of them to someone visiting HKG, it would be the Big Foot Tour.

the best spend 4 hours in Hong Kong. I did not spend much time in Hong Kong, but what I saw and learned in Joe's company was fantastic. Joe's take on Hong Kong is passionate, well informed, rounded, insightful, humorous with great insight into political, cultural, religious information. Not to mention the food. I would recommend it to everyone. Perhaps not the eastern take on British tea, but then I never liked milk tea anyway.

As good as everyone else says!. We loved our tour with Joe back in March (sorry it's taken me so long to write this, but better late than never I hope!). We learned so much, and the best part of that was learning it from the perspective of a local. We got to see so many things that I never would have seen any other way. I first considered just a group culinary tour, but then I found Big Foot on tripadvisor and decided that a private, customizable tour was the way to go, and it was. Joe was great to hang out with, and it felt like we were spending time with a friend. I'd love to hang out with him again sometime.

Outstanding on all levels. My girlfriend and I did the personal walking tour of HK island with Joe and it was absolutely outstanding. We did it on the first morning after we arrived as an orientation exercise, and did away with our guide book for the remainder of the holiday in favour of Joe's tips/suggestions.A fantastic balance of history, local interest and trivia, culture and the perspectives of a HK resident.Cannot rate this more highly...top of the list for anyone visiting HK.

Big Foot Walking Tour - Hong Kong. Joe was absolutely brilliant. He balanced history, local perspective, and terrific food perfectly. We both commented that the tour was one of the true highlights of our trip. We only wish we had had his guidance for our complete itinerary. -Blake

Excellent introduction to Hong Kong. My wife and I took our 14 year old son to Hong Kong in September. Luckily, we had arranged with Big Foot a half day walking tour well in advance to give us an introduction to Hong Kong culture, history and traditions by foot. And how fortunate we were that Ski Yeo was our guide! She really knows the place, and finds all quaint and off-the-beaten track places you would love to visit if you only knew what and where they are. In addition, it is really nice to spend time with Ski Yeo! She is so enthusiastic and full of knowledge and curiosity that time flies while you walk around the streets of Hong Kong. We spent our half day in Central, and only regretted that we had not also booked a similar tour on the Kowloon-side. Good to leave something for the next time we are in Hong Kong. Thank you Ski Yeo!!

Big Foot Walking Tour - Hong Kong. We wanted to see Hong Kong up close, so we decided to take the Big Foot Walking Tour of Hong Kong Island. We weren't disappointed. We walked from Central Station to soho to the mid levels and saw both the busy shopping areas as well as the city life for the average and not so well off Chinese. Our guide Ski is a wonderful young lady who knows how to accommodate your sightseeing interests. We learned about the food, history and culture of the city and a little bit about feng shui. All in all a worthwhile experience.

Just do it. I make a point to take a private tour in each new city I explore. In my opinion there is no better way to get to know a city and get your bearings for further exploration. I have yet to take one that didnt far exceed my expectations and this was no exception. Ski was great - friendly, excellent English, knowledgable, tireless. Well worth it and would heartily reccomend this service.

Big Foot Food Tour. This is an amazing way to get an introduction into Hong Kong, especially if you are a first time visitor as I was. My guide was Joe, who arrived promptly at the promised time and place. As we walked around, from high rise office to older sections of the island, he showed me things, we talked about history and culture and all the time stopping along the way to sample as much or as little as you wish to eat from a typical day's menu for a local. If you want to get out the hotel dining room and get into good food, but are afraid of where to start, this tour is perfect. Huge thanks to Ski and Joe for making the whole thing easy for a middle-aged, middle-of-the-road, kinda guy.

What a great way to be introduced to HK - worth every penny.. Thanks to other TA reviewers, we found Big Foot on the web. Ski was prompt in replying to our enquiry, and was due to be our guide but had to return home to Singapore on family matters. So we got Joe, who proceeded to show us, over the next four hours, quite a few of his "favourite" things. Half English, half Chinese, (see photo, I hope) he could switch between Sheffield and Canton at will. His enthusiasm for HK was infectious, and we learnt a great deal and enjoyed our tour enormously. On top of that he gave us some really excellent tips for what to do and see during our 6 days in HK. We did a good many of them, and found each one to be fascinating. Thanks Joe, and next time we might even do a food trip with you!

A very informative walk. We had the pleasure to have Jo as our guide, a very well spoken gentleman. Jo is book full of knowledge about this wonderful city Hong Kong. We had two days in Hong Kong. If you want to learn more about the city this is definitely the way to do it. You can determine your pace. We have a better understanding of Hong Kong after our tour. After the tour you are given a map of the area you covered. This is helpful, should you want to go back to a certain spot. We can recommend this tour to people who would like to know and understand the culture and history of Hong Kong.

Excellent introduction to Hong Kong Island!. My husband and I booked a one day tour and told Ski that we liked food and left it to her to plan it out. We met Joe in Hong Kong Island and had a fantastic five hour day with him. He was super informative about British and Chinese history, and took us to places in Hong Kong that were off the beaten track. We were in China and Japan for ten days and that one day in Hong Kong was the absolute best part of our trip. Worth every penny!

Absolutely terrific!. Since Hong Kong is fairly easy to get around some may think that a 4-hour walking tour would be a waste of time, not worth it or boring - this was the complete opposite. From the moment we emailed Ski with Big Foot Tours, we knew that this tour would be worth it. She was flexible with our schedule, responsive and extremely professional. She scheduled Joe for our tour. Due to business dealings, we were late, informed Ski and she told us not to worry that Joe will work with us and he did. Once we met Joe, he asked us which tour we would be interested and thus we completely changed what we were originally going to do because Joe's recommendation was much more interesting. We had an amazing time - he is smart, patient, extremely knowledgeable and certainly professional. He told us about and showed us places that we would have never learned on our own. It was fascinating and well worth spending the afternoon with him. Regardless if you have never been to Hong Kong, been once or many times, taking a Big Foot Tour is an excellent way to spend 4 hours.

thanks to Joe for a great day out!. We are a family of four including 2 teenagers. We wanted more from our Hong Kong experience than just the shopping. Joe, young and enthusiastic provided this in spades. He kept the whole family engaged and interested with stories of life in Hong Kong past and present. As we wound our way through the streets of Central on Hong Kong Island we listened to tales of dragons, made impromptu visits to small temples and learn't how to choose the freshest fish on the fishmongers stall. Lunch was a shared table with construction workers in one of the wet markets where we enjoyed one of our tastiest meals in Hong Kong. My husband rates our four hours with Joe as the highlight of our holiday. Joe left us well equiped with information and maps to continue our exploration of this facinating city.

Fantastic Walking Tour!. We recently took a four hour private walking tour of Hong Kong with Big Foot Tours and we are so glad we did. Joe was an absolutely fantastic guide - he is so knowledgeable and passionate about his city and its history that its was positively infectious! None of us (me, husband, 20 yo daughter) had ever been to Hong Kong before. For some reason, I thought we would just wander about and get a feel for the city on our own and so had not booked any tours in advance. We actually found that Hong Kong is not the easiest place to get to know in that way - perhaps because its so vertical? I finally contacted Big Foot based on good Trip Advisor reviews and fortunately they were able to accommodate us. We saw a LOT of the city on the tour, including areas we probably would not have come across on our own. We also had a lot of yummy street food and an interesting visit to a Chinese medicine shop. I just wish we had done it earlier in the trip so that we could have taken more advantage of what we learned and the other activities Joe recommended. This tour really exceeded our expectations and I highly recommend it!

Just what we wanted. Thanks Ski for the perfect tour. During the booking process, we were asked what we were interested in and what we hoped to see or experience. Ski tailored a perfectly paced tour for us that met all expectations. Ski was a great guide, and she made sure we enjoyed the experience. Highly recommended.

Excellent tour!! Excellent guide. Really glad we booked this tour for day 1 in Hong Kong.Ski met us in our hotel - sorted us out with an octopus card explaining what it can be used for and how to negotiate the MTR. Popped across from Kowloon to HK Island and toured from Central to the west - picking out more of the Chinese part of Hong Kong. Hugely interesting as Ski always had either a great historic story or interesting fact along the way. We saw some great sights from old china town to parks, a man doing Tai Chi in a children's playground, longest escalator in the world, interesting food items, markets etc etc.The tour flew by as Ski always kept it interesting - also gave us some excellent tips for the rest of our stay.Couldn't recommend this tour highly enough - for newbies or for those that want to venture a little more off the beaten track.Thanks Ski - we had great HK mini adventure :-)

Fantastic tour!!. What a wonderful experience! We wanted to see places where you don't see too many tourists and Ski was a wondeful guide! She was very enthusiastic and very knowledgable! We are not going to forget this experience soon! I would recommend Big Foot Tour 100%!

HK Central Sheung Wan and Pok Fu Lam village. Highly recommendedIf you are interested in having a total different perspectives of one of the best cities in the world, then choose Big foot tours Hong Kong. We did a 4 h tour yesterday (Sheung Wan / Central and Pok Fu lam village) with Joe (joesphclark@bigfoottour.com) and we enjoyed every second. Joe has a profound knowledge of his home town, has a very enthusiastic way of presenting even the small details, tells little stories to round up the picture and is also able to listen. It is a pleasure to have met him and I can only highly recommend his tour. We for sure will have another tour to see “the dark” site of town ;-). Joe thanks again! All the best. Steven
Private walking tour of Hong Kong. Really enjoyed the tour, loved all the stories about the history and beliefs still talking about them! Thanks Ski and Joe!

Must do.. The private tour with Joe was amazing. I definitely recommend doing this early in your trip, the knowledge Joe imparts on you provides context to the overwhelming surroundings and the whole city slows down, allowing you to fully bask in the charm and grandeur of this beautiful city. As a result, your stay will be significantly better and you'll leave Hong Kong with a whole new level of appreciation.

HIGHLIGHT OF OUR TRIP - JUST AWESOME!!!. This was our first trip to Hong Kong and the tour was our first organised activity. It was a perfect way to start our explorations of Hong Kong. We met Joe at the suggested meeting place and the tour started pretty much from that moment. It was obvious, from the first few minutes, that he was going to be a great guide - very friendly, knowledgable, passionate, articulate and funny. The walking tour was pretty fast paced (which we loved), we saw a great deal of the city, tried some delicious (and some not so delicious) authentic/exotic foods and enjoyed every minute of it. Joe gave us a great summary of Hong Kong's history and culture, as well as leaving us with heaps of suggestions on what else to see and do whilst there. I would recommend this tour to anyone going to Hong Kong, even if they have visited before. We learnt things that we would never have if we had not gone on the tour. Thanks Joe! :-)

The real Hong Kong. I had a private walking tour with Joe. He provided an insight into the history and a local perspective on what is Central. A great tour. I highly recommend it and especially Joe. He also gave me great tips on where to go next and how to get there. Maximising the experience that is Hong Kong.

Best Walking Tour of Hong Kong with Joe. This was our first visit to Hong Kong so we wanted an orientation about the history, culture, and food. We made our arrangements 2-3 weeks (to my best memory) before we arrived and had no problem getting the dates and times we wanted. Everything from making our reservations, making payments, and figuring out where to meet was done online by email. All my emails were answered within 24 hours by Ski who answered most questions we had even ones not relating to the tour. We did two 4 hour day tours on the first 2 days of the 5 days we were in Hong Kong. We did Hong Kong Island tour and New Territories tour. On the day of the first tour, we used public transportation to our meeting point which was super simple due to the instructions and maps provided to us online by Ski; they were also willing to meet us at our hotel but advised us it may take up valuable touring time so we opted to meet where they asked us to. We promptly spotted Joe and knew what he looked like before hand since they also emailed a photo of who was guiding us. We were on our way after quick introductions and confirmations on what our interest were. To sum up everything, Joe was an awesome, energetic, and personable guide and we could not ask for more. We are from the States and had very little knowledge of Hong Kong,their relationship with Mainland China, and other various important aspects such a feng shui so we learned so much in the two tours. We also got to sample the local cuisine which was delicious. The private tours are definitely worth money spent and our guide definitely deserved a good gratuity even though he absolutely does not expect one.

great day out. 8 people went with joe ( our guide ) on food tour aged form 13 - 50 all had great time.The tour was very interesting we saw parts of Hong Kong we wouldn't have seen and ate some authentic Hong Kong food.Joe was very enthusiastic and seemed like a genuine good guy Thanks you Joe

A MUST DO WHILST IN HONG KONG. This is the best way to see the experience the city through the eyes of a local. Tours are tailored around your interested and passions so there is never a dull moment. You really will leave Hong Kong feeling like you have seen the best of the cities quirks and secrets that you were oblivious to before. Joe the tour guide is fantastic, very informative and friendly. A highly recommended day if you're going to Hong Kong for a holiday or to live!

A fantastic introduction - and great fun!. We were a party of two adults and two teenage girls (16 and 18). We had a tour with Joe on the first full day of our holiday and I definitely think that this is the way to do it. Joe took us all over the main part of Hong Kong island and gave us an insight into the Hong Kong culture and way of life which we wouldn't have got by ourselves.We told him we were interested in food and shopping and we got lots of tips for both. Joe took us for a meal in s fantastic roast meat café which we would never have dared to go in by ourselves - a very local place with no frills - but the best meat ever!He also took us and showed us the "cut label" shops where you can buy designer clothing for a fraction of the price - I'm not sure I should thank him for this though as we went back the next day and it cost us a fortune :) !!!At the end of the tour he spent some time with us just recommending other things that we would like to see - this was really useful.From our point of view it was the perfect way to start our trip and he gave us confidence to try some other things for ourselves.Joe is young and lively and has bags of energy - I would recommend him as a guide to anyone travelling with teenagers or younger children - our girls loved him.

WOW - made our trip!. This tour blew me away! I always try and book a personal tour when visiting a new place and have done quite a few in the past - this was the best by far.We booked the private food walking tour which lasted 4 hours and was the perfect introduction to Hong Kong's culture.Joe made the whole thing exciting and interesting, taking us to places that we never would have seen without the big foot tour and explaining things that only a local person would know. Being a fluent English-speaker but growing up in Hong Kong meant he really could answer any question. We didn't want to spend our limited time in Hong Kong walking around museums and this was a great way to find out about the city. The highlight for us was the food - we were able to try all of the local delicacies; things we never would have been able to order by ourselves. I have a severe shellfish allergy which makes ordering unknown dishes a little dangerous, so having someone to explain and translate was perfect.The tour took us across all sorts of different areas and districts so by the end of it we felt we'd had a great overview of the "real" Hong Kong, not just the places easily accessed by tourists.At the end of the tour Joe illustrated maps showing everything we had done during the tour (I couldn't believe how much he fit into 4 hours) and giving great recommendations for the rest of our stay. The whole thing was first class and great value. I'd recommend booking a tour for the start of your trip as the recommendations for the rest of the stay are just as valuable as the tour itself.

Hong Kong beneath the skyline. Joe took us on an adventure through Hong Kong that showed us what we thought we knew and so much more. We took what we thought was a lovely walk through the lower and mid levels with a couple of pit stops for refreshment only to find when we sat down to lunch with Joe that we'd covered a whole lot more of the island than we thought - no wonder we were so tired!! Taking this tour was the best decision we made for our holiday - history, intrigue, love, sadness, war and adventure - that's what Joe showed us. I will definitely be doing another tour (or 3) when I get back to Hong Kong. Thanks Joe and Ski for such a fabulous way to get to know your beautiful city.

If you only do one thing in Hong Kong, do this tour. We booked a tour of Hong Kong island, joe met us at our hotel and we then spent 4 hours with him learning more about Hong Kong than we had done in 4 previous visits.We would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong, joe gave us a real insight into the island, but in a fun and informal way. Even if you only have a day or two I think this tour would add so much to your trip, we will definately recommend it to friends and will use it again.

All other tour leaders should be this good!. other reviewers have said it all, so there's not much left to add except to confirm that ski yeo is the most amazing guide: knowledgeable (with little-known yet fascinating facts and figures, supplemented by the large photos she carries in her backpack) and caring (she regularly keeps an eye on everybody in the group, to make sure nobody goes astray).she's bright and energetic, and tunes into people's needs and wants, adapting the tour if necessary as you go along.i've been travelling for more years than i care to reveal, and ski is by far the very best guide i've ever had. thanks, ski.ps the fact that the VERY prestigious upper house hotel (tripadvisor #1 of 542 hong kong hotels; owned by very customer oriented swire group, which also owns cathay pacific airline) has contracted with yeo to provide guiding services for its special packages also shows how highly she is regarded.

If you enjoy food, take this tour.. We took the walking food tour with Joe and had a blast. I was a bit concerned that four hours would be too long but it was the perfect amount of time and the anticipation of each new taste treat kept our feet moving forward. Joe's knowledge of the area (he grew up in the neighborhood) added an authentic element that we could not have gotten any other way. I have been to Hong Kong a couple of times before but each time left feeling like I did not really get to know it. Now I can depart the city with a belief that I got an ample serving of what I felt I was missing before. Best food tour ever.

Best way to learn to know Hongkong!. Thank You Joe for taking us on the most enjoying citytour. Our four hours just flew away. We are impressed with Your knowledge and the enthusiasm You showed us. This is the very best way to learn to know a new city. We really liked the opportunity to be able to ask questions about the citys history and of course we enjoyed the delicious street food we tried. All you need to go on this tour is a pair of comfortable shoes and a smile. We will be back in december and are looking forward to meet with You again.

Best Walking Tour ever..from two rather lazy people. Firstly we would like to Thank Ski for making the booking of the tour so easy..secondly for waiting at our hotel 30mins after the agreed start time due to our flight being delayed and a typhoon warning.Buggar the Typhoon and the rain we said let's get our walk on !Now coming from two people who had never travelled in Hong Kong before..definite not the fitness freaks and not speaking a lick of Chinese we were extremely glad we booked this Tour on our first day !Not only did Ski help us experience the many cultural and food experiences of Hong Kong but she helped us understand the MTR ( train) Octopus cards and the many tricks of where and when to shop ! This definitely helped us in the further 9 days to come. Ski is extremely friendly .always looking after us..giving us some interestingly background of HK and we all had a great laugh and a good night all round ! So get your comfy shoes on and do it ! :)

Outstanding!. I was referred to Ski and her first-class firm by a friend who participated in one of her tours in June. My friend was soooo right! Great tour.My 17 year old son loved learning about the buildings and their architecture - who'd a known he was interested in that?? - and the specialty food treat coupled with Hong Kong Pearl Tea.I appreciated the depth of knowledge and customization Ski offered during the tour to really engage me.First class and a must do.

Do it, ASAP!. My wife and I had landed in Hong Kong only hours prior to doing our walking tour, and I was worried that we wouldn't have the energy after the typically less-than-ideal sleep on the plane. But right from the off Ski's enthusiasm was very infectious, and our four hours with her just flew by!Ski was very entertaining and informative, letting us in on local stuff that we wouldn't have known if we'd just been left to our own devices for the whole trip. Her genuine, deep interest for Hong Kong is very apparent, covering everything from its history and beliefs to current-day hot spots.Doing the tour so early ended up being great for us, because it meant we could use our newfound knowledge to help us get around and go back to places that Ski had highlighted. She definitely enhanced our Hong Kong experience.Thanks very much, Ski! Hope to see you again soon!

Best tour ever!. We did the 4 hour walking tour with Ski and it was the highlight of our 3 day stay in Hong Kong. Ski was great company and knows Hong Kong so well.She kept us interested with fascinating facts about the history and local customs and managed to pitch the tour at a level that suited our 2 teenage boys ( 15 and 13) perfectly. She also helped us to haggle at the Cat Street Market We finished the tour with dim sum at a restaurant we would never have found ( or dared to go in to !) without Ski and came away feeling like we had experienced the real Hong Kong. We wish we could have done the tour earlier on in our stay so my tip is to book early !
Brilliant. Ski took us to places that were the real Hong KongInformative and amazing.I was disappointed with Hong Kong until we went behind the scenes.Food, Culture, temples.....had it all

Best walking tour in Hong Kong!. My husband and I only had a 24 hour lay over in Hong Kong, but wanted to at least get a taste of the Hong Kong lifestyle. We did a 6 hour walking tour with Joe, and he was awesome!! We loved Joe! He is high energy, knowledgable, friendly, and a total foodie. We ate congee, had duck, went for tea and even had dim sum. All of the food was amazing, the walking tour was amazing and it made me love Hong Kong. I highly recommend using this tour operator if you are visiting Hong Kong. It was great to be around people close to my age and see their perspective on where they live. If I ever go back to Hong Kong I would definitely use Big Foot Tours again.

Informative, comprehensive and fun!. My brother and I spent about 4 days in Hong Kong in June, and our tour with Joe was one of the major highlights - if not the biggest highlight - of our stay. The downtown core of Hong Kong isn't so large but you need to know where to walk in order to get the most out of your trip. You will also appreciate your visit much more if you have some knowledge of the history of neighbourhoods, the best places for food, the local customs, etc. Joe not only brought us on a fascinating visual tour of the city (covering modern highrises, traditional temples and everything in between) but provided us with a huge amount of interesting information about all aspects of city life. Joe is naturally interested in learning and travel, and as a Hong Kong local who has also spent years abroad, he was perfectly suited to give an excellent tour adaptable to our interests.

Great Tour!!. Our first visit to Hong Kong was incredible, I’m sure we will be back and contact Big Foot tours again. Joe is a fountain of knowledge, so enthusiastic and full of insights. He showed us different aspects of the city many of which we would have never seen on our own, while also including interesting details of the many traditions and customs. We had a little taste of what seemed to be the most authentic cuisine in areas mostly known only to people who are local. This has been a great experience and we highly recommend Big Foot Tours.

Fantastic Tour!. We took the Big Foot Tour in our first day in Hong Kong and it was perfect ! Ski is an excellent guide! She is knowledgeable, great fun and focus on relevant information. In a 4 hour tour we heard about history, architecture, culture, religion...and we tried local food (in places we would have never found if not for her!).The groups are (very) small, in our case it was just myself and my husband. It feels like a 'friend' is showing you the place. We highly recommend this tour!

Absolutely Awesome. We had an absolutely awesome time with Joe. From the minute he met us at our hotel until the time he dropped us off at the Star Ferry we felt very well looked after. Our main interest was trying as much local authentic cuisine as possible and Joe certainly got us into places that we would not normally have tried. He was very knowledgeable about local history and passed his information on in a very easy to understand way.We researched similar tours but kept coming back to the Big Foot website and are very pleased we did so. The level of email contact with Ski before our tour was great. We were very pleased with our whole experience and have recommended Big Foot to several people.

Got to see parts of Hong Kong I would have seen. My husband and I have been to Hong Kong before. So, it was very nice to be able to have flexibility in what we visited with our guide, Joe. Big Foot Tour was very easy to contact and adjust as needed. Also, Ski and Joe kept in mind of the time, trying to get the most out of the time given. Joe was EXCELLENT and enthusiastic. He gave us a lot of insight to many aspects of Hong Kong. Highly enjoyed our time visiting the sights. It was quite a small world to see him again by chance on top of another "ding ding" car in front of ours the next morning! :) 100% recommend Big Foot Tours. Next time, we'll save our appetite for the food tour! Joe gave us a little taste of Sham Shu Po, and it was quite the delicious treat and memorable experience!Thanks Joe!

The highlight of my HK trip. Having never been to HK before, we decided to take a Big Foot Tour after reading the many positive reviews it has received. All those reviews were well deserved. Unlike a conventional tour with a big group, this was an intimate 2-person tour tailored to my specific sight-seeing requests. The tour guide, Joe, was friendly, enthusiastic and interesting - the 4 hours we spent wandering about HK were less like a tour and more like meeting up with an old friend and getting an insiders perspective on their city. I have subsequently recommended this tour to other friends who also enjoyed it immensely. Thanks Joe :)

Amazing, the best tour ever!. We did a tour yesterday with Ski, she and the tour was amazing. We had a 12 and 15 year old boys, who learnt so much and enjoyed the experience. We ate authentic food, visited back streets, markets, temples,schools, playgrounds, parks, learnt history and experienced the real Hong Kong away from the glitz and big stores. Can't recommended this unconditionally. Thanks Ski you made our trip.

A must to do in Hong Kong. My family and I used Hong Kong as a stop over on our way to a 3 week holiday in Europe. We only had 2 days so we wanted to see as much as we could. Having our 2 children with us aged 14 and 13 we wanted to give them a true experience of life in Hong Kong.I came across Big Foot Tours on the internet and thought this is exactly what I was looking for. I was not wrong, the tour was excellent and highly recommend it to everyone wanting to see the REAL Hong Kong. Joe was our guide and he was fantastic. He was very knowledgeable and became instant hit with my 2 children because of his wonderful nature.If in Hong Kong this tour is a must do!!

A great way to start your holiday. I wanted to book a guided tour for when I arrived in Hong Kong and decided on Big Foot, after a little research. My guide was Joe and he was great. I had an afternoon tour which was tailored around my interests, all of which was pre planned with Big Foot. Joe was very enthusiastic about his country and knowledgeable. It was nice to see a young person with such knowledge. We really maxed out the time, covering a wide area but never once did I feel hurried. Joe also found the time at the end of the tour to draw out another itinerary for me to follow on my own, during my short stay in Hong Kong and it was spot on. They were also available via e-mail to ask questions, whilst in Hong Kong. All in all it was well worth the money. I did the tour on my first day in Hong Kong and it really set me up for tackling all the places I wanted to see, some of which were off the beaten track! If you are looking for a tour guide with genuinely nice people, relaxed, personal and suited to you, I highly recommend Big Foot.

Best Way to start your visit to HK. A MUST DO !!! Joe's extensive knowledge and passion was fantastic. Even though we were not very good at history he made it interesting and memorable (if only school history was that interesting). Great insight into everyday life, dine with the locals,discover the back streets & markets. Worth every cent. I suggest you dont do too much walking the day before & save your energy for the walking tour. Made it easier for us to get a feel for the layout of HK & get around on our own. Joe answered all our questions and gave us extra info on what to do and see during the rest of our stay.

Great Way to start your visit to HK. Met Joe and he gave us the best ever four hour walking tour of Hong Kong. His passion for the city was contagious!Kept a good pace with stopped now and then to point out things of interest and he picked the right times to stop and sit and have a taste of the local cuisine. Highly recommended!

Personal walking tour at your own pace. We were lucky to have a tour from the Boss (Ski) for our tour around HK island. The concept is very good and communication and payment was all very easy.We tailored the tour to things that we wanted to see and were able to stop when we liked to get a coffee or water etc.Although we had been on the bus tour the day before; the areas you go to on the tour are off the beaten track as you wind your way through the side streets and up escalators.I felt I really got to know HK.

Everything you want in a walking tour. I can't recommend Joe highly enough. My wife and I frequently hire tour guides when we travel, and Joe was one of the best we've ever had. Let me highlight 3 things in particular that we appreciated: (1) Fluent English: Joe is a native English speaker, which made it very easy to go beyond tourist English. It sounds simple but it's hard to talk about nuanced topics (culture, politics, etc.) without that. (2) He adds his own perspective. There were things we asked specifically to do, but honestly the highlights of the tour were the elements that Joe suggested (for instance, the wet market). Great tour guides show you things you didn't even know you wanted to see. (3) We left feeling smarter. Rather than just show us a series of statues and museums and landmarks, Joe helped us understand what it was like to live and work in Hong Kong. As one simple example among many: We wanted to see the Bird Market. It's a neat place and one that you could easily explore and admire on your own. But without Joe, we wouldn't have benefited from the extra color he shared, for instance, the unspoken competition among elderly men who take birds as pets, nurturing and training them ... taking them on walks and letting their cages sway as they walk in hopes of 'exercising' the birds (by building their strength and balance), and bringing them to the market to place their cages next to other birds who sing beautifully in hopes that their tunes will be contagious, etc., etc. You'd never get that kind of context without a guide like Joe.

the only way to see hong kong. I usually find a bike tour to discover the riches of a new city. However, due to the mountainous terrain of hong kong, i elected to seek a walking tour for my introduction. Trip advisor once again came through. A very easy, and accommodating reservation process introduced me to the Big Foot Tour. This was a wonderful way to discover the intricate areas of hong kong. Joe was a great historian, and very well versed in the geography of hong kong. My family especially enjoyed visiting all of the various neighborhoods, and engaging in the local cultured. the taste testing of various cuisines was awesome, and our visit to remote areas in the northern territories was excellent. We saw many sights that would have been missed if it wasnt for JOE and the big foot tour. Cant wait to return and sample other excursions..........just avoid united airlines for any trip to the far east. Our flights were horrific.........

Wonderful walking tour on Hong Kong Island. Our guide Joe met us at our Hotel and took us across to Hong Kong Island. This was a fantastic 4 hours walking the back streets of Hong Kong island. Joe took us places we might not be game to go on our own. He told us some history, showed us some food markets, took us into a chinese cafe for a cool drink and walked the residential back streets to get a feel for the real way of life in Hong Kong. We thoroughly enjoyed it and although exhausting it was well worth it and we would highly recommend the tour. Joe was very flexible and a lovely young man.

Awesome way to see the city. This was one of the first things we did when we arrived in Hong Kong.Great way to get a feel for the city and see a side of life that was ''off the beaten track'' Joe was a wonderful guide and gave us all the information we need and was willing to answer any questions we had.Tour is tailor made to whatever you want to see/do but i recommend looking at the wet market and having him take you for BBQ pork and an egg tart.We got ton of tips of place to visit after the tour from Joe to fill in the rest of our time in Hong Kong Worth every penny!!!

A highlight of our 5 month trip!. Our few hours with Joe walking and eating our way through Hong Kong was outstanding! It was extremely interesting and delicious. my husband was less keen on an 'organised tour' and couldn't imagine how he could find it worthwhile - and he loved it!It's not cheap, but we both thought it was worth every cent. Highly recommended!

AWESOME & COOL. Coolest walk done EVER! Ski is awesome! Time passes so quickly as we chill and hangaround the city. Sincere interaction, fun times, and VERY knowledgable. Can't say enough good things so... Book this now!!!!Ron and THE gang who stuffed too much Char Siew..........

Best thing we did on our trip. My wife and I walked the streets of HK with Joe from Bigfoot a few days ago and haven't stopped telling people how much we enjoyed it. If you are new to Hong Kong as we were, there's no better way to explore the city to get your bearings, especially since you can chat to the team beforehand and let them know your interests. Using a walking tour guide helps you to understand what you're seeing, if that makes sense, since you're constantly informed about the culture and history. Fascinating stuff, that we've continually referenced since when speaking to our friends about our trip. I would advise early bookings with the team as they seem to be fully booked about 2-3 days ahead, and a trip with them is the best way to START a visit to HK, as they can give you hints and tips to employ on the rest of your stay.

Great introduction to Hong Kong!. We went on a four hour food tour with Joe. It was great. Joe picks up on things that you may be interested in. We went to a couple temples and it was fascinating. Aside from eating delicious food and learning about the history behind it, we learned a lot about Hong Kong, it's history, and the people living there. Joe is friendly and upbeat with a great energy. Thanks Joe!

Amazing Tour and Highlight of Hong Kong. We traveled to Asia in December and January of 2012/2013. Our visit through Hong Kong was over 5 days and the best day by far was our tour with Bigfoot. We met Joe at Central and walked, talked, and ate for the next few hours. Joe was great with his culinary knowledge of both the main streets and back streets of Hong Kong. What we did not expect was to get a wonderful historical and cultural tour within the food tour. Joe knows his city, but more importantly he loves his city and you'll end up loving it as well. We felt after a few short hours of walking and eating that we finally "got" Hong Kong. The next couple days we walked around as locals, in our eyes at least, fully enjoying all the city had to offer with no timidness or hesitation. Might I add that my wife was pregnant at the time, so this was no small event to make us feel so comfortable in HK. Whether you are into Dim Sum, noodles, tea, diner fare, or even the unusual Bigfoot is absolutely worth it. They will tailor your tour for you and you will leave the hours with months of knowledge you can only get walking the locals path. Highly highly recommended.

Thanks Joe!. Our first time in Hong Kong and it was looking a little overwhelming. Joe took us on a 4 hour private tour and it was the best thing we did while there. He tailored it to the areas we were interested in (Central, Soho, Mid-levels etc) and had so much information to share about all the places we visited. The tour was with me, my sister and our Mum and Joe made sure we were all happy and comfortable right throughout the tour. He is very personable and friendly and by the end of the tour he felt like a close friend instead of our tour guide! I definitely recommend the private tour, because Joe can tailor this to the things you're interested in and you can hear more from him directly.We had a fantastic time on this tour and were exposed to lots of interesting shops, parks, buildings and information we would never have found or known without Joe.We picked a couple of spots to revisit by ourselves and found it easy to navigate back there thanks to Joe's directions. At the end of the tour he provided us with a map and pulled out key spots and restaurants for us to go to.Brilliant tour, if I go back to Hong Kong I'll be booking another Big Foot Tour to show me around a different section of the city.Thanks to both Joe & Ski.

Big Foot Tour with Joe. I traveled to Hong Kong several weeks ago with my family and our walking tour with Joe was one of the major highlights of our time there! He was very knowledgeable and gave us a greater understanding of local life in Hong Kong, which was extremely enlightening and interesting. Joe was personable and fun! We had a blast!!! DEFINITELY book a tour with Big Foot Tour company the next time that you are in Hong Kong!

Must do in Hong Kong. Whether you are in Hong Kong for only a day or so, or a week or more, we highly recommend you take this tour!We had just flown into HK and scheduled a private tour with Joe. It was fantastic. We had asked for our tour to center on history, everyday life and culture with a stop for dim sum. The insights into the culture were fascinating and explained so much. We were so glad that we did this first thing upon our arrival. Having had the walking tour, we felt very comfortable exploring on our own throughout the rest of our stay. Because I have a very bad knee, I was concerned about so much walking. However, Joe was attentive to this and I was able to last the entire 4 hours!!! And we covered quite a lot of ground! My husband was surprised (as I!). Additionally, Joe was very flexible, offering us options throughout the tour in case we were more interested in something than another. If you have any doubts, dismiss them now. Ironically, when we reviewed the 'list' of things that we wanted to see/do in HK on our third day, we had done most of them on day 1 through our tour! Lastly, Joe speaks perfect English, is quite engaging, and we never felt as if he was bored (having done this for some time.) Please believe the reviews as this company is really, really excellent!!!

Perfect 1/2 Day Tour. We hired Ski from Big Foot Tours for a half day walking tour of Hong Kong. She was knowledgeable, flexible, and had perfect English, all of which made for a wonderful tour. We never could have seen as much as we did, nor learned as much about the culture and history of Hong Kong on our own. On the day that we had our tour the ferry to Hong Kong island was free. She didn't know why but was kind enough to research it and email us with the reason when we arrived home. We were taken to a non-tourist restaurant for a dumpling lunch and she negotiated the acquisition of the kind of dumplings we wanted. We saw both the streets with the high priced stores as well as the narrow back streets with the older authentic shops. She also took us up the long escalator to the level required for us to see the synagogue which is well disguised so we would never been able to find it on our own. This is definitely a worthwhile tour!

2 days to see Honk Kong. 3 of us traveling back from a biz trip on the mainland decided to drop into HK - a first visit for all of us. Booked 2 half day tours - one on Hong Kong island and one in the New Territories. Joe was a great tour guide giving us enormous background to whatever we were seeing. Walked our ****'s off, but did not feel pushed as we stopped at temples, markets, reflexology park, etc. Joe helped us quickly learn the subway system (cleanest in the world) which we used in our free time. And he was kind enough to bring us to a local place for lunch after the tour ended and sit down and eat with us. We came. We Saw. We had a great experience.

A Hong Kong must. I can't recommend this company too highly. Joe took my wife and I on a fantastic walking tour of Hong Kong Central. We covered some territory that we had already covered but with joe as our guide we saw and understood so much more. His cultural insights are tremendous and he's such a nice guy. We will be back early next year and will take our teenage children to share this experience. Don't hesitate - take a tour.

Worth the money. I considered this an expensive tour and the problem is you don't know what you get until you have committed the money. However because of Big Foots excellent rating on trip advisor i took the plunge only to experience some difficulty in finding a time when we were free and Big Foot had capacity. In consequence in was quite late in our stay that we took this tour, it would have been even better had we been able to arrange it early in our stay. Therefore my first piece of advice is book early. Joe was our tour guide. In theory this was a food tour. We walked around the Central area of Hong Kong Island for over 4 hours grazing in little restaurants and cafes that frankly i wouldn't have had the guts or the language skills to visit without Joe. There were 4 in our party, this is the maximum number Big Foot accept and given the teeming nature of the streets we covered I consider the limit sensible. Joe is half English, half Hong Kong Chinese, his understanding of both cultures and his enthusiasm gave an insight on day to day life in Hong Kong that I found fascinating. We ate and or drank at 7 different establishments and turned down an opportunity at an eighth. The food was varied and in some cases excellent but above all else it was interesting. However the tour covered much more than just food. We discussed amongst other subjects architecture, Feng shui, politics, Taoism, Buddhism, how to buy a chicken, ghost towns, ghost goods, property prices, the suburbs of Sheffield, cursing your enemies, Chinese medicine, Michelin star restaurants and the difference between Far Eastern and European standards and a whole lot more. This was a fabulous tour because of the intelligence and enthusiasm of Joe. If food isn't your thing i am certain that a tour will be tailored to cover what you are interested in. Joe had previously done a tour covering sites used as film sets in Hong Kong. In summary this tour is worth every penny but a word of warning, walking outdoors for 4 hours 90%+ humidity is not for the faint hearted. You will need a shower when you finish.

Worth like 5 days but u spend just one.. We had just one day to spend at Hobg Kong. So we decided to try a guide. We had Joe. Nice guy, we start the day with "Hong Kong breakfast style". Amazing. There are things you'd never do if u were alone or with a regular tourist guide. At the end we felt like we'd been living in Hong Kong for almost a week.Really recommend. I now it looks expensive, and it it, like everything in HK, but like I said, we just had one day and we wanted it to be good. It was amazing.

Such a wonderful way to start your visit to Hong Kong. I found out about this on the Trip-advisor site and was so pleased I did. Our tour guide Ski was brilliant and gave us such an amazing first introduction to the city explaining the best way to get about and showing us areas we would probably never have visited On our own. Ski is such a warm and caring person who could not have done more to show us HK as any member of your own family would.A MUST for anyone going to Hong Kong, especially for the first time.

What a great experience. Slightly nervous just before on whether we were going to survive 4 hours of walking in extreme heat and humidity?. Shouldn't have worried, what a great time which absolutely flew by. Ski is a fantastic tour guide and a lovely lady which has a great ability to show the true and real Hong Kong in every detail.We would not hesitate a second to recommend this tour to anyone coming to Hong Kong. Thanks Ski for a great time.

Ski is the Best!. We had one and one half days in Hong Kong and wanted a complete overview of the city. We hired Ski for a walking tour of the city....the best thing we could have done! She picked us up at our hotel on Kowloon, spoke to us of the architecture of the city, from a native's point of view, and continued to lead us through the main streets and the back streets of HK. At our request we took the long escalator and stopped at the Ohel Leah Synagogue, a building we would never found on our own.Ski is knowledgeable, bright, caring, ( she slowed her pace for our comfort) and I would highly recommend her for an inside view of HK. She also led us to a local dim sum restaurant and taught us how to eat dim sum like a native!

Awesome experience with compassionate guide. Had an awesome experience exploring Hong Kong with Joe. Even though living in the city for 3 months he showed us great places that I never explored before and introduced us to new tastes and experiences! Would definitely recommend anybody going on a tour and explore Hong Kong with Joe and Big Foot Tour

great day in hong kong. Ski provided a better than expected walking tour of the city .. we covered a lot of ground got a great feel for Hong Kong , Ski was great and emailed us information on the attractions that interested us but did not cover in our 1 day tour. I have been in ,many places and have done many tours Ski delivered above and beyond my expectations

So glad we did the tour, learnt and experienced loads. Anyone thinking of doing a walking tour while in Hong Kong definitely should check out Big Foot Tour. Ski Yeo and I quickly exchanged emails and she put together a tailored half day tour for us to explore the real life of HK away from the bland shopping malls.We met up with Joe outside of Central Station on May 6th and spent a wonderful next 4 hours exploring and getting a taste of what life is like in HK and an understanding of the history and culture, as well as several opportunities to stop and sample various types of food and drink.Joe was an awesome guide, he made my partner and I feel welcome and comfortable and he had a great ability to engage with us and get to know us while being very informative and sharing plenty of personal tales about his city on our journey, even remembering it was my partner's 40th birthday and recommending a great restaurant.It was a true highlight of our holiday and we can't thank Joe enough for making our walking tour so much fun, enlightening and engaging and for taking the time to make sure we could work out on the map where we had walked and ensuring we got back to our ferry.Thank you Ski and Joe, I can't recommend this experience enough to anyone wanting to explore Hong Kong with out feeling any pressure or lost in a big group.

Best tour in 40 years of travel!. Our best travel day ever, after 40 years of travel, was the Sunday we spent with Joe on the Hong Kong Big Foot Tour. He made everything so interesting, and with such enthusiasm, that I forgot how much my feet hurt!.....he made the history and buildings of Hong Kong come alive with great stories instead of just quoting facts, he took us to good places to eat, and was such a nice guy I wanted to adopt him. Ski was also extremely nice -- I saw that she was from Singapore and asked her to recommend a guide, and she sent me her personal recommendations for sightseeing, restaurants, etc. That was the first day of our SE Asia trip, and we were fortunate to have pretty good guides everywhere, but Joe was the very best.

Best tour of our Cruise!!. Ski is absolutely the best tour guide we had. We were on the Diamond Princess and had one day in Hong Kong. Felt like we saw things others would have passed by. (a umbrella repair shop) The tour was perfect. Ski had us try some local treats (really good) and helped us buy a trinket at the market. She is very knowledgeable of Hong Kong and I would HIGHLY recommend her!! Even though it was a lot of walking we all agreed it was our favorite tour of the cruise!

Book now!!. My husband and I had a wonderful time on our foodie Hong Kong tour with Ski. She was amazing! We ate great food, had nice conversation, and learned a lot of insider information that we would not have gotten from a book. Thank you so much Ski! You were awesome!!

Great tour. Just came back from our tour with Joe who took us around Hong Kong. Joe is very knowledgable about the area as he grew up there. Really interesting tour, he took us to places we would not have known about as a tourist and pointed things out to us that we would not have noticed if we wandered around by ourselves and he's a really friendly guide as well. I really recommend this tour to anyone planning on coming to Hong Kong. Make sure you book this at the start of your trip. Also ask Joe for recommendations on where to eat and buy things. Also ask him to take you to the yum cha restaurant for lunch....fantastic food. I can not recommend Big Foot tours highly enough, great communication when booking and great tour. A++++++++

A tribute to Ski's wonderful introduction to our time in Hong Kong. What a fantastic time we had with Ski during our walking tour. It was the highlight of our holiday in Hong Kong. We were staying on Kowloon and had expressed an interest in the culture and history of Hong Kong. Ski recommended a tour of part of Hong Kong Island. After meeting Ski, she explained the MTR and transport systems, helped us purchase our Octopus cards before we took the MTR to Central. We began with some historic buildings followed by some Feng Shui features of some modern structures.Then we spent a fascinating time walking through narrow back streets with a variety of Chinese shops, markets, local eating places and other items of interest. We tasted egg tarts from Chris Pattens favourite shop and as we walked Ski told us a lot about the way of life for the people of Hong Kong . At the end of our tour Ski highlighted some interesting places for us to visit on Kowloon and as we were keen to visit the Peak, Ski gave us tips on the local bus route which saved much queuing for the tram and provided some spectacular views. Later we came down on the Tram.Ski was a wonderful, friendly, happy young lady who was very knowledgeable, easy to get on with and clearly passionate about her work. Ski is someone whom we will always remember and we wish her good fortune with her excellent Big Foot Tours.Thank you so much Ski

Greatt 4 hours. Fabulous insight into Hong Kong life. Just completed a 4 hour private walking tour with Joe from Big Foot. Totally happy to recommend this to anyone. Perfect way to get to see the "real" Hong Kong - completely tailored to your interests, speed and time of day. Joe is keen to share his knowledge with you. It's just like having a really good friend show you around his home town. Next time I am in Hong Kong I will definitely use his services again. Attentive, knowledgeable and interesting. Thank you.

How do dragons get from the mountains to the sea with so many skyscrapers in the way?. If, like our group, the answers to exotic questions like this one would add a lot to your tour of Hong Kong then Ski is the person to go with. Everything you could ask for plus one of the the more interesting food experiences we had during our Asia tour. Extensive knowledge of the city, attentiveness to our needs, incredibly interesting experiences in both 'local' and 'tourist' Hong Kong - well, you've read it all in other reviews so I'll keep this one short. Our experience mirrors the others so just go and do it. Great value.

Fabulous Four Hours. What a fabulous way to commence our holiday in Hong Kong. My wife and I, and our two friends travellig with us, had the most wonderful experience from the moment Ski met us at our hotel to the time she left us seated at a restaurant after four hours of walking and learning. Ski could not have been more attentive to our needs. With her extensive knowledge of Hong Kong, its history and culture, plus her wonderful personality and sense of humour she provided us with a great understanding of the city we had come to see and experience. Ski made sure that all four members of the party were accommodated from our physical capability to the range of individual interests. The tour was not expensive and was certainly value for money. We only wished that we had more time in Hong Kong to take advantage of the other tours that Bigfoot offers. I can't speak too highly of Ski and the Bigfoot tour. What an absolute delight Ski was.

You didn't do BigFoot? Huh?. Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful! ... ~ An absolute must do in Hong Kong, much more so than say Victoria Peak ~ Booking through Ski was really easy ~ We had 4 parents, 4 toddlers, 2 strollers & lots of bags in our Group... notwithstanding our logistical challenges and the undulating terrain, we would do BigFoot again in a heartbeat! ~ The highlights of our BigFoot Tour are well documented by my fellow BigFoot fans and reviewers ~ An exception might be our spontaneous detours to two kids' playgrounds, one of which Joe visited regularly when he was a tot! ~ We loved the tram ride back to the MTR ~ Joe was super helpful at the end of the tour as well, marking out our route and stopovers on a map ~ When told of our intention later on in the day to visit Mung Kok with some friends, Joe took the trouble after our tour ended to email me a map with circled out recommended spots... Thank you Joe.. Thank you Ski... Here's to ALL visitors to Hong Kong doing the BigFoot!

Worth Ever Penny. From A - Z our entire experience with Big Foot Tour was worth every penny. Booking online was easy and communication was prompt and clear. We booked Joe for a 4 hour Hong Kong Island Tour on one day and a 4 hour New Territories tour the following day. Both tours were outstanding. Joe is passionate about Hong Kong and the New Territories, well versed in the history and culture, and knows just where to go to meet client interests. An extra benefit for us was gaining familiarity with the Hong Kong subway system. We were able to go other sites on our own with full confidence. We highly recommend Big Foot Tour. On our month-long Asian trip we met 11 different tour guides. Most of them were quite good, but Joe stood out as the very best. Thank you again, Joe! Hi from Margaret and Jay

Joe's the Best.. We just finished a two week trip to China and Hong Kong and Joe's walking tour was a highlight of the trip. In four hours we got an incredible overview of and insight into the City, and got to appreciate its growth, its verticality, neighborhoods we would never get to see otherwise... a real sense of the City, its history, its culture and what makes it tick every day. With a great local lunch and some English mikl tea thrown it, we couldn't ask for more. Thank You, Joe.

What a tour!. With limited time in Hong Kong, and with a small group of experienced travelers with different interests, we were struggling to find something to do together (and I having lived there before as well). Thanks to Ski and her outstanding knowledge and organization, this walking tour Hong Kong made everyone extremely happy. We covered so many different areas in such a short time, from a local breakfast in a back restaurant that you would never find on your own, to one of the few remaining cart-served Dim-Sum where we were the only Westerners in the place, this was a tour we will remember for a very long timer. Ski's knowledge was broad as it was deep - from architecture and it's relation to Feng Shui (we had a couple of architects in the group who loved her descriptions of some of the major buildings in Hong Kong), to the food (we ALL loved the food), to the art galleries, to the traditional Chinese medicine stores, to the tour of the Central Escalator, to lunch - seen and done all within 4 hours! Highly recommend this this to both new and returning visitors to Hong Kong!

Best walking tour ever. This tour was the highlight of our trip to Hong Kong. We had a tour with Joe in March and what a fantastic experience it was. He met up with us at our designated meeting point on time and promptly guided us through places that we would not have found on our own. Along the way, he gave us enthusiastic and informative explanation, allowing us to have a taste of what life is really like in Hong Kong. Joe is very accommodating - he tailored the trip according to our interests, making sure we experience everything we wanted to. His passion for his country's history, culture, feng shui and architecture is very infectious. We learned a lot from him in those few hours. He also provided us with plenty of tips on what restaurants to try, places not to be missed and how to get there. So, try to plan for this tour on the first day of your trip as it's a great way of getting yourself familiar with the city. We couldn't say enough good things about Joe and Big Foot Tour. He went above and beyond, spending extra time with us and making sure we are headed the right way for our next destination. Highly recommended and wouldn't hesitate to go on another tour with Joe! Special thanks also to Ski for her prompt and professional reply through our email correspondents. Li, Lynn, Patrick & Siew Lee

Fantastic Tour. We cannot say enough good things about our 4 hour tour with Ski. Aside from all of the wonderful things that have been mentioned here, our tour was the beginning of our understanding of the relationship between Hong Kong and mainland China. We loved walking around, seeing the old and the new Hong Kong, but more than all of that, we loved our experience with Ski and our discussion about the politics, driving etc. I would recommend her tour to anyone and she is sensitive to the needs of the travelers. My husband was using a cane and she was able to adapt the route to accommodate him. We wish her the best in her business and hope that she can find others who share her enthusiasm and energy. It makes all of the difference in providing a fantastic experience.

High energy guide for insiders tour of Hong Kong. We had a 4 hour tour with Ski in Hong Kong in January. What a high energy, positive wonderful guide. She gave us a great explanation of sheng fui and the bank building, mid level elevators, the umbrella guy, and Chinese herbs. She helped us gather a selection of Chinese teas to take home and we had lunch at a popular dim sum restaurant. Highly entertaining and insightful. Highly recommended and would take another tour with her in a heartbeat.

Fantastic Experience. We had only a short time in Hong Kong and Joe was able to tailor our tour to ensure that we saw and experienced everything we wanted to. This is definitely value for money and also an experience not to be missed.roger

The Best!. We had only two days in March 2013 in Hong Kong and booked a four hour walking tour with Joe. That was the best four hours spent during our four weeks in S.E. Asia! Joe is young, enthusiastic, knowledgeable, personable and honest. He also has exceptional English skills, which cannot be overrated, especially once you've experienced other guides in Asia. Joe met us promptly at our arranged meeting place and then walked us through old Hong Kong in areas where he grew up. He showed us places that we would not likely have seen any other way and experienced what everyday life is really like. He has a full appreciation and knowledge of the history of Hong Kong and a keen interest in the future of this territory when it reverts to Chinese rule. Our initial contact with Big Foot was with Ski Yeo and she is particularly well organized and set us up with Joe, determined a logical meeting place and even sent us a picture of Joe so we could recognize him at the meeting place. We cannot possibly over rate this tour and these two exceptional people.Daune and DennisEdmonton, Alberta , Canada

An Adventure. Joe didn't just show me around Hong Kong and Kowloon, he made me a life long resident for 4 hours. Joe met me at my hotel, I told him the kinds of things I wanted see and avoid, and off we went. Over the next four hours, I got the low down on how to battle bad Feng Shui, tasted the best the streets (and back alleys) of Kowloon had to offer, and was submerged in a culture utterly different from my own. I got to see places that I would not have found on my own, and even if I did, I would not have understood what they were or meant to the people who lived there. Joe went above and beyond, providing me with information on what I should see during the rest of my stay. In one word, this tour was awesome. Go by yourselves, go with your family, go with your friends- just go.

What a great day!. My partner and I booked this tour to take on our first full day of Hong Kong and what a great decision! Joe met us in the lobby of our hotel and took us out to see the city! We had been a little apprehensive about venturing out because of the language issues but rest assured Joe shows you how to get around, where to go and what to look for. (For those of you apprehensive about the language, there is a lot of English spoken here and most signs are also in English.) He took us to places that we would never have seen and he was a friendly young man who has traveled, is educated and we felt like old friends by the end of the day as we were enjoying a beer and he was giving us a map of things that we had seen and of things not to miss. He had great knowledge of city history, architect styles and he gave us great tips on restaurants, city life, etc. This is a great way to get familiar with the city on your first day. Can't recommend this tour enough! Enjoy your time in Hong Kong! Thanks again for a great day Joe! Cheers! David & Gene

Educational and Fascinating Tour - A Must Do in HK!. I was in Hong Kong for 6 days with my husband, but he was there primarily for work. It was my first trip to Hong Kong, and I really wanted to get acquainted with the city and hear about it's history, culture, food and insights that I wouldn't necessarily be able to find out about on my own. I had come across Big Foot Tours on the web, and the reviews were fantastic, so I decided to book a 4 hour private tour. Joe met me on time and with a big, welcoming smile at out pre-determined meeting spot. Joe guided me through the winding city streets in a knowledgeable and insightful way. I saw and learned more in the 4 hours with Joe then I could have on my own over the entire trip.
