Most importantly, Joe took me to sights and restaurants that I could have never found on my own (i.e. the wet market). He really gave me a taste of HK beyond what the average tourist experiences. Do not go to Hong Kong without doing this tour. It was the highlight of my trip!

Excellent Tour. We did a tour in March with Joe as our guide. This was easily the best tour of our 2 week trip. We got to see and experience sites in Hong Kong that we would have never found on our own.

Great experience for our whole family. We booked a private walking tour for the 2nd day of a 2 week spring break holiday in Hong Kong - the two of us plus our daughter (15) and son (12). The meet up with Joe in Central went just as planned - and, almost immediately, torrential rain started and remained, to greater and lesser degree, through the walk. The makings of a poor experience? No, it was really great. Both kids absolutely loved the tour (as did we) and were perfectly happy to keep going through the rain just to hear what Joe had to say about this complex and interesting city. Joe's enthusiasm is infectious and he kept us informed and entertained at the same time - providing information of interest to each of us and all of us in equal measure. Joe related his experiences as a boy growing up in Hong Kong and shared his knowledge of its history as well as day to day living as now experienced by people here. In the days that followed, we often thought back to things he told us. I highly recommend this tour to anyone.

Brilliant.. Joe was assigned as my guide. He's a young savvy chap, and he introduced me to the daily life of Hong Kong, particularly in the Sheung Wan region (where Joe showed me one of the best roast pork restaurants known to humanity). Wet markets, snake soup, turtle jelly, paper funeral offering stores, the epicenter of the Hong Kong plague outbreak.... a myriad of insight and history that helped me break the ice with the locals and encouraged me to explore the city in adventurous, inquisitive manner for the rest of my trip. Also, Joe is a trained chef who has worked in Michelin rated restaurants, making a perfect guide if you want to eat local fair and have someone explain how it is made. Big Foot Tour... get one of their guides at the start of your time in HK and the city will open up for you.

Don't visit HK without booking this tour!. Even though we had read great things about this tour through tripadvisor it still exceeded our expectations. Joe's genuine enthusiasm for the history and culture of Hong Kong is really infectious. We only had two full days in the city and by taking this tour on our first day, we feel that we really discovered the true Hong Kong. In addition to our walking tour, Joe gave us the tip of taking the bus up to the Peak to avoid the tedious queue both ways on the tram (also the bus ride gives a brilliant view of the city!), and he even suggested a route we should take alone the following day - most helpful, again we discovered places off of the tourist track (we loved the wet market!). Highly recommended - don't visit Hong Kong without booking this tour!

BIG FOOT WALKING TOUR - FANTASTIC!. We loved our walking tour of Hong Kong Island. Ski was so knowledgeable about the history and local culture of the city. I enquired online after reading reviews on Tripadvisor, Ski was prompt in getting back to me & her enquiry form let us rate what our interests were so she could plan our tour to suit us. She emailed a map and good explanation of how to get from our hotel at Kowloon to our meeting point outside Central Station. We have already recommended Big Foot Walking Tour to several people. As we were doing the walk Ski noticed I was taking photos of mailboxes (as this is what Noel manufacturers back in Australia). Next thing we knew, Ski took us to a shop that sold "mailbox memorabilia!" I mentioned I was looking for some Jasmine tea to take home for my daugher, next thing we were in a tea shop! Ski asked if we were getting hungary......next thing, we're in restaurant for a yum cha luncheon......in a restaurant that we wouldn't have known existed....it was a fabulous experience mixing with the locals and eating authentic Chinese food. Make sure you wear comfortable walking shoes & have your camera ready for all those wonderful photo opportunities.

Big Foot Tour - gives you the real scoop! These guys rock!. A group of us was on a yoga tour, and we had the privilege and good fortune of getting a fantastic walking tour with Ski and Joseph. Right away, we knew that we were in good hands - our guides were smart, sharp, fit, and able to connect with everyone. So refreshing, as opposed to the kind of tour where the guide goes through the motions and gives everyone the same cookie-cutter tour. Not these guys! They listened to us, figured out what we were interested in, and adjusted the tour "on the fly: to show us stuff that we really cared about. Hong Kong is a crazy big city, and Big Foot Tours has the ability to show you everything - from the typical to the very different. Highly, highly recommend them! Thank you so much Ski and Joseph!

Great Tour! Highly recommended!. Thank you, Joe, for walking around with us and showing us the Hong Kong we wouldn't have found on our own, and for your great commitment.We really enjoyed it, as well as our few days Hong Kong alltogether, we'll be back for sure!

Great walking tour. My daughter and I had a wonderful afternoon waliking with Ski around Hong Kong island's mid level area.We based our tour around the foodie tour and had a wonderful time trying different types of chinese foods in place s we wouldnt have found ourselves. Yum! Also, Ski 's company was very pleasant and informative. I learnt a lot about Hong Kong that I didnt know, even though I have been several times. I would highly recommend the tour. Thanks Ski!

Must-do!. We were all Hong Kong 'frist-timers' and keen to learn a bit more about the city, in particular it's food! We found Big Foot Tours and organised it all from home. Ski was quick to reply and organise it all for us. Ski took the four of us on an amazing wander through the streets of Hong Kong, stopping at a few spots to try some local delicacies. All of the places we went into to eat or look at were spots we would have either not found on our own or walked straight pass as we couldn't read the menu! Ski constantly talked to us about the history, culture and quirks of this amazing city and took us exactly where we wanted to go.The tour was a great start to our own explorations of the city - we all learnt and experienced so much more than we could have on our own in such a short time.A BIG thank you to Ski who was patient with us and very generous with her time. Highly recommend trying a Big Foot Tour when in Hong Kong as soon as you arrive!

Delectable!. This was our second time in Hong Kong and on our first visit, we were astounded by the culinary landscape of this great city, where you can have wonderful food fitting every budget, every taste and every culture. So for our second visit, we really wanted to explore Hong Kong from a culinary point of view and with the help of someone local. Which is where Big Foot Tour comes in - we contacted Ski and she helped us arrange a culinary inspired tour of the city, guided by Joe.This wasn't our first food tour - we've done them in other cities, and I'm convinced it's one of the best ways to get to know a place and the people who live there, for real, and to the core. After all, there only are a few daily activities each culture, each time period, each person, needs to do every day: eat, sleep and go to the bathroom. Of those three, the second and last would be difficult to translate into a guided tour format. Difficult but interesting....Anyway - we met Joe on the second day of our trip to Hong Kong; he met us at our hotel lobby at The Icon hotel, making things very easy for us and whisked us away to HK Island, on a culinary adventure.We visited a small restaurant frequented only by locals to have a tasty breakfast congee with hundred year old egg and fried bread, a hole-in-the-wall place selling milky tea, an old-fashioned sugar cane processor where we drank pure sugar cane juice, a small mystery shop with wooden cages full of snakes where we had snake soup (it DID taste like chicken!), a traditional dim sum restaurant where you (or in our case, Joe) had to chase the dinner ladies with their carts and fight off fellow diners for the last basket of a particularly yummy type of dim sum and a bakery for egg tart.As we are not big eaters, we visited but did not eat anything, at some other places Joe brought us to, like a wet market and a pair of rivaling noodle shops.Most of all, Joe shared wonderful stories about his city and his life in Hong Kong, taught us about its history, its problems and its opportunities, its people. We had a wonderful time, and would recommend Joe and Big Foot Tours (here's a thought - why not found a subsidiary called Big Food Tours ;-).Only issue is that we didn't have time during the tour to stop for lunch ...Kidding! I most strongly recommend Big Foot Tours, both Joe and Ski, for anyone wanting to get to know Hong Kong intimately and through the eyes of the people who live there.

Terrific experience. We had a tour with Joe, who was highly recommended to us by friends. We also loved Joe! He was super knowledgeable, personable and had a great rapport with our 8 year old son. He showed us the parts of HK that we would never have found on our own, and it was great to hear his perspective as a local on HK's past and future. Great, fun, informative experience and we would wholeheartedly encourage visitors (even repeat visitors) to HK to call Joe for a tour. Also, Ski was extremely helpful and prompt in her communications with us to arrange for the tour. Thanks again!

SIMPLY THE BEST. Had a fantastic time seeing the real Hong Kong with Joe who is such a cool dude,he covered every aspect of what we had asked for and more,his knowledge is second to none.spent a whole afternoon and honestly only seemed like half an hour,we had such fun and learnt alot about the people and the culture of those who live in Hong Kong.We even had time for a quick bite and a beer before we were off again seeing temples and an array of markets.We even went over our allotted time but Joe just carried on as per normal and would not accept anything for the extra time he spent with us.If you want to see the real Hong Kong then look these guys up as they really are First Classand will enhancce any visit.

Thank you Ski. We only had 3 days in Hong Kong so took the plunge and booked Ski for a half day tour. This was money very well spent!Ski was friendly, informative and prompt! She took us to see things that we didn't know we wanted to see but without which our visit would not have been nearly as interesting. The walkways were fascinating and we really enjoyed our break at a local cafe for tea/coffee. The visit to the Man Mo temple was fascinating and I loved the fact that my fortune was better than Keith's!We would never have ventured into the dim sum restaurant without Ski and we would have missed a fantastic experience and delicious food. After lunch she took us to the right bus-stop to get to the Peak and we managed to get ourselves back down on the tram.Above all, Ski was great company and we chatted for the whole period of the tour and learned so much about Hong Kong from her.We would thoroughly recommend her services - you won't be disappointed!

Not to be Missed!. Definitely the best decision I made before travelling, was to book a tour with Big Foot for the first day of our first visit to Hong Kong. Ski was a fantastic guide, introducing us to culinary delights and local insights that we would not have discovered without her. Giving us a tailor made tour catering for our interests rather than anyone else's, Ski was friendly, attentive and informative. Suggesting a trip to the Peak for the rest of the afternoon, Ski took us to the bus station at the end of the tour and even supplied the correct change for the bus! For first time visitors or anyone wanting to know more about Hong Kong, this is an experience not to be missed. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Hong Kong. We had a great day visiting a side of Kowloon most people do not see.Joe took us on a wonderful adventure to see the life style of people thatare so removed from the high rise of the city. We learned so much about cultureand society as well. Joe has a energetic spirit that also enhances the tour.He was knowledgeable and adventurous. He read us well so took us to areashe knew we would enjoy most. It was the best tour of Hong Kong.

Big Foot Tour with Ski. We had the most fantastic walking tour with Ski. She is extremely knowledgeable about Hong Kong. She showed us things we would never otherwise have seen and told us lots of interesting facts about the places we visited.She is very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for her. She was more than happy to tailor the tour to our requirements. We had the best holiday ever, visiting Hong Kong, Bangkok and Burma and Ski's tour was most definitely one of the highlights. We cannot recommend Big Foot Tours highly enough. Thank you Ski for a wonderful tour :-)

Superb walking tour. We booked well in advance and were lucky to have owner Ski herself take us on a 4 hour walking tour of the island side of the city. What a great intro to Hong Kong! She picked us up at our hotel in the Pacific Center, took us on a comfortable walk toward the Central area, mid-levels and SOHO, and back to Atlantic. She expertly explained history and architecture in excellent English. For lunch she took us to one of the few remaining authentic dim sum restaurants in Chinatown where we enjoyed a fun lunch, local style. She fully explained the superb public transport system and showed us how to get an Octopus card for our remaining 5 days. Ski knows HK, has a sweet and engaging personality, and really seems to enjoy being with her customers. Outstanding young lady!!

No regret with Big Foot Tour ;). My family of 4 had our tour with Joe yesterday 19 Mar. Much was said about Joe in many of the reviews here. We had such a great time in 4 hrs exploring the central district, eating nice local food, egg tart, milk tea and even tram ride. Advise you guys to book earlier and plan this tour at the beginning of your holiday. I'll do that with Big Foot again when I return to HK. I'm sure Ski and her guys will do well.

AWESOME!!. Ski and Joe were amazing! We had a large group touring through Hong Kong and they were so great with all of us. Their knowledge of the city and some of the nuances of HK that you'd never know just walking around was so great that I actually took notes. They were fun, friendly and so gracious. I can't recommend them enough and I can't wait to see them again in June!

Best View of Hong Kong. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our four hour walking tour with Joe. His passion for his city was very evident. He is very knowledgable about the city in which he grew up and loves to share his knowledge with others. The night before our tour he was informed that I wanted to purchase an American mahjong set. He had no idea what this was, but did his research that evening and the next day was able to take us to a little shop where I was able to purchase a lovely set of tiles for a great price. He truly customizes the tour just for you. We enjoyed being taken off the beaten path and into the neighborhoods where he grew up. Having a guide for just the two of us, was wonderful. I wish we were able to do the tour with Joe on our first day in Hong Kong, not our last. They were booked for the time we initially wanted. We would have returned to some of places we visited or maybe even done another tour. The tour was definitely the highlight of our trip/cruise to Asia. Thank you, Joe!

Amazing Group Hong Kong Tour. Ski and Joe took our yoga group through a Hong Kong tour on our first day in the city and it set the mood for an amazing experience. The knowledge (and fun tidbits!) that these two gave our group opened up a foreign city in a whole new way. I loved being able to look at the skyline understand (I won't give anything away here... you gotta take the tour!). They customized our tour for our group, worked under ever shifting timelines and even escorted us to our yoga event to make sure we got there ok (long past our contracted end time). They were professional, fun and I can't wait to go back for more. Book these guys on your next HK trip!

Great morning with Ski. My wife and I went on Big Foot walking tour with Ski on 13 March 2013 and had a wonderful time with her. Her knowledge of the Chinese culture and Hong Kong in general is fantastic. Ski took us through the main business area, then to where the real people work and live in the back streets, where we got a real insight of how the locals live and work. We visited temples, markets etc and found the tour excellent on our first day in Hong Kong. Ski also suggested other locations that we visit on our stay here which was great. I highly recommend the Big Foot walking tour. Steve and Robyn Williams. Newcastle, Australia.

Hong Kong culture, sites and food in an AMAZING fun packed. 4 hour walking tour with insights into Hong Kong culture and history with fun filled FACTS with an introduction to an amazing city of excess and indulgence. Ate Dim Sum in a 5 story restaurant where you wash your plates and chopsticks with tea before eating and where English is not spoken or understood! Learned about Chinese Herbal Medicine and got to see the variety of ingredients available. Did you know that birds nest comes from swallow saliva? Explored Hollywood street and cut label stores? Pr----da and Arm---ni at huge discounts just because the label is intentionally. Meandered through SOHO boutiques and restaurants.  ripped. Rode the worlds longest escalator and explored hidden markets and unnamed streets. A First visitor MUST do tour. Ski was GREAT! Lovely personality and completely accommodating. Made our visit very special and memorable. Thanks.
wonderful guide. Ski is the best. She led us on a wonderful walking tour of Hong Kong that showed us the "inside" Hong Kong. I would highly recomend Big Foot Tour!
Great day. Our guide Joe was phenomenal. His passion and enthusiasm was amazing. His knowledge of the city and culture was fascinating. Highly recommend.

Best tour on foot yet!. We chose to schedule this tour within hours of landing in Hong Kong to get a feel for the lay of the land - best decision ever! Joe was fantastic - high energy, engaging, and full of knowledge about the region's history and culture. We learned so many little tidbits and stories about everything ranging from the architecture of some of the city's landmark buildings in the business district to the history behind an old man and his umbrella repair cart in SoHo that is being supported by the local residents. We tried chicken feet for the first time and came away from the tour with a strong sense of the richness and diversity of the city - we knew more about it than our friend who had moved there about a month ago! I'd highly recommend this tour to everyone!

Hong Kong uncensored. My Boyfriend and I spent one week in Hong Kong. We only had a few days to visit. That is why i decided to organize a tour with a guide. Joe met us at our hotel. From there we walked to different places and took the MTR. We learned a lot about the culture and the real life of Hong Kong residents. Joe really aknowlaged our wishes and showed us exaclty what we wanted to see. I can only recommend a tour with him. Especially if you only have a few days to visit.

Best 4 hour walk. My husband and I met Ski by the metro station exit in Central Hong Kong. She took us all over the area, down side alleys, markets, landmarks, and more. We stopped to drink milk tea and french toast made with coconut jam at a busy cafe. When mentioned that I had also read about the famous egg tarts, she immediately too us to a bakery famous for these tasyt treats. We covered so much ground, but never felt rushed. I we saw something we wanted to explore, Ski made sure we were given all the time we needed to check things out. This will be the best tour money you can spend. Wear your comfy shoes and get ready for great sights and knowledgeable explanations of everything you are seeing.

Hong Kong is more than a shopping mall!. After spending more than 4 hours with Joe today, we learned more about Hong Kong than we imagined possible. Joe not only shared the history of HK, but also helped us understand the cultures that make up this city. We visited every kind of neighborhood you can imagine. We saw the towering commercial skyscrapers, the alleys with vendors selling to city dwellers, residential areas, rich and not so rich. We learned so much about how people eat in HK and lunched at a local "diner". We may now be exhausted, it was worth every second we spent with Joe. Don't miss this walking tour if you visit Hong Kong.

Amazing overview of Hong Kong!. Just got back from a walking tour with Ski. She is incredible. She took me to so many places I wouldn't have otherwise found or known about. I feel like I saw the real Hong Kong today. I was the only tourist in most of the places we went. She is so fun and knowledgably. I loved her interesting tips and recommendations on what to do with the rest of my time here. I give her my highest recommendation!!

Eye-opening!!. Let me qualify by saying I've been to HK several times and I am a cantonese speaking Singaporean... I deliberately chose a guided tour because I WANTED to see something different from what I THOUGHT I knew about HK...And I was thoroughly impressed! Joe took us via the subway to Central, and walked us through many back alleys and streets... this highlighted the contrasts between the tall developed skyscrapers, to the dank yet bustling back lanes... which were filled with great local eats, and so much local culture! And we topped off the evening with my first ever ride on the tram ;-)While initially intended as a 'food tour', he accomodated us and took us down trips on memory lane, as well as eye opening cutural insights and of course, to local eats!It is worth noting Joe is not exactly fluent in Cantonese, so you may sometimes lack the leverage, but yet I sensed his acute familiarity with the locals which made him no less effective as a guide.I strongly recommend Joe to both first timers and regulars to HK! Thanks Joe! :-)

Super cool!. Joe, thank you very much for the wounderfull trip! We learned a lot about Hongkong life, culture, history and arhitecture. We spent a lot of time on Kawloon streets, which are just amaizing and real. Markets, restorants, old buildinggs, people, habbits. Great!

Joe's favorite places. Honk Kong is a land on contrasts. Joe took us on an outstanding tour showing those contrasts by showing his "favorite" places. We saw the inside and backside of HK through Joe's eyes. It was a great view. We learned history, politics, culture and some quirky things (like the umbrella man). Joe's tour has spoiled us for other tours. This will be had to replicate and not likely topped. A great experience for any visitor to HK.

One of our best ever walking tours! More than just a food tour! Loved it!. Our food/walking tour with Joe was one of the best tours we have taken! Joe's enthusiasm was contagious! Joe structured our food tour like a day in the life of a typical Hong Kong resident. From the very beginning of our tour, Joe's expansive knowledge of history and culture was evident! We went to off-the-beaten path places. We tried different food and definitely learned more about the culture and neighborhoods than we ever would have on our own. The tour was fabulous! Joe was a fabulous guide and a very personable young man! I highly recommend. Take this tour!

Fantastic do not miss this tour. When I arrived in Hong Kong Island I was so disappointed it was not how I imagined it. It reminded me of Canary Wharf in London. However after meeting and speaking to Joe he instantly knew what I was looking for. He took us to places we would never have found on our own. We experienced the street culture, local history, local food and drinks. Joe is such a positive young man he was very knowledgeable and could answer any questions that we asked.This is a must do for anyone visiting Hong Kong, you will learn more is 4 hours than you would in a week on your own. It was an absolute pleasure to be in Joe`s company.

Walking with Ski of Big Foot. My husband and I have travelled all over the world and have always put good local guides at the top of our wish list in any new place we visit. I'm happy to say that we had an excellent half day exploring the streets of Hong Kong with Ski of Big Foot Tours. We are energetic 60-somethings and she is a lovely, smart, young woman who quickly established rapport with us and showed us exactly the things we were interested in. We were full of questions about history, culture, politics, etc and she easily fielded our questions. Booking with her was quick and efficient and and the cost was very reasonable. We would enthusiastically recommend Big Foot to anyone heading to HK for the first time.

Amazing insight into Hong Kong in 4 hours. What a tour! From the organisation to the execution, nothing could have been better. We had 4 intense hours of information, sight seeing, and insight into Hong Kong. This is a must for anyone who wants to experience more than the usual tourist. Our guide Joe was good company and gave us plenty of ideas of things to do for the rest of the week. This tour was worth the money and more.

Best Cultural Experience of our Lives. My boyfriend and I were lucky enough to have a private walking tour with Joe the third day into our Hong Kong trip. The tour was tailored to suit our interests (history, culture, food and markets), and the amount of work Joe did on his own volition to match our likes, shone through. If you don't do this tour whilst you are in Hong Kong you would seriously miss out! This isn't your stock-standard cassette tape tour you do whilst following a leader with an umbrella, it's an experience where you feel like you're a local, exploring your city with your best friend.The tour is perfectly timed so you feel like you have only done a leisurely stroll, despite walking for most of the day. Joe is also the King of Local Cuisine and I would recommend eating EVERYTHING he suggests! We were also luckily enough to bump into Joe and also Ski with their friends the night after, and we can safely say they are the most genuinely nice, chilled back and generous people-all of them.We are not able to rave about this tour more, but as one last testament to how great the tour is-it has made both of us seriously contemplate moving to Hong Kong…when was the last time you had a tour do that for you?

Big Foot Tour. Was traveling to Hong Kong in January and decided to take a food tour. I have done food tours all over Asia and have been to Hong Kong maybe 6 times. Traveled with a friend who had never been to Hong Kong. I actually contacted another food tour first but after 3 weeks they never responded. When I contacted Big Foot Tour Ski responded the next day. We settled on a date and time and that was it. Note the other tour contacted me after 5 weeks and I told them "they must be having a laugh". Ski asked a few questions prior to the tour about the group that was coming, how adventures we were, had we ever been to Hong Kong and so on. I was impressed by this as the other 10 or so tours I have been on in Asia have never asked these questions. Ski arrived at the lobby of the hotel early, we arrived with hangovers from the night before! It was easy to see after 5 min that Ski was going to be someone who was easy to get along with as she took our hangovers with a good sense of humour and was quickly suggesting a filling breakfast and some Hong Kong cures :) It must have been a tuff gig to do a tour with someone who had been to Hong Kong many times and another who had never been but Ski balanced it out to perfection. She showed my friend the 101 of Hong Kong and still managed to teach me a few things along the way. I don't give glowing reviews very often but would definitely recommend this tour. It's in my top 2 food tours I have done in Asia so far and I do them every where I go in Asia. Without embarrassing her Ski is actually a Uni graduate who gave away a successful carrer to follow a passion, hence the big foot tour. She spent 2 years traveling Hong Kong to create the tour and it will show. She speaks good English and is very easy to talk to. Make sure you ask her how she got the nickname Ski !!! When the tour was over Ski refused to take any tip. That was kind of in embarrassing in the middle of central lol. My next stop was Singapore and Ski went home and wrote a practical food, drinking and entertainment guide to Singapore in a email for me. Ski went above and beyond on the tour and I will definitely be back.

So much to see. Joe was my guide for a full day, 8 hours. I had just one day in Hong Kong but came away feeling as though i'd really experienced life there. We never stopped except to eat & drink but the pace was just right. We used the MTR, the tram, the escalator, the Star Ferry and our own feet! I was introduced to food, customs & a way of life so very different to what i'm used to. I have seen so much and learned such a lot. There's no way i could have seen all this on my own. I'm so glad i found Big Foot Tours... you will not regret booking with them either. They will tailor your tour to your interests and that for me was a huge incentive to book with them. There's no real set itinerary so whatever you're interested in seeing will be covered... the culture, food, temples, photographing stuff, shopping, history... you choose or let Ski & Joe choose for you, either way you'll come away feeling as if you've spent the day with a friend who's shown & taught you so much. I can't recommend them highly enough.

The must do thing in HK. We had Ski do our afternoon tour on the 23rd of January, and after reading many reviews before and after our trip, i find myself lost for words..What can I possibly say that has not been said already..Ski is a wonderfully, bubbly, charming, accommodating, caring young lady.Even if your only in Hong Kong for a day, make sure at the very least you do a big foot walking tour, you simply wont regret it.My only mistake of the tour was forgetting to get a photo of the 3 of us...Cest la vie.Thank you very much Ski!We had a wonderful afternoon.Paul & Delwyn

AWESOME. January 2013 , it's a must if you are in Hongkong there no better way to see this city, Ski was my tour guide she was so kind and had all the stories about this city . This was one of thé best moment of my trip. I highly recommend this to anyone . MERCI. SKI

Best way to see the real Hong Kong in the shortest amount of time.. Joe was fantastic. My profession is travel so I have been on a lot of tours and I would recommend this tour. This tour is the best way to see the real Hong Kong quickly. Joe not only made it a point to make sure my husband and I were seeing everything we wanted to see he also constantly made sure our 10 and 12 year old were enjoying their selves so they would have lasting memories as well. I can't say enough good things in regards to our experience. You won't regret going on this tour but you will miss out if you don't!

HK Walking Tour. Joe took my kids (10,8) and I on a walking tour of Hong Kong on our first night there. He did an amazing job; he made Hong Kong feel like a friendly, welcoming place and took us to so many great places to eat. I have never gone on a walking tour before, but it was one of the main highlights of a 3 week East Asia trip. I would recommend it to anyone.

Big Foot walking tour, Hong Kong. Back in December my wife and I spent a wonderful morning on a walking tour of Hong Kong with Big Foot Tours. This was a customised tour, just for us. Our guide, Jo, met us at our hotel and proceeded to show us a side of Hong Kong we would never have otherwise seen. Our guide was very knowledgeable in regard to Hong Kong, plus he was fun to hang out with.Jo took us by foot, train and giant escalators all over the place. We saw local markets, stopped for breakfast in a little place full of locals and then later took us to an amazing Dim Sum restaurant. Fantastic food.Jo was more than happy as we stopped to take photos and timed our tour to perfection, getting us back to our hotel on time (as we had to catch our flight home).We highly recommend this tour to see the real Hong Kong.

A Definite "Must Do" while in Hong Kong. Can’t say enough good things about this tour. My husband and I took our first trip to Hong Kong during Christmas 2012. Our tour guide, Joe, was terrific. He was punctual, friendly, and very at ease showing us his hometown. We were interested in learning about the history of Hong Kong and seeing everyday life in this big city and Joe was able to fulfill both of these requirements brilliantly. He was a wealth of knowledge and as we made our way through different parts of the city, Joe always had an interesting story to share. We learned so much about the city, its architecture, its people and culture. Lunch at a popular dim sum place frequented only by locals was the highlight of our tour. If you really want to see the “real” Hong Kong, I highly recommend Big Foot Tour. Thank you again, Joe, for such a great experience.

most favorite part of Hong Kong- do not miss!. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and wanted to get a taste of Hong Kong that was off the beaten path. We were not disappointed. I hesitated on securing a booking until a couple days prior and almost missed out. To preface this review, my husband and I are from Los Angeles, early 30's, active and like to see things off the beaten path. Major sites are nice but we can get to them ourselves. We don't enjoy museums, endless historical facts and tourist traps. Ski Y. was our tour guide. She arrived promptly at our hotel and off we went. First off, Ski Y. is originally from Singapore and moved to Hong Kong a couple years ago. In her exploration of Hong Kong and it's many different neighborhoods, she's accumulated a lot of knowledge and insight someone whose lived there their whole lives may not. She is young, energetic, very personable and walks fast just like me. She asked what we were interested in and quickly drew up an itinerary that could be changed to our liking. We started off in Central where she showed us different buildings and local sites. We never lingered too long and she always offered to take pictures of us. We visited the moving escalators, umbrella man and a local dim sum restaurant where we almost saw a fight! Pretty entertaining. We also saw street markets and off the beaten path sites. I won't name all of them but they were each interested in their own way. Conversation between all of us was very natural and enjoyable. We covered so much ground that we had a whole hour left so she was kind enough to show us Sham Sui Po. This is where you want to go shopping! Prices are lower and less tourists. Ski also made restaurant recommendations of which we used the day after. Thanks! My husband doesn't enjoy walking as much as I do but he didn't mind this day because he was having such a good time.I can't say anything negative about our experience. In fact, throughout our three week honeymoon in Asia (Shanghai, Vietnam, Phuket, and Bangkok) it became even more evident what a great guide she is. I hired someone in each city we went to and it was NOT the same, not even close. Don't hesistate to book this tour- you won't be disappointed.

Exploring Hong Kong like a local. We were stopping over in HK for 2 days from a skiing trip in Japan en route back to Australia. Joe took us on our tour and we had a fabulous time! Our 3 boys aged 14, 12 and 10 thoroughly enjoyed walking around, catching the train, tasting local delights (egg balls in particular- they are still talking about them) and visiting spots we would never have stumbled across on our own and so did we!I have been to HK before but my husband and boys had not and this walking tour gave us a really good feel for the city and a great chance to explore and learn about its people and daily life generally. We highly recommend this very personal and delightful experience. Thank you Joe. (and Ski)

Big foot tour review. Had a great time on a walking tour in January 2013 with Joe. He gave a us a peek into everyday life in Hong Kong, which is what we had hoped to do. A wonderful storyteller with tremendous local knowledge, he shared tales of people, buildings and history, making the city all the more fascinating for us. We are a family of four, and Joe made sure to show things of each one's interest. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone seeking to discover everyday life in Hong Kong.

Big Foot review. We had a great tour with Ski. She knew all the places to go and was so knowledgable. We saw the side of Hong Kong that we would have not seen on our own and have some great pictures to share with our friends and family. I would highly recommend Ski and she is well worth what she charges. She is also such a nice and friendly person and puts you at ease immediately. I will have to ask my husband to download some of the pictures for you.

Big foot tour delivers. Recently went on a tour with Joe. Fabulous way to start the trip in HK. As others have mentioned, it felt like we were being taken around by a family friend. Great mix of history, culture, architecture and food. Joe's intimate knowledge of HK along with an understanding of the Western way of life made him able to present the information in a really relevant and accessible way. In addition, we had 3 school aged kids with us and he was able to engage with all of them. We stopped off for snacks and lunch and were given a great introduction into the Hong Kong culture of food and eating. A real highlight and thoroughly recommended.

Fantastic Tour!. Quick and easy booking process, Fantastic guide! Probably the highlight of our trip to Hong Kong.Joe's foot tour gave us a real insight into Hong Kong and it's people. We discovered things and places we would never have found in a vehicle. Joe's local knowledge was great and he also gave us pointers for after the tour which we followed up over the next few days. Joe mixed culture, architecture, history and food (pork buns to die for!) Wouldn't hesitate to recommend him highly!On top of this Joe was a really likeable guy and involved the four of us ( 2 teenage children) in the tour, great work. Thanks Joe.

Excellent!. Making this 4 hour trip with Joe must have been the best decision I made for our Hong Kong trip. I had already been to Hong Kong several times but it was the first time for my husband. Since my last trip was already 5 years ago, I wanted to organize something special for my husband.Ski was extremely pleasant during the booking process and made it incredibly simple. I felt already in good hands from the very start and after first e-mail correspondence. She even sent a picture of Joe so that we would not miss him since we met in Central! how great is that!And Joe is an astonishing accumulation of knowledge and such a nice guy! he managed to give us all this interesting informations about Hong Kong packed into such wonderful stories that are so easy to remember now for us. and we never really felt like having booked a "guide". it felt more like a friend was walking Hong Kong with us. since we didn't have a clue what we actually wanted to see he lead the way and we walked Central and Sheung wan. a shame the 4hours were over so quickly. Joe gave us many more tips for the rest of our stay but we did not manage to do them. thank you so much Joe for making this trip such a wonderful and personal experience! and should we came back soon we will definetely look up you other tips with you!

Joe gets our highest recommendation. My friend and I just returned from holiday in Hong Kong where we booked a 4-hour tour with Joe. The booking process was very easy; Ski responded to all emails very promptly and payment was easy.Our tour with Joe ended up being one of the highlights of our trip. We learned so much about the neighborhood that our hotel was in that we would never have known just walking around on our own. It was the right mix of food, culture, history. Wish I would've booked a second day of tours to check out another neighborhood in the same way. Really can't say much more other than I was thoroughly pleased! Thanks again, Joe!

Joe is awesome. Tours can be a great way to see a place. This is especially true when Joe is the guide to central HK.From architecture to street foods to cultural beliefs. Joe made this tour hit all the senses. We had the tastes of Hong Kong food, smells of incense and street markets, the views from outdoor escalators, noises of restaurants and foot traffic, and the feel of what it is like to be in Hong Kong.I wish I could have hired him for our whole trip. I know better now.Thank you Joe

Fantastic!. My fiancé and I had a tour with Ski just after Christmas, being a bit daunted about how best to experience Hong Kong in our 36 hour stopover on the way back from Australia. It turned out to be the best thing we did on the whole holiday! Ski contacted us after booking to find out our interests, and didn't bat an eyelid at a last-minute request to sample some of Hong Kong's more unusual dishes. Ski met us at our hotel and took us to lots of interesting places - tucked away cafés, temples, HQs of global banks and many more - and told us fascinating facts and stories as we went along. I really couldn't recommend the experience enough as a way to experience Hong Kong. We went to lots of places that we would never have found on our own, and learnt a lot along the way. Ski really knows her stuff and will make sure you have a great time, by tailoring the tour to what you're most interested in seeing. If we ever go back (which I hope we will), we'll be signing up again!

Look no further...best way to see Hong Kong!. First time staying on Hong Kong Island side, we weren't sure what was on offer. Ski came to the rescue and ensured our last day would be one to remember! She catered to our interests and was extremely helpful, friendly, caring and knowledgeable. You'll make great memories with Big Foot Tour, take my word for it!

The best 4 hours ever!!. I am a mom travelling with a teenager... I had never been to Hong Kong and was nervous about getting around on my own. I had read reviews of the Big foot Walking Tours and thought it sounded more like what i wanted for a first time visitor. I felt reassured by the Pay Pal invoicing. i elected to book 4 hours with Ski and Joe... it was amazing. Ski responded promptly to emails. invoiced promptly and sent the receipt immediately. I was in the hotel lobby at 3:30 and up came a young man. Hi Elizabeth... I'm Joe... and off we went for an amazing four hour tour . we were on and off subways, in and out of markets, and seeing Kowloon from a local perspective. Our daughter loved it and she says it was the best part of our whole trip. Wear good walking shoes, carry a water bottle, have cash for the subways and food... I just gave the cash to Joe and he did all the ticket purchasing. It was fabulous. i can't give enough praise to Joe for the tour that he gave us. He is chock a block full of history and stories about life in Hong Kong. I wholeheartedly agree with our daughter... the tour with Joe was the highlight of our trip and I will be booking with Joe and Ski again. so if you are reading my comments... my advice... book early... book now! you won't have any regrets! Elizabeth. Yukon Territory

Very very good. We took a Hong Kong walking tour with Ski amd we loved it. She gave us lots of information about Hong Kong, how they lived, their habits and took us to places we think we would not go by ourselves. Besides, she is really so cute and sweet and interesting. Thank you Ski for such pleasant tour!

Fantastic way to see Hong Kong!. Our first time in Hong Kong was made all the more fantastic as we hadSki to show us around some of the "local" sights! Ski was great companyand really went out of her way to do a tour of what suited our family.Ski suggested we do the tour on our first day which really made the restof our time so much easier! We even made it back to some of the wonderfulplaces she took us! Whether you've been to Hong Kong before or not, ourfamily (including 2 teenage girls) recommend you do a tour with Ski!

Upbeat!. A walk with Ski is akin to a dance in the city. Upbeat, with that adrenaline rush at the end. We took to enjoying the pulse and culture of hong kong and appreciate the various forms of city lines with this young lady and definitely loved it. i'm in the creative and artistic industry and this tour gave me so much inspiration for my work. Thank you Ski for your patience when i have to stop frequently to take the numerous pictures and videos (had to buy a new 2GB memory stick at the place you recommended us!)Will definitely be back =)

No better way to see Hong Kong. Fact.. From start to finish our experience with Ski and Joe was absolutely first class. Ski was really helpful in arranging a relatively last minute tour and advising us on what would be the best thing to do out of the impressive options available, taking into account food allergies, interests and the amount of time we had in HK. Instructions on where to meet Joe were really clear, and she also helped me sort out a couple of other things to do while we were there which certainly made life easier.Joe took our tour and was fantastic. I lived in HK before, whereas it was my girlfriends first time in the city. Joe took into account my (limited) knowledge as well as what Fi was interested in, and took us on a 4 hour tour that covered everything we wanted and more. His passion and knowledge of the city, its different areas and vast history was really impressive and made for a really interesting tour that we enjoyed from start to finish. To cover and exchange thoughts and opinions on architecture, history, religion, politics, food made for a really interesting and enjoyable 4 hours that flew by.I really cannot recommend Big Foot tours highly enough. Book it up now, and get ready to see and learn about the magic behind an amazing city,

Highly recommended !!!. My husband and I decided to book the tour with Big Foot Tour (BFT) after having gone through the great reviews here in Trip Advisor and their website which was precisely to the point. The whole booking procedure was very easy and quick. Joe, our tour guide was amazing. With his apt knowledge about the culture, food, and architectural stories he made this whole trip worthwhile and a great experience for my husband and I. We would surely recommend BFT to everyone visiting Hong Kong, if you want to save time yet cover most of the places in Hong Kong then book Big Foot Tours NOW...

Great time exploring Hong Kong!. My wife and I booked a tour with Ski after reading the amazing reviews she got on TripAdvisor. It is clear why she is #1 - she was absolutely delightful. It was clear as we got into our tour Ski was able to adapt the tour to suit our needs. Once she learned my wife and I were foodies she gave some GREAT food recommendations, including a "speakeasy" type Szechuan restaurant that knocked our socks off. The next day we were out shopping and ran into her in a store, and I honestly felt like I was bumping into a friend on the street. Thank you for everything, we had a great time exploring Hong Kong with you!

Top-tier. Can't beat this!. Our very first thought after meeting Ski,"She looks so young,does she really know what she is doing?"By the time our tour ended with her,"This is no joke,wait,does this tour have to end?".We can't put our fingers on the magic that she pulls in her tours.Before we knew it,we have gathered so much information and stories on Hong Kong yet it never once felt like dry academics.This is definitely the way to see a country and we highly recommend Big Foot Tour!

Great guys for a great diverse tour. My gf and I spent half a day with Joe back in December ... Great guy, he tailored for us a tour discovering the non touristic but true Hong Kong, a mix of culture, food and must see of the city....He has been also a big pleasure to talk with him and exchange opinions on how Hong Kong differs from other cities in the world, making the all cultural experience even more remarkable....I travel a lot throughout the world, and usually don't like guided tours and never actually take them... In this case I was very curious from all the good reviews these 2 guys got from tripadvisor and decided to give them a try...Absolutely the best choice done for visiting Hong Kong ...Highly recommend...

Excellent!. We booked a tour with Ski after reading so many fabulous reviews on here. I can't really add much to the previous reviews other than my wholehearted agreement with all the five star ratings. Booking was very straightforward and emails were always answered very promptly. We were really looking forward to our tour but unfortunately my husband, who suffers with a back problem, was in quite a lot of pain that day. Ski was incredibly patient with our slow pace. She was great company and very informative and knowledgeable. We learned so much - far, far more than if we had wandered around on our own, which is what we would normally do. When we return to Hong Kong (not "if") we will definitely book another tour.

Walked it, felt it and absolutely loved it. Just spent the most fabulous 4 hours with Joe, seeing a side of Hong Kong that was hidden to us. Ghost money, temple rituals, fantastic food, Feng shui, fortune telling .. This tour had all this and more. We are not generally tour people but after reading the trip advisor reviews this tour seemed a good idea. It was so great. If you want to get past the tourist sights and shopping and see real Hong Kong at a pace that suits you and be guided by a very articulate and knowledgeable young man, then this is for you. Great value, amazing food and an experience that will stay with us forever..what more could a tourist want. Highly recommended. Thanks Joe, will sing your praises to all and sundry

Hon Kong visit. Ski Yeo was referred to us from a friend and she did an excellent job showing us Hong Kong. Not only was she friendly & sweet, she spoke excellent English and was extremely knowledgeable. I would gladly recommend her highly to anyone needing a guide for the city - and I would certainly use her again.

Insightful, fascinating and simply outstanding!. I had an 8 hour walk with Joe around Kowloon and Hong Kong island. He was fantastic. His knowledge of both area's sights, traditions and cultures was outstanding. It was fantastic to have someone to take you off the beaten track and to encourage you to be as daring as want with trips for noodles, tea, dim sum and milk tea. I would highly recommend to anyone to take a tour with Joe around Hong Kong and would encourage you to leave it up to home where you go. The touristy things are so easy to do in your own but with Joe's help you'll see so much more of the other side of Hong Kong.

Great Food Tour in Hong Kong!!. This past Christmas, my hubby and I along with his mother and her beau decided to spend Christmas in HK, Macao and Shanghai. What a trip. We had a great time and it was awesome to be there as a tourist. I've been to Hong Kong for business, but never had the time to really explore the food culture like this.Let me preface by saying we are well traveled and almost never do a "tour" as we like to explore the hidden gems of the local culture. BUT, my hubby hooked us up with Big Foot Tour while we were in Hong Kong and it was the best 4 hours I've ever spent there. First of all, Joe (our private walking guide) was amazing! He met us at our hotel and off we went. He's attentive, considerate, and passionate about his culture. (My mother in law was under the weather and he seeked out some good healthy tea for her.) Tip: don't fill up on food before you do this tour! You'll be sorry . . . He will ask you how adventurous you are at the start. My hubby is the foodie in the group and will try anything so Joe accommodated him as well as taking pleasing the rest of us with dishes like dim sum, BBQ pork, congee, fish balls, milk teas and more. All were so delicious! My hubby really enjoyed the snake soup (tastes like mushroom soup) and the whole experience - it was so interesting and something I never would've done with hubby alone. En route to our food stops, Joe took us to a temple, giving us a brief history lesson; plus, he taught us about ghost money, pawn shops, chinese caskets and really anything you are curious about - which was great. (He suggested we get the Octopus card too and that was very convenient!) Anyway - it was a great day and Joe was amazing. My motherinlaw and her beau really enjoyed it and said it was the "highlight of the entire trip". Which is a real compliment! :) Next time we are in HK, we'll definitely do this again . . .

Experience the real everyday Hong Kong with Big Foot Tours!. Let me start by saying I'm not usually a fan of tours, normally we prefer to explore places at our own pace. However we were very short on time in Hong Kong and after reading the very positive reviews here on trip advisor we decided to book last minute with Big Foot Tours. Best decision ever! I organised & booked it all via email with Ski, who was wonderful and managed to fit us in on our last day with Joe as our guide. Due to our limited time she give us great advice as to which tour to do. We choose to do the 4 hour Hong Kong island tour. Ski said Joe could meet us at our hotel or at Central MTR. We would recommend meeting at Central as it gives more time to touring and with Ski's directions is easy to get too. Joe was waiting for us when we got there & from the get go you realise why Big Foot Tours receives such great reviews! Joe was simply wonderful!  Friendly, funny, informative & engaging. His enthusiasm & passion for his city was infectious & the 4 hours simply flew by. He asked us what we were interested in & tailored our time around our interests. I can say with certainty that we would not have found or even tried to explore some of the places Joe showed us. It was simply amazing to see & experience the everyday Hong Kong. Joe's explications & knowledge made it come to life in a way we could not have done on our own.  From the street markets in the lanes to the temples and wet markets, Cat street & Mid Level escalators & the residential areas.... It was a great overall experience. A huge thank you to Joe for enhancing our Hong Kong trip in so many ways, great local food & more importantly  showing me those dress shops in Soho!!! Two came home with me :-)!  I would highly recommend doing this walking tour great value for money & for us definitely the best spent 4 hours. Next time Kowloon & the New Territories!

Can't recommend Joe enough!. Wow! Our 4-hour private walking tour with Joe exceeded our every expectation. It was as if Joe had a sixth sense about what we wanted to see and learn, even though we ourselves didn't really know what we wanted. Joe is deeply knowledgeable about all aspects of Hong Kong and his authentic interest in the city shows through in his guiding. The sites Joe showed us were incredible, and many of them we would never have known to visit on our own. However, what really differentiated the tour was the beyond-the-guidebook cultural and historical insights Joe shared with us that were absolutely fascinating. By touring with Joe, we gained a much richer and fuller insight into Hong Kong as he made the hidden aspects of the city much more accessible to us. We learned a tremendous amount in a short time, thanks to Joe's engaging dialogue. Further, Joe is welcoming, personable, considerate, professional and organized! Who could ask for more? Some of the best money we've ever spent!
Hong Kong tour with Joe. Just spent 2 fantastic days touring with Joe. Very relaxed and informative style. Got to see the real Hong Kong and ate at some amazing local places. Highly recommend Joe.

Big Foot - Excellent Private Walking Tour. We can thoroughly endorse the favourable comments that everyone has made about Big Foot Tours. We spent a morning with Ski in late November and were extremely impressed with her depth of knowledge on all aspects to do with Hong Kong. She is very pleasant company, casual and fun, yet very professional and respectful. This was our second trip to Hong Kong - last time we explored on our own with the aid of a guidebook. We learned much more this time however and obtained a real insight into the local way of life, with Ski's help. We thoroughly enjoyed ascending the whole 800 metres of the escalator system peering down on the constantly changing street scenes below, and also the visit to the temple and Chinatown. Well done Ski, excellent tour.

Awesome Hong Kong Tour. Touring Hong Kong with Joe from BigFoot was really great. We had only one day in Hong Kong but he gave us a great flavor of the city and tailored the tour based on our preferences. I don't think we would have found any of the places he showed us on our own, and certainly not with his interesting commentary.

Ski Yeo (Big FootTours) is the only Guide you should contact.. We had a couple of days in Hong Kong, on our way to Vietnam, so it was really important to have the right tour guide. Regretfully we waited too long to book this adorable, smart young lady, and only had her expertise for 4 hours. However, our time with her was informative, fun and delicious. Don't hesitate to book well in advance, you will not be disappointed. She speaks perfect English, is energetic and very accommodating, hence a backpack full of band-aids.( Thanks again Ski)

Big Foot Tour. We spent an amazing and informative 4 hours with Ski and it was honestly the best thing we did in Hong Kong. By exploring the city with a guide as personable and knowledgeable as Ski, we learned so much about the people, their culture and their history. Ski answered our countless questions, provided a commentary and gave us great advice. In fact, we were quite lost without her the following day when we were left to ourselves!!!I highly recommend Big Foot Tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong who want to make the most of their holiday and to learn and see things that would otherwise go by unnoticed. It was a perfect introduction to the city with an engaging guide.

great way to see Hong Kong. Walking around Hong Kong with Joe from BigFoot was one of the best days of our trip. We were more interested in exploring the city's neighborhoods than in visiting "must-see" tourist sites. We felt safe wandering on our own but often confused or clueless. Having Joe with us made all the difference. He organized our path to show us a cross-section of areas, with interesting stops all along the way. For example, we visited a bakery, a little tea shop and an indoor market we would've otherwise walked right past. He didn't just take us to eat dim sum, he helped us participate. Joe shared with us a good mix of historical city information and his own life experience of Hong Kong; he was ready to tailor the tour and our conversation to include whatever interested us. Joe is great company and we had a great day together.

Awesome tours. Toured with Joe, a terrific young man, excited and passionate about his city.Experienced an overview of HK we otherwise would've missed.Pace was moderate (even for my pregnant wife), commentary first rate and recommendations honest and well researched.We loved our tour so much we booked another 2 days later!Thank you Joe for introducing us to such a diverse and vibrant city.Highly recommended!!!

Another Great Trip with Ski. We had spent a day with Shi last year and it just first class. This year we wanted to focus on a more specialized partof the city, the food industry. Ski took us to a local eateery for diner and exposed us to lots of Chinese/Hong Kong dishes. Thery were all great, service likewise. The next afternoon we vivsited local vendors for some higly localized dishes. Food items are for the adventeruos eater. I'm not one. Buy Skis comapny, kowlege of the area and keeping us on schedule were first class. We did conclude the afternoon at a very nice bar that made all things better.While we will not likely return to Hong Kong for year #3 we may be able to convince her to vacation with her family in Singapore. We sure hope so.John Dunigan

Outstanding. So worth it.. All these 'excellent' reviews are correct. Very informative, great mixture of local culture, sites, food, architecture and light exercise. Ski is super professional and made my one extra day in hong kong on business a delight. 10am pickup and back the hotel by 215pm. Thanks Ski!

Five plus stars for Ski of Big Foot Tours. Skit is special I felt like I was walking with my daughter. She is gracious, caring, knowledgable and speaks fluent English. Ski was especially helpful in communicating my questions and needs while shopping for gifts and satisfying my curiosity about foods and unusual items we saw in markets. We saw and experinced so much more than we would have even dared without her, we are already talking about a return trip to Hong Kong and doing another tour with Ski.

Fun and Informative - Nov 2012. It is not the Number 1 activity by accident!From the first email, Ski was helpful and professional. My wife and I said what we wanted to see, Ski suggested a few things and a plan was formed.Upon meeting Ski, we found an intelligent, funny, well informed young lady who brought an enthusiasm for Hong Kong that was infectious. She seemed to know everything about the local history, architecture, bars, restaurants, food markets, bakeries, cafes, antique dealers and and other local characters which made up a very thorough 4 hour tour, while wishing we could keep going. That being said, we were pretty happy we finished in Lan Kwai Fong!! Our legs were a bit sore and the bars were very inviting!We will do another tour on our next trip, for there is so much more to see.I thoroughly recommend Ski to show you all of it.

Great service. I booked an eight hour tour with Big Foot Tours, Joe was my guide on that day, an excellent guide. He showed me around Hong Kong, we tried local food, visited temples, I learned a lot about the culture, etc. Joe is very knowledgeable, has travelled a lot and has lots of enthusiasm. It was truly an unforgettable experience. I highly recommend Big Foot Tours.

Excellent service and tours!. Ski did a great job of setting up our tours, one on very short notice. We did two tours with Joe, one was a tour of Hong Kong, and one of the New Territories. Joe was a SUPERB! He's extremely intelligent, well traveled and insightful young man. He had sooo much enthusiasm and insight to share with us. We both really loved the time we spent with Joe. He showed us so much and took us to places we would have never found or knew about. I can't say enough good things about Big Foot Tours!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

Don't miss!. My husband and I booked a four hour walking tour with Ski in October 2012 and it was well worth it. Ski picked us up at our hotel and we had a very interesting and fun time. She gave us great insights into HKG and its culture. Along our way we tried typical Hong Kong food, visited temples and walked around small streets we probably wouldn't even have seen if we were on our own. Ski knows lots of interesting stuff you don't find in any travel guide. She also gave us recommendations for things to do, restaurants and bars which we visited during the other days.I can absolutely recommend the walking tour with Big Foot Tour.

Excellent Experience. Big Foot Tours with Joe and Ski provided an excellent tour experience. From our first contacts via e-mail through our post-tour communication, it was obvious that Joe and Ski are very passionate about sharing Hong Kong and ensuring that they provide travelers with a unique and unforgettable experience. Based on e-mails prior to our originally scheduled tour, Ski was concerned there might be overlap with sites we had already seen. She recommended a tour of the New Territories instead, and we were very pleased that we followed her recommendation. We visited sites that were definitely off the beaten path but very much worth seeing. Joe was a great tour guide and definitely went the extra mile in providing detailed maps and further recommendations for our remaining stay. We sincerely appreciated his knowledge, enthusiasm and very positive energy and thoroughly enjoyed our tour. Many thanks to both Joe and Ski for their time, consideration and wonderful assistance in helping us with a very authentic experience!

Hong Kong Walking Tour. as with quite a few others, looked at TA for some recommended trips during our three day stay in Hong Kong. Booked via the website from the UK. Great Comms from Ski. We had to change the day as I miscalculated which day we would arrive. Again no problem with the late change. We arrived at the meeting time, but aftr 20 minutes, Jo, our guide had not turned up. We contacted Ski, who, not knowing why Jo was not there, volunteered to come and meet us as a replacement. When Ski arrived, she explained Jo had been involved in a Road Traffic Accident and was en route to the hospital. Ski stepped in as guide, and we had a fantastic 4 hour tour of the "hidden Hong kong". I wont go into detail of some of the places we visited, as the surprises offered by Ski added to our trip. We would never have seen, eaten or experienced things which we did with Ski's expert knowledge. After the trip, Ski showed us how to use the MTR and advised us of where to go for some other experiences. When we arrived back at our hotel some hours later, there was a note in our hotel room from Jo appologising for not turning up and in his opinion letting us down. Not only that, but he had sent us some Hing Kong cake as a further apology. I would recommend this tour to anyone who is visiting Hong Kong. Ski are Jo work extremely hard.Hopefully Jo is back at work nowThanks AgainDarren, Linda, Ian and Hilary (Yorkshire, UK)

The best way to see hidden Hong Kong. Read the reviews of Big Foot on TA, booked a tour for our first day there before departing UK on the start of a far east holiday, and can only agree with everything written. Ski did a marvellous job showing my wife and I around Hong Kong Island, as well as giving us a brilliant insight into everyday life. She also gave us some ideas for further exploration. At the end of the tour we felt we had seen things that a normal 'sightseeing' tour would have missed, and even though we had covered a goodly distance did not once feel tired (and even got over jet lag as well!).

Great intro to Hong Kong.. Saw Big Foot on TP and decided to go with them. Well worth it, Jo was an excellent guide for the four of us-who were from 30 to 60.Not just the walk but the insight into living and working in the City from someone who had lived in the Uk for a while. Also good tips for where to buy things.It was finished off with a great dim sung where we were the only foreigners, so altogether a positive experience.

Fantastic walking tour of Hong Kong. We spent 5 days in Hong Kong and really wanted to make the most of our time there by experiencing as much as possible. We booked a private walking tour with Big Foot Tours before we left the UK to help us achieve this.What can I say... this was one of the best parts of our trip. Our guide Joe was one of the most pleasant and knowledgeable young men you could wish to meet, and went out of his way to make sure we saw the 'real' Hong Kong that we had requested.When passing a fruit stall we asked what a particular fruit was, and low and behold when we returned to our hotel later in the day there was one of these fruit waiting with a lovely note from Joe - a lovely personal touch which sums up the whole tour.Thanks Joe and Big Foot Tours.

Business trip to HK. I spent the weekend in HK on a business trip. I had never been to HK and thought that a walking tour with a local would be a great way to get a feel for the city. Even though it was raining I had the most amazing time and got so many fantastic insights into local life. I cannot say enough about my guide Joe. He was so friendly, enthusiastic, knowledgeable and able to adapt to what I enjoyed. I have never tried these sort of tours before but will be trying them in every city in the future and will definitely be coming back to Hong Kong!

Excellent walking tour!. My wife and I booked a 4-hour walking tour on the first day of our week-long trip to HK. Great experience! Ski was a wonderful tour guide and showed us some of the local culinary options and other sights to help acclimate us to HK. Highly recommended if you're looking for a friendly, local guide who will customize a walking tour.

A great tour by Ski Yeo of Big Foot Tour. We really enjoyed our walking tour of old Hong Kong by Miss Ski Yeo of Big Foot late last month October. She was right on time to greet us at our hotel, and did a great job of showing us around the parts of Hong Kong we asked to see. Our group was rather large with eight people, but she was very effective in communicating loud enough in very good English that we all learned many new things. Would definately definately recommend this tour on your first or second day in Hong Kong. I have taken other tours, and this one was much more personalized and custom....all 8 people really enjoyed !Mike Fulton

Exellent tour recomend as as a must do. Even though it was raining it never dampened ski's enthusiasm We seen parts of hong kong we would never of seen on our own nothing was touch trouble to ski. As we were going on to Singapore ski emailed us with places to visit there which also heped us once again thanks skiVaughan

The best thing to do to get to know Hong Kong. My husband and I recently took a 4 day trip to Hong Kong and the 1st thing we did was book the 4 hour private walking tour with Ski. I only booked it based on the feedback of previous reviews and we were both so pleased that we did it. Ski knows her stuff and is a very pleasant, charming and accommodating host. She took us around to lots of places that we would never have gone to, let alone found, and also recommend places to get our glasses made and hand made shoes. Great way to spend a relaxing 4 hours getting to know Hong Kong.

Fantastic - don't hesitate to book, Ski is wonderful. I had Ski for a 4 hour walking tour of Hong Kong in October of this year and it was a fantastic experience. Ski is incredibly knowledgeable about both the landmarks and the underlying cultural landscape of Hong Kong. Ski speaks English perfectly and tailors the tour to your interests. She was incredibly helpful in planning the rest of my time in Hong Kong, knew all of the tricks of the trade in terms of efficient ways of getting into tourist attractions and was very hospitable. A+! Thanks Ski!

Perfect way to get to know Hong Kong. My husband and I decided last minute to take a guided tour of Hong Kong. We were so glad that Ski was free on our desired day! We were only in Hong Kong for two days but thanks to Ski we had a packed afternoon of eating and exploring the downtown neighborhoods. I had never been on a private tour so I wasn't sure what to expect but Ski was very friendly and welcoming and full of great facts. I will never forget about the "Koala Building" or the story of the umbrella man. Ski did an excellent job of catering the tour to our interests and afterwords she recommended some additional sights that we enjoyed and provided us with an excellent map to help us find our way. :-)

The only way to go.... We took advantage of a beautiful day in Hong Kong to go off on a wonderful adventure with Joe as our guide. He and the tour could not have been more fun. What a way to learn about HK. You read these reviews with a skeptical lens but my wife and I could not have had a better experience. We learned and laughed and ate our way through many of Hong Kong's neighborhoods. We have since been back to many of these areas by ourselves. Makes us feel like we know what we are doing! Ha!Thanks Joe and Bigfoot.

Brilliant tour. Arranged our tour with Ski a week or two before we visited. Excellent friendly and prompt communication, including some great recommendations for restaurants for my wife's birthday. On the day we wanted to tour Ski was already booked so we toured with her colleague Joe. Any reservations we might have had about this were immediately dispelled. Joe is a bright, friendly and engaging young man who grew up in Hong Kong but has also spent some time studying in the UK.We had a fantastic 4 hours with Joe covering many of the areas around Central that we may not have visited on our own. We learnt about everyday life and the traditions and beliefs of the local people and exchanged views on all sorts of things including how Hong Kong has changed over the last 20 years. We visited markets, a temple, the escalators and a great Dim Sun restaurant. The biggest compliment we can pay Joe is that our tour felt just like walking around with one of your best friends. We really enjoyed his company and he was ever attentive to make sure we were covering what we wanted. At the end he made sure that we were on the right bus for our plans for the rest of the day (the Peak). Thank you Joe and Ski - we'd highly recommend Big Foot to anyone wanting to find out about the "real" Hong Kong.

See the real Hong Kong. Jo took us on a fantastic tour of HK island, talking through the history and changing political background that shaped the buildings around us. He also showed us a multi-layered society, the old co-existing with the new, and how geographical limitations have shaped the way this society operates. Fab tour. Would recommend this company for anyone who wants to deal with a small professional company who are able to shape your tour to your interests.

Great Way to Spend a Day. The walking tour of Hong Kong was excellent! Ski is a terrific person and is extremely well educated on the culture and history of Hong Kong. It was a real pleasure to spend four hours walking through Central Hong Kong with her. Excellent tour! No surprise she is so highly rated.

Great Walking Tour With Ski. We had a great and very informative 'Walking Tour' with Ski in Sept. 2012. Ski was punctual, knowledgable and very accomodating. We did the four hour tour in the Central part of Hong Kong and she took us to a great noodle restaurant by the 'Longest Escalator'. We especially appreciated her advise to utilize the airport express train transportation. I would highly recommend Ski for any tour.

Walking Tour - An Insight into Hong Kong Everyday Life. We toured with Ski on October 18th around the streets of the Central District and found her tour tour to be very informative and enlightening about day to day life in HK. It is a "travel must" if you want to understand the City! Ski provides us with a walk that provided a contrast of the City including business areas, government, markets, residential, religious and cultural sites. My suggestion is that she ask if the pace is okay. I found the tour pace to be a little slow and it would have been great if she had a relationship with one of the markets that allowed for a more in depth look at the foods etc. rather than just walking by. Ski also gave us detailed directions to our next site and she also sent a link containing Chinese music for that we were looking for.

Great Walking Tour. If you want to learn information about the culture and history of Hong Kong that may not even be in guide books, we would highly recommend Ski Yeo's Big Foot Walking Tour. My husband and I engaged Ski for a 4 hour walk around the Central area of Hong Kong. Although we did a lot of walking, we didn't feel tired because of the all the interesting information that Skiwas constantly sharing with us about the surroundings. Ski is knowledgeable and very nice, too.

Walking is the way to go. Thanks Ski for your great service and a fab day out. I orgainized Ski by website fast and efficient for the 12th of October 2012. My partner and l are fit and love walking to get your bearings in a new country. Ski showed us what we wanted to see which were the older parts of Hong Kong. Ski knows Hong Kong well and you can see she loves what she does. You must all try the 1/2 coffee tea fantastic. We walked, road the mtr and as said had a great day. Thanks Ski

Now this is Hong Kong!. Recent 4 hour tour of HK Central with Ski was simply the best!! She is a joy to be with; extremely knowledgable of HK, friendly, and shows you the regular side of HK life. The walking tour of Central showed the local life with all of its culture and history. The Dim Sum meal was delicious, and exactly like Dim Sum is for the locals. Touring with Ski is almost like hanging out with a sister. Can't say enough of how she weaves the real life of HK into your tour specifically tailored to your desires. If you're going to be in HK, find a way to schedule at least a 4 hr. tour with her, you won't regret it. Personal service down to finding you in HK to start the tour is a plus for tourists. And don't forget to ride the Star Ferry with her. Best part of our 15 day tour of China has to be our 4 hr tour with Ski. Outstanding!!

Food Tour with Ski You - It was Awesome!!!!. We recently had a 25 day tour of Asia and our tour with Ski was one of our favourite parts of the trip. She was extremely informative and provided us with our customized food tour as well as insights into the culture and history of Hong Kong Island. Ski spoke perfect english and provided us with an incredible 4 hour tour. Ski provided us with great pre-tour service - she advised us our original hotel was not very close to the downtown area and we ended up switching our hotel to on closer to downtown and the subway/ferry lines. Ski also provided us with suggestions of things we should do for the balance of our time in Hong Kong (which we did), as well as the best way to get around (subway, bus,ferry, etc). We highly recommend this tour with Ski. We got some great insights into the culture and history of Hong Kong that you could never get on a large tour. Ski was a wonderful person and the food was fabulous. Thanks for a great time.

One of a kind experience!. Ski was an amazing guide and provided priceless information about Hong Kong throughout our 4 hour walking tour. She tailors each tour to suit specific needs in order to maximize your personal experience. We opted for a custom tour focused on food and the local areas of Central, SOHO, and Western. Having this tour at the outset of our trip proved invaluable as we used the information Ski offered to navigate the city more efficiently. Ski has great insight into HK history as well as current trends. She knows about 'go-to' clubs, restaurants, and shops. She took us to local stands and vendors to sample great food and shop out of the way kiosks and streets. We scored some great spices, teas, and many of those pesky souvenirs! Ski is incredibly friendly, well-spoken and easy-going. I would not hesitate to see er again upon a return visit. Book in advance and possibly book twice!
