Great tour! Well worth it!. I recently went to Hong Kong on a mother/daughter trip with my 12yo. Apart from shopping I wanted to show my daughter some more traditional sights safely and confidently. Ski was great! She adapts the tour to your needs and does not mind changing agenda during the tour to suit what you like. Ski took us to some great sites we would never have find. Wonderful back streets, querky shops and areas of Hong Kong generally not shown on large commercial tours. Our tour went from 330pm to 730pm. This was a great time. Ski even stopped at a great noodle cafe that locals go to so we could try the best dim sims in town. Not to mention the famous custard tarts! We still managed to do more shopping with Ski and finished with a boat ride on the Starr ferry which was great at night. Highly recommend Ski's personal tour. She is a lovely young lady who's family should be very proud of her! Thanks Ski. xx

Personal tour. Petit. Courteous. Helpful. Considerate. Informative and caring. That is Ski. Our wonderful tour guide was all of these. She took us on 4 hour private tour, designed for our interest. We got a little off the beaten track. The escalator to mid levels, dry seafood market, Staunton Rd and others. It opened our eyes to more of Hong Kong and enabled us to appreciate more of this vibrant city when journeying out on our own. I thoroughly recommend Big Foot Tours and Ski if you want to get more from your HK experience.

an amazing insight into Hong Kong life...Highly recommended!. Ski was a total pleasure to deal with, right from the start. Gathering information about the tour and booking was so simple and easy, with great communication. She was really keen to know what we wanted and what we hoped to get out of our trip so she could tailor things according to our needs. The walking tour was fantastic, with amazing insights into HK life that we would never have known on our own..... and great custard tarts! will be recommending this tour to our friends and family!

Very enjoyable tour. Hong Kong is a dense, complex city with many layers of history and development. It's also a great, safe tourist destination. Ski's tours open up a window into the city which would be hard for a casual visitor to have any other way without living there for a while. She's also incredibly nice. We spent 4 hours with her and the time flew by. As others have noted, she personalizes the visit based on your interests and most of all, you can feel her enthusiasm for the city - she really appears to enjoy what she's doing. As others noted, we went to places and ate tasty things we wouldn't otherwise have done without her help. Highly recommended if you want a guide, book early.

Right on taget!. ski perfectly planned our morning based on my requests, interests, etc. She was incredibly easy to talk to and wealth of information. If I could take her with me to every city I go to, I would.

2 thumbs up!!. our experience with big foot tour was really pleasant right from the booking phase (very prompt response) to the tour itself.Our tour guide was affable and helped us to make sense of the sights and sounds around us, explaining to us why things are the way as we see it, even the building designs were linked to geomancy (apparently, the hong kong people are very superstitious people).4 hours flew by in the blink of an eye and although we were reluctant to let go of our guide whom was ever so watching out for us and making us feel comfortable every part of the way, we had to say goodbye but walking away with more confidence trying to navigate around the bustling hong kong citysee you again soon, big foot tour!

Wow!. Perfect start to our first big tour in Asia. We were given a lot of information about the city, from history to social issues, to everything else we can think of. Great sense of humour. It was a very comfortable tour where we come to realise that there is NO guide showing us around, but...a FRIEND. Thank you, Ski & Big Foot Tour.

Straightforward & Honest!. We like how straightforward everything is with Big Foot Tour for both booking/payment process and tour itself. She orientates us very well, enough to let us feel safe to explore and go on our own. 4 hours is perfect. Very honest tour. Background: during booking, we shared with her a long list of "to-see" things that we thought would be better to cover with her. We like how she was honest and told us upfront what should be seen on our own (as they are easy to get to or understand), so that we don't waste money unnecessarily on her guiding service. She could have easily upsell us to a longer tour duration just to cover everything, as it was clear that we were willing to pay for more tours. But she did not. Her advice was also spot on. After the orientation, we had no problem going around elsewhere in Hong Kong. Recommend this totally.We like her a lot.Trust her,go for it!

What a great afternoon/ evening. Recently on our trip to Hong Kong, based on previously read reviews on tripadvisor, we were fortunate to have oganized a walking tour with Ski- Big Foot Tour. What a great decision that turned out to be! The process of organizing our tour with Sk leading up to our tour was easy. She was interested to know f there was anything in particular we would like the tour geared towards seeing and bearing in mind my request to not walk up many big hills but prefer to go down she tailored the 4 hrs around our interests and requests. it was such a pleasure to meet Ski, she clearly has such a passion for what she does. So informative and enthusiastic. Ski showed us around many little laneways, little food venues( with some eating and drinking time- (My husband trying the custard tarts, and me trying an unusual cold coffee/tea mix concoction- it actually was't too bad ) we saw things that we would never have found or known existed. Ski walked at a pace to suit us and was happy to pick up the pace or rest whenever required. She is so easy to spend 4hrs with and found the tme had flown even though Ski felt we had probably covered 20kms during that time (although our feet knew it !!!!) A couple of suggestions.. don't leave it to make a booking until the last minute as we found Ski was very booked up even 3 wks prior to our trip. We did a 3.30- 7.30pm time walk and thought that was a great time as missed a lot of the heat and also got to see areas lit up with the night lights and the restaurants, bars etc were starting to come alive. Ski ended our tour pointing us in the direction of a little local restaurant that was cheap as chips and very authentic( we were the only non locals in there and it was packed). I have only wonderful things to say about Ski -Big Foot Tours - no wonder she is No. 1 on Tripadvisor !!

One of the Best Walking Tours in Hong Kong. I recently traveled with a good friend to Hong Kong for a vacation. I had heard about Ski and Big Foot tours while doing research for the trip. We met Ski promptly at the K exit/entrance of the MTR and we began the tour right away. Ski was extremely informative about both the culture and history of Hong Kong. She was able to answer many travel related questions we had. Like where to put more money on our oyster cards, and how to best travel around the Kowloon side. Her tour included many out of the way spots that we would have never seen without having Ski along. We were able to sample Dim Sum, and try the local milk tea which was delicious. The 4 hours with Ski went by much too quickly. I plan to use Ski on my next trip to Hong Kong and would highly recommend her to anyone planning on visiting Hong Kong. Thanks again Ski. Marie and I had a great time!Louis

Best Money Spent in Hong Kong. This review is well past due. I actually thought I had already wrote it, sorry Ski.  My wife 10 year old daughter and I used Ski on our very last night in Hong Kong in early June.  We wanted to make sure we really got a feel for Hong Kong, past all the touristy hyped places. Ski fully succeeded in this. The whole time Ski was showing us around she was also tweaking the tour destinations to match what she was learning about where we have already been and what we wanted to see. She took us places we would not have gone on our own or even known about. Many travelers want that locals experience on trips, but do not know how to get it. Ski can accommodate this. One of the things we had wanted to try was Turtle Jelly Soup. However, where to go for this we would have no idea. I'm sure I could have found some random place selling it, but who knows if it is a place you would want to try something like this. Ski brought us to a tiny shop in this small bldg with other retail shops. The whole shop probably had 4 tables in it. We would never had known about a place like this.  Since Ski knew we really like trying different foods she brought us to at least 4 different places to try local food. She knew my wife was looking for a small piece of Jade, so she brought us to some shops and street vendors that might have what she wanted.While walking through old China town, she would explain to us all the food items we were seeing in the in the shops. Most of which I would not have a clue what is was.It was just an over all great experience and am extremely glad we did it.Thanks Ski

Best HK tour. I found Ski's Hong Kong walking tour on trip advisor. I booked a private tour for my mom and step-dad who like to walk and are more interested in history and culture than one of the big bus tours could provide. My husband and I joined them, and we all had a great time. I now look at Central and Sheung Wan in a different light, thanks to the details about Hong Kong culture and history that Ski showed us. I recommend this tour to everyone! Thank you, Ski!

Absolutely Fantastic! Book now!. Ski is amazingg!! I took this tour today and I was blown away both by her knowledge and friendliness. I really feel like I know HKG now after only a day. When I first arrived I was totally lost and to be honest scared, by the time Ski left me I was able to manouver around, take buses and walk through the city and find my way back to my hotel. She is an amazing tour guide, and I think this is because she loves both her job and the city. I am a very shy person but Ski had me talking the whole way! She also helped me to get an octopus card and a sim card when I mentioned I needed them. I don't think there is a question you could ask that she wouldn't know the answer to. My only regret is that I was only able to book her for one day...I miss her already, it felt much more like walking around with a friend rather than a guide. Book this tour nowwww! you cannot find a better way to spend your money!

A fabulous experience. On our second day in Hong Kong we were looking for something a little different by way of a guided tour and we were not disappointed. Ski showed us a side of Hong kong that we would never have experienced on our own. She took us away from the beaten track, down little lanes and back alleys and all the time making each place become alive with her great local knowledge and history of Hong Kong. We could only manage to book her for four hours but those hours gave us a hint of what the area had to offer and enticed us to explore for ourselves. If you are looking for something a little different by way of a guided tour then I would highly recommend Ski.

Good introduction to HK. Hong Kong is one of those places where a little insider knowledge of customs, food and history make you trip alot more enjoyable. I would have walked by a lot of interesting things by myself. We booked a walking tour with Big Foot Tours at the last minute. They had an opening which fit our schedule. Ski met us at statue square.... really nice and full of information. We had a great afternoon. At the end of the tour she droped us (and helped us get a table) at a good restaurant. We mentioned we were headed to Singapore and she followed up with an email of recommended things to do, bars and restaurants. I would recommend a Big Foot Tour in Hong Kong.

You can't go wrong with Big Foot Tour. This is my long overdue review of my experience with Big Foot Tour in Hong Kong. First, I should confess that I'm a pretty bad tourist. Vague desire of "extraordinary experiences" coupled with complete lack of preparation, and half-@ssed research makes me that annoying type of tourist who has expectations, but no clear idea what he wants. But that makes my experience with Big Foot Tour even more outstanding. I stayed in Hong Kong for 2,5 days on my way to Saigon. I've spent my first day feeling lost among millions of people in Kowloon, trying to make sense of this place on my own. I did my best, but felt that this is really not enough. So I emailed Ski without any real hope of actually pulling this off, since it was just one day in advance. I got a response soon, the payment was arranged via PayPal (extremely convenient).  The actual tour was brilliant! Ski surely knows the city very well, she does a great job in revealing many faces of Hong Kong: amazing culture mixed with colonial past mixed with uncertainties of "one country, two systems" future. Probably, the one thing that I liked the most was that insight into the daily life of people in Hong Kong, which Ski was always ready to provide. Ski loves the city, knows the city, and enjoys helping tourists like me explore the city. What more could I ask for?

excellent booking system, great tour, perfect attitude. on a business trip to Hong Kong with only a few days. Booking is fast, quick and reliable. I had a great first impression of the city, its people, etc. Tour is interesting at all times. Attitude is very very good with very good service and always smiling. Highly recommend the tour!

A tour that made a huge difference. Great for elderly!. I brought my grandparents to HK/China for a long trip. They are in their 70s and walk very slow. my initial worries that the tour may be bad because of the walking was unfounded. It was perfect! ski is very attentive and led us through flat roads and help to watch out for traffic and step. she never made my grandparents feel that they were useless or slow. she was very respectful and we all could sense that she was genuinely sincere. she got my grandparents talking about their life stories and oh my, they couldn't stop talking to her! i'm glad that at their age, they made a friend in a foreign country. Thank you, Ski. It feels even more rewarding for me and I feel really happy that I brought them to HK.

Very Fun ! Will do again and again !. We speak not very good English . Our guide is very patient . Very happy happy day ! My daughter and I cannot stop shopping and laughing . My husband says it is money spend very well . We take many many pictures . We like Big Foot Tour !

Nothing but the best. Highest standard of tour!!!!. I was on honeymoon with my wife for 3 weeks all over Asia with personal tour guides in almost every city. Tour guide in Hong Kong, Ski, is well-read and knowledgable. So tour is very informative. Hong Kong is an extremely busy (and noisy) city compared to where we came from. We are quiet and introverted shoppers. So I was very pleased when she knows when to share and when to give us time alone (i have met other guides previously who could not stop talking). Best tour we have in our whole trip. Number 1 in our hearts.

Ski Yeo and Big Foot Walking Tours Number 1 for Hong Kong. Ski Yeo has amazing feedback on Trip Advisor, and this is the main reason I booked a walking tour with her in Hong Kong, for myself and three friends in July. I visit Hong Kong quite frequently, but not so my friends who had flown in the night before. Ski was prompt in replying to my emails and had some helpful suggestions as to where we might go for our walking tour. In the event, only two friends were able to come with me, and one had some limits to her mobility. We met Ski who was like a bright breathe of fresh air on a hot, humid Hong Kong morning. Ski paced the tour to accommodate everyone's needs, stopping as required, but still making sure that she provided us with plenty of information. Even though I have been to Hong Kong often, I learnt many new and interesting facts from Ski. She certainly opened my eyes to things I have overlooked in the past. Ski took us to a very traditional dim sum restaurant for lunch, which was awesome and different to the experiences I have had at other dim sum restaurants in Hong Kong. Ski Yeo is the consummate professional guide who has a bright, engaging personality, a great sense of humor and the flexibility to adapt to the requirements of her clients. I would recommend her tours to anyone no matter what their age, stage or mobility.

Very cool walking tour. My wife and I spent three days in Hong Kong as a stopover on the way back to the US from a longer trip elsewhere in south Asia. We selected Ski's tour based on other TripAdvisor reviews and are very glad we did. She was very helpful, courteous, professional, and knowledgeable throughout the entire process. The arrangements were set up entirely via email and easily done. She was also helpful providing suggestions on areas of the city in where we might want to reserve our hotel and after the tour provided us direction on other places we might want to see. The tour was very informative and she made it very interesting. We saw the off-the-beaten places and non-touristy places that make a city interesting, along with some very good eating establishments that we ordinarily would not have gone to if not for Ski. We took the tour as a couple but we would also recommend this walking tour for families or small groups.

Great introduction to Hong Kong. We selected this tour purely based on the Trip Advisor reviews and the Big Foot Tour website.Two members of our group of four had never been to Hong Kong before and we felt this type of tour would be a great introduction to Hong Kong.We found Ski to be a very friendly, professional and knowledgable guide who provided us with an excellent tour around the Central and Soho neighbourhoods.After booking online, Ski promptly contacted us by email to ask exactly what we wanted to see and do on the tour, so it felt very personal and tailored to our needs.We thoroughly enjoyed the day and would highly recommend Big Foot Tours. Ski also provided us with some great time saving tips for other activities we had been planning to do while in Hong Kong. Enjoy!

THE BEST. My husband and I were in Hong Kong on business and had very little time to see the city. In 4 hours Ski showed us more than we could have imagined. Her tour was beautifully paced and allowed for extra time in places we found of particular interest. She has a lovely way about her and helped us gain understanding of a culture that was for the most part unfamiliar. If we are lucky enough to return to Hong Kong we would no doubt book another tour with Ski !!!!

Brilliant!. The with ski was simply awesome. Ski as mentioned is very friendly and full of knowledge. She took us places we most probably wouldn't see, and taught us things would never know (Cheesy I know). The tour was fun and enlightening to our whole group. The trip to Hong Kong wouldn't be the same without the tour in which gave the visit to Hong Kong a lot more depth.I recommend this to any one who would like to see Hong Kong in a special way. You won't regret it :)Best Regards Gia

Amazing Walking Tour of HK!. Ski was very friendly and knowledgeable ! She showed us a lot of great places in Hong Kong you would not truly enjoying just walking around seeing the sites. She pointed out little things only a local friend would know, and was great company. She took us to a WONDERFUL Dim Sum restaurant that was very local, and SO delicious! I recommend her to anyone heading to Hong Kong wanting to truly enjoy this fantastic city.

Ski has a nasty side;). Yes she does indeed, I mean how nasty is this?? ski would only let me have ONE of the best pork buns i've ever had.... although I did limited myself to one of the still warm egg tarts( how I did this I still dont know) , and then later on in the tour she wouldn't let me leave until i had finished my turtle shell jelly. Which by the way has a flavour not unlike a very strong black tea.But all jokes aside, Ski does one of the best tours that I've ever had the luck to be on. It's not so much a tour as you a local friend going on a wander and exploring a new place that you havent been to before or maybe you have and you are seeing it through different eyes.For me it was my first time in Hong Kong and having someone help me get my bearings and give me how to get around hints was awesome. Seeing the little side markets that pop up out of nowhere and then then thrive... every allyway a different one. The stand where umbrellas are repaired (unfortunitly closed for the day when we got there) was remarkable in this day and age when every thing is thrown away. Ski was even able to show me where to go for the Take Out Comedy venue as I was going there a couple of nights later and was worried about finding it. Ski also gave me directions on where to take photos from the peak..which turned out to be one of the best locations. How do I know this?? Well locals where there taking shots and an Austrian advertising team turned up to do shots there as well for part of an ad campaign being run in Europe. Stay away from the Galleria.Only disappointing thing of the tour was because of the time of year (summer) I wasnt able to try the snake soup, as i had tried snake in vietnam only a few day earlier and wanted to compare to 2, so next time i'll just have to make sure i go back in the colder months and maybe Ski will be kind enough to let me try some. But overall I was taken to some wonderful places and took some great photos of every day life in HK and all done with a wonderful and talented guide in Ski.As a last note if I hear of anyone heading that way will be definatly putting thenm in touch with Big Foot Tours.

Fantastic Walking Tour of Hong Kong. I was fortunate to find Big Foot Tours on google and Trip Advisor. From the initial inquiry to the executation of the tour I found Ski to be friendly, professional and knowledgable. Our group was a challenging one to accommodate due to varied interests (7 indiviudals from 28 years to 65 years in age, 1 male, 6 females and a range of physical abilities). Ski met us at our hotel as promised (was there early), confirmed the itinerary and made the appropriate changes based on last minute requests and the concern about the effects of the day's heat &humidity. We booked a 6 hour tour that focussed on food, shopping and must see sites. Thank you Ski for your patience, flexibility and sense of humour. It was appreciated when you slowed down the pace when the "elders" required it or when we got distracted with the shopping!! What you pay for is what you get and Big Foot Tours was worth it!!

Hong Kong in the Rain. Over the past year I have traveled to south China for business through Hong Kong. Unfortunately I had never had time to see the real Hong Kong. I had been using TA to plan for an upcoming cruse to Italy. So I checked out Hong Kong and found Ski and Big Foot Tours. We arranged to meet for 4-hour walk about during my return to Hong Kong to reset my Visa.The weather did not cooperate - it rained but off we went with our umbrellas. I can honestly say I've never had so much fun in the rain since college. Ski filled the afternoon with an inside look at life and the culture of Hong Kong. I met ladies who job it is to curse those who have wronged you, got a glimpse of the Hong Kong above street level, learned about Tao China's chief religion, learned about the gentleman who rasied 9 children repairing umbrellas, and saw various interesting market places. The best way to describe the afternoon was that it was like going to visit a friend and having them show you around where they live! What a day!I have passed Ski's contact info to several colleagues and even the office manager of our Hong Kong office. I look forward to returning and seeing other parts of this wonderful city with this bright and interesting friend!

A very cool tour on a very hot day!. This is the coolest thing that I have done in Hong Kong! What else to say? Food, sightsee, shopping are all awesome! The weather was very hot (it's cold back at home right now) and we had some problems adapting to the humidity and heat. But the guide was all fine with stopping for breaks every now and then. We were brought to chic cafes, hippest bar in the town, etc, in the hidden corners of Hong Kong. Even when sitting down, the guide continues to chat about Hong Kong. Well worth the money, even when we are resting our feet!

See Hong Kong proper. We had booked a 4 day extension in Hong Kong on the tail end of a 2 week fully guided tour of China, and thought, being on our own the best way to get an appreciation of the city would be through a walking tour. On a trip to New York, my wife had pre-booked a tour of that city using Trip Advisor reviews as guidance as to who to book.For Hong Kong, it was no different, looked up Trip Advisor, found Ski and Big Foot (No.1 for Hong Kong), and booked a 4 hour tour for day 2 10..00 - 14.00.As we were staying at the Harbour Plaza Metropolis in Kowloon, Ski had emailed directions from the Hotel, to meet her on the Hong Kong Island.On a lovely hot but very humid Saturday morning we met up, and decided to see the local side of the city, the small markets etc, places we wouldn't have seen or pushed ourselves to see if we potted around on our own! It was hard work in the humidity, but we got a good education of the area (Tao temple, colonial buildings etc), leaving the numerous shopping malls to on side.Ski also gave us good information regarding use of transport, what number of bus to use etc and what other sights to see around the area.Ski's knowledge is definitely first class, and her enthusiasm for her job (never stopped smiling) is credit to her (she is originally from Singapore), so if you are looking for a tour tailered to your reguirements, go no further than Big Foot. The recent Trip Advsior reviews also reflect our own thoughts and feelings.

Excellent tour - Highly Recommend. My wife and I completed the four hour tour yesterday with Ski. Her knowledge of HK, its different areas, the people and culture was quite intimate and she proved to be an excellent tour guide. As mentioned before we completed the four hour tour which IMO was not long enough for me. I could have easily done the eight hour tour. We started off in the Central district (the business district) where we covered off the different types of buildings, the feng shui that went into their planning and architecture etc. We then moved further up into the ity towards the escalator, the SOHO district etc followed by a visit to a local Taoist Temple. Along the way Ski would pause and explain the different little aspects of each building, the people, their lifestyle, the markets etc, so she was quite good. We then moved on back down towards the water where we stopped for lunch and then back up through Hollywood Road and down again towards Central.We finished that in about 3 hours so we caught the MTR over to Mong Kok and toured through the markets and malls and then sat down for some delicious turtle jelly (said to be good for a cough from which i suffered, and you know what? it worked!).Look, Ski was fantastic, she's very thorough in her explanations, very clear, her English is excellent and she genuinely is a lovely person. I would definitely recommend her, especially for the walks through the alley ways where you tend to find how people really live.5 stars and two thumbs up! Well done Ski.

Wonderful Walking Tour. Ski is a Singanporean transplant to HK, but she knows the city better than anyone. She speaks perfect English, is very committed to her job and is always ready to add interesting facts. She has a wonderful personality. She provided interesting tidbits like the best place to get milk tea, or shop for J-Pop fashion or gave us a quick lesson on how to use the local transportation system. If you are in HK for a few days, start your visit with a 4-hour tour with Ski, and she'll provide you with all the info you need to have a successful visit.

Hong Kong's magical secrets unlocked. Ski made my husband and I feel very welcome at the outset. We had been to Hong Kong several times, and wanted to see some of the more unique places that was the real Hong Kong of old.We spent 4 hours walking around the back streets, starting at the mid level elevator. We sampled Hong Kong tea/coffee at a tiny little cafe, and at a bakery the "best" egg tarts. My husband even sat on a little stool, all 6'4" of him and relished the black turtle shell jelly with gusto, which I could not even attempt.She was really informative on various historical and interesting tidbits, both folklore and real, as we wandered around in the late afternoon.Ski was very sympathetic of my very sore feet, and suggested little stops from time to time.We meandered through the oldest area in the back streets to the dried seafood and herbmedicine streets, as she pointed out the interesting items on offer and the reasons that they are used and how to cook them.We stopped at a lovely little tea shop and browsed through the myriad types of tea.We would have liked to spend more time with Ski, as we saw more and covered more ground with her than we had previously. We saw umbrellas restored on a very very steep street, wet food markets. It was not so much a tourist tour, but one of genuine discovery of how the residents in Hong Kong live, and some of the disused buildings of a bygone era.If we go back, we will definitely want more. Fantastic. Thank you so much Ski, we will treasure those memories for a long time.

Fantastic and informative tour!. Most of the other reviews have expressed how we feel about Ski and Big Foot Tour. I also want to add that, for us, the best part of the tour was Ski's consistently upbeat and genuinely friendly attitude. She is always smiling and eager to answer questions. Ski is both an incredibly informative guide and a very nice person. You really can't go wrong with Big Foot Tour. Book it now!

Outstanding. I was so pleased to have found Ski and Big Foot Tours. As our first trip to Hong Kong, it was the perfect introduction to the city, its culture, history and attractions. Ski adapted the tour to our needs. I.e. she helped us find a special knife gift for our son, to visit a church for me and to sample unique foods for my husband. My husband was concerned that four hours would be too much walking for his bad hip and knees. But the pace was just right, with frequent stops, and he time flew by quickly. I wish we had more time in Hong Kong. It is a great city. When we return, we will certainly book another tour with Big Foot Tours. Ski is the perfect city host. I highly recommend that you book a tour... Quickly!

Hong Kong in Depth, Friendly, Relaxed and Fascinating. My wife and I can't praise Ski enough. We spent a very happy day walking around all the nooks and crannies of the island and the Chilin Nunnery. We learnt a lot about both the history as well as modern day life and culture of Hong Kong. It was just like being taken round the home town of an old friend. We were introduced to the art of a dim sum lunch, the frenetic market streets, Chinese medicine, Chinese symbolism in architecture and art, religion and beliefs, the retail and commercial extravaganza that is HK, British influence, everyday life and living conditions, death and after-life beliefs, Chinese herbs and cooking, education - the list goes on and then to the oasis of tranquility of the gardens and nunnery and a philosophical chat about contrasts between mainland, HK and Singaporean Chinese culture and politics. All done at a pace that didn't exhaust and which really gave us a good feeling for the place in such a short time. Good luck Ski in all your endeavours. We'd love to come back and tour and talk with you again. We have no hesitation in encouraging others to take the tour.

The only way to see the real Hong Kong. Thank you Tripadvisor for helping us fing Big Foot Tours.Right from the initial contact by email Ski Yeo proved to be an amiable & efficient tour guide.She collected us from our Hong Kong Hotel exactly on time & having established that we were not in the flush of youth she went out of her way to find out our interests. She did not frog march us around but yet showed us some delightful elements of Hong Kong which we would certainly have missed had we just used a guide book. Her depth of knowledge on every topic we raised was amazing. Having gone out of her way & time, she took us to the Star ferry terminal to catch the ferry to Kowloon whilst listing several other sights worth seeing on our remaining days in Hong KongWe can thoroughly recommend her services

Experience Hong Kong In Reality. I have been to Hong Kong several times and have been through all the tourist spots and traps with guided tours. So when I decided to try the walking tour with Big Foot Tour, I thought I might have to see some of the same tourist places again. But Ski surprised me completely when we walked through the streets of Hong Kong Island. She had info on every street, every kind of business, every ride that we took on the tram, metro, escalators! I was so engrossed in the in-depth information about the real Hong Kong, that we walked by almost all the tourist spots(which I had seen in my previous trips) without even noticing. I strongly recommended this tour for first time visitors and even for those who wish to discover Hong Kong all over again in subsequent trips. The beauty of this walking tour is that, besides the invaluable info, Ski also lets you decide the pace and speed of the tour as per your requirement. The comfort level of the tour is the deal-breaker. It is unmatched and therefore it is no wonder that Big Foot Tour is ranked as the number 1 attraction in Hong Kong.

The Ritz Carlton of tours!. We are a group of 5 with myself, my wife, 4-year old daughter and my parents who are in their sixties. Before that, we had a lot of email correspondences going on and Ski was very patient in answering all of our questions. My parents are old and they walk slow and they don't like to talk much because they know very little English. Still, Ski made the effort to chat with them and made them laugh and at the same time made sure that my wife and I are included in the conversation. We had a pram for our daughter and Ski helped us to get around Hong Kong which is DEFINITELY not friendly for prams at all and at times, she even had to help carry the pram up the stairs (feel bad given that ski is such a small and petite girl). She did all of these without a complaint. Everywhere we go, Ski will check with all of us to see if we are ok with it or if we are too tired to walk then she finds us a rest place, all entirely at our own leisure pace. I would highly recommend this tour because this is a level of services that I have not seen in a long time. And from where i come from, this is definitely a service i am thoroughly impressed with.

woot!. My girlfriend and I adventured to Hong Kong unknowing what we would do... then Ski emerged and showed us the way! The tour started in a late Friday afternoon while the sun peeked thru the cloudy innards of Hong Kong's hustle & bustle. We wanted to see what Hong Kong was really about without having the "Frommer's/Lonely Planet Travel book carrying tourist" look that eagerly waited to get pick-pocketed. Ski came with a sweet smile, innate gusto, and pimp sneakers. I already knew this was gonna be a great walking tour just from that. Ski brilliantly guided us to Hong Kong's own Chinatown, clustering HK seafood markets, Buddhist temples, & inclining street arts & architecture in all walks of Hong Kong life. Ski gave us enough to engulf Hong Kong. We even ended up eating at a deliciously quaint Won Ton restaurant, grabbing a Tsing' beer in Lan Kwai Fung, & picturesque boat ferry to Kowloon for the magical night lights of Hong Kong. This is how we started our Hong Kong adventure and it was perfectly executed.

Fantastic!. We booked a 4-hour walking tour because we wanted to see the "real" Hong Kong. I am so glad we chose Big Foot Tour! Ski really knows her stuff. Within just a few minutes of meeting us she had figured-out enough about us (without directly asking what we wanted to see) that she was able to tailor the tour to our interests. We had flown overnight from the US and hadn't slept yet when we met her for our afternoon (3:30-7:30 pm) tour. I was worried that we would be too tired to stay focused for the whole four hours. I shouldn't have worried. Ski kept the pace moving perfectly. If we ever come back to Hong Kong (boy do we want to!) we will definitely book another tour with Ski!BOOK A TOUR WITH SKI! BIG FOOT TOUR IS DEFINITELY WORTH YOUR TIME AND MONEY!!

Awesome!. After a 4-hour tour with Ski, I finally got to understand what Hong Kong is all about, beyond my office, conference calls and hotel area. The short tour is enough to give a very good overview of Hong Kong. It helped me with my business meetings as I was able to relate to the people whom I was dealing with in Hong Kong and even impress them with my knowledge of the local culture, fengshui and eating habits... how cool is that??!! this is what i call value for money beyond the tangiblesWhat I really like is that the tour slows me down in my pace to notice the little things around me. This is my first time doing a private tour and I find it to be really worth the money. I have learnt that there is no point rushing around Hong Kong trying to squeeze in 100 sights. I rather move slower, take in all the details that tells me what Hong Kong really is. To me, this will be... Big Foot Tour.

A fun and fascinating tour!. I asked ski to design a food tour for me and my partner where we could try all the local foods. It was brilliant. Even though it was Pouring with rain we still had fun. We went to a local dim sum place, bought antiques, tried sugar cane juice and turtle shell jelly, visited a temple, had our palm read, rode the escalators in soho and ate custard tarts. Not only were we stuffed with food but also with knowledge of the people and culture. I left thinking hong long is the most amazing place I have ever been. Ski was kind gentle and patient and answered all our questions. Thank you!

Walking Tour is the way to see the real Hong Kong.. My wife and I decided to try a walking tour to get to know a little history and culture about Hong Kong. We had a wet day, but Ski helped us understand that this was just part of Hong Kong, and showed us how the locals moved around the city when the weather gets in their way. Utilizing covered walkways we toured up from Statue Square to the mid level of the city using the worlds longest escallator. Ski helped us view how life is not only on the streets but above it in upper level shops and restaurants. In fact she showed us a local favorite Dim Sum Restaurant and helped us select some very good food off the carts that patrolled the sitting area. She also helped us by showing us how to dine with the locals. Ski was very informative, and was very willing to adjust her tour to meet our pace, and interests.

value for money, informative... really love it!!. this is a top tour at a really good price. i have checked around and seems that ski is really providing a bargain for the kind of service she is providing. she really loves the idea of showing people around and sharing with tourists all around what hk is about!

Excellent Walking Tour. This is a must do for anyone visiting Hong Kong. It gives you a real feel for the city and you see far more on foot than on an open top bus. We opted for the private tour with a focus on food. Ski was great, she was waiting for us outside the central MTR station and we promptly set of on our tour. Ski was very knowledgeble about the history of Hong Kong and pointed out buildings of note as well as some of the more subtle features drawing from chinese culture, an example of this being the central atriums in a lot of sky scrapers to allow mountain dwelling dragons passage to the sea !! all brilliant stuff. We sampled some great food and had the most varied dim sum of our trip. 10 out of 10 Ski and thank you again for a great tour, we will be back next year.

Outstanding. This is a must do in Hong Kong. The only mistake we made was limiting ourselves to a 4 hour tour! There is just so much to do and see in Hong Kong. Ski certainly told us so much about the Hong Kong way of life. Her personality and English are perfectly suited to being a Tour Guide. Just a wonderful lady to introduce you to the local Hong Kong at your own pace. We already have passed her details onto others in the hope they may also experinece Hongkers in the Ski way! Thanks Ski and will definately catch up next visit to Hong Kong. Sue and Jim Shortall

The Best "Must Do" Walking Tour of Hong Kong. If this is your first time to Hong Kong you MUST book a tour with Ski, without her we would have missed out on so much - not only through wasting time on finding our way around but also in understanding what was going on around us and why. We took a 6 hour tour which for us was the perfect amount of time, mostly walking but also bus, train and ferry. Her knowledge is extensive, we learnt a lot in our 6 hours, certainly enough to retrace our steps the following day and explore some more on our own. Ski is extremely easy to be with and her english is exceptional. She is completely flexible on how you spend your time and goes at whatever pace suits the group. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Hong Kong to get the most out of your visit. Thanks Ski for a great tour. Ros, Frank and Georgia (13), Calgary, Alberta, Canada.

Highly Recommended. As first time visitors to Hong Kong and China generally we found this service invaluable in getting familiar with Hong Kong. We had our tour first thing on the first of our 4 days in Hong Kong and Ski helped us navigate through getting to the right place to get the right kind of Octopus card and how to use various forms of transport. This gave us the confidence to go all over the island on our own later. Her commentary was interesting and useful and very responsive to us. Not the monologue you can sometimes get. She was very flexible in selecting what we would do in our 6 hour tour and we saw a lot. More than we expected. Having her at hand to explain things that happened to be going on around us, like the grave sweeping holiday and the domestics picnics on their day off, added a lot of depth to what we would have taken away on our own. In retrospect our old feet would have been fine with a 4 hour tour rather than the 6 but other than that I wouldn't change a thing. You will come away with a much better feel for Hong Kong and an enriched visit.

the best guide in hong kong. Ski is the best tour guide i ever had. My little girl Lou( 7 years) and i, have a four hours tour with her by foot, it was very lovely to have ski with us .She knew very well hong kong . Walking with her around the town and learn so many things was a great pleasure for us. If you go to hong kong make a tour with ski ,you just need good shoes and a big smile and ski will show you the best of hong kong.Thanks you ski .Carole and Lou

The number 1 attraction in Hong Kong!. It's funny to say this, but we feel that Ski is indeed the person that you HAVE to meet in Hong Kong. She gave us a very warm welcome into the city, amidst the terrible weather (all our feet were soaking wet that day but there wasn't a tinge of complain from her, even though some of our feet clearly smell). We love her passion, especially knowing how popular her tours are, but she is still able to show us around as though it is her first time! we tried to give her a tip after the tour, but this young lady is very insistent about her policy of just accepting what she charges. It is a very straightforward system that we really like. Oh yes, shop with her! She knows all the best places in Hong Kong (most of them are incredible hole in the wall shops) and she takes the hint to help you to negotiate for better prices (without any of us asking). Can't highly recommend this tour enough and I hope we get to book her again on our next trip to Hong Kong!

Big Foot is the Best. Ski made Hong Kong come alive for us! The tour was personalized, pleasant, factual and fun! In addition to showing us fascinating street scenes and landmarks of Hong Kong, Ski helped us get our Octopus Cards and showed us the ins and outs of taking the subway. She made us feel at home in a city we had just arrived in. Big Foot Tours is an asset to any visit to Hong Kong!Thank you, Ski!!
SKi was awesome!. Very nice. Very informative. Worth all the money. Great way to spend the time.

An eye for details. The best part of the tour is that you don't have to say much. Ski was flexible and stated right at the start (both from emails and the start of the tour) that she places our interests as the first and so if there was anything that we didn't like, we could switch a place immediately. We didn't know what to see in Hong Kong as this was our first visit, so we left to her to decide. You could feel that along the way, she tries hard to figure out our interests, be it pointing to certain things along the way and then assess our reactions, or simply asking if this was what we were looking for. I think she has done her role very very very well. we are very impressed by her flexibility and her sense of responsibility. So for the tour, it went very very well. We saw things that interest us, from small little shops with local flavour to food to culture and history. So we'll say, just trust Ski to plan the tour for you. It turned out perfect!

What more can you ask for?. This tour is super. My culture is very simillar to Hong Kong, so I was skeptical if it would provide any value to me. I warned her about it, saying that I want to see a different hong kong, but not into shopping, temples, etc. i told her she has much to prove and asked if she wanted to take up the challenge. Fact is, she did and ended up going WAY beyond my expectation. She knew exactly what to skip and what to show me more. The old side, the stories, etc. Along the way she checks with me to make sure things are going my way. I think it is a difficult job to be in, having to please so many people, but she does it effortlessly, always with a smile on her face. It made my trip in Hong Kong. Well done, Ski! I will highly recommend you to any one that I know who is visiting hk.

Great tour with Ski. Ski is a great tour guide. We had a four hour tour of Hong Kong with her and she took us all over -- from the Hong Kong side to the Kowloon side and back. We even went for dim sum! If you're looking for a fun, knowledgeable tour guide while you're in Hong Kong, Ski is an excellent choice.

Very nice experience, would surely be rated higher if no kids. We booked a private tour with Ski for our first afternoon/evening in Hong Kong. We found her to be very likeable and a nice person to be around, with good knowledge, and was a great way to become familiar with trams and star ferry etc. Definitely a lot better than a bus tour, in the ability to use public transport and for personalisation.If I was travelling alone, I would have rated this higher, but I was travelling with two kids, and so different. While they really enjoyed some things we saw, and especially loved the temple visit, and liked Ski a lot (and wanted to see her again), they were frequently asking when it would be over, and found the time dragged (in contrast to our later private tours in which they didn't want it over after 12 hours). Touring with kids is very different, and I am very sure I would rate higher if touring alone as Ski does have very good knowledge and a lovely personality.We also had not corresponded apart from basic arrangements before the tour, which I think would've helped to make the time a bit smoother, so definitely worth communicating your interests prior.I would certainly recommend a tour with Ski over a bus tour if travelling with a group of adults, it is a great way to get a feel for the city and for its transport, and pleasant way to spent time, and to see and do things you may not otherwise.

Off the beaten track. As this was our first visit to Hong Kong we wanted to see and does much as possible. We booked Ski of Big Foot Tours to,give the two of us an 8 hour private walking tour of places we would not find on our own so that we could get a.good taste of how the locals live. We figured we could see all the tourist spots on our own during the remainderof our visit. Ski met us at our hotel and, after a brief confirmation of what we wanted to do, we headed off to take the ferry over to Hong Kong. She led us through side streets, to a temple, Chinatown, parks, antique shops and even lunch at an authentic dim sum restaurant. Along the way she knowledgabley answered our questions and gave us much history and cultural information. When we mentioned it, she took us to a local tailor to get measured up for a suit and shirts. She insisted we try bubble tea at her favorite shop. We then ferried back to Kowloon where we continued our tour at the waterfront and then began a visit to the "dark"side. Further along we braved a couple of blocks of the flower market which was jam packed with everyone buying their flowers for Chinese New Year. The bird market was our final stop in a very enjoyable day. Ski gave us advice for the rest of our time in Hong Kong and, when she found out our trip included her hometown of Singapore, she took the time to email us her favorite restaurants and things to do. Big Foot tours went beyond our expectations, and Ski,the owner, is a gem. She followed up with us after our return home to ensure we received our suit, and when there was a delay in shipping, she personally went to the shop to check out the problem. We got a great feel for the real Hong Kong and only wish our stay could have been a little longer.

An attentive and considerate guide. Ski paid considerable attention to our interests and needs in showing us a wide cross section of Hong Kong Islands' historical, cultural and commercial attractions.She is knowledgeable, patient and courteous and timed the four hour tour well to our interest and energy.

Great personal walking tour. I visited Hong Kong with my mother for 4 days. We arranged a 4 hour tour with Ski on our first day. This was a great introduction and orientation for us. She showed us many of the traditional areas of Hong Kong Island. It was lovely to have someone to explain what was being sold and the customs behind what was going on in these traditional Chinese shops. We were able to have authentic dim sum and we were so glad to have Ski take us as we avoided some fairly major cultural stumbles! Ski helped us to organise our itinerary over the next few days and suggestions of where we might like to buy chops(they were great...and were delivered to our hotel), great shoes and tea. It was really an informative and interesting way to get to know the city and so nice to do this at your own pace and following your own interests. Ski is a great guide.

Ski is the BEST!. I am one of those annoying people who book walking tours but doesn't want to walk. All I have to say is Ski has the patience of a saint and met my every want and need in every possible way- with minimal walking!We are young couple (27 and 30) and we booked an 8 our tour with Ski. I wanted to see the important attractions as well as the 'real' HK that the locals live and breath.Ski was very observant of my wants and needs and showed us sooooo many interesting aspects of the city. She even took me to a sports shop to buy runners as I was silly enough to think I could to a tour in thongs. The restaurant she took us to was amazing.... the escalator... the tram... the peak tour...the local streets... the shopping... the food... the handy tips...I was truly impressed by everywhere and everything she showed us... Everything was amazing and exciting and a great photo opportunity!Ski is SO SWEET! I highly recommend booking any one of her tours no matter how long you are staying in HK... We were there only for one night and I can honestly say that I have been given a great view of HK and what it is about.

Getting prepared with Big Foot Tours. Living now in Hong Kong since some months I asked Ski Yeo for a very specific tour as I had already explored some "typical" Hong Kong attractions by myself. Ski answered to all my strange enquries and was able to make me love Hong Kong even more. She showed me around to some places I have never heard of before. Thanks to Ski I learnt a lot about Hong Kong's history, culture, people, and architecture and I am now even better prepared for my next years in Hong Kong!

Highlight of our trip. Best tour ever! An absolute must-do.. Forget the usual tour experience... this was just fantastic. My girlfriend and I went on a great 4 hour tour with Ski and had a great time. It was personal, customized and great value. It was great to have local knowledge, and venture off the normal tourist trips and see some of the great local sights that we would have otherwise walked right past! Ski is a great guide, very easy to get along with and a great sense of humour and fun. We can't speak highly enough of the entire experience. If only there were more of these around the world!

Tom & Margaret's Great Time In Hong Kong. We arrived late in hk on a Monday night and had arranged the tour for Tuesday morning.Ski arrtved at our hotel which was a fair bit out right on time. The tour was excellent and covered all aspects of life in hk religion food culture shopping and lots more.Ski's knowledge about hk is excellent and we cannot praise her enough. We certainly enjoyed our time with Ski and have no hesitation in recommending Big Foot Tours to anyone going to hk and wish Ski every sucess.

Ski is a great guide with a fun personality. We were lucky to get the last two spots on a 4 hour walking tour of Hong Kong. We were only 6 people so the tour was very personal. It was a wonderful tour and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Hong Kong. Ski is a great guide.

Reaches places that other tours don't get to !! - A 'Must do' in Hong Kong. My wife and I were lucky enough to book a Private Tour with Ski in February and saw parts of HK that we had never seen before. We learned so many new things about HK, the food, the culture, public transport, the transfer from the British, Feng Shui, the temples etc etc. all delivered with a great sense of humour.Lunch was also very special ....but I will leave that up to Ski to show you !We have absolutely no hesitation in recommending one of Ski's tours.

Place your trust in Big Foot Tour.. The best decision made by us when it comes to travelling. Personal, attentive, informative, and value for money. If I can give one advice, I will say don't think too much about it. leave it to the guide to plan for you, especially good if it is your first day in Hong kong. You will have a clear idea of what to do and how to go around for the next few days. Go for it!

Excellent Orientation in the City. All you need is a few hours with the guide! I did a 4 hours tour, because the guide, ski, does a wonderful job of orientating you around the city, teach you to use the public transport, share with you insider info about the city and then give recommendations for the rest of the trip. It's the most efficient way to get to know Hong Kong, especially if you are on a business trip or here for only a short moment. It will also be very easy to go around on your own after the tour.

A guide with a big big heart.. It is an interesting experience. Ski's number 1 position says it all, but yet not enough. She's clearly not in this business for the money, but with just a strong passion to keep sharing and hosting strangers from all over the world. You can't fake such feelings. I appreciate her tour service, because you know she is not trying to rip you off. She can easily command a higher price (just take a look at other private tour listing who charged way way way more, for reasons that I am not comprehending and how people are still going for it), but when I asked her about her pricing and how she does not accept tips at all, she says she's aware of the market, but she just want to keep it as fair as possible. She mentioned something to the extent that it's not about squeezing people out of their cash, just because they can well-afford it, but to offer something of true value. You also see her website that she remains humble. She doesn't brag or try to advertise by her achievements in tripadvisor. How many can do that? To be very honest, I would say that she is a lousy business woman, but a very good tour guide and friend to have. Hong Kong is very clearly a strong capitalist country, so it's refreshing to find someone like her to show you a local side of Hong Kong , as well as the gentler side of human kind.Go for it, Ski. It is my honour to know you and thank you so much for showing me around.

A Big Foot Tour of Hong Kong is a must, especially on a short stop-over.. Had 2 nights and 3 days in Hong Kong on our way back to London from Cambodia. Ski, our guide was waiting for us as arranged and spoke perfect English. She asked a few questions and quickly summed up what we were interested in seeing and off we went. Our tour lasted four hours and in that time we saw more of Hong Kong than we would have on our own in the whole 3 days. Neither of us are particularly good walkers (O.K. on the flat) she took us up on escalators into areas you don't see from the ground, into local coffee shops (no tourists), down alleys, through markets and finally left us at the Harbour. She gave us ideas of how to spend the next two days and explained how to get around on the underground. Even took us to the best store to buy new i phones. I was especially impressed that she devoted the whole time exclusively to us. Her mobile was switched off ! Thoroughly recommend. Money well spent.

Totally worth booking with Big Foot Tour!. I visited Hong Kong in March of this year with my husband and 2 daughters and booked a private tour with Ski of Big Foot Tour. Having limited time in Hong Kong (2 days), I didn't want to have to waste time searching for points of interest and getting lost along the way. Having Ski take us was such a time saver and it made it so much more enjoyable. We met Ski , on day 2 in HK, in our Hotel in Kowloon and went across the harbor to Hong Kong Island to explore Central. What everyone has said about her is true! So courteous, patient and very attentive to our needs! I didn't know what to expect weather wise and my 2 girls , 9 and 11 yrs old, were complaining how hot they were- the day was sunny and humid and they were using jeans --and this was the beginning of the walking tour. Ski took us for a pit stop at H&M to get a change of clothes for them. 2 pairs of shorts later, we continued on : ) We rode the famous escalator, ate HK comfort food, visited a temple, ate more food, shopped for trinkets...We were enjoyed everything we were seeing that we did not realize how far we traveled...15 km! I think that is a testament to how good the tour was! Anyway, I totally recommend booking with Ski and Big Foot Tour!

Fastest 8 hours ever. We had been to Hong Kong 3 times in the past and decided this time to get a more personalized tour. There were 4 of us, including my 10 and 18 year old sons. Ski has such a warm and friendly personality and is easy to understand. Her English is perfect so we were all able to learn so much from her. At first, my wife and kids thought that I was crazy for booking an 8 hour walking tour. When the tour ended, all were happy on how great the tour was and surprised on how fast the time went by. My youngest, who is so hard to please, loved everything. as well as our tour guide. Ski made sure that he was never bored and was also attentive to the rest of us. We went on the worlds longest escalator, had great BBQ pork for lunch, shopped at Western Market, the Ding Ding bus, walked around Stanley Market and the pier, finished the tour with the Ferry ride back to Kowloon. We had been to the Peak before so asked to skip it. Ski really knows Hong Kong and is so willing to share her knowledge with you. The tour went so smooth and was well thought out, catering to all the things that we had discussed beforehand. For sure we would recommend Ski and Big Foot Tours to anyone. Thanks again Ski for turning us on to some great things to do and places to see in Hong Kong. Hopefully we will see you in Khao Yai. :)

Shopping is not the only hong kong has going for it.. Ski Yeo from Bigfoot tours showed my father and I the real hong kong. From the first email to the end of the tour it felt like we were talking to a friend rather than a tour guide. Ski brings vast knowledge of hong kong as well as a down to earth and fun personality. She finds out what your interested in and tailors the tour to you, there are no pressured shopping trips or boring sites. After spending four hours with big foot tours I wanted to stay longer in hong kong. Don't hesitate to contact big foot tours, you will not be disappointed.

10,000x more helpful than Lonely Planet. I found the number of rave reviews of Ski Yeo's tours hard to believe, but they're absolutely spot on. Ski is an energetic, outgoing, friendly and courteous guide who speaks perfect English and knows Hong Kong intimately.We asked for a 4-hour tour focussing on food specifically, because we wanted some help finding and ordering things that would otherwise be inaccessible to monolingual Western tourists. Ski took us to places that looked totally nondescript from the street, or that you couldn't even see from the street, and which weren't in any guidebook but which served up all manner of culinary delight. From the routine (the yummiest roast pork ever) to the out there (snake soup and turtle jelly).I can't believe how much ground we covered in 4 hours, and how many places we visited. And at the end of it Ski escorted us to our next destination before leaving us.The fee (HKD1100 for 4 hours) is very reasonable for the service offered.

As good as it gets.. My fiancee and I visited Hong Kong in february 2012.  As we only had one and a half days to spend, we decided to hire a private guide to make the most of our time.  We chose Ski based on T.A. recommendations and I have never felt so grateful to those who take the time to share their experiences with others.We were lucky enough to book Ski for an 8-hour walking tour and we enjoyed every minute of it.   It was a specially foggy day and it was hard to watch the views that Hong Kong is so famous for, and yet she still managed to make it a day we will always remember. We walked along cute streets, admired many architectural gems, learned a lot about the island's history and present, visited the street markets, ate delicious local food, stopped for cofee at hip, trendy cofee shops and all these while enjoying the company of this young, educated, charismatic girl  who is building a business while doing what she obviously loves.  If you are planning a short stay in Hong Kong or are considering a private tour as an introduction to a longer stay, book Ski from Big Foot Tour.   It just can't get any better.

Short time in HK? – know more about HK with this tour. We had only 2 days. We are very happy that we did this tour with Ski on our first day in HK. Ski was very prompt in her correspondence and always helpful. We learn so much about HK and her culture in 4 hours. Ski is very thoughtful and flexible. The only down site, we were very tired already before the tour. Because there is only 1 tour guide – Ski, you will get good experience. I recommend if you have more days than us, this tour is still good to take at the beginning and get Ski to recommend places to go for the later days or you can come back to some of the sites that she take you.Enjoy the tour.Kristina

Ski Hong Kong - on foot. Do yourself a BIG favour and take a Big Foot Tour. I had a great full day tour and experienced a number of first's including a close shave by a very very old Chinese Barber yielding a cut throat razor, a great ride up to Victoria Peak, a bowl of snake soup (true), a Temple visit, and a wealth of local and cultural knowledge from Ski.And the best part - Ski (the tour guide) is a very nice person.

She´s the best. We learned about Big Foot Tour via Tripadvisor and because of all the good recommendations we booked a tour with Ski. Well, there´s not much more to say. She´s the best! We´ve done a lot of guided city tours around the world but never met someone like her before.First it started with a couple of emails between her and us, like if there´s something specific we´d like to see or do. We told her that we want her to decide, so we made up a meeting point in Hong Kong (she even offerd to pick us up at our hotel) and when we first met he,r it was like meeting an old friend. She made us feel like friends visiting her. She showed us a lot of places (we loved the little old snake soup place and will never forget) we would never have found or saw without her. She told us a lot of interesting things about those places and about the chinese culture...you will never find in your travel guide...we are still fascinated.It doesn´t matter if you are a first time visitor to Hong Kong or if you´ve been there before, you will love Ski and her way to show you around. We will definitely come back and do another tour with her. There´s so much to see in Hong Kong and even more with Ski!Thank you so much and we hope to see again really soon!

a must do. We did the Food Tour on the 15th March had a great time Ski was fantastic showed us thing we would not of found answered all are question she met us at our hotel on time her English was excellent .This was one of the better tour I have done on all my travels next time in Hong Kong I would be doing the walking tour to see what else she can so us.

This is a must do tour - you will NOT regret it!. I booked this tour because I'd read the reviews on TripAdvisor and decided that a tour 'off the beaten track' would be perfect as I'd never been anywhere like this before. It was my partner, myself and one of my partners best mates. We are all in our 40's and we all raved about this tour after it ended, then next day and then to anyone we got talking with afterwards! Ski is absolutely lovely and knowledgeable about so much - it was an interesting yet totally fun day. She knew where we could go to get the best souvenirs, great views, interesting places and facts and well.....i could rave for days about why you should do the tours with Big Foot Tour. But stealing a slogan from Nike.....Just Do It!!. You really won't regret it.

Hong Kong was truly magical. This was our first trip to Hong Kong and Ski Yeo, Big Foot Tours was a fantastic guide. She took us places not normally seen and explained a lot about the Chinese way of life and how that fitted into life in Hong Kong. She was extremely professional, giving us time to take in the sights. The only downside was we had only booked four hours! For visitors, first time or otherwise, having a Big Foot Tour is well worth it. Ski also helped direct us where best to see whilst we were in Hong Kong. This is one tour I would definitely recommend.

Excellent Hong Kong tour. My girlfriend and I had a brief 3 day stopover in Hong Kong. We booked a private tour with Ski for the first day we were there to get a lay of the land and some ideas to fill out our remaining two days. Ski was great. She helped us cover all of Hong Kong Island and gave us many ideas to cover on the Kowloon side. We definitely saw and tried things we never would have if we had just explored on our own. We're young so we moved at a pretty quick clip and got to see a lot for a single day tour and hence we were very pleased. If we had more time or if we go back to Hong Kong we will definitely be using Ski's services again.

A great way to see the real Hong Kong. We did a private walking tour of Hong Kong Island with Ski, who travelled to our hotel to collect the 3 of us. Ski's was warm friendly and her knowledge of Hong Kongs history was amazing. We saw parts of Hong Kong Island that we would never have found by oursleves, she also took us to a small cafe to try snake soup, which was certainly a different experience, we also tried Hong Kong Tea and Egg Tarts.Ski took us back to Kowloon and showed us a well known place to eat and also a a shopping centre.The tour was beyond my expectations, and Ski is a great tour guide.

Outstanding experience and very unique opportunity to learn about Hong Kong. Ski is an amazing guide. She offers tours of Hong Kong via ferry, subway, double decker bus, tram and on foot. She took us to places "off the beaten path" for lunch, as well as many of the sites everyone wants to see. She showed us authentic places that local people frequent, like markets and dim sum restaurants. One person in our small group of four couldn't handle too many stairs. Ski picked routes that minimized stairs and was very good about being attentive at the right time whenever stairs were involved. Another reason Ski is fantastic: at no time did we feel rushed. Ski is very intuitive and a good listener twhich makes her a good teacher. Our time with her is something we will never forget. If we go back to Hong Kong, we will definately be in touch with her.

A great afternoon. I visited Hong Kong the first week of March, 2012 and was to be on my own for a few days. I searched on Tripadvisor for things to do that were slightly out of the ordinary, and found a mention of Big Foot Walking Tours. I found the Big Foot web site and was immediately hooked. I contacted Ski, and her replies were immediate and excellent.I booked a private tour with her for one afternoon, as her group tours were filled. I had a wonderful time with Ski - she is friendly and professional. She had already asked by email, any preferences I had for the walk, and these were built in. I also had a couple of places that she was able to show me where they were.We had a great few hours and I saw and learned things about Hong Kong that I would not have done on my own. Ski is a great "companion" and nothing is any bother to her.If you have the opportunity to take one of her walks, I highly recommend you do so.

Big Foot Tour - Big Value for Money. Thank you for my tour, I thoroughly enjoyed it and appreciated how flexible you were in terms of tailoring it to my preferences. It really helped me get a very quick handle on the city, which ultimately saved me a lot of time and allowed me to easily zero in on all things I wanted to see and do whilst I was in Hong Kong. ThanksMy guide, Ski, was very accommodating and spoke excellent English. I would highly recommend this tour for those with little time to explore Hong Kong.

Best City Tour We Haver Ever Done. My husband and I only had a one day stop in HK - we didn't want to waste it getting lost in shopping centres, so we found a tour guide through Trip Advisor. Ski Yeo from Big Foot Tours was hands down the best tour guide we have ever had. She showed us parts of Hong Kong that we would never have found on our own. She could tell straight away what was interesting to us and tailored the trip around us. We saw amazing temples on the Island and what we think must be the only park on the whole of Hong Kong, with an acupressure walking garden made of stones to relieve our feet after all the hill climbing. She took us across to Kowloon to see the food markets and other street markets like the bird market and the flower market. We ate some things that we would never have known to try on our own - snake soup, turtle jelly and some dim sum where we were the only non-locals. It was a great experience. I am also sure that for people who didn't to eat snake soup or see the fish and eels being decapitated at the markets, Ski would be able to come up with an itinerary that suited. She knows HK backwards and could find a walking tour that suited anyone. She gave us a great tip for the end of the day - a bar on the top floor of a hotel on the Kowloon side with amazing views of the Island at sunset.Overall, this was a great experience and an excellent way to get the most out of a short stop in HK. Thanks Ski :)

Unique and Personal Guided Tour of Hong Kong. During my 6 day vacation in Hong Kong, I wanted to try out a couple restaurants that Anthony Bourdain (host of "No Reservations") visited while in Hong Kong. Tour guide (Ski) brought me to the same traditional Dim Sum restaurant and Snake meat store (for Snake soup) as featured in the show. A fantastic experience! After that, we went to Kowloon for a tour of the shops and surroundings. Ski is very friendly and knowledgeable. I enjoyed hearing about the local culture and history while walking to our next destination.All in all, I highly recommend Big Foot Tours. Unlike traditional tours, you do not feel like a tourist. There's nothing better than having a local take you under their wing.

So well worth it - it made our trip to Hong Kong. My 3 girlfriends and I booked Ski for a 4 hour walking tour, tailored to our needs. We wanted a behind the scene look of Hong Kong, something we wouldn't see and learn from a tourist book. We got that and more, there was nothing Ski didn't know and couldn't answer. From a traditional trolley service of Yum Cha to Temples, food markets,coffin shops, snake soup, Culture and History. It was value for money and the best part of our week in Hong Kong. If you dont book Big Foot Tours with Ski your missing out on what Hong Kong is all about and information you will never learn from a map or guide book. You wont be disappointed.

Great Walking Tour in Hong Kong. We took a four hour walking tour with Ski in central Hong Kong (we were staying in Kowloon), She is warm, knowledgable, and very helpful. She had arranged an itinerary that we really liked -- Star Ferry, old colonial buildings in Central, escalators to mid-level, Chinatown etc. It was perfect. We would have gone to the Peak but it was too foggy that day. She took us to a dim sum restaurant in Chinatown that had great food and terrific atmosphere (non-touristy!) and also to some shops that we wanted to look at as well as a fascinating temple. We recommend her highly -- you will learn about HK and enjoy her company as well!

It was like having a friend in Hong Kong. My husband and I took a four hour private tour with Ski yesterday and I have to say it felt like we were meeting our friend who lives in Hong Kong. She was easy to get along with, friendly and very informative. She helped us in getting our Octopus card and offered us advice on how to get around the next few days. We were also introduced to the best milk tea and best egg tart in Hong Kong - it was definitely good to have someone who can speak Cantonese! And boy, did we walk! We covered a lot of grounds in the 4 hour tour and it was the perfect opening to our trip in Hong Kong. If you are thinking about signing up for a tour with Ski, I'd advise you to go on a tour in the earlier part of your trip as she would be able to help you adapt so you can get around on your own later on.

Great personal guide!!. Ski was a wonderful guide in every way. She was very prompt in getting back to us before we left for Hong Kong and since we were meeting her on the second day of our stay she gave us tips on what to see so that there wasn't an overlap with her day. She tailored the tour based on our interests which included getting some Dim Sum, Snake soup, buying local artwork, and stopping for an afternoon drink:). She speaks English very well and it was like spending the day with a friend who happens to live in Hong Kong.

There is a reason why Ski Yeo is #1. For my wife's 50th birthday, we visited Hong Kong for the first time, and we had the good fortune to sign up with Ski Yeo at Big Foot Tour -- thank you, Tripadvisor for the tip. Being from Hawaii we are exposed to what tourists can be limited to, without the right info. A great tour of Hong Kong Chinatown via a leisurely stroll through its streets. We enjoyed the stories, the background and the entire experience. Thank you, Ski for a "local" take on Hong Kong, and the great advice regarding Macau, the racetrack and dim sum!

SKI IS THE BEST!. She helped us navigate a daunting mass transit system, walked with us to places that we'd never have seen on our own, took us to have dim sum with the locals, introduced us to snake soup, as well as showing us the beautiful garden at the nunnery on Kowloon--a wonderfully varied and interesting day. When my camera battery died, she took us to three different stores before we located the right one, and also helped us find a gift for our grandson. When we returned to our hotel, she sat down in the lobby with us and helped us plan for the next day when we were going it alone. With Ski's help, we discovered that Hong Kong was not just another big city, and only wish that we had had more time and another day with her. She is a bright, thoughtful, and energetic young woman. We would highly recommend Ski!

Remarkable experience. Ski had met us at the hotel and took us to great places that you can't find in blogs or websites. I was pushing my son's pram all over in a place where it is not pram friendly at all. She went out of her way to make sure that I can get an elevator. My Wife, my 2 year old son and I had fun and I really like the other part of hong kong that I had never seen before. Thank you Ski for a wonderful experience, we enjoyed it throughly.
We loved our walking tour with Ski.. What a charming and informative young woman. We are glad we found her company because the walking tour was over and above our expectations.

One of best 4 hours of this decade. I can call SKI not a tour guide but a good friend, a nice knowledgeable , intelligent, and cute person make the city so interesting that I never imagined of. It's like seeing the city inside out & ferry ride was awesome. Its a memoriable trip and I don't can ever forget Hong Kong & Ski.Take Care

knowledgeable, flexible, adaptive to your interests, fun to be with. This was our eighth trip to Hong Kong so we had seen all the tourists attractions and wanted to focus on local foods in the markets. Ski gave us four hours our first day and a broad education of what people eat as we toured various outdoor food markets, went to night markets to see food prepared on the street and were introduced to some food specialties we had not eaten before. The day was so successful we retained Ski' servicesfor our last day in the city. Ski is a delightful, resourceful young woman. We ended our visit feeling we had a very special friend in Hong Kong and that she greatly enhanced our visit.

The tour was superb as Ski was highly informative, flexible and utterly charming.. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour and we were taken to some very imaginative places. Ski' s in depth knowledge of Hong Kong was amazing and we would not have learnt nearly as much from any tour guide.

Great afternoon! Well worth it!!. I have done a few walking tours in other cities and have never had a great time.
