So, wasn't expecting too much of Ski's tour of Hong Kong however, I was pleasantly surprised. Before the tour Ski asked us a few questions about or likes and what we had already seen. After these few questions we set off. Ski not only created a perfect tour for us, but opened up Hong Kong. Her knowledge of the city is extremely impresive. We were able to visit restaurants that we would not be able to find (or order from). Anyone going to Hong Kong should book this tour!!!

Great day, great tour, great sites, GREAT GUIDE!. A friend and I did this tour on a recent trip to Hong Kong and had a great day, Ski was on time, friendly and very knowledgeable. We learned a lot in the short time that we were there about Hong Kong's people, sites and culture and had a great day. Thank you Ski :) Misty and Sophie!

If you're going to Hong Kong for the first time a tour with Ski Yeo is a must !". We recently went to Hong Kong for the first time and arranged a tour with Ski for the first full day of our holiday. Unfortunately Cathay Pacific had other ideas and due to technical issues with the plane our flight was cancelled and re-scheduled for more than 24 hours later. Ski was wonderful - despite being very busy she managed to fit us in for the same tour but a day later. We saw so many things we would never have found or understood if we had just wandered around on our own. We can honestly say that Ski helped to make our time Hong Kong truly amazing. Thanks Ski !Derek & Gill

Highly recommended, the best way to get to know Hongkong!. My husband and I were in Hong Kong New Year's Eve, we enjoyed the tour very much. Ski was perfect prepared for the tour. There was nothing that they didn't know. She made the tour according to our wishes and gave us a lot of tips for the next days. Thank you very much. Andrea and Mathias

Fabulous tour and lovely guide!. Ski Yeo was a wonderful guide with a lot of knowledge. She showed me everything you need to see in Hong Kong. Went on the Star Ferry, looked at the local markets, travelled on the longest escalator and lots more. It was 4 hours of non-stop sightseeing and great value for money. Ski is a lovely person and it was nice to have her company for that time. If you want to see Hong Kong in a short space of time, this is the company to go for!
number 1 tour!. very good! my guide ski is the best guide so far. we eat many things. we laugh a lot. very very happy after the tour. we will come back again!jiayou!

Outstanding Tourguide - very reliable - excellent service and value for money!. We chose to take a one day walking tour w/ Ski right after our cruise on Seabourn coming in from Singapore.She was reliable, charming, fun and helpful in every way. She even helped us put together a tour for the next day and went out of her way to make this Hong Kong stay a most memorable one. We truly recommend her and will call her for more sight seeing when we go back to Hong Kong.Make sure to reserve in time because she certainly is well booked! Thank you very much Ski!!!

our tour turned into a foodies paradise in HK. Ski was great! She met us at our hotel and the tour was really up to us.. Our tour group LOVE eating and the tour turned into more of a foodies tour.. We tried the turtle shell herbal jelly, the best egg tarts in HK, snake soup, stopped by one of the temples (i don't remember the name of it), and also stopped by the ladies markets where we experienced MORE eating.. stinky tofu, noodles in a bag, mango jelly pudding.. highly recommended tour if you want to experience HK from a local..

Unique tour that's definitely worth a mention.. Thank you, Ski. Tour was well-researched and you were extremely helpful. We feel relaxed through the whole tour and have a super great time. This tour gives me new (and higher) expectation for the tours that I would go in the future - out of the tourist maps areas as well as fun facts. Otherwise I think we would be stuck the usual tourist areas.This is what is missing in the market. I would recommend any tourist visiting Hong Kong to definitely do this!

great tour! i like how we didn't stand out like a tourist =). i feel strongly that this is the tour to go for if you visit Hong Kong. Many of us may want a guide who is knowledgable and bond like a friend. To me, on top of that, my main concern with going on tours is that I don't want to go around standing out as a group of westerners and end up getting high price for everything that I want to buy. True, we can bargain down the prices, but I rather have a more realistic starting price to begin with and save the extra time for other sights and scenes. This tour solves my problems for me. Great English, earnest attitude and it helps so much to have someone local going around with me. There is a natural ease when it comes to shopping, ordering food and even making sense of what the local people are saying. To be honest, it is also good that she does not look like a westerner. Most shop owners would think that she is my local friend and immediately give a lower price the moment we talk among ourselves. How fun is that? a pity that this tour company does not extend the service beyond Hong Kong. Now i am touring beijing and hoping to find a tour with a standard as high as what this tour company offers. wish me luck!!

Excellent Tour. Ski did a great job of providing an overview of Hong Kong that made the rest of our trip much more enjoyable. Booking was very easy with prompt email communication and we met up right in our hotel lobby. She helped us get familiar with the different neighborhoods and the various transportation methods which would definitely be more daunting without a guide. We did a six hour private tour which was just about perfect to see both sides of the city with a nice lunch break. The insight Ski provides will give you a good background on the sights and the people of Hong Kong. I would definitely recommend booking with Big Foot Tour!

Absolutely outstanding, book wity YSki you will be glad you did.. My wife and I were in Hong Kong on a cruise and ski met us at the cruise terminal and within minutes we were aboard a ferry crossing the bay to Hong Kong Island. We rode on thde world's longest escalater, walked through back ally shopping areas, went to Cat Alley the ancient antique market had lunch in a traditional Hong Kong restaurent. Boarded thde subway toured the flower and bird market which concluded our day. throughout the day Ski was a waliing eccyclopedia of local customs and stories. Thanks Ski for a wondeful day.

best tour in hong kong!. Superb tour. Price is fair and our guide, Ski, has strong work ethics. in today's climate where good service is tough to get, i think she did really well. when you are on a tour, the last you want is to feel that you want the tour to end, or that you can't communicate with the guide. But we didn't experience this with Big Foot Tour. Every minute was fun and interesting. At the end of the tour, when we told our guide that she did great and deserve a tip, she smiled and said (something to the extent of), "it's my responsibility. so keep your tip. you paid for your tour already." how impressionable is that? best tour, must go.

5-stars, no questions asked. It is our first time getting a private guide and without this, I'm sure we would have a bad start to our trip in HK. We ran into rude vendors, people who were pushing everywhere, as well as bad weather. Ski helps us through, negotiating, getting us through the crowd and more importantly, calming us down and bringing our mood back to the tour highlights. I wonder if she was a psychologist (or something) by training. On top of this, I noticed my wife was asking her so many questions that at certain point, I swear I was going crazy (only married couples will understand this haha). But she took the time to talk to my wife, and at the same time, made sure I was included in the conversation. When I walked off to take some photos on my own and then came back to them, she didn't leave it to my wife to repeat the sights to me, but told me everything personally.  I give her credits for her knowledge on Hong Kong, her patience, and for being able to wear that smile throughout the tour. All thumbs up from my family and me!

An absolutely fantastic and fabulous and great and wonderful tour guide!. Is there a 10 star rating that i can give to this guide???!Seriously, Ski is absolutely a wonderful guide. After the tour, we agree that the other reviews are really accurate - friendly, flexible, prompt, etc. Perhaps one understatement is that this is a rare tour guide with a good heart. You can feel it and you know that she is not trying to push for anything to go along her way or being extremely PR just because she probably has an incentive to please. Instead, you feel her sincerity in making friends and in really wanting to show you around the city - even though she does this on a daily basis. In fact, shortly after our 6-hours tour during the Christmas period, we bumped into her giving another tour to another guests. She still has that smile on her face and looks really excited about the city, even though she had been working the whole day during the festive week! Impressive! To me, it's evident. You wouldn't be able to do this unless you have passion for what you are doing (ok, and for walking). For the record, my body was aching (excuse my poor physical capability) after just a 6 hour tour with her, in a good way of course!Go for this tour and I assure you this lady is bound to make a difference to your trip! Go ski!

Awesome!!. Ski is an awesome travel guide. My husband, 11 year old son, 12 year old daughter, and myself went to Hong Kong for the first time during Christmas. We booked a tour with Big Foot Tours. This was my first time going to Hong Kong and my first time booking a tour with a personal guide. Ski helped to make our vacation very memorable. She showed us places that we would have never ventured out to on our own. She got along great with our kids and was very patient with answering our questions. My daughter wrote down every word that Ski said. When we returned home she created a PowerPoint based on the history that Ski shared and the places that she showed us and presented it to her history class. She made an A on it. If you are weighing the option of booking with Ski and Big Foot Tours, don't waste anymore time. Do it now. You will not regret it. You will cherish the memories that you will encounter for the rest of your life.

Lady with red shoes. After reading the fantastic reviews about Ski, I was curious to meet the girl with big foot and booked a tour. From our first contact in the morning, the tour itself and follow up Ski was super professional, prompt and extremely helpful. Ski provided a fascinating HK tour with great insights into the local lifestyle and odds and ends of every-day life. I like watching people closely and was very impressed by the hillside escalator (changing direction at 10:00am), the buzz of activities and the people on the market, the different vehicles on the street, the tradition that people alive can send gifts to dead people by burning faithful copies. I saw things that I know for sure I wouldn't see by myself or in a big tour group. Besides looking at tiny things the tour was peppered with historical and city information facts. Ski has an easy going and humorous personality with red sport shoes (normal size). At the end of the tour I was under the impression to know Ski already for years. I will definitely recommend Ski to my friends intending a visit to Hong Kong and I wish her great success in the future.

Seeing Hong Kong, the way it really is!. Knowledgeable, warm, fun Ski, shows you Hong Kong, the way it really is. 27-year old Ski walked the streets of HK for 2 years before hanging up a shingle to advertise her services as a tour guide. She won't inundate you with boring historical facts. Instead, she injects these, at appropriate times during your conversations throughout your tour. She tailors the tour to your interests, and she does adjustments throughout the day, as the tour progresses in case you change your mind about certain places and things. She will show you Hong Kong through the eyes of a local. Time with Ski is like taking in the sounds, sights, smells and feel of Hong Kong with a good friend. She is witty and fun, patient and yes .... This lady could walk! Will return and book a tour with Ski again ... To check out the outlying islands!

We've hired other guides many times in China, but Ski was the best.. My husband and I hired BigFoot for a six hour personalized tour of Hong Kong. Ski did a wonderful job of tailoring the tour to our requests and showed us parts of Hong Kong we would not have been able to find on our own or in the available time. Her spoken English is excellent and she has tremendous knowledge about the history of and the current situation in Hong Kong. We had a couple of questions which she couldn't answer (like where we could find the best antique maps of Hong Kong), but within an hour or so after leaving us she had emailed the info we needed. We greatly benefited from this tour and enjoyed her company as well, so it was a great day!

Turtelly wonderful. I booked Ski for a tour on my husband's birthday and he said that it was the best birthday he had ever had. Ski was friendly, had a great deal of knowledge and knew exactly what we wanted to see. We were interested in seeing the temples that the real Hong Kong people went to and to get within the skin of Hong Kong. Ski took us to places that we would never have found on our own and had it spot on. We visited a place that sold turtle jelly (delicious and made from turtle shell) and she arranged for my husband to have a tea that would help his cough which was interesting as I tasted it and him and I had two different takes on the flavour! We went for Dim Sum at one of the two last remaining places that still use a trolley. I can never resist a challenge so when we visited a snake shop I had to try the snake soup which again was delicious and yes tastes of chicken. Ski took us finally to 10000 Buddha's which was one of the best things for us in Hong Kong an absolutely amazing place. We went over our time with her and offered to pay for the additional hour, which she declined so we donated it to a temple at a later date.I dont feel I have done Ski justice in this review as she was just so wonderful in every way and I would definitely book another tour with her when we come back to Hong Kong. I suppose what I am trying to say is book Ski whether it is for a short time or the longer time you will not be disappointed, this is one young lady who deserves to continue with her success and neither my husband or I can rate her high enough.

Ski Is A Fabulous Guide!!. Our 2 days in Hong Kong with Ski are unforgettable. She is a knowledgable and personable guide. Ski took the time to learn about what we were interested in and combined that with showing us the highlights of Hong Kong which created an interesting and meaningful tour for us. We can't reccomend her highly enough.

Great way to get introduced to amazing Hong Kong. I am moving to Hong Kong in a few weeks time and was there on a business trip before the move so I thought it would be good to get introduced to the city by a tour guide. I saw the great reviews about Big Foot and got in touch with Ski and booked a personal tour that took in Central, Mid Levels, Sheung Wan, The Peak and The Star Ferry to Kowloon just in time for the light show.I have to say Ski was an excellent guide, very flexible, extremlely knowledgeable about Hong Kong and friendly which made my experience a very enjoyable one and when I move to Hong Kong it will be easier for me to find my way around.

Most interesting and efficient use of 4 hours in Hong Kong. First of all, book early because these tours fill up quick! Best to schedule your walking tour at the beginning of your trip if possible so your guide can answer any questions you have about the rest of your stay in Hong Kong. Request Ski Yeo as your guide. She is the best.I spent my first day in Hong Kong wandering around by myself and not really knowing what I was looking at. The next day I took the big foot walking tour and wow, what a difference. Ski was efficient in our walking path, took time to explain the meanings and interesting facts of each site, and gave me a whole new appreciation for Hong Kong. My tour guide Ski spoke english very well and she makes the tour really fun. Not sure why anyone would visit Hong Kong and not take this tour. The private tour is perfect for individuals, families, and couples because they can tailor the tour to any specific needs. I was in Hong Kong for 4 days and this was the best use of my time by far.

a different side to hong kong. Our guide Ski was delightful and showed my husband and I a side of hong kong we had not discovered on our previous trips to this enchanting city. Ski was informative and accommodating to our needs and as mentioned in all the other reviews, provided excellent suggestions on things to do for the remainder of our holiday.We had a lovely time with Ski and am sure you will too!

Superb Value for money. ok, i got to say i am a person who usually have reservations (and a little of a cheapskate) about spending to get a tour guide but ski totally proved me wrong! We like how the price is reasonable and not sky high in this worrying economy and how the tour doesn't force us to do something that we don't like, for e.g. factory outlets. some how, she seems to know where to get the best deals.  i think the tour is a perfect balance between professionalism (i.e. knowing the technical stuff) as well as making it a comfortable setting for all of us. Ski makes the tour interesting because unlike attending history lessons (just joking, no offence to all teachers), she is somehow able to let you know about Hong Kong in a very conversational manner, filled with her own interpretation and humour. clearly she cares and is attentive to details  our only regret is that we did not book her longer, because we thought we would be able to manage Hong Kong on our own. I mean technically speaking, we can, as it was a simple destination for us because we have been here before, and so have many of our friends who gave us their recommendations of shops and eateries to go. But the guide makes a difference. Ski's opinion adds a new dimension to Hong Kong and I will highly recommend her tour to anyone who is touring Hong Kong.Got to reiterate, her availability runs out fast (literally within a day mind you) so book her fast!

its exciting going around hong kong and so nice learning each part. it is our first time to see Hong kong (apart from Dubai) with a helping tour guide. Specially if your new to the place having with you ,someone who will teach you most of the stuff around, things that you should know and having like a friend that shows you around. even-though its like a 4 hours tour (just by walking to the main city) i did't felt that its been almost half of that day we've been walking seeing sites.We were really entertain from the places that we've been through.. But what i love most is the food!!! its really cool that even though we already have tasted it here in Dubai, its different taste it from the Hongkong.I really love it!!and our tour guide really brought us to the most known restaurant she knew.WE really had a great time. So next time you plan to tour the city for and dont have anyone. its really nice to have a tour guide to with you so your time wont get wasted figuring it by yourself and go thing you both be full both on the mezmering sites and food.!!!!ill definetely go back and bring my family along next time!!!to have the same experience!!!!i

Fun, educational, and a great way to see Hong Kong. We toured with Big Foot Tours for two days and really enjoyed our experience. Ski is very knowledgeable and there wasn't a question she couldn't answer about Hong Kong. Some highlights include touring through the Chinese part of HK as well the more European influenced part known as Soho. We did some street food tasting along the way and got a glimpse of what the locals like to eat, this included visiting the exotic street markets. We also walked through the beautiful flower markets that were in full swing in the time for the Chinese New Year. After spending these two days with Ski, we got a great feel for Hong Kong culture and way of life. I would definitely recommend reserving some time with Ski for your next visit to HK.

Most informative tour during my southeast Asia vacation!. My wife and I travelled to southeast Asia during the holidays. Ski's tour was by far the most informative private tour that we took. We really enjoyed the tourist perspective that Ski brings to the table since she ia not a local. Higly recommended!!

Excellent private tour ski is interesting nice and pleasent.. We take a private tour in hong kong with ski she is very interesting nice and know to fit the tour to us. Ski Show us some place in hong kong and Kowloon . She have a lot of knowledge and mor important a lot of patient .

Awesome way to see HK. My wife and I were on our honeymoon and we had decided on having a private guide to get a different perspective on HK. Ski met this and more. We did two tours with Ski checking out the bars and shopping. We are not big on temples so Ski did a great job of tying history, culture, food, shopping and bars all together. The thing we liked the most was home accomodating Ski was in making sure we had the experience we wanted to have and having the flexibility to stop and check out different things without working to a "schedule"If you want to see HK then I would highly recommend Ski's tour.

Best Walking Tour Guide In HK - Big Foot Tour. My wife and I hired Ski Yeo/"Big Foot Tour" for a private walking tour of HK & Kowloon. If a star rating system were to be applied to walking tours, Ski's tour would definetly be rated 5 STARS. Her vast knowledge of her subjects, pleasanat personality, and attentiveness to details helped make our vacation to HK most memorable. We set our own pace and our 8- hour tour flew by quickly. If one wants to see, feel, touch, and smell the real Hong Kong, then Big Foot Tour is your answer. Read more about this private tour company at Ski's web site of bigfoottour.com. Book early and enjoy your HK experience. By: Dudley10

Thorough, perfectly tailored, and organized. I can easily give this tour 5 stars. Ski showed up early to the meeting point, knew exactly where she was going at all times, answered all my questions (the ones she didn't know the answer to were emailed to me after the tour), provided a good background of information for the trip, and moved at whatever pace I wanted. She is also a good photographer! Even though I know she does this tour often, she didn't lose ambition or enthusiasm. What a great way to explore a new city. I recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind a walk!

What more is there to say - simply the best private tour!. Before booking a tour, I visited TripAdvisor to learn about the tours that Hong Kong offers. Maybe it's my work habits, I just had to do a rational comparison before committing to any tour. I zoomed into the top 2 on the list and it became clear very quickly that I should pick Big Foot Tour. Reasons being:1) Price - it's reasonable and way cheaper , even though it is number 1 on TripAdvisor! (Why does the other company charge so much more to begin with?)2) Quality - at that point, I couldn't judge except from taking a leap of faith in the great reviews posted as well as her email correspondences with me : prompt and helpful.Moreover, I noticed that there are a few common reviews between the two of them. Apparently there are people who went for both of their tours and her reviews are clearly better.After the tour, I feel even more strongly that I had made the right choice.1) Price - you get what you pay for...in fact, i think you get more than what you pay for! Probably work has gotten me very cynical so I was expecting some surcharges here and there (especially since her price is way lower than the other company). But surprisingly (and I'm not complaining), there is no hidden cost. She doesn't expect you to pay for her share of meals, transport and neither does she wants a tip! She would always politely refuse. There's no awkwardness at the end of the tour ( you know how sometimes service people tend to linger around hoping for tips...).2) Quality - the reviews thus far have been right. Flexible, fun, no commercial 'factory outlets' to go, speaks good english, know her stuff. I don't know what more to expect from a private guide. It's comfortable touring with her because there isn't a pressure or a divide. It's like hanging out with a friend who happens to live in Hong Kong.Conclusion: if you are looking for a reliable guide with reasonable pricing, I will highly recommend Ski from Big Foot Tour.

Fantastic day in Hong Kong with Ski. We spent a day (along with close friends) on a walking tour guided by Ski Yeo of Big Foot Tours. It was fantastic! Areas we saw included taking the metro to Central; the Mid Level Escalator; Soho; Hollywood Road; Man Mo Temple; Cat Street Market; Lin Heung Tea House (for Lunch); Old Chinatown (Sheung Wan); Victoria Peak and the Star Ferry. 2 of the highlights of the day were the view from the top (Victoria Peak) - simply breathtaking - along with lunch at the Lin Heung Tea House. We walked in to a dynamic, bustling restaurant where as best we could tell we were the only 'westerners' - a truly authentic Asian experience of Dim Sum. One of the women at our table didn't speak English but was willing to share her pot of tea with us! At another stop, our adventurous friends even tried snake, which apparently tastes alot like chicken.Throughout the day, Ski did a great job of informing us all about the culture and everyday goings-on of life in Hong Kong. She knew not only the streets and the areas well, but also had interesting things to say about the areas. The markets are also fascinating to experience, again to appreciate the truly diverse items that make up the Hong Kong and Asian diet.All in all we would highly recommend Ski for a unique and highly enjoyable experiencing of Hong Kong!

Super Ski!!....Fun, Interesting & Eclectic...Hong Kong Shown at it's Best!!. When we first contacted Ski, we had a list of places we wanted to see, but had limited time. Ski was prompt in all communication. She put together our itinerary based on our must see locales, but also included some of her own (we loved the incense infused temple). An impromptu stop for snake soup was incorporated for my husband (really does taste like turkey). The amiable owner gave us the added delight of pulling out a live snake so that we could forever capture this memorable stop. Ski covered both the British Colonial and Chinese perspectives in an easy going and fun way. We loved Hong Kong and highly recommend Ski to bring this incredible city to life.......Craig & Brenda Hill, Calgary, Canada

Very good service!. my english not good but Ski very patient with me. we were in a group and she did not leave me alone. come and talk to me to make sure everything ok. we go many places in hong kong: temples, little streets, many great food! thai very different from chinese - so i'm happy we see hong kong with her. if not i cannot understand the signboards or culture and history. thank you ski.

A Great way to explore Hong Kong. My wife and four year old daughter wanted to experience a trip around Hong Kong and learn more about the region, find some good places to eat and bargains to be had. Big Foot allows you to completely customise your tour. Just let them know what sort of things you want to do and they put it together for you within whatever time you have. The website was really helpful and we got a response quickly from the team confirming our requirements and providing an outline plan for our approval. Our guide was prompt and friendly. Our often shy daughter warmed to her quickly and was sorry to see her go atthe end of the day. We confirmed everything before we took off and was really confident in the guide looking after us. It was really up to us how much we did in the end and fast we were going to go. The travel times on the MTR were filled with interesting facts and stories about history of where we were going and the way people live and work around Hong Kong. We set our own place and our guide was able to help us answer any questions we had, offered additional information and sought out solutions to any problems or questions we had. She was also happy to wait while we looked a certain shops, went to a tailors she recommended and gave us a great experience of the markets and the food of Hong Kong.For the tours, have a look around web sites for what you may be interested in from cultural sites, to special shops or tailors you may want to visit. Think about what sort of thing you want to eat and how long you want to go for. We did six hours and was about right to see enough of the place. The day is not rushed so you can stop and rest as you need.The walking was not too arduous at all. Our four year old is a pretty good walker and only wanted to be carried a little through the day. The MTR is used to get around as well, it is worth getting everyone an 'Octupus Card' prior to the tour with about HK$100 on it to cover your rides around the area. A small backpack with hats, sunscreen, water and some snacks are a good idea. You are rarely far from a place with a bathroom. While Hong Kong has a series of hills but the Big Foot is well planned to reduce this to a minimum. If you have small kids who are not that keen with walking a light-weight stroller is a good idea, but needs to pack down quickly to get on the MTR and carry up steps in some places.I would highly recommend a Big Foot Tour and was a real highlight of our holiday.

Big Foot Tours. It's hard to say any more about Ski than other reviews. They're all right on. When we left her at our hotel it was like saying good by to our daughter. Exceptionally knowledgeable of all things Hong Kong, catered to our wants, and friendly and cheerful all day long. The Felix bar in the Peninsula Hotel was a nice way to end the day. We really missed her on day 2.

Ski is a terrific host and guide for Hong Kong. We asked for a private tour of Kowloon with Ski as our guide and what a good idea that was. We were at the beginning of an extensive tour of Hong Kong, India, Thailand, Cambodia and Vietnam. During our travels over two months we used the services of nearly twenty guides at various points and Ski is in the top one or two that showed us around. We spent our time in Kowloon with her and had a great experience moving through the markets and having her explain the foods, restaurants, street activities and making recommendations for more activities for our remaining time in Hong Kong. We took in the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple, the beauful Nan Lian Gardens and the Ladies Temple Street Night Markets. Highly recommended.

Good times. We had two walking tours around Hong Kong with Ski while we were there for our honeymoon. She was fantastic. Very informative about the history and culture of Hong Kong and open to our input as to where we wanted to go and what we wanted to see and do. We spent a morning walking around Hong Kong Island sampling some local food, seeing the city and how it works, shopping and talkiing to her about the culture. On our second tour we went to an amazing Chinese garden in the city, which we loved and would never have seen without Ski, and then she took us to some bars where we could people watch and see the lights of the city. It really was just like hanging out with a friend showing their city. I would recommend Ski to anyone who wants to get to know Hong Kong better than they could on their own!

Like meeting up with an old friend who knows Hong Kong so well!. We would thoroughly recommend you book a tour with Ski. Hong Kong has something for everyone and Ski has such dedicated knowledge leaving her clients with a fantastic understanding of this vastly colorful and layered culture. We were so impressed with Ski's cultural, socio-political and entertainment knowledge - she really ticked every box for us. The tour was personalized and completely tailored to fit our specific wishes. Whatever you want to learn or access in Hong Kong - Ski is the person to help you!Lisa TMelbourne, Australia

Best guide ever!!. When we travel, we very often go with a private guide for at least one day as inevitably, that day is the highlight of the trip. We have loved all of our guides so to stand out as the best amongst a really special group is something indeed. But Ski was the most wonderful, warm, knowledgeable guide we have had. I can't tell you how much she added to our trip to Hong Kong. We had two 6 hour days with her and honestly, we wish we had booked more! The first day was the overview of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon that others have talked about but my favorite day was yesterday when we went to the 10,000 Buddhas Monastery, the Chi Lin Nunnery, the Ladies market and a cafe known to locals as having the quintessential Hong Kong food. We were traveling with our two children and they were both truly sad to say goodbye to Ski, as were my husband and I. I know people say you can do Hong Kong on your own, because the public transportation is so good and the signs are in English but I guarantee you will see more, and more importantly you will see a more authentic version of Hong Kong with Ski. We are a family of foodies so I asked her if we could try certain foods I had read about, so she made sure we got to try every single thing on our list. She was friendly, approachable and so full of fascinating facts about the city and Chinese culture. She also helped us plan the days we would have on our own. One last thing that speaks volumes about Ski. As we were saying goodbye our first day, my 9yo son asks the meaning of some of the zodiacs. I told him that he could ask that again tomorrow as it was getting late. That night the bell boy knocks on our door with a package of information on all the zodiac signs that Ski had dropped off to the hotel, plus a color map of the area we had planned to visit on our own the next day. Amazing. But the word is out - book early as she is filling up quickly!!

Lantau Island's A Must-See When In Hong Kong!. I’ve been to Hong Kong so many times that I’ve lost count, and because it has many similarities to where I’m from, my visits were mainly to work, to dine, and to shop. However, since retiring from work, I’ve been keen on deeper exploration during my travels around the world. Hong Kong presented a challenge in this regard, as I wanted to see it from a fresh perspective.After doing some research, I decided to focus on Lantau, which is the largest island in Hong Kong, and the sixth largest in China. Although it is only 35-kilometres from the heart of the metropolis that is Hong Kong, and although it is where modern facilities like the International Airport and Disneyland are located, its greenery makes a sufficiently refreshing change to the concrete-jungle environment that I am so used to in this city. I focused my exploration of Lantau on the Ngong Ping 360 cable-car ride, with its enjoyable vistas of the surrounding mountainous terrain and dense forestry, the International Airport, and the 34-metre high statue of Buddha; the colourful and interesting Po Lin Monastery; and the rustic and quaint Tai O fishing village. These three destinations did give the new take on Hong Kong that I was seeking. For those of you planning on these destinations, I would recommend wearing comfortable walking gear, as the monastery and fishing village are best explored on foot. Also, at the fishing village, you may want to pass on taking a boat ride to sight white dolphins in the Zhujiang River Estuary, as they are elusive, and you may not get your money’s worth.In addition, I would recommend paying extra to ride the “Crystal Cabin” class of cable-car as its glass flooring is interesting, as well as paying extra to buy the “Journey of Enlightenment” package as it gets you onto the priority queue that is much faster than the regular queue, as the latter can take up to more than a hour on a bad day.By the way, according to netizens, visitors should be careful with the shopping, as many vendors are tourist traps. Nevertheless, if you are a shopping addict, the Citygate mall of brand-name factory outlets is located right on top of the Chung Tung subway station, which is the entry point to the Ngong Ping 360 cable-car ride, and you may want to spend some extra time here.Other attractions which I did not cover include the Tung Chung Fort, a remnant reflective of this island’s deep history as a Southern Song Dynasty refuge, a Portuguese and British trading settlement, and as a resistance hideout from the Japanese during World War II; and the 70-kilometre Lantau Trail with its hilly terrain, parks, and beaches. Also, photography buffs may also wish to stop at the Lantau Link Visitor Centre for the pretty night-time views of this 3.5-kilometre series of two bridges and one viaduct.Last but not least, I wish to thank Ms Ski Yeo of Big Foot Tour for bringing me around Lantau. Her command of the English language is excellent; she listens to and understands my preferences as an Asian tourist, as well as a photography buff; she was able to ply me with a wealth of information that allowed me to better appreciate the sights I was viewing, but knew when not to interrupt when I was occupied with taking a photo; and she helped me lower the cost of this trip by using public transportation wherever practical.

Fantastic-Ski is so knowledgable and fun. We now all agree that all the reviews about Ski and Big Foot Tours were right and we are just so glad we spent half a day with Ski on Hong Kong Island in fact we had such a good time the 4 hours turned into 6 .Ski met us at our Hotel in Kowloon and asked if there were any specific things we wished to see or as we explained we just wanted to get an overview of Hong Kong so it was off to the Bus firstly getting a Octopus Card which Ski explained we could use on all public transport saving the need to continually be looking for change,these cards can also be topped up during your stay and any credit can be refunded at the Airport, Bus to ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island we walked around China Town and had many of the traditions explained to us including the "snake shop" and the "funeral shop" then Ski took us to the oldest Dim Sum restaurant in Hong Kong for a bite to eat she made suggestions on food and of course had to do all the ordering as this is not a place for westerners normally,then walked around the Chinese markets onto the travelator thru Soho and a Pink Elephant beer at the Globe,and thru all the little laneways ,all the time Ski was telling us all the about the area ,it's history and many other little snippets of information that made it so interesting. Time did not seem to worry Ski at all she was more than happy to linger at various places take our photo and laugh along with our odd joke or two. Onto the bus to the peak via the local area and there were some very interesting sights on the way looking over Happy Valley race course and all the high rise apartments buildings as we wound our way up to the peak much better than the "tourist route".we then caught the tram back down and Ski escorted us to the ferry to, sadly for us,say goodbye.Ski's English is really good, she is extremely friendly and knowledgable and so willing to be flexible and accomodating to your wishes. We had a great time and learnt so much about Hong Kong and would recommend any person going to Honk Kong to get in touch with Ski at Big Foot and book at least a half day tour on your first day. You will then know and have the confidence to travel on public transport, and have a very good overall view and knowledge of Hong Kong so you can go back into some of the areas for dinner or drinks at night.We wish Ski all the best and are sure she will be very successful

The only way to go. I had a spare day prior to my return flight so I thought it would be best to go for a 1-1 walking tour. I spent almost 6 hours with Ski entirely on Hong Kong Islands seeing streets, shops and temples I had no idea about. Also, tried out turtle jelly (yes, I did like it) and had a great lunch in a place I would never have found myself. Requires some stamina but Ski is great fun and you will learn much about Hong Kong without being lectured at. I warmly recommend this - the only way to learn more about the city and its people in a few short hours.

The private tour rocked!. With all the set tours booked, I did the private tour with Ski and highly recommend it. She tailored the itinerary to our interests and showed us things we would never have found on your own. Local design stores, best egg tart in HK, rooftop bar with killer view and recommendations for the rest of our trip - these were just some of the items covered. My only regret is that I didn't do the tour earlier so I could have made the most of my new insider knowledge. I highly recommend Ski & her tours. Book one now!

Great way to see a different side of Hong Kong. 4 of us participated in this 6 hour walking tour which was so different to the normal touristy sightseeing tour. Ski took us to the "must see" places as well as other areas you would not normally visit. She was great fun and gave us a great insight into the real Hong Kong. Would highly recommend her tour as a great way to see the city.

Flexible, Fun and Friendly - What More Could You Want?. When my cousin and I wanted a one-day overview of Hong Kong, we booked a tour with Ski based on the TripAdvisor feedback - and we were not disappointed. Ski arrived early and put us in her very capable hands right away. She asked us our preferences for travel (ferry or subway), and adapted to meet our preferences. Ski knows her history, her way around town, and how to take care of customers. When we got hungry early, she adjusted the schedule to make lunch happen. When we got tired, she slowed down. When we wanted recommendations for the next day, she gave us great information. I would highly recommend using Ski for anyone who wants to get to know HK inside and out!

Just Do It!. I reserved a 12 hours tour with Ski and would do another all over again! Great pre, during and post tour experience. We went to old Chinatown areas, markets (temple street, jade, ladies), Soho, Kowloon, Nan Lian Garden, parks, 1881 Heritage, Hollowood Road, Cat Street, Man Ho Temple, St John's Cathedral and a few more.She was a pleasure to deal with from the start in our email correspondence where we finalized my tour agenda until the end of the tour and afterward too, sent me an email on certain things I wanted to know more about! She speaks fluent English and her intelligence and dedication to her tours comes across clearly from her in depth knowledge and research of everything Hong Kong. She did her prep work prior to starting her business and if there's anything she doesn't know, she will find out and tell you. There was no a single question i asked her which she didn't know the answer to. Well prepared and equipped, she knows the area, the culture, the food, everything and takes her job seriously towards a WIN WIN experience for both her reputation and your experience. There were times when I was tired and wanted to rest but she was active all through & infact wanted to show me more places that we agreed on if so I could see as much as possible & imagine at no extra cost. Infact, she barely looked at her watch to signal the end of a tour - only in the middle to manage her time and itinerary.What I loved most about her tours is that there was no hidden costs and she clearly came across as a person not doing this for the money (hard to explain until you meet her). She stated a price, we settled it on paypal and that was it. She ensured my costs were minimal by guiding me on local transport, taking me to eat at great joints yet which didn't cost an arm and a leg, paid for her own meals. tickets etc. and infact treated me to my first meal (dinner) in Hong Kong which touched me. Infact, even at the markets when she knew i didn't have change and she did, she insisted on paying for my purchases (as we had bargained and she didn't want the street vendors not returning the difference) and I paid her the lumpsum amount. Seriously, who does that?! She gave me great advice like using what I would pay back home as a base rate for the markets, walking away from insistent vendors, tips on getting around, water, etc.I would recommend taking a longer tour with her as you need to consider travel time to and fro in addition to seeing what you want to, wear comfortable clothing and shoes, and carry water. Anything else you need, Ski will guide you to. She is AMAZING and the most value for money out there with a strong work ethic & I wish her all the very best in her tours.My only wish is that she did Macau tours as well!!!

Ski Yeo of Big Foot Tours a truly perfect guide!. Ski Yeo and Big Foot ToursI’d like to say at the outset that ALL the previous reviews about Ski and Big Foot Tours are spot on!!!Originally from Singapore, Ski moved to HK to grow her business and how lucky for the rest of us looking for a guide that is unparalleled in all aspects.My mom and I were travelling to Vietnam and Cambodia early this past October. She thought that I might like to see HK and because we were going to be in that part of the world we might as well stop over for a quick 48 hours. She was given Ski’s name by a friend who lives in Hong Kong, who had highly recommended her. We made arrangements to have Ski accompany us for 4 hours in the afternoon on the first day and then again 4 hours in the morning the second day. She met us at our hotel in Kowloon, and then we were off on the MTR. Ski made sure we stopped to purchase the cash cards for the Metro and bus system so that we did not have to always be bothered with looking for HK dollars and/or change (and by the way she informed us that if we did not use up the entire amount on the card that we could stop at the desk at the airport and they would happily refund our money, which they did no problem in HK dollars.) We had told Ski we were not interested in the usual “tourist traps” but wanted to see any of the markets/restaurants/sights that only the locals would visit and that is exactly where she took us: outdoor food markets, department store and a local restaurant. She was happy to go over the allotted time, and we happily said no thanks as we were exhausted! Second day out, again picked us up from our hotel and this time we headed to the Peak on the Star Ferry. My mom thought it might be nice for us to take the tram up, but Ski advised against this as the queue is about 2 hours long and that would be a waste of our short time with Ski and she was right. Once on HK Island we headed for the #15 bus and took that up to the top…perfect way to see the neighborhoods and just how narrow the roads are with all the great twists and turns as you are looking down on Victoria harbor and real estate below the bus route! Ski suggested a walk on the paved path at the top that affords lovely views again of the harbor and Kowloon. Had a brief stop a the Haagen Dazs shop for an ice cream before we all took the bus back down and she dropped us off at Star Ferry terminal to head back to Kowloon and the end to a lovely 2 days with Ski.Ski speaks perfect English, is very friendly , quite accommodating and thoughtful. She was very concerned about my mom always checking with her as to whether or not she was tired or needed a break..an unexpected change in plans was absolutely fine with her. At the end of our time with Ski she provided us with a very user friendly map of HK, a bag of face masks for Ho Chi Minh city and a fan all of which were much appreciated. My advice is to: book early, by-pass all other local guides and go directly to Big Foot Tours and expect a great time with a truly perfect guide..you will not be disappointed!!

Great start for a first time visitor. We are used to travel off the beaten path routes and wanted an authentic experience on the areas of Hong Kong that our local friends won't take us on impromptu visits. We chose to take the Kowloon tour (the peninsula part of HK). We definitely enjoyed sharing this time with Ski. She is very knowledgeable and helpful, her insights on Hong Kong daily live were eye-opening.

Great personlised tour - highly recommended. I went on a tour with Ski in late October 2011. As I was staying on Hong Kong Island and was seeing much of it with the friend I was visiting, I asked Ski to show me another part of Hong Kong to get a deeper understanding of life there. She decided to show me around Kowloon, north of HK Island, with a very different feel to it. We met at Mong Kok MTR station and did a walking tour around the area for four hours. She asked me if there was anything specific I wanted to visit. I didn't know anything about Kowloon and so she showed me the highlights. We visited the Yuen Po Street Bird Garden, walked through the vast food and flower markets, had my fortune told at Wong Tai Sin Temple and finished up at the famous Ladies Market. I am really pleased I found Ski because otherwise I would have missed out on the other life in Hong Kong, away from the sky scrapers, ex-pat culture and the hundreds of other tourists. If you are happy walking for a few hours whilst finding out more about Hong Kong then I would highly recommend this tour. At the end, if you fancy it, Ski will take you for a well-deserved traditional chinese snack/meal - the only real Chinese food I ate on my visit, I am sad to say!!tourists.

We saw things we would have missed!. Our day with Ski was the best day out of our short visit to Hong Kong. She was able to show us things we would have missed. The gardens, the best dumplings and the great beer! Ski was knowlegable and sweet. We had her laughing at our American humor, and we loved spending time with her.It was drizzly and much cooler this particular day and that helped with the humidity and the crowds seemed less.....crowded. But that is what Hong Kong is all about. Ski guided us to the jade market where my friend bought gifts for her daughter and I found special gifts for family as well. We saw the most beautiful gardens right in the middle of the city. The nunnery was off limits, but that's ok. And to the peak at night for a spectacular view of the city lights.You need good comfy walking shoes, a light rain jacket, and plenty of energy! A camera of course and a sense of humor and adventure. And Ski's email address,

Great walking tour!. Going on the 8 hour private tour with Ski was one of the highlights of my trip to Hong Kong. Before going to Hong Kong, we e-mailed back and forth about what my mom and I wanted see and experience through the tour. She was able to come up with the perfect, personalized itinerary that included our interests in shopping and experiencing Hong Kong culture(ie: getting a close up look on how they handle their live produce at the markets). The tour was well executed and Ski was very thoughtful and asked if we needed a break from all the walking whenever we looked tired. She was also very knowledgeable about Hong Kong and was able to answer all my questions about their history, government system and pop culture. I thoroughly enjoyed listening to her impressions/reactions about Hong Kong culture from her point of view as a Singaporean and contrasting them with my own views as an Korean-American. Overall I had a great time with Ski! She was fun and made the 8 hour tour only seem like 4 hours. I would highly recommend her as a guide!

Two fun days in Hong Kong. My wife and I had so much fun touring around Hong Kong with Ski from Big Foot Tours. We usually go on tours with a single guide and driver. This was a tour with a single guide and public transportation, and we had so much fun. Ski knows all the great food stops, bathroom locations and some great shopping. Her English is very good, along with her sense of humor.Thank you Ski!

the best first impression of Hong Kong. I'd never been to Hong Kong before and wanted to get straight into the place without the usual info overload by digesting guidebooks. Having just 1 day and 1 night in HK en route to NZ, I couldn't have picked a better guide. Ski Yeo provided a tailor-made personalised guide which gave me the best introduction to HK. We spent the first few hours in the evening in the Kowloon markets and snacked our way through the entire walk. The next morning was a visit to Hong Kong Island. Quite a contrast from Kowloon. Walking through the CBD to the old chinatown provided a new-to-old nostalgic contrast. Dim Sim in one of the few remaining push-trolley restaurants was a highlight. All in all, the best first impressions of Hong Kong.

Learn New Things about Hong Kong. I have been to Hong Kong several times and finally decided that a walking tour maybe interesting. I joined the group walking tour for HK (central area) on a rainy day. So we had a wet start. What I think is really good about Ski was that she tried to gauge what people wanted to get out of the walking tour and try to tailor the program accordingly. She kept on checking that everyone was fine along the way. She managed to keep me interested and also provided me with information about HK that I did not know before. So yes, if you are in HK, I think the walking tour organised by Big Foot Tour is a very good way to spend your time there. I think she does private tours as well.

Wonderful introduction to Hong Kong. Ski was a charming guide. She introduced us to Hong Kong and brought it to life for us.We visited Downtown, Chinatown,temples,the Heights etc. We ate lunch in a Dim Sum restaurant which was a fascinating experience. Ski was easy to understand and prepared to tailor the trip to our requirements. She also taught us how to get around using buses and the Metro and advised us on places to visit during the rest of our stay. When we overran on time by over an hour, she would not accept any extra payment or tip. We wholeheartedly recommend her.

We really recommend Big Foot Tour.... We did a walking tour in Hong Kong and everything was ok, we had a lot of fun . Ski Yeo is a very nice professional, friendly and knows everything about the city . We really recommend Big foot tour...

Knowledgeable, interesting and fun - definitely try Big Foot Tour. My husband and I booked with Big Foot Tours as we love experiencing new foods and the recommendations were great. We met Ski, our lovely guide in Mongkok - in fact she found us as she had looked up my profile on Facebook so she could recognize me - now that is forward thinking and gave us an immediate insight into how sharp, intelligent and knowledgeable she actually is.We loved the fact that we just ambled at our own pace around the brightly coloured markets and Ski filled us with information about life, culture and living in Hong Kong.We tried various foods that we would never of had the courage to try, and she took us into places we would never have dreamed of going into. I think that's the beauty of booking a private tour, you have the freedom to go and try something completely new. The highlight was trying bubble tea, an unusual beverage containing tapioca pearls and the roasted pork - fabulous!Try Big Foot Tours, you won't be disappointed.

The best way to get to see Hong Kong. My Wife, my son (5 years old) and I, were visiting Hong Kong for the first time. We were in transit and we just had 3 days to get around this city. Taken a tour with Ski at Big Foot Tour was the a great desicion we made. She planned the tour in advance based on our requirements and her experience. She was very patient as we were traveling with our Five Years Old son. She look after him all the time. She takes you wherever you want to go at your own pace. She is very knowledgable about Chinese culture. We strongly recomend Big Foot Tour. Bring confy shoes as you will walk for hours.

Delightful afternoon wandering Hong Kong with my local guide. My husband & I began our 3 week honeymoon with a few days in Hong Kong. We decided to book a tour with a local from a site we found online. We were not sure what to expect but it turned out to be the best thing we did! My husband got sick as we first arrived in Hong Kong so the day of our tour Ski (our FAB tour guide) was flexible enough to reschedule with us until the following day in hopes ofmy hubby feeling better. Regrettably, he was still sick the next day but I got to entertain myself with Ski for the afternoon. It was a 4 hour walking tour (we started at 10:30am) which was perfect since I wanted to try some local cuisine for lunch. Ski picked me up at our hotel and inquired about what my interests were. I was mostly interested in shopping where the young, hip locals shopped and trying some local cuisine. Ski took me to the street markets first where I was able to pick up some unique souvenirs for friends and family and take some cool pictures of the busseling market. Ski is very knowlegable of the history of Hong Kong as well as where to go and what do to based on your likes and dislikes. She was very pleasant, spoke perfect English and was a delight to hang out with. She even took me to a famous (and her favorite) noodle bar to get my hubby a hot cup of noodles for his cold! She was truly awesome and my time in Hong Kong wouldn't have been the same without her! Thank you Ski - looking forward to showing you around Miami when you decide to venture West!

Brilliant. The "Big Foot" food tour gives you a taste of the real HongKong cuisine granting you a rare insight into the local tastes / customs of the area with on hand information that adds a unique experience and appreciation for the cuisine.From the simple to the most exotic, the tour provides a wide range of food varieties/samples to suit even the most ardent foodie. It's highly tailored to give you a personal insight into the various naunces/intricacies of the cuisine in the different areas of Hong Kong as well as immersing you in the culture at a pace and time that suits you.I would highly recommend this tour to anyone interested in food for it combines not only the food aspect/culture of the area but it takes you to places where the average tourist doesn't go exposing authentic undiscovered gems that will stay with you for a long time.

Awesome walking tour!. My husband and I really enjoyed our walking tour. Ski was very sweet and knew a lot about Hong Kong. It is a much better way to see the real Honk Kong than the group tours. We will definitely book another tour next time we are in Honk Kong!

Rare service quality in Hong Kong - great even for elderly. If there's a private tour you should go for in HK, i strongly recommend going for Ski from Big Foot Tour. Witty, interesting, informative and most importantly of all, she managed to keep my parents in their 50s extremely happy for a full 8 hours!! (I'm seriously contemplating learning a tip or 2 from her...) My parents came to visit and I signed them up for an 8 hour tour with Big Foot Tour and thank god i did that. The guide (Ski) was very patient, especially since my parents walk at a slow pace and erm.. not easy to please. I know my dad loves history but my mum would rather spend time shopping (the standard conflict of interest you know) and I wondered if Ski will know how to handle in case they start going into their usual 'loving' banter. Nonetheless, all these doubts were erased immediately when i joined them midway and was greeted by my smiling parents who seemed more impressed with Ski than the skyscrapers in hong kong. A feat definitely and kudos to her.We were shown an interesting side of Hong Kong that i never knew existed even though i had been working here for years. Asked her for really local eateries and she showed me this place that was so near to my office I never knew existed! You will never believe that it is a place for eatery to begin with! Even my local colleagues didn't know about it. She clearly knows her way around Hong Kong. Ok, maybe that's her job, but if so, she does it really well!She certainly has a way with elderly and on top of that, she speaks great English and all of us had no issue communicating with her right from the start. In addition, she was able to maintain an extremely good balance of all our interests (history for my dad, shopping for my mum and food for me!). Am sure if my parents were to write a review for her, it will definitely be more raving than mine.Keep up the good job Ski and a total of 6 thumbs up! P.S. for my parents as well =)

impressive. personalized right from the start.. it was good from the start. from the email enquires till booking till the day of tour. there's nothing we have to be worried about. she knows hong kong well and she's generous with her recommendations and hong kong tips. i think u have to book early though - her tours seem to get booked fast as our first choice of date was not available. other than that, if you ask me of a great tour in hong kong, i'll say... this is it!

value for money. guide is polite, humble and interesting. No hard-selling, no trips have to be made to commercial stores outlet, everything was simply to what we want. even when we decided to not go alo! ng with the initial plan because we were getting tired, no complaints made and she came up with a different attraction immediately that suit our mood. considering the quality of service, i think the price is reasonable, way cheaper compared to other private tours we enquired for hong kong. this is the first private tour that we go for, and well, it certainly sets the mood for us to want to start looking for private tours the next time we travel to other countries!good job! keep it up, ski.

pleasant surprise. definitely should go for her tours!. to be honest, i was expecting boring touristy stuff that i had read on the guidebooks. i wasn't even sure if we had made the right choice to go for the tours when we can possibly walk around ourselves if it was all the stuff on guidebooks and internet. when i expressed my concern during my emails to her before the tours, i was caught by surprised. she was eager to please (and that actually worries me a little initially because i was afraid of a higher set of disappointment) and told me that she will get it sorted out for me. on the tour day itself, she delivered her promise, bringing us to places that wowed us. i didn't know that Hong Kong has such rural sides! We visit a old walled village and ate at some rundown-looking place where the food was really good! I had the impression that it was all concrete buildings, all about modern shopping and eating. so it was definitely a sight worth catching and all the walking.  overall, i like the private tour. it was very customized and she was very considerate towards our needs in her planning. I actually asked if she had the time to bring us around the next day, but too bad, she mentioned she was already fully-booked but generously gave me some tips on where to head. i'll find her again if I ever tour Hong Kong again.

Great Snapshot of Honk Kong with the little time we had. We were met at the airport by our guide (Ski) and from then until we returned 3.5 hours later we didnt have to worry about a thing. She had arranged where we could leave our baggage, cashcards for each of us to facilitate transport and a coffee purchase. We were then given a great snapshot of the city within the time constraints and time that we had.

Great Service.. Made plenty of business trips to hong kong over the year, and by now, during our free time, we have gone for bus tours, city tour, hotel concierge day tours and then this Big Foot Tour.  All the previous tours we went had similiar attractions and we weren't looking forward to this tour by Big Foot Tour - it was just a "company event" to us, if you know what i mean. But I must say this is the best among all because we get to see really interesting aspects of Hong Kong on our feet. We actually get to walk around Hong Kong a fair bit - instead of the usual of getting down the bus, take a few pictures and then leave for the next attraction. One word - Refreshing.  For corporate workers like us who hardly walk or exercise, the trip wasnt as tiring as we thought. The guide has a funny way of relating hong kong facts to us.

highly recommended, a friendly sincere Hong Kong personal guide.. Went for a private tour with 3 other friends of mine around Hong kong island 2 weeks ago on a 6 hours tour lead by ski. Besides her in depth knowledge of HK, what struck me and my friends from the hours of conversations with her is that she is one of the more, if not most, friendly private tour guides around. To be honest, i have been on other private tours in cities like NY, taiwan etc but none came across as sincere and affable as her. Felt more like a friend leading me around versus the typical tourist kind style. In short: friendly, knowledgable and considerate, even when the weather was really bad (heavy rain). There were some pleasant treats along the way (for e.g. she bought us famous hong kong snacks to try). And the sights that she showed us were really local and interesting - not the usual tourist attractions stuff. Highly recommended!

Kowloon Walled City and Food Adventure. Olivia Tang guided us on a very interesting and ineractive tour. It was pouring down rain part of the time but she made it fun and had listening devices she gave us to wear around our necks to make sure we could hear over the typhoon. We were able to see many sights and foods we would have never experienced had we not ventured out with Olivia. Highly recommend tour.

"Kowloon Walled City And Food Adventure" with Olivia. My friends and we booked a private Kowloon Food Adventure with Olivia and had the best, most authentic time ever. It was the highlight of our trip to Hong Kong, in fact. Olivia is super bright and well-connected to the community, but her knowledge of (and passion for) her city is perhaps (if possible) outweighed by her sense of humor and warm and wonderful personality. It poured (the weather gods somehow missed the forecast for the rain to have tapered into tolerable showers) the entire time, but we hardly noticed. Olivia soldiered on and we were more than happy to follow. She walked us down streets in which we were the only tourists in sight, and was warmly greeted by passersby and the shop owners we visited. The clear affection of the vendors and neighbors for Olivia allowed them to greet all of us as though we were simply an extension of her family. We learned things we'd never had learned on our own, visited streets and vendors we'd never have found on our own, and sampled authentic Kowloon-fare we'd have never even have heard of had it not been for this tour and its fabulous guide. If you go to Hong Kong, be sure and check in with Walk In Hong Kong. Ask for Olivia. I promise, you'll not be sorry!

Informative, entertaining and enjoyable, excellent tour!. I joined the 'Hello Hong Kong tour' led by Olivia on Oct 2. It was a beautiful Sunday, and the tour turned out to be more agreeable! Beginning from the landmark Statue Square in Central, Olivia guided us through the heart of Hong Kong where colonial heritages, modern facilities and true Hongkongers' life fascinatingly meet. Our guide is very energetic, considerate, knowledgeable and speaks awesome English. The stories and histories she told were in-depth and very entertaining. We also passed by some well-known food shops and enjoyed some authentic snacks. The 2.5 hour- tour ended at an old Chinese temple in Sheung Wan and I truly wished that it could last longer. Overall, it was a great and unforgettable tour!
Hello Hong Kong Tour with Olivia. I've joined the 'Hello Hong Kong tour' led by Olivia，it's an useful and interesting trip, Olivia is energetic and full of humor, I love this tour!!
Walking tour wanchai. Amazing guide with fabulous local knowledge. Despite years in HK I learned a lot about wanchai. Highly recommended tour.

Good Evening Kowloon Tour with Walk Hong Kong. One of the highlights of my visit to Hong Kong and surely a must for anyone who wants 'insider' knowledge of some of Kowloon's most interesting landmarks. This was a 3 hour tour of the Temple Market and area with stops at a local street restaurant and Tony's bar. Think 'Lost in Translation' (the scene in the karaoke bar) and you won't be far wrong. Surreal in the best possible sense. Our guide for the evening was Olivia. She is friendly, knowledgeable and has a passion for her home town that has to be experienced. Her stories of growing up in the neighbourhood are wonderful and add to the charming atmosphere of the tour. Highly recommended. Ask for Olivia and you won't regret it!

In depth and insightful coverage by walking tour. We took this group tour of the Shueng Wan area of HK Island. Although we were the only ones, I project even with a bigger group, the attention, personal service and details provided by our guide, Olivia, would have been no different. She definitely provided excellent knowledge and insight to the neighborhood as well as the history and modern day culture of Hong Kong in a very enjoyable way. Her English is excellent and I would definitely take another tour with her. It was one of the better tours I have taken in my travels.

A very short trip into the layer of history.. Thanks to the brightness of our guide (Liz was much intellectual person), we've got to realize how Hong Kong had developed into well-known highly modernized port city during present-day history. It was good for us not to stray into downtown labyrinth spreading over the district, and besides, with her guiding, we could track the trail of development of this country from the viewpoint of ordinary people living in Kowloon. It was good experience one can only go through by traveling... Even in August, the climate is much pleasant in the evening. We heard Hong Kong will celebrate 20th anniversary of reversion in 2017 while enjoying local delicacy for our dinner (it was super good!!). We could discover what reversion brought to the country as she did not indicate practically, and this gave us new ideas to the area. We hope the prosperity will last forever.

Hong Kong Movie Tour. I participated in this tour on a hot day. It was well worth it ~ it was essentially a private tour! Favorite movies were on the menu with Leslie Cheung as a regular reference. Thank you Paul, for the experience!

Excellent Tour!!!. I can't remenber which HK artist said this: Audience sit for 2 hours to watch a movie, when they leave, there should be something left in their mind.Not only a movie, but also a day tour.I joined a day tour called 香港電影之旅 (Tour of Hong Kong local movie). It was a great experience to enrich your cognition of Hong Kong. You can tell Paul, our tour guide, and his team made so much effort on the whole program, especially the research. Thanks to his educational guiding, I truly feel the charisma of Hong Kong. I will never forget what he told me at the very beginning of the tour: We were once the most popular and fruitful region in Asia of movie exporting.

Well prepared and eye-opening guided tour. Joined their 2.5-hour LGBT tour in the hot summer season, but it worths our sweat! The tour is very well prepared, including the history, hot spots for LGBT community, games to help familiarise with specific terms with explanations. There is no other tour concerning this issue in Hong Kong so far, and it would be a good platform to know it better. Besides, it gathers people from different cultural background which enriches the whole thing a lot!

The best tours of HK and Kowloon. We had just been on two tours with them on our short trip to HK. Good Evening Kowloon tour with Isaac yesterday evening and Hello Hong Kong tour this morning with Liz. Despite having visited HK several times previously, we found both tours to be well-paced, highly informative and well worth doing.The Kowloon tour was particularly interesting as it centred on very local areas of Kowloon with several special highlights (I won't spoil it by divulging too many details). Isaac was full of infective enthusiasm and local knowledge, putting the local area in context with relevant interesting facts and history. Definitely off the beaten track stuff.Similarly, Liz was the perfect host in HK, imparting local knowledge and historical facts to areas we had previously visited and showing us previously unseen parts of Central and Sheung Wan districts. What a perfect way to end our short visit to HK.

LGBT. I learn something that I never know!Different places have different meanings and different stories.And we went to some places that were interesting.And our tour guides were interested and kind.We had a great nigh.
it was a nice tour. although it was hot, it was good. The guide was well prepared. I enjoyed it very much. I learned so much knowledge about film and the place where the crew took the shot.

Explore LGBT scene and history in Hong Kong. Being new in Hong Kong and wanting to know where the gays and lesbians are gathering, I joined the LGBT City Night Walk of WalkInHK. Guided by Benita Chick we not only passed various gay bars and other spots of interests but were also introduced to famous and historical gays, movies and interesting stories. At the same time we explored the Central and Sheung Wan area. All in all I had a wonderfull night and can truly recommend this tour. The tour is interesting for locals, tourists and expats alike.

Tai O Tour on Dragon Boat Festival. It is such an exciting and unique experience to witness the Dragon Boat Deity Parade on Dragon Boat Festival! Although I had visited Tai O before this tour, I realized I had missed lots of interesting stories of Tai O! The tour was informative yet entertaining. I would definitely explore other tours related to traditional festivals in the future!
Good Evening Kowloon. Great walking tour around Yau Ma Tai and the Temple St night markets, Paul was good fun and had lots of inside info.

Karaoke Fun, Street Food and Best Pic of Temple Street. A walking tour always gives such a brilliant insight into a city and especially with a knowledgeable guide such as Paul who showed us where he has grown up most of his life - exploring the city by foot, heading through markets and to a very authentic karaoke bar as well as indulging in some street food and a random carpark where you get the best view of the famous Temple Street. Fun tour, great walking itinerary. Would recommend it. Thanks Paul !

Great evening out where you learn about the underbelly of Hong Kong's history- Truly fascinating. I absolutely loved this tour. Great stories and authentic experiences you would just never get unless you were with a local. It was an evening well spent and the two guides with full of enthusiasm and knowledge. English was fantastic and we used headsets that projected what the guide was saying into our ear pieces. It meant the guide wasn't yelling at us all the time and we were able wander close to the guide or move away to look at something else that he was explaining. I would recommend this tour to all those that are interested in getting a bit of the history of Hong Kong. :)

Good Evening Kowloon tour. Great tour by Liz! She was great at weaving history with modern daily life in the Yau Ma Tei area. I had explored the area on foot during the previous day, but learned so much more and explored places I would not have ventured in on my own. Would definitely recommend for others looking to stay awake in the evening to fight off jet lag!

A Surprising walk even i am a local. i joined "Good Evening Kowloon" and Paul is a informative tourguide who lead us to those unseen local spots.
Very interactive tour that i can taste, play and even got a chance of fortune telling in few hours.
Solid tour with a friendly guide. I enjoyed this tour, covered some interesting sights in Central before a very interesting walk through Sheung Wan. I would recommend it.

Interesting even for someone who lives in Hong Kong. The Taste of Kowloon night walk allowed for a very tasty local dinner and a small exposure to old Hong Kong in the Yau Ma Tei/ Jordan area - how people entertain themselves , the markets and the history of the area accompanied by old photographs brought along by our knowledgable guide Paul Chan. Paul knows this area on a personal level and could enhance the stories with his own experiences. As a Hong Kong resident it gave me a greater depth to an area I had been to many times before without understanding its other side .

Learning more about the "real" Kowloon. Paul Chan was an excellent and fun guide on the history and every day life of the area. Understanding the history of the fruit market and its link to the independent Commission against Corruption was particularly interesting.

Superb Tour. Last month we did an afternoon tour of the Old Walled City in Kowloon. The walk was in a part not that frequented by the majority of tourists, and the history of the Peninsula and also the walled city was fascinating. We also had the chance to speak with a journalist from the local English daily paper about this experience in Hong Kong. Apart from the incredible history of the walled city we also had the opportunity to sample some local food at outlets where tourists just wouldn't go by themselves. The Tofu, fish balls and custard tarts were great. This company will be our first contact for walking tours next time in HK.

Kowloon Walled City (17 April 2016). My friend and I truly loved all aspects of Olivia's tour. I am a foreigner living in Hong Kong and my friend is a local; we both learned so much about the history of the 'Walled City' and enjoyed each of our stops to sample Chiu Chow food. Olivia has a deep understanding of HK's history, paced the tour well, and enthusiastically engaged with all members of the tour. Regarding the food stops, the fish balls and fried eel skin were particularly memorable!

Eye-opener. This was a fantastic tour around Sham Shui Po. Our guide Melanie was very knowledgeable about the area. The best part was the visit to the home of a local, Mei, to see how people live. Mei was very welcoming and we had a wonderful chat with her and Melanie about day to day life in Hong Kong. Would highly recommend this tour.

The best!. We love taking walking tours to really get to know a city, and man, did Melanie teach us about HK on this tour. Besides eating some delicious bites, she really went into the history and development of HK as a whole. Melanie answered every question we had and even gave us recommendations for the rest of our trip. A must-do if you're in HK.

Wonderful insight from a "real local". I had heard so many things over the years about Kowloon, the yin to the yang of Hong Kong island. The hustle, the bustle, the trading and the seedy stories. So many HK movies have the gangster scene somewhere in Kowloon; teeming with life, love and lust.
