I was very pleased that I decided to invest in a tour guide, actually I hate that term, more like a wolf pack leader, Olivia, who fearlessly led a small group of fellow tourists (and two locals!) into, and through, a set of experiences I would never have known about, or had the courage to try without her. More than just the language skills, which are essential, it was clear that Olivia really cared about, and had a deep affinity for her Hong Kong, and her Kowloon (I did the Kowloon Night Tour). From making a gaggle of middle aged women almost cry with my terrible rendition of American Pie, to hearing that the Year of the Monkey was going to be a great one for me from a wizened fortune teller, to the two or three hot steaming bowls of (somewhat scary) Hong Kong delicacies !!! It was a night, and experience that will live on forever, in every single Hong Kong movie I watch from now until I cant keep my eyes open any longer.Bravo Olivia, thank you for making my Hong Kong journey so memorable and special.

Hello Hong Kong - excellent overview. I enjoyed this tour hugely. Liz was friendly, knowledgable and keen to share her knowledge. She brought to life both the modern and traditional aspects of Hong Kong Island, and I would recommend this company to anybody trying to make sense of this extraordinary city.

Great Introduction to Hong Kong. My wife and I did the Walk in Hong Kong Day Tour with Liz and really enjoyed it.Liz described the history, architecture and different ways of life in Hong Kong over the last 200 years. She pointed out many features as we walked round which we would have passed without noticing.Liz was an excellent guide who tried to personalise the tour to suit the three people on it. She took us to a Chinese cafe where she bought local cakes and suggested that we try a drink which was basically a mixture of tea and coffee (unya??). It was good and I would not have come across it on my own. Another highlight was the tram ride which was great fun.This walking tour is a great introduction to Hong Kong for first time visitors.
Bravo. Very informative, nice selection of trail and spots,Enthusiastic tour guide. Recommended for all who are interested in the history and legal development of Hong Kong

A great experience with a wonderful guide. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour – Liz is an outstanding guide who provided real perspective on Hong Kong, took us to some very interesting areas, and really “connected” with my wife in a personal way. She first met us at the subway station and we asked about some of the Chinese characters – she explained how some of them are constructed through a combination of meanings and sounds. Then she walked us around the Temple Street neighborhood and provided some of the historical context – she showed us a number of pictures in her notebook so we could compare what we were seeing with the history. We stopped at a little restaurant where Liz ordered for us and we had a great seafood meal. Then went next door for some local “Karaoke” style Chinese singing. During our walk through the area we went by a Mah Johng gambling parlor, which started a great conversation between Liz and my wife on this (my wife plays each week). Liz is very knowledgeable and really seemed to understand our interests right from the start of the tour.  This was overall a great evening, despite rain and cold weather.

Walking tour around the University of Hong Kong. This is a tour that organised for my students. The tour guides toured us at some points near the campus of the University of Hong, sharing with us the history of this district and the city. Even though most students spent lot of time at campus, they found the tour informative and inspiring. A good tour that gave us deeper understanding of the neighbourhood and the city.

Good Evening Kowloon focusing on architecture. Thanks Cadence for her in-depth knowledge on architectural info in the area. It was a very special experience evening we have been living here for so many years. Kowloon in our impression is always just noisy and messy, but Cadence brought a new light on the neighbourhood through her eyes and things looked different since.Emil appreciates it especially on highlights on the importance of historical architectures with local stories.This is the best way to spend an evening no matter how many times you've been to Hong Kong coz you'll sure find something new or hidden.

Day walk tour, central. Candy our guide met us as arranged in the Statue Park near our hotel and we were lucky enough to be on the tour as the only couple. Candy had great knowledge of the city and was friendly and easy to talk to. This is a good tour if you want to get an understanding of the Central area and great to understand the location. For us it was a good intro to get our bearings on the first day to venture out on our own. It is an easy tour and easy walk

Urban Myths Tour - Wanchai - FABULOUS!. I have lived in HK for over 20 years and this tour was a total revelation. Our extremely knowledgeable guide Haider was a wonderful host and shared many anecdotes and stories from Hong Kong's past revealing a side to Wanchai that I would never have known otherwise. From the PP3 Bhudda, the Modrian designs, the haunted house......and who ever knew there was a huge and wonderful hidden catholic church in the heart of wanchai! A really exceptional tour and recommended for all visitors to HK. I can't wait to do another of the Walk in HK tours. Thank you Haider

Wanchai which you've never known. What an amazing tour! I have lived in the neighborhood for four years and roamed around quite a bit without noticing anything out of the ordinary - - Sun, Moon, Star, Ship etc. With the tour, we have discovered so many things which are right in front of our eyes. Haider transported us back through times and showed us how the Wanchai locals see it and live through it all. Highly recommended for tourists and even more for HK residence!

Good Evening Kowloon. I joined the Good Evening Kowloon Yau Ma Tei tour organised by Walk in HK. And I was pleasantly surprised by how interesting the tour was. Being a local Hong Konger, I have often took our streets scenery for granted and never realised there are so many treasure trove beneath the layer. Walkin HK help the visitors to unravel those treasure troves and I visited some truly local and authentic HK restaurants and clubs for the first time in my life. It was trully enjoyable.....

A wonderful evening in Kowloon. Had a lovely time wondering the streets of Kowloon, the tour is fun and insightful , got to really discover the real Hong Kong... I highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to get out the beaten track...

Very well researched tours!. I am a local (i.e. a Kaifong, a term used by Walk In Hong Kong) and have been on two different tours organised by Walk In (one on a historical red-light district in Sai Ying Pun/Pok Fu Lam area, and one on the printing presses in Sheung Wan). Both times I learnt quite a few new things about the city that I live in. Hong Kong is a curious mix of things old, new, Eastern and Western, and Walk In does a great job in putting them together. Will definitely join another tour with them (there are different tours on offer, some aimed at tourists with little or no prior background to Hong Kong, and some focusing on the history of a particular locality - it's good to check the descriptions to know which tour you are signing up for). Advisable to bring a good pair of walking shoes, as quite a bit of walking is involved. (Dora, my guide for both of the trips did a good job in reminding participants what to bring over email).

Best way to discover Hong Kong. If you want to explore Hong Kong like a local, this is the tour to do. Our guide (I'm disappointed to say I have forgotten his name) was a natural, real Hongkonger and history buff. I thought I knew Hong Kong, but at the end of the tour I walked away looking at every building in a new light. So it does not matter whether it is your first or not so first day in Hong Kong. I usually have very high standards for tours, and rarely write a review for them. But I make an exception in this case. So what do you think?

Choose History over the races. Right opposite the Happy Valley race course, is a vital part of Hong Kong history, spanning from the 1800s to recent history, where locals, and foreigners, lie in close proximity to one another. From the St. Michael Catholic Cemetery, to the Hong Kong Cemetery (with British military personnel, and Japanese, tombs in the midst), and even the Parsee Cemetery, every one shares important lessons to be learnt from Hong Kong's tumultous and colourful past. Good walking shoes are important, as you will want to climb up to visit some interesting tombs near the top of the hills. Reserve about three to four hours of your time for this visit.

A great blend of recent and century-old history, food, local nightlife, and current events. We (three women) went on the "Good Night Kowloon" tour with Isaac, a smart and well versed local guide who led us from YMT to Mong Kok, through fruit markets and night markets, feeding us clams and clay pot and pieces of local history along the way, including stops to see singing parlors and discuss local politics. A really fascinating tour for anyone who lives here or is visiting and wants to scratch below the "light show" "big buddha" "LKF" surface of Hong Kong.

Great way of getting to know Hong Kong!. My friends and me joined two tours: The Good Evening Kowloon Tour und the Sham Shui Po Tour. Both were a great experience! The tours are very personal as your guides tell you stories, that matter to them. They strike a perfect balance between sightseeing and social issues. You do not only get to see some of the most interesting spots in Hong Kong, you also learn a great deal about their history and get some really interesting and entertaining background information. It is great to learn how Hong Kong became what it is today and how it continues to evolve. We had a really great time and would recommend the tours to everyone visiting or living in Hong Kong! :)

Love this tour!. We joined a tour in the Sham Shui Po area. Thanks to our guide Olivia, we know so much more about the area and the interesting stories that so few know these days. We enjoyed it very much!

Walk in Hong Kong Supremely Authentic Experience. We had a fabulous night tour of Yau Ma Tei and Jordan area and Temple Street Market Tour guide Ann was full of great insights and kept us busy and entertained. Delicious dinner at a local restaurant and a visit to a "singing parlour" were highlights. Definitely would book another Walkin tour again!
Awesome Tour!. I loved everything about this tour and would love to do it again someday when I come back to Hong Kong. Ann was amazing and I learned tons of information from her. So fun!

These tours always encourage me to know more. Its always hard to imagine historical stories in Hong Kong cause it has changed a lot throughout the years. North Point is certainly a place containing conflicts from the past, but the past has also bonded them tighter. Walking through the streets and markets in North Point, there are times that I doubt where and when I am in Hong Kong, but suddenly brought back to reality when seeing the developers' marks in the city. The strong Fujianese culture here attracted me and I would like to know more about it.

Interesting Local Perspective. We were looking for something different from the run of the mill tour and this was a good fit. Very small, intimate group that allowed us to hear a local's perspective about the area that we wouldn't have gotten otherwise.

Nice introduction to Hong Kong. Found this 3-hour tour on TripAdvisor, and have to recommend it, too. Easy walk from the heart of Central. The big bank buildings, St. John's Cathedral, a nice stop at the Honolulu Cafe, and on to Soho through the wet market. Then the Man Ho temple, ending up in Tai Ping Shan. A knowledgeable young local guide made it all the more interesting and pleasant. For your first visit to Hong Kong, this is an excellent way to get the feel of both the new and the old. With none of the generic quality of a guided tour, it feels like a family friend is kindly showing you around. I've been living here off and on for two years, and enjoyed seeing things I had missed, and learned a lot.

The locals enjoy the local tour very much. I joined the Kowloon Evening Walking Tour: Yau Ma Tei and Jordan on last weekend. That experience is amazing for me although i am locals also. During the whole trip, I experienced more than I expected. I understand more about the little secret in the local community through the interesting stories in this district. That is a brilliant experienc to explore the secret Hong Kong.

Knowing the city's true character. Behind the heavily promoted mask of "shopping centre", the walk reveals Hong Kong's true character - a post colonial city with countless interesting stories that make this city unique.Should anyone walk in Kowloon City, the heart of historic Hong Kong unknown to many, without Paul's in depth knowledge and interpretation, one would easily miss the essence of the place.Everyone, locals and tourists alike, should definitely walk with Paul to discover the true Hong Kong.

Good Evening Kowloon Tour- the best way to see Yau Ma Tei and Jordan!. The walk is very impressive even for locals. The guide, Paul, is knowledgable yet humorous. During the walk, lots of fun stories of the red brick houses, fruit market, temple street, singing parlour, etc are shared. The walk is highly informative and entertaining. The highlight of the walk is the secret spot for seeing the lights of Temple Street. You must not miss it!Even for a local, this tour can surely amaze you! Highly recommended!

Awesome way to get under the city's skin. I will never look at my office building the same way again! I have lived in Hong Kong for years and was never told any of the amazing stories that our local guide Haider told us, which pretty much all happened right next to the building in which I work! I felt like I was sent back 100 years in the same spot and was experiencing the past century of Wan Chai flashing through my eyes. It was Halloween week so we got an extra dash of ghost stories too!Haider's day job is researching architectural history at the city's university, so you know his stories are not just randomly made up to entertain you and that's probably also why he is so passionate about these fascinating stories. I thought the 2.5 hours was going to be too long but we didn't want it to end! Gotta find time to do some of the Kowloon tours next time! The legs do get a bit tired though, so wear your comfy shoes and bring some water/snacks along.

For locals and tourists alike!. I have gone on two Walk In Hong Kong tours now, and they both have been so enlightening! Whether you are in HK for a few days or you are a local, you will definitely learn a lot from these tours. You walk by some of these things every day and never know that there is really a whole story hidden in them!I would strongly recommend complementing your time in HK with these highly informative Walks!

More than expected, a definite recommend.. The Urban Myths Tour in Wan Chai was a thoroughly enjoyable experience to me. I've been working in Wan Chai for 2 years but have never learnt about the hidden stories. The myths told by our knowledgeable guide were truly eye-opening, especially the story behind Hopewell Centre, where exactly I worked at. Though the haunting myths were merely stories spread by word of mouth, the guide's explanation was still very detail and informative. Engrossing stories, professional guide, an afternoon very much well-spent! :)

know more about the history of Causeway Bay!. This is a nice trip and Paul is a very great guide who did lot of research of Causeway Bay. We know more the relationship between HK history and Causeway Bay and how these changes had affected nowadays. It's a interesting experience despite i live in Kowloon district, it's also enrich my knowledge of HK history.

Great memory to have . Myself and my family were brought around Central and all the wonderful sights by Ann. She was most friendly, good humoured and helpful. Definitely added to our experience of HK. Thanks Ann!

New understanding of Causeway Bay. I have been live in Hong kong island side over 30 years and go to Causeway Bay over 1000 times. I'm still surprised that I was able to re-recognize the area.It is a very interesting experience.

See Causeway Bay in a different way. The walk in Causeway Bay was very interesting and also impressive. Our guide was knowledgeable and well-prepared. He introduced the history and changes of Causeway Bay and also showed us some hidden architectures that we might miss out if we go there alone. Walk in HK will definitely be a good start for us to explore the beauty of HK.

Causeway Bay walk is excellent. The walk offers an indepth understanding of Causeway Bay's history and its warm stories. I now know that Jardine Group was once the largest landlord in CWB before Hysan buying land from them and developing into like today. The 2.5 hours walk was simply excellent.

Sheung Wan Walking Tour. Excellent! The tour started in Central, Statue Square, and ended in Sheung Wan. Visited Maoist temples, markets, local eateries, parks, and more. So thoroughly enjoyed the tour and am signing up for another one!

An unusual, but wonderful, tour in Hong Kong. The tour, Good Evening Kowloon, takes you on a evening walk through a part of Hong Kong tourists rarely see. It explains the history and architecture of the area as well as the culture of the people who live there. It takes you to places you would never find on your own. One example is the Singing Parlor, a unique form of Hong Kong style karaoke. Great fun! Another example, a street lined with different types of fortuneteller booths. Also, a unique look at the Temple Street Market. All in all, a unique and fun way to spend an evening in Hong Kong.

Quirky, off-the-beaten-path experiences. My arrival to Hong Kong for the weekend meant that most popular, cookie-cutter stopover tours were off. And so during my search, I stumbled upon Walk in and their unique night tours.Piece of warning: I only recommend these tours to archi lovers, history buffs, and expats who are SERIOUS about learning about Hong Kong's history. The commentary during tours is so in-depth; unlike anything I've ever experienced in the many tours I've joined throughout the years. That being said, Walk in Tours is NOT "go go go!" like many other companies, with whom you try to see as much as you can in as little time as possible.So! With that out of the way ;) I took part of the Hungry Ghost Festival and Good Evening Kowloon. They were both extremely unique night tours, with a good mix of expats and locals joining in. The use of mic and headphones is brilliant, so you get to hear what the guide is saying the matter were in the crowd you're at.Kowloon tour was all about the dirty little secrets and gritty background of Hong Kong, which was absolutely fascinating and very unlikely to be a part of! We learned about the history of old buildings and very dangerous neighborhoods; fascinating to see the safe, thriving areas they find themselves in today. We even learned about the local Mafia and how it operated back in the day - quite cool! At the end of the night, we got to eat a very historic restaurant and sample several Chinese dishes. For the Hungry Ghost Festival, I learned even more about Hong Kong's dark past, specifically related to death. From how many immigrants died and the locals had a hard time handling the bodies to rich people having to deal with the "lost souls" of bodies which could never be sent back home to mainland China. Yes dark, but fascinating. All this background info really helps you understand the nature of the festival itself, which culminated with the burning of several offerings for said souls. Really, it's a piece of Hong Kong the barely any tourist gets to see.I must admit, I'm not used to such verbose tours. Yet, I learned so much about Hong Kong and its very soul that I could not give Walk In any less than 5 stars. Isn't this the very reason we book tours instead of exploring independently anyway?! Thank you Paul, for the many pieces of Hong Kong you gifted me. You are brilliantly knowledgeable!

An In-depth learning about a city. The tour is well-organized, and I am even surprised as a local. Rich content with lots of stories of the city, along with a well-designed route, that can guide the participants to discover the real faces of Hong Kong. I do highly recommend any foreigners, expats and even locals joining the tour if they wish to be cheered up.

Tai Hang Ghost Festival Tour. I joined the Tai Hang Ghost Festival Tour on 3 September 2015. Although I am born and raised in Hong Kong, I have never experienced the Ghost Festival organized by the Chaochow community. We gathered at the Central Library and ended the tour at Lin Fa Temple in Tai Hang. During the first half of the tour, I learnt about the traditions and origins of the Ghost Festival. I was particularly impressed by the Chiuchow drama for ghosts- they even have electronic subtitles! The second half of the tour was about Tai Hang, where we had the pleasure to go through the winding streets and learnt about some exciting incidents that happened in Tai Hang. And I also learnt more about Lin Fa Temple (Do you know why it has a little balcony even though it's on the ground floor now?) Our guide, Paul, was wonderful and very knowledgeable. It was a lovely experience and I would love to come back for more!
good. the guide is knowledgeable, I heard some HK local stories from him. It is very excited to visit those places in person. the hungry ghost fest tour is fun!

special way to experience the real Hong Kong. I joined the hungry ghost festival walking tour and it was fun! it is not about ghost stories but the history of death in Hong Kong. The hungry ghost festival at the end of the tour was a highlight and how can you imagine this kind of local festival could be held at the centre of the city? The guide, Paul, had a well knowledge about the history of Hong Kong and have a sense of humour to make us laugh!if you are interest on the tradition of Hong Kong, it will be a good way to explore more.

Super fun and informative tour even for a local. I first discovered Walk In Hong Kong when I joined their North Point tour about the 1967 riots two years ago. Last week I joined their Hungry Ghost Festival tour in Causeway Bay. As a local and a half-buddhist, I must say although I am aware of the Yu Lan Festival I never bothered to learn about its traditions, rituals or stories behinds the big sheds that get set up throughout the city during the Lunar month of July. After the tour not only did Paul (the tour guide) answer all my questions he also told me tales I didn't know existed about the area and the festival itself. I can't stress enough how important these walking tours are to a city like Hong Kong where most people are just too focused on making money and forget how interestingly cool their own city is. It is a placed filled with rich cultural traditions and hidden gems. The walking tour totally helped me reignite my love for my hometown. So before you think you are a local and you know everything about the city already, spare some time to join one of the tours organised by this group of passionate HongKong-ers -- I promise you won't regret it!

Hungry Ghost Festival walking tour. I joined hungry ghost festival walking tour on 6th September. We started at Possession Street in Shang Wan and ended the tour at the festival gathering just behind PMQ. The tour was fascinating as we walked through the old mass cemetery area and listen to stories from the past. As a local, we have long heard of these haunted tales in our neighborhood but we never knew why it happened how it happened. The tour explored many culture aspects of these tales, put it into context, and brings it to live just in front of you. I recommend tourists of even locals who are interested in getting to know the traditions of Hong Kong to join.

Good Evening Kowloon walking tour - A worthwhile experience even for locals!. I joined the Good Evening Kowloon walking tour with Paul last week. It was truly a worthwhile evening for my friend and me, even both of us are locals! The tour is not as demanding as other walking tours I had in other countries, as the walk covered just a few streets yet the content was very fruitful. Our guide Paul, who grew up in Yau Ma Tei, is knowledgable and fun. He shared not only the interesting stories and histories of the district, but also his own experience. One most unforgettable spot must be the singing parlour. Time seems to have frozen in the 70s, from the retro decor to the atmosphere. Paul said people either love it or hate it. I am definitely the former.Another thing I like about the tour would be the secret photo spot. I took amazing photos there. I am not going to spoil the fun and post the photo here as I am pretty sure most of my local friends would not know such a hidden gem in our city! I recommend this tour to all of my friends, both locals and foreigners. If you only have a few days in Hong Kong, this tour is not going to be missed!

Good Evening Kowloon - Walking Tour. The walking tour was very fun, and as a local who always has been living at the Hong Kong Island, I'm no difference to the visitors on how refreshing I'm feeling to the spots we visited! The singing parlour was the highlight of the tour personally thinking, never would I visit a place like this in my life and it happened that night! I was very thrilled to have received warm welcomes from the owner of the parlour and some passionate audience. One thing that could be improved will be the duration of the tour, if it could be controlled under 3 hours then it will be a perfect tour for anyone!

Special Occassion Tour - Lo Pan's Birthday Special Tour. I'm a local Hong Konger and have lived here my whole life, but I still discovered SO MANY new things about this city under Paul's walking tour! Even as a local, this tour is mindblowing. For visitors, this is an even more precious experience! Highly recommended if you want to get to see the REAL HK - not just Soho, the Peak, Avenue of Stars etc... We're privileged to have Walk in Hong Kong introduce our city's many facets and heritage to our dear visitors. Thank you!!

Good Evening Kowloon - Yau Ma Tei & Jordon Tour. The tour includes some local food delights and it is absolutely value for money. Walked through the legendary spots in Yau Ma Tei & Jordon Areas, you definitley will be excited to learn about the history the Yaumatei Theatre, the Fruit Market and Temple Street. Absolutely fascinating and authentic. A showcase of the real Hong Kong!!! Highly recommended !!!!

Wan Chai Tour. I joined Walk in Hong Kong's Wan Chai tour and found the tour very insightful and gave me the Wan Chai I have never thought of. The experienced tour guide told the urban legends about Wan Chai, from the early British military settlement to the mysterious stories of a local tycoon (in relation to Hopewell Centre erected in the district), you felt the weight of history. I highly recommend Walk In Hong Kong if you wish to dig deeper in the Asia's World City, which is always overshadowed by its skyscrapers and sparkling shopping malls, that its untold neighbourhood stories and urban myths would take your Hong Kong experience to the next level.

Tai O Dragon Boat Parade Tour. It was a unique and wonderful experience, to see a different side of Hong Kong. This tour was organised specially for us to view the traditions observed by the Tai O village for the Dragon Boast Festival. The tour guides were friendly and knowledgeable about the traditions and the history of the area. A special experience worth going for!

Tai O Dragon Boat Parade tour. The trip to Tai O with Walk in Hong Kong was an unique experience. The trip was specially arranged for the annual dragon boat parade, in which our guide Paul showed and explained the traditional rituals and celebrations of this cultural heritage. The tour also covered the history of Tai O and its relation to Hong Kong and the surrounding areas with photos from the past. An interesting and informative tour worth joining!

Wonderful private tour experience. Im a big fan of walking tour and i like to join different tours when i travel.I have been to Hong Kong before but Its my first time to visit here with my family. I searched Walk in Hong Kong online and found that they provide full day private tour, which the guide would suggest the itinerary based on your preference. Since my family would love to visit the countryside / places that are peaceful and quiet, the tour guide suggested us to visit Tai O and the Tian Tan Buddha. We really like it because the guide was so friendly and passionate to let us know all the history behind the lovely village. The schedule wasnt too rush and my mom found it relaxing too. The price varies upon the itinerary but i think its reasonable if you join in a group. Its totally worth it and i wish i can join their special tours next time.

An inspiring walk in western district. What an inspiring , informative and interesting western district walk by Dora from Walk in Hong Kong...from Tim Kee of handmade noodle near witty street of Shek tong tsui, tong sai fung yuet, Lo Pan temple, Kwun Lung Lau, stone wall trees near Forbes street...the whole trip ended at the wonderful sea scenery at New Praya, Kennedy Town...an enjoyable and impressive city walk on 7 June!

The best way to explore real Hong Kong. This was a unique and oneoff experiance like no other. The tours are conducted on unique and special itienaries and you really feel the personal touch and the extensive amount of commitment throughout the tour. The guide was very knowledgable with constant annecdotes and experiances being mentioned allowing us to see Hong Kong in the eyes of a local. She also made the tour interactive. In addition she also carried pictures which gave us a very clear picture of the real Hong Kong. All in all this is one of the best ways to explore Hong Kong.

A Wonderful Tour with unknown Hong Kong. It is the first time I joined the tour organized by Walk in Hong Kong. Even I live in Hong Kong and study in the university nearby, I have never been to these places and I really love the place that could overlook the harbour view!!!
Amazing Central walking tour. Despite I worked in central for many years, this tour still impressed me a lot with many indepth history of the daily scene and buildings!Excellent and eye opening

A cool themed walking tour. I did the Money World walk, which gave a history of Hong Kong's banks and how they relate to each other, their main buildings and elements of feng shui in their construction. I enjoyed it, would have loved to see their other walks too.

Fantastic Tailored Tour!. I visited Hong Kong a few times for work but never really have the time to tour around. This time I managed to stay over for a weekend and saw good reviews on this company on Tripadvisor so gave it a go. They didn't disappoint me at all, rather, gave me a great surprise of what Hong Kong has to offer. I had them tailored a tour for me on a Saturday morning to the Central CBD area and the nearby Sheung Wan. I spent most time in Central everytime I come to Hong Kong but didn't know until now that there are so many rich stories and history about the area. Sheung Wan area is more of a residential nature and yet, still a very interesting area to explore. Their guide is very knowledgeable and patient in explaining all the little detals to me and have my questions answered. I also had the chance to sample some street food! Certainly worth the time and the money. Would definitely recommend it!

Great insights into a already known Area (Wan Chai). We found Walkin Hong Kong via Trip Advisor when we searched for a non-standard guided tour for our wedding guests. As most of them have been to Hong Kong frequently, we wanted to go for something interesting & different from the usual sightseeing. We booked the Urban Myth tour through Wan Chai as a private group and found a very interesting and diverse tour through Wan Chai. There were plenty of stories around Wan Chai and despite some of them being proper Myths, they were more stories about the past (in line with the previous information that we received).Our guide adapted to the heat and humidity as well as the fact that we have to babies in strollers along and removed some parts with stairs towards more information on other sights.We had a great time and will definitely join one of their public groups as well.

A Hood Comes Alive. Five glimpses into life as lived in Sham Shui Po. The guide, Olivia Tang had a fine capacity to adjusts to the interests of our group of three, breathing excitement into stories of things beuatiful and not so beauttiful. A real tribute to the people of the arrea in which she grew up.

Surprised a local by the Wanchai stories. I’m a local born and raised here, but like many of us grown here, there’s just so much we dont’ know about this place, or just have a merely vague impression about the place. Recently, many locals whom have been living here are feeling uneasy as this place and culture are undergoing such drastic change. In order to understand the moment and orient myself better, I have a strong desire to learn about the past and joined this walk in Wanchai, which turned out was very good to serve me this purpose. Thru story shared from a passionate guide, the distant (but still relevant) history unfolded as we wandered in the oldest (but also renewed) parts of the district. We could connect ourselves with the greater part of history here: the beginning of the colony, context and dynamics in the district, juxtaposition of the rapid changes in the distant past and what is happening in the district right now… I was simply stunned by the myraid of stories, conflicts and tour de forces of places and people in these 175 years (especially when we’re in the midst of another new era of geo-political change). To be frank, during the walk, I was shocked as I myself has personally witnessed the changes: I had taken a similar walk in less than 10 years before, but I’d say its like 30% of the landscape already changed in the district…With the great preparations by Walk-in HK, rich details relevant to our understanding were demostrated and highlighted to let us understanding better. I have a feeling that its like going for a travel to some OTHER countries as I reckon I knew so little about this place before.When I have time, I’ll definitely join more of the walks by Walk-in HK as I kinda feel that I have missed so many stories of this place even though I’ve been living here since I was born.

no sleeping city. Had a great day with the girl ( forgot her name)and she was very knowledgeable and flexible. We all thought it was good value for money and only paid on tour so no upfront fees. If you like walking tours this is for you.

Step into Hong Kong's colourful past. The walking night tour of Kowloon with Paul of Walk In Hong Kong is an enlightening look at the city's more rough and tumble past. Paul really knows his history. His fun anecdotes about the local theatre, market and a well known cafe famed for appearing in many action movies are entertaining and eye-opening. The best part of the tour for me, though, was stopping by a traditional "singing parlour," the local and traditional version of what we know as a karaoke bar. You really feel like you're getting a true, local experience!

Walk on the wild side. Well, not wild as in chaotic, but wild as in mind-blowing! Paul knows more about the history of Hong Kong than most museum curator; yet his walks are definitely not boring. He packs the info in via funny snippets, quick quotes, quirky routes. One of the best things I did while in Hong Kong! I only wish I'd had time to do a few more of his walks taking in other things this fab city has to offer!
Very inspiring tour!. I enjoyed the tour so much!Very informative, and let me know more about the stories of the legendary person James Wong, and also my lovely home town.

Tour of Sheung Wan and old Letterpress. We had a great morning walking around with Dora, who was very professional but also fun and easy going. The guided tours make you look at the streets of Hong Kong from a different perspective. There are unfortunately lots of lovely, old history and buildings that have been lost over the years and it's nice to know there are tour guides like Dora who are still enthusiastic about telling people all about it.

History , Myths and more!. I wasn't expecting too much from a walking tour in the city, but I was pleasantly surprised to see such a reach history in the district of Wanchai. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and passionate about history which was a plus. Walkin tours also provided many opportunities to learn about the community of Wanchai and how it has changed over time.A good learning opportunity to learn something more about the country you are visiting rather than just the surface.

A worthy birthday present. My husband and I have lived in HK for 10+ years, and like many who lives in a busy city, rarely pause to think about the many places that we pass everyday. For his recent birthday present, I organised a private tour of Wan Chai Urban Myths and the Happy Valley cemeteries. We started off being apprehensive as we were not sure how much more is there to find out about Wan Chai that we do not know already? We were totally surprised by the enthusiasm, the depth of the knowledge and the variety of stories that our guide, Haider, shared with us. Little things like what his 90 year old grand mother called a particular place on Queens Road East, his folder of researched pictures/maps showing the history of the places, and also his own expertise in architecture research added many layers of context as well as just facts. He also shared his personal passion for the people and history of HK - one got the feeling of being shown round by a friend rather than a "guide". After alll these are all people with full time professions, doing this because they love HK! We will certainly come back for the other tours, especially those in parts of Kowloon.

A Glimpse Into Old Sheung Wan and PoHo. Another very informative walk in English conducted by Walk In Hong Kong! My company organized a small (we were 15 people) private walk around Sheung Wan and PoHo last Saturday morning. Our guide, though a little under the weather, was full of passion and shared interesting historical tidbits about the area. The highlight of the walk was a visit to a Chinese letterpress shop where we were taken back to the old days of printing and experienced the art and labour intensive process. What makes guided tours by Walk In Hong Kong so much fun is the human touch - the tour experts are not only knowledgeable but you sense their love to share stories and uncover aspects of the past that link us to the present Hong Kong. This was our third walk and we look forward to many more.
Sheung Wan Letterpress workshop. Excellent historical walk and fun experience in the Letterpress workshop. Well done Dora, Candy, Cadence!

Informative and impressive even to local HK people. Joined their tour about HK legendary lyricist - James Wong. enjoyed it so much and it was informative and loads of history that we could associate to ourselves. Having joined so many walking tours in other countries, this one is one of the best. Tour guide and Dr Ng is professional and have many insights to get you understand even more about Hong Kong. Highly recommend to all tourists and locals.

Fun and Great local stories. Passionate local guide and thus loads of local stories that one cannot find easily from books nor online. We had a good laugh too! The theme "Money World" on HK is also a special take. The end point is awesome but won't spoil it here!

The History of Hong Kong comes to life. We participated in the "North Point – The North, the Left and the Rootless" tour. Our truly expert guides guides evoked a pivotal, and too little discussed, let alone understood, moment in Hong Kong's history, in the streets, alleys and innocuous lobbies where it happened. In putting together this tour, Walk in Hong Kong, along with Professor Yep, are offering something much deeper and more serious than the vast majority of tourist experiences. I wholeheartedly recommend Walk in Hong Kong, not only to those visiting HK, but also to residents who want to get beyond the surface of the city.

Fascinating experience!. Joined their walk in Wanchai a while back and was very impressed. The walk lasted about 2.5 hours and we walked through some very interesting parts of Wanchai one would never venture into otherwise. The guide told us juicy stories - personal experience, words of mouth (from grandma), historical facts, gossips, etc, with a pint of haunting elements. The historical part wasn't too hardcore and were told in an interesting way. Certainly something you won't know by reading a guidebook. Totally enjoyed this tour and would recommend it to everyone!

Guide to Wanchai's informal histories. Whether you are a local or a visitor, this tour of Wanchai will surprise you with fascinating details that you won't find in history books or tourist maps. It presents an unofficial history of Wanchai passed down by word of mouth - rumours, urban legends, superstitions, gossip and more. These are the cultural meanings that make places (even in a city dominated by monotonous single-purpose spaces) visible in a new light.Many thanks to our amazing guide, and hope for more of these tours - and less of raze-and-build urban renewal!

Worth every cent. If you want to get the ins and outs of Hong Kong in 3-4 hours book a walking tour with Walk Hong Kong. It was the most fun and interesting 1/2 day we spent in this city. Martin Heyes, our guide wasextremely knowledgable and accommodating, made our Sunday morning very special.Tours are offered in English, German and French. Go for it!

Learning about My Adopted City. Friends and I have been looking to do History walks around Hong Kong for a while and after much research found Walks in Hong Kong. We meet the tour guide on time and he was very clear to spot as he was wearing a company Polo with there name on. After a quick introduction, we were on our way and although the tour didn't cover a huge expanse of space, which is good if you dont want to do to much walking. It covered a lot of cool facts, history and Myths about the Wan Chai Area of Hong kong. I am personally a massive local history geek and i learned lots on this tour that i didn't know. and i was surprised by many of the sights id never seen or noticed, such as a 1920's (Haunted) Mansion. The team were super nice and answer any question you wanted to ask. not only that but a few days after the walk, the team also sent me an email with more of my questions answered, which was great. I will be doing more in the future and i will highly recommend these to friends also.Well worth the time and the money.

Movie, culture, history trip of Central, Hong Kong. Very in-depth movie, culture, history trip of Hong Kong. Starting from the Hong Kong University , end up in Central. Smooth and clear explanation and lively visual adds. Despite not previewing those movies before hand, still can catch most stories where been shot. Just take a little bit curiosity, interests about hk movies, and ability to walk and easy hike 2 hours. You are sure not regretting to attend and must be rewarded.

Great,alternative tour. Tour guide is very knowledgable, trilingual and offers very interesting stories about the lesser known side of Hong Kong. Definitely recommend the tour for tourists and Hong Kongers alike.

Not to be missed activity in HK!. I joined their walking tours couple of times. Being a regular visitor to HK, I have already done all the "touristy" things so it's time to explore HK in a deeper way. The tours they offer bring me to the local neighborhoods like North Point, Sham Shui Po, etc, and I truly enjoy listening to the interesting stories about those places and the locals. I also joined a "thematic" tour called "Money World" which revealed the history and interesting stories around the Central CDB area. Next time I come for meetings in Central, I can bluff about what I learned at the tour, stories that probably not a lot of locals know! Give it a try, you won't regret.

North Point Tour. It was a fantastic tour and we truly enjoy the knowledge that we learn from our tour guide, Paul.The tour is relax and our tour guide will go in accordance to our pace. The explanation is clear and provide insights to foreigners like us.

Victoria City walk. The walk was a very interesting blend of history and interesting facts, and even as a local, we often tend to overlook certain things (gems!) that has somehow blended into the background of the city. With Walk In Hong Kong, they will bring your attention to details and stories behind some of these buildings and structures, enriching your understanding of Hong Kong, whether you are a local or a visitor.

Yau Ma Tei Walk. I am a local and thought I know Yau Ma Tei but this is not the case after the walk with Paul, our fabulous guide last week. I got to see and learn about the hidden parts, stories and history of heritage buildings as well as local communal areas like old theatre, wholesale fruit market, temple, night market, poor man's night club.....which have been with us ages. I highly recommend this tour to visitors who want to know about Hong Kong, behind its financial, commerical and shopping icon.

Great Tour!. Highly recommend the Life and Death Tour of Sheung Wan. So eye-opening and full of secrets which are normally overlooked. Even got to go into the back areas of some really interesting temples and coffin shops. Such a unique tour!

Sheung Wan - So Old, Yet So New. When I travel, I love doing tours with local tour guides. Some can be hit and miss, but this one with Walk in Hong Kong was sensational! I've been staying in Sheung Wan and I wanted to learn more about my local area. Bronson and Haider shared a range of stories including history, gossip, trivia, movies, culture, and their own personal stories that connected them to Sheung Wan. We visited many old and new sites, and I saw my district with fresh eyes. Seriously, after walking up and down these streets many times during my time in Hong Kong, I still saw things I had never seen before. Many thanks to Bronson and Haider for such a delightful, fun and relaxing 3 hours!

Wan Chai Tour. The tour was definitely one of the highlights of my trip to Hong Kong. One of the best things for me was to hear the stories behind the street corners, the buildings and even public spaces. It is a great blend of history, architecture as well as sociology and I came away with a much deeper understanding of the neighborhood than I had expected. Will highly recommend the tour. If you want to hear stories that only a local can tell, and to hear them in English, this is the place for you.

Excellent tour without replacement. I joined the tour to North Point and I was led to some places that I have never been to before with interesting stories. It was a nice trip with in-depth explanation to the history of the past of the district. Visit to local stores was another attractive thing that I have never thought of. Recommend the trip to all of you who love history, culture and our city!

It makes a difference. Travelling to me is never a just 'eat, drink and be merry' activity. It's more like to an experience to extend our comfort zone and to explore more about our people, culture, history. From there we ask questions and so to enrich ourselves to see our world in different perspectives. Walk in Hong Kong makes a visit more than just sight seeing. During the walk, the guide shared with me about history of the place, how people lived and what are the implications to the HK nowadays. Being a Hong Konger, I thought that I know a lot about HK, but this walk brought me to a more sophisticated understanding and made me love this place more. Thanks, Walk in HK.

North Point Riots. I joined this walking tour in November and whilst I knew there had been riots in HK in the 60s I didn't really know where and why. The tour filled in some of the gaps for me as Professor Ray Yep and Paul Chan shared their local knowledge. Both are passionate about HK's history and enjoy sharing their knowledge. Although I have lived here for years, I learned many new things and explored a new area of HK. The timing of our tour was particularly well chosen as we currently witness the Occupy protests. I wonder if in 50 years there will be a tour of the Occupy sites! I think this tour would be interesting to both locals and visitors.

Bringing Hong Kong to life. Paul and his team passionately retell the stories of Hong Kong, bringing the city and its people to life. My family and I joined a tour exploring a unique and oft forgotten chapter of our history, and were very impressed by the team's research and storytelling. Even as long time residents, we still learned new things. Make sure to ask lots of questions to get the most of their knowledge!!!

Seeing the unseen Hong Kong!. I am a local and have been living in HK for over 25+years. Yet HK has never been so exciting to me not until I joined the Walk in HK tours. The walks they organized in both Yau Ma Tei and North Point (1967 Riots walk) in Oct and Nov respectively, were definitely beyond my expectations. The former was led by Paul Chan, who is passionate and knowledgeable. He started the tour by leading us to the Red Brick House, historic theater, fruit market etc, and eventually stopped near temple street. During the journey, he was able to tell lots of juicy stories plus showing us a bunch of old photos and videos, which was really entertaining. As for the 1967 Riots walk, it was guided by both Paul and Professor Ray Yep from City University of HK. Personally, I am not too familiar with the topic, but obviously I felt they had an in-depth study on it and they relived many of the most dramatic moments of summer 1967 at those key sites in North Point along the way. In a nutshell, I guess the walk in Hong Kong tours may not be the cheapest offer in town, but every penny I spent is valuable and I really look forward to joining their other tours in the future!

New perspectives. I throughly enjoyed my experience on the "Urban Myths" tour, Haider's quirky take on the development of Wan Chai, coupled with his expansive knowledge of Hong Kong history made for a enlightening experience and delightful afternoon. As an architecture student and enthusiast, I found this tour extremely relevant to my interest. The tour artfully merges the past and the present and allowed me to see the city I thought I knew in a completely new light! I strongly recommend this tour for anyone who wants to relive Hong Kong's glorious as well as darker days in a mere 3 hours.

Unique & Informative Walking Tour. I went on a walking tour on the 1967 anti-colonial riots organised by Walk in Hong Kong. The walk started in North Point and was led by Paul Chan of Walk in and Professor Ray Yep. I was born and raised in Hong Kong and have been living in Hong Kong for most part of my life. Yet this tour took me to places that I would never have paid attention to. It was an eye-opening experience to learn that history is everywhere in Hong Kong. Paul was a very helpful and cheerful leader. Professor Yep was a very passionate and knowledgeable speaker. For HK$300, it was worth every penny. The topic itself is quite specific but it is certainly topical now given that there is an ongoing democracy movement in Hong Kong. It is enlightening to see how different the 1967 riots were compared to the current democracy movement. I highly recommend anyone who is interested in Hong Kong to join this tour!

The Best Walking Tour In HK. I was able to go on a walking tour with some of my colleagues from SCAD and tour the Sham Shui Po District while we were visiting Hong Kong for a few days over the summer. I had a great time exploring and learning about the history of the community. We had a fantastic tour guide, Paul, who knew so much about the area. I hope to return to the city soon and plan to take another tour from this great company.

An Organic Renewal to breathe Hong Kong. Their walks are close to heart rather than your feet - genuine and organic! Covering History to culture to simple information, Walk in Hong Kong is fun and refreshing. They have a personal warmth and the feeling I was left with after doing the Victoria City Walk, was - when do I get to do another one!!??? They have the sharp ability to touch on the most interesting places and themes, know the backdrop very well and can make the group come together, which I think is superb and important. Hong Kong is terribly rich with modernity and tradition co existing side by side and neither melting away - through the walks, you get to experience and realise this. My love n the best to Walk in Hong Kong and I am already figuring out my next tour with them!

Searching for Hungry Ghosts in the City!. I joined their tour on the "ghost festival" back in the summer. There were a lot of interesting settings in Hong Kong during this period and it's good that there's a special tour giving us some background on the festival and the rituals. It was a night tour (goes without saying!) and we were shown to a very big site occupying the entire sports ground behind a very busy street where the central library was. It's amazing how the site was very well blended into the hustle and bustle of the city. There were huge paper offerings, a Chinese opera stage, and a lot of interesting rituals going on. Certainly an eye opener for me! The guide then gave us a short trip around the neighbourhood. Very informative. He also gave us some very important tips on the dos and don'ts during the period. Never walk too close along the walls is the one i still remember...I would highly recommend this tour to you if you visit Hong Kong next during the Hungry Ghosts Festival!

Scents of the City Tour. The walking tour was most informative, interesting and tickle the bottom of our hearts with the scents and aroma working positively on our nostrils. Paul as the tour guide was very clear in his explanation in English and we could imagine the bustling and scents of Hong Kong in the heydays. We get to know some of the places not known to tourists. A really nostalgic experience indeed. The walking tour ended with a sweet aroma of jasmine tea served by one of the Hong Kong’s tea connoisseur.  Highly recommend the walking tour to anyone who seeks to dwell on the scents of Hong Kong and the forgotten links to the past.By : 4 girls from Malaysia : Grace, Irene, See Meng, Kuan

Wanchai Private Walking Tour. We were a party of 20 and thoroughly enjoyed our private walk in Wanchai on 25 Oct. This is my company's second walk with Walk in Hong Kong (we did the Scents of the City Tour last year)and our guide Haider is an expert full of knowledge about the area's history and local tales. The tour is 2 1/2 hours long and there was not one single dull moment as we were introduced to hidden architectural features, historic spots, mythic tales of the supernatural kind and religious practices. It was a great way to discover a little about our city's past and walk in the footsteps of old Wanchai residents. We cannot wait to join another walk and strongly recomment Walk in Hong Kong tours!

Scents of the City Tour. Our guide Paul was knowledgable and very enthusiastic. The tour is 2 1/2 hours and different in that it is based around stories of the different scents of Hong Kong from flowers to toilets, tea to perfumes. The stories around each scent were fascinating and made the tour supported by Paul's iPad with photos old and new. We had seven people on our tour. The places we visited are however essentially the same as most Hong Kong walking tours. Definitely worth doing as an alternative twist on a Hong Kong tour and much cheaper than booking a private tour on your own.

Better know Hong Kong through the historical and cultural perspectives. I've joined Yau Ma Tei Walk on 18 Oct. Paul, our guide, showed enthusiasm for the hidden history of the area by doing lots of research. It's enjoyable to learn more about Yau Ma Tei through the tour. He presented it very well by using the photos, videos and stories from the oral history. He showed the authentic livelihood of the local grassroots, how they strove for survival in the past without any support from the government -- the hard knocks that the hongkongers regard it as "Lion Rock Spirit". I don't know knowledge from Paul before Even I was born in Hong Kong. "Walk in Hong Kong" help us to better know about the "What's Hong Kong".Gary Tse from Hong Kong

Great way to get to know Hong Kong. I went on the Yau Ma Tei walk on 18 Oct and while I had visited the area a few of times it was great to have my eyes opened and see it in another light. Paul's enthusiasm and story telling kept us all entertained. I have already signed up for another walk and strongly recommend this as a must do for all visitors and locals wanting to get a closer look into Hong Kong.

Very enjoyable tour with knowledgable guide. I did the Yau Ma Tei walk with guide Paul. Had no idea about the neighborhood's rich history, so it was really interesting. Paul knows everything and is able to explain things in a fun way.

Interesting tour to a local neighbourhood opening your eyes to a different HK!. I joined a tour in Yau Ma Tei with Walkin Hong Kong. It's a very intereseting experience. Yau Ma Tei is not one of the top tourist must dos you can find in any guidebooks and yet this tour brought me the taste of the local livelihood quite different from what I would expect to experience from my trip in Hong Kong. The route was well planned and the stories we were told on the way seemed carefully designed as they interwined to help piece a jigsaw of the old Hong Kong. The guide Paul was enthuiastic and knowledgable about the area. I particularly like the part on the story of the fruit market. I would recommend this tour to everyone, whether you're a traveller or even a local (some locals on the tours didn't know the story about the area either!). Would love to join another tour with them next time I come to Hong Kong.

Great way to learn more about Hong Kong neighbourhoods for residents and visitors alike. In the past year, I have attended three Walk-In Hong Kong tours - in Sheung Wan, Sham Shui Po and Wanchai. Like the neighbourhoods themselves they have all been different but hugely enjoyable and informative. Each of the tours was loosely built around a theme fit for the neighbourhood, thereby enabling you to dig deeper behind the stereotypes. With tour guides with genuine passion for their chosen theme and the neighbourhood, you are guaranteed to hear insider stories and be shown hidden gems that you otherwise would have been unlikely to notice. Booking and paying for a tour through their website is easy, the service reliable, and the instructions for meeting up etc clear. The tours suit people with various levels of fitness although the Hong Kong weather and hilly streets and steps can claim their toll! The crew puts lots of care in making the experience enjoyable to all though, and have usually designed the routes so that it is possible to purchase refreshments en route. Highly recommended!

Be attached to the vibrant city. The trip to Sheung Wan is awesome even though I am a HongKonger. The guides provide us another perspective to see, understand and learn more about the place from the another way round. We are brought to be attached to those sites, rather than being told, by their vivid narrative and description about the episodes from the past to the present. Time does run short for visiting the sites and I am more excited and attentive to everything happening or happened to the place, and the city.

Private walking tour. Paul took us around a private walking tour of Hong Kong Island. We were able to see/learn a lot about Hong Kong that other larger tours could not provide us. Paul was great and very informed. He even took us through the Umbrella Revolution and explained what was happening regarding the political situation in HK. It was a great tour, and I would highly recommend them to anyone visiting HK.

Great tour of colourful Sheung Wan. I had a great time being taken through the interesting district of Sheung Wan by Walk in Hong Kong. The route was thoughtfully designed revealing the hidden steps and lanes that may be unknown even to locals, combined with the important landmarks of the area. Participants were presented with stories that link the past with the present, so that the changes through time could be understood in context. From local stalls, quaint cafes, temple, bakeries, traditional businesses to dried seafood shops, the tour was full of stimulations for sight and smell. All these were delivered with passion and a cheerful vibe by the energetic guide.

Walks with a Passion. A wonderful and insightful tour of Yau Ma Tei by Night. Guide Paul Chan clearly has a passion for the history of the area and told us some great stories along the way that we would not have normally learned. It was fun and informative.

An awesome tour. I didn't regret at all signing up for this tour. Enjoyed myself so much to roam around and to know the itsy bitsy stories that I may not get elsewhere.The tourguide is friendly to the point that he remembers on our small conversation that we had while we're on the tour and provide small info regarding that conversation. Recommended for sure.

Great tour led by enthusiastic guides. If you're looking to get off-the-beaten-track a little in Hong Kong, then this walking tour would be ideal. I have a particular interest in the HK film industry and they took me on a cool walk around sites where famous (and not so famous) films have been shot - really bringing the city to life. Paul and Keith, our guides, were incredibly enthusiastic and really knowledgeable about the city and about film making. Hong Kong has wonderful food and towering skyscrapers, which should definitely be experienced, but these walking tours are a great way to get under the skin of the city!

Yau Ma Tei by night. Paul took us round Yau Ma Tei in the evening, revealing a community that is still very much awake past nightfall- markets, karaoke for all to hear, Temple Street lined with tents where palms and cards are read, and fortunes told. I particularly enjoyed hearing about the history of the Red Brick Building and Yau Ma Tei Theatre as I find myself wandering the streets of the city I call home and knowing little of where things are and how they came to be. The fruit market at night was beautifully moody.An interesting mix of sights and stories told by a highly knowledgable and enthusiastic guide. Thank you Paul and Walk in for a fun night!

Urban Myths - Tempest in Wan Chai. As a local growing up in Wanchai, this tour uncovered some of the urban myths and sites that I never realized existed before. The tour was well-researched into these myths supported by making phone calls, interviewing locals and historical photographs. I can feel the passion of Haider, who is fascinated by the history in the area and spent a fruitful and interesting Saturday afternoon with Haider leading the tour. Locals, expats or tourist alike will enjoy this trip!

A highly recommended walking tour. I joined the Lo Pan Birthday Walk on 9th July 2014. It was a really good chance to witness the celebration of this over 2,000 years traditional Chinese festival. Truly amazing. I especially enjoyed the second part of the walking tour in Kennedy town. Paul is very knowledgeable and passionate about the history of this area, which let me understand more of this lovely town. A good walking tour suitable for local and foreign people to know our history and culture.

Introduce you the old western district in a quick tour!. I joined the special tour to Lo Pan temple, it was great to see the celebration of Lo Pan's birthday. The tour also brought me to different places and told me history happened at different point of time in the district.

Exploring and Discovering the unknown - Urban myths. Everyday we may pass by a shut door, a roadside shrine or a slope without knowing why / what lies beneath. If you have a curious exploratory streak in you (or not) then joining the Walk In Hong Kong team on the Urban Myths tour around Wanchai is a must. Our erudite & engaging guide, Haider took us around the vicinity, pointing out either the history , legend or urban myth of a particular spot. From the time of the Portuguese, to the Japanese in WWII to later British colonial rulers, Wanchai is seeped in history. Heavily bombed during the war, the resilient district continues to flourish. We discovered places that we had not known existed, there are temples that now mean more than just a place of worship, walls that are remnants of a different past, the history behind the architecture of certain buildings and how all this has shaped modern Wanchai. Perosnally I believe that you have never fully lived and understood a city, until and unless you have breathed and imbibed its culture and physicality through knowledge, exploration and discovery. And this is what this tour does. Haider our guide is very keen to share his well researched knowledge through careful study and personal experiences. If in doubt, always ask him questions, which he answers to the best of his knowledge.There is more to Hong Kong than just skyscrapers, amazing cuisine and tourist attractions. Scratching the surface is just not enough, one needs to dig deep. Tours are tailor-made to suit individual needs. This tour was not strenuous and all other details on what to wear and what to bring is very clear on the tour company's website.I would highly recommend the tour to locals and visitors.

HK history in a nutshell- fascinating!. I joined the walk in tour in Yau Ma tei and another one in central. The tour guides are extremely knowlgebale and clearly put in a lot of research about the area. I grew up in HK and walk past these buildings every day and had no idea there were so many fascinating stories behind these roads and buildings. Highly recommend locals and non locals to go on these tours. Eye opening experience! I'll try to go to all the other ones too

We have the right guide!. We were lucky enough to get a private tour guided by one of the founders of this company, who happened to be the author of the Lonely Planet guide to Hong Kong! We have visited Hong Kong a few times so we are sort of familiar with the city. This is the first time we joined a tour and the experience is exceptional. The guide, Chung Wah, brought us to some lesser visited areas like Kwun Tong, Pok Fu Lam and Kennedy Town. There we attended the annual fire dragon dances during the Mid-Autumn Festival, found interesting vintage shops hidden in abandoned factory buildings (we even visited a collector's storeroom and saw tons of pre-WW2 collections of different types!), and tasted some authentically Hong Kong dim sum and drinks. I will definitely recommend this walking tour company to Hong Kong newbies and old hands alike.

Scents of the City. We thoroughly enjoyed this tour. It was recommended by our niece who lives in Hong Kong - she has done several walking tours with Walk in Hong kong. I must say Haider was exceptionally good - very well presented and a great knowledge of the content of the walk. It was at a leisurely pace having plenty of time to rest in the extreme heat of Hong Kong (Central District) It was great to be able to buy produce on the walk - especially tea. We would recommend this company to our friends back home in Australia. If we have the chance to return to Hong Kong - Walk in Hong Kong will be high on our list of things to do. Keep up the good work.Don & Joy Linke (AUSTRALIA)

Absolutely amazing walking tour! Highly recommended. I joined a tour about "smell" in Central District and I must say it is an extremely creative and fun walking tour. We didn't just visit places - we also participated in the space by using our sense of smell. Our guide Dora is a friendly, humorous person, very knowledgeable about stories in Hong Kong.

Explore the city differently. Despite the typical hot and humid weather in Hong Kong, tour guide Haider told anecdotes vividly throughout the tour and answered questions from other participants patiently.Based on the theme 'Scent', we had visited several spots including wet market, temple and tea house to know more about HK's history. It was great to discover things what most travel books wouldn't mention, yet sad to know some places visited in this tour are going to be demolished. I highly recommend Walk In tours if you wish to know more about the city and not just wandering around repetitive shopping malls or standard tourists spots.

Great Experience | highly recommended. I must say that my tour through Sham Shui Po was without a doubt one of the most enjoyable experiences I had in HK.Their staff was really friendly and knowledge of almost everything and everywhere we went.two thumbs up!

Insightful tour at Yau Ma Tei. It was a great tour to explore the local culture and history and to listen into the stories behind the scene. Quite enjoy the tour. Glad to find the social entrepreneurship rooted in Hong Kong which brings more people to care and value the place people live.

Amazing tour!. Paul took our group through Sham Shui Po yesterday and I was thoroughly impressed with his knowledge of the area. Paul speaks English very well, he was easy going and flexible when we wanted to stop in various shops to browse. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone wanting to see an authentic look of Sham Shui Po!

A fresh experience to not only see, but also SMELL, Hong Kong!. The tour I joined today is called "Scents of the City". It was basically a 2.5 hour walking tour around Central with a highlight on the sense of smell around this area. It was truly a fresh angle to feel the city and the scents in the tour did add much spice to the tour, making it well more remarkable and impressive to me. Particularly I like the Graham Market and Tea shop parts. I love the interaction of our guide Haider with different stores owners in the market. The atmosphere was definitely warm and local and we can know a lot more from different shop owners. The visit to the traditional tea shop was another highlight which I love the tea tasting part and tea trading history in the old Hong Kong. Though I live in Hong Kong, it is still pretty fresh and interesting for me to experience Central this way! Highly recommended!

extraordinary walking experience. Joined the Lo Pan Birthday Walk on 9th July. Such a good chance to witness traditional Chinese Festival and to learn about the history of the rapidly-changing district "Kennedy Town". Really love the last part of the walk (the wall is unforgettable) :) Btw, Paul was really knowledgeable (seems like that he knows everything about the district)

absolutely amazing experience, highly recommended. I have done two tours around Central - the scent tour and the money walk tour. The guides were extremely knowledgeable and passionate about history of HK. Both tours are packed with interesting stories and fun facts about hk's past and present, from fung shui to architecture, culture to finance.I personally found the scent tour a very creative and witty way to introduce HK, you will get to savor and appreciate tea, flower, incense (that's where Hong Kong's name came from!), soy sauce, chinese herbs etc. Also check out the last stop of the scent tour, definitely the most surprising scent you can ever imagine!

A creative way to see the city!. The two-hour walk in Sheung Wan I joined last Saturday was not just about introducing the history of the area but was also about observing and documenting the changes in this old town of Hong Kong by sketching. We first visited an art library where we had a bird's eye view of this traditional Chinese quarters on the island, then we stopped at a garden, a temple and a historical building-turned museum and we sketched at each stop. It was quite a challenge for an amateur like me as we had only about 10-15 minutes to sketch. But it didn't really matter and I thoroughly enjoyed this new way to see the city where I have been living for a couple of years. A plus is at the end of the tour each of us had a wonderful souvenir, a Decoder sketchbook! This tour is family-friendly and if this activity is going to be held again I would like to bring my daughter along.

A nice trip down the memory lane of Hong Kong's past. I joined the Victoria City tour in Central on a scorchingly hot summer day. As a Hong Kong native, I am always interested to hear stories about the old Hong Kong and this tour satisfied my curiosity about the city's colonial past. We walked from the Mid-Levels to Central through the Botanical Gardens.The tour guide is very knowledgeable and informative about the historic buildings (some are quite hidden) and their significance in the history of Hong Kong. What particularly fascinates me are the people associated with these places, including Bruce Lee and Robert Hotung (yes, both are related in quite an unexpected way). I read about their relationship before but it's nice to be reminded of that piece of information in a lively manner.Just beware of the boiling hot weather if you do the tour in the summer. The oppressive heat can easily make you lose concentration. Also bring a mosquito repellent or you'll risk having mosquito bites at the end of the tour like me...

A Walking Tour unlike other. It was obvious that the guide was truly passionate about local history, and most of it is not textbook history but stories of interesting anecdotes or interesting people. However it was not only a tour that allows us to learn about history of Victoria City, but also colonial history, colonial policies, and even the connection to Hong Kong today. It is a good way to start learning about the history of Hong Kong and relate it to the Hong Kong that we know today!

Highly recommended!. Since last September, I have joined four walks organised by Walk in Hong Kong, getting to know more the history and stories of Wanchai, North Point, Yaumatei and Tai O. Despite I have been living in this tiny city for years and I definitely think the tours help me understand my home better!Recommended for both locals and expats.

Excellent choice of corporate event - engaging, informative & educational. I was organising a corporate clients event at work. Walk in HK tailored a Sheung Wan Cultural Walk for us to entertain and mingle with our clients and it was an astounding success. The leader of the Walk, Haider was very professional with lots of intellectual credibility. We were shown all the hidden gems Sheung Wan, off the beaten track and told lots of stories as we went along. However they're not just telling you history, but relating the past to what you see today, and focusing on the recurrent social themes that emerge and re-emerge decades later. All our clients were gobsmacked when they were shown what our Sheung Wan office used to look like 100 years ago, and learnt about the relationship between the Bubonic plague and Blake garden in HK. Most importantly, we recieved overwhelmingly positive feedback from our clients saying how much more they know about this neighbourhood, and they also think it was very creative of us to organise an engaging and infromative cultural activity with them. This is a farcry from the usual corporate and sterile cocktail gatherings. Everyone was genuinley interested, engaged in the tour and helped us build even deeper relationships with our clients. It also has good PR effects showing that we care for and promote local heritage. I would recommend them to anyone thinking of corporate awaydays or clients events.
An Intimate Tour of Yau Ma Tei. Paul is incredibly knowledgable and passionate about the history of the area. He was very friendly and showed my group of five students Hong Kong's interesting past.

interesting tour!. the tour enables participants to know more about the Fukien and Shanghainese community in North Point, Hong Kong. The guide is attentive and knowledgeable. it's a very nice experience even for local Hong Kong residents.

Fascinating even for a local, highly recommended!. I was born in Hong Kong, sometimes I was embarrassed by how little I know about my hometown. I could spend days exploring lands abroad, but I simply ignored the historical and cultural insights in Hong Kong. I joined the Walk In Hong Kong: North Point Nostalgia tour yesterday, I was surprised to find a Soviet-styled architecture, a small local noodle factory and some underground stories of North Point. Our tour leader (Chung-wah, a writer for the Lonely Planet Hong Kong) explains everything clearly, she is knowledgeable and an inspiring storyteller, she was also happy to answer any questions in this 2-hour tour. I could see that she (or they) takes great pride in what she does, it's interesting for me to "travel" in my own place, I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to see Hong Kong from a different perspective.

Rediscovering the city. This is my second time to join a tour from WalkIN Hong Kong win the walk in Sheung Wan + letterpress workshop. Although this is an area where I hang around all the time, the stories and interesting trivia from our guide Dora amused me at every turn. A very well researched walk supplemented with movie clips and old newspapers. The second part of the walk was the letterpress workshop, where the owner shared his family passion and a personal account of the rise and fall of an industry in Hong Kong. We could take home a personalised souvenir too!

A tasty slice of old Hong Kong. I joined the Victoria City tour in Central on early May 2014. The tour guide is very knowledgeable and speaks very good English. I am working in Hong Kong but I don't know there are so many hidden historic buildings and interesting sites in the city, which the guide introduced us with an album of old photos.I particularly liked the story of the first American female missionary to China (and Hong Kong), and the juicy scandal concerning a former Governor's wife. It's always enjoyable to hear some near-lost tales of the past. Many Asian cities are undergoing rapid city gentrification and these stories become all the more important for preserving the memories of old communities.

Yau Ma Tei walkabout. It was great pleasure to be lead by Paul in his walkabout of his old neighbourhood which he has a passion to share, not merely anecdotal, of historical significance for a deeper understanding of the community in the context of HK's development ...very much enjoyed by an always sceptical local :) and will be signing up for more!

Best walking tour company in Hong Kong. I did the Shamshui po, HK cemetaries and Yau Ma Tei walk. Really friendly and knowledgeable guides, they will take you back into Hong Kong history, and let you meet and hear the stories of local residents.
