Choose this company if you want more than just the typical shopping trip and if you are interested in experiencing true local culture.

My kind of Hong Kong. It's all about intriguing stories of interesting people who shaped the great city. Explore the city in perspectives which are sure to impress. The City of Victoria Walk did just that.

A way to view Hong Kong differently. Joined the North Point trip, you could see a very local district in HK and listen to intriguing stories. Recommend for travelers who want to enjoy the authentic place of hk, except for the classic travel spot.

you will find an unique hong kong!. I joined the walk of Victoria city for about two and half hour. We visited several wonderful historical places and the guide told many interesting stories behind. The stories are collected from many different recourses and reflect the true life of people living and building Hong Kong City. Worthy joining it and great to know a vibrant Hong Kong - not only today but also in history!

Visit to the ghostly spots in Wan Chai!!!!. As a Hong Konger I am surprised by this trip that there are so many things in wan Chai that i never knew before! It's absolutely a good thing to do for both locals and tourists and I enjoy meeting tourists and their different perspectives on the same places and pieces of history presented to us during the trip. The guides are diligent and I can feel their passion in presenting a different Hong Kong to us that is more than just a financial city and shopping paradise!

Good tour. I participated in a walk in Sham Shui Po this past Saturday, and I enjoyed it. The guide is from local and very knowledgeable and professional. And the tour included a variety of aspects about the place. I highly recommend it to anyone who has an interest in understand Hong Kong's local culture.

A Fabulous Tour. I joined a tour from the City Lane to Possession Street. It came across the Hollywood Road, Pound Lane, Wing Lei Street, etc. Through the 2-hour tour, I know more about the urban development and culture preservation in Hong Kong. I felt amazed when I passed through a narrow and dark stair, I saw a bright and wide floor which is the Pak Tsz Lane Park. It recorded the history of Qing’s Revolution and Sun Yat-sen. It surprised me as I did not notice this place before. I also saw many graffiti works during the tour. They are on the wall, on the street and on the lamp pole. They are beautiful and some are meaningful. Join the tour and you will not regret!

Don't miss it.. Walking start from Hong Kong University to central, the story and history start from 1912 to 2014. Our Guide Cliff introduce good old days of old Hong Kong with film footage and old pictures. Highly recommended.

Worth the 2 + hours. Excellent Death and Life walk around Tai Ping Shan area with Haider on Sunday with my mother. It was just us with Haider, which meant we could take as long as we wanted and asked as many questions as we wanted (not that we needed to, Haider was thorough as could be and very accommodating).I don't have a favourite part, because the entire walk was great, and I learned a ton about the history of the area.It's rare to find people today who are really passionate about what they do, but you could see Haider enjoyed what he was doing and sharing his knowledge with us, without holding anything back. Using photos and sharing stories and facts, as well as linking all information to be relevant to today's issues, he really brought the history of the area alive and wasn't boring whatsoever. If you want to learn more about parts of Hong Kong, and cannot be bothered to read dry books, I really recommend Walk In HK tours because it is definitely worth the money and time. The walk would suit anyone (family, friends, couples, business people, etc.) who enjoys walking areas in the city you perhaps would not normally spend much time in, and learning interesting stories and facts about neighbourhoods in HK.

Awesome in every way. We took clients on a walking tour of Sham Shui Po. Our guides knew SO much about the area, and not just the stuff you can read online. Intimate little stories from ages ago that contribute to the historical quality of the area. They also had ipads which they used to show us old pictures of the current spaces we were looking at. Our guides also had so much personality! They were really fun and entertaining. They were also very flexible and accommodating. Definitely recommend!!

Hong Kong's history comes alive. Paul led the Money World walking tour in Central. The group learned fascinating facts not only about how Hong Kong transformed into a world financial center but also how the area developed from the mid-1800s to the present period. The anecdotes made the buildings and statues come alive. Great use of old pictures that led to greater understanding of the extent of change the city has undergone. Paul was extremely knowledgeable and encouraged questions for greater understanding. Looking forward to making the tours a regular staple of future trips to Hong Kong.

A real slice of Hong Kong. To experience and understand what Hong Kong really is you have to join Walk in Hong Kong's walking tours. Hong Kong is more than just shopping and eating. It plays a very unique role in modern history. The tours are all well researched and the guide will take you back in time to understand the city's history and culture. They connect the dots from seemingly irrelevant incidents and paint a vivid picture of why Hong Kong becomes what it's like today. Highly recommended if you are visiting Hong Kong.

“walk in”, experience the history in your neighborhood. Paul and his team offered us tailor-made familiarization tour in our neighborhood – Kennedy Town and trained our students to participate as tour guides. We really enjoyed the time of walking into the spots that we usually “ignored” even those we walk by everyday. It was awesome of experiencing the tradition and culture by following Paul and listening to the fascinating stories. Join "walk in", you will know the city from its history to the present, and look at your familiar surroundings differently.

Highly recommended!!. Forget the average tour guide bus!! This guided walk by Paul was an excellent way to see bit of insights of Kowloon - with good opportunity for taking pictures of the spots which are not easy to find if you don't know the area. Even if you are a local "been there done that", there's a good chance this walk will give you something you haven't seen! Would also recommend to anyone visiting Hong Kong first timeOur last 2hr walk went through Yau Ma Tei and Mongkok areas where I learned interesting facts about Kowloon trading and history of local shops, markets and old style city design.Good fun, a bit of walk and got great photos!

Good Tour. You get to learn more about Hong Kong especially the little details and stories behind. I was part of a big group so while I get to meet other travellers too, a little bad side is not being able to hear the guide occassinally.
Awesome walk. Thank you Dora, Paul, Sum for a great walk to Western District and I learned so much about HK history. Well done and looking forward to the new walks in Architecture, Money, etc.

you will fall in love with Hong Kong. The team of walk in Hong Kong are really doing a great job, helping us, both in and out of Hong Kong, to dig out the real beautiful things and cherish memories of Hong Kong. Just walk with them and you will fall in love with this city.

Fascinating historic walking tour of HK - Locals should go on this tour!. I took the Urban Myths walking tour and it was brilliant! It was really fascinating to hear all the stories of Hong Kong's cultural heritage in the context of our ever changing landscape. Our walk took us to old historic colonial homes, secret bomb shelters, buildings designed with extreme feng shui considerations and new property developments that are still gentrifying Wan Chai. Despite being born and bred a local Hong Kong person, I still found this a very interesting experience!

Scents of the City. The Walking Tour: Scents of the City ended at a success today! Having visited the wet martket at Central, chatted with the owner of an old tea shop at Sheung Wan and walked through streets, we get to know about the urban redevelopment, HK and China all along close relationship as well as the local colonial history and culture, all directed by the feel of scents. What an awesome trip indeed!

Scents of the City- Hong Kong's aromatic (and stinky) past. What an experience!I have been on other tours of Hong Kong before but this one was completely different.If you want to see Hong Kong in a completely different way, learn more about its historical origins and have the opportunity to try some authentic Hong Kong tea, then this is the tour for you!Really enjoyed it and it was very worthwhile.

Excellent guides. On a three day stop-over in Hong Kong last week we did three walking tours with this company: two private and we joined one group tour. They were all outstanding. The Yau Ma Tei district is in central Kowloon and visits streets, shops and markets and ended with tea in a strange art deco café. The tour of Tai O was very different: it is at the far end of Lantau Island and takes about 1.5 hours in all to get there but is extremely interesting and worthwhile. A small fishing village with an extensive history. A lot of walking was involved to temples, houses on water and other points of great interest. The group tour was City Scents which takes place in central Hong Kong and visits places with different smells and scents.. Each tour was about 3 - 4 hours (Tai O a bit longer with travelling). We had three different guides and they were all outstanding: really knowledgeable about the places we visited, and also friendly and flexible, so we could also decide what we wanted to do. An interesting feature of each tour was the historical aspect as each guide brought an Ipad with photos of some of the things we saw taken a long time ago, so one could see the changes. The Hong Kong we saw on these tours was completely different from the glass and skyscraper environment of most hotels (which is also a beautiful part of Hong Kong), and so we got a very diverse view of life and society in the place.If you are spending any time in Hong Kong, this is the thing to do. When we visit next, we'll be doing some of their other tours. Really unmissable.

Sham Shui Po tour. This is the second time I joined Walk in Hong Kong's tours and this time it was to Sham Shui Po. This is a place I seldom visited though I know there are a lot of interesting stuff in this neighborhood. The guide was born and bred there so she is truly an in-the-know. Her childhood stories were already fascinating enough. We visited the open-air markets, the historical housing estates and tried some awesome street food there (It's hygienic, so no worries). The markets were hustling and bustling and we were told that there would be an ocean of shoppers and visitors alike on Sundays. We went on a Saturday afternoon so it was still manageable. Most of the tours offered by Walk in Hong Kong are on the sleek Hong Kong Island and this one to the very down-to-earth areas in Kowloon is kind of refreshing in a way.

A Wonderful Kowloon trip. We visited the old Chinese quarters in Sham Shui Po in Kownloon with this company and we thoroughly enjoyed the walk. There are not only thematic markets in this area but also some interesting old buildings, including a beautiful magistrate court turned art school and an H-shape public housing estate, which is now preserved as a youth hostel. The guide is a good presenter and she kept us engaged throughout the tour, with pitstops when necessary. I would say it's a tour suitable for both old Hong Kong hands and new comers.

A must-do in HK for both travelers and locals!. I always loved walking tours whenever I travel, and the Walk-in tours are simply awesome! I did both the Wan Chai and Cemetery walk and am fascinated by the unknown side of the city. HK is such an interesting place, despite its small size, history is tangled with mysteries, adventurers, refugees and various political powers etc... It's amazing to dig into its past that has been woven (and somehow hidden) into the modern tapestry (outshined by the skyline). The tour guides researched extensively on the routes and I strongly suggest that you speak with the guide after the tour to learn more about them individually!

An awesome tour in Happy Valley. I joined Walk In HK's Happy Valley tour last week and I highly recommend it. We visited two cemeteries there in 2.5 hours and the guide told us at least 10 very fascinating stories of the early pioneers of Hong Kong. If you are into history of this former British enclave this is the tour for you. It gives you an overview of historical demography and you'll be stunned how multicultural Hong Kong used to be. The "residents" in Happy Valley cemeteries are expatriates. I hope this company will do a guided tour to the Chinese cemeteries in Aberdeen etc.. so we'll have a more complete picture of how the early settlers, both locals and expats alike, transformed a barren rock to a metropolitan.

Yau Ma Tei Tour. Paul, the tour guide, had researched his tour carefully so as to offer a wide ranging, in depth, original walking tour of Yau Ma Tei. He asked us questions to engage us. He used his Ipad to illustrate interesting aspects of the history of the area, such as the protest years ago where social workers demonstrated to uphold the rights of fishermen's wives in the area. He checked that people could hear his clear, easy to understand presentation. Although my husband and I had lived in Hong Kong for six years we were attracted to hearing something in depth about the history of the area. We were delighted with the interesting sites, the genuine people he involved and many fascinating points about the architecture.Paul brought out the spirit and resilience of people who lived in the area.  We liked the originality of this tour. It was genuine, rather than slick and showed the area in depth. We would recommend this tour to those who already live in Hong Kong as well as to visitors wanting an engaging and 'real' tour of Yau Ma Tel.

Fascinating insight into the rich history and culture of Hong Kong. We've now joined 2 different Walk in Hong Kong tours and would highly recommend them whether you live here like us or are just visiting.From our experience the guides are all very invested in the subject matter and do a lot of research to make sure the tours are both informative and entertaining. The first tour we went on was around Hong Kong Cemetery and gave a very interesting perspective on a part of the city and its history that I've often wondered about. We go through Happy Valley every day so it was great to get an insight into its origins.More recently we went on the Da Jiu walk in Yuen Long. Even though they had only decided last minute to add this to the schedule, our guide was well informed and kept us all engaged for over 2 and a half hours. The walk through Yuen Long Old Market gave us a glimpse of what HK was like before all the high-rises. Hopefully the government will learn before it's too late that people are really interested in Hong Kong's heritage and start conserving some of the few historically significant areas before it's too late.We'll definitely be signing up for more walks to continue learning about what we already know is a brilliant city!

excellent trip. i went for the cemetery walk in happy valley. i thought i am so familiar with hk i was wroooog! in the trip, i learned the development of hk and the stories of many people who had a great impact here. lookng forward to joining other trips,

A great way to know Hong Kong.. Hong Kong is a metropolitan and modern city. However, there are still tracks of history around the city.I've joined several tours of Walk in Hong Kong: Sheung Wan Old Shops Tour, 'Da Jiu' tour and North Point historical tours. Even i'm a naive Hong Konger, there are still much I did not know about the Old Hong Kong, but the informative tours had made me know much more. The tour size is good and the guide is very patient and informative, it definitely worth you to spend some time for the tour if you visit Hong Kong, if you want to know more about the authentic HK culture.

Amazing tour. I joined the 1967 Riot tour and it was very impressive. History was explained in an interesting way by Prof. Yep, an expert in that part of the history. The tour itself was designed in an innovative way by Walk in HK, and even for a local Hong Konger, the tour is such an eye-opener.

A unique way to understand Hong Kong. I joined the tours of 67 riot and to Yau Ma Tei Districts and both are eye-opening. I am a native Hong Kong person but the tours made me realize I am literally ignorant of the history and the social fabric of my home town. Their tours are one-of-a-kind in a city like HK who is always portrayed as a materialistic, shopper's paradise. The tour guides are very passionate about their city too. The tours are recommended to travellers who wish to understand HK beyond its surface, and to local people who find their city too boring.

Sheung Wan Old Shops Tour. Very impressive guide with great knowledge of the area and the different shop owners, who welcomed us in places that may otherwise be tough for tourists to visit. Very patient with answering many questions and narrating the deep history of the neighbourhood. Would recommend!

True gem for Hong Kong history and culture buffs. I joined the "Cemeteries – A Tribute to the Brave, the Tragic and the (In)famous" tour. Being from Hong Kong, I myself never knew the stories or great families behind our tumultuous colonial heritage. It was certainly a wonderful 3 hours well-spent wandering through Happy Valley in an intimate ~10 person private group, they had a wealth of anecdotes to share for every gravestone, with a rich dossier of photos and reproductions of historical documents and maps to illustrate their every point of interest. For those who like to roam, they thoughtfully prepared wireless earphones so you could listen to live narrative while on-the-move.My tour guides were diverse, passionate individuals who seamlessly cover native-level English, Cantonese and Mandarin. They grew up in Hong Kong, returnees from working as highly educated professionals abroad, and so recognize every nook and crevice, taking you from the most in-the-know cha chaan tengs in tiny neighborhoods to chatting in dialect with the lifelong seafood traders in shophouses. They will certainly provide you with the deepest access to local interactions, with a treasure trove of personal anecdotes on their own family traditions and growing up in Hong Kong across generations, in the way average English-speakers only tours simply cannot offer. Who could possibly know Hong Kong best? I would strongly recommend 'Walk In Hong Kong' for this precise reason; as a discerning traveler, you should never accept any degree of compromise.In terms of length, these tours are perfect for travelers passing through on a stopover or anyone with a free morning or afternoon, as each itinerary is about 3 hours long. This is a true gem - unmissable, for both leisure / business travelers and locals alike.I cannot wait to explore their lovingly curated area and thematic tours selection: 'Death and Life', 'City Scents', 'Old Shops', 'Urban Myths', '1967 Riots', 'Art Galleries', 'Architecture', 'Indie Music', 'Nature'. It's time for me to re-discover my home city and fall in love with Hong Kong all over again.

Unique and must go!. I have joined in total three tours with this company. Must say it was impressive to hear stories about Hong Kong and it's history such as Opium war and fisherman village at TaiO. Though I am Hong Kongers myself, i was shocked by those urban myths and location. Thanks so much for those who have organised this - really enjoyed myself :). Will join again for other tours as they come up.

Sheung Wan Old Shops Tour. I already joined a lot of walking tours around the world, but this tour was one of the best. The tour guide was very well prepared and told us a lot of stories about history, chinese medicine and food and even how to prepare all the ingredients for a healthy meal. Sheung Wan is for me, I come from Germany, a spot of typical Hong Kong. The old shops were presented by the tour guide as well as by the shopowners in a very magnificent way with lots of informations and stories you remember the next day. Thanks a lot for this great tour.

Tai O Walk. Joined the Tai O tour in November. Thanks so much for another wonderful and informative tour. Enjoyed seeing everything from the dried white sharks to the mysterious mortuary hidden behind the bamboo forests. Can't wait till the next walk! : )

intelligent and informative. I joined Walk In Hong Kong's 67 riot tour, which is certainly one of a kind tour that brought you to understand the avoided red and communist past of HK, something you don't read from a mainstream guide book. Very enriching and intriguing, especially for history frenetic. This tour group does provide very special thematic tours. The content may be too advanced and specific for tourist though. The guide said there is another beginner's level tour on North Point which talks briefly on the 67 riot, and brings people to very local old shops, where you get to talk to master who makes traditional noodle, Indonesia herb store that reflect the area's multi ethnic background and a very delicious tofu shop.

Know HK more. They gave me hidden history or information what I can't find in general ways. I found there are many interesting history in HK Cemetery after the tour. Although I live in HK, I found I'm not familiar with my lovely home town... It is a must-do when you come to HK. I'm interested in their coffin shops tour now!

Guaranteed to Impress. I joined the Urban Myths Tour around Wan Chai. The guide was extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic. Along the tour, we were told stories and tales linking the past and the present, the old and the new, which added a lot to what makes this city so charming. The itinerary is well designed around hidden (and invisible) corners which you would definitely have missed otherwise. I especially liked how old photos were shown on the spot in contrast to the present. Make sure you get a special taste of the area with this tour. It's guaranteed to impress -- even to a native!

informative and entertaining!. I followed a walking tour to Yau Ma Tei with Walk in Hong Kong. Before the tour, i thought i knew this area quite well. But I was wrong. The guide told me many things that I did not know. There were lots of history in this area here and I was glad to know about the past. Also the guide was well-prepared. He showed us lots of pictures to compare the present and the past. It's an interesting experience!

Unique insight into HK. I've just moved to HK with my family and in a bid to get to know my new city, signed up for the Sheung Wan and Wan Chai walks. I was extremely impressed by the knowledge of our guides, and felt I got a real insight 'beyond the guide book' as we walked around hidden corners that I never would have come across otherwise. We also visited a local printing press and its nice to know in a small way through our fee we're helping to keep this impressive and niche local tradition alive. The group is a nice size and the guides seem very proud to be sharing the local stories and histories of their city.We took our baby in the the sling and it was fine, despite the steps of HK so I would urge new parents to do it, and enjoy learning about HK while your baby sleeps.

Excellent tour. I have just moved to Hong Kong, and went on the walking tour of Sheung Wan, my new neighbourhood. It gave me a fascinating insight into the history of the area, including great little anecdotes that you wouldn't find in a guide book. Clearly a lot of research and thought had gone into preparing the tour, and it was clear the organizer was very passionate about Hong Kong and sharing its history. I would highly recommend to all and will definitely be taking more myself!

Uncover the Hidden Gems. I was born and grew up in HK but never realized there had been so many interesting spots in the district until joining the North Point tour. The tour was very informative and the organizer Paul was well-researched. The trip did not only reveal the missing spots of the area, but also highlighted some places that I had been "taken for granted". No matter you have lived in HK for decade(s) or new to the city, I would still highly recommend it to you. HK just needs more trips like this to share our stories!

Visit to a traditional printing house. I enjoyed the tour very much. Although I am a local, I have never visited a traditional printing house before. It's both entertaining and educational! I look forward to more workshop like this.

Yau Ma Tei tour. Excellent tour of Yau Ma Tei ~ giving local insights to the area. Would recommend this to both visitors and locals. Having lived in HK for over 6 years hears it was great to discover more about that area and look forward to joining the organiser Paul on more of his behind-the-scenes tours of Hong Kong. Highly recommended.

An inspiring walking lecture!. I joined a tour about the 1967 Riots in Hong Kong last weekend with this company, and found the tour amazing. The walk covered the areas of North Point and Quarry Bay on Hong Kong Island and we visited a number of historical landmarks of this important yet violent chapter of Hong Kong history, which quite a number of local people still think it's a taboo to talk about. The docent is a professor and I was so impressed by his vivid narration and unbiased presentation of facts. The walk was simply like an outdoor lecture. The only drawback was it was so noisy on King's Road and there were certain places we could hardly hear what the docent said. But once we went more uphill to a residential area (the spot where two kids were killed by explosives in 1967) it was quiet enough and we were able to make a quick pit stop to refresh ourselves. Overall it's an inspiring walk and I look forward to joining some other tours in the future.

The One and Only History and Cultural tours in Hong Kong - I liked :). Hong Kong is Not just about food and shopping, but there are many unseen sights and unique local culture that are indeed really, really worth to explore. Yesterday I had great fun walking around those interesting areas, streets, stores in Central which I never pay attention to in my whole life. Really enjoyed listening to those memorable stories and history behind. Thank you Walk in Hong Kong for reminding me the beauty of my city:) The tour is fun but also very informative and educational! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - Not just expats but also the locals here!

Great start for art beginner. Great exploration of HK gallery, it encourages me to visit more galleries in daily life.
It's really a great way to see another side of HK besides the eating and playing.

Great tour of contemporary art! . We took the Saturday art gallery tour guided by Candy around soho and it was well worth our time. Definite recommend as a must do in HK even without prior knowledge of art! Our guide was very knowledgeable and friendly.

Great tour. Really great tour! The guide explained a lot about the galleries and the art. It was nice to get a background on the painters and paintings. Also we went to a lot of galleries we would not have found ourselves. I would definitely recommend this tour.

Delightful Gallery-hopping. Hong Kong has lots of galleries, but most people probably don't dare to step into one. Joining such a group gallery tour is just what we need... The guide is a local art enthusiast, who brought us to 5-6 different galleries, showcasing different types of arts. She was patient & enthusiastic in her explanations. She even showed our group some public graffiti art, which most would probably overlook. Definitely time well spent on a Saturday afternoon!

History and Superstitions. We went on the heritage and haunted Wan Chai tour with Maria - it was great! We learnt a lot about Chinese superstitions, spirituality and beliefs and toured around some of the hipster and less salubrious streets of Wan Chai. Maria was a fantastic tour guide - professional, informative, and funny. It was a really interesting introduction to Hong Kong's history and something different to do!

Interesting and Informative. I did the ghost walking tour in Wan Chai. Maria was a great guide, who showed me a great deal of the area. There were a lot of interesting stories told, and the tour gave me a better understanding of the history of the area. This tour is not just about ghosts and haunted places, but about the general history of the area as well. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who is interested in history.

Génial! I highly recommend.. I did the Soho gallery tour: it was a wonderful experience. Will, the guide shares his knowledge and creates inter-connections between people in the group . Très bel échange humain et cuturel autour de l'Art. A faire,sans hésiter, durant un séjour à Hong Kong
Great Tour!!. Maria is awesome!! Liuda tour is a "must have" introduction to Hong Kong's geographic, history and culture. We (a group of 4) had a great fun with this tour. Highly recommend!

Soho Gallery Tour. i joined this tour a few weeks ago and really enjoyed it. The guide was so knowledgeable and informed us in a very nice and clear way. We visited a mixture of galleries and types of art. I had walked past some of these galleries and not known they were there so it was a real insight. I highly recommend it as a great way to spend a couple of hours.

Brilliant insight into forgotten HK history. Longyi was a terrific guide: young, very engaged and enthusiastic, and well-informed. She made this obscure episode of the Cultural Revolution come alive in an engaging, human way, without seeming dry or academic. As a student, she seemed to present a very balanced view of the political situation at the time: neither pro-government nor pro-"leftist". The places she took us to for illustrating the story were unusual and off the beaten track: not the places that tourists, or even locals, would think to go. Loved the experience - we overran on time, and it was still too short!

Art and Candy. We went on an Art tour with Liuda Cultural Walking Tour guide, Candy. It was a great way to see some of the smaller galleries in Hong Kong and Candy gave a very informative explanation of the work and the Hong kong art scene. It was nice to chat to the other participants too. I would thoroughly recommend this tour.

2 excellent walking tours: HK and SOHO Art. We took 2 walking tours with Liuda while in HK and both were excellent. The first was Hong Kong 101, my son & I were the only ones on the tour which was very lucky, Maria is a very interesting lady who loves her city and transmits that passion in her tour. We met over in Kowloon, took the Star Ferry to Central, went up the IFC tower to admire the view, took a tram to Sheung Wan, rode the 1km escalator to the mid-levels & visited the Man Mo Temple, all in 3.5 hours ! We also did the SOHO Art Gallery tour with Candy which was interesting but unfortunately several of the galleries were closed so we only visited 3.

Really Recommended.. Maria was great explaining us, literally any small detail during the a bit more than 4 hours tour. I´ll try to get another tour with her as I am pretty sure i´ll get to know any important space, area, store, temple, building, view or experience that any "tourist" or new "immigrant-expat" ( :) ) in the city needs to know. It was a great time with Maria around HK.

Excellent Introduction to Art World in Hong Kong. We went on a very interesting and relaxing Soho Art Gallery Tour. Our tour guide Long Yi was extremely knowledgeable and engaging. She shared many stories about the artists and her perspectives and understanding of the art works. As additional materials, She also showed paintings and photos on a tablet to introduce us to the background information of modern art. The experience was interactive and entertaining - I only wish we could have gone to more galleries and had a longer tour.
Open up a new world about HK and art. Really excellent experience, for the selective galleries and nice tour guide, also a startup for understanding about artists and some art investment.

Some great stories. Did the Wanchai Haunted Tour with Liuda in a relatively small group. Maria is a long time Wanchai resident and knows the lanes, bylanes and stories associated. Not just restricted to be a "dark and spooky corners" tour, she also took us around the main street in Wanchai to regale us with some of the stories and odd customs there. I am a Hong Kong resident but I didn't know a lot of these stories.My only suggestion would be to make it a bit more dramatic and scary. A lot of people come to the tour to feel the fear as well.

Soho Art Gallery Tour. A really relaxed and interesting way to see Art in Hong Kong. Will was a great guide, who instantly put you at ease, engaged the group and knew his subject very well. A tour for Art and non-Art enthusiasts.

fantastic introduction to Art in Hong Kong. The tour was extremely interesting and I have learnt so much about the Art scene in Hong Kong. Will was an excellent guide, he was well prepared and there was a lot of background information. I will highly recommend this to anyone who is interested in learning a bit about Art in Hong Kong.

A fantastic HK dessert tour with Maria!!. We had such an awesome time on this tour with Maria. She is absolutely wonderful, the perfect tour guide. We were lucky enough to be the only couple on the tour, so it was really nice to be walking around Hong Kong with Maria at our own pace.We stopped at 10 places on this tour. Definitely do not eat beforehand - there is so much amazing food on offer, you will leave very full!!We did this tour on our last full day in HK and wish we were able to do it on one of our first! We would then have been able to go back and eat all these desserts again and again!Thank you, Maria!
Great walking and knowledgable tour. Such a nice tour guide and a great group to walk together and admire the arts on a Sat. morning. It has been a great pleasure.

Impressive Art Gallery Tour. Although it was a gloomy rainy day, this Art Gallery Tour brightened me up. The tour guide Candy is very knowledgeable and friendly. It's impressive how HK is an art center indeed. And I think I've become more interested in and capable of interacting with art in the future!

Unique experience: Soho Art Walk. What a unique start of my weakening Hong Kong. I took part of the Soho Art Walk and was pleasantly surprised. I learned so much about Chinese and Hong Kong art movements & their background, all while admiring incredibly-unique pieces and galleries. Our group was small, 4 of us including our extremely-knowledgeable guide, Will. Imagine my surprise when he casually mentioned he works in investments and the art tours are just his HOBBY! Wow! I seriously thought he majored in art in college! Makes sense why he's so passionate. Absolutely loved the experience. My only complaint is that the tour wasn't longer ;)Unfortunately, none of their food tours were available during the weekend. Can't wait to go back to Hong Kong to try them out. This company has some really unique offerings and I encourage you to check them out -- it's not the same ol' boring cookie-cutter tours.

Interesting Tour. My husband and I took a very interesting Hong Kong 101 tour. Our tour guide Maria was very friendly and knowledgeable. She patiently answered all of our questions. We saw a lot of sights in a short amount of time. Maria made great recommendations on other places for us to see during our stay in Hong Kong. During our tour we made some stops for local snacks that were interesting to try. There is a maximum of 12 people on the tour and we had a nice small group of 4. I would recommend Liuda Tours during your visit to Hong Kong.

Not so many ghosts, but saw some new places!. We've lived in HK for nearly 3 yrs, but always in the new territories so know very little about the island. This tour was not only very interesting to hear about the heritage and cultures of the people of Wan Chai, but also to see some parts of the area we didn't know about previously. It was called Haunted Heritage tour, which is not so much a "Ghosts" stories tour, more a potted history of the atrocities committed by the Japanese during their occupation, which was interesting. Taking our 9yr old on the tour, with hind-site, perhaps wasn't the most appropriate thing, obviously the lockheart road area has a certain reputation that it gained from being close to the port with lots of sailors, which is not a subject that is easily or comfortably discussed with such a young innocent boy, but Maria did an excellent job of conveying her message without to much graphic detail. All in all, a very nice night out.

Highly recommended - Art Gallery Tour. I've been living in HK for six years yet i have never known so much interesting galleries in HK before i tried out Liuda's Art Gallery Tour. The guide Candy was super friendly and knowledgable, and the small group setting made it really easy to interact with each other. Spent a wonderful afternoon. Will definitely try again.

Hong Kong 101. It was our first time in Hong Kong and the Tour with Maria was the perfect start to get to know the city and people. Maria showed us some hot spots of Hong Kong and not just the typical tourist attractions. Furthermore we got unique recommendations on activities for our following days. Maria was speaking english very well and had an answer to every question. You could tell that it is her passion to show people her city. A great highlight were the visits of local food stall with long tradition to have a little snack. Thank you very much for the great time!

Excellent Dessert Tour!. Had a excellent dessert food tour was exciting, food was excellent and the tour guide was amazing and had so many useful tips and hints about the area. Highlight of the foods were Rice Ball with Sugar Coconut Sesame;Sweet Ginko with Mashed Taro; Osmanthus Jelly; Creamy Custard Buns; Egg Tart and Sugar Puff. As a Pastry Chef would highly recommend this tour to anyone who has any interest in trying local foods.

Great tour. My wife and I went on the Hong Kong 101 tour with Marie. The tour is filled with interesting facts about Hong Kong the city and Hong Kong the state, and Marie was always open to further questions about everything. We went on a ferry ride, got to the 55th floor right in the middle of the Hong Kong Central, took a tram, tried a couple of local foods, and saw very different sides of this magnificent city. I sincerely enjoyed this tour and highly recommend it to everyone!
Soho Art Gallery Tour. 5 galleries, excellent knowledge of trip leader. Range of types of artists shown. Very enjoyable and relaxing for the price.
Very nice tour with Maria. It was a very interesting tour and a good combination about history, spirits and Chinese superstitions. Maria is wonderful.

A thoroughly good introduction to Hong Kong. We were a small group of 4 persons on a very hot day. Maria was very patient and answered so many questions and explained so much additional information that we overrun by a good half hour but she wanted to make sure that we were truly satisfied with our tour. We were.I had arrivied in Hong Kong shortly before the tour started but I don't regret the exhaustion that I experienced towards the end by going straight into the tour instead of waiting a day.Definitely recommended.

The 1967 Riots in HK tour (English). Excellent commentary from our tour guide Loneyi. She has guided us through some historic sites in North Point being one of the important sites, and she also had some photos on hand to show us via the tablet. Hong Kong is a very noisy place, we each had a listening device using our ear-plugs (bring your own), listening through a microphone clipped on our tour guide's top. Great idea for listening whilst walking around! It's a worthwhile tour and it is an important part of the Hong Kong history, I am surprised that it's not being included in the "Things to Do" list in Hong Kong on some tour websites!

a great gallery/art tour in Hong Kong. If your are interested in art, specially contemporary Asian art, this tour is great for you. we had a professional guide to show us some of the most famous galleries in Hong Kong. also tell us some interesting stories behind the scene (painting)...it will show you the artistic side of HK, highly recommended!

A must have experience in HK, both for tourists and locals . A must for anyone who's interested in arts, in exploiting HK from a different perspective, or in getting engaged in good conversations & company. Very informative and sharing, the tour guides you through some of the galleries located in Soho (one of my fav spots in HK) where you get to see the artworks, to know the stories of the collectors/artists, and understand a bit of the art market and pricing. Will is a well prepared guide, instead of just throwing out what he knows he encouraged an interactive communication among the participants to explore the art world collectively. Would definitely do it again later when some new galleries/exhibitions coming up.

Finding a different Hong Kong. I was happy to spend an afternoon enjoying such a great walking tour.Candy was a nice guide.She introduced many famous art works and the art market in Hong Kong,and it not only enlarged my view of art,but also of Hong Kong.We walked through 3 different galleries and the experience was fun.

Highlight of the trip. Very short trip to HK and the best decision made was HK101 with Liuda. Very good introductory tour for first timers and it was absolutely great experience to hear all the history from a local perspective. very well curated activity that has changed my perception for HK. egg tart was also a must try. i googled a lot of terms after the tour and it was very helpful for my research. Also my friend Amy has tried out the gallery tour and heard it was great (the tour was led by an ex-banker!!) maybe tips for other visitors is to bring more water as it involves a good amount of walking.

informative art lecture and arty experience. Will took us to many galleries and it was like a small seminar of not only the galleries, but also the concept of art itself. I enjoyed the interactive explanation and meeting cool people! Great discussion and really fun time :)

Highly Recommended Tour. Candy did a great job in explaining the galleries and their history. The experience is very fun and i discovered a different side of Hong Kong. I will visit the galleries myself from time to time.

Haunted heritage tour a must do for people who want to explore more than bars in the evening!. I can't think of a better way to have spent Friday evening on my short visit to Hong Kong than with Maria on the Liuda Heritage and Haunted Tour of Wan Chai. The very dynamic Maria regaled our small group of a mix of locals and tourists with fascinating tales of haunted houses, hotels, schools and more. I was initially more interested in the historical aspects of the area, but got quickly pulled into the haunted tales through Maria's storytelling skills. Great value!

Liuda soho gallery tour with Will. I loved this soho gallery tour! It's not easy to find galleries that are hidden in the buildings and Liuda tour not only let's you discover galleries in HK, the tour guide explains each artist exhibited and the history of art in each culture. Amazing guide Will and thank you so much for teaching us and guiding is to new findings!! Highly recommended.

Briliant experience. I joined 3 Liuda Tours. My tour guide for each of the tours was Maria - a warm and motherly lady who was very helpful and was a walking encyclopedia for interesting facts about Hong Kong.The Hong Kong 101 tour was very informative. Although I had walked past some of the buildings and neighbourhoods we were taken to on the tour before, the experience was much more enjoyable with Maria explaining some of the history and interesting facts about them. Maria also took us on tram and ferry rides. It was my first time on both the tram and ferry and having Maria explain how it worked took the hassle out of figuring it out how it worked by myself.The dessert tour was a wonderful experience. We sampled 10 different desserts and Maria as usual had interesting stories about the desserts and the shops selling the desserts. The selection of desserts was a good balance between the more common desserts i.e. egg tart and less common ones i.e. chiu chow bean soup and yam pudding. My favourite desserts were a mango cheong fun and a bun filled with the runny yolk of a duck egg. The Wanchai tour, as Maria explained was a more a cultural tour rather than an out and out haunted tour. Nevertheless, some of the places she took us to did give me the chills. If you bring a camera, you get can some spooky pictures.The Liuda tours are very good value for money and cater to a wide range of interests - whether you want to sample Hong Kong desserts, get a feel for the area or scare yourself silly. Would definitely recommend them.

A vivid journey into a troubled era. I lived in Hong Kong during the mid-90s, and finished high school in the city, but my understanding of the territory's history really changed after joining Liuda's tour of North Point.With clarity and insight, our guide Raymond discussed the events of the 1967 riots. It was a solid overview, from the riots' historical roots (migration from China; squalid living conditions; colonial policies; lax labor laws) to the factors that sparked the unrest (global youth movements during the Cold War; the creeping threat of invasion by Beijing; rising Leftist agitation in the schools and factories). From there, Raymond explained how it shifted from a valid labor rights movement to an anarchic terror campaign with a civilian body count.All of this is solidly grounded in location-based storytelling, including visits to the site of a deadly blast and the apartment building that was once ground zero for Maoist organizing circa '67. The walk is suitable for all fitness levels and includes some memorable sights, like the Yik Cheong housing estate in Quarry Bay.My only gripe is a slight mix-up about the meeting point at North Point MTR station. However, this misunderstanding was quickly cleared up, before it could delay the tour. A very satisfying experience overall!

Awesome spooky tour of Wanchai. I joined the Wanchai Heritage and Haunted Tour that takes place every Friday night. Our guide, Maria, was very friendly and knew Wanchai inside out, having lived in the area for ~30 years. I've lived in HK for awhile now but still learned so much about the rich (and violent) history of the neighborhood--the 2-hour tour takes you around the red light district, haunted buildings and former cemeteries (now overtaken by yuppie restaurants and bars). Some parts of the walk were actually quite scary, especially if you believe in spirits.Highly recommended tour for both tourists and locals--and a convenient spot to relax after with drinks!

Appreciating Art Made Easy in Hong Kong. With a great guide, the tour made appreciating and understanding fantastic art pieces located in some of Hong Kong's art galleries an easy and less intimidating experience.

Fantastic intro to art galleries in HK. Living around the neighborhood of these art galleries, yet I never went in any one of them. Liuda helped break the ice and it was a well designed two hour intro to the art world. Our guide, Will, is very knowledgeable and interesting. The tour is interactive and entertaining. I believe there is no other tour operators giving similar experience in HK. Kudos to Liuda!
excellent experience. the tour guide was nice, patient and knowledgeable, how she thought about those arts were inspiring. it would be nicer.

Excellent tour. Professional guide. Candy is knowledgeable. She introduced the history & development of modern art, very systematic and easy to follow for beginners. Well designed tour. Selected galleries are representative and different in styles and taste.

Great for everyone, tourists and long term residents. We enjoyed our tour enormously. Having been in Hong Kong for 13 years, there is still so much we don't know about Hong Kong. Our guide, Maria was fun, entertaining and knowledgeable about Wan chai. We enjoyed learning about the history of the area. Definitely recommend for a fun evening out for something different.

Fascinating tour. Maria was an excellent guide and very entertaining. I had already heard quite a lot of stories about Wanchai's history but I learned a lot more at this tour. A few places we visited were quite spooky but it was a fun evening out and I came out of that tour wanted to learn more about Wanchai's rich history.

Very well designed tour. I went to the HK 101 tour with Liuda. It was very well designed to provide an intense, informative, punchy tour. We experienced 3 different transportation methods. I have to say the guide is extremely knowledgeable. She gave us the micro audio receivers so we can all hear things clearly in some noisy places. It was definitely very considerate. But the weather is a bit hot. So i would suggest other people to apply more sun protection before and during the tour.
Excellent ghost / heritage tour of wanxhai. Maria really carried the tour - loads of great information, backed by so much personality and interest. Really great evening out.
Excellent - Strongly Recommend!. Soho Gallery walk past Saturday was an amazing tour - fun and educational! Long Yi was an exceptional tour guide and made the tour a great experience.

Fantastic!. I feel I'm very lucky come across this amazing tour online, it feels very enjoyable & inspiring! I love the tour, she has very good art history knowledge and very good attitude, she makes me feel very enjoy the tour, the galleries and what I learned, for sure I'd love to do it again!

Excellent, fun & thought-provoking 1967 Riots tour!. Thanks to Liuda and Long Yi (龍伊) for a very well researched and well thought out tour of significant historical relevance. It was both a very thought-provoking and fun afternoon - interesting and informative, and a different perspective on the HK we normally see. Everyone from the NZ Society of HK enjoyed it immensely.Long Yi was an excellent guide and provided clear and interesting information and insights into a fascinating subject. We also appreciated the ear-phone receiver and iPad display.We would highly recommend any Liuda Walking Tour and are looking forward to doing another one soon!

Excellent heritage and haunted tour. Thanks for a great tour. Found it very interesting and chills ran up and down my spine at times. Also I have a suspicious photo that I took. Looks like a image of a ghost on the roof of the last house we visited. Only on a close up I can see a image of a head and shoulders looking down at us when we were on the stairs. Thanks Maria.

Maria was an excellent guide!. We arrived in Hong Kong at 5:15am after a 16 hour trip from JFK. The best decision we made to battle jet lag was to take the 2:00pm Hong Kong 101 tour with Maria. She spoke excellent English and was an amazing source of local information. The tour lasted 3 - 3 1/2 hours and Maria walked us through Hong Kong, gave us suggestions on what to visit, how to get there, a bit of history, and colorful insights into this wonderful city. Definitely a must do!
Wonderful. The tour guide told many interesting stories, so the trip is really enjoyable and knowledge-expanding.

Start with a meaningful weekend tour. I joined Soho Gallery Tour with my friend last month and visited four showrooms. The speaker shared difference artists' stories from Chinese to Western, details and meaningful.I recommended that you should have a lunch after the tour as this is central!!!

Wonderful tour. i booked the hk101 tour basically 1 hour before they started. it was a wonderful tour. I have effectively only one day in HK and i had business meetings before and after the tour. so i was looking for a crash course to get the most out of it. it was very worthy. The price is cheaper than what my hotel concierge has told me. I had almost 3 hours tour while the website said 2.5 hours. we have taken star ferry, tramways, central escalators, and visited statue square, central pier, hk monetary museum, oasis buidling, hollywood road and man man temple. It was a very photogenic tour and i really wish i could have brought my camera with me. Definitely value for money - but maybe a bit tiring after walking for 3 hours. mharder for me because i have other business matters to attend to... if you attend this tour i woudl suggest to have lighter plans for the evening. but again, highly recommend!
excellet experience. Tour guide was nice and professional.A recommended tour in Hong Kong.I think two hours was a little bit short.

Excellent experience. The tour is very meaningful and interesting , much better than my expectation. Super 5 star recommendation of our guide: Ms Long Yi, her presentation and interactive with our group audience make us think more about the profound impact of art!

101 tour, highly recommended to get to know HK within a limited time!. This tour shows you the major highlights of HK with some very interesting background information ....just enough to get more excited to explore more of this amazing city. Our enthusiastic guide spoke fluently English and completed the tour in a good pace...to make sure every minute was worth it.

Very interesting adventure. Definitely a new side of the old story. I used to spend quite a lot of time in this trendy neighborhood especially for dinner and drinks. Now I need to summon more courage before stepping in again. The tour guide gave a full two hour lecture on wanchai history and it was very informative and entertaining. Especially in the moden context of recent accidents, it is more than spooky!

Hidden gems to art in hk . People don't usually recognize Hong Kong as art center because artists don't live here. But HK is definitely a big art market. Big auction houses and art fairs keep the city artsy all year long. Artists cannot afford to live here but gallerist can find buyers around the world from here. It was obviously a hidden gem to overlook. We have seen Kusama, Picasso, Wu Guanzhong on this tour and I think the price of hkd200 is totally justified.

Couldn't have a better time than walking and eating :). Yes, it was a serious dessert tour. The guide gave us specific recipes, taught us how to make them and shared the secrets of sourcing different materials. We thoroughly enjoyed all the eateries, maybe less so for egg tart because it is quite common in Hong Kong - but you still won't regret as it is probly the best egg tart I had :)
More than I was expected. Many thx to the tour guide Maria for her vivid and detailed stories. If she did not mentioned the irrelevant part, it would be perfect.
Hong Kong 101 walking tour. Even though have been too Hing Kong many times learned and saw many thigs hadnt known about, very enjoyable tour with Marie

Heritage and haunted tour. The tour started at WANCHAI mtr and went all the way to the haunted house of WANCHAI. Maria the tour guide was extremely informative and had a lot of stories to tell about the history of the region and we did find the walking tour a very nice way to get to know the history and culture of the city but as walking tours go this one was not exceptional and as haunted tours go this was merely average. In a bit more detail - I am an avid traveller and have a special love for walking tours. I find they are a great way to get to know a city and understand its culture. A haunted tour similarly needs to explore the dark past of a city and Maria did share a lot of stories to that effect, however, she was either having a bad day or dint believe in the stories her narration was informative but not entertaining. The overt use of photographs was distracting from the mystic nature a haunted tour could have. If I could make a suggestion, I'd recommend that Maria or the team attend either the London Grim Reaper tour or Edinburgh Witchery tour if they can to get a perspective on how entertaining such a tour could be.I have no affiliation with any of the mentioned tours and merely suggest them because I enjoyed them.

More than just a walking tour. My recent Hong Kong 101 tour with Maria was a great introduction to Hong Kong. I booked on my own and there was only one other person on the tour. I'd recommend this tour to anyone who has limited time in Hong Kong or who wants an introduction to the city. We covered a lot of ground in 3 hours but it never felt like we were rushing. The itinerary has obviously been well thought out and some of the highlights for me were the ride on the star ferry, the visit to the 55th floor of the IFC building, the ride on the mid-level escalator and the quick stop to buy an egg-tart and some delicious sugar cane juice. Maria was a fantastic guide and had a lot of knowledge and passion for HK, without going into too many facts and figures. She was always making sure myself and the other tour participant were OK, that she wasn't going too quickly, and offered to take pictures for me. Both the starting and finishing locations were within easy reach of MTR stations and there's opportunities to use a bathroom and buy water during the tour.

Wanchai Heritage & Haunted Tour. Great Tour with our guide Maria, who was so very kind to wait for us almost half an hour - nonetheless we walked more than 2 hrs along all those hidden places in Wan Chai.Start at the MTRexit is easy to find. Living in HK for a long time, our guide could tell us a lot not only about buildings, professions and history of the quarter, but also provided us with interesting facts about culture, religion & superstition and - of course - ghosts and where to find them.Marias English was easy to understand for not-native listeners and always loud enough to hear (even along big roads).Five green owl-eyes for this exciting tour & our excellent guide - see you again for the dessert-tour ;)
Very delightful!. I went on this tour on my own and it was so much fun. Our tour guide is both informative and interesting, I feel like knowing more of the artistic world already!

very helpful to know another side of Hong Kong. very helpful to know another side of Hong Kong, the history, the big events, the difference and similarities between yesterday and today. I live in HK for almost 7 years, but this is the first year i feel to know more about it since I'm with Liuda. Very lucky this time is the founder Raymond himself led as the guide. Very interesting, also we can ask a lot of questions that we care to have more discussion and sharing of views.
Excellent tour with Long Yi. It is a great tour with the tour-guide Long Yi. Her introduction to modern art gave me a deep impression and makes me thought a lot.
Ms. well planned tour! The last stop is stunning - public housing estate at quarry bay! And we took the tram!

Worth visiting Hong Kong in this way. I've joined the 1967 Riots Tour. Since I'm interested in South China studies/history, I think this walking tour is very useful for me to get a better panorama of the past stories especially when you stood there where the things exactly happened. If you're not interested in history but in Art, Liuda can also offer a tour for art-lover like you at Soho area in Hong Kong. Very meaningful and impressed. Thanks Liuda and thanks Longyi.
Very inspiring tour. The tour guide - Long Yi is great! Her introduction to the galleries and paintings made me reflect a lot.

Off the beaten track Wanchai Tour. My boyfriend and I went on this Friday evening tour with Maria and thought that it did a very good job of shedding a different sort of light on the Wanchai neighborhood. She brought old pictures of the neighborhood and brought us to those exact spots; she spoke about the history of the places as well as the local superstitions or cultures. I liked how her stories really engaged us and made us feel like we were seeing a different side of Wan Chai. Some parts were a little spooky too, which was fun for us. The tour went from 8pm to around 10:30pm. Definitely something a little different!

Best art tour ever. It’s easy to imagine Hong Kong as something of a cultural desert. But look closer and you’ll see that the theory doesn’t hold up. Liuda's soho gallery tour offers an excellent opportunity to explore the arty side of the city for a new comer like me. The tour was very well organised and the guide was the sweetest guide I have ever met . I look forward to joining other Liuda tours in the near future!

Fantastic tour into a interesting piece of Hong Kong history. The tour was designed to offer you a chronological review of the 1967 leftist riot taken place almost half a century ago. The tour guide is definitely well prepared and very knowledgeable on this subject. The tour becomes vivid when you step foot onto several places which have witnessed the history unfold. One thing I specifically like about this tour is organizers' effort to present subjective facts and leave them with yourselves to think and judge if you will. Definitely worth the time and effort!

Back to 1967!. Having participated in Liuda's gallery tour & haunted tour a few months ago, it became my daily practice to check its website, waiting to discover its new tour offers. Finally the chance came - another new route went live - 1967 Riots Tour, luckily I got 2 tickets secured before it's booked out.The walking tour attracts a mix of expatriates, mainlanders and HongKongers, all wanting to understand the history of the former colony and in search for the connection between history & the politics today. We walked pasta series of old buildings in North Point & Quarry Bay and hear a lot of untold stories from the professional guide.We took a step back in time that day, and now the city became another maze for me to discover!! Amazing walking tour & highly recommended!!

Seeing the dark side of Wan Chai. This is a great way to learn more about the dark side of Wan Chai, from the first morgue and funeral home, to haunted cinemas, houses and schools, through to the meaning of the offerings made outside the establishments in the Red Light District. Maria was very informative and funny, and the 2 hours went by very fast. Great tour for those interested in something other than the usual Central/TST spots.
Love it. Love it, learnt a lot about contemporary art. also get to walk around the classy hollywood road area at Sheung wan. Olivia is a quite nice and helpful as well.

Very impressive gallery tour in HK. Olivia is an awesome guide!! Very helpful and knowledgeable tour guide taking us to a few galleries of different styles, including galleries of HK local artists and global ones like French and Russian.Mike

really really interesting tour. We went on an art gallery tour with Liuda. We saw five or six art galleries in two hours -- which is a good amount of art to see before you get all tedious. Our guide, Long Yi, is really awesome. She is from Mainland China, I think, and she adds a unique perspective on censorship and art on the Mainland side, versus on the more liberal HK side. Art galleries we visited are pretty eclectic too -- from calligraphy art to Chinese avant-garde art to European photography. We could have gone into them ourselves of course, but our guide's firsthand knowledge of both artists and gallery owners really add extra dimensions to our visit.

knowledgeable 2 hours!!. A friend of mine took me the tour of "the 1967 riots", it`s one of the most significant incident happened 50 years ago. The speaker took us to the neighbourhood of North Point, where the riot was first taken place. The speaker helped us to understand why the riots happened in the area, and what`s the connection with nowadays life of Hong Kong people. I have say the speaker was really knowledgeable and skilful, she was able to elevate the historical archive into something interesting and fun to listen! One of the fascinating thing on the way is that, the block we walked through was quite different from the Hong Kong we usually came across: many old-school shops and many local aged people. I think the tour spotted some of the originality of the city for us, and it is always happy to do so!

Informative, intriguing, and a good walk. The tour takes you around the North Point area on HK Island, now North Point isn't your typical tourist area so I think it is quite interesting to see a fairly different side of Hong Kong. The 1967 riot was a significant event in HK history as one can witness some of its legacies even to this day. Through this tour you will not only get a general idea of this historic event, but also more in-depth information such as individuals with their roles and fates in the movement, the roles of Britain and China, and the general public's opinion throughout the movement. Overall I am quite pleased with the tour and would recommend it to anyone who wants to know more about the history of this city.
Great !. Explore another side of the city. Open yourself up to the art industry of Hong Kong. The tour guide has excellent knowledge about art history and art business in hong kong

Knowledge-enriching. The trip will let you know the wholestory of the 1967 Riots as well as anecdotes of the old streets in the district. May refresh your impression to the history of nowadays prosperous and stable Hong Kong.

Nice walk around HK and learn about its history. The tour does not only let you learn about the riots, which was a very significant event in Hong Kong and changed HK in so many aspects, but also let you establish the link between HK today and HK 50 years ago. I would especially recommend this tour to foreigners who work in HK, as it will allow to you see HK from a totally different perspective than before.

Fantastic!. I truly enjoyed the haunted Wan Chai tour, Maria was an amazing guide , she had so much knowledge about the area that made the walk really unique . It's not a typical ghost tour but rather a walking tale of the history of Wan Chai, which has to be the most fascinating area of HK. Definitely recommend this tour.

Beautiful Sunday afternoon in Soho. Don't worry if you are not an expert of Art and don't have much idea about the Gallery world. Olivia is knowledgable and nailed to deliver everything in a simply and fun way. Every art piece I saw still in my mind and I can recall background/ information/ fun fact of each Artist/ Gallery Olivia told us. I wish she was my teacher, so I don't have to bury my head in textbooks to get good grade. lolAnd Soho is an amazing area. From Fine Art to Street Art, Eastern to Western, Local to International. I felt like walking in a kaleidoscope. We are so grateful last Sunday was a sunny winter day. After the 2 hours fantastic gallery exploration with Olivia, we went to enjoy a cup of coffee under warm sunlight. Aww...what a beautiful day, I am in love with Soho now!

Second Tour with Liuda - Very well designed. This is the second tour I joined with Liuda - SOHO Gallery Tour. It was a chill walk around SOHO, and we visited 6 gallery and also some street art. Olivia was extremely knowledgeable and helpful for us to understand all type of Art piece, as well as Asia art market. The tour is very well designed, even through I was late for 5 minutes, I can simply walk in the first gallery and join her.
Like the tour. Even as a HK local, I found the tour very informative, and it's nice to hear all the stories behind spots which I might have overlooked in the past.

SOHO Gallery Tour - fantastic!. During my stay in Hong Kong I would regularly walk past the galleries in Soho and find them quite intimidating. I was curious to enter, but didn't feel like I could, not being a regular or even occasional collector of art. So to stumble across this walking tour which demystified the Hong Kong art gallery ecosystem and took me into many of the galleries I had only walked past was a god-send! You get exactly what they describe in the tour information! Tour guide Longyi was an awesome host, sharing her passion and knowledge of modern art and contemporary artists, and providing insight into how the gallery system works in Hong Kong. We visited 6 or so galleries, each featuring different styles of work and artists from around the world. If you're an art lover, would like to step into these galleries without hesitation, and to get a taste of the Hong Kong art scene, then don't go past the Soho Gallery Tour. It's worth it!

Great Tour. This is the second time that I joint this tour. I really enjoyed the sharing given by Longyi, she perfectly presented her views towards art and the behind stories. Each time the content was almost different, so I am really looking forward to my next experience with Liuda Gallery Tour.

Lovely guide, interesting tour. We really enjoyed the Wan Chai Heritage and Haunted Tour on Friday. Maria is a very sweet lady who obviously has a passion for Wan Chai and knows a lot about the area. The tour is quite long so perhaps there could have been the occasional opportunity to sit down (especially as my friend has a bad back). The highlights for me were the Star Street area and the red brick house. We booked through Klook.com and it was a really quick and easy process. Thank you again Maria for a great (and alternative) evening.
Nice tour!. Thanks to our guide Olivia for having shown me galleries in SOHO. I look forward to attending another tour soon!
Excellent trip. The smart professional tour guide knows a lot about modern art. Well-designed route and enjoyable artwork.

Urban tour into the art deeply. I would thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone who loves to explore the heart of the urban HONGKONG. It was really informative and user friendly. The tour guide knows tons of different galleries and artists,like ART EXPAT who would show you the right and insightful knowledge about chinese art work.

good experience!. our tour guide is Olivia, very knowledgable, and very nice girl! I like her soooooooooooooo much. the galleries we went are all different style, cover so many fields like Chinese, Thailand, Japanese, Middle East.. from traditional painting to modern ones even to photography and street art. Strongly recommend! I didn't imagine I can learn so much in 2 hours before the tour!

Great experience. My friend and I did the walking tour led by Maria this week. Maria was really passionate about the area and highly knowledgeable too. She took us to a variety of places and had great stories about some of the history too, explaining the Canotnese expressions as well as the English. I'd highly recommend this tour. Great value for money too.

an excellent and interesting little thing to do in HK.. it was a great experience to have someone guide me through paintings instead of standing outside the gallery guessing what is the artist trying to tell by myself. Suggest to start a membership for those regular attendees and update them with the latest gallery news to maintian customer stickness-i didnt have much idea what i was expecting to see before meeting up with my guide.

A good experience to get a taste of Art in HK. Get a taste of contemporary art and the gallery info in HK, knowing the background of the art collection industry. The guide is really nice and knowledgeable!! It is worth to join~

Amazing tour for SOHO area and Chinese contemporary art. I spent a Saturday morning with Liuda to get to know a few things about the galleries in SOHO area of Hong Kong and it was absolutely worth it! Our guide Longyi is very knowledgable and talked not just about the 5-6 galleries we went to, but also intensively about Chinese contemporary art history. If you are an art lover, or just want to know sth about the galleries in SOHO area, this is definitely a great tour to join!

A pleasant and informative 2 hour wandering in SOHO. Being an art lover I am so happy to find this gallery tour in HK. Never really walk around the galleries as they don't seem that approachable. Liuda did a good job by curating galleries of different style together with deep dive in some artists yet still be able to maintain variety. We visited some big ones and also edgier ones. The pace is good with no rush. We can stop take photos and enjoy paintings when we want to. I like the part about art history. Also find the background stories about how the art dealing world work interesting. The interaction between art lovers, painters, dealers and auction houses are fascinating. We even met one artist today with his paintings which is another bonus point! A good way to explore Soho area off the tourist traps. If you are curious about art then book it!

Enriching Art Gallery Tour. It was a truly enriching experience. Longyi's understanding of the art market and history was impressive and complex, yet she was able to convey her knowledge and impression in a very gentle and engaging manner.Will definitely consider joining other Liuda activities.

Amazing tour with the best guide!. First clarification: although named after "haunted tour", the tour itself was not scary at most time. Instead, it was very enjoyable with all the surprises and excitements as we explored the different side of Wan Chai. So, don't be scared off by the name! The tour was also very contentful in terms of history. And with probably the most interesting and experienced guide in Wan Chai you can ever find, Maria, I am very postive that you can enjoy a night of joy and new knowledge. :D

Educational and unique. Very interesting tour - spent two hours walking around different galleries in Soho. The guide was very engaging and knew the galleries inside out, asked a ton of questions to interact with the guests to make it more interesting for everyone. Especially enjoyed the part where the guide explained how the "art ecosystem" works i.e. artists, galleries, auction houses...etc. All in all an enjoyable way to spend an afternoon.

Fantastic walking tour. We recently did the Heritage and Haunted walking tour of Wan Chai with Luida Tour. We could recommended it highly enough. The walk is easy physically expect if it is a hot night then you will need to bring a bottle of water.Maria our tour guide lived in Wan Chai for more than 20 years making her incredibly knowledgable about the area. Bonus was she was able to point out some great local restaurants and advise on the ones that were too expensive! Fantastic as we had recently moved to Wan Chai from Australia. The tour last two hours and provides a lt of context and understanding of why certain buildings exist and why certain landmarks or features are where they are. Very interesting overall and will certainly help us explain things to our family and friends when they visit. Well worth doing if you would like to understand some of the heritage of Hong Kong.

Best local tour ever !. The private gallery tour I joined on a beautiful Saturday was totally beyond my expectation. With the nicely-designed routes, detailed explanation of artists & art-pieces, Liuda tour helped me revealed the other side of Hong Kong -- artistic yet tranquille

Excellent Haunted Tour of Wanchai. Maria has charisma in spades and it was fascinating to hear her stories growing up in the area and how they tie into the 'hauntings' she mentions. I also liked that she brings in aspects of Chinese culture and superstition, mixed in with observations about how current businesses or residences have supposedly been affected by them - very eye-opening and spooky, if you believe in that stuff (After all I heard that night, I just might start!)

A Unique Art Experience in HK. Hong Kong is a hub center for Asia's top work of art. Yet, there is few tour to cover the art market in HK. Liuda Tour is the just right choice for an art enthusiast such as me. The guide is very knowledgeable and the organizer is very considerate in picking up the art galleries to visit. Hollywood Road used to be my most familiar road. But after the visit, I found that there are so many art spots which I haven't observed in the past. Thanks to Liuda, I got the opportunity to revisit the road with a brand new experience. There is no doubt that this tour can provide the visitors a great chance to learn about the artists, the art galleries, and how the industry works. I would definitely recommend this unique tour to my friends.

Best Gallery Tour Ever!. There is no doubt that this is the best tour I ever had. The tour guide Olivia is fabulous and knowledgeable. I am quite surprised to find that I became so interested in modern art after this wonderful gallery tour. I'm also eager to try other tours held by Liuda Tour and surely I will recommend to my friends.

Great tour that guides you for unknown stories in a familiar neighborhood. This Liuda's haunted tour was not my first but yet the best haunted tour I've experienced. Living in Hong Kong for years, it was amazing to find out that Wai Chai, a very familiar neighbourhood, has so many ghost stories that I never heard of before. Maria was knowledgeable and funny and sometimes tried to draw herself into the characters of her ghost stories, which was definitely fun to watch and enjoy. For that two-hours tour, you would be feeling like a character in a scary movie! This tour is strongly recommended for tourists and locals, a must-do in Hong Kong.

Very knowledgeable guide. We spent around 2 hours in Wan Chai and Admilty. The walk was easy though a bit hilly. The guide was a very knowledgeable local HK lady and spoke perfect English. She gave an overview of Wan Chai in the early 20th century and pointed out quite a few haunted places along the way. The highlight was the visit to a deserted terrace upper hill in Wan Chai where no one was around. It's a very cool experience.

Interesting tour of a local neighborhood. I joined Liuda's haunted tour of Wanchai as a free-trial customer. I have lived in Wan Chai for over 5 years and yet almost everything on this tour was new to me. The guide was a local lady who spoke perfect English, she was funny and energetic. Everyone was given headsets so we could hear clearly even on noisy streets. It was sufficiently spooky and yet not too scary - a good balance.

Really interesting experience to uniquely odd attractions. The tour was like 2hrs long on Friday night, walking around Wanchai to see historical/haunted places. The guided is every experienced and she told tempting stories. Now I still think of the cinema ghost story now and then. The route is well designed, covering offbeat roads which few people would have gone to if were not guided by someone knows the place well. Also I learnt a lot about Hong Kong's culture and history. It was really fun and knowledgeable.

Dare to be scared?. Compared those black and white old photos with the bright modern buildings, passed through narrow and dark alley praying not to hear any weird sound, listen to the stories told by a lady who has been living there for a few decades. She did a great job to drag us back to the old days and imagine what was happening there. A scary but kind of fun walk, better go with someone to share the "excitement".
