Good that there are lots of bars in just 2 blocks away if you need a shot to calm down.

Very interesting haunted tour. This haunted tour by Maria is very unique, usually haunted tour guides are just trying to scare you - but maria brought in a lot of historical anecdotes to make the tour even more fascinating. All haunted stories are dots connected and Maria gave us a closer look of the unseen Hong Kong. Highly recommend!

Knowledgeable and interesting, eye opening and great story telling. It was a two hour easy walk around wanchai with lots of interesting hidden culture and haunted stories. Maria is very energetic, and she knows wanchai and HK culture inside out. I was amazed that she didn't even need to drink a bit water for two hrs of story telling. Definitely one of the best walking tour I have joined so far. She is apparently very Knowledgeable and interesting. it was an eyes opening trip, and I have lots of new things to share with my HK friend now!

Best haunted tour ever. We had very fun, educational, interactive and entertaining two hours with the award winning tour guide Maria. She lived in Wanchai for almost 20 years and she is extremely familiar with all the small alleys as well as the haunted stories hidden inside. Ghost stories come from old mansions, which are also historical attractions. She is fluent in modern HK history and her tour was very informative/updated in the current social context. I was very glad to choose her as our tour guide as i dont think i would be able to repeat the same experience elsewhere.Haunted tour was a must do in Hong Kong given HK is just such a superstitious city. HK used to be the biggest producer of horror movies in Asia. Wanchai must be the muse-alike place inspired all the movie makers. One thing i know for sure is that - i dont think i will like to hang out around star street, at least not alone.

Mong Kok Food Tour - Memorable Afternoon. Excellent afternoon on the food tour in Mong Kok., Yan was amazing and we loved spending time with her while she shared her knowledge of the local food and her home town. It was the highlight of our time in Hong Kong and we went away with great memories. Thank you Yan!!

Food tours are a great way round dive into scary foods. This tour was similar to others I have done in other cities. I find that hong kong food is scary, and this food tour challenges you to try some local items. Tour guide, Yan, also educates you on the neighborhood (North Point). Although, I did not enjoy all the items, I knew that I wouldn't. I did discover several items that I loved and had not tried before. Overall, a very good value at 600hkd...I was full at the end and Yan knows what she is doing.

A Great Food Experience in Hong Kong. We went on the food tour with Yan and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. We tried many different types of foods which is why we do food tours. We toured the fascinating markets of Hong Kong which was a worthwhile experience in itself. Yan's English skills were very good and she is an excellent host. We bonded well with our tour mates too! I left my phone at the snake soup restaurant and Yan was helpful reuniting me with the group after I went back to retrieve it. A good experience and highly recommend.

Mong Kok Kowloon Food Tour. Terrific afternoon with friends and family on the Kowloon food tour today in Mong Kok. Jacky our guide was excellent - helped us navigate the wet market - and try things we would never have been able to (or dared to) try. For anyone planning to take the tour - don't eat before you go! Once you've finished you won't need to eat again for a week.

Discover HK beyond the noodles and dim sum!. I truly enjoyed my food tour with Eating Adventures! Jackie took us to places I otherwise wouldn't have gone to or known about. HK food is so much more than noodles and dim sum, so if you want to discover what the locals eat, then I'd definitely recommend to join Eating Adventures on one of their tours. The small groups make it more personal and easier to manage and since they work with born and bred Hong Kongers, you are guaranteed a true insight in the local food culture! Would highly recommend!

Awesome Tour!. If you are looking to experience the hustle, bustle, heart and soul found in the streets of Hong Kong whilst at the same time sampling its delicious, authentic and traditional delicacies, The Eating Adventures Food Tour is an absolute MUST do! Be sure to book with Yan, who was everything you would hope to find in a guide, knowledgable, accomodating and most importantly cheerful throughout. Her local know-how and expertise takes you to all the hotspots a tourist might not find on their own. She describes the food with such infectious passion and clearly takes pride in the rich history and traditions that surround every dish we ate, you can't help but get swept up in the culinary journey. From mouthwatering goose, desserts with a Hong Kong twist and even the daringly unique Snake Soup (don't worry, it actually doesn't taste like you'd fear!) there is definitely something for everyone to enjoy. For me personally, seeing the hard working market salesmen and women as they prepare and present their treasures of brightly coloured fruits and bounties of seafood was just as heartwarming as the meals you get to enjoy. Knowing that our visit adds to the longevity of the small business in a tough market ruled by big corporations makes our meals that much sweeter. Yan and The Eating Adventures Food Tour of Hong Kong gets two big thumbs up from me!

Walking Tour. Great walk - food was different but excellent - Jacky our guide explained how each dish was made, showed us the raw ingredients in the markets and then we tasted the cooked version. Would highly recommend if you are seeking a taste of HongKong.

Delicious and Enlightening . We had a fabulous experience with Jacky as he took us through a maze of streets, alleyways, overpasses, tunnels and shortcuts to discover an amazing range of foods, tastes and sights. Jacky had an interesting story to tell about each food we tasted which helped us understand a bit of Hong Kong culture and way of life. So much to taste - recommend you do not to eat before the tour!!! A must do tour!!

Great local experience. Great food, great tour, great guide (Yan). Would recommend the tour to all foodies. Yan also explained to us a lot about how it is like to live in HK, the tradition and was super nice in general.

Great experience but a bit expensive compared to similar excursions. . I want to start this review by saying my group had a wonderful time, enjoyed the food and our extremely friendly and knowledgeable guide Yan. The tour was very good as we learned a bit about the food in Hong Kong as well as a little about its history. The only small complaint was the price. This trip was $110 CAD/person which can by a whole lot of honk kong food if you are on your own...as we had dim sum the previous night and it was under $310 HK for 4 people but we understand there is a cost associated with time spent. The other note is that in one of the markets there is a bit of a graphic scene with some of the meat so ppl with week stomachs or vegans may want to be aware. Overall I would still recommend this tour, especially for first timers who want to find some good restaurants to try again during their stay :)
Worthwhile. Knowledgeable guide Yan, well planned itinerary, and most importantly: delicious food. Do this tour.

A taste of Hong Kong island cuisine. Jacky was our tour guide. He clearly knows his way around the Hong Kong island food scene. The tour lasted just under 4 hours, as advertised. Spoke very reasonable English. Much of what Jacky talked about was done on the streets, and the road noise sometimes made hearing difficult. We found it challenging to navigate the crowds. We enjoyed the wet market, though we did not eat there. We certainly tried things we would not have ordered on our own. The goose was excellent.

Must Do when visiting Hong Kong!. An amazing day, with a wonderful guide, and great great food! We did the Kowloon Food Tour on day 1 in HK and I loved everything we had on our tour - especially the goose, Dao Fu Fa, and Pandan Ice Cream. It was very fun, with a small group (there were only 5 of us) and really great value for money as all the foods are included in the price of the tour. We went through markets in Mongkok which were full of locals and all kinds of foods - and got to try all kinds of new foods in venues I would have been too intimidated to go into myself. It was great to have someone there showing us everything and explaining Hong Kong culture! A great memory and a real highlight of our few days in Hong Kong!

gluten free in Hong Kong. Need gluten free food in Hong Kong and don't speak the language. To get some help, do a food tour. We were lucky on a Friday afternoon to have Yan all to ourselves and she took us to places we would never have found without help. My partner doesn't eat gluten free(gf) and not everything was gf, but I was able to taste lots and with Yan's advice feel comfortable. We had a wonderful experience and Yan was very knowledgeable. After the tour she emailed me more information with names and addresses of places to find gf food in Hong Kong. Definitely a 5 star experience with extras.

Recommended food tour. My brother and I had so much fun during our Mongkok food tour with Jacky. Not only did we get to taste authentic local food, but we also learned a lot about Hong Kong culture. Jacky really made an effort to share knowledge he has of every place we went to, and stories behind the dishes we were eating. Our co-tourists were also fun to be with. I highly recommend joining an Eating Adventures food tour when visiting Hong Kong. They also offer food tours in China.Thank you to Wai, Jacky, and everyone in Eating Adventures for a wonderful time in HK!

Excellent food and host. We opted for the Hong Kong Tour, starting at 2pm. Pre information was very good, my husband is coeliac and they changed some of the tastings to accommodate the fact that he couldn't eat gluten - sending us a list in advance of the food we'd be having which was very reassuring. We ate loads of food along the way, and visited lots of stalls in an open air market. Out guide Jacky was brilliant, explaining lots of the different foods as well as conversation ranging from politics, lifestyle, sport and cooking. We had a great time and would definitely recommend this to others.

Great HK tour when we were limited for time. We had just 2 nights in HK on our way back to the UK from Oz and NZ, and to get as good an experience as we could we decided to get a private tour with Jamie. He was very knowledgable, funny and very happy to go out of his way to ensure we got the sort of experience we were looking for. Full of interesting and varied information. Highly recommended.

Interesting and delicious!. I phoned in the morning and they got us in that afternoon for our food tour of Kowloon. We made our way from Hong Kong Island and met our guide Yan at the easy to find meeting spot. We were the only two on the tour! Yan was a wealth of knowledge about the local food and history, pointing out various interesting things along the way. We enjoyed all the food we tasted, especially the dim sum - so delicious! Great way to spend a few hours. Totally Recommended.

Fabulous Food Tour of Mong Kok. For a foreign tourist this tour gave a wonderful insight into the variety of food on offer in Kowloon in restaurants, street stalls and markets. This walking tour was in a relatively confined area and most of the time was spent tasting delicious dishes and learning about the food culture of the Hong Kong Chinese. Our guide Yan was brilliant! Her enthusiasm for the food was obvious and her knowledge was considerable. Yan greeted us warmly and her vivacious personality made her a delight to be with. We highly recommend this tour.

A fun look at food of HK the with a great local guide.. I emailed the company and joined a tour as a solo traveller ad they only take bookings of 2 or more on the website. The process of emailing and booking was super quick and easy. The team behind the scenes was really responsive. Christine was our guide for the day she w was really awesome. She has a really global eye for the world and knows and shared a lot about what Hong Kong is like for the people who live there. The tour I took started from Mong Kok The food spots were really interesting the day I went unfortunately the snake soup. shop wasn't open for a holiday. The tour went on and they made up for the lack of the snake soup.It was a fun afternoon. Pretty easy on the walking and it's clear that the guide and the company planned a good outing to expose people to what kinds of things Hong Kong has to offer in a way tha t makes it accessible to foreigner. I definitely reccomend trying to get a tour with these guys if my experience is in any way representative, it will be a good memory.

Much more than food tasting!. This Kowloon tour was everything we expected and much more. In addition to the food tastings described on the website, we were given an insight into not just the food of Hong Kong but wider cultural aspects, by our excellent guide Yan. We were warmly greeted at the meeting point (easy to find) by Yan and set off immediately to our first tasting restaurant for crispy goose! Along the way Yan stopped at a number of different shops and stalls, enthusiastically describing the styles of food prepared and sold and also the background of the typical owners and customers. This was repeated as we moved between the eating points including the wet markets and live poultry shops. We were warmly greeted at each stop by the owners and Yan's engagement with them and others along the way created a really authentic atmosphere which extended far beyond the food. As we ate she was happy to discuss broader aspects of Hong Kong/Chinese culture which only added to the experience. We sampled all of the food described on the website which was all freshly prepared with the dim sum, egg tarts and snake soup (yes, really!) all particularly good. That said, there was no obligation to eat anything and a degree of flexibility in the choice. Overall, a great experience with an engaging and knowledgeable guide. Highly recommended!
Small group food tour . Our guide knew a ton about local food and history. We had a bunch of great dim sum, snake soup, and really good dessert

Food Tour. Jackie was a great guide. He was charming and he took us to a number of interesting places and restaurants we'd never have gone on our own. We ate very good local food and enjoyed every minute of the trip and his company. The food was all included in the price. If you're a new company - then good luck! and well done with your tour.

Great experience. Yan is a good tour guide. We loved the experience and afterwards asked ourselves how could you not do something like this ? Due to learning about the food and culture and insights from a passionate and friendly local. Will definitely recommend. The snake soup was actually good! Never thought I'd say that...
Great! . The kowloon food tour was an enjoyable and educating experience for my daughter. Our guide Yan was enthusiastic and passionate. Highly recommend it.

Great intro tour for our trip!. We took the Kowloon Food Tour with Yan, and it was a great way to learn about the area from a local and to taste a variety of foods. Yan was energetic, extremely knowledgeable, and made us feel very comfortable. The tour took us to restaurants and markets to see, smell, feel and taste a lot of new-to-us foods. There was no judgement if we didn't care for food types, which we really appreciated.We learned a lot about local life and customs in a way we would have been unable to do on our own. It was a great way to start our Hong Kong trip!

Great tour . Had a fantastic and very enjoyable tour with guide Yan, who was able to give out tons of information on not just the food, but the city, the history and everything else around Mongkok. Lots of tasty food stops, in a well thought out itinerary. What was meant to be a group tour turned out to be a private tour, so got to spend a lot of time chatting to the delightful Yan about everything, which made for an excellent afternoon being introduced to Hong Kong and its food. Great tour and guide, would recommend to anyone.

Great tour!. My bf and I booked this tour and were are glad we did. Our guide Yan was excellent. She provided excellent information about the restaurants, food, and general life in Hong Kong and added personal stories which was great! It gave us great insights into the culture and food scene in Hong Kong. We sampled many dishes which we wouldn't have otherwise (goose, fish balls, egg tarts, snake soup, dim sum, etc.). I would not hesitate to recommend it!

Excellent tour, delicious food and informative guide . I had Yan as my tour guide for the trip and she was excellent. She was incredibly informative about the food we tried and the places we visited. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone looking to try authentic Hong Kong cuisine and learn a little bit more about the history and architecture of Kowloon too. I will also be returning to the goose house and dim sum restaurant on my next trip to HK!
Well worth doing. Our guide was knowledgeable and kept us informed on everything we saw, answering all our questions. i especially loved the snake soup. I would highly recommend this company.

The highlight of my visit to Hong Kong. If you are considering booking this trip I would whole heartedly advise you to do so. The walking food tour was easily the highlight of my visit to Hong Kong. The places we visited I know I would not have found or approached to try had I not done so on this tour. This gave me a much better impression of the food scene in HK, as otherwise I would be sticking to only places that had English menus or English speaking staff. Yan was the guide for our group and she was wonderful. She was very knowledgable, friendly, and easy going. You definitely will not leave hungry after this tour- we had everything from soups to roast goose to dim sum to sweets. Every restaurant we went to Yan explained to us why this restaurant was chosen rather than others serving similar items- usually due to traditional cooking techniques or recipes. That is what makes this tour so great- I would not have known to find these traditional places otherwise!

You won't leave hungry. I really wanted to experience the food scene of China, and also gain some insight into the traditions and culture. This was a fantastic tour that let us sample so many different foods that we waddled home afterwards in a happy food coma. Tour guide Jackie was friendly, knowledgeable and easy to chat to! My only request for the future would be that he is easier to spot at the meeting place and also has some kind of bright coloured clothing - it was easy to lose him in the Mongkok crowds! Thank you for a delicious and entertaining afternoon.

Fantastic Food Tour - Recommended . We did the tour with our two kids - 7 and 9. Yan was a great guide, very friendly and immediately put the kids at ease. It was just the four of us and she was very flexible about the time we spent and where we went (diverting for regular toilet stops for the seven year old for example!). We tried a great selection of food - snake soup, goose, dim sum, egg custard tarts, bubble tea, bean curd etc and there was enough for the kids to enjoy (nine year old polished off the snake soup!). The kids loved going round the food stalls and interacting with the street vendors - holding live crabs and prawns and seeing all the live fish!A fabulous afternoon - highly recommended!

delicious exotic experiences. Our sweet guide for this Food Tour in Kowloon was Grace and she brought us to places we would never been able to find on our own. I will not detail the many different specialities Grace had us try, but they were ALL exquisite and extremely exotic for us Europeans (except maybe the dim-sum we are more accustomed to).We spent several hours going from place to place in Kowloon, mainly in Mongkok, but it was not exhausting because we were seated in 4 different "food places". I cannot call 2 of those places "restaurant". They are more like open food shops where the small staff simply puts the ordered dishes on one of their few tables for you and you dig in.Enjoy!

Fabulous Food Tour in Hong Kong. We were given this tour as a gift from our family who knew we are not adventurous when it comes to trying new foods, and knew we had booked a holiday to Hong Kong. So glad they gave us this gift. We did the tour the day after we arrived and it was a great start to our holiday. We were given clear directions on where to meet our guide and even though we were on the other side of Hong Kong, and had never been there before, we managed to easily find the meeting place using the local MTR transport. Our guide Yan was wonderful. My husband, myself and our 8 year old daughter ended up being the only ones on the tour so we felt very spoilt. The tour was great and there was lots and lots of yummy local food to try. Yan also filled us in on some of the local history and culture. She was also wonderful with our daughter as well, including her in everything. I would not hesitate to recommend the tour, make sure you arrive with an empty stomach!

Best tour of entire trip. Spending the afternoon eating our way through the markets of Kowloon was the most memorable experience of our entire trip to Hong Kong. Really special. My kids loved sampling everything from tofu pudding to chicken feet. Hight recommend.

Don't miss this adventurous food tour!. When in Hong Kong, do yourself a favor and book this tour! My husband and I did the Kowloon food tour which takes you around the bustling neighborhood of Mong Kok. We were looking for a tour that focused on the more traditional foods and this was it! We tried everything from the expected to the incredibly unexpected. Not only did we leave with full bellies, we left with a better understanding of the culture and history of Hong Kong and China. So, don't miss out on this tour. I promise, you won't be disappointed!

Amazing food tour in North Point. We booked this tour online and were very happy with all aspects of it. The guide met us at 3:00 p,m. promptly in front of the bakery. The instructions to get there were clear and simple. We then began a true adventure for foodies. First were egg pancakes (actually look like egg carton, but taste terrific!). Then we tried mango/coconut dumplings followed by marinated goose and brisket. The next stops were shanghai dumplings (look like gyoza) and then dim sum. Our last (sixth!) stop was for dessert dumplings, my favorite being sesame seed in a ginger broth. Each of these stops was in local "restaurants", nothing fancy, lots of people waiting in line for this great food. Some of the sitting areas were outside, with shared tables with locals. We truly felt like we were in one of Anthony Bourdain's TV program. We visited live markets and heard a lot about the history of the area. Yan, our guide was fantastic. She was vibrant, motivated, and a true native proud of telling us about all that is great about Hong Kong. The tour lasts 3 1/2 hours and you need to bring a good appetite. Highly recommend this. If we had been in the city longer we would have booked the second tour organized by this company in Mongkok.

Informative tour. Thoroughly enjoyed the Hong Kong food tour hosted by Yan. There was just the 2 of us on the tour which made it very personal indeed. She showed us interesting markets and tasty street food which we would normally walk past. Good insight into the history of the area we visited. A great way to pass 4 hours or so.

Food Tour in Mongkok. I totally recommend this tour for anyone visiting Hong Kong. It was a definitely a highlight of my short holiday in Hong Kong and I thoroughly enjoyed all the dishes and snacks offered on this tour. I would advise anyone doing this tour to come hungry and not to book any dinner reservations as you will leave feeling very full (loose pants are also recommended). I was fortunate enough to join the tour with a group of food bloggers which made the dim sum meal very enjoyable and our guide, Jackie, was hilarious. He was also very passionate about where he took us and where we ate which is a sign of a good tour guide.

Wonderful Food Tour!. We had an amazing time on our food tour of Hong Kong with our guide Jackie! We tasted so many different local dishes in places we would have never found without otherwise! It was varied (good mix of food markets, street stalls and restaurants) and interesting, Jackie was great, he shared a lot of information with us, not only about food, but also about Hong Kong customs and lifestyle! We even learnt a few Cantonese expressions - "yum cha"!! We couldn't have asked for more and would highly recommend it!

Mongkok Food tour. Our Mongkok Food tour was just great! We - my wife and me, no kids, since ours are grown up already - were lucky to be the only guests that day (Dec. 6th, 2015) and to have a local guide like Grace! She is a warm hearted young lady, very charming, who introduced us to the secrets of local cuisine in an extraordinary manner: strolling around the vibrant streets of Mongkok, northern part of Kowloon, in the middle of the open markets, amongst all these local Chinese people. We really experienced the normal daily life of the locals and have been taught what people like, what the origin is of certain habits and traditions and have been educated about the enormous variety of food and dishes. Many thanks to Grace who really helped us understand and enjoy the great food!And of course many thanks to the people of Eating Adventures, who made this happen - great idea!All the best, Dorothee and Bernd from Germany (celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary during this tour)

Great Food Tour in HKG. We are HKG residents and received this tour as a Christmas gift from a family member. We booked a tour around the North Point area of HK Island and were met on a wet and windy day by our guide Yan. Immediately she was highly approachable and we commenced our tour at an egg waffle stall. As our tour progressed not only did Yan take us to some great food establishments, she was incredibly informative about the history and architecture of the area, as North Point was the Communist Area of 1960's HKG. Our 3.5hrs went incredibly quickly and while we visited one familiar restaurant, all others were new to us and very good.In summary, we had a very enjoyable afternoon and if you want to see and experience some of the true HKG, this is an ideal way. Thanks again Yan :)

A great eating adventure!. We met with our guide Jackie who took us along a wonderful journey of tasting different kind of dishes in small local whole-in-the-wall restaurants around the Mongkok area. We also ventured through the local food market with everything from all kinds of fruit and vegetables to meat, fish, live chickens and turtles etcA great tour that I would like to recommend to everyone with an interest in learning about and tasting all kinds of Hong Kong food.

Great way to discover the culinary secrets of Hong Kong. Got a couple of days in HK and don't know what to do? Want to discover the hidden culinary gems of this city but don't know where to begin. Then start with a food tour from Eating Adventures. From discovering street eats like the Gai Daan Tsai to getting a history lesson into HongKong opera to eating at a one-Michelin star restaurant, you will get to try this all as part of your tour. I went along on this tour with another British family and we all had a great time. My favourite bit was trying Chicken Feet for the very first time and discovering that Black Jelly is actually a cold jelly made of green tea! If you like to eat your way through a city, this tour must be a part of your itinerary.

Great insight into local food. We love to take food tours so this was a must do on our first visit to Hong Kong.We chose the Hong Kong Island food tour and were met by Grace who was an excellent guide who spoke good English.There were only the 2 of us on our tour so we really got a personal insight into the local markets and eateries in the North Point area of Hong Kong which we probably wouldn't have seen had we been on our own. Grace was knowledgeable about many other aspects of Hong Kong life so it was a very interesting afternoon. We tried many different kinds of food and saw local markets. It was a great introduction to Hong Kong and the next day we knew exactly how to order Dim Sum in a local restaurant thanks to Grace!Highly recommended.

Fantastic tour, well worth it. We arrived to discover that the other tour participants had cancelled and so my husband and I were the only 2 on the tour! For 3.5 hours we had a personal guide in Hong Kong who introduced us to wonderful food, explained the local history and also traditions around food. We were able to try a variety of different foods which was fantastic and by the end were so full. Yan also sent us a list of recommended eateries near us that we got to then try on our own during the following days of our trip.Thank you Yan for being one of the highlights of our trip to Hong Kong

SUPRISINGLY AWESOME!!!. Eating Adventure is a good choice if you want to have a food tour trip here in Hong Kong! me and my clients from AIR ASIA PHILIPPINES had so much fun! its a walking tour and every stops is worth trying and a good value of money plus the tour guides are very energetic and knowledgeable! Surprisingly they exceed all clients expectations! Overall it was great and fun tour!! I highly recommend this food your!

Really got to know the good local food. I have been to Hong Kong many times and I thought I have tasted most of Hong Kong food. Eating on my previous trips were mainly either through googling or from write-ups. Had to travel from one joint to another for the meals. This time, I felt that I should perhaps go on a foodie tour and really eat like a local. Together with my wife, we joined the Kowloon food adventure. It was led by Yan, a bubbly and knowledgeable guide. There were 8 of us on the tour. We walked around the nooks and corners of Mong Kok, feasting not only on the food but also on the sights of wet markets and local daily activities surrounding the street vendors and small shops. To whet our taste buds, we had roast goose, egg tarts, Chinese pastry, soya bean curd, fish balls, amazing dim sum; and for adventure -- snake soup. For a Chinese from Singapore ( another food paradise) , I am glad that I enjoyed the tour. It gave me a better insight of Hong Kong Food than what I gathered from write-ups and the net because I actually experienced it.

Really fun trip through the kowloon markets. Our tour guide Yan was very insightful and friendly as she took us to 6 or 7 stops on the 3+ hour tour of Kowloon. We ate dim sum, street food, duck, and more. She made sure we had things that were common and not too common as well. Highly recommend this walking tour.

You need to be open to trying food you've never tried before!. Firstly, it was easy to book online. They take a 25% deposit and the balance is paid in cash to the guide on the day. We met our guide - Jacky - at the rendezvous point near Mongkok (translates as 'busy corner') which was easy to find. He introduced himself, gave us a bottle of water and off we went. I suppose our first surprise was we were the only 2 on the tour which we felt was a little disappointing as sharing the experience as you go with others is normally good fun. Still, others may be happy with the exclusivity I suppose. I won't go into the detail of what we ate other than to say is a mixture of long established 'restaurants' and street food. Its also true to say that not all of the food was to our taste but surely that's the point of these tours, ie trying stuff which will be alien to your taste buds! Jacky is a good guide, very knowledgeable about both the area and the food. All in all good value and worth trying we'd say,

Fantastic day experimenting local cuisine. Eating Adventures was a great way to learn about the local cuisine from a local. Grace took us around to an exciting part of the city in Kowloon and explained the cultural habits of shopping in the street market to the different varieties of local cuisine.We were able to try many of the local street food and cafe cuisines with the help of a real Hong Konger. This is something that I wouldn't have been able to do on my own.The tour was well organised and we stayed on track of our time of 3 hours. If you like to experiment and try local food, you won't be disappointed.

Great tour, great tour guides to learn the local favourites. The tour was a very relaxing and convenient way to eat at excellent restaurants and see the markets of hong kong. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and took the group to specialty restaurants such as the famous shop which sold only waffles, michelin starred dim sum and peking duck and roast pork. The tour was extensive and a relaxing way to be guided through the maze of fresh food markets. Highly recommend it. I wouldn't have been able to find these places on my own.

Dim Sum & Then Some!. As an Aussie Expat I wanted to be able to embrace the local cuisine and learn more about my new home and Cantonese culture. This tour did exactly that, and more! We started the tour off wandering through the vibrant wet markets of Mongkok and learned about traditional Chinese medicine and what all the weird and wonderful ingredients are used for.There were multiple stops throughout the 3.5 hour tour and all were equally as interesting. We got to sample freshly baked Cantonese sweets including egg tarts and deep-fried red bean pastries, slurped down a bowl of congee as well as snake soup! We gobbled up streets snacks, tried a silky smooth bowl of tofu pudding and finished the evening off with amazing Dim Sum!Our local tour guide was great and the tour is definitely value for money. The tour also caters for diet restrictions and you aren't pressured to try anything you're not keen on.

Great way to taste AND see Hong Kong. Right off the bat I could tell this food tour was unlike the rest. After meeting our hosts we were handed a grab bag of helpful items for a food tour - wet naps, plastic gloves, and plenty of space for leftovers. This was a food tour first for me and a great idea. We sampled several great dishes throughout the day and the hosts were happy to explain and let us try what peaked our interest outside of what was on the stops. Favourites were a shop specializing in goose and getting educated in dim sum.What made the tour really great was the insight behind what makes Hong Kong dishes so great. We toured a couple local markets and even took a ride on the historic Hong Kong Island tram line. All in all a great day. Make sure you come hungry!For more on my day with Eating Adventures including lots of pics see here - http://www.thislifeintrips.com/hong-kong-eating-adventures-review/

Very relaxed tour!. Enjoyed our food tour with guide, Grace and guide in training, Mary. We booked the tour online just the day before and booking was handled quickly and efficiently. My husband and I were the only ones on the tour which was a bonus as that gave us the opportunity to ask lots of questions about things we were interested in. The guides were happy to answer all our questions and to give us a picture of some of the aspects of their lives in Hong Kong. We liked finding foods in the markets that were a little unusual. The foods tasted were generally delicious and our favourites were the Lo Soi Goose and the prawn dumplings.

Excellent Food Tour and Fantastic Local Guide. This tour takes you to places that you would probably not go and eat. Food was fantastic. May our guide was excellent and very knowledgeable about the different food groups. She also gave us comments on local landmarks and the history. Great personality and loved this tour!!

Great for those who want to eat like a local. We did the 4 hour food tour at the end of last month. Our guide was very informative about the local foods in the market - things we had never seen before. There were 6 or 7 'food stops' on the agenda, where we were given food to sample. Some things we were familiar with (dim sum) but others had never tasted (tofu dessert). We had eaten before we left which was a bit of a mistake - as we just weren't hungry- and just couldn't eat much. We were more interested in learning about the local foods than eating anyway. Our guide wasn't a Chef but did know her stuff about the local foods. It poured with rain the whole time which was a bit of a drag - but we still carried on. I think the guide would have happily cut it short but we wanted to see all the food stops on the agenda. It was great to be able to tall to a local about all sorts of things - not necessarily food related - while we were wandering along. We are serious foodies and operate our own food tours in New Zealand, so we are quite harsh critics - so I did think it was quite expensive compared to our NZ tours, for what you get. However we were still pleased we did the tour, and did learn a lot. It was easy communicating with the organiser and efficiently organised. We did 4 food tours in China and this ranked second. Would recommend it.

Tucked away local joints. This is the perfect way to see a piece of Hong Kong while getting to know the best eats. Our guide was friendly, informative, and shared her knowledge about the city as well as the cuisine. Doesn’t hurt that the food was delicious – the Michelin star Dim Sum was a highlight for sure, but anyone can find this place (and they do). My favourites were the little tucked away local joints that your average tourist would probably never try. I can’t remember the name of them, but that just further solidifies the need for a local guide  Yum!

Discovering new flavours. We have a super nice experience with this tour in our trip in Hong Kong, in a super big city we manage to discover a real nice spots with a delighted food quality. we have fun, we eat we laugh and we learn a different culture thru the food

A Totally Must Do. One of the best experience in Hong Kong was engage in this tour. We manage to discover unique hidden spots where you can taste the fresh and natural food of Hong Kong. The staff have a strong knowledge about the habits and customs of the local cuisine. Is not only the high quality of the food, is the tips and historical reference during the whole tour. Absolutely worth it, the gem of the foodie tours

Great experience - perfect way to see other parts of Hong Kong. I had a fun and interesting afternoon in May's company during the food tour of Mong Kok. We had several different food and a interesting walk through the market. The communication before the tour was fast and precise. I can only recommend to do this kind of tour if you are interested in food and would like to see where the locals buy and eat food.

Highlight of our trip to HK. We did the foodie tour in Northpoint. It was one of their first tours. The food was excellent, more than we could finish as it was just the two of us on the tour. The guide was friendly and easy to spend time with. Definitely the highlight of our short stay in Hong Kong.
Tai Po. We wanted to see a non-touristy side of HK and the places & local food that Mandy introduced to us in Tai Po were excellent. Even our 6 year-old son enjoyed the tour very much.

Apple's enthusiasm and effort made for a great tour. Apple and her sister Mandy are batting 1000 on their ratings and they certainly deserve them. Apple took me on a HK @ nite tour of the city last Sunday and was a great host who took care to gauge my interests and then led the way. I strongly recommend them.

A Perfect Day in Hong Kong. My wife and I were traveling to Hong Kong for there first time to visit our son that was studying there for a semester. I set up a 8 hour tour and I got quick detailed response from Mandy. I confirmed the appointment the day before and we agreed on meeting at our hotel. Since we were staying in the Mongkok district our adventure started the moment we stepped out our door. Mandy was quickly began taking us to the open markets that are in Mongkok. We were in the hustle and bustle of the markets seeing the everyday life of the people of Hong Kong. It was fascinating seeing all the new and exotic foods that we don't see in the States. Mandy was excellent in answering all our questions. Our next destination was the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple. Mandy wanted us to use the subway and explained the benefits of the Octopus card. Once we arrived at the Temple, she was very knowledgable on the history and importance of it. Next we hopped on a bus (using the Octopus card) and headed to Tai Po district. Here we saw the beauty of Hong Kong. The vast green parks and bodies of water the surround Hong Kong. Here we ate at a local restaurant that specialized in wonton soup. This place was delicious and the staff was very nice. Next we went to a quiet fishing village in Tai po that was so calming and interesting. She would talk to the locals and they allowed to visit for a while as she would translate our conversation. Next we got on a boat ride that took us to the fish farms and witnessed what many local do on their down time. They were hanging out fishing and having a good time. There are many photo opportunities throughout the entire trip. Finally, as the day was winding down, we headed to an indoor food market. There we began looking for what we wanted to eat for dinner. I chose a fresh grouper and then took it to one of the many kitchens on the top floor and they prepared it to my liking. The experience of eating the freshest food and seeing families eating and having a great time was awesome. I highly recommend booking a trip with Mandy, it was the highlight of our trip.

So amazing! . Apple and her sister were great! We absolutely loved this tour! We took their tour back in August and had a great time. We got the chance to see many parts of Hong Kong that many people do not get to see. They also were very accommodating to specific needs within our group. The tour was great and I would highly recommend to my friends and family! Also they are natives of Hong Kong which made it way more informational. They are both awesome, Everyone will love this tour!

Amazing Tour - Highly Recommended!. I booked the tour in advance and we arranged to meet at our hotel on our first morning in Hong Kong. Mandy emailed in advance asking questions about our plans, what we were looking for in our tour, and outlining the financial commitment on our part. The whole tour was tailored and bespoke to our likes and dislikes, which was great.The tour was 5 hours long and we covered both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. The time was well planned, and we managed to have drinks and food along the way. Her explanations at the Wang Tai Sin temple were much appreciated, and the lunch at a local 'cafe' was the one of our favourite meals. At no time did we feel rushed, and we were amazed at how much we covered.In addition to the tour Mandy had planned for us, she provided us with a whole host of information about Hong Kong's history, places to eat for the rest of our stay and recommended attractions to visit. She emailed directions and suggestions for additional visits once the tour had ended. Mandy gave us the confidence to try dim sum with the locals which was one of our highlights.I would recommend a tour with Mandy at the beginning of your visit, as it will enhance and add to the remainder of your stay.Thank you so much.

Great day tour. I am very late to this review but figured better late than never. Apple was very knowledgable and entertaining. We loved every bit of the tour, especially eating in the fishing village. We cannot wait to visit again and get another tour by her. Her english is very good also so no worries about communication issues. Thanks again

The best tour I have taken in any city in the world. I frequently travel internationally for business and when I visit a city for the first time I try to take a guided tour. A good tour will show you the highlights of the city, and a great one will make you feel that you have learned something about the culture and the people.The tour I took with Mandy was great. It is the best tour I have taken in any city. I emailed in advance and told her that I was most interested in culture, history, and food. I emphasized that I would prefer to visit a neighborhood of Hong Kong rather see a lot of things.Mandy met me at my hotel at 8:30 and she brought me to a neighborhood restaurant for a typical Hong Kong breakfast of eggs, macaroni and ham soup, and a piece of French toast. I would never have know to venture into a place like this on my own, nor would I have understood the history of why they exist.Since I am an adventurous eater she brought me to a snake restaurant where I had snake soup and a green wine made from snake bile. Again, this is a place I would never have found on my own.Mandy is intelligent, charming, and vibrant. I never felt that I was on a tour. I felt that I was seeing Hong Kong with a friend who loved her city and was excited to share it with me. She even gave me recommendations of where to eat in the evening and other sites that I should visit before leaving Hong Kong.I cannot recommend this tour too highly. If you want to take a tour of Hong Kong, this is the only choice.

Excellent wonderful lady . We were 6 men aged 40-50 that were taken on the most amazing tour that covered everything we asked for from 10am to 4pm using the metro system , walking and taxi. We had just agreed that it was the highlight of our trip

A very special day with Apple. Don't pass up the opportunity to go on a private tour with Apple or Mandy.We went with Apple for a 5 hour tour. Some of the highlights included:Wong Tai Sin Temple (Taoist Temple)Nan Lian Garden and Chi Lin Nunnery (Buddhist Temple)Dim Sum lunch in a Cantonese tea house in Kowloon Tong We especially loved the Nan Lian Garden and Chi Lin Nunnery. There were very few tourists and it was extremely beautiful and the gardens were an oasis of serenity which is a great short term escape from the hustle of most of Hong Kong. Apple was a perfect tour guide for us. She is a lovely, warm person with a sharp mind and fun sense of humor. She anticipated what we needed in terms of depth of information, transport and even when we needed to stop for a break. She is engaging, knowledgeable and is happy to share her views on the city and culture. We learned so much more travelling with Apple than we would have on our own or in a large group tour. It also was fantastic to have Apple order lunch items at a restaurant where there wasn't another Westerner in sight. Everything she selected was delicious - our best meal in Hong Kong and easily the lowest cost. Apple also provided recommendations for the rest of our trip, including ideas for Macau. We loved our day with Apple and recommend this company for anyone who is looking for a customized tour experience. They will make the tour fit what you want and will travel at a pace that suits you. I have had some health issues and Apple took this into account in her planning and on the day of the tour. She genuinely cared about my special requirements and was very considerate and patient. If you want a high energy tour, I'm sure you'll get it. If you want a more moderate pace as we did, they will deliver that. Their goal is for the customer to be happy and with Apple, it showed during every minute of the tour. We highly recommend Hong Kong Getaway Private Tours and will go on another tour with them when next in Hong Kong.

Mandy's love of Hong Kong is contagious!. Like the other reviews we instantly felt we had met a super friendly relative who just also happened to be a tour guide. She loves Hong Kong and it shows in her passion and energy when she shows you around. She showed us a Hong Kong that is full of contrasts. A stunning metropolitan center as well as a home to a diverse and unique people and culture. Her local knowledge led us down secret ways with stunning views and fantastic local eateries that i'm sure do not show up on any tour maps. This is the sort of tour and guide you are always hoping but very rarely find. A real treat. We can not recommend her highly enough. Enjoy!

Unforgettable experience. As soon as we met Mandy we instantly felt that we had met up with an old friendher warmth and personality made us feel at ease.Mandy's knowledge and history of Hong Kong is very vast and quite interesting. From all the sites we visited, from Victoria Harbour to The Peak, to Railway Clock Tower and the Peninsula Hotel and many more.We will certainly be visiting Hong Kong next year and booking with Mandy for a another unforgettable experience.

Hong Kong with a friend. We just returned from a weeks long visit to HK and one of our highlights was a day long tour with Mandy. She is just absolutely charming and well organized. She is professional and tailored our tour to meet our interests. We definitely visited and ate places that we could not have otherwise without a local. Her recommendations for getting around were invaluable, along with follow up emails to aid us during the remainder of our stay to see sites she knew we had planned to visit. You won't regret spending part of your time with Mandy and seeing HK the way only a local could show you.

There should be a 6th star rating available for things like this.. To give this tour a 5 star rating is an understatement. We are accomplished travelers of the world and this was our first time in Hong Kong. We booked Mandy for 5 hours on our first day. She previously had asked questions to determine what kinds of things interested us and catered the tour accordingly. The day we chose was unusually foggy, so she adjusted some plans as to not waste our time looking for views (and mapped out our remaining days to include them after the weather cleared up!) and as the day went on she asked questions and asked our opinions on each thing we saw to even further personalize our experience.I can not stress enough how starting your vacation with a tour from her will help you out. We missed nothing and saw things we didn't even plan on or imagine possible in 3 days. She sends out not only a recap of your time with her, but her personal guides and tips for many other attractions both big and popular and little known. From things like seeing how public housing life is for locals, to first class Michelin Star restaurants. Small dumpling and noodle houses to local craft beer. How to do Lantau Island in 6 hours including all the sights, to finding chilled pig intestine and snake bile wine.One of the best things was learning the MTR train system right away. we were so comfortable with it that we didn't take cabs and saved a ton!Thank you, Mandy. Look forward to our next trip!!!

Hong Kong Highlight. My adult daughter and I joined Mandy for an amazing 5 hr tour of the city Mandy loves. She was prompt in meeting us at our hotel and began by asking us relevant questions which enabled the three of us to plan a tailored adventure for our short stay in the city. She also assisted us in planning our evening events for that day and the following day too. Super efficient use of our time in Hong Kong. Most importantly though, we connected with Mandy right away. Great conversations, lots of laughs and many special moments for the three of us. Highly recommend!!!

Just a Certificate of Excellence doesn't do justice to the tours of HK Getaway!. I had the pleasure of having an amazing 4 hour tour with Apple a few days ago and I would personally recommend her food tour to anyone who is going to visit Hong Kong for the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th or any visit. I can't wait for my next visit so I can check out Sai Kung and Lantau Island to see the Big Buddha if I've got time. When I have that opportunity, you already know who I will call to help me learn a little bit more about this beautiful and mysterious city-state. Apple was so thoughtful and ran over time by almost 1 1/2 hours.. AND on top of that, she helped me find a calligrapher to get my parents a beautiful, original gift for their 30th anniversary. When she was leading my young daughter Marilyn and I around the city, she was so good with her and Mar can be very fussy, especially after a long day. She held her hand on the MTR (aka Hong Kong's subway) and even carried her up the stairs when we were leaving the metro system. Apple was so knowledgeable about her city and was able to answer every question we had except when my daughter was extra stubborn about getting the exact number of gallons of water in the Victoria Harbor as we were riding on the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Around dinner time, we went to a wet market where Apple had found a small, authentic restaurant where she ordered us the perfect meal. Even after just a few hours, it felt like Apple was someone my daughter and I had known for a number of years and truly cared about how we experienced Hong Kong. If I had to grade her on a scale of 1 to 10, she gets a 12! Loved every second, will definitely refer anyone I know going to HK to contact the Hong Kong Getaway to get an authentic peek into life in Hong Kong.

The must do tour in Hong Kong. If you have 24 hours or 2 weeks in Hong Kong, this is the must do tour. In 8 hours with Mandy, I experienced 4 of my top 5 Hong Kong moments. I had 90 hours in country and knew to get the most out of my time, a private tour operator would be the most beneficial. Mandy went above and beyond all expectations, I cannot thank her enough for the hospitality, follow-up emails (recommending best route to Tian Tan Buddha) and knowledge she shared with me. I booked an 8 hour private tour with Mandy on day 1 of my visit to HKG. From the initial email, the tour was tailored around what was important to me; seeing one or two tourist attractions from the local perspective, and getting off the beaten path. I sent Mandy my "wish list" of places to visit, and in about three days and half a dozen email exchanges she had put me at ease that I would see the essential HKG as I asked. Mandy was flexible on meeting at my hotel lobby, and immediately I felt at ease as she asked how my travel day was, where I was from and what type of activities I enjoyed on vacation. Did I mention she's a former flight attendant and her sister currently is for a major Asian carrier? She knows how to break the ice (especially if a solo traveler), and talking with her is like meeting an old friend.I won't list every detail of our tour, but the highlights for me included the hike along Lugard Road Morning Trail (great photo opportunities of HKG and the harbor), local wonton lunch with her and Apple (her sister), tea and mooncake while visiting their home (incredibly generous offer), hiring Mrs Cheng's fishing boat and Tai Po's wet market....and yes, chicken feet. MTR, tram, ding-ding, bus, and boat, we covered a lot of ground and none of it would have been possible on my own. Visiting her home and seeing how Hong Kongers live, truly something I will never forget. Trust in Mandy's plan of action when you tell her your style of traveling, she will make it happen without hesitation.Highly recommend you carry small bills while traveling during tour to pay for misc. items such as cab fares and hiring Mrs Cheng. Mandy helped me find legitimate / functional chopsticks at a local market stall, not the tourist version. We ran over in time w/ transit back to the hotel, and Mandy kept a smile and her friendly demeanor throughout. She encouraged me to text w/ family because of the time difference during the tour, and she was willing to discuss anything and everything about HKG culture.You will not regret booking a tour with Mandy and Apple. I booked 9 months in advance, and it was worth the wait.

Simply the best start to our Hong Kong Experience. After our first visit to HK this week we were delighted with our 4 hr introduction tour with Mandy. The busy metropolis could be quite overwhelming, however, Mandy's local knowledge and tips for getting around were invaluable, along with ideas for seeing the sights and contrasts of Hong Kong. Mandy was very professional and quickly tailored our tour to suit us and our interests. I highly recommend Mandy for her attention to detail and not to forget her warm, friendly and welcoming manner.

You can't go wrong!. A quick look at my past reviews will show that I am not one to easily assign a rating of excellent. However, in this case, I am happy to do so. My wife and I were joined in Hong Kong by friends of ours who live in the Philippines. Our friends have been to HK several times and I was looking for a tour that was customized based on our interests. In particular, we wanted a culinary and cultural tour that was a little out of the ordinary.Mandy did a great job showing us interesting places that are not on the "tourist map". She is pleasant and well informed. It was like spending time with a friend or loves the city in which she lives and enjoys sharing it with others.In every way the tour exceeded our expectations!

Excellent Private Tour of Hong Kong. Apple was our tour guide as her sister was unavailable that day. Apple was extremely knowledgeable, friendly, thoughtful, and professional in her tour. She will tailor the tour basically to any of your requirements. She is capable of doing food, culture, and tourist attractions. I asked for help with the MTR, getting a SIM card, and some sightseeing around the city. Apple was absolutely perfect and helped me so much. I saved a great deal of time with help with the MTR and the SIM card, and I am extremely grateful for doing that. What took Apple about 15 minutes would have taken me hours. Therefore the savings and time was well worth it. She also took us to a small restaurant which I never would have been able to even order from, and we had a really excellent snack. I have done tours all over the world, and this was one of my all-time favorites. Bravo, Apple.

Great Hong Kong Experience. This was our first visit to Hong Kong and we were very fortunate to have chosen Hong Kong Getaway Private Tours. We booked three days of tours and went to Hong Kong island, Kowloon, and Lan tau Island. Mandy and Apple were our tour guides - they were excellent and we couldn't be more pleased. They are knowledgeable, flexible, reliable, nice and just so much fun to be with. We could not have seen or learned sooooo much about Hong Kong without them - we had such a great and memorable time. The next time we are in Hong Kong, we will definitely contact them again. Thanks to Mandy and Apple we had a great first experience in Hong Kong. We look forward to another trip there to try more of their suggested restaurants.

Refreshing Tour of HK from the Lens of a Local. My husband and I have been to HK a few times in the past, but this is the first time we took a local guided tour, with my American foster parents who were visiting Asia. The half day tour was a refreshing experience! Mandy took us to see the other side of HK-- the old public housing of locals, the gardens, the religions and temples--- sights and experiences which we would never had walking around the malls and Hong Kong's highly commercialized tourist spots. We absolutely loved it! The tour was customized to our requirements and pace, the guide was highly insightful re: Hong Kong life (being a local herself) and personal (not to mention, personable). I highly highly recommend this tour for individuals and small groups who want to see Hongkong from the lens of a local.

Must-do Tour of Hong Kong. I was lucky enough to spend a day with Mandy as my tour guide in Hong Kong. The tour was tailored to my interests and needs, and Mandy was knowledgeable, kind, and considerate. She also took me to the best meal I had during my entire stay. My only regret is that I didn't take the tour earlier in my trip -- I think it would have enriched my Hong Kong experience even more. This tour is definitely the way to go to explore Hong Kong, both as a tourist and a local.

Best Guide Ever. My wife and I have been to Hong Kong several times and had visited most of the traditional visitor spots. This time we wanted to visit areas of Hong Kong that most tourists never see. Mandy suggested her Tai Po tour.About an hour after we reached Tai Po the heavy rains began. Mandy adjusted and suggested that we visit a local home. We spent the next hour having tea with the residents of the home and thoroughly enjoying ourselves. Then on to the wet market for both visual and eating experiences that were new to us. After touring the Tai Po area on foot we made our way back to Central by bus with Mandy giving us detailed instructions on how to use public transportation.That evening We received 5 emails from Mandy suggesting other activities that she thought we might enjoy, along with detailed instructions on how to access each activity by public transportation, what to see/do and what to skip.In our opinion, best guide ever.

Private tour in the new territories. We spent half a day with Ka Wan, and had chose to go off the beaten tracks for once. We did not regret.We got to see a side of HK we just had no idea existed. The tour combined a visit to the old fishing communities, incredible vistas, a tour of Tai Po and a visit into a private home, giving us a sense of how the locals actually live.Ka Wan, as a guide, was excellent, and she was good and patient with the kids.Definitely a must do.

If you want the most complete, inside look at Hong Kong and the people, then choose this tour!. If you're looking for an intimate discovery of Hong Kong then this is the way to go. Even after days with local friends in Hong Kong, Mandy, our guide, was keen on knowing what we had already taken in, and we discovered new hidden gems during our time. There is absolutely no rushing around, and you'll get a perfect picture that was tailored for you.

A absolutely must!. My husband booked this walking trip as part of a surprise honeymoon, and it was the highlight of Hong Kong! We saw so much of Hong Kong in the day we spent with Mandy, she was professional, friendly and informative - it was like visiting a friend is a new city! She was able to adapt the tour to our needs (and the weather!). I would definitely recommend for anyone visiting Hong Kong! If possible book for the early stage of your visit, as you do so much in the one day and the things you learn with Mandy (transport, food etc) enriches the rest of your visit! Yes you have to pay for the tour - but it's completely worth it! You save so much time and money across the day by having a local explain how to do it best!

Excellent if you have time and essential if short of time!!. We were so short of time...and in 3 hours we saw the essential of Hong Kong, we step in a typical tram, we had delicious dumplings and other delicacies from Hong kong and we enjoyed typical pastries of Hong Kong in a wet market, went in the ferry...unbelievable!!And she was so nice, so patient with all our questions (we were 6 women, Spanish, who love to comment and ask about everything...)I´d FULLY RECOMMEND THEM! 12 out of 10!!

Wonderful way to Hong Kong. 2 days ago, we had the chance to meet Mandy to be our tour guide. We were a family with 2 kids 7 & 6 yrs.I had arranged things by email couple of days before the appointment. I Noticed that Mandy would like to tailor the tour according to our needs. Before we met, she emailed me to know my family members, where we want to go, dietary restrictions etc.When we met her in the lobby, she recognized everyone by name and clicked with my family quickly.We started our tour in Kowloon, where we are staying. We had a nice tour seeing a temple set in a wonderful Chinese garden "Nan Lian garden". Then we went to see Hk skylines and in our way we saw some iconic buildings and hotels.We took a ferry to reach HK island. The weather wasn't perfect to go to Victoria peak. So we had another good and free alternative to view Hk. By that time we were hungry, so she took us to a good vegetarian restaurant. Then we ended the tour by visiting a local market which the kids enjoyed a lot.At the end of the tour, Mandy promised to send "pocket guide" emails about different places and she did.In brief, it was a nice tour with an expert local guide who has a good since of humor and cares about her client.Thanks Mandy :)

2 wonderful days in Hong Kong with Mandy. Mandy met us the day we arrived and we had the most wonderful day looking around HK - I can't speak highly enough of the tours - I am still bubbling a week later after the HK trip and the 2 days my wife and I spent with Mandy looking around HK. Its the best thing I have ever done on an overseas trip. We did 2 days with Mandy - starting the day we arrived meant she taught us how to use the subway, bus system and trams so were we pretty able to go wherever we wanted using public transport for the next 3 days before doing a 2nd day based on the new territories and more rural areas. I then started my conference and my wife traveled every day around HK using advice from Mandy.

the best day of the trip. A tailor made tour!! Mandy showed us the whole day the contrast in Hongkong including hidden gems and a glance of the low, middle and upper class Hongkong real life. Without the tour we would have missed a lot of fun places and information. Even after the tour we got tips by whatsapp and email about things to do, good dining places (budget and top) and drinking places. On our next trip we will do another tour.

Great choice. We did two tours with Mandy - Hong Kong food and culture and Tai Po - and I'm so glad we did! Mandy is engaging, professional, and was great with my kids (ages 8 and 10). She helped us make sense of the city on our first day so that we could get more out of the days we were on our own. So worth it!

Great afternoon with a charming guide. Not knowing Hong Kong at all, we booked with Mandy Cheung for a 4-hour afternoon introductory tour. Although the price (260 USD) might seem a little high, it was money, and time, well spent. Mandy is an articulate and engaging guide, with great people skills. She tailored our tour to the things we were interested in, and over the 4 hours, gave us an excellent insight into many aspects of HK life - religion, education, cuisine, housing, transport etc. At the end of the session, we felt much better equipped to visit this complex and fascinating city, and made much better use of the following 2 days than would otherwise have been the case. Highlky recommendedAndrew & Gill, Adelaide

Wonderful Way to See (and Taste) Hong Kong. If you do nothing else in Hong Kong I would recommend you do this tour and if you have more time, do this tour at the start to get oriented and do the tour to Tai Po later on. Mandy made us feel thoroughly welcome and at ease in Hong Kong. We were fascinated by what we learnt. The food we ate on the way was delicious (we even plucked up the courage to try chicken feet which weren't bad at all!). Mandy gave us some great ideas of what to do on the other days of our holiday with crystal clear directions on how to get there on the subway.To be honest I wasn't at all enthusiastic about seeing hong Kong. My husband wanted me to keep him company while he went to a conference. I imagined feeling hot and lost while he was busy at his conference. Instead we had a wonderful time together with Mandy and now the conference has started I'm looking forward to doing more of the visits that Mandy has told me about.

Amazing. Unfortunately, we only spent 3 hours with Apple. She was professional, kind, smart, fun. We visited amazing places, ate local food, enjoyed every recommendation and time with her and improved our knowledge. It is the perfect choice to discover Hong Kong. Highly recommended. Unforgettable

Awesome, Easy, & Real World . I spent 4 hours with Apple towards the end of my stay in Hong Kong. I learned so much in 4 hours (despite having already been in Hong Kong for several days) and left the tour knowing that I had gotten to see a bit if the real Hong Kong, a better understanding of the history, as well as what is currently taking place in Hong Kong, and the geographic layout. As a frequent traveler, I can honestly say it was one of the best tours I have had in recent years.

A great way to see the real Hong Kong. We had a great day last week with Apple. It was a wonderful way to see the real Hong Kong with an expert local. Mandy and Apple are flexible in tailoring each tour to your needs. We had been to Hong Kong before but saw so much more this way. Highly recommended!

Simply the BEST!. Our family spent 2 days with Mandy on our recent visit to Hong Kong and we could not have been happier with the time we spent with her! It was our first trip to Hong Kong and we came knowing very little. We booked the Hong Kong Island Tour for our first day and learned so much about the city. We loved her easy going manner and at the same time we were fully engaged the entire time. Our 13 year old son loved her! At the end of the day she gave us several suggestions on where to go and what we might find interesting. We were booked with her on day 3 of our trip to do the Kowloon and Tai Po Secret Tour. This is a must if you really want to feel like you experienced Hong Kong. Mandy and her sister grew up in the New Territories and you get an up close and personal experience of what everyday life is like. Our son said it was the best day of his life!Mandy was professional and delightful. We felt like a long time friend was showing us around. Even after 2 days with Mandy we would have booked additional days had she been available. Seeing Hong Kong through her eyes was priceless.

Hidden Hong Kong discover. Contacted Mandy by email to get some suggestion for our day-tour in Hong Kong.Finally we figured out some places to visit but kept our program open in case the weather would not be good. Well the weather was that bad, that our flight from Switzerland to Hong Kong was cancelled!! ;-(( One day later it was ok again and we arrived with about 10 hours delay in Hong Kong at 3:00 AM . Fortunately we could contact Mandy from the airport and agreed to start at 12:00 instead of 09:00 ;-) 12:00 like a Swiss watch, Mandy showed up at our hotel lobby! ;-) great smile and very good first impression. shortly discussed the program and then let's go! :-) A nice asian garden was our first stop. Surprising quiet in the middle of Hong Kong and Mandy explained all details. After some rain and a short food stop with amazing Dumpling's , we continued to the peak by taxi. the view and the walk around there was breathtaking ! again Mandy explained all the details and we learned a lot on that day about the history of the city. So the day passed really fast and finally she dropped us at the highest roof-top-bar in the world!! drinks are not cheap but the view is with it anyway! ;-) time to say goodbye to Mandy after a great day and fantastic tour. We all could feel that she is a tour guide with heart and seoul! We couldn't find any better for our tour! we really recommend to book her if you wanna discover some secrets of Hong-Kong with her! Tx again Mandy from the Swiss-Group.;-)

Must do when visiting Hong Kong. We had the pleasure of spending the day with Mandy. First off all she is super nice, fluent in English, got a great sense of humour and have all the knowledge you need about Hong Kong. We went all over HK, including spots you would never go on your own. We learned a lot about the city and its people, ate a lot off great food in local restaurants and had the best time ever! We feel like we got a new best friend in Mandy. If you only have a few hours or a full day we do recommend that you spend it on Mandy or her sister. Thank you for making our day so special! Margrethe and Georg

Amazing service. We booked tour few days before our Hongkong visit we were really happy from great service from Apple,especially perfect attention to our children. Whole tour was completly professional,we can high recommended!

Marvelous Tour with Mandy!. You're going to read review after review of Hong Kong Getaway and think how can so many people get a perfect experience? But the only way to have the experience is booking a half or full day with HK getaway tours. I spent two days with Mandy and wish I could have had two more. Our first day we spent on every mode of transportation HK has to offer to see everything from the peak to the local city wet market and everything in between. I had traveled alone three days before my partner to acclimate to the time change and experience HK myself. Mandy provided a tour that made me fall in love with this incredibly fast paced modern city. I learned about the banking system, architecture, history and culture from Mandy's comprehensive knowledge and passion. I became quickly comfortable with the layout of the city. The second day we spent doing her hidden tour - leaving central and feeling like I literally became part of her family. We visited a local floating village and other outskirts of Hong Kong sights. I could not have asked for anything better. My third day on my own was incredibly fulfilling as well, because Mandy emailed me a comprehensive way to see other sights we had not yet visited. She goes truly above and beyond everything any other guide I've ever hired. I fell in love with Hong Kong. I usually and realistically think I won't return to many of the places I travel to due to the endless places to visit, but Mandy made me look forward to visiting HK again soon! You may find the tour costly, but it's worth every penny. Thank you!!!

Great way to see Hong Kong!. Mandy is an excellent tour guide who is simply overflowing with information. We didn't know anything about Hong Kong when we arrived, so we didn't even know what we wanted to see. She picked out great attractions for us, but she was also completely open to our suggestions. Along the way she told us all kinds of interesting stories and was able to answer all of our questions. Mandy was also super cognizant of our needs, always finding shade to rest in at the right times and bringing us to eat local food when we were hungry. Basically, taking the tour with Mandy helped us see all the difficult-to-see parts of Hong Kong in the easiest way possible.10/10 for content alone, 11/10 for the added benefit of a super friendly guide! Well worth your money.P.S. Mandy even gave us some ideas of other things to do on the days we didn't tour with her! She gives excellent directions and her suggested trips are very fun.

Mandy the owner/tour guide has become my daughters best friend!. Yes, my hubby has already reviewed this tour (AZTOAD) and he summed it up rather nicely but I have my own stuff to add. Now my husband goes to Hong Kong often for business but this was the first time our 8 year old daughter and I got to join him. Now we wanted a cultural experience for her in Hong Kong, not just shopping, so my husband found The Hong Kong Getaway and I am so happy he did! We took our tour on the first full day of our 17 day trip to Asia and met Mandy in Tai Po we took a brief walk and she showed us how and where people actually live, the process in getting a home and the insanely expensive cost of living. We then went to Sam Mun Tsai Fish Village, which was beautifully simple and rustic. We were warmly welcomed by the locals and we had their version of french toast and lemon tea... my daughter is now addicted to lemon tea and its a staple in our home. We took a brief tour on a fishing boat and then I had a very bad fall, to be honest if it wasn't for Mandy saving me this could have been a trip ending fall. I don't remember much of it but do recall Mandy springing into action to provide medical attention and a new pair of shorts(yes, I ruined my super cute outfit). She was very calm at a moment when my daughter and husband were very upset, there is nothing scarier than being really hurt in a country you don't know, she made everything better! We continued our tour with a bike ride, a wet market, a street market, and an amazing late lunch. Now, for me being a mom the best part of this tour was how Mandy interacted with my daughter. I am very used to keeping my daughter engaged, and helping her understand whatever tour we are on. Emma is 8, and very curious, and Mandy answered all of her questions and kept her engaged and interested in what was going on. Mandy even tried with all of her might to get Emma to eat shrimp, sorry Mandy, she still won't eat them! LOL I know this is the longest review I have ever written and there is still so much more I could write about how wonderful she is! In my opinion, don't plan your own tour itinerary, in your email let her know your interests and let her plan it for you. Thats what we did and we are so happy we did! So thank you Mandy for being a good person, great with first aid and wonderful with children. Emma already wants to take another tour, and next time I will be wearing anti-slip shoes!

Wonderful English Speaking Hong Kong Local. We booked our tour by email and Mandy arrived on time at our Hotel on the first day of our 8 day holiday. A lovely local who has incredible knowledge of Hong Kong and she shared this with us. Mandy quickly understood what we wanted to achieve on the tour and we felt like we had been friends for years. One of the most useful things for us was the email that Mandy sent the next day with detailed instructions and photos for the attractions which we did not cover on the tour and this helped us on the following days to see all the tourist spots. Mandy is Fantastic.

Great 5 hour tour of Hong Kong!. Mandy was great - she provided a private tour for three of us in late June and met our expectations of seeing local sights + touristy areas. Two in our group had been there a few times before and it was the first time for the other. Mandy arrived promptly at the prearranged time/location, was incredibly flexible and responsive to our changing preferences, and was well informed about the places she took us. We were fortunate to have a cloudless day that provided a once-in-a-lifetime view of HK from a hiking trail on the Peak. Thanks again, Mandy!

You've found your tour guide. I would not hesitate a second to book with Mandy again. It was my family's first full day ever in Asia and Mandy made an impact that we will never forget. I made the request through the site and was promptly responded to about availability. No money was needed to hold the reservation, just a virtual handshake. From that moment, I knew this would be different. Our group included my wife and 8 year old daughter. It was their first ever trip to Asia and i wanted it to be special. After some correspondence we decided on Mandy's Tai Po secret tour. I wanted to see how people really lived in Hong Kong, not just the area around the harbour. I put my complete trust in Mandy and was really rewarded.I was able to meet her at the mtr station to maximize our time in the new territories.We started out by going to the building she grew up in. She explained the process for buying a home, showed the size, gave some examples of how the community functions, and took us to the top floor.
