After, we stopped by her favorite wonton shop below for a great snack which cost about 3 USD for all of us to share.We then went to a fishing village where she showed us a fading lifestyle of local fisherman which is strong with community relationships. Mandy has a great way with people and will often approach them to have them show what they are doing. Again a stop for a snack of local favorites, French toast and lemon tea. We left with lemon tea now being standard fare in our home. We then had a local fisherman give us a tour of the fishing bay and even their boat house. There was a small extra cost but well worth it. Getting off was a bit of an adventure as my wife slipped and hurt her knee and foot. Mandy revealed that she had been a flight attendant and jumped into action getting bandages and even buying her new shorts from a local vendor.We carried on renting a 4 person bike which Mandy helped me peddle across a dam with my wife and daughter as passengers in the back. She talked about the history of the dam that was used to create a freshwater lake where there had been salt water before.We then took a cool little 16 passenger bus to a local market where they had levels of sea food, meat, vegetables, and restaurant where you could have them cook sea food from the first floor. we stopped for a final quick taste of duck, goose, and a beer.Mandy followed up with some great detailed ideas for our next day. I really felt like she was still with us.I really respect Mandy and her sister Apple for taking the leap and starting their own business. While we had a great time with Mandy on a personal level, it's clear they take this very seriously with excellent communication and creating an adventure outside of any tour book or site.The photos show some of the spirit Mandy has. When we wanted to take our monster face photo, she didn't hesitate and jumped right in. My daughter asks if we will see her again. I hope we do.Two tips. 1. Do it on your first day. The info you get will help you tremendously in your days after.2. Book early. I was lucky that i did it two weeks ahead, but she refused 5 others after my booking for the same day.

Fantastic! Highly recommend. Going for a tour with 2 kids and 95 degree heat could have been a disaster but this tour was anything but. Probably the highlight of our 1 week vacation in Hong Kong. We went on a 4 hour tour of Hong Kong with Apple. She was insightful and highly personable. Great with the kids. We were given a fantastic tour of "old" Hong Kong. Got to dine in a traditional Chinese tea house and saw a great street market where my daughter actually tried durian. That alone was worth the price of admission. Apple was very accommodating. Made stops for water and washrooms. When it got to be too hot, we found an air conditioned mall in which to cool down. Cannot recommend this tour enough. Only regret is that I booked it so late that we didn't have the tour earlier. If you're going to be in Hong Kong, this is most definitely worthwhile. Thanks for a wonderful tour!

Great tour!. We had a 5 hour tour with Apple during a very hot and humid summer day. As we had mainly seniors in the group we didnt walk as fast but that didnt stop Apple from being super kind and understanding. We had a great time. I highly recommend the tour with apple and and her sister.

One day in Hong Kong with Apple. We had booked a 6hour tour basically to see New Territories. When Apple heard we were visiting the city for the first time she changed plans and took us on a city tour starting with the metro and the Peak... a lot more in between finishing off at the Wet markets and a secret elevator tour. Our teenagers really loved these special places. We also had a classic HK dim sum lunch in between. 6 hours went by really quickly and we continued after that on our own according to Apple's advice with the Star Ferry to the Kowloon side where we found some serious shopping.Apple was really good at steering us forward in a good pace and it was a very good decision to do the city tour! I would like to warmly recommend Apple and Mandy for any visitors to Hong Kong.

Excellent customer service. After much research, I had booked a tour for our first morning in Hong Kong with Mandy several weeks before our arrival. When no one showed up at our designated meeting time, I called Mandy who thought we had cancelled our tour. Turns out someone with a similar name called the day before to cancel their tour and she cancelled our tour instead. Mandy was extremely apologetic and told us she would make time for us later in the day and give us a complimentary tour. Mistakes happen but it is how you handle them is what makes your business and this could not have been handled more professionally by Mandy. We ventured out on our own that day and then met Mandy late afternoon back at our hotel.She gave us a wonderful several hour tour of the Kowloon, Mongok area including the many markets in this area. It would have been a challenge to find the markets on our own. Mandy has a great personality and knowledge of her city. To end our tour, she took extra time and brought us to the Eyebar and was able to secure an outside table with amazing views of the harbor. We enjoyed a drink with Mandy and then stayed longer on our own to watch the Symphony of Lights from this great vantage point.Mandy even followed up with several emails with instructions for other sight seeing we had talked to her about during the tour. I would not hesitate to recommend Mandy. Thank you for a wonderful tour and handling our situation with such professionalism and excellent customer service.

Awesome!!!!!. Mandy was recommended by a friend who was accompanying us on the trip. And she did not disappoint. Going out with Mandy was like going out with a friend you have known for years. She made all of us very comfortable. She was very knowledgeable & more importantly flexible. I do not believe we could have accomplished visiting these many places in such a short time if we had done it on our own. She is fun, witty and warm. Get her for a tour for as long as you can!!!!!!

Best Local Guide to Experience the real Hong Kong!. My wife and I arrived in Hong Kong for a two day visit. Mandy's sister, Apple, met us at our hotel and took us around Hong Kong for a half day tour - we hit all the high lights with her and had a great experience. The next day, Mandy met us at our hotel for a full day tour of the backwaters of Kowloon, a visit to the public housing (which was eye-opening), along with numerous markets (fish market, produce market, Cat Street Market, etc.). We experienced a very different (and not touristy) side of Hong Kong - it was Great! We loved purchasing fresh seafood along the way and having it prepared for us by a local restaurant. Mandy was a delight to spend the day with - I highly recommend her.

A Wonderful Hong Kong Guide. Spent a very pleasant day with Mandy exploring some of the backwaters of Kowloon. Mandy has a wonderful personality and being a Hong Kong native, she knows many places of interest that are not typically found in guidebooks. She also provided us with loads of informations of things to do when we would be on our own. Mandy made our Hong Kong stay quite memorable!

Short trip in Hong Kong made special by Mandy!. My husband and I stopped in Hong Kong for an extended layover of just one day for the first day of our honeymoon. With just one day to check out the city, we asked if Mandy would be able to arrange an extensive tour to hit the highlights. We decided on a six hour tour, given we were going to a nice restaurant for dinner, and wanted time to go back to our hotel to prepare. Mandy was incredibly accommodating, showing up early in the morning, to begin a great day of touring. Unfortunately, the day started off cloudy, so we began with some indoor sightseeing, and historical and cultural landmarks. She offered personal insight and background information throughout the day, and certainly was able to point out all the best local street food! Given our unusual request to see as much as possible, she was incredibly flexible as as well as knowledgeable even for those spots that she doesn't traditionally stop at on her tours. Luckily the sky opened up and we were able to stop by at a local beach and she directed us on how to get to Victoria peak. My husband and I both agreed that taking the tour was a wonderful addition to our honeymoon, and we would do it again in a heart beat! For reference here is our itinerary: Sky Lobby at Central PlazaStar FerryTsim Sha Tsui Water Front PromenadeNan Lian GardenChi Lin NunneryWong Tai Sin TempleBus to Repulse BayWanchai Market drop-off

Repeated Excellence - Making a rainy day beautiful !. Mandy and The Hong Kong Getaway showed repeated excellence and made a rainy day especially beautiful.On a second trip to Hong Kong we wanted to see a different side of Hong Kong (Kowloon) and thought again that The Hong Kong Getaway - Day Tour would be a nice way to be lead on a wonderful adventure. This proved to be a great decision.Mandy was able to have an opening on the day we wanted to tour, so we looked forward to a pleasant time, but the weather didn't want to cooperate. Mandy arrived right on time just as the skies opened up and huge amounts of rain came down. We discussed our options, however at the time the outdoors looked miserable. We waited araound awhile, things didn't get better. She was very understanding and we decided to cancel for the day, without complaint or charges. We all were disappointed with the weather as she headed home. On the way back she stopped and emailed some options for us to do on our own or possibly another day.An hour or more later the rain lightened, then started again to taunt us about our lost opportunity. But all was not lost. I emailed Mandy about rescheduling and found out she had stopped for lunch and was not so far away. The rain now seemed to be ending. Great, we decided to resume our plans for the same day.We had a somewhat shortened tour, but never less Mandy guided us to some wonderful sights and experiences. The skies cleared, the sun shone, and Mandy took care of us in her special, talented way. We were extremely pleased that a little luck and her diligence turned a dreary morning into another special and long to be remembered visit to Hong Kong.The Hong Kong Getaway - A Day Tour is a repeat favorite travel experience.

Off the tourist track. We booked two tours with Mandy and would strongly recommend her. The first was an orientation tour in Kowloon where we were staying which started at Diamond Hill and gave us a great introduction to the whole area. The second took us into the New Territories and Mandy's home area looking at public housing the fishing village and finished by choosing fresh fish in the market and taking upstairs to be cooked. She is very knowledgeable and informative and a pleasure to be with.

Hong Kong off the beaten path. I contacted Mandy last minute and she was able to fit me in the day I arrived in HK. I requested a tour of sites and experiences most tourists skip and she delivered. We spent the day in Kowloon visiting gardens, temples, a wet market with live animals, and a housing project. She was super knowledgable about Hong Kong's history and socio-economic situation. She explained the different religions in the region and gave me a hands on experience in different temples. We had lunch in a very local restaurant where I discovered delicious milky toast. She followed up with emails about what we had seen as well as suggestions based on what I expressed further interest in seeing. The price seemed high at first but the individual attention was well worth it.

Great But Pricey. Apple was our guide for two days prior to our embarking on an 18 day cruise. Despite rather miserable weather, we couldn't have been more pleased. Apple has a great personality, is very knowledgeable and is a delight to be with for two days. We had great expectations, as this was the most expensive guided tour we've been on, and we were not disappointed.

Perfect Personal Tour of Hong Kong!. I traveled solo to Hong Kong in April 2016 and booked a personal tour with Mandy. After exchanging some emails with Mandy about what I'd like to see and my goals for the tour, we met at my hotel in Causeway Bay, had some coffee and discussed our day. We had to adjust a little bit due to the weather, which was too cloudy for Victoria Peak unfortunately (the clouds were so low that we would not have been able to see anything from the peak). Nevertheless, Mandy had the day planned seamlessly and we ventured out. We started with some street food a short bus ride to nearby markets and shopping as well as exploring the area in general. We went to observation levels at a couple of buildings with incredible views of Hong Kong, we had a great lunch at one of her favorite local restaurants. We took the Star Ferry across the bay to Kowloon and went to Avenue of the Stars and the Bruce Lee statue. She familiarized me with the MTR, which couldn't be easier to navigate. In fact, getting to know public transport was actually one of my major goals. I booked my tour with Mandy early on in my visit and I wanted to be able to hit the ground running on subsequent days. Nan Lian Garden and Chi Lin Nunnery were beautiful and Mandy was sweet, kind, professional, knowledgeable, with great insight and a pleasant nature. I was a bit jet-lagged near the end of the tour, but Mandy kept us going and was patient with me as my energy was waning. I thoroughly enjoyed my time with Mandy and she met all of my goals and expectations. We ended the day at Eye Bar, which is a rooftop bar in Kowloon and had a couple of drinks with an incredible view of Hong Kong island. I left my day in her hands and she was wonderful. I even took her recommendation and tried the Mango Mama :) After our time together, I felt very comfortable venturing out on my own for the remainder of my stay in Hong Kong and ended up checking off my complete list of sites, areas, restaurants, etc. In addition, Mandy's pocket guides for Soho, LKF and The Big Buddha served me well and saved me time! I can truly say that I loved my trip to Hong Kong! Thanks Mandy!

I am already planning to come back! Thanks to Mandy!. I spent the week of the 18/04/16 in Macau and thought it would be a good idea to visit Hong Kong too. My husband couldn’t join, so he organized a private tour on the 21st. I was a little bit hesitant because we normally get very well around most of the places, and with some preparation, we manage to get a good flavour of the cities we visit by ourselvesHow wrong was I! The day I spent with Mandy in Hong Kong was one of the bests I had in my travels worldwide. I think I should not call it a tour; it was more a life experience. Moved by Mandy’s passion, knowledge and sensitivity, I became a Hong Kong citizen who loves its town. The day went so fast, as when you meet a best friend that you haven’t seen in some time!Mandy is so well prepared and immediately understood what my main interests were. We sailed out of the beaten track; I learnt so much about the city, its history and especially about its people. It was such a fun and passionate encounter with HK!I am already planning to come back! Thanks Mandy!

Mandy Fabulous Hong Tour guide. Mandy was our Hong Kong tour guide for 3 couples. She was fabulous. Mandy is extremely knowledgeable, lots of fun and knows great restaurants and Hong Kong sites. We thoroughly enjoyed our all day trip with Mandy and we would highly recommend her. What a professional!
Linda H

"A 'Less Touristy' experience including street dining and a night market? 11 out of 10". After 28years we arrived in Hong Kong again after a 21 day cruise from Australia. As part of our 7night stay in HK we booked commercial tours to see major tourist sites over the first 4 days. When we asked members of our hotel staff if they knew of any private tours operating it was suggested we look at the Hong Kong Getaway site. WOW 5 Star rating. The response from Apple to our email enquiries was swift and informative. As fit mature aged retirees, we were looking for a 'less touristy' tour of approximately 4hours that included the walking required to view some older areas, partake in dining at a street eatery and walking through a night market.Apple's personality, passion and knowledge of her Hong Kong and delight that we wanted to see non touristy things just added to our sense of doing something special and we really appreciated her company.So, we visited one of the early public housing estates, walking around with Apple explaining the history of the 60yo estate was very interesting and enlightened us on a part of Hong Kong we had no knowledge. There was nothing awkward or confronting about walking through, maybe a little bit sad, so if anyone wants to see some 'old' to compare with the new, include an 'old' walk in your tour request.Having Apple guiding us on and off the MTR was great. We just enjoyed going with the flow and followed Apple's directions. With my wife and Apple arm in arm, it felt like we were being shown around by one of our daughters.Visiting the local dry and wet markets in Sham Shui Po was a bit of an eye opener but it was great to see different critters.Apple's choice for our local alfresco dinner was excellent. The chatter and vibes from those already dining was great to be a part of, the owner was a bit of a character and the menu was huge. Based on our wishes, Apple's choices from the menu were way better than we would have chosen and obviously we loved it. The crispy deep fried pigeon was a ....what the....oh wow how good is that....kind of dish. :)Walking from the original local Temple St through the packed throng, bright lights and market stalls tourist part of the night markets was a fun way to finish our night out. We felt sad saying goodbye to Apple back at our hotel, we had thoroughly enjoyed the whole evening and it was obvious Apple had too. So relaxed was she walking with us, that our 4hour tour ended up being 4.45hours.For anyone like us who is looking to experience Hong Kong a bit differently, we recommend checking with Apple and Mandy because we are confident they will program a tour to suit your wishes.Thank you Apple, you really were great company.Kind Regards,Colin & Gloria M.

Private tour with Mandy is a must in Hong Kong!. This was the first time we have ever done a private tour. We had a limited window of time in Hong Kong - 3 days - and we wanted to make sure we saw EVERYTHING! Booking a tour with Mandy was the best idea because she could guide us on our tour without us having to figure out how to get to the places, or getting lost and wasting our time. Mandy showed up at our hotel in the morning and we proceeded to explore the sites. She took into consideration our input as to what we were interested in and catered the tour to our specifications. Our first stop was at the MTR to get an Octopus card. Hong Kong has one of the best public transportation systems in the world and it is extremely affordable. Once we had our Octopus card we were able to go to all the sites by train and walking. Unfortunately for us, it rained the whole time the 3 days we were in Hong Kong so there were certain sites that we couldn't go to like Victoria's Peak. The great thing about Mandy was that she knew an alternative place that we could go and see the same great view as the Peak. She also took pictures of us and with us plus took us to a great restaurant for lunch. She had great insight as to what areas to stay away from, where to go shopping, and followed up by email on suggestions for the rest of our stay. On a rainy day we went to: Nan Lian Garden, Chi Lin Nunnery, Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple, Mid-Levels escalator and walkway system, Victoria Harbour and Central Plaza 46th floor for the view. After Hong Kong we took private tours in Chiang Mai and Beijing and I can positively say that Mandy and Hong Kong Getaway Tour was above and beyond the best experience we had during our trip!

Perfect Hong Kong Day. Our day in Hong Kong with our tour guide Apple was a great way to get to know the city. We were only in Hong Kong for two days and decided to do a one day tour with Apple. Apple customized the tour to our desires and she adjusted the tour for the foggy rainy weather. We enjoyed exploring a diverse range of neighborhoods. We like to explore cities and find things that are off the beaten path. Apple took us to neighborhoods that we would never have come across on our own with fascinating histories. Apple is very knowledgeable and very personable. We greatly enjoyed learning about the history and culture of Hong Kong. She is a proud Hong Kong native and it shows. One of the highlights was our dim sum lunch! Apple ordered perfectly for us and explained the customs and tradition of dim sum. I would highly recommend this tour!

Fabulous tour. Great tour with Apple!If your going to Hong Kong book this tour!She covered all the things we were interested in. The open air market and lunch at a restaurant that the locals go to were the highlights. Very knowledgeable and just a delightful person. Truly brought the culture alive for us!

Absolutely the best time with Mandy. We had spent six days in traveling in Beijing and Shanghai before arriving in Hong Kong. We'd been "off the beaten track" for most of our days and really needed to get back "on track" for a while! Mandy was absolutely the best fit for our family of two parents and four teens. She is enthusiastic, well organized, easy going, charming, informative. She arranged our day in Hong Kong to include sights and views, food, and history. We could not have asked for a better guide. We even found a prom dress for our daughter with Mandy while the boys shopped elsewhere.

What more could one want!. I used to give walking tours but on a specific topic in a limited area. The ability to dial down a full city tour to a few hours, walking, is as advertised quite a getaway! I wanted an overview of current and historical Hong Kong, a view into the dynamics between East/West, China/Taiwan/USA; a peek into daily life of Hong Kongers. I researched tours and narrowed to a few. Mandy responded quickly to my inquiry.I hesitated slightly when Mandy suggested a 6 hour tour but the many positive reviews convinced me. I was delighted to find the time was filled with fun crowds, city-life, night markets, beautiful scenery, tasty food and some light exercise. Particularly interesting were our discussions around the public housing estates and a fun hike up the Garden Hill in Kowloon. I will always remember the views overlooking the city and harbor as the sun set and light switched from day to night. Our day:- Star Ferry Across the Victoria Harbour- MTR to Shek Kip Mei- Visit one of the oldest public housing estate, light hike up the Garden Hill- Visit the Sham Shui Po Street Market- Mtr to Yau Ma Tei, and dinner in the Temple Street night marketA useful benefit was learning to use the Octopus card and the MTR. I believe this is one of the world's best transit systems, I used it instead of taxis for the rest of this stay and on my return a week later.Ka Yan (Mandy's sister) was a wonderful host and guide. Enthusiastic about her home city, she was open to any question on any topic. I stumped her on only one question, "who was the architect for the beautiful bridges (Ting-Kau and Stonecutters)?" In thoughtful host fashion, Ka Yan made sure I was enjoying the pace, the sights and was well fed and watered. A very satisfying day, I highly recommend The Hong Kong Getaway!

Time well Spent. We had never had a private tour before but our time with Mandy was the perfect start to our 8 days in Hong Kong. She provided us with piratical, historical and cultural information that you just don't get from a guild book. Before we arrived she wanted to know what we wanted from our day together and she deviled our wish list and so much more. We took the unconventional route to the top of Victoria peak, bypassed the usual crowds and worked our way back to the lower street markets. She showed us how the buses, the trolley, and the subway worked. Invaluable to our time alone later in the week.The next day she e-mailed us details on how to reach a variety of attraction our time together did not permit us to reach.My wife and I enjoyed our time with Mandy, With her sparkling personality she became one of our trip highlights.

Best Tour We've Ever had from 36+ Countries. Whenever we arrive in a new city we take a tour to get familiar and understand the heritage. Mandy, by far, took us on the best tour out of anyone....ever. She knows every detail of the city, ever trick and tip, and she does it all with amazing fun energy and a huge smile. She instantly felt like a long time friend, showing us her city. When we asked for the real Hong Kong, she took us to the public housing areas where we ate HK French Toast(must try this) with the locals. She was also very knowledgable about normal tourist sites, where you will mix with the normal tourists then suddenly dart off to her secret spot with is a 10x better version (local markets, Hong Kongs best bathroom to see the harbor view). Im not a review writer, but had to sign up to share. Bottom line, when Mandy dropped us off at Mr. Wongs (another must see) we were begging her to cancel her next tours and show us around for the next three days. She carries a special passion and excellence for her work.

Great Tour. My wife & I met Mandy& did a fantastic walking tour shortly after landing in Hong Kong, it really is a great way to get orientated.She was an excellent guide & there really is nothing that she doesn't know about HK.I would definitely recommend going with Mandy.

Excellent tour in Kowloon. We had an excellent guided tour of Hong Kong with Hong Kong Getaway. There were four of us in our party, and as two of us already had a little experience of Hong Kong we asked our guide, Mandy, to take us on a four hour tour in Kowloon to some places outside the “top-ten”.She met us at our hotel in Causeway Bay and we started our tour with her by taking a bus across to Diamond Hill in Kowloon. During the journey, she chatted to us about our interests, and gave us an introduction to what we were going to see. The first place she took us to at Diamond Hill was the Chin Lin Nunnery, which is a Buddhist Temple, and the Nan Lian Garden. The peace and tranquillity here was a most welcome contrast to the bustle around Causeway Bay. At all times, Mandy was giving us just the right amount of interesting information about what we were seeing; enough, but leaving us time to take it all in.After Chin Lin and Nan Lian, we upped the tempo a bit by taking the MTR to the Wong Tai Sing Temple, whose claim is “to make every wish come true upon request”. This Temple is home to three religions (Taoism, Buddhism and Confucianism), enabling many people to express their wishes, Again Mandy’s explanations were most interesting and amusing, especially concerning the methods by which people were expressing their various wishes, sometimes in what seemed a quite earnest manner.After this, Mandy checked with us what we would like to see next and we chose the Flower Market and adjacent Bird Garden, which are located near Prince Edward. These were both very interesting and enjoyable to see, and illustrated different aspects of life in Hong Kong.And the end of our tour, Mandy led us back to our hotel in Causeway Bay, giving useful travel tips (especially about the MTR) and suggestions of places we might like to go for the remainder of our holiday.In summary, we had a most enjoyable tour given by an excellent guide. Thoroughly recommended

The Best Guide!. We feel like we made a friend in Hong Kong after having Mandy as our guide. We communicated by email months in advance. She met us promptly at our hotel. We packed in a full day with an 8 hour tour for 2 of us (18 year old daughter and me - her dad).While Mandy had an overall plan for the day based on what we said we wanted to do, she was great at adjusting the pace to spend more time doing things we really liked the most - like browsing the local markets and trying some truly local dishes together (century eggs & cold pig ears).Mandy gave us a true window into life in Hong Kong, sharing her experiences growing up and showing us how natives live, struggle & thrive. She taught us some of the great history of Hong Kong yet we never were lectured to. We enjoyed a lot of great conversations just strolling the streets and parks of the city.Importantly, Mandy showed us how to get around Hong Kong using public transportation. It has already made our stay here so much easier. Finally, after our tour Mandy sent us a list of all the things we saw as well as detailed travel guides for things we could do on our own, including transportation instructions and great tips. Mandy has a passion for making visitors feel welcome. We left Mandy feeling like we met a great friend. We highly recommend Mandy to anyone visiting Hong Kong!

An Amazing Two Days. My husband and I and our two teenage daughters feel very fortunate to have experienced Hong Kong with Mandy.She guided us through the sights and experiences of Hong Kong with amazing knowledge, grace and humor. She is articulate, and clearly loves her city and culture. She took us to both well known tourist spots as well as delightful less touristy spots of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Mandy is a truly skilled excellent guide, never rushing, always making us feel safe and relating to us and our girls with her lovely warmth and humor. We have travelled many places with excellent guides, and Mandy ranks at the top of our list.

A Great Tour of Hong Kong. Mandy is a rock star among tour guides. I had already visited some tourist haunts before my day with her began. She took me to parts of Hong Kong that few outsiders ever see. It was like going backstage at the theater. Mandy took me to a fascinating and very busy Taoist temple and a very serene Buddhist garden and nunnery. She was able to explain some of the beliefs and practices of those faiths in a way that made the experience much more meaningful. She took me to visit some public housing estates so that I could see where and how very many Hong Kong residents live. We also went to some awesome local markets. She took me to eat in some English-free local food venues that I would have been too intimidated to visit on my own. It was so great to let her order for me and eat some very unique local food. After the tour she sent me an email with some suggestions on what I might want to do with my remaining time in the city. They were very good suggestions. It's obvious that Mandy loves her job and her city. She was very informative and kind. And she was also just a lot of fun to spend a day with. If I get a chance, I'll tour with Mandy again.

Amazing Tour. Mandy met us at our hotel the night we flew in and took us on a tour of the Harbor and made us feel right at home as we toured the local markets and food vendors. The second day we walked through Chin Lin Nunnery, Nan Lian Gardenand and SIk SIk Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple before eating at a local spot surrounded by students from a nearby school. Such a great trip.

Absolutely Fantastic!. As a 16 year old, I've been fortunate to have travelled to other countries and to have experienced different cultures through various private guides - but I have to say, Mandy is definitely my favourite! She made sure the tour met our needs, showed us the most interesting and non-touristy places that we never would have found on our own, and really helped us experience what life is like in Hong Kong. We are so lucky to have had Mandy tour us around and we miss her already!

Great Experience. Our guide was Apple. She was terrific and took us to places we never would have thought of going to ourselves. We saw a side of Hong kong that most visitors dont even know exists. All the way through she was tailoring the tour to suit both our ability and interests.Great way to see part of the real Hong Kong and in good company.
Mandy is The Best!. Many showed us a side of HK that is rarely seen but tourists. The tour was customized to our needs and she made it fun and personable. Thanks Mandy!

Best Tour - Ever. . I'm almost 14 years old, and I've travelled to other countries before and done tours with other guides. Although they were all amazing, Mandy was my favourite guide. She is interesting to listen to, and very informative. I learned so much from this tour in Hong Kong, that I wouldn't have learned if we didn't have her with us. I felt so safe with her, and really enjoyed talking to her about Chinese culture. If you don't go with her, you are definitely missing out! It was an unforgettable experience :)

Fantastic Private Tour of Hong Kong. Mandy put together a perfect day for touring Hong Kong. From navigating the mass transit to touring Victoria Peak away from the crowds, Mandy was excellent. She knew the city, knew what first timers would like to see and made it a day we will always remember. She went the extra mile by emailing us shortly after we finished the tour with ideas and directions for restaurants, night life and additional markets to visit. Highly recommend her for seasoned travelers or first timers.

Great personalized and relaxed private tour!. I was in Hong Kong for a 12 hour layover and wanted to make the most of my limited time in the city. The tour with Ka Yan (Apple) was terrific and showed me all the highlights of Hong Kong with ample photo opportunities and local experiences. She took the time to find out my interests beforehand, customized it to fit my expectations, and provided a post-tour outline of what we did so I can properly document my photos. So helpful!Ka Yan also provided some ideas of awesome less traveled places to visit the next time I'm there. All in all a great tour with a super friendly guide!

Best Private Tour That I've Taken. I spent 6 days in Hong Kong in February 2016 to celebrate my 36th birthday and decided to do a day tour with Apple (Kayan). Setting up the tour was very easy, as Mandy responded to my request in a timely manner and Kayan was on time and ready to go the day of the tour. From the start, Kayan was very friendly and accommodating which set the tone for a great day of seeing the sights of Hong Kong. Along with some of the more known tourist attractions, Kayan exposed me to a side of Hong Kong that I would have never ventured to on my own.Outside of the sites, there was never a sense that Kayan was my tour guide and I was a tourist. She was very personable and the conversation throughout the day felt as if we were old friends. She is a very intelligent and articulate young lady whom clearly has a passion for what she does and a deep love and knowledge of Hong Kong.I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong and I will definitely tour with Kayan when I return.

Amazing private tour! Make time for this tour!. Mandy was an excellent tour guide from start to finish, making our tour day a truly memorable experience. Booking the tour via email was very easy through a few informative communications. Mandy also sent some very helpful emails before (and after) our tour day on trips/activities that I could explore given that I had a few free days in HK. She met me at my hotel on our tour day and could not have been nicer, kinder, and more comfortable to spend a day with. She is extremely knowledgeable about the history of the city where she grew up as well as current events. Her attentiveness to ensuring the 6 hour tour was what I wanted to see and do was noticeable and appreciated throughout the whole day. Highlights included a walkway on Victoria's Peak without the crush of tourists, a walk through the Central district with descriptions of the buildings and what they each mean, a stop at a historical Christian church, a delicious dim sum lunch where I was the only foreigner in the bustling restaurant, a Taoist temple and park visit, a walk through a flower market followed by a bird market, visits to numerous street markets and wet markets to see how locals shop and eat, a quick stop at a local bakery to taste local pastries, and general guidance and information throughout the whole day as we rode the train to various sections of the city. I highly recommend this tour and hope that you get to experience the joy and warmth of Mandy as she introduces you to the wonders of Hong Kong. You will not regret this experience!

Our best ever private tour. As seasoned travellers we always use a private guide to give us a city tour and I can honestly say this was the best tour we have ever had.Ka Yan (Apple) was our guide and you could not wish to find a more personable, friendly, informative and fun tourist guide.Right from the start she made us feel as if we had been friends for years and we were so comfortable in her company my wife and I were quite sad when the tour ended.I could mention all the areas we visited and sights we saw, different modes of transport she took us on, lunch which included dim sum in a non touristy restaurant, but the overriding factor was the sheer joy of her personality in explaining what makes Hong Kong a truly fascinating city. Thank you Apple.

Excellent tour. My wife and I typically take a guided tour when visiting a new city. For Hong Kong we chose a 5 hour tour with Mandy. We gave her the most minimal information ahead of time and Mandy put together a full itinerary. The best thing about the day though was that after about an hour we were totally changing what we were going to see based on the conversation we were having. We ended up way off the beaten path seeing parts of Hong Kong we never thought we'd see but it was fascinating. Mandy knew exactly where to go and was knowledgeable enough about most everything Hong Kong related to explain in detail the way people were living. It was truly an eye opening experience and one of the highlights of our trip.As an aside if you go with Mandy (and I highly recommend you do) have her drop you at Mr Wong's restaurant after the tour. What a treat! You serve yourself beer (all you can drink) and as far as we can tell food just keeps arriving at the table......all for 60HKD per person. The food is great and the value is second to none. Thanks to Mandy for an excellent tour.

Quick visit to Hong Kong. We had a 5 day stay in Hong Kong. The first day we booked Mandy for a 6 hour tour. Starting from our hotel at 10am. We did a mix of the sites, culture, shops, transport and finished with Yum Cha food. Excellent really great. Mandy is lovely, organised and informative. It was really helpful as after this we felt much more confident getting around Hong Kong. Highly recommended. We all enjoyed it. Mandy also gave us excellent info for things to do and see on our own.

Top notch tour!. My sister and I with our spouses spent 2 days with Mandy. We let her set the itinerary and it was amazing! Mandy is vibrant, full of life and genuinely enthusiastic about her city, it's history and culture. She is professional and knowledgable, and accommodating of all our needs. She is just downright fun to be with. I would use her again in a flash!

Let a good friend show you the real Hong Kong. Having Mandy to take us on a private tour at the beginning of our stay in Hong Kong was definitely the best money we spent on the entire trip. Some of us have been to Hong Kong before but we wanted a combination of both the tourist spots and at the same time we want to stay away from tourists. Mandy was able to cater all of our needs. She is knowledgeable, funny and energetic, making our 6 hours tour flew by so quickly. We seen places in both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, and were able to visit one of the poorest areas in Hong Kong which is definitely an unforgettable experience. The tour overran but she did not mind as she wanted to make sure we experienced enough before sending us back to our hotel. After the tour, she also assisted us to plan for the rest of our trip, which is a great bonus! I highly recommend The Hong Kong Getaway to anyone coming to Hong Kong

A rainy but very nice day with Apple. We only had two days in Hongkong and wanted to explore as much as possible. We found The Hong Kong Getaway on tripadvisor with only top rates. Even if the rain was heavy we still had a whole afternoon in the center of the city. The dim sum lunch we had at the local tea house was the highlight.We can strongly recommend this guided tour.Thank you Apple!Peter, Nina, Daniel & Victoria, Sweden

A six hour tour that took care of our request for hidden and secret places as well as tourist "must see" places. We just had three days in Hong Kong and booked Mandy the first day. It was the best money spent on the entire trip. First of all, Mandy is the perfect guide, friendly and attentive to our needs whether it was time for a rest, a quick coffee break or answering our questions regarding whatever topic related to Hong Kong´s ancient or recent history. In fact, after a short “introduction”, it was like a friend showing us her city. We learned so much we never would have found in any guidebook. Also, Manny gave us useful tips for the rest of our stay. We really felt that she cared about us and wanted our stay in Hong Kong to be as interesting and exciting as possible. Kjersti and Terje from Stavanger, Norway

Getting closer to the real Hong Kong. Our family had a wonderful half day with Mandy. She put a great program together, and made sure that we could see, explore and learn a lot about the real Hong Kong through the perspective of a local. We went to the poorest districts with her, explored hidden markets, learned about the public housing system, hiked up to see an amazing view of the city and visited two extraordinary temples where Mandy taught us a lot about Taoism and the ceremonies around Chinese New Year. She was knowledgable and open, and very kind. She is also great with kids! We did this tour with our two young sons and they were not bored for a moment.Should we return to Hong Kong we would definitely spend more time with her to go behind the scenes of the well-know, touristic routes and get closer to the real city.

A journey that I will never forget. I was on a business trip to Hong Kong and happened to have two free days there. After doing some research online and seeing all the positive reviews about Hong Kong Getaway's tours, I decided to give it a go.Before the tour, Mandy customised the tour to suit my interests. I told her that I wanted to see some of the major attractions, but at the same time I also want to experience the real local companies cultures. I am so glad that I did it. In our 8 hours tour, she took me to these most breathtaking places, from the Victoria Peak to small villages without any other tourists. We saw so much in just one day and ate delicious food in places where I was the only tourist. She was also extremely knowledgeable, humorous and patient. She was always making sure that I felt fine and had rests in between different spots. For the next day, I was able to explore more places on my own using her recommendations, which is a bonus. I am so glad that I did this and Hong Kong is definitely one of my favourite cities, thanks to Mandy!

Wonderful Tour. If you are looking for a tour combining an overview of the major spots in Hong Kong with a touch of off-the-beaten-track, this is the one to go to. Mandy is cheerful and very professional. I just needed to leave it to her and she customized the tour according to my interests and also the rainy weather. After the tour, she even sent me a summary and also suggested other things to do during the rest of my stay here. Her restaurant suggestions were wonderful too – you won't be able to find those restaurants on TA and yet they are so good. You know you are in the right place when you see only locals and no tourists! Thanks Mandy, all the best to your business!

Truly Exceptional Experience - A Fabulous Introduction to Hong Kong. Our choice of The Hong Kong Getaway - Day Tour was the best decision made in planning our vacation in Hong Kong. This is a friendly, knowledgeable, professional service that provided an introduction to Hong Kong and Asia that exceeded all expectations.The initial contact and ongoing communications were all handled with quick thorough answers to all our questions. Having never been to Hong Kong we were not exactly sure what we wanted to see and do, but Mandy assured us our tour would be flexible and personalized to our needs. How true this was. We were blown away.It was amazing how much we covered and learned in our 6 hour tour. All of our senses were excited. We saw, tasted, touched, smelled, and heard things that were special, gratifying, unique and thought provoking. Even our imagination was revved up. The tour also left us with great confidence and new skills to better understand the Hong Kong landscape and be able to use local transportation to continue our visit there. Of course we did feel somewhat lost without the guidance we received during the tour and that made us again realize how special this tour service is.Mostly we imagine being able to return to Hong Kong and tour and fun times in other areas with The Hong Kong Getaway. The name is so appropriate as we were able to getaway from our normal lives and experience a different part of the world and even therein experience and see things that many of the locals probably never were aware of.Our guide was fabulous. She was smart, attentive, knowledgeable and very passionate about her city. The content and pacing of our tour was skilfully handled to maximize our time and experiences. Her passion rubbed off on us and now Hong Kong is one of our favorite cities. Thanks Apple and Mandy. Best wishes for each of you and for your company.Wish we could be there for the coming Chinese New Year. May the next year and every year bring you good health and rewards.

Perfect time with Mandy. This was my first visit to Hong Kong. I had no idea of what I wanted to see, but Mandy seemed to have read my mind. She arrived right on time at the W Hotel and we were off to explore HKG. We had a nicely paced 5 hour tour that covered a lot of ground but without feeling rushed. Mandy took me on all the major forms of transportation available in HKG, which was very helpful, and made me confident that I could get around on my own after our tour. She is also extremely knowledgeable and passionate about HKG and gave me a real feel for the history and culture without feeling like I was being pumped with factoids (like some tours can feel). I especially enjoyed her recalling the Umbrella movement -- her description made it come alive. As others have commented, she is also just a lovely person who manages to make you feel quite comfortable and welcome in her city. I will do another tour my next trip. See you soon Mandy. And, thanks again. P

Best Guide We Had in Asia!. I have been a tour guide in Washington, D.C., so I really appreciate a good guide, and Mandy was the best we had in 3 weeks throughout Asia. She gave us great ideas in structuring our day in our correspondence from home. Although the day set records for cold (also drizzly and windy), we were having such a good time with Mandy we didn't mind and went a full 8+ hours. She got us to an ATM to get our HKD's, then to buy the "Octopus" card for public transportation for our 4 day stay. She made sure we saw all the highlights and avoided lines even for the Peak Tram. She gave us the history as well as some contemporary insights into Hong Kong today and her thoughts about the future. We told her we would like to stop for typical snacks and she made sure we found the tastiest ones. She is not only extremely knowledgable and professional, but she is friendly and fun too. She immediately sent us very helpful follow-up emails on itineraries and logistics and restaurants for the rest of our stay. You couldn't ask for more. Thanks Mandy!

Best tourguide I've had!. It is the first time we decided to hire a private tour guide, and it is definitely the best decision ever. Mandy was very friendly and helpful. We felt like instant friends the moment we met and she had been so accommodating to our needs throughout the tour! We took a whole day tour with her, and she was able to show us the beautiful view at the Peak without having to line up. We saved so much time because of her help. We were also able to visit the real local areas where tourists can't possibly visit without the help of an experienced local tour guide. We learnt so much and it was a really fun day for us. She even sent us a lot of follow-up emails to make sure we can explore Hong Kong on our own. Without her, we wouldn't love Hong Kong as much as we do. Thanks again Mandy and we will for sure come back for you!

Exceptional tour with local insights. I and my boyfriend took a daytour with Mandy and the communication before the tour was very smooth. We requested to see the non-touristy spots and get a more in-depth understanding of the life style of local Hong Kong people, since we are quite a frequent traveler to Hong Kong. Mandy didn't disappoint. She tailor-made the tour for us and we are very satisfied to learn a completely different side of Hong Kong. From old fishing village to local markets and the public housing.... I am most impressed when she took me to the secret mountain where only locals would go. The view from there is amazing and I think it is more beautiful than that from the Peak. I really enjoyed the tour and am glad that I decided to hire them. Book them, you won't regret!

Best way to see Hong Kong. I usually don’t do private tours, but I booked a flight to Hong Kong last minute and I wanted to get the most of my time so I booked a private tour with Hong Kong Getaway. My tour guide was Mandy, she was everything you would expect from a tour guide and more. I asked her to bring me to places where I wouldn’t be able to go alone due to language barrier. I didn’t really know what to expect with my vague request but I ended up enjoying the whole tour. Her prepared plans for the tour had to be revised a couple of times due to weather conditions, but everything seemed to have gone by seamlessly due to her knowledge of the ins and outs of HK.After the tour she sent me emails of various itineraries that I could follow and do for the rest of my stay in Hong Kong. She was also open to follow up e-mails for questions and suggestions after the tour, but I didn’t have to because her guides were more than enough. Overall, the private tour was very well worth it! Highly recommended!

Awesome Experience!. My family had a wonderful time with the guidance from Apple. She was a kind and smart lady who knows a lot about HK and loves to share great stories with us. My 13-year old kid became a good friend with her and my wife fully enjoyed the 6 hour trip with Apple. I was very happy because my wife and kid were very satisfied. I am grateful to Apple and I strongly recommend this company to other travelers to HK. :)

No complaints - perfect tour of HongKong. Mandy organised 2 tours for myself and my teens, and everybody is happy with the service Mandy gave us. From getting the octopus card to additional information on places that we did not see (how to get there and tips to get there and what to see). A lot of history also was mentioned in the tours. I do not have any problems recommending Mandy to anybody.

BEST PRIVATE TOUR IN TOWN!. Mandy is a very passionate, friendly and knowledgeable tour! My husband and I really enjoyed the trip she planned. With Mandy, we were able to get to somewhere that tourists would never go, like the public estates and the local restaurants. The experience was unforgettable and we could see another side of HK. By the end of the tour, we became friends with Mandy and she suggested other good places for the rest of our trip. Thank you Mandy:) I highly recommend The Hong Kong Getaway to every HK tourist.

Excellent tour guide. I have used Mandy for two different city tours of Hong Kong. Each was excellent. The first time was a general overview of the modern city. This included Big Buddha, the cable car, the Peak and the amazing city lights of Victoria Harbor. The second involved more of the "real" side of Hong Kong. Meaning an old fishing village, understanding the history of public housing and the traditional shopping areas of Kowloon. Mandy is very knowledgeable and extremely personable, and I would highly recommend her. I plan on using her when I return in the future.

Best Private Tour Guide!. We recently went to Hong Kong for our New Year's vacation and thought we'd get a tour guide to make sure we saw as much as we could during the time we had there. We got online and chose Mandy with The Hong Kong Getaway. This was the best decision ever!We travel quite a bit and are accustomed to finding our way around ourselves so were on the fence about getting a guide. The first day we met Mandy in the afternoon and we stayed around the Kowloon and Hong Kong island area. She took us to the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade then we took the Star Ferry to Hong Kong island. We went to Crystal Jade for lunch in Wanchai and the Shanghai dumplings were so very good. Mandy taught us how to eat them so the juice didn't escape and we got the pleasure of eating them the right way. This was an afternoon tour so after we walked around the island a bit we took a taxi to Victoria Peak and walked on a trail to a beautiful view of the city. Mandy did not take us to the spot where the rest of the tourists went, it was way too packed! She took us to a spot where only the locals know about. Much better! On day 2, we traveled to Tai Po and were shown where many Hong Kong people live in the Kwong Fuk Estates. We then visited a fishing village and went on a boat ride with a fishing lady, Mrs. Cheng, and visited her fish farm. We visited Tai Mei Tuk which is a large area with outdoor BBQs and many families were there BBQing lunch. We were so shocked that they were offering us tastes of their food to welcome us to Hong Kong. We were so honored that they shared their meals with us. We went to the market in Tai Po where we bought some shrimp and went upstairs where one of the restaurants cooked it for us. Then, we did a little shopping in the market nearby. We ended the day back in Hong Kong island as we wanted to see the longest escalator.By having Mandy with us, we were able to get to the touristy sights and also visit areas that tourists would never find. We had so much fun with her and she checked in frequently to see if we were enjoying ourselves or if we needed to alter the itinerary. Very intuitive!My suggestion to you is to book Mandy right away so you can enjoy your trip. You won't be disappointed.

Great Tour of Hong Kong. Hong Kong can be an intimidating city. With so many districts, interesting places to eat/drink, and such diverse culture, having a versatile and flexible guide is critical, and we got so much more than we bargained for. Mandy was waiting for us in our hotel, ahead of schedule for our morning tour. She had crafted an itinerary based on our pre-trip preferences, and adjusted to focus on our interests as the tour progressed. By the end of the day tour, it felt as though we were walking around with a knowledgeable friend instead of a guide. We would've been lost without her. Later in the day, we received several e-mail with focused suggestions for the rest of our trip. I definitely recommend The Hong Kong Getaway for travelers of any age. Whether you're interested in culture, local food or architecture, they will have you covered.

Awesome private tours!!. My family was visiting Hong Kong for a week and Mandy has been amazing! We booked two days with her and we were able to see the major tourist spots on the first day and the real local neighborhood on the second day. She is very knowledgeable and friendly and make sure the tours suit our interests. I am so glad that we have her or otherwise we would never have discovered the side of Hong Kong which is impossible to see without a local. Thank you Mandy!!

Perfect introduction to Hong Kong. We just had a 1-day layover in Hong Kong. We had the immense pleasure of spending the first few of those hours with Mandy, who introduced us to some of the most delightful markets, best food, astounding city views, amazing buildings, and beautiful temples in this fascinating, bustling city. We only got lucky in making a last-minute appointment thanks to a cancellation--you probably want to book her farther in advance. You'll be glad you did!

Must do !!. Let me start by saying Mandy is the nicest,most knowledgeable tour guide/ now friend in all of Hong Kong.While in HK on business Mandy took a group of us to dinner via subway,to a place that we would have never found with out her. We were treated like family at this restaurant (by Mr.Wong ). It was an amazing experience. Do not visit Hong Kong without booking The Hong Kong Getaway-Day tourThanks again Mandy. KM

Fantastic way to see Hong Kong. Met Mandy for the first time and felt like instant friends. I'd never had a one on one tour before but after this I would definitely do it again. Mandy's knowledge of Hong Kong is engaging and her love for local food was a bonus for me.Thank you very much Mandy.

Terrific way to see a very different Hong Kong. First things first, Mandy is lovely and very knowledgeable. We visited so many places where tourists simply do not go. We visited a fishing village, an apartment complex and a shopping area for local residents. All places that give you a much better idea of how an everyday person lives. Our lunch in the little tiny fishing village was amazing. Mandy has established relationships with many locals, and as a result, was able to get nine of us into a little restaurant for lunch with the cook making special dishes for us. Without Mandy, I don't even know if I have found this restaurant. Just wonderful. I would highly recommend!! Mandy also gave us excellent ideas for things to do the next day, even though we were not going to be going with her. You can tell that she loves her job and loves her city. As a result, anybody who takes a tour with her has a terrific experience.

Unforgettable. If you're an avid googler and trip planner like me, don't bother researching too much to make sure you've covered all the must-sees and must-eat lists. While I had the pleasure checking off the list of touristic spots, the best part of my Hong Kong trip was getting the non-touristic experience.I knew most cities have hidden gems, but I never knew Hong Kong had that many! I can't tell you how exciting it had been for me to have learnt and discovered the country through the eyes of two local girls who were SO well-equipped and competent as tour guides (who are also such beautiful souls). Mandy and Apple not only took me through some history lessons; they spoke of politics and gave such eloquent perspectives about life that had me too impressed with my overall experience with them. Their patriotism is infectious. I did MANY cool things during my 5-day trip. I've seen, tasted, heard & danced a whole lot more than timeout could ever recommend. I cannot wait to go back to Hong Kong to unlock the rest of the hidden gems from Hong Kong Getaway!

Local guide leads the way. If you are travelling to Hong Kong and want a personalized tour Mandy is the person to contact. Her warm, friendly disposition is engaging. Mandy will take you "off the beaten path" to see an amazing insiders view of Hong Kong that one simply cannot access all on your own. From a charming harbor crossing, onward to spectacular mountain top views, hipster art galleries and speakeasy themed bars you will enjoy yourself immensely.

Perfect overview. Mandy did an amazing job of giving my wife and I an overview of the city. She really knows how to get around the town so you are able to see all the top spots but avoid any long lines. She also sent us an email the next morning with details and tips on additional spots we were not able to get on the tour. Mandy is very personable and really knows Hong Kong, our trip would not have been the same without the tour, a must do if you are visiting Hong Kong.

Go outside of HK Central with a real local guide. I spent a day with Mandy and enjoyed every minute of it. Mandy met me at my hotel, and we quickly got on a bus for the trip to her hometown of Tai Po, in the New Territories. She showed me where she grew up, then we strolled around the area and into a pretty park. A taxi ride later we were in a small fishing village, where we ate lunch in a very local restaurant, followed by a stroll through a local market. At the end of our day, Mandy took me on the high speed train back to Kowloon, where we got onto the famous Star Ferry for the trip across to HK Central. Throughout the day Mandy told me about her city, the country, the history of the area, the customs, and many other things with perfect English and a big smile. Snap her up before someone else does!

#1 Guide In All of Hong Kong. If I was a tourism professor grading tours and experiences on my recent trip to Asia, the only A+ would go to Mandy. I can not say enough good things about the overall experience - from the amazing sights & sounds of Hong Kong, to the interesting facts shared at each stop, to the laughs and conversation we had throughout the tour.Here is just a brief list of things of the things we did on the tour for reference:• The Peak• Peak Tram to Central• Double-decker bus to Repulse Bay• Minibus to Stanley• Wanchai Wet Market • Hopewell Centre Observation Lift• Bus to HotelMy time with Mandy was so great that I plan to do ANOTHER tour with her on my next trip to Asia. I learned so much, but most important to me was that I had FUN. Thanks again, Mandy.

See Hong Kong with the 'locals'. Mandy was a gem. Mandy provided an excellent itinerary which allowed us to enjoy multi facets of Hong Kong culture. The one-to-one experience allowed the opportunity to ask many questions and to better understand the city and its residents. I would highly recommend this tour company.Thanks Mandy!

TERRIFIC HONG KONG LAYOVER. I did a tour with Mandy on a 12 hour layover in Hong Kong. It was a terrific way to see the Hong Kong. Mandy is extremely knowledgeable and informed. She knows the city well and is very skilled at getting around busy Hong Kong. She asked what I was hoping to learn and see on my tour and then did everything to make sure my exception were met. Mandy is terrific and a lot of fun! I definitely have a new friend in Hong Kong.

Fun time in Hong Kong . We did an afternoon tour with Mandy. My wife and I had a great time with her. She was very informative and went at our pace. I told her I wasn't into crazy food and was food shy. She made sure and focused the tour on the things we liked. We went to the flower market , bird market, visited the peak at night, went to a night market and rode the star ferry. Would recommend this tour. It was a great afternoon for us. We already like Mandy!!!

Fabulous Way to Experience Hong Kong!. This tour is an absolute must when visiting Hong Kong! Mandy is such a fantastic person, and she made our trip so much smoother. We met Mandy on the first night of our trip, and that is exactly what I would recommend, as she gave us so many tips and tricks for the rest of our time in Hong Kong. She was fun, flexible, knowledgeable, and so accommodating! My friend and I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who is coming to Hong Kong for the first time, or anyone who wants an in-depth tour with a local. Thank you for everything Mandy - you are a wonderful person!

I feel like we have a friend in Hong Kong. The ONLY Cantonese /English Speaking Tour Guide. We spent about 11 hours touring Hong Kong and the New Territories with Mandy on October 11, 2015. She met us at our hotel and took us to places that we could never have experienced on our own. There are other guides on Trip Advisor, but most do not speak Cantonese. We not only saw places in Hong Kong, but experienced the heart and soul of the people that live in Hong Kong through visiting a non-tourist places. We learned about Majong by watching fisherman playing the centuries old game in an old fishing village, we ate fresh fish that we purchased at the "wet" market and then Mandy had cooked for us at the Hawker Center and Mandy even introduced us to her parents so we could experience the real Hong Kong.I am embarrassed that it took me so long to write the review, but Mandy worked so hard for us and we had such a wonderful time. The tour was not inexpensive, but very worth the HKD spent. Mandy even provided us with itineraries for the more tourist places that we could do on our own. Thank you so much Mandy!!!

WOW!! What a blast !. I have visited HKG on several occasions but never experienced the local side of town. Mandy really made me fall in love with the city and I would have never had such an insight without her help. It was both culturally and socially interesting and she gave a lot of insider tips which will be useful on my future trips back to HKG. I recommend this to anyone, whether familiar or not to the city.

Very personal!. I have been to Hong Kong for business many times and my friends/work-colleagues have always taken me to places all around the city whenever we saw a free slot in between our work-days. This time I decided to take a week-day off and wanted to have an adventure I had not experienced before. With the good reviews on Tripadvisor, I was keen to try a tour from the Hong Kong Getaway Company and had a fantastic day-trip with Mandy to her home-town in the New Territories. For one person, it was probably a little bit pricey, but for this unique experience with such a wonderful person, I was happy to pay it. Thank you, Mandy, for a day filled with wonderful adventures and your recommendations for adventures after!

Tour? Invaluable Friends trip!. Dear Getaway Ladies!My first private tour, travelling very much all over the world, but normally on my own. But after reading all the nice reviews I decided to give it a try and follow a local.What a fortune!Wow, from our first meeting I did not even think I was on a tour, but on the road with a friend, loving the job she is doing. Thank you Ka Yan for taking me to your hometown. I was amazed of the changing surroundings, leaving the rush of Kowloon, after the short ride with doubledecker as well as Minibus to Taipo. On the bus, I got recommendations for the next attractions I could visit (which I did actually). Arriving at Sam Mun Tsai New Village I tried the Wonton, Beef Tendon / Brisket with dry noodles in a local restaurant, where I could not even read the menu. Experiencing the old fischer villager we took a boat ride by a "Hakka" lady and saw the Tsz Shan Monastery as well as a floating fish village and boat house of the Hakka lady. The Hakka coupled explained how they were raising their fish and made living on their floating refugium. Climbing from the boat on a dam we were overlooking the Plover Cove Reservoir. Although I felt like singing in the rain, we were lucky to keep dry. Back in Taipo town center we visited the wet market, and also the local food court to have some fishballs and doughed mango (KaYan - I forgot the name of it!). Trying to play hide and seek with the locals on a busy market saturday. Ever been to Hongkong public housing? My first time as well - at Kwong Fuk Estate. Reflecting the mood of this grey building it started to rain heaviliy (typhoon warning 3). But that did not stop Ka Yan to explain how life is like in Taipo and Hongkong, which made my tour a invaluable occasion.If tripadvisor allowed for 10 points, my Getaway friends would get an eleven. Thank you very much and I cannot wait to see you again for my next private tour,赛巴斯坦 (Sebastian)

A amazing Layover Tour with a friend!. I had a 12 hours layover in Hong Kong today. After checking the various Daytour Operators I choosed Hong Kong Getaway. Why? They mix sightseeing with food tour! Apple picked me up at the airport. We took the MRT and went directly into the city. We visited her favourites places far away from mass tourism. It was a little bit like coming home or visiting a friend. She went with me in a Tea House and we were tasting excellent local and tradional food. Several times she surprised me with something new and explained to me why she loves those places. I booked a 6 hours tour. Finally we were 8 hours together and I left from Hong Kong having found a friend! Thanks Apple (tipping with my finger twice on the table ;-).

An exceptional introductory experience of Hong Kong. From my initial email to Mandy, she was a pleasure in setting up a tour during mine and two of my friends time in Hong Kong. She was flexible in her dates and very responsive. We wanted an introductory experience of Hong Kong on our first night there and she provided an exceptional tour of Kowloon and Hong Kong. She met us at our hotel and took us not only to some of the must see tourist attractions, but also the local hidden gem experiences, like a ride on the tram or her favorite site seeing spot of the Victoria Harbor. She was also able to gauge based on what our preferences were a customizable tour so we were able to try some new cuisines but also cognizant that we were jet lagged. You could really tell that she put thought into her tour and had copious amounts of knowledge on each area we went to. She was great in also assisting us back to our hotel to ensure we arrived safely and took care of us all the way to the end. She really creates an experience and wants the people on her tour to have an amazing overall trip of Hong Kong, so she sent us two follow up emails with suggestions of other places to visit (Stanley Market, Lan Kwai Fong, Temple Street, and SOHO) during our time there based on our conversations with her of other places we were interested in. These follow up emails included best modes of transportation and highlights to continue our amazing trip!Here were the highlights of our tour with Mandy and I would recommend anyone visiting Hong Kong for a short of long time to book through her: Nathan Road Hotel Peninsula - Felix Bar ('s bathroom!) Tsim Sha Tsui Waterfront Promenade Star Ferry The Peak Mak's Noodle @ the Peak Central - HSBC Lan Kwai Fong  MTR to Hotel

Excellent tour of Hong Kong!. Mandy and Apple gave us an amazing tour of Hong Kong!!!! We were a big family group of ten people, and only had two days for our visit. On our first day we visited Victoria's Peak and some other local attractions on our own. We asked Apple and Mandy to show us areas we might not know about from the guidebooks. We had a fabulous day visiting an old fishing village, hiking up to a fabulous view of the city, visiting a local marketplace and enjoying a local lunch. Apple and Mandy were especially good relating to our kids and making the day work for them - by the end of the day there were hugs all the way around!! I can't say enough about these sisters - you won't get a better tour of Hong Kong!!

There is a reason they have a perfect rating. Mandy and Apple were simply phenomenal tour guides. We visited HK with my wife and 2 kids (9 and 11) and my brother and his family - including 2 teenage boys. Quite a span to entertain. Within minutes of connecting with Mandy and Apple, one was walking hand in hand with the younger kids, the other was entertaining the boys with stories of HK nightlife. Meanwhile they shared their views on HK politics and stories of their childhood life with the parents. They really had an amazing ability to connect with all of us.They also really listened to us when we described our desire to see "the real HK" - off the beaten path. They adjusted our plans and took us to a remote fishing village near where they had grown up. We had lunch in a tiny village restaurant and after a hike took a small local fishing boat back to the village. We saw a side of HK we never would have seen out our own.They also went out of their way to help us with advice about what we should see on our own, and how to navigate a very short connection in HK airport (which we would never have made without their help).Thanks Mandy and Apple!

Excellent tour, not only downtown HK/Kowloon. I booked two tours with Mandy in September 2015. One to give an overview on Hongkong Island and Kowloon and a combined biking/boat tour to Tai Po and around Plover Cove including Sam Mun Tsai village. Mandy checked upfront what my points of interest were an perfectly tailored the tours accordingly. Right from the beginning I had very much the impression that Mandy really loves her city and what she is doing. She knows a lot of details and background on architecture, culture and history. Being a native local, she also knows a lot of stories about Hongkong’s daily live including the best places for street food. The second tour was completely different and showed a side of Hongkong which not everybody would expect. The tour included Tai Po town, a boat tour an Plover Cove and a fishermen village. Very interesting, very beautiful. If you have time and budget for more than one tour, I really recommend to do a nature/landscape in addition to Central/Wan Chai/Kowloon to get a more complete picture. Having travelled quite a bit in Asia, I know there sometimes are issues understanding the “local English”. Not here, perfect also for me, not being a native English speaker. I really enjoyed both tours with Mandy very much and highly recommend her. As a person she is very friendly, educated, open minded and helpful. She gave me a lot of additional valuable information where else to go/eat/hike/look. Mandy, thanks again, it really was a pleasure!

Outstanding Mandy!!. After a morning hike up the Buddha trail, I wasn't sure how the additional 3 hour "walking" tour with Mandy would go. Let's just say it went great! She tailors the tour based on your likes, dislikes and even your tired legs! Easy going, knowledgable and super friendly. Highly recommend!My climbing buddy back out last minute, so I went solo with Mandy. To start we took the mini bus #1 up to V Peak and walked the Lugard Trail with great visibility of HK! NO additional hiking required. Then we took a taxi down to Central Market and explored the Man Mo temple, some local shops and finished off with a quick bit to eat (duck and pork) from a local "diner". The 3-hour tour was not long enough, but after a long day, Mandy was kind enough to "pour" me into the subway and point me in the correct direction towards my hotel.Thanks again Mandy for sharing HK with me. Good luck to you and your sister in your Hong Kong Getaway tour business. Scott WeaverWashington DC

Hong Kong. Super enthousiastic young lady who felt right what we wanted and not wanted. Visited TST Waterfront Promenade, Star Ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui, Taxi to the Peak, A walk in Central, Mr Wongs @ Mongkok and Sai Yueng Choi Street Market.

Brilliant . Mandy was certainly exceptional. The bespoke tour provided us with a perspective of Hong Kong that was completely unexpected and immensely enjoyable. Mandy's warm, sincere and friendly personality makes you feel like instant friends. Our only regret was that we couldn't take her home with us:) if I could give our experience a name I would call it " Parts Unknown". A visual of Hong Kong rarely seen by westerners. Anthony Bourdan himself would of been proud of the experience. I've traveled the world. From India to the Maldives. From Argentina to Indonesia. I've been on many many tours. And this experience will always stick out. Not only because of what we saw, but because of who we saw it with. Mandy is a wonderful person and tour guide. I highly recommend her.

Mandy is amazing!. Two girlfriends and I took a walking tour with Mandy on our first night visiting Hong Kong. My friend booked the tour based on her TripAdvisor searching, so I can't take any credit for that. Mandy met us in the lobby at our hotel at 7 pm as promised and took us on a full and exciting 4 hour adventure throughout Hong Kong! She was enthusiastic and very friendly from start to finish. We started by walking along the Hong Kong harbor area and our first food stop was to get an egg tart, which is one of the dishes that the city is known for. She gave us ample time to get the city view from the harbor and took all of the photos that we wanted. She then led us to the Star Ferry to take across the harbor to the Hong Kong island side (we were staying on the Kowloon side). From there, we headed up to "the peak" shopping mall area in a taxi given that the line for the tram was very long. She took us to the "touristy" viewpoint of the harbor, and then on a walk to her favorite viewpoint, which was definitely better! Our second food stop was at a street food cart to get "siu mai" (fish dumplings), which I absolutely loved. Since I enjoyed them so much, she recommended that I look out for curry fish balls during the rest of my stay in Hong Kong, and I was certainly not disappointed when I found them in Macau the following day! We stopped to grab some dinner at a place called Mak's Noodle, where she directed me to the wonton and beef brisket noodles. Again, an excellent choice! She then took us down the peak on the tram, which was very steep, and to Lan Kwai Fong (the "party" area) of the city before directing us back to our hotel. From start to finish, Mandy was friendly, professional and enthusiastic, which we absolutely loved. She also followed up the tour with an email containing other suggestions of things that we could do. Compared to a more "standard" tour of a city, I prefer this version 100%. Keep up the great work, Mandy! :)

Great contrast to the frenetic swirl of the city. We contacted Mandy last minute and she was very accommodating with fitting us in and also when our bank cards wouldn't work in the atm - thanks Mandy! She recommended a visit to Tai Po and San Mun Tse, which was lovely. We had already done the usual sights in the city and we really wanted the children to see a different side to Hong Kong, it's not all skyscrapers and malls. The boat ride and village were great, it was quiet and calm. Had a cool drink in a local cafe and a tasty dim sum lunch at a nearby restaurant. Wonderful views and so unexpected!We explored the town, very interesting market (wish we had the variety in the UK, especially the seafood) and the local housing. We were so involved in looking at everything that we ran out of battery power in two phones and one camera. So no group shot with Mandy. Our tour ran over by two hours but there was no extra charge.Would love to go back and try a hike or bike ride one day. This little tour company is highly recommended for anyone who wants to see a little more of Hong Kong beyond the usual tourist spots (not there is anything wrong with that). Just make sure your camera has enough battery power!We enjoyed Mandy's company, she is very friendly and helpful. She was more of a friend who knows the area than a tour guide and all of our group related to her well (from 19 yo son to Grandma).Mandy, upon research we found UK customs won't allow any meat products through, dried, canned or otherwise, so no Yunnan ham for me. Had to leave it in the hotel.

Book this tour now! Such a fun tour.. I found this tour after reading the reviews on trip advisor , and was so glad that I was able to organize a last minute booking.
