My boyfriend and I had an absolutely amazing experience with Mandy and throughly enjoyed seeing HongKong through the eyes of a local. Mandy is so friendly and engaging, that It felt like we were spending the day with a friend! She is very passionate about sharing her culture and shared so many interesting, and "edu-taining" tidbits with us. Mandy is well versed in the history of HK so you will learn a lot on the tour. Just be mindful that time goes by very quickly! I would highly recommend this tour, especially if you're interested in getting off the beaten path. You can customize your package, but I would leave it to Mandy. You'll be happy that you did.

Entertaining trip to the outskirts of Hongkong. We spend a really happy day with Apple and visited Taipo, a smaller area in the New Territories. Our trip included a boat ride, a visit to a fisher woman's swimming hut, some old public housing (quite interesting!) and some walks around the freshwater reservoir. Apple was funny, comprehensive and friendly. Strong recommendation from our side!

Great Tour and excellent guide. Mandy is very friendly and her services simply AWESOME :)Without the guided tour, it will be very cumbersome for us to move around HK & Kowloon as we are not that familiar with the local sights and transportation.With a 5 hours tour, we were intro to HK and Kowloon, especially the Peak.We have great experienced with taxi, bus, Peak tram and ferry ride.The street food experience was great too, so was the dim sum lunch and very yummy local Cantonese dessert.I strongly recommend the services of The Hong Kong Getaway Tour by MandyMdm Kuan

our visit is spectacularly amazing, those attractions and views around.. places to visit is quite informative giving the ideas of their cultures, and archetecture. Visiting the places gives one total peace and tranquility, the beauty reserved the peace they offer to everyone , enjoys the ambiance that will keep you to come back to places.

A perfect day (More than perfect). Our target was to know the "real" HK and It was a very special day for me (my 50th birthday). Ka Yan Cheung is a amazing,nice, polite and educated young lady. She took us to the New Territories, the borrough where she lives. And everything exceed our expectations we saw a lot of great places that we could never see alone.I appreciate a lot her behaviour. I only regret something: I gave her a tip smaller than she deserved. At least I want to send her again my gratitude It was a perfect birthday.

Half-day tour in HK. Apple took us on a lovely tour, going up North to Tai Po area. We enjoyed the won ton mee at the fishing village, boat ride and walking around her home town. We had specifically asked to non-touristy parts of HK so the itinerary was great. Apple is a lovely and friendly guide and felt like it was a relative who lives locally showing you around. It was a wonderful way to spend the afternoon.

Great day out of the city. Our tour start time was delayed twice because of flight delays. Our guide Mandy answered our E mails and arranged new start time without hesitation. We asked for a tour off the beaten track and that's what we got. A fantastic tour of her home town-and surrounding area without seeing another tourist. A market tour with tastings and explanations of what was happening and a meal in a local restaurant with explanation of customs and traditions plus the great food.a visit to authentic fishing village and a boat trip in a working fishing boat. Mandy. Also helped educate us on the use of public transport plus gave us plenty of information to make our trip to HK very enjoyable.Highly recommended.

Couldn't have asked for better. From the first email to Mandy til we parted company, a great experience.Mandy was so helpful and the best guide we could have asked for.Mandy is so friendly the 8 hours we spent with her were very easy.As this was the first time in Hong Kong Mandy was keen to show off the place she loves. Our first experience was in a dim sum restaurant that the locals use. We would never have ventured in as in didn't even look like a restaurant from the outside. Mandy then explained to us the rituals that surrounded the dim sum meal. The food was delicious.loved it.Then Mandy took us exploring her wonderful city. From skyscrapers to local life and ending the evening with a delicious meal. The Peking Duck was a very interesting meal.I would definitely recommend Mandy to you. She personalises your tour so it fits what you ask for.By the time we parted we felt that we had known Mandy for years.

Awesome Action packed day customized day tour. I had one day to explore Hong Kong after a work trip before flying out in the evening. Apple put together an itinerary for me after telling her what I was most interested in seeing, experiencing, eating, etc. The tour was a great pace and I was able to see several highlights, take heaps of photos, experience almost mode of transportation, and eat lovely authentic (vegetarian) cuisine. I loved not having to worry about getting lost trying to tour HK on my own, I got to see a lot more instead of figuring out logistics of getting from place to place, and Apple had many great options to choose from. She picked me up at the hotel and made sure I got back in time for my flight, and was very informative about the historical aspects and culture of HK. I would definitely recommend Apple and her sister to anyone traveling and wanting a tour guide. I will be back in November and if I have time I will ask them to show me a few more places again.

Great Day Trip with a Local to get off the beaten path!. Our family went on a day trip with Mandy and we had already seen a fair bit of Hong Kong so many of the "obvious" destinations that Mandy wanted to show us, we had already seen. She changed plans on the spot and took us out of the city on a tour of Tai Po and the surrounding areas for the afternoon. We were able to see how the locals live, talk about the day-to-day life in Hong-Kong and really see a totally different side of HK. Mandy also organized a short boat ride on the spot to see the local fisheries.What was amazing was how beautiful and green the landscape outside the city was.We thoroughly regretted that we had not called Mandy right at the beginning as she really knows the place well and we felt that she could have shown us a better angle of what we had already seen thus far.We would recommend without any hesitation, if you want a tour with a personalized touch.

Best decision ever!. What a fantastic experience. Mandy was an excellent guide and companion on what was a very wet day. Like a trooper she soldiered on though and shared with me some of HK's magical sights. The insight she provided on HK life and culture gave depth to what might have otherwise been just a pretty view. My only regret is only squeezing in a half day tour as I could have spent the entire day in such enchanting company. I can't recommend these ladies enough.

Great day. Incredible tour, the assistance mandarine (aka mandy) provided us with during and after the tour, was a key factor of our great trip to hong kong. The only thing i regret is not having more space in my luggage to take her back to spain.

A wondrous experience in HK !. Mandy’s private and tailor made tour was like no other. I'm a tough person to excite but Mandy knew the best places to take me. I had no plans whatsoever coming into Hong Kong. I did not realize how wonderful and beautiful Hong Kong is. My tour included a small nature walk to Mandy’s secret spot, gazing down onto the extravagant and brilliant creation of the city. You are able to see the contrast of nature versus man-made skyscrapers. This short walk gives a better view of the city below without having to deal with all the touristy crowds. A much preferred private tour. Not only was the view spectacular but also Mandy keep dishing out very knowledgeable history. I won't say much on this, as Mandy will sure tell you.After this we took the ferry across. Once again seeing the amazing city now from the waterfront. Mandy is always switched on; though I kept forgetting I was on a tour. She has an upfront bubbly personality but very subtlety teaching you about Hong Kong. We finished off our tour with a nice dinner as good friends. She is the best tour guide I've ever come across; you don't realize you're on a tour because she becomes a friend showing you around town.Mandy is a sweet young women, with a strong desire for her passion and love of Hong Kong. I would definitely hire her again to take me on another tour to see others parts of Hong Kong. You should too, you won't regret it.

Hong Kong Private Tour Guide. I chose Hong Kong Getaway Private Tours because I wanted an authentic tour from a local “Hong Gonger” during my visit and after reviewing what past guests have written about Mandy and Apple, I knew these were the tour guides I wanted to hire.Since it was just me, Mandy showed up alone on a very hot Tuesday morning and immediately, I felt as if I were reuniting with an old friend. She was warm, pleasant, easy to talk to and has a great big wonderful smile, undoubtedly to match her big heart.Immediately she started giving me some of the history of Hong Kong as we walked from the MTR station through Nathan Street. We didn’t stay there long because she wanted to take me to see both the highlights of the city as well as some of the local hang outs, allowing me to experience the “real” Hong Kong.I won’t go into the details of my day as she will create a tour that is specifically customized for your interests. She will ask you what you’d like to see, yet provide suggestions and even take the lead if that is what you prefer.Like all the other reviewers, I am so happy to have spent the day with Mandy and enjoyed getting to her and her fascinating city.Note: I finished my day with Mandy a few hours ago and I’m still getting emails with suggestions on where to go for the rest of my trip. If you are looking for a tour guide to show you Hong Kong, whether it’s your fist time or if you’ve been here before and want to explore some of the more intimate, local areas, Hong Kong Getaway is a great choice.

Great way to explore Hong Kong!. What a fun and memorable experience we had as a family! Although I've been to Hong Kong a number of times for work, this was the first time my family and I got to spend the weekend together in this amazing city. We have a six-year old daughter and Mandy customized our tour with her in mind - we avoided the long queues at The Peak. While at The Peak, she took us to a trail that are known to locals but not to tourists. We explored the city using local transport. Our daughter loved the double decker bus ride to Stanley Market and Repulse Beach. Mandy was knowledgeable, friendly, polite and made the whole tour fun and interesting for all of us. I very much appreciated that after the tour was long finished, Mandy sent us a follow-up e-mail recommending other places for us to see and eat. Based on our experience, I highly recommend Mandy and Hong Kong Getaway for families especially with young children!

Hong Kong Insider Tour. This is an excellent private tour for solo travellers, couples or small families. You get to discover Hong Kong as if you live there. Mandy is extremely friendly, very knowledgeable of her beautiful city, speaks perfect English and very funny too! She recommended the best itinerary to explore Hong Kong various areas, and gave me loads of tips and suggestions on things to do on my own after our tour.She is also very flexible and altered the tour to meet my specific timings and preferences. It actually felt like going out with a freind and not a tour operator, which was great.Here is a list of things we've done on the tour:Day 1- Yummy Dimsum breakfast- Tsim Sha Tsui Waterfront Promenade and Peninsula Hotel- Star Ferry to Central and bus to Repulse Bay and Stanley- Wanchai Market and Hopewell Centre's Observation Lift- Took the bus up to the Peak and see Mandy's Spot!- Drink in Bubba Gump at the Peak- Taxi back to Central and took Star Ferry to TSTDay 2:- Mid-Level Escalator- Soho Area- Hollywood Road- Lan Kwai Fong and a hidden barThanks Mandy, and best of luck!
best and friendly tour. Mandy is nice and friendly tour guide, Once i meet her i didnt free that i am talking to totally stranger, very polite friendly down to earth

The Real Hong Kong (the non-tourists tour). When I contacted Mandy I let her know that I was interested in seeing the "real" Hong Kong. I'd seen nice hotels and restaurants and some of the touristy things, but I wanted to understand more of how someone living in Hong Kong lives day to day.This is exactly what she showed me. We went to her hometown and saw apartment complexes where most average income people lived and the shopping available to them. We ate at one of the local places(no walls other than clear plastic hanging down.. drains cut through the cement floor, etc) where another couple joined us at our table(as it is normal to share tables when space isn't available elsewhere). She also took me to a fishing village so that I could see how people there lived. Again we ate at a place that was apparently a restaurant.... although if I had been alone I would have thought that I had walked into someone's home and asked them to cook for me.There was no English spoken or written in the fishing village. So, it was great to have Mandy along. If she had left me I'm not sure how I would have gotten back to my hotel.After this she took me to a larger mall that was still a local mall in her hometown to help me shop for gifts for my nieces and nephews. She was very patient and helpful while I shopped. She also rode the bus back with me after our tour was over so that she knew I was in an area I felt comfortable in before she left.Mandy is an extraordinary person. She's extremely friendly and knowledgeable about both the tourist areas of Hong Kong and the "off the beaten trail" areas of the city. On my next trip I may have her take me hiking to some of the beaches she told me about. I highly recommend calling Mandy to get a great tour of Hong Kong while you are visiting. Her English is excellent as well, so if you need an intelligent translator she would be a wonderful choice.

Apple and Mandy were a highlight in our Hong Kong visit. We visited Hong Kong for three days in July, and wanted to spend a day with a local guide that would give us a flavor of the Honk Kong life--as opposed to other sanitized tours where you don't get to know the "locals".We also celebrated our anniversary while in Hong Kong. I must have emailed Mandy at least ten times after we confirmed the tour, consulting on restaurants and places to go. Mandy responded promptly, and made a restaurant recommendation that we thoroughly enjoyed.The day of the tour we met Apple (Mandy's sister) and had a blast. We saw places that no tourists saw, went to local restaurants, and visited the south--two smaller towns that gave us a better flavor of Hong Kong.Apple even planned our next day making very detailed suggestions which we followed and also enjoyed the day.Overall, it shows that both Mandy and Apple are above all, excellent human beings, and delightful to spend one or more days touring Hong Kong with.

Exciting, funny and interesting Hong Kong tour. We have seen many interesting places during the tour, a real part of Hong Kong life. Mandy became part of our family we really enjoyed the way she guided us through Hong Kong, flexible and funny. Further Mandy send us an email with excellent tips for the rest of our stay in Hong Kong and a few restaurants tips really worthwile to visit, top service.

A fun and fascinating morning walking tour!. Having spent some time in Hong Kong in the past I wanted to get off the beaten track and do something different. Mandy was very flexible and customized a fun morning for us. We visited a temple, Kowloon Walled City, Sham Shui Po (for some delicious street food) and then Monkey Hill. Mandy told us lots about Hong Kong culture, history and society. She is knowledgeable, friendly and very interesting.

We saw so much and it was like being shown around by a good friend. I can't express how impressed I was with our tour today , it was like a friend showing us around their home town. Travelling by myself with a 10 year old can be challenging trying to keep them interested is sightseeing but Apple made seeing Hong Kong fun and exciting. We travelled by ferry, MTR, tram, bus and walking. Eating at a local restaurant my daughter tried food that I would never have been able to get her to try but there she was finishing a whole plate of noodles and spicy dumplings. Apple listened to what we were interested in and custom made our day. I would HIGHLY recommend having Apple show you her Hong Kong. My daughter gave her a 10 out of 5 !!!! Thanks you so much Apple.

Amazing time in Hong Kong!. This was my fourth visit to Hong Kong, but after this tour it might as well have been my first from all the new things I saw. I finally felt like I broke through to see the actual city of Hong Kong, and wow! it was beautiful! Mandy was my guide for two days, taking me on a tour through many of the must see sites on Hong Kong Island, Kowloon and the New Territories.It was a unforgettable experience, and having been to Hong Kong a few times already Mandy adjusted the tour to skip the things I'd already seen and make this a truly bespoke tour.All I brought with me was my camera, a 'can do' attitude, and Mandy and her team did the rest. After all the jet lag I had from my long flight from San Francisco, it was easy to settle in and just HAVE FUN! I hope to see some other sites in HK that are off the beaten path next time I return.

Great tour and a wonderful guide. Arriving in Hong Kong for a 22 hour stop over we were greeted by Mandy who was friendly , knowledgably and above all very interesting. I would recommend Mandy to anyone wanting to experience Hong Kong and see some of the "old" town as well as the usual spots.When my colleague lost his passport Mandy was fantastic and had arranged a interview for an emergency passport, revised the tour and ensured we still made our next flight.Thanks for a great HK experience!

Hong Kong day trip. Even if you've been to Hong Kong before, you must allow Mandy to show you around. She's articulate, friendly, and knowledgable with insights that only a native can have. In just one afternoon we saw everything from local markets to sea shores. Also eat our way through the day. If you are adventurous, Mandy can lead you through a street food tour of Hong Kong. ( she also knows great restaurants as well). I'll call her the next time I get to HK.

An amazing experience. Highly recommend.. I was visiting HK with my son and mom and was cautious about what plans we made to make sure that whatever it was it would be safe and suitable for all ages. From the very beginning of contacting Mandy, she was very prompt and helpful. Although my request was not her typical tour, Mandy and Apple went out of their way to show us the area we wanted to see. Our experience of hiking was amazing. They were very kind and attentive to our needs and genuinely wanted us to have a great experience. Apple was great with children and Mandy was very friendly and outgoing to my mom. I am fortunate that I connected with these two. They made our trip unforgettable. We will always remember this day especially my son. Thank you Mandy and Apple. I wish you all the success.

Great day with a great local. I have been fortunate to travel the world and I have been on all kinds of tours, as of late I only do private tours. With only 3 day in Hong Kong and one available day to tour I booked Mandy for a 7 hour session. Mandy is knowledgeable and passionate about her home town and we covered a lot of ground in that time. It was a great mix of both the glitzy Hong Kong and the more typical every day Hong Kong. She knows her stuff, knows her way around, is very easy to be with a communicate with. If you want the " roll up you sleeves and get in the mix" experience I highly recommend Mandy. A perfect day for what I was looking for.

The friendliest tour in town!. My traveling companion called 3-4 well reviewed walking tours of HK upon our arrival into town. Mandy was first to call us back within an hour and provided a detailed itinerary of options for us to choose from and said she could tailor the next day's tour to us. We booked our time (10am-2pm). Mandy's sister Apple ended up being our tour guide (they work as a team). She met us at our hotel and asked if the itinerary still worked for us. Having never visited HK, we really didn't know where to go, but wanted to see areas off the beaten path. First up, Repulse Bay via public mini bus. Never would have ventured on to one of these, but super efficient like everything in HK. RB was stunning. Gorgeous ride there, then a wonderful stroll on the beach to a picturesque Oceanside temple. Next to Stanley Bay, also very pretty and a little less built up than RB. Starving so treated Apple to lunch then hit the market stalls for a bit. Then it was back to the city. Apple accompanied us back to our hotel, but made sure we wee familiar with the ferry, and the MTR before we arrived home so we could get around on our own the next day. Our 4 hours ended up being 5.5, but she only charged us for 5.In conversation she mentioned that the HK White Party was the next night and said she thought her sister Mandy might be able to get tickets for us. YES was our answer! She was able to get them from a friend and Apple even hand delivered them to us at the hotel just 2 hours after she had dropped us off! The White Party was a little on the young side for us, but what the heck, we pulled out our inner 20 something's and let our hair down. An incredible night, an incredible visit to HK and memories forever with the help of two very friendly and genuine sisters. If Trip Advisor had the ability to rate them with ten stars they would get an eleven. Cannot recommend them highly enough. Plan 5-6 hours for the complete royal treatment. Very affordable for the experience.Thanks ladies! Look me up when you are in Boston!

Excellent tour-felt like we were visiting a friend in Hong Kong!. I contacted several tour operators upon arrival into Hong Kong for a tour on the following day. Mandy answered the phone call and agreed to meet us in the AM the next day for a 4-5 hour tour of the city. Ended up her sister/partner Apple took us around instead which was fantastic-she did a wonderful job showing us the city as well as the out of way places and things that you wouldn't get on another tour. She also got us our Octopus cards and showed us how to get around town with them. Among the hightlights, we saw Repulse Bay (highly recommend!), Stanley Market, Star Ferry as well as some locals only bus rides (that you could use the Octopus card on!) where she pointed out neighborhoods and points of interest. We also went for a great lunch and toured on the double decker too as it was quite a hot day and this was a relaxing and cool break between sights! She was very flexible and totally catered to what we wanted to see. We even went over our time and she walked us all the way back to the hotel which wasn't necessary but very much appreciated. It was a fantastic day and we felt that after touring with Apple we were much more comfortable getting around the city and knowing where to go. She gave us great ideas as well as restaurant info and even was able to get us tickets to a sold out event that her sister was working! We did get to meet Mandy that evening at the event and she was just as lovely and sweet as her sister. These two are wonderful tour guides who are the perfect people to show you around the city they grew up in. Highly recommend!!!

HK super tour. Mandy rocks. Not one for viewing the regular tourist attractions and having seen many of the postcard attractions before, i challenged Mandy to come up with a custom tour for me. Challenge completed, it was amazing. I was able to see parts of hk i never knew existed, like the old wall city. It was a great experience, only wish I could have done it sooner!

First rate city tour. Mandy took us first to Repulse Bay and Stanley then back into the heart of the city. She was completely in tune with what we were interested in doing and learning about. We sampled food we otherwise wouldn't have dared try and was able to answer all our questions. Highly recommended!

Awesome day tour! Best tour I've ever been on.. I wrote to The Hong Kong Getaway about a tour and Mandy responded very promptly. Our actual tour was with Apple - she was a fantastic guide. We had a full-day, custom itinerary (Apple even organized a nice surprise visit to a cat café, which my girlfriend loved!). Apple met us at our hotel (she was right on time), and immediately made us feel welcome. Apple asked my girlfriend whether she spoke Mandarin and when she found out they both spoke Cantonese, conducted our tour in both English and Cantonese!Apple provided us with Octopus cards for the Hong Kong Metro and bus system (which we reimbursed her for - only $300 HK dollars for both, and they lasted most of our 5-day trip in HK).Apple led us to the nearest metro station and to the ferry to Lamma Island, our first stop, and pointed out sights along the way. We got to see two villages on Lamma Island, and had a nice light hike and stopped at a beautiful little beach and got our feet in the water. We had frozen pineapple at the top of one of the peaks on Lamma Island, and had a wonderfully refreshing beer at one of the waterfront restaurants on the village at the other end of the island. Got beautiful pictures of the Aberdeen side of HK from a great lookout spot on Lamma Island near the windmill.Apple took us to the ferry back to HK, and led us to Central District, filling us in on landmarks as we went. We took the Peak Tram up to Victoria Peak for a stunning view of the nightly HK skyscraper lightshow.Afterwards, Apple led us back (via another scenic route down another side of Victoria Peak) to the Central-Mid-Levels escalator via historic and bustling Queen's Road Central, pointing out more sites along the way. We had a delicious Cantonese dinner, and Apple directed us back to our hotel. We were a little sad to leave her! Apple was truly the best tour guide we've ever had. Can't recommend enough.

THE BEST bathrooms in Hong Kong!. Mandy is a natural tour guide - super friendly & bubbly, accommodates any requests/requirements asked of her, and has an overall positive and enthusiastic attitude when leading a tour. Furthermore, of the tour guides I could find here on TripAdvisor, she was probably the only true local, "born & bred". She took me and my elderly parents (in their 70s) to see the Repulse Bay & Stanley, and finished with a skyscraper tour in Wan Chai. They were all wonderful parts of Hong Kong that we would've never known to check out without her guidance. It was a laid back tour that both me and my parents enjoyed immensely. She even found for us the nicest, cleanest bathrooms for each location we visited. Only an insider knows this valuable information. I will definitely use her again the next time I'm in town. I recommend her 100% without any reservations. THANKS MANDY!

Fantastic day out. Mandy showed my brother and myself around very local areas in Hong Kong, took us cycling in the Hong Kong countryside and for some great local food.Mandy is very passionate, loves to talk and explain things, and very organised. We both loved our day out in HK with her.Highly recommended!

Tour in HK down town. During my business trip in HK I met Apple and we had an evening tour in Central. She introduced me the real life of HK. She is professional and pleasant personality. Ι thoroughly recommend it.

Fabulous!. This tour was amazing! Apple was a fabulous guide, she showed us both cultural sites as well as great places for food and she was really knowledgeable about her country. Half way through I forgot I was even on a tour, it felt like we were just being shown around by a friend! I felt like we got a real local perspective of Hong Kong.

A great day in Hong Kong. I had a fantastic day having a look around the 'real' Hong Kong with Mandy at the end of March 2015. She was an awesome guide and was totally happy to tailor the tour to suit my needs. She even helped me find tickets to the Hong Kong Sevens the next day. Mandy was friendly and informative and took me places that I simply would not have seen if she hadn't showed them to me. Some delicious food starting with a Dim Sum breakfast and highlighted by a well earned beer at Big Wave Bay after our Dragon's Back hike! A great day; thank you Mandy. I recommend Mandy to anyone wanting to be shown around Hong Kong.Paul, Perth Australia

Great Trip, Would Highly Recommend It!. This was by far the best tour experience I have ever had. Mandy knows Hong Kong like only a local can. She took us in and out of places we never would have found on our own. It made our time in Hong Kong all that much better. We were able to get great food recommendations from her as well, both street food and upscale restaurants. It was an unforgetable experience.

Perfect Tour. Thanks to Mandy it was an unforgettable tour in Hong Kong. She showed us the real Hong Kong with great individual places. From the typical Hong Kong Chinese lifestyle in Kowloon to the luxury western style of Hong Kong Island side. By here kind and sunny nature paired with excellent knowledge about culture and history it was an awesome experience. A day tour is an absolute must! Thanks again Mandy! We come back! Best regards Lars

genuine and fun, just an excellent experience. I normally do not like tours but this one was definitely of a different kind...A breath of fresh air so to say My tour guide Mandy has a genuine passion for her local city Hongkong and she's a lot of fun to be around. Like a true local she brought me to some lovely area's, some right in the city and some "off the beaten track". I guess all the good spots need to remain a secret hey so I wont tell your future guests ;)Thank you very much Mandy for providing me with an excellent, genuine, fun and passionate experience. I can see you love your city and now I know why.kind regards, Baulke

A wonderful getaway to HK with the best guide. I was doing a round-Asia tour and Hong Kong was my last stop. Indeed, my friend and I had visited Hong Kong before and we wanna see something different about the city. Therefore, we decided to join Apple's local tour. It was such a great experience that even before the tour, Apple showed her great hospitality by her of arranging us the accommodation and airport transfer (we were a bit troublesome since we keep changing our schedule). But Apple was very professional and friendly throughout the arrangement. The tour itself was excellent, Apple has excellent knowledge about her hometown and was able to tell us many interesting history and facts about the places we have been to. We basically love all the food Apple chose for us and she was great at finding inexpensive foods with exceptional taste. Apple was very caring and really treated us like friends from afar and we really appreciated it. We really enjoyed Apple's tour and therefore, I would definitely recommend a tour with Apple when you come to Hong Kong.

A real Hong Kong Getaway!. This is my second time going to hk. Last time I and my hubby just strolled around and we loved it. This time we decided to hire a private tour guide for a day. We were so glad that we made the decision. We had Mandy for the day. Before the tour she talked to us and asked about our interests and expectations, and then she decided to show us the town in new territories where she grew up in. It was such an unforgettable experience and we are sure that this is something you can't see without a local. Mandy is a very sincere young lady and we can feel her passion in doing the job and also her love for Hong Kong. Thank you for the wonderful time! We will definitely come back to Hong Kong and have your tour again!!

Fun and worthwhile!. We paired up with Carrie in Sham Shui Po for a morning of tasty pineapple buns and pork belly with rice! Those were definitely the highlights for me! Our guide, Carrie, was personable, funny and shared a lot of interesting information about the area with us! Even living in Hong Kong for over a year now, this was a test to help us explore a new area and new foods!

Hong Kong Foodie tastimng Tour. Paired up with Carrie who was provided us with an excellent overview of the local food on foot in and around Kowloon district of Hong Kong. We visited a variety of Cafes and Restaurants sampling the local cuisine. Carries information and local knowledge was excellent and we were given a bit of history about the businesses and the local area. Our family is not the most adventurous in trying new food but Carries tour and recommendations provided us with the confidence to experiment .Additional language tips made the trip more enjoyable as we were able to say a few common phrases in Cantonese.An excellent trip. Thank you Carrie. We will be recommending this tour.

Informative and Tasty. Local sweets, medicinal sugar cane juice, popular egg tart, BBQ Pork, Tea & Dim Sum each stop on the Central & Sheung Wan walking foodie tour was a delicious surprise. Our guide was both a delight to accompany and very informative both on the cuisine we were tasting and the local area history.

Food and cultural insights: Hong Kong. Our tour guide was Yammy. She is personable and engaging, and guided our small group expertly, on foot, around Central in Hong Kong, where we experienced diverse tastings in six different locations. It was a great opportunity to learn about Hong Kong food, but also more unusual products such as medicinal preparations and dried fruits. Everything we tried was delicious. We also visited a local wet market - definitely worth a look. All in all, a tour well worth taking. Thank you, Yammie, and Hong Kong Foodie tasting tours.

Great Food! . We made the Central and Sheung Wan Food walking tour, it was a fine and classic selection of Chinese food, freshly prepared in small chinese run family businesses, very tasty and fresh food, delicious dim sum!Yammy was our guide, she was an exzellent tourguide, as a real hongkong person she could answer all our questions about the way of life in Hongkong and its people.Also I really would like to point out and thank the management of hongkongfoodietour for being so flexibel and customer friendly as I have confused the dates of our arrival in HGK and the booking date.

Good tour!. We joined the Foodie tour in the Central area with Yammi and had a good time visiting small family run local eateries. At each location we sampled food of traditional Hong Kong origin. Between each restaurant Yammi answered our questions on our location, the food, local customs etc, she was more than happy to comment etc. On the tour we visited the local market which was interesting but nothing special as we had visited it on our own the day before. Overall, the tour is a little overpriced for the actual experience I was rather hoping that we would have seen a bit more of 'behind the scenes' in the restaurants we ate at but generally it was a good interesting experience, could have been better.

Yummy food with Yammie. I attended both the Sham Shui Po tour and the Central and Sheung Wan tour. These two areas of Hong Kong are very different. I was lucky enough to have Yammie as my guide both days. She took us into kitchens and shops so we'd have a better understanding of the culture. She had pictures on her tablet to provide a better understanding of certain things. The Sham Shui Po tour is in "old Hong Kong" where few tourists go and had more exotic foods compared to the Central and Sheung Wan tour. I enjoyed both tours equally. Prior to the tour the company sends emails with specific directions to the meeting locations. During the tour, a brochure is given with the names and locations of the restaurants toured along with what you ate at each restaurant. The brochure also provides you with suggested restaurants that were not toured. Lastly, it contains a few fun translations for words such as "delicious " and "thank you". I would recommend these two tours to anyone. I hope Yammie is your guide because she is great!

great tour. we went on this tour and Jess was our tour guide. It was excellent. This is a walking tour so be prepared to take a hike. My wife and I are senior citizens and we loved it. Jess our guide made sure we had a great time. She showed us a market a pharmacy with traditional Chinese cures and the amazing Chinese cursing grandmas. The food was good not great but that was just my taste most people really liked it. We made four or five stops and it was completely worth it. If you are vacationing in Hong Kong don't miss this its a lot of fun. P.S.Jess is the best.

Great introduction to the local food and culture. I took the Sham Shui Po tour led by Yammy (in late October). From first meeting the group through to helping us all work out how to travel back to our hotels, Yammy made the tour a real treat. Even though it's a foodie tour, it's about more than the food. We learned about the area, the culture, and some simple phrases like Jo Sun (good morning) and Ho Sik (delicious). But of course, the food is the main event and that was also excellent. There was a good variety in the 6 tastings, both savory snd sweet. When you book, you can indicate any food allergies / intolerance, and the guide will find alternatives .Be warned, it's a lot of food - even spread over 3.5 hours. So skip breakfast and you probably won't need to eat again until dinner.

Yammy was an excellent guide!. The Sham Shui Po food tour with Yammy was interesting, unique and very authentic. Be adventurous and open to new tastes in an old part of Hong Kong that you might not explore otherwise. Yammy introduced us to locals at work and shared stories about their shops and restaurants that brought the food experience to life. Thanks Yammy!

Fabulous food tour. My friend and I joined a group of 4 other people for a fantastic food tour of The Central district. Our guide was Yammy, whose enthusiasm, friendliness and food knowledge made this tour a highlight of our Hong Kong trip. We enjoyed walking to each destination and loved being able to ask many questions particularly as we wandered through the markets. I would highly recommend this tour!

Hong Kong Foodie tour with Yammy. Four of us joined this walking foodie tour, led by Yammy. There were a total of 12 people on the tour. We visited 6 places in approximately 3 1/2 hours. Tammy was excellent, friendly and engaging. She grew up in Hong Kong and was able to give us a good background of the neighborhoods. The food was very good and filling. An excellent variety - wonton soup, roasted meat, dried fruit, dumplings, egg custard. Although I am not a big fan of dried fruit, this stop was the most interesting to me. We had the small shop to ourselves and were given a good descriptions/explanations of a variety of dried fruit. We also visited the wet market which was excellent.

Average value for money. The tour was OK but I expected more. I love food tours and often go for those when I travel. IMHO this particular tour was lacking content: I would love to hear more details about the places we visited, neighbourhood history and life in Hong Kong. We walked around quite a lot so there was plenty of opportunity to learn more about the city but unfortunately the content was very limited.The tasting of wanton noodles, roasted pork and dimsum were quite nice but you can just go to those places yourself and get absolutely stuffed for the price of the tour :)

Great fun and value. A very informative and varied introduction to HK food and the fascinating back streets. We visited six places and were given plenty of information by our excellent guide Yammy who went out of her way to speak to everyone. The route covered the local wet market and was well paced. Mmm Goi Yammy!

Hong Kong Foodie Tour. Carrie was a brilliant tour guide really enjoyed her knowledge and love of Hong Kong and its wonderfull food, its a must do if you are thinking about going to Hong Kong and love its food.

Great tour - A must do in Hong Kong. Sham Shui Po Foodie Tour was a great way to start my holiday in Hong Kong. Fantastic to see that the tours go to locally run and operated business rather than chains. The food was very authentic and great introduction to the cuisines. It was made even better by our fantastic guide who not only had great food knowledge, but also shared great insights into other local heritage matters throughout the tour. Don't eat before the tour! Will be doing the other tours next time I am in Hong Kong.

Great Tour!. We did two tours, the Central & Sheung Wan tour and Sham Shui Po tour. Our tour guide Yammy was fantastic! She is very knowledgeable. The food was great. The tours are a great way to see behind the scenes of restaurants in Hong Kong.

Central & Sheung Wan tour. Wonderful tour. Yammy is an excellent guide. Informative, fun, and knowledgeable excellent English as well. The food was delicious- ho sik! We tasted, ate well, saw the roasting of whole pig a rare sight in HK , and finished off with the best egg tart in the world. Thank Yammy for also taking us to streets we would have ventured in to this was a tour of old authentic HK. It is a must.
Great Food Tour - good for Solo's as well. Great food tour! Our tour guide Yammy was excellent! Super fun, delicious bites and fun facts!Also good for singles!

Behind the scenes tour. Our guide , Yammy, was very friendly and informative. My husband wanted to try a thousand year old egg and vomit fruit which were not included on the diverse tour. However, Yammy took us to a market and negotiated a price for each item and then served them at our next restaurant. She also gave us an insight into the local culture and our party of six were all impressed.

Fun way to learn about Hong Kong. My husband and I had enjoyed this tour 2.5years ago and decided to do it again with our adult family. Again we were expertly guided by Silvana who was able to answer all our questions and provided interesting information on both the venues we visited and the general history of the area. I highly recommend this tour to anyone who would like an insight into the history of the Central and Sheung Wan district while discovering mostly family run businesses that you might not otherwise choose. Lots of walking but well paced.

Fantastic Tour! . This was a fantastic cultural food tasting experience. Yammy our guide was an absolute delight! She is knowledgeable and informative sharing with the group in a friendly and charming way. She was keen to ensure all members of our group of 8 were having a good time and went out of her way to accommodate everyone's needs - even when that involved one of our party wishing to try some of the more adventurous foods in the market!!We ate so much delicious food, visiting restaurants we would never have known were restaurants and saw behind the scenes in the kitchens how the wonderful food is created.For the 6 people in our party this was a real highlight of our visit to Hong Kong! Thank you Yammy for a wonderful foodie tour!!

A perfect way to taste Hongkong cuisine. Yammy did a great job showing us the diverse of Hongkong cuisine. We enjoyed the walk, sampling the highlighted dishes in downtown Hongkong, knowing the way to cook them from a very knowledgeable guide. Worth trying !

Central and Sheung Wan Foodie Tour.. My friends and I had a great time on the tour today. Our guide, Yammy, was friendly, engaging and very informative. She made a real effort to keep everyone involved and happy. The food was as varied as the scenery and streetscapes. Great afternoon.

Great activity for all foodies!. I did the Central & Sheung Wan foodie tour last september. It was a great experience, with great people. Yammy is an awesome guide! She was super smily, friendly and knows a tons of fun facts about Hong Kong. I tried many different and authentic dishes, came back with a list of good places to return to. Even if the prices are a little bit high, I really enjoyed my afternoon and highly recommend this tour!A real treat! :)

Walking Food Tour. While visiting Hong Kong with friends and family we had the opportunity to enjoy a walking Food tour" Central&Sheung Wan Foodie Tour". It was a great way to enjoy Hong Kong and Food with friends, family and new friends. Our guide Yammy is the best, personable and informative.

Fantastic Experience . We have just finished the Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour. It was a great experience: well organised and considered. The food stops were brilliant, authentic food. Yammy, our guide was perfect for the tour: great English, great knowledge, great sense of humour. Not only did we taste our way around, but Yammy gave us a great insight into the history and life of the people of Hong Kong. Thoroughly enjoyed the afternoon and highly recommend this tour!

The most fun we had in HK!. I believe food brings people together, which naturally brought my husband and I closer to HK! We love to eat and try new things when we travel, so it seemed appropriate to do a foodie tour. The food was delicious! The central food tour is a great tour for those not too adventurous with food, but want to try the more traditional dishes. Our tour guide Yammy provided a nice balance of food tasting, cultural knowledge, and geography of the central and sheun wan areas! She was a delight to tour with. This was definitely the most fun thing we did in HK!

Great introduction to HK food. I did the Sham Shui Po district tour from breakfast to lunch. Great combination of food tastings and walks/knowledge about the districts and markets around that area. Interesting and well balanced selection of tastings, and nice highlighting for more adventures for those who want it (ended up with a century egg pastry...) Carrie, our guide, was great, knowledgeable, energetic, welcoming and turning it into a really great experience

one of our favorite adventures during our Hong Kong visit. What a great way to spend the afternoon! The food was amazing, the stories our tour guide (Yammy) shared about the businesses and about Hong Kong made it that much more interesting, we walked long enough that we were ready to eat more ;) but not so long that we were exhausted. Yammy took care of everything - provided plenty of water for us along the way, brought napkins for us to use at the local stands, etc. She thought of everything, Our SIL (who has lived in Hong Kong for a year) joined us on the tour and she was amazed at how much she learned about her neighborhood. Everything we tried was delicious - my husband said when he dies he hopes it is in a bowl of the roasted pork. Ha!

Central & Sheung Wan tour with Yammy. This tour was a great introduction to Hong Kong food with plenty of variety. Our guide was Yammy, a friendly and knowledgeable Hong Kong native. She expertly shepherded our group of about a dozen through Hong Kong's crazy streets. She was also very accommodating with my dietary restrictions and got me substitutes. I really liked the printed handout with the restaurants we visited and some further restaurant recommendations, which made it easier to revisit the restaurants later. I highly recommend this tour!

My taste buds took a tour they would not otherwise have with a great guide - Yammy!. We visited six establishments and it is hard to pick a favourite as they were all great, not just because of the authentic and fresh food but the knowledge that Yammy was able to provide at every stop. Wontons, bbq pork, dim sum and egg tarts were fantastic but even the story and different tastes from a very old Chinese confections shop were unique and interesting!

Great Food and Learning Experience. Our foodie tour of Central/Sheung Wan gave us much more than we expected. The focus on small multi generation food businesses was a unique look at great food in Hong Kong. Small family businesses that one might not expect to deliver such great quality and taste experiences. Our guide Silvana was first class. During our almost four hour tour we learned how urban development was eroding places such as the Graham Street market and the dai pai dong (street stalls). Sad to see such fine examples of old Hong Kong disappearing.In addition we learned much about the history of Hong Kong and in particular the families that operate these wonderful eateries.As native Torontonians we grew up very familiar with Chinese food because of Toronto's very large Chinese community. In fact Chinese is the third most spoken language in Canada after English and French. The wontons and barbeque pork were probably the best we have ever tasted. The dim sum and the bakery were at the top of the list of the best we have enjoyed. A great, totally new experience was the preserved fruit shop that is not to be missed.Our next visit to Hong Kong will include the Kowloon tour.

Wonderful Immersive experience. This was one of my favorite parts of my recent visit to Hong Kong. The tour was safe and exhilarating; so many different local foods sampled. Pineapple buns, Milk tea, tofu dessert, rice noodles, etc. Carrie was a terrific tour guide, not only taking us to restaurants, but several local shops, and explaining the economic, living conditions, and daily life of Sham Shui Po residents. In fact, this may have been my favorite part of the tour.So much food too. I'm glad I learned Cantonese for "full belly"!

Central food tour with Yammy. We went on the food tour around Central and it was great, each of the places we went to were delicious with friendly staff. My favourite was the roast meat place, the BBQ pork was so good and we went back there a couple of nights later. Yammy was our tour guide and she was very friendly, helpful, had a lot of knowledge and shared some interesting insights with us. I'd definitely recommend doing this food tour.

A great intro to Hong Kong. I got off the plane and went almost immediately on my tour which was a great way to dip my toe into busy Hong Kong. Yammy, our guide, was knowledgeable and put all at ease. The food was delicious. Not too exotic but all excellent.

Wonderful taste of Hong Kong. This food tour took us around a number of restaurants that served absolutely delicious fare, but that we may not have been brave enough to try on our own. We had the best Wontons I've ever eaten and got to see a behind-the-scenes look at the kitchens in one establishment, which has ovens large enough to cook an entire pig in two hours!Yammy, our guide, not only introduced us to each of the restaurants in turn, but also gave us a wonderful flavour of what it was like to live in Hong Kong. She was even game enough to buy one of our party a thousand year old egg from a market vendor when he expressed an interest in trying one. She absolutely could not have been more helpful or obliging, not to mention knowledgeable about local culture and history.As an introduction to what can be the intimidating world of Hong Kong cuisine, this tour is an absolute must. Do it early-on in your trip to get the best value - you'll be coming back to some of these places!

Yummy food with Yammy. I went on this tour as I wanted to know more about the local food in Central, HK. Our guide Yammy was very knowledgeable of the local area and the history behind it. My favourite place on the whole tour is definitely the Wonton tasting session, the prawns were big and flavoursome. I would recommend this tour to anyone that likes seafood or anyone that wants to experience HK local food. The tour lasted about 3.5hrs and there is loads to see and eat...

Good but could be better. I will echo some of the comments of a previous reviewer; IceKeeg was actually in my group of 11 hosted by Lillan this past Monday. I was solo visiting Hong Kong and booked a private tour with another operator for 8 hours, and booked the Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour the following day. Whenever visiting a new city, domestic or internationally, I believe food and bike tours are the best way to feel the pulse of a city, learn its cultural diversity and eat like the locals. First and foremost, Lilian was a great guide and her positive personality was infectious during the tour. She conveyed the significance of each dish to Hong Kongers, and she provided brief history tidbits for the duration.The room for improvement I see is sharing Lilian's warm and inviting personality with other guides, and capping the tour size at 8. I admit, I was 20-25 minutes early to the meet spot where I inadvertently ran into another guide as she prepped her two person tour. Instead of any basic pleasantries, I was met with a snarky "well you're early," and a clear don't associate or speak to me or my guests. I get it, I'm not on your tour group but you also have us meet inside the lobby of a busy building. I was attempting to say hello and get some basic info, not ride the coattails of your tour. I did not get her name, nor did I care at that point as my outlook for my tour was already soured. A group of 11 at the majority of Hong Kong eateries is not going to fit in one corner, often splitting at minimal two or three tables. Part of the foodie experience is to socialize with fellow travelers and the guide, this missed the mark. When you're missing half the demo / experience in the kitchens because the group is too large to accommodate, it's time to downsize the groups. Navigating the alleyways and some streets, Lilian was more shepherd than guide with stragglers. Overall a good tour, but I don't necessarily believe this would be a repeat tour.

Yum, yum, yum. I took the Central and Sheung Wan Foodie Tour. We went to 6 different restaurants: wonton soup, roast meat, fresh juice, preserved fruit, dim sum and egg tart. Our guide, Yammie was GREAT. Along with the restaurants, we got lots of local knowledge about the history, architecture, religious and cultural history of the neighborhoods. Definitely have an empty stomach and a willingness to eat/drink things you might never have seen before (or will see again). WORTH IT

Delicious educational fun !!. Yammi the guide was terrific!! Super nice, took 12 strangers and formed us to a group. She just waltzes into a restaurant leads us after her. food is served, delicious, you learn about the food the culture you look inside the kitchen and... here outside again to the next stop. I took the center city tour.I had only 36 hours in the city. This tour really changed my trip for the better.Thank you Yammi!

Food,fun and history....... We went on the Sheung Wan district tour with Lillian. It was a beautiful day in HK so it was a great day to walk in the city! Lillian was energetic, fun and kept our group of 12 moving smartly through the streets in between stops. She was pleasant, fluent in English and funny as she explained the food we were tasting, the history surrounding the restaurants and the cuisine as well as the architecture of the old district.Here are the high points:-we visited very local , small places which we would not have entered without a guide. We are well seasoned and adventurous travelers who do not need to be led around by the nose. However, in Hong Kong it was a pleasure to be led along this very well planned and all inclusive food tour. Clean, safe and local food gave us a taste of old Hong Kong.-guide was stellar. I had left my camera at the meeting point but did not realize it until after we had all been seated at first restaurant. Lillian ran back to the meeting point and found my camera which she promptly returned to me! She saved the day!!!! -comprehensive menu with plenty of time to digest each tasting as you walk to the next venue. I would not eat a hearty breakfast as you will get a lot of food!!!!!!!!!!!-I enjoyed meeting others from other countries. We were 3 of only a few Americans. There was one woman alone who was enjoying the day while her husband worked. Don't feel shy if you are by yourself. This tour attracts a friendly and adventurous crowd and you will have a good time!-directions to the meeting point is excellent. Allow time to arrive by MTR. You are basically arriving and meeting in a lobby of an office building.I will be back in Hong Kong and I will definitely try another tour.Price tag is high but you get a wonderful experience..and hey, you're in Hong Kong....splurge a little!!!!!!!!!!!Thanks Lillian for a great tour....see you again soon!!!!

A must do in HK!. As I echo myself in all of my other food tour reviews, I believe there is no better way to get to know a city than taking a food tour. You learn history, you will likely see parts of the city that you otherwise wouldn't have, and all the while, you are eating delicious food and getting to understand it - which should be helpful for the rest of your trip! The only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is that this is a fairly typical large group operation - there were almost a dozen of us, and while our guide, Lilian, expertly herded us about, you do lose the personal touch we've been lucky to find in some other food tour operations. But again, Lilian was great - funny, energetic, and kept the pace going perfectly. The food was, without exception, fantastic. A little handout is provided with additional recommendations, and these served us well on our trip. This should definitely be part of your HK experience!

Sham Shui Po Tour With Carrie. This was my second Hong Kong foodie tour. My first was in 2013. We met easily at one of the MTR stations. I was very pleased to find out that there were only 4 of us on the tour. We went to 6 different places and tried different foods at each one. Our tour guide Carrie was very friendly, enthusiastic, and helpful. I highly recommends the tour. Excellent value. Plan on walking a few miles. You need to wear very comfortable shoes.

Great local food tour, even better tour guide. Only in Hong Kong for a few days and decided to take the food tour through the Sham Shui Po district to get a sense of local food. This food tour was great because it takes you to hole in the wall places that you would never stumble into on your own since they don't have English menus and are full of locals. You definitely get a sense of "real Hong Kong" and not the touristy BS in other parts of the city.Though the best part of this tour without a doubt was our amazing tourguide Carrie. She was incredibly knowledgeable about the food and the area, taught us a ton of super interesting facts about Hong Kong and always had insightful answers to our questions. I cannot say enough good things about her - my girlfriend and I have taken food tours all over the world and Carrie was by far our best tour guide ever. She made our Hong Kong experience incredibly memorable!

Great food tour. It was super interesting, wonderful food and the guide perfect. We went on the Sham Shui Po tour and I am very happy we did that since the ares is traditionally not a tourist place. The excellent guide told us not only about the food but about Hong Kong history and gave us tips on what to see, do and eat. The six restaurants we went to was all very authentic and the food delicious. If you have a chance don't miss this while in Hong Kong - it will make your trip so much more interesting and fun!

Hong Kong Highlight!. We have just spent a couple of days in Hong Kong en route home to N.Z.We really enjoyed this Tasting Tour with the knowledgeable, bright and cheerful Yammy. She took us to some WONDERFUL places and we ate some yummy dishes. She was really interesting and obviously loved both her subject and her city and, of course, FOOD! We were with a really nice small group too which enhanced the experience. Plan to do the Kowloon Tour next time we are in H.K.

Twice as Nice!. After doing the Sheung Wan and Central food tour two years ago, I was keen to try the Sham Shui Po tour on my second trip to Hong Kong and I was not disappointed. Easily the highlight of my trip.The tastings were delicious, the tour was fantastic and it was interesting to see another side of Hong Kong.The small group meant we didn't feel rushed, or awkward. I thoroughly enjoyed this slice of Hong Kong life. I've been dreaming of soy pudding and rice rolls ever since.I would HIGHLY recommend booking a tour - any tour - with Hong Kong Foodies. It's bound to be the highlight of your trip.

Highlight of our Hong Kong trip!. We went on the Central tour with Yammy and had an amazing experience. Yammy was a fantastic tour guide, explaining the dishes, restaurants, and history of Hong Kong! This was the highlight of our trip, and we cant recommend it enough. We did this on our first full day of our trip and that timing was perfect, as we were able to enjoy their suggestions throughout our trip! Would highly recommend to anyone and everyone!

Delicious and Informative. Did the afternoon tour led by Yammy. Visited several locations, all with different offerings. It was a very good experience. Yammy is from HK and knows the food and provided interesting comments on the culture and the places we visited. We even got to see a kitchen where whole hogs are cooked. The group was kept small so we didn't overwhelm the places we visited. I'd recommend this tour.

Loved it. Three great things about this tour:1. The food of course, especially the wanton soup and bbq pork. 2. The area we went through and what we learnt abut it3: Yammy our guide, who was knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and fun. Overall a fantastic tour. My 10 year old son and I loved it. Some tips: Don't eat much at all before. And if doing the tour in hot weather bring water and a fan. Many of the places we visited were air conditioned though.

Great Hong Kong Foodie Walking Tour With Yammy!. I did the Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour. It was about a 3 hour or so walking tour with a fair amount of walking in which we stop at 6 different shops/restaurants to sample a variety of local Hong Kong foods. Our tour guide Yammy was excellent! She was very informative and pleasant. She even gave us a brochure with useful Cantonese phrases. My favorite was the Tsim Chai Kee Noodle Shop. I highly recommend this tour!

Great way to find out how the locals live. Well worth going to, our guide Carrie was very happy to answer any and all questions and is very helpful and friendly. The tour gives a chance to try out local Chinese food in places that if you didn't speak or read Chinese, or know Chinese restaurant customs, you would certainly find it to be a lot more of an adventure ! There is a fair bit of walking but it's all on the flat and not too fast, with frequent stops. The small group nature of the tours means that you can have a close look at the sights and ask questions more easily
Sham Shui Po Tour. Absolutely wonderful tour. Our guide Carrie was very informative and a great guide.Must bring an umbrella as there is a good amount of walking involved.

Great tour with Yammy. We were hosted by the lovely Yammy and really enjoyed the tour. The food was delicious and I loved that we also walked through markets and along Hollywood Road and past Mo Man Temple which we had been told to do in HK. Yammy was also keen to answer any questions we had about life in HK, it was great to talk to a local.

Graze your way around Sham Shui Po. Thoroughly enjoyed our foodie tour around Sham Shui Po even in the pour rain. Our guide Carrie was friendly, informative and fabulous. The booking process and customer service was also good. We sampled some amazing food and learnt so much about local history and traditions. I would highly recommend these tours as succinct way of experiencing local culture and cuisine.

Bring an appetite with you. We did the Sham Shui Po Foodie Tour, as a crash course intro to food on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong. Truly an experience to see all the local fare in the area. Our Tour guide did an amazing job, not only explaining about the food but also some of the stories behind the area. We walked away very satisfied (Stuffed to be exact), and a lot more confident on what there was to eat on our own. After this tour we pretty much knew what and where to eat. This redefined our take on Chinese food from back at home in the States. No real "adventurous" eating, all of the food was rated "PG-13". we had a stop for Snake soup, as an option, we took the option and were delighted with how good it was. Plenty of walking to do so do as they say, wear comfy shoes, and bring an umbrella you can expect a downpour at any time (in September at least). We always had a table at our stops, and had enough to eat, not taste, eat! you usually get a sample but not here, we got enough as a meal at every stop. One of my favorite food tours I've done.

Foodie tour of Sham Shui Po. We were met by the very friendly Carrie who was a first class guide. Carrie has an amazing knowledge of food and local culture. Her pleasant and respectful commentary was fascinating and her ability to build a story around the local history was so interesting.We visited 6 different establishments and were treated to some fine local cuisine.This tour has been a high lite of our trip to Hong King and I recommend Carrie and Hong King Foodie Tours.

A great way to be introduced to the food of Hong Kong. This is a walking tour. About 3 and half hours of knowledge was given from our tour guide Yammy. She was wonderful. And the little places she took us for food was great. She explained places in the city, how the food came about and its history.The only trouble is that by the time you get to dessert you have had so much can't fit it in.Highly recommended.

A must do.... Thank you Yammy. A fantastic experience. The intimacy, smoothness of the operation (no waiting), great food, Yammy's knowledge and humour made for a great afternoon. Both my wife and I had some dietary restrictions, which Yammy handled with ease. Thank you Tammy.

Central afternoon tour was amazing. Yammy was an excellent tour guide that took us to a variety of 6 historical and new restaurants. The food was spaced well over a 3.5 hr period with generous portions of freshly made wonton soup and bbq pork to start with. She gave us tours of the kitchens as well, highlighting the roasting of the pork in progress while teaching us the history of the restaurants. Before the next stop, a city walk that stopped at markets, shops, and the Man Mo temple provided a well needed break from eating as well as hitting many tourist spots we planned to do the next day anyway! Fresh sugar cane juice and a preserved fruit stop were a well needed refreshment before another generous portion of food followed, this time with dim sum followed by a fresh egg tart dessert. All of the food stops were fresh, homemade, and unique to Hong Kong, unlike similar food I had in China and elsewhere. I would definitely sign up for another tour my next time in Hong kong. Thank you Yammy!

A Gem. Great for guests and even better for those of us who have lived in Hong Kong for a while. Good history mixed with food and culture. Carrie was very knowledgable, helpful and just amazing all-around. I highly recommend this and I am going to do all their tours :-)

Great experience. My husband and I both went on the tour and our guide Yammy was absolutely outstanding!! She was extremely thorough and had answers for all our questions. The places we went to were great (that good we went there the next day to get more). Would recommend doing this tour beginning of your trip so you can go back for 2nds as I know you will.

Sham Shui Po. Toured Sham Shui Po today with Carrie. Although I've lived in Hong Kong for 2 years I learned so much about Hong Kong - of course making me love Hong Kong even more!!! Great food, amazing tour guide, fabulous day! I recommend this tour for anyone. I'll bring my parents back when they visit. Thanks Carrie!
Tai Po Market Food Tour. This food tour is a little outside Hong Kong but I totally recommend. It's very easy to hop on the train and it's so nice to get out of the usual tourist territory.

Central and shrunk wan tour. Great tour. Don't eat lunch or a late breakfast. Great tour by Yammy. Lots of lovely things to eat, catering for all tastes. We tried loads of stuff we would never have tried on our own and saw many markets and stalls where we could ask questions without being afraid of being hassled.

Great way to discover HK!. Our tour of the Central & Sheung Wan areas in HK started off in a centralized and easy to find spot, where we met Cliff, our wonderful guide who was absolutely fluent in English. I want to mention that I myself am a vegetarian, while my husband isn't. We were told this would not be a problem, and appropriate accommodations were made, for which I'm grateful. We went to 5 different restaurants (one was closed due to a holiday), all of which are family run operations. We learned about the way the different foods we tasted are prepared around the city, and what made them special at the specific place we visited. We travelled by foot from one place to the next, which allowed for some great learning and sightseeing along the way. The food tour was a great way to get a bearing for the city, and enjoy foods you may not be able to order yourself if you don't speak the local language. Highly recommend to anyone who likes to eat and learn!

Superb insight into the area and an opportunity to try new cuisine. We took my brother on a tour of Sham Shui Po for his birthday and as a way of introducing him to an area in Hong Kong he might not have otherwise seen. Our guide, Yammy, was absolutely superb. She gauged our interest, found fantastic places to introduce us to everything from pork cheek to pineapple buns, but also added some history into the mix. I would highly recommend this tour so not least to get off Hong Kong Island and see a different side to life in the SAR.

Food and Culture through a local's perpective. A lovely way to spend a morning exploring the nooks and crannies of one of Kowloon's less touristy neighborhoods, Sham Shui Po. Carrie was our enthusiastic tour guide, spoke perfect English, and was very knowledgeable about HK history, culture and local way of life. Our food explorations was varied, from sweets to savories. Every stop on the tour included foods that were made onsite, which added to the authenticity of the experience. One of the highlights was a decades old homemade noodle restaurant where the original owner made the noodles just a few doors away from his shop. I would have never have known to stop into these restaurants; but with Carrie's introduction and handy takeaway map, I know where to go when I'm craving pineapple buns, soft tofu or shrimp noodles.The trip was very well organized, and everywhere we went, we had reserved seating. HK Foodie Tours also seemed to have a good relationship with the owners, as we were never rushed or made to feel unwelcome. This was especially impressive given that several of the locations had waiting lines of hungry locals.I would highly recommend HK Foodie Tours for those who want to experience Hong Kong the way locals do.

EAT LIKE A LOCAL. A definite must whilst in HK especially if you want to experience food like a local. The groups are small, the guide very knowledgable and the tour is on foot so you get to see parts of the city you wouldn't normally. Not only was it about food but the history of the city. And so much food to eat as well. The markets and an explanation of the produce was a highlight. Our guide Cliff was engaging and informed. A charming gentleman who made the afternoon just fly by. My tour was Central and Sheung Wan but there are other areas of HK available. A perfect perfect afternoon.

Necessity!. We had Carrie as a guide for our family and she was outstanding. I was hesitant at first as I didn't think it looked like good value for money but it turned out to be a bargain. Not just because of the food and the real world experience but because of the local knowledge that Carrie imparted on us. Do this tour, not just for the food but to truly understand Hong Kong a little better.

Sham Shui Po. Carrie did a great job; she was very knowledgable about the local food, but was also happy to explain all aspects of the local Hong Kong culture. I've lived in HK 5 years, and I still learned a lot from her. I'm looking forward to trying the other tours.

Wow! a first rate experience!. This tour far outweighed my expectations. Silvana and Alvin were exceptional. Their knowledge, passion and experiences made this a special tour. I loved the charm of visiting the family owned businesses and the food was delicious!!! I would highly suggest this tour for visitors and new expats. The intimate groups allow for comfortable sharing of the experiences.

Good food tour with interesting facts & lots of traditional food. We recently did this tour of Central & Sheung Wan. The tour was organised and our guide provided lots of interesting information. The food was good, the first two stops being the highlight. Lots of walking which is fine, better if it is not such a hot & humid day.

Awsome culture and great food. We did this tour on our stay in hong kong. We had a small group of 3 and our guide "carrie" was unbelievable.... she was very knowledgeable and also joined in on our request to try foods that wernt included on the tour! If anyone is interested in learning some traditional culture and adventurous when it comes to food this is your tour! Highly recommend...

Fabulous!. We did this tour with Yummy in June. She is a great tour guide and steered us to a variety of places. She was careful to select places that Americans would consider clean and that had functional bathrooms. Along the way, she gave us a slice of Hong Kong culture with the stops and her descriptions of each dish. Highly recommend!!

Central and Sheung Wan walking tour. Went on the tour today hosted by Savannah and Alvin, on a very hot and humid day.Visited six locations trying wonton noodle soup , bbq pork with rice , sugar cane juice , dried fruits , dim sum and last but not least custard tarts. The tour was easy paced and the hosts took into account the very hot day. The tour interesting with a great range of Cantonese cuisines. The history lesson between locations was informative and helpful. Would definatley recommend this tour.
Great foodie tour. Alvin and Silvana gave our group of 12 a fantastic tour this afternoon! Wonderful food, very knowledgable tour guides.

Sham shui Po - great food your!. Definitely worth doing if you have the time. Our guide Carrie, was very knowledgable and really made the tour a delight. We have lived in HK for a few years, but learnt quite a bit, both about local food traditions and the area. Also found a brilliant place for Pineapple buns!

Food Tour. We learned a lot about Hong Kong and traditional culture. The food was very good and we walked around - each spot a different tasting of local Hong Kong cuisine. Carrie and Silvana great! Ask for Carrie when you go -she is a local with exceptional English and such enthusiasm.

Great guide, great food. Thoroughly enjoyed this tour of six restaurants and shops in the Central and Sheung Wan districts. Cliff was a great guide - enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and looked after us well on one of the hottest days for decades. The food was good too. I particularly enjoyed the wonton noodle soup at our first stop.

Amazing food and great way to experience the city!. My husband and I took the Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour while recently traveling through Asia on our honeymoon. We only had a couple of days in Hong Kong and we both agreed that the tour was the perfect way to get acquainted with the central area of the city during our stay. Our favorite aspect of the tour was exploring the wet market and we loved the pork buns served near the end of the tour. Definitely come hungry and wear comfortable shoes because you'll be in for lots of walking and eating! Yammy and Alvin were amazing guides and super friendly. Thanks for a great experience!

Nice overview of Hong Kong food. Yammy was our guide and for 3.5 hours she was friendly, warm, knowledgeable and just a great guide. She clearly loves HK and knows the history of each of the 6 spots we stopped in. I posted the menu separately so please see that. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants a taste of HK.

You won't be disappointed . The second time I have been on this tour in 3 years and I was just as happy! Some stops were different but essentially the same vibe: friendly, inclusive, full of cultural information, not to mention the food. Our guide, Yammy was great, and even remembered everyone's names. We had a wonderful time tasting foods we may not normally try, favourite was the prawn dumplings, or the dim sum... or the egg tart...

New to Hong Kong? If so, highly recommend this!. We took the Sheung Wan ('intermediate'' in terms of food!) tour on our very first morning of ~5day stay in HK. We are a youngish Australian couple and it was a group of 4 which I think was a perfect number. Yammy was wonderful, bright and fun. More than the food, we enjoyed quite a complete cultural tour of the Sham Shui Po district including some of its history and lives of the people living and working there. The wet markets and medicinal shops were great (although potentially a bit smelly/confronting) and certainly not places we would've looked at on our own.I think doing this tour early on in your HK trip is well worth it; so you have a better idea of looking for food that may be out of the regular touristy areas and often cheaper and just as tasty!

Food Tour Central and Sheung Wan- Excellent. Yannny was professional and very knowledgeable of the area. I would have never found the places she took us to on my own. The food was incredible with with my favorites being the egg tart and dim sum. It was also quit interesting to see an entire pig being roasted in the very hot oven in about 2 hours. The markets and local culture were a great experience to see. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone wanting to experience food and culture as a local.

What took us so long?. My husband and I live in Hong Kong and have meant to take a foodie tour ever since we got here. We did the Central/Sheung Wan recently with Yammy and regret that we didn't do it sooner. We've had a lot of the dishes elsewhere that either were not prepared as well as the ones on the our or there are massive crowds to get in. We chose the Central/Sheung Wan tour because we live nearby and wanted to find some new spots to eat. This tour showed us some less known gems to which we will definitely return.We started with delicious shrimp wonton noodles. The shrimp were large and the rice wrapper was soft but held together nicely. The next stop was a roast meat restaurant. The roast barbecue pork was tender with a crispy skin and a slightly sweet barbecue sauce. It was delicious.Next we drank sugar cane juice and then we sampled dried fruits. They were not my favorites but I enjoyed seeing the little shops and learning about the medicinal properties of the fruits. After a stroll along Cat Street, we wound up the tour with some of the best dim sum we've had in Hong Kong. Two low price dim sum restaurants in Hong Kong have each been awarded a Michelin Star.
