We have eaten at both and prefer the one on the foodie tour to either of them and not having to wait to get in was a bonus. Warm egg tarts were a perfect way to top off the tour.Our tour guide, Yammy, was delightful. She is very upbeat and provided lots of information about customs and history and even pointed out a tiny hole-in-the-wall barber shop that I've probably passed a hundred times without noticing. We really enjoyed this tour a lot and will return to most of the stops on the tour. The only down side I can name is that it is a little pricey, given that the places where we ate were very inexpensive.

Tai Po Market tour--adventure leads to dire consequences for me. During my last visit to Hong Kong 17 months ago, I took this group's other 2 tours (Central-Sheung Wan and Sham Shui Po) and had a great time. I believe this tour was added in the fall of last year. It's perhaps the most adventurous tour because it's the furthest away from Central and also because of the food offerings. For instance, on the other tours, you walk by snake shops offering snake soup, but on this tour it is an actual tasting stop. This tour is also more costly, perhaps because of the food offered, the portions were quite generous, and the tour length a bit longer.Alas, the combination of the foods offered and my physical makeup did not mix well for me that day. I ended up with severe gastrointestinal upset that severely marred the rest of my Hong Kong trip, even resulting in an overnight hospital stay for dehydration and low blood pressure upon my return to the USA. To be clear, I do not fault the tour or food preparation, but in the end, my gastronomic plans for this trip (including plans to revisit the wonton noodle, roast meat, dim sum, egg tart and pineapple bun shops from the other tours) were shot to heck.Tai Po Market is in the New Territories north of Kowloon. If taking the very efficient but sometimes congested MTR subway system from Central, allow about one hour travel time. I used 3 different lines, ending on the above-ground East Rail Line which was once part of the historic Kowloon Canton Railroad (these trains even have a First Class car with regular upholstered seats). At the Tai Po Market stop, I met our guide, Elise, who got her start with the Tasting Tour group via Fiona, my Sham Shui Po tour guide last year. There was only one other person on our tour. Even here in the New Territories, this area is still quite urban and bustling, a mix of old and new, not unlike Sham Shui Po in Kowloon. Like the other tours, this tour not only includes the tasting stops, but brief stops for discussion of the area's history. Also, we had a bit time at the Railroad Museum, located in the old Tai Po Market station, and at a temple (named Man Mo like the one in Sheung Wan). As usual the Tasting Tour group focuses on vendors that are family-run, long-standing, definitely not part of a chain or conglomerate, and hygienic.First stop--rice rolls. These are a quite ubiquitous dish, but are special here because of hand-made, in-house technique and unique fillings--pork liver and dried scallop in our case. While I admired the exquisite texture an quality of the rice roll itself, I was not a big fan of either filling. The only liver I really like is foie gras or a pate, and the dried scallop reminded me of the potent dried shrimp I have disliked since childhood. Had these rolls been filled with the more traditional fillings like BBQ pork (char siu)--which you can certainly order here, they would have been fabulousSecond stop--roasted goose with rice noodles. My favourite stop, and a very large portion. I've traditionally had roast goose or duck with rice and a plum sauce on the side, but here the goose was served over rice spaghetti in a broth with vegetables and a cherry dipping sauce. Delicious, although quite fatty in a good way. Third stop--house-made candies. This was a stall in a wet market along the street, run by a couple originally from Macau. All their cookies and candies are made in-house. Our gift package included candies made from peanut, pumpkin seed and ginger. Samples of other treats were freely offered. We were somewhat pressured to purchase additional goods, which I did so willingly.Fourth stop--snake soup. A tiny place, uncrowded now because snake soup is traditionally a winter dish. The sign out front had a cobra and turtle on it. Indeed, some of the snakes used are venomous cobras--all are imported from Indonesia. Other snake shops keep snakes in open cages; here they were housed in wooden drawers where they cannot see their kin being eaten by humans. We were given both the snake soup--thick with shredded snake (tastes like chicken), mushrooms and other fungi/herbs--plus snake broth--a bit medicinal in taste but not unlikable. Snake wines were on the shelves. The proprietor showed us all the snake bones used to make the broth--who knew snakes had so many bones? Worth a try--better than the rattlesnake posole I had once in Arizona.Fifth stop--a trio of dishes served in an indoor cooked-food centre, not unlike a Singaporean hawker centre. This family apparently started their business as a dai pai dong (outdoor eatery), but later moved here to a more comfortable and hygienic place for all. Since there so few of us, it was like a banquet. We started with deep-fried cuttlefish (like squid) balls-clearly very fresh. I would have preferred a smaller ball size. Next came a steamed whole mullet fish with black bean sauce. Also very fresh and simple, clean. Last was steamed glutinous rice (aka sticky rice) with fresh crab. This would have been my favourite dish had the rice not included the dreaded dried shrimp that has haunted me since childhood--it is often used to flavour glutinous rice, unfortunately for me. We had a lot of leftovers, which the other participant took home since she lived locally. We were also given the option of having a beer with our meal, a first for a Foodie Tour. We opted for coconut water, made fresh of course.Sixth and last stop--warm tofu dessert. This was a street stall with a lot of takeaway business, since there very few places to sit. On the Sham Shui Po tour, there was a tofu stop, but I think it was cold, served with a ginger syrup. Here, the tofu is warm, served with an almond milk topping (we were given the option of black sesame, brown sugar or ginger as well). Good, very plentiful. The entire tour took about 4 hours. There were restroom stops along the way, but I would find myself needing 2 of these stops in the MTR stations on the way back to Central. I spent much of the remainder of the trip trying to recover in my hotel room, thankfully a luxurious Harbour-view room at the Mandarin Oriental. I had most wanted to revisit the pineapple bun place from the Sham Shui Po tour--I can still taste and feel their cloud-like deliciousness--but that became out of the question. It was also a shame that I could not fully enjoy the lavish breakfast buffets offered daily at the Mandarin's famous Clipper Lounge, included in my room rate. I had to make do with toast, clear broth and plain congee. Some hints: wear comfortable shoes, of course, and bring an umbrella or whatever additional clothing you may need depending on the weather. Water, a packet of tissues and wet wipes are offered by the guide, but bring more of any of these if you need them. And of course be willing to try different things!

Excellent and entertaining tour. I took theSham Shui Po morning foodie tour with Yammy. The tour was good fun and entertaining as well. The selectin of different foods gave you the opportunity to try some real local food and the area in which the tour takes place gives you a feel for how HK was many years ago. Yammy is an excellent guide and gives you a lot of information about the area you are visiting as well as explaining all about the different foods.

Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour. This tour is a must do, the food and cost is well worth the walking. Our guide Lilian told us lots of information about the food, building and HK history. We shopped for a few minutes. We tasted good soup, BBQ pork and rice and dim sum. All the food was good and very filling.

Delicious & Authentic Food Tour. I had a wonderful tour with Yammy and Carrie on the Sham Shui Po tour.The meeting point was easy to find and the group was small so it felt like a very authentic & intimate tour throughout Sham Shui Po with old friends. We stopped at 6 different tastings, with other stops along the way to point out the culture, history, or other notable points. The food was delicious and authentic! The tour was very informative and showed me a different part of Hong Kong (a very non-touristy section) that has tons of character. The only downside I see was the high price tag (~$100 USD), but I still think the tour is worthwhile if you can handle the cost. This was my first food tour ever -- I had a blast and would recommend to others!

Great tour of Sham Shui Po!. We took this tour as part of our time in HK and loved it. I think the Sham Shui Po your is great as it's a bit off the normal tourist areas, so you get to see some 'real' Hong Kong. I enjoyed it for the photos as much as the food! Our guides Yammy and Carrie were fantastic - full of local knowledge, super friendly and even had an iPad to show videos of how some dishes are prepared.Highly recommended! :-)Thanks, John and Lisa

Great Tour. The tour with our guide Yammy was fantastic. Amazing food and Yammy gave us lots of good information about the food, history and life in Hong Kong. Lots of variety for food lovers. Would highly recommend!!

Highly Recommend !. I live in Hong Kong, and this was my second tour with Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tours! Love these guys and I wouldn't go any where else for an authentic, informative dip into this incredible city's culture and food adventures. I've brought 2 sets of overseas guests in Hong Kong for the first time with me now to experience the back streets and local flavours of this wonderful city through the eyes of a local. I love the small group vibe -- and the personable, relaxed and very knowledgeable tour guides. Yesterday Yammy our tour guide did a very professional and thorough job of introducing yesterday and today's Hong Kong....culture, history and life as well as flavours to our guests on the Central/Sheung Wan Tour. She was an absolute delight, and remembered everyone's names all day ! Impressive! Always a firm favourite stop on this tour is the Tsim Chai Kee Noodle shop on Queen's Road Central.....pungent fragrant soup broth, fresh dumplings & al dente noodles !!!! I want a bowl now! I would love to join the Kowloon and New Territories tours too just for myself!!! I am sure I will learn something new every time. Thank you everyone at Hong Kong Foodie Tours! We love you!

An authentic Cantonese food experience. If you love food and want to know what Cantonese food prepared in family restaurants tastes like, the afternoon tour is a rich experience. Lilian took us to many wonderful places that we would never have known about without her. Lilian's knowledge and enthusiasm made this tour our best experience in Hong Kong. Strongly recommended for those who want to know and appreciate what the locals eat, mixed with interesting historical information.

A Great Way to Spend the Afternoon. We'd been in HK for a couple of days doing the obligatory tours to the Peak and riding the Star Ferry back and forth to Kowloon with side trips for shopping. This tour started near the base of the worlds longest under cover escalator and wound it way through the surrounding area. I have to say our hostess Yammy was lovely, we'd arrived 15 minutes early and so we wandered about a little either side of "The L Place" meeting point and then returned and she arrived right on time. She greeted us and all of the other 9 members of the tour and the managed to remember the names of every one, not an easy trick when your dealing with people from at least 6 different countries. So off we went and into the first of six different spots on the tour. We traversed a set of stairs to the basement of a Dim Sum shop and dined on locally made Shrimp Dumplings and broth, which were delightful. Yammy is an effervescent individual and mixed with commentary is a lesson on Cantonese language to help us with our adventure. The food on the tour is fresh, made on site and all of it healthy. If this is your first trip to HK then I suggest that you take this tour with Yammy, she knows the area and the people, the two old blokes in the Sugar Cane shop look like uncles, and probably are but they as they were happy to chat with the group and were up for a laugh. The food was great, the pastry from Hei Lee's was almost as much a highlight as the roast Pork at the Dragon Restaurant. A must do!!!

Best part of our trip to Hong Kong. Wonderful afternoon. Had amazing food at many family owned restaurants we would never have found on our own. Our guide, Lillian, was very knowledgeable about history of food and Hong Kong in general. A delicious way to learn about Hong Kong and have fun in the process.

Tai Po Market tour. Fantastic. Way out in the New Territories, great our of a unique neighborhood. A first thought the tour was pricey but it was worth it. There is truly enough tastings that I only needed a light snack later. The snake broth was the best!

FABULOUS. We booked this a month before going and from the time of booking everything was easy. The confirmation email, the meeting location and the payment. Our guide for the day was Lillian (truly amazing), great English and very thorough with her knowledge and explanations.We ended up being the only two people on the tour which gave us a very intimate, fun and adventurous day.Anyone looking for a tour which is not typically your normal Hong Kong tourist hot spot, give this a go. Plenty of food, Hong Kong history and laughs!

Tammy was great!. Loved the tour and what made it great aside from the food (come hungry) was our guide, Yammy. She knows her stuff, loves to share and answers al questions. We did the sham po tour, saw where the blue collar workers ear...authentic as it was delicious.

Great Experience!. Even with our little one in tow, this was a great 3 hour tour of Hong Kong. It was not just restaurant to restaurant, but truly a glimpse into the culture and foundation of what makes Hong Kong food so unique and delicious! Thanks to our tour guide Lillian and the patience of all the patrons with us. We had a great time and would recommend this to anyone visiting Hong Kong!

Five senses immersion tour. This food tasting tour was a great way to get into the heart of Hong Kong on a very short stop over in this city. Food was the perfect vehicle to get to know more about the people, culture and architecture and the unfolding history of this fascinating city. The tour was well-paced, leading us through a route of constant variety over the afternoon, including wet markets and the kitchens of some establishments. Lilian was very well-informed and clearly at home with the material and the vendors we met along the way. As well as tasting freshly and expertly prepared specialities we gleaned insights about the role of edibles in Chinese medicine and beauty regimes! And the evolution of the food industry. Fabulous. Highly recommended.

If you were not in love with HK already, you will be after this Tour. It wasn't just the fantastic food, nor the interesting HK historic fact, it was the enthusiasm of our guide Lillian that put this tour on the top of our tour experience list.

A new glimpse of HK. It's been a while since I was on a Foodie expedition so I was excited to try the Tai Po tour. I knew it would be more adventurous than Sheung Wan but that's exactly what I was looking for. And I wasn't disappointed! It was lovely to discover Tai Po - a hidden gem that I'd never visited properly. Loved all the food stops EXCEPT for one - the snake soup. That was a first and I'm glad I tried it, but it's not on the repeat list. Highly recommend this tour to HK residents like me who want to rediscover new bits of the Territory or to travelers that want to go out of their way to have a 100% authentic Hong Kong experience.

Tastings of both food and the city. Yammy led us on an engaging, interesting, and treat filled tour of Sham Shui Po. Great pace through the morning, good connections into behind-the-scenes information, answers to our questions, and fun facts to build our knowledge of this part of the city. After living here for two years, with Yammy's help, we got a bit deeper into our experience with Hong Kong.

Amazing!!!. My friends were visiting me from the UK and I decided to take this tour with them (cos I'm lazy), and they certainly do a much better job than I could've. Lots of hidden gems that even I don't know about and I live here! Great value and learnt a lot about my city. Would definitely get my friends to go on this tour when I have frds visiting. And props to Yammi as well! Amazing guide!

Still Unsure if I'd Recommend. Well, good things about it were entering into the culture, into a part of town we usually wouldn't get exposure to. Our guide Yammy was helpful, sweet, and knowledgeable. We didn't like the pace—our guide walked slowly—and we also didn't like the price. Because the food served is all street food, the price was exorbitant. What we didn't know was that the tours in the different neighborhoods signify different levels of adventurous-ness about food: the one in Central is pretty mainstream, ours was in the middle, and the other option has the most extreme/unusual food choices. That being said, I only really loved two of the six food places we went. It was fun to go into the button/ribbon shops and kitchen supply shops, and it was fun to see the kitchen of some of the restaurants she took us to. Overall, we didn't like it while we did it, but we were glad we did it.
YAMMY IS AMAZING!! . This foodie tour is a must do! YAMMY was awesome! We had a blast! Food was amazing! Wonton noodles were my absolute favorite !

Amazing experiences. I love the way they pick up and transfer us around the city for special restaurants and food streets. Most food are spicy and hot which is my favourite. Tour guid is fabulous, he showed us he language skills with latino, english, french frequently.

Yammy was amazing!. Yammy really killed it on the Sham Shui Po tour. I'm a fluent Mandarin speaker, have been to China and Taiwan several times, and have a bit of Cantonese under my belt too, but she was able to give our group a really wonderful experience that I couldn't have gotten on my own -- we tried some incredible food and got an excellent sampling of local lore. I was able to experience Hong Kong life in a way I would not otherwise have been able too.

An experience that would be nearly impossible on your own.. Well planned and excellent tour of the Sham Shui Po area given by our guide, Yammy. Everything was timely and the food was excellent and well rounded - extra care was taken for any restrictions or preferences. Nearly every stop was one that I would not have tried to navigate on my own so we felt like it was a genuine HK experience. Highly recommended.

Sham Shui Po Foodie Tour. Yammy was a fabulous tour guide!!! We went to all of the local places that we otherwise would not have gone to. Not only did we get to taste different types of foods, we also got an opportunity to tour the local neighborhood and she filled us in on local life, not just food - it was amazing!!!

I ATE SNAKE AND IT WAS GREAT. My wife & daughter organised this tour & I am so glad I went.We visited about 7 different restaurants & markets as well as a great railway museum.Yes one restaurant specialised in snake food & it tasted great plus as a bonus we got to see a live(non poisonous) snake.The tour guide was terrific & we got to meet a lot of interesting hard working locals who were pleased to show us their products.

Awesome food and experience !. We just got back from the Central and Sheung Wan foodie tour. In one word Awesome! Food was incredible with 6 locations and behind the scenes tours of kitchens. Yammy, our wonderful, warm and enthusiastic guide was top shelf! Not only did we get insights into Hong Kong culture, but exceptional food! By far the best tour I've been on! I would definitely do any of the other Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tours next time I come to Hong Kong!

Delicious food tour. Fantastic guide. Generous portions.. We did the Tai Po Market foot tour with Silvana and I could not recommend it highly enough. The train ride from our hotel in Sheung Wan to Tai Po Market is about an hour long and involves a few train line changes. The MTR system is so easy to follow and HK Foodie provided excellent instructions to find our way to the start point. I was a little worried about the Tai Po Market tour for 2 reasons - (1) it seemed expensive at about $150AUD pp and (2) because I thought it might be a bit TOO adventurous for me. I love food, but I'm not a huge fan of seafood and even the thought of snake soup made me a little queasy. The other two tours were booked during our stay (and I knew my husband would LOVE it) so I booked us in. I didn't need to worry - all of the food we ate was absolutely delicious (yes, even the snake soup) and I enjoyed every bite. The portions were also very generous, so if you don't particularly like something you taste, you can be sure you won't be left hungry! Silvana is very knowledgeable about the area and has lots of passion for her job. She was happy to answer all of the questions we had (about the food or about things we had seen around Hong Kong during our travels so far) and she did a fantastic job of ensuring that our group of around 10 mingled with one another during the tour. 10 out of 10. Definitely worth the money and the train ride out there.

Excellent introduction to Hong Kong's food scene - good for veggies too!. We took the Central & Sheung Wan tour on our first day in HK. It was a great way to start the trip and visit many restaurants that we wouldn’t have found on our own. My highlight was the Dim Sum shop, I thought all the dumplings there were delicious and the portion sizes were very generous! I also loved taking a walk through one of the outdoor markets and seeing all the fresh produce being sold. Our guide Yammie was awesome – friendly, excellent English and lots of interesting stories about the food & the city. She worked hard to make sure everyone in the group felt included and enjoyed themselves. This tour is perfect for first-timers to Hong Kong, you will try many traditional foods but nothing too exotic (like snake soup!). They can also cater very well for vegetarians and will try to provide you with good alternatives to the meat tastings. We were all very full afterwards so you will not need to go for dinner once you have done this tour!

My second tour with HK Foodie Tasting Tiurs. Loved the Sheung Wan tour so much last trip that I booked for the breakfast in Sham Shui Po tour last week. This time our guide was the delightful Yammy, who covered food and culture over the four hours we spent with her. Highly recommend doing a tour at the beginning of your trip if you are new to HK. Don't eat before the tour. So much yummy food. This is not gourmet but the best of everyday foods that locals eat. Lots of fun. Thanks Yammy!

Great Experience. Went on the Hong Kong Foodie tour yesterday. Lillian was the tour guide. I'm not a big walker and was a little nervous about how far I expected to walk. But.... Turned out to be great. The places we visited were fun and the food was very savory. This is really a "must do" for Hong Kong. Lillian talked about many aspects of Hong Kong... Not just food. When I come back, I will go on another Hong Kong Foodie Tour.

Excellent tour. Yammy is an excellent guide who was happy to answer all sorts of questions about life in Hong Kong giving real insight into the culture. She was also really fun and got the group interacting. A very fun tour. Highly recommended.

Fantastic food and guide.. I've just finished the Central and Sheung Wan tour with Yammy. It was a great experience. Yammy is a well informed local who really knows the food and history of the area. The food stops are varied and well thought out as well as being utterly delicious. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Excellent tour for food and local knowledge. Today we did the Central and Sheung Wan Foodie Tour with Yammy. We really enjoyed the tour, with 6 stops for tastings, from Wonton Noodles to Dim Sum.Yammy gave us insight into the history and preparation of the dishes we tried, and also was full of information on the local area. As well as the delicious food, we got to see areas that we would not have otherwise visited.It was an excellent tour, and we would highly recommend it.

Very Fun, Good Food. Yammy gave an excellent tour and was knowledgeable about both the food and Hong Kong. Within just a few minutes of the trip beginning, she knew all of our names and made an effort to get to know each one of us personally. The food was very good and very filling and I liked how the stops were spaced out among the trip.

We loved our Hong Kong Foodie Tour with Yammy!!. We did the Central and Sheung Wan Foodie Tour today. It was excellent. Our guide Yammy was knowledgeable, enthusiastic and lots of fun. We went to places we would never have discovered on our own. The food was fantastic and we also saw lots of sights and other historical features of Hong Kong. We had the best wonton noodle soup and dumplings ever!

Good tour. Did the Central and Sheung Wan tour. Tour guide knowledgeable and very enthused about the tour. Lots of traditional Chinese/Hong Kong food from noodles, to Dim Sum and Barbecue Pork and rice. Enjoyed the tour a lot and recommend. Do not go if you are not hungry.

A tasty trip round Hong Kong. Great foodie walking tour of Hong Kong. Cliff was slick, professional and very accommodating. The food is tasty, the sights really interesting, and I'd recommend this if you're new to the city and want to get your bearings with a variety of tastes thrown in. The company provides useful information enabling you to find the locations again if you want to go back for more exploration/dishes at a later point. Good pace of walking versus eating, and you cover a lot of ground in 3.5 hours - definitely don't have lunch beforehand!

Amber took us into Sham Shui Po. Very interesting and lively. I've been to Hong Kong many times, but had never spent time in Sham Shui Po, so there was lots to see and learn. We went to many small eateries and tried the wares. Got to see behind the scenes. Guide Amber was informative and entertaining. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour. Thought it was well worth the money and the time. Recommended.

Great way to feel like a local. We booked our Sham Shui Po tour on the recommendation of family and we wish we had done this tour when we first arrived in Hong Kong as it was a highlight of our stay. Yammy our guide is a Hong Kong local who speaks excellent English and is very passionate about the local areas. We went to 6 amazing tastings and discovered foods that we would not have normally tried as well as visiting several other types of businesses. Yammy gave us some great general tips of Hong Kong that only a local would perhaps know and she allowed us plenty of time to take photographs and did not rush us.

Eating & walking in Sham Shui Po. My husband & I love to explore new places, cultures, & cuisines. This tour gave us an insight into the life of people of Hong Kong. Fiona shared great stories about the neighborhood. Highly recommend this tour. Thanks, Fiona!

Excellent food tour. We did the central & shueng wan tour with Cliff. He was a great guide, with lots of stories and local history. Thanks Cliff. The tour has 6 food/drink stops, which maybe doesn't sound like much. But it was very filing and we didn't need to eat again that day. I don't want to give too much away because I think it was nice to be surprised with each stop. Just to say all the food was really good and the tour is worth doing.

Excellent - well worth doing. Yammy was our guide and she did a great job. The food was excellent and a good range of things to try. Yammy was very informative about the food we tried, but also about local culture, a bit of history and local interests. We had a great group of nice people which is also common with food tours that I have done - and that adds to the fun.Highly recommended if you have half a day to spare and have an interest in local food.

Sham Shui Po tour well worth the effort. We thoroughly enjoyed our meanderings through Sham Shui Po with Fiona.She was very interesting and full of local knowledge.The Foodie Tour is certainly a must if you have the time while in Hong Kong

Recommended!. I recommend this tour for anyone visiting HK and interested in checking out the cuisine. Our guide was delightful, and shared a lot of very interesting information about Hong Kong's food, history and current state of affairs.

Best HK tour for true foodies!. This foodie tour of Tai Po Market is one of the highlights of our time in Hong Kong. This area is authentically HK and slightly off the beaten path. From delicious crab rice (see photo) to snake soup and regional rice rolls, our guide taught is about not just the foods that influence this old fishing village area, but was so knowledgable about the history and its people. Highly recommend this 4-hour walking tour!

A Tour de Force. We were met by an energetic Yammy who proceeded to introduce everyone and herself. She sets an easy pace between her chosen restaurants and maintains an interest in the welfare of the individual and group. The restaurants chosen were all excellent providing a cuisine snapshot of the locals - with the egg tart being the highlight. Yammy was also able to carry meaningful conversation in between the restaurants with interesting information and anecdotes on the surrounding streets and shops. It is fair to say that Yammy added another dimension to this tour.
Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tour. It was a great tour! Friendly tour guide and a great way to taste the local favorites. Be prepared to walk approx. 3 - 4 hours, rain or shine.

Unique Food Tour. Yammy our tour guide presented a unique and interesting tour of Hong Kong food spots. This included some interesting places along the way as well. A nice way to see some more of Hong Kong while tasting its delights.

Outstanding simply outstanding . Thanks to Cliffe our guide who took us through 6 exquisite locations to sample and enjoy local food owned and operated by family run operators that go back to generations and history in this exciting city. Taking in local markets selling local fruit veggies meat and seafood we were guided through an array of different but all equally interesting and tasty delights. You will not be disappointed and all within close proximity and walking distance. Do yourself a favour and do this tour you won't be disappointed.

Wonderful behinds the scenes tiur. Our tour which included six food and drink stops in the Chinese market district was the highlight of our Hong Kong visit. Our very knowledgable and personable tour leader Cliff knows the area and food scene very well and in passionate about what he does. The only pity was that we did this tour at the end and not beginning of our stay. Most people without local knowledge would walk past these simple family owned restaurants without having any ideas what great value for money gems of dishes lay within. Bring good walking shoes. There are some steep streets to climb to access the markets but it is worth the sweat.

Great tour for a great price!. Yammy had the best energy and was so fun. I go to go on the Central tour with her. I loved the choice of restaurants, especially the dim sum place. And the egg tart! I oculd eat those for the rest of my life!

Yummie food with Yammy. Highly recommended!. Our guide Yammy took us around this foodie walking tour in the Central & Sheung Wan area of Hong Kong. The tour was managed professionally and our group was a mix of people from the US, New Zealand and Australia. Yammy also provided historical and cultural insights between food stops. Her English is good and she was engaging and fun to be with throughout. She remembered all our names and was happy to explain questions, food or non food related. We had 6 foodie pit stops which also included peeking behind the scenes. If we had more time we would definitely explore the other areas with this company. Highly recommended and thank you Yammy!

yammy was yummy!!!. We did the Central tasting tour with Yammy. We believe this was one of the highlights of our time in Hong Kong . Slow paced relaxed and really informative not to mention delicious.

Bring an extra stomach--you'll need it. I was traveling to HK solo and for a limited time, and a foodie tour seemed like my best bet for getting an overview of the delicacies on offer there. The Central and Sheung Wan Districts did not disappoint. It was a drizzly weekday offseason so there were only two of us on the tour, but I have a feeling our guide, Cliff, would have treated us as personally if there had been 20. We visited several spots that had a very local feel and absolutely everything was delicious. Cliff, whose family is from the region, had a lot of insight into the city's culture as shown through eating habits, and in between tastings he pointed out various items sold by street vendors, identified what they were and explained their significance. If you are looking for an overview of HK cuisine and food culture, this tour should make you very happy. If you can figure out a way to bring an extra stomach along, you'll be even happier.

Yammy was YUMMYLISCIOUS. Thank you to Yammy for taking us on a wonderful foodie tour around central & Sheung Wan in Hong Kong. The tour was professional and we met a lovely mix of people, American, German and British. The small group of 8 aloud us personal attention and Yammy was very thorough and informative. She went beyond the normal food tour and showed us other things as well. Her English was very good and she has a great sense of humour. The venues were great and ready for us upon arrival with no waiting. A wonderful introduction for culture and food. Highly recommended!

Excellent insight into local cusine. We had a great time with Fiona exploring the Sham Shui Po area and tasting different foods. Each tasting was perfect, well spaced and the tour overall was well-timed to avoid peak periods and make opening times. We tasted pineapple buns, rice rolls, biscuits, roast pork, tofu dessert and shrimp egg noddles. Fiona explained each dish, showed us videos and gave us a fantastic insight into life in HK. Thanks so much!

Fantastic Introduction to Hong Kong. I participated in the Central and Sheung Wan tour with Yammy on my first night in Hong Kong-- what a fantastic decision! This tour was the perfect introduction to some of the Chinese foods I hadn't yet tried and a reintroduction to others I hadn't had in years. Yammy was a fantastic guide, engaging with everyone in our group at a pace that neither felt lazy nor rushed. Do yourself a favor and book this tour. It's for foodies and everyday travelers alike!Note: food is included, which isn't the case in other food tours in the city

Long time HK resident discovers new deliciousness!. I have lived in Hong Kong for 12 years and my sister was visiting for the third time. What new adventure could we find? our foodie tour with Yammy to Sham Shui Po was the perfect solution. Even though I had issued this neighborhood countless times Yammy discovered the very best food on each category. We had no idea that rice rolls could be so yummy!!! In addition to the most delicious food we were delighted to learn so much more about the neighborhood history and markets. In the days after our tour we would try some of the same foods in different neighborhoods and they were never nearly as delicious as on the HK Foody tour.

Great introduction to Hong Kong food, culture and history. I did the Central and Sheung Wan tour which provided a great introduction to Hong Kong local/classic foods. Silvana was a fantastic guide and the food tasting places were great. I highly recommend this tour for anyone looking to get a good mix of local food, history and culture. Will definitely be doing the other Hong Kong foodie tours when ever i'm in Hong Long again.

Central Food Tour with Yammy. Some friends and I signed up for this food tour. Yammy was our very friendly, enthusiastic and knowledgeable guide. She clearly loves her job. We got to try a number of classic HongKong delicacies, but the real treat was the background information Yammy provided about each restaurant and dish and how to best enjoy it.

Great Time!. I was hesitant to sign up for this as it is expensive but I was so happy I did. Yammy was our guide and she did an amazing job sharing some local foods and the culture of the people of Hong Kong. Her outgoing personality made for a delightful day. She showed up some interesting things as we walked from each eatery and by the end of the tour we were all quite full and happy. My favorite was the wonton soup.......sooooooo good!!!!!

Troy & Denise. Yammy was an amazing tour guide. She was very knowledge about the history of Hong Kong and had a great sense of humour. I would highly recommend this tour. Thanks so much Yammy for making it such a great experience.

Fantastic guide. I took the Central tour with Silvana and thoroughly enjoyed it. The food tastings were great, especially the wonton noodles. However, for me the best thing is getting a real feel for the area you are staying in through its food culture. Silvana knew Hong Kong so well and was so passionate about the small businesses that we visited. I would love to return to Hong Kong and if I did so, would definitely take another Hong Kong Foodie tour.

Great experience. Our tour guide, Yammy, was really knowledgeable and informative. She made the whole tour really fun. Besides the local restaurants we ate in, we really enjoyed the tour of the food markets, seeing the "fresh" fish (still kicking) and the different herbs and spices. A really great way to spend over three hours in HK.

A good summary of the local food with a bit of history and culture thrown in.. Cliff was an excellent tour guide for our foodie tour through the central district. The food was diverse and tasty. I would definitely recommend this tour for something to immerse you in the city so famous for its food. The Portuguese tarts were my favourite part.

Two excellent tours. We did two tours with the company - the Central and Sheung Wan tour with Silvana and Sham Shui Po with Fiona. Both tours and both guides were excellent. As others have said, the food experience is greatly enhanced by the social and cultural history provided by the guides.The food on the Central tour would largely be familiar to those with previous experience of authentic Chinese food and dim sum, but it was fascinating to see these small businesses surviving among the high-rises of Central. Silvana's commentary was excellent and she also took us to the Man Mo Temple and pointed out some very local sights that we certainly would have missed on our own.The Sham Shui Po tour was in a neighbourhood that is still pretty local and "authentic" and the food was more unusual as well. Again, the commentary was excellent and Fiona is an extremely outgoing and enthusiastic guide. The tours aren't inexpensive but they offer an experience that goes beyond the food tasting itself. Highly recommended!

Great tour. We really liked the explanation about the food and the places we went. Also the guide told us a lot about Hong Kong and the way of living there, which was also great. We did not like all the food, but that had nothing to do with the tour but more with the Chinese food (not a huge fan of meat and they eat a lot of it).

Wonderful tour.... We participated in the Foodie tour with Yammy as our guide. The tour was great. Yammy was enthusiastic and knowledgeable...not just about the food, but also about the culture and history of the area. We would highly recommend this tour to all visitors.

Fun & Yummy tour with our guide Yammy!. Great way to experience Hong Kong - through its local food culture.Took the Central foodie tour on 24 Mar 16, with our guide Yammy. She was enthusiastic, knowledge-able and showed us food that non-locals probably didn't know of. She even brought us to see how the food was made in the kitchens and gave us the history while doing a walking tour of the food-stall back-alleys.Needless to say, the food was delicious!

A pleasure to book and experience. We did the Central tour with Cliff the afternoon after we arrived in Hong Kong. I had asked for directions and they were nice enough to not only send directions but also include a map showing the way to the meeting spot. All inquiries were answered and confirmation sent promptly.Cliff was engaging and knowledgeable. In addition to the great food ( the shrimp wonton may be my favorite dish from whole vacation), this was a great orientation to today's hong kong. Cliff was easy for us to understand since he had lived in US. We had a congenial group from Great Britain, NZ and Australia - they seemed ok with his American accent :-).Great start to our vacation and perfect antidote to jet lag. Just don't make plans for dinner...

This was a great tour. We have been to Hong Kong many times and we do walking tours many places, but this was one of the best ever! Yammy was our guide and led our group of Americans and Australians up and down through Sheung Wan and a wide variety of food experiences. She also wove in LOTS of Chinese and Hong Kong life and culture that didn't have anything to do with food. Her English was good and she knew enough about westerners to know what we were thinking and what questions to address. We had 3 people who were dealing with leg problems and needed to go a little slow. She did a good job of going a short distance and then stopping to eat or talk about something. On top of all that the foods were very good and there was more than we could eat comfortably. We went to great places we would never have found or gone into on our own. We got to see behind the scenes in some of them so we found out what it takes to make things like roast meat Hong Kong style. I might do this tour again when I'm back in Hong Kong. Another thing - a lot of of the traditional places are vanishing with the building boom in Hong Kong, so go soon before they all turn into hip restaurants and high rises. By the way, this is not a weird food tour, it's normal good food.

A Must-do tour. We spent the afternoon on the Central tour with Lilian who was wonderful. she took us to 6 food stops. All family run restaurants/shops that we wouldn't have ventured into on our own. We started with prawn dumpling/noodle soup then progressed to BBQ Pork (including a visit to the kitchen) then sugar cane juice, then preserved fruits then dim-sum then custard tarts. I didn't need dinner that evening. Lilian was excellent.

Great Experience. Great way to spend 4 or 5 hours. Our guide, Lilian, was terrific. She was very knowledgable both in regard to both food and the area and its history. We were a part of a group of 12 and everyone got on with everyone else. The selection of food was well thought out and tasty. It was also great to taste the authentic product. Thoroughly recommend it.

Cliff was awesome. This was a highlight of our trip to Hong Kong. Cliff was by far the best tour guide we've ever had. He was interesting and extremely knowledgeable. The places we went to were all outstanding to say the least. He brought us to places we would have never found on our own. Do yourself a favor and book with this company, you won't regret it.

The perfect way to spend an afternoon!. I went on the Central and Sheung Wan Foodie Tour. It lasts around 3.5 hours with 6 stops to sample some truly delicious food! Our guide was Lilian who was friendly and informative who added lots of detail about the culture, history and insider info about the places we passed. As a solo traveller, it was great to meet people and spend the afternoon together eating, walking and chatting. The BBQ pork is amazing and the egg tarts heavenly. We also got a really useful handout with other local recommendations. Would highly recommend this experience!

Great Central tour!. We recently enjoyed the Central tour with Lillian. From the noodle soup shop to the egg tarts, all the food was delicious and interesting. Loved the roast meat restaurant and the visit to their kitchen. Roast pork will never be the same again! Lillian was a great tourleader - full of lots of local knowledge and made us feel welcome. Thanks, hope to do some other tours on our next Hong Kong visit.

A highly recommended tor!. Our Foodie Tour was guided by Lilian, who was excellent. Fun & knowledgable, she made the trip very enjoyable.Lots of different things to try, with lots of insight into how the food is prepared & served.A really enjoyable afternoon.

Incredible, informative, and yummy!. A group of 4 friends (mid-20s) went on this tour with Yammy and it was amazing. Yammy was an extremely friendly and knowledgable guide. We had so much fun asking her questions about HK food culture, and many other topics ! Her passion for food, her home city, and her customers is clearly evident and we couldn't have asked for a better guide. She was the absolute best :) The tour is excellent in itself - a great way to sample some of the best dishes in HK at local, family-run shops plus learn about the city along the way. We are so glad we did this tour while in HK, and highly recommend it!

Food tour is excellent. This was the highlight of our trip. Fiona was a wonderful tour guide. She was very friendly and delightful. We met great new friends. The food was all very good. It was great to hear about the culture and get the inside scoop on how the markets work. It made us feel much more comfortable and gave us the confidence to shop in the market.

Great way to eat like a local. This was a fantastic trip, lots of variety and plenty of food. Fiona our guide was great and helped to make this trip an extremely enjoyable event. Highly recommend this trip.

Wonderful Food Tour of Sham Shui Po!. I took part in the Sham Shui Poi food tour which was a great way to see a part of town and taste the local cuisine that I likely wouldn't have seen otherwise. Fiona was our guide for the tour and was knowledgeable, friendly, and energetic throughout. We tasted a number of food items at 6 stops while walking around the Sham Shui Po neighborhood. I certainly recommend this tour as a great way to taste different foods and see a part of town that felt very local and authentic.

The first tour was so good, I went on a second one!. I took the Central tour. We were given precise and easy to follow directions to meet up. Then we taken through Central and Sheung Wan. Our guide Lillian was friendly, upbeat and gave us not only a foodie tour but also a cultural tour. We learned not only about the culinary side but also various traditions and historical background and what it's like to live in HK today. The food tastings were excellent. I remember still the amazing char siu! Tender and perfectly bbq'ed. The only disappointment was the dim sum restaurant, whose offerings were unremarkable. The tour ended with some of the best egg tarts I've ever had.I had such a good time on that tour, that I signed up for another one - the Sham Sui Po. This one was led by Fiona and once again was a blast! This neighborhood in Kowloon is quite distinct from Central, and that itself was worthwhile to experience. The tour started out on an entertaining note with Fiona telling us about the etiquette and operation of the subway washrooms! At the first restaurant I was stunned to see what looked like the largest pineapple bun in creation :). What was even more surprising was how good it was. We have them in my home town but nothing like this. My second favorite restaurant stop was the tofu dessert with sweet ginger sauce, but all six stops were worthwhile.I'm definitely taking the third tour (Tai Po) the next time I visit!Tips: 1. remember to bring your walking shoes. This is a multi-hour excursion.2. bring an open mind - you will see foodstuffs that may be new to you. If you don't want to eat something, don't, but you'll get the most out of the tour if you take just a little bite of everything.3. bring a camera because there's lots of photo ops4. they supply you with a bottle of water which was very thoughtful and a dining guide that lists the itinerary for future reference.5. remember to tip your guide. They work hard!

Great Tour of Sham Shui Po. We did the Sham Shui Po food tour this past weekend. Fiona was our guide and she was great--very enthusiastic and well-spoken. We not only learned what people in this working-class neighborhood eat, but also some things about how they live. Very eye-opening. My favorite of the foods we tasted was the rice rolls, but everything was good. Ho bau!

GREAT WAY TO START YOUR FIRST VISIT TO HONG KONG. Our guide, Cliff, was excellent. The tour lasted 3 1/2 hours on foot. Two toilet stops. Easy to follow the guide in spite of busy streets and restaurants. We were taken to restaurants that First visit westerners would not venture in their own. All family owned businesses that were welcoming with incredibly good food. The tour is not just about food. Cliff told us about local history and plans for future development as we walked. Fantastic value for money. If you only plan to book one activity in advance, make it this one. Helps you understand Hong Kong and helps you to find your way around. Our guide was very knowledgable. A resident of Hong Kong, he has spent several years in Chicago and his English was excellent. His enthusiasm was infectious.

Fantastic afternoon!!. This tour is a fantastic way to roam around the streets and eat at the local restaurants. Our guide also provided us with local history and showed us points of interest. A very relaxed walking pace - but be warned don't have any lunch - you will have much more to eat than you could possibly need!!!

Central and Sheung Wan Food Tour- Highly recommend!. We did the Central and Sheung Wan food tour. During the tour, we went to 6 authentic, small, family-owned restaurants. The food was absolutely delicious and each place we went was very different. We got to see neighborhoods we wouldn't normally see as a tourist. Our guide, Cliff, was outstanding. Cliff was personable, knowledgeable, and professional. A native of Hong Kong, he was passionate about his culture, especially food. I highly recommend this tour!

Food tours are the best way to discover the culture and history of a city!!. Last week my husband and I were in Hong Kong. It was my first visit to the city and we had limited time to explore Hong Kong Island. We have taken food tours in other cities and have decided they are the best way to discover not only the food, but the culture, architecture and history of an area. Our Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tour was the highlight of our visit and our guide Lillian was amazing!!! ............ she had a wealth of information, her stories were memorable and her personality brought us together as a tour group and kept our attention throughout. We chose their Central and Sheung Wan option and were introduced to six local eateries. If we ever return to Hong Kong, we will definitely revisit those restaurants, and we'll also take another HK Foodie Tasting Tour!

Food tour. We had a great afternoon with Yammy. Learnt tonnes about Hong Kong history & a variety of local foods. It was great to actually see in the kitchens & learn the secrets to the cooking. A top way to get to know Hong Kong if you have limited time. Yammy's knowledge was amazing.

An amazing experience. I have been very lucky to get this Christmas present: a Foodie Tasting Tour in Hong Kong! This is, I can tell you, un unforgetable way to discover the culture of Honk Kong! Delicious food, the kindest people... That was perfect!
Great Finds in Central.Hong Kong. Yammy our guide took us on 3+ hour tour of 6 great locations including a Noodle Shop, BBQ Meats, Sugar Cane Drink, Dried Fruit, dim sum and custard tarts

Real China Real Food + a Railway Museum. Chose the tai Po tour partly due to its afternoon / early /evening timing but also because it was out of centre in one of the new towns but easily accessible by MTR train. They say they there is no minimum tour size and there were only three of us on this one which made it even more personal. Thus is billed as the more adventurous tour , although only the snake soup might fall into this category. An excellent way of sampling the small family eating places that are increasingly being priced out of the central districts and also getting past any language barrier.......and for a railway nut,an unexpected bonus of including the small railway museum - even smaller on this occasion as it was part closed for refurbishment. Four hours passed quickly .Highly recommended.

Fantastic and Educational. We just returned from our foodie tour and I felt like I should post a review immediately! We were met by our tour guide Fiona. She spoke English very well. I found that the tour gave us a great understanding of the local food and culture. Fiona explained many customs and traditions of the Kong Kongers. I was pleased that we arranged the tour our as our first day experience. Fiona was educational, knowledgable and friendly. We visited the local food establishments that I would not have dared to try on my own. We have travelled to over 65 countries and I would consider this tour a "must do", especially if you are interested in a local flavor!

Delicious afternoon!. My husband and I were in Hong Kong to celebrate my birthday and he booked the Tai Po Market tour for our second day in town so we could do some adventurous eating and get some food insight for the rest of our trip. Silvana and Elise were our guides, and despite a cold, wet, rainy day, we had a truly delightful afternoon with them. Given that it wa smy first time in Asia, I especially appreciated the additional insight and context they provided along with the information about the food itself - it allowed us to learn more about Hong Kong, the culture, the New Territories, customs, history, etc. etc. And the food! We are from San Francisco and have access to excellent Chinese food at home, including a penchant for fresh/local/seasonal fare...this tour highlighted exactly those things. The restaurants and shops we visited were all family-owned, and in many cases we met the owners and their families, and got to see how the food was prepared. We tried winter-specific specialties (snake soup!) and Silvana and Elise pointed out all of the New Year-specific foods and customs. Who knew how much we would like black sesame soup, or how different a homemade sour plum sauce would taste from packets? We're now back at home, trying to seek out the types of homemade delicacies we had in Tai Po Market! Truly wonderful from start to finish. Highly recommended.

A must do for any food lovers. Absolutely wonderful. Our guide Lilian was full of interesting info about the food, the history of the shop owners and a history of the Central and Sheung Wan areas. The food was delicious too! Well worth it!

A tourist buys trinkets, a traveler learns new things. Better than waiting with a mob in line for the Victoria Peak tram, better than hitting the Japanese department stores on Causeway Bay, walking the streets in Sham Shui Po with a knowledgeable and friendly guide was great fun! We liked eating in restaurants that we would never have entered on our own and eating food we never would have ordered by ourselves. Sure, some of the food was not to our liking, but a lot of it was and it was great fun experiencing something new. These Foodie tours let you feel, even if in a small way, that you're experiencing the real Hong Kong. Highly recommended!

Sham Shui Po Tour--highly recommended introduction to local culture. Our morning tour with Fiona was probably the high point of our week in Hong Kong--certainly the most interesting thing we did. It was really more of a cultural introduction to Chinese life than strictly focused on food. Not fancy or luxurious but completely authentic. She took us to 6 different local family owned restaurants--some would call them dives--to sample typical local favorites done the traditional way. Between restaurants we walked around local markets and shops and talked about Chinese life and families--everything from Mah Jong parlors and pawn shops to a knife shop run by a 94 year old and his family and the used electronics "men's market", "saving face" traditions, and people living in cages. We saw herb and dried fish shops, shops specializing in kitchen utensils, home made noodles and snake soup. This s not intended to be a high end gourmet experience--but it's a fascinating and often funny introduction to local life and culture. Fiona is a very impressive young woman---a graduate student in literature who has studied in the U.S. and speaks perfect English.

Loved every bite and every step!. We had a marvelous tour of the best family-owned, quality-made secret food spots in Hom Kong. Lillian was gracious and cheery and very knowledgable about not the food and the city. The dim sum was sumptuous. The roasted meats were amazing and we even got to tour the kitchen. If you like to stroll a city and get past the tourist traps to some authentic culture, go on this tour when you are in Hong Kong.

Still talking about it. My 20-year old daughter and I went on the Tai Po Market foodie tour, billed as the most adventurous of the three tasting tours offered. Tai Po Market is about a 45-minute train ride ride from central, and the area felt much more like mainland China than anywhere else we had been in Hong Kong. We made 6 stops combined with a walking tour of the street market. The food choices were excellent, ranging from rice rolls and roasted goose to snake soup and fried squid balls. We definitely expanded our food horizons! Our guides (Silvana and Elise) were excellent; providing good local knowledge along with moving us efficiently from one restaurant to another. Absolutely one of the highlights of our trip.

Eating my way through Hong Kong. During our recent trip to Hong Kong, my daughter was very interested in trying out the local cuisine. I, on the other hand, was not too excited as I am a vegetarian. We decided to try the Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tour. We had a great time! Our tour guide was Yammy. She was very knowledgeable regarding the local cuisine as well as other interesting details about Hong Kong. There were 12 people on our tour. At each location, the dishes were ready for us. Yammy did a great job accommodating my vegetarian preferences. We tasted foods at six different locations throughout the Central area: a wonton noodle shop, a roast meat restaurant, a sugar cane shop, a preserved fruits shop, a Chinese dim sum restaurant and a bakery shop. Everyone enjoyed the foods, as well as the details Yammy provided in regards to the preparation, history and cultural significance. This tour is so much more than just the food. We visited a local temple, saw a unique barber shop, and so much more. By the end of the tour, I felt as though Yammy was an old friend. I would highly recommend this tour while vacationing in Hong Kong.
Food tasting tour. All i can say "perfect" Food and people are warm.. the cuisine is wonderful that really makes me want to come back again

Great tour with Fiona . I did the Sham Shui Po tour with Fiona this morning and loved it. Fiona has a ton of positive energy and does a great job of interweaving the food with the culture. Definitely come hungry!! But beware the massive pineapple bun at the start of the tour! Super filling. I particularly enjoyed this tour because it was in an older part of Hong Kong that I probably wouldn't have seen otherwise.

Food tour terrifically tasty!. After 2 weeks of eating fabulous food in Italy we were disheartened and overwrought after our first dinner of a 4 day HK stopover on way back to Oz. HK Foodie Tour and their delightful guide Ed to the rescue! A very enjoyable, educational and most importantly delicious 3.5 hours spent with Ed on the Central /Sheung Wan tour. Had raised an eyebrow over cost but value received more than worth$ paid. Local knowledge/stories, cultural background and insights, insider info on restaurants and dishes sampled all added up to terrific and filling experience! The HK food scene can be mind boggling, expensive and plain hard work without some inside track but Ed changed our frowns to beaming grins. On top of the fun and lessons about some typical dishes many of the restaurants chosen were long standing family owned establishments. So a nice historical touch came along with our food, beyond the education we received as we walked throughout the neighborhoods. Ed provided entertaining running commentary as we went and as we dined, always happily answering any question or request thrown at him. Highly recommend this tour to all HK newcomers and anyone else who enjoys eating genuine local cuisine as its meant to be. Even if you've been to HK before you'll have a fun filling culinary adventure and bet you see/learn a few new things as well ! Thank you Ed! Who knew a mere egg tart could be so life changing?!!

Good food and lots of history. Ed was our tour guide and provided an entertaining and informative session. The tour was about 3.5 hours and we went to 6 different restaurants/shops. Along the way we strolled through the Graham Street Market and Cat Street. The food was really delicious but the best part was learning about how the neighborhoods are changing and how gentrification/urban renewal is affecting those that own shops, restaurants and sell their goods at the street markets. I feel I got a really amazing introduction to Hong Kong and a glimpse into how things are changing for the locals. The wonton soup at the first stop may have been my favorite. Highly recommended!

Excellent Sham Shui Po experience . This is one of the most interesting things we have done to explore Hong Kong. Being a resident, you tend to ignore your own city at times. Sometimes it needs a friend go gift something like this to you, to actually try it. It was a very unique experience. Walking through the lanes of SSP old style HK, the street hawkers, the amazing smelling food.. Can't help but want to try it all out. Right from the pineapple bread at Kowlpon restaurant, to the melt In the mouth rice rolls, hot tofu dessert, the braised good and pork, cookies and last but not the least bamboo noodles. Great experience! I shall do the other tours too.

Great way to spend an afternoon exploring Hong Kong. We were travelling with our 3 adult daughters in Hong Kong for New Year and wanted to do some sort of cooking or food tour. I researched several tours on the internet and decided to go with Hong Foodie Tasting Tours. Great decision.... Cliff was our guide for the afternoon for the Central & Sheung Wan Tour. Thank you Cliff for a fabulous, informative and very yummy tour!!! We would not have ventured to this part of Hong Kong if we hadn't done this tour, was great to explore the streets and markets and enjoy the food along the way - 2 of my girls don't eat seafood, substitutes were made at each stop. So pleased with went with Hong Kong Foodie Tours, we will be recommending them to all our family and friends. Thanks for a great afternoon.

Great culinary and cultural experience!. We booked this tour online from Japan before arriving and, as we only had 2 full days in Hong Kong, we were searching for something memorable to do with little time. Had read Trip Advisor reviews and decided that although it seemed a little expensive for our family of 5 it should be worth it. How fantastic it turned out to be! Our guide Yammy was wonderful and so informative and lovely with us and our 3 teenage sons! The tour is extremely efficient and well structured with just the right amount of food and time between courses. Food in each venue was wonderful and ready immediately. The focus is more on tradition and food that is prepared fresh and mostly onsite. Was great to visit parts of Hong Kong and learn about the city from a local that we would not have otherwise experienced. Top marks Yammy and this food tour!

Fanatic tour even though I have been to Hong among numerous times before hand. I decided to go on a food tour around Hong Kong and decided to do their Sheung Wan/ Central tour. I know quite a bit about Chinese food as my ancestors are originally from Hong Kong but I live in another country. Our tour guide Lily was great and had a good sense of humor she was very knowledgeable about the places we visited. The places she took us were very good and had a good variety of Cantonese cuisine. Also they have quite a bit of deep history about them. All the places they took us to were different and had different styles of food. The walking part was fine and even though Hong Kong island is very hilly the work was very comfortable and not a lot of effort was needed. Great tour.

Very good intro, some stuff you may certainly already have tasted, but in their real version !. Very good, well balanced walking, eating. Some very original things (or thinks you may have not thought of tasting) and some basics in their finest version (wonton with big pieces au shrimp, the best BBQ pork ever, ...). Very nice guide (Hi Ed !), replied to all question also non-food related ones.Tour taken: Central & Sheung Wan (and now I'll try to book another one)
A fantastic tour. I did the Sham Shui Po tour with Fiona as the guide. The tour was great - interesting food and great to understand more about the history of the area - and Fiona was brilliant.

Dumplings - just tip of the bowl!. We had a brief stay in Hong Kong over the New Year period and friends had recommended the Central & Sheung Wan Tour. We were not disappointed! It was our first full day in Hong Kong and a fabulous way to travel streets we would not have ventured into had we been exploring independently. Our guide Lillian was charming, witty and very knowledgeable, sharing not only information about the variety of different food, but a lot of information about the history and culture that makes Hong Kong such an incredible city. From Wonton Soup to Egg Tarts, with much in between, this tour is a must for any traveller to Hong Kong.

central and sheung wan tour. I cannot speak highly enough about this experience. Every aspect of this was very well executed and thoroughly explained in advance so I knew exactly what to expect. this was by far my favorite tour ive taken in any country. when I arrived for my tour it was a small group of just myself and one other person and I really loved this because we took our time at each stop and our amazing guide Lillian took her time to talk to us about the history of the city and the places we visited. she also went above and beyond and gave me some great recommendations of places to see for the rest of my time in hong kong. I felt she was extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and witty. im so glad that I did this tour at the beginning of my trip know I now know where to explore and what to look for when searching for places to eat. 10/10 wonderful experience and I would highly highly recommend this to anyone visiting hong kong!

AWESOME TOUR EVEN MORE AWESOME GUIDE. Being my first time in HK I wanted to experience something local and this tour was just what I asked for and even more. The guide, whom by the way was one of the most funny and smart girls I've ever met, (thatnks Fiona) takes you to the everyday Hong Kong, opening doors that you would pass by as a tourist or wouldn't dare to enter.However, this tour is really well planned so everything you eat is "approachable". A really good taste of Hong Kong's local cuisine.

ONE OF THE BEST EXPERIENCES YOU CAN HAVE IN HONG KONG. We got Fiona as a guide. She is perfectly articulated in English and she has an amazing sense of humor. Her approach to food its very sensitive and gives you a great perspective of the food and today Hong Kong's society.

A Great Way to Learn More About Hong Kong. I went on the Sham Shui Po tour with my sister, brother, and my brother's friend. My brother and his friend both live/have lived in Hong Kong for nearly 10 years and my sister and I have been to Hong Kong over 15 times. And even then, none of us had tried all the foods on the tour. I felt like we didn't just try new foods, but also learned a good deal about an area of Hong Kong that I was unfamiliar with. Sylvana was an outstanding and helpful guide. I would also like to point out how much I appreciate the sign up - it makes it easy to separate who has what food allergy or restriction. If every food tour used the same form as their Hong Kong counterpart, it would be much, much easier. I hope to take the Tai Po market tour on my next visit to Hong Kong. Thank you for such a great time!

What a great way to experience Hong Kong. This was our first trip to Hong Kong and we were a little worried about knowing what to select to eat. This was a great first day in Hong Kong Tour. Our guide, Cliff, was great. He not only introduced us to traditional foods of the area but provided us with a great history lesson of the area, also pointing out architecture, sites and additional restaurants to visit. This is a walking tour so be prepared to log some miles, but you take lots of breaks and sit down at the restaurants so there is plenty of time to rest. One caveat...there are a lot of hills and stairs,steps, etc in Hong Kong in the central area where we toured. If you have some mobility restrictions, you might want to chose one of their other tours. (they have foodie tours in other areas of Hong Kong with fewer steps and flatter terrain) We enjoyed every minute of the tour and even went back the next day to sample a little more of the food. They provide you with a great map, pictures and the appropriate names of the food so if nothing else...just point to the picture. I would highly recommend Hong Kong Foodie if you want a fun, personal tour (group sizes are kept small) of Central Hong Kong. We learned so much from Cliff and enjoyed all of his stories.

Great food, history, architecture and culture in one wonderful package!. We researched the various "food" tours available and using the TA network, came down on the Sheung Wan/Central Foodies Tour. Our group of ten was lead by Lilian- a truly delightful host as mentioned in many other reviews of this company. Firstly, the preliminary information provided on the tour outline, directions to the meeting place etc. were extremely well written and easily followed. Everyone was there on time and we set off on our food walk around Sheung Wan and Central. What I had not appreciated was that the establishments chosen were all very old family owned businesses, generally in heritage buildings, and providing classic Hong Kong dishes popular with the local inhabitants. A broad range of menus were covered; wonton soup, roast pork (yum yum)and dim sum. We also visited a specialty Chinese sweet shop and tasted a range of dried fruit and the very interesting stop at the one remaining sugar cane juice shop.Lillian really makes this tour very special. She has a great knowledge of the food scene in HK and was able to provide us with many useful tips for the remainder of our stay. She is charming and warm and has a great sense of humor. The ideal leader for a tour like this. Very few will be disappointed with the Foodies Tour- full marks Lillian!

Culinary delights round every corner! . We've just returned from a fascinating & delicious Central tour with Lilian & would highly recommend it to anyone looking to scratch beneath the surface of Hong Kong. The pace & length of the tour were just right & took us round some intriguing neighbourhoods, with plenty of tasty refuel stops en route! Lilian was amusing, informative and gave detailed answers to all our questions. A great way to spend a few hours exploring.

An excellent tour led by an excellent guide showcasing yummy local Hong Kong cuisine. I wish I had done this food tour earlier in my trip but due to availability and the days I was staying in Hong Kong that wasn't possible. Nonetheless I was really happy I went on this excellent food tour led by our guide, Silvana who was excellent. The tour took us to 6 different places showcasing local Hong Kong cuisine. The venues were generally family run, some for many generations and were authentic in that regard. The food was excellent as well, I really enjoyed the array of food. I'd definitely recommend this tour as an excellent way to experience a little of Hong Kong. We also received a pamphlet of other restaurants we could check out too.

Kristin H: Excellent Tour. Having been to Hong Kong several times, I decided to try the Central and Sheung Wan Foodie Tour and it was amazing. Lilian our guide was very knowledgeable about the area and took us to places that I would never have thought to go to and told us about the different changes going on. Now I know where to go the next time I visit Hong Kong. Thank you Lilian!

Fun Foodie HK tour. As a resident of HK for 8 plus years I thought I knew most of the good eating spots! My sister came to visit and we had a fun and informative tour with Ed. Not only did we eat delicious staples of the HK diet, Ed shared lots of insight on the markets, the impact of the aggressive urban renewal plans and introduced us to several family run businesses and market traders. Since the tour I have been back to the majority of the restaurants and to the market stalls. Thanks Ed..I will be brining all my guests on your tour!

Very interesting food tour.. Our morning spent in Sham Shui Po with our lively guide, Fiona, was time well spent. We talked about food, history and social change in this interesting area of Hong Kong. I enjoyed each tasting and learned a lot along the way. I felt this tour was good value.

A Nice food tour. Went on a Group tour in Sham Shui Po, Hong kong. Our guide was nice and well prepared, and her English was very good. The portions were of good size and nothing was to weird, it all tasted nice. This tour would be a good thing to do at the start of your visit as you get some information about the food and culture and you have a local (the guide) you can ask questions you might have. The tour was quite long, maybe longer than necessary. Sometimes it felt like we were just walking around the block to fill the time. That being said, I enjoyed walking around, also to let the food sink between the meals. Thumbs up for getting us on a tour on a short notice (the day before) and for affordable prices. One area that could be improved was the facts the guide told us about this and that at several 'stops'. The guide could have chosen far more interesting subjects, for instance more about China, Hong Kongs history etc. Her rehearsed 'facts' were very local and not that interesting, like 'here it used to be a pawnshop, but it's not anymore. Ok, lets move on to the next stop'. Maybe we could have spent longer time at each stop, just talking and getting to know each other better. Any ways, we don't regret doing this tour and it was probably the best thing we did in Hong Kong.

Superb!. An excellent food tour in Sham Shui Po with an even more excellent guide, Fiona! A very appropriate mix of adventureus tastings and more ordinary snacks. The guide was well prepared and very knowledgable. Overall, the tour well worth its price!

Outstanding!. This food tour is outstanding. Yammy's local knowledge of Hong Kong's food scene (and the city in general!) is incredible. We visited six restaurants, each with carefully selected dishes, and it was the perfect introduction to one of the truly great food cities of the world!

Sham Shui Po Foodie Tour. Let me say that we loved the tour and thought the guide, Fiona, was wonderful. It was an important juxtaposition to see this other side of Hong Kong where many of the less fortunate locals live. However, for us, eating the food was not a highlight. The highlight was seeing all the markets and hearing the stories from Fiona. Just be aware that if you are not an adventurous foodie you might want to fill up on the first two stops.

Food with a great insight into Hong Kong history and culture . We did the Hong Kong foodie tour with Silvana. It was one of the best things we did in our 3 day visit. We should have done it at the start of the holiday as we would certainly have gone back to the tasting places again. They were all excellent. Aside from dim sum and won ton soup (some of the best we've ever had) we experienced things we would not have tried or been able to find on our own.Aside from the really good food, and drinks, we learnt a huge amount about the area going back in Hong King history to now, with all the changes that have happened and continue to happen.A small group size made it manageable in the busy city streets.It happened to be raining hard for our tour - but it didn't matter it was excellent. You would have just as good time in the dry, so don't be disappointed if it's not raining when you go!

A Necessary Experience for any Foodie. Over my three day stay in Hong Kong I took both the Central Tour and Sham Shui Po tours. The central tour was an incredible introduction to Hong King cuisine combined with a historical overview of the area. My favorite was the best noodle soup I've ever had with a splash of black vinegar. So good.The Sham Shui Po tour took us to a very cool more local area of Hong Kong where we wound through some very interesting streets tasting some off the beaten path foods. The Pineapple buns and milk tea where a standout here.Sadly we weren't here long enough to take the third tour to the new territories but we certainly will the next time we're in town. Thank you Fiona and Silvana for two wonderful days tasting our way through Hong Kong.

Best Food Tour in Hong Kong!. We took the Sham Shui Po food tour and it was definitely one of the highlights of our time in Hong Kong. As big fans of Asian Cuisine, the food did not disappoint, and our fantastic tour guide Fiona gave some great insight into the history and culinary culture of the area. Highly recommended!

Great way to experience local culture! . We (myself and my friend) had just two nights in Hong Kong and this tour made us feel like we really experienced the city and it's culture. The Sham Shui tour takes you right into the heart of Kowloon and we visited places you would never know about unless you lived there. Fiona was a fantastic tour guide- the right balance of information, history and anecdotes, she shared things which only a true local would know. Fiona was also very considerate about having breaks/pitstops and ensuring you had water and tissues etc.The food was fab and we sampled flavours which, once again, you might not have found for yourself. But I won't spoil the surprise!!

Fantastic foodie tour!! . My Husband and I did the tour in Nov and Lilian was our guide. She was extremely knowledge and the places we went to were simply great. Very local and we had the best roast pork ever at one of the stops.
