No English, but there was a photo of Samantha Brown with the owners in the window. Also a write-up and photo of an apparently famous and respected Chinese food critic. We started the tasting with pickled turnips, then had egg noodles with shrimp roe and broth served alongside. The noodles are hand-made with a bamboo pole by the owners at home. The shrimp roe was a new taste for me, a bit bracing but far more pleasant than Chinese dried shrimp, which I do not care for. Others were not so enthused. Non-tasting stops included wet market streets with noodle shops and shops selling dried things, including a dried gecko-like reptile splayed out on a stick like a fan. We stopped at a kitchen supply store featuring knives of many shapes. The area has a lot of notions shops (buttons, ribbon, fabric, etc.), some pawnshops, local clothing stores and phone/electronics stores and stands (including a discount electronics mall). We also stopped at a snake shop that served snake soup and snakes in cages awaiting slaughter. Fiona also stopped and discussed the difficult housing situation for the city's poor, showing pics on her phone of "cage houses"--stacked cages meant to house large animals that some humans call home. Quite distressing, especially after seeing renovated loft buildings in Central that rent for $75,000 HKD monthly, and a tacky pink Bentley whose garage space rent isprobably nearly as costly.Overall, very worthwhile tours. I would try to do one or the other at the beginning of your visit, so you can return to the places visited. Plus, you'll learn about so much more than food on these tours, about this always fascinating, always frenetic, always changing (not necessarily for the better) city.

A good thing to do with guests. I decided to take my guests on this walking tour for something fun and different to do. The food was good and the experience as a whole very enjoyable. As someone who lives here, I enjoyed finding local restaurants and seeing a different part of the city than I normally do. My guests had a great time eating local food and learning some city history. Fun, fun!

nom noms. I did this tour a while back and even though I live in Hong Kong, I really recommend it, especially for ex pats. They recommend places that you can go back to and are actually quite cheap so you can feasibly eat there regularly. Hong Kong has an obvious high end culinary scene but it isnt that easy to randomly find delicious local eateries that are not laden with MSG

Excellent intro. I can only echo all the great comments below. We booked on the walking tour for the day we arrived in Hong kong (as others on here had suggested to do it on day one). It really is a great introduction to the history and food of the area. We revisited many of the locations on subsequent days and tried different foods as recommended by the guides. The tour is much more than just the tastings. I particularly enjoyed the section at the fruit and veg stall as it introduced us to many new veg most of which we then went on to eat throughout our trip. Very highly recommended.

Great Tours. Did Central and Sham Shui Po tours back to back with Savannah. I feel stuffed, lol. Great tours full of information and good food. Look forward to doing your New Territories tour if it starts before I leave. You guys should do guided tours to the food museum: Tao Heung Museum. I signed up for their tour on Sunday but it's in Cantonese.

Like a local - foodie tour Hong Kong. There is so much choice when it comes to food here in Hong Kong but if you are not a local deciding where you should eat can be both challenging and confusing. The foodie tour (central and sheung wan) took us to some excellent family run restaurants and shops where the food on offer (wonton noodle soup, barbecued pork, pork and shrimp dumpling and crispy bbq pork bun, egg tart) were outstanding examples of the slow food movement still available in Hong Kong. Not only did the tour help me understand Cantonese cooking better, it also provided some history of the area, a tour of the wet markets, an opportunity to learn more about fish maw, shark fin, dried scallops and mushrooms, the medicinal qualities of turtle soup and why drinking sugar cane juice is good for sore throats. Our two young guides were excellent and the walk through central and sheung wan was a fabulous way to feel a tiny bit more prepared for all that Hong Kong has to offer. Highly recommended.

Sham Shui Po foodie tour.. Just recently done this tour with local guide Silvana.I was worried to start with as I was the only person on the tour this day.But my thoughts were soon put to ease as Silvana showed me around the sights, sounds and smells of Sham Shui Po district. After a while it didn't feel like I was on a tour, but more the feeling I was been shown around the area by a friend passionate about her city. This I must say made the day very enjoyable. I recommend that you DON'T eat any food before you start this tour as even after the first food stop you start to fill up quickly.Thanks to Silvana for making this a experience one of my greatest highlights of my stay in Hong Kong.

Interesting for local info as well as the food. Enjoyed the food and the walk but particularly enjoyed the enthusiasm of the 2 young guides in their sharing information about the history and changes to Hong Kong's living and possibly disappearing local street culture

Awesomeness!! . This was a really awesome food tour. I had taken another food tour previously with another group and it was horrible compared to this one. Obviously, through my experience, they are the only licensed operating food tour in HK and its completely obvious. professionalism at its best. Sylvanna was our guide and she exuded professionalism in every aspect. Food history, cultural aspects of HK. Slyvanna understood not only what to eat but how to eat. Every course was filling, sweet, savory at its desire timing. Even when we visited the restaurants, there was no long waiting and the food was ready for us. Overall this was really awesome and the food was sooo delish. All of it!!! Highly recommended!!

Awesome tour.. Sylvana and Ed were awesome tour guides on the Sheung Wan foodie tour. We got not just a flavor of some of the local foods but also slices of history from the various places we walked. It's clear they care deeply about the culture of Hong Kong, some of which is disappearing quicker than one might realize.The food selection was perfect, from portions, to variety, to timing. I was proudly able to return the next day on my own and order char siu faan knowing that I would be eating something delicious. Not only is this a highly recommended tour but you'd be supporting great people in a great city.

A Must for Foodies. We went on the Central tour with Lillian who was excellent. The best advice I can give anyone going on this excellent tour is not to eat lunch and do not make any dinner reservations as you probably won't need those either.Inspiring, relaxed and highly informative this tour is a must for any foodie wanting to get a good intoduction into Cantonese cuisine. We were taken to restaurants and shops that normally we would never have entered and tasted simply delicious food.We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and highly recomment this.

First class all round. We were on the Central tour on Monday afternoon with Sylvana and it was excellent in every way and something I will recommend to anyone who asks!It was so nice to go to genuine family run, third and fourth generation places all with a little history.The food was beautiful, the quantities well balanced so you were not overloaded with food. I still am savouring the tastes in my mouth - even the cane juice which I thought I would not like was delicious. Sylvana was a first class guide, so knowledgeable and the tour not only takes you to six eating spots, but you have Sylvana giving you the stories of the shops, the changes in the area, the challenges long established family businesses have with rents etc. the walk through the wet market was especially interesting though sad to hear next time I return to Hong Kong it will no longer be a street market and the area will have been redeveloped into trendy cafes.I have some slight walking difficulties on steps (there were very few) but Sylvana took time to check I was ok with the walking pace, which I was, but it was nice to be asked.I am so glad I found out about this tour here and I plan to do the other tour on my next visit. All arrangements are perfect with very good email communication in place etc So if you are thinking should I book or not the answer is, yes yes yes

The No#1 Foodie tour in HK!. My boyfriend and I were lucky enough to secure a last minute space on the Central Foodie Tour. Cecilia contacted us via text to advise that there had been a cancellation and that we could make the afternoon tour. We were so excited and were very impressed with the prompt response we received via email and text. We secured our booking through a PayPal payment and we were then sent a confirmation with the location on where we were to meet. There is usually a total of 12 people on every tour which allows for opportunity to meet with other tourists and locals on the tour. Make sure you have good comfortable walking shoes and that you do not have a heavy bag or handbag to lug around as the tour lasts for approximately 3-4 hours. If you are not a big eater I would recommend to not eat breakfast and just have a coffee/tea before you join the tour. Also don't forget to tip your tour guide at the end of the tour. Enjoy!

Central and Shueng Wan Tour. Amazing!! Do it when you first arrive in Hong Kong. It was relaxed and informative and encompassed not only incredible food tasting and restaurant experiences, but also gave us an insight into recent and past culture and life in Hong Kong. Lillian was a fabulous guide. The food, selected from local, family businesses with their own histories and most importantly integrity was truly delicious. The wontons amazing, the roasted meat sublime, and the most surprising delight, the preserved fruits were sensational. The dim sum and egg tarts were fabulous. The whole tour managed our gluten intolerance with discretion and care and provided us with tasty delights that in no way seemed lesser than what the other participants had to eat. This tour is highly recommended!! Thank you for a relaxing and insightful experience.
Wonderful afternoon in Hong Kong!. Wonderful experience visiting family run businesses and tasting great food in conjunction with experiencing the city and its market on foot.

Great tour!. I was on the Sham Shui Po tour with Fiona and it was fabulous! I lived in Hong Kong for a number of years and was very happy to learn lots of new things about the area. I would recommend this tour to visitors interested in tasting and learning about the Sham Shui Po neighborhood and various classic Hong Kong foods.

Wonderful tour, helpful and knowledgeable guide. I have lived in Hong Kong for just over 2 years, but decided to sign up for this tour with Fiona since my brother was visiting Hong Kong with his family for the first time. From Hong Kong milk tea to roast goose, we all enjoyed nearly every dish (perhaps excepting the pork knuckles). It was a great tour for those who know a bit about Hong Kong but don't know how the food is made, or are not aware of the everyday lives of people at the lower end of the social spectrum (our tour introduced us to everything from shared apartment living and the illegal purveyors of items like roasted chestnuts to some of the most popular small restaurants - some including Michelin stars). Our guide, Fiona, exuded enthusiasm for Hong Kong and was willing to discuss any topic that came into our heads. With one vegetarian and a couple of small children in tow, she did not have an easy task but kept us all well fed, happy and entertained -- and we learned quite a bit too! I highly recommend the Hong Kong Foodie Shamshuipo tour.

More than just food!. We took this tour with Sylvana a few days ago and we can only echo the praises of the other reviewers.What sets this tour apart from other food tours is that it is also rich in history. Walking through various neighborhoods we sampled excellent food from family restaurant prepared for us while we were there. But what added to the value was that we also heard about the history of the families that operate the restaurant as well as the areas where they are located.The tour is very well planned out. The stops are timed perfectly - just when you are ready for a little snack and to get off your feet.We try to take a tour like this in every new city we visit. This was one of the best.

Great Food Tour. Tour with our guide, Cliff, was really great. We had a lot of fun and learned about the food and history of Hong Kong. Would highly recommend. The food was great and we will definitely go back to the restaurants we visited on the tour to eat again.

Best thing we did in HK. We loved this interesting and fun tour through some great restaurants and cafes and cultural parts of HK. All of the food was amazing and all from family businesses. As well as the food we wandered through interesting streets and markets and learnt about the past, present and future of Hong Kong from our local guide. A really enjoyable afternoon. Highly recommend!

Beautifully choreographed. I like good food, but when I first saw that this tour was 3.5 hours long and visiting 6 locations, I had a moment of panic that we would all be waddling around the city like overly-stuffed turkeys, ending the day with a terrible case of indigestion. I couldn't have been more wrong! The tour is beautifully paced to give us time to digest between the heavy courses, and I ended the day feeling pleasantly satisfied. Sylvana was truly knowledgable about traditional Chinese philosophies on food, and wove that into the day as well. We had two expats on our tour who had lived in HK for 3 years... and even THEY learned new things about the cuisine.I highly recommend this tour.

Great food !!. My wife and I throughly enjoyed this. The guide was very informative not only with the food but with all our journey on the our , pointing out so many interesting locations and their history. This is a must experience !!

Exceeded expectations. Sylvana Thank you for being such a wonderful guide, attentive to all and highly informative a great source of knowledge that you shared in such a way it was easy to understand. Each stop on the Central and Sheung Wan tour had something delicious to offer along with a story to tell. Although a fair amount of walking involved it didn't feel like it as we went along. (You definitely don't need to be very fit either) Will highly be recommending this tour to anyone else that visits Hong Kong. Has definitely been the highlight of our trip. The added bonus of history and cultural knowledge that was shared made the tour more than just trying some food. Can't wait to have some more sugar cane juice (hot and cold they taste delicious but so very different) I could write on and on about the 3.5hr experience but I think I've got my point across. If you're thinking of doing it, stop thinking and book!! Nat and Sarah from Australia

Education can be very tasty. Just finished our tour with Silvana. So much fun, great food, lots of history, interesting places to see. Silvana has genuine love for traditional food, culture, history. So sad to realize old, traditional places are going, almost gone, like Wet Market has 2 years at most, then it will never be the same. I'd say - come and see, eat, explore while you can.

Very educational food tour. Just did the Sham Shui Po Foodie tour with Fiona. She's a very knowledgeable, intelligent, gracious tour guide. This is a tour of the "old" Hong Kong. Don't expect luxury malls or big seafood restaurants on this tour. Go on this tour to learn more about Hong Kong culture, traditional ways of doing things (e.g., hand-sharpened knives, hand-pulled noodles), and little-known facts about charming, overlooked (?) Sham Shui Po. It's a little off the beaten path. But not too exotic to drive away first-time Hong Kong tourists. This is the real Hong Kong mall! I went to Elements Mall the other day and it's just like any other high-end glossy shopping mall -- might as well be in Dubai or Malaysia or Singapore; I would never know the difference. Bring your appetite, an open mind, an adventurous spirit, and a cheerful acceptance of a culture that may be different from yours. Bottle of water and tissue provided on tour. Would love to do the Central Foodie tour next time, only with Fiona of course.

So much fun- will do the Sham Shui Po Tour next time!. This was one of the highlights of my first trip to HK. Even though I have friends that could recommend great places to eat, bc there are a gazillion restaurants that are tucked away in little corners, it was really nice to have someone to guide me to the best that HK has to offer. Plus the tour guides are knowledgeable about the history of these dishes came to be which speaks to HK's unique history. My favorite was the sugar cane juice and the egg tart (to die for ^^) My group was small, only 4 of us, so we were able to get to know each other and ask lots of questions. Highly recommended!!

Highlight of our trip. We did the Sheung Wan foodie tour and it was fantastic! The food was the best we tasted all week. And our guide was friendly, very knowledgeable, and good with English. She not only brought us to exquisite food, she taught us a great deal about Hong Kong history, culture and, of course, food. Our only regret is that we waited until the end of our trip to do it; had we done it at the beginning, we would have been able to go back to those restaurants! If you like food, this is an awesome way to spend an afternoon!
A real taste of Hong Kong. I loved the mix of sightseeing and visiting family owned local restaurants to sample their wares, excellent value and well worth it.

Great for the first time visitor to Hong Kong. We enjoyed a "grown up foodie" tour around Central/Sheung Wan on 1st Nov. The food was delicious but then it is hard to get bad food in Hong Kong (HK). The tour is a lot about the culture as well as food. We have visited HK previously and are reasonably adventurous travelers so perhaps our expectations were a bit too high for this tour but then we were there for the food more than the walk via markets, historic buildings etc. Food was superb, the tour was OK but not spectacular. Great for the first time visitor and a good introduction to HK life so if you have never been to HK or experienced Chinese/HK culture this is well worth doing. Yummy staple food, clean foodie places and knowledgeable guide. Pretty easy walking, not a lot of distance covered, and lots of stops. Pretty 'english-i-fied' tour in wealthy area so I would like to try the tour these guys do on mainland HK as we really love wandering the back streets of Mong Kok where you do step back in time. We are also pretty adventurous with food and so we thought the food we tasted on this tour was faultless, but mainstream. However the places you visit on this tour you will go back to I am sure.... the baked pork buns were special!

Outstanding!. We enjoyed the Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour with Silvana and Lilian on Nov. 15, 2014. Our guides were extremely knowledgeable & very personable. It was a wonderful introduction to local food & culture of the city. The restaurants chosen were excellent and family owned. This was more than a "tasting." And we loved the "Wet Market" tour. Fantastic! This is a must! Gary & Caryle, Tucson, AZ USA

Worth every Hong Kong dollar. My wife and I did the Sham Shui Po tour on 19 Sep 2015. Everything from the first email to the last mouthful of food was very professional. Sylvana was our guide for the day and had a very in depth knowledge of the area and food. Her English was excellent. The places we visited you could have just walked past and never had known they were there. The true secret was how to eat the food and what condiment was used when and how. Not just eat what was in front of you. I would highly recommend the Foodie tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong. Excellent service. Thanks Foodie tours.

Very worthwhile. I did the Central and Sheung Wan Foodie tour on 5 Nov 2014. There were 11 people in our group. Our tour guide Silvana was excellent. She was very well informed about the places that we visited as well as some of the history of the area. It was evident that she is very passionate about food and the history of HK food. The dishes and drinks we tasted were delicious and i enjoyed the variety.

Yummy. The walking food tour was awesome. We went to multiple family owned restaurants and got to try variety of yummy foods! We also visited local markets. Our tour guide was great and very knowledgeable. She gave us historical background information on the foods, restaurants, and Hong Kong.This is must while in Hong Kong!

Our Perfect Introduction to Hong Kong. We participated in Sylvana's Oct. 13, 2014 Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour. It truly was a perfect culinary intro to the tastes and essences of this unique city. The diversity of the tastings was spot on. Sylvana's leadership to the various "out of the way" long time established shops was amazing. Not only did we obtain a delicious intro to the various foods made famous in HK, Sylvana gave us an understanding of the culture as well. We highly recommend this organization for their professionalism, knowledge and the warmth exhibited from every email to the end result!

SPECTACULAR.. NO OTHER WORDS...... Booked this half day tour and was one of the BEST things that I did during my week in Hong Kong.The tour guide was amazing, knew all of the great locations, gave us the the history of the areas we walked through, explained the significance of the food, vendors, etc..This is a MUST DO when you are in Hong Kong.. That simple, no exceptions...Worth every penny!!!!!!

Great tour with excellent guides. We joined this tour on October 27th. The guides were very personable and highly knowledgeable. They provided in depth information on the food and the owners of the selected restaurants/shops. The variety of foods was really well planned. The guides also provided good background information on some of the cultural sites on tour. Highly recommend

fantastic guided tour gets you to places you wouldn't find otherwise. Sylvana and Lillian have a fantastic depth of knowledge, not only of the food of Hong Kong, but also the local history. The tour is well paced so you don't have to worry about over eating.All in all a fantastic tour that we would thoroughly recommend, we'll be back next time we visit this vibrant city

Great Value. This was a highlight of our trip to Hong Kong. Great way to spend an afternoon. A wonderful local guide, Sylvana, who took us to small family run businesses, and advised us on so much more that only enhanced our time in this great city.

A great way to start any visit to Hong Kong. My wife and I did the Central tour with Cliff. It was the first day of our first ever visit to Hong Kong and it was the perfect way to get under the skin of this amazing city. Cliff took us to 6 different family run businesses and we sampled very different foods in each place. Together they made a wonderful meal and we felt we had seen a great cross-section of the island. There was nothing that we didn't like. In addition Cliff gave us some useful information on the history and culture of the place. We now have a lot more confidence of where to go, and what to ask for, to get great food. Really recommended.

Tasting the historic history and foods of Hong Kong.......... My wife and I are frequent travelers and our experience with the food tour with our gracious host Silvana was simply perfection. Many of the food tastings we had already experienced throughout our travels, but tasting the rich history that Hong Kong has to offer was memorable. We really enjoyed the then and now history of the island. Highly recommended for the first night in Hong Kong, because the day after our tour we went to various restaurants and sites Silvana highly recommended from our tour. Thanks for the memorable experience!!!

2 Tour Review. We did both the Sham Shui Po and Central & Sheung Wan food tours. Both tours were very informative from both the food and historical perspective. The tour guides were so open and friendly and extremely knowledgeable. Both tours were great, but our morning Sham Shui Po tour had only 6 people and for that reason we slightly preferred our experience - and Fiona our guide who was doing her first tour did an amazing job!

Fantastic authentic experience. My husband and I did the Central tour with Cliff which was really well organised, visited family run places, no MSG, great historic stories, cultural tips - would thoroughly recommend!

Do this tour early and do both. We did the central tour our first full day in Hong Kong. They start at an odd time but I believe that is to miss the lunch crowds. So skip lunch and go hungry there is a lot of food to try.Not only do you get great food you get explanations of the places you are eating at and why and a little history of the city itself. Perfect. You will go to places you will want to go back to and they give you other recommendations throughout the city as well.Next day was the Kowloon tour. We tried things we normally wouldn't have and enjoyed it very much. It's a great way to get introduced to both parts of this great city.We had a different guide for each tour and they both were very pleasant and spoke excellent English.

Great food and culture experience. We did the Hong Kong foodie tour during our 2 day cruise stop. It was so worth it. The guide was informative and walked us through areas we would have otherwise probably never seen. It piqued our interest so much that we went back to some of the neighborhoods the following day. There were six venues and the food was delicious, the store owners gracious and our over all experience proved more than we expected....thank you foodies.

You don't have to be a "foodie" to enjoy. History, food and fun!. Really liked this walking tour, and agree with the comments from other reviewers - well organized, interesting, informative. A few more comments: I did this tour on my own as my husband is here on business (and I took time off to see the other side of the world!). Being a solo traveler can be intimidating for some, but the tour guides were very welcoming, and I was part of a nice group of about 12 from all over the world. NOTE: You can specify dietary restrictions when you book (i.e. no pork, no eggs, etc).That said, the food on the tour was interesting and tasty - we had 6 stops in the 3.5 hour tour in two different neighborhoods - we tried shrimp wontons/noodles, BBQ pork, sugar cane juice, dried fruits, dim sum (4 different dishes) and, finally, egg tart, which was shockingly good. In addition to foodie insights, the guides - who speak perfect English - gave insights about HK history, culture and day-to-day life. I would suggest skipping lunch and come hungry - the portions are big. By stop 5 of 6, I was full! NOTE: There was a good amount of walking, a few hills, but nothing too hard. TIP: It's also a good idea to do this tour early in your visit to HK as it will give you great options to go back for a complete meal and to check out the neighborhoods and shop. And, finally, wear comfy shoes, bring extra water, and get your camera ready! Go forth and EAT! :)

Great Hong Kong Foodie Tour. We did the FOODIE Tour on Hong Kong Island .... It was great. There were 6 stops wandering amongst the streets on HK. The guide was very knowledgable and took us to places that were interesting and had great food. I had no idea that there was so much in these little back streets, but the walking and information was a great insight as well as the food. The portions were not large, so worth having a snack before you go. But would highly recommend it to anyone. Wasn't that hard but a reasonable amount of walking. And easy to get to and return home ... Last stop is by the station so you can easy get home no matter where you are staying.Really worth doing !!!

An excellent food, culture and history experience. The Hong Kong Foodie Tour is a well designed and well led tour of an interesting variety of food (wonton soup, pork bbq, dim sum, egg tarts) and drink (refreshing cane juice and fruit tea) along with excellent commentary on Chinese food culture and Hong Kong history. Highly recommended.

Great way to experience the city. We really enjoyed the food tour. The meeting place was easy to find and Savannah was very knowledgeable about the city and the food. You definitely do not leave this tour hungry...the food is paced out nicely which allows you time to enjoy each stop. You are also provide with a guide on places to visit on your own after the tour. I highly recommend doing the tour the first day you arrive in the city. A highlight of the tour was the walk through the wet market and seeing parts of the city that we wouldn't have found on our own.

a must do if visiting hong kong. We did the Hong Kong Foodie Tour yesterday and enjoyed every minute of it. First, we were taken to a Wonton Noodle place for the best noodles I have ever had. They even showed us the kitchen which was very clean. Then to a roast meat restaurant where we have BBQ pork, again cooked on the premises. As we continued to walk, our guide talked about the history of the various areas we walked through. We then had sugar cane juice followed by Dim Sums and custard tarts. All the places we were taken were out of the way and unless we had done this food tour we were not know they existed but be left to the over priced restaurants that tourists crowd to. My only regret is we did not do the tour the first day we arrived as this would have given us a whole lot more options and understanding of where to eat.I simply can't praise this tour enough and urge very one visiting Hong Kong to do the same as you will not be sorry. Do this tour as soon as you arrive and really open the doors of Hong Kong food for yourselves.

Fun in Hong Kong. This was a great way to spend 3 hours plus in Hong Kong. We did the Central & Sheung Wan tour and were most impressed with both the food tastings & the cultural experience. Our tour leader was Silvana & she was great. We went to unique places with history in Hong Kong & the quality of the food they offered was the reason these businesses were still trading. The variety was amazing - wonton, bbq, unique juices & fruits to name a few. Interesting stories about the city as we walked were fascinating. There is a fair bit of walking sometimes on quite steep streets but although we are on older couple we had no problems. A good idea is to go early in your stay so that you can go back to these places.We have done food tours in many places across Europe & this one is right up there with the best of them. Highly recommended.

Good way to explore Hong Kong. We found a recommendation on tripadvisor and decided to join the tour on a Saturday afternoon. The meeting point was perfectly described and easy to find. We got a warm welcome by our tourguide Cliff. Shortly after we took of to explore the 6 foodie places. It was a good variety of food, drinks and sweets. 4 hours that run by quickly. A good tour which I would definitely recommend and choose again!

A bite sized view of Hong Kong culture. We thoroughly enjoyed a personalised tour of the back streets of HK with Cliff our excellent Hong Kong Foodie Tasting tours guide. Interesting tidbits from current affairs to the origins and history of places and food visited was fantastic. Will revisit some if not all of the gastronomic stops again but this time as a knowledgable guide to friends! Definitely recommend this experience!

Fantastic tour and experience. I did the Sham Shui Po Foodie tour with my wife and 3 kids (9 years, 6 years and 23 months) and was incredibly impressed. The tour combined food tasting with an insight into Hong Kong life in Sham Shui Po as well as behind the scenes look at the restaurants and shops in the locality. It is a tour for anyone who is a foodie at heart, and doesn't just like authentic food, but also is interested in how history and societal changes affect the food. We visited about 6 restaurants starting with breakfast and ending with lunch in authentic places. A number of restaurants I would never walk in to by myself as a tourist but once inside the food was fantastic. My kids loved the rice rolls, pineapple (crispy) bun and roast goose and all the restaurants visited were very accommodating of kids - however none had a high chair. Also, most of the restaurants were tiny and couldn't fit a pram which had to be left on the street. Having said that, it was always safe and could be stored in the doorway of most the restaurants. The tour guides were Savannah and Fiona who were well versed with all aspects of the local area. They also provided recommendations for additional restaurants and shopping options. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting HK.

Central and Sheung Wan Foodie Tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour. It was a perfect blend of cultural and historical information with the pleasure of wonderful authentic food. Silvana was extremely knowledgable and patient and the tour was paced just right. I would definitely recommend this great experience!!!

Fantastic slice of Hong Kong Life. We recently took the Sham Shui Po HK Foodie tasting tour. What a great time was had by all - Our guide and host Silvana provided not only a 3 ¼ hour gastronomic and historical tour, but given the ongoing events of the time - a little bit of an insight into both the politics and underlying deeper socio / economics issues. All of which offered a slice of Hong Kong life off of the beaten tourist track. This tour provided an insight (and taste) of small family run businesses - many of whom are being squeezed by rising rents and real estate prices (the eye watering real estate prices make Malibu almost affordable by comparison). But I'm guessing that ultimately food tours stand or fall by the quality and variety of food - and so with super comfort food such as rice rolls and congee; a tofu dessert to die for, fresh soy milk the taste unlike any from a supermarket back home; braised goose and pork knuckle; and finally egg noodle with shrimp roe to die for (not to mention the century egg pastry!)A foodie tour of a city is always on our must do list and IMHO the HK Foodie tasting tour is the best I've been on and sets a new benchmark. I can't recommend this tour highly enough.And yes, we saved the cookies for much, much later!

Great tour with family. My family (two boys aged 9 and 12) did the Sham Shui Po (probably spelt that incorrectly!) tour with these folks a couple of weeks ago. Was a fantastic tour with visits to some amazingly authentic places. Unfortunately it was a baking hot day which made it a little challenging in wanting to wander the streets but also wanting to stay out of the sun.The stops were great and the little places in between we walked past very good. Well worthwhile to go and see how things in Hong Kong are off the beaten path of Central/ Kowloon

Brilliant. The one thing I had a burning desire to day whilst we were visiting Hong Kong, was a food tour. This tour did not disappoint. Silvana was friendly, knowledgable and engaging. There were so many aspects of this tour that were really great. I love that we were taken to some out of the way places to try traditional cuisine, but were treated to foods that would appeal to a 'western' palette- nothing too strange or unusual, but traditional none-the-less. I loved that it was more than just a food tour, it was an interesting history tour as well. There was a period of walking and soaking up the history in between the eating, which was very necessary to try and make room for the next stop! I only wide that we had time to try the other tour offered around Kowloon. Next time! This tour was my favourite thing about our visit to Hong Kong.

Wonderful foodie tour with Hong Kong Foodie. My adult son and I love trying new foods. While in Hong Kong, we wanted to learn about and try Hong Kong foods. We took the Hong Kong Foodie tour one afternoon. It was wonderful. Our guide not only took us to several mom and pop restaurants where the food was prepared at the restaurant (with special ovens), we toured several "wet" markets to learn about typical foods. We also learned about Hong Kong culture regarding food. We had many types of food-shrimp won tons, shrimp and pork dumplings, fried buns stuffed with pork, bbq goose, duck and chicken, soups, egg tarts, freshly made sugar cane juice, dried fruits, etc. It was an excellent choice to use this tour service. I highly recommend them.

Amazing!! . I've done a couple of food tours in Hong Kong but this one has been the best! Silvana was extremely knowledgable not just on the food side of thinks but also the fascinating history! The food is interesting and delicious and not what a westerner would find on their own. Highly recommend it!!

Nice Food Tour, Need More Dim Sum. Had a great time travelling around wan-chai and central area to eat and know the local history of Hong kong. Definitely recommended for those curious on Hong Kong delicacies. Wish they provide us with a more amazing dim sum though.

Sooooo Worth It. What a great experience! Silvana is a very poised guide who designed a very thoughtful tour. You'll eat and drink some great samples of food enjoyed in Hong Kong and learn interesting facts about the properties of the food you will eat and the neighborhoods you visit. We enjoyed two of the restaurants so much we went back several times after the tour. This was a great experience for us and we're so glad we signed on.

highlight of Hong Kong. we did the central tour on Hong Kong Island. There were 12 of us but the guide was very careful to include everyone equally and very knowledgable. We ate the most wonderful wontons (not like the American ones),delicious roast pork,sugar cane juice, dried fruit, dim sum, and yummy custard tart. Not a taste of each but full servings. We ate and walked through soho, Hollywood street, the antique district, the cat market, and up and down a lot of steps. But the reward was great. This was the best tour ever. We got to know interesting facts about Hong Kong and had a wonderful time.

Good food and a nice tour of Central Hong Kong. Although I have been to Hong Kong many times, I haven't wandered off the beaten path as much as I did this afternoon on the central foodie tour. Our guide, Sylvana, was great. The six stops consisted of a wonton noodle shop, a roast meat restaurant, a dim sum joint, a sugar cane juice shop, a preserved fruit store and a take-out bakery. I saw some neat parts of town, learned a bit about the city's history, ate some good food, and got a bit of exercise!

Superb Trip - Great Food and Fun. Brilliant experience and great value for money. Really nice to meet a diverse group of foodies all taking a brilliant adventure through the street vendors of Hong Kong. Silvana was our expert guide, charming and informative. All the stops were well chosen. Amazing won tons, awesome BBQ pork, great dim sum, especially the pork buns and overall a really enjoyable few hours. Do it.

A highlight of my time in Hong Kong - Get Involved :). This tour has so many great reviews here on TripAdvisor and going on it - it is very easy to see and understand why. The team do a great job putting up an amazing tour (very unforgettable experience). What's not to love about the tour - the food, the history, the company (it's a small group so you're never lost in a sea of people and can ask all the questions to your heart content). Our guide, Silvana was a really really really (repetition for emphasis) amazing guide. Her enthusiasm, passion and genuine excitement sharing bits of her culture and her life with the group was infectious.At the different stops, the food choices are explained and the staff were a lovely bunch with smiles on their faces. The three hour plus on the tour did not feel like a chore at any point. I found it really engaging as the guide through the walking speaks through the history of the area, the food. She also worked her way through the group - getting to know bits about each and everyone (which I thought was a sweet, warm and personal thing to do). I loved this tour (can you tell?) and would recommend it to everyone and anyone whatever your interests. I enjoy getting to learn about food (so it was a no brainer for me booking onto the tour) but one doesn't have to be a "foodie" to get the best out of the tour - just an appetite and open mind for fun and to meet people.At the start of the tour, you get a guide with the stops on the tour and recommendations for places to go afterwards. I would recommend people to go along to this in the first few days of getting to Hong Kong as it sets up one's journey. (that doesn't really matter though, just go along for it - whenever, most importantly). GO!The Hong Kong Foodie Tour was a highlight of my time in Hong Kong. It was that good (I really loved and enjoyed it), I booked on the other tour they had (unfortunately, the typhoon had other plans...LOL). If you ever get to read this (thanks so much Hong Kong foodie team).

Great 3.5 hour food walking tour. We spent 3.5 hours walking through the city, visiting family food businesses and eating and drinking local treats. The tour was a great follow up to a bus tour the day before. Our host, Silvana, gave us a great insight into life in Hong Kong. We visited 6 family businesses to eat and drink local food as well as visit sites of interest on the way. The food was excellent. The group was small, there were 9 of us. I think group size is restricted to 12. The trip was excellent and the trip was great value for money. I'd recommend anyone who enjoys quality food to join a tour.

Excellent Tour. One of the best tours ever thanks to the professionalism of our tour guide. The restaurants for the tastings were chosen for quality and variety which in turn then appealed to all tour participants. The walk through Sheung Wan was fascinating with our guide sharing interesting anecdotes and pointing out historical sights along our route. For these, our guide stopped and had us gather around her so that everyone was sure to hear. There were 5 tasting stops, all perfectly spaced out.Unfortunately I booked this tour for my last day in Hong Kong so I was unable to return on my own, whether to eat or buy some fruit, or even to shop for gifts.

Fantastic Tour! Wonderful Guide, Excellent Food!. There were 4 of us taking this tour together as part of a full group. It's fair to say that we are of different levels of bravery with food and ability for walking about, but the food choices were safe while still pushing a few boundaries and the pace of the walk suited all of us.A special mention should go to our guide Silvana, who was entertaining and informative. She even helped my mum out in the tea shop buying some bits and pieces to take home. A captivating speaker, she made an effort to speak with everyone on the tour and did a stirling job of keeping us together and safe from traffic! The food selection was excellent and really opened our minds to trying out local places instead of playing it safe with branded eateries. We regretted not having time to return to the won ton soup shop, and I never got around to trying goose - but I will certainly now be hunting down these dishes and more in my local Chinatown! We had an absolute blast on this tour, each of us enjoying something different and taking some new ideas away with us.If we are ever back in Hong Kong we will be coming back for more foodie tours.A huge thanks to Silvana once again for being our guide on such a warm day, she did a fabulous job.

Loved the tour. Small intimate group with a knowledgable tour guide and yummy food! What more can you ask for from a food tour! My girlfriend signed up the tour and I'm so glad she did. The places they take you have such interesting background and stories. We even went back to visit one of the eateries! On a side note I'm also glad they include restroom break.

Delicious and informative experience. This tour was so much more than I expected.We did the Central HK tour which runs from afternoon to evening. We visited food places we would never have found on our own and had an experience within the restaurant you would receive just walking in. We went into the kitchen and saw the roasted meat hanging from the ceiling and watched wontons being made. Our guide introduced us to the families who ran the restaurants and they shared information on the food, how to eat it, how traditional Chinese families cook and use ingredients and eat their meals and even how to tell the difference between duck and goose on your plate!Along the way we were shown various sights and provided history and information about the area and how things were changing. Our guide was so knowledgable and spoke perfect English.Highly recommend his tour. If we had more time we would have done the other tour which covers breakfast/lunch.

Reconnecting to My Root. After I had spent a year in Australia backpacking, Hong Kong did hit me with a "reverse" cultural shock. This place looked so remote to me I didn't feel like it was my hometown. Hearing a lot of good words from friends, I randomly bumped into this food tour and decided I should give it a try to reconnect myself back to the town. The tour mainly aimed for expats and tourists, but the tour guide Silvana made my felt very comfortable and welcomed. Well, I have to say, I considered myself quite a local expert, but through the tour I learned a lot of local history from Silvana, along with the delicious food that filled my stomach. Good god, I even lived in Central for 2 years before I left for Australia, but how pleasantly surprised that she could still show me the faces of Hong Kong I had never seen before. And among all the tours I've ever joined, Silvana is one of the top 3 most favourite tour guide I've met. She had really in-depth local knowledge and took care of every single guests during the tour. It's such a pity she had to watch us eating all the taste food through the whole tour without having a bite!

Must do!. After a month travelling around China & Australia, and an abundance of amazing experiences, the Hong Kong Foodie tour is one of my fondest memories. The groups are small and the guide had so much knowledge on Hong Kong culture & dishes. They take you to places you'd never find on your own & the variety is fantastic. Highly recommended!

Great time. We had a great time with the Food tour. We ate at places we would have never chosen ourselves, but the food was great. Learned about Hong Kongs history and walked over a market. Where we learned about the different foods there. We had enough time to ask questions. Our guide was very friendly and spoke very good Englisch. I liked it so much, I´m now thinking about taking another food tour in another city. I recommend taking this tour!
The street food is the best and can't get it in Australia.. Love the street food and dislike the rain and the China Tour group screaming and yelling in the hotel.

Excellent way to eat great food in Hong Kong. We did the Central HK Food Tour and it was a great experience. The small tour group (10 or so people) was able to walk through the streets of Central Hong Kong, hearing and seeing the sites, meeting new people while trying a great variety of delicious foods. The guide was friendly and knowledgeable and provided the group with a leaflet which included a map of the places we went to, other restaurants which were recommended and suggestions for other foods to try. The tour went to locally owned, food places which produced the food on-site and where family run. It was an excellent variety of food (lollies, dumplings and roast meat) and definitely some of the tastiest. If you have a chance to do this tour, I'd certainly recommend it.

Excellent Hong Kong Foodie Tour. With limited time in Hong Kong, the Foodie Tour looked like a good option to pack in as much local food options s possible. This was a superlative experience, a great guide, no language problems, we walked through historical areas and learned a lot of Hong Kong and its history as well as tasting delicious food. BBQ meat was brilliant, the Dim Sum fabulous, a great experience, saw the street produce markets, enough stops on the hilly terrain to fit the not so fit older tourist, at the end of the tour the guide was very helpful in providing information on getting back to our hotel for our transfer to the airport. If you are visiting Hong Kong put the Foodie Tour on your list of must do activities.

Curious about local food in HK? Do this!. I did both tours offered, the first in Central HK and the second in the slightly more curious Sham Shui Po area. Both were excellent. I learnt lots about Hong Kong food and also about the history of the areas. I love that they told us why they has specifically picked these venues over others and also took us to some slightly unexpected places. It's not all dim sum and bakeries on these tours! The meeting places were really easy to find if you use the MTR (underground metro), which is very simple. Equally, other guests took taxis and said it was also pretty simple. Even though the days I chose were super hot and humid, the guides were professional and took care of us with bottled water on arrival and air con stops where requested. I really enjoyed my tours with these guys.

A very good foodie tour. Savannah was an excellent tour guide who expertly showed our group through the eateries of the Sham Shui Po area. The starting location in a train station was easy to find (for those sensible enough to catch the very good MTR trains). Luckily we had a great group with us, and no rude tourists like the ones who expected the tour guide to pay for a coke drink and items not on the menu). It was a great contrast to the two and three michelin star restaurants we tried at night. Not everyone liked every food item but that is only to be expected. Some of the great restaurants in Hong Kong are ones that tourists do not normally see.This was a must do tour. Many thanks Savannah

The old Hong Kong. Four of us took this tour and we were all very satisfied both with what we learnt about the Sham Shui Po area and the food we tried. We are two teenage boys and their parents and were staying in the Sham Shui Po area. We had walked past a lot of the places we were taken to but we're not confident to enter. After the tour you could not stop us, it gave us confidence to walk into the eating places in the area which is very much the old Hong Kong. Now it is not only food that is interesting in this area but also the markets and local businesses. Prices here are some of the best around and as Savannah says "this is where the locals shop". We totally enjoy our tour and there was more than enough food to try along with great local knowledge.

Central District Delights. Silvana took us on an amazing walking tour to 6 eateries and recommended a heap more. A great introduction to the culture, history and food of Hong Kong in an interesting lane and market ways. Great day!

Excellent Food Tour!. I had the fantastic opportunity to live in HK for three months when my husband was transferred there for work. I had made quite a few local friends who had shown me around the town including the local cuisine and where to eat (both more 'western' and 'local' places). I decided to take the food tour with Savannah on my own, curious to see the places she would take me in Central, which was the area I lived. After the first stop at the shrimp dumpling and noodle place, I knew the tour would be special. She took us to the best 'local' places, run by local families. What really set the tour apart was not only the fantastic food, but that she gave lots of local history about the eateries and the areas we were walking around. I really enjoyed the little things she would point out about why buildings were certain ways, or how she explained the taste and use of the funny looking vegetables in the the wet market. I did the tour by myself and was totally fine and happy the entire time! I liked the tour so much that I also did the Sham Shui Po tour too. On the second tour I ate foods I hadn't eaten the entire three months I was there - they were definitely unique and well thought out food choices. I also really liked seeing a working class Hong Kong neighborhood as it was very different from the often too western feeling Central area. I'm still dreaming of the pineapple bun and egg tarts…never thought I'd really love these things but that's what Hong Kong does to you! Thank you Savannah for introducing me to some of the best places to eat in Hong Kong!

Should be 3.7 but I rounded up. My husband, myself and our 3 college kids went on the private Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour. We started the tour searching 1-1/2 hours for the meeting location. We have taken numerous tours throughout Europe and Asia and the majority of private tours meet us at the hotel or for an extra fee can arrange transportation to the starting location. This tour only came with directions from the train station once we arrived on Hong Kong island. Our hotel was located in Kowloon. We took the ferry across the bay and when we finally found the meeting location we were all in a very pissed off mood. I did comment to both tour guides about the directions and the female guide had a sarcastic comment back that our hotel was closer to the train station than the ferry. Here's my question back, " since I don't live in Hong Kong, how would I know that?" I didn't like her attitude after that. The male guide was awesome, he went to school in our home town so we got along great. My second complaint is the fact that we booked a private tour which is for up to 8 people and we only had 5. So I paid for 8 but they only needed to supply food for 5 so the rest was profit for them. My daughter wanted to try turtle jelly which wasn't bad and they didn't charge extra for, but they shouldn't since they saved the food cost for 3 people but they were too greedy to pick up the cost of 1 can of coke that my son ordered. Really? Aren't you making a ton of money already on me. That's just greed!!! My final complaint was that I spent 820.00 USD on the tour and they charged me 110.00 USD gratuity for 8 people as part of the total. Although there were only 5 of us, again, Greedy!! The term gratuity is given as a tip when the service is above average. The gratuity should have been at my discretion and not forced upon me and taken when I signed up for the tour. The food at the stops was tasty, but not the best I've tasted. I did a fabulous food tour in shanghai by a company UnTours that was outstanding and Jamie was an awesome guide. There was a large part of history on the tour but my husband really enjoyed that. They did provide us with good directions by train to get back to our hotel across the bay. It was an enjoyable tour but for private tours they should give custom directions from my hotel, not generic ones.

Excellent Food Tour of Sham Shui Po. Our 2 guides were excellent, very friendly and knowledgeable. It was a great experience to try new foods and learn about the history of the foods and the area. The group size was small (6 in total) which was really nice. I would totally recommend this tour while you are in Hong Kong!

A tasty insight into Hong Kong. I have recently moved to Hong Kong so I was already somewhat familiar with the Central and Sheung Wan areas but the places we were taken were all new to me.Our tour guide Fan was very knowleagable about both the food we tried and the culture and history of Hong Kong. It was a great small group experience as there were only 6 of us.We all chatted and got to know each other.All the food we tried was yummy and filling. The wonton noodle soup was so cheap and the best I've tried here. And the char siu bun at Dim Sum Square was out of this world good! A great find that I can take friends back to! Loved the fact that all the restuarants we were taken to were family run businesses with an interesting background.I liked the fact that the tour accomodated different people's allergies and walking pace.The walk itself is a great insight into Hong Kong life. In particular I loved walking down "Coffin Street" and hearing the history behind the local area.

A great taste of Hong Kong!. Our family of four took the Central Tour and would definitely recommend it. Our guide was warm, knowledgeable and fun and made the experience engaging for each of us. The kids enjoyed (most of!) the foods and hearing a bit about their history and cultural relevance. They paid attention throughout and though it was a good bit of walking, they did well. We tried places we wouldn't have necessarily found on our own and enjoyed the fact that the establishments we visited were family-run and truly authentic Hong Kong spots. Our favorites were the wontons and the roast meat.
Exquisite. I have had the great pleasure of tasting the foods over a business trip, around 5 years ago. It was something to remember! If you are planning on going to HK, please give it a try!

Excellent. I have been on several food tours in different cities, but this one is the best. The tour guide, whose name I have regretably forgotten, lived for some time in the US, speaks perfect English, and really knows Hong Kong. The tour to 4 or 5 different locations provides plenty of food and the commentary covers not only food, but interesting Hong Kong history, as well.

Sham Shui Po foodie tour. I am not usually one to take tours, preferring to explore on my own, but Silvana was a knowledgeable guide that took us to places we'd have never found on our own. She gave us the background on traditional dishes, cooking methods and history as well as colorful tales about the neighborhood - I highly recommend taking the tour and returning on your own! The food was nothing short of spectacular.

Do this tour!. We had best food, lots of fun, learned alot as well. Cecila was such a congenial host of the tour. She speaks perfect English. We took the Central tour which was the "less adventurous" food tour and we loved it. We went up small streets to the markets, saw Cat street, met the restaurant owners at times. Best food: it was all amazing. Thanks Cecilia!

DON'T MISS THIS!. This is a great way to get a feel for the City. Silvana, (our guide) made the Hong Kong Central tour the absolute highlight of my stay in Hong Kong! Having been born and bred in HK, and then educated in the US, she brought a perspective to this tour that I doubt few others can rival. The places we stopped wreaked of authenticity and tradition. I get the feeling that this view of "old" HK is quickly disappearing, and therefore, I'm grateful to have had this opportunity. In fact, I did revisit a few of the places with my husband later on during our stay.

Best experience of the trip!. Such an interesting way to get acquainted with Hong Kong. But it was more than just tasting a variety of foods; it was learning about the neighborhoods that we were walking through, learning about the history and the customs - and the future of these neighborhoods. Silvana was easy to understand, entertaining and clearly has a good repore with the local establishments that we visited. The food was delicious but the whole day was so enjoyable. Highly recommend this !

Highlight of my trip!. Silvana was an kind and amusing guide, taking us to places I never would have gone to alone as a tourist. Not only did we eat delicious foods, but she took us through the wet market and told us about a lot of Hong Kong history, which I wasn't expecting on a food tour. A really wonderful combination of eating and touring -- I would recommend this to anyone!

The best thing we did in Hong Kong. We did the Central and Sheung Wan tour on my birthday last week. This was the best thing we could have done while we were in Hong Kong. Five stops of delicious food from wonton soup to egg tarts and three hours of history, culture and sightseeing. Our guide, Silvana, was knowledgeable, funny and friendly. It was fascinating to learn about the changes in Central and Sheung Wan and how the area has evolved over the years. And the food? Simply incredible. We even went back to a couple of places later in our trip.Wish we had time to also do the Sham Sui Po tour - will be booking next time we're in Hong Kong!Thank you for a truly memorable afternoon!

Sheung Wan Foodie Tour. In HK for a few days and this seemed a good way to see both a little of HK and enjoy some of the foodswe often don't come across at home, as well as offering the opportunity to go back and try/see more when sightseeing.Good food from a number of family run restaurants was offered and whilst not as exotic as perhaps I thought it may be it did cater to lesser experienced foodies very well. Go early on in your visit, as you probably will go back for a second helping.

Must do in Hong Kong. I live in Hong Kong but had some visitors in town and signed up for the tour. It was an absolute highlight of the trip--a chance to see, taste and smell the city's true charm. I am adding this to my repertoire for all visitors and will be joining many more tours in the future!
Amy

Great tour well worth it. I went to HK for an exhibition and had only one afternoon off, I took this tour, the website was excellent, i mentioned I dont want pork and there were some vegetarians on our tour and we were very well taken care off, went to awesome places which I would never venture out on my own, restaurants are clean , hygenic, good food, the best part of the tour was the guide and i think the founder as well, her name is savanna, very sweet warm friendly person, unassuming at first very natural, genuine person, she had a bad throat but still managed to explain everything and made the tour a very fun thing to do in HK, dont miss it. It a must to do in HK.From the wonton fish balls to the goose to the egg tart and the food in between, excellent tour

Hong Kong old time. Never imagined that we would find old time Hong Kong in Sham Shui Po. Most of the shops and restaurants are selling local stuff and food. This was the place that we would wanted to see in HK, and tasted local foods. The tour guide, Sylvana, was amazing, very knowledgable about HK history, culture and food, and the way she presented the subject made the whole tour interesting. After the tour, we did return to this area two times to taste more food at her suggested restaurants, we would recommend that you take this tour early in your trip.

Yum, the food was delicious. We joined the Central and Sheung Wan Foodie tour for a four hour, afternoon, walking tour on Hong Kong island in the financial district. Silvana, our friendly and knowledgeable local guide, provided a real insight into the history of the area and also tempted us with the variety and taste of the food that was offered in 6 different family run restaurants, shops and tea houses, in this fascinating area. We walked through the Wet markets, which are gradually being depleted as property developers move in. Our guide was able to tell us about some of the fresh fruit we were surrounded by and she showed us a number of stalls which were selling dried fish products and live fish tanks, waiting for customers. For me the highlight was the wonton noodle shop and the tea studio, but my partner's favorites were the Chinese dim sum shop, (which we returned to the next day for more delightful dim sum) and the roast meat restaurant. Everything was fresh and authentic. We really appreciated learning about the cultural and historical background as we strolled through the small streets and laneways. But most of all we enjoyed all of the delicious food which we were able to eat on the way. We did not need any dinner that night.

Must do experience. A wonderful way to orient yourself to the City, the culture and the food. We did the City and Sheung Wan walk and enjoyed every minute of it. I am a bit of a fussy eater but I can say without reservation that I enjoyed every dish served. The quality was high and the experience very good. Fan (Fanny) is a fun and knowledgeable guide. Highly recommended.
Great choice!. I had one day to visit HK años this tour was a great opportunity to taste real local food! The tour guide was very nice and helpfull. I highly recomend this tour!

HK Foodie Tasting Tours Rocks!. I am a food fanatic (yes, I live to eat) and HK Foodie Tours has managed to quench my thrist for good tasting food in HK.Went for Central and Sham Shui Po Tours. Latter was done just yesterday.As for Silvana, she's a great guide. If you want a better tour guide, you would have to run the tour agency yourself.May we all eat well and prosper. Cheers to all!

Best thing I've done all holiday. . Had to kill a few days in HK by myself and signed up at the last minute to do a tour. Couldn't have had a better time - not only is it about food I got to find my way around the local suburbs and some really interesting commentary.

Great Tour. We did the Central and Sheung Wan Foodie Tour in March 2014. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Not only did we stop off at a diverse range of eateries but Sylvania our guide gave interesting information on the culture and history of Hong Kong. All the food stops were excellent with samples of traditional food and drink to consume. We revisited some of the stops later in our stay. We would definitely recommend you try the tour early in your visit to Hong Kong.Sylvania was a very good guide and knew her subject. It is also good that there is a maximum number of 12 people per tour.Thoroughly recommend this food tour.

A 'must do'. Whether a first time or frequent visitor to Hong Kong this really is a must do activity. It deserves all the plaudits it gets on trip advisor. It is fun, interesting, informative about the food the culture the history & life in Hing Kong, & great value for money. We didn't need a meal that evening. We did the Central tour & will definitely do the Kowloon one on another visit.

Outstanding. Did the Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour in January with four other Aussies and a delightful French couple. This tour goes beyond introducing traditional flavours - it deals with the history and traditions of this vibrant city. The tastings were delicious and walking in between stops gave us a great insight into this area of the city. Definitely would not have found many of these traditional haunts independently. Next trip to HK will do the tour on the Kowloon side.

Another 5 star vote for Silvana. My wife and I - together with 10 others (a mixture of Brits, Aussies and Americans) - took the Central and Sheung Wan tour on Monday 10 March 2014.Nothing else to add as far as the standard six stops food experience is concerned - but I was disappointed to note that, myself apart, only one other tour member appeared to tip Silvana at the end of the tour.Come on guys - this lady puts her heart and soul into this; surely a HKD100 per person tip is the least she deserves?
Hong Kong Food. Good Tour, organized and fun. Informative and worth the time and money to understand part of Hong Kong

What an excellent trip. Silvana you did a great job of showing us around and taking us to eat in places that we would never have considered. Each of the 6 stops provided different taste experiences and all in all it was a wonderful afternoon with a guide who was very informative about Hong Kong in general and its food. I'd thoroughly recommend it to everyone and as proof we have already been back and had another quick bit of Dim Sum in one of the selected restaurants after diving to Causeway Bay for a bit of shopping.

A great adventure off the beaten path.........but not too far!!. If you are going to Hong Kong, especially for the first time, you MUST take this tour. Not only will it familiarize you with the area, it will also highlight some great places to eat. Silvana, our tour guide did a fantastic job of showing us around as well as sharing her knowledge of Hong Kong's culture. If you are looking for the perfect dim sum, BBQ'd pork, or dumpling/ramen soup (pictured on this site and does not disappoint) you will be glad you took this tour. There are a million places to eat in HK, some great and some not so great, this tour exposes you to the great ones. I will definitely sign up for it again whenever I go back.
Good Food. Dumplings verry good in different restaurants in Hong Kong also on the nightmarkets also on the borders from victoriya harbour by the ferry,s

A great experience. I am a local and I tried out all local delicacies prepared by other restaurants before. But tasting some real and authentic flavours and combining them with culture are really something different.Remember to skip your breakfast before you start the Sham Shui Po foodie tour, or you will regret for sure.I forgot when was the last time I saw such a big pineapple bun. The buns sold in chained bakery are small and cold so the breakfast at the first stop was just incredible.Then the group was served with more treats: traditional puddings, tofu desserts, goose, pastries and noodles (the last stop was my favourite).Our tour guide shared with us the culture related to the food, the district, and led the group through with one of the most vibrant street markets.Highly-recommended.

Just wait for the goose…. I was fortunate to be with a group of friends who took the Sham Shui Po tour during a recent visit to Hong Kong: we had a really great experience. Our tour guide – whose name I am embarrassed to say I have now forgotten – was simply brilliant. Her knowledge of the local culture and food was very thorough: it felt like you were walking around with a friend who just happened to live in HK and was taking you around her favourite places. Unlike many tours, the structure was conversational and unhurried. Our guide was more than happy to discuss anything we asked about and really allowed us to see and taste heaps of things in a relatively small geographic area. The food was obviously the highlight (the braised goose is something to savour) but I cannot complete this review without mentioning the kitchen shop. If you are after a good knife, in particular a heavy cleaver, you are in for a treat. The meeting point is easy to find, and for us, only 5 stops away on the MTR (Tsim Sha Tsui). This tour is worth every cent – I totally recommend it.

A fresh take on Hong Kong. Being a regular visitor to Hong Kong, I already have my "go to" restaurants when I visit. I had a bit more time in the city on a recent visit, though, and decided to join a food tour to discover new local eats, as well as get to know the city from a different view.The Hong Kong Foodie tour was excellent - a good mix of Hong Kong's culture and food. It built my knowledge of Hong Kong cuisine, as well as local practices and customs. And it allowed me to explore parts of the city I had not previously visited.The guide adjusted to dietary restrictions quite well, which I very much appreciated, as I could not eat meat on the day of our tour.Wear comfortable shoes with good traction - you walk up and down stairs and inclined streets. Also, if taking an afternoon tour, skip lunch. There will be much for you to eat during the tour.Read more here: http://whyhellomel.blogspot.com/2013/09/a-hong-kong-tour-for-foodies.html

Wonderful Way to learn about Hong Kong. Our tour guide, Silvana, made the experience a delight. Her knowledge of Hong Kong, its cuisine and people was like the best college lecture, riddled with amazing food stops. You will not be disappointed. One recommendation - take this tour early in your visit to Hong Kong. We took it later in the stay and really regretted it. Try everything and don't plan on eating dinner afterwards. If you're worried about the price, do it anyway. It's worth every cent. We took the Central & Sheung Wan tour and wish that we had time to do the Kowloon one as well.

A must for your visit to HK. This afternoon we did this tour with a very knowledgeable guide and a great group of people. The food was to die for, so so fresh and tasty. Not only great food but a walk around Hong Kong's business district and beyond to places not covered in your usual tourist trips. Would absolutely recommend, but do it early in your trip, so that you can go and eat at some of the restaurants again. Thanks for a memorable afternoon!

Excellent food, knowledgeable guide, very interesting. We loved the 4-hour foodie tour of Central and Sheung Wan. We were taken to places we never would have walked into without a guide and weren't disappointed. We tried wonderful Won Ton soup, four kinds of amazing Dim Sum, sugar cane juice (a first for us!), traditional tea, BBQ pork, and egg tarts. This is a must-join experience for every serious foodie visiting Hong Kong.

Great experience, even for someone living in HK. Had a fantastic time on the Central and Shueng Wan foodie tour with Silvana. The commentary was engaging and informative. We got to sample some really good food at joints we would normally not visit despite being Hong Kong residents, because we wouldn't be able to read the signs or the menu. Sure, the tour is not cheap, and the cost of the food is a fraction of what you pay for the tour. Still it is well-worth it, since you couldn't know about the restaurant or what to order there, if you didn't have a local to guide you. They also give out a handy pamphlet with details of each of the joints you visit, as well as recommendations of other restaurants to try in the area - so you can go back for more anytime.

Do them first before you set out to explore. We could only get on to the HK tour late in our visit despite booking a Month in advance, and as we were staying in Kowloon were disappointed in ourselves for not trying earlier.If you do both Kowloon and HK you will always have some where great to eat while you stay .The tour was run very professionally and the commentary was excellent, the places you go your will never find, we had a local on our tour who had not seen them.The pace of the tour was good, with plenty of time to enjoy the delicacies and stories, even for a coffee addict the tea stop was enjoyable, but please walk in with an open mind and open taste buds , try and enjoy, I never join web sites but I am now reading their blog...Small note very hard to find a toilet at the meeting place prior to the tour ( the L place) but there are facilities while on tour.

Drinking Sugar Cane Juice with Silvana is SWEET!. We were in Hong Kong for a long weekend in January 2014 and had heard there was 'decent' food in the vicinity. Rather than simply trust our noses, we signed up to explore the city with the experts of Hong Kong Food Tasting Tours.Our guide was Silvana and we embarked on our adventure with a group of ~8 at about 1:30pm. From there, we visited 5-6 venues for AMAZING foods, and got many more recommendations and tips for the duration of our stay. The wonton - superb. The pork barbecue - thrilling. The tea tasting - heart warming. The dim sum - naturally, out of this world! And the sugar cane juice - so SWEET! I have to say that the snake soup recommendation we followed up on later was also spot on (snake, too, tastes like chicken).Hong Kong can definitely be thanked for the fantastic food culture and cuisine, but without Silvana (awesome, awesome, awesome guide) and Hong Kong Foodie, we never could have tasted our way through such a fun Saturday.We would strongly recommend this activity to anyone who A) likes food, B) is good to walk the streets for several hours, and C) doesn't mind learning a thing or two.

Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tour. It was definitely one of the highlights of our 9 day stay in Hong Kong for myself, my husband and our two daughters who are 20 and 17 yrs old. We did the Central and Sheung Wan tour. The food was amazing and we revisited 3 of the 6 places in the tour. The wonton soup was the best. Silvana was an excellent guide, her local knowledge of Cantonese food and Hong Kong was excellent. We expected the tour to focus only on food, so it was an unexpected bonus for us when Silvana also provided information on the cultural history of the area and the restaurants we visited. Would recommend highly! Worth every cent.

Excellent HK experience. We thoroughly enjoyed this tour with HK foodie tours. We did the Central and Sheung Wan tour with 9 other participants from around the world. Our guide was a charming Hong Kong native who studied I the US so spoke fantastic English. She was knowledgable and friendly and presented all information on the tour in an informative and intimate manner. We were shown through so many interesting parts of the area, food related and otherwise, so it was a great way to begin to understand this pumping city. As advised, we had a hearty breakfast at about 10 which left us in a good position to get stuck into the food. The directions provided for the staring point were clear and it was easy to find. We were also provided with a booklet with lots of other recommended food spots and a map. Overall, really well organised, really well thought out, intimate, local food and cultural tour of this area of HK.

Eye-opener! Must try!!. I have moved to Hong Kong 2 years ago and never had the chance or initiative to visit Sham Shui Po. Came across the Sham Shui Po Foodie Tour on the official site and figured "Why not?". Few of my friends and I went on this amazing tour. To name a few qualities - friendly tour guide, Silvana, was professional and she spoke perfect English; food recommended/tasted was authentic and delicious: my fav are - fresh off the oven delicious pineapple bun, rich HK style milk tea, best ever braised goose & pork knuckle. We walked through the "older" part of Hong Kong and our tour guide shared with us local culture, history and pointed out hidden gems that you would definitely miss if you have gone to this area by yourself! Definitely a great way to learn about Hong Kong/authentic food cultural. I have highly recommended this foodie tour to all my friends and foreigner friends visiting HK! Some of my friends have gone on the Central/Sheung Wan tour and I have heard equally positively reviews from them! Don't hesitate to check out these 2 foodie tours if you are visiting Hong Kong!

Great tour - well worth the money!. I don't normally do 'tours' and thought initially that the price was a little bit steep - but once I'd done the tour, I understood that it was good value for money! I did the Central/Sheung Wan tour.There was a group of 13 of us, I think, plus the guide, Silvana, who was lovely. Very knowledgeable and friendly. The six venues we visited were all interesting and served some great food (I went back to the dim sum restaurant and the wonton noodle restaurant a couple of days later). A couple of the places we visited I would never have gone into on my own - just due to the lack of English signage and not really knowing what they sold or how to order!Don't eat lunch beforehand! You do eat quite a lot of food but it's spaced out a bit and there is a little bit of walking around so you have a few minutes to digest:-)) The sugar cane place, by the way, is absolutely fine.
