Its decor is original and it's not fancy, but it's in no way unhygenic as a previous reviewer stated. All my group drank their juice and enjoyed it. We could see it being prepared in front of us.Try to do this at the start of your holiday. I returned to the area and visited a few places that Silvana had mentioned (i.e. a market and the Central escalators) and then dropped in to a couple of the restaurants we had visited. You get a map showing the restaurants the tour visits as well as others that they recommend, so hang on to this, it's useful if you're in the area!There is another tour you can do to, in the morning, I think. I would've done this if I'd had more time.

Very worthwhile tour. My husband, my daughters (17, 20) and I just completed this tour. We all thoroughly enjoyed it. We saw parts of HK we would never have found. Our guide Silvana was very informed. The tour was a good balance of walking and eating. Highly recommend this especially if you are a first time visitor.

Best Way to Learn about a City. We did the Hong Kong foodie tasting tour in December 2013 and loved it. You learn so much of Hong Kong during the tour and of course there is the food! You learn how it is made, why it is an important food to the area and all the food is great. The variety is great and really gives you a full meal experience while walking around because there are so many tastings. Our tour person was great, informative, helpful and proud of Hong Kong. Suggest good walking shoes and an empty belly to start!

Outstanding tour. Our group for the tour of Central was from all over the world: two fellows from the UK, a couple from Australia, a couple from Switzerland--all first time visitors to Hong Kong--and me (a frequent visitor to HK). Other reviewers have commented that the tour combines foodie pleasures with information about Hong Kong and the two neighborhoods we visited. It was very informative and enjoyable. Part of the pleasure was meeting the other members of the group, but our guide (who I believe founded the enterprise) was the real star. She is charming and bright and very knowledgeable. And it is a great pleasure to be introduced to places that would be hard to find on one's own. The shop that sells roast meats, for example, is not one I would have thought to enter, but oh, my, the barbeque pork. And the won ton noodle soup place is a treasure. And if you don't know the difference between a Hong Kong won ton and a Shanghai won ton, you need to take this tour. I'll be returning to Hong Kong next year with my wife, who couldn't come this time, and this tour will be the first thing I plan.

Excellent Foodie tours and more!. We did both the Central/Sheung Wan and Sham Shui Po foodie tours in Jan 2014. Our group includes my mum, who is 70 yrs old. We enjoyed the yummy food tastings, how they are eaten by locals as well as the history and changes seen in the neighbourhoods we visited. Tour is well-paced and suitable for young and elderly alike. Many thanks to Silvana, our excellent foodie guide. Highly recommended!

Wonderful experience. I took the Sham Shui Po food tour back in July. It was my first day in Hong Kong and it was a great start to my visit. Our group was a really great mix of people from the US, South Africa, the UK and myself (Ireland) and we all got on like a house on fire. I've truly never had so much fun with a bunch of strangers as I did on this tour. Our guide was fantastic, a Hong Kong native who pointed out so many hidden gems and details I would have walked right past. I didn't enjoy all the food we tired but that was kinda of the point, to try different things. Everyone in our group had a different favorite of the foods tried so they covered a wide range on this tour. I was the only vegetarian in our group but was able to eat something at every stop we made. My only critique of the tour is they should time the tour to allow people to shop at some of the stops. We packed alot in and had to keep moving to make each food stop and the website is clear that there isn't time to shop on the tour but you can go back after but it's hard not to want to buy something esp in the Kitchen supply store!Over all a great morning and when I head back to Hong Kong I hope to take their other food tours!

Great way to learn about Hong Kong. This is much more than a food tour-it is a history and culture lesson about Hong Kong. The guide who conducted the tour my daughter and I went on was extremely knowledgeable about the history of the neighborhoods and the food traditions of Hong Kong. It does take a while and it is not cheap, but the experience is something you cannot get in any other way that I know of. Our group included people from all over the world (Sweden, Ireland, Dubai, Australia and the USA) and talking with them added value to the tour. My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

Excellent foodie tour even for a Hong Kong local. As a Hong Kong native, I have to say this was an AWESOME food tour that not only having yummy food but also reminding me of some interesting spots in Central and Sheung Wan area that I have missed out, some of which I have never been to……seriously. It may look odd for a Hong Kong local to attend a local food tour, I was also questioned by other travelers at the beginning....haha. I work in Central, but most of the time I just passed by those restaurants in the neighbourhood without trying the food there, joining this tour allowed me to taste all yummy food in one go. The route was nicely planned and Silvana did an excellent job, not only explaining the stories of selected local food but also the history of those old buildings and streets along the tour. This food tour is definitely more than just food tasting, it really inspires me to find out more about the history of Hong Kong as a local. Thanks Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tours!

Best way to experience Hong Kong. I joined this tour on just the second day of my trip based on the excellent reviews. I have to agree with all the positive things that have been said, this is a fantastic way to experience not just the food in the Central & Sheung Wan neighbourhoods, but the areas themselves. You will see local streets and sights that you may not have come across otherwise. Our guide was Fanny who was amazing - she was so knowledgeable and friendly. There is a fair bit of walking, including stairs, but this is good because there is also a lot of eating! Just be prepared and wear comfortable shoes. I can't recommend this tour highly enough, it was well worth it.

Food Tour was just OK and too expensive. The tour is scheduled for roughly 4 hours, which is way to long. This could be done in two to two and half hours if planned properly. The places we ate at were actually pretty good, however there was one location where we had a sugar cane drink that was just disgusting inside. I wouldn't drink my beverage as I had no idea how hygienic the place was. I was actually very unhappy they would take tourists to this location. Just disgusting.Our guide was very knowledgeable however, discussing the local buildings to kill time, was a turn off. This is a foodie tour, stay on topic. Also it was $90 US. Not worth the price as the locations were low price restaurants as the guide pointed out. $25 is the price it should be. Also, don't ask for tips right off that bat. Poor etiquette.

Foodie Tour - Sham Shui Po. LOVED this tour! I found it by accident whilst surfing "gluten free guides to hong kong" randomly around the internet. We chose the Sham Shui Po tour as we had been to Hong Kong several times before and thought it might be nice to get out and see an area we had not yet explored. Our guide was incredible and i really appreciated the way she looked after my gluten free needs. She advised what i could and couldn't eat upfront and offered alternatives along the way. Having done this tour i would feel confident visiting this area again (nto sure if i would have before this) and all i could hear my Mum say for the next few days was "Can we go and have another pineapple bunnnnnn?" :) HIGHLY recommended and a wonderful addition to any Hong Kong adventure :>

Great food, great intro to Hong Kong. I really enjoyed this tour (I did the Central one) - I wish I had had the time to do it closer to the beginning of my trip rather than so close to the end because I didn't have a chance to go back to some of the stops. It was also a useful orientation to the central Hong Kong area. The tour does go up some steps, and is long (about 4 hours), but there is plenty of time to rest, bathroom breaks, and the pace seemed fine to me. The only stop that dragged was the tea shop, the lecture on tea was much too long.The guide (Sylvana) was informative and nice, she provided a good mix of information and entertainment. The comments about there not being enough "foodie" information are unfair, I think. The food stops are not new wave or ultra modern to require exotic explanations, the food is sampling of typical Hong Kong fare. It was all very good and extremely fresh. I was happy to have the help to sample local dishes that I might not have known to order without a guide. There was nothing too "weird" on this tour - if you are looking for really non-Western food this is probably not the tour for you. No chicken feet or jellied turtles. But the food was good, varied, and the commentary was an interesting mix of local information and Hong Kong history.I've never been to China or Hong Kong before, so there were some things that intimidated me in ordering in restaurants and I have to admit, I'd been sort of sticking to restaurants that cater to Western tourists. But this tour gave me some information and experience in how to order in more local Hong Kong restaurants that that was well worth the cost of the tour.Really, if you factor in that you are getting a fun afternoon and a TON of delicious food - it's a HUGE bargain. Highly recommended.

Too long of a tour and too many walking steps up stairs!. We spend over 4 hours walking around the area and it really should of been more like 2 to 3 hours. It was a mix of food stops and other information about the area. They website said no more then 8-10 to a group but we were about 15!. As a foodie I expected more conversation about the food and why the Chinese people use certain types of herbs, spices, etc., instead we walked around learned a little history about the area and ate at 6 locations in total. 3 of which were beverages. I was somewhat disappointed given the fact you pay so much money about 90.00 US and get about 20.00 or less worth of food! A market tour of Soho or a restaurant tour would of been more interesting.

Foodie Tour - Sham Shui Po. Guide was extremely knowledgeable, there was a perfect amount of walking to food ratio and it was great to get out and see a different area of HK. This was my third visit to HK so this Foodie Tour was perfect for getting off the beaten track. You won't need to eat before or after!! They were even able to cater for my sister who was GF (Gluten Free)

Terrific tour of central (victoria) and food in hong kong, do your first day!. This was a terrific tour of both the neighborhood and of food in hong kong. Should have done this the first day as I found myself wanting to return to all the places to sample more extensively. Sure you can find dim sum and roasted meats everywhere in hong kong, but understanding how to pick the better ones makes all the difference. Would highly recommend this to anyone and to do as early as possible on your trip will make your culinary experience for the whole trip better. It was even raining during most of the tour and don't regret it a bit.

Delicious and Insightful. We are so happy we did this tour as it really helped point us in the right direction. All the stops we so delicious. The dim sum crispy BBQ bun was so good. My husband and I went back to 2 of the places as well as stopped by one of the referred restaurants. We highly recommend doing this tour especially at the beginning of your trip. You will not regret it!!

Great way to start your stay in Hong Kong. My husband & I did this tour on our last day in Hong Kong & wished we had done it at the start. Like all the recent reviews Silvana was very enthusiastic and with clear insight into the local food scene. The food was of a high standard and also a great variety. I now know not to pour boiling water on my green tea and what dim sum should really taste like. I would recommend booking well in advance as the day we did the tour it was completely full.

Great insight in to local places to eat. Silvana was as great as we had read about on other reviews. Her local knowledge is fantastic and her ongoing commentary just what first timers to HK need.The food is great from the 1st Noodle Shop just down from the meeting point to the Sugar Cane juice to the Crispy BBQ Pork Buns.We learnt about tea, things that all of us never knew and have taken home with us. I will never eat another steamed BBQ Pork Bun. If you do the Central & Sheung Wan Tour, hang out for the BBQ Buns!! You will be fighting over the crumbs. I loved standing in the street amongst the locals sipping, Cane Juice, ambiance, we eat and drink with all our senses. Silvana also passes on some great local history, I just hope the old guy in the barber shop at the bottom of the stairs is open when you go? Go on the tour it is well worth it!! Next time we will try the other tour over Kowloon side.

Authentic Hong Kong. What a memorable afternoon we spent, walking the little, back streets of Hong Kong Central on the Central/Sheung Wan tour. Silvana made the experience come alive with her friendly and knowledgable way. The food was excellent, just the right mix and quantity. The tour took us to an interesting array of traditional eating places and all at a leisurely pace that allowed for everyones questions on the way. Our group of eight seemed just the right size in the busy streets and the temperature was perfect. A reasonable amount of walking up and down hills is involved so go on this tour with that in mind. We really enjoyed it, however those less mobile might find this a challenge, especially in humid weather.Some of these places may well disappear in the years to come as real estate prices continue to rise. If you want to experience the authentic food of Hong Kong today and catch a glimpse of the past then this is a great tour. Thanks Silvana, for adding to the richness of our visit to this vibrant city.

Outstanding!. As a traveller who has roamed the world on many tours, I have to say this is one of the best. My son and I booked this on our first day in Hong Kong and it was the perfect way to start. We joined a group of 5 others, two from Scotland, two from England, one from Australia and one from Belguim. We were a very compatible and interesting group. Sylvana was our guide and excellent. She kept us on schedule and offered mountains of information, not only about the food, but also about the history and culture of Hong Kong. The stops were all local cuisines and the atmospheres and tastes were varied. Noodles, roasted meats, pressed juice, incredible teas, dim sung, and pastries - not all to everyones tastes, but we all enjoyed the variety. I have a feeling that this tour will become extremely popular, so book in advance so you aren't left out!

An excellent experience. We booked onto the Sham Shui Po tour and had a very enjoyable few hours. Our guide Silvana was very knowledgable and the trip was as much about the area, the people and the history as it was about the food. This was an area we would probably not have visited without being on this tour and I felt we learnt a lot about the history of Hong Kong - which was just what we wanted. We visited 6 different tasting locations, and although not all of the foods were to our taste, that didn't distract from the overall experience. I absolutely loved the Pineapple bun, and have already found a source in London - I hope they are as good! We felt this was good value for money as all the tastings were included (about £55 each for nearly 4 hours entertainment). If we every get to go back to Hong Kong we will definitely do the other tour.Many thanks Silvana for making this so enjoyable.

tasty, informative and entertaining. Our food tour in Sham Shui Po was an excellent choice. Our guide Silvana took us around to six different places in this area of Hong Kong which we had hardly visited if not for this tour. It was a great pleasure to learn from her a lot about the area and people's every day lives but also about the particular food and the different shop owners we met. It was very informative and entertaining and it was a great experience we do not want to miss. We were given material which shows the walk and the different stops - some of the food was so delicious (the pineapple bun in particular) that we could find easily find the place again and have more of it. Many thanks to Silvana!

Great food, wonderful guide. This tour was a great intro to Sham Shui Po. It included foods at 6 locations, from Soybean milk (I tried the dessert rather than the straight milk), Braised goose, egg noodles and HK Milk tea. Thanks to Sylvana (the guide) for making the experience both informative and enjoyable.
Can't wait to try the Central tour.

Foodie fabulous experience!. My partner and I brought out of town visitors on the Sham Shui Po tour. We had such a fantastic time that we booked the Central Sheung Wan tour for the following week. The guide on the Sham Shui Po tour really knew her stuff, told great stories and the food choices were very varied, interesting and also really tasty! Although some of my rather elderly european family might not be the most adventurous Asian eaters, they loved it all! The favourite on the Sham Shui Po tour must have been the meats and the freshly prepared pickles at the yummy noodle shop. My other half loved the homemade soy milk shop (real, super fresh made-that-day silky soy milk - nothing like what you buy in regular shops out of a carton!). During the Central tour, the dim sum visit was superb and super fresh and delightfully light as they should be, we lapped up warming (and cooling!) teas and discovered the best locally made chilli paste on the planet! (I've been back three times already to by jars of the stuff..) Highly recommend and we're going to book the next lot of visitors who are coming around Christmas, we liked it that much.

Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour. We have just participated in the Central foodie tour with Silvana as our guide. My husband and I were 100% happy with this experience and especially the food of course. Silvana was a fantastic guide with a vast knowledge of the food and the culture which she imparted to the group in a very professional, courteous and sometimes humorous manner. We would thoroughly recommend this tour and am sorry that we didn't get to do the Kowloon tour also, but will save that for next time.

Central & Sheung Wan Foodie Tour and Sham Shui Po Foodie Tour. I attended the Sham Shui Po tour and it was excellent, the range of food tastings, and sights provided a terrific slice of this location in Hong Kong. The tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and clearly has a passion for Hong Kong food. The tour was so good, I had to attend the Central & Sheung Wan tour the next day, this is the afternoon tour and again the sights, smells, and food tastings was an excellent experience. There was a different guide and again, simply wonderful person with a passion for food and Hong Kong. Although I live in South East Asia, and have travelled to Hong Kong many times these two tours provided great food experiences and photo opportunities that makes it easy for me to recommend all visitors to take these tours and enjoy a different side of the normal Hong Kong experience.

Perfect for tasting Hong Kong!. This tour was perfect for a couple wanting to taste the best of Hong Kong but overwhelmed with the abundance of choices. Silvana was an excellent guide, putting together an impressive list of restaurants and bakeries consisting of food all made local and in-house. Every stop had some history involved, which made the food taste all the better! It was an excellent introduction to the local food scene in the Sheung Wan & Central areas, and also included small history lessons as we walked. Be warned though that it IS a walking tour and may not be suitable for older individuals, as we had a couple older ladies take extended breaks at the tea houses due to the heat and humidity (Silvana was VERY accommodating). That being said, the walk is very casual and very well paced, and is interrupted by incredible food tasting! So good, in fact, that we went back to the restaurants and bakeries she suggested several times!A must do!

Interesting but not what we expected.. We wanted to book the 'original' foodie tour, the Sheung Wan & Central tour on our 1st of 3 days in HK but it was booked up despite us requesting this day weeks in advance? We wanted to go on a foodie tour as early in our stay as poss so chose the next available tour on the 2nd day which was the Sham Shui Po tour. With hindsight we probably didn't understand what this tour was all about compared with the SW&C tour but it certainly wasn't a pleasurable experience! Sham Shui Po is a run down area of HK, on the verge of being a slum! The 'food' on offer is the basic food that the locals eat, most of which is prepared in squalid conditions & is either bland or unpleasant tasting. We wanted to taste a selection of good HK food which presumably the SW&C tour provides. Please be wary of booking this tour unless you are very adventurous & prepared to try the local food on offer. The guide, Silvana is very good and knowledgeable about HK in general but we just the thought the food was too extreme for Western tastes. The area, although poor, was very interesting and the people very nice and welcoming but the conditions & cleanliness were a worry. The last place we ate in smelled of rotting food which made us feel nautious!

Awesome. We did the Central/Sheung Wan tour on our 2nd day in Hong Kong. Our guide Silvana was great. A very pleasant and personable girl who spoke not only about food but about the things of interest along the way. Dont eat a huge lunch before this tour as you get plenty to eat!! Wear comfy shoes as there is a lot of walking and some of it hilly. I loved the roast meat shop, hubby enjoyed the dim sim but it was all great. Great instructions on how to meet the tour and a fun few hours eating yummy local food. Do this at the beginning of your trip because you are going to want to revisit these shops.

A must do. What a great idea, trying different foods in places away from the main tourist areas and seeing and learning a little about Hong Kong as well. My only bit if advice is book this for your first day in Hong Kong, then you have the rest of your trip to go back and enjoy. The barbecue pork buns are the best.

Great foodie tour. Silvana delivers a terrific foodie tour. We got to taste lots of yummy dishes and Silvana is very knowledgeable in Hong Kong history. Interesting and diverse. Would highly recommend this tour.

Foodie Alert! Simple and delicious fare.. We had about 12 people on our tour and Silvana did a fantastic job of guiding us throughout the narrow streets and old neighbourhoods of Central and answering all our questions. She was very knowledgable and articulate about the history of each restaurant as well as the food that was served. Although we signed up understanding that it would be a sampling of 6 different dishes, we left the tour both satisfied and very full. Great way to see the city and experience traditional Chinese dishes!

Super Silvana Tour!. Great tour by Silvana of Central and Sheung Wan! First trip to Hong Kong, and she made me feel like home in this big and beautiful city. All food was FANTASTIC, but highlights were the BBQ pork place (visited by the great Anthony Bourdain), and the tea tasting. Take this first thing when you come to Hong Kong, it is top of my list.

Excellent Tour. My husband and I did the Foodie Tour of Hong Kong on our second day with the aim of making us feel more confident with the foods of Hong Kong. This was a great tour to do just that, we met at a central location (in the Island business district) which was a short walk from the Central metro station. Silvana our guide made us feel welcome and comfortable from the very beginning introducing us to one another which united the group immediately. We walked a well planned history route through the surrounding area sampling some of the most delicious foods from traditional shops which have been in families for many generations, Silvana was happy to share her love of her city and country with stories and facts which plumped out the 4 hour tour. We enjoyed wanton noodle soup, bbq'd pork and rice, sugar cane juice prepared by the traditional method of wringing the canes, some of the best dim sum we've ever tasted, a visit to a traditional tea shop before finishing with one of the tastiest egg tarts ever. A definite recommend for your next visit to Hong Kong.

Fun orientation to Hong Kong. I thoroughly enjoyed the Foodie tour of Central and Sheung Wan. We sampled all of the basics (wonton noodles, BBQ pork, tea, and dim sum) plus some interesting finds (sugar cane juice) and dessert (egg tart). Each place was ready for us when we arrived and I thought the quality of each sample was top notch. We got a good look into the kitchens at most places. The itinerary was well thought out and separated the bigger food portions with tea and sugar cane juice and walking to give us a bit of time to digest. Savannah was the tour guide and she was incredibly pleasant and very knowledgeable of the foods and history of the HK area. She was also very helpful in giving me detailed directions back "home" after the tour. Our group was small, and I participated on my own, never feeling "weird" or left out. This was quite fun and I hope they will start new tours of other areas around HK. There's lots of food to explore around there!

Very nice tour. We did the central district tour with my girlfriend, and we enjoyed it a lot. Our tour guide was very welcoming and knowledgable. Our group had only four people so our guide was happy to answer our questions. Every dish we had was delicious, and the restaurants seemed local indeed. Having eaten quite a lot of asian food before i would've liked the food to be a bit more adventurous, but this tour is definitely a must if you want an introduction to hong kong cuisine!

Interesting and enjoyable. They have two tours; we did the Shamshuipo one. The range of dishes we were introduced to was wide and well chosen and the tour was led by an experienced and highly knowledgable guide. The staff of each small shop and restaurant obviously counted her as a friend and were happy to welcome us in to take photos, chat and look around even in the kitchens and workshops. This would be highly unlikely if not on a tour!I recommend this tour for newcomers and long-term residents alike.

Sooooo good!. I signed up for both of the tours this company had to offer and each time I got way more than I signed up for. Aside from the very well planned culinary adventures, they also offer lots of cultural/historical information.The two tours had similar setup but offered completely different experiences since they were in different parts of town. As I said before, they are well planned; each meal/dessert/drink is very well thought of and is served in a local family owned place that ensures top notch quality. They do pick meals that represent HK and at the same time super delicious. You'll also learn a lot about their cooking methods, local ingredients the history behind each meal. Aside from that, the portions were just right, the walks in the middle of the courses were perfect, and my lovely guide Silvana was awesome. She knows everything about everything and did a great job educating me and the rest of the group about all things worth knowing. If you want to get to know the central district/kowloon, experience their cuisine and learn a little cultural background, these tours are your best bet IMO.

Well worth it!. I did the Central district tour today with a lovely group of other tourists. Our guide Fanny, was welcoming and made sure we were a cohesive group in the first few minutes. She remembered everyone's names and ensured we were all well taken care of. The whole experience was amazing. Not only were we treated to some of the best food HK has to offer, we also learned lots of local history on our way. The tour took us to places we would never have known to go and into restaurants you wouldn't realise were there. I would thoroughly recommend this tour for people who want to immerse themselves in local culture. As a photographer, there was ample opportunity to shoot the often unseen side of HK.
Loved it!. Our guide, Silvana was the best. Our family of four took the tour and loved everything about it. If you are in Hong Kong, this is a must do.

Great Fun!. Took the tour last week on Thursday July 4th – wonderful experience, enjoyed every minute! Besides the variety of food samplings, the guides are really the highlight. I loved how they share wonderful stories about the shops history and unique buildings during the tour. A must do experience for the first time or frequent visitor to HK!

Loved this food tour. One of the best food tours I have been on. First, our guide, Silvana, was wonderful. She made the group feel at ease immediately and was incredibly knowledgeable about the food, restaurants, history of the area, and culture of Hong Kong. Second, the food was wonderful. It was always ready quickly at each of the stops and delicious! Also, two of the stops were drink stops which were perfect and refreshing on a hot day. Lastly, Hong Kong Island was the perfect place for this tour. Besides stopping at the restaurants, we walked past markets, shops, and sites, and Silvana patiently answered all the questions we had about the market food and the area in general. I cannot recommend this tour enough. I would give it 6 stars if possible. I would also love to try the other foodie tour if I am ever back in Hong Kong.

Delicious food, and great insight into a district of Hong Kong. A wonderful way to get to know Hong Kong a little better, and great fun! Take comfortable shoes, an open mind, and an empty stomach. You will eat some fresh and delicious foods and learn to see beyond the usual tourist level. Your delightful guide will also provide you with recommendations and valuable information about ordering great fresh food later on, as well as teaching you about the cultural or local significance of the food and the family businesses which produce it. You might also meet some interesting fellow travelers on the tour. The best recommendation I can offer for HK Foodie Tours is to tell you that I have booked a second tour for a few days time. And I can't wait!

Don't miss while in Hong Kong. Excellent & worthwhile tour for foodie & nonfoodie types alike. Knowledgeable and personable Hong Kong native tour guide. Thoroughly enjoyable afternoon walking food tour.

A tour worth taking. I took the Central and Sheung Wah tour while in Hong Kong this week, my husband was working so I went by myself. The tour was wonderful and the guide, Silvana, was very knowledgable and obviously passionate about food. All the places we went were fabulous and interesting but my advice, go with an empty stomach, the meals are very filling! Looking forward to returning to Hong Kong and doing the Kowloon tour as well as any others that are on.

Three tongues out!. Took the HK Foodie Tasting tour with a friend last week-end as we wanted to do something different and find new eating places in HK. Silvana, our guide, was very knowledgeable, smart and took the time to make everyone in the group (there were 12 all in all) feel welcome and engaged. We discovered some interesting bits and pieces about the Central and Sheung Wan area, walked through some un-touristy back streets and had a great time, even if it was drizzling throughout. The food stops were also very good, some better than the others. Aside from food stops and the food information, Silvana also pointed out historical, cultural and architectural points of interest. I plan to take their other tour, Sham Shui Po Food tour the next time I'm in Hong Kong.

Excellent food tour of Hong Kong. I went on the Sham Shui Po Foodie tour and loved every moment of it! As I was travelling alone and not for the first time to Hong Kong, I wanted a tour taking in the lesser known aspects of Chinese food whilst also discovering more 'local' areas of Hong Kong in a group. This tour ticked all the boxes! The size of the group was perfect (6 people) and Silvana, the guide, was very friendly and extremely knowledgable about the food and area. What I loved about this tour was that I was able to taste food that I've seen many times before walking through the streets of HK and that there was a broad selection of food to try: typical locally baked goods/sweets ('pineapple' bun); drinks (soy); desserts (local typical biscuits) and savoury dishes (goose dishes and homemade noodles)! Aside from the great selection of food, the area itself is fascinating and REALLY added to my enjoyment of the tour! It was so local and appreciated Silvana pointing out all the history and aspects of life of a typical Hong Kong-er, which I never would have had the opportunity to learn about otherwise. From the way they live and the kind of accomodation they occupy, local eating habits to family run businesses: everything was a real eye-opener. The tour lasted around 4 hours, though as you're stopping every so often, wasn't tiring and time flew by. I would wear comfy shoes, though. There are rest stops along the way and time to take pictures - don't forget your camera; it's a photo enthusiasts paradise! You're advised not to shop during the tour (can see why, easy to get carried away!), though wasn't a problem as I returned later to the places that caught my eye, after the tour had finished.I fully recommend this tour for a unfettered insight into local food and life! Thank you so much HK Foodie, and Silvana, you really brought the tour to life!

Great Tour!. Did the Sham Sui Po foodie tour in June of 2013. For tourists that want a more adventurous experience that is not in the typical tourist area of Hong Kong this is the tour to pick. My family and I are familiar with traditional dim sum so we wanted to experience something a little more unique and this hit the spot taking us to odifferent places to eat and shops in the neighborhood. Highlight might have been the place that served fresh soy milk. I have never enjoyed soy milk before but the soy milk here was delicious. Make sure you come hungry because they give you a ton of food spanning from breakfast to lunch.

More than just a food tour!. I recently went on the Sham Sui Po foodie tour and thoroughly enjoyed the experience! As a solo traveler, I appreciated how much Silvana, our wonderful guide, included me in the conversation. Her history lessons on the neighborhood were incredibly interesting and made the experience that much richer. We visited six eateries, all specializing in something different. Since it was the morning tour, we started with a delightful breakfast of freshly baked pineapple buns and HK-style milk tea. Then we slowly worked our way through the old, working-class neighborhood, stopping at places of note such as an old pawn shop and a family kitchenware business. The day was filled with pleasant moments, like when we stopped to get bottles of soy bean milk and the shopkeeper let us taste his freshly made tofu dessert for free. At the pudding shop, we got to have our photos taken with the elderly owner who happened to be enjoying his breakfast in the small dining room. Of the dishes and traditional snacks we tried, the roasted goose was the crowd favorite dish. Just don't fill up on the accompanying rice as that's not the final stop. By the time we ended at the handmade noodle restaurant, I was completely stuffed!

A Great Way to Get Aquainted with City. I have been living in HK for 4 years and by no means consider myself a foodie. I really enjoyed the tour. I experienced some great local cuisine I would otherwise never have discovered on my own and learned some of the history of these local cuisines. I also enjoyed the history lessons in between each of the stops. Even though the tour took about 4 hours (through Central and Sheung Wan) it didn't really feel like it was that long. The guides were very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. I wish I had done this tour when I first moved here!! I highly recommend it to anyone who is in town for a short time or anyone who has been living here for a while. There were 7 people in our tour group which ranged from couples, friends to solo travellers.

An absolute must do!. I went on the Hong Kong Central tour and it was the absolute highlight of my time here so far. The enthusiasm and passion shown by the tour guides was second to none, and as a newcomer to Hong Kong it was a great way to learn all about the cuisine and the history. The places we visited were all off the beaten track and I never would have discovered them if not for this tour. Wonderful food, and the sugar cane juice and tea house were also completely fascinating! I want to come back and do the other tour; it will be first on my list of things to do!Finally, I thought this was just amazing value for money. We were walking and eating and drinking and talking for hours; they really could have just rushed round the places and then been done with it, but it was perfectly paced and every minute brought something new.

the fab secrets of Sham Shui Po!. If you want to experience HK at ground level - meet real locals and try authentic local dishes then this is a MUST DO tour. 3-4 of the most enjoyable hours you can have with Silvana (your guide) and a like minded group of food lovers. And Sham Shui Po is such a great place to visit. I went back several times during my HK stay just to eat at some of the places we visited and to shop at the street markets. It is so easy to get to on the MTR too. No good if you don't like walking, but that's why it's so interesting....you get to see more.Mr Mak and other local 'personalities' add to the colour of this great foodie, cultural and historical experience. Thanks Silvana - you girls are on a winner! And I look forward to doing it again.

Excellent Authentic Tour With A Clued Up Freindly Guide.. Silvana our guide was so clued up about everything we ate and saw, thank you for an amazing foodie experience in Sham Shui Po the authentic food tastings were amazing, We learned so much about the history and culture of the area as well, I was testing my partner afterwards about the things we saw along the way, It was a perfect day, Thanks again for a truly delicious experience, Andy & Stephen

Great food reflecting on the history of the city. The guide was excellent, well informed on the history and 'story' of all the food tasting locations and the districts in general. Takes the risk out of trying some of the places that you always want to - authentic and those that have been in the family business for generations. Great variety, best wanton noodle soup i've ever tasted, dim sum, bbq pork, tea, sugar cane, and desert. GOLD.

Great way to explore Hong Kong!. What a great afternoon!! Our excellent guide took us for a very interesting walk around central Hong Kong. We stopped at 5 places on the way - noodle soup, dim sum, sugar cane juice, tea and custard tart shop - and ate some of the very best Chinese/Cantonese food ever!! We also got lots of interesting social history information! One of the best trips I've done and I would thoroughly recommend it!

Sham Shui Po - excellent local tour. The Sham Shui Po is the new tour by this group and was a perfect gift given to my husband and I as we arrived to live and work in HK. The Sham Shui Po area is a bit more local and the food different to the central one. It was an excellent tour in an area we probably wouldn't have uncovered ourselves, and helped us understand local foods away from the normal dim sum style. Our guide Sylvia was really lovely and knowledgable and showed us local shops and market and explained history of the area, as well of course the food. We ate in places that are truly local joints and were really full after we finished. It was a perfect way to get to know more about HK and the food, and I would highly recommend this tour.

A Must do in Hong Kong. My husband and I were in Hong Kong last month for only a few days and decided to check out Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tours after all of the great reviews. We didn’t know fully what to expect, but wanted a combination of a food and a history tour and this was a perfect choice. The tour was very intimate being only my husband and myself, very informative and the food was incredible. Silvana was an amazing resource and wealth of information. We really enjoyed learning about the family run eateries, the history, architecture, and how Central & Sheung Wan has transformed over the years. I could go on and on, but suffice it to say we truly enjoyed our experience and I would highly recommend this tour for anyone who loves food and is looking to get a taste of Hong Kong culture.

You have to do this!. Savannah? Was our tour leader, and she was fantastic! Really knowledgable, and was all in all, a fantastic leader! The food tastings were fantastic, taking us around to a few places, and sampling the food was great. Just the right size'd food portions, so by the trips end - you're full! No dinner required! The only thing perhaps is to allow a small amount of time (5-10mins) to shop a the tea house - because we wanted to buy things - but didn't end up getting back to the shop. All in all, fantastic tour, and great service!!

Food and Fun in Hong Kong. We spent a terrific afternoon in Hong Kong with Silvana of Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tours. Our first stop was a wonton shop with delicious shrimp wontons. This was followed by the Roast Meat shop, my favorite. We then sampled sugarcane juice, which is supposed to be quite healthy for you. Next was a visit to a tea shop where we sampled several teas, and tried making our own Oolong tea. We strolled through the streets and visited the local food and wet markets on our way to Dim Sum, which was good - especially the pork bun. Last was a traditional bakery shop where we had an egg custard tart. This tour was excellent. Silvana was very easy to understand and it was really interesting. This tour is about much more than just food; it is a walking tour through a fascinating city. Highly recommended.

If you have 4 hours........ I had an afternoon free and decided to try this tour. I like to try new food experiences but like to know what I am actually putting in my mouth. The group was mixed European/American and very friendly which made the experience much better. The tour guide was excellent and did not confine her commentary to the food but ranged over many topics depending on questions. It was a great introduction to local cuisine and gave me confidence to try other local foods. For those that really know their teas the Tea Room stop was one of the highlights. One person left there ecstatic and the rest of us now know a lot more than before about Chinese teas. I was very happy with the tour overall and certainly don't feel short changed.
Trip highlight. Super-knowledgeable and engaging tour guide, spot on with the restaurants they picked. Not just about food: history, sociology, architecture. Highly recommend.

Flawless Tour: Exceptionally well organised: LOVED every moment.. This was a superb tour in every aspect. It should be seen as a benchmark for others. The meeting spot was civilised, safe, comfortable and weather protected in the lobby of a nice business tower. We had 9 tourists on our day, 3 of them were my husband, 9 year old daughter and I. Silvana was absolutely lovely, intelligent, informative, polite, with a very likeable personality and a genuine passion for her profession. We were all given a brochure at the beginning, showing a map of where we were going, and all the details of the eateries we were to visit, and a bunch of other suggestions for later on, as well as useful Cantonese phrases.Aside from being a delicious and excellent quality foodie tasting tour, Silvana also covered food culture and customs, local heritage, impact of gentrification, the quest of quality SMEs in the food industry, residential living conditions and all sorts of interesting topics. It was absolutely fantastic, and while I spent a good part of the tour taking dozens of great shots (I'm a keen photographer), I was listening to almost every word she said (regardless of appearances). My daughter grilled me later on why I wasn't paying attention. I was paying attention, it's just that I was multi-tasking! I loved the fact that this tour gave us an intimate socio-cultural journey through the heart of Central and Sheung Wan, which we could retrace the following day (and we did in part). It covered Cat Street (Lassau Row) and The Ladder and passed local schools, aged care facilities, disability workshops and temples. It was probably the most richly detailed 4 hours I've spent in my recent life, and yet it was not at all exhausting. It was pleasureful throughout. They even scheduled appropriate toilet breaks. They thought of everything! You do need sensible walking shoes, and there are quite a lot of steps involved (great for working the pork and dumpling fat off your thighs!), so you might get an itsy bitt puffed at times, if you're not used to lots of steps. Silvana was also very good with our daughter - Not at all patronising, like some people can tend to be around kids. Our daughter asked lots of intelligent questions and Silvana answered with consideration and respect every time.The food was extraordinary and the choices of eateries showed integrity and a genuine commitment to recognising 'the little people' in the community who strive so hard to provide quality food and beverages that are true to Hong Kong's epicurean heritage. I once did a food tour in New Orleans that I thought was brilliant at the time, but this tops that one, hands-down.I could rave about this tour for weeks. It was highly educational, exceptionally well thought out, and I'll leave others to talk about the food choices, as they were all exceptional. Bravo HK Foodie Tasting Tours - LOVED the experience - Thank you so much.

Great introduction to food in Hong Kong!. One of the best things I did in Hong Kong! The guide was wonderful, too, very knowledgeable and personable. We had a full group (of 12), and were delayed by several heavy rainstorms, and she kept up a good attitude during the entire time. I landed at the airport at 6 pm, and did this tour at 2 pm: a perfect way to begin my Hong Kong adventure.

Great local food and city history tour. knowledgeable tour guide and great opportunity to tour the city on foot; raining hard, but we had a great group that hung in for the duration. I enjoyed every bite, and all of the knowledge shared along the way. Highly recommended!

Worth the cost, time and effort. A nice cross section of local foods, customs, and history. I strongly recomend this tour for those a bit nerous of tasting the local foods from the less "gam" joints. My wife and I went back to every location, several times to the Yum Cha place. The walking and timing between courses was well planned and the stops at the local wet markets and others spots of interest were great. Yes it is overpriced and yes you can fing the places on your own but i think one could argue this for mostr every tour anywhere in the world. I know I will be doing the new tour they are launching in April when I next head over, so should you.

Great food with history thrown in. We joined our group of travellers and proceeded to find out about Hong Kong food in the actual venues where it was made. So authentic and delicious, was wonderful to try food from stalls/shops that had no English signs or menus. I enjoyed the Chinese tea experience very much and now have a love for the tarts, not as sweet as I'd expected. Silvana was a brilliant tour guide and host.Highly recommend

Soooo yummy!!!!!!!!!!. I loved this tour and so glad I took it!! The guide was wonderful and very informative. We ate at the yummiest places that I never would have found on my own. At the same time I got to see the city I would not have been able to otherwise!!! Definetly worth it!!!!!!! My favorites were the noodle soup and the dim sum! So wish I was there now!!!

Needs a little more zest. While I like the chance to mingle in a small group, the places aren't too special. If you have a bit of time to do some basic research, you can head to these places easily on your own. As we hop from place to place, I find that for most of them, I have read about it in guidebooks/website before, It is just if you know how to read a map and navigate there. Not big into tea, so the tea stop wasn't interesting (even though to be fair, i was aware of this before I book... just thought there would be more value for the rest of the food stops).Thus the cost of tour comes across as expensive, including tipping and also a booking fee online.

Great Tour - SO Much Fun!. This was a great tour. I loved it. I was concerned about the price, but it was totally worth it. Be prepared to do quite a bit of walking. Also, bring an umbrella as it rains quite a bit in Hong Kong and the tour won't stop because you are getting wet. Met a bunch of nice people on the tour and the tour guide was excellent. The first stop was Tsim Chai Kee Noodle - amazing wanton noodle soup. Next was Lung Kee Restaurant - excellent roasted meat - especially the pork! Next was Kung Lee Sugar Cane Juice - really interesting and tasty. I wish I would have tried the Turtle Shell Jelly and Sugar Cane Pudding - do that if you stop there. We then went to a Tea Studio and did a traditional Chinese tea service - great. Next was Dim Sum Square - awesome Dim Sum. Finally ended at Hei Lee Cake Shop - great Egg Tarts. Excellent experience that I highly recommend - good way for solo travelers to meet others too. NOT good for children, strollers or wheel chairs.

Great Experience. This was an excellent orientation to the food and culture of Hong Kong. In addition, it was a good orientation to Central and Sheung Wan. Sylvania, the guide, was knowledgeable and lots of fun. I was a bit hesitant to pay for something in a foreign country in advance, but we had no issues and the tour was worth every penny. This was the best food we had in Hong Kong and helped us a lot at future meals. Do this tour at the beginning of your trip. Although we didn't have our kids with us on this trip, the tour would be great for kids too.

Best way to learn about the culture of a city is by eating its food!. Nice combination of walking and noshing through some of the central neighborhoods of Hong Kong. Learn, taste and understand some of the unique food delicacies and specialties of these Hong Kong neighborhoods. The tour attracts similar minded traveler/explorers who make spending the afternoon together even more enjoyable. The roast goose was divine and dim sum scrumptious. Learn about tea in a very special specialty tea shop and then enjoy a famous "Hong Kong egg tart".

GREAT TOUR. We spent 2 days in Hong Kong and this was a great way to see and experience the real city. We enjoyed it very much and would recommend it, but you do need to be fairly mobile as you do walk some distance and go up and down steps. The guide was very knowledgable and friendly.Take the tour you will be pleased that you have.

great fun. Had a wonderful time on the tour, the guide was great she knew so much about the local foods, as well as the history of them. The food was fantastic, and the trip to the tea shop was a lot of fun and very informative. All in all I couldn't imagine a better way to spend an afternoon.

Great experience. Thanks to Silvana for a wonderful and fabulous experience. The foodies Tour through central was a great trip to learn about Hong Kong culture and the different food as well as the daily living in one of the most favorite cities of the world. The food combination was absolutly perfect .... Wan Tan Noodle Soup, DIM SUM and unforgetable the Tee Ceremony .... it was a great day. Thanks

Amazing. thank you very much for a wounderfull time. I am very happy that i started my Hongkong trip with such activity, as learning best food to eat here. I had really little knowledge about chinese/hingkonh food before, so now i know at least about wanton noodle soup, bbq pork, sugac cane juice and some dim sum types. Thank yiu again, for such classy standards!

Great way to immerse yourself into Hong Kong. This was a fabulous experience in HK, quite the highlight. Silvana is friendly and engages with people easily. The food was exceptional and located in out of the way places. Along the way Silvana points out architectural points of interest and is happy to answer any questions. With the promise of a similar tour to be run in future in Kowloon we will definitely put this on a list of things to do next time.

Great way of indulging into the local food culture!. Great experience worth every penny!Silvana is a great guide who will not only tell you everything about the local food culture but will also guide you through the history and culture of Hong Kong. If you are travelling alone this is a perfect opportunity to meet other backpackers/travelers!

Best intro to HongKong neighborhooods!!. All the reviews are right on! You will love this tour as your first introduction to Chinese food.Silvanna did an excellent job and gave a thorough tour of the neighborhoods. You get to trythe best of dim sum etc, Very worth while!!!

HongKong Foodie tour. We had a wonderful afternoon learning not only about HongKong food but also about the culture and history. We wandered leisurely around various venues tasting local specialities, investigating little shops and markets and looking at historic landmarks all lead by the very knowledgeable Silvana. We were a group of 8 from various countries which was a perfect size allowing us all to ask questions and there were a lot of them! Silvana answered them all expertly. The tour exceeded all our expectations and we would thoroughly recommend it to all visitors to HongKong both first timers and experienced visitors.

Great Tour!. Great Tour! Silvanna is very knowledgeable about the history of each business we visited and most importantly the dishes were fabulous. Too bad I joined the tour on the last day of my trip in HK otherwise I would have definitely returned to get some more of the BBQ pork. There were also breaks in between the food to learn some of the history of the area. I highly recommend this tour for individuals who are in HK for the first time. I would not have found the places on my own.

Amazing !. Was happy to join the foodie tour as it introduced me to the local grub in Hong Kong. Silvana, our tour guide, was very informative and patient in explaining the Chinese delicacies. Every single stop on the tour served scrumptious food and it was right on the spot. These spots are where the true HK natives frequent, therefore it is the a great way to step in the shoes of the locals. We were never rushed and Silvana took her time to explain the history of Hong Kong and also gave us wonderful recommendations on where to eat. Looking forward to join their Kowloon tour when I come back .

Fantastic. Have lived in Hong Kong for 2 years and loved this tour. The food was great and the guide full of interesting facts about the area we covered. The were also great at arranging gluten free substitues at each venue for me.

Fantastic!. This was a great afternoon with some really delicious food and a way to meet some other people whilst on my own. At the end, realised how far we'd walked but it's broken up so it doesn't feel like a trek and plenty of stops at the different places along the way. When I go back to Hong Kong, I want to try the new Kowloon tour which they said would be opening soon!

Wonderful way to connect to Hong Kong. I was in HK on business and this tour was a terrific way to connect to the city. Small group of really nice people, knowledgable and charming guide, thoughtfully chosen places. Very good logistics (email confirmation and reminder, easy-to-find meeting place). I am glad they plan to add a Kowloon version, I would like to do it when I return.

Yum!. Great way to be introduced to the amazing food in HK, and also the culture of eating. Described as a "tasting" tour but we we did more than taste! We ate loads of great food. Silvana mixed in a bit of history and culture and made great recommendations for other places to eat. We were provided with a map of where we went with the other food places recommended also indicated on the map. Although that may not seem like much, I think it's a fabulous idea and so helpful in finding the places again (we kept going back to the yum cha restaurant for their amazing pork buns!). We had a full group of 12, which initially seemed like a lot, but it was fine and great fun. Highly recommended.
Excellent history of Cantonese food and Hong Kong. Highly recommend this event. Great way to meet people if you are traveling alone. Definitely come with an appetite because you will eat a lot.

Excellent way to spend an afternoon..... Our guide Sylvana was very knowledgable, and took us to places that normally we would have walked straight past. For example, doorways in streets that led down to basement restaurants that made the BEST wonton noodle soup in Hong Kong. We visited 6 places over an afternoon, including a traditional tea making house, and came away feeling like we knew much more about the history and culture of Central Hong Kong. Our group of 10 was not too large or small, the walking was all very manageable, and we would highly recommend the Foodie Tours if you want a good introduction to some wonderful food in an amazing city!

Perfect for orientation and gastronomification!!. Not sure that is a word but you catch my drift?! Fantastic tour through the amazing streets of central HK. Great mix of education, exercise and tasty food. Silvana is very well informed and the mix of restaurants is perfect. We were told they are starting a Kowloon tour in 2013 too. Great way to spend your afternoon.

Fabulous. It was the highlight of our short stay of 3 nights in Hong Kong. Sylvana, the guide, was very knowledgable of the culinary and at the same time very gracious . We enjoyed every place she took us to savor the food of Hong Kong and the food was remarkable. That was a great treat. Worth every penny. The best wonton soup I ever tasted.

Fantastic tour. Can't recommend this highly enough, well worth the time and money. The food was wonderful and I learnt so much about it. Also wonderful to be given recommendations of other great places to eat although after the tour I now feel much more confident in what I am looking for on my own.

Great tour!. Absolutely recommend! It is a great way to get a sense of the central area. Definitely something to do on your first day in HK. Also, they give you great recommendations for places to eat when you are here. We really enjoyed this!

Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tours. As a group of four we did this tour on our second day in Hong Kong (Dec.'12). It was my highlight of our trip not only for the food which was incredible but also for the insight to Hong Kong. We all learnt so much from our wonderful guide Silvana. After the tour we were more confident not only on ordering food but making our way around the back streets of Hong Kong. A few days after doing this tour we revisited two of the restaurants finding our way with no problems. A definate must do if you visit this city.

Good mix of food and culture. If you are having doubts about what to do I Hong Kong, definitely do this option. It is well worth the time and money. I had both an incredible guide and tour group- all very friendly. Our tour guide (female, but I forgot her name - I am incredibly bad for remembering names). Anyways, she took us to places I would have never known about or would have ever walked into. One place had zero English and no pictures to go off of when ordering and the staff could barely speak English. So in this case, it was perfect she took us there because I would have never gone else wise. My recommendation: Don't eat a lunch. Have a bigger breakfast. This tour fills you up. It's 3.5 hours long. Time flew, so if you think 3.5 hours is long, it is not. Also, if you are a solo traveller this is a nice option. Not only will it help you get your bairings and help you decide what to do on your trip, but its a good place to talk to and meet like minded people/tourists. It can get a little boring doing things by yourself. Surprisingly, this tour is partnered with the food tour in Chicago (one of the best ones I have done). Because of this it was modelled in similar fashion. So in addition to the food, she entertained us with history of Hong Kong, the different neighbourhoods, buildings, people, agriculture, etc. and she was very open and knowledgable when anyone asked specific questions. Enjoy!

Brilliant - a must do in HK. We did this tour on our first day in HK in November 2012. We were looking for a tour to learn more about the city but didn't want to sit on a tourist bus. This tour was perfect.The tour is a mix of food and cultural sites and the balance is just right. The guide, Silvana, is super friendly and interesting.The restaurants visited are very tasty and we learnt so much about HK food and their culture.Don't think twice about this tour, just book it!

Do this on your first day.... You won't regret it. I am a self-proclaimed foodie and trying new, local dishes is one of the primary reasons I travel. As a solo traveler, it can be a bit intimidating to get a lay of the land. Silvana was an excellent host / guide and delivered exactly what I was looking for on my trip to Hong Kong. I not only sampled great local dishes, but I was able to get my bearings and then navigate the city so much better for the remainder of my trip. As I have explained to all my friends, the tour more than paid for itself. Rather than eating at the more expensive and touristy restaurants, I was comfortable eating what and where the locals eat during my stay in HK. I hope to find other tours like this in more cities. Until then, I can't wait to go back to HK to eat the delicious and inexpensive dim sum HK Foodie turned me on to.

A great way of combining eating and exercise. The guide really knew her stuff. We did the Central tour and stopped at a number of family-run stores. She seemed to know the locals and got on well with them. A highlight was the tea appreciation session with Ivan. Now I know not to burn the tea with boiling water unless its breakfast tea. A great time for very little money.

Tasty and informative!. I'm a regular visitor to Hong Kong but this is the first guided tour I've done and boy was it worth it. I went on the Foodie's tour Central and Sheung Wan on Xmas Eve and the combination of tastings and information was just right. The choice of dishes and destinations highlighted local cafes and restaurants that I never would have dreamed of visiting and has given me plenty of places to try on my next visits. Thanks!

Fantastic Foods and Fun! (Ho Sik!). Hungry for all that good food you see the locals eating, but don't know where or how to order it? If you're like me and enjoy eating, but just want to be taken from place to place by a local and learn a bit about the Hong Kong culture, history and of course eat a lot...definitely book a tour! This is a great way to try all the favourite delicious foods that you want to eat, but don't know what it's called or how to order it without pointing or getting lost in translation (mushrooms anyone? - inside joke. One of the tour group members asked a local waiter where the 'washrooms' were and the waiter happily brought over the menu and showed her all the 'mushrooms' options). Anyways, I digress.Book this tour and you won't be disappointed. You definitely eat a lot (not tasting size portions) and you do walk a bit (so good for eating a lot!). The best part of this tour is you go from place to place and everything is all set and ready to go for you. There's no waiting, no struggle to order what you want to try and you are provided a good explanation of what you are eating, a bit of history of the restaurant and much more!This tour is great for first timers to Hong Kong, regular visitors and even locals. We had some locals on our tour that were amazed at the different locations and even some of the back roads we walked in. It's just a great way to spend an afternoon with a local and try all the delicious food Hong Kong has to offer.I will definitely come back and try their new tours! Sik daw dee (eat a lot!)

Wonderful tasty afternoon. This was a great way to spend an afternoon both for getting to experience some unique restaurants and enjoy the sites and sounds of Central Hong Kong. Each of the restaurants that we visited focused on a particular type of food and were places that as visitors, we would have likely not walked into on our own. The tasting experience was terrific. Our guide, Sylvana, was extremely knowledgeable, fun and friendly. My wife and I would highly recommend taking the tour. (If we get back to Hong Kong, we would even take the tour again, I am told they are considering a future tour in Kowloon.)

Great insight into Hong Kong. The tour was excellent. Fun, but low key, with a group of three. Sylvana, our guide, showed us some great places that we wouldn't have found ourselves, and gave us an insight into Hong Kong that we couldn't have learnt from guide books. Food was excellent, and we'll be going back to track these places down. Also, really good value for money. Really happy we did it.

Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tour. I went on this tour with Silvana in early December. I happened to be the only guest that day so I had a private tour. Silvana was lovely, well-informed and very easy to get along with. I won't describe all the various stops as those are detailed in others' reviews, but all were delicious and interesting. I loved that they were family-run, small operations that I never would have found on my own or in guidebooks. The quality and quantity of the food and drink were very high, and I learned a lot about the history and culture of Hong Kong. All in all, a highly enjoyable experience.

not your average Central tour. The Central foodie tour allowed me to see a different side of the area. As I'm quite familiar with Hong Kong, the tour brought me to some places that I have never been before - the residential and local side of Central. All the food tastings were delicious and i enjoyed the sugar cane juice the most as it's something i've never tried before.

Good tour, but expensive compared to other expenses in HK. Your was interesting and informative - a mix of food history, and general tour of HK. It was good because otherwise, it is hard for foreigners to go to real local eateries as many menus are in Chinese. The tour was great but price was not... From memory, it cost me $70AUD-ish, and they expected a tip on top.Whereas a similar standard food tour in Helsinki, Finland was only $45AUD. Considering the cost of food in HK is significantly less than jn europe,, I'm wondering why the HK tour cost so much more than a similar standard European food tour?????!?!?!

both cultural and delicious. having already had a few days to find my way round HK, it was both delicious and a delight to get the inside gen on some of the history and background to HK, family-run businesses, architecture and cultural changes. For a start, our guide was knowledgeable and friendly and our first pit-stop - a third generation wonton shop was amazing - shrimp wonton in a fish stock made that morning, as it is every day. From there, the selection of drinks and foods - finishing with a proper tea tasting, and excellent Dim Sum, left me feeling full both of interesting facts and fantastic food. To find out about the other side of life - the old HK lady pouring water onto her stack of cardboard to make it heavier, as recycled cardboard sells by weight to the tea expert who really gave us a glimpse into why tea is so revered in HK and China - all of it so interesting and more than you would normally discover as a tourist. Thanks again!

Good food and more. The Hong Kong Foodie Tour is a great introduction to some of the choices for eating in Hong Kong. We were a small group, only 3 tourists so got time to talk and ask lots of questions. Although mainly about food, we also learned a bit of HK history and culture. Wish there were some other tour options, but I guess those are coming.A quick note -- there is a bit of stair climbing on this tour so if that is a problem, let them know when booking.

A great HK experience. What an amazing tour - I read what others had written on Trip Advisor so decided to give it a go, and I was not disappointed!! It was wonderful to experience some of Hong Kong's culinary delights from a local, not from other tourists. The food was amazing, not only from the restaurants / food outlets that we tried, but also from the recommendations that were also provided by our wonderful guide, Silvana.A great experience, and one I highly recommend you do in HK:-) It is an absolute must!(Thank you Silvana for a wonderful afternoon)

THE BALI "OLDS". My Bride of nearly 50 years & I got the tour with Silvana. When it was completed we waddled off having tasted some ripper tucker.We were so impressed with this young lady that we have invited her to holiday in Bali with us.Remember Silvana, the invitation was serious.Best regards from Barbara & Gordon

Fantastic tour.... My husband & I recently did this tour with Silvana and had a fantastic time learning all about the different types of food the locals enjoy. And Silvana also gave us a load of information about the areas we visited, the different specialists shops around the lanes and also various bits of historical information. We probably wouldn't of gone through these areas of Hong Kong, so very pleased we joined the tour. Everything that we sampled was delicious and we went back to one the restaurants before we left HKG as the shrimp wonton soup was delicious.Highly recommend!

hong kong foodie tasting tour. Made our way to the meeting point (easily, good directions) and met with the lovely Silvana and our other 10 foodie companions for the afternoon. Most enjoyable, Silvana was informative and passionate about her city & its food with very good reason. Great selection, noodles, BBQ pork, tea, dim sum plus others in a fast disappearing section of older Hong Kong. Pleasant companions and very nice resturanteurs willing to share their culture & food, Great way to explore a city, make sure you wear comfortable shoes & elastic waist bands!Similar experience in Bangkok, great tour to do where-ever you can find them.

Fascinating Afternoon. No doubt about it - the restaurants chosen were authentic and delicious, Silvana is very professional and informative and it's a great way of seeing an insiders view of Hong Kong and it's intimate eateries, explore the architecture and soak up the original and local Hong Kong.Loved the fact in this pork laden city, Silvana is able to provide a vegetarian option. Highly recommended.

Fantastic foodie afternoon.. I am travelling alone and I spent a wonderful afternoon with nine other like minded congenial people, tasting a variety of different traditional Hong Kong food and drinks. The tour leader was Silvana who was an absolute fund of knowledge about Chinese food and history, and was happy to share this knowledge with us in a very entertaining way. We visited three small family run traditional restaurants, one Chinese tea shop, a Chinese bakery and a shop that made and sold sugar cane juice and turtle jelly. All the food and drink was made freshly by traditional methods, and it all tasted outstanding. We learned about different teas in the tea shop, did some tastings and learned how to make tea properly by the enthusiastic owner. We gorged on wanton noodles, barbecued pork rice, a variety of dim sum, and a wonderful egg tart. I loved the turtle jelly, and I hoped it would get rid of my cold, we have to wait and see about that. Anyone with a serious interest in food would just love this tour which lasted nearly four hours.

Mouth-Watering Fun!. Had a lot of fun on this tour and really got to see a part of Hong Kong that is different from what tourists usually know / see of Hong Kong. Great architecture, lots of older neighborhoods (the old man's haircut place was eye-opening!) and of course living up to its name, this tour was a fantastic experience for foodies! There was a perfect balance of eating vs. strolling vs. learning about the history of Hong Kong -- i.e. right when I was getting really full, we took a longer stroll before the next foodie stop; and right when I was craving something sweet, we got egg tarts. Must have taken a lot of planning! Tour guide was also very knowledgeable about Hong Kong (not just food scene but cultural topics as well) given her native upbringing, though she was a great communicator and presenter in English as well! Especially loved the hole-in-the-wall roast pig place and the dimsum place -- the former tourists would never be able to find and the latter was simply delicious. What I wished I got to try a bit of was the Hong Kong style French Toast and milk tea! Thank you Foodie Tour for pointing this out and mapping it for me though -- I must return to try! Sounds delicious! Highly recommended if you're looking for a delicious afternoon, especially right now when the weather is nice and cool! Would do this in the beggining of a stay here though, since there's so much more I want to return and try!

Great intro to Hong Kong. Excellent selection of food and great commentary of surrounds too. Guide was informative and the tour was well planned in terms of the order of tastings. We did this on our first day, which I'd recommend as it gives you a good feel for the food and the city.

Best Intro to Hong Kong. If you've never been to Hong Kong, this tour should be the first thing you do. Not only do you get an introduction to the amazing food this beautiful city has to offer, you get an overview of the culture and a nice walking tour of Sheung Wan and Central area's. The guide spoke perfect English and happily discussed many topics beyond food. The restaurants they took us to were fabulous, and they gave us a list of other great places to try. I can't wait to come back to Hong Kong and do this tour again!

Great intro to Hong Kong. We did this tour on our first day in Hong Kong. It was a great introduction to the food and culture of the area. Both Silvana and her sister were very informative and helpful guides. There was plenty to eat- all of it delicious! The tea tasting was informative. A couple of days into our holiday we visited one of the tasting restaurants for yum cha and received a great welcome.I'd thoroughly recommend this tour to all Honk Kong visitors.

Great HK Experience!. I had been to Hong Kong a few times prior to doing tour, and I wish I had done it earlier! It was a great way to get to try new restaurants, explore the city, and see areas that aren't necessarily on the tourist route. Silvanna was quite knowledgeable and spoke perfect English (always a plus when doing a tour!). The restaurant choices were delicious, and the stops are nicely spaced out. My favorite stop was the tea ceremony with Ivan - you can even buy some to bring home for gifts. Like others have said, make sure you come hungry! I ate a light breakfast, and then didn't even start feeling hungry again until about 11 pm that night. Thanks for the great experience!

Great tour - should have done this as soon as I arrived in HK!. This was a great tour, and the idea is to give the visitor (or local) a good guide to some great places to eat in and around the Central / Sheung Wan areas of HK Island.We walked around a few food places over the course of the afternoon, and got some good ideas about more restaurants and food stalls to check out in the area, as well as whetting my appetite for some more things at the places we went to (from a Char Siu pork shop to a dim sum place).My only regret is that I didn't do the tour until my last full day in HK, so I didn't get the chance to check out these spots again and explore the menus in more depth.

Great introductory tour to Hong Kong cooking. I did this tour on my first day in HK and found it to be a great introduction to HK eating places. I loved all the food we tried and found it really helped me feel more comfortable about heading into other local eating places that otherwise I maybe would have shied away from. Plus, getting a bit of the history of the area and the background story on some of our eating places was fabulous as well, Sylvana was a great guide - really helpful and friendly.I went back again for more Dim Sum and probably would have revisited more if I had more time - especially wish I had made it back to the roast meat place as that was my favourite. As well as the tastings we visited we also got a list of other recommended places to try and it was great having those tips too. Definitely try the French Toast place if you go to HK...so good!I would say that the food wasn't highly adventurous but I was fine with that and at a few of the stops there were other items that you could have gone back for if that's more the thing you are after (turtle jelly or roast pigeon anyone?).

Great introduction to HK. My wife and I were really excited about this tour after reading the reviews and we weren't disappointed. Great selection of food (and venues) nicely spread over 3.5 hours. A great way to spend your first or second afternoon with a local. We loved the wanton soup and din sum. Thank you Silvana.

Excellent Tour. We did this tour on our first full day in Hong Kong, and it was a nice start to our vacation. Our tour guide Silvana was very nice and was very helpful in explaining the food as well as the sites in history of the neighborhood that we were in. We never felt rushed, and even though the tour was just prior to a national holiday in Hong Kong, we still had plenty of time to enjoy the foods served to us. As others have said, the stops that you make will definitely fill you up, so make sure you come hungry and don't make any large dinner plans for the evening you take tour.

Excellent intorduction to the local food scene. A very comfortable well organised tour with a great guide, Sylvana. There were only three of us on this tour, but I am sure it would be as enjoyable even in a larger group. There is a bit of walking, but Sylvana didn't rush us, and catered to our speed of walking very well. Food is excellent, but you can ignore the light lunch before hand suggested on the website as there is more than enough food on the tour for even a strong appetite. Overall enjoyable and informative, I recommend it.
