Wonderful tour with great food and insight into the city. It's been a wonderful tour by our tour guide Silvana. The food places were very interesting and the food we had tried were delicious. Silvana was a very attentive tour guide and helped us learned a lot about the food culture in HK and the story behind the stores. Besides the great food, we enjoyed a lot learning the history of different bits around the city centre. Highly recommended if you want to learn more about food culture of HK!

Must do for Hong Kong. We had a wonderful time with our guide Silvana, the tour is packed with good information about food and Hong Kong, and we took advantage of the 20% rebate at the Tea shop. I recommend not to eat much before, in order to fully enjoy all the great food that is presented to you during the tour. What we loved about the experience is that we went to places that we would have not dared to enter without a local, and this gave us a unique opportunity to visit and taste the food those places were offering. But this isn't just about food: our guide gave us much cultural and historical information, which helped us to understand and appreciate HK. We highly recommend this tour, it's one of our favourite experiences during our week in HK!

Make this the first thing you do in Hong Kong!. I will be honest, I tend to travel on my stomach. If the local food is good, the trip was wonderful and I want to visit again. If the food is so-so or bad, I will generally try another destination. I live in the Pacific Northwest and there is a lot of bad "Chinese" food here and I am generally not thrilled with it. The Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tour was absolutely wonderful and I will definitely visit Hong Kong again.I have never been on a food tour, but having recently seen a food tour being conduced in Portland, OR, I thought that might be a good way to get a feeling for Hong Kong. I did some research on-line and found this tour and read the reviews on Tripadvisor. After some deliberation (do I really want a tour? Me, who prides myself on going my own way?), I booked the tour for the day after I arrived. It was amazing and possibly the best way to be introduced to Hong Kong and the local food.There were 5 of us on the tour- two from the US, two from Singapore and one American living in Taiwan. Silvana introduced us all and kept conversations going throughout the tour. At each stop (5 in total), she asked us about the dishes in our local areas. We had fascinating discussions.The food was the star, though. The first stop was a noodle shop. It was my favorite! We had yellow noodle soup with HUGE wontons filled with amazing shrimp. She had us try the broth before we added any other flavors (red vinegar and chili sauce). It was the best I ever had and got a bit of food high from it. The next stop was roast meat. I saw a lot of roast meat shops on my walk through the city that morning (tour started in the afternoon) and was a little nervous. The shop window was filled with roasted duck, goose, quail, pork and suckling pig. The pork that was served was wonderful- moist, tender, flavorful and perfectly done. The third stop, after a wonderful long walk, was a sugar cane juice shop. That was the first time I have sugar cane juice and it was a real eye opener. It was sweet, but earthy at the same time. Very refreshing!We had a longer stop at a nice little tea shop. It was the most modern shop and the quietest. Ivan, the owner, was very knowledgeable and very proud of China's tea. We learned how to steep each type of tea, how to pour tea properly and now to really appreciate tea. It was right next to a neighborhood shire and was very serene.The second to last stop was incredible. Dim Sum! I had been looking forward to this stop since I booked the tour. It was amazing and exceeded all expectations! We had crystal shrimp dumpling, shu mi, baked pork buns and spring rolls. All were excellent, fresh and wonderful! I am used to the dim sum with the carts and large dining rooms and this was nothing like it. It was hot, fresh and had so much flavor, sauces were not needed.Our last stop was for the sweets. We stopped at a tiny bakery to try egg custard tarts. This has become my favorite dessert!Along the tour, Silvana pointed out other restaurants that carried local food and were good places to eat. I ended up going back to three of the tour stops and one of the other suggested places. I can go on and on about this tour, but I cannot put into words how wonderful it was. I felt so much more comfortable with Hong Kong, the food, the culture and the people from this tour. I would highly suggest you take this tour your first full day in Hong Kong. It was a great introduction to everything that is Hong Kong! As a side note, Silvana suggested a restaurant in Macua (I was going there in two days). I was amazing and I am so happy she suggested it!

Great Tour for Visitors. We booked this tour for our first full day in Hong Kong and we could not be happier with the experience. Not only did we have great food and benefit from a little narrative whilst walking around in Central and Sheung Wan, this tour made us more comfortable with the whole Hong Kong food scene. We are not food shy, but I doubt we would have braved a tiny cafe just off Cat Street for french toast - and worked through the language barrier - without the tour. Likewise, The roast meat shops are fascinating to look at, with hanging ducks and squab and geese in the windows, but intimidating. Now I would be happy to go in and negotiate a bowl of duck and rice, or char siu.We later returned to three of the places we visited on the tour. We intended to return to the tea shop, but got sidetracked and missed it.The tour includes a bit of walking but it is not strenuous, and the dishes are very approachable for people not familiar with Asian cuisine. I think it would be suitable for most any visitor, and very exciting for those who are not familiar with Chinese food. But just because the dishes are not adventurous does not mean they are not delicious. (I am the guy who would be eating fried scorpions in Beijing just for the unique experience, but I loved the wonton soup and shumai, too.)

Great Tour, Great Idea and Great Tour Guide!. The tour was really great, enjoyed it a lot and thought everything was yummy and delecious. The idea of having a tour on food in HK is a great idea, especially at the beginning of your trip to HK. And last but not least was our guide Silvana, she was so knowledagble and well informed about the tour and the food items we ate, the history of each place we visited in the tour, and how and why they picked that place. A big thank you goes to you guys that we enjoyed our time in this tour.

Delicious!. We spent a great afternoon with Silvana as she showed us around six excellent food and drink places. The dim sum restaurant was so delicious that we went back the next day for lunch! My advice would be to take this tour as early into your stay as possible so that you have time to go back to these places as they are excellent. Loved learning the history and seeing a unique side of Hong Kong. The best experience of our trip!

An absolutely wonderful experience. I found this tour through tripadvisor and couldn't be happier. Silvanna, our tour guide, took the 5 of us around on an almost 4 hour tasting tour that also included history, culture, and local insights. Even when it began to rain a little we pushed forward and didn't allow a bit of wetness to dampen our spirits. We did buy umbrellas at a 7-11 after which the rain promptly stopped. :)The tour has 6 stops that allows you to try Hong Kongs most popular foods and drinks. Even if you are familiar with Hong Kong food the tour will take you to the very best places to try the highest quality items. The dim sum place was my favorite and I returned there the next day for breakfast. Additionally the places on the tour a super cheep so you soon discover something things in Hong Kong don't have to be so expensive to enjoy quality. The tour has lots of walking around the neighborhoods which is great but if you are less mobile this tour might be a bit harder to do. Also remember that the heat and humidity can be a bit much to handle if you're not used to it. At the first stop you get a nice cold bottle of water that helps. But you might want to bring your own or buy some at a 7-11 along the way. And make sure you were comfortable shoes!All in all I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong and has a few hours one afternoon to spent eating great food and learning about a fascinating city.

Excellent Tour!. This tour is defnitely a must-do when visiting Hong Kong, especially when visiting for the first time. I would recommend doing the tour during the beginning of the holiday so you get a chance to sample all the foods and perhaps revist some of these great local food spots. Our guide was a Hong Kong local and very enthusiastic and knowledgable on both Hong Kong and their local food. What was great was that she took you to places that you would normally never find, or would be a bit worried to try on your own. The food was fantastic - from barbeque meats, to dim sum, wontons and tea tastings - it was defnitely worth while. She also provided you with a list of food spots to try out once you complete the tour. I tried some of the eateries and they were really authentic and the snacks / food we had were excellent. A great way to spend an afternoon in Hong Kong! You won't need dinner that night :)

Highlight of Our Stay. This tour was probably the highlight of our 9 days spent in Hong Kong. The guide was extremely knowledgeable on the various aspects of both Hong Kong food and the countries' history as well.This tour took us through Central which is one of the older areas off Hong Kong island. It’s an easy walk through a mix of both old and new buildings and shops. Many of the restaurants we visited have been run by the same families for multiple generations, so you can be assured that the food is very authentic and a good example of local food culture.Included in the tour is a list of suggested restaurants for specific types of meals. We made use of the Hong Kong french toast and milky tea option on our own and it was excellent.If we’d been on our own it’s unlikely we would have ventured into many of these restaurants, but that’s probably one of the best reasons for taking this tour. The locals are are often surprised to find tourists in their favourite restaurants or cafes but they’re always welcoming and it’s a great experience.

Very cool fool tour. My wife and I did this tour on a short 3 day stopover we did of HK (in July) while on our way back from South Asia. We thought this tour was a great way to spend an afternoon in HK and experience the variety of restaurants available. The tour consisted of stops to six restaurants, each with a different specialty from tea to main dishes to desert. Each place also provided vegetarian options for my wife (But be sure to mention it when booking your tour).Along the way the guide kept things interesting by talking about HK food, it's culture, and took all questions. We took the tour as a couple but would also recommend it for small groups or families with teenage or adult children.

Great Taste of HKG. My husband and I just did this tour last week. We were in HKG for a quick three days and love tasting as much local flavor as possible. The tour was a great overview and the tastings were generous portions and delicious. We liked the dim sum place so much we made time to head back for our last meal before the airport! Our guide was great and knowledgeable-- our only feedback was that it felt a bit "scripted" for a tour would have loved to have some more flexiblity with the talking points and also the times at different places. Totally recommend this though and will definitely be checking out their sister tours in other cities.

A highlight of my Hong Kong experience. What a wonderful way to spend an afternoon, dinner was definitely not needed after an absolutely stunning tour. Surprisingly I was the only person whereas the day before ther had been a group of 8. Having my own personal tour guide made me feel very special and the conversations ranged from food to urban renewal! Some of these wonderful food places might not exist in the future as another urban rebuild is planned. If you only do one special tour in Hongkong make sure it is this one. The places visited are usually bypassed by visitors so having a local share their love of great food gives you an opportunity to delve into some delightful restaurants. Enjoy.

Interesting and Tasty. My review is a little late because I've been traveling but here it is! I did this tour with Sylvana about a week ago and it was a very pleasant afternoon. I particularly enjoyed hearing all about the culture and history behind a lot of the places we walked past and visited. I think I was also very lucky because I was the only one on the tour so I was treated to a private tour. Sylvana was only too happy to answer any of my questions. I liked all the places we went to except for one. That was the meat and rice one. The serving was a bit ordinary and I felt the owners weren't very welcoming, however all the other eateries made up for it. I would recommend this tour and would definitely like to see what other tours they have in mind in the future.

Take this tour!. My girlfriend and I have done several walking/food tasting tours around the world and loved the Hong Kong Foodie tour. The food, information, and tour group were all worth the price -- we loved the recommendations and even went back to the same dim sum restaurant that we visited the next day to try more!We're looking forward to trying some of Hong Kong Foodie's new upcoming tours of the other areas of Hong Kong on our next visit!

A Delightful Eye Opener. I've lived in Hong Kong a few years and decided to do this tour on a friend's recommendation. SO glad I did as literally every stop was a revelation. Wonton noodles in an incredible broth; meltingly good char siu pork from a tiny restaurant you wouldn't look twice at; dim sum of a quality far above more well known and expensive places; a tranquil tea shop (and a lesson on how to pour tea properly). Interspersed with all that great food was a relaxing walk through the back streets and lanes of central and sheung wan. One minute you're plunging through crowded pavements, next you're in a quiet back alley learning a bit of Hong Kong history from our lovely guide. All in all, an excellent tour for people like me who live here but haven't discovered Hong Kong's secret gems and a great way to spend a Saturday afternoon the next time visitors are in town. A word of advice: there's lots to eat on this tour so make sure you start it on a empty belly or you wont make it to the pastry at the last stop (I had to take mine home!)

Food tour with some history thrown in.... Booked this tour after seeing good reviews on tripadvisor. A great tour, run by passionate foodies (thanks Cecilia) as I could not fault the tour at all! Great food with a great history attached to every spot we visited plus a few hidden gems along the way. The next time I am in Hong Kong I will be looking you guys up to see what new tours you have in store. The Kowloon one sounds intriguing... Also... the pork buns at the dim sum place we visited on the second last place on the tour... OMG!!!! I will be petitioning for these to come to Austalia asap... awesome!!!!!!!

A lovely way to spend an afternoon and enjoy the culture of Hong Kong!. We decided to do this tour at the last minute and were lucky to book on the day (deadline is 10am). The meeting place was easy to find and a good starting point. The tour included a perfect balance of the different elements of Hong Kong culture including the delicious food, local history and architecture while being shown the backstreet jewels of Central and Sheung Wan. Our guide was lovely and very knowledgable. She was happy to give tips and suggestions for other places to visit and how to make the most of your visit to Hong Kong. Overall and a very enjoyable afternoon with a wide experiences all in one tour. We will definately reccommend this to visitors and friends.

A full package of HK food and culture. I happened to drop by Hong Kong for a weekend last but ran out of options of what to do in Hong Kong, so one of my friends suggested me to join this new foodie tour. I didn't expect too much from it because I thought I knew quite well about Hong Kong. Actually, I was surprised that how this tour managed to show us a different side of Hong Kong culture. They brought us to where I called the "back door" of Hong Kong Island to try out some really local food stalls. The food was undoubtly great, but what attracted me the most was how they combined the history and exploration of local culture together. The guide was very helpful and professional, so I would definitely recommend my friends to join when they go to HK next time! Other than Hong Kong Island, I really hope they can expand their tours to Kowloon and New Terrirtories as promised, so that I can join the tour again next time!

Food tour with culture. I'm not really a tour person but a friend who went on this tour recommended this to me. I love real Chinese food and thought I should give this a try. This tour really surprised me. Although this was not my first time visiting Hong Kong, I really enjoyed the historical aspect of this tour. Not only did they bring you to eat delicious local food, the tour guide also told us stories behind these mom and pop stores.Oh btw, the tour guide is a real local and she's definitely well-travelled. She understands what travellers are looking for. It's a fun tour where you can also meet other people from around the world. I highly recommend this tour.

Fun and tasty. Good tour, very informative. Long and hilly, but with lots of stops and places to rest your feet. Lots of tips about places to return if you have time later in your trip. We did not, but will definitely check some of them out if we return.

Great food with interesting tour. We went on this tour with friends and really enjoyed it. The meeting point is very easy to get to, as it is located between two MTR stations. The only reason we didn't give it 5 stars was the price - it seemed a bit expensive for what you got (HKD$600 plus a ticketing fee of HKD$31 per person that you don't find out about until booking). That was the only negative we could find. The food and drinks were all good and very typical Hong Kong. The tour guide had outstanding language skills (she studied in the States for several years) and purchasing the tickets was very easy. We also enjoyed the history and other info about Hong Kong that she discussed during the tour.

Yumm.. a lovely afternoon.. i have been meaning to write this review since I got back.. I was traveling solo in Hong Kong and was a great way to tour Hong Kong and I met some very interesting people, the other 3 were from Europe.. Much better than dining solo at the top restaurant in town. Hong Kong Tour, www.hongkongfoodietours.com was interactive, informative, fun and the food Was awesome.. makes me want to go back just to eat! I dont know what my favorite dish was.. cant decide between the BBQ pork ( i am a southerner , USA) and the wonton soup. I had a good time. Also, the tour is definitely a foodie tour but the guide, Sylvane, also threw in a lot of interesting HK info too as we walked past various places, etc. She also did a good job of explaining how everything would go.. Which of the stops had restrooms for example. I did the central tour, cost was about $80 US, 600 HK. I thought it was a good price for what I got out of it. Quick tip: bring an umbrella , it may rainQuick tip 2: wear flats, involves a decent bit of walking.

Just do it!. My partner and I did this on Saturday. It was our second trip to hong kong, and this time we wanted some real insider information. Our tour guide was both insightful and delightful, taking us to places, we would never have found on our own. They even replaced one of the dishes at the last minute for my partner as she has an allergy to some mushrooms. You get plenty to eat and drink, with six stops included and plenty of local knowledge and history on the strolls inbetween. If you're visiting hong kong I'd recommend doing this early on your trip as you'll discover heaps of places you'll want to revisit. They even give you a takeaway map and guide to assist with this. Lots of thoughtful touches make this a fantastic experience.

Great shortcut to getting to know HK & local eateries. Just been on this tour today, with my (young) teenage kids. The tour takes place between the Central and Sheung Wan MTR stations. We sampled food and drinks in 6 local eateries, which I have to admit I would've never found or indeed have the confidence to enter, due to my lack of knowledge of Cantonese. We sampled generous portions of wonton soup, dim sum, fresh sugar cane juice and more. It you consider just the food sampling, it can appear expensive for a family of 3 or more. However, if you consider that the guide shows you around and introduces you to the more cultural aspect of HK, it's a great day out. Fantastic way of experiencing the city while avoiding a shopping frenzy!

A great little tour!. I booked the tour for a surprise present for my husband's birthday and we thoroughly enjoyed it. If you like to find out a little about the culture and history of a place whilst sampling some of the most famous local foods then this trip is for you! Right now I'm thinking I will never have to eat again but when I do, I can't wait to show visitors to Hong Kong some of these truly great finds :)Thanks HK Foodies!
Just great!. Not only the history of Hong Kong and the tea studio!

average. this tour is not quite to my liking. felt a little tricked given the reviews here. i signed up after reading that even locals like the tours (if locals even need a tour for the food, then i guess i should really go for one). Food is as mentioned as other reviewers: bbq pork rice, dim sum, egg tarts, wanton noodles (which I also got it off my guidebook). During and after the tour, i kept wondering why would a local want to go for all these common items? I had too much expectations, perhaps for more adventurous food or things that locals would be really excited to get to know/taste. disappointing. saw so much street food along the way but didn't get to try, even though i thought those are the interesting food that should be in the tour.

Eye opener and wonderful surprises! and I consider myself a local!. My wife and I love to discover all the nooks and crannies of each city we visit, follow your nose so to speak, and go off the beaten track, those side street alleys in Florence, little ma and pa run eateries in Hakone etc. So when I found out about a new foodie tour in the city I live in - right here in Hong Kong, I thought what can they bring to the table that I don't know about already!! I was curious.As it turned out, it brought us an enjoyable day filled with wonderful surprises! As a Chinese brought up in Australia, not that I don't know what a wonton noodle is, or har-gow (steamed prawn dumplings), these types of food I can find in many places in this wonderful city of ours, but what was special about this tour and the food it introduced, was that the foodie guide brought us to new places we've never considered eating at before, quite off the radar, and all family run places with very interesting history and background. During the walk, we also noticed loads more of the history in the area thanks to our lovely guide, some of which we walked past every weekend without blinking an eye at, then it was like, wow... didn't know this was here with such a story behind it. Our guide was super friendly, helpful and informative at the same time, we felt very comfortable with her, like family.Some of the most memorable bits for me during the tour walk include finding an old small shop selling old school style cooking sauces that my grandma used to cook with, a 70s hole-in-the-wall eatery (which crossed our path during the walk, but not a designated eating location) was pointed out to us by our guide for some traditional "HK style afternoon tea sets", the tiny family run dimsum place that produced very very tasty treats, and a history and learning session in tea drinking which blew my mind (although the tea instructor could be less teacher-like and more friendly in general...). I was actually told off gently by the guide (in a very nice way of course... haha) because I wanted to do some shopping after the tea talk, but she informed me they don't encourage shopping as this is a tasting tour, but I'm welcome to come back later at our own time if I want to purchase some. I thought later, this is actually very professional of the tour guide, I was impressed.Anyway, we took the tour in April. We'll most likely try it again next year to see if they have a new route and perhaps some new discoveries! I will recommend this to my visiting friends from abroad, it's a fantastic way to see a different side of Hong Kong as we know it, and as long as you like to eat off the beaten track like us. ;)

Fantastic Food and Culture Experience!. The food tour is excellent not only because of the great local food we had, it was the stories and the experience that really makes this special! I learnt so much even having lived here for a little while. It challenges comfort zones to go to small local restaurants and wet markets where tourists might be cautious to give it a try without knowing the language and what to order!! It is very organized and well run. The tea place is especially interesting where you can learn about all sorts of Chinese tea and their benefits! Highly recommended if you're looking for great food and experience!

What an adventure. Had a fantastic experience all the places on our tour were excellent my favorate noodle place Tsim chai kee noodles but then the BBQ pork so good. Every one who goes to hong kong should do this. It's more than a tour it's an adventure back to old hong kong
Interesting. this is a very good food tour. i am glad i went for it. the food is good and the guide is very good. go for it!

Must-do tour for Hong Kong visitors. This is a truly unique and exclusive experience. Out guide Silvana was great. It was our first day in Hong Kong, we were hungry after a 10 hour flight, and the timing of fantastic food experience in Hong Kong was perfect. Tea studio was one of the highlights - thanks Ivan and Silvana!I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who is keen on Honk Kong and Asian food. Artur

Overhyped. I'm not keen to recommend this tour. I guess it was too much of an overhype, so I had very high expectation for the tour and it didn't quite live up to it. Perhaps I have a picky taste bud . Heading to the tea shop feels like a visit to those 'factory' shops that I dread in a group tour. Tea master was naggy. It would be better if we can save the time to try other food (I'm sure Hong Kong has lots more to offer) than to sit and watch a tea ceremony. Some of the food stalls (e.g. egg tarts and wan tan noodles) are just easy public knowledge. Ask a friend, do a google, or read some guidebook, you will probably get them. I didn't feel that the bbq pork rice was worth the tour. I tasted better ones on my own and I wonder if the shop was chosen because it was just in the vicinity.  To be fair, I like the tour when they touched on the family history of the shop, the history/culture of Hong Kong and even the walk along the Graham Street wet market. It gives more perspective than just the food alone.  But then again, for the price that you have to pay for a group tour (i.e. there was clearly a fixed route and fixed food items to try), I'm not sure if it is worth it.

Hong Kong Foodie is more than just Food. What a lovely way to spend an afternoon. Turned out because it was a rather hot day than I was the only person on the tour and they still my guide ahead with it. Great food stops but also lots of local history and culture. If you are into tea the tea master session with Ivan is a blast. I learned a ton - and then you get Dim Sum. Fabulous way to spend an afternoon in HK getting to know the city.

Great food and more...... We did this tour on our second day here and it was superb. Silvana, our guide was very knowledgable with her info on the food, history and life in Hong Kong. Impeccable english and able to answer questions with authority. Was also happy to help out with other recommendations as well if you wanted. Definitely one to do early in trip so you can use what you have learnt for the rest of your stay. We have been back to one of the places to eat and they recognized us and were so appreciative of us coming back. We've also eaten at places we wouldn't have but we're happy with our knowledge to order good food. Thanks heaps Silvana!

EXCELLENT!. My guide Silvana is great! Although there was only me in the tour, it went on! Her English was excellent and she gave me lots of information of the places and I learnt a lot from this tour about Hong Kong. The food that they recommended were also very good~ Although I have tried some of the food before, but the food that they have recommended were really authentic and delicious. Besides the food, you can even learn more about tea brewing and it was also very nice to meet the boss of the Tea Studio and I have learnt more from him. I love Chinese tea and because of this tour, I could get more discount for the tea.I actually accidentally purchased the tour twice but Hong Kong Foodie provided excellent service and made sure that I did not purchase wrongly.All in all, if they have other tours, I will definitely want to join them again.

Hong Kong, very pleased to meet you!. We had a large group of 11 friends sign up for the food tour. As has been mentioned the stops were wonderful. Had some of the best wonton soup, char siu faan, and dim sum i've had in a while. Silvana, our tour guide was great. Her english was impeccable as well as her knowledge of the area. Would definitely recommend it to anyone, be sure to make it early on your trip so that you can revisit some of the places. We unfortunately had it towards the tail end of our trip so i can honestly say i am very sad to be leaving with a craving for more of that Char Siu Faan!! Hope the ladies of Foodie start more tours in different areas so that the next time i visit, we'll be able to explore other parts of this great city.

Great food, great tour!. This tour was great! It offers the best of two worlds. You get to taste excellent foods while getting a nice tour of HK and learning some history! It was truly amazing. I would definitely do another tour like this. Heck, I would the same one again, the food was awesome!

Book This Tour Immediately!. As someone who has been to HK over 10 times, and who also gives culinary tours in Shanghai (www.UnTourShanghai.com), I was excited to take the tour, but also thought I'd seen and eaten it all. I set this up for 10 other friends who were in town for the weekend, and we were not disappointed. The tastings go through the best part of Central HK, and the food stops are interspersed with just the right amount of background on the city and the historical buildings. Our only regret is not doing it on our first day in town, because we would have definitely gone back to a few of the restaurants for a few meals (SMOKED PORK!). Unfortunately that wasn't possible, but now I have some more ideas on restaurants and food streets to return to next time I'm in town. Thanks again, and I can say without hesitation that this tour is a winner, even with a group as big as 12 people! Discounted group prices would be nice, and allowing for a bit of shopping on private tours would be nice (especially at the tea shop) but everyone was very happy with the tour! THANKS for making me look good by setting this tour up for everyone.

Another satisfied customer. After reading all the positive reviews, I had to try this. After spending some time in Korea with my Korean speaking relatives, and basically doing what they wanted - our visit to Hong Kong was on me for planning. I planned out the first day to do some sort of tour guide to get a feel for the city, and decided what better tour than one with food? Booking was simple through the website, and we had adequate directions to meet our guide - Silvana. My mother and I had a personal tour, and it felt very comfortable having a native take us around, and answer any questions we had. The food was great, Silvana was great - and the price was very reasonable. Worth doing on the beginning of your trip! We visited the roast meat shop that Silvana took us to the next day, and would have never found it if it wasn't for the map we were supplied during our tour. I don't think we would have been to find it easily. Even after having Silvana there, the next day it was a bit intimidating because none of the folks there spoke english. But, alas! Our food guide map had the english pronunciation for BBQ pork on Rice so we could order like pros. For a relatively new tour set up, this was run very professionally and I hope to try any new food tours that they have set up next time I visit. Kyle from Ann Arbor, MI

Great Food / Walk. We spent a nice afternoon in late May walking around the west side of HK island. The walk was mixed up with 6 stops for food or drink. Our tour guide spoke excellent English. Some foodie events can be quite intimidating. This was not that type of event, and the food was not nearly as exotic as I could have imagined. I am not quite a foodie and my wife is quite particular about what she eats. She enjoyed this walk and tasting very much. All of the places we stopped at were clean and comfortable. This is not a gourmet tasting event, but rather an authentic look at classic Cantonese food and drink. Each stop had a special history and built on an overall theme.Our guide, was able to share an oral history, with a great appreciation for the city and culture. This was a highlight of our 6 day trip to HK and I would highly recommend it. Mike…

A must do when visiting Hong Kong. A small group of 3 plus Savannah our host. A fantastic insight into the local food a bit of history and exploring some great areas of Hong Kong. Very enjoyable and a must do when visiting Hong Kong as this tour hi lights some wonderful traditions that will disappear over the years if not supported by us the tourist. Well done Savannah will recommend to anyone I know coming to HK.

Great and very informative. After reading reviews on this site I was very keen to do this tour. However when I went to book tour dates werent available for dates I was in Hong Kong. I sent an email to company to check any availability. Silvana contacted me promotly and explained tours weren't being run due to tea merchant being closed. She offered however to run the tour at a reduced price for me as we were visiting one less tasting stop.Luckily for me I had a private tour with Silvana. Instructions about where to meet where well explained and the brochure she provided with route and info about tasting stops was well laid out. Her stories about the history of each of the food stops and interesting facts about the areas we walked around were great. Little things like the shop that made shoes for kung fu.The food at all of the stops was lovely. My favourite was probably dim sum square. This restaurant was reviewed in the South China Morning Post several days after my tour veryvfavourably.My son lives in Hong Kong and is keen to try some of the other restaurants suggested on the tour brochure.Overall, I cannot recommend this tour highly enough and I hope next time I am in Hong Kong, I hope Foodie tourschave started tours of other parts of Hong Kong.

Enjoyable even as a local!. As a local the experience was surprisingly good and it gives interesting insight to what has been missed out normally even as a resident in hong kong.Highly recommended experience for locals who wish to discover gems of the area and understand the history of hong kong. The story behind the food stores and restaurant is also value adding. Make sure you are hungry enough though, quite a long food tour covering most types of the best local food in the area.

Very well organized food tour!. Had really a great afternoon with Silvana, really enjoyed different dishes in different restaurants; the tour was very well organized and the guide had very good knowledge about food and Hong Kong!Also some other restaurant recommendations were given and when it started to rain, I was able to borrow and umbrella from the tea studio.I have visited HK several times but the foodie tour afternoon was really one of the highlights – a real must to do in HK!

You HAVE to do this.. Hong Kong is full of amazing food, but it's a little overwhelming to know where to get it. This tour takes care of that problem. You get to try the best renditions of classic HK dishes like wonton soup, dumplings and egg tarts without having to attempt to speak Cantonese! Genius. My guide, Silvana, was friendly and full of information about the city's cuisine -- as well as its general history!

Great food combined with a nice walking tour. We spend a wonderful afternoon in the central streets of Hong Kong tasting without exception 6 stations of great traditional Hong kong food and tea. Our guide, Sovanna, knew a lot of details of the restaurants, explaining their familiy histories and the food. We walked along a clear tour way, documented by a tour support flyer with all addresses a map and the language support. The tour organisation is still very new in its set up, but perfectly organised, will certainly get a little more relaxed with experience. I will definitively do it again next time as soon as they set up additional tours, and the restaurant addresses are all worth to do again.

Invaluable experience when visiting Hong Kong. I took the tour Sat. May 5th & had an absolutely fabulous time. I had already walked thru several markets without a clue of what was going on or what they were selling. The tour guide explained everything & then introduced us to restaurants that I never would have tried without her. Which would have been a crime as all of them were great. Note: allergic to shellfish & the guide made sure I could eat everything safely!!

A Must-Do in HK - Even Having Lived Here for 15 Years!. This was my first food tour and what a wonderful experience! Even having lived in HK for 15years, I learned so much on this tour. Booking tickets on-line was easy and I felt the cost justified the tour. The tour guide was extremely friendly and so full of information, having grown up in HK herself. The tour group was also quite small (around 10 people) and allowed us to stay together as a group on the entire walk, take photos and ask questions, in a private setting. The Chinese restaurants that where chosen for the tour were not only diverse and tasty, but all were owned and run by local families who were brought up, for many generations, in HK. Learning about how their families started and grew their business gave eating their food a deeper cultural meaning. The tour took 3 hours (with bathroom/water breaks in between) and even though you do walk quite a bit, it's as a nice day out, learning about HK, exercising and filling the belly with scrumptious food all the same time! A must-do especially for out of town visitors but also a must even if you live here!

A chef's disneyland. As a chef, being able to discover the best hidden gems of Hong Kong cuisine was an amazing experience. The restaurants were great, the stories interesting and the tour was run very professionally. I live in Hong Kong and it was refreshing to discover those places. I particularly loved the BBQ pork (also Anthony Bourdain enjoyed it inthis little joint), the knowledge that the tea master shared with us in his studio and my favorite won-ton mien in town. I will recommend it to all my friends visiting HK, few hours of great fun.

A wonderful surprise. Being my second time in Hong Kong i decided to try out the local eateries and i guess eat what the locals eat. So i booked this tour on impulse based on the reviews and the really well organized website.Pros1. Very organised beginning ( emails and pamplet during the tour) and end2. Fluent english - very important3. Knowledgeable and very intelligent4.Was almost like a 4-5 course degustation 5. Best wontons i've ever had!!Cons1. Was taken to a tea place... while the owner was knowledgable and some what entertaining - his english was poor and he talked about tea for far too long and got a tad too complex about itOverall i'd recommend this and have recommended this tour to all my friends and wish they had one in Tsim SHa sui (spelling) as well.

My first foodie tour makes me want for more!. I have actually been to HK for countless of times in the past 3-4 years and everytime I always end up eating the same food at the same place. My family and I got tired of going to the same restaurant time and time again and hence, I decided to book the foodie tour to see what else there was in HK that I missed out.There were no regrets and we all agreed that the 3.5 hours tour was one of the best experiences ever!Our guide was really patient and nice and took the time to explain to us about the HK culture, and a little of history and things that I probably wouldn't know if I weren't a native. The food was excellent. I personally feel that the noodles and dim sum were my favourite of the lot. We loved it so much, we went back to the same stalls the next day to have a second serving! One thing I really appreciated was also the little brochure that they personally designed, with the trails that we are embarking on, and the other food recommendations that had their addresses on it. It shows me how much enthusiam and sincerity the company has!This tour made my HK trip much more meaningful as compared to the other times I've went and I would recommend it to anyone who is going to HK! Thumbs up to the HK Foodie Tasting Tours!

This tour should be compulsory. My wife and I made the happy decision to book this tour this week while we were in Hong Kong. It is an extremely professionally run tour, and excellent value for money. Our tour guide is a Hong Kong native with impeccable English (she went to University in the US), and really knows her stuff. The places we got taken too were all small, privately owned and run little gems, each with an amazing history and impeccable pedigree. All made all of their dishes or produce fresh on the premises, unlike many other places. These are places you would not glance at as an uninformed visitor, but with this insider's knowledge we have now experienced them and know where to go back to. She also pointed out lots of other interesting history of some of the other recommended restaurants and sights along the way, and taught us some meanings of names of food, and food etiquette.We will be recommending this tour to everyone we know, even if they are not planning a trip to Hong Kong! We only wish we did this right at the start of our trip to HK.

Excellent intro to HK food, off the beaten track. We did this on our last visit to Hong Kong.It gave us a chance to discover those little known places frequented by mostly locals where the best food often lies. The dim sum was great, also the sugarcane juice. We've visited Hong Kong dozens of times before, but this food tour produced some revelations we had never known before.

Best Part of our Trip to Hong Kong!. We had a fabulous time on our tour today. Our guide spoke perfect English and was a Hong Kong Native. She understood that we really wanted to get the local flavor of Hong Kong and not the polished tourist spots we could easily do on our own. One highlight was the private tea tasting with a Tea Master who patiently explained the different kinds of tea and how he hand selects his teas from the mainland, etc. Each stop of the tour was carefully selected for it's heritage and authenticity. I recommend doing this on your first day because she was kind enough to help us plan the rest of our visit as well. We will be going back to many of the places we went to today. Excellent tour, even in the pouring rain we still loved it. We would highly recommend this tour to anyone looking who appreciates good food and the local experience.

A definite for ANYONE visiting/new to HK. I was on a weekend trip to HK and was afraid I wouldn't be able to eat/see/do as much as I had hoped. Signing up for this tour was by far the best decision I could've made! Within roughly 3.5 hours, I tried the BEST wontons, noodles, bbq pork, sugar cane juice, dim sum and egg tart! I know it sounds like a lot, but if you love food as much as I do, it is all worth it. A MAJOR plus to the whole tour was the guide's knowledge of Hong Kong's history. She was able to explain the background of the various streets and buildings. Highly recommended for anyone and everyone!

A must do if you want to experience local flavors and see unique Hong Kong attractions off the beaten track!. This tour was recommended by a friend - I am so glad that I went on it! It turned out to be one of the highlights of my trip despite my short visit. Far different than the other tours that I went on (to Victoria Peak, Harbour Cruise, etc), this one was the most authentic and worth every penny. The guide spoke perfect English, the "foodie" tour group I was in was small so you really get personalized service. The restaurants/food stalls that they took us were also visited by the locals and everything was yummy (egg tarts, wonton noodles, bbq pork, etc)! The tour guide was very attentive and explained the history of all these attractions in the area as we walked by them. It is definitely an off-the-beaten-track kind of tour and I would do it again!

Food, culture and history in one wonderful experience. Hong Kong Foodie Tasting Tours is a unique experience that is a must-do when you are visiting Hong Kong. Not only do you get to try some of Hong Kong's best local foods, but you will learn about the history and culture at the same time. Silvana was a wonderful tour guide, professional yet fun and very insightful (and her English is perfect). We explored the quaint streets of Soho and Sheung Wan and tasted some of the most delicious foods in Hong Kong. Do this tour early in your visit because you get a pamphlet with all the best places to eat that you can use for the remainder of your stay. We had wonton noodle soup, roast pork, dim sum, and sugar cane juice just to name a few and a wonderful lesson on tea. Definitely do this tour, you will not regret it!

Great experience! Must do in Hong Kong!. Well, I never thought I would do something like this, going on a tour to sample food.. but since Hong Kong is famous for food and if you have limited time and energy, this tour is the best way to get a crash course in the city and its famous tastes. It turned out to be a lot of fun as well !!! Just be aware that bringing in extra friend without booking a ticket upfront is not going to work out.

Orgasmic Egg Tartlets, Wicked Dim Sum & First Class Noodles!. Whatever you do, DO NOT EAT before you embark on this walking food tasting adventure throughout Hong Kong's down town neighborhoods as the local delicacies that you'll be devouring with gusto are simply amazing! Our tour guide was very personable and displayed in depth knowledge of the history behind Hong Kong and the places that we visited along the way. I lived in Hong Kong for a couple of years in this neighborhood and was totally surprised by the tasting locations as they were tucked away like hidden gems just waiting to be discovered and enjoyed. With a funky variety of tasting locations, an awesome guide and scrumptious treats blended with a casual stroll throughout bustling Hong Kong - this tour is an absolute must!

Awesome tour, food was good and the tour was good. I had the tour with my friend in Feb 2012. We spent a great afternoon. Silvana was our tour guide and she was great. She took us to restaurants which were not usually on the guide books. And the food was awesome! Silvana also told us the history of the food, restaurants, and some history about the surrounding areas. It was a great experience.I love food, that's why I had this tour with my friend. If you love food, I highly recommend this half day tour because you will have food that would amaze you. And you will definitely know more about Hong Kong.

Fantastic tour experience with Hong Kong Foodie. I had a great time in joining the Hong Kong Foodie tour. The tour guide was very professional and provided a lot of insights about Hong Kong cuisines. The collection of food tasted was excellent - yummy, good quality and truly representative of the culture of Hong Kong. I now know a lot of good restaurants in Hong Kong and I'd love to go back to check them out again. Oh, in addition to enjoying the delicious food, Hong Kong Foodie did a great job in introducing different interesting attractions, buildings and shops along the way. All in all, I highly recommended it.

GREAT GUIDE. After taking Michael's tour of Central Hong Kong, I signed up for two more of his tours. Michael is intelligent, very personable and speaks excellent English because he lived and studied in the US. He makes you feel like you are being shown Hong Kong with a friend who is a local. His temple tour took me to places I never would have gone and the food "delicacy" tour was like going out for a very unique eating experience with friends. Even locals were on his tours.

Michael shows you the best off beat places a tourist would never see. Showing up at the rendezvous point Michal was super easy to recognise and by seeing me look at him he walked very inviting up to see and asked me if I was here for the tour.After everyone has arrived the tour started, the Masters of the traditional industries seems to be very happy to see him, and are very forthcoming in their stories on their specialty and their products. I had a very enjoyable time and would take on another tour with Michael if possible.

impressive walking tour with an overview of HK culture. Michael is full of passion, doing quite lots of background study to support this walking tour. It lasted for rough 3 hours walk from Admiralty Station to Sheung Wan Station with an overview of the HK history, politics, building and diverse culture. I was in HK for 4 months before but still could gain some new stuff in this tour. Recommend to those who would like to know this city more in an efficient way.

Excellent customer service!!. I got stuck when I was trying to help a friend of mine to plan his itinerary to visit Hong Kong for 3 hours when in transit to another country. I am thankful to find Michael when doing research online. He was very patient and after gathering my ideas and needs, he helped me to plan the entire itinerary for this friend. Once again, your help is greatly appreciated!
Great Made in HK tour!. Great tour to know some of the local stuff at Sheung Wan, Hong Kong!Look forward for other tours from Mike!

Excellent and unique tours! Learn about a side of Hong Kong you've never seen. I am an expat working in HK, and like most, I have visited and seen all the typical HK attractions. In fact, I just went by the typical top 10 on the Discover Hong Kong website. However, these tours are unique and not your typical been-there-done-that type of experience. Michael, the tour guide, speaks clearly and in easy to understand English. He mixes in very informative facts with some humour, history and trivia as well. He tells you what to expect upfront, and is always accommodating to peoples’ needs. He has scheduled drinks / restroom breaks, will wait for latecomers or let them know how to catch up, allows time for photos and is never in a rush. The tours are run smoothly and efficiently, and are always well prepared. He even provides cups and forks for you for his food tour! All you need to bring is yourself and an appetite. I have also been on the history tour, religion and temple tour and even a hiking tour and they are all free - where you just pay what you want and you don’t feel pressured to pay. The food delicacy tour (my personal favourite), does have a cost but you are basically just paying for the food and you get to try a large variety from snacks to desserts. The tour guide truly has a passion for it and it never feels like he’s just ‘reading from a script’ and bored with it.  Overall, I recommend these tours for both visitors, locals (who have also commented that even they are seeing new things too), and working expats like myself. I have a new appreciation of what HK has to offer and it helps break up the routine of work, tall buildings and concrete.

Free City plus Delicacy Food Tours - YES YES YES!!!. After coming across Mikes Free tours by chance online I thought why not!! Everyone likes something for free and I was very pleased I chose these tours run by Mike.The Delicacy Tour was run at night and the City Tour I did the next morning.Mike is well organised, professional and most importantly knowledgeable and very entertaining. Definitely NOT the run of the mill plug and chug follow the guy with the flag type tour!.The city tour was enjoyable and informative. We had a good look around the island side of Hong Kong. At the end of the tour Mike took some of us who were hungry to a local food hall for lunch (NOTE - This is not part of the tour and you pay for what you eat and drink). He helped place the order as well but could not join us for lunch as he had another commitment. He went above and beyond to help us with this!As for the Delicacy Tour, well I'm not going to say to much about the food as I promised to keep it a secret and surprise for his future guests. (NOTE - Though the tour is free you pay as you go to the food vendors for what you eat, it is so cheap as well). The variety of food is interesting to say the least. Much you will enjoy, some you will be challenged by, some you will be thinking 'I just ate what....????' but no matter what you will have a blast. I think the bigger the group you end up with the more entertaining it will be just watching everyone try to guess what they are eating. I am allowed to let slip one item I tried to the great amusement and thumbs up from the local men in the restaurant when I downed a very tasty shot of 'Snake Penis Wine'. It was really good, sweet and strong. It was doubly good as it had no 'chunks of snake manhood' in it ;)Don't worry as there are no bugs on the menu to eat but I'm sure Mike could find some to try if your keen and no animals are killed in front of you then cooked.Regarding the 'Free' part of the tour, yes it is free but a tip to Mike of what you feel the tour was worth to you would always be appreciated but as stated by Mike it is not expected nor is it pushed. I was more than happy to give a tip on both tours as it as well earned because Mike exceeded my expectations for sure!Go on the Delicacy Food Tour with an open mind and you will be rewarded by trying foods that the locals consider every day and normal for them. You wont eat like this at home, so just go for it!Cheers Mike and thank you for a really good enjoyable day and night.Regards,Milan

Exceptional. We first decided to try out the delicacy tour and were blown away by its value for money. Michael took us to real local restaurants and stalls to experience what the people of Hong Kong would actually eat and I have to say that a lot of it was really tasty. As a result of how friendly and enthusiastic Michael was, we then decided to join the religion tour. Michael was knowledgeable and adapted the tour based on what we were interested in finding out. When I lost my phone on one of the minibuses, Michael went above and beyond in phoning the relevant people and accompanying me to the minibus stop point (during his own free time) which resulted in me getting my phone back. He really deserved so much more than the tip we were able to give him. All the best Michael and thanks for a great Hong Kong experience.

A very information and impressive tour in Hong Kong. Michael is a very nice and friendly tour guide who provided interesting information about Hong Kong such as Feng Shui, history and even delicacy food which we couldn't find in any other commercial tours.
Review of Hong Kong Free Tour. Amazing experience even for a Chinese native. Interesting range of food, including range of desserts!

Surprisingly delicious. me and some of my friends tried the Food Delicacy tour with our guide Michael. Michael himself was super nice and very entertaining. He showed us (Europeans) very local spots, which we wouldn't have found ourselves. The food we tried was far from the average dumplings and noodles but it was great fun! The expressions on our faces after he told us what we ate were just irreplacable - but we really enjoyed it a lot! We will definitely do another tour with Michael!

HK free tour: best last-minute decision. Perfect way to familiarize yourself with the city, its culture and history.. I joined the Saturday free HK tour as a last minute decision after seeing a flyer at my hostel. It was one of the best decisions I made on this trip. Michael is not only knowledgeable about Hong Kong, he's passionate about it! It was like having a local friend showing you around. You get to cover a lot of things about Hong Kong - history and area-wise - in three hours. I am bummed I didn't get to join the Friday delicacy tour. I will definitely join that the next time I find myself in town. Michael also runs a religion-focused tour on Sundays and arranges other activities as well. You can easily fill up your itinerary with Michael's tours!

The feel of what traditional Hong Kong is. - Made in hk tour -As a local, I have never experienced the traditional industry in first hand, thanks Michael. He showed me the old hk with detailed explanation. It's so unique. Also, he's really a nice guy who is eager to answer every of your doubts.

LOVED IT!. Came late for the tour and called the guide through online contact details and the guide was extremely friendly and helpful in trying to help me get to the group even though it was a free tour! They had nothing to lose even if I did not come! They were genuinely nice people and I enjoyed everything about the tour it was an insightful and fun tour definitely!

Not the usual touristy experience - MUST DO in HK!. Michael is very engaging and cheerful and gets you have an early start for the Religious Tour in HK. You get to go and see temples that you wouldn't normally do out of a guide book or even Lonely Planet. You get to experience a true local way of life - and understand the culture better. What was amazing for me on the religious tour was how I could draw parallels with the customs and beliefs of Taoism and Buddhism to my own religion! Definitely gives you some perspective! A very easy walk, Michael gives enough and more breaks and ensures you participate in the group!

Awesome tour! Will try the others when I return next year!. So I had nothing to do on a Friday night and decided to browse for things to do in Hong Kong. Michael's tour came up and was the only one with perfect ratings and I decided why not. I joined the Delicacy Tour which entails walking around Hong Kong and eating the "weird" and "different" foods of Hong Kong. Although I'm not Anthony Bourdain or Andrew Zimmerman, I did get to try foods that I never knew about and that I would've never tried on my own. Food like, Stinky Tofu, Snake, Thousand year old egg, and the list continues... *yummy*. The food tastes better than it sounds. haha.Michael was very passionate in sharing his knowledge about the food and history of Hong Kong. I am recommending his tours to all my friends who will be visiting Hong Kong in the future.If you're reading this Michael, thanks for the great tour and please send me those photos! Keep up the great work.

An excellent tour guide can let you see the deep inside of the prosperous city. I have to say that this guy is really an excellent tour guide. I took part in his traditional hand-made / craft journey. He showed me 30 years ago or even earlier HK's local business. Those who were supposed to be extinct, but continues to exist in a corner of the prosperous metropolis. Micheal can speak English very well and easy to understand. Even my English is not very good, I almost can understand what he introduces to us. I believe he must love this city, so he understands a lot of local history. I can not even believe that the Queen's Road under my feet was actually the old coastline. If you want to come to Hong Kong, you don't hope only see the modern tall buildings. Only take the ferry, take the cable car to the Peak, or to the Lantau Island to see the Buddha. You must come to participate Micheal's tour guide. Michael is a tour guide who really know about local history and can tell the good story. Moreover, he is a very warm and friendly person.

A true cultural tour !. It's scare opportunity to see a city in true cultural side in deep down aspect. Michael is a nice gentleman who really dedicated and passion on deliver the true side of Hong Kong in stead of "Can- schedule ".He speaks good English and Cantonese as well so no worries on language barriers. I personally definitely recommand this tour to all of my friends ! If you are looking for speaking to someone who can really answer your cultural, political background of HK or even ask about wired phenomenon in Hong Kong , Here's the right place!
Unique tour: Made In Hong Kong - Old Industries In Hong Kong. No tour guide will tell you so much as you will learn in this tour!! Walking and discovering old traditional Hong Kong first hand

Great Tour!. Michael was a very friendly guide from the first second and it was really interesting to get to know hongkong like that! Also besides the planned stops of the tour, he always enjoyed talking to you and sharing some special tips about his city! Would go there again, also for the other tours!

Never seen before side of Hong Kong. Michael is a great tour guide. He speaks good English so you would be able to understand the stories that he regales about Hong Kong's past and present. he takes you to walk to back alleys and roads that you seldom would see and he'd point out to you good food too. Very informative. A good way to kill 3.5 hours if you have the extra time in Hong Kong. All you have to do is be open and be inquisitive. There's nothing Michael can't answer. Best part is....ITS FREE!! but because Michael is such a sweet person, everyone gives a little anyway.

Highly recommended- A True Hong Kong Experience. I highly recmmend you join this tour if your visiting HK, or even if you have lived here for a long time. Michael has a friendly network of local craftspeople and personalities who, like him, care deeply about sharing and preserving HK culture. This tour will take you far off the beaten track to meet real people who have been practicing their trade for generations. Thanks again Michael for a true experience!

Fantastic!! Thank you so much .... I was not aware that we could find the spectrum of different delicacies in a small community like this! I thought I have tried most food in the area until Michael brought us to these off the beaten path eateries! The most surprising is that I, as a local, have also learned quite a lot and some I had no idea until Michael told us!

Priceless experience!. Guide Michael is one of the most passionate and sweet people I've met on free tours around the world. He taught us how to eat all kinds of street food, learn about historical and cultural heritage plus we had the chance to peak into the vast mysteries of local religion. We got answers for everything we asked and enjoyed recommendations for more places around Hong Kong afterwards. Above all, as an exchange student I definitely appreciated the price since there's none (or a pretty low fee for extremely unique fun time :). Definitely check out all the different types of tours, it's more than worth it!

Very interesting tour!. We are living in Hong Kong and my friends organised me a bachelorette surprise party. We began with Michael for a guided tour of Admiralty area. We learnt lot of things about our city and Michael was so interesting and nice that we really want to try his food tour on Friday night ! Thanks again for everything, we had a wonderful time with you ! Camille

Great tours that tell you that Hong Kong is more than just a "shopping heaven".. I joined 3 out of 4 trips organized by Michael and they were ALL great tours! The tours are full of detailed introductions / explanations with fun facts that even locals have not heard of! Michael's tours are really casual and informative. It's a great way to learn about HK's local culture and make new friends. I strongly recommend the tours to people who are new to HK and are curious about the history and the identity of the city other than just a "shopping heaven".
Great tour, great guide.. Been in HK for a few months now, and the guide (Michael) had a wealth of information. Learned quite a bit, and the pace was perfect. Recommended.

Tours not to miss!. Without joining the Hong Kong Free Tours we would not have managed to learn and see a fraction of the local sites. Michael is very knowledgeable, relaxed and easy going, always ready to respond and answer questions. He nicely marries the old world culture and practices with the new world thinking and realities, all told from a local's perspective - no canned, commercial tourist script. Micheal also responded promptly to all our email inquiries about the walks.Thoroughly enjoyed the two walks we took. We had locals join our groups and they also learned a lot about HK. We look forward to the Made in Hong Hong tour next Saturday. So if you have little time in HK, we highly recommend you do one of the Hong Kong Free Tour walks. Or do them regardless.

Great weekend in Hong Kong!. On Saturday, Michael took us to very special places in Hong Kong where we visited typical local industries. I would never be able to find such places on my own. Michael is very knowledgeable about the Honk Kong history, the people and their lifestyle.We had a unique chance of meeting local business owners and their arts and crafts first-hand.The Sunday's tour was surrounded by an atmosphere of spirituality, religion and of course good mood!

Great tour ! Great guide !. I am at local hk ppl, joining michael tour hy coincidence. The places we visited were really rarely have chance to be visited in details. Michael showed his passion to introduce us these places and the masters. He did well preparation to build the relationship with the shops we visited. Worth going ! Good job and thanks !

I love Hong Kong moreee after this trip :). I born and live here but I don't know those culture until I meet Michael. He is really a great tour guide. After this 3 hours tour, I love Hong Kong more. Thank you!

The best use of your time in Hong Kong. Michael is both knowledgeable and passionate--a perfect tour guide combination. His Made in Hong Kong tour of local crafts people and artisans was a treasured experience for me. Highly recommended.

Must do for the travel enthusiast!. I was lucky enough to join Michael on the free walking tour around admiralty and central when these tours first started. It was great then and I imagine even better now. In my 3 years of living in HK I did not learn as much as the 3 or so hours spent on this tour. It was fascinating. It was also not too taxing of a walk, and there was opportunity to sit down and rest whilst listening to Michael delve into the history of our surroundings. I will definitely be joining again when next in HK, probably try out the delicacies tour and really stretch my tastebud limits!

probably the best way to spend a weekend morning. As a local, we often neglect the obejects' histories & rationale of existence even if we pass by them on a daily basis (and most cases, we don't even recognize such object even existed!). Michael, the passionate guide who led the tour, have done so much fact finding and managed to condense all of the interesting information together with the well planned route was simply fantastic. Well versed and caring for those who joined the tour, the 3.5hrs walk from Admiralty on a Saturday morning was very enjoyable -- and I actually learned a lot of new & interesting facts about things I see everyday. Thank you Michael and I look forward to joining your other tours soon!

Don't miss this tour!. I can't recommend strongly enough the Hong Kong cuisine tour. The tour guide was well-informed, charismatic, and accommodating, and while the food selections might take you out of your comfort zone (no spoilers here...), you're sure to try something new and almost certain to discover something you didn't know you loved before. The tour will introduce you to local dishes and experiences not easily accessed by tourists, and the price is unbeatable.If you find yourself in Kowloon on a Friday night, you should definitely consider taking the cuisine tour.

I would go again!. I joined Michael's tour to Tai Long Wan and I had such an amazing time! He is very knowledgable of Hong Kong, speaks flawless English and is very considerate of everyone in the group. He never left anyone behind and waited for people who stopped to take pictures or who were simply slower. I really wanted to go for a swim as well, although the tour was intended to be purely a hiking trip and he of course accommodated for that! Made me so happy! By the end of our hike he even carried my bag (I packed way too much) as he saw I was getting exhausted from carrying it. I know he has 2-3 other tours in HK and I'm very excited to join again! I can definitely recommend Michael and his free tours :)

Well paced and enjoyable tour. Hiking to Tai Long Wan beach with Michael's Hong Kong Free Tours was a very pleasant experience. Michael ensured that all of us kept a constant, unhurried pace and moved together. I liked how he used to halt periodically and give us a brief introduction about each stop. The beach was beautiful with a great scenery and worth the hike. Micheal is well travelled, knowledgeable and eager to share his experiences. He is also friendly, ever smiling and engages with everyone. I would recommend Hong Kong Free Tours with Michael for anyone looking for a great tour.

Amazing experience for new comers and locals. I have been to three tours in the past couple months. Love the informative, clear and straightforward introduction Michael gave us for each spot we visited. All the tours were well timed, and I was very comfortable with the pace in spite of the extremely hot & humid weather. The most recent one I went to was the hiking trip in Sai Kung. The scenery and beaches were breathtaking, and the trip was enjoyable with all the chatting & laughter. I would highly recommend anyone to join this group, and I look forward to going to their other tours/events in the future.

Local delicacy for brave heart. If just walking around Temple street does not fully satisfies you, join in Michael's food tour. You may need to summon up your courage to try some local delicacies but no worries! Snake wine will help you open up your brave heart. Truly enjoyed the night out with Michael and the team!!

HK Delicacies Tour - Jordan. This was one of the best activities in my 5 days of HK! I won't spoil anything, but you will eat food that you wouldn't find on your own walking around town. It's all tasty I promise! From savory to sweet. Nothing scary, no pranks. Michael is a great guide. All smiles and laughs. He has great insight into the history of the food as well for the curious ones in the group. When I go to HK next time I'll do it again. Thanks Michael!

Great tour. Michael is really nice and informative. This is my first time to go to Chi wan temple even I born in hk. He told me many things about chinese culture that I don't know. He explains well at each point and give you time to look around and take pic. You feel relax and no pressure. Thank you very much Michael

A great look into the historical, and religious aspect of Hong Kong (at an unbeatable -free- price). The tour is an excellent way to get an overview into Hong Kong. Michael as tour guide is well versed, knowledgeable and has passion for his city and its history. This is a great tour for anyone not afraid to take great walks and explore the city from within while learning about the culture, religious aspects and historical view. It is also a great way to meet other similar explorers who are interested in seeing the city in a new way and make friends of different nationalities.

Hong Kong delicacies in Jordan. Joining Michael’s tour was tasty, informative, and fun.I ate different kind of delicacies that I could not have even imagined that people ate them, even to come to the idea of eating it!!Michael created a very open and relaxed atmosphere while providing information about the different dishes.A definitely recommend!

Perfect for Weekend getaway. The most informative guided tour I have ever done. I was lucky enough to have Michael, the organiser of Hong Kong Free Tours, as our guide, and he ensures that all her guides are keen, interested and very knowledgeable. Michael has a range of interesting and exciting tours to offer and will definitely seek him out for one of those next time.

HK Food Tour - Excellent!!. Michael is so enthusiastic about his subject matter that it's infectious. We had all sorts of exotic local food, from pigeon tongue to curried stomach. Great flavours with a snippet of history too. I've been on his other tours and can thoroughly recommend them.

Great for Visitors of Natives!. I lived in Hong Kong for years and recently moved away. On a trip back I decided to join the walking tour, and it was one of the highlights of my experience in Hong Kong! Michael met us in a park and gave us the overview of what we would be seeing and who we would be meeting, and then he gave us a framework to use to understand the different industries and people we would meet. I went on the Made in Hong Kong tour and we went to a print shop, sausage maker, qipao (traditional Chinese dress) maker, dried seafood goods shops, and more. It was about three hours long, and the time flew by. At each place Michael had arranged for the master of the industry to speak with us a little bit about his occupation and Michael helped translate English questions into Cantonese so that we could ask questions of our own. Be sure to budget the whole afternoon (or morning) for the tour because the people you meet and the sights you see will keep you wanting to ask more questions.
exciting and knowledgeable!. this is that invaluable local insight tour. catch up with Michael to enjoy and to discover authentic alleys in HK!!

It's a must-do in Hong Kong. Even though I am from Taiwan and share the almost the same culture with Hong Kong people, joining Micheal's tour made me view my own culture from a third-person. Also, the spots that Micheal showed us are not on guide book. You can experience the local culture and gain knowledge!

Fabulous tour - would highly recommend!!!. Our family of 3 initially went on the Saturday morning tour, and found it so interesting and informative that we attended the Religion tour the next day, which was equally good. Michael speaks excellent English, but having grown up in Hong Kong, is also very knowledgeable about the local culture and history (or anything else you may want to know)as well as being very passionate about showing people the true Hong Kong. We have done a number of free tours in other countries in the past, but Michael has gone one step further by showing photos and videos on his personal Ipad as well, which helps to explain concepts or elaborate on points he is making. Furthermore, he is very happy to answer any questions you may have, whether it is related to the tour or not.Overall, we thought these tours were excellent and worth the time spent. We would definitely recommend them to other tourists!!!

Excellent!. Even I am a local, I learnt a lot about Hong Kong after joining Michael's tour! He showed his passion and knowledge throughout the tour and I highly recommend tourists to join. He is detail-minded, informative and caring. Have a great time with him when you are in Hong Kong!!!

Great Tour. Although I grow up in Hong Kong, there are so many places that I haven't been to before. This tour helped me to discover and understand Taoism and Buddhism more. Michael is a friendly and helpful tour guide, he offered a very infomative tour and opened to every questions.

Free tour with heart. I did a lot of tours, but these one, was one of the best I ever did. When you listen to the guide you really feel and see the work which he have done for that tour. You get a lot of extra information, which you never would get in other tours. And the guide is open for every question you ask him and gives you every information you need. Doesn´t matter if it´s about food, party or other question. If you have the possibilty to join this trip, do not hestitate for joining!!!

Totally recommendable!. Thanks Michael for a very entertaining and educational tour through Hong Kong! The guide showed us parts of Hong Kong no tourist would go with a lot of love in details. He told us about the history of Hong Kong and gave us an insight into the traditions and beliefs of the locals there. I would do the tour anytime again! :)

A different perspective of Hong Kong. One of the best informative tours I've ever been in Hong Kong which speaks about different cultures, religion and architecture. Would highly recommend any group who wants to know about Chinese culture & religion.

Chinese religion. Had an inspiring Sunday morning with Michael's Chinese religion tour which he generously shared with us the Chinese Buddhism and Taoism schools of thinking.The tour was not limited to "The Temple" and "The Monastery" which the tourist information centre would be glad to show you the way. We have also visited hidden gems in town which average locals may not have heard of.A very thoughtful tour for a glimpse of Chinese heritage from the religion perspective. Highly recommended if you are ready to recall the pain you had been through in hell, get started in understanding the noble truths, put down your pain and suffering from greed, aversion and delusion, and look forward to your future.

Interesting and fun tours through Hong Kong. I have already participated in three of Michaels tours: the "religious" tour, the "delicacies" tour and just recently the "historical" tour on Hong Kong Island, each of them special in its own way and absolutely recommendable. Michael is a great guide, very knowledgeable, dedicated and well-prepared, but also knows how to present historic facts in an interesting and fun way. As I had two friends visiting me for the weekend who wanted to explore the city, my past experiences with Michaels tours led me to recommend to them joining this walk. They were delighted: Hong Kong (Island)s history, sights and fun facts wrapped up in a nutshell! I have been living in Hong Kong for eight months now and although I had already done a good deal of "sightseeing" stuff, I also learned some interesting new things about this incredibly amazing city.
