So I can recommend these tours for visitors, tourists, but also expats who have been living here already for quite some time but for sure do not know everything about HK yet - I think even some "true" Hong Kongers might find it useful. And in the end, you have nothing to lose. As the tours are on tip-basis, it is in the end up to you to decide how much it was worth to you. It's hard to beat that in terms of value-for-money.

A great half day tour. It was a real eye opener for me. Within a few hours, Michael was able to passionately show us various places as well as tell us interesting history behind them. Worth every minute during this tour with Michael.

Chinese Religion: Taoism and Buddhism. Michael was very approachable and knowledgeable which allowed the tour to run smoothly. He was also understanding as I had just come from the airport and still had my bags with me. He made sure that the bags were safe and sound with the security guards at the various places we visited. He also gave the group ample time to take pictures, stay hydrated and to use the bathroom. Would definitely recommend!

Professional tour in a informative and relax atmosphere. Hong Kong is a big city with so many fascinating things to see and stories to tell. This tour helps better understand aspects of Hong Kong; History, Food and Culture. Walking from one interesting shrine or food stall in a small alley with excellent explanations to another such as the Hong Kong skyline viewed from Wan Chai. This tour is a great experience, with professional informative explanations.

Very informative & great tour. I attended the historical tour that got me through the past & present of Hong Kong Central area. Being in HK for already more than a year, i discovered too many new things or history of the places that i usually pass by during daily life.Michael was very good and knowledgeable.Very good tour overall!

Authentic and Intriguing Local Tours of Hong Kong. Michael was very warm and friendly, offering a polished and informative tour of several temples with excellent guidance. It was great to get a non-commercial, non touristy and old style form of experience with somebody who is genuinely passionate about Hong Kong.

Awesome tour and guide. Michael and his girlfriend were very friendly and showed us around some of Hong Kong's booming and dying professions. We were even able to visit a famous paper joss maker. The tour ended in a nice pub.I'll definitely join your delicasy tour when I'm back in HK.

Excellent tour. If you are interested in the history of Hongkong, you are highly recommended to join this tour. I joined the tours organized by this group twice, and I have discovered a lot of fascinating stuff in Hongkong that I don't realize before. The tour guide is well prepared and can help you discover Hongkong from another perspective.

Great free tours. I have lived in HK for a year, and through these tours I discovered new things about HK, hidden gems in the city, old industries and temples. Michael showed us fascinating sites, accompanied by explanations and local insights of history, traditions, contemporary trends. Well done! Highly recommended.

Fascinating free Hong Kong tour. I have lived in Hong Kong for three years and our guide still managed to show me some fascinating new sights accompanied by interesting and humorous anecdotes relating to Hong Kong's history, architecture and customs as well as plenty of local insight to life in present day Hong Kong. A highly recommended tour whether visiting Hong Kong for the first time or if you've lived here for years.

Vivid introduction of Hong Kong. It's been an amazing trip with Michael and other walkers!!Slowly going from the present to the past. Learning history from stories is much better than reading books, in my case. Vivid introduction and interesting stories are definitely the highlight! Love it a lot!!! Thanks again~Michael~

Free tours. Michael is a really good tour guide. He puts a lot of effort into his research before the tours.I'v done a couple now and they're all very well organized and a great way to meet some people and discover Hong Kong.

Hong kong Free Tours. Michael does very good tours, i have been to 3 of them so far and he is very knowledgeable and interactive. I would recommend it to any expat or any local.You also learn a lot about the history and things you didn't know about and good way to meet new people.

Free, most importantly GREAT tour!!! Don't miss out :). Michael has made it his mission to introduce various aspects (including culture, foods, history, religion) of Hong Kong to locals and visitors alike. His research is pretty thorough and his tours are very enjoyable. I have attended most of his tours already and see that he is continually expanding the list of tours available (most recently the Hungry Ghost tour). Don't miss out on joining his FREE tours!! Keep up the good work, Michael :)

Best Day in Hong Kong. I spent a few days in Hong Kong and did activities on each day. But the tour with Stephen was the most enjoyable one.The process of booking the tour went smoothly and Stephen was very prompt with his replies and helpful from the first contact. Even after the tour, he sent an email with more information on what we did as a follow up.He asked what I would like to do and tailored the day to that. We did a hike to see Hong Kong's skyline (in a place that was not full of tourists), then went to the Sheung Wan district and saw the dried seafood market, Possession Point, Kwong Fuk Ancestral Hall, Kowloon, Sham Shui Po, a wet market and the Tin Hau Temple. He also showed me a great view of the city from the top of a hill at the end of the day.I wanted to try local Dim Sum and we went to a restaurant that was really good. He suggested some things to try and they were all excellent. Afterwards he suggested some tea, which was also good.Stephen is a really nice guy and it was like a day hanging out with a friend in another city, not a tour bus guide who is doing it because they have to be there. I had many interesting conversations and saw Hong Kong from a local’s perspective, which is what I wanted to do.Thanks Stephen!!!

Unforgettable experience of Authentic Hong Kong. When many people book a tour of a foreign country, they wish for a tour where all human senses are catered for. While the majority of 'Mass Market' tours fail to do this, Stephen showed a sense of professionalism and genuine ownership of his tour unmatched by any other I have experienced.Knowledgeable and with an authentic love for Hong Kong, Stephen was able to capture the true meaning of what a tour should be. While walking the tour, he spent time answering many questions on Hong Kong's past and future and was happy to discuss a number of issues affecting this great city. There was no sense of rushing and he allowed me to absorb the true Hong Kong at my own pace; something that regular tour operators simply cannot do. As other reviews have mentioned, his pre-tour communication via email was immediate and provided the necessary information to ensure I was well prepared for the day.Stephen, thank you for providing me with truely unforgettable memories of the Authentic Hong Kong!

Brilliant. We spent a day with Stephen yesterday and the tour was perfect for us. We wanted to see the history and culture of old Hongkong. We saw things we would never have found on our own. Temples, the Kowloon walled gardens, (once a lawless city with virtually no natural light it was so crowded) foodstores, buying and using the octupus card, the tram, ferry trip and so much more.The lunch at a 'locals' restaurant was superb! The BEST pork bun i've ever eaten. Pastry like, slightly chewy, and uncious. Spring roll with a rice noodle outer! Sticky rice that was perfect.If you're over 60 as my husband and i were, wear runners. We walked our socks off

Perfect day tour of an authentic Hong Kong. I found Stephen via a Google Search, and was immediately impressed, not only with his very informative website, but the service he gave me before, during and after my tour with him.Before my tour with him, he was very quick to respond to my emails, usually replying within 24 hours of me sending them. The reason I like to hire private guides is because it gives me a chance to personalize what I want to see. And Stephen was more than willing to make sure he included some of the more recent events - e.g., the Umbrella Revolution - in Hong Kong's ongoing transition back to China. My 8 hour tour with him was the end of September, 2016 and I have nothing but very positive comments about what I was shown and his explanations. He is very much focused on giving visitors a more "authentic" Hong Kong, focusing on cultural aspects of the City, rather than on common tourist attractions or more Westernized sections of Hong Kong. I happened to be staying in the Sheung Wan section of the Central District, which not only made it easy to start the tour, but ended up being one of the cultural centers he wanted to focus on. So my tour actually started from my hotel in Sheung Wan.My personalized requests included a discussion of the Opium Wars as well as the Umbrella Revolution, which he gladly described.Stephen is native Hong Kongese. And I greatly appreciated his ability to talk about the ongoing tensions that many Hong Kong people have with assimilation back into mainland China. His descriptions included the "controversial" use of the Simplified Chinese Character Set (which many there view as a symbol of Communist China). He took me to the Admiralty district, where students and protesters took over sections of Hong Kong's financial area during the Umbrella Revolution. Other stops on our tour included more temples dedicated to Confucius ancestor worship as well as the gritty markets of Northern Kowloon. I was also treated to a steep hike up a hillside in Northern Kowloon, where I got a nice view of Hong Kong's skyline. Also included was a memorial park where the British first landed and it is here where Stephen gave me a great summary of the Opium Wars.Probably the most unique and unexpected thing Stephen took me too, was the memorial park where the Walled City of Kowloon used to be. It was a fascinating place, photos and other memorials to what used to be a huge slum where native Hong Kongese were walled in, surrounded by the British during colonial times and up until the mid 1970's. After my tour, he gave me hints on going to the Tian Tan Buddha and other sites on Lantau Island. As well as recommendations on where to shop for some unique souvenirs.Stephen was extremely helpful, speaks very fluent English, and was very attentive to my wishes and needs. The tour included a lunch stop and when I needed, bathroom breaks. It was a great pleasure touring with him for a day and I give him my highest marks as a tour guide (and I've had many guides in many countries). I would highly recommend him as your guide.

Interesting and beautiful historical tour. My friends and I got shown around a historical village in the New Territories. Stephen was really knowledgeable and friendly. He knew so much and shared so much with us about the history of Hong Kong and particular spots. It was also really interactive, he asked us if we'd heard of various things before. It was a great few hours seeing a different part of Hong Kong!

Outstanding tour, not to be missed!. I am a big believer in doing travel planning at home. Having traveled extensively, I look at guidebooks, history books, and TA reviews before finalizing any plans. This time, I was excited about our tour with Stephen based onTA reviews. Yet, I agree with rainecj: our experience with Stephen far surpassed our expectations in every way.Stephen's e-mail communication is immediate, appropriate and free of any sales pressure. He provided us with excellent recommendations and helped with every step of our itinerary. Of the days we could tour, he was only available for one full day. That is my only regret!His recommendation of Lantau/ fishing village tour was a surprise--but what a treat! Our tour was pure joy--beginning to end: beautiful sites, wonderful hikes, excellent knowledge of and passion for local history, culture, and people. Great eye for photography and hints for taking better pictures. We visited temples and wet market, fishing village and sampled foods there. We walked on a beautiful serene beach and stopped to see a local family owned food store. None of the sales pitch or tourist-filled sights. Instead, Stephen carries with him great love for and deep understanding of both--local customs and history and international history. His college education in history and government is a great help to his broad view of the world and understanding of the place Hong Kong occupies within it. To top off already outstanding experience, he researched and connected me with a Macau tour guide we loved (he never worked with her but did research because I asked for recommendations). That's not all! Within a few hours, I got an e-mail from Stephen that had a summary of our day with descriptors and history highlights. He was asking for feedback and ideas to improve the experience further. Truly, I have no suggestions--this was an outstanding experience in every way!

Value for money. Our family of 5 recently enjoyed a walking tour of Hong Kong with Stephen. We were met at our hotel, we purchased Octopus travel cards and then we caught the MTR to Sheung Wan and walked this interesting district visiting an historic ancestral hall. Back on the MTR to Sham Shui Po, a very authentic district and then our final stop was at the Kowloon Walled City Garden which has a very interesting and recent history. A 5 hour tour - bring lots of water for the Hong Kong humidity and sturdy walking shoes.

Excellent Hongkong Tour. We must say we have a great 4 hour tours to appreciate the city of Hongkong. Stephan has insightful view to the city and his knowledge is infectious as much as we learn so much about the history of the city through our guided walk.

Surprising sides of Lantau Island with awesome guide Stephen. I Googled and noted the reviews on Trip Advisor for this tour which ticked all my want boxes. What I got far surpassed my expectations. I easily found Tung Chung via the MTR and met Stephen. The trip by bus to the Lantau fishing village of Tai O made for good introductions and Stephen's enthusiastic cultural knowledge was just the ticket. Although raining heavily, we had a very enjoyable wander under umbrella, through the streets, pathways and temples of Tai O. After a refuel of refreshing ginger pudding and bus trip to Pui O, we set off on a hike to Mui O taking in the Asian Water Buffaloes and other insect wildlife and then on to Tai Ho. The views from the coast and highlands looking out and back up towards Hong Kong were breathtaking as the rain cleared. I returned to Tung Chung, tired after the trek (57 yrs old), but full of wonderful memories. Six out of Five for this. Well worth the day trip out of Hong Kong if you want to see something different.

Awesome and very special city tour!. Our tour with Stephen took place in Kowloon and we saw some pretty interesting things which we wouldn't have found on our own, so we got to know a place for having typical local breakfast and small street markets. The highlight of the tour was definitely the Kowloon walled city park and its history. Stephen knows a lot about the history of all those places and can give really interesting insights regarding to culture and day to day life in Hong Kong. We all enjoyed this tour a lot and would recommend it to our friends, as it's a really special experience and a great chance to get to know the non-touristic spots of Hong Kong. After all it was a really nice atmosphere and a great opportunity to get an answer to your questions you want to ask a local resident.

Excellent, Authentic Tour of Hong Kong!. As a student traveler, getting a tour of any city can be expensive. If available, Stephen offers free, abbreviated tours of Hong Kong for students, and I was lucky enough to take one of these tours. Stephen and I discussed my interests and he created a personalized and engaging tour that delved into the history, culture, and food of Kowloon. He is incredibly knowledgable and passionate about all aspects of Hong Kong and can tailor a tour to whatever your interests may be, whether you're looking for a tour of the city or want to hike in the surrounding area. His tour was a highlight of my trip to Hong Kong and I cannot recommend Stephen enough!

Excellent tour with a friendly guide. We really enjoyed our half day walking tour with Stephen. He is very friendly, helpful, & knowledgeable. Our trip involved seeing parts of the old areas of Hong Kong that are not really visited by tourists. A real plus was Stephen met us in the hotel lobby & also ensured we returned back to the hotel without getting lost. Stephen's knowledge is very interesting & both my friend James & I found him very interesting to talk with. I personally found his knowledge & views on HK politics and overseas events to be most interesting. It's a great introduction to seeing HK & Stephen even helps with train tickets & getting used to the local train system. Stephen is energetic, fun, and easy to talk with. I loved his tour and would rate the experience a 5 out 5.

Very knowledgeable guide. Stephen took us for an amazing tour near where we were staying (in Hollywood Road) and gave us a real insight into the history and culture of HK. We also went across to Kowloon and if you get the chance, ask him to take you to one of the wet markets - north of Kowloon - really fascinating. Stephen is great guide, warm and personable and we thoroughly enjoyed our 5 hour tour (he gave us slightly longer than usual). After the tour he us sent extra information about the places we'd been to - very useful. Stephen is a history and political studies scholar and he was able to fill us in on HK's conservation efforts and the political scene there. He told us he thinking of doing his doctorate in oral history - I would encourage him to do so, but to also keep up the tour guiding!

A must do on your 1st day. It's not very often that you meet someone who is truly passionate about what they do. With Stephen, you can sense it as soon as you meet up with him. He was very professional, and responsive from the first time you get in contact with him until after you meet. The amount of useful service that he provides is unprecedented to anything I've ever experienced. He ensured that what we did on our day was purely to my interest, as well as recommending what I should do for the rest of my trip without the hassle of touristy expenses and crowded areas. I don't think there was a moment we weren't talking, he has a vast and diverse amount of knowledge that should be utilized the entire tour. It was a rainy day but we still had a blast! Whatever the price is, if you have time for the longer tour, or both, it is worth it hands down. You will get your monies worth and then some. Thanks for everything Stephen, you were a gem!

A Great Way To See Hong Kong. If you are looking for a guide to see other parts of Hong Kong outside of the standard tourist spots, look no further. I had a great 4 hour tour of HK Island and Kowloon. Thanks Stephen!

A great way to understand Hong Kong!. We hired Stephen for 2 tours during our 4 day stay in Hong Kong, one a 4 hour city tour and the other a 6 hour outing to Tai O fishing village. As a born and bred Hong Kong resident of Chinese descent, Stephen was able to give us an insightful understanding of the uniqueness of Hong Kong and its people. He referenced his family and life experience helping us to understand the way this society operates, its history and culture, its superstitions and practices. We feel we learned a huge amount. Stephen is educated, personable, flexible and interesting. His historical knowledge is great (I was particularly interested in the period of HK’s colonisation), he is politically aware and was also able to give us a lot of information about the Chinese customs that inform the HK way of life. It was a thoroughly enjoyable experience (albeit that the heat and humidity were at times overwhelming!) which we haven’t stopped talking about since arriving home 2 weeks ago. Would recommend!

Fantastic Tour Lantau Island. We have been on a 8 day City Trip to Hong Kong in March - April 2016 and during the planning fase we wanted to get the most out of it so we decided to book some private tours. As we had booked pior already a more city focussed tour I was on the lookout for a guide that could bring us more out of the city and to more rural areas including some hiking if possible. Tripadvisor brought us to Stephen. During the contact fase (mail), Stephen was on top of his game, pro-active, informative interested to understand our needs and he planned a complete tour around our requirements and shared the mainlines of what was awaiting us via mail. Our hotel was based on Jaffe Road (Causeway Bay area - Hotel Mira Moon) we agreed on starting the tour on March 29 from Tung Chung city which was 50 min travel by MTR with Causeway Bay station as our leaving point. Arriving in Tung Chung Stephen gave us a warm welcome he is a very open, communicative and attentfull person and truely interested in you as a person. We did a tour in Tung Chung, Ma Wan Chung village, Yat Tung estate and the Tung Chung Battery. From there Stephen took us on a bus going to Pui O a small beach village where he introduced us as well to something we didnt expected but very much appreciated being seeing Asian Waterbuffalo's wandering around freely in an area going to the beach. From Pui O we took the bus to Tai O where we had an excellent tour of Stephen including a very nice local lunch. Stephen introduced us to Wong Wai King a local Tai O writer whom has some kind of little museum and is famous for written a beautifull book about Tai O which we bought (personally signed copy) and gives insight on the history of the little fishing town. We also signed a petition against extending the Cable tray into the village as that would kill the already affected authenticity of the little town. From the town Stephen took us for a hike more in the rural part, we recommend to have decent walking shoes when going for a hike. Stephen brought us to beaufitull spots excellent for nice pictures. From Tai O we went to the Big Buddah, the Po-Lin Monastery and back with the Nong Ping 360 cable system, the last 3 not being part of Stephens Tour but we were lucky he joined us back down. Stephen is very knowledgeable on history, culture, politics, architecture, cuisine anything basically related to Hong Kong and even China in general. He is very motivated to give you the best tour of your stay in Hong Kong. Stephen speaks multiple langauages so do check for your own language if you would be less comfortable with English. We can highly recommend Stephen as your private guide if you want to see and be informed about a different Hong Kong.

Amazing History lesson of Hong Kong. Knowing we had only 24 hours in Hong Kong we decided to book Stephen for a 6 hour tour around Hong Kong. It was our first time and we wanted to experience as much as we could in the time we had and Stephen did not disappoint. His knowledge of the city and its history was wonderful. we learnt so much about a city we knew little about.We strongly recommend Stephen as it was a personal tour rather than a large group which we liked.

Fantastic Experience - 'Full on' day tour of Hong Kong. Would strongly recommend a tour with Stephen. We booked a 6 hour day tour before we travelled and it was well worth it. You need an above average level of fitness as there is a significant amount of walking to explore Hong Kong and Kowloon. The tour was tailored to our preferences of the history and culture of Hong Kong. Stephen is a very pleasant guy who took us 'everywhere' :-) If you have limited time and want to make the most of your visit do one of Stephen's tours ; he navigates and you simply follow. He is very knowledgeable and extremely affable - always ready to answer questions and maximise your experience. Stephen exceeded our expectations and made our first trip to Hong Kong memorable.

Wonderful introduction to HK!. We had booked a private tour with Stephen for the first full day we had in HK. It was our first time travelling in the region, and we wanted to get a good feel for the city. Stephen met us at our hotel lobby, and off we went to explore several areas of this wonderfully vast city. We started off by going to the local subway station where Stephen helped us get our passes, load money onto them as well as understand the way the subway system operated. Stephen was a wonderful story teller, captivating our attention the entire day by pointing out various important landmarks, and referencing both their historic and cultural significance to the city of HK. We stopped for a lovely lunch at Dim Sum Square (which we went back to later in the trip), where he arranged for a special lunch, accommodating my vegetarian dietary needs. The tour itself was insightful, and we certainly learned a lot about the culture, food and economy in HK. Moreover, by the end of the day we felt we had made a true friend! I highly recommend booking a tour with Stephen, as he is flexible and will tailor it based on your needs. Stephen is a bright tour guide with a passion for his city, and it translates so well in his guidance!

Insightful day in HK. I strongly recommend Stephen for any private tour in Hong Kong (city or hiking). We did a half day tour - visiting Sheung Wan, the Possession Point, Sheun Shui Po and finished by a beautiful view at the top of Garden Hill. I was looking for a non touristy visit of the city - and Stephen offered us exactly that: an insightful day, full of historical facts and a dive in Cantonese culture. Stephen is a very energetic, passionate, flexible and intelligent guide. Next time I am in Hong Kong I will definitely want to discover another part of the city with him! Thanks Stephen!

A PERFECT day . Stephen is a GEM !! Don't hesitate to book this - it is a wonderful tour with an amazing person, extremely knowledgable about culture, history and everything I could want to know! A great story teller and on top extremely kind and generous. What could you wish for more? Thank you Stephen for showing me so many facets of your city in what was my best day so far in Asia!

A trip in July to Lantau Island. I had a private tour with Stephen. We met up at Lantau and I was really late due to commuting problems but Stephen was very understanding of this which made me feel good right from the start.From there he showed me around Lantau, one of the highlights of the day was to visit the fishing village of Tai O, we had lunch together at a local spot and then he took me on a very interesting and educating walk around the village. Stephen is so knowledgeable and pretty personal which makes him a great tour guide. He showed me a side of Hong Kong that I would not have discovered if not for him.

Half day tour in Kowloon with Stephen. Touring with Stephen in HK was definetely the best decision I could have made for my trip. He showed me the local side of HK: took me to not so touristic places that are hard to reach normally for tourists, made me try the best local food at reasonable prices and told me a lot of it's history. I think HK went beyond my expectations because of him and all the different places he showed me, especially outside HK island. I was really interested in the history of this city and he taught me a lot, and could answer every question I had. Really recommend to touring Hong Kong with him if you want to visit the real HK! Cheers Stephen and hope to see you again soon.

Met as strangers and leave as friends. First at all I promise I will never forget that tour!!During our 4 days in Hongkong we booked several activities including three guided tours. Honestly spoken the private guided tour by Stephen exceled our expectations...In a kind of atmosphere of friends we got the opportunity to dive into the real Hongkong neighborhoods including tradiotional places as well as native daily business areas. Beside Stephen explained a lot about historical background of the city and took us to ancient and hidden places. Furthermore we had typical Cantonese food and traditional herb tea - awesome. We also enjoyed the flexibility of Stephen which is completly different compared to more commercialized trips where they tell you keep on time, do this for 20 minutes, come back to the bus...bla bla bla.Other guided (more commercial) tours we did have been far behind the quality of this one!If you are interested to overcome common tourist spots I highly recommand this tour!

Outstanding Tour of Hong Kong. Our family of five had a wonderful time with Stephen as he introduced us to Hong Kong. It was a wonderful way to begin our visit, as Stephen orientated us to Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, provided insight from the perspective of a local, and even gave us tips for the other days of our visit. This tour takes you to the non-touristy places, which is perfect since the touristy places can be visited without a guide. The information provided by Stephen gave us a familiarity with HK that allowed us to confidently explore later on our own.Stephen is a great guide and his tour is a perfect addition to any stay in Hong Kong.

Highlight of our trip!. Based on TripAdvisor reviews, I had high expectations for our tour with Stephen--and he managed to exceed them. From the initial booking to a written recap of the highlights of our day, he was just terrific. Stephen helped us get beyond the traditional tourist sites to better understand and appreciate Hong Kong’s unique history. He is knowledgeable, engaging, friendly and fun. His passion for history and culture shines through—he’s an outstanding guide. As a bonus, he was great with our two teens. The level of service Stephen provides is impressive. He truly did go above and beyond, helping us decide how to use our remaining time in Hong Kong and providing detailed, helpful suggestions. Booking with Stephen was the smartest choice I made on this trip—it made all the difference.

Authentic local experience with top notch guide. Stephen provided us with a real local immersive experience with a 6 hour non-touristy tour, allowing us to soak in the local scene and hidden treasures, both visual as well as gustatory, visiting fascinating areas both in Hong Kong as well as a Kowloon. We bombarded him with questions which he dealt with effortlessly, and it was a real pleasure to spend a full (and active) day with him. Giving a 4 star rating but would say this deserved a 4.5 (good to leave a small margin for self improvement!)

Awesome tour!!. Stephen was amazing tour guide. He gave us a wonderful tour of Kowloon and Hong Kong island. If you want a tour of authentic Hong Kong then this is it!! Stephen has a ton of great info and history. He even gave us great ideas for the one extra day we had on our own. Thanks Stephen!!!

5 Star Hong Kong Tour - 6 hours of total entertainment. Stephen replied to my query about his tour within 12 hours and designed an amazing 6 hour walking tour to perfection - incredibly knowledgeable about the city of his birth,the diversity of the population, the ancient and new customs and religious believes of the community,the local Chinese traditional medicines and their uses as well as visiting a variety of view points, wet markets, cafes and tea rooms the latter to partake of local health beverages - In addition he outlines a clear adventure plan that I could enjoy under my own steam the following day. If you want to feel Hong Kong please ask Stephen to share his knowledge and expertise with you - it is worth every cent!

Exciting discovery of HK in good company. In just a few hours Stephen showed us many worth seeing places of Hong Kong. There's no lost time, each street visited is interesting, and the tour condensed all the aspects required : historical, cultural, folkloric, gastronomic...etc. It was very pleasant to walk with Stephen who's an experienced guide, with an answer for all your questions. With him we saw and understood things about Hong Kong and chinese culture than we would have missed. We're completely satisfied with this tour and highly recommend Stephen to anyone. He understands your favorite topics and will give you an ideal fitted tour around this unforgivable city. Thanks Stephen to have helped make our journey engraved in our hearts and minds. Gregoire, Nathalie, Laetitia from Belgium

5* HK tour guide . We choose Stephen as our guide based on trip adviser reviews & our desire to explore more than the obvious tourist spots during our short stay in HK. Our day in Lantau Island did not disappoint! Stephen is friendly, interesting & easy going, a pleasure to spend time with. We visited places on the island, such as the temples, which on our own we would of appreciated from the outside but would not of ventured in to. Stephen took us inside, explained the meaning & symbolism of points of interest & we even got to ask a god a question. Booking with Stephen was very easy, he is very responsive over email & whats app. He has such an attention to detail & even helped us plan our self guided days in the city. He really went above & beyond. Highly recommended :)

Wonderful, personal tour of HKG with a fine HKG resident!. Just finished a fantastic tour of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon with Stephen Tse.He is professional, knowledgeable, interesting, young and happy. Everything you want in a tour guide. He loves Hong Kong, it's history and is a proud 'global' citizen. His excitement over this city is infectious. He loves it's nuances and understands what tourists might find interesting and different. I had my fortune predicted in a side street temple and ate durian for the first time! This was not your typical 'top sights' tour. Stephen caters it to your requests and our was 'off the beaten track'. It certainly was! Thank you Stephen for a great day. I can't wait to see how successful you become as Hong Kong's best tour guide! Jess

A great day trip on the Lantau Island!. We were a group of professor and students, we had a really wonderful day with Stephen on Lantau island! It was very hot day to walk in the middle of the summer in HK, but it was worth it to see all the beautiful landscape and the lovely village of Pui O and Tai O. We learnt a lot from Stephen about the wildlife of Lautau Island. We will for sure make Stephen to be our guide again!Tammy, Berlin

Couldn't have asked for anything more!. Stephen is the perfect tour guide for a specific type of traveler, and he is very good at setting expectations up front. Stephen is very clear from the initial communications that he is not the tour guide to hire if you are interested in going to the 'tourist' sites (that you can easily go to on your own), but his specialty is getting you off the beaten path, as cliche as that sounds. He's an expert at offering a more local experience, with focus on culture, history and food. I was delighted to spend the day with Stephen, on a private tour, around Lantau Island. I reached out to Stephen about a week before my last minute work trip to Hong Kong, and he was extremely responsive. Not only did Stephen help me plan the day that I would spend with him, but based on my interests, he also helped me schedule the rest of my free time in Hong Kong, ensuring that I got to see the more touristic sites that were important to me, and easily visited on my own. All through my time in Hong Kong, Stephen made himself available via whatsapp to answer questions about activities, restaurants, and other tour operators. The day of the tour was perfect. It honestly just felt like I was hanging out with a friend that had many shared interests with me - a love of the outdoors, photography, history, and culture. He took me all around Lantau Island, jumping on and off the city bus, navigating fishing villages and hiking trails. It was a really special day that was the highlight of my time in Hong Kong.I would happily recommend Stephen to anyone that is looking to get beneath the touristic surface of Hong Kong, and see more of the city than just Victoria Harbor and the Peak. Additionally, the quality of the tour aside, Stephen is actually just a cool guy with a great sense of humor that's fun to hang out with and spend time with. If I ever go back to HK, I'll happily explore more of Hong Kong with him.

Local Hong Kong like no other!. I am just amazed with Stephen. He is a great organizer and a historian with a deep appreciation for Hong Kong. The tour ran seamlessly and without a hint of rush. He immersed us in Lantau for the day: fishing village, nature and hidden sights that are not in English guide-books. I still remember how delicious the peanut-stuffed rice cake tasted at a stand he recommended. I love Stephen's deep knowledge of Hong Kong history. He will gladly sprinkle information during the tours for added value, but if you're not into it, he does not insist. He will adapt to the group and individual preferences. I highly recommend Stephen. If you're looking to experience the relaxed, local flavor of Hong Kong beyond the urban glitz, I could not think of better tours!

Great tour!. I did a walk with Stephen in north east new territories while I was traveling to Hong Kong. It was a very interesting place to explore, the Hakka lunch in the hidden village was a highlight. I would have never imagined to have places like these in before. Really like Stephen's walk very much, and I highly recommend it

Highlight of the Trip!. Exceptional private walking tour! Stephen is very knowledgeable and quite personable - he happily met us at our hotel and proceeded to introduce us to various parts of HK. He was careful to ask our particular interests prior to the tour and really arranged visits based on this - much more attention to personal interests than we could have hoped for. Very happy to take extra time and discuss - he was not on a rigid schedule but rather would happily take some extra time if we had questions or wanted to see something in particular. Great value and our highest recommendation!

Tailor Made Tour!!!. Stephen's private tour was simply amazing! A walking tour so wear good shoes but there were times to stop and rest which was nice. He tailors the tour to what you are interested in and even adjusts as you go! Very knowledgeable about all of Hong Kong today and in the past and great at telling the history. Loved his personal reflections on life in HK! My husband and I had never been to HK before and Stephen provided us with so much insight and knowledge and even gave further recommendations. Great guy! Great tour! Amazing experience!

Stephen Was Awesome!. My colleague and I travel to China on business every April. We find ourselves burned out after 15 days running all over the country visiting vendors and attending trade shows. We look forward to our time In Hong Kong near the end of our trip. We enjoy the shops and restaurants, however there is only so much shopping and eating you can do and a couple days so we thought we'd look up a guide and go out of the city for a more cultural experience. Those searches lead us to Stephen and I must say it was a solid decision to spend the day with him. He's a wealth of knowledge. Easy going and his English skills are outstanding. Stephen met us at the harbor (ferry from HK). From there we took a 45 min bus ride to a fishing village where we toured the town and temples. Very cool stuff! We had lunch at a local restaurant which he recommended. We then hopped a 20 min bus ride to an area where a path goes along some wetlands that held water buffalo. Really cool to see them so close up. We went on a long hike (4 hrs) up a mountain and back down towards the harbor. What a great view the entire way. if you're looking for an outdoor adventure with a great historian, Stephen will not disappoint. Good luck and Good travels!Bill

Thanks Stephen - your tour made all the difference for our weekend in HK. We are really interested in local food and culture wherever we go and Stephen gave us a great tour with his personal reflections and historical remarks to add to the rich and great guiding. We did the morning 4 hour tour on Hong Kong island and walked straight into the thriving markets and continued with temples and culture and beliefs of the local community. A late breakfast at a local Dim Sum place and everything you need to know about dried fish and herbal remedies. Highly recommended! Very easy communication and booking. And we got a personal summary sent after.

Stephen Tse's amazing walking tour of Hong Kong. I had booked Stephen's 6 hour tour of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and what an amazing tour it was...As an excellent preparation he inquired about any specific interests I might have and custom tailored the tour around it.Dim Sum for breakfast in Sheung Wan, the street markets of Kowloon, a secret way up to West Peak, ancestral halls and Temples of this amazing city and much more - all very knowledgably prepared and explained. He gave many great tips for photography opportunities and I could get many excellent photos. Back in the hotel later, I was amazed to receive a very nice summary of the sights we had seen - this is ideal for remembering, many many thanks for that.A tour thoroughly enjoyed, and thoroughly recommended.All the best,Andreas

Highly recommend!. I went to Tai O with Stephen. He is the best tour guide I have ever had: patient, knowledgeable and personable. Above all, he is a genuine person and take care of you seriously, he also customize the trip based on your preference. I highly recommend Stephen, it is a great way to make your stay in Hong Kong memorable.

Great tour. Our tour with Steven was great, and I would recommend him to anyone going to Hong Kong. He is very knowledgeable and nice, we saw so much in four hours. I cannot imagine going to HK for only 3 days and not having a private tour. Booking was easy and he answered the emails promptly. The price was fair and we really enjoyed seeing HK with him.After the tour he sent us a nice email with the places and the route with did. He even added a list some of the Chinese words that he thought us. His English is great and his perspective on HK is very interesting, especially because he gave us some great insights into his culture, traditions and how it is being a native from HK. Steven was a great choice, and we had an amazing afternoon.

Highlight of our Week!. We spent a week in Hong Kong, and hands down the highlight of our trip was our tour of Lantau Island with Stephen. Before the tour he spent a lot of time learning about me and my husband so he could make sure to tailor the tour to what we were interested in. We spent a lovely (albeit rainy!) day exploring and hiking around Lantau. Stephen is incredibly knowledgable and personable and was a blast to spend the day with. Hiking around Lantau Island was also a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city. If you're considering this tour, absolutely sign up for it! You won't be disappointed.

Tour of Lantau Island with Stephen. Stephen gave us a great all day tour of Lantau Island. He was very informative and it was great to see a different part of Hong Kong. He was also so flexible and easy going, especially when we slightly changed our itinerary. Stephen also took us to a very authentic Chinese restaurant on the island which was a highlight. I highly recommend taking this tour.

Private tour in Hong Kong with Stephen. Thank you Stephen for a amazing tour in Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Our 4 hours became 6 hours and the tour was a great pleasure and really nice and personal. Stephen has lot of knowledge of Chinese history. I really recommend him if you want to know Hong Kong from another angel.

Lantau Island Tour. Very nice day! The tour really exceeded my expectations, you really need more time to go on walking and discovering amazing places. Stephen has lot of knowledge about Chinese history but most of all the interaction with him is very very good. Always available since we talked about the tour, he kept adaptable to your needs and interests. I highly recommend him if you want to know Hong Kong from another angle.

Great and very interesting tour through Kowloon City. Stephen guided me through the older parts of Hong Kong, the Kowloon City area and surrounding with plenty of history sites, as the Kowloon walled city , temples, local markets and restaurants. He was very friendly and courteous and he has a very profound knowledge of the Hong Kong history and culture, so feel free to ask him anything, he most certainly will know it.

Friendly and knowledgable guide for off the beaten track tours. My girlfriend and I were visiting Hong Kong. It was my girlfriend's first time in Hong Kong while I have visited the city a few times before. Nevertheless, both of us enjoyed the trip very much and we both learnt a lot about Hong Kong.Stephen shows great pride and knowledge in Hong Kong culture and you can feel his enthusiasm of the subject! He is eager to share his city, it's culture and it's food and you can tell that it's more about sharing his passion rather than just a job. He is also very easygoing and a pleasure to be with. He was slightly concerned with us being one of his first Asian customers and he wondered if we would be as interested as Westerners but I think he did an excellent job and tailored the tour well.If you want to visit touristy sites, Stephen will not be the guide for you (and he would also recommend you to do it yourself) but if you want to have a feel of the real Hong Kong and it's different facets, then he's the guy for you!Friendly, prompt, knowledgable and reasonably priced, I would without reservations recommend him to anyone seeking a private walking tour guide in Hong Kong.

Discover Hong Kong . My partner and I signed up with Stephen for a day tour. We're Malaysian-Chinese and although we have some cultural similarities with the people of Hong Kong, there was still a lot we didn't know so we decided to go on a walking tour. From the booking to drop off, Stephen was really great! He was thoughtful, always in contact and really took into consideration what we wanted to see and learn. He was also really knowledgable and like I said, although we do have some cultural similarities, I still got to learn so much about Hong Kong's rich history through Stephen, something I don't think I could have done without a guide like him. He also brought us to a loooot of food places as we highlighted that as one of our must-dos. I'm still drooling over some of the dishes! (The goose rice and the French toast were amazing).He also brought us to temples, parks and even a little hike for a lovely view, changing his schedule on the go to suit us as he got to know us better as the day went on. The whole tour was pretty off the beaten track and that suited us perfectly.I think going on a walking tour with Stephen is a great idea for someone who wants to know the real Hong Kong. Spending the day with him really gave me a feel of this amazing city and was just a lovely experience. Plus, I think that even if you're of a south East Asian background, you still stand to learn a lot from one of his unique tours so I would still recommend it, just be aware that his tours are usually away from the usual tourist hotspots so if you really want to see those, you might want to set aside another day for it. Thank you loads Stephen! Let us know when you come by to Sarawak :)

Hong Kong tour. It was an absolute pleasure having Stephen be our guide in Hong Kong. We couldn't have picked a better person. We had combined two tours into one and had a long day ahead of us. Half way through the day our 2 year old son got very sick and we were quite concerned. He took us to the nearest hospital right away and was incredibly accommodating. He even refunded the second part of our tour without us neither asking him nor expecting him to do so! Besides being an incredible and honest human being he was an amazing guide who showed us the real Hong Kong, stuff you'd never see on regular tourist tours. Thank you for an incredible day and thank you for being so understanding and patient when things didn't exactly go according to the plan.We look forward to more tours with you when we come back.Sincerely,Oksana Brewster

Historic tour Wan Chai and Sheung Wan. I had a fantastic tour through the oldest parts of Hong Kong. Stephan could tell me really a lot about the history of Hong Kong and Chinese culture. Hey also showed me where to eat good local food and taught me on Chinese characters. It was a really nice afternoon with very much and personal attention from Stephan. I would certainly recommend to explore the city with Stephan on your side!

Walking Tai O, wonderful experience. My mother and me had the wonderful and very enyojable chance to visit Tai O (大澳). We went with very kind, freindly and patient Stephen. He was born there and he knows a lot of information about it. It was very interesting to explore old buildings and temples. He told us about history, traditions and customes. He also love hiking outdoors, and he hikes this beatiful landscape at least once at year. Then We really enjoy the splenderous view. At end of afternoon we had some desert to say goodbye. My mother and me think it was very complete trip.We have one of the most cute walks ever.

Amazing Tour Experience. We took a six hour tour with Stephen during our trip to Hong Kong. I specifically chose Stephen because we wanted to see parts of Hong Kong not frequented by tourists. He was outstanding. I travel to Hong Kong frequently for business and never saw the sights we toured with Stephen. He is enthusiastic, well-educated, and energetic. He took all the time we needed to rest and ask questions. The booking process was fast and easy. I highly recommend him. There are lots of other tour companies but they are quite large. With Stephen you get personalized attention. I will book him again when I return.

Half day private Hong Kong tour. Stephen was a fabulous tour guide. We did not go to the most "touristy" attractions -- like Victoria's Peak, which I could do on my own -- although we did cover many of the most famous parts of Hong Kong. What I liked best was the cultural and historical information Stephen provided along the way (he knows so much!), as well as his own personal stories about growing up in Hong Kong, and day to day life, and his family's history in China. Stephen was very easy to talk to and great company.

The perfect way to get in touch with Hong kong. We booked a tour with Stephen early on during our stay. A good choice! He took us on a long tour first to the Sheung Wan area and then we headed over to Sham Shui Po and Kowloon City. He had excellent knowledge of the sites and was able to tell us about the history and many cultural aspects of the sites we visted. No matter what we asked, Stephen always had an answer and was able to go deep into the subject (if asked for).Stephen was very patient and responsive to our requests and willing to provide information and suggestions about Hong Kong apart from his tour itinearyWe felt very taken care of and can absolutely recommend him as a guide and his tours.

Passionate and. Stephen took us on a 5 hour long tour through the city of Hong Kong - street markets, history, food, the walled city in Kowloon, tempels - Stephen knows everything about everything, and told us about it with passion and engagement. He ist truly comitted and seroius about his job, well educated about Hong Kong and very eager to make his guided tour as interesting as possible. I truly rekommend him!

Great tour with Stephen! He loves his city!. We had only one full day in Hong Kong. Knowing that this was probably the one and only time we would ever see this lovely city, Stephen offered to include a trip to Victoria Peak, a site swarming with tourists and not typically on his tour for that very reason. Sadly, the fog had descended on the city (we couldn't even see the mountains) and we were not able to head to this vantage point, but it was kind of him to offer. He knows his culture and his history and he is passionate about his city. His English is excellent. We came away from our one day in Hong Kong with a good sense of this fine city's essence, which is exactly what we wanted. I would highly recommend his tour. Debbie, Rich and Alex Rifkin. Cranbury, NJ USA

Hong Kong guide tour. I´m so glad I found Stephen on internet when I was looking for a guide in Hong Kong. His nice and kind personality combined with a lot of knowledge, entusiasm and patience he is someone I can strongly recommend. You can feel that he is truly doing this with heart and passion. You can´t get a better guide then this! Thank you again Stephen for an amazing day!

Very interesting visit and full. I had a great after noon in the heart of Hong Kong with the visit of places full of stories, street markets and real places where you can eat local and cheap!
I was alone and just arrived, Stephen gave me a lots of advices to get by in Hong Kong.
Very interesting guy and passionate about history!
I recommend!

Incredible tour! Highly recommended!. Stephen is a great guide! Stephen showed us the most beautiful places in SHEUNG WAN, took us to really good restaurants and enriched a lot our knowledge. Lantau Island Private Tour. Stephen was an incredible guide who took me around remote areas on Lantau Island and shared personal experiences ...I was visiting my daughter, who was busy with exams, and this was a day away from the busy streets in Hong Kong!I would definitely recommend a tour with Stephen, as he customizes the tour to meet your needs!

Great tour, highly enjoyable. We participated in Stephen's Lantau Island tour and had a wonderful experience. He is knowledgeable about the history of the area and the modern politics. We saw the natural beauty of the island, which was a nice escape from the city. Seeing the water buffalo of Pui o was really unique, and the beach there was amazing.

Tour of old Hong Kong. Stephen gave us an interesting and informative tour of Wan Chai and Sheung Wan. He has a broad knowledge of local history and culture as well as current affairs. We felt like we say Hong Kong through the eyes of a local and not the usual tourist traps of the shopping malls.

Great and very informative tour - highly recommended. Stephen is a great tour-guide. It's obvious that it's his passion. He can show you the best parts of Hong Kong, especially those which aren't very easy to reach on your own. He took us to Tai O village which was great to see and totally different from typical skyscrapers area which come to your mind when you think about Hong Kong. I really enjoyed our discussions about almost everything related to Hong Kong like culture, food, history, religion, nature, education... Stephen is extremely knowledgeable and he was also curious about our country and culture. It was great opportunity for culture exchange. I really recommend having tour with Stephen to discover hidden treasures of Hong Kong! Thank you :)

Great Tour!. Stephen's trip was excellent. I was particularly interested in history of the places that we visited and Stephen is a big fan of Chinese and HKG history so he was able to explain me everything in details. He also gave me overview how political changes caused Kowloon district to be created... and then destroyed. Later on we visited Chinese Temple - that was the first time I visited a temple! Stephen exlained me the basics of the religion and celebrations as I was not aware of those facts. I must admit that it made me understand many things and made Asia even more interesting - I will keep exploring it in the future for sure. Summing up, do not hesitate to take a tour with Stephen, you won't regrett it!

Finding the hidden places on Lantau. This was a great tour I was over for business but wanted to escape and see Hong Kong's natural and traditional sides during my stay. This was the perfect trip for this. Stephen is a great guide that does not bombard you with facts like big tours do so you get a proper feel of the place, whilst having your tour personalize before and during the day. As well going to the places we agreed upon before we went to a lot of extra places so you do get a lot for your money. So thank you Stephen and next time I am over I will definitely arrange another tour to discover more hidden places in Hong Kong.

Walking With Stephen in Hong Kong was a highlight of our visit to this wonderful city.. My husband and I booked a city tour with Stephen before we came to Hong Kong. He promised that we would have an "off-the-beaten path" experience and we did. Stephen is passionate about Hong Kong, very knowledgeable, outgoing, warm and an excellent communicator We walked, rode the subway and the double decker bus to neighborhoods that have changed little in hundreds of years We visited open air markets, learned about the food that ordinary people eat. sampled dumplings,visited a beautiful Taoist temple with an ongoing service, and another temple steeped in the ancestor worship which is still very much a part of life for the majority of Chinese people. We learned about where and how land had been reclaimed in HK to make room for its growing population, and learned about family life, history and current events as well. We recommend this tour and this guide very highly. Gwen and Robert

Friendly, kind and very knowledgeable - excellent man. We spent 5 days in HK and did two tours with Stephen. City center and Lantau island rural tour. Both were excellent, thanks to his big knowladge about culture, religion, history and everyday living in HK. And he was so patient and kind while we doing some small shopping, never complaint - we were a group of 4 ladies:)) He took his time to answer all the emails I sent to him prior and after tours. I can reccomend him with any doubt.

Excellent man and perfect tour!!. I was very lucky to meet Stephen in the beginning of my trip in Hong Kong.He took me to Lantau island to a magnific tour in a very special part of the island.I really learnt a lot of things about the history of Lantau,its population,culture,traditions,religion...things that i could never discover on my own!I highly recommend Stephen for any tour around Hong Kong because his knowledge is priceless.Thank you so much Stephen for make me fall in love even more with Hong Kong!!!

Excellent tour with Stephen!. We spent few days in Hong Kong at the beginning of this year. We took this excellent tour with Stephen. Then we took amazing pictures of a fishing port and village and after that we climbed throught a place where we could have a nice view of the complete Island! It was a great experience. Stephen is so polite and friendly and he knows well his country. I really recommend this tour. Don't miss the opportunity of learn about Hong Kong!

Friendly and knowledgeable. Stephen is very friendly and he knows his things about HK, the culture, history, religion etc. He took his time to duly explain everything and was very responsive in all email communication prior and after the tour, so fully reliable. Stephen Tour is excelente.. My wife and me went to Hong Kong for a few days the past january, and we had the opportunity of meeting Stephen. I extremly recommend Stephen for your tours.

The best experience in Lantau Island!. We spent a fantastic day tour with Stephen in Lantau Island. He is an excellent guide!. He took us to many places in the Island and he taught us about the history and the culture of Hong Kong. It was definitely great to learn so many stories about Hong Kong and its people. We enjoyed the tour very much because we learnt much more than we expected. I recommend a day tour with Stephen if you want to have the best experience in Hong Kong!

Memorable trip because of Stephen. It was our first time to the beautiful island of hongkong and our trip was to visit Disneyland for my 8 year old daughter.once that was done our energy was drained and wanted something for us the parents. Stephen being so well versed with english and knowledgeable and kind enough to take my daughter into consideration took us for a tour then ended up with beautiful dinner. Amazing tour. I was looking for a tour a bit different than the usual city tour, as I wanted to see the real Hong Kong, the one you don't get to see as a tourist alone. Initial plan was to visit Lantau island, but since the weather forecast was not that great, Stephen was flexible enough to fullfill my request to do something else. He suggested to visit the Kowloon walled city and the markets and temples in the neighborhood. He is great guy, very knowledgeable and passionate. Every part of the visit was accompanied by history, anectodes and interesting information. I even got to try local food, from the most typical (roast duck with rice, milk tea) to the weirdest (pike intestine on a stick). On top of being a great guide, Stephen was also interested to hear about me and my experiences, I appreciated this exchange.I will for sure go back and this time, I will join him for a hike on Lantau. Looking forward

Lovely walking tour on Lantau Island. I most enjoy meeting Stephen and strolling around his home island, Lantau Island. He is very knowledgeable about the history and culture there, so I learnt much as we wandered through various historical sites and towering apartment blocks. I liked how he also showed interest in my country, so it didn't feel at all like a tour guide/tourist experience. I highly recommend meeting up with Stephen if you go to HK; he is a lovely person with lots of history and local politics to share!

The best guide in Hong Kong. Stephen is an amazing guide. He loves Hong Kong and knows a lot about the culture and history of the place. I highly recommend taking a tour with him if you would like to learn more about HK, beyond the touristic places. Stephen is a serious and experienced guide, he makes sure that his clients are happy with their tour and doesn't hesitate to adapt his itineraries to better suit each person.When I met Stephen, I had a lot of questions about HK and he was happy to answer me and teach me many things.

More than just a walking tour. Stephen has the nicest smile ever. we know straight away, that's a friend. It felt like walking around the city with a friend who likes to tell you stories. And the stories he tells are astonishing, interesting and some funny. We had really nice conversations while drinking tea and eating local food. He is totally open flexible and good organized which is very important where you sometimes forget how big the distances are. Thank you so much Stephen for everything.

Wonderful walk in Hong Kong. In November 2015 me and my boyfriend decided to take a guided tour in Hong Kong with Stephen. That was the best decision we could have made! He is an excellent guide with wide knowledge not only of Hong Kong, it's history and culture but also about the world. We could discuss with him the political and economical situation in Poland! He showed us not very well known places like West High and gave us very useful tips for the next days. Besides that Stephen is a very friendly and open person we can highly recommend as a guide!

Amazing untold stories of Hong Kong!. Me and my mother had a wonderful time on a walking tour with Stephen. He has exceptional cultural and historic knowledge of Hong Kong and China, and is able to share his insights in an engaging and personal way. His friendly person made for good company, where we always felt safe and intrigued where ever he brought us. I can highly recommend taking a guided tour, but take your time to communicate your interests with Stephen, both before and during the tour, so that he can make an exciting itinerary. We asked for the focus to be on local culture and history, avoiding all the touristy spots that we visited on our own and that can be read about in books. He took us to East Kowloon, bringing us to local markets & food courts, temples and even old shabby districts soon to be demolished. Along the way he explained many of the cultural quirks and traditions that where present all around us but often overlooked. I am very thankful how Stephen graciously shared personal anecdotes, making his factual insights uniquely real. It was interesting how many Chinese religious customs that have mostly gone lost in mainland China, survive in Hong Kong and are kept alive by the city's older generations. The best part of the tour was the Walled City exhibit. What a fantastic story!! :)

Hong Kong walk tour with an amazing guide!!!. The tour is very well structured and very interesting to understand the Hong Kong society evolution.First, the market tour helps to understand the traditional culture and appreciate the food diversity. Also the importance of the temple is introduced there and it will be illustrated by the visit of a local temple.After, the visit of the park is very interesting because it illustrates how dense the city is and how the lack of space have created crazy situation (well commented especially with the historical context of the area). The temple visit is also smoother as it is a very local and quite, so it is easy to ask questions.Last but not least, the tour of an old area is an interesting point to compare past and future. I highly recommend the tour, Stephen is a very knowledgeable guide.

An excellent guide. We booked him for a day tour of the city of Hong Kong and he proved to be a reliable, knowledgeable and nice person. He walked us through the centre of the city giving us plenty of information, not only about the city itself but also of the local customs and traditions. Highly recommended.

Old city walk tour on Hong Kong Island. Stephen take me to visit places in Hong Kong and the tour was amazing. In this tour we visit Wan Chai's old neighborhood, the dried seafood market, the Tai Ping Shan Street temples and also the beautiful Man Mo Temple. The major theme of this tour was focusing on local culture because I wanted that way. My favorite was seafood market when I saw so many chinese food culture thing and Stephen just laught with me because I was so thrill about everything! :D He is very wise and he know about Hong Kong something more deep than usualy guide do, so I highly recommend this easygoing and relaxing guide to take you to private and unique tour.

Awesome tour! Highly recommend!. This tour was incredibly insightful. As this was my second time in hongkong I was hoping to find something a little more authentic and I did! He took me to some local temples and really gave a thorough introduction to the local folk religion, we walked through a colorful street market and it ended in one of hongkong's older remaining 1950's cafes. He is very informative and I left feeling like I understood Chinese culture much more and had a real taste of hongkong. If I had more time I would have taken another tour with him through another area. Was a highlight of my trip!

A Great and informative tour of the real Hong Kong. Stephen showed us a great time and shared the history and culture of Hong Kong with us. He was really knowledgeable and fun to talk to. It was great to see some of the real Hong Kong, and get away from the shopping malls and guys hawking handbags to foreigners.

Private Tour for Family of Four. We had a great time with Stephen. Definitely felt like we got a tour that included unique and interesting stops not on the regular tourist itinerary. We really enjoyed Stephen's story about his family and growing up in Hong Kong. It added interesting fabric to our trip and gave us a richer understanding of life in Hong Kong. Our group was a family of four with our sons ages 16 and 14. Thanks Stephen. Hope to see you again in the future!

Very enjoyable, super interesting. Must be one of the best tour guides in Hong Kong. Really good that he doesn't go to any tourist spots and just sticks to the cultural side of things. Very informative. Loved it

A great way to learn about the real Hong Kong. Stephen managed to fit us in on a Wednesday morning after we contacted him just before we arrived in Hong Kong. It was a great decision to go on a tour with Stephen on our first day. He helped us orientate ourselves and he gave us some really useful tips for the rest of the time we were in Hong Kong (how to use the subway, ferries and ding dings, places to eat and to visit). He sent us a long email after our morning walk about where we had visited and even answered a few follow up questions on his recommendations. His tour took us off the main tourist track including lunch at a really authentic, old-style Dim Sum restaurant which we would have never found, let alone tried on our own. I'd highly recommend his private walking tour for those who want to learn about the real Hong Kong, past, present and future.

Best Experience In Hong Kong. We took Stephen's private walking tour of Lantau Island on our third day in the area. It was the best experience we had because for the rest of the trip we knew so much about the places and culture that we were seeing. Stephen showed us many little known historical sites on Lantau Island including several pre-colonial sites. Stephen knew everything about the local area and taught us things about Chinese culture and Buddhist religion that we never would have learned on our own. Stephen also taught us language and customs that helped us for the remainder of our trip. I'm so glad we booked this experience early!!Stephen was informative, reliable and polite. He catered our experience uniquely to our tastes and I would recommend his service to anyone visiting the area. Thanks Stephen!

Best way to get in touch with the Lantau Island. It was our first day in Hong Kong when we did the tour with Stephen to Lantau Island but he managed it that we where fascinated by the culture of Hongkong only after a few hours. We visited a lot of places I would have never gone by my self because I didn't know them. It was really nice that he asked us in which topics we were interested that's why the tour was really unique for us. We tried some of the deliouciust fish balls and even learned some Chinese written and spoken language. He was interested in our culture too so we had like a little culture exchange. I can't say what thing was the best at the tour but our little hike on top of a hill at Tai O was awesome! We catched the sunset and had a breathtaking view on the fisher village. If you are fit enough to walk as fast las Stephen does you should definitely tell him to go there :)!

Amazing way to see another side of Hong Kong. Stephen has been the best tourguide we could have wished for. Before our tour started he asked about our interests and planned a unique tour which included everything we wanted to see and actually things we didn't even know we wanted to see :D I am so glad we had the chance to meet stephen and could see places where we would never have gone on our own. For example the small beach town Pui O with it's beautiful scenery and the wild Asian water buffalos who where living there.Our next stop was Tai O, an interesting fishing town in the western side of Lantau Island. My favourite parts where the Sham Chung stilt house area, the walk through a dried seafood market and the short Fu Shan hiking trail with it's amazing view.We would recommend Stephens private tours to everyone visiting Hong Kong, this is something we will remember for ever :)

Visiting Lantau island. Stephen showed me the unexpected beauty of Lantau island. We took a short walk by the sea, we went to chinese temples and reached beautiful viewpoints meanwhile I got to know how fishermen live their everyday life and heard his interesting stories about culture, religion, life... Stephen is a very intelligent person, highly recommended for curious travellers!

Very interesting tour to authentic Hong Kong. Stephen made a custom private tour for me, based on my preferences which he asked me for before the trip (local food, history, culture). It paid off and the places we went to were very interesting to me:I saw the Kowloon Walled City Park, ate delicious local food and saw more authentic Hong Kong Live than what you find in the more touristic places (where I had my hotel). Hong Kong is a great city and the best places are not "The Peak" or "Victoria Harbor". Stephen showed me places I wouldn't have found alone!

A view of Hong Kong I never would have experienced on my own. Stephen was an excellent tour guide! The tour was in Kowloon city, our first stop was the wet market. I was the only foreigner there and therefore got to experience a truly local market selling fish/meat/vegetable/fruit/clothing, etc... Stephen was very knowledgable about the items being sold and the history as well. We then visited the Kowloon Walled City Park. Stephen knew so much history about the area, I truly learned a lot and he kept me interested and wanting to know more. I can now say I know the history of the Kowloon Walled City! After the park he took me to Hau Wong Temple and Nga Tsin Wai Village. The temple was really interesting and it was great to see what a Chinese temple looks like. Stephen explained the temple gods and traditions in a way that was easy to understand. Nga Tsin Wai Village was awesome because it is one of the last pre-colonial Chinese villages that still exist in Hong Kong's urban area. I would have never been able to experience these places without Stephen's tour, I 100% recommend it!

Hong Kong we would never see ourselves. Stephen shown us local places which you could not find in a lonely planet. Thanks to him we saw true Hong Kong despite the fact that we had only two days for this city. Definitely recommended!

An interesting non-mainstream tour in town. It was a pleasure taking Stephen's off-the-beaten-track tour to the old town of Hong Kong. I think this kind of an introduction is really worth the time and money, it was fascinating. Stephen is a very knowledgable young local man with great enthusiasm and punctuality. I definitely recomend!

Awesome Private Tour of Hong Kong. Stephen knows Hong Kong and what better way to get to know the city then through the eyes of a life long resident of the city. Stephen took the time before our tour to understand what my interests were and then personalized a tour based upon my interests. He was always responsive, very informative, and really loves his job. I could not recommend Stephen more.

A different side of Hong Kong. I am so thankful I took this walking tour with Stephen! After spending my first days walking around the hectic city, it was a breath of fresh air (literally) to be shown around the beautiful, sea side town of Tai-O!Stephen took me to a local shop for Wanton noodles and oh my, they were so delicious! It was so nice to have Stephen there to help me figure out what to order and to speak the local language :)We walked all around the city, and through the stilt house area which was so neat! Such a cool experience to see how different people live all over the world. We also "hiked" up to the top of a hill to see amazing views of Tai-O and it was so beautiful! Also amazing because of the breeze that day :)Stephen is a very well informed and also sweet tour guide! He is very thorough and can answer so many questions because he's lived in Hong Kong so many years! Highly recommended.

A view of Hong Kong you must experience!. This was a wonderful tour through older parts of Hong Kong with a young, enthusiastic, and very knowledgeable "guide." In fact, Stephen is a one-man tour company and he really wants you to have a wonderful and very insightful visit to some of the parts of Hong Kong that are special, meaningful, and full of cultural significance. Indeed, this is what you will get and it was special. Dim Sum in a place you'd never find on your own, temples with remarkable history and meaning located in the heart of Hong Kong, and visits to markets and sights not easily found by the tourist. Spend 4 hours with Stephen and you will have a memorable and unique Hong Kong memory. If that wasn't enough, Stephen sent us a follow up email with a detailed account of our itinerary, so it's easy to match your photo's with a description of where you visited. I am sure that he will succeed in his tour business, and only hope that he keeps the personal and unique approach to the tour as things grow. Go now - while he can still take you around and offer this amazing experience.

Amazing guide and amazing tour!. Stephen bring us to an unconventional tour in Tung Chung Hong Kong. He knows places that you cannot find in the guide book like Ma Wan Chung village, the old fishing town of Tung Chung. He customized the tour and the explanations on our needs and interests asking in advance what we were interested in.....so smart! Also The next day he sent us a recap of everything we saw. Really an high level service!

Great experience in Hong Kong with Stephen. We spent a half day with Stephen. After living some days in the heart of crowded and noisy Hong Kong, it was such a great experience to see the other part of the city and to enjoy the professional support of Stephen. I can highly recommend the excursion and Stephen as a guide for everybody who would like to get to know traditional Hong Kong.

Perfect city walk through old Hong Kong. The experience of taking a walking tour through the old Hong Kong with Stephen was top notch! We started in the Wan Chai area and then proceeded to the Sheung Wan area. In all, I was able to get a first hand look at temples, historic buildings, local markets and much more; but what made the experience so special was having Stephen's input and knowledge. He really knows his business and will give a profound and clear explanation of Hong Kong's history, culture, food, etc., keeping up his characteristic friendliness all the time. Therefore, I cannot give Stepehen less than 5 stars for this. Totally recommended!!!

Taste of traditional HongKong. I've spent a half day with Stephen who took me to Lantau island and we explored the Tai 'O village. The trip itself was very nice. Stephen is very easy going and knowledgeable person who can talk a lot about history, religion, tradition or present situation. You can see also his interest in other countries and cultures. A guide in the right place doing what he likes and enjoys. I can truly recommend!

Terrific Day in Tao. We spent a day with Stephen exploring the fishing village of Tao. It was a lovely contrast to the city of Hong Kong. Stephen was personable, knowledgeable and eager to please. His English was quite good. I would recommend spending the day with him to see this quaint village.

Perfect local tour. We met with Stephen an early morning and he took us around different areas in the wan chai district.
