He also took us to a temple and explained to us some of the history of the religion and how it is practiced. We finished the tour by going to a local dim sum restaurant, which Stephen recommended - and which was absolutely delicious. Stephen is very good at English so there were no problems with communication. He answered all of our questions and he also gave us lots of advice on what to do and see the last days in Hong Kong. It was a very positive experience and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Hong Kong, who wants to get to know the country in a deeper way than just the regular touristy sightseeing ways.

The only way to get to know the real Hong Kong. This was my first time to Hong Kong and I have to say that Stephen was an unbelievable tour guide. He crafted a tour that not only matched my interests (which he was able to pick up on as we were on the tour and adjust accordingly) but also showed me the parts and history of Hong Kong that I would never know even if I walked right through them. Stephen is incredibly friendly and knowledgable about all aspects of Hong Kong live - the history, the culture, the food, essentially everything. Excellent guide!!!. Stephen is the best guide you can get in Hong Kong!! He asked us before what we prefere and the he prepered his tour. He knows the city, the history of it and culture and he kindly answers to every question :) I really recommend this guy as a guide in Hong Kong!! Thank you again for a great day :)

Absolute Must-do. We have been to Hong Kong for the first time and only had a couple of days to spend in this amazing city. Excellent personalized tour. I enjoyed the half day tour around HK. Stephen is very full of knowledge of HK and will show you around the most interesting areas. I like that you can get a tour which you decide what to see and do. Keep it up Stephen. :-)

Amazing personalized Tour in non-tourist areas. Me and my boyfriend did a half-day tour on 26 of November 2015 with Stephen. It was an amazing tour which was fully personalised. Very nice Hong Kong tour. We really had a great day together with Stephen. He arranged us a walking tour specific to our interests. The original time for the walking tour was from 14:00 -17:30. Amazing private tour with and amazing guide. This private tour through no-turistic places was the best experience I had in Hong Kong. Great customized tour. Stephen's tour was great! Before the tour, Stephen asked us about our preferences in order to personalized the tour for my friend and I. The tour we had was at Tai'O village in Lantau island. One thing that is great is that Stephen is very knowledgeable. Any questions you have about Hong Kong or in general, Stephen will spark a good conversation. Therefore, the tour wasn't formal, but more fun and personal, which is exactly what we were looking for. Also, the length of the tour and place visited we're really interesting, and it was even better with Stephen, because he was able to explain a lot on the temples, fisherman village, history of the place, etc. which we would have never known by visiting on our own. Very nice openminded guide. We really enjoyed a afternoon with stephen at lantau island. We went for a nice local dim sum restaurant, visited a local market and did a cool short hike (Ngong Ping 360 cable car rescue trail) where we enjoyed the sunset.He has a big knowledge about his home and is really interested to get to know other cultures!We hope to be able to welcome him one day in switzerland!

Very professional personal tours. Stephen created the perfect tour for me. A mix between history, nature and the modern Hong Kong. Best tour if you want to go off the beaten path!. If you are interested to go off the beaten path and want to see a different and pure side of HongKong, than stephen is your guy!! I did a tour in and around Tai O, an old fishermansvillage on the island lantau. He liked it to learn everything about me and my culture as wel so we ended up talking for hours.I have learned so much more about HongKong in a very deep way these hours, than my entire stay in the rest of hongkong.

A perfect customised tour!. Stephen was my guide for getting to know Hong Kong island and Lantau island. This is how I visited the city and the amazing island of Lantau, exploring a fishermen village and the surrounding areas. Stephen has a lot of knowledge and explains everything very clear. I would definitely recommend him to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

it was the experience I was looking for. Stephen offered me a tour based on my personnal interests: tradicitional culture, arts, history, gastronomy... He took me for a walk around hong kong's old towns to see tradicional wet market, temples, old buildings, with a lot of details and peculiarities that just a local could tell. It was the best experience I could ever had in Hong Kong!Stephen is a nice, gentle men, always worried by our comfort and pleasant. A perfect host!Thank you Stephen! ;)

Fantastic and Authentic Hong Kong Tour. Stephen's Hong Kong Tour simply fantastic. Very thoughtful private tour ��. Stephen invited us to an afternoon tour of some of the most special spots in Hong Kong. It was an amazing afternoon. Stephen is so knowledgable about his city, he was able to answer all our questions and explained so many things we never even knew to ask about. He went at a great pace and showed his concern for us by making sure we were keeping up with what he was saying and the walking pace. Going on the tour with Stephen gave us a better understanding and appreciation of Hong Kong. If love history and learn about cultures, we would highly recommend a tour with Stephan. I know he will not disappoint you.

Great walk, nicely explained!. Stephen took my friend and I to a walking tour in the fishing town of Tai O, it was great to see this little town, specially having Stephen explaining the little things that we would have not noticed otherwise and that became something that stayed on our minds for the rest of the trip in Hong Kong.I really enjoyed this tour as it felt more personal than those tours with big groups of tourists and I would definitely contact Stephen on my next visit to Hong Kong!

Great Tour with an great Guide. The Tour with Stephen was amazing and absolutly the highlight of my Hong Kong experience. About Stephen:He is one of the nicest people I've meet during my traveling around the world. He knows a lot about the City, Chinese (and especially Hong Kong's) History, the Culture as well as Relegions. He will show you some very interesting places, which are hard to find on your own, and can tell you everything about it. I was really surprised how much he knows about other countrys and there culture all around the world, he was well informed about my home county (Germany) and also about recent events whats there happening. If you are looking for an nice, friendly, well informed, good english speaking Tour Guide I would totally recommend Stephen. He will make your stay in Hong Kong very special.About the Tour:The Tour was 2.5h long and startet at an good to find Subway Station on Hong Kong Island. He gave me clear instructions when and where we meet. Unlike me, he was there at time and waited patently for me to arrive. I simply underestimated the huge amaount of people on the subway and came a few minutes late. Then the Tour started. As my preferences for the tour was on culture and history, we started to walk through an local market where you can buy some really crazy things I've never seen in my life before (not even on similiar markets in china mainland). There was no other western looking people around, so I had the feeling it was a real local's market. After that we went on to an very impressive temple where he told me a lot about the religion and history of it. Then he showed me around the oldest part of the Hong Kong city and also explained a lot about it. I could write a 10p essay about the trip but for this "short" review this seems to be enough. Just go on and book your tour with Stephen. I had not that feeling of an touristic guided tour, it felt more like a travelling experience with an good old friend.

Great tour of Hong Kong!. I went on Stephen's tour with my two sisters and had a great experience. Throughout our 7 day stay in Hong Kong, we learned the most about Hong Kong's history during our 2 hour tour. Stephen is very knowledgeable about Hong Kong's history and has a binder full of information ready to use at his disposal. I definitely would recommend Stephen to be your tour guide in Hong Kong if you truly want to understand its history.

Fantastic Tour!. If you really want to get some in-depth knowledge about Hong Kong, it's history and how it really works, this is the tour for you. My boyfriend and I stayed in HK for a few days, but in our 2-hour tour with Stephen we learned more about this country than the rest of our days put together. He is ridiculously knowledgable about everything from history to culture to nature, and he understands many foreign cultures so he can put everything in context for you, regardless of what continent you come from. He is also very up-to-date on current events and outs a lot of effort into understanding what is going on around the world, so even just talking about current events is very interesting! His English is clear and easy to understand, plus he has a great personality.He is also very accommodating- we only had a small window of a few hours with which to squeeze in a tour before or flight out, he was punctual and kept everything within our time limit so we had no stress at all. And in that short time, we learned and saw so many things, even in a small part of Lantau Island, that really surprised us.Even if you have only an hour or two to spare, I can guarantee that his tours are completely worth it, and if you are truly interested in learning about Hong Kong this is the best thing you can possibly do!

Highlight of my stay!. Stephen contacted me through couchsurfing to ask me if I would be interested in a tour, to discover another side of Hong Kong and I'm so glad he did! Great tour!. Stephen is a great tour guide, he is very friendly, punctual and he adapts to your interests very well, depends on what you are looking for he manages to create your tour. Great tour guide in Hong Kong. Stephen is a great tour guide. He knows a lot about Hong Kong. Culture, history, food and many more things. Perfect day, perfect guide!. Stephen took me to Lan Tau Island for a day-trip, and he was the perfect guide. Walk Tour. Stephen gave me a 3 hour tour in Hong Kong which I found very useful and interesting. Some of the highlights covered were religion, politics and local culture. He took us to a market and was very patient and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend Stephen!

Very interesting . Stephen is a very nice and friendly guy, who told us a lot of interesting facts about the religious traditions, history of Hong Kong and overall about the everyday life of local people. I would highly recommend to spend some time with him on a tour in Hong Kong!

Halfday Tour of Hong Kong Island with Stephen. We (a small Family with 8-year-old daughter) booked a half day tour with Stephen and had wonderful time. The best guide!. Stephen is an amazing man with so big knowledge about Hong Kong. This area was underwater? Hong Kong has grown!!. Spending the morning with Stephen was a informative and casual walk through neighbourhoods that gave us a deep insight into Hong Kong history. A perfect morning of discoveries. Stephen gave us a city tour and it was better than we expected. He was very accommodating and adapted to our interests. Off the beaten track tour in Hong Kong. My day with Stephen was the best day I had in Hong Kong. Experiencing a different side of Hong Kong. I had the opportunity to visit the traditional fishermen's village Tai O together with Stephen. And as soon as you know everything about the village and HK you can talk to Stephen about other things too as he is very interested in other parts of the world as well. Good job Stephen!

Excellent day out. Steven was very informative, got to see another side of Hong Kong that I didn't know existed. He was very friendly and gave me lots of interesting information. Tried some local food and visit a fishing village. Awesome day, Thanks Steven..

Great local tour outside the city to see the other side of HK. I had the pleasure of Stephen showing me around Tai O, a small village outside of the city - about one hour away from the city center. The place in itself was very interesting all though the fishing community the livelihood of the village had been based on almost has disappeared. From the village it is also possible to see the construction of a massive bridge towering in the nearby ocean making a very concrete contrast between the localized past and the global future changing the landscape.Stephen chose the site based on very brief questionnaire I filled out online before coming to Hong Kong making it possible to for him to personalize a guided tour that fit my interests. In my case it was history, culture and food. No doubt that Stephen has extended knowledge about Hong Kong and Chinese history and culture. This made the bus ride to the village in company with Stephen (almost :) ) as enjoyable as the tour itself. So if you are interested in the history about Hong Kong I definitely recommend Stephen as your guide. Finally, I had a day on my own a couple of days later and asked Stephen for a couple of recommendations for where to go in the city, what to see. I expected a couple of names of locations or sights and then I could do some research myself. However, in stead I got detailed descriptions including detailed journey plans using public transport on how to get there and continue to the next site. So definitely going the extra mile. Stephen is a very nice guy who is very enthusiastic about what he is telling about. And his English is also very good so no worries there! I had a really great afternoon.Thanks.

Wonderful tour of Hong Kong. This morning we went with Stephen on a tour of Hong Kong and thanks to him we were able to see the living beyond the big building. We went out of the tracks and discovert a so unique culture, fusion between China and United Kingdom. Stephen is very professionnal, you will see that is mind is full with the knowledge of the history of Hong Kong and he will makes you see it bringing you to major places in the history of the city.I enjoy it because I like to now more of the culture, the history and the food of the country I visit. ^^ . I appreciate because he knows which place is famous and why, he can explain with the context and the perspective.

Real local visit oh Hong kong. Stephen is a really nice and helpful guide. He knows the good places to go either if you're more interested in nature sceneries or in the city attractions. I learnt a lot about Hong Kong history and China's culture (temples, gods etc). I definitely recommend him !!!

Great alternative to crowded touristy itineraries. We had two 4 hour tours with Stephen that were wonderful. He is a bright young man that speaks English very well. His tours are packed with culture and history as opposed to shopping and glitz. He makes the most of your time by letting you do The Peak, Star Ferry and other time consuming things on your own, as opposed to wasting time on lines.he also makes great suggestions and sends directions and pictures for things to do and see apart from the tours. He made our time in HK wonderful.Abraham AlvarezNYC

Great local tour guide. Did a half day tour with Stephen around Hong Kong and it was just great! He planned the tour in advance according to my interest and time so I really could get the most out of the tour.We walked around the older parts of the Hong Kong island; went to the "wet market" ; saw temples hidden between skyscrapers ; and even had a local breakfast.It's an amazing thing to have a tour guide that does not only know the place and its history but also lives (and loves) the place and the culture. This way we really saw the city from inside and I got an opportunity to feel the local Hong Kong culture. Would highly recommend taking a tour with Stephen to anyone who would want to learn the fascinating history of the place and get a real feel of the Hong Kong current lifestyle.

China town tour. I have met Stephen on a Monday morning in the oldest part of Hong Kong. He gave me a real and authentic tour, which cant be forgotten. He is tailoring the tours according to your wishes and interests, which of course was agreed in advance. I liked his structural and clear approach - he informed me on the beginning of the tour of our full plan and goals. He was very open to my questions and asked me as well about my country and background from pure curiosity. This approach have people, which are continuosly in process of education and life is an open book. After the tour I was a big step closer to understand the fascinating history and culture of Hong Kong. Thank you Stephen 唔該

Unforgettable! Must Do In Hong Kong!. Met Stephen for the most epic hike ever in Hong Kong! Who knew Hong Kong was more than just a lil big city with pop flashy lights, towering towers, and suited up suits crawling out of the woodwork. What I loved most about our city walk and island hike was Stephen's accute attention to detail and his conversational prowess. It is rare I meet individuals who are aptly able to discuss anything and everything in between... not to mention while hiking for 8 hours in high humidity uphill both ways! Ok ok... maybe it wasn't uphill both ways but goodness knows I felt the burn after! Such an awesome day with such an awesome individual. The day hike on Lantau Island from Tung Chung to Tai O was a fabulous experience I will never forget!

Excellent local walking tour. Stephen met with us in front of a subway station in Kowloon, firstly he led to a local restaurant for a breakfast, and then to a local wet market (quite of shocking haha), a park where the Kowloon Walled City was located and then to a Chinese Temple. Stephen is a very smart guy and during the walk he told us a lot of things about history, politics and local economy of HK. The tour was very interesting, we had such a great time together!

Great sightseeing tour. Stephen is a very clever guy. He showed us lots of a not very touristic hong kong, exactly how we had demanded, and knew about local history (and world's history as well), as we were interested. He was well prepared, with pictures and material about the places we were sightseeing and his fluency in English is such a great advantage of this touristic guide.I strongly recommend Stephen's services if you want to visit Hong Kong and experience hong kong with high quality of informations. He has lots to offer, and that is so impressive!

Great personalized HK tour. I was very lucky to be able to take a tour with Stephen. He is not only very knowledgable about everything that has to do with local history and culture, but also good to talk to on a personal level. He customized the tour exactly the way I wanted and it could not have been any better.

Interesting tour. The tour was very informative and interesting. Stephen knows his stuff :) We saw parts of Hong Kong that we would have not have seen if we did not go on the tour and gave us incites into the culture and history. Also learnt about traditional foods, we tried some tofu pudding!! Good to know that I didn't like it so won't buy it again :) Really good day :)

Great day exploring Hong Kong. Stephen is a great, friendly guy with a lot of local knowledge. He's very easy to talk to, so you'll have fun right from the bat. I had a great day with Stephen exploring Hong Kong. He knows all the right places to go, to get a great sense of Hong Kong unlike any other tour. The best thing is he avoids all the touristy area's and instead views Hong Kong like the locals. We had a taste of the local delicacies, enjoyed some history / culture, and visited multiple temples. All in all it's a great way to indulge yourself in a different culture!

Tour hong kong. We had a half day tour through Hong Kong this week and it was great!He sent us an email where we could choose what subjects we were interested in like history, food, nature etc. So he could prepare a nice tour. He knows a lot about history (he was interesting to listen to) and his English is very good. Stephen was Also very flexible and changed a bit so we could also Go to the peak. We had a great day. Best tour I've had so far. Stephen is also very interested about other countries and cultures. I really recommend Stephen as a guide! We had a great day :)

Learning about local culture and history. The half day tour was very great! Stephen knows a lot about the history and culture of Hong Kong. We started the day in a very local restaurant for the breakfast and explored the surroundings of Sheung Wan. He knew a lot of special details about people, urbanisation, religion and local habits. We visited temples, local markets, important streets and historical sites. After we took the local transport to another area and kept learning a lot of new things. Stephen has a good level of english and he is open to answer any questions. Totally recommend him to any person visiting Hong Kong.

Very good tour in HK. Stephen was our tour guide in HK for a half day this week. The tour was very interesting and tailor made as we asked. Indeed Stephen focused on the discovery of local markets, local foods and temples in HK including also a bit of history of the city, it was really interesting. He brought us to the non touristic areas so that we could have a real "insider tour".He also brought us to a nice restaurant to have a local HK breakfast and to a local famous tea shop.What i really appreciated was that Stephen was really adapting himself to our rythm, stopping in the streets and didnt hesitate to answer to all our questions about the food we were seeing, the buildings and other monuments. We also took with him the "ding ding" - local tram. I really recommend his your :)

Awesome Day!. Stephen was the best tour guide I ever had! Stephen war echt der beste Tourguide von mir jemals! He knows so much about Hong Kong and has always known an answer of my questions. Er konnte mir jede Frage beantworten, und wusste wirklich alles über Hong Kong was ich wissen wollte! He has shown us some typical local places where typical tourists never will go to and we see the really fantastic natural side of HK with dream beaches and also a really nice 360° view from old mans hill!! Er hat uns lokale Plätze gezeigt zu denen normale Touristen niemals hinkommen würden, traumhafte Strände und einen sehr schönen Ausblick vom old mans hill! It was really awesome and beautiful!! Thanks for that really nice day Stephen, It will be long one of my really nice memories! Es war wunderschön und fantastisch! Es wird mir lange in Erinnerung bleiben, danke Stephen!

Tour of Hong Kong. I am really glad I took a tour of HK with Stephen. He showed me sides of HK that I would never have seen had I gone alone. He was fun to be with, sharing a wealth of interesting historical and cultural knowledge, and catered the tour to my interests! We went all over the oldest part of HK, and finished the day with a great view of the city. And got good food too :) I would highly recommend touring with Stephen! Seriously, do it!

Great nature side Hong Kong tour. Stephen is a local from Hong Kong with a great knowledge about history, religion and culture in HK. Punctual and well organized he gave an 8 person group tour in Lantau Island. It is the best option to get to know this mountain including small villages near to Big Budda.

Beautiful tour around Lantau Island! . Stephen showed us a different side of Hong Kong and introduced us to the beautiful nature a bit outside the big modern city. The hiking tour took us through the mountainous scenery around Hong Kong with chinese tempels and ended with a nice chinese diner. Stephen knows a lot about Hong Kong and could inform us a lot about culture, history, politics and other information of the area. Thank you for the good company and the amazing tour, Stephen!

Great and Informative Tour. Stephen took us a on a great tour of the more wild side of Hong Kong. By wild, I mean we saw some of the amazing nature HK has to offer. Who knew HK wasn't just a big bustling city? Stephen took us around Lantau Island and showed us a great beach, an incredible fishing village built on stilts above the water, and capped off the evening with a great meal at a local restaurant. His knowledge and enthusiasm for Hong Kong culture and history is inexhaustible. Thanks for the first rate tour Stephen!

Great tour of more local side of Hong Kong. I met up with Stephen on Lantau Island for a trip to Tai O this past weekend. Before the tour, he was incredibly detailed with planning a tour that I would be interested in and giving me all necessary information I would need for getting to Lantau and he gave me some tips for my entire Hong Kong stay. He really did a great job doing a tour customized to me. He was incredibly knowledgeable about Hong Kong and Chinese history, their politics, and the local culture. I had mentioned being curious about how chinese characters differ from Japanese kanji as I live in Japan, and he went out of his way to discuss the meaning of different characters around town. He took me on brief hike up the side of the village and I got to see a side of Hong Kong I didn't know existed. He also sent me a detailed self guided tour for my last day of Hong Kong and it was also just as careful considerate of my likes and what I needed to accomplish on my last full day. Stephen's love for his culture and history are evident in his tours and you leave knowing much more than you did before you started. I would recommend Stephen's tours to anyone, especially those looking to dig a little deeper into the culture and history of Hong Kong.

Highly recommended!. I was happy to be guided by Stephen during my short stay in Hong Kong and I must say that the guide he has provided me with was both very interesting and comprehensive. Tailored to my needs, as I am interested in history and culture, the tour took place in the oldest parts of Hong Kong. It was a very good start into understanding this amazing city. Furthermore, Stephen was kind enough to provide me with a detailed itinerary of places to see and things to do during the rest of my stay, to ensure I don't miss anything important. Certainly, I can recommend Stephen as an excellent tour guide!

An enriching glance of HK. Stephen was a great guide who showed us the city in its many aspects. The route was very nice, and the tour truly insightful in terms of general knowledge and personal anecdotes. Great guy !

Excellent tour!. We have been travelling many months and we made several guided tours. Stephen is one of the best tours guides we met! He is expert in history, he taught us a lot of interesting local things about the city, he showed us some places we could have never seen with out him. Also he is a very nice and fun person to meet. If you want to really know the city and how real people live in it, and not just take pictures in touristic places you should absolutely contact him.100% recommended!

One amazing afternoon at a not known face of Hong Kong. Stephen was my guide at Mui Ne. The town, is a traditional fishermen village, not known for many torusits. Stepehn knows all about the history,the culture and the people of the town. He could reply all my questions easily. He also knows some awsome places for photos. Then he took me to a hill where you have great views of Mui Ne village and you can also see the Hong Kong-Macau bridge. The trail to the hill is quite demanding as it is not well maintained and can be quite hard to follow. All in all, i strongly reccomend Stephen, as he is a great guide and will teach you a lot about Hong Kong.

Amazing!. Stephen took me and my boyfriend on a private walking tour in the oldest neighborhoods of Hong Kong island. He showed us some local markets, temples that we never would have found without him, sharing so rich information and history about the place. We learned so much about the culture, history, politics, religion and Hong Kong's people way of life.He also took us to a very authentic and old place to have breakfast and made us try new and very tasty things!At first we thought 4 hours would be too much but the tour was so interesting that we didnt even notice how fast time passed.We learned a lot and definitely recommend this tour to any visitor!!Thank you, Stephen!

The real HK with local shops and food!!!. Stephen took me and my friend on a great 4 hour tour through the Wan Chai District and Sheung Wan District. Amazing Wan Chai wet market including typical Chinese street food, very impressive local Chinese temples that no guide book would mention and a stunning cultural walk tour in Sheung Wan including the dried seafood market, the old street area of Sheung Wan and Man Mo Temple. He even took us to a local breakfast place!!! Even though it rained hard during the tour he still told us many many stories about his cultural background, the fok religion and interesting facts about the history of HK.Please make sure to not just hit the touristy spots of HK but go on a tour with Stephen. Great tour guide with enormous knowledge!!!!

Best walking tour I've ever had!. Stephen took me around Lantau Island and it was so brilliant and interesting. We walked on the beach, met Billy the cow, walked around the dried fish markets, visited temples, ate tofu pudding, and went on a mini hike! He also made sure we went to lots of great photo taking spots. He was very knowledgable and interesting and could answer all my questions and more. The tour was specially tailored to my interests and it was certainly worth it- one of the highlights of my whole Hong Kong experience. A must do if your visiting! Stephen went above and beyond what I expected from a tour guide and I look forward to touring with him again in the future :D

Food Tour in Hong Kong. The food tour that I had on Saturday was a highlight of the trip. From the tea at the correspondents club, the amazing diner street food, and the amazing Dim Sum, it was all amazing and gives you unique perspective for the remainder of the trip. Thanks Daisann, for a wonderful experience and your knowledge of the Hong Kong culture is amazing.

A fun and interesting way to explore HK!. The Sunday in Wan Chai Group Walk with Little Adventures in Hong Kong was a fun and interesting way to explore the city. I am a sucker for walking tours, and this tour didn't disappoint. My tour guide, Daniel, was insightful and shared a lot of information about Hong Kong culture. I appreciated the random food samplings along the way (I loved the tea!) and really loved some of the facts he shared about Hong Kong's architectural history. I would definitely recommend this for anyone who wants to get to know Hong Kong on a more intimate level. Definitely a highlight of my trip!

Come Hungry!. Fun Fun Fun tour, lots of walking, lots of eating, lots of great chats, and laughs. I highly recommend, if you have a shot stay in HK and want to see the city and eat, do this. You get a great selection food that are very much HK. TheTour leader was fantastic keeping us together and sharing about HK and life there. I love the Wong Tong stop (so huge!) and the BBQ pork. Thank you for a memorable afternoon, and a full tummy...no really, fast before coming!

Amazing walking tour. Exceptional value.. If ever you go to Hong Kong, do a walking tour with this outfit. Do not hesitate. No questions asked. You will not regret it. And you will be eternally thankful. They are very professional and really give you a unique perspective of what is going on around in Hong Kong. We had Janice Leung Hayes - she was highly knowledgeable, insightful and connected a lot of what food was to the social, economic and cultural make up of Hong Kong. This is a must do experience for visitors to Hong Kong.

Shau Kei Wan and Lei Yue Mun. Having lived in Hong Kong when our children were tiny, we returned with our (now 30 year old) daughter and her fiancee to revisit old haunts. We love walking tours and our daughter found little Adventures in Hong Kong. Laura was our guide and she took us on a fascinating and illuminating trek through Shau Kei Wan, then on the ferry across the harbour to Lei Yue Mun. Many highlights, but it was all worth it just for the waffles out of a hole in the wall just past the Shau Kei Wan wet market and the beer on the very home. Laura was the perfect guide for us - knowledgeable but modest about it. it was all heaps of fun and we'd recommend it to anyone.

Value-Basing the Price of Memories. I booked a tour with Little Adventures to celebrate my first paycheck after accepting a new job. Only after requesting reservations, however, did I realize the expense: $115 an hour...not including meals! So I did some research of Little Adventures and read several positive reviews. I also came across some negative ones and was impressed with the thorough and personalized responses Little Adventures gave to these (few) disgruntled customers. Overall, reading these reviews helped me decide to keep my booking, convincing that I would indeed be getting my money's worth: a catered food tour with excellent customer service. Daniel was assigned as my Won-ton-a-thon tour guide, who freelances with Little Adventures when not providing PR for local restaurants. And before my tour, Little Adventures and Daniel himself were good about corresponding with me, addressing all my concerns and detailed tour preferences.Daniel is an eccentric individual, incredibly well traveled, a skilled conversationalist, and very knowledgeable about culinary arts. During my food tour of Sheung Wan and Wan Chai districts, I ate some delicious, local, "the camera eats first" food (and which Daniel partook; which should be expected, but the custom to pay for the tour guide's meals, as well as you own, is not clearly mentioned from Little Adventures). Though I immensely enjoyed the food, for me, the highlights of my tour were of what I visited and experienced: one of the oldest local supplier of snake wine, meat, and medicine, a 4 time Michelin recommended Cantonese roast meat shop, an 80-year-old candy store, the birthplace of Wonton noodles in Hong Kong, the oldest market street, one of the oldest (and notoriously hard-to-find) speakeasy bar, an iconic sugar cane juice ship (since '68), the oldest temple in Hong Kong (and which incidentally some historians think is responsible for giving Hong Kong its name), and the infamous wedding cart street. Besides giving us a historical tour, Daniel also gave some invaluable local knowledge: taxi drivers, once you're inside their taxi, legally have to take you wherever you want to go; if they refuse, just ask to be taken to the nearest police station where you can ask for directions. Hah!In the end, I paid approximately $400 USD for a 3.5 hour tour, and spent an extra $650HKD for souvenirs and food. Though I still feel Little Adventures' fees are a bit inflated (due to a lack of competition, or perhaps a "value-based pricing" strategy), I thoroughly enjoyed my tour and was thankful for my tour guide, teaching me that sometimes it's worth budgeting for experiences like these.

Won ton a thon. This review is long overdue! I have been to HK a few times before this particular trip in April 2016. But this tour with Daisann was the highlight of them all. She is passionate and knowledgeable about Hong Kong and its food and culture. She tailored the tour to our liking and led us through a part of HK that most tourists don't get to see and experience. Starting with breakfast at a little mom and pop store, tea shops, dry and wet food markets and ending at Maks noodle shop. Every stop was delicious and Daisaan regaled us with information about local customs, language intricacies, and restaurant recommendations for the rest of our stay.You should NOT miss this tour! I highly recommend it.

World Class Tour! World Class Guide!. My sister, who works in Hong Kong, researched the best food/walking tours of the city and immediately booked my fiancé and me for this excursion. It was our very first experience in Hong Kong and a brilliant introduction to the city. Our tour guide Daisann was fantastic. Her knowledge of China's culture, food, and politics is second to none (she's an award winning travel writer). We experienced an amazing combination of local food, history, and customs. Learning about Hong Kong's past and present added depth to our trip and gave us great perspective throughout our stay.BOOK THIS TOUR!

A morish and insightful Hong Kong experience. I spent the most glorious day with Daisann walking through the Central, Sheung Wan and Wan Chai areas of Hong Kong. She was so generous with her time and knowledge and has a real passion for the culture and food of Hong Kong. Everything we ate was delicious and everything we experienced was fascinating.Little Adventures will tailor your walk to your needs and interests. I highly recommend their walks if you're in Hong Kong for the weekend and want to get to know parts of it inside out. They will also share tips and information on things to do while you're in town and must try food and cultural experiences.

Super informative and very cool. Really amazing morning/afternoon exploring Hong Kong food. We are veterans of a lot of food tours in different places but this one was best ever--terrific detail and depth of culinary and cultural knowledge from a young chef named Daniel who knows his stuff. Learned a lot, ate in some out of the way places we never would have entered on our own. Communication from the company was great too--they sent us recommended restaurants and cocktail bars to check out too. Highly recommend.
Had an amazing experience. Daniel was a great guide. I learned much about local food while touring around the city. Highly recommended!

Highlight of our Trip to Hong Kong. We booked the culinary tour last minute and Daisann was very accommodating. She got back to me right away and took the time to explain the different tours offered over the phone. Our tour guide Daniel met us at our hotel the next morning for a walking tour. We had a really good time talking to him and learning about a side of Hong Kong that I hadn't previously experienced. He is very knowledgable and really into helping you learn about Hong Kong. If you are going to take one tour, take this one. I cannot say enough great things about our experience with Little Adventures.

Amazing cultural experience. I am a very demanding tourist and in general I complain about guides and their attitude. This tour was simply amazing. It covered a wide variety of topics: from history, food, religion, markets, you name it. We had a lovely breakfast with a proper explanation of traditions, then we went to the market where we learn how locals buy their food, we saw architecture, we learnt how expensive is to live in this amazing city. Outstanding. Fully recommended!!!

Hong Kong from the viewpoint of a resident. Although I like my food (a lot) I am just as curious about the history and culture of a country. Dianne ticked all the boxes, being knowledgeable about all aspects of Hong Kong. Being shown around by a resident is always the best way to see somewhere. Thank you Diasann for a passionate and fascinating glimpse into what it is like to live in Hong Kong. Someone who chooses to live somewhere (as opposed to being born there) always has an interesting take on their country of residence. I was a solo traveler as were 3 others of our 5 person group. All were convivial and had stories to tell. I would definitely recommend a tour with Little Adventure, and thought it was great value.

A morning food and historical site touring with Daniel-Fabulous!. When researching tours available for our upcoming trip to Hong Kong, I found Little Adventures in Hong Kong owned by Daisann McLain. Her name sounded familiar and I realized that she had been a travel writer for the New York Times.We were so pleased that we booked Sundays in Wan Chai on our first morning in Hong Kong. Daniel is so knowledgeable, trained as a chef and works in the industry. He is a lot of fun too. Our first stop was the historic Honolulu Café which was filled with locals having breakfast. We joined them with egg custard tarts and macaroni soup, all delicious and part of Hong Kong breakfast traditions. .Next he led to a variety of food markets pointing out the various fruits, vegetables and meats and poultry for sale. The whole time we walked, Daniel taught us about Hong Kong history, home life and religion. We asked for restaurant recommendations near our hotel and they were both outstanding! Thanks Daniel and Little Adventures in Hong Kong for a wonderful morning's introduction to a great city.

Captivating cultural experience in Hong Kong!. Our food and cultural tour with Janice was far and away the highlight of our stay in Hong Kong. She crafted a customized tour that perfectly fit all of our interests. We were so captivated the entire tour that the four hours flew by and my only regret is that we did not have more time together. We kicked off by the morning by heading to a traditional tea house to sample delicious dim sum and other traditional Hong Kong breakfast treats, ventured through the fascinating dry and wet markets, toured some historical temples, and checked out the storied street food carts. Janice was so incredibly knowledgable, insightful, and interesting. She knew the answer to every single question that we asked, even the most obscure ones. We did not realize that learning about the food of a city could be so fascinating and could teach us how so many of the unique traditions in Hong Kong came to be. We would highly recommend any tour with Little Adventures in Hong Kong and Janice during your next trip to Hong Kong. This magical adventure should not be missed!

Hong Kong Local Food , Culture and Markets. We had the pleasure of two tours while in Hong Kong. Janice took us on a walking tour of Hong Kong markets with stops in local tea houses and establishments we would have never ventured on our own, Our interest in local food movements was more than satisfied as we became more understanding of local culture and history.Diasann took us on our second tour of out of the way local markets and establishments. It included a first hand visit to fishing villages and unique sites and sounds we would never been exposed to without their knowledge. I highly recommend a tour with these guides.

A highlight of our time in Hong Kong. Our tour with Daisann was on Good Friday when a few places were closed. Daisann's extensive knowledge meant it didn't really matter - if our planned stop was closed, Daisann quickly improvised. A great way to see HK.

The best introduction to HK . Laura was the most brilliant host and gave myself and my 21 year old daughter a really insightful, interesting and informative trip around Hong Hong island - taking time to discover what we were interested in and tailoring our tour accordingly. The entire experience from initial enquiry, through booking, the event itself and follow-up after was seamless, professional and personal.Can't recommend highly enough. Will definitely come back for more. Both my daughter and I loved our HK adventure and it was made all the more memorable by our time spent with Laura.

My day in HongKong with Daisann. I had a 14 hour stopover in Hong Kong & decided to book a tour with Little Adventures in Hong Kong. It was the best decision. Even though it has been last minute, Daisann contacted me immediately to figure out what kind of tour I was looking for. She was also the one taking me on the tour. During the entire time the communication & organization with her was perfect! On the day of my tour she met me in town & showed me some of Hong Kongs most beautiful sides. I can highly recommend them. She went above & beyond to make sure I was alright after my tour ended since I still had a few hours by myself. The time with her was totally worth the money. If I happen to come back to Hong Kong I'd book another tour with them right away. Do yourself a favor and let her show you the city. Thank you so much for this experience Daisann!! :)

The highlight of our trip to Hong Kong. We had a truely amazing time with Daniel on Sunday. His passion and knowledge of Hong Kong and its food were amazing. This is the perfect way to get a feel for this wonderful city, it should be the first thing anyone does when they arrive in Hong Kong. Daisann organised everything for us at the last minute and we tried some of Daniels suggestions for places to eat and we were blown away. This made our first trip to Hong Kong very special. Thank you both!

Fabujous tour, and a great way to spend a short stopover in Hong Kong.. We had a 12 hour stopover in Hong Kong on a business trip, and rather than spend the day in the airport, we chose to do a 5 hour tour with Daisann, and what a fabulous experience it was! We started with a morning snack of yum cha in a popular local eatery, then walked through a variety of markets selling herbal and traditional medicines and to a shop selling a variety of Cantonsese cooking sauces and pastes. We then saw temples, markets, specialist food stores and tea shops, and had a guided formal tea tasting, before heading onto the wet markets and seeing the vast array of foods on offer there. Finally we had a wonderful and delicious guided dim sum lunch before heading back to the airport to catch the next flight. All of the things we saw and tasted were accompanied by fascinating, insightful and entertaining conversation with Daisann, covering the cultural, political, historical and artistic side of Hong Kong. We had a fabulous and educational time, saw so much more of Hong Kong than we would have on our own, and ate fantastic food in the process. Would love to come back and do it again!

The Magical Mystery Tour of Hong Kong. Daisann and her company Little Adventures in Hong Kong are a miracle! If you want to get under the spell of one of Asia's most exciting cities with its unique history, culture and population than look no further. I was privy to an unforgettable tour of Shau Kei Wan and Victoria Harbour on Sunday, 6th March and the five hours just flew by. Daisann takes you away into a new world, the world of a Hong Kong as it used to be. Her knowledge of the place and its history is second to none and I enjoyed every second of the tour. And I have not yet mentioned the many food places we stopped on the way around. I will definitely try and book another tour at some point in the future. Given that Little Adventures will give you bespoke tours of Hong Kong I am happy to give them an Overall Rating of TRUELY OUTSTANDING.

Excellent introduction to Hong Kong for first time visitor. I just wanted to say how much I enjoyed the tour with Daniel on Sunday. He was an excellent host and guide. His knowledge was expansive, his explanations clear and his passion for Hong Kong, and particularly Wan Chai palpable.

Great food tour plus more. We signed up with Daisann for two days on our way to Indonesia. Then we used her again for a couple of days on our way back home. Our trip was one year ago today. It has obviously taken me awhile to fill out this review. I tell everyone how absolutely fabulous our experience was in Hong Kong. I can still remember everything...the neighborhoods and their history, the markets, and every meal that we ate. We had a memorable dinner with Daniel that was so delicious. Daisann took us to have dim sum and it was so different than what we get at home. Plus the menu was in Cantonese and we could have never ordered anything. We were given a list of recommended restaurants to check on when Daisann was not with us. Every restaurant was excellent.Hong Kong had never been on my radar screen. But now we are trying to plan a trip back in which we would use Little Adventures in Hong Kong.

Walking, Talking and Eating in Hong Kong. I spent 5 hours with Daisann and it added greatly to my understanding and appreciation of my time in Hong Kong. It was a treat to experience the day through her eyes - she brings history, politics, culture, food and joy into the conversation. We tasted a variety of foods that would not have been on my radar screen. And, her ability to communicate in Cantonese opened doors right and left. We walked and talked (I listened a lot!) and the time flew by! If you are visiting Hong Kong - your should not miss out on a tour with Daisann!

A Personalized View of Hong Kong. Two wonderful days of walking around Hong Kong and being exposed to its people and culture through their love of food. We started with a choice of snake wine or soup (we choose the wine) and moved on to markets, temples and small local eateries. Our guide Daniel was a trained chef and extremely knowledgeable about his hometown. We did the major tourist sites on our own, but with the help of valuable advice from our hosts. Highly recommended for a different take on Hong Kong.

Efficient food tour in Hong Kong. Do you have a few days in HK and don't want to miss the best of food and secret food spots and their history? Well, this is the tour for you!Daniel, our guide, was great. He told the story of every place we visited in a very personal way, which made us feel engaged at every point of the walk. We appreciated how he helped us taste as much as we could in the little time, his improvised quizzes, and his after-tour tips.This tour saves you time to reach those spots you might spend hours getting to if using a guidebook, and gives you access to many chinese-only canteens and, furthermore, incredible unwritten stories.

Local foodie paradise!. We had a wonderful walking won ton-a-thon with. Daniel, through Daisann's coordination. We saw great local traditions (tea shops, food markets, dim sum, won tons) upon which we never would have stumbled. Daniel was full of information and tailored perfectly to our wants, style and level of knowledge. This was a perfect complement to fine dining in Hong Kong

Highlight of our visit-- food tour and more. Fabulous tour -- worth the price! We arranged a private tour for our family of 4 for Wan Chai. We are from the US and travel frequently and have pretty high standards. This tour was a fantastic way to start our visit (first time in HK for our teenage daughters. My husband and I have been several times but not in years). Daniel was fantastic -- not only did we eat great food, learn about food customs and traditions and new food trends, we also learned about religion, history, fashion, etc. Daniel was a natural and easy to be with -- he answered our questions and tailored the tour to our interests. I had to convince my husband that the price was worth it -- and after the tour he completely agreed!

Great tour!. We made a reservation from Japan for first tour to Hong Kong. We were looking for food tour which were available in the evening after flight arriving, then found this tour.They kindly arranged a tour guide, he is the only one who can speak Japanese. I really appreciate it. And we enjoyed the food. We walked around Sheung Wang area and visited one cantonese restaurant. It helped us a lot to know about Hong Kong and get familiar with it on the first day of our stay.I would recommend their afternoon tour because some places are limited to access in the evening. And I feel a bit expensive. But totally, we are satisfied at this tour. Thanks!

Informative and good food. My sister and I booked the Wonton-A-Thon with Daisann and had a fab time wandering around the streets and filling our bellies. She took us to the types of places we'd never find on our own. In between eating, Daisann provided a constant and informative commentary about the history of Hong Kong, particularly the culinary past. We got to go to places that we'd never have been able to do on a larger tour.

Fascinating, informative and delicious. I was able to book a tour with Mark, who writes much of their material. He is a local Cantonese Wan Chai which was great since I was staying in Wan Chai. I needed dietary restrictions for my Dim Sum and the place we went to had terrific options, all amazing and Mark's commentary about food and history and culture were fantastic. A bit pricey, but then you get what you pay for.

Terrific small tour. I had been to Hong Kong about a half dozen times and was looking to expand the knowledge I had and came across Little Adventures after reading about it in the the NY Times. The small group Sunday morning tour worked with my schedule and budget and Won Chai was a neighborhood I hadn't previously done any type of touring in. Tour was great and very interesting. The small size was perfect and was a great way to start my 3 week trip. I would definitely go on another tour with them.

The Ultimate Hong Kong Experience. Experiencing Hong Kong through the eyes of Little Adventures in Hong Kong is a rare and wonderful treat.My wife and I are very experienced travelers, always seeking memorable times.Daisann and Daniel were both fantastic in the breath and depth of their knowledge including daily life in HK, the history, the foods (all of the team members are deeply involved in the food industry), the best restaurants, contemporary art, photography and culture.It was as if we were insiders into the best of Hong KongI highly recommend this team of professionals with a unique set of skills especially if you want truly great food experiences

Great way to get to know Hong Kong. Having spent little time in Hong Kong, we wanted to get a feel for the city, and Little Adventures proved to be an excellent way to do that. Daisann's walking tour gave us more than a little exposure to a lot of things: the history, present and evolving circumstances of the neighborhoods and country; the local population and cultures; the architecture and land policy; the economy; and, most impressively, the local food and a taste of a good amount of it. That she seems to know everyone and communicates with them in Cantonese gives an authenticity to the experience. We would recommend to everyone that they start their visit to Hong Kong with this enlightening walk about town.

Informative Tour. Daisann guided me though the half day City tour. As a 13 year resident of Hong Kong, she provided valuable historical, cultural, political, and culinary insights that only a local could. Prior to the commencement of the tour we discussed various options and focuses, and then during the tour she remained mindful of the areas of my interest and emphasized those but was also flexible in modifying the tour plan as we progressed, as my interests somewhat changed.I scheduled my Little Adventures tour at the beginning of my trip to Hong Kong so that I could determine what areas I wanted to explore further on my own. Daisann's introduction to Hong Kong provided that opportunity.She has advised that her staff are carefully selected and knowledgable in the various areas of interest mentioned above.I would certainly recommend Little Adventures.

Average Tour. Was excited about this tour after reading so many positive reviews. I think the issue here is that I am well travelled and expected more information from our guide rather than him pointing here and there saying how cool things were. I am sure this company is good for travelers who are scared to wander and venture on their own. I wanted some meat on the bones! It is very expensive for what it is and frankly I would suggest a good app or well written guide book.

Got a totally new perspective on Hong Kong. I've been to Hong Kong several times over the decades but contacted Little Adventures on the recommendation of a good friend. My sister and I did the tour, and Little Adventures really gave us a great experience. We had terrific food that we wouldn't have found on our own. Our guide was wonderfully knowledgeable. The pre- and post-tour information was substantial and helpful. I'd highly recommend this for anyone who enjoys a very personal touring experience.

Exceptional, fascinating, and delicious combination of superb food, interesting culture, and historical perspective.. Daisan described various options and choices giving the pros and cons of each and once we indicated our preferences we were off on our adventure. The tour included a sampling of exceptional dim sum followed by in depth descriptions of the street stores and markets we saw. Then we stopped for noodle and won ton sustenance, which was again of excellent quality followed by a tour and description of the wet market for fresh foods and vegetables. Our combination tour ended with a tea sampling at a wonderful old tea store that included the proper preparation of the teas involved, which was also a unique experience.

Fun afternoon tour of Kennedy Town. Emma Dodwell-Groves gives great tour! We really enjoyed getting to know this up-and-coming neighborhood with her on our first day in Hong Kong. The afternoon tour was a pleasant mix of walking, talking and eating -- loved my first taste of egg tarts and milk tea in Hong Kong! We were able to get inside the Carpenter's Temple (fab Deco-style roofline!) and walk through back alleys and small hidden parks and drink local beer on the Harbor promenade at sunset. At the end of the tour Emma showed us where to experience our first authentic Hong Kong dim sum - and we returned to eat at Sun Hing in Kennedy Town the next morning! Thanks!

Great experience. My husband and I booked the Essential Hong Kong tour with Sarah, which turned out to be such an amazing experience. We only had 3 days in Hong Kong and I am 8 months pregnant so it was really important for us to maximize our visit but also to factor in that I couldn't spend too much time going from one attraction to the next. By booking with Little Adventures in Hong Kong, we were able to tailor our trip and make sure we saw exactly what we were interested in. Sarah included nice stops so I could rest but also get to experience the real Hong Kong as much as possible. She was incredibly generous with her time and explanations and we left with a much better understanding of Hong Kong life and culture. Though the tour was a bit of a splurge for us, given my physical limitations and our limited time in HK, it was completely worth it.

Exploring Wan Chai. The walk was quite interesting as we explored Wan Chai. Our guide was fun and took us to some little hidden gems. We were disappointed though as we didn't do any 'foodie' stuff. It is quite an expensive tour, so I expected more tastings and experiences of local eating haunts.

Probably the best thing I did in Hong Kong. Our guide in Wan Chai, Daniel, was bi-cultural (East/West) and very informed. He was also quite funny. In 2 1/2 hours walking the streets and markets, I probably learnt more about Chinese and Hong Kong culture from him than from almost anything else I did in 10 days in the city. However, I must also highly recommend the Museum of History in Hong Kong (Kowloon, next to the Science Museum) to put the city into a larger context.

Excellent Walking Tour with Dim Sum Lunch. My husband I thoroughly enjoyed our customised walking tour and dim sum lunch with guide Emma. She was knowledgable and delightful company, answering our questions with sophistication and good humour. She took us to a tiny dim sum restaurant filled with locals that we never could have navigated ourselves and explained the history, culture and local customs as we toured the Hollywood Road district. The entire experience, from booking through farewells, was handled with professionalism and courtesy. Highly recommended.

Private Tour Was Amazing. My wife and I wanted a personalized experience during dinner time as opposed to when most tours were offered (breakfast), due to our travel plans. Little Adventures hooked us up with Janice, a great person/food blogger/guide to show us around HK Island for the evening. They were able to ensure we tried everything we wanted and then some. While a little pricey (4 hour = $460), we were able to sample a huge variety of food. My suggestion to maximize both the price and the experience is to max out the group size (I believe 3 or 4); with 2 we found ourselves getting full earlier than we would have hoped (this might be a personal problem :), but I suspect with a larger party this could have been mitigated and price split between 2 couples would have been a great price point.All-in, really was a fantastic night. Learned much about the city, culture, food, and went home fat and happy!

Food tour with dim sum lunch. We booked the Essential Tour with guided Dim Sum lunch as part of our honeymoon visit to Hong Kong. This was our first visit to Hong Kong, and booking the tour for the first day gave us a great feel for the city at the beginning of our trip. Our guide Daniel was affable and made it a very enjoyable day. We learnt about food as well as culture and got to try some things which we wouldn't have been able to do on our own, like king cobra sake! Thanks Little Adventures and Daniel for giving us a great introduction to your bustling city.

Wontonathon. We had an afternoon tour of Sheung Wan and Wanchai with Daniel. He was funny and knowledgable. This was my third trip to Hong Kong and I learned many new things. The food was awesome but it wasn't all food we learned details and anecdotes that only a Hong Konger would know. Highly recommended. Thanks guys.

An interesting morning in Hong Kong. We spent a morning with Sarah Fung on a tailor made walk, taking us around Sai Ying Pun, Sheung Wan and Wan Chai - so many interesting things we saw, interesting things we tasted and Sarah gave us so much interesting history along the way. I would highly recommend contacting them and arranging a trip to suit your taste if you are visiting Hong Kong - it is a fascinating way to take in the old and the new, with the old sometimes hidden amongst the new and bright.

Outstanding way to see the real Hong Kong. My husband and I were in Hong Kong for 6 days of fun after spending a week in mainland China. This was our second time in HK and I wanted to make the trip memorable and do something very different. I had read about the custom walking and food tours offered by Little Adventures Hong Kong and knew that they would be ideal for what I was looking for, especially since their custom tours are meant for no more than 3-4 people. Communicating with Daisann at Little Adventures HK was very easy via email before we arrived. She helped understand what experiences we were looking for and customized two different 4-5 hour walking and food tours for us. These were truly the highlight of our stay in HK. The first tour was the Won Ton-A-Ton food tour and what a full day of touring! Taking a tram on HK Island we went to an old HK coffee shop of which few remain. What a walk back in time and a unique part of the HK heritage. After tasting a vanishing array of coffee shop delights (milk tea, egg tarts, scallion bun and crust less toast spread with peanut butter and warm condensed milk) we walked the streets in Western where all the amazing Chinese shops are that displayed dried everything, most of which Daisann had to define for us and explain how and why these herbs, fish, etc. are used. Daisann had a wealth of information for she can speak Mandarin and has lived in HK for 12 years (formerly a New Yorker!). Dim Sum lunch followed in a restaurant where only Mandarin was spoken. What an amazing and delicious lunch she chose for us, my favorite always being the sea cucumber! We ended our full day by an impromptu walk through the student “Occupy” which was occurring at the time in Central. This was a profound experience and Daisann helped us understand the reasons for this occurrence. Our second tour took us to the far reaches of HK that most tourists would never ever stumble upon on their own, Shau Kei Wan and Sam Ka Tsuen. Shau Kei Wan is an old sea village and we walked its street market which was very busy this being a Friday. Best of all, no tourists so we drew quite a few stares. We sampled various teas at a teeny tea house and visited a shop for one of Daisann’s favorite snacks which were waffles that tasted like ice cream sugar cones! We walked many of the old streets of the area which were studded with very very small and old shops. Of course walking makes one hungry so we stopped at a terrific noodle shop where they make their own fish cakes and fish ball noodle soup. I could have stayed there all day eating that soup it was soooo delicious! We then strolled along a nice promenade and typhoon boat harbor to get to an old ferry that took us across Victoria Harbor to the old fishing village of Lei Yu Mun famous for its fresh seafood restaurants, and what restaurants they were! Huge and many tanks with all sorts of fish and sea creatures available to be cooked and served to you in the associated restaurant. Enormous blue lobsters, huge king crab, and cuttlefish were only some of the offerings among the variety of fish available. Walking through the narrow alleys of restaurants led us to the real gem of this tour: the 80 year old village of Sam Ka Tsuen. This village represents a typical fishing village of HK looking just as it did decades ago. The contrast between this old village and the glaring lights of HK Island across the harbor was jarring, especially as now it was dark. What an amazing two days of touring with Daisann. She gave us experiences of HK we never would have achieved on our own and filled us with knowledge of its cuisine, culture, history, and people in ways that only someone truly in love with her adopted city could. There was nothing that we disliked about our experiences at all and the tours are no problem for anyone who loves walking, to learn new things, and to have fun exploring the unknown. Thank you Daisann and Little Adventures of Hong Kong for making our trip truly memorable!

A fun and interesting way to learn some HK history. It's been some months since I went on this tour (March 2105) but I would still like to review it. My partner and I had a great time - our guide, Emma, was a fantastic tour leader, and I found her enthusiasm and genuine personal interest in the history of Hong Kong to be a highlight of our walk around Wan Chai. She is a lifetime resident of Hong Kong and her personal background is very interesting and unusual. The tour took in a wide range of different local, religious and historical sites, was an easy walk that was just the right distance and not at all challenging. The food and drink samples were great - not just typical Asian fare but also a Chinese medicinal tea shop and a typical breakfast - who knew about toast and butter with condensed milk, as a traditional HK meal? Not me, anyway. Our group was particularly lucky in that one of the group lives on Macau and brought Portuguese egg tarts for us to share and compare with the HK version. I definitely recommend this as a relatively quick and easy way to get to know more about Hong Kong, and if you're lucky, you'll also get Emma as your guide. She was also very helpful in recommending restaurants to visit at other times, and providing contact details for some medical treatment I needed while I was there. Thanks Emma!

In Good Company. Some friends from the U.S. came to visit Hong Kong so we booked a tour that offers culinary adventures in this fascinating city. We are a well traveled group, and myself a third time resident expat of Hong Kong. We wanted something fun and unusual and that is what we got! Our guide Daniel, had himself lived around the world and was a trained chef. He took us to some really interesting places and taught us some things that we would not have learned on our own. I would really recommend giving them a try on your next visit to Hong Kong!

Sunday morning walk in Wan Chai. My wife and I had a wonderful experience of Wan Chai with our guide Daniel last Sunday. From eating freshly baked egg tarts to drinking Chinese herbal drinks to 'cool the blood', the sights, sounds and smells of the fresh food market, I would recommend the experience to anyone visiting HK. Daniel provided a great insight into life in Wan Chai and happily answered all of our questions. Daniel also went the extra yard by arranging us to be placed on the 'friends list' of restaurant that doesn't take bookings- we had a fantastic meal at Ho Lee Fook in Central.

The Hong Kong you see but don't see. My wife and I spent several hours with Daisann exploring places barely yards from our hotel but which we'd never have found or appreciated on our own. Heading off from the cool comfort of the Foreign Correspondent's Club on a blistering day, we sauntered to outdoor cafes, ate delicious char siu surrounded by noisy workers, took in along the way numerous on-street explanations of Chinese produce and ended in a tiny won ton restaurant feeling very pleased with ourselves. Daisann even took my cold-encumbered wife for a cup of medicinal tea. Exclusivity has its price, but we crammed more discoveries into a morning than we could possibly have done in a week on our own.

Amazing, Personal tour of HK with Daisann. My husband and I were in Hong Kong for a few days in April -- our first time to Asia. I found Little Adventures online and was convinced to book given all of the incredible reviews. I thought that even though it was expensive, if all of the reviews are as positive as they are, then it must be worth it. They are all right!! Daisann met us in the lobby of our hotel - The Pottinger in Central (fantastic as well!) - she sat us down for about 15 minutes to get to know us both and tell us a little about herself, the places we would be seeing, and the plan for the next 4+ hours. Then we got started -- she took us to the most amazing little hole-in-the-wall places that we never would have found by ourselves -- we felt like we experienced the "real" Hong Kong, not just the tourist spots we were able to research on our own. Our favorite stop was an outdoor restaurant with the most fantastic, flavorful tomato noodle soup we've ever had. Daisann felt like more like a friend than a tour guide. She's incredibly knowledgeable, intelligent, funny, and genuine. We couldn't have asked for a better tour. It was worth every penny. Thank you Daisann!!

Amazing experience and perfect host. We were absolutely treated to a 5 hour walk about with Daniel. His in depth knowledge of the culture, history and ins and outs of Hong Kong was exactly what we were looking for! A definite must for those looking to truly experience what HK has to offer, especially when it comes to food.

Hong Kong Highlight. Ever visited a foreign city and wished you had a friend on the ground, who could show you around local haunts; talk you through the traditional customs and culture; and give you thoughtful recommendations on everything from unique souvenirs to hip bars? That friend is Daisann and her LAHK team.Our customised Won-ton-a-thon food walk was thoughtfully curated by Daisann to accommodate a seafood allergy, and a guest who was seeking interesting dishes outside of traditional dim-sum. Daisann intuitively picked up on our interests, such as local planning and construction, and incorporated her wide knowledge to point out interesting features along the way. As a micro-manager, it was a real treat to be able to pass the baton to a host who knew Hong Kong like the back of her hand, and could read and speak Cantonese. Daisann is passionate about the city and the people, and that showed in her choice of stops and vast knowledge.I particularly loved the exclusive LAHK foodie and activity guides, as well as their concierge email service, providing all sorts of feedback regarding places to eat and drink, and things to do.LAHK was the highlight of our Hong Kong holiday.

A Taste of Cantonese, and the Flavor of Hong Kong. We took two tours with Little Adventures. We had a very short time in Hong Kong, and we chose these tours over all the things that everyone we had talked to told us we had to do. We were so pleased with our decision, as we saw things that an unguided visitor would never see. The first was a four hour walking tour. We first experienced an outdoor cafe serving retro HK haute cuisine. Imported items such as macaroni and canned tomato soup, incorporated into the Cantonese palate in an interesting and delicious way. In another tiny shop, we had the most incredible crackling pork, roasted until the skin was crisp, thick and still delicate. We had a tea tasting and the opportunity to purchase some tea. We roamed the streets of the herbal markets where dried ingredients are sold both for traditional Chinese medicine and for incorporating into everyday cooking. Finally, we had soup in a noodle shop where perfect noodles are stirred into a flavorful broth with some vegetables and Wonton. We revived to go to dinner at a Cantonese restaurant with a chef as our guide for our second tour. He had spoken to the restaurant chef earlier in the day and had preordered some dishes. We had a multi course meal and had the benefits of descriptions of the preparation of our dishes in English, and a Cantonese speaking guide to help us order. It was a spectacular experience. This is a Foodies must do!

Last minute walking tour of Hong Kong. We organised a last minute walking tour of Central during a very busy time. From the initial briefing where we learnt so many things about Hong Kong that we didn't know. (We were all in Hong Kong for the 3rd or 4th time) Then a few hours exploring some really cool areas, tasting great food and understanding its significance was brilliant. I now have a new appreciation for Hong Kong and really hope that the Govt starts putting demotion restrictions on the place before it all disappears.

Excellent, but insanely priced. I had a great tour with Daniel. He was very knowledgeable and we went to a lot of cool places. I found out a lot about the area we went to (Sheung Wan). Every place we went to was pretty fantastic and great tasting. I couldn't have asked for better. The congee place was amazing. It was first on the tour and I wanted to eat the entire bowl but I held back so I'd have room for more. Saved it on my Google maps, however, for next time :) Tea tasting was really cool too. I highly recommend the tour.One star off because of the price, however. I ended up shelling out $500 USD total. Around 450 for the tour and another 30 or so for the food. And it was a little insulting to not only have to pay for my food, but also for the food my guide ordered and ate, which was unexpected.I have done other Hong Kong tours for 1/3 the price of this one and I did not have to pay a dime for the food and drinks we had. It would have been more reasonable if I had someone with me to split the cost, but I didn't. I wouldn't recommend it solo unless $500 is a drop in the bucket for you. There are better tours for the solo traveler out there. With two people to split the cost the price wouldn't be AS bad (only double what I paid for some other tours I did that were just as good).

Unknown Hong Kong. Had a wonderful tour of the eastern end of HK with a very knowledgeable guide. Sarah pointed out old HK architecture as well as unusual fruits, vegetables and other food stuffs. We even stopped for a herbal tea which helped get rid of my cold

Personalized Excellence. An ultimate food lover's experience. Our tour, conducted by Daniel was excellent. The program was tailored perfectly to our desires by he and Daisann. Communication was detailed via mail; tour was well organized with an insider perspective to the HK food scene and culture.Uncovered areas and food destinations that we wouldn't have realized. A truly enriching experience. Suggested restaurant and bars for remainder of our stay in HK were also first rate. Although it can be an expensive proposition it is truly worth every dollar. You won't regret booking with Little Adventures.

Great company for in depth tours. I recently spent 6 weeks in HK for work and took two tours with this company; their Sunday Wanchai group walk and a private tour with just my husband and Daisann (the owner). Both were fabulous. Daniel led the group walk in Wanchai and gave us a great overview of the neighborhood, food and people. I did this tour as my apartment was in Wanchai and it was a great introduction that gave me a little more confidence in getting around. Daniel is a wealth of knowledge, particularly with restaurant recommendations. He clearly has a passion for what he's doing and it shows in his tour.For the private walk, Daisann and I went back and forth a bit trying to find an itinerary that would work given that it was Easter Sunday and Ching Ming, and that we had a flight in the later afternoon. We decided on a food-centric walking tour of Sheung Wan, which I was a little apprehensive about as I had done some exploring in that area myself. However, she was able to shed a whole new light on the region and showed us some really interesting places that I had not seen. It was a great way to spend half a day, and the timing worked out perfectly.Then, as if the two tours by themselves weren't enough, when we returned to HK after a trip to Palau for a night, she had left us an amazing present at the hotel we were staying at. It was a lovely and much appreciated touch!

No better way to experience Hong Kong...... Discover the best of Hong Kong with this first rate company. We spent a delightful 5 hours meandering through the markets and back alleys with Daisann the owner, a former New Yorker, who speaks fluent Cantonese. It was like being guided through a foreign city in the company of an entertaining and informative friend. No subject was off limits. Though the overarching theme was local food culture and tasting, Daisann also has an excellent understanding and appreciation of the history, architecture, customs and politics of this complex and fascinating city. Escape the high end shopping malls and experience the best of Hong Kong with this company.

The highlight of Hong Kong. If you are in Hong Kong and enjoy food markets and all things food then this is a must. We had the most amazing and informative time being shown around by Daisann - the history and culture of Cantonese food as well as the opportunity to taste dishes we would never normally have dared to try - a real experience

Authentic Hong Kong Experience . High praise to Little Adventures! We did two tours- the Won Ton a Thon and toured a local fishing village. Both tours exceeded expectations. The customization and attention to detail really set this company above the rest. Little Adventures truly made our HK experience. Thank You for the memories!! Do yourself a favor and book a tour with Little Adventures!!

What to Expect: Perfect Intro to Hong Kong Food and Culture. We took a private, personalized walking tour that introduced us to the food and culture of HK. It was wonderful. Most importantly it helped us put our vacation visit into context. We did not become HK experts by any means, but it helped us understand what we ate and saw later, and why those things were so special or otherwise unique to HK. What to expect:Walking: We walked all over. The streets of HK are crowded and busy.
