It was not a difficult walk but someone with an impairment will be challengedGreat Info: Our guide was a HK expert who had lived all over the World. This inside-outside perspective was very helpful.Food Food Food. Our food focused tour left no stone unturned. We had the option, but no pressure, to try some exotic (for us) fare. Isn't stepping outside ones comfort zone now and then what a great vacation is all about?Price: OK, it's not cheap, and you have to pay for the food too, but for us the personalized tour and all the info was worth twice the price.It is absolutely worth while to hit HK's backstreet and get a real into to it's amazing food and culture. Don't miss this opportunity.

More. If you want to see more, learn more and leave wanting more, Little Adventures is a perfect tour. It is such a privilege to see beyond the surface of the fascinating place that is Hong Kong in the company of a local expert who shares her passionate love affair with this city. This was the best investment I could have made to maximise my experience of Hong Kong on a very brief four day visit. Worth every penny.

Unparalleled insights into life, history and culture of Hong Kong. Daisann brings a seasoned anthropologist's depth of insight into her tours which are customized for each visitor. She loves this city. I have travelled extensively in Africa and South Asia for work over the last 20 years and this was the most informative and engaging tour I have ever experienced. If you're interested in learning about Hong Kong this is great value for money.

Fantastic customised foodie's tour. I am into my food and wines and had a few hours of an evening spare from a work trip so they organised a customized one on one evening tour. They put a lot of effort into the planning of the tour, we did craft cocktails at Pawn, looked at a wet market and had a very special "innovative authentic cantonese" dinner at Kin. The, guide (Daniel) was extremely knowledgeable about the local food and wine scene and had close connections with many of the places we visited. It would be very difficult for an unaccompanied foreigner to do Hong Kong in such depth. The price for the customised tour was pretty exhorbitant but the experience was fantastic and very enjoyable and educational at the same time.

A different way to see hong Kong. What an amazing experience - the Private Tour of Little Adventures in Hong Kong is just that. Go into places you would never have before and join the local people, whilst also hearing about a lot of the history of Wan Chai. Absolutely delightful

Start your HK experience with Little Adevntures because it will vastly improve the quality of your time in HK. Daisann crafted a tour specifically for our interests and we enjoyed every moment of it. She skillfully combines entertaining you with informing you. Experiencing "mom and pop" shops selling HK delicacies and sampling some of the varied and delicious food of HK restaurants gave us immense pleasure. Daisann's visits to two small temples and explanation of the spiritual nature of the HK people provided context for the approaching Lunar New Year and made it all that more enjoyable for us to take part in. For us the Little Adventure tour was the difference between standing at the doorstep of HK and actually entering the wonderful life of the HK people. Daisann's vast knowledge of HK provided us with the cultural foundation that informed us for the remainder of our time in HK. Daisann's fondness for HK and assisting people in enjoying the HK experience was evident before we embarked on the tour. She provided us with information on restaurants and activities in HK through email before we left for our trip and she provided us with numerous suggestions during the tour and after through email for what to do during the remainder of our time in HK. We tried as many of her suggestions as possible and we enjoyed all of them. We were fortunate to have Jade, a new host of Little Adventures, join us for the walk and her knowledge of local art, architecture and local culture was a wonderful enhancement to our tour. Thanks to Daisann and Jade's informative tour we are continuing to enhance our love of Hong Kong through suggested books, online HK newspaper feeds, Twitter and some of the local food and recipes we brought back. We have found the thick white bread in our local Asian market and are having HK milk tea and the wonderful toast with our family and friends whenever the opportunity arises. The simple joys of life-good friends and simple comfort food. Thanks for the wonderful immersion in HK culture Daisann and Jade. I do hope we meet again.

More useful information and context per second than any other tour. Our walking tour of HK focused on the history of the city, current social and economic conditions, architecture, and neighborhoods that are representative of the city's history and culture. Daisann is an extremely giving and knowledgeable guide with just the right amount of humor and wit added to ensure that you are paying attention. The tempo of the walk was perfect for us -- we covered quite a bit of ground in four hours -- and the pace of the information shared and questions answered was consistent throughout our time. She didn't trail off as many other guides seem to do. Moreover, her knowledge is based on a years of personal research for her writing; she has a deep and genuine interest in HK and its future, and she wants to impart her enthusiasm to her guests. I highly recommend working with Little Adventures -- no matter how long you may be in HK (a day, a week, a few hours).

Amazing informative generous. Daisann was a wonderful host! she was extremely knowledgeable and catered to our needs. She took us to some great spots not just restaurants but other fascinating locations as well. She was willing to take us on a tour even though many places were closed for Chinese New Year. She knew so much about Hong Kong and Chinese history and culture. She thoroughly answered every question we had. I cannot say enough good things about this tour and must thank her immensely for making our trip to Hong Kong so much better. Keep up the great work!

Above and Beyond. I have nothing but wonderful things to say about Little Adventures.My travel companions and I arrived in Hong Kong while Chinese New Years was in full swing and thus found that our guide books and many online advice columns were useless in directing us to restaurants and cultural activities, not because they lacked pertinent information or failed to interest us, but rather because everything was closed!We contacted several food tour companies most of which were either closed or fully booked. Little Adventures went out of their way to accommodate us, opened especially for us, and led us on an amazing tour even amidst the closure of many of the top locations they normally visit. Daisann was extremely personable, knowledgeable and tailored the tour to suit our interests, while also giving us a taste of the Hong Kong only a seasoned local could find, and showing us the things we wouldn't have even known to ask or look for. Our discussions covered everything from architecture and real estate, culture, religion, cuisine, to fortune tellers, politics, traditional medicine, and daily life in Hong Kong, while we visited local buildings, markets, restaurants and even a temple. Our group consisted of a Chef, a Chinese-Canadian, and a History teacher, and all three have declared ourselves to be wholly satisfied and pleased with the accuracy of the information imparted to us, as well as with the food selection. I would highly recommend this tour, and hopefully will be able to use this company again.

Planning a trip to HK? Book this before your plane ticket.. Cannot say enough good things about Daisann and her company. Despite everything being closed and being turned away by every other tour operator, she was willing to take us out on an adventure in the city. Learnt so much about the culture, history and food. The food we tasted was truly authentic and could not have been experienced without her presence. In addition, updated restaurant guides and 'things to do when not with us' made the booking last much longer than the 3 hours we booked. Furthermore, she went above and beyond - not a clockwatcher, and more than able to answer any questions that we could have thought of. I certainly plan to come back and book with them again.This experience made HK feel like a second home.Don't worry about the price, it's worth every penny.

Not to be missed. Don't go to Hong Kong without taking at least one of these private tours or group walks. Daisann and her group offer the best insight into the food and culture of Hong Kong. We ate foods and went places we never could have found on our own, visiting small villages and eating local specialties, listening to Daisann converse in Chinese with the local people. We toured the markets and learned what many of the dried herbs and foods were used for, drank medicinal teas, and began to understand what Hong Kong was all about. Our three tours with Little Adventures were the best possible way to get to know the real Hong Kong.

Excellent Tour - A Must Do. We have lived in HK for over a year and always wanted to do a tour, to learn more about the culture and one that i could recommend to all our visitors - well we found it. We did the Wan Chai Food and Culture Tour and it was excellent. Our tour guide was Daisann, a fascinating American lady who can speak incredible Cantonese and has lived in HK for a long time. We went to a traditional tea house and tried some delicious HK breakfast food, roamed around the markets learning about all the food and traditions, tried some Chinese medicinal tea, visited the temple in wan chai and sampled the famous egg custard tart. I learnt so much and enjoyed every minute. My only complaint is that i wish it had been longer. It was 3 hrs long and the time flew by. We didnt have time to do everything on the list. 4 hours would have been perfect, to fit in the rest. But the tour was still brilliant and i would highly recommend it to everyone - visitors and expats.

An authentic and personal experience. I was in Hong Kong for work and didn't have much free time to experience Hong Kong outside the business setting, but one thing that I really did want was to get a sense of what Honk Kong is like beneath the skyscrapers. I emailed Little Adventures in the evening thinking that there was no way they could accommodate me for the following day, but to my delight I got a prompt response that I could join a group tour the following morning. I did the Wan Chai tour and it really was more than I even hoped it would be. Daisann was a wonderful guide and the tour was filled with interesting facts and stories about Hong Kong and its history, as well as what daily life is like for the locals. We also stopped by various places and had some very good food, that on my own I never would have ventured out to try.Once the tour ended I continued walking with Daisann as she was going in the direction of my hotel anyways and she kindly asked if I wanted to grab lunch with her. I happily accepted and we ended up having lamb curry at a Cantonese Muslim spot that I most definitely would not have known on my own. That meal I shared with Daisann is one of my favorite memories of my visit to Hong Kong and was truly a highlight of my trip that I love to share with people that ask me about the trip. That gesture on Daisann’s part really speaks to her as a person and she brought that same enthusiasm and care into her tour. More than anything, my experience with Little Adventures was like coming to Hong Kong to visit a friend; I really got a much more authentic and personal experience. I wish Little Adventures and Daisann could be in every place I visit. Thank you Daisann and Little Adventures!

Must do if you're a serious foodie!. Had a fantastic time doing the private food tour with Daisann! Got a real sense of where the locals shop and eat. If it wasn't for this tour, I wouldn't have found the best place to buy Chan Pai, or where to get the best Roasted Goose, or even a local shop that specializes in X.O. Sauce. Daisann really tailored the tour specifically to my interests. Therefore we did a tour that focused mainly on food, with some really informative cultural highlights and stories that gave a real sense of what Hong Kong is all about. If you're a serious foodie, consider the private food tour as you won't find these places, unless you're with a local!

Something different.... I was looking for something a bit different to do in Hong Kong, and my group walk in Wan Chai with Little Adventures ticked all the boxes. Our guide was brilliant, and the stories she told us were informative and fascinating. I thoroughly enjoyed the mix of history, food and insights into the life of locals. I'd recommend this without hesitation...

Fantastic cultural experience. Having previously been to Hong Kong, I've ticked all the usual touristy spots off my list. I wanted something different and culturally in-depth for my second trip, and thankfully that was exactly what I got thanks to Little Adventures' fabulous host Johannes. Apart from being very knowledgeable about the city, he gave me a concise Buddhism 101 lecture while we were visiting one of many Buddhist temples in HK. The foodie spots we visited were also amazing, with a nice variety of dishes, from snake wines (!) to fine dim sum. Highly recommended!

Amazing food, super-knowledgeable host. I wanted to taste the best Hong Kong food so I contacted Little Adventures because they seemed like the best choice for a serious Bay Area foodie like me. I figured the food would be good, but I wasn't prepared for how amazing the experience would be. Daisann and Daniel put together a two-day custom tour for me, hitting both little noodle shops and terrific Cantonese restaurants that I never would have dared to enter on my own. Daniel is a chef and he knows his stuff inside out. If you're serious about digging into Hong Kong food, put yourself in these guys' hands.

Informative and loads of fun... not to mention yummy!. One of the best things to do in any city I visit is to go on some kind of "insider" tour. In HK, my friends and I went on not one but two tours with LAHK; a walkabout around Wan Chai with Daniel and Fanling with Daisann. Although I am Asian and not unfamiliar with street stalls, markets and temples I learned so much walking around Wan Chai with Daniel. Sure, you can read guide books but going on a tour with an insider, you get news and little snippets that are "now"... everything from real estate prices to the latest restaurant trends. Fanling with Daisann the next day proved just as informative. We got to see how the Hakkas lived in walled villages which are really at the point of disappearing with the encroachment of new developments. I loved both tours, enjoyed the lunches we had with Daniel (who is a trained chef and so knows his food) and Daisann very much. LAHK is like having your own friend show you around, I cannot recommend it enough.

Going Beyond Shopping, Ferries and Dim Sum. We have been to Hong Kong many times before, and wanted something a bit left-field from the usual tourist "must-see" attractions dictated by guide books and random Internet searches.We stumbled onto this walking tour and after doing a bit of research, plumped for a walking tour of both Wanchai and Fanling.Distant and her fellow guides were absolutely amazing - their insight into the island, its history and its quirks left us with a new outlook on Hong Kong.We especially loved the tour of Fanling, in the outskirts of the New Territories. Venturing where no tourist would normally go, we got to experience rural Hong Kong and all its authentic culinary wonders, avoiding the dim sum trail that so many limit themselves to.Highly recommended tour!

Not Very Informative- Over Priced-Get a Guide Book. Boring-Had a three person tour with Johannes. Very nice guy but didn't really have much of a plan. Over priced for what we got. Wandered around having him point things out but not giving very much historical context. I think the tour is more geared for people who have never been to Hong Kong and want a very light historical take on the city. Probably best for tourists who have never been to a big city.Had a tour with another company which was way more informative and the guide was very invested in teaching people more about the history and neighborhoods of Hong Kong. Johannes didn't really know that much about the neighborhoods we were in and liked to talk about himself a lot. Save your money, buy a guide book.

This is how great memories are made. My walking tour with Daisann exceeded all my expectations! She is extremely knowledgeable about the city, guiding me expertly through the streets and back alleys to see the authentic Hong Kong so many visitors overlook.Daisann tailored the experience to my interests, creating the perfect itinerary combining food, culture, and the many hidden charms of old and new neighborhoods. Both the Essential Hong Kong Tour and the trip to Fanling were delightful. The walks were so well organized that we covered a lot of ground without ever feeling rushed. The flexibility she had in shifting gears throughout the day was priceless.I have been on many trips and few rival the wonderful two days I spent with Little Adventures of Hong Kong. I wish there were one in every city!

A feast for the senses. I did a walking tour with Daisann yesterday and was emerged in all of Hong Kong's delights. Everything from the food, the history sites & sounds. My only regret is I didn't do this sooner.

Experience another side of Hong Kong. I arranged a Little Adventures tour of Wan Chai and North Point for my boyfriend's birthday. We are expats living in Hong Kong, and were keen to see another side of food in the city. The tour, ably taken by Daniel Cheung, absolutely provided this. They were even able to arrange a small 'foodie gift pack' for my boyfriend. Dan had endless patience with our never-ending questions. We'll definitely be arranging another tour in the future, and would 100% recommend this experience to others - both expats living in HK, and visitors to the city.

Food, history, culture: the real Hong Kong. I'm a bit late in writing this review as our visit was in early October, but if you want to get a feel for the history, culture and food in Hong Kong as the locals know it, this is the tour you want. This was our first visit to Hong Kong and we signed up for two excursions, a walking tour with a focus on local food (markets and cafes/restaurants), and a guided Cantonese meal. Both added so much to our trip, and provided a deeper understanding of the unique culture of Hong Kong (and put into context the current student protests and some of the challenges faced in this region). Daisann was our walking tour guide, and her passion for and knowledge of Hong Kong as well as her flexibility and good humor made the tour a real pleasure. Daniel was our guide for the Cantonese meal, and the dishes he selected as well as his explanation of the customs, preparation and presentation made a delicious meal truly memorable. He also recommended a fabulous tea shop and another restaurant that was a favorite with locals to try on our own , where we enjoyed fabulous roasted pork and duck. Both Daisann and Daniel went above and beyond to help us before and during our visit, and we highly recommend Little Adventures In Hong Kong, whether your interest is Hong Kong cuisine, culture or a mix of the two.

Backstage Hong Kong with Little Adventures. We did 2 fabulous tours with "Little Adventures" during our recent stay in Hong Kong. The walks took us behind the scenes and bustle of the big city and to give us a comprehensive overview of the history, culture, politics and tastes of this fascinating place. Our guides were very professional, knowledgeable, fun and interesting. If you want to get to know the real Hong Kong, this is the tour company for you. We're looking forward to our next trip to take their other tours!

A Great Day With Littles Adventures in Hong Kong. We had the best time with Janice, and I have given your information to a large NYC travel consortium. If you have inquires from Fran or anyone else at Ovation travel it comes from us.We will be back next year and will contact you for more tours.Thanks again Janice!

Great walk thanks!. We walked with Daniel who had great enthusiasm and knowledge for Chinese food and cooking in general. We walked all around a very old neighborhood and tasted all kinds of things. He took us to the places we mentioned we were most interested in. We saw veg markets and fish markets and tasted roasted meats. We had some very good sauce tastings and soy sauce too. We went to one of the oldest deli's or counters in Honk Kong. I asked where I could buy these funny Mao ceramic sculptures and he brought me right to them! Thanks Little walking tours, we had a great day and wouldn't change a thing.

Little adventures, big tastes!. My easily bored husband & I finally found a tour upon which we could agree!! It was an excellent way to experience Hong Kong's culture. Our guide, Daniel was knowledgeable, friendly, & fun to be with. This truly was a great way to discover the "flavor" of this amazing city. We would highly recommend this tour to anyone traveling to Hong Kong.

Excellent! Much more than a food tour.. My experience with LAHK was excellent. I cannot recommend them highly enough. Being an Australian living in Hong Kong, I already have some knowledge of HK, its food and culture, but, unfortunately, no Cantonese. I booked a tour with LAHK to give me, and some visitors from home, access to the amazing world of local food that a Cantonese speaker can provide. Daisann, and her tour, far exceeded our expectations. Much more than a food tour, Daisann treated us to her immense knowledge of Hong Kong food, its history, and, at this important time of the Occupy Central protests for democracy, the social and political fabric of the city. An amazing time to be in Hong Kong.Setting out in the morning for some extremely tasty dim sum in Sheung Wan, Daisann was able to order a variety of dishes for us, explain them and engage in some jovial banter with the trolley ladies which, in addition to few laughs, provided a very local experience for us - her Cantonese is fluent. We were guided through the winding streets of dried seafood sellers and herbalists, explanations and discussions along the way, stopping for milk tea and more snacks at a cha chaan teng .. all excellent!Daisann tailored the tour to suit our particular interests in addition to food, in this instance urban and cultural planning. The stories and history Daisann provided, allowed us a unique opportunity to view the city from a newly informed perspective and understanding. We had such a great time with Daisann, who is very entertaining and an absolute fountain of knowledge, that we ended our tour in the air conditioned shelter of a pub where we had a few drinks and continued chatting.It was a fantastic tour. Wonderful food, people and experiences.I will definitely be booking with LAHK for future visitors.

Great day in Hong Kong. We were lucky enough to book a private tour with Daisann. The whole day went perfectly. The food was amazing and we also got to see the city. Her knowledge of the food and different styles was a highlight of our trip. I would recommend this tour to anyone looking to gain some knowledge and enjoy all that Hong Kong has to offer. Her ability to speak Cantonese allowed us to experience things we wouldn't have been able to do ourselves. A great way to start your trip off in Hong Kong.

Great way to spend a day in HK. My travel-mate and I consider ourselves pretty knowledgable foodies (we're Brooklynites, haha), but had little idea where to begin in Hong Kong. After researching EXTENSIVELY online, we decided to go with Little Adventures, because between their website and reviews here it seemed like they really knew their stuff— and they seriously do! We booked 4 hours with them (Daniel was our host) and wound up wishing we'd booked more time. We ate SO well (roast goose, pork, amazing noodles) but even better, learned about the preparation and what went into it from a proper chef, which Daniel happens to be. What also made an impression on me was the fact that the LAHK folks are into sustainability and locally made food (this appeals to Brooklynites, the stereotypes are true). Besides the great meals, we were able to buy some handmade, small-batch soy sauces to bring home. It was also really fun wandering down streets and into eateries we probably never would’ve found on our own— another plus. Thank you, Daniel, for a great wander and delicious afternoon!

Great tastes, but we got much more.. We did the food tour with Janice, who is a lovely young woman with an impressive amount of knowledge, not just about Hong Kong food but also culture and society. As we wove our way through the streets, Janice introduced us to the different styles of Hong Kong food, from milk tea and buns to bitter herbal drinks. Although we booked with Little Adventures because of their food expertise, we got even more than that, because Janice also provided us with lots of background information about Hong Kong, from its current political situation, to the relations with China--she answered all our (too many!) questions thoroughly and patiently and we came away with an understanding of Hong Kong that we didn't have before (even though we'd read a lot and researched before coming). We're big fans of these kind of private tours, and we've done them in many other cities, but this is one of the best we've experienced, in terms of the caliber of the guide and the amount of insight gained. It was well worth it, and we are happy to recommend Little Adventures to others.

Elite Professional Tour Guide Prices for Below Average Tour. My expectations were high given the reviews in TripAdvisor. Initial contact with Daisann was very helpful and promising. Maybe it was that our tour occurred on a holiday, as apparently many of the guides were away/unavailable. I was assured that Johannes was a more than competent and very accomplished guide. He seemed to be a nice person upon meeting him, but at these prices one expects a true professional. We started our tour walking the neighborhood, and he discovered a lot of his usual spots were not open. He apparently did not check the holiday schedule ahead of time. So we wandered the neighborhood looking for what was open, without a real plan. We got to see a market and ate in a few shops with some explanation of the food items we were experiencing, but by no means did he have encyclopedic knowledge of the topic. On another day a tour billed as an Art Antiques walk and pub crawl amounted to more of the same, amounting to walking down a street in and out of shops with the only planned item a visit to a private museum of Ming and Ching Dynasty furniture. After paying an additional fee, there was a knowledgeable person that joined us to explain the furniture, but the collection itself was disappointing, only amounting to several similar chairs and tables. One of the proprietors was a friend of the guide. The pub crawl amounted to a cocktail in a bar down the street. Having a Chinese/English speaking guide was helpful, but walking in and out of shops on a given street I could have done myself with a language app instead of paying $500 for for 4-5 hours of a poorly organized tour.

Fantastic Foodie Fun. We booked a tour with Little Adventures (Daniel was our guide) for our first morning on Hong Kong and we are so very glad we did. They put together a fantastic private tour which took into account our interests and desire to get to know Hong Kong. Not only that but we stopped at restaurants I'd have never known existed, ate incredible food and were given some fantastic foodie tips for the rest of our stay. This tour is like hiring a friend for the morning, a friend with the inside scoop to all the coolest, hippest and tastiest places. I can not recommend this enough, I doubt that there is a more personal tour of Hong Kong available.

A must-do experience.. Little Adventures is a rare gem. Founder Daisann McLean is an insightful, articulate and generous guide who knows the city like the back of her hand. An award-winning journalist, she fell in love with Hong Kong and has made it her home. Our half day spent with her, followed by another half day with her colleague Daniel Cheung, were absolutely the highlights of our week in Hong Kong. We wondered through backstreets and markets, noticing what we would otherwise not have seen. The architecture of different eras crammed side by side; an extraordinary array of herbs and medicines, baskets of frogs and many kinds of fish ready to be taken home and cooked. Small businesses clinging on tenaciously alongside ubiquitous multi-story developments. And we ate like locals as we went. Simple and delicious congee with century egg from a tiny shop. The best roast pork from the 'pork place', where we squeezed in beside workers on their lunch hour as Daisann, a fluent Cantonese speaker, ordered and told us about how the pork was cooked and the broth flavoured with cooling pear. Outstanding Won Ton soup from a hole in the wall cafe - Michelin star and all. The L.A. team knows their food. We ate from their recommendations most of the week, and they were spot on. Daniel took us to a fabulous bar that we would never have found ourselves, and which we re-visited later. With Daniel we wondered Hollywood Road taking in antiques and art and, a real treat, a private viewing of a superb collection of Ming and Ching Dynasty furniture and 1920's & 30's artefacts. For all this, the pace was relaxed; a relief in the heat of July. For me the best part was hearing Daisann's insights into Hong Kong's history and contemporary events, shared with our encouragement - we are interested in that kind of thing. We felt as though we had met warm and intersting new friends, and had been allowed to scratch below the surface, even if just a litttle. We will definitely be back next time we make it to Hong Kong. Lisa (Melbourne, Australia)

LIttle Adventures - Excellent value, lots of fun!. This was an excellent choice and well worth the money for us. Daisann and her co-workers have put together a very thoughtful, flexible and enjoyable tour/discussion of Hong Kong that we strongly recommend. I wouldn't call this just a walking tour, or a food tour, but rather something like you might experience when a friend-of-a-friend decides to show you around her city, and takes the time to figure out who you are and what your interests are. That happens rarely in tours of this type. They only take small numbers of folks to retain that intimacy, but in our case it really made it special, and she reorganized things more or less on the go (slightly) in accordance with the conversations we were having along the way, and what she found out about our background. Wow!Hong Kong is of course very modern, very up-scale in the shopping district and easy to navigate, but that doesn't mean you'll find your way to the out of the way stuff, and some of the most interesting points, that might have been part of the old Hong Kong but which are rapidly giving way to 55-story high-rise condos. Daison will guide you in amongst all of that, all the while regaling you with stories that make you appreciate her journalist/travel writer's eye for interesting local details that we would have missed otherwise. We were there just before a special, politically important period, and would have missed the run up to this and its significance on a much larger stage had we not been with her for two days.And the food along the way was surprising in its variety (I thought I had had Won Ton noodles before -wrong!), and its reflection of the efforts of local chefs to provide their customers with something special - and not necessarily tourists. Never in a million years would we have found our way to the places we stopped to eat, and the stories and pictures we collected along the way.We wound up doing two tours with her on two different days, and wound up wishing we could do more, in other cities. We will be keeping in touch with her and her company, and you should too!
highlight of my stay so far.... did the Sunday morning group tour of Wan Chai last weekend with Danny - it was fascinating, I loved every minute.

Unique and interesting view of Hong Kong!. My mom, her friend, and I really enjoyed our tour with Daisann. She walked us around traditional markets and explained many interesting products there. We enjoyed tea and treats in a hole-in-the-wall cafe and a delicious dim sum lunch. The best part, however, was her knowledge of the city, including its history and current economic/political trends. Definitely added to our time in HK as we saw things we would not have otherwise!

Great Job Guys!. I took my banking desk to HK for an offsite and decided to join Little Adventures for a walkabout. Even as Asians and frequent travellers to HK I wanted a different perspective from a hybrid individual like Daisann who can both impart a foreign and local flavour to my Singaporean charges. Everyone enjoyed themselves very much and my downside was lugging the opportunitistic shopping that the ladies on the tour took (argument was:" we may not come this way again") throughout the 2 tours we took on the Island. Thanks for making it special!

See the real Hong Kong. Our walk with Daniel was simply wonderful. It was an exciting adventure that gave us an insight into a Hong Kong that you need to leave the main streets to see and experience. Daniel's gentle manner was a blissful antidote to the noise and bustle, and when combined with his insightful guiding, it was a magical experience. And all that even in the rain!!!

Reconnecting with Hong Kong. I have been remiss in writing up my thoughts on my past experiences with the folks at Little Adventures in Hong Kong. Since my initial trip with them back in March 2012, I've returned twice to Hong Kong and on both trips tapped their services. My second trip was in December 2012, where I did a half day tour followed by a dinner at an excellent Cantonese restaurant. What I came away with, and the reason I would come back again to LAHK on my third trip was the depth of knowledge and expertise in navigating the HK food scene excited by the team. Despite HK being quite the international city, when it comes to trying to experience the best authentic Cantonese cuisine, there is still very much a language barrier. As a non-Canto speaking American tourist with limited time, not having to worry about this is an immense relief, combined with knowing I am being introduced to places that have been curated by the knowledgeable staff to my specific taste - it's really these two things that brought me back for my second, as well as third trip to HK. For example, we went to Ser Wong, and I'm sure I could have managed to order the snake soup on my own, but it was knowing the back story of that dish in that restaurant as well as the other dishes we ordered there that I probably wouldn't have known to order on my own that made the experience memorable. That evening, we went to a high end traditional Cantonese restaurant (I'm reluctant to identify the restaurant - my little secret, maybe for a little bit) and the LAHK team picked the best dishes (some of which had to be preordered) as well as some excellent seasonal dishes. Again, you might be able to figure some of these things out, but I did't have to because the heavy lifting had been done for me. The meal was excellent, by the way. My last trip to HK was this past April, where I only had a day in HK and I had another excellent, curated Cantonese meal. I know there were less expensive tour options in HK, but for my time and money, I find LAHK a great value. I really have come to trust the LAHK team with my trips to HK, especially given my time tends to be limited. I appreciate the staff's knowledge and familiarity with the ever evolving HK dining scene, their knowledge and passion when it comes to Cantonese cuisine, and their overall excellent attention to detail and customer service.

Wonderful walking tour!. On short trips like ours, one often doesn’t have the luxury of wandering around and discovering things independently without the risk of missing a lot. Having a customized tour like this one is a luxury too, but we enjoyed it immensely. Daisann proved an enthusiastic, informed, and energetic guide who introduced us to Hong Kong's idiosyncrasies, gave us a good foundational background for independent exploring, and gave us insight into ordinary life in Hong Kong. The tour was tailored to our interests and we got informative responses to every question. We could not have asked for a better tour, and recommend it highly.

Highly recommended. Had a great time on the Sundays in Wan Chai walk. I was a solo traveller who had never been to Hong Kong before but didn't want to do anything too "touristy". This tour was perfect in that it felt like a couple of friends showing us around their favourite spots.

An adventure for those who truly want to EXPERIENCE Hong Kong and not just "see the city”. For visitors who truly want to EXPERIENCE Hong Kong rather than just "see the city” then booking an adventure with Little Adventures in Hong Kong is a MUST! As a corporate event planner based in Southern California, I was asked to set up a social activity and group dinner for colleagues and clients attending a conference in Hong Kong in May 2014. This is a well-traveled group of more than 20 people who didn't want the standard run-of-the-mill tour that you end up napping through; they wanted an experience; something they would actually remember past dinner. I’ve always set my standards high and was not going to disappoint them, but HOW can you succeed in such a quest from thousands of miles away? Well, it was easier than I ever thought possible. After extensive research, and much frustration, I found Little Adventures in Hong Kong through Trip Advisor and my goal became a reality. I worked directly with Daisann to customize a memorable walking tour weaving through the historic Wan Chai district, followed by a private, guided dinner at a Michelin-starred Cantonese restaurant. Our resident foodie and guests were delighted with the walking tour and the added experience of extending our “tour” into a guided culinary adventure to round out the day. By having Little Adventures in Hong Kong plan the menu and provide a guide as part of our dinner experience, our guests were given an opportunity to experience dishes they may not have chosen on their own, sample a wide variety of revived Cantonese dishes and gain a stronger understanding of the ingredients used as well as the history and culinary principles in Cantonese cuisine. Planning events sight-unseen from thousands of miles can be a nerve-racking experience, but working with Daisann put my mind at ease. With her attention to detail, prompt communications and extensive knowledge of the “real” Hong Kong, the entire experience was wonderful. Even with a 15+ hour time difference she took the time to speak with me when it was convenient for both of us (and occasionally woke up VERY early on her end to fit a planning call into my busy schedule)! By the end of our planning, I felt I was sending my group off with a close friend rather than a tour guide.If you book an adventure with Little Adventures in Hong Kong, I am confident your experience will be unforgettable and one that deserves more than just one page in your scrap book!

Highly Reccommended. My sister and I took the tour on a Saturday morning a couple of weeks ago. It was a flying visit for us, (only two nights) and we hadn't done much research about the city, however this tour was certainly one of the highlights of our short trip. It helped us not only understand local food but also the neighbourhoods, the geography of Hong Kong, and even the trams! Daisann is a very interesting person, having travelled the world working for publications, she knows her stuff. Her fluent cantonese meant she had a deep grasp of local culture, rituals and traditions, communicating expertly with restaurant staff, taxi drivers and the odd characters we bumped into in the street. Our food tour covered a little cafe where congee and bread was served, a wet market, a roast pork shop, meat markets, roast goose shop, soya milk tea, a bakery, noodles and wonton soup, Chinese voodoo, a real cat with a 'welcome' sign around it's neck, chicken soup and a lot of sweating on my part! My sister said she'd seen and done more in Hong Kong in 4 hours that she'd done in 2 previous visits.What's also very good about this tour is the after service - a list of recommended restaurants in HK, and the knowledge that if we had any further questions Daisann would be ready to help out.I have no hesitation to recommend this tour to anyone, in particular if you are new to HK and want to get a grasp on the city quickly, but in a personal and engaging way. Thanks again Daisann.

Not to be missed. After spending almost three weeks in China my wife and I ended our trip with two days in Hong Kong. No question that the two days we spent going around the city with Johannes and Daisann were the highlight of our visit. After going back and forth with Daisann about what we wanted to see and suggestions on her part, we set off exploring the city for two days. Fortunately it didn't rain and we were able to cover a lot of ground. We walked quiet neighborhoods, explored markets, and went where the locals went. The amount of history and information that these two informed travelers gave us made us feel like we lived there. We walked, talked, and ate. What could have been?If you are going to Hong Kong, and you really want to see the city like a local with two terrific people, then you must use Little Adventure. It is a treasure and experience not to be missed.

Food walking tour. We wanted to get a real Hong Kong experience of eating..we've eaten at many restaurants and felt we weren't getting authentic food until we did a tour with Little Adventures. We had a great host in Johanness who took us too truly local eating places as well interesting food shops along the way.He was very obliging and shared our passion for food. Highly recommended, expensive but value won out we're still taking about it.

Not cheap but very good. I'm an Australian expat new to HK and so spent a morning (9am til 1pm) with Daisann on my first day here, to discover the in-and-outs of my local neighbourhood Wanchai. Daisann was delightful and clearly experienced & seasoned in her knowledge of HK and my neighbourhood - particularly from the perspective of an expat wishing to immerse oneself, whilst maintaining a balance of local and other. From cheap local tea, to boutique bars, to simply daily convenience tips of trams, trains and travel cards - this day was enormously helpful to orientate me well. It wasn't an energetic, rigorous walking tour of many miles and sights, which an athletic type like me would have been up for. It was more a gentle, casual but well thought through jaunt of the area and things to know about and to visit. At the time, I enjoyed it but came away a little unsure of the value given the cost. However now that I've been here for a month or so I appreciate how much was revealed to me that day and how much it fast tracked my understanding. I'd recommend it to others.Peter, Sydney Australia

Exceptional Insights, Great Value!. My experience with Little Adventures in Hong Kong was one of the best I've had in my many travels. I was in Hong Kong for a professional convention and had only a few hours free to get a feel for the real Hong Kong away from the skyscrapers and modern shopping, which didn't interest me much. I contacted Daisann and told her what my interests were--real streets, real markets, and most of all real food. She proposed a customized itinerary, and she really delivered. First of all the food was amazing, from a little hole in the wall place that served beautiful, flaky crust egg tarts to a delicious Cantonese lunch with dishes I never would have dared to order on my own (just let her do it, which she will--in Cantonese!). I should mention that when I booked she also emailed me their company's guide to restaurants in Hong Kong that I used to find great places to eat after the tour.But what really made this tour stand out from the run of the mill was the level of insight I was able to get in a few short hours into Hong Kong. Daisann's a journalist, and she knows the ins and outs of the place, and especially the current events. She was able to give detailed and nuanced answers to all my questions about the local economy and society. I came away with a better understanding of Hong Kong and China than I'd gotten from some of those professional seminars I was here to attend--which made this tour an exceptional value indeed!

Not what I was expecting.. By no means to I want to discourage people from taking this tour as it was fun, informative and we tasted some great food, albiet, the tour is quite pricey! However, since we were in a group of five, it was very tough to hear Daniel as he is soft spoken. My travel companions and I are FAST; we walk fast and sight-see fast, and the other two in this group were not not our pace, so it wasn't as good as I hoped it to be.

Expensive but an Excellent Experience. I booked a 4 hour food tour for my Mum who was visiting Hong Kong and was keen to explore some of the less familiar locations. Daniel gave an excellent tour and gave a real insight into food and culture in Hong Kong. This included visits to some incredible places and a real sharing of knowledge on food in Hong Kong......This is an excellent tour for anyone visiting and keen to get off the beaten track.......it does however come at a price !!

Brilliant walking tour - highly recommended. Absolutely amazing tour, this is a must do activity! My sister and I were lucky enough to spend the day with Janice walking around Sham Shui Po exploring the area and eating everything we could get our hands on. Janice was a wonderful host, she provided us with so much information about Hong Kong. I would highly recommend a Little Adventures Walking Tour to anyone travelling to Hong Kong.

Great Experience!. We spent three days in Hong Kong this last March. Since we knew very little about the food or the city, we decided we needed an education and researched the various tours. Based on Trip Advisor and other references, we decided to spend an afternoon and lunch with "Little Adventures in Hong Kong and signed up for their "Essential Hong Kong and Sheung Wan walk with Dim Sim lunch. We were accompanied by Janice Leung who was fantastic.The first day, we hired a guide from Little Adventures in Hong Kong and explored the Hong Kong side. We started with a great dim sum lunch at a local restaurant and then the rest of the afternoon explored the markets and the central district. We learned more in four short hours on this tour than we ever would have on our own. Our guide Janice was great and gave us a good education on Hong Kong customs and it’s food scene. I highly recommend!

Great walking customized walking tour!. I spent the better part of a day with Daisann learning the history of HK, seeing offbeat sights and visiting cool art galleries. She told me about the legends and superstitions and was a delightful hostess to the city that she loves! It was a great way to learn about HK and try some delicious local food including peppercorn and lime ice cream. Highly recommended!

Great Introduction to HK and Wan Chai in particular. We had just moved to HK and wanted to find a walking tour that would give us an introduction to the local food and markets we had heard about. Little Adventures in Hong Kong was the most appealing because it caters to very small groups (no more than 5) and therefore can be personalized. As newcomers to HK we feel so fortunate having Daisann as our guide. She shared her knowledge and insights into this vibrant beautiful city that we now call home. This was good value for the information that we took away with us! Thank you Daisann.

Great tours, fantastic hosts!. We took 2 different tours with Little adventures in HK.The first tour was aimed at giving us a general overlook of HK and its marvelous foods, and we were accompanied by Janice. Janice is a delightful lady, who is extremely knowledgeable about HK, its culture, traditions and of course food. She speaks an impeccable English and it was very nice to get to know the city better with her as a guide. In fact, it was almost like walking around with a friend who gave us unique insights on Hong Kong.Our second tour was with Daisann, who was accompanied by Daniel, and was in a less conventional part of the city. Although a very different experience, it was equally fun and interesting. It gave us another facet of HK and a different point of view. During this walk, we discovered great foods as well and I had the occasion of taking great photos.It is indeed not a cheap way to see HK, but we really did not regret it. Worth to add that before our arrival, and until the end of our stay, Daisann and Janice were always available for tips, advice and good addresses and we found this to be a great help. They do this out of love and passion for their city, and it really shows! Thanks for sharing it with us!

Foodie walking tour. We had a great tour with Daniel - really interesting to see lots of varied places and taste different dishes. The dim sum, breakfast cafe and traditional market were particular highlights and Daniel was a brilliant host, sharing a wealth of information. The only criticism I have is that the company makes a lot of noise about customising the experience to make it personal - which given the fairly high cost is understandable - but in fact when we came to do the tour, it didn't really include any of the things I'd mentioned; in fact it felt pretty standardised. Having said that, Daniel was able to give us some recommendations for other restaurants, which was useful.

Food and fun!. The highlight of my recent stay in Hong Kong were the days spent with Johannes Daisann and Daniel. The private tours were perfect as an introduction to the city and were customized to my interests The group tour was exceptional as well we lived the Wan Chai area and the amazing market. All if the guides were so knowledgeable friendly and fun. I ate way too much each day I also got great advice on what to do when I was not with them. Truly a great experience.

A Unique Urban Experience. Our tour with Little Adventures in Hong Kong was the highlight of our time there. Daisann, our guide, gave us real insight into Hong Kong and not just into its food, although we believe learning about how people eat is one of the best ways to learn about them and about their hometown. Yes, they can be more expensive that other tours, but that is not surprising considering the tremendous insight the guide has to offer on the food of Hong Kong, its culture, its history and its people. It's also not surprising considering the effort they make to find out what you are really interested in and to not waste your time. This is not a scripted tour. We visited a tiny congee shop, noodle shops, Chinese medicine shops, a dim sum restaurant, markets, and other places where there were no other tourists. HIghly recommended.

Incredible Tour with a True Professional. Our tour with Daisann was spectacular. She was so knowledeable and gave us a great insider perspective. We took a walking tour showing us behind the scenes of Hong Kong. Having visited many times on my own, I appreciated seeing parts of the city that were new to me. We made an impromptu stop at a local coffee/snack shop unchanged from Hong Kong's days gone - a place we never would have found on our own, much less have known how to order. Daisann was invaluable. After we finished the walking tour, we headed to our Dim Sum lunch where all was well until one member of our group started to feel ill. Daisann jumpted into action (she even knew the pharmacist downstairs!) and made sure we had everything we needed. Not to mention she followed up with us later that day to make sure all was well. I can't say enough about Daisann and Little Adventures in Hong Kong. I am already looking forward to my next visit so I can try another walk with her.

Very special Urban Architecture tour. Our Sheung Wan walk with Little Adventures was fantastically interesting. Our guide knew the fate of different historic building types, and we saw their original sustainable designs, but all within the context of the history, politics, and development of the city. Totally great, and on top of the treats for the mind and eye, the restaurant recommendations were out of this world and off the beaten track.

Great way to explore Hong Kong with limited time. My wife and I went on a tour with Daisann recently and we had a great time. In just four short hours, we learned more about Hong Kong than we ever would have exploring on our own. Indeed, I'm fairly certain that my wife and I could have walked down the very same side streets and back alleys, and by the very same store fronts, and had no idea what was going on right in front of us, or it significance to Hong Kong's history and he daily life of its people.We had only two days in Hong Kong, and this was a great way to get our mini trip started.

A Great Day Exploring Hong Kong. We really recommend this tour. Daniel was our guide for the day, and he is nothing short of brilliant. While we were ostensibly on a food tour, Daniel gave us highlights of Hong Kong which we hadn't expected. As well as food (he has a culinary degree), he knows the history, the architecture, and the politics of Hong Kong and China.Oh, and the places he took us for food were great, too! For me, Mak's Noodles was the highlight of the tour. My girlfriend was thrilled to find Teakha (I believe that was the spot), a trendy tea shop on Hong Kong Island.Overall, a great day! Highly recommended!

Treasures of Hong Kong. A morning with Daisann unearthed treasures of Hong Kong that I wouldn't have been able to find on my own or had the confidence to try. Great food, fascinating history and local culture brought to life by our guide. A truly bespoke tour which was worth the investment.
Little Adventures in Hong Kong. Was a brilliant tour - we had a great day. Full of history, information and great food. Will do it again.

Wonderful Tour!. I booked 2 tours with Diasann while I was in Hong Kong and it was wonderful! The first day we did a foodie tour "Won Ton a Thon"and went to local eateries that I would have never found by myself. We also ran into a store front that hand made bamboo steamers - the only one left on the island. The food was outstanding and I went with everything Diasann recommened and was not disappointed. The second day we walked around the old part of Hong Kong where the local culture still exists - we had tea at a couple of places and the owner made me feel right at home - nothing fancy at all just a small shop that is very inviting. Diasann put together a great itinerary after getting to know me and what I wanted to get out of the tour. She is very knowledgeable about the culture of Hong Kong and focuses on it's traditions and people. I also made a new friend! The next time I'm in Hong Kong I will definitely book a few more!

relax sunday morning with friends. It was my second experience with Little Adventures in HK and i was happy to return. This time i booked the 3 1/2 hours semi-private "Sunday Morning in Wan Chai" tour. I really felt as meeting god old friends. Daisann and Daniel have been great hosts combining lots of insides about HK history and present developments with fantastic street food to remember.I can recommend Little Adventures for very private and individual tours. Thanks again for great times with you.

A wonderful Sunday morning adventure!. I found Little Adventures in HK online and am sure glad I did. I had a free day on my own and while I've been to HK many times I had not ever explored Wan Chai. Both Dasiann and her chef-partner Daniel were great hosts and guides, filled with great facts on food, culture and history and were simply great companions for the day. I especially loved exploring the wet market, learning the history of the haunted mansion up the hillside and sitting down for some true, outdoor street food that was absolutely unforgettable. I will definitely recommend this to my friends and co-workers that visit HK for a weekend.

A fantastic little adventure. On our visit to Hong Kong, my wife and I wanted to see some of the old Hong Kong, and get to know some of the traditional parts of the city. Our walking tour was with Daisann, who proved to be extremely knowledgeable and able to show us more than we could have believed possible about the history, politics and culture of this amazing city.. Our walk around Sheung Wan, which was followed by an superb dim sum lunch really opened our eyes. She took us to find some wonderful xo sauce which is going to spice up our meals now we are back home.I cannot recommend this walk highly enough, and we will certainly be calling on Daisann again on our next trip.

Outstanding way to spend 5 hrs. My morning with Little Adventures was outstanding. We were able to visit multiple neighborhoods and try all sorts of great food. I was introduced to places and things I could never have found on my own. The walk was tailored to my own personal tastes and there was no pressure to do or try anything. After my morning, I felt empowered to explore the rest of Hong Kong on my own. A wonderful introduction to the nooks and alleyways and sumptuous food of Hong Kong. Definitely one the most memorable days here. I am a Raving Fan for sure. I will join her team again on my next visit

Passionate guide. We had just one day in HK and had spent a month traveling so wanted to do something different. Daisanne was our guide. A journalist by profession who speak Cantonese and is passionate about what she does. A very interesting and different tour. Well worth doing.

A terrific experience in every respect. We went on a walk with Daisann through the Central and Sheung Wan neighborhoods, snacking at places that we would never have found otherwise -- a congee stand; a shop selling wonderful roast pork; a Hong Kong noodle restaurant tucked into an alleyway -- and visiting small producers of things such as xo sauce (much more flavorful and nuanced than what we get here). Along the way, we learned about Hong Kong's history and architecture, traditional Chinese medicines, current real estate development pressures, and relations between Hong Kong and mainland China. We even heard some great stories about Daisann's days as a calypso singer in Trinidad.

Stepping into the real Hong Kong. As a huge foodie & with limited time in HK, I booked a walking tour with Little Adventures after reading all the positive reviews. I have to say I was not disappointed. The lovely Daniel was our guide the day, taking us through Central, Sheung Wan and over to Kowloon. It would have been impossible to have seen, tasted & learnt all we did with Daniel if we were left to our own devices. I highly recommend Little Adventures.

Little adventure in the fishing villages. My afternoon with Daisann was fun, interesting, and a great way to explore part of Hong Kong that I would have never seen otherwise. Daisann personalized it to suit my interests and I felt like I was walking around the city with a very knowledgable old friend. We had great food along the way and I would highly recommend this experience to anyone traveling to HK.

You must go on this tour!!!!. My wife and I visited Hong Kong during our honeymoon throughout Asia in early January 2014. We both love food and wanted to go on a walking food tour in Hong Kong but did not want to go with a large group. We were lucky enough to find the Little Adventures in Hong Kong Food and Walking Tour and decided to sign up.Our tour guide, Johannes Pong, was amazing. He was friendly, knowledgeable and funny. We were taken on a wonderful four hour experience throughout part s of Hong Kong that we would have missed if we were on our own. We ate unbelievable food at local restaurants and food stands and we are still talking about it with friends to this day. Johannes had us sample well known Chinese food as well as giving us the opportunity to try things we do not have access to in the U.S. like snake soup. By the end of the tour we felt like we made a new friend, ate wonderful food and saw so much of the amazing city of Hong Kong. I truly recommend this experience if you visit.

A fantastic tour. I booked Little Adventures for myself and my parents during our recent 3 day trip to Hong Kong. This was our first time to Hong Kong and Asia and we thought it would be a great, personalised way of getting to know a new city and country, without being part of the typical large tour groups – we were not disappointed. We had the most fantastic tour conducted by Daniel and cannot recommend this company nor Daniel enough. The tour itself was a great way to get to know the city and learn all about its history, politics, culture and, of course, food. It gave us a real insight into the back streets of Hong Kong which we would have been unable to find by ourselves. Daniel was a tremendous tour guide, with a great knowledge and true passion about the city. He took us to great places and showed us invaluable inside local hints and tips. The tour was so much fun and we all felt very comfortable in Daniel's company.He also took us for a dim sum lunch, ordering what he felt was most suitable. We had the best dim sum we have ever tasted! After a fantastic day with Daniel, we really felt that he was part of the family and cannot thank him enough for making our time in Hong Kong a more memorable one. Whilst the price of the tour is not cheap, it is worth every penny to experience a truly personalised tour with an extremely passionate and knowledgeable guide. We would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong. Thank you!

Worth every cent!. We took the tour on our first day in Hong Kong - and we enjoyed it immensely! Being from the food industry ourselves, we found Daisann to be very knowledgable and she took us to some amazing places. Taking this tour on the first day is fantastic as it helps to orientate you in the city, gives you the opportunity to return to some of your favourite places, and visit the ones you didn't have time to do on the day. Doing this tour gave us the confidence to visit places on our own that we may not otherwise have had the 'balls' to walk into. We ended the tour with full bellies and laden with excellent XO sauce, soy sauce, black vinegar and other locally made foods. We have recommended this tour to friends who have lived in Hong Kong for years, and will continue to recommend this to anyone who is looking for a personalised experience with a great host! We would do it again in a heartbeat.

HK's Little Lanes and Secret Food Places. It was indeed a little adventure in HK with the fascinating, charming and genuine places the tour brought me too. I would never have been able to find these places on my own. The food was delicious and tasted home-made thanks to the up-to-date resources of the team. It was so enjoyable to see, smell and taste a slice of life of the streets of HK.

An insider's view of Hong Kong urbanism and architecture. Little Adventures in Hong Kong is an unparalleled way to gain an in-depth understanding of the history, architecture, landscape — and of course, food — of a unique urban phenomenon. I encourage anyone interested in what Hong Kong has been, is, and will be, to contact Daisann and find out about the range of places and urbanist topics you can explore with her.I am an adventurous and generally autodidactic traveler, but when I heard about the Little Adventures tours, I thought it might be a good way to get an in-depth experience out of what was to be a very short stay in Hong Kong, and my first time ever in East Asia. I couldn't have imagined how well-suited an experience awaited me. As a New York City-based historic preservationist, I am interested everywhere I go in the visible history of urban spaces, and in how historic resources are understood and treated in contemporary economic, political and social life.I met Daisann in the heart of Central, where we resumed a conversation on these topics that had begun over email. We plotted our exploration around Fanling — a still-rural area near the border with the mainland, where ancient walled villages and silent wetlands still sit (for now) just beyond the monumental postwar New Towns public housing projects, and a new wave of gigantic luxury housing development. It was a perfect place for Daisann to help me understand the course of Hong Kong's real estate-driven politics and policies over the last several decades. On our way back, visited Shek Kip Mei, the site of Hong Kong’s pioneering high-rise public housing development — the ancestor of so much of Hong Kong’s skyline — where some of the striking original modernist buildings are being adaptively reused. We wandered through a rollicking street market nearby, in an “ordinary” residential neighborhood that was alive with activity during the Chinese New Year holiday, unlike the touristy areas I might otherwise have been largely confined to.All this plus a dim sum lunch with Dongguan specialties, and typical blue-collar Hong Kong snacks on the way.... All in all, not just an education about Hong Kong, but a stimulating exchange on the nature of global cities today.

What a day!. What a time we had with Daisann! I feel we should apologise to her because we had so many questions and she answered everyone in detail which meant that between us the only time we weren't talking was when we were eating the wonderful dim sum lunch. The outcome of our time with Daisann meant that we had an understanding of the politics and infrastructure of the area and will gain so much more from our stay in Hong Kong than if we had just done the tourist things. Would recommend anyone to spend time with Daisann or another member of her team.

Little BIG Adventures in Hong Kong. There need to be more stars to truly give my Little Adventures in Hong Kong experience with Daniel its true rating.To be able to spend the day with somebody who can really show you the many, many sides of a city as vibrant and diverse as Hong Kong is indeed a treat.To be able to spend it with somebody who was born there is a bonus. But, add moving with his family to live in Vancouver, Singapore and Sydney to finish with Cordon Bleu in London before moving back home to Hong Kong is nothing short of a gift.Daniel, clearly raised and educated all over the world, is a young man who is passionate about food and his hometown. No better combination to set out to explore a teeming city with so many nooks and crannies than with a native who speaks English, with a British accent, Cantonese, Manadarin and " enough French to get by". My day was tailored to my specific requests: Learn as much as I could about Hong Kong. Learn how to order a meal and then the polite way to eat it. Learn how to navigate my way using public transportation.I am now zipping around Hong Kong like a native, feel confident I can go into any off the beaten path eatery and all the while appreciate where I am because of all the things Daniel showed me and explained. His stories of his family and so many relatives were fascinating adding yet another dimension to my experience. I travel a fair amount and love taking tours first off to learn about a city. My time with Daniel rates as one of the best. His knowledge, sense of humor and passion for food, culture and his city made my tour seem like a visit with a family friend.

Very informative afternoon. My afternoon with Daniel was very informative and interesting. He showed me around areas of Hong Kong that I never would have been able to discover on my own. The Dim Sum lunch was awesome.

Our little adventure. Although initially Little Adventures was hesitant to take kids (and it should be on a case to case basis), they welcomed my two teens to the adventure. My girls were absolutely delighted with Johannes. He was our BFF for a few hours. We had a blast touring around, and would have preferred several more hours. He was fun and knowledgeable and filled with lots of facts to teach the girls as well. My husband had his own interest and Johannes easily went from one conversation to the next making sure everyone got their time with him. A highlight was a tea tasting, the kids loved it and we were introduced to some great teas too. Be prepared to be stuffed!! We would gladly call Johannes again when we return to HK.

Perfect day in Hong Kong. What a great day! Having taken many a tour.. we've experienced good ones and some not so good. Janice's tour takes top honors. We walked, talked and learned so much about the food, the history, the culture and what makes the city work. And the lunch! Perfect. We would have never truly experienced Hong Kong had we organized this on our own. We would definitely recommend this tour.

Won ton a Thon eating tour. Thanks for the "wontonderful" tour. Daisann was a great tour guide. She was very informative and we enjoyed our private tour of old Hong Kong. From the very quaint coffee shop of days gone by to the surprisingly tasty snake soup and lastly the most delicious won ton noodle soup. We had a fun time on our "little adventure" in Hong Kong.

Tour of the city personally tailored to our interests!. Our group of three people met up with Daisann first thing in the morning, and after a brief discussion about our interests she came up with an itinerary for the day that was perfectly tailored just for us. We found this company by researching online and are so pleased that we booked a tour. We visited places and saw sites that we never would have gone to on our own. We rode the buses, walked the markets, tried some speciality foods, rode ferries, walked through villages and took cabs all in the pursuit of the true Hong Kong experience. Daisann's experience and knowledge resulted in a very unique tour. And we all enjoyed our discussions with her regarding life in the city - she very patiently answered our questions. Though our tour was more focused on the sites and history of Hong Kong, rather than the food, we could tell that Daisann is a foodie at heart and we are sure that her food-focused tours would be exceptional. We would all highly recommend Little Adventures in Hong Kong to anyone visiting the city who appreciates a more unique experience off of the beaten track.

Magical tour of Hong Kong. Can't speak highly enough of the experience we had on our walking/eating tour of Hong Kong with Janice Leung. She truly showed us a wonderful side of this exciting, bustling city. There was nothing she couldn't answer, and her in depth knowledge of the history, food and culture was outstanding. There is no way we would have experience the delicious food, tea and good company of Hong Kong without this tour. Huge thanks to Janice :)

The best food/city tour that is completely personal & YES, it's worth the cost!!. My husband and I recently took this tour while vacationing in Hong Kong. It was exactly what we were hoping for, easily exceeding our expectations. We felt it was worth every dollar and would recommend it to friends and family with no hesitation.A guide can really make or break a tour like this and Diasann was fantastic! She is very knowledgeable and her appreciation and love for Hong Kong and the local culture shone throughout the tour. We found her to be a fun and delightful host, providing a lot of information about Hong Kong, for topics including the food, the markets, the city, the language, and the history. She spoke fluent English and Cantonese, which made it very easy to get around and interact with locals. Moreover, she really went the extra mile for us in a number of ways. When we mentioned in passing that we liked to cook, she took us to a local place that sold an incredible X.O. sauce where we were able to sample before deciding to buy. At the end of our tour, she also went out of her way to escort us to a high-end tea store near Times Square so that we could look around and shop. And unbelievably, when we arrived at our hotel the day after, we found a gift bag waiting from her that included some soy sauce from a different store that we weren't able to make it to as an extra side stop on the tour. I couldn't believe it! We really felt special, and she made us feel like we were her close friends visiting from out of town. For us this type of personal experience is what ultimately delivers a higher value. Oh, and she also helped provide us restaurant recommendations for the rest of our stay, even reaching out to the owner of a restaurant we were considering!We appreciated that the tour was private, just us, and felt that it added to the personal experience. You can tell that through long practice they've polished the agenda and logistics. Everything started on time, and it was easy (and interesting) to meet at the Foreign Correspondents Club. From there, the tour brought us generally from west to east across a good portion of the island central via a mix of taxi cabs and walking. It was nice to do it this way. I realized later that we ended up seeing a little more of the city than I originally expected, and that we didn't get tired from too much walking. She also mixed in some extra places, like a local wet market, a popular street for dried herbs and medicines, and another street where they sold wholesale dried fish. It was eye-opening to learn how much dried fish bladders cost!Of course, the food was very good too! We liked that we stopped at some local places that you couldn't just find from just any tourist book. The stops made a good, logical progression, from a more traditional, lighter breakfast to a mid-day tea, and then a dim sum lunch. We didn't overstuff ourselves, though we did run out of room towards the end and ended up choosing not to sample a couple of other items after dim sum. The duration of the tour was scheduled for 4.5 hours, but we did end up going over time - though it never felt that way, and we never felt hurried.If you want to interact with your guide a lot, are genuinely interested in the city and the food, and don't want to do it in a herd of people that you don't know, this tour is for you! We'd recommend doing it early in your trip to take advantage of their insights, advice and recommendations.It is absolutely worth it!!

Lots of insight; little time. I visited Hong Kong on business with only a few hours free between flights. My hope was explore the city with a guide, in the hopes of making the most of my limited time. Daisann really exceeded my expectations by taking me on a very personalized tour of the cities sights, tastes, history, and culture. Considering that we moved at a very leisurely pace, and never felt rushed, its amazing for me to reflect just how much of a feel I got for the city. Highly recommended.

Fantastic way to truly understand the food and culture of Hong Kong. Daisann knows and loves HK and the food and cultural experience was exceptional. We gained a real understanding of the Cantonese cuisine and the confidence to try the new and unknown. Engaging with the local community on the walk was a bonus. The 4.5 hours went too quickly. This is a highlight of a HK stay and not to be missed.

expensive but worth it. This was one of three food-related tours that we did and HKG and it was the most informative regarding the food and ingredients plus taking us to a few really good and off-the-beaten-track places to have a snack.Daissan, our guide (and the company owner as well) is American, working among other things as a writer for the National Geographic Travel magazine. One can tell. A lot of experience, extensive knowledge and insight. Everything one would expect from a private tour and its guide.The only downside is the price - at 100 US$/hour it is definitely not cheap. However, if you have little time and are willing to spend a bit more - do it. You will go beyond the "postcard places" of HKG and learn a lot.

Fabulous Tour & Staff. Little Adventures in Hong Kong provides an exceptional travel product which took us across some of the most interesting parts of Hong Kong. The company matched our needs and interest and designed two days of activities and sights that fit our needs perfectly. Their guides and staff are some of the to journalists and professional i the city and we were very lucky to get to spend the time with them.Highly recommended for anyone looking for a premium travel day in Hong Kong. You won't regret it.

Hong Kong Must Do. My husband, 25 year old daughter and I were lucky enough to spend a morning with Daisann on our recent trip to Hong Kong. Her background on the city, its politics and financial situation as well as general knowledge of Hong Kong life brought the city alive to us in ways we would never have experienced on our own. I highly suggest you book a tour as early as possible during your stay to provide a basis for your time there. Our dim sum lunch was also excellent - need to bring those pork buns back to Chicago! In addition to our tour I felt free to contact Daisann on other matters in Hong Kong and she proved very helpful on several fronts. Interesting, insightful and very enjoyable.

A Personal Experience. I chose to go with Little Adventures based on all of the wonderful reviews I'd seen here on TripAdvisor, and it was one of the best tours I've ever taken. Johannes is extremely knowledgeable about the best food spots in the town, and about the city's history. We had a great time learning about the city while also trying out some of the distinct foods that characterize Hong Kong. It was a great experience and something I'd definitely do again.

Adventures in Hong Kong. Thank you to Charmaine for a wonderful tour. It was great to see behind the usual tourist glam to see some of the real Hong Kong. We wouldn't have found any of the eateries by ourselves, and it was a delight to travel around the back streets with someone who knew and uinderstood the history and significance of them. The tour was done at our pace and would have deviated where and when we wanted. It was especially relevant with Charmaine sharing her experiences as a younger person living in Hong Kong and trying to make ends meet. We would have no hesitation recommedning this tour to other people.

The best walking food tour -Hong Kong!. Thank you, Johannes Pong, for the fabulous time spent with you in Hong Kong. What a treat to see and eat the local food. The visit to the hotel kitchen and meeting chef was amazing. Thank you. Would recommend everyone with an interest in different foods and cultures to do a walking tour. The meals were well chosen and most interesting.Fantastic!!!!

Fantastic tour, best part of our stay in HK. I'm pretty adventurous with food and travel, but taking this tour with Janice was the highlight of my trip.
