We went to places that we would have NEVER, EVER seen on our own. She took us where the locals eat and we ate among them. The food tour was absolutely fantastic and it was really an adventure. We enjoyed Janice so much we took another tour with her a few days later and saw another side of town. Janice has a lot of knowledge about the culture and history of Hong Kong. I would highly recommend this trip. Worth every dollar.

Great tour, but expensive. My wife and i spent 5 hours with Janice who was really wonderful. She has a great personality and is a font of knowledge both about the city and most especially about the food. Our walk took us past temples and markets in a very unspoiled area of Hong Kong. While it is true that you can do the tour by yourself, it wouldn't be nearly as enlightening or fun.The only real issue that I have is the cost. It is very expensive, but of course we knew that going in. I would say that somewhere between $50 and $75 would be more reasonable. Other than that, I would most heartily recommend the tour.

Hong Kong experience. We had a fabulous walking tour of the dried fish markets herb markets and several temples that we would have never seen if not for our expert guide! The dim sum lunch was superb. Our afternoon tour of outdoor markets and a town of true unspoiled Hong Kong was also enlightening!Would highly recommend one or both of these excursions.

Highlight of my stay in Hong Kong. It was my first time in Hong Kong and far East and I was there for a business conference. Because I had only 4 days I wanted to get some help in exploring the food of Hong Kong,as I take a keen interest in it. It turned out to be much more than that because Daisann turned out to be not only en expert on food but also great source of information in many other topics, especialy the history of the region. So, I did not get oriented only about the food of the region, but a I also got to feel the city's atmosphere overall and how people in Hong Kong live, all thanks to Daisann's detailed and warmhearted presentation. I am very happy i did it and that a walking food tour turned out to be a real "little adventure". Well worth the money!

Excellent insights into HK food and culture. We took a 4.5 hour food-centric “Central and Sheung Wan” walk with a guided dim sum lunch and it was the best city tour we have ever taken. Daisann was an outstanding host with extensive knowledge about Hong Kong food, traditional medicine and culture. The walk provided a wealth of information about the ingredients and philosophy of the local cuisine and medicines and the lunch, besides being extremely tasty, gave us the knowledge and confidence to eat at other local restaurants that otherwise we would not have been able to find or navigate. It was a wonderful introduction to Hong Kong which we would unreservedly recommend to others.

Fantastic overview of Hong Kong food scene. I am a US-based food writer and, having never been to Hong Kong, wanted a full tutorial on the local food scene. Daisann set up a terrifically informative tour that included several stops along the way for dim sum, roasted meats, healing teas and more. We went to places I never would have ventured on my own. She gave me background on all the foods I was eating, guided me through the dried seafood market and Chinese herbal tonic stalls, and was truly a wealth of information. I did specify that I wanted to cover culinary topics ONLY; if that is your goal, be sure to convey that message.

Storm be damned! Janis came through, and it was terrific.. I was a little worried about the weather, but I'm glad our guide didn't cancel. We were only in Hong Kong for 3 days and wanted something that wasn't guide-book reliant. We did have to postpone until 2 p.m. but we were being constantly notified through text the day prior. I really appreciate that kind of professionalism rather than a last minute "Oh well, we're really sorry". Janis took us to places both popular and local. I can't tell you how invaluable it is to have someone show you around (anywhere) that speaks the language, is truly knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the food. It was 4 well spent hours, and it was only around the Central neighborhood because of the weather. It made me wonder where else we could've gone on a sunny day. We visited 6 different places and had quick bites/light meals. Do not have breakfast. Come hungry, take photos and business cards. Ask for a copy of the menu if you can. Not everyplace was outstanding, but the place (I wish I could remember the names) that served the Ha Zi Low Meen (sorry about the spelling), the milk tea/french toast place, and goose restaurant more than made up for it. 4 out of the 6 places were certainly not in our guide books, I don't even think they would show up on Trip Advisor. Big thanks to Janis. Her knowledge of cuisine was super impressive: Ingredients, dishes, regions and cultural tidbits. She was patient with our endless questions too. It's definitely an expensive tour. I noticed the prior reviews didn't mention what their fees were, so it's best to just get in touch with the proprietor. But if you're a food enthusiast, and want to try some down home, everyday regular fare and not just another tablecloth establishment-which by the way, they sent us recommendations for those too, how awesome is that?-and are terribly short on time, do book the tour. It was quite special. Thanks again Janis.

Best we've used in our travels!. My partner and I came to Hong Kong for a conference and only had a half day free to explore the city, so we didn’t want to waste time fumbling around with a guidebook. We’d used private guide services with success in other cities, and based on the great reviews we decided to book with Little Adventures. We’re glad we did--in fact we’d have to say rate they’re the best we’ve used in our travels anywhere.Daisann, our host, is a terrific host who really knows her stuff. She led us through the little side streets and markets of a very old Chinese area of Hong Kong, explaining every item and how it is used in food or in medicine (they’re often the same thing!). My partner is a doctor and interested in Chinese medicine, and Daisann was thrilled when she took him into an old herbal shop to meet the traditional doctor--who was delighted to meet us, showed us through his apothecary and posed with us for a photo. This was all possible because Daisann speaks Chinese like the locals even though she’s American (from New York, I think). You have to see the surprised look on people’s faces when she opens her mouth!. We love our Chinese food, so we also asked Daisann to take us to dim sum, and we’re really glad we did. Once again, she used her Chinese to help us navigate the restaurant (we were the only non-Chinese there), and order dishes from the Chinese menu. We expected the food in Hong Kong to be good, but had no idea it was THAT much better than what we can get back home. We’re very happy we booked with Little Adventures and feel it was well worth it. We got more out of our short time in Hong Kong than we ever would have on our own. In terms of expertise, knowledge, and the right fit, this was exactly what we were looking for in a tour. We have no hesitation in recommending Little Adventures to other travelers like us.

Little Adventures a little disappointing. Day one, we waited over an hour for our guide to arrive at our hotel and we were finally able to connect with the owner who was honestly very sorry for our experience and offered the guide's excuse (which did not match his when we met the next day). Owner and guide very nice but our experience was disappointing. This is not an inexpensive private experience and we enjoyed learning about the cultural eating habits of the locals; however, the tour did not live up to the website. We were expecting small bites along the way to get a real sense of the depth of flavors. Our guide had a great personality and seemed to know many people along the way but he kept asking what we would like to eat. We reminded him that we were there for the Won-Ton-A-Thon (whatever that entrailed). I felt like this tour guide should be the expert. We should have been asked what we would never want to try (e.g., fish that were alive on the plate) and then taken his recommendations for all the rest. We enjoyed viewing the markets, dried food shops, etc. But we would never do this again.

Incredible experience!!. If you want to really learn about Hong Kong- do not miss Little Adventures in Hong Kong! I spent and absolutely incredible day with Daisann during my brief visit to Hong Kong. Daisann makes every effort to customize her tour. Since I was traveling to Asia for the first time, I really wanted to get a glimpse into the culture of Hong Kong . Her understanding of the culture , combined with her intelligence and sensitivity made this experience a truly enjoyable day. Daisann took me into neighborhoods I never would have found on my own, explained the medicinal, symbolic, and culture significance of the foods/ herbs used in cooking and healing. We were able to wander around Sheung Wan without being too obvious as there were only 2 of us and Daisann speaks Cantonese! My lunch experience was also fantastic- could have never navigated on my own and was one of the best ways to taste some delicious examples of dim sum. I would recommend without hesitation for someone who is only spending a few days or a repeat traveler.

A Great Day in Hong Kong. From the first email contact with Daisann to the actual tour itself, we couldn't have asked for a more professional and caring individual to show us around Hong Kong.In describing our expectations to Daisann prior to our tour, we asked that she design the tour around the local markets, history of Hong Kong, ect... and no shopping. We were leaving it all up to her and she certainly delivered beyond our anything we expected.From the temples, the spice shops, the local food markets, the history of Hong Kong, everything was described to us with such knowledge and passion.Lunch and the stop for tea were outstanding as well.We have booked many similar tour companies throughout our travels around the world and Little Adventures in Hong Kong rank in the top 2.We will certainly return for another visit and will be booking Little Adventures in Hong Kong without any hesitation.Thank you again Daisann.

A fun and delicious way to spend a Saturday morning. Take this tour if you're interested in more than just roaming from restaurant to restaurant mentally crossing off a list of "must eats". We were given a four-hour food tour of Sheung Wan as an awesome wedding gift. We recently moved to Hong Kong, and learned so many new things about the city.Daisann was great. She took us to local places that might not show up on openrice (or even have menus in English) but were popular with those in the know. She gave another dimension to the yummy food we tried (roast pork, dim sum, milk tea, pineapple buns, herbal tea) by mixing in lively stories about the neighbourhood and the history of Hong Kong in general. She was willing to change our itinerary during the course of the tour to follow whatever took our interest. Most of all, her obvious passion for Hong Kong was catching and we looked at this city through new eyes. Thank you Daisann!

A fantastic weekend in Hong Kong. We are a family of 3 visiting Hong Kong for the first time end March 2013. When planning our travel to Asia, we understood that we needed some professional guiding to explore Hong Kong during our short 3 days stay. We found Little Adventures in Hong Kong on Trip Advisor and contacted them for an offer. Very quickly we received answer from Daisann with proposals for how to spend the valuable time in the city. We agreed on 2 half day tours which worked very well for us. Daisann helped us to explore the city further than the shopping centers and high buildings. We came home with a pretty good impression about how it is to live in Hong Kong today, but also how it was to live there before all the construction works and retail industry "took over" the city. We also had some good food experience with a Dim Sum lunch, some streetfood etc. We can really recommend Daisann for your next visit to Hong Kong.

Do you really want to experience Hong Kong?. I've always wanted to visit Hong Kong. We only had 3 days in town on a 3 week tour of Asia, so there wasn't any time to waste. We found LIttle Adventures on Trip Advisor. From the first contact with Daisann, they were polite, helpful, and informative. I started by describing what I thought we wanted, and, while they were happy to customize any tour, we ended up going with their recommendations. Janice was our tour guide. She was extremely knowledgeable of every aspect of the tour. She walked us through parts of Hong Kong that we probably wouldn't have found, and definitely wouldn't have understood. From temples that I would have walked by without noticing, to back street food markets that I wouldn't have had a clue of what things were, Janice described everything. The additional cultural knowledge she imparted on us was exactly what we were looking for. All of our questions were answered, and in a short time we really got a great view of the real Hong Kong.

Fantastic, Tailored Experience. For my first trip to Hong Kong, I really wanted to immerse myself in the food culture. I knew with a language barrier and only a short amount of time, I was going to have a really difficult time going it alone. I reached out to a few different tour guides, but Little Adventures got back to me with exactly what I was looking for. We customized the entire tour, from length to topics to destinations, to make sure I saw exactly what I wanted to, and discovered things I didn't know I wanted to see. By touring one-on-one, I was able to get all my questions answered, and veer off of our planned itinerary as changes came to mind. If you are passionate about food and really want to dive deep, I very strongly recommend Little Adventures in Hong Kong.

No better way to start your Hong Kong journey. I had long dreamed of traveling to Hong Kong, that unique intertwine of Southern Chinese and British cultures. But even more than it's fascinating history, I was drawn by the idea of eating real Cantonese food in a predominantly Cantonese city. I've become fairly proficient in eating locally and deliciously in Europe & Latin America, but I knew my very limited knowledge of spoken & written Cantonese would be an impediment to a full and satisfying experience in Hong Kong. Finding Little Adventures seemed like it might be the perfect solution, and it was -in spades. Daisann - who has seen much of the world as an extremely accomplished travel journalist - fell in love with Hong Kong and has made it her home, and her passion shows. I would highly recommend the full 5 hour Won-Ton-A-Thon and suggest that once you give her an outline of your areas of culinary interest you leave the details in her very capable hands. She will give you plenty of options within the framework.As others have mentioned, it's not just the meals themselves, but the larger context Daisann provides by taking you to the markets and purveyors that supply many of the restaurants around the city, and in some cases, around the world. You'll finally be able to identify those wondrously strange things you might have come across in your local Asian market, and you'll come away with new knowledge about what gives a particular dish it's color, texture, & flavor. And the restaurant experiences are greatly enhanced by Daisann's facility with the language - she'll order the best and most interesting things on the menu and if they're out of something or the recipe has changed she finds out the why and how. My little adventure was a great beginning to a fantastic week in Hong Kong and made my time there richer, deeper, and tremendously resonant.

The Best Travel Resource in Hong Kong. No guide book could deliver the same quality of experience! This was my first visit to Hong Kong with my husband that was working. A friend recommended Little Adventures to me as I was alone during the day to explore Hong Kong. The guided walking tour was the best! We navigated the city and local area by using taxis, subways, boats and feet. The depth of my guide's knowledge was astounding and went from the historical beginnings of Hong Kong to its current state and beyond. My questions kept coming over the 5 hour tour. The overview of Hong Kong I received as a customized tour was invaluable. Simply a must if you want to enjoy and learn about Hong Kong as well as the surrounding region.

In The Know. I moved to Hong Kong a few months ago and have learned to make my way around Hong Kong just fine. But when my family came to visit for the holidays, I knew I needed backup. Sure, I could take them to the Peak and order them some dim sum (provided there was an English menu). But when it came to telling the story of Hong Kong - connecting the street-level sights with the city's history and culture - I didn't speak the right language. Janice was our interpreter for a morning, and a great one at that. The tour unfolded beautifully. She started with the basics in Sheung Wan - deciphering the dried-food stalls of sheung wan - and as the day unfolded adjusted the tour based on her perception of our interests (chinese medicine, for example). One of our party had recently had knee surgery, and was a little slower on her feet. I especially appreciated that our tour cut a relatively flat path through hilly Sheung Wan.

Foodie Heaven. My husband and I are big foodies, and so on our recent trip to Hong Kong of course we wanted to explore the local cuisine. Since we live in New York, we already knew the basics of Cantonese food from visits to Chinatown so we were looking for someone to guide us to a deeper level of knowledge about the cuisine. I found Little Adventures in Hong Kong through Trip Advisor, and they delivered exactly what we were looking for and then some. The experience from start to finish was professional, and we loved being able to decide what and where we wanted to eat. We also felt it was a tremendous value, because even before we arrived in Hong Kong Daisann was helping us with answers to our many questions about hotels, neighborhoods, and restaurants.I can't believe how much delicious eating we packed into only a few short hours. We actually ate dim sum twice, once at an old fashioned tea house, and then later at a gourmet restaurant where we would have been utterly lost without her to translate the Chinese menus (they had an English menu, but like most Chinese restaurants the best dishes are on the daily menus printed on little slips of paper in Chinese). We ate amazing roast goose, a perfect little bowl of won ton noodles, and we still managed to get in some walking around the enormous herbal and dried food market in the center of town, with Daisann identifying every unusual ingredient (and then later pointing them out to us and explaining how they were used in the food we were eating)It was our travel fantasy to eat like Hong Kongers in Hong Kong, and thanks to Little Adventures, that's exactly what we did. Highly recommended for foodies who want to get to that next level of understanding of Chinese food.

Get a guidebook instead. Good: My favourite part was going through the dry seafood markets and getting to know what each weird looking food item is and getting to go into local restaurants for food. (Then again, before I left the airport, I found a guidebook that has the food items listed, costing only HK$180.)Bad: Unless you have the cash to spare, don't book. The tour is informative but it's ridiculously expensive. The starting place at Fringe Club is nasty to get to. It is my first time doing a private tour. Probably not used to the system or more work needs to be done by the tour company, the privacy level drives an awkward feeling at times, what makes it harder was that I had to pretend everything was fine to keep things going.Conclusion: Not convinced by this tour. I would still prefer a guidebook.

Dim sum, fish bladders and apartments.. Daisann's hugely insightful and entertaining 3 1/2 hour personal tour last week was more than we expected and excellent value for money. Not only was she knowledgeable about food, culture and history of Sheung Wan and HK generally, but she has a real passion for the city overall and we were inspired by her enthusiasm, which meant we were able to enjoy subsequent days on our own walks much more. Hong Kong architecture and the "mystery dried things" in Chinese medicine shops now have much deeper understanding attached to them, and I am proud to say "I've eaten goose feet" (and quite enjoyed them!) By booking with LAIHK I felt we got a completely unique experience and would not hesitate in recommending them to others who want an intelligent insightful few hours in Hong Kong.

Wonderful experience - so worth it!. My husband and I booked a 5 hour Wonton-a-thon tour with Daisann and had an amazing time. We both love to eat and planned our trip around all the food we wanted to try. We started our Hong Kong trip with Daisann and spent several hours eating our way through Hong Kong Island. All the restaurants and food stalls that she took us too were delicious, and she gave us wonderful recommendations for the remainder of the trip. Initially, I was not sure that we needed this tour as I had done quite a bit of internet research (Openrice.com, Chowhound.com, food blogs) and felt that I could find the best places to eat on my own. But many of the places that Daisann took us to were much better than the ones I found on my own. Plus the tour was about more than just the food. She was a source of tremendous knowledge about Hong Kong's history and culture, food-related and otherwise. For 2 Asian-Americans who grew up eating the best Chinese food in SF and LA (and I speak Mandarin and read Chinese), this tour was still so worth it to introduce us to Hong Kong. Highly recommended!

Exceptional tour!. My husband and I very highly recommend Daisann’s 4 ½ hour “Essential Hong Kong” food and walking tour. For our first visit to Hong Kong we wanted to truly experience the culture and better understand the people, food, sites and neighborhoods. We booked through Daisann’s company after considerable research and feel that our customized tour exceeded our expectations. As others have mentioned, our tour also included sites and restaurants that we would not have discovered on our own and we greatly appreciated Daisann’s expertise and suggestions. In a city that could have been overwhelming we easily navigated back streets and busy markets, covered a large area on foot and still had time for dim sum at two, very different restaurants. Daisann’s keen eye, in-depth knowledge and incredible life experiences contributed not only to our enjoyment of our tour but to the remainder of our stay, as we were much better able to understand and appreciate what we were seeing. Daisann is very bright, personable and fun to be around and she truly helped us fall in love with an extraordinary city. We consider her tour one of the absolute highlights of our visit.

Amazing neighborhood walk!. My wife and I have been to Hong Kong each year for the past three years, usually just passing through from other vacations, this year we wanted to visit and understand Hong Kong. We booked a 4.5 hour tour with Daisann, it was the perfect experience! We did a neighborhood exploration and grazing tour that finished with an amazing Dim Sum lunch. I'm Chinese and my mom grew up in Hong Kong, so I'm familiar with many of the Chinese foods that we ate and somewhat familiar with the types of markets we toured, but often I've felt like I was watching a silent film of everything I saw, not really understanding what I was walking by or seeing. Daisann, really gave us a true understanding of the neighborhoods of Hong Kong, showing us what the markets were selling, and the specialization of each of the stores. Then there was the food! It wasn't just about the markets, but it was a tour of the small specialty restaurants, milk tea and toast, congee, wonton, egg tarts, and finally dim sum. I was familiar with all of these foods, but I've never experienced the quality as I did on this tour! This was the highlight of our visit!One other thing that this tour gave us was the confidence to just go into any food stand or restaurant and eat!

Very Nice Tour. We had a great time walking around and EATING with Daisann! We booked 4.5 hours and I'm pretty sure we even went over a bit. Daisann was very eager to have us taste all the local specialties and her passion for the food, culture, and history of Hong Kong really showed. Yes, it was expensive. But like has been said here before, you get what you pay for. It was totally invaluable to have our own personal guide and to be able to tailor our experience to our personal desires. We opted for the "Won-ton-a-thon" which was a great combination of eating and walking/exploring. We had a long list of "must-try" foods and we got to do almost all of them thanks to this tour. She also walked us around some gorgeous, historic areas and even helped us out with getting a dinner reservation later on that night! Thanks so much to Daisann for really giving us a "taste" of Hong Kong!

Little ADVENTURES, Big MEMORIES.... Wanting to make the most of our first visit to Hong Kong, my husband and I booked the Central Hong Kong and Sheung Wan 4 1/2 hour Food & Walking tour with Daisann McLane, and without a doubt it was the highlight of our visit. The one-on-one tour is a definite bonus, as two people can easily hear everything Daisann had to say (and that with the noise from the streets is most welcome) and of course a small group can move around easily. On our own we would never have discovered any of the places we visited and even if we had, we would never have understood or appreciated what we were seeing. Daisann's knowledge and enthusiasm was evident and the pace she set was leisurely. We weaved our way around streets of old Hong Kong visiting both dry and "wet" markets, to temples, to specialist shops, including ones selling paper replicas to "feed" dead ancestors.We glimpsed local people living their lives and running their businesses. It was just fascinating. We sampled milky Chinese tea and ate thick white bread spread with peanut butter (a local delight) sitting in a funny little restaurant on plastic stools. This reinforced for us how non-touristy our tour was and how lucky we were. Daisann's Cantonese was used throughout and without her knowledge of the language we would never have tasted the best Yum Char ever. Up until then, we had always thought Yum Char was over-rated, but this restaurant changed all that. The specials of the day were all in Cantonese and even if by some miracle we had stumbled across this restaurant (a bit difficult when it is on the third floor) we would have missed so much. We were more than happy to leave it to Daisann tho choose the dishes that showcased this most famous cuisine. I could go on and on, but suffice to say we just LOVED the whole experience, and being with Daisann was like having a friend to show you her special places. We wish there were Little Advenures in every part of the world.Reece & Mick, Gold Coast, Australia

Highly Recommended Food Tour of Hong Kong. Being a foodie and a lover of Chinese cuisine, I contacted Little Adventures in Hong Kong to go on a five hour "Won-Ton-A-Thon" food tour of city. I am also an adventurous eater so I was determined to eat snake soup (which luckily for me happened to be in season). After meeting up with my extremely knowledable and Cantonese-speaking guide Daisann, we visited a dim sum restaurant that catered almost exclusively to the local population (we were the only Westerners in the entire bustling restaurant). The food was phenomenal. Daisann not only chose the most delicious dishes for me to eat but also explained each item in detail. The restaurant was located near the dry markets so I was able to explore this section of the city while en route to do more eating. Per my request, Daisann took me to a special restaurant that served snake soup, which was actually quite satisfying. What really made this tour special was Daisann's intimate knowledge of the food scene in Hong Kong and her ability to tailor the tour to my food preferences. My father, who was in the city on business, met us for lunch at a more upmarket dim sum restaurant that had mouth-watering flash-fried pork buns (definitely worth traveling to Hong Kong solely for these buns!). He is less of an adventurous eater so Daisann made sure to order some less exotic dishes as well. If you are looking for an experience where you will get to eat your way through Hong Kong while learning about this fascinating city, a tour with Little Adventures in Hong Kong is definitely the way to go. Just make sure you come hungry!

Little Adventures in Hong Kong w/ Janice. A buddy and I were in town for a couple days before heading to Thailand. Being from New York, we understand how the hustle and bustle of such a big city can sometimes mask its cultural underpinnings. It's for this reason we chose a private food tour with Little Adventures. I try to do food tours in new cities as I feel it gives me the best access to the true pulse of the city; its traditions, food, drink and the reasons they came to be. In Hong Kong especially, the reasons why are as important as the actual indulgence. The places visited were integral and authentic. Janice was ever-knowledgable and adaptive to our particular ideas (namely, off-the-beaten-path foods). It all culminated in an unforgettable experience in gluttony, adventure and education!

Eating in Hong Kong. My family and I were visiting Hong Kong and wanted a non-tourist experience. Little Adventures did just that! We saw parts of Hong Kong and Kowloon we would never have seen enriching our China experience. Both Janice and Daisann introduced us to incredible restaurants and food. Janice steered us to the best Night Market stalls for the best of Hong Kong tastes. Daisann made Hong Kong come alive with rich history, photography and food. In 30 years of traveling, I have never taken a guided tour and was reluctant to start now. However, the private tour experience of Little Adventures is highly recommended. When we return to Hong Kong my first phone call will be to Little Adventures.

Wonderful and knowledgable guide, super-friendly people - great value!. We contacted Little Adventures in Hong Kong Food and Walking Tours before our trip to Hong Kong because we were interested in Food and Photography and wanted to have a knowledgeable local take us to places we would probably not see on our own. The guys at Little Adventures in Hong Kong Food and Walking Tours were really friendly and helpful as we went through the process of booking and they send us great tips for restaurants and things to do when we arrived. The walking tour was 4 hours and we saw a part of Hong Kong we hadn't come across during our own days of discovering the city. Our guide was really knowledgeable about the food, architecture and the history of Hong Kong and gave a great frame to what we saw on our tour. We ended the tour with a lunch together and it was great to have her recommend food and other restaurants based on what we wanted to experience. I would without doubt book another tour with Little Adventures in Hong Kong Food and Walking Tours should we go back to Hong Kong - it was a great, highly personalised and highly valuable experience.

A great slice of everyday life in Hong Kong Central. I was visiting Hong Kong for a conference and was able to take a day off and was so happy to have found Little Adventures to help me see and feel what life is like in Hong Kong. Two friends were able to join me on the tour. Our guide, Janice was knowledgable, delightful and insightful. From dry markets to wet markets (you'll just have to go on the tour to find out what those are if you don't know!) to temples and some great dim sum, the five hours (slightly extended tour) was some of the best spent time we had in Hong Kong. I have traveled extensively throughout the world and although I am very comfortable getting around unfamiliar locations, I don't always know what I am looking at or the back story. A personal tour with someone who can explain the traditions and culture is invaluable. I highly recommend this tour company!

Little Adventures in Hong Kong Food and Walking Tours - Private Tour;. A first trip to HK for us and although we are pretty independent travellers we wanted to get an insight into the food and culture/traditions around the HK/Chinese cuisine (and knew that we wouldn't be able to fully achieve this alone and without guidance!) so, we took a four hour trip to the Sheung Wan District (with Janice). Although we didn't really know what to expect, we had certain expectations of some of the things the day/tour would cover however, she blew them out of the water!! The trip was terrific, not your everyday 'typical guided tour' and we both thoroughly enjoyed it, learnt so much more than we could have ever imaged and had the opportunity to ask all our questions! We found Janice to be so informative, knowledgeable and easy to be with. It really was a true insight into life, traditions, culture and everyday that we otherwise certainly would not have experienced. Highly recommended.

"The Reluctant Traveler". Recently I was able to accompany my husband on his business trip/seminar to Hong Kong. Admittedly, I’m not the most adventurous soul when it comes to visiting new places, much less a city the size of Hong Kong. However, I was determined to do some exploring and not interested in participating in the generic “excursions for spouses” provided by his company. Before we left I stumbled upon Daisann’s Little Adventures in Hong Kong website. After a few E-mail exchanges I was able to convey what I was hoping to see on this trip. I booked two four hour walks with Daisann and I must say the experience I had exceeded my expectations! Daisann is truly a wonderful traveling companion extremely informative but also intuitive enough to allow the first time visitor to Hong Kong experience the city through their own eyes. Dining was a pleasure because she speaks Cantonese fluently, which is such a plus when you are trying to order food. We ate meals I never would have dreamed of ordering!  When I  returned to the hotel and exchanged stories of the day with the other spouses, it became quite evident  (although I knew it already) that I had a much more diverse and interesting visit to Hong Kong. All I can say is “Money well spent” and many thanks to Daisann for bringing the reluctant explorer out of her shell!

Best Time of Our Lives!. When my wife and I were planning our trip to Hong Kong and came across the Little Adventures in Hong Kong website, we were so excited because we'd been reading Daisann's terrific writing in National Geographic Traveler magazine for years. We emailed her with some questions and then booked a four hour walking with her. It was priced a bit higher than some of the other tour offerings but this was our trip of a lifetime and we wanted the best of everything. Exploring Hong Kong with a professional travel writer was just too good to miss! Well, I have to say that Daisann lived up to all our expectations and then some. She's smart and insightful, tells great stories, knows everything about Hong Kong and took us to places we never would have discovered without her. Best of all, she explained EVERY thing, all the little details about Chinese life in Hong Kong that outsiders like us would certainly never find. After our walk, we went to the most delightful dim sum restaurant. Daisann ordered for us in Cantonese from the Chinese menu, so we got to try things that the locals were eating. The staff were clearly amazed and delighted by this American woman speaking to them in their own language and so were we!This was truly the highlight of our trip to Hong Kong. We are so glad we decided to go the extra mile and book with Daisann instead of joining a tour group and you will be too!

Insightful and delicious!. My Husband and I recently had a 6 day stay in Hong Kong and decided it would be worth organising a private tour. We were both first timers to Hong Kong and I know I was feeling a little overwhelmed with all the things to see and do and so I found I had no idea where to start!After some internet research, I came across Little Adventures in Hong Kong Food and Walking Tours. I found several glowing reviews on Trip Advisor and so I decided to make contact with Diasann to get some more information.The email correspondence was smooth and informative - within a few days we had organised and paid (made easy through paypal) for a 4 hour tour with Janice.Janice agreed to meet us in our hotel lobby on the morning of the tour. We were in the lobby right on 9am and so was she! Because we were staying in Mong Kok (the tour took place in the Central Districit) she gave us a few options on how we could get across to Hong Kong Island. We opted for the MTR, so Janice accompanied us on this trip and gave us some tips for using the subway system - which did help us throughout our trip.We made many food stops including an authentic yum cha breakfast/lunch place - this was one of my favourite places on the tour. Janice told us what we were eating so there was no mystery and she also was able to explain how each item was made. She gave us details history about this kind of eating in Hong Kong while we ate. We would have struggled with a language barrier without her and I probably would have been a little intimated trying to do this on my own!There were many other stops and at each place Janice was able to give us some detailed insight on the food, the people and the history. She was engaging, friendly and knowledgable. She answered all our questions and gave us suggestions for other places to visit and things to see and do for the remainder of our holiday.I am so glad we booked this tour - it was worth every cent and I would highly recommend Little Adventures in Hong Kong Food and Walking Tours to anyone who enjoys food and wants to get to know a bit more of the real Hong Kong. You won't regret it!

Sheung Wan to Central with Jason Tse. If you are only in Hong Kong for a short time, or travelling alone I strongly recommend organising a few hours with a private walking guide, and you could do a lot worse than spend that time with Jason. Jason is working with Little Adventures in Hong Kong with Daisanne Mclane. He knows HK well, can share a wealth of information and share with you the amazing nooks and crannies of this city full of history that so easily would be missed. We weaved through lanes looking at the old shops, understanding how they trade and what they trade for hundreds of dollars! On my request we visited a couple of temples which I loved, and where Jason told me some of the background and traditions. And being a keen photographer i got to enjoy taking photos of the wet markets with old and young selling their fish, fruit and veg. A very enjoyable morning if very hot and sweaty! Wear comfortable footwear, natural loose fabrics and carry and umbrella! Thanks Jason, you were a star. And, in case you are wondering, having schooled in Canada Jason is totally understandable, and happy to answer all your questions!

"thoughtful, meaningful..well worth it". I had only a morning as I transited through Hong Kong, and Daisann made the very most of it for me. She is a thoughtful, knowledgeable, adventurous woman who lead me through hidden street tableaux pointing out unique social and architectural gems. She has dedicated herself to understanding the language, people and culture of the streets of this city. I look forward to another visit and exploring other neighbourhoods with her in the future.

Best tour ever. I recently was fortunate enough to undertake a tour with LIttle Adventures in Hong Kong. My guide for the tour was Janice Leung. She was extremely knowledgable, friendly and with a real and obvious enthusiasm for what she does. Janice discussed with me my particular interests and then proceeded to take me to restaurants the locals go to, historical temples in the back streets, food markets, tea house and much more. After to several visits to Hong Kong I feel I have finally begun to discover the real Hong Kong. Hong Kong is so much more than shops and skyscrapers. Janice engaged me for the entire tour. I will certainly do further tours with Little Adventures in Hong Kong.Well done Janice and Daisann

great tour. this was an wonderful tour. daisann is very passionate about hong kong's history, culture and food and obviously enjoys sharing this with her clients. we spent five hours visiting very local places and i wish it would have been longer! she knew exactly what i was interested in.

a wonderful guide in HK. Daisann was one of the best guides we've had on our travels. Extremely knowledgeable about HK, it's people, food and culture she engaged us throughout the morning as we toured backstreets, street temples and food shops we would never have found without her help and certainly not understood. Her travels around the world and 16 years in HK certainly gave her a great insight and perspective. Highly recommended.

WEALTH of Information, Customized, Friendly, Above Expectations. For our first trip to Hong Kong, with little time to spare, we wanted to find someone who could show us “what we couldn’t find on own”. Daisann made sure that was exactly what we got, in a mere half day booking. When asked if we had any special interests, I mentioned that I would like to know about what happened in the area during WWII. When we met up with her, Daisann had done research, provided us with printouts, and had a plan for our day to encompass what we were looking for. We simply could not have asked for more. Further, she assisted us in planning the rest of our time in Hong Kong, which was immensely helpful. Daisann knows of what she speaks!

What a brilliant way to spend a morning. Daisann was a wonderful host and really good company. She took me around areas I would not have discovered on my own and gave some tips on what to do in my remaining time here too. We had Yum Cha with locals, browsed the local dried food markets and she has a wealth of knowledge about all the things you might be curious about. We also had a special tea from a little street shop, which cured my cough! It was a really lovely morning and I would recommend it to anyone.

If you really want to understand HKG food.... This was my first trip to Hong Kong and I was looking for someone to give me an honest, unadulterated taste of the city. And boy did Daisann deliver. I was taken to places I most likely wouldn't have either found or gone to on my own. We went from tiny, whole in the wall cheap eats to Michelin starred restaurants. And the personal tips and advice are invaluable. It was like having a friend on the ground with an in depth knowledge of the HKG's food scene. She totally customized the trip to my personal tastes and goals. Over the course of two days I had an excellent introduction to Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. I normally always start the first day in any city with a private guided tour, and this was one of the best I've experienced. I plan on coming back to HKG and will definitely seek out Little Adventures in Hong Kong again. There are other, more generic tours, but to me, I think it's worth engaging a specialized tour like Little Adventures in KHG to get the most of your time in this city that has so much to offer.

Brilliant guide and host. My partner and I spent three days with Daisann on a recent visit to Hong Kong. I've visited the city many times before, but this was the first time that I've really felt like I experienced as it should be experienced. We ate brilliantly, we saw things that we wouldn't have otherwise, and Daisann allowed us to live like locals for a short time. I would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending Daisann and her tours. Simply brilliant!

Excellent Tour. While tagging along on a business trip with my husband in Hong Kong I arranged to have a private tour with Daisann. What a wonderful way to spend a morning! Daisann is no ordinary tour operator. She is an American journalist who has written for a number of prestigious publications and has lived in Hong Kong for at least a decade. Her insights into Hong Kong and its culture come not only from her obvious intelligence but from the fact that she speaks and reads Cantonese. Daisann is sophisticated while also being very warm and approachable. The tour starts at a private club in a historic building. Her warm welcome made me comfortable immediately and I felt like I was seeing a friend! She tailors the tour to your interests or needs. We visited various neighborhoods, temples, medicine shops, and restaurants. I would have never discovered these places on my own. One memorable spot was visiting a hidden part of a temple that you never see. What a fascinating exploration. I am a foodie and could not miss the dim sum lunch at an authentic restaurant. Having Daisann order in Chinese was an entirely different experience as the English menu did not seem to offer the same description. Such a memorable meal. As a matter of fact, I keep the dim sum menus in my purse so when I return to Hong Kong I can order Daisann’s recommended dim sum.

A Visit To A Hidden World. Old Hong Kong still exists, but you need a guide who knows where it is and what it means. Daisanne loves Hong Kong – both the gleaming modern city and the frayed Cantonese side streets -- and her love for the town’s history, food and people shines through.Some of the things Daisanne introduced me to: A time warp of a café in Kowloon that has not changed since Bruce Lee ate there. How to judge the quality of jade jewelry. The incredible cold pudding at the Yee Shun Milk Company. A dim sum parlor so authentic we were the only Westerners. And the tour started at the Foreign Correspondents’ Club, a diplomatic haunt that feels like something out of a John Le Carré novel – because it is.Daisanne’s tours are customized to fit your interests, and, as a veteran travel writer, she’s versed in the culture of the entire region. Other operators offer cheaper packaged tours, but, if you’re flying all the way to East Asia, you might want a higher-end, personalized experience.

Amazing day in HK. I can not recommend strongly enough. We took a culinary tour but also learned so much about the history and people of this amazing city. Daisann is extremely knowledgeable and just a great person to spend the day with.We will taking another tour when we return

Excellent private walking tour of Hong Kong. This was a thoughtfully crafted walking tour based on my interests in the history of Hong Kong and its current culture. Starting at the Foreign Correspondents Club, Daisann shared her city with me. From historical colonial buildings to fascinating neighborhood markets to a beautiful city garden, Daisann spent the morning introducing me to her city. There were charming details like the elderly men "taking their birds for a daily walk". The tour ended with a delicious lunch including amazing pork dumplings. If you want a customized walking tour with an intelligent, pleasant guide who will share her love of Hong Kong with you, hire Daisann! She's wonderful!

Incredible experience!. I had such a fantastic tour of Hong Kong! Daissan knew all the most wonderful and Tasty places to go- She tailored the adventure to me, was incredibly knowledgeable, and we became fast friends! Couldn't recommend more highly!

Strongly recommended from a first time visitor. We spent a magical morning in the company of Daisann on what was our first visit to Hong Kong. We did the tour on the second day of a five day trip and this really added to our perspective of Hong Kong for the remainder of our trip. From weaving in and out of the fascinating food markets, to gaining an insight into the beliefs of the after life to privileged glimpses of sacred temples, we really had a magical introduction to this amazing place. Daisann's passion for Hong Kong shines throughout and the whole experience finished with an expert trip through a restaurant menu and well earned and most pleasant lunch. I cannot recommend this tour highly enough.

Amazing, Informative, Gastronomic and Nostalgic. My FAVORITE thing to do in Hong Kong is the Little Adventures in Hong Kong tours. We've gone to places that I didn't know existed in Hong Kong - many of them being removed for new buildings and communities, which is the saddest part. The tours are filled with history, culture, food finds, great shopping tips, and great food. I took meticulous notes so that I can go back to the many places that we didn't have the time or room left in our stomachs to try. I've never had more amazing congee, and the little nooks and crannies of street food and specialty food shops makes me yearn to go back to Hong Kong. I couldn't give Little Adventures in Hong Kong a higher recommendation, whether you're a local or a visitor.

Daisann is wonderful. I was in Hong Kpng on business and only had a day free for myself. Daisann made that day the most memorable of my trip. Right from the start she made me feel like more than just a client by taking me to her club for tea- what a great way to feel the old British style in Hong Kong. Daisann made Hong Kong come alive for me. When she found out I was a doctor she explained the health care system to me and took me to a traditional Chinese pharmacy. She is super intelligent and well spoken and she completely understood what I wanted to get from my Hong Kong trip, and made the day a perfect one for me from start to finish- including the best dim sum Ive ever had in my life.( She ordered everything in Chinese!) If you want to leave Hong Kong feeling like you really know what makes the city tick, you absolutely should get in touch with Daisann- she's pure gold.

Excellent - a perfect way to discover the heart of Hong Kong. I've done this twice with Daisann, and it's been a treat both times. This is a highly customized and personalized way of discovering Hong Kong. Daisann does a fantastic job in researching & tailoring the itinerary. When I made a vague request to see some Hakka heritage, she went out of her way to scout out villages to visit. Daisann is a walking wikipedia of Hong Kong history. We had great conversations about food, history, architecture, religion, politics and culture. In one taxi ride, after she'd told me an interesting story, the Taxi driver turned around and thanked HER for telling him about HIS hometown town :-) With a camera to capture pictures and a notebook to capture stories .. Little Adventures is a perfect way to discover Hong Kong !

A true adventure!. After many trips to Hong Kong, I was certain that I had seen most everything that truly intrigued me in this fabulous city. I was referred by someone in HK to Daisanne Mclane at Little Adventures in Hong Kong--what a fortunate thing that was for me. After brief, but detailed, questions about my wishes, Ms arranged a walking tour that lasted several hours. It was perfectly paced for my comfort, and completely fascinating. I was immersed in the life in this city as I had never been, and it was so much fun! She is a delightful, knowledgeable, and professional guide.Especially if your time in Hong Kong is brief, I recommend contacting her--you do not want to waste a minute here. This is far beyond any of the standard tours. I hope your experience will be as wonderful as mine! I cannot wait to return.

Tailor-made tour. With only 8 hours between flights in and out of Hong Kong we wanted to make the most of our visit, and Amy didn't disappoint! Communication leading up to the trip was excellent; and on the day she made sure we got a flavour of the city via the full range of transport options. She made sure our young son was kept interested and entertained throughout, which meant the whole tour was a pleasure for all of us. We saw the sights, sampled the food and made it back to the airport in good time. We would highly recommend Amy, particularly if you don't have a lot of time to get to know Hong Kong, as she will make sure you get the experience you want.

Great day with Amy at Hong Kong Greeters. We spent the better part of a day with Amy visiting Hong Kong's various corners and had a fabulous time. Amy listened to what we were wanted to experience and arranged for an interesting, fun and diverse tour of the city. Having lived in Hong Kong for quite a while now, Amy has a lot of knowledge of the area and this makes the tour very worthwhile. We can thoroughly recommend a Hong Tour with her.

Bravo Amy!!!!. Amy is quite simply awesome, my wife arranged all of the trip with Amy before we arrived, we had about 4 hours to see HK, and Amy made it worth while. We met at the airport and Amy guided us through the travel system, explaining everything we spotted en route.In the short time we had, we made Kowloon, Hong Kong and the Peak. Hong Kong was but far the most packed and we were shown everything to make the trip memorable, the scars on a lion, too the fish markets that entertained our 5 year old for ages.The detail of information passed on was immense, not just what we were shown, but also the out of sync questions about smaller insignificant buildings that we asked about, out of the blue was met with detailed responses.Amy is a well resourced guide who should make any trip to HK a trip to remember.

What a lovely introduction to this amazing city. If you want a small intimate tour with a personable knowledgeable guide I would highly recommend Hong Kong greeters. Amy took us to places that we may not have gotten to on our own.We both felt that her explanations were spot on.from the meeting place at the clock tower to riding the subway ( underground) she made our travels easy. We visited the Kowloon Walled City, Wong Tai Sin Temple and Sham Shui Po for a chance to try some local snack food and then will finished at the Ladies Market. I don't think we would have found the bird market or fish market easily on our own.The small group setting ( of 6 ) made it a wonderful way to spend the morning.Thank you Amy.

Our Great Day With Amy. Amy you were awesome! We only had two days in Hong Kong and messed up and didn't plan to get an all day tour planned. The day before we started emailing folks in the top 10 on TripAdvisor. Amy had a cancelation and we had her the next day for the entire day. She adapted to our long list of 'must sees' and packed a lot into the day we had. She also told and emailed us after on the remaining things in our list so we could do them the other day we were there. She was awesome.

Outstanding Tour. We booked with Amy for a driving tour around Hong Kong and it was the best decision we could have made! We managed to go all over the harbor, island and mainland and see all of the sites. We hit the flower markets, bird market, went on a fishing boat ride around the harbor, the peak and even snuck in a visit to the Ritz Carlton for a view from 103 floors up! We also stopped for a great local lunch that we both enjoyed immensely. She was great at explaining the history of Hong Kong and was always ready with answers to our questions. I highly recommend her tour and would totally book with her again!

Amy - just amazing!. Amy guided my parents on a half day tour of Hong Kong. These were no straightforward travellers - both of them being visually and hearing impaired but very independent people. A trip on their own around the amazing city of Hong Kong was not an option and Amy came to our rescue. Incredibly good communication to ensure their time was well utilised. They raved about their time there. Amy helped with accommodation option suggestions and even personally drove them to the airport and saw them to their check in after it was apparent a taxi service would not be appropriate for their onward leg to London. Just outstanding. You are absolutely in the right hands by using Hong Kong travellers - but it blew my parents away how much the impact of having Amy as their guide shaped a fantastic day.

Hong Kong Tour. Amy met us at our hotel. The next four hour were crammed with information on negotiating the public transport systems, best attractions and historical sites. We had previously discussed where and what we wanted to see and the time line needed. All in all without Hong Kong Greeters Tour we would not have managed to see a fraction of the delights of Hong Kong and Macau.

2 days Tour at Hkg. We had an excellent two days Hkg Tour with Amy.Our 9 years old son was very happy to walk or using tram,metro,bus,Taxi.Amy is very well organized and can modify the path of route depends on you and weather etc.She nicely entertain our son with run races or showing interesting things at markets ;) It was very hot during our all stay at Hkg therefore we Had luck to have Amy because we could skip waiting lines at cable train going to Buddah etc.We did excellent pictures during Tour.We went for nice dim sum at Aberdeen and boat Tour at local Venice:) With Amy you could find out a lot of history of Hkg as well local habits etc.Our favorite place was Stanley were in the end of Tour we could relax in nice restaurant. Amy is doing her tours very professional and She must see that you enjoy this! It's not 6hrs tour because time is not So important,important is that you enjoy the Hkg Tour.Apart of this must say Thank you very much for excellent tours,taking care about us and later on sending more tips where we should go and look.Appreciate this very much and your tips Amy were very helpfull. We are in touch. We were first polish Family with Amy.Do not forget Amy " Osmiernica" ;) Konrad still Remember Octopus pass ;))Regards and Thank you very much for all your efforts to make our Tour during hot days So "Cool"!!!

Amy's tour.. Amy was our day tour guide for day1 of our stay in Hong Kong. Amy showed us exactly what we wanted to see and with her extensive knowledge of the history we found out more than we could of hoped. The pace was spot on and Amy showed us how to use the public transport system, and we had a great lunch. I have no hesitation in recommending her service for a relaxed informative day. Warm regards Mark and Marie.

Grand Tour of Hong Kong in a Day. Amy did a fantastic job of maximizing our day together on our 8-hour tour of Hong Kong. This is a private tour, so you can request the length of your tour and what you would like to see. Amy also has lots of good suggestions. She plans everything carefully and thoroughly to ensure that the day is fun and interesting for everyone.For a small additional charge, Amy met us bright and early at our resort on Lantau Island. She helped us buy our Octopus Cards and we jumped on a ferry to Hong Kong Island, where Amy told us about the history of Central and the feng shui of various buildings. Then, we rode the tram to the top of Victoria Peak and took a stroll along a beautiful, shady path with uncrowded views of Victoria Harbor and Kowloon. Our morning snack at a Peak restaurant was fun - there were puffs filled with ice cream, bubble tea and fresh lemonade available.While in the area, we took a double-decker bus to Hong Kong Park. Be sure to sit in the top story and in the front for an especially fun ride! At the park, we enjoyed the Museum of Teaware, lotus ponds, gardens and the wonderful fountain. Hong Kong has one of the best mass transit systems in the world and Amy is an expert at getting around. After a stroll through a bustling outdoor market and sampling some exotic fruits, we climbed on the MTR for a ride out to the New Territories. There we visited the Hong Kong Heritage Museum in Shatin. The museum is modern, but built in a courtyard style and is quite beautiful. I loved the traditional Chinese brush paintings representing the seasons. There were also amazing exhibits about ancestor worship, traditional medicine and the fishing village at Tai O on Lantau Island. But, what I found most fascinating was the huge exhibit about Cantonese Opera - staging, costumes, etc. We zipped back to Kowloon on the MTR and stopped at a small shop to sample some snacks favored by local school kids. Then, it was on to the Wong Tai Sin Temple. Don't miss this colorful temple full of Buddhist, Taoist, and Confucian worshipers. Be sure to see the twelve zodiac animals and rub the dragon's paw for good luck! The temple claims to make every wish come true! Be sure to try throwing the fortune sticks and do see one of the fortune tellers.Our last stop was at the nearby Chi Lin Nunnery and Nan Lian Garden. Both are very tranquil, beautiful places and a great way to end the day.We could never have done this much in one day without Amy's expert guidance, knowledge and good humor. She really is a fantastic guide. And, you'll feel as though you made a new friend.

Walking Tour of Hong Kong with Amy. This walking tour of Hong Kong with Amy was amazing. She showed us combinations of both old world culture and new world thinking. Highlights included a visit to the old, outdoor markets of Wan Chai where people come for the foods for their meals, a trip to the Peak to see the city and harbor unfold itself beneath us (breathtaking), and a visit to the ancient Pak Tai temple. Lunch at Maxims Palace was also wonderful. Amy is deeply knowledgeable about Hong Kong and is one of the nicest and friendliest people we've ever met.

Excellent taster tour of HKG. Amy was recommended to us by neighbours at home. She was so relaxed and easy going with the kids it felt like we were being shown around by an old friend rather than someone we just met that day. Amy did her best to accommodate all our tastes and adapted the itinerary well to the weather (heavy rain!). She was especially good with the kids and our 5yo warmed to her very quickly and was happy to hold her hand all afternoon! We would gladly book Amy again to explore some more.

Family trip. Amy was fantastic. I totally agree with whoever said if you only have a little time in Hong Kong you have to do this! Although the trip was booked for four hours, we really appreciated Amy staying on to help us get into a great restaurant and figure out the menu.

Amazing day in Hong Kong. Our stay in Hong Kong was short as it was a port stop for a cruise we were on. We decided a guide would be the best way to use our short time and Amy didn't disappoint. She always responded promptly to any emails as we made arrangements. Amy met us at the port and we were off for our 1/2 day tour. The sites were amazing and she did a good job of keeping our 9 year old engaged so the adults could enjoy the tour as well. Hong Kong is a beautiful city and we hope to make it back for a longer stay. Would book again without hesitation.

If you only have a few days, do THIS!. Or do this anyway, it was great! We had 3 days in Hong Kong at the end of a 2 week Southeast Asia trip and left the planing until the last minute for this piece. We contacted Amy a day and a half before we were to arrive. She was great about answering immediately and working with us. She was booked (reading the reviews I can see why) but arranged for us to tour with a colleague Melanie K. Melanie was EXCELLENT, low key, friendly, super knowledgable and flexible in what we wanted to see. We went out on one of the hottest days in Hong Kong and were able to see a lot as well as take interesting breaks. We had lunch in a Dim Sum place we would have never found as tourists-very cool. Also in walking/touring with her we learned how to navigate the city with various forms of transportation so were able to explore on our own the next day (although we talked about hiring her again because she was so great). Two specifics that we loved 1) We really enjoyed talking to Melanie about everyday life in Hong Kong...education, a bit of politics and history and general info about living in a big city 2) Melanie sent us a follow up email with restaurant names, things to do the next day, and walking maps to several places we had talked about visiting. Anyway, I think all of these reviews are right on- if you are a first timer, this is an excellent way to get to know Hong Kong! PS we're in our late 50s and the walking was totally fine.

Awesome and incredible days in Hong Kong with a great person !!!. We had 4 days to visit Hong Kong and Macau, and since the moment that we contacted Amy we felt that this is going to be special, she provided us great recommendations and matched with what we wanted to do in Hong Kong and Macau. We traveled with our 2 kids (5 and 4 years old) and Amy with her incredible charisma guide us through the main places of Hong Kong feeling that we were exploring the city with an old friend that has a lot of experience and knowledge of Hong Kong. My kids immediately had a great link with her and happily we enjoyed every steps that we made, taking trains, trams, ferries, buses, taxis; visiting temples, or eating local food.Definitely Amy is not only a certified and experienced guide, she is a person who adapts and customizes the tour according of what you need, and in our case was perfect.The next time when we come back to Hong Kong she will be our first person to meet again. We will never forget Amy and her lovely family too!!!.Thanks Amy for everything, see you next time !!!!

It was like visiting your friend - only with lots of knowledge and history thrown in :). We booked a full day tour as we had 10 hour stop over in Hong Kong. When you meet Amy, it feels like you have known her forever. She gets what you want to experience and see, and she manages to squeeze the maximum out of the few hours we have got. The kids loved her as well. We had the best time in Hong Kong thanks to Amy!!!

Amazing tour and great recommendations for our further stay x. We booked Amy for a whole day tour (8hours). The Tour was adjusted to our interests and we had a great time with her exploring this amazing city. She made notes about the stuff we were especially interested in and sent me an email with recommendations for our further stay the next day. We did almost everything she suggested and all her suggestions were great. Thank you Amy!

Like having a knowledgable relative living in Hong kong!. Amy is not a tour guide. She is more like a relative you have that lives in Hong Kong and you are visiting. She has an incredible personality and unbelievable people skills. Our family of four felt at easy with her within 10 minutes of meeting her. I have two daughters with very different personalities, but Amy fully connected with them, and they ended up loving her. Amy took us on a "six" hour tour of Lantau Island. I use quotation marks because, even though the contract stipulated we would be using her services for six hours, she decided to go extra early to the ferry station just to make sure we had good seats on the first boat. also, at the end of the day, she even volunteered to take us safely back to the hotel. We declined, but you could tell she meant it. Oh, and after the visit, she emailed us to see if we had made it back, and included a very lengthy list of recommendations for restaurants, coffee houses, markets, and even shops to buy a backpack. We cannot thank her enough.anyway, back to the tour. We took the ferry to Tai O. She quickly navigated the narrow streets and made time to stop for snacks (I had previously mentioned to her that I love street food). She even bought fruit and shared it with us. We took a short boat ride around the area, and came back to tour the island a little more. The day was very hot and humid, so sensing we were tired, she changed the schedule and took us to a local restaurant to have delicious pizza and coffee.After we were done, we took a bus to the Big Buddha and she went up the 268 steps with us. I mean, come on, she could have just said "I'll wait for you guys here", but that is not Amy. On our way to the cable cars, she stopped and insisted on buying Ice cream for my daughter. Just like that!I think you get the idea. I would highly recommend her to anyone visiting Hong Kong, and looking for the best time ever. Amy, Thank you so much, My family and I love you!

Memorable Morning AAA+++. My daughter and I arranged a 5 day trip to Hong Kong in April and I had no idea where to start. After doing many endless nights of research on my own accord I decided it was best to do a guided tour on our first morning into Hong Kong with someone who knew the City and its culture. Amy was the perfect person! From the moment I sent off an enquiry on Tripadvisor she was responsive and helpful to my questions of her. The tour was fantastic very informative and very Hong Kong! We used all modes of transport which was fun, a small group so easy to move around together and wandered streets, markets & temples we would have never have found on your own. On top of a terrific morning of tastings, culture and sightseeing, Amy took us to lunch at the famous Maxims Dum Sum House at the City Hall. This was much needed after a few hours of walking and talking!! Amy was the perfect tour guide, informative, witty & just a lovely person. Post our tour we asked many more questions of Hong Kong of where to go and what to do. Guess what that evening an email in my inbox with step by step answers to the questions we had asked. I would have no hesitation on recommending Amy to any traveller to trust and be guided in the amazing City of Hong Kong.

Amazing Expereince. Amy is incredibly knowledgeable, nothing is too much trouble and she has huge energy. We had a wonderful day exploring, eating and sharing Hong Kong and went to new and exciting places beyond the tourist route at times. Can not wait for the next our we are able to go on with her.

A delightful, personal and insightful tour. A highlight of our holiday.. We booked a walking tour with Amy based on her overwhelmingly positive reviews on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. Amy was a wonderfully helpful, friendly and insightful guide. We felt completely comfortable, like we were being shown around the city by a close friend. Amy took us to some well known sights as well as a number of lesser known gems that we were thrilled to discover. After the tour, Amy was incredibly helpful, suggesting and directing us to more fantastic locations. We can not recommend Amy and Hong Kong Greeters highly enough, they were simply a pleasure to deal with in every aspect. Thank you Amy!

Amy, more a friend!. I cld arrange Amy to guide my wife and myself in HK, after reading the reviews abt her in Tripadvisor.Amy was more a friend than just a person doing guiding! Her insight and knowledge of HK, delivered in an interesting and passionate way made the tour more entertaining.She had patiently replied to all my mails expressing my too many doubts, pertaining to all aspects of HK, even a couple of months before my arrival in to HK! She took us for an all day tour in her car to all the interesting places in HK. She was very accommodative to our needs and very helpful. She took us to the floating restaurant and helped order a fantastic lunch. She has a great wealth of knowledge when it comes to shopping, wherein she can help you identify the right shops, for the specific goods you require, and most importantly, help in getting the price down!Thanks Amy for a lovely day at HK! .

A fantastic day out. Meeting up with Amy was like seeing an old friend! We had such a great time and even though we were only in HK for two nights, we were able to see so much of HK with her. Despite having two young children with me, Amy was able to tailor our tour to suit them and everything was great from the birds in the market to our trip on the ferry and all the strange new fruits to see and taste in the markets. I can't recommend her highly enough.

Wonderful introduction to Hong Kong with Amy. Friends of ours recommended Amy to us and she did not let that recommendation down. We had a wonderful time and got to see and experience parts of Hong Kong that we would not have done without Amy. From the ferry ride to the wet markets and then Victoria Peak and back down to the heart of Hong Kong with all sorts of added information, insights and tips along the way.Amy also went the extra mile for us by sending us an email later that detailed where we had been and also recommendations for other things to do (and transport options) for the rest of our stay in Hong Kong. Also sent invaluable information about where to get good coffee!!!Overall it was a wonderful experience with Amy and I would highly recommend this service.

Amy - an invaluable asset.. Amy was recommended to us by some friends and proved to be an invaluable asset to our trip. It was our first experience of Hong Kong so Amy offered detailed advice about how to travel quickly and cheaply to our hotel from the Airport as well as recommending several restaurants. We took a half day group tour with her on our first morning. There were only six people in the group which Amy said was her maximum number. This made the tour feel personal, friendly and fun. Amy is a mine of knowledge about Hong Kong delivering information in an interesting and enthusiastic manner. The details of the tour have been mentioned by other reviewers so suffice to say it is well worth doing. At the end of the tour we all went to a great restaurant and ate dim sum together! After the tour Amy emailed details of how to do anything anyone had mentioned they were interesting in doing during their trip and offered to be on hand for any any other advice needed. She really goes above and beyond her remit in a friendly and professional manner. Highly recommended.

Half day group tour. We had never been to Hong Kong before so decided to book this tour before venturing out independently. Although a group tour there were only four of us, my husband and me and a father and son. Amy is an excellent guide, friendly, knowlegeable and full of enthusiasm for Hong Kong. It was amazing what she packed into one morning, but at no time did it feel rushed. Everything we'd requested was included in the tour- the Peak Tram, public transport (including the vintage trams), a temple, but I think the highlight for us was wandering around the market in Wan Chai soaking in the atmosphere and tasting a variety of street food.Armed with what we had learned from Amy, we confidently set about exploring more of Hong Kong over the next few days.We highly recommend this tour, both for it's content and for Amy herself.

Excellent Introduction to Hong Kong. Chris Cheng was an exceptional tour guide with a substantial knowledge of Hong Kong's history, culture and architecture. He tailored the day to hit the points of interest we most wanted to see, and provided excellent suggestions for additional sites to see on our own following the 6 hour tour which we took on our first full day in the city. He also got us familiar with using the public transportation system which was very helpful as we continued to explore the area. Amy the owner was very responsive and helpful in getting things set up prior to our visit. I would recommend Hong Kong Greeters in general and Chris specifically to anyone planning to visit Hong Kong.

Exploring Hong Kong with Amy . My wife arranged the tour off trip advisor and Amy was amazing. She told us the best and cheapest way to get from the airport to our hotel and was always available for advice. The tour she took us on was fantastic, we saw all the sights and had a very full day . Amy even sorted our dinner reservations for that night and the following day. We saw so much and Amy's enthusiasm certainly got our holiday off to a cracking start.

Our day with Chris. We recently met with Chris on a rainy day during our trip to Hong Kong. Feeling a bit lost, Chris gave myself, my wife and young daughter a lesson on the MTR which was incredibly helpful. Chris has a wealth of knowledge about the area and we learned so much more than we would have had we been stumbling around unaided. We maintained contact even after our day together and Chris even dropped an Easter surprise in for our daughter the morning we checked out. I would strongly recommend that if you have some time in Hong Kong, make use of the greeters and get some local knowledge at the beginning of your trip. It helped us immensely to learn what we did on the first day.

Wonderful way to spend the day. Thanks to Amy for making our only day in Hong Kong truly memorable! From Dim Sum to the peak and markets, Amy did a fantastic job showing us around Hong Kong as she is down to earth and is very knowledgeable. It felt like we spent the day with a friend who could fills us in on day to day life in Hong Kong as well as the history. We used our Octopus cards to travel around using buses, subway and of course the star ferry which was very fast and efficient. The tour was well paced and the food along the way was a highlight.

Fantastic city tour. We, a family of four with two 11 years old twins, had a fantastic day tour with Amy in Hong Kong.Amy took us around the city by the underground, ferry, taxi and bus.Lots of interesting things to see in this amazing city. Amy was a very good guide.

Extremely knowledgeable guide. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip around the highlights of Hong Kong and thanks to Amy we felt that during our short visit to Hong Kong we saw and experienced all the best that this city has to offer. Would thoroughly recommend Hong Kong Greeters.

Fabulous Afternoon with Amy in Hong Kong. From Peak views to afternoon Dim Sum Amy guided us through this very special city. Our first time to visit. She is very organized, well informed, energetic and fun. Amy obviously loves the city and introducing it to visitors. In addition to the standard sites she has some intriguing behind the scenes spots to share.We could not have had a better guide. Thanks Amy-Mike&Melissa

Outstanding Day!. We had a fantastic day with Amy getting to know the city, tasting the food, and learning so much about Hong Kong. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip! Would recommend this to anyone that is going to visit and wants to see the city!

Outstanding!!. I had a great trip and tour around Hong Kong, from a knowledgable, expert and cheery guide. I cannot recommend enough that you go with Hong Kong greeters on your tour. I not only saw the sights but visited some local secrets and interesting places. A great trip made very special. Thank you!!

Private 4 hour Tour. Just back from a great morning with our guide Chris, who was knowledgeable and keen to show us the sights of Hong Kong.We had a very informative and worthwhile trip, seeing and hearing about the local culture and traditions.Would throughly recommend this trip.

Day hit by rain but still good!. We had bad luck with the weather as it was raining like crazy that day, but Amy still made the most of it, taking us to to see e.g. the Bruce Lee museum which was really cool, a nearby fishing village which was a great experience, and she also went and brought her car to avoid walking that much in the rain. She was also very kind in the email communication before the tour to help us organize our itinerary etc.
Excellent day ou. Day walking tour was everything we needed. Went on all forms of transport and visited lots of places of interest
