what an amazing 2 days with amy.. we have just returned from a wonderful week in hong kong and had the absolute pleasure of sharing 2 days with amy. I cannot praise her highly enough for her warmth and friendliness. She made us feel as though we were loved family members she was showing around her city. nothing was too much trouble - showing us how to get octopus cards, top up the same, travel the rail network, short cuts to popular sights, beating the queues, the list goes on. besides seeing the popular places we ventured to the meat and fish markets and delicious eateries, hidden temples, rode authentic sampans and saw and learnt so much about hong kong in those 2 days. amy arrived at our hotel and whisked us back safely each day. we also had a wonderful night with amy's husband on the harbour for the new year fireworks. Thank you so much for your delightful company - we were certainly spoilt to have you. best wishes to you, matt and the kids. when you are next in Australia, you know where to find us.

Flying tour of Hong Kong. Stopping in Hong Kong for two days, en route to Australia, we decided to use a tour guide to get the most from our short stay there. Really enjoyed our tour with Amy who met us at our hotel as arranged and on time. Amy was very knowledgeable and gave us a running commentary about HK, as we boarded the bus, answering our questions along the route. We experienced various modes of transport, tried Snake soup in a market and stopped for lunch at a Dim Sum restaurant. We visited different areas of the city within distances manageable for the four hour tour. It gave us a real flavour of HK and enabled us to navigate around more easily by ourselves on our second day. We asked to be shown the more hidden HK and to include a Dim Sum stop and back street markets and Amy planned the four hours before we arrived, checking via email that we were happy with her suggestions. We would recommend to anyone visiting HK as we all enjoyed our time with her. Thank you Amy.

Lovely NYE cruise, very helpful all-round. I contacted Amy when looking for a private guide for three days in Hong Kong just after Christmas. While she was booked out herself, she could not have been more helpful setting us up with other guides and providing tons of helpful information. She also booked us on her New Year’s Eve harbour cruise which turned out to be a brilliant way to bring in the New Year. The boat was well equipped and watching the fireworks from the deck anchored along a dozen other boats in the middle of the harbour was an unforgettable experience. Amy herself was handling the catering and logistics (I felt sorry for her as she hardly got a chance to enjoy the evening herself) and couldn’t have been a more gracious hostess. Embarkation at North Point and disembarkation at Sai Wan Ho worked out perfectly for us staying at the Harbour Grand HK. Would thoroughly recommend Amy and her Greeters!

Superb Introduction to the City. If you are unsure about what tour to choose from all the options on here then look no further. I've been on many tours in various cities around the world but Amy's has to be one of the best. Our tour took place on a very wet morning but it certainly did not dampen Amy's spirits. She is enthusiastic, friendly and extremely knowledgable. We crammed a lot in during our morning including some history, sightseeing, sampling the local food and a glimpse into the locals way of life. At no time did it feel rushed though and Amy seemed very willing to tailor things to our needs. At the end of the tour we were shown a great restaurant which I'm sure we would have never found otherwise. Also, Amy emailed me with other tips on things to do for the rest of our trip which I thought was a nice gesture. Highly recommended!

day trip in Hong Kong. We arrived to Hong Kong January 23, had a boat excursion, the next day we had to get off the boat in the morning and we had a whole day to be in Hong Kong till our flight at Midnight. we schedule Amy to come pick us up from the boat, and tour some more of the island.there are no words to describe Amy, she was pleasant ,knowledgeable, willing to go over and above to show us everything and then some. we thank Amy for such a memorable experience, and highly recommend her services, she is amazing !!!!!!!!!!

hong kong car tour. i have a knee injury that is why i booked a car tour. as much as i want to take the trains and buses in hongkong, i am physically unable to. and i did not have any regrets. amy and rich are excellent guides. the car provided was roomy and comfortable. rich was a good driver. and they were both accommodating and considerate of our needs. the best part of our visit is our requested dimsum lunch. it was so good and satisfying. amy and rich are very knowledgeable of the culture and history of hong kong and very warm and friendly. i highly recommend this personal tour. i can't wait for my next visit in hong kong. i will book them again.

Outstanding two days exploring a new city!!!. On our three week itinerary some of the best memories we took home with us are from the two days with spent with Amy. She was fun, friendly, knowledgeable, and very intuitive about what we would like to know, where to go, and what questions we might have. We had a few last minute changes and additions to our itinerary - and she accommodated our schedule changes without a problem. Also she helped us see way way more then we would have been able to do in a whole week, leave alone two days! She got our tickets for Lantau Island and the Big Budda experience in advance so we could skip 3 hour long lines which we would be stuck in had we done it ourselves without her. She made reservations in a really authentic Dim Sum restaurant where we had an outstanding delicious and educational lunch. Without her we would not have known about this place or would not have known what to order or how to communicate with staff who did not speak much English. So long story short - with Amy it's a 5 star experience all around, just like having a really cool knowledgeable and fun friend in Hong Kong. Book a few days with her - you will not regret a second of it!

Highlights Of Hong Kong. Excellent tour with Amy! She is very knowledgably and pleasant. She went out of her way to make sure we saw what we wanted. One of the people on our tour forgot her wallet in her car, and she volunteered to drive back to the airport to return it. We really enjoyed spending the day with her

Excellent Orientation Tour. I booked Amy to provide an overview of Hong Kong as I may be moving there In the next couple of months. Having not visited before, I was keen to get a flavour of the island in particular. Amy planned a very enjoyable and informative day getting around using all the forms of public transport and experiencing a snapshot of what Hong Kong has to offer. Spending the day with Amy gave me the confidence and experience to continue my explorations over the rest of my week's stay. Amy was knowledgeable and easy to talk to. A very pleasurable experience.

Great first insight into Hong Kong. Having never been to Hong Kong before we wanted to book a tour on our first morning instead of wandering around on our own. I would highly recommend 'first timers' doing this. As well as being a great and diverse tour it gave us the confidence to go on the ferries, trains and buses by ourselves after finding out how easy it was with Amy. We visited things we would never have found ourselves and Amy was very knowledge about all things Hong Kong. Amy also give us great restaurant recommendations and after our trip even emailed us some more helpful info for the rest of our time in Hong Kong.Highly recommend this tour.

This is the right guide. Our family of six (grand-parents, parents and two adult children) had a wonderful day (8 hours) with Amy in Hong-Kong. We were at the beginning of a 14 days cruise vacation and we had 1 ½ day in Hong Kong. Amy crafted a tour that matched our interests. On top of that, to maximise our ‘’visit time’’ in Hong- Kong, she even took the time to give us good recommendations of what to see the day prior our tour when we were on our own. Amy is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about all aspects of Hong Kong live - the history, the culture, the food, essentially everything.You can tell that she loves what she does, and enjoys sharing her city. Amy took us to some awesome places I am sure we would not have discovered on our own.It is without hesitation that we recommend Amy as a tour guide for Hong-Kong. Logistics: Punctuality at the meeting point, time management, vehicle quality: 4/5Knowledge and explanation of the country and places visited: 5/5Attitude, friendliness and ability to make the tour interesting: 5/5Visits quality: ability to direct us to the most important and essential elements. Ability to add a local flavor to the tour by visiting sites that are not taken by the tourist onslaught: 5/5Remarks: Amy was not at the meeting point she mentioned she would be. However, she was not very far. If I hadn’t had a phone to reach her I would have been worried. That’s the reason I can’t give 5/5 for logistics.
Great Private Day Tour with Hong Kong Greeters. Briljant day in Hong Kong with our Tour Guide Richard. Well prepared, knowledgeable and great fun. Highly recommended.

Great Tour Guide, Especially if its Your First Time in Asia. Amy is a wealth of knowledge, especially from an ex-pat perspective. I really appreciated her thoroughness and use of public transportation. If you're nervous about being in Hong Kong and how to get around - book her the first day you arrive! You'll be moving around, eating local and comfortable in no time. Great for kids and families, too. Wonderful disposition and I would not hesitate to recommend.

New Year's Eve Night Junk. I was a little disappointed with the quality of food and quantity of drinks available as I have done other junks in Hong Kong with similar arrangements that were both cheaper and better catered. However, this being New Year's Eve what's most important is the atmosphere and this junk certainly didn't failed on that point. Celebrating the new year with a wide array of interesting people from all parts of the world certainly made up for any discrepancy of food and drink. Also, the junk was easily the nicest I've ever been on with plenty of space to mingle which anyone who has been to a fireworks display in Hong Kong is nearly impossible to do with the crush of crowds. The fireworks themselves were nice, but not amazing as Hong Kong saves their best for Chinese New Year celebrations.All in all, a bit expensive but still worthwhile event. If they figure out the food and drink situation I would happily do it again and recommend it to anyone.

New Year's Eve Boat Trip. It was my first time on a boat trip in Hong Kong and I had a great time - it was so lovely seeing the harbour all lit up and the fireworks were truly a blast! Amy was a lovely host and she and her staff worked hard to make sure my husband and I had everything we needed. There was a good mixture of people on board and it was nice to meet a few of them, the conversation flowed all night. The night rounded off with everybody singing and dancing, so much fun! Thanks Amy/Hong Kong Greeters!

A great day out for tourists and ex-pats alike. We live in Hong Kong but we are always keen to explore the amazing city we live in. My boyfriend and I took a bike tour with Amy, meeting at Tai Wait MTR, hiring bikes and set off towards the Shing Mun River. we cycled on cycle paths along the river bank and it was flat all of the way so very easy and family friendly. The highlight of the trip was a stop off in Tai Po to explore the markets, temple and cooked food centre where we stopped for a delicious lunch.This is not an exhausting cycle ride but a guided tour during which you will see the more peaceful side of Hong Kong life and some key sights such as the HK History Museum (which you can stop off and visit on the way back), the Tsz Shan Monastery and Tai Po market.Amy was very informative and enthusiastic having lived in Hong Kong for a number of years.Recommended for tourists and those living in HK who wish to explore a little more of Hong Kong.

Brilliant tour - Made our holiday. From the moment we met Amy, it was like touring the city with a friend. The tour was fantastic. The right balance of tourist information and helpful tips and we got to see and do more on the day tour with Amy, than we would have done if left on our own for a week! We had our tour with Amy of our first day in Hong Kong and it gave us so much information and confidence for the rest of our stay. Simply a must do tour for Hong KongReally can't recommend Amy's tours highly enough. minimum 5 stars!

Excellent private tour. We chose Amy to be our tour guide she was very friendly and knowledgeable. We opted to do this on our first day in Hong Kong which proved an excellent choice. We started our day by going to the Nan Lian Gardens & Chi Chi Nunnery we loved this place it was so peaceful and not full of tourist, interesting it hardly got a mention in the top 10 book of Hong Kong that we had bought. From there we went for some Dim Sum at a local restaurant which was excellent, Amy ordered for us and her choices were good, we even returned to the same restaurant the next day. We also visited Wang Tai Sim Temple which was lovely that was more crowded very interesting to hear about the different religions . We then got the Star Ferry across where we visited the Peak which has stunning views over Hong Kong. We took the tram back. Amy had recommended we get an Octopus Card which was excellent value it could be used on the buses, the Star Ferry, the MTR and even the Tram. I would highly recommend doing a private tour with Amy, Hong Kong is so busy I feel we would have missed stuff and her recommendations as to places to visit and getting around Hong Kong were invaluable.

Excellent Tour - Like touring with a friend. We recently had a long layover in Hong Kong, and wanted to see the city for a few hours, so we contacted a number of tour agencies. Amy from Hong Kong Greeters was by far the most responsive, friendly, and helpful from the very first email. She was flexible in customizing a tour to meet our needs, and truly cared about making our visit as enjoyable as possible.When our flight landed early, Amy even met up with us early, and from the very beginning of the tour, we felt like we were simply touring the city with a long-time friend. Amy took us all over the city - around Kowloon markets, Tsim Sha Tsui, and over to Hong Kong Island. We used practically every mode of transport in the city (small buses, double decker buses, trams, metro, the Star Ferry, and the mid-levels escalator) and never could have seen so much of the city without Amy's guidance. We even popped into a local grocery store, where she showed us some local snacks. Our tour was in the morning, but Amy gave us an excellent lunch recommendation for some dim sum, and she even texted me after the tour with her recommendations on what to order!Overall, I can't recommend Amy enough - she really goes above and beyond to offer fantastic tours, with a personalized touch that really shows that she cares.

Fantastic Tour. Amy was amazing. My Mum and I only had 1/2 a day to tour Hong Kong, but taking a tour with Amy, we saw and experienced most of what there is to see and all the highlights.Amy was very flexible, extremely knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble. Would definitely recommend Amy and would love to come back with my family and have her as out 'tour guide'Thanks Amy :)

Get to know Hong Kong. Great experience with Amy. She met us at our hotel and set the tour for exactly what we needed. Got to see lots very interesting areas and landmarks. Managed to get an idea of the districts and how to get around to see them. Loved the history and knowledge that Amy provided which made the tour more meaningful. We had a short tour but it was jam packed, including going up to the peak and ending with a great lunch. Amy is very friendly and talented at her job and we felt that she would be able to create a fabulous tour for any age, gender or interest group. This a good start to a stay in Hong Kong and very good value for money, highly recommended.

So glad we booked Amy. Quite simply Amy made our stay in Hong Kong.We had an amazing day with her, and could not have asked for a more pleasant an easy going guideWE saw everything we wanted to see and also Amy showed us loads of things we would never have even looked at . What is more important she gave us the confidence to do things and this carried over for us into our next two days She also gave us some great sightseeing tips and local ways which saved us time and moneyOur three days in HongKong was tiring but we had a blast. She is a lovely person and if you are even thinking about a personal guide look no further - stop thinking and get booking.Prompt responses to all my emails and we had confidence in her from minute one.

Private walking tour of Hong Kong. Amy picked us up at our hotel and showed us all of the sights around Hong Kong. We used every kind of public transportation that was available, all super efficient and clean. We loved the market tour and delicious Dim Sum lunch. So nice to be with an English speaking guide who has lived in Hong Kong for several years.

Another superb tour with Amy. Guiding us from HK to Shenzhen (crossing the boarder) for some shopping. Amy had contacts in Shenzhen which eliminated difficult bartering and good bargains were had.Thanks Mate Will Be Back :-)

Wonderful insight in just a few hours!. We had a short layover at Hong Kong airport and thus could only manage a 4 hour tour with Amy, but she managed to fit so much into that time and gave us a fantastic experience and a wonderful insight!!

Fantastic tour guide, very knowledgeable & helpful. Had a full day tour (8 hours) as an orientation to Hong Kong before I decide whether or not to move to the city. Amy tailored the tour perfectly to my needs, going round the residential areas, sports areas etc. genuinely a fantastic tour.The next day I joined a public more touristy tour which was also great, some sight seeing, along with a trip to the peak. I'd highly recommend Hong Kong Greeters, good value for money,

A True Taste of Hong Kong Made Easy. We had a 12 hour layover in Hong Kong, on return from the US. We had never been to Hong Kong so wanted to get a taste to see if we would like it and maybe return one day.Amy met us in the Arrivals Hall at the airport and straight away felt more like a friend than a tour guide. She knew the ins and outs and short cuts to everything. Amy was completely adaptable to the itinerary, her use of public transport was amazing and the MTR train system is unbelievably efficient. Those Octopus cards and what they can be used for – I wish every city had them! In 7 hours we got to see some of the real Hong Kong from the goods markets where we tasted sweet and savoury treats and exotic fruits to the Star Ferry across the harbour, up to Victoria Peak by public transport and then down by the 100 year old Peak tram. And the dying art of bamboo scaffolding still used for building skyscrapers was something to be seen.We had a dim sum lunch on the 26th floor in central Hong Kong and walked through the very prestigious Peninsula Hotel foyer where the string quartet were playing and heard about the fleet of dark green Rolls Royce available to select guests, we even got to see one on our travels.It was a last minute decision to take us to what we thought was the highlight of the tour – the Chi Lin Nunnery. There are no words that can express this beautiful Buddhist nunnery and tranquil gardens, you really have to go there.Thank you Amy for all your help and advice planning the itinerary and even the directions for us to get around on our own when we had a shorter layover coming across to the US. We thoroughly enjoyed seeing a taste of the real Hong Kong and will definitely be contacting you next time we visit.

Hong Kong Insight. Lucky enough to find half a day to spend with Amy in Hong Kong for an insightful and very enjoyable overview of This great city. Amy is an ex pat but with great local knowledge and would thoroughly recommend using her as a private guide. Easy decision if available. Thanks Amy.

Highlight of a 17 day tour of China. I wish I could give Amy 10 stars - our Hong Tong tour with her was the highlight of a 17 day trip to China. She showed us a side of Hong Kong that only a local could bring. Still in amazement of the story of Hong Kong, bamboo scaffolding, wet markets, strange fruits, great dim sum, negotiation skills in street markets, and the super efficient MTR and bus system we used throughout the day. Thanks, Amy, for a great day!

Awesome Tour Guide. Amy is very knowledgable, friendly and accomodating. Designed a tour exactly to our needs and managed to keep 2 teenage boys from getting bored!! There's one thing visiting places, but it's another thing having it all explained to you. Highly recommended indeed!!!

You defiantly won’t be disappointed if you hire Amy. WOW - Hong Kong was amazing and seeing it through the guidance of Amy was fantastic. Amy knows all of the spots to see. I think we used almost every mode of transportation. Walking, MTR (Subway), Boat, Tram, Bus. We went to a Market. Had Dim Sum which our kids LOVED! (They loved it so much that we went to a Dim Sum the next day too.) You defiantly won’t be disappointed if you hire Amy to tour you around Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Thank you Amy from our entire family.

Great first day in Hong Kong. 30 years after winning a trip to Hong Kong on a television game show (which I forfeited at the time), I finally went to Hong Kong! Amy was an amiable, friendly, informative guide. She showed us how to get around Hong Kong using an Octopus pass, and even to the Toy Market Street so my nephew could add more miniature jets to his collection (he plans on becoming a pilot when he grows up). She took us to all the major sights in Hong Kong, and even to a wonderful dim sum restaurant! If you have never been to Hong Kong, and want to see its highlights, Amy is your guide.

really great guide to hong kong. amy did a fabulous job - showed us lots of interesting things and was extremely personable and pleasant. Told us a lot of interesting things from the ex pat perspective and reminded me of the reviews I had read that said that going around with her was like getting a personalized tour from an old friend. Would highly recommend

Best way to see Hong Kong. Amy was amazing! Without her, there was no way I would be able to see all that we saw on my own. She is funny and very laid back. It was like two friends exploring the city. She even gave me tips on the best way back to the airport. When I return to Hong Kong, booking Amy will be my first stop!

Fantastic Day Trip to New Territories. We had a group of 6 adults and had visited Hong Kong previously. Amy was very helpful in catering a private day trip for us to the New Territories. Enjoyed a fabulous seafood lunch in a place we would never have tried on our own and Amy was a fantastic guide, extremely personable and helpful. Gave us a great recommendation for a Portuguese restaurant for our stay in Macau. Would definitely recommend her as a guide.

Absolutely outstanding tour guide!. My fiance and I had a fantastic time with Amy. We hired her for two (2) days and wish we would have time for another day with her during our trip because she was great!From insider info and help before our visit to the her insider info and extensive knowledge of Hong Kong it was great. She even helped me find a great place for a special proposal to my fiance!She provides service and care far beyond anything you will find with the "tour companies"!When we go back to visit we will definitely hire Amy for at least one day, but probably more because there is so much more we want to do in HK and KNOW that Amy can ensure we have a great time!You definitely can't go wrong hiring her as your tour guide!

Tour of Local HK. I originally had a full day private tour but had to cancel due to a cancelled flight. I was offered a refund and or an opportunity to join a group tour the following Saturday. This was a blessing, we had a local walking tour with 4 other women and this was such a good time. The tour was great, it was localized with activities, history and tips. This was such a great experience.

Amazing and friendly tour guide. My husband and I visited HK in April. We hired Amy for a day tour and she was amazing! Friendly, knowledgable, gracious, and flexible. She knew all the great places to see and the best way to see them. It didn't feel like she was a guide, but more as a friend showing us around her town. We highly recommend Amy when in HK.

Hong Kong in Black Rain.. what a hoot!!!. My wife and I have just returned from a three week trip to Vietnam and finished off with a few days in Honkers where we had never been to. We booked Amy before we left and felt very comfortable with her from the first email. From the outset she was able to give us information that was relevant and helpful.On the day of our tour the weather forecast was not encouraging and Amy called us to see if we still wanted to do the tour as it was likely to be a bit damp. We were on a tight time schedule and we were still keen to go come what may. Amy said she was up for it if we were so at the appointed time we met her in the lobby of the hotel and headed off to the closest MTR station and with Octopus card in hand were introduced to Hong Kong's famous public transport system which really is fantastic. Amy took us to the Chi Lin Nunnery and when we got there the rain had started in earnest and it was travel umbrellas and 20 paces. The nunnery in the turned out to be a great experience if anything it added to the serenity of this beautiful place and meant we had it pretty much to ourselves because most other tourists were seeking cover from the Black Rain event which it had just been upgraded to. Amy gave us another chance to literally take a rain cheque but we come from Australia and were not overly concerned with a few spits of rain and so on we went. It was back to the MTR and off to one of Amy's favourite restaurants for lunch where she ordered a nice selection of dishes the standout being the Honey Glazed Pork. With lunch over the next stop was Wong Tai Sin Temple to rub a lion's paw for luck, burn some incense and have a fortune read lots of fun and then back on the tube to get across to HKI to hop the tram to the Peak. Amy had already been in contact with the "Guy in the Sky" (her hubby who worked in the IFC) real time weather man to see what it looked like at the top of the Peak who assured her it was all good. We walked up from Central to the tram station making a few detours to learn about some of the interesting history of the area and then literally walked straight on to the tram which is almost unheard of. At the top Amy gave us some time to immerse ourselves in what has to be one of the best views in the world and then when we were satisfied with that took us back across the harbour on the Star Ferry to drop us off at the YMCA where we had started. We had a great time out with Amy and it really set us up for the remaining time we had in Hong Kong and Macau. Amy backed up with more information and travel tips which we followed over the next couple of days and she was even kind enough to give us a couple of tickets on the Macau Turbo jet which were set to expire.... BONUS. We would have no hesitation recommending Amy to anyone who wants a fun low fuss intro to this amazing city.

5 hours in Hong Kong. I was an "airport layover tour" -- I took the train from the Airport to meet Amy in Hong Kong and I only had 5 hours to spend in the city. Amy utilized the time very well! I consider myself a decent navigator but I would have never been able to do all that we did on my own. Amy was kind, knowledgeable, and knew the insides and outs of the city. She made my brief time in Hong Kong very memorable! Highly recommended!

Bike tour in New Territories. As we are a group with already some experience in city bike tours from different parts of the world, we picked one in HK, too. With a bike you can see a lot of things in a very short time, covering a wide area of attractions. We were pleased Amy pick a friend Richard for helping us - so we had two guides! Both are very kind and warm persons, so we felt very comfortable in their company during all the trip. The trip itself is not very difficult, as the New Territories are all flat (not like HK island). The trip is also very safe, as it runs on cycle paths all the time. Probably the most important thing is they both came from western world and are now HK residents, so you can get a good and understandable perspective of this marvelous place.With two guides, on safe clycle path you have all the time to talk about the exceptional scenery. Kindly Recomend!

Great tour with Amy. Hong Kong Greeters was absolutely fabulous. Amy squeezed me and my colleagues in for a Sunday afternoon tour and it was fantastic. This is my second tour with Amy and both have exceeded expectations. She does a great job adjusting the tour to meet the needs of her client. She is knowledgeable, friendly and a joy to tour Hong Kong with.

Amazing tour with tons of local knowledge. My tour with Amy was absolutely awesome. I had a private tour with her and because I had seen a few of the sites she was planning to take me to, she changed the tour on the fly to accommodate me. She had a ton of local knowledge that added interesting culture beyond the generic historical stuff you usually get when doing tours. Not only was she great on the day of, she also gave me great suggestions of things to do on my own the next day or two and those recommendations did not disappoint. I am just back from a 3 week SE Asia trip and this tour was hands-down the most insightful and enjoyable.

The perfect way to get your bearings in Hong Kong. My friend and I had just a brief 2 days in Hong Kong and Amy was gracious enough to squeeze us in for a half-day tour, even though she was scheduled to leave on a family trip in the evening. That in itself speaks volumes about this lovely woman. During our four hours together, she not only took us to some beautiful sights, but she got us totally situated to continue on our own - hooking us up with our Octopus cards, explaining the transport system, and marking our map with our next destinations. Besides being incredibly knowledgeable, she is lots of fun and we really enjoyed her company. Thanks to her, our time in Hong Kong was extra special and when we return, we'll definitely look her up again.

Covered all our requirements. My daughter and I visited Hong Hong as we are considering moving to Hong Kong in the next couple of months and wanted to have an overview of the ex pat way of life and different areas to live. She contacted Amy only a couple of days before arriving and lucky for us, Amy was able to show us around on our second day. She quickly understood our requirements and adjusted the tour to suit our needs while still showing us a few of the historic highlights. She answered our many questions about her life in Hong Kong with patience and gave us many tips on shopping, eating, renting apartments and getting around Hong Kong. She took us on the Star Ferry, the subway and even a tram. She also followed up with a couple of emails with web-sites for different restaurants and other valuable contacts. Thanks again Amy

Awesome Chinese New Year Harbour Cruise. We joined the Chinese New Year Harbour Cruise, as many people say it's the best way to see the fireworks. Well that is true! The evening was so well organised, we were well informed of boarding and how the evening would progress. Amy and Jacky and the team kept everyone is good spirits with their welcoming hospitality. A fabulous night made wonderful - thank you!

Amazingly Excellent Experience!. How very, very fortunate we were to find Amy (Hong Kong Greeters)! Hong Kong ... the Chinese New Year ... and Amy ... led to a couple of the most amazing travel days I have ever experienced. Beginning with our initial online connection, Amy was responsive, proactive, organized and, most importantly, focused on what would make our Hong Kong experience memorable. (We are two senior ladies ... but I can definitely see how Amy's approach would work for anyone: couples, family, solo travelers). In addition to the requisite HK tourist stops, she advised of other things we could do when not with her, even making a reservation for a wonderful tea at her recommended location. But, it just gets better: One of her colleagues (Jacky) had some spare time and joined us as well ... as they introduced us to a local restaurant and helped us choose local specialties. (Would never have done this on our own.) Such fun! And then, the crown jewel ... as we learned that Amy and her colleague had organized a Chinese New Year boat cruise in the harbor ... to see the amazing Hong Kong fireworks. (Yes, we extended our stay by an extra day to do this!) By the time we departed Hong Kong, we not only had met an amazing excellent tour guide ... but also felt as though we now have a friend there in Hong Kong. Truly a trip to remember ... I am still smiling!

Best Guide Ever. My family & I, (Mum, Dad,14yo & 11yo) visited Hong Kong over Christmas & Amy couldn't have been more accommodating. We ended up booking her for 2 fun filled days. From the numerous emails I inundated her with prior to travel to answering or organising anything we wished to do whilst we were there, was never any problem.We visited & saw so much more with Amy then we would have seen if we tried to navigate this amazing city on our own.Prior to our holiday I gave Amy a list of things we wished to see & do & she helped us fit as much as we could into our 2 days with her. The things we did on our own still felt like Amy was with us as she 'd give us things to keep an eye out for, recommendations on how to get the best out of the attractions we visited. Even what probably seemed simple to her but what was a great help to us was the MTR's to take, which exit to take & then even which direction to take when leaving the station (Thanks Amy, We could have ended up anywhere). Christmas Day we headed over to Macau, the day before Amy helped us buy our tickets for the ferry & happily gave directions & recommendations whilst there, once again helping to give us more amazing memories for our first christmas away from home.We would not hesitate to recommend Amy to anybody visiting Hong Kong if you want to get the best out of this city. She not only made my husband & myself feel happy & relaxed but the children adored her. Sam is still counting 7/11'sThanks Again Amy for the Best Holiday Ever.

Two (2) day tour of Hong Kong. We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 days with Amy in Hong Kong. She performed well beyond our expectations. Looking for a great, excellent, or just plain "good" tour guide, Amy is the answer.

A night to remember. I joined the Chinese New Year boat cruise organised by Amy and her colleague Jacky. We had a perfect view of the fireworks display over the harbour accompanied by free flowing drinks and copious amounts of amazing local food. The hospitality and friendly company was gladly received when experiencing a major celebration so far from home. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Amy with her extensive knowledge of Hong Kong and her genuine welome.Truly a night to remember!

Fun In The Rain. Amy was very quick and helpful in all pre-tour communication, creating a tour that met all our needs...... And then we landed in Hong Kong (an hour late) - we were greeted by crazy down pour of rain - and Amy in the arrivals lounge waiting for us :-) Amy went on then to adapt a very informative night tour of Hong Kong covering what we wanted to see adding a bit extra and leaving out what was affected by the unforeseen weather. With hotel drop off (not offered by other guides I researched)We will defiantly be booking a tour with Amy again. Mat & Rhi

Extremely Helpful with a lot of knowledge. We read trip advisor and picked Amy to take 4 of us on a tour of Hong Kong, she's awesomeand accommodated us in many different ways, sightseeing, shopping and sampling local foods. She even took us to the markets and gave us advice on how much to pay for items. She'svery friendly even e-mailing us later providing us with more suggestions.

very knowledgeable & fun. my husband and i had about 4-5 hours to see the highlights of hong kong. and we did!but first things first: when we first contacted amy, she was immediately very helpful, supported us in finding a good hotel and made suggestions as to what we could do. nb: that was before we even finalised and made the payment.secondly, the payment process was straightforward and easy.then, on the day itself, amy picked us up from the airport (what an added bonus!) and we could leave our luggage with her. lucky us, as we were quite pressed for time!amy is very knowledgeable of the city's highlights & the public transport system but she also confidently answered all our questions on hong kong's history and recent political/social/legal developments.when our tour was finished, amy dropped us at our hotel. altogether, we were busy for a good 5 hours, even though we booked amy only for 4 hours, at no added cost.last but not least, amy was fun and we really enjoyed ourselves on this private tour!here is what we did: midlevel escalators, local markets, victoria peak and the symphony of lights (every night at 8 pm). cost: 200 us$ - certainly not the cheapest way to go but definitely worth it, especially if you don't have a lot of time!

Layover Tour in Hong Kong. I had a 10 hour layover in Hong Kong and didn't have much time to plan my visit to the city. I looked up tours in Hong Kong and Hong Kong Greeters came up. I went with Amy because of her stellar reviews. There's a reason why she has such great reviews. She's incredibly friendly and accommodating and made sure that I got to see as much of the city in a short amount of time. She took me around the different neighborhoods and up to Victoria Peak. The journey up there is worth it--the view is amazing! I also asked if we could go see the protests and have soup dumplings. It was like having a friend show you around. Hong Kong is an amazing city and I hope I can go back someday. I highly, highly recommend Amy!

Great for visitors to HK. I live in HK, and was looking for a tour for my visiting Grandparents whilst I was at work, so booked them a tour with Amy. Prior to the tour, Amy was very thorough in working out their mobility requirements, any food allergies etc. She was also very quick at responding to any queries which was great. I am so glad I booked them the tour, as my Grandparents loved it! HK can be a little challenging for those who aren't as fit as they used to be due to stairs, crowded MTR etc, so I went with the car option available. They had a fantastic time and could not stop talking about the things they had seen and how lovely Amy is. The tour meant they saw some attractions that it would have been exceptionally difficult for them to get to on their own. I will definitely be recommending HK Greeters to our future visitors.

Tour of Hong Kong during an airport layover. We ended up having a 12 hour layover in Hong Kong on our flight from India to Canada, and we booked a 5 hour tour of Hong Kong with Amy. Amy was very quick at responding to my inquiries during the booking process and worked with us to create an itinerary that suited our needs and interests. The protests in Hong Kong were in their first week during our travels, and Amy took it upon herself to contact us by email while we were in India to update us on the status, and to assure us that we were in no danger and that our tour would not be affected. Amy met us on time at our airport arrival gate and she quickly proceeded to get us set up with public transit passes. She also made sure we had a place to store our luggage, and checked if we needed to exchange any currency. We took the train into the city centre, during which time Amy provided us with a brief history of the city and answered any questions that we had. We went for a quick walk through the financial district, where Amy pointed out interesting features of the architecture and the history of the area. We then were able to walk by the area where the protests were held, and then to the Wan Chai market. Due to the protests, some of the roads had barricades but Amy was able to quickly and efficiently arrange alternate routes of travel. We visited Victoria Peak that has a beautiful view of the city and harbor, then back down into the city for lunch at a fantastic vegetarian dim sum restaurant and tea house, and finally to visit a nunnery and garden. We ended up running short on time, but Amy was able to keep us on track and make the most of the time we had; she even ended up staying with us almost an hour beyond our scheduled time before making sure we arrived safely back at the airport. Although not originally from Hong Kong, Amy is very knowledgeable about the city, knows travel routes very well and has no issues communicating with native Hong Kong residents. Although we were jet lagged and still had a long flight ahead of us, she was very personable and made sure that we enjoyed our day. Amy made the stressful process of booking arrangements from overseas very easy for us, and I would not hesitate to recommend her to anyone wishing to book a tour of Hong Kong!

Hong Kong Greeted Us!. It was my first trip to Hong Kong (barring transit through the airport) and whilst I am someone who is usually happy to get a guide book and explore a city, I was convinced by my fiancée to book Hong Kong Greeters for an afternoon. We were lucky enough to have Amy as our guide. Amy is very knowledgeable about Hong Kong, having lived there for many years. As many others have commented, Amy is super friendly and helpful – we shortly felt as though we had known her for years. As well as introducing us to the Stanley area, visiting the markets and helping us with some haggling ( a wonderful print of the island sky line) , Amy showed awareness of the cultural side of the area as we visited a shrine. She explained how these shrines were still used actively today which we found quite amazing. As well as our Stanley experience, Amy was able to offer us a lot of advice for the remainder of our trip, transport tips, places to shop, great views and great restaurants. We were really pleased to experience proper dim sum – we shared our lunch with Amy as she suggested to us different types that we would like and some that were a bit different! All part of the magical experience that is Hong Kong!I was really pleased that we used Hong Kong Greeters – we wouldn’t have been able to experience half the things that Amy suggested using our guide books!! And when we next come to Hong Kong, we will be sure to look up Hong Kong Greeters again for another side to this wonderful place!

Hong Kong Private Tour. My family had a great day visiting Hong Kong with Amy. She picked us up at our hotel and whisked us around the city using various forms of public transportation - making it so easy. We loved that she was a mom who understood what traveling with two kids is like...and easily accommodated my youngest son's request to take the Star Ferry in the afternoon. We had a delicious dim sum lunch at an ideal location with Amy and she was able to help us pick out some yummy choices! Can't say enough nice things!

I was so happy with Amy!. I had enjoy my time and had precious experience with Amy and her family in Hong Kong.I had very nice Dim Sum Lunch !She is very kind and so cute lady and also great guide!If I visit to Hong Kong, I ask her again!See you next time　(^o^)／Thank you.

A fantastic tour conducted with great personality!. I was lucky enough to be able to hire Amy at fairly short notice and she was a fantastic tour guide. We did a 4 hour tour around HK and she fitted in a great balance of seeing the main sights as well as some little nuggets off the beaten track. She clearly loves what she does which makes a huge difference. At the end of the tour she took me to her favourite noodle restaurant and even stayed to have lunch with me then helped me navigate to the other side of the island. I don't think there was a minute that we weren't chatting away and it was more like hanging out with a friend which was perfect. I can't recommend her highly enough.

Exploring Hong Kong with Amy. I just returned from three fabulous days in Hong Kong spent with Amy. She was professional, fun and very informative. One would expect her to assist us once we arrived in country, but I must say Amy was amazing from the moment we booked her as our guide. She helped craft an agenda that was perfect for the two children and me. I was prepared to take a cab from the airport since we are often exhausted after long flights but Amy suggested taking the train right from the terminal to the Kowloon station where a free shuttle bus awaited from our hotel. It was definitely the right decision, since traffic can be terrible in Hong Kong but the train quickly delivered us with just one or two stops before our destination. Amy also was generous with her time. On our second scheduled day with her which was suppose to be a biking day, it was raining, we met at the bike location and realized it wasn't safe to travel that day. So we postponed until the next day which turned out to be sunny and hot and most importantly safe for the journey out of town. The bike ride was a perfect way to see other parts of the city and enjoy some local sights along the way.You are in great hands with Amy.

Perfect in Every Way. Amy is an excellent tour guide. As a professor, I appreciate Amy's natural ability to educate. Her knowledge is extensive and well researched, and she balances details with fun facts. She cared about us having a great time and experiencing Hong Kong in a way to fit our needs and interests. She has a great personality, and it was like reuniting with an old college buddy. We saw and experienced more than we had hoped. Amy effectively and efficiently navigated the city and always made us feel comfortable. She even had ponchos for us to keep going after an unexpected rain storm.

Nice choice for family with young kids - Amy. Hi,We chose Amy as we were looking for customized itenary to avoid regular tours stop over at factories etc.Amy was very nice, amicable and flexible. She showed up on time and place as promised. Was quite familiar with public transport usage. Was able to give place related recommendations as needed.Recommended for english speaking tourists.Only thing s that I was expecting her to have detailed info as in guide for various sites visited and someone who would have knowledge of both local language as well as english.I would recommend her as general english speaking friendly tour person for family with young kids.Thanks Amy for wonderful day spent. Kids remember your cute kiddo.Regards,Kannan & Shruti

Excellent insight into Shenzhen. Having never been to Shenzhen and knowing how big and complex it can be, I wanted to find someone who could show me around and enable me to have a productive and enjoyable trip! Amy definitely made this happen - her knowledge and enthusiasm were so appreciated, showing me all the different areas, as well as helping me to pick up some great bargains with her amazing bartering skills! Without her I wouldn't have found/seen anywhere near as much and I found it comforting having such a knowledgeable person to guide me in a place where very little English is spoken.

Great intro to Hong Kong. Although we had 10 days in Hong Kong, as it was our first time there, we thought we would get a local to give us an introduction. TripAdvisor led us to the amazing Amy of Hong Kong Greeters. We were not disappointed! Amy met us at our apartment & we spent the next 7.5 hours (although we only booked her for 6) exploring the wonderful city that is Hong Kong. The markets close to our apartment, bus ride to the peak, the peak itself & its amazing view, tram ride back down, dim sum, MTR to Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple, where our futures were told, ladies market, where Amy spent an amzaing amount of time trying to get us bargins, then finally back to our apartment...We, family of 2 adults & 2 kids (14 and 10) had a great time. Amy got us onto the Octopus card - easiest way to use the public transport system. She introduced the kids to a very different place - our 10yo daughter was having culture shock the night before, but after our day with Amy was OK with most of the new sights & sounds. Not only did we have a great time with Amy, she also then sent us an email at 11pm after our day with an update on the all the things we discussed during our day with her - a good tailor, a day in Macau, good places for dim sum near our apartment, good places for cycling & walking, best place for our 14yo to buy a new camera, best places for shopping, including specific location of particular shops we wanted to visit, best way to see Hong Kong from the ICC Tower - don't pay for the observation deck, go for drinks at Ozone bar - and so musch more. It was like Amy was an old friend, & we were just travelling with her to a place she knew & we didn't. We would recommend Amy to anyone who doesnt know Hong Kong & wants someone to introduce them to this wonderful city. The best comment came from our 14yo son, he said he couldn't believe how much of Hong Kong we had seen and it was only our first day...it seems like we had been there for a week. Thank you Amy.

A Great 1st Day in Hong Kong. My sister, her 7-year-old and I were fortunate to have Amy be our guide to Hong Kong on our first trip to Hong Kong. I had won a trip to Hong Kong on a TV game show, but did not take the trip then. 30 years later, I finally made it here. Amy took us to some of the city's top sights and showed us how to use the public transportation (MTR, ferry, etc.) We saw the skyline from atop Victoria Peak, rode the 100-year-old Tram back down, rode the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbour to City Hall's dim sum restaurant for a delicious lunch. A visit to Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple gave us the opportunity to seek the advice of a fortune teller. Since Maxwell is a fan of airplanes/jets, Amy took us to the Toy Street Market for affordable miniatures. By the time Amy left us back at our hotel, we felt very comfortable about getting around Hong Kong on our own. We definitely recommend Amy as a tour guide, should you be lucky enough to find yourself in Hong Kong!

A Perfect way to see the sights of Hong Kong. Knowing we only had 2 days to spend in Hong Kong, the four of us travelling decided to book a day tour with Amy which was the best decision we made. Amy is so friendly we were instantly relaxed. Her local knowledge is incredible and helps you navigate the tube and buses with ease, providing useful hints and tips along the way. We saw so much more than we thought possible in the time we had, including some pleasant surprises such as Chi Lin Nunnery and Nan Lian Garden which were stunning.We have learnt so much from the trip and certainly got a true experience of Hong Kong life and culture.Amy we all thank you again for a wonderful day and making our time in Hong Kong so memorable. Mark & Katrina Allen & Fiona & Phil This is certainly a tour not to miss!!

Interesting and most informative tour. When we first arrived in Hong Kong we took the Big Bus tour. This works for shooting video without much understanding of what you are seeing. By the time you figure out what building the audio track is describing, you have already moved past the building. The bus audio track is historical in nature, but out of historical sequence, thus not very meaningful. The tickets were $50 apiece. Then we signed up for Amy's walking tour for about $10 more and the whole experience changed. No language barrier as there was when we got off the bus, and we could ask questions. Not only did we learn historical information in context, but also culture and customs in this part of the world. You need to do this tour! Brian & Bobbi Santa Barbara.

Best way to see Hong Kong. I booked a day tour with Amy together with 2 colleagues on a weekend trip to Hong Kong. We wanted to see as much as possible in just 2 days. Amy took us around to the places you wouldn't go on your own (as a first timer that is) and gave us plenty of tips for the second day where we explored on our own. In just 2 days, we did the nunnery, the Sik Sik temple, a traditional dim sum lunch (in a beautiful yet cheap restaurant), a ferry tour, wet markets, goods market, Vilain hitting ceremony (all with Amy), Victoria Peak walk, cable car to the Big Buddha (thanks to Amy's advice, we avoided the lines!), Tai O (incl. short trip to see the pink dolphins), walking tour of Cheung Chao (one of the islands),... Amy is knowledgeable, helpful, funny and above all a nice person!Many thanks for a wonderful weekend - highly recommendable!

Great Trip to Hong Kong. I booked two tours with Amy during a three day stop off in November 2013 & I couldn't recommend her highly enough. Her knowledge & experience of life in Hong Kong made my trip such a memorable experience. She is an absolute whizz at public transport in HK, and for this reason we managed to squeeze so much in. Amy will tailor your itinerary to your needs so if you want to make the very most of your visit to Hong Kong and see some hidden treasures along the way book a tour with Hong Kong Greeters.

Great tour. We booked a last minute tour with Amy who was very accommodating and a great communicator to ensure the tour fan smoothly. I would definitely recommend Amy to other people, we felt we learnt a lot, saw a lot and got to eat some great dim sun that definitely wouldn't have happened without Amy's expertise. My only reservation was that I thought the tour was a little bit expensive, but that could just be me.

Hong Kong at a different pace. Thanks for a very relaxing tour Amy. You took the stress out of travelling with a 8 and 10 year old in Hong Kong. Welcoming, accommodating and a great way to spend a few hours in a new city for the family.

It's like catching up with a friend. I had the pleasure of doing a tour with Amy in November 2013. My first contact with her was via email, organising the day and I found her to be very organized and flexible in coming up with an itinerary that would suit me, given I have been to HK before. On the actual day of the trip, she was very punctual and welcoming. After we met, she took me on the tour, which was to Cheung Chau island. I had a great day and enjoyed Amy's easy going style. Nothing was too much and she showed good knowledge of not just Cheung Chau, but also of HK in general. I would highly recommend her service and look forward to maybe doing her cycling tour through the New Territories when I am next in HK.

Best Holiday tour decision we have ever made!. We found out about Hong Kong Greeters via Tripadvisor and were encouraged by all of the positive feedback. We are usually very happy to explore new places by ourselves but decided, based on the relative short time in Hong Kong available , to get the 1-1 treatment. I must say that we were delighted with Amy and believe that her service is really great value for money and a "must do" for Hong Kong.Firstly, the booking and payment was effortless and our pre- tour email correspondence with Amy gave us great confidence and excitement. Amy was also extremely punctual on the day.Secondly, Amy made full note of my wife's post-surgery back condition and created a great itinerary that allowed us to experience the real Hong Kong, whilst also visiting a number of well-known landmarks and sights. Amy was friendly, helpful, and sensitive to my wife's health- always allowing us to travel at our own pace.My wife and I are not extrovert people and we had some pre-tour concerns about getting along with a tour guide for a whole day but Amy was great company and there was never any uncomfortable silences during our 7 hours together. It was just like looking around with a friend that knows the City very well. We had a great Dim sum lunch together and, with Amy’s help, could order much more adventurous dishes from waitresses that could speak little English.Lastly, as we visited the Ladies market, Amy showed her real skill. She helped us to find stalls that had "quality" stock in a "back room" - this one was on the 23rd floor of a nearby apartment building. Once the good stock was unveiled, Amy haggled like a pro and got us some great bargains.I must say that, while I’m a seasoned traveller, I’m sure there was a lot that we experienced on the day with Amy that we would never have achieved on our own, or in a large tour party.We certainly would not have followed a local stall owner for two blocks along the back streets of the ladies market , entered a shabby block of flats, and then haggled aggressively with the local expert to buy a handbag :-). Amy appeared in her element and completely confident and this made us a lot more comfortable.Finally, and this was the biggest praise I could offer. There was absolutely no clock watching. Amy was adamant that she would stay with us until we had secured exactly what we wanted from the markets. We overran by at least 50 minutes and there was no question of requesting further payment or any pressure . We suggested, during the day, that we may be interested in visiting Macau. An hour after the tour finished we received a mail from Amy with precise details of how to get there, where to get the best priced show tickets, Turbojet Ferry times, and additional tips and recommendations. Absolutely first class !In summary - we had a great day and would thoroughly recommend Amy to our friends and colleagues travelling to Hong Kong in the future.

Hong Kong From locals perspective. Amy does a great job giving you a local's Hong Kong. From taking you to the sites and sounds of Hong Kong Island to any place that would like to see or have an interest in. She is very accommodating to wherever you want to do. Would use her again and would refer her to anyone traveling in the area.

Your new best friend in Hong Kong. Just a couple of days before our trip to the Far East we decided that with only one day in Hong Kong we needed help to make the most of it. Luckily we found Amy's website for a Hong Kong greeter. She responded promptly and helpfully to all our questions and planned our day taking into account all our requirements. What a brilliant start to our holiday to be met by a lovely friendly person who really knows her way around. We covered all the sites we requested, ate dim sum in a local restaurant and enjoyed a full day of sightseeing using various modes of transport and missing all the queues due to her expertise. It was just like having a young family friend showing us around her home town. She looked after us so well, is a lovely young lady and we were blessed to meet her and enjoy her company and help for the day. We would certainly recommend her and wish her well for the future too.

Great day trip to Shenzhen. Amy was superb from the moment she met us in our hotel lobby, happy and relaxing, a real joy to be around and things moved at our pace, contrary to some of the guides we saw !The thing you need with a guide is confidence in what they are saying and doing, no problems with Amy here, for example she knew exactly what to do with getting us across the border, the process would have been torturous without her expertise.Amy also had those small inexpensive items on her to help the trip go smoothly, things that you wouldn't think about if you hadn't been to mainland China before, there was never any expectation of charging for these essentials either.We were kept well informed on how the locals behave and what to expect, leaving us to be prepared for a wonderful experience but not leaving us in the dark.We had a fantastic time shopping, Amy navigated us to trusted sellers and steered us away from the somewhat suspect sellers.Lunch was in a very modern hotel, clean and very high end but for an amazingly small cost, we felt relaxed and comfortable, the food was excellent, especially as we are vegetarians! To sum things up, this was the best day of our week in Hong Kong and China, having a western guide that really knew the local ways really put us at ease, Amy was definitely the right choice, it was like being shown around by a friend.

A great way to get orientated to Hong Kong. My sister and I met Amy for the first two days of our visit to Hong Kong. We found her to be a great source of information without being too regimented. We had a lovely one and a half days with her in which she gave us a good overview of the city and got us used to hopping off busses and trams and riding the MTR. This allowed us to spend the rest of our time in Hong Kong seeing the sights we wanted to see knowing where we were going and being able to move around comfortably. I would not hesitate to recommend Amy to anyone visiting such a busy city as she really gets you familiar with the place and shows you things as you travel around. She is such a great 'tour guide' and you so get so much packed into one trip that I felt as though we had lived in Hong Kong....sore feet and all!!!!!!! Thanks Amy for being so patient with us it was great getting to know you.

Confidence boost in Hong Kong. For first time visitors this was an ideal introduction. Amy is both professional and personable.Our itineray was planned around our interests (ie we hadn't a clue!) Arranging to bring us our Octopus cards was brilliant. We then learnt how to use them on the numerous forms of transport and how to reload them.She gave us the confidence (and detailed drections!) to spend the next two days visiting places on our own using the superb bus system.Amy is much more than just a tour guide -she gives of herself and ends up feeling more like family. Do book a tour.

What a way to be welcomed to Hong Kong!. Having never traveled to Asia, we certainly wanted to maximize our time in Hong Kong. Amy was a wonderful guide. She prepared a personalized itinerary and was quick to offer options when weather impacted our planned activities. She efficiently navigated the city, showing us points of interest we would not have discovered on our own. She picked us up at our hotel and ensured we were safely dropped off at the end of the day. But what we enjoyed most was Amy's enthusiasm for showing us the city she has come to love. Her tour was not a rehearsed script of history, temples, etc. Instead she helped us understand about daily life in HK, the blending of cultures, and the struggles of the citizens. We felt that we truly experienced the city and it was lovely to do so with the help of Amy.

The best way to see Hong Kong when you only have a short space of time to go sight seeing. I had the opportunity to have Amy from Hong Ong Greeters as my tour guide at the end of June. I just had a day and a half to see all that I could in Hong Kong. Having read the reviews on TripAdvisor, she came highly recommended. I will definitely be suggesting her to friends who will be making the trip in the near future.She was quick to reply to my request, gave a good outline of suggested sights and timings and was well priced. She even suggested places to stay, as HK was new to me. Prior to my trip, Amy sent me an iteniary. Once in HK she met me at my accommodation. Really liked the fact that she was easy going, organised and super helpful. Not once did I feel that I was being rushed from place to place. She knew her way around the busy city. Once all done for the day - she even insured that I was 'dropped off' back at my accommodation and met me again th efollowing morning for part 2 of my tour.I will definitely suggest, that should you need a guide to show you around the city and other places in HK, Amy from Hong Kong Greeters would be a super choice.

A Fabulous Day with Amy. We found Amy via a referral and then TripAdvisor. My parents and I only had 12 hours in Hong Kong. This was our first time in Hong Kong and we wanted to make the most of every moment. From the first email, Amy from Hong Kong Greeters worked hard to personalize our itinerary and ensure that we got the most from our brief visit.Amy was incredibly knowledgeable, personable and flexible. It was great to get to know Hong Kong through the eyes of a local and lovely not to be hearded like cattle or find ourselves wasting time visiting places we had no interest in. Spending the day with Amy was like travelling with a friend. Amy meet us at the train station and then we spent 9 hours visiting some of Hong Kong’s key tourist attractions as well as a few interesting spots off the tourist map. We travelled via train, bus, cable car, ferry and a cab. We enjoyed a great Yum Cha overlooking the harbor and an elegant afternoon tea with macaroons and a beautiful view. The Nan Lin Gardens were delightful and are well worth including on your itinerary.Amy and Hong Kong Greeters delivered above our expectations and I would have no hesitation in recommending them.

Great first day orientation. It was our first time in Hong Kong and we needed some basic help navigating and with orientation. Amy met us at our hotel, got us set up with an Octopus card and efficiently guided us to many of the things we hoped to see on the trip. We packed so much into that one day. She took us to a great dim sum place we would never have found on our own. Rather than waste time in line for the tram up to Victoria Peak, we cabbed it and rode the tram down which was much faster. We finished by canoodling around one of Hong Kongs most interesting neighborhoods. She was able to give us guidance on areas we eventually came back to visit later. Amy was a very easy person to spend the day with and she really helped us make a great start to our week long trip.

Visit to Hong Kong February 2013. We chose Amy on a recommendation from Andy GB. We had a stop-over on our way home from New Zealand. Two nights only and wanted to make the most of our time there. Amy was excellent. Kind, patient and considerate, putting together a varied and interesting itinerary, and adjusting it to suit us. We particularly enjoyed the visit to Hong Kong Park and the Edward Youde Aviary containing birds, trees and plants from the Malesian rain forest. Hard to imagine such a place exists alongside this dramatic urban environment. Go to the Peak for amazing views over the city. We went up on the bus- to avoid the queues -and down on the Peak Tram. Amy took us to a great pub, The Globe, SoHo HK just off the Escalator, a good way to get around this steep district. Good food and drink. We were enjoying ourselves so much that we nearly missed the Symphony of Light Show. It began whilst we were on the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbour. A must do is the tram- see photo. But make sure you see a temple or two. Thank you Amy for ensuring we made the most of our short stop over. Cindy & Andy

an excellent tour which allowed me to make the most of my trip. I traveled to Hongkong in October. I had Amy for my guide on the first day of my trip and I am glad that I did. I was spending a few days there and was looking for a guide who would not only show me things that would be hard to find without local knowledge but would help me navigate the transport system so that I would then be comfortable to explore more on my own. Amy was great from first point of contact. She took time to find things that I would be interested in and planned a really enjoyable day for me. It was a diverse tour and really gave me confidence when it came time to explore solo. It was very relaxed and I appreciated the flexibility of the schedule. I also like the fact that as we spent time together she was able to recommend things that I might enjoy doing on the rest of my trip. She went above and beyond my expectations, for example messaging me after my tour with suggestions of places I might enjoy to eat and drink at. I really couldn't have asked for a better tour.

Hong Kong Greeters. My wife and I visited Hong Kong for the first time in 2012 and, not having a lot of time, decided to spend a day with Amy from HKG. We'd heard about the sevice from friends who raved about it, so we had high expectations before we arrived. They didn't disappoint!Before we arrived, there were a few emails going back and forth to make sure our itinerary was what we wanted. We didn't know much about Hong Kong - the only things we were interested in were trying some (cheap) local food and seeing the skyline. Amy threw in her own suggestions and took us to the Peak, the main shopping district and recommended the best bars for each night we were there (valuable information given the nature of bars in HK - they can be packed on a Tuesday and empty on a Wednesday).It was a great experience: mainly for the food and drink. If we hadn't spent the day with HKG, we wouldn't have experienced the best noodles I've ever had, that beautiful park in the heart of bustling Kowloon, nor would we have had nearly as much fun at night. Thanks so much HKG. It's great to eat and drink where the locals do. If you've got more secrets up your sleeve, we'll go with you guys again when we're back in February!

A great guide to show you the sights of Hong Kong !!!!!!. Having not visited Hong Kong before , and being a solo female traveller I really wanted a guide to help me navigate Hong Kong and I made the right choice choosing Amy. I found her friendly and ,knowledgeable and above all so welcoming. I had Amy for 3 full days and the whole experience was amazing I saw so much more than I would of seen on my own. We used the forms of public transport which was a great experience and Amy planned the 3 days itineraries around the sights I wished to visit with a few suggestions from her own personal experiences. I can not recommend this guide enough.

learn from residents. In November, i stayed for a week in Hong Kong. Eventually, I made 2 appointments with HK-greeters. Amy from HK-greeters is a very enjoyable and committed guide. A must!1. On my first day, Amy guided us through the busy heart of HK-island. HK is hectic, grand and impressive. You're hardly able to take it all in. The tour took 3 hours. We talked and discussed while walking at a leisurely pace, we hopped on a passing tram and visited crowded, local markets, old houses and temples (at places you wouldn't expect). We went inside shops, ate at a food stand and ended our tour with a well deserved cup of coffee. I enjoyed it very much. 2. My second appointment with HK-greeters was on Sundaymorning. I took the guided bicycle tour in the new territories, away from the busy citylife.To me, this was a revelation, as it is not something you would expect to do in HK. In Sha Tin, a suburb, I met Amy again at the MTR-station, we rented a good bicycle around the corner and started the tour. We cycled all the way on well kept bike paths along the shoreline, parks and suburbs. Bike paths are safe and always separated from motorized traffic. We made some stops for a drink or a snack. In the afternoon the bike paths were more crowded. It was a fun, relaxing and slightly adventurous tour.

Perfect Way to get to know Hong Kong. Having visited HK before my wife and I wanted to experience some of the "hidden" Hong Kong that most tourists would not see on their own. Amy prepared an interesting itinery and guided us through some of the more daunting experiences (for us!) such as going for a Dim Sum lunch. Our tour culminated at Happy Valley Racecourse for Wednesday night racing and Amy even came into the stadium to ensure we knew where to sit.Recommended to all visitors to Hong Kong, particularly those who only have a short stay who may not have time to orientate themselves.

Well thought out and helpful introduction to Hong Kong. Making use of Hong Kong Greeters whilst on my trip to Hong Kong was one of my smart moves! I found Amy to be incredibly friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable about Hong Kong - she is originally from the UK but has lived in Hong Kong for three years. With some advanced notice, she was able to plan an itinerary for me which took in all the tourist sights but also showed me a flash of real Hong Kong life. Together we made use of the public transport system and the easy to use and cheaply priced taxis. We used the MTR, Star Ferries and the local buses. Amy also took advantage of my active lifestyle and we walked from the Victoria Peak down which afforded us fabulous views on a clear and sunny day. She also advised me how I would be able to get in a daily run outside in an incredibly busy and densely populated city - at the Happy Valley racetrack! Overall, I was very impressed at my introduction to Hong Kong and would definitely recommend this friendly, helpful service!

The Real Hong Kong. I visited Hong Kong in March 2012 to primarily attend the Hong Kong Rugby Sevens. However, during my visit, I also wanted to see as much of Hong Kong as possible. I came across the Hong Kong Greeters website & felt it catered to my needs as I wanted something personally tailored as well as showing me the 'real Hong Kong.'Amy has been living in Hong Kong for around 3 years and she gave a refreshing take on the country, ideas of things to see & do as well as recommending some great places to eat! It was fantastic not to be herded along (as can often be the case as part of a large organised group tour) but to have my own personal guide to take me to the places I wanted to visit. My time with Amy was well organised & enjoyable but most importantly, there were no unscheduled stops in 'tea houses!' We travelled across Hong Kong on foot as well as on public transport (Amy arranged for an Octopus card). We also got a few taxis but using the local transport really added to the experience. Amy was organised, professional and enthusiastic. She was able to answer my many questions & contributed greatly to a fabulous holiday.

Outstanding service and knowledge. Full disclosure: I spent most of 4 days with Jacky.I liked Jacky from the first emails which helped me prepare for my trip. And again from our first phone call because he was flexible and pleasant with a very nice voice and impeccable English from his many years living in Australia (but without twang).Jacky gave me a good whirlwind of Hong Kong to give me a basis to explore confidently alone later. The next day we did a thorough one day look at Macao. We then went into Mainland China for my business and were together for two entire days of travel, which he arranged with the casual ease of one long familiar with travel in these same areas. We used Uber, trains and subways and a superb hotel. He never lost me in the crowd and knew exactly where we would meet after going through different Immigration lines. I found him an easy companion. He was good at finding the balance of being an informative guide but not overwhelming with too much talk.I do not know what he could possibly have done to improve his service to me given what I wanted, asked for and was capable of. (I walked a good deal; other options are possible!) He even took some photos so I could focus on the experience, not on a camera.At the end of our time together Jacky gave me careful instructions for two more days in Hong Kong based on what he had seen of my desires and abilities. I was able to navigate those using the experience he had given me to move about on various transports, including buses and ferries, with self-confidence. You can plan to work with Jacky with complete assurance. He has my unreserved recommendation.

Family bday vacation. Our family went to Hong kong- Macau for a family and birthday vacation. Jacky has done a wonderful job in making our stay a memorable one. I just sent him an email and he was very patient enough to reply back and forth. He went above and beyond in accommodating my family needs. He was even patient with kids. He was even like a member of our family. I consider him as my new friend in Hong kong. So I highly recommend his tour. Thank you Jacky Wong for exceeding our expectation. You've done an excellent job!

Fantastic and personalized!. We had a brief stay in Hong Kong, and we contacted Jacky to show us some of the "non-typical" sights, as my husband and I had already visited the city once before and had seen all of the major tourist attractions. Jacky gave us a WONDERFUL tour - it was personalized and unique, and it gave us a really great sense of how people live, shop, eat, commute, etc. in Hong Kong. It was exactly what we wanted. He is also great with food - he guided us through an excellent dim sum lunch, and we also stopped by a bakery and picked out some great Hong Kong treats (try the cocktail bun - my new favorite!). He also shared so much interesting history about Hong Kong that we never knew. It was a really great day, and we are SO glad that we hired Jacky for this tour!

Just perfect. With only a couple hours during our stop over in Hong Kong we wanted to get a "feel" for the city. Jacky's tour was in all ways just perfect as he is very knowledgeable and was very good at making our tour (2 adults with 2 children) a great success. He was very flexible, friendly and clearly deserves top marks. Thank you!

Biking in New Territories. Had a great time biking with Jacky. On our way we also had a nice chat, visited a temple and a stroll through the market at Tai Po. Can reccommend Jacky as a guide, whether you want a tour on bike, foot or car.

One day overview of Hong Kong. My wife & I have never been to Hong Kong so we wanted a one day private tour to see as much as possible. We got in touch with Jacky who worked in with us to ensure we were satisfied. It was a fun & interesting tour & was just what we were looking for - thanks Jacky.

Fabulous!. Jacky is a wonderful guide. His extensive knowledge enables us to avoid the long queue at the cable car station during our Saturday trip to Lantau island. During the night, he brought us to kowloon to have the feel of the hongkongers' daily life. That's something we enjoyed so much. He even go to the extent of helping us to look after my little boy so that we can do some shopping. His service is needless to say.... awesome. I would not hesitate to recommend Jacky to anyone who needs his service. My next trip to Macau... Jacky of course.

Complete Tour Of Hong Kong. My friend and I visited Hong Kong for the first time last week. Jacky provided a fast-paced, always interesting and quite complete tour of the area with a visit to a delicious dim sum restaurant for lunch. We saw everything on our list and ended the tour feeling as though we were part of the local crowd!

Engaging Tour in Hong Kong. My wife and I had the opportunity to take a tour with Jacky last week in Hong Kong. We highly recommend his flexible tours. While helping us get acquainted with the geography of the city, Jacky quickly helped us learn to navigate the metro, bus system and ferries. We visited trendy design studios and markets were locals buy their goods. We saw temples and tourist attractions and sampled local cuisine. The tour was a great introduction to Hong Kong and helped make the rest of our stay really enjoyable.
