Fantastic Hong Kong Tour!. We had the pleasure of having Jacky as our tour guide for our first visit to Hong Kong. Jacky's tour was fantastic! He took us to areas in the city we never would have explored without his guidance and he thoroughly explained the significance of each area visited. Jacky also made sure we were able to visit some must see tourist attractions. The tour was six hours long and included the use of subway, bus, ferry, tram, and PLENTY of walking. The use of public transportation was important for this tour and Jacky made using it seamless. I highly recommend booking Jacky as your tour guide while visiting Hong Kong. Jacky is very knowledgeable and passionate about Hong Kong; he's flexible and seeks input in designing the tour, and has a laid back demeanor that puts you at ease.

Incorporated all the highlights and the best tour ever!. Jacky was the perfect tour guide! He was very attentive to what we wanted to see and knew exactly the places to go. He took us to places that were not just the everyday tourist spots and was very knowledgable about the area. He made it fun and exciting and it was one of the best tours of our trip. We had dietary restrictions and he immediately knew the perfect spot for lunch that we all enjoyed. If you're looking for a guide in Hong Kong, you don't have to look further - we highly recommend taking a tour with Jacky.

Hong Kong Tour - Aberdeen and City. Jacky was an excellent guide who showed us the non-tourist side of Hong Kong. From riding public transportation to get to our sites, to a private boat to motor along the sampans in the floating city, to taking the trolley the entire width of Hong Kong - it was a fun filled and educational day for us all. This is the second time we used Jacky and I would recommend him to all who come to Hong Kong.

Lantau Island Tour - Jacky is Wonderful!!!. Jacky took us on a tour of Lantau Island. The day started with a very locals ferry over to the Island. Our first stop was the Tai O fishing village. We spent an hour or so just meandering through the town and tried their pastry which was peanut flavored -very good! My friend got yelled at for taking a picture of this woman chopping fish - we didn't understand what she said - but she got her message across. We saw long boats where they were rowing through the canals. Very much a village that relies on fishing for making its livingNext we took a taxi to the Big Buddha. It is 268 steps to the top. Quite doable and the view is very scenic. We also had a vegetarian lunch at the monastery. Not a vegetarian but the food was good and very plentiful. I highly recommend.Next was a little village that looked like the shops were from Disneyland - very whimsical and touristy. I bought some figurines from the movie "Ted". From there we took the nong ping cable car to get back down. Jacky was very accomodating as my husband wasn't sure if he wanted to do this. Jacky was very open to an alternative if my husband didn't want to do this. In the end, he decided to do it and was fine - I was the one who ended getting a little uncomfortable a couple moments. I thought it was great.Jacky was a friendly, knowledgeable tour guide. He touched base with us the night before to confirm and his communication skills are excellent. You can't ask for anything more in a tour guide! Thank you Jacky for a wonderful tour.

Private evening tour in Kowloon and day tour in HK. We enjoyed the fact that we were taken to the local eateries and the must see sights of HK all through HK's local public transport. Jacky ordered food/snacks on behalf of us wherever we go so that adds as a bonus as we wouldn't know what to order/eat for a first timer here in HK. Walking with Jacky around the many streets in HK allowed us to see many things within a day trip. He also taught us how to use the MTR and navigate between lines, plus showing us the map so that we were able to travel on our own without hassle within the next few days. A recommended guide for private tours in HK! Hopefully I'll be back for Shenzhen and Macau!

Hong Kong layover tour. My cousin and I had a layover in Hong Kong for a few hours and wanted to do a quick tour since this was our first time there. The only problem is that we would be in Hong Kong at 8pm so we needed a private evening tour. After doing some research I learned it is difficult to find a guide for those hours. That is why I'm soooo happy I came across Jacky's profile. I messaged him about the tour and hours and he had no problem accommodating us and was very responsive. The day of the tour he was in the exact meeting place at the airport and we started the tour right away. He was able to show us a lot of Hong Kong in a short period of time and we even stopped to grab some delicious food. I would definitely do another tour with Jacky...he was fun, personable, knowledgeable and kind. Two thumbs up!

Hong kong Lay Over. Jacky met us at the cruise Terminal and promptly took us to Kowloon Airport Check -in so that we could pre- check our bags and obtain our boarding pass for our flight later that same day. He also purchased our Rail ticket for the Express train to the Airport. We stored our carry on bags in a locker close by so that our load was decreased for a short tour of Hong Kong. Jacky then took us on a terrific tour of Hong Kong. We walked to areas of interest as well using available local forms of transport...such as Trollies, Taxi and Ferry, subway/train. Without Jacky's help we would have had to get to the Airport many hours early by Taxi ( approx 1 hour required in traffic } and we would not have been able to see some very fascinating sites in Hong Kong. Jacky was professional, courteous, friendly... just an all around great person to spend the time we had before catching the Express Train to the Airport. The Express Train to the Airport was modern and comfortable and only took 25 minutes. We highly recommend Jacky as a very special guide while in Hong Kong.

Private tour guide from Hong Kong airport layover by Jacky Wong.. He is great,coming to pick me up at the airport arrival ON TIME. We useed airport rail riding to city, up to Victoria peak via a local bus, down by the tram,riding up to midsection of the V. peak by an 800 meter long escalator. Then we explore old city of Hong Kong and Soho etc.I saw professional dogs walker I did not expected to exist in Hong Kong.Then we rode a subway to Kawloon Prince Edward station( the border end of old teritory in Kowloon) exploring the area then rode double deck bus to the Star ferry pier with spectacular view of Hong Kong skyline with the night lighting. We then rode the Star ferry to Hong Kong, them I took the airport rail to the airport. I learn how to use all public transportation and see how the local live and spend their days. We had a hot milk tea and local bakery for afternoon snack. I also learn about the Octopus card. He is very friendly and knowledgable about the history and current issues of Hong Kong. His English is impecable as he spent 10 years of his youth in Melbourne, Australia. His English is Americsn though although I heard some hint of British English at times. I had a good time spending about 6 hours of my 12 hours layover in Hong Kong. I had previously visited hong Kong twice. The first time in 1969 and the second time in 1980s. The city has changed tremendously. We became a good friend at the end. I highly recommend Jacky Wong as your local tour guide. I will use him again if I am in need of a private guide to Hong Kong.

ABSOLUTELY BEST TOUR FOR HONG KONG. Jacky gave the best tour in Hong Kong. I had less than a 24 hour layover and found Jacky to give me a private tour of the city while I was there. Nothing could have gone better. Jacky will work with you to tailor your tour to the sights and attractions that interest you, while also throwing in some extra spots and sights along the way that you wouldn't expect or know to go to on your own. I cannot say enough about how great a time it was -- there are no better tour guides in Hong Kong!

Great tour guide!. We really enjoyed Jacky's tour - saw a lot, learned a lot, were greatly entertained. Jacky's English is impeccable (he spent his childhood in Australia). He is highly educated, polite and fun.Most importantly, however, is that Jacky tailored the tour to our specific needs (neighborhoods, culture / history / foodie angle).Highly recommended!!

Best tour guide!. I was in town for a convention and business meetings but had a couple days for private use and was traveling alone. Jacky put together an itinerary that totally fitted my schedule and was very flexible. I saw a lot on his Kowloon night tour and went to the next day to Shenzhen with him. Even when I needed some specfic items for souvenirs or presents he checked out all the shops until I got what I needed. His service was most excellent! Thank you for a great time in Hong Kong!

Amazing NYE Harbour Cruise!. If you're looking for a memorable, exciting, and stress-free way to spend New Years Eve in Hong Kong, look no further than Asia Private Tours. For a reasonable cost, they organize EVERYTHING, including an amazing yacht, all-you-can-drink wine, champagne and beer, and great food! I highly recommend this experience.

Great Tour Day. Had a half day food tour with Jacky during December with myself, wife and son. Jacky was efficient with communication and flexible with our timetable and tour variety, although we had booked for a food tour none of us were very hungry at the start so we just did some of the sights near our hotel as well as sights further afield. Jacky knows his history and has good insight into the daily lives of the locals and provided a running commentary of the areas we visited. We ended the tour with more a foodie twist and were thankful that Jacky showed us what we could get close to where we were staying. We had a meal and good chat with him to end and I was impressed that he handed over his card with contact details with an offer to answer any questions we might have during the rest of our stay (even if it was to ask for help when lost.) I would certainly recommend Jacky as a guide for your HK experience.

Fantastic Hong Kong with Jacky. It was our first visit to Hong Kong, Jacky showed us so much in one easy very enjoyable tour. We all got to see, taste and experience Hong Kong as it really is. Jacky was easy to deal with right from the start and helped with the rest of our stay. We even join Jacky on his New Year Eve boat cruise.... which I highly recommend. A fantastic night watching the fire works on Hong Kong Harbour. We will be definitely going back again. Thanks so much Jacky....

We spent two wonderful days with Jacky. We feel very lucky to have found Jacky Wong through Trip Advisor and he was available for us on Christmas Day. When our arranged food tour for the next day cancelled us, jacky was gracious enough to find time for us the next day as well.We have seen the usual tourist sites and had a walking tour on parts of Hong Kong Island. Jacky took us to the heart of Central as well as Kowloon. We saw various neighborhoods from rich high rises to where the very poor live. We saw how real people shop for food and clothing. These were real markets not tourist markets.Jacky was great introducing us to street food and quaint eating places where the locals eat.We sampled buses, taxis, subways, and a ferry in our two days.All in all, we had a memorable time with a young native of Hong Kong who has live for a while in Australia. His English is excellent, and he has a wealth of knowledge about Hong Kong and many surrounding countries.My wife and I highly recommend his services.

Ok Tour. While our family of three enjoyed our day with Jacky and found him to be a nice guy, we really yearned for and expected a bit more. Jacky is very quiet and we felt like we had to continually ask questions to really learn anything. Though we enjoyed our day, I was left wanting more. We've taken many, many such tours over the years and have always left overwhelmed (in a good way) with information and that just wasn't the case on this tour.

Day Trip to Macau. It was our first time to Macau and Jacky did an amazing job of giving my family and I, a group of 11 adults, an overview of Macau. Jacky was extremely knowledgeable of the history of Macau and very skilled with getting around the busy streets of the city. He also had good suggestions on where you can get good food. I would highly recommend Jacky to anyone interested in exploring Macau.

Great trip to Lantau Island. My wife and I recently took a day trip with Jacky and had a great time! Jacky was knowledgeable about how to prioritize things to see and the proper timing to avoid crowds. We accomplished a lot in a 3/4 of a day. We say Tai O fishing village, Big Buddha, lunch at monastery, 360 cable car ride (get the crystal cabin to avoid long lines) and spent some time on the way back strolling through the markets in Kowloon. We were lucky enough to get about 7 hours with Jacky and it was well worth it! I would definitely recommend and use again for friends/family.

Jacky was a great guy and he gave us a fantastic overview of Hong Kong old and new. We are a group of eight adults and this was our first ever trip to Hong Kong and we had booked up with Jacky prior to coming out here.On Day 1 of our trip we met up with Jacky at the Train station and from there we went via Bus Train Tram & Foot. We saw so many things/places I just don't think we would have seen if we tried to do this on our own.We stopped for lunch at a fantastic restaurant where we were introduced to Dim Sum, Jacky ordered a variety of dishes all of which were great.After lunch we continued around the city and were given pointers/ideas of where else to try out and the best one was the hotel roof top bar we arrived just before sunset and we saw the city change from day to night which gave a totally different amazing view at nightI would as would the other seven in our group recommend using Jacky again as would we recommend him to our friends.100% Happy thank you Jacky for a great day out

OK intro and overview of Hong Kong. We had a 9 1/2 hour layover in Hong Kong, so booked a half day tour.Jacky was very friendly and gave us a bit of history on a walking tour. He also took us to a yummy yum cha place for breakfast.A couple of downsides were that our flight was about 45 mins early (before 5am), so we were waiting, which we didn't mind, and checking on the people holding signs, looking for my name to indicate his arrival. Rather than the usual A4 sized paper, Jacky uses a flashy app on his phone, that makes the name scroll across. It looks cool, but meant we missed each other for 45 mins, as he had realised we were early, so was there the whole time.The other downside, was it wasn't clear enough what was included. We caught the train from the airport, and got return tickets, which weren't included. The Yum Cha was extra too, though I kind of expected that. the train down from the peak was also extra.Also he didn't take payment at the beginning, and when we got to the end we had over spent the small amount of $HK we had gotten at the airport, so that was pretty embarrassing for us.You'll also get a lot of emails afterwards begging you to review him on trip advisor, so I have finally capitulated.

Jackie was awesome!. We spent a day with Jackie taking us around Hong Kong, he met us at the airport in the morning on time, helped us with the currency exchange, and took us too many places though this fascinating city, he knew where the long lines were and how to get around them. We also went for an authentic Chinese lunch and he guided us through the menu which was all in Chinese and not a single English word, as well as the proper protocol while dining. Only thing is I wish he had taken us back to the airport at the end of the day instead of just giving us directions back. That aside, highly recommended!
Perfect Guide. Everything was perfect! Jacky made us feel that we are a part of the people living there. Absolutly perfect!
Call Jacky!. Jacky did a great job showing us so much in just one day! We made a quick mileage run for a weekend and we saw what most people take a week to see.

An interesting day!. Jacky met us at our hotel in Kowloon side and we had a discussion about what we were interested in seeing. For us - one of the most interesting aspects of the day was using local transit! We were off to the Star Ferry for a "cruise" across the harbour and we then took a local bus to The Peak. Jacky quite rightly advised (we discerned later) that you see more on the bus - you can wait hours for the Peak tram and you don't see much until you get to the top. At the Peak a bit of history and an understanding of the layout of the city then down the tram for a walk through the historic district and mid-levels - and a tram ride to the local markets. Visiting the markets and seeing the vegetables, fish and meat all laid out was a highlight! Jacky was great at answering all our questions regarding how locals live, where it "matters" to live, the political situation with the PRC and local issues. Next a bus to the other side of the island to see Aberdeen. We had an enjoyable putt around the harbour in a small local boat. All in all a great day - Jacky delivered us safely back to our hotel

Comprehensive Snapshot. My Mum and Dad and I were visiting Hong Kong for the first time for a two week stay. Jacky met us at our hotel on the morning of the first day, he was prompt and polite and had a very calm and considered personality. He is not an overly chatty guy, but I liked that about him, there is so much to absorb in this busy city, but his presence was not imposing at all. Any question asked, was answered thoroughly, and he offered insight when necessary.We did not feel rushed, yet we kept a steady pace. In four hours, Jacky showed us how to use what seemed like every mode of transport (bus, ferry, tram, train and taxi), gave us a brief history of Hong Kong and an overview of the culture. We saw the main tourist sites, where the locals shop, the hip areas and he also pointed out places we should come back to if we had time. After the tour, Jacky marked out on a map where we had been so as we could retrace our steps if we wanted to. We were happy to find that a few days later we could still find the places he had taken us to. We saw more with Jacky in four hours than we would have we had wandered around like aimless tourists for two weeks and we also had the confidence to explore event further.If you haven't been to Hong Kong before I highly recommend meeting up with Jacky on your first day; it's like having a friend showing you around their city, and the experience in priceless.Thanks Jackie.

A lifetime Day Tour in Hong Kong. Myself and husband, brother and his wife recently had the privilege of a tour like no other tour around Hong Kong. We were collected from our hotel and taken on a six hour walking journey being amazed, and entertained at every corner. We experienced every mode of transportation that Hong Kong offers, saw the old and the new, tasted the most delicious dumplings and custard tarts, drank authentic Hong Kong coffee, walked through markets, enjoyed a visit to many historical sights. At the end of our day over a beer he then proceeded to pass on his vast knowledge of Macau. We visited Macau the next day and saw so much thanks to Jacky. Value for money? Absolutely, a lifetime memory, thank you so much we haven't stopped talking about it.
Not Good Enough. ok guy, but quiet and just not overly insightful or knowledgeable. went out with one of his competitors the next day and she rocked.

Great Tour !. My wife and I took a tour with Jacky in Hong Kong in order to better understand the city and get the most out of our stay there. Jacky was outstanding in his orientation of the city, transportation, food, restaurants and neighborhoods. In a short time we had the knowledge to be able to go out on our own and find our way. In fact we returned to many of the places that Jacky took us to for a wonderful experience. Plus Jacky kept in touch with us after the tour to answer questions and make suggestions. I highly recommend this tour if you are in Hong Kong, it will be well worth the effort. Thank you Jacky !

Private tour of Macau for a family with kids and seniors............... We were a family of six (with 2 kids, aged 9 and 12, and 2 seniors) visiting Hong Kong and Macau. We were reasonably familiar with Hong Kong but not with Macau. So with our past good experience with private tours in France, we decided to book a tour with Jacky after reading the good reviews on TA. Jacky met us at our hotel in Macau. He brought us through historic Macau and also the iconic Lisboa and Venetian hotels. Walking the streets of Macau on a hot sunny day was not easy for the kids and seniors but Jacky managed to bring us through it smiling, perking us up with timely drink and snack stops, and cheering us on with his knowledgeable commentary and good humour. He also brought us to a local cafe for a really delicious lunch. At the end of the tour, we learnt so much more about Macau then we would ever have been able to had we done it ourselves. We will highly recommend Jacky's TIA private tours. In fact we plan to get Jacky again when we next visit Hong Kong!

Great walking tour of Hong Kong during layover. My wife and I had an 8 hour daytime layover in Hong Kong en route to Borneo. Jacky met us promptly at the airport and got us to the central district right away. He made sure we hit all the highlights in the short amount of time we had. We started the morning eating at a very cool dim sum restaurant that the locals frequented. The food was fantastic. Jacky then led us through several historical sights and markets. We tried some Milk Tea and tasty desserts. He then guided us to the ferries for a short trip across the water to Kowloon Bay. I thought Jacky did a great job tailoring the tour for our short layover. It was a great way to see the city.

A local's view of Hong Kong. Jacky showed us the local's view of HK -- we walked, rode a bus, took the subway, and didn't wait in line at any crowded tourist attractions. The tour was a nice mix of local markets, a temple, exotic food stores, bakery items, dim sum lunch, and his take on local culture and attitudes. Jacky's English is very easy to understand and he has a patient and knowledgeable approach to guiding newbies through the big city. Great tour!

For your Hong Kong layover, this is the one to call!. We had a full-day layover in Hong Kong, so made reservations for Jacky's all day tour, and were really, really glad we did! He's a native to Hong Kong; young and energetic. He helped us, by email, before the tour as to where to leave our carry-on baggage, and where to meet at the airport. He converted our dollars to the local currency to save time, knew where to go to avoid the long lines (like on the Peak Tram), where to go where the locals go (instead of the touristry areas), and truly maximized our time in Hong Kong, including where to go for a true Chinese lunch, teaching us the customs of eating in China. He also gave us some history lessons on this amazing city. All in all, we saw a LOT for being there for only one day, thanks to him. Highly recommended!!!

Hong Kong Night Tour and Macau. We did 2 tours with Jacky -- a night market tour and day tour to Macau. As we had covered a number of the markets earlier in the day with another guide, Jacky was flexible with our night tour and took us to areas we had not already visited as well as viewing the streets all lit up at night. The areas looked completely different aglow in neon lights. He also took us to see both the good and bad sides of Hong Kong which we enjoyed. It started to drizzle and we left the markets and at our request went to visit the Ozone Bar as well as the Intercontinental. This was a treat and we enjoyed hearing Jacky talk about Hong Kong.We went to Macau the next day with Jacky and it was fabulous! He used to live there and knew alot of the history of Macau. We walked through the old sections in the morning and ended up walking through the casinos in the afternoon. It was a great mix and he spent the right amount of time at the different places -- enough so we could see the site and wander around but not too long as to get bored. I have a food allergy and he made sure we ate a restaurant in a hotel that was used to dealing with allergies. We were only in Hong Kong for 2 1/2 days and I am so glad that we took a day to visit Macau. The night market tour was interesting but we had seen much of the same earlier in the day (our fault -- not Jacky's). I would definitely recommend a walk through the markets at night to see the lights and all the people. It is quite amazing.

Walking Night Tour - Waste of Time. DISCLAIMER: we were negligent in thoroughly reviewing the contract and did not realize the payment currency stated in the contract was USD, not HKD, thus resulting in a radically higher fee than anticipated. This oversight was completely our fault and has no influence or bearing on the experience that ruined our very short visit to Hong Kong. If you are looking for a boring and negative perception of Hong Kong, Jacky will fit the bill. Jacky speaks English very well and earned 2/5 points for appearing to have high level knowledge of how to navigate the city as would any local (street names, public transportation, common events/activities around the city) but provided no unique or interesting perspective to what a basic tour should provide, not to mention a personal tour. We learned more in the 20 minutes we spent reading Wikipedia, over the dull three hours spent with Jacky. Jacky met the two of us at our Hong Kong Island hotel. We briefly discussed some of the activities we had already completed in brief Hong Kong visit and what we were looking forward to seeing in our personal tour. Jacky determined that a walking tour through Kalwoon and its evening markets would be a good fit for us. During the 25 min commute from Hong Kong Island to Kalwoon, there was very little conversation. I was hoping that Jacky would jump in with facts, history, or interesting information about the evening ahead, but other than surface level discussion about his career and background, no other talking points were exchanged. Having spent several hours at the Hong Kong Peak audio tour earlier that day, we had a high level introduction to Hong Kong history but were eager for more information. We picked Jacky’s brain about the history of Hong Kong and the geographic advantage to its location. While he appeared secondary education of Hong Kong history, his delivery was curtailed and contradictory to what we had heard/read. For instance, when we inquired whether the reference to Kalwoon meant nine dragons, he stated that was incorrect and the reference to eight mountains and a Chinese emperor was “made up history.” In a moment of odd silence, he did not offer up any additional information. Immediately upon arrival at Kalwoon, Jacky suggested he was tired and offered to go for Hong Kong Style Milk Tea at a local diner. This was how we started out our tour. Again, there was little discussion. Thirsty for information (not Tea), we began spewing questions at Jacky about the location, politics, history, culture, etc. Having a communications background, I was able to fill the air with a healthy amount of questions, but after an hour it became exhausting. After about 1 hour, I made it a point to inform Jacky that we would like a more informative tour without us having to ask so many questions and he responded "I like when you ask questions, it's better for me." Jacky had answers to all of our questions, but his answers were high level and did not contain historical depth. Despite not having a real grasp on the history, he had nothing of interest to share. His responses about Hong Kong life and culture provided us absolutely no breadth or uniqueness. We literally had to ask every single question. If we didn't ask a question, there would be silence or Jacky would state the obvious name of the street, market or area. The following quotes are verbatim: When I asked the significance of the Peninsula Hotel, Jacky said "it’s an old hotel with a nice lobby."When I asked about economic influence and the main export, Jacky said “watches and re-export.” When I asked if there are fun facts that I should know about TST (Tsim Sha Tsu), Jacky said "not really, I wish there was. Tourism in Hong Kong is going down, there really is nothing that special."There was zero entertainment value provided by Jacky and on all accounts of what a tour guide should be (Energetic, Storytelling, Talkative) he did not meet any marks. Although Jacky was very explicit about the contract and we were clearly at fault for misinterpreting the rate, collecting even a dollar for this type of tour is a robbery. Jacky has no business being in the tourism industry and depicts a shameful portrayal of Hong Kong.

Hong Kong experience. Jacky was the perfect guide to show us the real Hong Kong. Four adults and three kids learnt how to get around Hong Kong and saw some amazing behind the scenes action. We will never forget some of the food market stalls around Wan Chai nor morning tea at a local diner and then lunch at a local restaurant. We highly recommend Jacky.

Tours of Hong Kong and Macau. We had a great week with Jacky! He met us at our hotel and showed us all around HK. We did 3 different tours with him and all were great! We went well beyond the contracted hours for the tours each time. You tour like a local and he customized it for us. When we did a different tour with a large group and tour company, we really missed Jacky. We appreciated his send ofHumor and he added lots of laughs along the way.

Hong Kong day tour. Jacky gave us a very good tour in Hong Kong. If you want to go past the tourist spots, Jacky is the person to hire. He speaks great English and can explain any questions you may have.

Outstanding bespoke (customised) tour - worth every cent!. We have just spent 5 days in Honk Kong and we were keen to see Macau, but we could only allocate one day for the tour. After much research we decided on a full day tour with Jacky Wong and I must say we weren't disappointed. Let me begin by saying that if you're after a cheap quick and 'dirty' tour - then look elsewhere. Jacky isn't cheap, our full day tour cost us about $650 USD, BUT....the old adage applies.... "You only get what you pay for". For those with discerning taste (and reasonable means) who elect to read on, I shall continue...Jacky met us precisely on time at our hotel, the Novotel on Nathan Rd. Our journey by ferry to Macau was smooth and our tour unfolded as we had requested. We were less interested in Casino's etc, and much more interested in the culture, history and architecture of Macau and its UNESCO World Heritage status. Our tour by foot was smooth, targeted and covered exactly what we had asked for. I'm of the view that a traveller might be able to execute this tour alone, but it would not be easy. Jacky made navigating the journey seamless and simple, saving a lot of wasted time. Perhaps this is they key value of this style of tour. It is straight to what you want to see, with a detailed local knowledge, with the benefit of a tour guide who not only speaks English like a native, but someone who certainly understands Australian humour and nuances.I've used personal guides like Jacky a few times - not often, but occasionally - and from my perspective our tour today (11th Jan) was money well spent. Thanks Jacky! (and sorry about the shorts, although they caused a lot of mirth for the locals...)

Informative & Extensive Experience. It was a first time for us in Hong Kong and we decided to go for a walking tour (another first for us) with Jacky. He was right on time at the hotel (Full Marks on punctuality & professionalism) tour was of four hours but he spent another couple of hours showing us around and escorting us back to the hotel. Score ! (for going that extra mile)If you are looking to experience & learn about the tradition , customs , social behaviour of the city of Hong Kong I suggest you look no further and contact him. He Knows Hong Kong inside out & Will take you through the real Hong Kong even if you are short on time and make you experience the city like you really should - Like a HongKongese if you May!We covered a fair bit of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island and after we came back to the hotel he sat down with us and explained what are the other places we should see around nearby (we were in sham shui po) and also in Lantau Island (part of new territories) once we get there which was very helpful. He also offered to call him up if we needed any help.Last but not the least,Be very clear what you want from the tour, as it is not a travel agent package tour wherein services will be packed, you are basically paying for his time and not for other things although he was kind enough to buy us some delicious egg custard tart ,sweet bread (I am forgetting the name will ask him) and a refreshing hong kong tea as part of the experience! Overall , a must do if you are willing to walk and experience the true Hong Kong outside the hotel rooms and resorts !

Fantastic Tour. It was my first time in HK and I had 2 days to see the sites. To maximize my experience, I signed up for a 1/2 day tour with Jacky. The tour was perfect -- I saw the bigger tourist sites, saw things only a local would know about and learned about HK history and culture. In fact, the tour was so complete, I almost didn't have things to see the second day of my trip!!

We saw Hong Kong with Jacky, Like a local!. My wife and I spent 3 great days (actually 2 days and one night) with Jacky. He covered all of the places we wanted to see and then added in all of the things he thought we should see. He allowed us to also become totally comfortable in managing our way around Hong Kong. We avoided the crowds and got so much covered in our time together. His fluency in English and Chinese allowed us to communicate perfectly and also to go to places to eat where being fluent in Chinese was a must to experience the true local culture. We HIGHLY recommend Jacky if you want to see Hong Kong like a local.

learned so much. My wife and I had an eight hour layover in Hong Kong and arranged for Jacky Wong to show us Hong Kong. We saw so much more than we could have on our own; Victoria Peak, the demonstration campsite, Kowloon, local markets and restaurants, and the public transportation. Wonderful.

Half Day Hong Kong Tour. We engaged Jacky for a half-day (4 hours) Hong Kong tour to get to know the local culture and taste the local culinary. Jacky certainly exceeds our expectations. He knows Hong Kong well and brought us to places off the tourist track. He spent almost a full day, way beyond the 4 hours, with us way and was very obliging to our requests. We would certainly recommend him to anyone who needs a guide to go round Hong Kong.

Kowloon walking food tour. On our first visit to Hong Kong we wanted a personalised tour of some of the different types of food available. Jacky certainly knew plenty of places from street vendors selling fish balls (popular with the locals, not so sure ourselves) as well as some restaurants off the tourist track serving local food, well cooked and prepared. Jacky expertly combined the food experience with a wander through some of the various local markets that are there. Great fun - recommended.
Good day trip to Lantau. Jacky was on time to meet us in our Kowloon hotel, had planned an excellent route to maximise our time on Lantau Island and was good company all day.

Jackie was very helpful, informative and a wonderful guide. We would highly recommend him. Jackie met us at our hotel in Hong Kong and escorted us to a very informative tour of Macao. Macao is more than gambling and we saw it all in one day
Personalised. Jacky was easy to get along with and catered to my every need. Visited so many places in one day and had good food experiences. Professional and friendly. Worthwhile, would recommend !

Sight seeing in Hong Kong!. Loved Jackie! He took us through this not so easy, huge city to see the highlights of the city. Got to see and taste some of their spectacular bakeries and tasted some local street food. We just loved all of it! Thank You Jackie!

Jackie the Man. Jackie was an excellent guide. Very professional and did a great job tailoring his tours to our interests and schedule. He did an awesome job showing us Hong Kong, his city from his view. We saw a lot in the time we were there and I felt having him with us gave us insight we would otherwise never had. He even gave us pointers on how to maximize our exploration of the city when we were on our own. He didn't have to, that concern was greatly appreciated. I could not more highly recommend him!

Goes the extra mile. My daughter is headed off to school in Taipei so I wanted to go with her and stop off and spend a few days in Hong Kong. I booked a tour with Jacky and he went out of his way to make certain we were set. We traded emails prior to our arrival and although we were not meeting with him until Thursday, he called the hotel Wednesday evening to make certain we arrived safely and if there was anything we needed help with. Our tour was to begin at 2:00 PM the next day, however, Jacky offered to come by early and chat and answer any questions we may have. He took us to many of the areas you will never see on the big red tour bus and was very informative. The one thing that really stood out was we felt as though he really cared about our trip and wanted us to make the most out of it. There are a lot of tour guides that can show you the markets and the back streets, however, there are very few that go the extra mile and Jacky is one of them. What was interesting was by the end of the day you could really tell the places with all of the tourist and the ones with the locals. I fell in love with Hong Kong and can't wait to come back and spend another day with Jacky.

Fun night in Kowloon. First things first - A party of four people with ages ranging from 43 - 72. Jacky entertained us from whoa to go. His knowledge of Kowloon and fun personality gave us an amazing night tour of Kowloon. He made sure he involved my partially deaf father in all the talks and ensured my parents rested if required. You must get Jacky to take you through Kowloon.

Jacky knows his stuff. My wife and I enjoyed our half day tour around Hong Kong with Jacky in June. He is very professional, has great knowledge of Hong Kong and its' history and he explained easily how to get around the city using the public transport system. He listens and tailors the tour to your needs. We recommend Jacky for your next tour of Hong Kong.

Great tour of Shenzhen. Jacky guided us on our first visit to mainland China and helped us to gain a real appreciation of the city of Shenzhen. We found it very easy to make the arrangements with Jacky and he provided us with his excellent knowledge of the area as well as some very interesting insights into modern China. We found the itinerary both interesting and, at times, quite amazing having put our trust in Jacky to assemble something to suit our needs. Logistically, Jacky had everything under control and the day went very smoothly.

Great experience. We enjoyed our tour out and about Hong Kong with Jacky. In addition to his knowledge of Hong Kong, he was extremely helpful with getting us acclimated to the public transportation system. He also made great suggestions for planning of the rest of our trip in his vibrant city, as well as what we should see on a day trip to Macau. Highly recommended.

Jacky is No. 1 tour guide for Hongkong and Macau. Jacky provided exceptional service, his extensive knowledge ofvarious cultures and history was 1st class, totally professional,Jacky pre-empted our needs and level of fitness.I became ill in Macau and jacky took control and organsied mmedications for me, we would have been lost without himWhen my husband and I recall our amazing holiday it is with gratitude and fondness for Jacky who assisted us in creating a memoriable holiday.Thankyou JackyA great ambassador for Honkong and Macau
5star. You get a excellenct experience with jacky. Nice bloke know Hong Kong like the back of his hand and you will get to see parts of Hong Kong that not many tour guides will show you.

Great Tour. A must tour if you are in Hong Kong, visiting the section of Mongkok during the day is not the same as going by night when the area comes alive with it's markets and street musicians. It looks like the back drop of a Hong Kong movie. Jackie did a fantastic job of showing you the area and finding great points to take photos. Do yourself a favor and take the tour. He also did a fantastic job showing off Macau in a way a tour group could not. Taking the time to visit the historical sites as well as a few casinos. Jacky has great knowledge of Macau. He also took photos and later e-mailed them to me. I highly recommend Jacky and the tour. Jacky gave a great tour and it was a great time.

Hong Kong with Jacky. Jacky was a great guide. He was very knowlegable, friendly, flexible and attentive.He was with us for 2 and 1/2 days and showed all over Hong Kong and Macau. I highly recommend Jacky when you go to Hong Kong and Macau.Phil MDallas, TX 75287

2 fun days in Hong Kong. We thouroughly enjoyed our 2 days touring Hong Kong and the surrounding area with Jackie. He took us to see the highlights but was also flexible to meet our needs. It was great using public transportation to get us everywhere. It made us feel part of the city life. Jackie was knowledgeable and fun to be with and we highly recommend him.

Great insight into a different Hong Kong. We did a night time walking/eating tour with Jacky. It was fantastic - he took us right up to the top of Kowloon where we had amazing dim sum and then walked the markets and had more food at a restaurant we would never normally go to as tourists. Jacky was interesting, low key and good company. Highly recommend.

Very pleasant. Suggest you try to schedule him for the beginning if your trip so you don't duplicate locations.. Great guy! The nightlife tour is sampling street food if u like and taste local non alcoholic drinks. It is not a pub crawl. Lots of walking but see everything.

Excellent Tour Guide. We had a wonderful experience with Jacky. In the few hours we had due to a layover he was able to show us most of the city highlights. He took us to a wonderful lunch location and was able to share the history of the areas we visited. I would highly recommend him as a city guide.

Hong Kong tour like a local. I can highly recommend Jacky from TIA Private Tours as a guide in Hong Kong. I regularly book a private guide when arriving in a city for the first time. I made arrangements with Jacky via email and he maintained contact with me via email and cell phone during the week leading up to my arrival. The booking and confirmation process was easy. On the date of the tour (May 28, 2014) Jacky met me promptly as arranged in my hotel lobby. Of the many private city tours I have taken, this felt the most authentic and personal. We traveled by public transport - MTR via subway, bus, trolley and minibus, as well as using the Star Ferry and taxis. His explanation of the subway and transit system enabled me to confidently use the MTR and taxis on my own the next day. Jacky is very personable takes special effort to assure his client is comfortable and sees what interests them. We visited a few notable tourist sites, but also as a result of our dialogue, visited a few places such as local markets and food vendors that interested me. I have already recommended him to friends traveling to Hong Kong later this year.

Passable tour. Jacky took 3 of us around the evening of our first full day in HK. To be fair, the weather was not great and we were tired. But the tour was not of any great caliber; We went near Boundary street and Nathan, etc; from reading the other posts this sounds like a pretty standard tour. We were able to ask questions about local customs and expectations re:tipping, etc. which was helpful. He bought street bites for us - but didn't inquire as to whether there were any food restrictions before spending our money on the food - one of the ladies was pregnant and the other can't eat spicy food!A big storm was due to hit the island so we ended up going to a high-rise bar and getting a drink and chatting. We asked him about other sites; Jacky seemed peculiarly anti-Hong Kong - he warned us off Stanley Market, Victoria Peak and other landmarks as tourist traps and not worth a trip. He was pretty high up on Macau though. Based on his recommendation we shortened a planned trip to Stanley Market. The thing was, Stanley was great! Yes, it is touristy - in the way Saint Augustine is touristy. We had a great afternoon and wished for more time. Luckily, I was able to go again and enjoyed the promenade, the view, being by the coast, etc. There's a great ex-pat bar there called Smugglers Inn which I highly recommend. However my travelling companion was miffed as she wasn't able to return due to her work schedule. The funny thing is that Jacky was adamant about visiting Times Square when he visits the States. Talk about touristy! LOL. Bottom line: Jacky is a nice enough guy if not the most imaginative. And don't listen if he tells you not to spend a day at Stanley Market.
Any idea about the charges. I heard abt Jacky being one of the most recommended guide. I am visiting hong kong in august. So,I just want to know how u charge for a trip.

If you don't see Nathan Road with Jacky, you're doing it wrong.. Jacky Wong took six lawyers out to Kowloon and Nathan Road for Dim Sum, markets, beer, and noodles, and a little edification. He got us to Kowloon just in time to watch the Symphony of Lights, took us on a great tour where we learned things about Hong Kong we never would have learned from tour books (mobile pawn shops, anyone?) and fed us the best dim sum ever. His English is perfect (he's got a pretty interesting background), and he is fun to be around. And the pictures he got from our night in Kowloon sum up the night perfectly. He's the best. Hire him.

Macau in One Day - Ask Jacky. We recently asked Jacky to show my wife and I around macau for a day. We had arrived in Macau the night before to see the House of Dancing Water show which we highly recommend. Jacky showed us both the historical and newer parts of Macau. Many of the sites we would not have found without his guidance. We enjoyed covering the areas by foot, bus and taxi. Our highlights included seeing Stanley Ho's personal collection of art and artefacts, markets at the china/macau border and the old light house. Thanks Jacky, we had a wonderful time.

Hire Jacky!!. What a wonderful way to see Hong Kong and Macau! We took three of Jacky's walking tours at the start of our Hong Kong stay. Let me start by saying Jacky is lots of fun to be with, knows his city well, and speaks native (Australian) English. First was the walking Tour of Hong Kong, where we not only walked, but found our way around on bus, tram, subway, escalator, and ferry. By the end of the day, we not only had "seen the sights" but had our own Octopus cards and felt confident finding our way around Hong Kong by ourselves. Jacky gave us lots of ideas for further adventures. And did I mention the wonderful dim sum lunch??Next was the day in Macau. The morning explored the Portuguese heritage of the island and included a yummy Portuguese lunch. The afternoon took a look at the casino development...not gambling, but understanding what has been and is being built here, and how it relates to mainland China and Hong Kong. And last, the Kowloon at Night visit to the teeming street markets. To the Westerner, block after block of stalls may look somewhat the same. With Jacky, each block is different. Here is where the real life of Hong Kong is. Loved it!All I can say is, whether you plan a day or a week or the rest of your life in Hong Kong, you'll get a great orientation, and a fun day if you hire Jacky to show you around!

The perfect guide. jacky took us to a hong kong that very little turist ever experience. Very intresting . He knows everything . He took care of us , explain everything very clearly and we enjoy every minute. Best way to experience this amazing place.

Personal tour in Hong Kong by Jacky. By getting a tour by someone who knows the city like Jacky you just get to see more.Also, he gave me good advice to explore some other places of interest on my own during the next days.I had a fun time and therefore recommend a tour by Jacky to anyone!

Great day. Great guy. We thoroughly enjoyed our full day tour of Hong Kong with Jacky! Travelling on all different forms of public transport only enhanced our experience. Hong Kong & Macau tour - Feb 18 & 20, 2014. Hong Kong with Jacky. Jacky is a good guide with fluent english, unobtrusive and pleasant person. No better guide in Hong Kong or Macau.... Perfect day in HK. We had a picture perfect unforgettable walking day tour with Jacky in HK island and Kowloon on January 23rd. Great layover tour of Hong Kong. Booking a tour with Jacky was very easy. He responds right away to e-mails and his tour is very flexible--you can choose to do more shopping or more sightseeing. Jackie the Magnificent.. Just finished an excellent tour day in Macau with Jackie. He is a very informative tour guide who somehow managed to cater to my very active partner and me who is a chronically lazy walker.Other than being very informative, Jackie has an excellent sense of humour. Stress-free tour. We spend a day with Jacky, he was knowledgeable and brings us to place that we wouldn't have visited by ourselves. We didn't have to worry on where and how to get there because Jacky was leading us, using always the most fun and efficient way of transportation.It's difficult to please a family with 2 teenagers (15 and 18 ) but Jacky did it!

Perfect organization - excellent guide. We recently spent two full days with Jacky (of our 5 day stay). He organized a tour to the New Territories and a visit to Macau – this was the only part of our trip, where I felt of having a local expert would be beneficial, as I’m normally do all be myself. All went perfectly. From several initial e-mail exchanges where we pre-planned everything to organizing a car for the day (otherwise all my wishes would have been impossible to accommodate – and by the way a lot cheaper compared to the offer from the hotel) up to getting the ferry-tickets to Macau in advance and even doing pictures of us both with his own camera (of course mailing them to us afterwards) and my own one. He gave me hints where best to exchange money (where I would get the best rate), to which restaurants to go during those days where we would be by ourselves etc. I can only highly recommend Jacky. He respected our interests fully. Not the usual travel guide who constantly talks and swamps you with facts and figures you anyway forget soon….just what is really essential to understand where you are and the key facts. I told him in advance, that I’m a keen photographer and sometimes need my time to get the right shots – he suggested spots for the best views. We like to take our time with lunch (in places where local people would eat) and to smoke a cigar afterwards – he knew the right places where you can do this. These sorts of things which show you, that your individual preferences are always respected.Conclusion: When we come back to Hong Kong, we will definitely book Jacky again to show us the more “hidden secrets and unknown gems” of his home town. He is worth his fee!

A perfect way to end a trip in Hong Kong. We visited Hong Kong in January of 2014 prior to a business trip to mainland China. After researching the city, we decided that hiring a guide would be very helpful (which it was).Jacky not only helped arranging our trip within Hong Kong, but arranged for a taxi to DongGuan, CN. His quick and detailed email responses are extremely helpful, too. On the day of our tour, we met Jacky in our hotel lobby, and immediately liked his positive and energetic attitude. To say the least, we continued to feel the same way throughout our tour. His impressive knowledge on Hong Kong was great, too! After already planning another trip to Hong Kong, I can guarantee that we'll be hiring Jacky for another tour.

a local perspective. Jacky made immediate contact upon booking, and promptly met us at the hotel on our agreed date. He immediately inquired about our previous experiences and interests, and tailored our tour based on our answers. The tour was informative and fun, and it was refreshing to see HK as a local would see this amazing city. We would definitely recommend Jacky to anyone, and we can't wait to visit HK or Macau again with Jacky showing us even more.

Walking tour of HK. Jacky Wong took our family through the main sites of Hongkong in a six hour walking tour. We used buses,trams,ferries and escalators in the most efficient and interesting way. Jacky was everything a guide should be: interesting, knowledgeable and fun to be with. There were 7 of us and we all enjoyed our 6 hours with Jacky and the view of HK he gave us. Thank you Jacky.

Great Tour of Hong Kong. My family had a 11 hour lay over in Hong Kong coming from Australia. I thought it would be a shame not to see some sights in Hong Kong while we were there. So I was very lucky and found Jacky on Trip Advisor. I have nothing but good things to say about this tour. Jacky met us at the airport as soon as we landed which was 7:30 in the morning. His detail on where to meet him at the airport was very accurate and very easy to follow. We seen so much of Hong Kong in the limited time we had. There was no way we could of seen as much on our own. We took several different transportation systems to see the city. We also got to try the local cuisine. Which was very tasty and interesting. My kids really raved about Hong Kong after our tour. And my son is usually pretty quiet. But Jacky really made it interesting for them. Yes the tour may seem a little expensive to some but how much can you learn driving around in a bus or taxi by yourself. Hearing the history, and stories of Hong Kong has much added value to the tour. Plus the tour was very personal not a whole bunch of people sharing the tour with you. Thanks again Jacky for showing us the real Hong Kong and not just the tour spots it is a trip we will never forget.

Great Tour of Macau and Hong Kong. My wife, 4 sons (ages 16,14,14 and 10), and my Mother visited Hong Kong over Christmas. We were unable to find a guide that could take us for all 3 days, so we used 2 different guides that we found on tripadvisor. Both of the guides were fantastic! Jackie handled days 2 and 3. He was everything that was advertised. He was very knowledgeable about all things Hong Kong and Macau, and was most importantly flexible in terms of what we saw each day. With 7 people touring, and with the age range of 10 to 75, you can imagine that we needed to occasionally alter the plan inter-day. Jacky was absolutely happy to go with the flow. In terms of the actual touring, he was very good at getting us around a very crowded city and avoid most of the lines. In one instance, on our way to see the Big Buddha, he took us out by the airport, and then on a local ferry (20 minutes), to avoid an hour long bus ride to the Buddha. Besides saving time, it was very interesting getting to interact with the truly local people. Jacky was also great with the children. My boys were focused on buying a few electronic type items. Jacky was not only able to take us to the area of Hong Kong where the locals go to buy computer parts, but was able to find, and negotiate, the purchase of all the items they were looking for. This was over and above any expectation that we had. Jacky was also thoughtful enough to take some photos of us during our tour, and forward them to us by email. I could not recommend Jacky more highly for anyone wanting to get an insiders view of either Hong Kong or Macau.

Conscientious and professional attitude. We took a one day tour to Macau with Jacky. Saw everything we would like to see and even more: when we already got tired and were ready to return to Hong Kong, Jacky insisted on showing us couple of more interesting places, and they were really worth seeing. We are really impressed with his professionalism and conscientious attitude to what he is doing and can definitely recommend this guide to other travellers.

Perfect day in the Life of Hong Kong!!. We thoroughly enjoyed our full day tour of Hong Kong with Jacky! Travelling on all different forms of public transit only enhanced our experience. Jacky planned our day so well, we were able to avoid crowded areas and got to see many of the hidden jewels only residents of Hong Kong would know about. Many larger tours and buses couldn't travel to or don't bother to see places we saw. Jacky also introduced us to delicious yum cha and authentic egg tarts, pineapple buns and milk tea that were 'to die for'!!! Jacky will make sure your day in Hong Kong will be a day you will never forget, authentic and original. Thank you Jacky, we will never forget you and our wonderful experience.

Perfect Sightseeing Tour. I`ve visited Hongkong with some friends. The city is amazing and fascinating. But we didn`t want to see just the typical tourist places. We`ve asked Jacky to show us the city - his hometown. He has perfect knowledge of the city and showed us places where only locals go. I can highly recommend him as a professional guide for Hongkong.

Macau and Hong Kong. Booked Jacky for one day each in Macau and Hong Kong. Proved to be the best decision for the trip. He was efficient and helpful, accommodating to the pace of 3 elderly in the group and was flexible to cater to our last minute requests to change itinerary. His recommendations of places to eat were good too. Thanks, Jacky!

Stu and Fay. "Just the tour I was looking for". Having experienced Hong Kong two years previously we felt compelled to return and explore this fascinating city in much more detail, but how, we needed the eyes of a local. I found Jacky through the tours by locals website offering a full day tour of Hong Kong island and Kowloon, all done on public transport and by foot - exactly what we were looking for. Jacky phoned our hotel room the previous night reconfirming our tour and arrived prompt the following morning - I was impressed already. The tour itself was so much more than we expected combining the must see places with the unknown places that must be seen, a delicious authentic dim sum lunch, highly informative and fun conversation and the pleasure of using an unrivalled public transport system. Thanks to Jacky we had the confidence and knowledge to move around the city for our remaining days like a true Hong Konger.

Great Time in Hong Kong. We have a GREAT time with Jacky!!! I wanted him to pick us up in our hotel in Shenzhen as myself and my daughter was not sure how to get over to boarder. BOY am I glad he did that as we would have been in the wrong line, which would have taken hours to get through customs, very confusing signs!!! We booked him through Tours by Locals which was great, as we were able to customize our tour and some companies do not let you. Everyone is looking for something different in a tour and being able to write Jacky he could get an idea what we were wanting. We wanted to see a little of old Hong Kong, test street food and see some popular places for tourist and locals. We loved our experience with testing foods and for lunch he took us to a place with only locals and no one spoke English. He looked through the list of items on the menu and we tried several local dishes, some we liked some we did not but the experience of this was fabulous! When I tour I ALWAYS pick a person that speaks the language and is a native of that country or area. We were able to see a lot in a very short time, Jacky knew where to go, the best way to get around including, a small bus ride up the mountain and a cable ride down the mountain, WOW that was great. We were able to see everything and more than what was on our list. I highly recommend Jacky!! I have posted a couple of photos.

Great day in Hong Kong. Our travel agent booked Jackie by chance thru Tours by Locals and boy were we glad! We emailed each other prior to our arrival in HK (on our honeymoon) to discuss what we might like to see. Jackie suggested we have $500 HKD for each of us for transportation, snacks, beverages and shopping. Upon arriving in HK the night before our tour with Jackie, we spoke via phone and confirmed time and arrival at our hotel.We decided to see the Island and city by local transportation; which was great! Jackie asked us if there was anything specific we wanted to see and we told him to take control and show us HK as a "local". our base was a tour of three different areas: White collar, Middle Class and Working Class neighborhoods. It was very interesting to see each group of locals in their working and living environment. Jackie's knowledge of the Island and mainland is very extensive and he had great insight to each of the areas we visited. In addition, we toured 3 different street markets, local department stores, high end shopping areas and sampled local snacks and drinks. In addition, we had an incredible Dim Sum lunch at a local establishment (Jackie ordered all the food items and they were most excellent.)Upon escorting us back to our hotel, we asked Jackie to join us for after tour beverages. We landed on a patio at local bar 4 blocks from our hotel and enjoyed beers while reminiscing about our day. When we go back to Hong Kong, Im sure we will connect with Jackie again; for a more 'informal' tour of local drinking establishments.We enjoyed our day with Jackie immensely and look forward to our next visit with him!

hong kong night tour. we booked Jackie over a month before our trip from usa. He was prompt in his response courteous, flexible and informative. Great day tour of Hong Kong!. I went on a day tour of Hong Kong with Jacky while I was in the city for a business trip. I highly recommend him as a tour guide. Jacky is a great guy and speaks perfect English. I would highly recommend this tour.

Tour of Hong Kong. I traveled with a group to Asia in October and we had a nine hour layover in Hong Kong. Fantastic day in Macau. We spent the day in Macau with Jacky as our guide. Jacky was very professional and wanted to ensure we got the most out of our day in Macau. A wonderful day in Macau. Everything went to plan right down to checking our luggage at the train station for our evening flight to London .We then proceeded to the ferry and were whisked away quickly towards Macau .Jacky took care of everything and we just followedGreat lunch included in priceMacau casinos fantastic Transfer back to Hong Kong all on timeA great tour for the day thanks jacky You should define toy use this company

great tour. Real family treat. We visited Hong Kong for 1 week but only because of our professional guide we were able to enjoy every moment of this trip. Overall he is an excellent guide with friendly smile.

Memorable day in Hong Kong. I had booked Jacky as my private tour guide at my first visit to Hong Kong in August 2013. I can just say that it was an absolutely memorable experience that I will never forget. Jacky picked me up in my hotel and over the coming 7 hours Jacky showed me a good mixture of both the 'must-see' sights, as well as many hidden treasures of Hong Kong that the 'ordinary tourist' does not see. Jacky speaks English excellently and has a very broad knowledge of the history of Hong Kong. I very much enjoyed talking to him, although I was so impressed of many of the things that he showed me that I was rather calm. Needless to say that he also picked a very authentic place to have lunch and to enjoy some of the sweet delights that Hong Kong has to offer the afternoon tea. He found a very good balance between giving me enough time to watch and enjoy the views, make photos etc. and not to waste too much time at certain places as many other attractions were still to come. He finally also gave me very good suggestions what to visit over the next few days. So, I can only very highly recommend him and will definitely book him again during my next visit to Hong Kong.

Jacky is the best way to spend your 1st day in macau!. Jacky w was fantastic. He know the islands perfectly, made sure we did all the "must dos" but also showed us all the casinos and other things that interested us. I am 42 and was there on a boys weekend, and jacky was just plain cool! His sensibility and mindset is global, his sense of humor is perfect, and he was very flexible, even joining us for dinner and drinks. Must sees: the bar at the top of the aia building, the best bank for exchanging money, and the zoo! Thanks again jacky! Lew Echlin August 1 2013
TIA Hong Kong Macau Shenzhen Private Tours. Jacky's service is excellent! He knows the city very well and the places of interest. I highly recommend his services.

Couldn't have done it without Jacky. Jacky picked us up at our hotel in Hong Kong and "ferried" us to the ferry to Macau. Our trip was a little different because we were spending the night in Macau and then heading to the airport. Jacky assisted us in getting the tickets for the next day and showed us, when we reached Macau, exactly where we would need to go to catch the correct ferry to the airport.I booked Jacky because I knew my husband would disappear into a casino and not be seen for awhile. I didn't want to tour alone (and Jacky was able to steer my husband to some of the casinos that offered what he wanted to play)I will also say that Jacky kept an upbeat attitude even when mine wasn't as happy as usual. I was coming down with an awful cold but I wasn't sick enough to stay in the hotel. I couldn't quite tour at the pace that Jacky had planned but he rolled with it. I told him the top three things I wanted to see and that was that. I enjoyed my tour and hope one day to return to Macau to see the things that I missed!

Hong Kong with Jacky Fantastic. Jacky was an excellect guide, who spoke very good English. He knew a lot about Hong Kong and was very informative during the tour. He took us to Macau, Shenzhen, and Kowloon over 3 days. We loved the Portugese Egg Tarts. They were Yummy!!He took photos of us and sent them via email to us after our tour. Thanks Jacky.

An excellent tour guide -. Jacky was great! He was a few minutes early and sat down with us to see what we wanted to do. He gave us an excellent behind the scenes look of Hong Kong. It was not what you would typically see and that is what we were looking for. He also had us try local food from meat, bakeries, etc. We toured both Hong Kong island and Kowloon. We would HIGHLY recommend him. He also spoke excellent English.

Macau Jacky Style. Four of us chose to use Jacky's service to show us around Macau. It was so great to have a local show us the other side of Macau-not just the casinos. We started with a walk through the old Portugese historic area. We went through the museum and then on to the Grand Lisboa casino. Being from Nevada we weren't that interested in the casinos but we were really glad that Jacky insisted we visit at least one. There are differences from a Macau casino to a Las Vegas casino. Overall it was a terrific day. We almost missed our ferry back to Kowloon due to a problem with a purchase. Jacky maintained calm and helped us get on that ferry with a minute to spare! It's a day we will not soon forget.

I had an awesome time, I'm glad I did the tour.. Anytime you go on a foreign country tour it's a good idea to find a local guide. Not just a local guide, but a good one. Jacky was awesome! Jacky had perfect English and we had no problem communicating. Jacky being a native of Hong Kong, knows everything there is to know about the area and the culture, as well as the best routes and ways to get you where you need to go. In regards to transportation, customs, and all the logistics of moving about on our tour, what probably would've taken us half the day and hours of our own time and lots of stress to figure out on our own, Jacky was able to accomplish in a very short and efficient time frame. Jacky personalized the tour for us and made sure we were comfortable. I highly recommend Jacky and his tour. We had a blast and I'm glad we did it!

Want a great guide? Jacky is your man.. I spent an evening with Jacky seeing Kowloon. His local knowledge and his language skills made the tour so very interesting. It was fun sampling the food along the way. We finished the evening by seeing the harbour light show. I appreciated his honesty regarding the show. We finished the evening by having a nice cool adult beverage in a pleasant place very close to my hotel. The next day I spent most of that day with Jacky seeing the sights of Hong Kong, riding the ferries and other forms of public transit. Best way to see the city. We had lunch at a great dim sum restaurant that didn't look like it saw many tourists. I saw all that I wanted to see and learned a lot about a fascinating city from a native Hong Konger.

Tour Macau with Jacky Wong. We spent a most interesting rainy Monday getting to know Macau earlier this month with Jacky Wong - a consummate professional with unique insights into this city. From the moment he met us at our hotel in Kowloon, he proved himself to be personable and completely trustworthy. I was immediately impressed by the route he selected to take us to the Macau Ferry Pier - instead of walking on the crowded streets of Kowloon, we went through Kowloon Park - a welcome parcel of green tranquility resplendent with flamingos! Our time in Macau was everything we could have hoped for and more - Jacky had lived there himself and in the course of a day guided us through all the highlights with expert pacing and understated intelligence. We felt fortunate to have found such an engaging and informative guide for our trip. We'll be back!

When you want the best...book Jacky!!. I only had two day's in Hong Kong but with Jacky as my guide I managed to see everything I wanted to see, do all my shopping, and still managed to fit in plenty of other things as well. Jacky's local knowledge and language skill's are the best! ..his English is perfect!!.. and of course he speaks perfect Cantonese. Jacky effortlessly guided me around Hong Kong on a combination of buses, under ground trains, taxi's when required, and the Hong Kong ferry, which is a must see. Meeting me in the lobby of my Hotel Jacky immediately planned a schedule that would enable me to get everything done in the limited time I had. Friendly, relaxed, organised and a great companion for both days, I'm returning to Hong Kong shortly and I'll be booking Jacky again....because he's the best!! Shane / Europe

A Great Introduction to Macau!. We were a group of two with one day to visit Macau. Jacky expertly guided us through Hong Kong and Macau immigration procedures and then provided us with an interesting introduction to Macau itself. From Portuguese churches to modern casinos, Jacky showed us the major sites of the city. Furthermore when he discerned that our interest lay chiefly with the Portuguese history of Macau, he modified his itinerary to show us more of these sites than originally planned. Overall, it was a great day out. Thank you!

Excellent Tour. Really enjoyed my tour with Jackie. I spent six hours exploring Hong Kong and Kowloon at just the right pace. Jackie hit the right places and provided an excellent insider's view to the city. We used just about every mode of transportation Hong Kong has to offer, visited a couple of great locals-only restaurants and saw some interesting sights. I give him my highest recommendation.

A Fantastic Tour Guide in Hong Kong. We have travel the world and experienced many places and many guides, Jacky stands out as the best. His knowledge and his caring manner to show us what we wanted to see surpassed our expectations. He informed us that he was a walking guide but because of our age (73 and 80) we asked for a car and driver. As we got into the car he said this was a first for him. Well for the four of us (including the driver) it was a fabulous 8+ hours of pure enjoyment. Jackie took us to places the normal tourist would not see and was very careful to stay close to us when we had to walk a little. In the end he enthusiastically told us how much he and the driver enjoyed our company and let us know if we ever came back and needed a wheel chair he would be sure to get one. It was our fourth trip to Hong Kong and the very best one. Thank you so much Jacky Wong.

Hong Kong and Macau. Jacky gave us a great tour of Hong Kong and Macau over a period of 2 days. He met us at our hotel in Kowloon and using public transit we traveled to Hong Kong Island and Macau. I'm not usually a fan of public transit but with Jacky's guidance it worked out very well and it gave us a view of the city that we couldn't get in any other way. We had a great Dim Sum lunch in Hong Kong that Jacky arranged. Jacky is very knowledgeable about the area and it's history and customs and is eager to share it with you. I expected the Macau visit to concentrate on the casinos but he gave us a great historical perspective of the Portuguese influence and the local foods. We did visit the casinos and made good use of their free bus system to get us around Macau. I highly recommend Jacky for a private tour of Hong Kong and Macau.

Had lots of Fun. Jacky our tour guide was very knowledgeable about Hong Kong and his english was very good. We did a 8 hours walking, subway, bus, and ferry tour that covered most of Hong kong and Kowloon. We got a good feel for area and had a great meal a local dim sum restaurant. Please look Jacky up for your tour needs in Hong Kong.

Visit the Casinos in Maca. When I went to Macao with my girlfriend we just went to check out the casinos and we didn't really needed a guide. We needed more of a translator. After looking online we found Jacky. He didn't mind going with us and helping us with the normal translation. We just ended up using him for a couple of hours and he charged us the same price as he would for guiding which I think was very good.

Shopping in Macao. When I was going to visit Macao I initially didn't had any guide as don't really like visiting historical places but I'm not a gambler either so my friend suggested Jacky he went with me everywhere. From casino to casino. From shopping places to restaurants. He was just a great person to have around if you are going solo.

Macau Visit. We decided to use Jacky when we went to Macau. He brought us to the historical places like The Macau Ruins. His English was very good and his knowledge of everything we saw was impressive. He spend the whole day with us leaving us at night in a very nice Portuguese restaurant.

Visiting Hong Kong and Macau as a Native. Jacky spent two days with us and provided us the history and visits to all the key sites in Hong Kong and Macau. He did a great job and his recommendations were right on. Not once did we cross paths with a tour bus, have lunch with other Americans or Europeans on tour, or wait on line with loud tourists to see any of the sites. We walked a lot but experienced the cities from the ground up. Just what we were looking for. Our traveling group of four people all highly recommend Jacky if you are looking for an insiders tours to Hong Kong and/or Macau.

Hong Kong Private Tour. Jacky was easy to work with from beginning to end! He responded to emails quickly and answered all questions up front. Traveling with a diverse group of four women, we all had different things we wanted to see and experience. Upon meeting Jacky, we handed him our list of things to see and do while in Hong Kong and Jacky went to work right away! He took us shopping at various malls and night markets and patiently waited for us while we all shopped the night away. He made sure we saw almost everything on our list while also bringing new suggestions to he table. He introduced us to a fun and delicious hot pot dinner as well as a yummy ice cream spot for dessert. He also helped us plan in full detail the rest of our trip in Hong Kong as well as a day trip in Macau, which we couldn't have done successfully without his input. As a tour guide, Jacky was very friendly and informative and helped make our Hong Kong visit fun and exciting! Thanks Jacky for everything- From your Chicago girls~

Excellent!. We had Jackie take us to Macau for a day... The walking tour was well paced with regular check points which not only allowed short breaks but sufficiently detailed briefs of historic sites. He was constantly tailoring the walk to our preferences and accommodated us throughout without losing pace nor opportunity. We were also particularly pleased to be brought to lesser known local eateries where food was outstanding! Jackie made sure to maximize our last day in HK and our timings were perfect with us arriving on time at our gate ready to head home! A truely memorable and rich experience and I highly recommend him!Thank you!

Personal & private hong kong tour. Jacky is terrific! From all of our quirky questions traveling with four women age ranges from 30-65, we all had different things we wanted to do and see, and jacky managed to cater to each of our specific needs. For two consecutive days, following all of his recommendations we were able to experience everything hong kong had to offer from a tourists mindset, a local's comfort level, as well as taking a full day trip to Macau-which is absolute must do if you have the time. Macau is a gorgeous town filled with beautiful european charm, and perfect blend of east and west. If you are on a budget, Jacky is perfect for allowing you to shop, eat delicious bites, and people watch.

Hong Kong day tour. We had an 8 hour layover in Hong Kong. I found Jacky's email on the web and contacted him. He met us at the Airport and we had an outstanding tour of Hong Kong and Kowloon. We used the bus, train, tram and ferry. We also walked a lot. Jacky took us to parts of Hong Kong that the most tourists do not see. We did not see one other tourist at our lunch stop. Lunch was great and Jacky ordered a good variety of different traditional Hong Kong dishes. We truly enjoyed lunch. Jacky impressed me with his knowledge of the history and culture of Hong Kong. He checked with us on what we wanted to see and do. We had input into where we went and what we did. Although many times we just said: "take us to your favorite places". We are both in our 70s and Jacky would check to see how we were doing and adjusted the pace to suit our needs. My wife and I both feel our tour of Hong Kong was one of the real highlights of our vacation. We highly recommend Jacky. "TheRads", Dave and Nancy

Hong Kong Private Tour. We found Jacky on Trip Advisor and are very happy we did. He replied to our initial email almost instantly and we made arrangements for him to meet us at the Cruise Terminal. I initially thought that after reading many travel books that I could do it on my own. I had second thoughts about this and then sought help.
