Jacky toured with our group of four the entire day, ordered a great dim sum lunch for us and provided great insight into the city. It was foggy in the AM so we decided to forgo a visit to the Peak, however when it cleared up in the PM, Jacky changed plans and we hopped into a cab to go to the Peak, bypassing a long line waiting for the Tram. A the end of a long day Jacky offered suggestions for the evening as well as for the next day on our own. He implored us to call him if we needed his help which we did from Tai O. He seemed delighted that we called and helped us plan a ferry trip back to Tung Chun to the MTR. Call him for your travel plans and you will not be disappointed.

Kowloon Nightlife Tour. Jacky went out of his way to accommodate us, and was very willing to increase the length of the tour based on what we wanted to see, and to even change the itinerary based on what we wanted to do. We did a combination Kowloon nightlife tour with some food stops thrown in as well. I wanted an introduction to Chinese cuisine, and Jacky took us to a very authentic hot-pot restaurant. We had a good time eating the food, and Jacky gave us instructions on what was what, and how to "cook" the food. I also enjoyed traveling as the locals do, via the local Kowloon buses.

Very nice tour guide great city. Jacky was a great way to see Hong Kong. He met us at the cruise ship, gave us a very knowledgeable tour, he was organized and knew his way around. One of the gentelment in our party needed a dress shirt and he took us to a nice reasonable shop, perfect! We were a party of four and we all agreed that it was a great day!

I only do reviews if it is an extraordinary experience be it good or bad. On a two month very upscale trip thru the Middle East and Asia . I have chosen top hotels and airlines , Seabourn as our cruise line and private tour guides based on trip advisor reviews . What can I say . Our experience with Jacky was definitely well beyond what I would have expected. Forget about private car , driver and guide . Not only do you waste your money but you also waste precious time . Jacky's mantra is to do nothing twice . That means if you take the public mini bus up to the peak you will take the tram for the return . I have been on the peak several times before but I have never seen it as I saw it this time . This statement applies to our Lantau experience as well as to our Macao day trip . Jacky knows the hidden gems , be it a small but excellent Portuguese restaurant or be it the little ferry that goes to Lantau and no other tourist was aboard .Bottom line an more then satisfying experience with a knowledgable well educated young man with style who knows where to take you and what to show you

Hong kong without Jacky. After spending an amazing day with Jacky, we had to face Hong Kong on our own and then we realised how much he adds value to a days work. Ironically Hong Kong, unlike the other Asian countries does not have many places of interest or a history and frankly, in my view, hong kong is all about its people and their lifestyle. We had a totally tailor made itinerary and it includes shopping for mammoth tusk carvings, kind of jerky pork among everything else. We our selves were not to confident of achieving all the in one day especially with the Christmas shoppers but then we didnt know Jacky at that point either. Jacky had planned the trip to go "against the traffic" we took the bus to the peak and Tram coming down. the bus had no queue. the drive was longer.. but better views and the line at the trams station! I don’t think we ever back tracked the whole day despite ever increase shopping needs. This is a skill that needs to develop. This we realized the remaining time we spent in Hong Kong. Even with years of travel experience, we really struggled to be efficient in HK. Once we spent 2 hrs and 200 dollars to travel from Aberdeen to kawloon. Just getting there became a struggle as not many people on the street spoke English. Try locating the sony shop in Nathan street. Wonder where all the sign boards are.We never got a Cantonese meal right since the day we were with Jacky. Something’s we ate since then is still unknown to me and i prefer to keep it that way. We walked.. talked... he updated us on little history they had, we did amazing local shopping. it was a fulfilled day and not until we came back to the hotel we realized what a lot we had achieved without that much of an effort. We missed all this the rest of the time.Not many people in Hong Kong can match his charm. He actually smiled as he spoke with us!!!!!. Amazingly friendly and totally down to earth. We are sorry that we never had a chance to meet for a meal again. Highly recommended as a very professional individual

Macau in a day. While friends were sceptical that I needed a guide in Macau since I understand and speak some Cantonese and Mandarin, I was determined to have one just so that I won't miss out on any of the must-sees in Macau as well as the history behind them. We (a group of 4) are neither serious shopaholics nor foodies nor history buffs, but just a bit of each. Jacky was able to meet our varied needs well without wasting any time 'cos he really knows his way round Macau and the large casino hotels. I was pleased to visit Taipa and Coloane for a glimpse of the 'old' Macau which was more leisurely and laid back. Finally, despite the declining standard of food in Macau, Jacky selected Crown (Wong Kun) restaurant which served good crab porridge, and shrimp roe noodles in response to our request for these 2 famous Macau dishes. We rounded off our lunch with a yummy portuguese tart from Margaret cafe. It was a pleasure to see so many lovely and well maintained churches in Macau and thanks, Jacky for leading us on the heritage trail at a nice pace despite my anxiety that we may run out of time to do Taipa & Coloane. You really know your stuff and we thank you very much.

Jacky Wong in Shenzhen, China - personal tour. Jacky Wong Shenzhen Day TourWell organised, flexible, personable, knowledgeable, courteous and interesting guide.These are only just a few of the adjectives I could used to describe Jacky. He provided a very professional service well tailored to suit our diverse family needs. This was for a wife who had specific shopping requirements not just normal tourist trap sites. My twin adult boys also had special electronic and sports clothing requirements. I just wanted an interesting day out without the concern of organising the family or dealing with the hassle of thinking or planning the tour.I would highly recommend Jacky to everyone who wants that unique personal tour guide service.DetailsMy wife and I had been to Hong Kong several times in fact we spent our honeymoon there and had been back a couple of times since. My sons had not spent any time in the city.This was the last time we would spend as an entire family touring. The boys had just turned 20 and they have different interests when touring now. So I emailed Jacky for a tour around the city of Shenzhen He designed the tour based on some facts about ourselves and our interests.He arranged to meet us at our Hong Kong hotel and took over from the moment we left there to until we finished and departed at the border at Shenzhen. In fact we spent nearly 12 hours with him. In that time he kept us informed about all aspects about the journey (impeccable English and native speaking Chinese).Every question was answered and he amused us with key culture backstreet facts. He was not a typical fact quoting tourist guide, who lacked emotion or thought. His commentary was unique and informative with lots of little insider points of view. He protected from the touts who just wanted to sell us anything. We had strangers just walk up to us and shout “SHOPPING” in our faces.

Hong Kong with Jackie. Great guide and tailored what we saw to get a good overview during brief stay. Plus, we are senior citizens and needed to slow down the pace which Jacky did. Liked that he blended what we wanted to see with an authentic locals experience. We highly recommend him as he even called us in the USA to discuss our itinerary.

Professional service perfectly tailored to my needs by some one whim speaks perfect English and Cantonese.. Always on time. Always efficient. I will use him again. He was outstanding in both urban and more local settings. He got me away from the tourist traps and created a very authentic local experience.

hong kng tour with jacky. a great guide who knows whre to go, also his recomendations fo restaurants and sites of hong kong were right on !!!!. i would call jacky again when in hong kong and YOU SHOULD TOO..

What a great experience with Jacky. I was in Hong Kong for business for only 3 days but thanks to Jacky I had the impression of staying one week with everything we discovered in such a short time.I asked Jacky to show me the new trendy Hong Kong with interesting stores or concept stores as well as the more traditional historic part of HK and we did more. I feel like I really know Hong Kong not the only touristic part but like a real "insider"Thank you Jacky.I can't wait the next trip with you and hopefully my family.

Hongkong in a Day. Jackie was prompt to meet at our hotel and created the program on the fly understanding our needs and requirements. We loved the way he covered the Hongkong/kwaloon Island and we used the ferry, the metro, the tram, the bus, the taxi and ofcourse we walked all around.This was a fantastic trip and very educational one on top of that. Jackie went out of the way to ensure of special conditions (we did not want to use the escalators and Jackie's knowledge of the hidden lifts at every location was priceless). The overarching objective in Jackie's guidance was the experience of Hongkong. It is nearly impossible to cover so much in such a short time and I really appreciate Jackie's help and guidance.

Kowloon evening. It was our first trip to Hong Kong with my husband. First 2 days we just walking through the city looking at the amazing landscapes. But we steel felt ourselves and behaved like tourists. But one evening with Jacky changed everything! We choose evening excurion on Kowloon for 5 h.and dived to this beautiful city with crazy drive! Thanks to Jacky we were merged with the crowd and felt like real Hongkongs people, looking at home pets and Goldfish stree, trying all street foods (some looked with dangerous), buying souvenirs in the hidden trade centers with no any tourist, drinking in Soho with crazy Australian guys! and even see famous Red district:)! Thank you very much for the tonns of tips and recos we received fom Jacky - it makes the rest days so full and interesting. We were missed you in Macao!Anastasia&Dmitriy

I would check further for assistance
have hired a taxi to see as much or even
Look further for help. We all were very disappointed in Jack as a guide. We could have hired a taxi for $250 dollars or a little more and covered more. I use trip adviser a lot and was able to have terrific guides in Siem Reap, Cambodia and Beijing. Jack would not ever give us an idea what we were going to see. We could have taken our own taxi to Victoria peak and figure out how to take the ferry ourselves, and etc. We paid for our own transportation and got nothing really towards a guide, I guess some of this was my fault for not insisting some sort of schedule. But I suggest look further or do the touring yourself.

Very Insightful Tour with Jacky. Jacky is a very energetic tour guide. As promised, he brought us all over Hong Kong and Kowloon in 8 hours. We could have gone further but we were so dead tired. We rode all form of transportation from train, ferry, electric tram, and bus. Jacky showed us the significance of each location like Shen Wan and Wanchai and bit and pieces of history here and there. Jacky also pointed out which food is very local and he even made us try a chinese rice cake. We requested Jacky to take us where we can buy computer peripherals and he even helped us in translating what we want with the stall owner. If you plan to go with Jacky, get ready to walk as this indeed is the best way to see, and feel Hongkong. One note though - Jacky relates better with adults than with kids.

Great tour of Macau. My wife and I arranged a Macau day trip (from Hong Kong) with Jacky. Communication via e-mail was great and Jacky met us on time on the day of the tour. We traveled by subway to the ferry terminal and then by ferry to Macau. Jacky was extremely knowledgeable about Macau and took us all over the place. We definitely saw many sights that we would not have found on our own. After seeing historic Macau, we spent an hour or two going to the casinos (at our request). Overall, Jacky is an excellent tour guide and we would highly recommend utilizing his services.

The best tour guide in Hong Kong. My friend and I visited Hong Kong recently onboard a cruise ship. We were in port for just one day. I have mobility problems and use a motorised scooter. The ship didn't offer any accessible tours but I wanted to participate in a day tour to see Hong Kong. Thankfully, I found Jacky Wong. Jacky was a fantastic tour guide. Despite my disabiliy and mobility limitations, Jacky escorted us on public transport and taxis, through local markets, to The Peak, shopping, a museum and a fabulous restaurant. His local knowledge, friendliness and professionalism enured our visit to Hong Kong was fantastic. I highly recommend Jacky.

The only way to see Hong Kong. Jacky Wong is definitely the best tour guide I have used. We had him show us around Hong Kong and Macau. He's punctual, knowledgeable and friendly. He took us from one end of Hong Kong to the other and we used every type of transportation available. We were then able to travel around confidently on the public transport system ourselves on the remainder of our trip. He is very flexible and can organize a tour to suit your needs. I highly recommend him.

The best way to see HK and Macau. As a solo traveller on my first visit to this area I was concerned about how I was going to cope. Fortunately I found Jacky's name on a website and my concerns were solved. He was everything a tour guide should be, punctual, knowledgeable, attentive and humerous but never boring. He provided a fascinating insight to Kowloon nightlife on the first evening. Gave me an amazing tour of Hong Kong Island the next day where I was taken well off the normal tourist trail yet saw all the main attractions and a lot of the "real" Hong Kong besides. The following day we "did" Macau and again Jacky took me off the tourist trail while still visiting all the main attractions. Jacky provided me with a fascinating visit to the region, I saw much more than I would have had I attempted to book the normal organised tours. I travelled on buses, trams, the metro and ferries always with Jacky to guide and advise and ate in restaurants and cafes that I would never have found on my own. All in all, a memorable and very worthwhile experience and one which I highly recommend to others. Thank you Jacky.

Fun, but exhausting evening. Jackie met us at our hotel (Kowloon Shangri-la) at 6pm for a 4 hour tour. We took the subway to the other end of Kowloon and pretty much walked the whole way back. Weaving in and out of all kinds of night markets, shopping and tons of food. My husband loves street vendors, Jackie had tons of great recommendations for food.I would have liked to have had more time to sit and relax, 4 hours is a long time to be walking non stop, so depends on your priorities - more ground to cover, or time to enjoy the sites and soak it all in. I prefer to soak it in.

Nice day with a nice tour guide--Jacky!. Jacky is a very nice person, he responded to my email very fast and answer every single questions that I have asked patiently. Because of him, we explored a different side of Macao successfully and did enjoy a lot throughout the journey. He is friendly and punctual. He brought us to go the must see places and ate all the must eat food there. He helped us to take a lot of pictures as well as we are a family trip that always like to take a lot of photos. He is responsible, and definitely will take good care of you throughout the way. If you have any special requirements, can talk to him, he will try his best to help you. So, just relax and depends on him, he is reliable. :)

Best tour guide !!!. Jacky is in our opinion the perfect private tour guide, interesting, funny, openminded and has answered all our questions. He is definitely worth the money and we would recommend him to everybody who wants to see Hong Kong like a local.Thanks Jacky.

Fabulous guide. Jacky was our first guide in Hong Kong and as such gave us a fantastic orientation to this great city. We used every form of transport , saw a vast area of the city ranging from the main island to Kowloon and from every facet of life that the city has to offer. Throughout the tour Jacky gave us an insight into the cities history and culture and added his own personal anecdotes. As Australians we particularly enjoyed his company as he had spent much of his adolescent years in Melbourne and could identify with where we came from. He was great company and we particularly enjoyed his sense of humour. If you are keen to see the city by foot with a guide that is great company as well as informative then I would highly recommend Jacky

Fantastic Tour Guide!!!! He is well worth it!!!. Jacky was great!!! Excellent tour guide. He showed us the true scenes of Hong Kong. It was an oringinal tour and gave us a view of the locals of Hong Kong. Jacky was great aswell. helped with the preperation prior to the actual tour assured that we were in good hands and we were!!! I would recommend him to close friends and family as well as anyone looking for a guide to show them the City of Hong Kong or macau!!!! Thanks Jacky! You made my Fiance's and My Trip one of a kind!
Casinos galore. get off the ferry and grab a free bus ride to any of the casinos just for a wander round or a flutter.

Best experience ever in hk macau. i came hk many times ,with friends sometimes with family .Always hang around same places like shopping area , lanta island , tst, etc.. But this time i came here just for three days then i think wat should i do during 3 days?? ,,,hang around at same places?? Just drink?? No!! This time i want more,so i Googled and found Jacky on tripadvisor and contacted him During trip 2 days hk-macau, he came on time ,great service, provide u the best, very friendly ,and guided me local food local hk-macau culture, also he took u to see alot of unseen hk macau!!! .. What else u need more from private guide!?!??!! I ll definately recommend jacky to my friends and ppl around me who wanna visit hk macau that if u wanna get wat local ppl do in usual life, or unseen hk macau which u r hard to get from other tour operator, ill recommend jacky to friends and who wanna visit hk

SEEING HONG KONG WITH JACKY WONG. I have just enjoyed a wonderful day with Jacky Wong in Hong Kong. He met me at the airport, helped me check in my luggage, then we set off for a day filled with the excitement of Hong Kong. Public transport, lots of walking and visits to spectacular sights made it a day I will never forget. Jacky was profession yet became my friend for the day. As a woman traveling on my own he made me feel very comfortable and I would strongly recommend him to anyone looking for a guide. He gave me a special day filled with incredible memories for which I thank him. I would give him a 6 star rating - but there are only five stars available!Sue MordinIrvine, California

enjoyable day in Hong Kong. Jacky came to meet us at the airport in Hong Kong at 7 am. Spent with us all day and returned with us to the airport in the afternoon. Jacky showed a great desire to present the real Hong Kong. At our request, we ate lunch at a good authentic and relatively inexpensive Dim Sam restaurant.Thanks Jacky for a successful and enjoyable day in Hong Kong.

Best day tour I had anywhere!. We booked this tour online, being the first time in HK, and only for a day (traveling from Sydny to Tel Aviv).Jacky was very informative and helpful in adjusting the tour and meeting place. He actually came to the airport to meet us on 7:30AM (!) in order to adjust to our schedule.He then proceeded by taking is on a whole day tour of HK, inncluding sites and off-tourist attractions, using every mean of tansportation possible, and going native as much as possible in food and experience.The thing most impressing, apart from the knowledge and excelent guide skills, was the flexibility and willingness to fulfil our wishes, were these to do with food, shopping or sight seeing.I highly recommend this tour and guide.
nice one. went Macau through it, just the boarding place not that comfort. please read and ask for more understanding

Great private tour with sweet, knowlegeable Hong Kong/Macao native. We spent a rainy day in Macao with Jacky in April. He came to pick us up at our hotel in the morning and helped us get the less expensive tickets with the shorter lines for our trip over to Macao. Once there he helped put together a tour in the rain that allowed us to get a real flavor of the island, taste the local foods, visit the wet markets and see the main sites. I highly recommend him if you would like a private tour that is designed to meet your needs.

TIA Hong Kong private tour. We spent 2 days with Jacky in Hong Kong and were extremely happy with his services. He organized the places we would go to and designed a perfect itinerary. As a native he knows every nook and cranny of the city and took us to places where other tourists do not go that gave us a taste of the real Hong Kong.We highly recommend him and could not have had a better experience.

Great day in HK!!!. Even the weather was not cooperating that day, Jacky turned that into a great tour that left a great flavor of HK for my wife, my baby (22 months) and myself. From start to finish we were able to do the most of our day, from wet markets to banks, from great views to different types of public transport... Jacky showed us the best and interesting part of HK.Ps. Food was awsome, real cantonese food.
Great service!. Wasn't able to go on tour with him because we were quite familiar wit HK and he was booked during our trip to Macau but he hooked us up with a car service at no extra cost!

Jacky is the BEST!. Leading up to our trip to Hong Kong, my wife and I debated whether we would even need a guide because the city is so tourist-friendly and public transportation is excellent. Nonetheless, we heard from friends who had used guides in Hong Kong previously that it would be worth it to have one since our cruise ship would be docked there for approximately 16 hours (8am to midnight). After reaching out to many guides, we realized that the cost would be very high to hire someone who can offer a customized tour for 2, for at least 8 hours. We finally found Jacky's name and information online and were pleasantly surprised to hear his response. He would take care of us as if we were friends, offered a very reasonable rate, and told us that he could stay with us the full 16 hours if we wanted! Nobody came close to offering us the full 16 hours without charging 2x or 3x more than their base rate after the first 8 to 10 hours. After agreeing to have Jacky as our guide, we went back and forth trying to put a basic itinerary together. He knew the city like the back of his hand and set up a few sample itineraries for our day. Once we arrived, we found him to be very knowledgeable, still flexible to our wishes (what to see/do the day of the tour), and most importantly, just fun to be with. He obviously knows the main tourist-oriented spots, but also the spots that only a true local would know about. We ended up doing some shopping, where I had a fantastic custom suit made and then shipped to the USA. We visited some historical sites, which Jacky was able to explain and teach us about. The food choices were excellent too...we got to sample some of the most delicious Cantonese food based on his recommendations, and then we topped the night off with some drinks at an awesome bar/lounge overlooking the city! All-in-all, I'd have no hesitation recommending Jacky to anyone - couples, families, college kids, retirees - because he is very knowledgeable, flexible to your needs, and just goes at the pace you're looking to set for your trip.

Hong Kong Done Well!!!. A group of us used Jacky in January 2011 for a full day around Hong Knog. From start to finish, everything was amazing! So out of the ordinary! We used various forms of transportation and got to see quite a bit. Jacky was fun, energetic and anxious to please! He is extremely knowledgeable and has the ability to make every stop exciting. He provided exceptional value and even met with us the day before the tour to discuss what we wanted and how he could accommodate our every requirement. Jacky exceeded our expectations! I am confident he will exceed yours. I have recommended him to amny friends and anyone who has used him has felt the same way I do! Book with confidence....Jacky is a keeper!

Hong Kong Tour. Jacky met us at the airport and took us for a day tour of HK, while on a 10 hour layover. We did everything "local style", taking transportation, shopping, having Dim Sum and taking in all of the sights. He did a wonderful job and his fee was reasonable.

It would have been great. We booked a 8 hour tour with Jamie and spent about 2 1/2-3hours with him before he decided to call it off due to very poor weather. We were very grateful of the time we did spend with him as he gave us a little insight into Hong Kong as a local. We are really sorry we did not get to spend the whole day with Jamie and unfortunately we didn't have another spare day we could change to. We will do all we can to get back to Hong Kong some day in the not to distant future to try again to take this tour which we knew from the start, would have been a day well spent. Keep up the good work Jamie and we hope to meet you again one day

what a fabulous day!. We booked a hole day (11 hours) with Jamie before arriving in Hongkong.That was the best decision we could made. It was very special to see the city through the eyes of a local. If you decide to see a city for a short time, to book a private guide is just the best way.We had a great time with Jamie and enjoyed our first day in HK.And thanks for the idea to have the Afternoon Tea at the Peninsula Hotel. We went there on Saturday, we had a little waiting time, but absolutely worth it!!!!And Jamie gaves a lot of other hints and tour descriptions for the next days to do, and so we did. He was like a friend who took care of us. If you´d ever come to HK, see Jamie! and have a great time.Thanks again!K + N

Two great private tours of Hong Kong - One full day, one night. Incredible knowledge of the city, the culture, and the people of Hong Kong. We had a great time with Jamie. From the booking, to the tours themselves, to the dropoff, was a first class experience. Easy to book online, pay online. Great knowledge of the city, had his own spot on "The Peak", impeccable timing on certain attractions to minimize traffic, just genuinely fun to be with, sent us over 30 additional emails on things to do during our time in Hong Kong apart from our private tours with him. Was even able to make sure we had great weather on our tours!! Would highly recommend his tour over all others.

Get to Know the Real Hong Kong. My husband and I had the privilege of having Janie as our private guide the beginning of October. I must say, we could not have a better guide to give us a true picture of Hong Kong. He knows this city inside and out and all about its detailed workings. He has lived here for 43 years and he loves his city. Jamie was so thorough in preparing us for our visit. He instructed us about the Octopus Card and areas we might like to see, but he wanted us to see what we "had on our list." We told him to please just plan our 6 hours with him the way he would take close friends who have never been to Hong Kong. Well, he did and he did a masterful job!! In just 6 hours I felt like we had really become acquainted with Hong Kong with all its facets. Jamie knew so much detail from the everyday life to the economic status of the city to its religion which is not very serious. If you want a really amazing tour to really learn about the "behind the scenes" of Hong Kong, you will thoroughly enjoy being with Jamie. He was fantastic!!! I might add that because he lived in the USA during his early years, his English is perfect! Thank you Jamie for 6 amazing hours!

Excellent and authentic way to see and experience Hong Kong. We booked two tours with Jamie before arriving in Hong Kong. The first was a four hour tour for my 15 year old (very mature) daughter to enjoy with Jamie while I was in a conference. We got very lucky that both tours were the only time during our 5 day visit that it did not rain. Jamie took Juliana to the top of the peak. Not just where the vast majority of tourists go, but further up for spectacular views and photo opportunities. They then took the cable car down and talked about life in Hong Kong. He stopped for bubble tea, which is one of her favorites. A couple of days later, following a typhoon, Jamie took both of us to a temple that was close to the public housing and a bit less crowded than other temples. He talked at great length about the culture and rituals of the Chinese and their superstitious. He was both highly engaging and funny. From there we went to the Ladies market. He taught us how to negotiate with the locals for goods sold along the streets. We used public transportation and felt very comfortable and safe throughout the journey. We would highly recommend him!J3 was one of our best decisions.

Great Tour . Had a great tour of Hong Kong with Jamie, very casual and flexible to suit our needs & preferences, very informative and good option to set us up for return visits, thanks for being so accommodating it was a pleasure
was ok. Im a 44 year traveler and for me this tour, ugly places and old local temple wasn't what I expected, the tour guide was very nice and was a good company during the tour.

Seeing where and how locals live in Hong Kong. Jamie took us by MTR to Wang Tai Sin public housing area ,difference from 70,s to current housing.Also visited Local Sik Sik Yeun Temple and tried our luck with the lucky number sticks.Was away from bustling Hong Kong shopping area.Then went to Peak Tower with plenty information along way. From least expensive area to most expensive.View was abit hazy on day but worth Jamie's extra little walk for 180^ view.Had not done private tour like this before but would recommend him,plus he has emailed more trips for us to do on our own with explicit instructions included.

Great Tour. Thanks Jamie for the wonderful tour! It was a pleasure planning our tour with you from start to finish. Very accommodating and going at our pace. Highlights of the trip were the lucky numbers at the temple, the view from the Peak, and just talking to Jamie and learning about the people. We like to learn about the people and customs of where we travel, and Jamie was a wealth of knowledge. Highly recommend Jamie and his tour!

Night lights. Jamie met me at a hotel next to the airport as I was on a stopover en route to London from Perth. I was travelling alone and wanted to see the city, but didn't fancy going alone. As I arrived later in the day, we had an evening tour of Hong Kong. We did some walking, went on the subway and also on the ferry across the harbour. It was fantastic. Jamie is very knowledgeable about Hong Kong and it's history and I found him very interesting. He has a great sense of humour and I had a brilliant evening. I absolutely recommend his services to all who want to see Hong Kong. It beats trying to navigate your own way around and getting lost!

Fantastic Tour of Hong Kong with the Family. We met Jamie in our hotel lobby and set off for a incredible full-day tour of Hong Kong, notable stops included The Peak -180 degree view, amazing views of Hong Kong, The iconic Peak Tram down ride, Wave at the US Consulate on Garden RoadSt. Johns Cathedral circa 1849, Famous Anglican Church, Cheung Kong Centre / Communist Bank of China, Rub the HSBC Lucky Lions, Lunch at Din Tai Fung (fusion dim sum), Wong Tai Sin Public Housing, low cost Government HousingHousing designs from 1970 - 2014, and The amazing Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple (Statues, Gods, Incense, Lucky Number Sticks). Lunch at this Michelin star restaurant was wonderful, and Jamie ordered wonderful dishes for us to eat.Our kids, 10 yr old Girl and 12 yr old Boy, had a great time and they as did we loved Jamie! He has a wonderful sense of humor and provided answers to all of our questions and kept everyone interested for the ENTIRE time. When you can keep a full family of four on a walking tour for 8 hours and no one complains and EVERYONE has a great time, than that is all we could ask for and more.Jamie also provided us with a great deal of additional information and detailed instructions on other self-guided tours for ourselves on our remaining days in Hong Kong which was very helpful.We thoroughly enjoyed our time with Jamie who made us feel as if we were old friends on a personal tour of an amazing city. We highly recommend a tour with Jamie if you are visiting Hong Kong, it will be well worth it!Thanks Jamie!! : ) Your new friends from New Orleans (Prevost family)

Walking tour with Jaime. I had only one day to tour Hong Kong on what otherwise was a business trip. I carefully looked at tripadvisor for help in choosing the best tour for me. I decided on a full-day walking tour with Jamie. I'm so glad that I did. From the moment my decision was made J3 Private tours made everything as easy as possible. Jamie asked what my expectations were, if I had anything that I particularly wanted to see and what, if any, limitations I might have. I decided to leave the day entirely it up to him. I was not disappointed. Jaime picked me up (right on time) at my hotel and off we went using a variety of transportation options including trains, buses, taxi cabs and boats. We started the day at The iconic Chi Lin Nunnery, very serene and peaceful. We enjoyed the Nan Lian Garden - lots of bonsai trees, rocks, koi, waterfalls, pagoda, red bridge (even though it is really orange)! etc. After a quick drink we were off to Nathan Road - longest road in Kowloon, almost 2 miles of shopping and home to the iconic Peninsula Hotel and a fabulous view of the Harbour and Hong Kong Island We took the iconic Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island (lower deck) and a taxi to Stanley where we visited a most unusual Temple. A nice walk around the Stanley market and a relaxing lunch at a lovely Mediterranean restaurant. Each stop enhanced by Jaime's story telling and knowledge of Hong Kong history. Great buss ride back with breathtaking views of the harbor, Cricket Club and other interesting sites. No trip complete without a visit to Wanchai wet market to remind us that Hong Kong is certainly a multifaceted destination. Certainly a fun filled day made so much richer by Jamie's knowledge, sense of humor and love for his adopted county, Hong Kong.

A fabulous day with Jamie. My husband, 13 year old son and myself visited Hong Kong recently and used Jamie for a full day tour of Hong Kong. We only have wonderful things to say about him. He not only knows the city inside and out, he is full of great stories, is extremely knowledgeable of Hong Kong sites and it's colorful history. You will be entertained every moment you spend with him. Taking in the local culture, taking taxis, trains and walking this very exciting and beautiful city. He is worth every dollar you spend on this tour as you will never receive such an immersive hands on experience as this. As a travel consultant myself I will never hesitate to recommend Jamie to all my clients travelling to Hong Kong whether by air or as a stop on a cruise. He is definitely at the top of Trip Advisor's List for a very good reason!

Excellent first introduction to Hong Kong.. Having never been to Hong Kong, I wanted to make sure on my first trip, that I tried to see the city from a local's perspective. After some research on TripAdvisor, we found Jamie and J3 Private Tours Hong Kong. I'd like to congratulate myself on an excellent decision, but alas, it was a stroke of luck on my part. Jamie is a wealth of information on Hong Kong having lived there for the past 44 years. Though a Brit, Jamie has lived longer in Hong Kong than many of the younger 'native' tour guides. He has lived the history they have only read about. We spent a wonderful day touring parts of Hong Kong that aren't necessarily on the big bus tour routes. Jamie is able to customize your trip for you and get you to exactly what you want to see while in HK.Walking with him and listening to his historical and modern tidbits on HK was a great way to experience the city first hand. Though a showery day, he made even the occasional stops to get out of the rain enjoyable with his knowledge. We learned a lot about HK and some of the history of it's predominately Chinese population. Very informative.Our day was capped off by a visit to "The Peak" (a must see). However, Jamie foregoes the normal tourist view points to show you a much broader view of HK and Victoria Harbor. Well worth the 15 minute walk off the beaten path to catch this view.All in all, an excellent way to see Hong Kong on a first visit. I would have no hesitation in booking another tour with Jamie and fully intend to do so on a future visit to HK. Highly recommended!

Fun day with Five girls and Jamie;)). My husband was traveling to HK for work and invited me along and when my daughters found out they wanted in on the adventure. Having not been to HK in 30 years I was a little overwhelmed to tackle the job of tourist with my four daughters ranging in age from 15-22 by myself so booked 2 consecutive days of tours with Jamie. Jamie arrived promptly at our hotel and took a a few minutes to chat with me and the girls and see what we were interested in and get a feel for our personalities. He quickly figured us out and off we went. Won't go into too much detail but, was a wonderful combo of walking and getting the feel of the culture and then having the pleasure(cool air) of taking the very efficient public transportation. Jamie blew us away with his "special spot" on Victoria's Peak and gave the girls an unforgettable experience at Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple. Had a beautiful authentic delicious lunch of dim sum and got to know each other better. Can honestly say Jamie was personable and funny and so easy going with my girls which is always key to my girls enjoying themselves on what sometimes can be a boring history laden tour. He really made sure that he gave them knowledge and experiences that would be interesting to them. Really appreciated that as a mom and made the second tour day eagerly anticipated by all of us. Second day we took a scenic bus tour to Repulse Bay, wandered around, took in the beautiful view and had a great lunch where once again Jamie patiently answered all of our questions. He even let us take a quick detour into the H&M because what teenage girl can resist!!?? Don't want to give any of Jamie's secrets away but, we had a wonderful time and would definetely look him up again if we are ever fortunate to visit HK again!!

A wonderful day with Jamie. We had very little time to spend in Hong Kong and we wanted to get the most of this city. We decided to hire a private tour guide and I found J3 Private tours. Jamie picked us up at the convenient time, took us to very special and beautiful places in Hong Kong, like Chi Lin Nunnery, Nan Lian garden, an exhibition of Murano Crystal and a very special spot at the Peak where we saw a magnificent view of the whole city. Jamie is very friendly, an easy going person with a special sense of humor. He loves photography and he enjoyed being taking pictures with us during our visit. His service is expensive, but it worths every penny. You need to be aware that it is a walking tour: you will be exploring the city by public transportation at your own cost. However, these facilities in Hong Kong are outstanding and it allows you to move everywhere faster.

Our first experience in HK, and so very worth it!!. Sometimes it's better to be lucky than good. Well, in this case we were good to book in advance and lucky to have done it with J3 Tours! A Yorkshireman in Hong Kong, Jamie provided a unique perspective on the local life after living in Hong Kong for over 40 years. Jamie met us at our hotel and we were off and running on places we were excited to visit. Some of the items we covered were the views from Victoria's Peak, taking a ride on the Peak Tram, and exploring the financial district. Jamie will tailor your tour based on your time, interests and personal requests. We love learning about the 'little things' in places we visit, that sometimes are only noticed by the locals. Jamie provided that. He also took us on the MTR as we wanted to feel comfortable traveling around Hong Kong without the use of taxi's. It was seamless and I would strongly recommend utilizing the MTR. Don't forget your camera and your walking shoes and know what you might be interested in, so you can focus on that first. We cannot recommend Jamie enough. He is witty, informed, gregarious, and kind. We look forward to seeing him again, next time we are lucky enough to travel back to Hong Kong.

A most informative day in HK. It was our first trip to HK and thanks to Jamie, we came away a lot wiser. We enjoyed the day, which was taken at a leisurely pace while we enjoyed the sights of HK. Jamie also took the trouble to send us detailed directions of other places to visit during our stay which was much appreciated.

Great trip to HK thanks to Jamie. Thanks for making our trip so enjoyable Jamie. We spent a great day and learned and saw a lot. Jamie is a Brit but has lived in HK for 40+ years so he knows all you need to know. After our day together Jamie sent us 30+ emails with trip suggestions including detailed instructions and photos. We had a great few days in HK with these guides and particularly recommend the Chi Lin Nunnery which wasn't in our guidebook but was beautiful.So thanks Jamie and look after yourself !

Our First Visit to Hong Kong. We had the good fortune to enlist the very professional services of Jamie. He provided 6+ hours of first hand information regarding every site we visited. I dare say that we hit all the highlights in Hong Kong in only one day. This would have been impossible with his help and knowledge of the area. In addition Jamie was a vast resource of information. I am a numbers type of guy and love the statistics that he quoted about the history of Hong Kong and the current culture and facts. We could not have been more pleased. I would definitely use his services again if we return to Hong Kong to explore it further.......

The Unexpect Side of Hong Kong. I lived in Hong Kong as a child from 69-74 while the first road tunnel was being built and I thought I had explored every corner of this city. So for our 25th Wedding Anniversary I took my wife to a part of the world that had such a big influence of my life. I came across Jamie and his website and gave him a tough challenge, to wow us with something I may not of encountered and was of interest.I have to say Jamie excelled himself and initially met us in our hotel and we travelled out to Diamond Hill, on the MTR, to see the Nunnery there. He took us through the history and the links between the Nunnery and the Monastery based on Lantau Island. I don't want to spoil your visit but its worth an hour of your time and the café is a nice tranquil place to take a rest. Check out the Red Bridge ("shh, it's not red, it's orange!!!).This was followed by trip to Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple (Statues, Gods, Turtles, Incense, Lucky Sticks the works). Were all forms of Hong Kongers worship come together. (See if you can spot the Star Wars look-a-likes and find your luck character. If your unfamiliar to Chinese Astrology Jamie will break you in gentle. Everyone there knows him and he's a real local with all the staff; I suppose that comes from living there for 40 years during the colonial times and now a Spec. Admin. Region of the PRC.Jamie's knowledge and depth of subjects is vast and I am sure that if you engage his services you will have a great experience and understand what makes Hong Kong tick, why it's so special, and why the Hong Kongers don't want to surrender what they have.Should you book with Jamie he will avail other tours and visits you can do on you own, without his guidance. A very valuable tool, should you wish to explore more of Hong Kong. As in my childhood/teenage years, and now, I found HK to be one of the safest cities in the world and no-one will bother you if you don't want it. Don't forget to go to the Races on Wednesday nights at Happy Valley, and be daring catch the tram, a great way to see the city, night or day. Buy yourself an Octopus Card at the airport when you arrive, you'll find it invaluable and they do special train fares into HK at reduced rates and you'll find a free (air conditioned) mini bus service to all the hotels when you get to the HK terminal.Finally, Jamie is a petrol head and is fascinated by the plethora of high value, prestigious fast cars. HK is the place to visit should you wish to see the best of the best, there's even a Ferrari Sales Garage on Repulse Bays Beach. Thanks Jamie, for getting our holiday off to a great start.

A first-rate guide. I'd been to Hong Kong a few times on business but never had the chance to see much of the place; on this trip, with a couple of free days, I decided to hire a guide. Jamie led me on an exploration of the city, with a series of major destinations interspersed with some more casual sightseeing in various neighborhoods. It was a long day, but we stopped for an excellent lunch.Jamie was an excellent guide. He knows the city and its culture incredibly well, but he also has something of an outsider's perspective which added to the tour's character. He is also extremely good company throughout the day. He was very receptive to adjusting the tour to reflect my own interests. As I said earlier, it is a long day; I am glad I had a good pair of shoes, and a bottle of water with me.He also sent me a set of very detailed emails about possible activities on my other days in Hong Kong, and I took full advantage of those.The tour was certainly not cheap, but in a world where you get what you pay for, I would say it was extremely good value.

Fabulous day out. We were a family of 4 (2 children aged 11 and 8). Jamie arranged a tour at a good pace given the July heat. Jamie's communication prior to the tour was fantastic - he responded to all emails promptly and met us on time at our hotel. He was very well informed and communicated with the children really well to keep them interested. We used all forms of public transport and he had provided detailed instructions on purchasing Octopus cards. We visited a "crazy" temple and Jamie explained all the rituals and beliefs in detail. We made a great lunch stop and Jamie helped us all try new foods. Then we went to the peak and found a lovely viewing spot away from the crowds where you actually got a better view of HK. After the tour Jamie sent us lots of information on other places to visit in HK during our stay with very detailed instructions on how to get there, what to see, etc. We used his Stanley guide and it made for an easy day out. Jamie really helped us to understand HK in a day much more than we could ever have done on our own and I would thoroughly recommend you book Jamie regardless of how long you will be staying in HK.

A great full day in Hong Kong. We were in Hong Kong for a few days, and took Jamie for one of them to show us around. Jamie was knowledgeable and fun to be with, and we had a great time with him. While certainly not cheap, we felt it was worth the price.

Private tour of Hong Kong -. We paid for the most expensive tour, just my wife and I and Jamie for 8 hours, but we were very happy with the tour. His pre-tour emails contained lots of useful advice and information, such as getting Oyster Cards for public transport. Before we met him, Jamie had gone to the trouble of finding out where my grandfather had built a house in about 1920 on Mt Kellet Road on the Peak and took us there as well as to many other interesting locations which were not crowded tourist places. A Yorkshireman who has lived in HK for more than 40 years, he was very friendly and knowledgeable about the places we visited as well as Hong Kong generally. It was a great way to spend a day.

Awesome tour!. My son and I arrived in Hong Kong at 6:00 p.m. and we had to catch a flight out the next afternoon at 2:30. Jamie gave us some great ideas about a good place to eat our first evening and some great things we could do during the evening. Thanks to his advice we had the best dim sum we have ever eaten anywhere and we saw some incredible highlights of Hong Kong after dark. The next morning he met us at our hotel at 8:30 a.m. to take us on a fast-paced, interesting 3 hour tour. We took the ferry, went up to the peak, saw the cathedral, the lucky lions at HSBC, an interesting fresh food market, the McLaren showroom and much, much more. If you have the chance to take a tour in Hong Kong, look no further. Jamie is the best!

Do Yourself A HUGE Favour!!!. Let me start by saying I'm a 45 year old woman who was traveling solo for the first time ever, and never in my wildest dreams did I ever imagine I would set foot outside the safety of the HK airport, but I did!! And I don't regret it for a moment thanks to the awesome Jamie of J3 Tours!!I was flying home from Western Australia and knew ahead of time that I would have a 9 hour layover in HK, so after some research, I decided that I couldn't sit in the airport the whole time without at least seeing some of this amazing city.I booked Jamie well ahead of my trip and he answered all my questions in a very timely fashion. We met in the airport at a predetermined spot and set off on an incredible 4 hour adventure!!Right from the start, Jamie and I hit it off. Especially when we found out our sense of humor was quite similar and the laughs were plenty after that! We used all public transportation which I highly advise. Nothing gives you a sense of what a great city this is until you've surrounded yourself with it's inhabitants, and the Air Con was a relief after the humidity outside!It was 4 hours of sight-seeing, education and all out fun!! It would take me days to write out everything I experienced and felt, but I will very enthusiastically say that this tour is an absolute MUST DO. Don't look further, stop researching and just book J3 Tours. It is worth every single 'penny'. You will not be disappointed!!If I ever have the opportunity to visit HK again, I'm hoping to have my daughters with me, and I will most definitely introduce them to Jamie and have him show them the city as well!

Insiders Guide. We (2 couples) have seen most of the obvious sights in HK over the year so we booked Jamie (J3 a Private Tours) to show us other sights we had not seen. He certainly delivered! We trained and local bussed out to the Sham Tseng Squatter Village, the Famous Goose Restaurant and the wonderful Sik Sik temple and a lot more.Jamie is full of knowledge and enthusiasm for HK, we had a really informative and enjoyable half day with Jamie. Highly recommendedPaul, Sydney

Hong Kong May 2016. We enjoyed the experience of touring Hong Kong and seeing some of the sights that we would have missed without an experienced guide. Canadians do appreciate the dry British sense of humour so that added to the fun of the day. The temple at the end of the tour and the insight into the "culture of luck" that is a large part of the fabric of Hong Kong was an interesting insight. Jamie's experiences as a non-Asian living in Asia were enlightening. Prior to and after our tour Jamie sent us loads of information, via e-mail, on things we would see, how to get there with incredibly detailed descriptions, what to expect, best times of day, restaurants to try, etc, etc. The dim sum restaurant he suggested at the end of our tour, One Dim Sum, was excellent. The one mildly negative comment was that we found the cost of the tour to be a bit high. To be fair, that may also have been because our Canadian dollar is not at a high value right now. Well done Jamie. Keep shooting all those exotic cars you see in your city every day.

Two great tours with Jamie. We just did two great tours with Jamie. On our first night in Hong Kong, Jamie met us at the hotel and gave us one of his signature night tours of Hong Kong. The tour give us a good introduction to the city, and allowed us to see its beauty at night. On our second day, Jamie gave us a full day tour of Hong Kong. He took us to a number of places that are off the beaten track. He is extremely knowledgeable about Hong Kong. We enjoyed spending time with him both because of his expertise, but also because of his great personality and his sense of humor. It was a great way to learn about Hong Kong. We walked extensively and utilized public transportation at every opportunity. Jaime gave us an excellent introduction to the bustling city. We would recommend Jaime to anyone who is looking for a great guide in Hong Kong. We were also impressed by Jamie's follow up. After our tour he emailed us a number of excellent detailed suggestions for our day on our own. Jamie was very efficient and punctual. We had a great time. Thank you Jamie

So glad I did this on my free day in Hong Kong. My first visit into Honk Kong. I had only 1 free day and I am so glad that I found Jamie. He totally customized the tour for me and I had a blast. Here is what I did:Hotel Pick UpTaxi to the Peak2 Shopping Malls at the PeakHong Kongs 2nd most expensive house, 9,900 sqft US$192,000,000The Peak - my spot wonderful views of Hong KongThe Peak Tram downSt. Johns Cathedral / Cheung Kong Centre / Bank of ChinaHSBC Lucky Lions - Historical MonumentsStatue Square / Statue of Sir Thomas Jackson / Thousands of Filipino MaidsNew Court of Final Appeal Building / Mandarin Oriental HotelWalk to the Jewellery Street via Queens Road CentralWalk to Sheung Wan MTR Station and then MTR to Diamond HillNan Lian Garden - lots of bonsai trees, rocks, koi, waterfalls, pagoda, red bridge! etcMTR to MongkokThe Ladies MarketBus to TST Jade Bracelet US$1.935 Million!! Luk Fook Jewellery Co.Nathan Road / Chungking Mansions - famous from 1961 The Peninsula Hotel - Afternoon Tea, Graff Diamonds, 14 Rolls Royce Phantoms, Waterfront / Cultural Centre / TST Promenade for the view of Hong Kong IslandStar Ferry to Hong Kong IslandTaxi to the Hotel and drop off

Know your audience. Jamie was right on time to meet my daughter and I at the Sheraton Hotel, located on Nathan Road in Kowloon. We had 4 hours to explore with him and had email communication in advance to let him know our interests. We were touring on a Sunday and had read that Victoria Peak was crowded that day so had suggested that we do this on our own the following day. Jamie is very accustomed to taking tourists to the Peak and in many of the reviews, they tout his special viewing spot and he really wanted to take us there so we went. We took a taxi in both directions because the line for the tram was so long. There was a political protest taking place with about 5,000 protestors forming a human chain the entire length of the trail. Jamie's "special viewing spot" is on the trail which anyone can walk. Despite the crowds, we felt Jamie's attitude was demeaning. I guess we are more tolerant of differing viewpoints and this condemnation was disheartening. The torrential downpour at the Peak was unexpected, but always carry an umbrella for sun and rain. There was absolutely NO view once it started raining.We enjoyed the nice bathroom stops in the fancy hotels, but we are not the type interested in multimillion dollar baubles in the jewelry display cases, nor the Rolls Royce Phantoms at the Peninsula Hotel. In fact, this kind of opulence seems so wasteful when so many people in China live in poverty. The comments about the billions of dollars of real estate spent to live in status locations was absurd. We began to understand why Jamie said that Hong Kongers rate low on the happiness index, because they can never achieve the amount of wealth and status they desire. So sad not to be satisfied with life's basic needs and to work together for the good of the community as we had been exposed to the previous weeks in Bali and Tanzania.We appreciated being shown where to exchange our currency at the Chungking Mansions, and we would never have trusted to go there alone as it really is quite "dodgy". We also went to the Nan Lian Garden which is a beautiful and calm oasis from the chaos of traffic and people in the city. We enjoyed our vegetarian lunch in the restaurant in the garden which has a waterfall veil falling over the windows as you dine. Then, we walked on our own to the Nunnery and enjoyed the serenity of the chanting and praying of local people and nuns. We really appreciated Jamie's followup email with directions to several destinations that we wanted to explore on our own. We enjoyed the ferry to Cheung Chau Island, about 30 minutes from the bustle of Hong Kong. If you are looking for a more authentic "Chinese" village, this is a quaint place to visit with nearly empty beaches and no cars! It made for a nice afternoon trip with a ferry coming back into the city as dusk became night and the lights of the city were coming on. Beautiful.The following day we took the "free" 3 hour walking tour from the Clock tower near our hotel in Kowloon and although we didn't cover as much of the city, we had a guide with a very positive attitude and that was a refreshing change.

An outstanding guide and this comes from one who has been on many great tours. Jamie met us right on time and took my wife and I on a world wind tour of just where we wanted to go - using public transportation (cleanest, nicest, friendliest) we have ever encountered. First to the Giant Buddha climbing the near 300 steps and watching a service at the Temple. On to the Nunnery and its beautiful gardens - a quick stop at my tailor H&K and then for a Ferry ride. More sites and we were exhausted by days end. Jamie was a wonderful host and a great ambassador of his adopted city.

A look at Hong Kong from the outside in.. Jamie's tour is a very unusual concept in touring. Usually, a guide will represent a location, devise a plan of attack to get you to the highlights of the location and provide tidbits and facts as learned and experienced through their training and own native perspectives.Jamie does not pretend to do any of this. Jamie gives an easy walking tour of Hong Kong based on his observations of you, his client and what you ask to do or see and interjects his opinions and knowledge somewhere in the middle of the process, as he continues to size you up. Actually, a quite clever approach!It makes for a refreshing tour. Like having a big brother show you around, because he knows what you really will find interesting, and throws in the more unusual facts that he feels will entertain you well along the way. Not formatted.Our 8 hour tour included the usual Hong Kong must sees that are on every Hong Kong tours list, but were approached from an off the beaten path method. Jamie pace is leisurely and avoids all the crowds.Jamie shares an outsiders perspective of Hong Kong; therefore the knowledge you are given is a more cultural perspectives than textbook facts. As an Englishmen, having lived in Hong Kong for over 30 years, his observations make for a tour that most will enjoy - however he does not hold back on his opinions, which may include you too! Be prepared.Yes, you could probably find many of the locations on your own, but you would be lacking in enjoying Jamie's wit and insights, and of course knowledge. Time is money when on vacation, and Jamie's tour is a wise investment in making sure your time is not wasted and you walk away with more than just "facts". Yes, he will provide additional directions for things to see, after your tour, and through his "training" during your tour, it will be easy to navigate on your own thereafter. If you are looking for more than a parade of Hong Kong "must sees' and textbook knowledge, I recommend you engage Jamie's services. His tour offers more insight and understanding of Hong Kong than just the basics!

THE Best way to see Hong Kong and Kowloon. We were only going to be in Hong Kong for a day and a half -- not much time to see such an amazing city -- and we knew we would never be back so we needed each minute to count. We found Jamie through trip advisor (our go to place when traveling) and he delivered 150% more than his best review!! We scheduled an evening tour and saw places we never would have found on our own and then a full day the following day. Using public transportation was not our initial choice --but what an awesome way to see the city! His path to Victoria Peak provided an exceptional view! From the ease of scheduling to his willingness to offer a myriad of options to us was unparalleled! Highly recommend -- Thanks for the memories Jamie!!

Great way to start our trip!. First time in Hong Kong. I was touring with my 7yr old daughter. Jaime took us to Victoria Peak and Wong Tai Sin Temple ( I believe that was its name). Both are amazing sites that should be included on your lists for the city. Jaime has lived in the city the majority of his life was very helpful. I highly recommend a tour with Jaime to start off your Hong Kong trip!

Fantastic Tour of Hong Kong with Jamie!. We couldn't be more happy with our tour of Hong Kong with J3 Private Tours! Jamie was very easy to communicate with beforehand, extremely responsive via email. We paid for the tour before we got to Hong Kong and that process was easy as well. Jamie was waiting for us in our hotel lobby. We booked 2 days with him. He took us to all of the major sites! We traveled by bus, subway, ferry and taxi! He explained all the different customs and rituals to us. He made it exciting and interesting for our kids as well. We burned incense, saw the Big Buddha, the wet markets, the ladies market, where we had a blast bartering for things. Jamie took us to his special spot on Victorias Peak where we had an amazing view of HK. We did so much more too. We let Jamie lead the way and we were not disappointed. He went at our pace, we never felt rushed. If you are going to Hong Kong, I HIGHLY recommend J3 Tours. You will not be disappointed!

Excellent, Outstanding, Amazing.. I found J3/Jamie on Tripadvisor and the internet, the whole process was a seamless service: I emailed him, he replied with trip suggestions and we arranged to meet in the hotel lobby. No payment was exchanged in advance, we paid on the day. Jamie is so knowledgeable, he gave advice, facts, ideas of where we could go and once we had completed our walking tour of Hong Kong his service and guidance did not stop there, he emailed us suggestions we could do for the remainder of our trip. Jamie is really recommended, good cost and he gave value for money, I would have booked another day with him, however I was in Hong Kong working for a few days so time was limited. He left us to select what we wanted to do and added his experience and advice, The Peak was amazing, do Jamie's trip better than waiting for the tram. Very unique, an English guy doing tours in Hong Kong! Recommended.

Fully Satisfied This Picky Traveler. After carefully studying numerous reviews on numerous websites, I finally decided to book a tour with Jamie for my 14-year-old daughter and me. I've traveled extensively and normally find tours a bit boring, but our day spent with Jamie was fantastic. He provided the perfect combination of seeing interesting things, learning interesting facts, getting a sense of the inner-workings of the city, and making it fun instead of feeling like school. The fact that he is a native English speaker definitely helped, as I've found other "English-speaking guides" were somewhat difficult to understand. I'm extremely picky, and I recommend Jamie wholeheartedly.

Hong Kong with Jamie. I am late writing this review about my 8 hours with Jamie back on the 31st March 2016.The itinerary one can suggest but best to use Jamie's knowledge of 40 years living in the city. He can take you away from the tourist trail to visit places such as the Sham Tseng Squatter Village and the famous Goose Restaurant nearby. One of the highlights was the Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple ( Statues, Gods, Turtles, Incense,and Lucky Sticks. Late afternoon wonderful views of Hong Kong from The Peak mountain. But most important Jamie will treat you like a friend. Highly Recommend.
5 hour tour. Great, personal , insider view of HK. Highly recommend Jamie to show you more unusual side of the town. Jamie will Taylor day to your needs.

Unique perspectives on Hong Kong with local tour guide.. My wife and I arranged a one night stop-over at an airport hotel in Hong Kong on a journey from Adelaide to Budapest. This left us with a full day to explore HK before our midnight flight. Finding on TripAdviser a fellow Yorkshireman who lived in HK and was a guide seemed too good to miss. Jamie picked us up at the hotel and as per previous correspondence we had left the planning the details of the tour until we met. This was just as well as it rained pretty well all day so having the flexibility of a personalised tour was a real bonus. The tour itself was interesting, informative and entertaining. It really felt like we were being taken around by a well informed friend intent on giving us a good time. We certainly saw parts of HK that one would not normally see as well as managing a dash to The Peak during the only short break in the low cloud and rain the whole day. I may be giving away one of Jamie's secrets but the restaurant in the YMCA is not what you expect and is a great place for lunch off the tourist trail. Overall a highly recommended and productive way to spend a day in HK.

Can't recommend enough! Fantastic guy & tour guide!. I had a private tour with Jamie with my boyfriend. He is really relaxed and easy to get on with. Wish we could have had more time with him! I really feel like we saw things that we would not have seen on our own! Jamie also showed us how to use the train system and how to get about on our own. This was really valuable and helped us enjoy the rest of our holiday. You get more than just a tour, because following the tour Jamie emailed me lots of tips and guide. These included step by step maps on how to get to places of interest with photos. This was amazing and I can't thank him enough. The stour started by Jamie meeting us in our hotel lobby. The tour was conducted on foot, train, star ferry and by taxi. We saw many great things with Jamie. The tour was fun, informative and relaxed. It was the best thing we did in Hong Kong. I would recommend his tours to everyone. Worth every penny! If only he can give us a tour in every country we visit!

Hong Kong Perfection With J3. Recently 6 of us off a cruise ship spent the day with James on his J3 tours. Great decision! We enjoyed all of our stops, our public transport-really a fun way to go-and all of James expert knowledge. His suggestion for lunch turned out to be the best lunch we had during our 25 days in Asia. Sometimes tours and locations seem to blend together but we will always remember Hong Kong in detail. Thanks James!

Tailor made tour, great experience. I had just one day free in Hong Kong and was so glad I spent it with Jamie. Very knowledgable, kind and funny guide that showed me the true Hong Kong. Thanks Jamie, wonderful memories.

Unique, fun, interesting.. Spending the day with Jamie was like hanging out with a friend who lives in Hong Kong. Inside tips, humorous anecdotes, as well as historical and cultural information. Highly recommended!

Excellent overview of Hong Kong. We spent two consecutive days with Jamie touring us around on a walking tour. We saw many interesting places and some "tourist" must sees-but it was Jamie's personality and humor that made the days great. He did a great job explaining some history and superstitions among the locals, and we also saw the "real" Hong kong as well our personal requests. Jamie was a pleasure to be with and made our days there full. thank you Jamie. I highly recommend.

Top tour in a top city.. Firstly I'd like to take the opportunity to thank Jamie again for our brilliant tour. As a group of 5, we spent an entire day with Jamie as he showed a bunch of first timers the beauty and hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. Jamie is obviously a very knowledgeable guide having spent an awful long time in the country and was able to perfectly tailor the tour to our wishes. What I enjoyed most about the tour was that although we visited the most talked about and known parts of Hong Kong, we were also shown and learnt about the areas not mentioned on Trip Advisor. Visiting beautiful nunneries and inner city temples along with Jamie's information of the area gave you a real feeling on the way in which the locals really went by their day to day business.Jamie was also kind enough to send through a lot of additional information of other places to visit including directions and top tips so that we could spend our last days clearing up our things to do list.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Jamie's tour to friends and family and my advice to you if considering it? Book it now! You really won't regret it.

Wonderful Tour - well worth the time and cost. This was a GREAT way to see some of the sites of Hong Kong and learn a lot about the city, it's history and it's people. Jamie met us early on a cloudy, then rainy morning and we had a wonderful time. Because of his schedule and ours, we had time for just a 4 hour tour, and that was just right for us. His knowledge of the city and engaging dialog made all of the difference as learned as much as we saw sights. His tour also gave us the confidence to see some of the other sites on our own the following day. The mix of walking and riding public transportation was just right for us...although I should have picked up an umbrella at the hotel before we left. :-) We could not see some of his favorite sites because of the cloudy and rainy weather, but his tour was wonderful and we would look forward to another tour with him should we make it back to Hong Kong.

Informative and fun!. Our group of 5 spent the day with Jamie. He met us at the cruise ship port and we were off! It was fun to navigate the streets and subways as he helped us explore Hong Kong. He even gave us directions on how to get to places the next day when we were on our own. Book him early and enjoy!

Fantastic Tour with Jamie!!!. Professional and friendly from start to finish. Jamie provides a lot of useful information prior to, during and after the tour. You will need to make sure to book in advance as his schedule can be quite full. If you can, book Jamie at the start of your HK stay as he can give you suggestions for the rest of your stay.We had a 6 hour tour (which ran 7 hours) - Jamie was very generous with his time and wanted to make sure we saw as much as possible. We went to the peaceful Chi Lin Nunnery and Nan Lian garden. We actually saw a nun - per Jamie this is like seeing "Bigfoot" - a very rare sighting!. We went to the Temple where they many HK people go to play the "lucky stick" game. I say playing a game for a reason. They shake out a stick and if its an unlucky stick number, they put it back and try again. I got #62 which means - double easy life. I liked that one so didn't feel the need to go back for another one.We went to the Peak and Jamie took us to his favorite spot which is about a 20 minute walk away from the observation point. Its on a walking path. We had a beautiful view of HK. Jamie was enjoyable to be with and felt like a friend. I would highly recommend Jamie to anyone who is looking for a private tour.
Tour of Hong Kong. Jamie was excellent. Very knowledgeable and gave us tidbits that we would not have otherwise known. Would highly recommend him.

Amazing day with Jamie!. Our family of four, including two children ages 6 and 9, spent a full day with Jamie touring around Hong Kong. He kept our children occupied and interested for 8 hours and my son wanted him to join us for dinner! He was informative, entertaining, and delightful. He taught us about the culture of Hong Kong while showing us great sites. Our daughter still talks about the lions outside the bank! Jamie's secret spot at the peak was such a bonus. It was an amazing trip for our family and Jamie was phenomenal. We wanted to spend another day with him but unfortunately he was already booked. He sent us detailed instructions on how to enjoy a trip to the Big Buddha which we planned for the following day. He has our highest recommendation. We will definitely call him the next time we are back in Hong Kong!

Fantastic overview of Hong Kong sites. Jamie is fabulous not just at providing a wonderful tour, but also providing his insights about what Hong Kong is all about - who lives there, how the city works, etc. This was a totally worthwhile way to start our stay in Hong Kong I highly recommend booking some time with Jamie!

A fantastic way to see Hong Kong like a local!. My boyfriend and I were docked in Hong Kong harbor for an overnight on a cruise ship. Since we only had a day to explore the city we wanted to make the best use of our time. Two different friends of mine who had toured Hong Kong told me that there is only one way to see the city--Use Jamie from J3 Tours! Nothing in the city is inexpensive, including a tour with Jamie, but you certainly get what you pay for and much, much more. We took trains, buses, a taxi, a tram, ferries, moving sidewalks, escalators and elevators covering about 20 miles in our 8 hour tour of the city. There is simply no way we could have seen all of the sights in a single day with any of the ship's tours, and when we compared notes and pictures with others on our ship we came out the clear winners for the best tour. Thank you Jamie for one fabulous day in our new favorite city.

Made to feel at home in Hong Kong. Jamie was a pleasure to spend time with. He looked after us very well and took us to see sights that we wouldn't have ventured to on our own. The travelling became part of the experience with anecdotes and information about the areas we passed through to reach our destination. Once at the destination Jamie's knowledge was passed on in a very entertaining delivery that was genuine and pitched for all ages in our family group. Jamie was very considerate, making sure we had a first class experience. He even cut short our tour when rains came in, rearranging for later in the week so getting wet didn't spoil our enjoyment. We definitely gained invaluable confidence using public transport that enabled us to follow several of Jamie's detailed recommendations for other places to see on our own.Overall a first rate experience that left us feeling connected to the history and day to day life of Hong Kong as though we live here.

A must for everyone. We are just back from HK and we enjoyed our private tour with Jamie. He is a very friendly person, with a deep knowledge of the city and all the anecdotes about such a great place. We had not just wonderful time with him during the tour but also a lot of hints for the following days so that we were able to get out the best from our time. Great also if you have children with you. In my opinion, consider always the longest time you can afford, as time literally flies.Actually you have to consider his tour as the best investment you can do while in HK!Trust him!

Great day with a great man!. We love tours that take us into places most do not go to. The tour was diverse as we went from neighborhoods to Temples, from the greatest view on earth (the Peak) to watching women dancing in closed streets. You must take THE PEAK tour with this man as he knows every inch and the best views. We give Jaime the highest of highest recommendations for his knowledge, his wit and his manner.

A great day. We had such a wonderful day with Jamie! He picked us up promptly at our hotel and he guided us around Hong kong. We started at Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple that really gave us a insight to Chinese religion and how important numbers are in their lives. Just when Jamie told us that we would draw some attention to us, we suddenly became surrounded by smiling mainland chinese women that wanted their photos taken with our blonde and blue eyed daughters. For girls from the selfie generation that was a really exciting experience! We then went to many other places like Nathan road, the Peninsula Hotel (and all the luxury cars outside), star ferry, Stanley and much more. We learned a lot about Hong kong and their culture, and we saw many different sides of Hong kong from the public housing in Wong Tai Sin to the skyscrapers in central to the old colonial Stanley. We had a great day and would highly recommend Jamie as a guide to anyone that is looking for a great day in Hong kong. Or actually many great days since Jamie kindly offered his recommendation and detailed guides to other places to visit by ourselves. Although all the talk about numbers made us feel a bit uncomfortable seeing that our plane back home was departing from gate 44. Luckily we are not chinese so we got home safely!

Great afternoon with a great guide. With a limited time in Hong Kong for our first visit I wanted to hire a guide and I got very lucky with Jaime. Met us in the lobby of the Residence G hotel and we were off for a 5 hour tour. His incredible knowledge of Hong Kong history, people, customs and beliefs really helped us understand the city and how it works. We used the subway, bus, cabs and walked and had a truly wonderful time. His advice on things to do after we were together was excellent and he is a "must do" when coming to Hong Kong. Unfortunately, the day we had for our tour was cloudy and foggy. Made for a really cool trip across the Star Ferry, but not good for photographs at his "special" spot at the peak. Oh well, we'll try again next time. I'll also be on the lookout for those special statues around town next time. Personally he is a super nice person, witness how he treats and is treated by people we encountered on our tour. I couldn't recommend him more....thanks Jaime. Hope to see you soon on our next trip.

Brilliant tour guide!. We spent one and a half days with Jamie and saw more in that time than if we had spent a week on our own. Jamie has spent most of his life in Hong Kong and knows the place inside out. He has masses of information about most things but will tailor the tour to meet your interests. We were particularly interested in culture, history, religion and everyday life in Hong Kong and that is just what we got. Travelling on public transport was an experience in it's self and so very easy. We would highly recommend his tours.
