Fun day on a private tour!. I scheduled my only free 5 hours in Hong Kong with Jamie! He met me in the lobby of the Mandarin Oriental at 10 am on Sat. Mar. 12. It was a gloomy, cool and foggy day but his upbeat personality and sense of humor cut thru all of that. By subway, ferry and taxis, we covered lots of ground while he filled me in on history, cultural norms, religious customs, local government, etc. I had a view seldom seen by the average tourist, including public housing (he pointed out clean streets and lack of graffiti and why), the details and importance of picking lucky numbers, temples, original markets and modern neighborhoods, bays and piers. Because of the fog, we did not visit the peak, but I did not miss experiencing it because he later emailed photos taken on a clear day. We did not enter museums or visit touristy shops, using our time to be on the streets and near the water. He dropped me off back at my hotel lobby after a fun day - felt like touring with a friend!

Relaxed and very informative!. We only had 2 days in Honkers this time and wanted to get a taste of Kowloon so arranged a 4 hour tour with Jamie. We discussed what we wanted beforehand via email and Jamie tailor-made our tour to incorporate all we wanted and more. Jamie picked us up from our hotel reception and using Octopus cards (pre bought at the airport on Jamie's recommendation), we travelled the underground MTR to Diamond HillChi Lin NunneryNan Lian Garden - lots of bonsai trees, rocks, koi, waterfalls, pagoda, red bridge! etcMTR to Wong Tai Sin Wong Tai Sin Public HousingSik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple (Statues, Gods, Turtles, Incense, Lucky Sticks)MTR to MongkokLadies Market Drop OffJamie was informative, amusing, relaxed and the tour was definitely just what we wanted!

Intimate Knowledge of history, customs & day-to-day details of life in Hong Kong. Bottom line, Jamie is an absolutely excellent tour guide - do yourself a favor and look no further!!! During an 8-hour tour he showed us the highlights of Hong Kong and set us up with the information needed for all the additional sights we might want to see while we were there. Most importantly to us, he was able to answer all the very detailed questions we asked of him about the history and life in Hong Kong ranging from income tax rates to real estate values as well as a whole lot more. To us, these details really made an impression of Hong Kong that we will have with us for the rest of our lives. Having been to China previously it was most interesting learning this information from the point of view of a long time English resident of Hong Kong.

private tour Hong Kong. Took an 8 hour tour with Jamie, well worth it as we covered a lot using local transport that we would not have been brave enough to navigate ourselves. Great insight to Hong Kong way of life and customs, enjoyed our day and if we return would book again to see things we missed this time. Hope you are keeping well Jamie, and sticking to the diet. Thanks fot everything.

Night time city walk with Jamie. Jamie met us at the clocktower at 7 for a 3 hour tour in the evening. He took us effortlessly through Hong Kong, using the octopus cards that he lent us. Professional, full of information and very comfortable in the city, Jamie is a great guide to hire in Hong Kong.

Half Day Tour with Jamie. One of the best tour guides we have ever had in any city we have visited around the world! THANK YOU JAMIE!!!!Jamie is a wealth of knowledge and very personable. Truly wished we had more time with him! His follow up emails with additional information of things to see and do made the rest of our 4 night stay in Hong Kong terrific! He's not inexpensive, but you do get what you pay for when visiting a big city like Hong Kong!! I HIGHLY recommend Jamie!!

Very worthwhile, highly recommended for short stopover sight-seeing tour. Good way to see the sights on 2 day stopover. We visited four areas in a single day with 2 children (12 and 8) - was helpful to have Jamie to explain public transport (very straightforward). Jamie good company, helpful, organised age-appropriate sites and managed the day very well. Would highly recommend a tour guide if you're only in HK for a short time, and Jamie was excellent.

Excellent Intro to Hong Kong Tour with Jamie. We scheduled a 6 hour tour with Jamie for December 21, 2015. He showed up at our hotel promptly for pick-up. He assisted our group of 6 with obtaining Octopus cards and we were off. Jamie did a great job of showing us first-timers the major sites as well as providing entertaining social commentary and historical facts about Hong Kong. Jamie did a great job of keeping our 9 and 12 year olds engaged and keeping the pace relaxed for my 68 and 70 year old parents. He even took some great family group photos of us with his camera at his spot at the Peak and emailed the photos to me that same night! Jamie came highly recommended through TA and he lived up to his rating.

An excellent start to our stay in Hong Kong. Jamie tailored our tour to what we wanted to see during the full day with him. As well as seeing the important sights, he explained much more about the city and the people living there. His knowledge of the public transport system enabled us to quickly get around Hong Kong and his suggestions of what to do on our next day with full instructions was a great help. A very friendly professional guide who we would thoroughly recommend to other people.Thank you Jamie

A foggy day in hong kong. Despite the low cloud I had a fantastic day seeing Hong Kong and Kowloon. He tailored the day for me and to make the best of the weather. It wasn't just about "on your left there is" we talked about the culture, the people and the ups and downs of living in HK. I am a woman travelling alone and he was courteous and considerate. I would recommend him to anyone visiting the island

Perfect Day. Jamie is an outstanding guide and our day with him was great. We (6 adults between 63-73) all felt that without Jamie we never would have seen many of the sites. He made sure we had the best seats on the bus, took us to the best spot on the Peak (not the top of the building) and he explained many things that allowed us to better understand Hong Kong. I highly recommend Jamie. We had another partial day in Hong Kong and Jamie sent us suggestions of places to go with detailed directions of how to get to them. He is a great guy and we enjoyed a day.

One of the best tour guides I've ever had. I was in Hong Kong for 5 days this past December. Jamie spent two different days with me touring Hong Kong. He tailored the tour to exactly my liking and I learned a tremendous amount about the city on my tours with him. Jamie is a great guy, and a total blast to be around. I hope my travels take me back to Hong Kong again. I would love to experience more of the city with Jamie's knowledge again.

First time in Hong Kong made so easy with Jamie. I had read about Jamie on trip advisor and knew he could help two older ladies from the English countryside manage the transformation to large city inhabitants. Hong Kong is a huge City with fantastic transport links. Prior to our trip and upon booking Jamie, he emailed us with all the info needed. Very professional, very trusting, no deposit required....... Perfect.He met us at the hotel as agreed and the took us on great trip through Honk Kong'shistory with iconic views from the peak, historical buildings and traditions, social and religious history travelling to parts of Hong Kong your average visitor would not see. He also gave us the way with all to get our Octopus cards for the remainder of our trip.However the aspect that places Jamie above a bog standardguided tour(apart from his humour) is the aftercare. He had recommended a top Dim Sum place to eat the night after our tour which was close to our hotel. After 45 mins of looking I sent a desperate text to Jamie explaining we were lost and within two minutes he replied and gave us the exact instructions to find this place and we had the best Chinese meal ever!When we got back to our room there were seven suggestions for things to do the next day so with his instructions and a map of the islands we sat over a beer and made our choice.The next day, armed with Jamie's detailed instructions with photos at every turn, we country folk mastered the MRT, public bus service with our octopus cards walking through buildings, up and down escalators to get to our destination which was across the other side of Hong Kong Island. Stanley what a great place. Wow! No high rise, great market, sea front restaurants what a difference and an area we would never have seen without Jamie's help. We had lunch on the front in quiet and peaceful surroundings. Bliss.We are now in Sydney feeling pretty pleased with ourselves for making the decision to stop in HongKong when the apparent safety of Singapore has always drawn us on previous trips. Hong Kong was very safe........ We were there just before Chinese New Year so it was teeming.Thanks Jamie........ Wonderful trip which we will always remember.

Interesting. We spent just over four hours with Jamie and he explained a lot of stuff to us that we would never have known about Hong Kong. He clearly loves the place, as you would want from a guide. He is a bit of a litter lout though (he's not - it's a private joke).

Bill Sievers was great!. I had booked a tour with Jamie, but he was ill and not able to be there. He asked Bill Sievers to do the tour instead. We walked aver 10 miles, so wear comfy walking shoes. We went to places I would NEVER have seen otherwise. A special place on the peak, a nunnery with fabulous gardens, the ferry, the bus, the underground. What a great experience! Thanks, Bill!

Zooming through Hong Kong with Jaime. We were fortunate enough to spend a day with Jaime at J3 Private Tours Hong Kong yesterday and I have to say it was money well spent. My husband Dan and I enjoyed our time with Jaime very much. He added so much to our visit to Hong Kong and only wish we could have spent more time with him. He has such a depth of knowledge about this wonderful city and he knows where to go and how to keep the day interesting. It is one thing to walk through an area and see things on your own but seeing these sites with Jaime provided us with insights and perceptions that helped us understand the culture and history of Hong Kong. He knows the city inside and out and i would have followed him around the city all day.

Hong Kong. En-route to India, we spent 6 incredibly informative (and entertaining) hours with Jamie Lloyd of J3 Private Tours) while in Hong Kong. Our tour included visits to the HSBC Lucky Lions, Statue Square/Statue of Sir Thomas Jackson/Weird Antony Gormley Statues, New Court of Final Appeal Building, taxi to the Peak, breathtaking views of Hong Kong from Jamie's special spot, a Star Ferry crossing to Kowloon, the Waterfront/TST Promenade for the view of Hong Kong Island, Hullett House Hotel/1881 Heritage (boutique hotel and mall), the YMCA (we stayed here in the early 1990's), The Peninsula Hotel (Graff Diamonds, 14 Rolls Royce Phantoms), Nathan Road/Sheraton Hotel for a cigar stop, lunch at Din Tai Fung, and finally Nan Lian Garden (an idyllic space with bonsai trees, rock gardens, koi, waterfalls, pagoda, red bridge and quiet from the bustle of the City). We heartily recommend booking a tour with Jamie Lloyd!

Great 4 hour tour for a solo female traveler. I set up my tour with Jaime because I was traveling alone and wanted to get assistance getting around the area & seeing some highlights to give me an idea of how I'd like to spend my next 2 days in Hong Kong. He picked me up from my hotel promptly at our agreed time. He was very professional & knowledgeable, and I got to see some amazing views that I would never have know how to find. Not only was the tour itself great, but sent me several other ideas for places to visit on my own time; that included detailed directions specifically from my hotel. Having such thorough directions really helped save me time from getting confused in the subway. As a solo female traveler I felt very safe with Jaime, and would recommend him as a tour guide.

Perfect way to start a Hong Kong visit. My 20-year old daughter and I spent a week in Hong Kong in early December. While I had been to Hong Kong before, I wanted to have a better sense of sites that we needed to see. So we booked an afternoon tour with Jamie. After meeting at the Star Ferry, we took the MTR to Wong Tai Sin and spent time at the Wong Tai Sin Temple. Jamie's knowledge of the temple, its iconography, and rituals (like lucky sticks) was both amazing and interesting. He also gave us a better understanding of the political and economic situation in Hong Kong. Next, we returned to Kowloon and walked through the Peninsula Hotel, giving us a preview of afternoon tea (which we did later in our trip).Almost as wonderful as the tour itself were Jamie's follow-up notes. He took the time to send about 10 e-mails with suggestions for the rest of our trip based on our discussion. We found his recommendations incredibly helpful for the balance of our stay.I definitely recommend booking a tour with Jamie--do it early in your trip so that you can benefit from his extensive local knowledge.

Jamie: a fantastic guide!! A wonderful adventure!!. We spent 2 days with Jamie who gave us a wonderful introduction to Hong Kong. He amazed us with his knowledge and entertained us with his good humor and infected us with his love of cars! He showed us the city 'beyond the typical sites'. He explained the culture, history and real life. We were beyond thrilled and wholeheartedly recommend him. He assisted us with finding a food walking tour and planned an outing for us to The Big Buddha with detailed travel instructions and excursions. We are planning another visit to Hong Kong next year and we cannot wait to spend another day with Jamie. The best guide ever!!

Amazing time and wealth of information!. So glad I came upon J3 Private Tours Hong Kong in trip advisor. After I read Jamie's website, I knew this was the perfect tour for my family. I was completely amazed that even before I had booked with Jamie, he responded to my email exchange questions promptly with advice and recommendations in the planning of our broader trip. Jamie's enthusiastic demeanor in his email exchanges truly added to the excitement of the trip. The tour with Jamie allowed us to experience HK and its people at street level. I intentionally scheduled the tour the first full day we were in HK so that we could take full advantage of our education from touring with Jamie (i.e. how to utilize public transportation and Jamie's vast insider's knowledge) to make the most of the remainder of our stay in Hong Kong. The knowledge and insight Jamie shared was immeasurable. Our son told us after the tour, he enjoyed Jamie's tour, his wealth of information and personality as much as my husband and I did. After the tour, Jamie provided additional 'sight seeing' and 'things to do' with step by step 'how to get there' instructions for the remainder of our stay. Honestly, the hours spent with Jamie was right up there with the highlight of our Hong Kong trip!

Fascinating Day with Jamie. We toured with Jamie on the 31Dec. He actually had other plans with family but was nice enough to take us on a day tour since that was the only day we had available. We had a great time. Both before and after the tour Jamie sent us information that we needed to know, and later sent photos and other tour links. Yes, he is not cheap but saved us lots of time because he knows the alternative ways to the sites and added value due to the additional information and stories during the tour. He is very charming and both my husband and I enjoyed his company and tour guiding ability.

A local celebrity who knows his stuff. I took my mother for her 70th birthday and thought it would be better to have a local private guide so we could go at our own pace and see what we wanted rather than be part of a large escorted group. I'm so glad we did! Jamie was the perfect host for the day and we were impressed with his extensive knowledge and gentle nature. Jamie was very thoughtful and genuinely cared that we were seeing what we wanted to see. It was my first experience of having a private guide and Jamie has set the bar very high.

on the road with Jamie. Jamie is friendly guy. Knows HK like a native and makes a good combi of the touristy stuff and the not so well known but interesting places. Important is also that he does not overload you with facts and figures all the time like some guides do.Its a good balance between conversation and information

Great way to start your vacation. Jamie's tour was a wonderful way to begin our vacation--it's lovely overvie of both sides of Hong Kong, as well as a good primer for how to get around on the MTR. In addition to his unique perspective on HOng Kong, we enjoyed hearing about th dichotomy of pre- and post-transition HKK. His follow up guides about quickest ways to transact her sites were invaluable both to return to the Peak as well as goi out to the Tian Tan Buddha. Thank you!

A big dose of local knowledge makes all the difference. We would highly recommend this tour if you are considering a guided tour of Hong Kong. Jamie is very laid back and chilled but also extremely professional and courteous. He very quickly put together an itinerary that suited us perfectly and hit all the high points we wanted to see, including the Peak, star ferry and a temple, whilst including several snippets of interesting facts in between. His experience meant that we got the best vantage points to see the city from, from the best seats on the bus to the best viewpoint on the Peak, and his understanding of the local customs and traditions was very illuminating. He has a good sense of humour which added to the experience and left us feeling both informed and entertained at the end of the tour. An added bonus was that although Jamie is very clear on not being a "foodie" guide he had plenty of recommendations for good restaurants to try. Altogether a very enjoyable experience and ideal if time is limited during your visit to Hong Kong.

Evening walking tour of Hong Kong. Jamie Picked us up at our hotel - on time!He walked us through the maze of Octopus Card options.We caught the MTR to Admiralty MTR Station and then a taxi to the Peak.We had a quick look at the malls but then went to a spot Jamie knew and which we never would have found. It had the best uninterrupted views of HK and we had it to our selves!He knew a Vietnamese Restaurant where we shared dinner.We then caught a taxi to the Mandarin Oriental Hotel, saw some amazing chocolate at Chocolate Creations and caught the Star Ferry to Kowloon via malls / Apple Store / Hong Kong Eye.We dropped into the The Peninsula Hotel, walked up Nathan Road and he dropped us off.We might have done all of this our self in 4 hours, but probably wouldn't have. More importantly Jamie's interesting commentary and very tailored approach made the night for us.It was worth every cent!

Highlight of our trip, reinvigorating end after week in Hong Kong. This was our first ever walking tour, and it did not disappoint—my mom can't stop talking about the tour days afterward!Despite his busy schedule, Jamie accommodated our last-minute booking for a 4-hour tour on our last day in Hong Kong. We had seen most of the major attractions after being there a week, so our only request was that we go somewhere new that we hadn't visited and more off the beaten path.Even with the downpour that day (Jamie is not discouraged by bad weather!), we managed to visit some interesting sites, including the Wong Tai Sin Temple and Mongkok wet market in Kowloon, that we would've otherwise missed. At his recommendation, we ended our tour with a satisfying dinner at Din Tai Fung.Throughout the tour, Jamie shared historical, current, and cultural issues/events of Hong Kong and its people as well as his own experience growing up and living there for 40+ years (and all with no sugar coating, which I appreciated). He was a jovial, easygoing, and enthusiastic guide.Jamie's tour was a worthwhile way to end our first trip to Hong Kong, and we would tour with him again. We recommend you book him for a longer tour (can be anywhere from 3-8 hours) and do the tour at the start of your trip, so that you can refer to his insider tips and recommendations when planning your itinerary. Share your interests/requests and ask questions to get the most out of your tour—Jamie has much to offer. Have fun!

Excellent tour with Jamie!. My family and I chose to tour Hong Kong with Jamie. This by far has been the best tour we have done. Jamie was an excellent tour guide. We learned so much about Hong Kong from the people, the history, and the food. Jamie is very knowledgeable about Hong Kong and knows all the ins and outs. This is a must do tour when visiting Hong Kong that you will not regret! Jamie recommended the best Chinese food restaurant as well. Thank you so much Jamie for an unforgettable day!
Great tour guide, highly recommended!. We had a 5 hour tour with Jamie which we had wished was longer!Friendly and knowledgeable, you will not regret booking him.

The perfect overview and confidence booster we needed!. We had a 7-hour tour with Jamie on our first day of a week long stay in Hong Kong. My son (11 years old) and I had our eyes opened to getting around Hong Kong. We learned how to use the subway system and now use it with confidence. We visited a temple and now have a fascinating understanding of Chinese lucky (and unlucky) numbers. Stuff we'd have never known about had we chosen other ways to get to know Hong Kong. Our tour was full of laughs, conversation and was over all too soon. It completely set us up for the remainder of our stay, and he even sent us some useful emails to help us out for the coming days. Thanks Jamie, we'll be recommending you to a friend who is visiting in August. See you next time we come to Hong Kong!

Perfect day with Jamie!. Our tour with Jamie is one of our favorite honeymoon memories! Jamie is incredibly knowledgeable about Hong Kong and taught us so much. Jamie planned an excellent tour for my husband and me, which incorporated history, culture and cuisine. Not only did Jamie plan a perfect tour, but he also sent my husband and me sample itineraries for our second day in Hong Kong because we told him that we did not have anything planned. This was extremely generous and very much appreciated. We truly enjoyed Jamie's company - there was never a dull moment and we laughed a ton! A tour with Jamie is an absolute must-do if you are visiting Hong Kong!!

Just the Right Size. Our tour of Hong Kong was just right, as much as we wanted and needed but no more, never intrusive, never to excess. When he greeted at the hotel, he already knew our names and professions. He gave us a representative sampling of what we wanted to see, starting with the enormously interesting Wong Tai Sin temple, with an informative introduction to Hong Kong religion and money. He called our attention to the throngs of mainlanders, who looked at us westeners much differently than their Hong Kong brethren did. From there we visited the Mong Kok street markets (and saw how subaltern Hong Kongers live.) Watching a fish monger whap an eel against the sidewalk was quite striking! He taught how to haggle for silk scarves in the Ladies Market, and recommended another, hugely eclectic market that we visited on our own (Yue Hwa Emporium.). As part of our tour, he took to an excellent restaurant, where he (at our request) ordered a sumptious repast. After lunch, our 6 hour tour turned back to Hong Kong island (another perk of thetour was to learn how to use the subway system) where he gave us a brief but informative tour of the architecture and a recent art installation.He escorted us back to the hotel, a tour that turned to 6 ½ hours with not a moment wasred. After the tour he sent us a well thought-out list of suggested activities.

Understanding Hong Kong - Not just observing its treats. Jamie is a wonderful character, bigger than life ( or so his wife would assert) and full of passion for Hong Kong. He has a laconic approach to sharing insights into what makes Hong Kong tick whilst imparting huge amounts of knowledge about the history, people, sites and politics of his chosen home. I've engaged many tour guides over the years and it's a pleasure when you meet one who has a deep knowledge of his city and keeps it current - but then delivers it in a way that has you hanging onto every word. Not one boring moment. We saw more than we imagined existed, and enjoyed every mimute of it. Many laughs, a few shocking facts, many amazing insights, a few subjects we agreed ( in good humor) best not explored for the sake of harmony. In sum, a day we'll remember forever. Do yourself a favour and contact JAMIE next time your in his territory.

Great Day With Jamie. My 21 year old daughter and I spent the day touring with Jamie yesterday. It was fabulous. Book Jamie for your first day or two in the city. He will devise a tour to your interests and desires- no cookie cutter tour with him! He is intelligent, interesting and fun.He also will help you with logistical questions and suggestions for the rest of your trip.Just hire him- you won't be sorry.

Jamie Is Absolutely "The Best" Private Tour Guide In Hong Kong. Early in December 2015, my wife and I, along with another couple booked tours with Jamie of J3 Private Tours Hong Kong – one in the morning and the second in the following evening. Jamie met us at our accommodations in Tin Hau and we set off on foot. It was as if we had known him for years from the very first moment that we met. His sparkling and truly outgoing and warm personality serves him exceedingly well. It seemed as though he knew people where ever we went. A veritable treasure trove of information on this fabulous city, we learned facts and figures on various aspects of Hong Kong that would be impossible to acquire from other than a true expert and resident. He has so many “insider” stories about the city that a typical group tour guide would never be able to learn of, let alone share. In addition to experiencing the serious cultural and physical aspects of Hong Kong, we quite simple “had a ball” while we were seeing the sites…lots of good laughter made our long walks seem easy. Jamie showed us how to use the MTR and bus systems which are extremely convenient ways to move about this great city. We left Hong Kong with the feeling that we were leaving a new friend behind. We truly felt that his services were worth every penny of his fees. One simply cannot go wrong by booking Jamie as a private tour guide. He has justifiably earned our highest possible recommendation.

The best way to visit HKG. Jamie made our Hongkong trip very exciting and worth remembering. Jamie told us lots of interesting stories, which in a short time, helped us to get to know this city better. Thank you Jamie for the great experience in Hong Kong. Thank YouDominika, Paweł, Karolina & Nina

rain cancellation. I had booked a night tour with Jamie but unfortunately it was one of those days with low clouds and rain all day. Jamie showed up at my hotel and offered me the option of cancelling as there would be no views on the city due to the clouds. I thought this was very fair on his part.As he was already fully booked the next day he recommends me a colleague.All in all this gave me a very professional impression!

THE BEST. If you are visiting Hong Kong, Jamie is DEFINITELY your guy! We booked him for a 1-day tour and it was simply unforgettable. We visited some awesome places that we would otherwise never have known to check out, but what was truly above and beyond was the cultural knowledge he added to the experience. From teaching us about Chinese numerology to the local religious customs to information about government housing programs it, it was all interesting and plain old fun! Jamie's dynamic personality made for an easy-going and relaxing day that was somehow still packed with sight-seeing more places than we ever thought we could visit in 8 hours. An even better addition was Jamie's willingness to help us plan the rest of our days in Hong Kong. He had some great recommendations for things to do and places to see on the other 2 days we had in Hong Kong and it helped us maximize our short time here. It is thanks to Jamie that we feel we got the "true" Hong Kong experience. =) THANKS JAMIE!!!

First trip to HK --full day tour = amazing!. Jamie was a fabulous guide. He took us to unique spots around town that we wouldn't have found ourselves. He was great company, super knowledgable, and provided us with memorable moments that we will never forget!! Can't wait to come back to HK- when we do, we will book another tour with Jamie.

Belated review for J3 Private Tours Hong Kong. As we plan for another trip to Hong Kong I just realised that I had neglected to upload a review for time spent with Jamie from J3 Private Tours Hong Kong back in January 2014. Jamie's personalised, private tours were fantastic. We spent a day and an afternoon/evening with him. Use of public transport was a perfect way to get around this amazing city. He was able to tailor the tours to our specific interests and we saw parts of the city that we had NEVER seen on our many previous trips to HK. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a different perspective on this dynamic city and particularly if you want to avoid the typical impersonal group tours. Jamie also generously emailed us directions to help us some other places of interest. MANY thanks Jamie - Judy & Patrick from Australia.

Half-Day Tour with Jamie. As first-timers in HK, we called on Jamie to give us his "greatest hits" tour in 4 hours or less. As total HK newbies, Jamie met us at our hotel and we started the tour off by going to the train station to purchase our Octopus cards. We appreciated Jamie's local knowledge and expertise of commuting through HK. Our first stop was Victoria Peak; a quick train ride then taxi to the top and then a walk to Jamie's secret lookout spot for the best view. The best thing about having a guide like Jamie is that he knows all of the "secret" spots and how to avoid the crowds and lines. Next we trained back into the downtown area and took a walking tour through the central business district, with Jamie pointing out all of the significant buildings and historical monuments, while simultaneously impressing us with his wealth of local history. Next came the highlight of our tour, a visit to the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple. Again, Jamie impressing us with his knowledge of the statues and gods, explaining the importance of lighting incense and trying our luck with the lucky sticks, all while giving us the background on the superstitions of the Chinese and numerology. It was fascinating stuff! Lastly, we had asked him to end the tour at a casual dim sum restaurant, and we were not disappointed. It was a nice place, with great service, food & prices. Overall, we felt that our time with Jamie was well-spent. When I asked him to recommend some things for us to do on our own the next day, Jamie emailed me a bunch of detailed information and directions. That is what a professional guide does!

Knowledgable guide and tour. We enjoy private tours of cities as they are usually more informative and interesting and without the rush of the big groups. This was no exception. Jamie was knowledgeable and kept it entertaining. It was a warmish day when we did it and the children were getting tired by the end, but Jamie managed to keep them entertained and at the same time explained us about life in Hong Kong. I would recommend it to those looking to get a better understanding into Hong Kong.

Great Tour with Jamie--November 25 !. My wife and I had a great time with Jamie on our recent Hong Kong trip. Jamie was professional, fun, and gave us another experience of Hong Kong which one can only get with a local. He answered all of our questions. You name it, and we probably talked about it: politics, culture, people, sports, society, sanitation and garbage pickup, cars, watches, construction, money exchange, shopping, Jamie’s family, etc. This was the second time to visit Hong Kong for us and we were very satisfied with Jamie’s tour and conversation. Before our trip, Jamie communicated extensively about any question we had. On our first trip last year, we took the shuttle to our hotel in Kowloon. For our second trip we asked Jamie; he recommended a taxi and he was so right. Jamie made a recommendation for dinner near our hotel. What a fantastic place to eat--Din Tai Fung a modern Chinese Dim Sum Restaurant.Originally, we thought about doing a 4-hour tour, and then decided to do the 6-hour tour. Time goes by so fast, now we realize we should have done the 8-hour tour. So, a recommendation, do the 8-hour tour if possible.We very much enjoyed our time with Jamie and recommend him. One really can’t get know Hong Kong without a tour guide like Jamie. Thanks Jamie, no doubt, we’ll see you on our next visit.

A fantastic HK Tour. My father and I took a Tour with Jamie after the many solid reviews on Trip Advisor, the man really knows his craft! Now, I had made a few specific requests for Jamie in advance, as we had already toured a number of HK sites by that point, and I was hoping to get a chance to learn a bit more of the history of the island under British Rule, focusing in particular on the inspirations for the old James Clavell novels, Tai Pan, Noble House, etc... and Jamie delivered in spades! We started off by going to the Peak, which is one of those classic must-see tourist destinations you read about HK, and it definitely lives up to expectations! We were treated to a great walk along an unexpected path towards the best view of the city, narrated with some great insights from Jamie on the history and recent news on all sorts of notable (and little known) landmarks. Jamie's knowledge of the island and its goings on is encyclopedic and we were really left with the sense that he had tailored the tour to our own interests. From the Peak we took the Tram down and got the best seats and view on the tramway, descending down to the financial district where we first explored a bit of the history and significance of St. John's Cathedral and then moved on to the HSBC building and had a great introduction to the architectural design warfare between the major rival banks over achieving the best Feng Shui and continued on to Statue Square, Prince's Building and New Court of Final Appeal to learn a bit more about the original "Taipans" whose built their headquarters there, and which became the heart of commerce on the island. All in all the tour was a great success, we ended off at the Mandarin Hotel going a bit later than we had scheduled so in parting he gave us some easy to follow directions to place to stop for lunch nearby, which we took and were extremely satisfied!Although we were interested in some of the colonial history of HK, it's clear that Jamie has a wide range of experience conducting many different types of tours of the city ,and the best advice I can give is that if you want a specific type of tour experience just contact him and tell him what you're looking to do. Top Notch, definitely recommended!

An excellent whistlestop tour of Hong Kong. We had a fantastic day with Jamie sight seeing around Hong Kong. He was great company, informative with lots of local knowledge. He tailored the tour to our own specific interests. We would highly recommend him to anybody who is thinking of a personal tour. Thanks for a memorable day Jamie!

A Wonderful Introduction to the City. Three of us spent a full day with Jamie, traveling by bus and underground, using the Octopus Card to get around. We started in Central, where Jamie suggested we visit the Ohel Leah Synagogue. Walking through the streets to the Mid-Levels escalators, we headed up through Soho, and stopped at the Jamia Mosque, another spot we never would have know about on our own. Traveling by bus we headed down to St. John's Cathedral, and then onto the subway headed to Kowloon. We toured the beautiful Chi Lin Nunnery and the Nan Lian Garden, and another temple seemingly dedicated to prayers for success and money, and wandered through the wet market seeing all the interesting items and creatures for sale. Jamie told us about Hong Kong through the eyes of an ex-pat and long-time resident, and was not shy about his opinions. We had some interesting discussions. Jamie tailored our tour to our interests, which he does for all his clients. Ask him to show you where you will be going on a map, because with all of the moving around, it is easy to lose track of where you are. Jamie is very good about communicating with you to organize your tour, as well as answering questions about Hong Kong in general. You won't go wrong spending time with Jamie.

Walking tour of Hong Kong. The day of our tour was rainy but Jamie made the most of it. We barely got wet due to his knowledge of the city and ways to avoid the rain. We visited the Chi Lin Nunnery which was spectacular and which we would have never found on our own. We stopped for a snack before visiting the beautiful Nan Lian garden. We then took the MTR to Nathan Road where we strolled and saw the 24K gold Mickey Mouse, all 23 lbs of it. Following this we viewed the waterfront and took the ferry to Hong Kong island. There we went to the top of Victoria Peak to a breathtaking view of the city from a wooded path away from the crowds. We then had lunch at the Lookout restaurant followed by a trip back to the city to see the Peninsula and Mandarin hotels with their spectacular architecture, Graff diamonds, and Rolls Royce limos.Jamie made a dreary day into a very pleasurable experience and I highly recommend him for those who want a personal tour.

Fantastic Tour.. I travel all over the world for business and had been to Hong Kong several times. This visit was for fun, and it was my wife's first time in Asia. After doing a lot of research on tour guides in Hong Kong, I settled on Jamie. As a lot of other reviewers have noted, Jamie is not the cheapest, but you definitely get what you pay for. My wife and I had a tremendous time. Aside from being a great tour guide, Jamie is the type of person you want to spend all day with. He has a lot of interesting things to say, and we really enjoyed his company. As for the tour, we took the Star Ferry, saw Jamie's spot on the Peak, and went to Stanley. We skipped the Wan tai sin temple, as we did that the day before on our own. It was a tremendous day. We preferred taxis to public transportation, and don't worry if you feel the same way. Jamie just wants you to enjoy your experience and is completely flexible. I highly recommend Jamie, and can't say enough good things about him and his tour guide skills.

Hong Kong through the eyes of a native!. My wife and I just returned from an extended holiday in Asia. Our adventure began in Hong Kong, where we retained the services of Jamie Lloyd. Jamie’s knowledge of Hong Kong, willingness to share his comprehensive expertise and experience, from suggesting we purchase an Octopus card (to make paying for the Metro and other services easy), to giving us detailed instructions on how to find some of Hong Kong’s hidden treasures was greatly appreciated. His enthusiasm was infectious and made our three-day visit memorable. Jamie is a consummate professional, who listens to your requests and finds sites that make one marvel over the “magic” of Kong Kong. This skill was greatly appreciated, particularly when he took us on a tour of Hong Kong at night that was breathtaking. My wife and I have nothing but the highest praise for Jamie’s knowledge, expertise, and keen insights into his city.

An Excellent Tour Experience!. The two of us had scheduled a short stay in Hong Kong after a two week tour of China and we engaged Jamie for a four hour tour for the morning of 09/23/15 which was our first full day in the city. Jamie arrived promptly at our hotel and made sure he took us to several popular sights we had requested to visit. He also took us to some fascinating places we would never have even known about had we been exploring on our own. Jamie was friendly and knowledgeable and we moved about the city on foot and on public transportation at a pace that worked comfortably for us. Jamie answered all of our questions and we really had a great time with him as our guide! His graciousness and expertise were evident throughout our entire experience with him as he provided invaluable information and insights regarding transportation, dining options, and things to see and do which helped us even when we were out on our own that afternoon and the following day. We would highly recommend Jamie's services to other travelers visiting Hong Kong! Great job, Jamie, and thanks again!

Very interesting tour!. Although rain was permanent, we really appreciated the detailed tour through daily life in Hongkong with Jaimie by public transportation!If I come to Hongkong once more, trip with Jamie is on my list...Thanks JamieAndrea and Florian

Wonderful in all respects. Jamie was a truly great guide. He understood what we were interested in (off the beaten path) and did an absolutely fabulous job. He was prompt, funny, and interesting. I have nothing but praise for his tour.

Amazing tour with Jamie of J3 Private Tours. This past summer, my family (husband and two teenagers) went on an Asia Adventure. Besides Japan and mainland China, we spent 3 days in Hong Kong. For our first full day, we booked Jamie of J3 Private Tours. In summary - worth every penny and we all had a terrific time! Jamie took us to temples, shrines, markets, The Peak, Stanley, a seaside lunch, and a short bus trip! While on the mainland we had local guides who were Chinese (and excellent), it was unique to be able to get a foreigner's perspective of Hong Kong from Jamie - although he's lived there long enough to be considered a local himself. Being a typical Brit, he had us in stitches with his sense of humor. He told us things about the Hong Kongers that were enlightening. We definitely felt as if we'd gotten a taste of Hong Kong in half a day and many, many insider tips for the following two days that we spent on our own. Jamie genuinely cares about the people in his tour and he listens to what you'd like to see and/or experience. Highly, highly recommend. You won't be sorry!

FAVORITE TOUR!!. This summer I visited many places around China, but our first stop was Hong Kong. My sister and I are 17-18 and went touring with Jamie all day! We had such an amazing time. We went MANY places in 6-8 short hours! He filled us with many fun and interesting facts. He was definitely our favorite tour guide of the whole trip. He is so full of energy and will literally take you everywhere if you want to go! He also took pictures for us so we could keep many memories! I would definitely recommend this tour guide to families!

A new best friend jamie. As my senior trip was coming to a start I was ecstatic as to what China has to offer my family. Our first tour guide, Jamie, not only showed us the entire city and made it the most entertaining learning experience of our lives, but he also showed us to enjoy the little things in like. Even if that happens to be a strawberry frap!! My family and I have not only made a friend for life but we have many pleasant memories with our dear friend Jamie. You are the best.

Fun and efficient Hong Kong overview. Our group - two moms and two girls, ages 6 and 7 - had only one day to see what we could of Hong Kong. Jamie did a great job assessing what we could/should see and getting us around the city (on a rainy day) in an efficient manner. He was courteous, personable, and well informed and gave us a wonderful Hong Kong overview. I would not hesitate to hire Jamie again if we find ourselves in HKG again, hopefully when we have more time and flexibility in our schedule. Many thanks Jamie!

Amazing Anniversary tour. I am going to start with an apology for the lateness of this review due to my workload since our return. We booked a private day tour on the 10th Aug for our anniversary treat and we were not disappointed. Jamie is a fantastic guide and we were given a diverse tour of the city. Jamie is very knowledgeable and could answer any of our questions and we had some very interesting conversations so much better than being one of many on a group tour. I would not hesitate in recommending Jamie and when we return to HK (which we hope to do soon) I will be booking with Jamie once more.

a unique tour in Hong Kong. I had an overnight layover in Hong Kong and wanted a tour of Hong Kong that would give me an overview of the city in 4-5 hours. I am so glad that I found Jamie, having lived there for more than 40 years he certainly knows the city, the quirkiness of life in Hong Kong. He is well read, current on politics, business, culture which leads to great conversations. In our tour through the city I felt like I was out with a friend. We used taxis as well as public transportation and covered quite a bit of the city. We were not overly tired, we went back energized and still talking about all the things we saw. Jamie even gave us the right advice as to where to stay since we had an early flight out of Hong Kong. After years of giving tours he seems to be able to gage his clients well and what they would like to see. I am looking forward to my next visit to Hong Kong.

Superb Day Out with Jamie. We had a wonderful full day tour with Jamie yesterday. For my wife it was a first trip to Hong Kong and for me a first visit in ten years. Jamie's communication both pre and post booking (and indeed post tour) is clear, concise, accurate and prompt. We wanted to do the tour on our first day to both orientate ourselves and to see parts of HK we probably wouldn't otherwise see. Jamie delivered a masterclass in a day tour. It was like walking round with a very well informed old friend. The conversation never flagged and included both detailed information and little tit bits about life in HK generally. A natural story teller with an easy manner that keeps you engaged throughout.We were concerned that an eight hour tour in the heat and humidity might be too much for two of us in our fifties. It is perhaps here that the skill of an experienced guide comes through. Yes it was hot and humid but every time it was perhaps just starting to affect us it was time to visit an air conditioned building or move onto the air conditioned metro or stop for a cold drink. We actually over ran at the end of the day and walked over 5.5 miles without really noticing. Now that is skill and experience.We did indeed see things we would not otherwise have seen in areas of HK we would not otherwise have visited. We also got many useful ideas on how best to see things on our own, best times to visit, tips for viewpoints etc.Overnight we have received so much follow up information from Jamie that we will need longer than the week we have to take advantage of all the excellent suggestions.We cannot recommend Jamie highly enough. We have been travelling since January and Jamie is the best guide we have had. Absolutely excellent.

Visit To Hong Kong. My wife and I have always wanted to visit HK and we did for our anniversary in Sep 2014, and loved the place; so much we wanted to get back asap. We got the chance in June 2015 with our daughter and her friend. For this visit we wanted to lean more about the history of HK (which is rich), but more from the perspective of a colonist who lived the transition from Britain to China. We found Jamie through TA. Jamie was fantastic, HK is a small place and we thought we saw it all on our first visit. Jamie made our second visit more enjoyable than the first (which we did not think was possible). We learned about what drives the HK people, how they live and the about the many facets to the jewel that is HK. Jamie is a accomplished photographer, car enthusiast, and lover of nature, all of which helped make the day we spent with him fun. We would all highly recommend Jamie for your visit!

The Best Hong Kong Tour!. Booking this tour was the best thing we did in Hong Kong. We decided to do it the first full day we were there and that worked out very well. Not only did Jamie provide a wonderful day for our tour, but he was able to help us plan out the rest of our days and gave fabulous instructions that made it stress free to get around. We felt like we saw things we never would have seen on our own. Jamie was very flexible...we weren't sure what we wanted to see....we were able to see so much more than expected in 5 hours. The bonus was learning how to navigate the MTR....this was priceless for the rest of our trip. HIghly recommend Jamie, worth every penny!

Personal guided tour of selected Hong Kong sites, culture.. Having Jamie as a personal tour guide was brilliant. We did not want an en masse shopping-oriented tour. Jamie showed us the Hong Kong he obviously knows and loves, and gave us an informative commentary on its culture, traditions and changing face. As a long-term resident, Jamie provides an objective overview. He is also happy to research and provide info and tours on specific requests, to make it all very relevant and meaningful to the individual tourist. He does short, middling and long length tours, using public transport, taxis, walking, etc. All very manageable.Great four hours!!

A man for all seasons. We took the morning tour with Jamie and were so impressed that we also booked the night tour. We are a family of 4 with 2 sons of university age. Jamie took us around at our pace and his knowledge and delivery was excellent and entertaining. We went to the Peak, took the Star Ferry to Kowloon, and visited the Temple Market amongst other key sites, and Jamie also took us to less well known and fascinating placesWe strongly recommend Jamie as your guide in HK, and he even aranged the weather to behave for us. Also if you like cars he is your man.

The best way to know HK. Jamie made our Hongkong trip very exciting and worth remembering. Jamie told us lots of interesting stories, which in a short time, helped us to get to know this city better. Thank you Jamie for the great experience in Hong Kong.

Hong Kong Tour. During our honeymoon trip we had a 10 hour layover in Hong Kong. We looked into a tour of the city and chose J3 private tours based on all of its great reviews. We weren't disappointed. Jamie met us at the airport and from there we spent 5 wonderful hours with a kind and knowledgeable local. Our expectations were met above and beyond...we would highly recommend Jamie if you are wanting to learn about and see Hong Kong! Cheers to you Jamie...until next time!

Excellent introduction to Hong Kong. We spent an excellent 4 hours with Jamie. He managed to keep my wife, 4 kids aged 16-6, and I engaged and excited with his immersive trip round Hong Kong. He was very helpful in helping us plan our next days' activities, and emailed us details options and itineraries. A great first day in Hong Kong. Thanks Jamie!

great hong kong tour. Best guide we ever had. Let us go at our own pace which meant that we were almost 2 hours over the 4 hour tour - no charge! So much better than a bus tour. He took us to the Peak, metro to cab on the way up, the tram on the way down. Avoided the 1-2 hour tram wait! The day after the tour we got 10 very detailed tours to the places we did not visit, including picture by picture guide to get there. I don't know of any other tour that does that!

Great insight to HK. Highly recommended.. Jamie's communication both before, during and after the tour was fantastic. He advised us to purchase an octopus card and gave clear instructions on how to buy one before we even left the UK. This was an invaluable piece of advice since it made getting around so simple.We had the eight hour tour. It was completely flexible with start time and itinerary but we left the itinerary up to Jamie as his knowledge and experience was based on many years of living in HK. It was interesting to use local transport as part of the experience.His insight as a 'life long' expat was invaluable and gave a unique experience which was well delivered and we would highly recommend Jamie!

Well done! . We had a great day with Jamie! We decided to take a tour with him on our first day in Hong Kong and we are so glad that we did! He has lived in Hong Kong for many years and has vast knowledge about hongkongers and the culture in Hong Kong. It is very interesting to hear his stories and also looking at his car picture collection. He is a very nice person who is able to adjust the tour according to your needs(helped us to get a SIM card along the way) and also takes excellent pictures. You don't have to worry about the itinerary with him as he would have a rough idea planned out for you already. Just set out with him and you are bound to come back with a wonderful day where you did not have to worry about directions/what to do next. We went to many attractions with him in Hong Kong (peak, nanlian garden, star ferry, Wong tai sin, chow tai fook etc). Besides that, he gracefully provided us more details on things that we could do on other days! Places to eat, things that we can do and also how exactly to get there. He's a great guide and so friendly that you'd feel you were just spending a day out with a friend:) Thanks for making our Hong Kong trip a more memorable one!

Excellent!. If you have a few hours or days in Hong Kong, don't miss out on a personalized walking tour with Jamie. It will be one of the highlights of your trip as it was ours. We always treat ourselves to a personal tour guide in one city when we travel and luckily for us Jamie was available on very short notice. There were so many factors that could have dampered the 1st day in Hong Kong and it was just perfect with Jamie. We arrived 10 hr earlier after traveling for 16 hours but Jamie was very considerate with the pace of the tour without anyone mentioning it. Nevertheless, a lot of ground was covered in 4 hrs with a well traveled 7 yr old in tow. Even though the weather was hazy,Jamie sent us several beautiful photos of our family overlooking the Peak using his camera. It was hotter and more humid than we had ever experienced in our lives, but we rode the MTR train, the Star Ferry to Kowloon and Tram from the Peak in great comfort. And that great Octopus card he talks about in great length we used afterwards at Starbucks, the indoor ice skating rink and grocery store in the Elements mall connected to Ritz Carlton by escalators. And even after the tour, he emailed us 10 itineraries ( we used 2 of them)with detailed instructions and pictures so we could navigate HK on our own. Incredibly generous!

Couldn't have done it without him! . Couldn't end our family trip without mentioning Jamie and leaving him a well-earned 5 star review (he gets a special 6th one from me just for his patience!). We enjoyed 3 wonderful tours with Jamie with our 5 kids in tow. He gave us not just the famous landmarks but lots of fascinating facts and tidbits from his extensive knowledge of Hong Kong. It was a pleasure spending time with you Jamie and if we're ever in your neck of the woods again we'll definitely be giving you a call. Good luck with that elusive Number 8!!

Jamie is a star!!!. Had 3 amazing tours with Jamie in Hong Kong. What this guy doesn't know about Hong Kong isn't worth knowing. He has a great sense of humour and is so kind and helpful.If it helps we travelled with 5 children age from 15 to 7 and they all really enjoyed themselves.Have absolutely no hesitation about recommending Jamie, remember to ask him about his car number plate collection!!
Best deal. Very good...The trip was memorable for me.....its have fun ...cherish always in our mindso we want to visit here again ....Every time

Great evening taking in the Hong Kong Skyline. Jamie gets busy, tried to book before we left home, his only availability was in the evening. As it turned out this was a blessing as temperature had dropped and we had a great time at the Peak watching the sun go down and the lights come on. Would have no hesitation in recommending Jamie, his knowledge of all things HK is clearly second to none. We booked a three hour tour, Jamie met us in our hotel and dropped us at excellent Chinese restaurant 4.5 hours later at no extra cost.

Jamie is a GREAT tour guide!. Early this year, a colleague and I were planning a ten-day business trip to Hong Kong. He suggested that we take one of our days to tour Hong Kong. I contacted a business associate in Hong Kong who told me she would arrange a private tour and asked what I would like to see. I told her I would do some research and get back to her. That's how I found J3 Tours on Trip Advisor. The reviews were so engaging that I suggested to my colleague that we bypass our associate in Hong Kong and sign up directly with J3. What a great decision! Jamie met us at our hotel and took us all over Hong Kong - subways, taxis, walking, ferry - we did it all, including lunch at the famous Peak Lookout Restaurant. Along the way, Jamie had wonderful stories, special places (one special viewing spot high above Hong Kong that was spectacular!). Not only was the day enormously enjoyable - Jamie is great guy and lots of fun to be with. We even taught him a thing or two - including how to use Shazam! If you have the time to tour Hong Kong and if Jamie is available, you can't do better! Rick Brenner

Hong Kong from a local's perspective!. Jamie's tour of Hong Kong was wonderful. I would highly recommend him! He offers a fun and interesting perspective of the city, from the posh to the nitty gritty. He has endless knowledge to share, gained from having lived there almost his entire life. Not only did Jamie spend his entire day with me on a personalized tour, he was more than willing to offer me advice and tips on the sight-seeing I was planning the following day Lantau Island. His advice ended up saving me time and money. I give two thimbs way up for J3 Private Tours!

Wonderful tour with Jamie. Jamie is a great Hong Kong guide. We had a half day tour to see the highlights of the city and it was great. Jamie is a very nice person, knows the city very well, managed the time and the group perfectly, and has a good sense of humor. I strongly recommend him.

4 hour tour Hong Kong. Family pilgrimage trip to Hong Kong. Easy to book with Jamie and he gave us advance information of places to visit and how to get there. Sadly the weather was bad with lots of rain but Jamie made the best of this for us and we visited places we would not have done if the weather was good. He used the ferry and subway systems and so any future visits will be much easier. We felt very lucky to use the system like the locals do. Advance information about the Octopus card also a great tip. This was a great way to spend 4 hours with a tailored tour in a vibrant city with an enthusiastic chap. Thank you Jamie.

Knowledgeable Ex-Pat with Amazing Cultural Insight. The best thing you could ever do if you are an English speaking Westerner going to Hong is hire J3 Private Tours. He was a fantastic guide who gave a unique perspective of the Hong Kong history and culture. His native language is English, so no language or humor barriers. It was all so easy. I am delighted that we found him right here on Trip Advisor. I would highly recommend J3 Private Tours for your stop in Hong Kong - without any hesitation. You should too!

4 Hours in Hong Kong. I made a business trip to Hong Kong and only had a half day to explore the city. As I started researching the city, I was a little intimated and overwhelmed. I wanted to make the most of my short time there so I decided it would be best to hire a private tour guide. It was easy to check Jamie's availability and book his time. He was also very accommodating as I reached out to him with only a week's notice. Jamie met me and my colleague, who decided to join at the last minute, at our hotel. He was prompt and friendly. We spent 4 hours touring the best parts of Hong Kong and along the way Jamie exposed us to the taxi, ferry, bus and subway system in Hong Kong. (I found this valuable, because if I ever return to Hong Kong, I will feel much more comfortable navigating the city on my own.) If you don't have the time to research and plan on your own, or you simply find it too intimidating, then I recommend booking a tour with Jamie.

Effortless fun, just what we all needed !. We booked a 5 hour private tour with Jamie. Myself , my husband and my son aged 14, really enjoyed the whole day .Jamie showed us many sights around Hong Kong and explained the MTR system very well, so we felt confident to go on it again on our own. On the tour we felt like locals not tourists, as we moved effortlessly around the city .We all most enjoyed getting to walk around the back streets and be told all about the happenings of the city . Would defintely recommend to first timers to Hong Kong, with a few days , to people on layovers who can only spare 3-4 hours , actually I am sure Jamie would tailor the tours to suit anyones needs. I would like to see more of the surrounding areas of Hong Kong and when I come back Jamie will be the first person I will contact . Thanks Jamie . Carol, George and Kyle Watt

Very nice private tour. Jamie told us a lot background information about Hong Kong. Showing us nice places. He managed to choose different topics and balanced our view. We went with the ferry to Kowloon, visited the impressive Peninsula hotel, the Wong Tai Sin tempel. Furthermore we got very detailed advices for our next days in Hong Kong.Jamie was very kind to our kids of 10 and 12 and managed to keep there attention!

A day in Hong Kong. Jamie did a wonderful job. We would love to explore the city with him again! We so enjoyed our afternoon with him wish we had had more time. Walking the city and using public transportation really was the best way around. His stories and knowledge of Hong Kong is what makes him such a great guide.

Great way to see Hong Kong on a layover!. We arrived in Hong Kong at 6pm and left the next day at 10:30am or so. Knowing that we would have slept at least some on our 19 hour flight, we thought it would be a shame not to see a little bit of Hong Kong. Jamie was the perfect answer. He met us at our hotel near the airport and accompanied us into town. We spent 3 hours seeing the highlights of Hong Kong at night. He then accompanied us back to the hotel. Great tour. No worries. No need to learn the transportation system or the currency. He was charming, friendly and knowledgeable about the history of this unique place and the political, economic and cultural changes it has been through. Although the price was a bit intimidating, we would never have been able to take better advantage of our time in Hong Kong.

A great introduction to Hong Kong. As a first time visitor to Hong Kong spending a day with Jamie was a great introduction to the place. His knowledge of the city and the history was excellent and I now feel equipped to explore on my own. Thanks for a great day.

An excellent private tour of Hong Kong, ideal for day one. My family and I recently had our first visit to Hong Kong. We decided to start our trip with a private tour with Jamie. It was a great decision. Jamie is extremely familiar with Hong Kong, and provided an excellent commentary about the history of Hong Kong while taking us to a number of key sites, including temples, the peak, and key areas of Kowloon and Hong Kong. We experienced things that one wouldn't normally see on a tour and was accompanied by an in-depth understanding. We spent 8 wonderful hours with Jamie, and greatly enjoyed the day. It was a superb start to our visit.

"Hong Kong , Native style". Jamie was our 4th tour guide of our 3 week holiday in Asia and he was by far the best! We packed so much into 1 day visiting places we hadn't even read about. We travelled by subway, taxi, tram and walked around street markets. Jamie was prompt and very flexible with our day, I can't believe how much we packed in. He advised us on what we could do with the rest of our time in HK solo unlike many guides who try to push for more trips. By the end of the day we felt like we were saying good bye to a friend!

Walking tour hong kong. Thank you Jamie for a great informative day! Your tour was aimed at the entire family and succeeded 100 percent in achieving this. It was great to get a westerners view into hong kong culture. Your wealth of knowledge ceased to amaze. My petrol head husband enjoyed your love of sports cars! Well recommended way to get your family an inside view of hong kong!!!!

The ' must do' tour of Hong Kong!. We had been to HK before and had visited the usual sights without a guide so Jamie organised a full day of the most interesting and unusual places to visit. He was fun to be with and very knowledgeable. After a full day he then emailed us later that evening with suggestions for the rest of our trip with detailed instructions and photos of how to get to each place-so thoughtful. Just look at the other reviews and read why this is THE tour guide for HK!

Hong Kong Day private visit and exploration . My Son and I recently did a day trip and exploration if Hong Kong and it was phenomenal. Jamie was prompt, very flexible in terms of what we wanted to do, really knew the city, culture, and history very well, and was a delight to spend the day with. Highly highly recommend it. If and when back to HK, Jamie and J3 Private Tours will be on the agenda. He even recommended two restaurants. Both were fantastic Thanks JamieBest Chuck and George

Excellent tour - thoroughly enjoyable experience!. We were recommended Jamie's tour through some friends so we pre- booked a 4 hour tour with him while planning our holiday to Hong Kong. We were very impressed how efficient and organised he was, in emailing us with information prior to our trip. Unfortunately we we had to cancel our trip at the last minute, but hoped to rebook the trip and his tour the following year. Jamie was very understanding and remained in contact. When we finally confirmed our trip and tour the following year we were very excited and looking forward to the experience as we had read numerous rave reviews of his tours on Trip Advisor. Our expectations were surpassed! We found Jamie to be very professional and knowledgeable. He was very friendly and we enjoyed his great sense of humour. Our 2 daughters aged 7 and 9 found him entertaining and his jokes very amusing! We had a lot of fun and learnt so much more than if we tried to visit these places on our own, let alone even know these places existed! He was very efficient and organised in taking us on a bus, ferry and trains. He met us promptly at our hotel and took us to visit Stanley Bay, Murray House and Blake Pier, Stanley Promenade and Stanly markets, a ride on the Star Ferry, visit to the Peninsula hotel, walk down Nathan Rd and marvel at the 24k gold Mickey Mouse. There was so much to see that we seem to run out of time after 4 hours. Jamie said that we didn't have enough time to do what he wanted to show us, possibly because we made a few drink breaks, as our girls were getting a bit tired. He offered to take us on another 4 hour tour free of charge! We were very impressed and surprised, but also obviously very happy. After our tour, Jamie sent us about a dozen emails with itineraries and detailed instructions and directions with photos attached, outling other day trips we might like to do on our own while in Hong Kong .The following week, Jamie met us at our hotel and took us to see the Wong Tai Sin Public Housing (poorest neighbourhood in Hong Kong), Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple, walking in the peaceful Nan Lian Garden and Chi Lin Nunnery. The highlight for us on this day was the visit to the temple to shake the lucky sticks. We had a lot of fun shaking the sticks and interpreting our lucky numbers. The girls loved this and wanted to keep doing it over and over! We also burnt incense and had photos with our "animal Gods". Jamie's tour was one of the highlights of our trip to Hong Kong. We thoroughly enjoyed his tours and will definitely book with him again next time we come back. Thank you Jamie for a first class experience!

Celebrate in Hong Kong. We organised an evening walking tour with Jamie to help celebrate our mum's birthday. Jamie had organised the perfect itinerary for the occasion, we visited the IFC Mall, Mid Levels escalator and stopped off at SOHO where they have every restaurant except Chinese! The Mid levels was an exciting place to explore, Jamia Mosque, Rednaxela Terrace and stopping off to check out just how much it cost to purchase real estate in Hong Kong. Jamie answered all our questions about life in Hong Kong and had us patting the HBSC Lions and Fu dogs for good luck! Our surprise at the end of the evening was a visit to the opulent Ritz Carlton Hotel and the Ozone Bar on the 118th Floor where we took in the magnificent harbour views.

So many things to see and do. Other friends had recommended a walking tour in Hong Kong. Jamie's tours exceeded all expectations. He picked up my daughter's and I from our hotel and headed straight to the Star Ferry to explore Hong Kong Island. Sights included the view from the Peak, the Peak tram, St. John's Cathedral, HSBC building, Wong Tai public housing, Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple, Chi Lin Nunnery and Nan Lian Garden as well as familiarising ourselves with Hong Kong's public transport and taxi system.Who could have believed that we could have seen so many sights in a day!The pace was excellent and the girls got to try their hand at the lucky sticks at the Sik Sik temple.After parting with Jamie we felt confident to safely use all modes of public transport throughout Hong Kong. Jamie emailed us ideas and directions for numerous other tourist sights, these all included detailed pictorial instructions and we never got lost once.

Professional Treatment. Jamie met us at our hotel for a full day, private tour of Hong Kong. What struck us the most about Jamie was the care and attention to detail that he exhibited prior to our arrival. We were in communication with him several months in advance and gave him some ideas of what we would like to do. We received several very detailed (including photos) emails from him about what to look into prior to arriving in Hong Kong. Once the tour started we received very honest and professional treatment and an "insiders" look into life in Hong Kong. We would have waited for hours to take the Victoria Peak tram but Jamie knew his way around and avoided the long line-ups. Plus, Jamie showed us the home of 'Cream Bro', Hong Kong's famous cat which we would have missed even though it was just around the corner from our hotel. Trust Jamie to tailor your tour based on your interests.

Hong Kong Snipet, Broad Overview Inclusive. So much to see in Hong Kong, so little time. However, our tour with Jamie satisfied all yings and yens so we maximized our three day visit. We met him in the morning and immediately got on the subway to a temple - the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin temple - where we instantaneously were inculcated into the Chinese culture. Sculptures abound and numbers both lucky and unlucky were explained as well as witnessed firsthand by pulling wooden sticks with numbers. Saw public housing. Walked a lot and ended up at the waterfront Promenade for view of Hong Kong Island,the ferry to Star Island, then taxi to the Peak. And then Stanley Island.a great day and a real snapshot of Hong Long. Jamie was truly a delight, sharing his historical knowledge as well as personal observations from living here for forty years. Late that night he emailed us exactly what to do the next two days - perfection! From a tour guide, and a real joy to travel with Jamie.

Invaluable intro to Hong Kong. Jamie is a wonderful resource to learn about Hong Kong culture, which added so much to our visit. He also teaches you how to get around and gives you insider tips on popular tourism sites. Had it not been for Jamie, we would have waited in line for hours for the Victoria Peak tram and gone to the observation deck with the mobs. Instead, we took a short cab ride up and a stroll to a much better vantage point with few people. At the Sik Sik Temple, we would have had not idea what was going on, but Jamie explained the beliefs in numerology, fortune telling and the Chinese zodiac animals. We had never been to Hong Kong so the 6 hour tour we did with Jamie was perfect. After the tour he emailed us detailed instructions and suggestions for things to see on the rest of our stay.

Walking Hong Kong. Jamie met us at our hotel and takes an interest in his guests, has a sense of humour,a very broad knowledge of local culture which he explains well. He took us to two contrasting sites that were well chosen to provide many talking points. In addition he provided tuition on the etiquetes of subway use, tipping, crossing roads etcOverall very worth whileAnt

Great tour, super special person. My sister inlaw booked some tour days withJamie. What a special treat this was. Jamie has tons of knowledge about Hong Kong and the humour to match. It is amazing to have someone that is truly passionate about the work they do. The exact words from Jamie was "I have the best job in the world" and I believe him.. It might have been the egg tarts, the view from the Peak or the praying Mantis making it's way across our path. It was all shared with a high level of enthusiasm. Our small group had ages of 20 to 58 and he seemed to know what each one of us enjoyed and made a point to keep us all informed and entertained. If I was to ever take a tour in another part of the world I would hope Jamies clone will be the one doing it. He truly made that part of the trip special for all of us. As we said our goodbyes it felt like we were saying it to our friend. In my opinion that makes it a great tour with a very special person.

Great Half Day Tour in Hong Kong. What a great way to start your trip in Hong Kong. Jamie was a fantastic guide,witty and with a fountain of knowledge about Hong Kong and beyond. My wife and I and our 2 boys 19 and 13, all loved the tour.Nothing planned till we met, which was great so we could personalise the tour for 'us'and away we went.....we gained a much broader knowledge of Hong Kong, that we could not have got on a larger impersonal tour. And then afterwards Jamie emailed many other fantastic suggested trips for us, which has been invaluable.

The best private tour ever!. Jamie is the best tour guide I have ever met before. He is very professional, kind and knows everything about Hong Kong and Chinese culture. It is a great experience and the best value for your money.

Best spent Layover. I had a 9 hour layover in hong kong and wanted to make use of my time. I looked online and saw that a private tour of the city was a viable option. I went with J3 Private tours because it seemed reputable. As a girl travelling alone in her 20's, I wanted to make sure it was safe. I was picked up at the airport and we did a walking tour, taking all sorts of public transit including train, bus, and ferry. The tour was 5 hours, and I was escorted back to the airport at the end of the tour to catch my flight. Wonderful tour. Lots of knowledge and details I would never get on my own, especially with my time restrictions. I would recommend J3 Private tours for sure!

Excellent Walking Tour of Hong Kong. We arrived on a Friday afternoon, and Jamie provided information regarding a great place for a dim sum lunch, and then a short tour that we could manage on own. His instructions were detailed and right on point. No problems finding our way around and was a great introduction to HK. Saturday morning, he met us at our hotel and proceeded with an 8 hr walking tour. A mix of history, culture and nature…. lots of entertaining stories and a fantastic way to hit the hot spots in a day. Great recommendations for restaurants and night life. Jamie made us feel at ease from the beginning and we were never bored. He personalized our tour to fit exactly what we asked for. Thanks, Jamie!

Easy going and entertaining!. It was like visting an old friend in a foreign city, and having them show us around. Jamie made a wonderful impression - meeting us at the hotel, taking us through the MTR, sharing information on Wong Tai Sin Public Housing, trying our luck at Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple with the lucky sticks .... we were all lucky with our numbers on the day!. We loved Jamies special viewing point of HK - awesome. Jamie set us up with heaps of information and ideas on how to enjoy the rest of our stay. Thank you Jamie!

Brilliant idea!. We only had 3 days in Hong Kong on our way to New Zealand and wanted to try and get a feel of this vibrant city and some of it's quirky places. This was totally fulfilled by Jamie in our personal tour for one of the days. We had a good insight into how the Chinese new year worked and all it's rituals and a good look at several places we would never had known about without Jamie. This is a MUST do in Hong Kong if you have limited time.

An Amazing Way To Be Introducted to Hong Kong. We did 2 tours with Jamie on our recent HK trip, what a great way to be introduced Hong Kong. Jamie assisted us in more ways then just a tour guide, he gave us additional information on shopping, restaurant, other places to visit and most importantly how to get around HK. On our tours Jamie's knowledge of HK is just amazing and he is very accommodating should you have any special request plus he creates a very relaxed atmosphere & nothing is too much trouble. Jamie elimates all the hassle of trying to work out what to do & where to go. Thank you Jamie for making our trip an amazing experience as this would not have been possible without you. When we return to HK we will not hesitate to contact Jamie for another tour.

Wonderful Walking Tour of Hong Kong. My husband and I had a great full day tour with Jamie. He knows Hong Kong inside out and we enjoyed his insight into the city. We used a lot of public transportation and the Octopus cards came in handy. Jamie is friendly, informative and entertaining. We highly recommend him to anyone wanting an introduction to Hong Kong.

Jamie is awesome. We recently had the privilege of touring Hong Kong with Jamie. He describes himself as “a bigger than life George Clooney” and I would add, “and a bigger than life personality to boot”. His tour is not a typical sit on a bus and have a guide drone on about the city for hours on end. This tour is an active tour, where will you take public transportation around the city to really get a feel of what it is like to experience the city. You will truly get to see Hong Kong as an insider. Jamie is an interesting chap with a wealth of information, and always kept us entertained. If you really want to see the nitty gritty of Hong Kong, from the peak to Stanley Market, to the solid gold Mickey Mouse, you will surely have a great time.

An Introduction to Hong Kong.
