The following is a program for our recent tour of Hong Kong with Jamie of J3 Private Tours:* Pick up at the Cruise Ship Terminal* Mini Bus to Kowloon Bay MTR Station (and organise Octypus Cards)* MTR to Wong Tai Sin * Wong Tai Sin Public Housing* Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple (Statues, Gods, Turtles, Incense, Lucky Sticks)* MTR to TST* Chow Tai Fook - 24K Gold Mickey Mouse 23lbs US$460,000, Nathan Road* The Peninsula Hotel (Afternoon Tea, Graff Diamonds, 14 Rolls Royce Phantoms)* Waterfront / TST Promenade for the view of Hong Kong Island* Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island* Taxi to the Peak* Starbucks for a quick bite to eat* The Peak - my spot wonderful views of Hong Kong ( a little cloudy )* Mini Bus to the Star Ferry* Star Ferry to TST and drop off at the taxi stand.All in all a fantastic 6 hour introduction to Hong Kong and a very good prelim for our next 4 days in Hong Kong. Jamie was also kind enough to e-mail a detailed summary of suggested trips/tours that we could undertake over the next 4 days of our stay. No hesitation in recommending Jamie to any first time visitor to Hong Kong.

Fantastic Guide. Jaime is the best. We were in Hong Kong for a few days bwfore we met with him. Jamie took us to Taio Village on Lantau Island. It was a wonderful town to visit even in the rain. I would recommend Jaime, as he can customize a tour just for you, which is what he did for us. He even sent us tons of information about other things for us to do on our own.

Excellent guide to a strange city. Hong Kong has a city that has long been on my bucket list. On a recent layover from Thailand, we booked Jamie for a 4 hour tour of the city at night. He met us on time and in the right place and took us to a couple of the sights we could visit at night.Jamie was extremely knowledgable about a lot of things (not just Hong Kong!) and was a fountain of information. He knew the answer to every single question.I found Hong Kong itself rather strange. When you have been in Thailand where the people are so friendly, its hard to see people who are living in one of the best cities in the world and yet seem so unhappy.The colours, smells and tastes of Thailand are so vibrant and Hong Kong seemed the opposite. To me, I would liken Hong Kong to a beautiful girl or boy with no personality. Almost soulless. Having said that, I only spent 4 hours in the actual city, so I didn't give her a fair shot I suppose.I would recommend Jamie any day. Thank you for the lovely evening out.

Great Guide to a great city!. My husband and I spent our first day in Hong Kong with Jamie. We had a wonderful day discovering the past and present of this amazing city. He not only personalized the day to our wants but also "trained" us well in the art of getting around Hong Kong. Octopus card, ferry, metro introductions all made the rest of our stay much more enjoyable. Jamie is very professional in his manner but most importantly to us, very personable. His knowledge of the city coupled with his sense of humor made us wish we had booked him for additional days! Following our tour - as promised - Jamie sent us detailed information about restaurants and other sightseeing adventures, each accompanied by metro lines and exit platforms. Plan ahead and get your booking(s) made - we will next visit!

Excellent tour, thank you!. Jamie met us at our hotel and we booked a night tour and an all day one. The evening brought rain and Jamie met us anyway, explained that the evening would be ruined by the weather, did not charge us for the hours lost and met us the next day. That was surprising and unusual and we appreciated it. The day was wonderful. It was our first time in Hong Kong and we spent a great day with Jamie, utilizing the underground which was interesting in itself. He took us to his special walk at Victoria's Peak, and really all over hong kong the day we were there. He was responsive before we left home as well as being very informative and had great suggestions for the time we spent on our own. Jamie is a gentleman and we would highly recommend him for time in Hong Kong.

Professional guide. My daughter Hannah and me were guided by Jamie one whole day and one evening, he took care of us very well, showed us the things and views expected, gave us background information, so it was really worth, having Jamie with us for this short available time. The one star less is only because of the real high price for this kind of service, but it's everyone's own decision. Thank you Jamie!

Brilliant tour, thanks. I had been running out of time at work and tried to arrange a tour very last minute with Jamie. He responded very quickly and we had a half day tour on Sunday 29th March. Jamie met us in our hotel lobby and took us around for 4 hours. I wish I had booked earlier and been able to book a full day tour. I know we saw things we otherwise would not have seen (my husband would not have queued for 1.5 to 2 hours to go up the Peak tram - andI am not sure we would have thought of a taxi) ) and on the day there was a charity eventuality place making it even busier.Jamie not only gave us lots of time he was full of information and we were able to ask questions I would not have felt able to ask someone else. Interestingly everything he said about the views of Hong Kong born people was confirmed by our driver taking us to the airport.What was even more helpful was the amount of information he gave us and the detailed information about where to go and how to get there he sent us in e mails. We arrived on Friday 27th and following his instructions got to see the Big Buddha on Saturday and after he left us on Sunday he put us on the bus to Stanley. I don't think we would have visited Cheng Chao Island without his advise and he made the journey to Nan Lian very simple. I can totally recommend this tour.

Thank you for a fantastic tour!. Jamie was very responsive to my emails. We were in Hong Kong for a few days visiting our daughter who works there and enlisted Jamie's services for a day tour. Not only was he knowledgeable but he was very pleasant and accommodating. At the end of our tour, we asked him to give us suggestions on what to do for the remaining 4 days in Hong Kong. He sent us very detailed itineraries that helped us navigate the city . Thank you for a great time. We would highly recommend him!

A Day In Hong Kong. Spent the whole day walking and riding through the city with Jamie. He seemingly knows everything there is to know about this unique city and is very open about its good and not so good points. Even though he's livd in Hong Kong almost all his life he is still a Brit at heart and you will enjoy his sense of humor. We saw everything from older temples to panoramic views to the modern business side of Hong Kong. All fascinating. His knowledge of the transport system and the best way to get around will alone likely save you much frustration and staniding in line. Highly recommended.

A short but fantastic tour that really introduced me to Hong Kong and Chinese culture. Jamie and I had 3 hours for a private tour. He wisely took me to Sik Suen temple in North Kowloon(sp. may be off), which illustrated a working temple, the nature of worshippers and all of the vagaries of seeking good fortune. Jamie's knowledge is endless and he is a very friendly, personable fellow. I learned much about the cultural views of hk Chinese vs mainland visitors. Subway then cab to the peak, where the view was stunning and his commentary fascinating. Jamie also gave me detailed directions to shops and restaurants. This was the smartest thing I could do in Hong Kong. Highly recommend him

Great tour. Thanks Jamie for introducing us to Hong Kong and for your interesting anecdotes. We had an enjoyable 4 hours and made use of the extra suggestions you forwarded afterwards.We will definitely look you up next time we come to Hong Kong.

Jamie is so much more than his tour.... When Jamie met the four of us at our hotel to give us a walking tour of Hong Kong, one that had been prearranged by my wife, I have to say I was a little dubious. Let's face it, right away you have a pretty good idea that this Yorkshire accented gentleman is not Asian! I'm thinking, "what is he going to do or show us that we couldn't do ourselves using hotel pamphlets?" It ended up as, "Just about everything, that you could hope to see and do in a relatively short time by someone affable, understandable, witty, and with forty years experience, that's all! Ha! Jamie is a true gem. My wife and I have been blessed by having walked on every continent in the world in our travels, our relatives almost as much. This means we have had tour guides by the dozens...and dozens. I would put Jamie in the top five of our experiences with guides anywhere. Top marks for local knowledge, ease of relating to us and our needs, a willingness to follow our requests instead of a rigid agenda like most guides, and an ability to quickly establish an honest to goodness heartfelt camaraderie. We felt like we were partners in an adventure rather than students at a lecture. His tour used all the local transportation methods with easy to follow, interesting, and at times, quite comical, explanations and instructions for using them again when we'd be on our own. His choice of "inside" destinations was right on the money. We were never disappointed or bored, quite the converse and my in-laws are sticklers!At the end, my wife, her sister, and brother in law, went inside the hotel, and, instead of going home, Jamie decided to keep me company while I "vaped" a pipe or smoked a cigarette, probably both. (several months later I was to quit those nasty habits all together). Well, we regaled each other with stories and jokes and asked and answered questions about ourselves for well over an hour. When he found out I was with a rock band we really started connecting. He was a lot of fun to talk with and a very memorable person...after all, it's been over a year and it's still fresh in my mind. An hour ago I ran across Jamie's service while browsing the web's travel section and am only now fulfilling a promise I made to myself a year ago, that I would tell others not to miss Jamie's wonderful tour of Hong Kong and not miss the pleasure of meeting Jamie himself. Sorry about that Jamie. See you next time Helen and I visit Hong Kong, count on it! ; )

Jamie was great!!. We spent our 1st day in Hong Kong with Jamie. At our request, he showed us the highlights of the city. By using multiple methods of transportation...walking, taxi, subway, bus & ferry, he gave us confidence to navigate on our for the next 2 days. With Jamie's experience of living here, he also could explain how the locals lived as well as their political & social beliefs. Overall, an interesting, educational & fun day thanks to Jamie!!

Experience, knowledge and a great sense of humor.. We did the evening tour with Jamie towards the end of our brief visit to Hong Kong. This was a late booking. Jamie met us at our hotel and traveled with us to Kowloon. Jamie is both knowledgeable and entertaining with a wealth of experience and stories. He is generous with his time and expertise, not only going with us to areas I had expressed an interest in, but even indulging my desire to have a drink in the Peninsular Hotel (as close as I will ever get to that lifestyle). The time flew by, and Jamie kindly supplemented our experience by emailing us suggestions and detailed directions for other places to explore before we left to return home. I cannot recommend Jamie more highly, and would definitely book to go with him again should we return to Hong Kong.

Best Tour for a short visit !!. My wife and I were on a full world cruise where stops are mostly brief (less than 2 days). We wanted to make the most of it and get some walking in :) Trip Advisor to the rescue and we found Jamie, and what a great find. It was Chinese New Year and our booking was last minute. Jamies real time online scheduling is awesome as is his communications. He asked about what WE liked and wanted to see which is a great asset, it demonstrated his caring for our satisfaction. All the 5 star reviews are accurate so I will not regurgitate it all :) We really do not write many reviews but Jamie deserves this one. He is straight up and knows HK so do not hesitate to us his services !!

A fun day exploring Hong Kong. As this was our first, and probably only, visit to Hong Kong, we wanted to make sure that we explored the city with a local. He met us in our hotel, discussed what we wanted to do, and then we set off. He obviously knows all the tricks, and short cuts - like taking the taxi up to Victoria Peak and avoiding the hour long queue! And also where to walk to get the best photo shots. Our highlight was the temple visit, shaking the sticks and learning our future !!!! He was also able to give us useful information about what to do/see on the following day - we took the 260 bus to Stanley on the south side of the island which was brilliant. An absolute mine of information - Jamie is well worth the cost. You certainly wouldn't see, or learn as much about Hong Kong from the open top bus tours!

Jamie knows Hong Kong. Jamie is so knowledgeable and entertaining. He knows what tourists want to see and he does provide excellent follow-up for other ideas for restaurants and sites. The first activity with him is to go to the subway and buy a transit pass which lasted for our whole visit. Covers all public transportation and is half price for seniors. Great idea. We usually like to do a Hop-On tour, but with Jamie, we didn't need the orientation of a bus. Yes, the tour is pricey but it is a customized tour with a small group and a VERY good value. He explained a lot of local customs and interesting tidbits about how people live in Hong Kong as he has been there for 40 years but still has a delightful British accent with that sharp, dry British wit. Great way to end our vacation.

A Customized Tour of Hong Kong. Jamie did an excellent job of listening to our requests and interests and designing a tour which included the "must see/must do" things in Hong Kong with some our of the ordinary things, such as the Crazy Temple and the Nunnery and its Garden. A tour which was well worth the cost. Jamie is very ethical and does not make referrals for commissions, which I understand is pretty common.

Full day tour of Hong Kong with Jamie. My wife and I spent a full day touring Hong Kong with Jamie on 24 Feb 2015. I was feeling a bit under the weather resulting from a disagreement between my stomach and something I had eaten in India a few days earlier. Jamie set a pace that allowed us to enjoy the day by seeing a lot without too much rushing about. Jamie has a good sense of humor, he's opinionated (a good thing since it make the tour more interesting), and very knowledgeable. I would recommend him completely.

Terrific tour, even better emails about other activities. My husband and I engaged Jamie for a half-day tour after we had already done a cruise-arranged half-day intro to Hong Kong by bus (you know, Victoria Peak, tram, Repulse Bay, Aberdeen) and wandered around by ourselves for a whole day (flower market, bird market, electronics market, Nathan Street, mid-level escalator, SOHO). So, we left it to Jamie to fill in the holes and we thoroughly enjoyed our time together -- highlights included a white-knuckle bus ride to Stanley, taking a ding-ding, and rubbing the famous HSBC lion's bullet-pocked rear end for good luck!Just as important as the tour itinerary, though, we learned so much from chatting with Jamie about everyday life in Hong Kong and getting his ex pat take on the politics and culture. Plus, if you need help or advice on other things to do in HK, Jamie has wonderful email instructions for places to visit and to eat ... including pictures of every turn along the way! Following his directions was like going on a treasure hunt and he saved us lots of time and frustration.So, book Jamie if you can!

Excellent in All Respects. My girlfriend and I hired Jamie for a full day HK tour in February. We were fortunate to have beautiful weather that day, and the tour exceeded our expectations in every way! Jamie was prompt, friendly, engaging, and knowledgeable of the city. He spent time educating us on the topics that were most interesting to us. He knows the city so well, on the fly, he can accommodate just about any request. He even took the time to lay out some things to do our remaining time in HK (which was perfect). I've learned the best way to learn a city in a short period of time is to hire a local (who speaks very good English). Our tour with Jamie simply affirmed my belief. Highly recommended.

Guided tour around Hong Kong. Jamie turned up promptly at our hotel and we had a very interesting and enjoyable 4-5 hours visiting many places around Hong Kong many of which are not on a typical tourist trail. His depth of knowledge about the City was really informative giving you a taste of the culture ,obsession with numbers and devout religious beliefs. It also gave you first hand advice about getting around ,and use of transport.This is our first time in Hong Kong and I we would highly recommend his tourJ &J Crawley and friends

Unparalleled service, knowledge, humor, and value. I'll start with the bottom line: Book with J3. I've just come off two tours with Jamie--one midday, one night--and both altogether exceeded expectations. Jamie provides only customized itineraries and knows the best places to go (like his spot on The Peak!), has the best anecdotes to share (which give remarkable insight into culture and history alike), makes the most hilarious wry observations (such as ours regarding nun sightings at the Chi Lin Monastery), and nigh guarantees his clients the best possible time. He moves at just the right pace, ensuring depth and breadth of exploration, and seems to work for love of the job. (Proof of this: He didn't just allow but altogether insisted my traveling partner and I to reschedule our night tour when the weather soured. Who else, what other tour company would do this? But that's just Jamie's way, to say nothing of an indication of his commitment to excellence.) Put simply, he's "the one" for, well, just about anyone. Trust in him; you'll not be disappointed. Just make sure you book early. (He books up fast, but he does take last-minute bookings when his schedule allows.)

Not my cup of tea. This review is being resubmtted after the tour guide lodged a complaint with tripadvisor. The operator indicated that my review was number 444, which in Chinese mythology signified death, death, death. I found this interesting as during the tour he constantly pointed out instances of chinese mythology and superstition, which he duly mocked and belittled. I found this to be a blatant insult of the local people, and significantly detracted from his service.Based on reviews, decided to book a couple of tours. Communication at booking is friendly and efficient. On meeting our tour guide you quickly note that he has the gift of the gab. This is important to note as the services provided by this operator are almost all totally dependent of his ability to communicate. Play along and he'll dazzle you with nonsensical facts such as the fact that Hong Kong has 43,000 rubbish bins, there is a ministry for slopes, and the avg apartment is 33sq metres. Hhhmmm fascinating! All of the sights we visited would have been just as easily accessible with a guide book. However, his tour did provide an insight into the bitterness that the the local British have as a result of the handover back to China. On a number of ocassions he displayed a blatant resentment that any local could exercise any authority over him. This detracted significantly from the quality of his service as we found it most embarrasing and disrespecful. On a lighter note, I must say that his sense of dress is quite fetching. This comment is warranted as he made similar sarcastic observations of my dress. Totally rude and disrespectful and nothing to do with providing a tour! The tour was worth it in the end, just to see a side of conflicting cultures and confirm the true feelings of those who have resented the hand over of Hong Kong back to China. By the way, he did volunteer that he owned 43 rolexes! My, how fascinating, though not much relevance to gaining an understanding of Hong Kong and its culture. I'm sure people will still be taken by the inane facts and figures! By the way we rescheduled one of the tours. This was done a day in advance, not minutes before the tour as he suggested. The tour guide actually added that the change in time suited him better. Also the cost of the tours is far in excess of what the service that is provided, as noted in other reviews.Finally, I'd like to point out that my original review, for the short time that it appeared on tripadvisor, received 7 helpful votes. This is worth noting as it appears other tripadvisor users found it relevant to their trip planning and research.

Visit Hong Kong with Jamie. Jamie provided us with a tour, personalized to our wishes and time needs. So much interesting information that included local and current dimensions of Hong Kong. We had a half day tour and did the next day on our own; but even then, Jamie's help was invaluable as to suggestions and directions. We would most definitely contact him again should we travel to Hong Kong. He was a tremendous source of guidance and information. We enjoyed getting to know Jamie and feel fortunate to have used his service and expertise. LF & PF

Two days with Jamie. We just spent two days(4 hrs. each) with Jamie, I can highly recommend him. Entertaining, flexible, informative all describe his unique style of guiding. Having spent his entire adult life here gives him a great perspective of the phases HK has gone through and currently going through. Thanks Jamie

Wonderful guide to Hong Kong. Fantastic....we really got a great feel for the city by using all sorts of public transport and Jamie's commentary on local politics made the city come alive. We saw everything our short 3 day trip allowed time for without feeling rushed and his confident, English only, approach to traveling around the city gave us the techniques and confidence to do sightseeing on our own on the day he didn't aideal tour ccompany us. His comprehensive knowledge of the city and vast experience leading tours smoothed our path at every turn. Spending time with this generous man is a fabulous way to see Hong Kong.

Absolute must for first time visitors to Hong Kong. We could not have had a better experience exploring Hong Kong with Jamie. We booked him for our first day of our four day visit which was ideal in that he gave us the confidence and detailed travel suggestions to navigate the city on our own the next three days. On our six hour tour with him, we road the train, ferry, bus, taxi, and walked the peak trail. One of the many favorite stops was the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple where we observed the locals and learned the meaning of all of their rituals. We toured the flower market, bird market, walked the Peak trail to a viewing destination that was far better than what you would see from the observation deck. Jamie knowledge of the city, it's people, and detailed advice on traveling out on our own was invaluable and we would MOST HIGHLY reccomend him to anyone visiting this magnificent city.

Fantastic honeymoon courtesy of Jamie!. I had booked Jamie as a surprise for my wife as were honeymooning in HK in January 2015. I decided to book him on our first full day so we could have a brilliant start to our experience in HK and learn where to go and what to see quickly. We spent almost 6 hours in his company which was absolutely fascinating. His knowledge of Hong Kong is superb and he offers great insight into the local culture and history of the whole place. He makes a real effort to pack the tour in with as much variety as possible travelling in all forms of transport! His sense of humour is great as well making him an extremely personable person to spend time with especially as my wife was from Yorkshire too so they hit it off immediately..:) As others have said he then emailed us that night with lots more recommendations and detailed instructions how to get there and what to do which we used all the time and simply made our honeymoon a magical experience seeing things we wouldn't have dreamed of or found without his help. I would highly recommend Jamie and we will be booking him again when we return to HK in the future. Thanks a million Jamie!

Outstanding. I see that Jamie is ranked #3 in tours. I can't imagine anyone doing a better job than he did. We went on two tours with him and they were both fantastic. We rode four different modes of transportation which was great. And his knowledge of the area is endless. We highly recommend him to anyone who wants to get a complete tour of this area. He meets you at your hotel and makes sure you get back there. We did five hour tours and that's what we recommend.
Attentive and Informative. We thoroughly enjoyed our private "insider" tour of Hong Kong and Hong Kong Island. Jamie is well informed and accomodating!

“How to get the best out of time in Hong Kong”. In December 2014 my wife and I spent 8 days in Hong Kong. It was our first visit to this amazing and fascinating “city”. First impressions were not particularly favourable as the traffic was horrendous due to student protesters obstructing roads. It was a “white knuckle” taxi ride to our hotel through back streets.Our early perception of Hong Kong was completely changed the following day. Fortunately our son, who had visited Hong Kong a few months earlier, advised us to secure the services of Jamie at J3 Tours Hong Kong (http://j3tourshongkong.com/). Jamie is an entertaining, friendly, ex-pat Yorkshireman who has lived in Hong Kong for most of his life. He has a deep understanding of Hong Kong and its people.Jamie gave my wife and I six and a half hours of his time on our first full day in Hong Kong. Six and a half hours may seem a little OTT when only in Hong Kong for a few days but it was worth every minute. Jamie showed us places we would never have found ourselves, educated us in the culture of Hong Kong and physically showed us how to navigate around the city and surrounding area by public transport (which is an education in itself). The same evening Jamie emailed us sightseeing recommendations together with detailed instructions of how to get there. My wife and I are reasonably experienced travellers and normally avoid guided tours but, on this occasion, it was a “good call”. Try Jamie, you won’t regret it.On the back of Jamie’s introduction to Hong Kong my wife and I had a fabulous time. Hong Kong was something of a culture shock but the people were friendly and courteous. My wife desperately wants to go back.Salopian from Wellington in Shropshire

Arranging a tour as a gift was a breeze!. My sister and brother in law were celebrating their 60th birthdays and were flying from Melbourne Australia to Hong Kong for a holiday. What to get them was a huge dilemma for me until I checked out J3 Private Tours Hong Kong. From the very first response I received from Jamie, I felt extremely confident that he would give them an experience to remember and they were not disappointed. They couldn't rave about their tour enough and it really helped that my brother in law and Jamie are both car nuts so they had a lot to talk about! Thank you Jamie for making my birthday present such a wonderful memory for them both. Tanya Fleming.

Jamie Is Incredibly Informative. My wife and I took a 6 hour walking tour with Jamie at the end of November. This was our second time in Hong Kong, and we decided to take a tour and have a local point out things that perhaps we had missed on our first trip. We were not disappointed -- Jamie took us places that we had not seen nor heard about last time. He answered all of our questions and filled us in on local trivia and customs. Plus, he has a wicked sense of humor which made it all the more enjoyable. If we return to Hong Kong, we will definitely take another tour with Jamie.

Excellent Tours of Hong Kong. I went on two tours with Jamie during my two-week trip to Hong Kong. Both were excellent. I took the first tour on my first day of the trip, when I didn't know which sights were most important to visit. The second tour was on my last day in the city, when I had a much clearer idea of the places that I wanted to visit but still hadn't seen. Both times Jamie came up with an itinerary that was interesting and fun, and I enjoyed his informative and entertaining explanations of all the sights.

Best Decsion. First, this was our first trip to Hong Kong and we consider ourselves urban explorers who like to walk a lot. This was the first time in our travels that we have ever worked with a guide. Thus, naturally I was a bit hesitant; however Jamie is THE BEST and definitely worth working with. He made everything easy and fun. Before our arrival to HK we were able to ask him for advice and ideas. He has many picture driven ideas that will help you plan your vacation. The day of the tour we created a meeting spot that was on the MTR making everything easy and efficient. Once we connected he sought to understand who we were and what we were trying to see in HK. From there he created an unscripted walking tour of some true HK sights. We enjoyed talking to him the whole way as he is extremely knowledgeable about the city (past and present), and he was very accommodating to basically anything you would want to do. We would not have done our HK trip without connecting with Jamie.

THREE INCREDIBLE DAYS IN HONG KONG WITH JAIME OF J3 PRIVATE TOURS HONG KONG. My husband and I had three fabulous days in Hong Kong on private tour with Jaime. We were visiting HK by cruise ship on December 30, 31 and January 1. Since this was our second visit to HK, we were looking for a unique off-the-beaten-path experience. Jaime definitely delivered. We explained to Jaime that we wanted to gain a sense of "daily life" in HK - where the locals live and work, how they spend leisure time, neighborhoods and communities. Taking the public transportation system with Jaime definitely added to our experience. We walked with Jaime through working neighborhoods, markets, residential areas, neighborhood religious sights, and all the time Jaime explained in detail how each of these neighborhoods fits into HK life, religious practices, politics, economy, etc. It was a wonderful surprise when Jaime took us to the neighborhood where he lives. It really personalized the tour for us. If this is your first visit to HK, you are likely looking for an experience that concentrates on the "must see" sights, and I'm confident that Jaime could design a tour to include all of these sights specific to your interests. For example, he took us on a night tour to Victoria Peak - a very "must see" sight that we had visited previously in the daylight - for the most exceptional and unforgettable view of the HK lights and skyline. It's breathtaking! This is one of the great features about Jaime - he makes a point to design a tour specific to each tourist's interests and desires. Jaime is very accommodating and polite as he escorts his guests through his city. He loves HK, and by the end of your tour with him, you will love HK (and Jaime) too! If you are looking for a uniquely special experience with a charming tour guide, who speaks excellent English (because it's his native language!), then Jaime is your man! We highly recommend booking a tour with Jaime of J3 Private Tours Hong Kong! Thank you, Jaime, for giving us three spectacular days in HK!

Insiders view. Jamie gave us an insiders view of life in Hong Kong from politics, to shopping, to Mainland Chinese supporting the economy to Chinese lucky numbers. It was money and time well spent. He also was very generous in giving other sites to see and how to get there. We recommend him!

Great way to explore the city.. I had two tours with Jamie. First we visited a temple and Jamie is absolutely not the reason I don’t remember the name. I’m just not good with names. He not just told me the name of the temple but also a lot of things about religion in Hong Kong and also a lot of usefull info about other Hong Kong related themes. He does this in an enjoyable and funny way, it’s like walking through the city with an old friend. Our second tour was to Cheung Chau Island and it was obvious that Jamie loves Hong Kong and he will share this love to this fantastic city with you. Big recommendation.

Our day could not have gone better!. Knowing we only had one full day in Hong Kong, Jamie was the way to go. After reading numerous reviews, I booked him way in advance so we could spend a full 8 hours with him. We were not disappointed. Jamie was on time, courteous, knowledgeable and helpful. Our day could not have gone better. My husband and I are well-traveled, but being in a new city we wanted to see it all without possibly getting lost or rushing through things. Jamie was the perfect solution. He still has that British sense of humor, which we love, and talking with him was great. My husband loved all of the cultural and historical knowledge he had to offer. I loved his easy going ways like stopping at the post office so I could mail something, getting a coffee or a much needed ice cream after walking up to the Big Buddha.He is quick to respond to email and offer any advice he can. He was most helpful with planning our trip, even after our day with him was over. He emailed me detailed directions on how to get places we had discussed during our time with him and that was very much appreciated.Jamie’s special spot at The Peak is not to be missed!If you have limited time in Hong Kong or just want to get to know the city on a more personal level, Jamie is your man.
great custom tour. Jamie was great , lots of knowledge .... showed us lot of things in very short time. Helped us at the airport with luggage.

Best guide ever!!!. I used Jamie after seeing his reviews and reading his website and he exceeded my expectations. I saw all the main sights of course but also many places that one would never see on a group organized tour. The best part for me was all the information he gave me about what it was really like to live in Hong Kong, the cultures and traditions of the people both born and raised there and trasnplants like himself. He is very personable and is a wealth of information. You will not be disappointed. He also went out of his way to give me very detailed information before I arrived and also on other things to do and see when I was not with him. I followed his directions and had no trouble getting around to the other places. I highly recommend using him for tours. Thank you so much Jaime for making my first time in Hong Kong such a great trip. It was a pleasure meeting you and seeing your town with you.LisaFt. Lauderdale, FL USA

Excellent personalized tour of Hong Kong. Jamie was personable and very knowledgeable about everything Hong Kong. We had a great tour with him and learned so much that we would never have known if we visited the same sights on our own. We appreciated his candor and sense of humor. He was also super helpful in assisting us in setting up the rest of our itinerary and made it very easy for us to find the places he suggested. Great communication skills.

Simply amazing - Jamie's personal tours are the best!. Since I had such a terrific time on my tour with Jamie in July, I booked a 6-hr tour on my recent trip to Hong Kong. We met at my hotel and headed out to see the Admiralty protest zone and hear about the various positions and impact on Hong Kong business. From there we went to The Peak where Jamie took me to the absolute best spot for a view of Hong Kong. To say it was spectacular is an understatement. We then took the MTR to see the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple, with statues, gods, turtles, incense, and lucky sticks. We ended the tour at my hotel. I learn so much about Hong Kong from my trips with Jamie. I am already thinking about my next trip to Hong Kong and will definitely book another tour or two with Jamie. He is willing to share information on sites that I could see on my own and provides detailed information on how to get there and what to look for. He is definitely the best!

A half day 101 course in how to enjoy Hong Kong. Want to learn how to navigate and explore the wonderful city of Hong Kong in just one half day? Book a tour with Jamie. He will share his vast knowledge of the train, bus, ferry and taxi system while showing you famous sites and unique, out of the way places that most tourists might pass by. From a glamorous bathroom in a luxury hotel to a tiny bakery tucked away in the basement of a bustling shopping center the variety of experiences covered in a five hour walking tour were brilliant.And learn you will! With a nine hour layover at the Hong Kong airport at both ends of my trip, I was able to comfortably and confidently navigate the public transportation system by myself on the second layover thanks to the very detailed and clear instructions Jamie unselfishly shared via email after the tour. I even found the bakery again and enjoyed another bun!I may never pass that way again but thanks to the kind attention of Jamie I will hold memories of this vast city and have a deeper understanding of this fascinating place. Should my travels put me at the Hong Kong airport with some time on my hands again, I will certainly contact Jamie who will quickly respond to my questions or, perhaps I will book another tour.

Awesome Tour of Hong Kong 11/25/2014 With Jamie. My husband and I booked a 6 hr. tour with Jamie after reading so many great reviews about him. We started our tour at 10am with Jamie meeting us in our Lobby at the JW Marriott. Our only request was to visit a few parts of Hong Kong that a typical tourist might miss and the rest of the itinerary we left to him.We began our tour up to "The Peak" and a short stroll to Jamie's favorite spot. WOW, what a view of the city. "Spectacular" and not to be missed! We then journeyed down and I mean straight down on the Tram and spent 5 hrs. walking, hopping on and off the MTR and visiting the flower market, bird market, street markets, a unique temple, etc. etc.. So many things of interest and I could go on and on. We ended the day visiting the Mong Kok protest site. Very Interesting!I must say the "extensive" knowledge Jamie has about everything you pass is very impressive! He is truly a "walking encyclopedia" of Hong Kong. Jamie delivered a great experience and "do not hesitate" to book a tour with him!My husband travels the world on business and has been to Hong Kong but never had the time to tour. This was my first trip to Asia and I am a self proclaimed scaredy-cat , but this tour took all my hesitations away. I now can admit that I Love Hong Kong! Jamie supplied us with very easy directions of interesting things to visit for the next three days of our stay, we had a blast! Please take the time to view his pictures via his website. Thank you Jamie for a great time!!!!!Sarah & David Lapinski Syracuse, NY

Terrific day in Hong Kong. We had one day to see the major sites in Hong Kong and were very pleased with Jamie's tour. He helped us buy our Octopus Card which was very useful for the rest of our visit. We saw the major sites and learned a lot from his commentary. Don't hesitate to tell him what you want to see, he is flexible and very knowledgeable. We would definitely book with him again.

We had a great day with Jamie, despite the rain!. We thoroughly enjoyed the morning we spent touring Hong Kong with Jamie! Even though it was raining, we still managed to cover a lot of ground and see many of the highlights of Hong Kong, including his "secret spot" at the Peak. Jamie was even kind enough to not only recommend a restaurant for a dim sum lunch, but he walked us to the restaurant and then explained the menu to us, even though our tour was completed. I can't recommend Jamie enough!

Great personalized tour of Hong Kong!. My husband and I contacted Jamie just a few days before our first visit to Hong Kong. Even though he wasn't available for his full-day introductory Hong Kong extravaganza on our first day in Hong Kong, Jamie kindly squeezed us in for a great 4-hour visit to the city. He gave us a great behind-the-scenes view of real Hong Kong life, and filled us in on the juicy historical and sociological details we were thirsting for! And at the end, he dropped us off at our dinner reservation to make sure we found our way and made it on time. We also appreciated all of the tips he gave us for activities that we could do on our own on the other days we were there. All-in-all, a great HK experience! We highly recommend Jamie's tour for either a first-timer or a repeat HK guest!

Hong Kong "Tailored Taster Tour". We spent a day with Jamie; he filled it with interesting experiences which we may not have been able to source for ourselves without some level of trepidation! This was my first trip to Hong Kong, however my husband has visited before on business and "done" the usual things, "The Peak" etc.From my perspective Jamie offered a new slant, inside knowledge and advice well beyond the time you spend with him to assist you during the rest of your visit.Basically it is your tour and Jamie will tailor it to what you wish it to be, if you don't know what you want I am sure you will enjoy what you are given! He provided more than a tour as, during the day, he found out what we might be interested in and emailed us extra information accordingly. We found our day with Jamie to be invaluable in giving us the confidence to just go out there and explore! In fact we bumped into him near the Star Ferry Terminal nearing the end of our trip when we had just decided to go to Cheung Chau Island on a whim!Thanks Jamie!

Jamie is the perfect tour guide to experience HK as it should. My husband and I have lived in Hong Kong for the past year and when my in-laws came into town, we wanted to get a tour to explore areas of Hong Kong that we haven't before. Jamie was the perfect guide, meeting us at our apartment in the Mid-Levels, we explored Kowloon, took the DingDing, picked fortune numbers at Wong Tai Sin Temple and admired the beautiful view at The Peak. He knows all the ins and outs of Hong Kong and will plan a perfect and flexible itinerary for you which is exactly what great tour guides do. I was even impressed after when he sent 5 other places that we didn't visit and hadn't yet been to in the past year. He sent pictures, directions and the best ways to get there....what a huge and wonderful bonus!! I would highly recommend J3 tours to anyone visiting Hong Kong for the first time or if you have been here before, especially if you want to take advantage of public transport and see Hong Kong how the locals do.

Our Private First-Class Tour of Hong Kong. Jamie is amazing. He is the absolute perfect tour guide for anyone wishing to secure an English-speaking guide. He has lived in Hong Kong the majority of his life and can answer just about anything you would want to know. I wish we had been able to have him with us for the rest of our trip simply because he not only possesses an immense knowledge about Hong Kong, but he is a joy to be around. He doesn't provide a cookie cutter tour of the city - he tailors it specifically to what you are looking for and want to see. He doesn't rush through anything and makes sure you have enough time to enjoy all that you want to enjoy from any attraction. Our tour was as follows:Hotel Pick Up at The Ritz-Carlton, Hong KongMTR to CentralTaxi to the PeakThe Peak - my spot Reasonably clearThe Peak Tram downSt. Johns Cathedral / Cheung Kong CentreHSBC Lucky Lions - Statue SquareMTR to Wong Tai Sin Wong Tai Sin Public HousingSik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple (Statues, Gods, Turtles, Incense, Lucky Sticks)MTR to Mong KokStreet Protest site - quiet with lots of PolicemenMong Kok Street MarketsTaxi back to The Ritz-Carlton, Hong Kong

Wonderful Guide!. Jamie met us in the hotel lobby and was so friendly and welcoming.We spent a wonderful day touring Hong Kong and his knowledge was exceptional.Would recommend him for couples, families and groups.

Excellent day in Hong Kong. Another five star review for Jamie. We were met at the cruise terminal and Jamie took us to a place where we could safely store an overnight bag as we werent returning to the ship until the next day. We spent 8 hours seeing and experiencing the city. We loved the local food treats Jamie got for us along the way. We got a good feel for what life is like in Hong Kong and it was interesting to hear Jamie's perspective. Saw much more than we ever could have on our own!

Tour of Hong Kong. Recently I had to go to Hong Kong on a business trip. While I've been many times he gave a fresh view to a city that never sleeps. A colleague was going for the first time and time was limited. I found Jamie and the rest is history. He quickly set up a wonderful tour which covered a lot (with plenty of detail and history) in a short amount of time. His perspective of the city gives an insiders view. His knowledge and professional approach was very much appreciated. I highly recommend you do an overview of the city with Jamie before you do anything else.His personal insight will make the rest of your trip wonderful.

Walking day tour of Hong Kong. We spent a wonderfully informative day with Jamie touring and learning the ins and outs of Hong Kong. Not only did he take us to some of the better known sights but Jamie also showed us a Hong Kong not many tourists see. We hiked to a beautiful quiet spot from the peak where the view was unbelievable; we learned how beliefs of fengshui dictated the position of several of the most prominent buildings in Hong Kong: we experiences the Mong Kok fish markets and we ate the most delicous Dim Sum at Maxim's. Without Jamie we would have never had the "inside" tour and definitely would have not learned so much history, and culture. Not to forget , the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin temple where believers all go to pray and a good fortune may be told. We had a great day and a bonus was all the information Jamie sent us later so we could followup his tour with more on our own.Jamie does an amazing job as he has done so much to prepare. I would recommend him to everyone. Additionally we would take another tour with him anytime.

view of hong kong. We met Jamie on our second day of Hong Kong, looking back I would have made our tour with Jamie on our first day, Jamie knows Hong Kong and took us on the tour to show us the top highlights, he gave us history and answered all our questions, Jamie was great, my advise do a tour with him first then head out on your own

Wonderful afternoon and evening with Jamie!. We chose Jamie because of his prompt, no-nonsense communication by e-mail and the wonderful reviews he has on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. Our tour included: Pick up at our hotelMTR to Wong Tai Sin Wong Tai Sin public housing - a light educational discussion of the cost of housing in HKSik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple (Statues, Gods, Turtles, Incense, Lucky Sticks - this gave us some background for the rest of the tour!)MTR to Mong Kok to review protest area - lots of Police action going on!Mong Kok Street Markets (fresh fish, meat, fruit, veggies, etc.)Chow Tai Fook Jewelry store - 24K Gold Mickey Mouse 23lbs US$460,000The Peninsula Hotel - GORGEOUS!Waterfront / TST Promenade for the view of Hong Kong IslandStar Ferry to Hong Kong IslandTaxi to the PeakThe Peak - Jamie took us to his personal favorite viewing spot, which is off the beaten path and it is WONDERFUL!We enjoyed all of the inside scoop on the culture and history, as Jamie was always willing to answer any questions we might have and clear up any misunderstanding we might have.One more thing: we asked Jamie to give us some info on other sights we might see on our own the following day, and within an hour or two he had sent me several step-by-step e-mails to help us find our way around the following (which we used and thoroughly enjoyed):The Flower Market and Bird MarketThe Ladies' MarketBus trip to Stanley (HIGHLY recommend this! It takes two or three hours round trip)The Long Escalator and SOHO - DO THIS!! We also ate at a wonderful restaurant that Jamie recommended in SOHO - Al Dente. The nightlife and activity in SOHO just has to be experienced when you're in HK....don't miss it!All-in-all, we would highly recommend using Jamie for an overview tour of HK.
Jamie is a superstar. Jamie knows Hong Kong better than anyone else if you are coming to HK the best thing is to book your first day with himThe insight into the city he gives you is unparalleled

Jamie is the BEST!!. This was our first trip to HK and we booked a full day tour with Jamie on our first full day.He is one of the best private tour guides we have ever met and we highly recommend his services.Prior to arrival, I contacted him regarding our concerns, he answered promptly and was most helpful.Back to our tour. Jamie showed us how to get our Metro card (octopus card) and away we went for an informative and fun day. We saw many sites and he explained much about the local culture and customs.He helped us to focus on what we wanted to do on our own and sent us many emails with detailed directions and instructions to things that might be of interest to us. These were so helpful! He also emailed us an itinerary of what we saw with him on our tour.Later in the week, we spent a morning going up to the Peak with Jamie. What an amazing time! This trip was particularly helpful as the buses were diverted in the Central area of HK. Jamie took us a different way (and we stopped for some delicious custard pies at the Tai Cheong Bakery) where we could take a cab up to the Peak. Up at the Peak, Jamie takes you to a viewing spot that you would never know about. It was beautiful! We ended this tour with lunch at the Peak Restaurant. We really appreciated Jamie and his generous sharing of his knowledge.
Jamie is awesome!. I highly recommend Jamie. An informative detailed tour of Hong Kong. Jamie knows his stuff and is very reliable.

Your Best Friend in Hong Kong. We booked an all day and an evening tour and were very pleased with his service. It was our first time in Hong Kong ,and Jamie made certain we made the most of it. The city has excellent public transportation and good taxis. I felt sorry for the people we saw stuck on tour buses in traffic. Jamie will go at your pace and take you anywhere your want to go. He is easy to talk to and just seems like an old friend. My only concern is that he prefers Pink Floyd to the band Chicago.At first, I saw this as a major character flaw ; but then I remembered he is British and probably can't help it.

8 hour trip with an excellent tour guide - don't hesitate to book people!. It was our first time in HK and we had a short 3 day stay on our way to Thailand.I knew that we wouldn't be able to see the half of it if we hadn't of decided to book Jamie.Jamie was prompt at meeting us at our hotel and took us on a fantastic 8 hour tour of HK. This guy knows the lot. We were so happy and impressed by him I felt compelled to write such a glowing review. Our itinerary was as follows Taxi to the PeakThe Peak - great views and quite a few spidersTaxi to the Mandarin Oriental HotelChater Road - Filipina Maids - Statue SquareHSBC Lucky LionsMTR to Wong Tai SinWong Tai Sin Public HousingSik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple (Statues, Gods, Turtles, Incense, Lucky Sticks_MTR to CentralHong Kong Stock Exchange - Hang Seng IndexStanley Plaza, Stanley Temple (Tiger skin), Stanley Pier, Stanley PromenadeStanley MarketBus 260 to Central via Repulse Bay and Deep Water BayAs you can see we covered a lot of areas in the 8 hours in the baking HK heat (Jamie I don't know how you cope lol)It was a wonderful day and it made our stay in HK complete and a memory that will always be remembered.If and when we return to the fabulous city that is HK we will be sure to book Jamie and would encourage others to also do so also.Jamie if I was to say my favourite part it has to be the maids I was in ore of the culture which is so different to ours.Thank you for being apart of our journey and keep doing what your doing!

6 hour day/night tour with beautiful sites and interesting history. We booked Jamie based on the other positive reviews on Tripadvisor. He is the real deal. He has a vast knowledge of the Hong Kong area and this allows him to guide you and educate you on the fascinating history. We found his tour of great value and there is no way we could have seen what we saw on our own.We started at 3 pm and finished at 9. This way we got to see the city by day and night. It was great, and we took some memorable photos.I recommend Jamie if you are looking for someone who is passionate about Hong Kong.PS. If you are car buff, Jamie has 1000's of photos of Hong Kong's hottest wheels!

Wonderful Day in Hong Kong. My wife and I had a wonderful day in Hong Kong enjoying the sites, sounds and aromas of this vibrant city with Jamie of J3 Private tours. We were met promptly at the cruise ship terminal and were off on an exciting and adventurous day. What an experience spending the day with someone that brought us the true local perspective. If you are going to Hong Kong for a day or more, Jamie is your choice for an excellent day. Bottom Line - We would happily hire him again and suggest his services.

J3 Tours is first class. Jamie joined us for a 4-hour tour in Hong Kong on Sept. 29, 2014. Because of the protests, we asked him to limit the tour to Kowloon. He met us as promised in the lobby of our hotel. We had a nice chat about his long relationship with Hong Kong. We set out by subway -- which gave us an opportunity to walk in several neighborhoods and experience HK's excellent transportation system -- for two great sites. We first visited the Chin Lin Nunnery and related Nan Liam Garden, both of which were outstanding. After a couple of hours there, we traveled to the Wong Tai Sin Temple, a lively and very interesting Buddhist/Taoist temple. We have spent the prior two days in HK as part of an Odysseys Unlimited 3-week tour of China and HK. Neither site was on our Odysseys itinerary. Jamie is very knowledgeable, has a great sense of humor and was a fun companion. Given the personal nature of the tour (just my wife and I), I thought Jamie's fee was quite reasonable. We both heartily recommend J3 Tours to anyone interested in seeing Hong Kong up close and personal.

Fascinating Tour of Hong Kong. We had a wonderful time on our 8+ hour tour of Hong Kong with Jamie. We traveled by train, taxi, tram and ferry and it was all seamless. We visited The Peak, St. Johns Cathedral/Cheung Kong Centre, Hong Kong Park and Cheng Chau Island. We requested to see the Asia Society Complex and Jamie took us there. From there we wanted to see the protests taking place and Jamie obliged. We walked among the thousands of protesters. It was an amazing experience we will never forget. My husband and I liked that Jamie tailored our tour to include places we wanted to see, in addition to the wonderful itinerary he put together. He met us at our hotel and accompanied us on the train at the end of the day. Jamie gave us a lot of information about the history, politics, economy and culture of Hong Kong. I would highly recommend J3 Private Tours to Hong Kong visitors.

Very interesting and individual tour. In advance I did tell Jamie what might be of interest for me. Especially interested I was interested in how is it to live in Hong Kong these days.From that information and from his experience as someone living in the town for a long time as well as from his experience guiding people through the town he prepared something very interesting for me.It was not only interesting to see things but also to get background information. There was not a single question Jamie wasn’t able to answer sufficiently. Since I know I’m dragon born I feel more comfortable …“Jamie’s spot” on Victoria Peak is paramount …We did talk about a lot of things (Chines numerology, Hong Kong car plates, football (what is the right side of Manchester?), fancy and expensive cars (now I know also Pagani cars even I never could afford one), spiders and snakes on Victoria Peak, Monty Python, … )After our tour Jamie sent me lots of very helpful tips and information of how to spend the remaining days of our stay.Bottom line: 5+* tour and 100% recommendationOne last thing: Looking at pictures from 3 years ago, this guy really dropped 20 kg of his weight doing this job. I’m a little bit jealous.

A great snapshot of Hong Kong life. A 5-hour tour with Jamie really helped me to understand a different side to Hong Kong. I'd been to Hong Kong twice before on lightning visits. This time with Jamie, I visited temples, discussed cultural and lifestyle aspects, a walk through the market visit, even a public housing neighbourhood, and a walk through the swanky side of Hong Kong. Using the public transit and the ferry, was great and quick way to get around. We did some green belts in the heart of the city of Hong Kong , which was most surprising for me . I enjoyed the personal knowledge and our conversation over a well-chosen spot for dinner ( Although Jamie does not run foodie tours!). No regrets for this walking tour with Jamie !

A Great Overview of Hong Kong Sights and Life!. We recently had the pleasure of experiencing Hong Kong with Jamie of J3 Private Tours. Within 5 hours he not only showed us the highlights but gave us a great overview of Life in Hong Kong. He was very interesting! And, he went above and beyond with his time, directions, information, emails, etc....even after our tour was over he answered many questions. We highly recommend his tour which is customized to your interests! Memorable day!

Time well spent!. Jamie is a great tour guide! We started with a trip up Victoria Peak, without the hassle of queues and with a magnificent view. We explored markets off the beaten path, viewed iconic buildings, and even caught sight of a squirrel! Jamie explained why that was a rare event on Hong Kong. Along with the superb tour, Jamie provided us with detailed itineraries for the rest of our trip. We most heartily recommend Jamie as an entertaining and informative tour guide!

A wonderful, bespoke experience. We did a 7 hour tour with Jamie on September 18th as part of our brief stay in Hong Kong. Since we were limited in our time in the city, we wanted to spend that time with an expert. For us the difference that Jamie makes is his local knowledge. As a long time resident who lives with real locals, not in the fancy ex pat areas of town, Jamie was able to give us a real sense of the city, its history and its people. We were able to see some of the great high points of the city, including Victoria Peak (from his special vantage point, worth the walk!), the Star Ferry, Kowloon and some of the outlying areas. It was a really great overview of the city but to really know it, I would recommend getting more than one day out of Jamie if you can manage!Traveling the city by public transit was great. HK is very well connected by trains, buses and trams, it really is the way to get around. Don't be intimidated by doing a full day tour on foot. There are plenty of opportunities to sit and cool down throughout the day in HK's oppressive summer heat. We also had a lovely lunch in Kowloon at a dim sum-fusion type of place. Jamie's recommendations for food should be heeded. The place we went to he has eaten at more than 500 times!!With anything in life, you get what you pay for. What we received was an unforgettable, bespoke day that was the perfect way to end our honeymoon in SE Asia. Jamie's knowledge, humour and company was worth every penny. You are in good hands with Jamie.Have fun and happy travels!

positive start to our holiday. If you are visiting Hong Kong and need a guide who is both informative and friendly then look no further than Jamie. We have recently returned from a fabulous 10 day break in Hong Kong and this was largely due to Jamie setting us on a positive footing right from the word go. Jamie met us at our hotel right on time and we clicked with him straight away. Loved his sense of humour and insights into Hong Kong that we may not have discovered or learnt ourselves.He has lived in Hong Kong for many years and believe me he knows this place!We spent several hours with Jamie and enjoyed every minute. We visited several major attractions such as the peak....which on another occasion we went back to at night following Jamies suggestion, along with out of the way places you simply wouldn't see on any organised tour.The tour with Jamie didn't end once he returned us to our hotel.He literally emailed through heaps of other options with very detailed instructions on things we could do in our following days there.This also included a restaurant he suggested which was fantastic.Absolutely no need to book any organised tours of Hong Kong other than Jamie and you would spend days wandering around without learning half the stuff he told us.Not only does Jamie enhance the whole Hong Kong experience you are meeting a truly great guy as well!

Best part of Hong Kong for me!!. The highlight of my trip to Hong Kong. Jamie provided a unforgettable experience on my half day tour which included the hidden side and the best locations. Jamie prepared me for my solo adventure in Hong Kong as well helping with transport and information for other hidden gems in this beautiful city even with typhoon in the area. I believe I not only got an unforgettable experience but also a friend as well.

A great night tour. Had a one night lay over in Hong Kong and wanted to get a feel for the city. That is exactly what happened. I was totally satisfied with the tour. Jamie was well informed and able to add personal input. He was intelligent and added stimulating conversation to the evening tour.

Great Tour Delivered Exactly What I wanted - 8 hour tour. I corresponded with Jamie via e-mail prior to my arrival, he was very responsive and attentive to my questions. I highly recommend hiring Jamie for your first day in Hong Kong so you can orient yourself to the city. I made 2 requests of Jamie a) take me places that are a little off the beaten track b) provide some recommendations of places to see during my remaining 6 days in the city. He excelled at both, mixing temples and walks through the city with a visit to an island via ferry where everyone rode bikes rather than cars. It was a very authentic experience and I got some of my best pictures that day. I peppered him with questions regarding local customs, what to do / not to do so I could feel comfortable for the rest of the week. As soon as I got back to the hotel I had a series of e-mails with recommendations and explicit directions for a great list of things I should do for the balance of my week. Spectacular tour, recommend to anyone.

Fantastic Patience. Hi Jamie,Just a quick thank you for putting up with our little 'disaster' last week. Your quick assistance in helping us resolve the problem was fantastic. It was for sure not planned and it was a right pain for the 3 of us.Deb enjoyed her trip to Wan Chai, plus we enjoyed the day with you and the various highlights that Hong Kong has to offer. Anyone who is looking to tour Hong Kong, well Jamie is your guy because he fits in your needs and looks after you so well during the day. His use of Public Transport is second to none and he gets you to your destinations the quickest way possible. Jamie's humor is also excellent and nothing ever seems to faze him.

Great experience and lots of fun!. Our family spent a day touring HK with Jamie and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. He took us all over the city and had interesting insights and information to share everywhere we went. He has a great sense of humor and really knows "his stuff!" He followed up our tour with numerous suggestions and detailed information on other places we could visit during our stay. Highly recommend him!

Great way to see Hong Kong through the eyes of a native. This is an excellent way to see the city through the eyes of a native. We took a five hour tour.Positives:Jamie is very personable. Takes into account likes/dislikes etc.Varied sights. Information provided as you travel.Metro tickets provided, and taxi costs all included in our trip fee.We had a further day to spend in Hong Kong and received emails with suggestions and clear directions as a help, super!Bravo, well done, don't miss this if you want to walk and see the real sights.Negatives:None really. Weather was hot and humid but as we interspersed our walks with air-conditioned taxis, was no problem.

Slow start but very enjoyable. Jamie was very responsive to his email (does he sleep?) and despite late notice he had a slot which we booked an evening tour which is a little unusualCan't fault his customer service and assistance pre tour post tour and his email suggestions for places to go and eat are very good.Whilst I admit the tour got off a little slowly (we went to the peak where we went the previous night) however we went to a much better viewing point and Jamie probably took one of the best photos of my wife and I that we have ever had taken. From here it all went well and the ad hoc nature of the tour and being with a true local (even if a westerner for intensive purposes Jamie is a local) was great. We saw some interesting buildings, features and heard some funny stories. Don't be afraid to ask loads of questions as he will know most of the answers but sometimes you have to press (it's not a big bus narrative tour after all).We went to both Kowloon and HK side which was good. Using a combination of taxi and MTR was good as it allowed time to explain some aspects of local life and history.Perhaps the best added benefit of the tour are the suggestions and email guides he sends to these locations, you can't get lost and we used a couple of the suggestions for the next day.Certainly made our trip to HK ore fun and has given me a good opener to the place and I can't wait to go back, and again use Jamie for a different part of the island.

Great tour. I was only spending a few days in Hong Kong and did not want to do a packaged bus tour. I found J3 tours online and with all the favorable reviews decided to give Jamie a try. I am so glad I did. There were 3 of us on the tour.(we had only met each other the day before as this was part of a business trip). I felt like we were a group of old friends and Jamie was showing us around his home. We experienced all modes of public transportation including rail, ferry, bus, and tram. He told us, after one day with him, we would master the MTR and could do it on our own with no worries. How right he was. We left the itinerary up to him and he took us to the main attractions. Elizabeth B comments give more itinerary details of our tour. He shared his extensive knowledge and personal views of culture, politics. Our tour was an eight hour day tour. I would not hesitate to recommend Jamie. Some reviews have commented on the price, it was well worth every dollar spent.

Jamie is awesome!!. I visited Hong Kong from August 5 - August 8th, 2014, and I was fortunate to spend August 6th with Jamie. I have never been to Hong Kong before and wanted to see everything I could while I was there. He picked us up at the Clock Tower and we were off from there. We took the Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island and the MTR to Tung Chung. We took the bus to the Giant Buddha (including cow sighting!) and we climbed The Giant Buddha and the 268 steps up and down! Then we took the Cable Car to Tung Chung and the MTR to Central. We took a taxi to The Peak and we took AMAZING pictures!! Then we took a taxi to the Mandarin Oriental Hotel and then the MTR to Wong Tai Sin (Wong Tai Sin Public Housing). We ended our trip at the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple where we rubbed various statues for good luck. Jamie dropped us off at the MTR Station and gave us perfect directions back to our hotel.I learned so much on our tour and we walked over 8,000 steps. His knowledge is impressive and his energy was invigorating! I highly recommend Jamie!

Insiders perspective on HK. Purpose - We only had a few hours in Hong Kong. While the city is relatively easy to navigate, we didn't have the time to research the "not to be missed" spots, how to get there or the best times to go (or avoid). Price - I agree the tour is expensive but welcome to Hong Kong. Everything here is expensive. The price is competitive for a customized tour in HK. Jaime picked us up from the hotel promptly at 9am, by the time he dropped us off at 1pm we'd learned more about HK then we could have read in a guide book. We discussed historical issues like the lease of HK to Britain, as well as current issues such as the changes in HK over time, the controversy in raising minimum wage, the cost of education and apartments, the absence of daycare and the existence of foreign maids. Here's a quick synopsis of what we did along with my commentary. - The Peak (amazing views and only a short hike)- Tram ride down (so happy we didn't have to wait in the line coming up - looked like an hour wait)- St. Johns Cathedral ( just in time to see the procession)- Cheung Kong Centre- HSBC and the lucky lions (and a spot for the foreign maids to spend their day off)- Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple (also got to see a procession and hear about all the HK traditions)If you want an insiders guide to the city, jaime is a great choice!

Jamie is great!!. Jamie is a great tour guide with many years of experience in Hong Kong. My husband and I have never been to Hong Kong and only had a limited amount of time there. Jamie took us to the main attractions and was extremely receptive to everything we wanted to do. His knowledge of Chinese culture was very impressive and overall we had a great time touring HK with him!

Well worth it. My 14-yr old daughter and I were lucky enough to join my husband on a whirlwind around the world business trip with some time for vacationing in April 2014, during her April break. We had literally 48 hrs in Hong Kong before heading off to our next destination. We had traveled from NYC to San Francisco on a Friday, left SF on Sunday afternoon and arrived Hong Kong Monday night. My husband was booked from 7:30am the next day through 11pm that night, so my daughter and I were on our own for Tuesday. I lived in HK as a little girl in the mid-60's andf had never been back. I had some memories of my years there and a strong interest in seeing some of the places I remembered. I researched tour guides a couple of months before our trip and had several recommendations for some professional tour companies, but decided to research some independent guides thru Trip Advisor. I'm so glad I did as that's how I found Jamie. During our correspondence over the next few weeks, I told him of all the places I remembered from my childhood and he knew them all. Since we were only in HK for 2 days, I knew we wouldn't hit everything, but Jamie was able to fit in as much as possible and provided a fantastic tour down memory lane for me, and a glimpse into my early life for my daughter and husband.I'm sure we would have enjoyed a nice tour with a large tour operator, but I have no doubt it would not have been as informative, personal and meaningful as the time we spent with Jamie.Thank you, Jamie for a nostalgic and fun couple of days. It was a pleasure for us all.

Thankyou jamie for a fantastic day !. We visited hongkong for a week and spent 5 plus hours with Jamie being shown the Hongkong we would never have discovered on our own . Jamie's knowledge and love of Hongkong is very evident ! Again thankyou ! Will definitely call when back in HK. Thankyou for the photos and we did follow up on the other sites that you suggested for us to visit .

The Nelson Hong Kong 1 day tour August 2014. Having arranged a 4 night stay in HK after a holiday in Vietnam we wanted to have a whistle stop tour of HK showing some of the highlights of this wonderful place, so after trawling through web sites and Trip Advisor one name kept on popping up all the time with great reviews and this was Jamies. We wanted to have a tour on the first day of our HK trip so we could get an understanding of the transport system while in the hands of an expert.Jamie came to meet us at our hotel which was the Marriot Sky City (next to airport) from there he took us to the Airport Express HK station so we could get some travel cards (Octopus) from there we took the train to HK Station where we took the Star Ferry to TST Kowloon. Jamie was letting us know all along the way points of interest and details of the area. This area was a great photo opportunity (as was most places) Jamie was always willing to take any group pictures along the way. From here we went passed the 1881 Heritage and Peninsula Hotel (actually went inside the Peninsula for a look around, very impressive) then headed to Nathan Road, we wandered along the road passing the many Chow Tai Fook high end jewellery shops (44 I seem to remember) and viewed the 24k Gold Mickey Mouse that was on show in one of them, priced at $460,000 and weighing 10.5 kg. From there we jumped back on the MTR and headed to Wong Tai Sin and had a look around the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple, Jamies knowledge in this area is just outstanding he gave us detailed information of all the points of interest. We all had a go at shaking the bamboo cylinder (Kau Cim) containing fortune bamboo sticks (100 sticks in total with a number written on each one) this referred to good or bad luck.. On my attempt I chose the number 25 on 4 separate occasions which was quite spooky. From here we took the MTR to Mongkok and had a brief look around Langham palace Mall, we then proceeded again on the MTR to Admiralty and then took a taxi to the Peak. Jamie took us away from the tourist area and to a spot of his choice, this was just wonderful. Along the way walking in the Peak area we observed some of the HK wildlife, some quite large spiders, we managed to get some great pictures of these along with the wonderful view of HK from this amazing vantage point. This was the end of our tour and from here we took a taxi to IFC / HK station and headed back to the hotel.I cannot express enough the value that Jamie brought to this private tour he is very flexible and made our day very enjoyable. On the tour was myself my wife & daughter and we all felt the same. Some people may think the rate that Jamie charges is a little high.. I guess I thought the same initially, but remember you get what you pay for. We were more than happy..

Great day!. Jamie came to meet us at our hotel, and took us around for a great experience from hustle and bustle of Hong Kong central to watching lazy strollers with their pedigree dogs on Stanley promenade and finishing off at the Peak for a breathtaking view of this amazing city. It was a very hot and humid day, full of walking and great fun! Wear comfortable shoes, lots of water to drink if you are doing this tour in August as we did, and before starting the journey, buy yourself the Octopus card as it will save a lot of time! For first timers in Hong Kong, I would strongly recommend it!

J3 Custom Photography Tour - Perfect Mix. Contacted Jamie via his J3 Tours website to arrange for a two custom photography tour while in Hong Kong. I was traveling back from 14 day photography trip throughout mainland China and had a laundry list of areas I wanted to visit in Hong Kong. Jamie was extremely helpful in coordinating all logistics for my two full days we traveled together. I was not after typical tourist shots and wanted to hit out of the way markets, villages and Hong Kong older lifestyle locations. He tweaked my photo 'wish list' to cut out a couple unrealistic items (based on time) and added in some real nuggets I had not thought of. I was there during a very hot and humid period and Jamie was a trooper hanging in with me the whole time as we made our way in and around Hong Kong, hiked up to the big Buddha, and through wet (fish) market areas.There is no way I would have been able to see and photograph half the locations I did without his in depth knowledge of Hong Kong and neighboring islands. His knowledge of the buses, ferries and 'short cuts' allowed us to travel very efficiently and not waste time waiting around for transportation as well as sequence shoot locations to maximize time with minimal crowds. Jamie also provided great recommendations and time saving suggestions for my free time after our two day tour ended allowing me to easily explore other Hong Kong areas on my own including 'his spot' for shooting Victory Harbor at night.If you want the most out of your time in Hong Kong and a true custom guide, J3 Tours is the way to go. I highly recommend Jamie for other professional photographers and tourist alike. Don't bother with the canned tours, book Jamie, you won't be disappointed.

Hong Kong - guide. I enjoyed the tour with Jamie, but felt that it was a bit expensive.Hong Kong's transportation is really fantastic and with a bit of research one can travel to most of the sites.But for the nervous traveller, I will recommend Jamie.

Discovering what makes Hong Kong a fascinating City. My wife and I had never been to Hong Kong before, but by the time we had finished our six hour tour with Jamie, we felt we knew what makes Hong Kong tick! He has a very warm, friendly manner, and an incredible knowledge of "his" home city for the past 38years.(Previously from the UK.) We visited the main tourist sites (without wasting time in queues!), and learned how to master all four forms of public transport. (Trains, trams, buses and ferries.) We visited places we would never be game to go on our own, and saw things in the markets we have never seen before! (And in some cases, hope to never see again!!) We admired the view of the City from his "special" spot at The Peak with NO crowds, and enjoyed lunch at Repulse Bay! We would have no hesitation in recommending him!!

Loved the tour.. We were 2 families travelling (4 adults and 3 kids)Jamie was punctual at the hotel lobby, waiting for us. He started talking to us and the kids about our interests and immediately formulated a tour to cater for us and our kids.We did a 4 hour afternoon tour through Kowloon and Central.He was a very jovial character with a lot of interesting stories, that kept us entertained for the whole time.I would say HK is a very big place and 4 hours doesn't do it justice. I would advice 2 x 4 hr toursso you get to see more of HK, through Jamie, a HK local's eyes.I would definitely recommend him to anyone.

J3 Private tours Hong Kong. Jamie was a delight. i have been to Hong Kong on many occasions, so I thought I would try something a bit out of the ordinary. Jamie met us at our hotel and then we were off on our private tour of the area around Hong Kong. We visited Cheung Chau island, spent time at Kowloon, saw the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple and the Mongkok wet market. All this was done by public transport, which in itself was a bonus, as you felt you were a part of this wonderful City,Jamie was informative, entertaining and a pleasure to be with. I most certainly recommend his services
