A Quintesssential Yorkshireman. You can take the boy out of England, but you can't take england out of the boy !! Not my first time in Hong Kong but glad to have used Jamie's experience to compliment any knowledge i had of the City. Jamie is happy to accommodate the experienced and the novice and certainly enhanced my knowledge of this part of the world. On time and ready to go, not a minute was wasted and we certainly visited places off the tourist route, the use of the public transport got us around in short time when you know where to go. We hesitated using a guide but are delighted we discovered J3 Tours. Well done Jamie.

Very friendly guide for first timers to HK.. Jamie is very knowledgeable and very accomodating guide. I have 2 young kids travelling with me and Jamie made sure they're as comfortable as possible during the tour.

Fascinating Evening. We had an evening tour with Jamie. We adored the fact that he made himself available for evening to his customers which is something unheard of worldwide: a great dedication to service but also for us a great opportunity to make our visit to Kowloon at night an experience filled with intelligent and very informative insights. When we met Jamie we had already had a previous introductory tour of Hong Kong with another guide so the challenge to him was higher and he was easily able to meet the challenge of providing us with complementary information that was fascinating to us. Jamie has the advantage of being a western world educated individual with a life spent in the eastern world. His perspective is thus incredibly interesting as he can easily underline the differences, the complements, the fusions, the advantages, the sparks and the champagne bubbles it makes in daily life in Hong Kong. We felt we could ask all possible questions and he had history, economics, current affairs, and anecdotes to tell about so many subjects. Fascinating. Definitely recommend.

Outstanding Introduction to Hong Kong. On my first day in Hong Kong, I had the pleasure of going with Jamie (J 3 Tours) for a walking (walking, ferry, subway) tour of terrific Hong Kong sites -- Chi Lin Nunnery, Nan Lian Gardens, Wanchi wet market and market, and the hordes of teenagers attending the Comic Book Convention. What I like most was interacting with Jamie and learning much about Hong Kong. He made this day's outing truly exciting. What's more, he went above and beyond and sent me detailed instructions on seeing additional sites while I am in Hong Kong. Jamie's expertise and insights are invaluable. He is definitely a must.

J3 Tours of Hong-Kong _AWESOME. We recently (July 2014) visited Hong Kong and since we had only a short time and no knowledge of Hong Kong, I contacted and booked J3 (Jamie) for a full day tour. We had a great time and saw a great representation of Hong Kong - he kept it fast paced, funny and interesting (he kept our 17 and 19 year olds interested and involved as well) We learned and saw alot from someone who has been in Hong Kong for decades. We will be back in Hong Kong soon and will book Jamie again.

a must do to see Hong Kong. having never been outside the air port at Hong Kong before,i was pleased to see we had a time gap to actually leave the airport this time, in transit. i found Jamie offering private tours. Jamie met us at airport and took us on trains and across star ferry. Jamie was just so knowledgeable, learnt so many things as he explained about Hong Kong life. i found this a great way to see around and with someone who knew this place very well, would definitely recommend a private tour by Jamie.i asked to go on star ferry as this was on top of my list.left the rest of site seeing to Jamie. hes so nice and easy to get on with.well worth going on a private tour, got back to airport in plenty of time for next flight.

Excellent Day. Our day began when Jamie met us at our hotel. For the next 8 hours we were moving from one fantastic place to the next. We used every kind of transportation, saw many, many places, ate a lovely lunch (Jamie ordered). Every question I had was answered and to my satisfaction! I feel much richer culturally, and from the knowledge gleaned from our guide. Although my friend had been to Hong Kong before and had done several of the things Jamie took us to, she also benefitted from Jamie's great tour and great company. We had a marvellous day; thanks Jamie!

GREAT TOUR, GREAT TIME. We Booked a 4 HOUR TOUR with JAMIE online. He was ontine and we toured HONG KONG and STANLEY ISLAND. We walked, used public transport system and taxi. JAMIE is very knowledgeabe and has a lot of information in case you need something.I highly recommend him. he is also a great photographer. would use him again. It is well worth the money. MORIE

Great tour and full of facts. After spending a few days venturing on the standard Hong Kong tourist trail, we had a tour with Jamie. It eventuated like this because Jamie was booked out on the day we arrived in Hong Kong and the next. So we asked to be shown part of real Hong Kong that is not usually on the maps. Jamie delivered. He is so full of facts, keen to share his experiences and knows all about rituals, traditions and culture relating to the sites and surroundings. He goes the extra mile and answered all the questions we had (and my 12 year old boy asked a lot of questions) and more. This was the first time I have taken a 'private guide' and I was not sure what to expect - when I came home to talk about my travels in Hong Kong I realised how much I learned and how much richer the experience had been through this tour. I definitely recommend it. Thank you Jamie !!!

Hong Kong in seven days. Just one day after we arrived in Hong Kong we booked a five hour tour with Jamie. Though the weather wasn't promising we visited several spots in Kowloon as well as on Hong Kong Island. Jamie thoroughly met our interest we had given to him before. Further he provided us with several e-mails to meet other spots in the town. The descriptions were extremely helpful, especially as the subway network of Hong Kong isn't really good. Thanks a lot Jamie!

Fantastic personal tour - well worth the $$$. We spent our first day of a two week visit to Hong Kong on a private tour with Jamie which really set us up well for the holiday. Using the public transport system was a breeze with a local so we were set to use that for the rest f the trip. He knew our interest in photography and ensured we visited places at the right time of day for the best photos. Our visit to the Peak included a walk in the shade to the most amazing viewpoint and we were fortunate to have a very clear day. His knowledge of the local culture and politics added to his interesting tales of the city. Jamie is friendly and personable and very flexible with his tours. He clearly loves taking people on tours and you feel like you've made a new friend. He followed up the tour by providing detailed email guides for many other day trips. I highly recommend his tours - so much better than a large group of strangers. Thanks Jamie for a wonderful day.

Thank you Jamie from 4 Aussie Travellers. It was my first time I have used a private guide in my travels and what a great day we had with Jamie we all felt like we were spending a day with a friend not a tour guide. Jamie showed us how to use the public transport system, we learnt about history and culture and saw some amazing sights but especially our visit to the Peak we will never forget. To end a great day Jamie left us at one of his favourite restaurants where we all enjoyed a delicious meal. Jamie's day with you does not stop there he forwarded us many itinieries of places to visit with detailed instructions and even photos to match so travelling around was made even more easier for the rest of our time in Hong Kong. Words cannot explain how much we appreciated the time and effort he puts in to making your holiday enjoyable and carefree. Five days in Hong Kong was not long enough for us so when we return we will be definitely contacting Jamie again to spend a day with him to discover more of his wonderful country.Thank you Jamie again from Louise, David, Sue, Andrew

Another high quality experience. I was passing through Hong Kong on my way back from China and decided to take a couple days and tour with Jamie for a third summer in a row. It was nice to know he would allow for a flexible itinerary given I’d spent quite a bit of time in Hong Kong on previous trips (and previous tours with Jamie) so didn’t feel the need to come up with a list of must see things ahead of time. He really is a consummate professional who cares a lot about providing his clients with a good experience. It was super to see him again and the tours we did (including a couple islands I hadn’t visited before as well as some off the beaten track sites in the New Territories) were as great as the previous ones I’d booked with him. I’m all for learning the lay of the land and getting around on my own, but it’s also nice to be able to relax and follow the lead of a personable, skilled and interesting local.

Made my first visit to Hong Kong a GREAT experience. Jamie was great. My aim was to feel more comfortable getting around Hong Kong in the days following my walking tour. It worked!! We did lots of walking but also used the MTR, so I got familiar with that AND I didn't get lost in the days that followed. Jamie was really interesting and easy to get along with. Afterwards, he emailed me lots of different options (with directions) for filling in my remaining days in Hong Kong. If I ever get back to Hong Kong I will certainly do another tour with Jamie. Thanks again Jamie.

An amazing experience. If you want a tour with a difference then you will have a wonderful time with Jamie he is such an interesting character & will take you to places you wouldn't think of visiting he sets a wonderful pace nothing is rushed. He has a fantastic sense of humour & we felt like we had spent 6 hours with a friend.

Wonderful 6 hours with Jamie - we did so much!. Hiring Jamie in Hong Kong was a very smart decision. Despite a wind driven rain, we saw and experienced so much. WE contracted him in advance for 6 hours. I had a few things that I wanted to include in our tour with him (Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple) and also wanted to experience all modes of transportation (MTR, Star Ferry and Bus) while on tour. Jamie fit that in and so much more. He picked us up at our hotel (Fairmont) at the appointed hour. Besides above, after purchasing Octopus cards, he also pointed out the various kinds of public housing in the city. We took the bus to Stanley - 45 minutes each way by bus), went to the TST Promenade for a very toffy view of HK Island, stopped in the Peninsula Hotel (the restrooms are not to be missed - and if you don't mind the wait stay for Afternoon tea. (We did not have time to wait for 1 1/2 hours). Jamie did give us the tip that if you showed up for tea between 5 and 5:30 the line would be minimal. Because he knows so much about Chinese customs he explained the meaning of numbers, and explained exactly what was happening in the temples and why. It was very helpful in the remaining 3 weeks of our travel on the Mainland. Jamie is articulate, funny and engaging. The only thing I would have done differently is I would have brought our own camera rather than asking him to take photos for us. (He did send us all the photos he took while on tour - and many others). In his web description it discussed his camera and his ability, but it was raining buckets and he was a little hesitant (understandable) to use his camera. We also toured independently the day before we met Jamie. The Nan Lian Garden and the Nunnery should not be missed and if you only have a day - be sure to include both in your tour with Jamie. We arrived when it opened at 9:00 and there were very few people there. I highly recommend Jamie and think a 6 hour tour is ideal.Tip - use the balance on your Octopus card for buying bottled water or a Starbucks as it is taken at 7/11 and Starbucks.

a must-do !. Whether it is your first or fiftieth trip to HK, you will not regret booking a tour with Jamie ! From the moment we made an enquiry, he was prompt and professional, and we did two tours with him - a short afternoon tour and a longer night tour. Jamie has a wealth of knowledge about Hong Kong (and more!) and an indepth understanding that i suspect very few can and will offer. We had a brilliant night tour including an unforgettable trek to The Peak (thanks Jamie - lead the way!)

Make the most out of your Hong Kong experience. You can see a city visually on your own and obviously research places to go, things to do and seE OR you can hire Jamie .We are family with three adult children.Jamie is bright personable and takes tremendous pride in every aspect of his travel touring business.Prompt with communication and a wealth of information relating to Hong Kong.Jamie is the quintessential private guide!Whether you have shopping questions, dining recommendations, queries on history ,politics , current events and more jamie is there with answers.You'll be thrilled with Hong Kong thru J3

Full Hong Kong experience. My wife and I booked Jamie for a full 8 hours Hong King experience. We booked via emails, responses were very prompt and professional. It was nice to know that once we'd booked with Jamie we could let him take charge of the day. We only had 3 days in HK and wanted to make the most of all our time there so decided, rather than muddle along as we usually do, to book a professional tour guide to show us what was HK had to offer. There was no pre-determined itinerary. Jamie met us at the hotel and then talked through what it is we were wanting to get out of the tour, special interests (photography etc) and go from there. It worked for us. The day was extremely varied from the MRT/Octopus cards, Sik Sik Yuen Wong temple (Jamie explained all the differing aspects of the temple), Star Ferry (fantastic and of real character), The Peak (special Jamie spot), Wanchai Market (interesting to see the real locals going about their day to day lives), but to name a very few, there really were too many sites visited to list. All means of public transport were used which simply added to our immersion into HK life. The day with Jamie added to our confidence to venture further afield on our own, which we did on the remaining days. Jamie even emailed us idiot proof directions to Lantau Island (Big Buddha) - they worked perfectly. We ran out of time to use other suggestions he made. Jamie was happy to talk about wide and varied aspects of life / culture in HK and was incredible at pointing out the unusual that we would otherwise have ignored. We were delivered back to our hotel with plenty of ideas for the next 2 days solo site seeing. Initially I felt we could have squeezed more out of the day and certainly some elements didn't work for us (I still have nightmares about a monstrous gold Mickey Mouse), but we set Jamie the challenge of showing us the usual and unusual and he not only delivered but gave us time to soak up the surroundings. It worked. Its not always about rushing from one site, grabbing a few photos and charging off to the next "must see". We had a great day, Jamie's style and approach works. You won't go far wrong by putting your precious time in Jamie's hands. This review is written by a Yorkshireman living in Yorkshire (using so many words has not been easy), so tha's nowt more to say than "Jamie - keep up thee good work!"

Great tour all around - would definitely recommend. My wife and I opted for a 8 hour private day tour in Hong Kong with Jamie in mid April 2014, and it was the best decision we ever made as this tour turned out to be the highlight of our first trip to Asia! We felt that in the limited time we had (3 nights in HK) a private tour on the first day would allow us a "taste" of the city and we could then choose our activities for the following days. While a private tour is not an inexpensive option, you definitely get your money's worth in terms of how much you are able to see and do with Jamie's tour, so there was a lot of value in that for us. We estimated afterwards that if we had used a subway card and guidebook we might have been able to see 1/8 of what we experienced on the tour, and really would have missed the Hong Kong from a local resident perspective, which was extremely valuable to us. We can't say enough good things about the experience with Jamie, all emails were very professional and courteous. We were well taken care of from the moment we were picked up in our hotel lobby, to the "after tour" followup email we received later that evening after the tour giving us detailed directions (with pictures even!) on getting to some of the other sites we talked about during the day with him that matched our interests. A true professional, he knows Hong Kong intimately, and shared his knowledge and love of the city with us. You simply will never get that perspective in a group bus tour type arrangement. He even provided us with an emailed recap of what we saw and did after the tour, which was really helpful when trying to remember the names of some of the places we went. We especially appreciated the fact that Jamie adjusted the tour based on our interests during the day, and adjusted our activities based on traffic and tourist lines at popular attractions.This allowed us to save a lot of time and see more of the city. We especially enjoyed walking to his favorite overlook spot of the city, a stunning view that most tourists would never get to see based on where it is. We appreciated the fact that no questions were off limits, and we were able to have some very interesting discussions about the city, without the sugar coating that you get in a group tour or from a guidebook. We would highly recommend his tour to anyone looking for a unique, educational and fun way to experience Hong Kong with a local.

Top Notch in Every Way. My sister has already posted her review (4aSong in Wichita, KS) and I'll second her comments. Jamie is bright, articulate, knowledgeable and eager to share his love for Hong Kong and comment on what life has been like for the past 38+ years and his views on what the future holds for Hong Kong. While we covered a lot of ground in our 10-hour day (a Wanchai Wet Market, slow ferry to Cheung Chau to explore the island, "his" spot on the Peak for spectacular views away from the crowds, Star Ferry back to Kowloon and the Promenade for view of Hong Kong Island and spots in between), we were never rushed or pulled away from where we wished to linger. It was, all in all, a terrific day and a highlight of our three weeks in China. Don't miss the opportunity to tour with Jamie when you're in Hong Kong. He offers 4-8-10 hour tours as well as evening tours. You can't go wrong if you're looking for a unique experience. Enjoy!

The very best of a 3 week trip. My sister and I traveled through China and then ended our trip in Hong Kong. Jamie was our guide for ten hours on one marvelous day. It was not at all the cookie cutter approach. He has a great deal of knowledge of the history and current state of Hong Kong. He is open to all questions and discussion which was refreshing. We chose our own restaurant on the fly which turned out to be delightful. I could tell you everything that we did, but your tour with him will be different, as there is no one way approach with Jamie. I had a terrific day and only wished it could have been more. In fact, we wished that he could have been our guide on all of our trip. Just the best!
a day with jamie. a day with jamie was filled to the brim-- got to do things that you won't do with a standard tour. saved us money for the rest of our time by showing us how to use the octopus card

5 modes of transport in 9 Hours. Wow...I wish Jamie could be our tour guide on all our adventures (although I am sure he wouldn't mind). What a great day. He took us to a hole-in-the-wall restaurant that was fabulous (way better than the $500 Michelin Star dinner we had later that night). We saw the Temple --- what an eye opener for crazy traditions. Some times I wondered whether he was towing us a long with his stories....but they all checked out. He really knows his stuff. We started on the subway, followed by ferry, by taxi, by bus and street car. He taught us how to spot the tourists, which is now useful in our everyday travels when we see someone carting a suitcase down the sidewalk (insdie joke). He left us in a market, gave us a few tips on who and what to avoid, so we could search for a painting for our home. We made it unescorted back to our hotel with a beautiful painting that fits right in. Thanks so much Jamie and if you are ever in Canada look us up! Sarah and Shawn

Learn a Lot, and Have Some Fun. What a great tour guide Jamie is. You can expect a truly professional operator, who not only knows his stuff, but can quickly assess individual preferences and tailor the tour as you go.Jamie has a huge depth of knowledge about Hong Kong, whether it be history, traditions, infrastructure, commerce, sights to see, or even stores to visit. Start him on any subject and you will benefit by understanding it now from a unique Hong Kong perspective.We've done this type of personal tour in other cities, and have always found them beneficial. Jamie, however, demonstrates a key point of difference, and that is in his truly relaxed and engaging nature. Spending a full day with Jamie was akin to wandering around Hong Kong with an old friend, who just happens to be a total expert on the city.If you are new to Hong Kong, and interested to find out what it's all about, I strongly urge you to take the time and do a private tour with Jamie. Even if you are an old-hand in visiting HK, I bet you would learn a lot you didn't know by spending some time with this guy.Strongly recommended. Thanks Jamie . . . you'll be interested to know that we visited the pearl dealers every day for the next three days . . .

Great Tour of Hong Kong in 8 hours-. My husband and I spent the day with Jamie touring around Hong Kong. Our request was to see HK like a local. Jamie took us to Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple via the MTR. His insignt into HK is great, as he has spent his adult life living in HK. We learned so much about the culture of the city through his eyes. We also rode the bus and the Star Ferry to HK Island as well and learned how to use the Octopus card. At Victoria Peak he shared his favorite viewing place with us away from the crowds. And we had lunch at his favorite Chinese local place. Jamie's humor only added to his interesting stories and local insight! Worth every penny. karenjennie

Great tour; worth the money. It was great to have a tour with Jamie on our first day in Hong Kong. It's very relaxed and he really knows his stuff. He's obviously very experienced as a guide and knows exactly how to form the perfect itinerary for you. He covered everything we asked him to in a perfect loop and gave us lots of very useful information for the rest of our stay, including some superb instructions on how to access other tourist sites such as Victoria Peak.When you take a tour with Jamie, do it at the start of your stay as it's not just one tour; it's setting you up for the whole trip. Well worth it! The photo below is a view of Hong Kong island from a point specifically explained to us by Jamie; it was indeed the best vantage point and we wouldn't have otherwise found it!

The Right Choice Tour. The Guidenot only knows the city and it's history he also has a great knowladge of localTraditions and interesting stories of the past.Taking all the transportation systems and walking around the city landmarks and points Of interest Iike a local is what makes this tour unique ,Jamie's sense of humor is a plus for the Hong Kong experienceI highly recomend this tour Rodolfo StiglichFort Lauderdale

3rd Time with Jamie. G'day Jamie,Thanks mate for showing around Hong Kong and finding those pesky jewelry storesfor Deb. She's a very happy camper with the new bling!!!!Loved wandering around with you on the Island, just sensational, not to mention youfound us some lovely silk material at the Western Market in Central.Its always easy traveling with Jamie, its either the Octopus via the MTR or Star Ferry, plus some very easy walking around. Jamie will always ask you where you want to go and what you want to do which makes the day easy to plan out.So if you're planning a day or two of just looking around HK, then Jamie is the person to do the touring with of that we have no doubt.Thanks JamieCraig & Deb

Jamie is the man. We had the most informative 6 hours with Jamie, he moved at our pace and was a great intro to Hong Kong. He then emailed us about a dozen tips on where else to go for the rest of our stay.I would say our stay in HK was more complete thanks to our time with Jamie. He will do whatever you want, within reason and it will be the the best money you will spend in HK, without a doubt, thanks Jamie, keep up the great work.

Great day in Hong Kong. If you want to avoid both the hastle of organising a day in Hong Kong yourselves and being treated like cattle in a group tour, choose Jamie. As an additional bonus you will get great photographic locations, and an insider's view of the city! Highly recommended!

Inside Hong Kong. We had a wonderful 6-hours-Trip with Jamie, who, living in Hong Kong for about 40 years, is a perfect insider ot the town and it´s highlights. Spontanously booked, he was very flexible in showing us the town as it could only be done by an inhabitant. But he also had a feeling for the things we were interested in. Like markets, foods and stuff.We got a lot of information about the superstitious Chinese and their "religion" and what the living is about in HongKong.And after all we had the best Dim Sums for lunch at the City Hall.

FABULOUS TOUR with a FABULOUS GUIDE. As a first-time visitor to Hong Kong in February, I wanted to make the most of my limited time in the city so I decided to hire a guide. I've traveled all over the world by myself and have never had any interest in a guide. But again, as my time was very limited, I decided to give it a go. After lots of research, I booked Jamie's services. It was an excellent decision and a wonderful experience. The following are the positive points that immediately come to mind regarding Jamie: extremely knowledgeable, informative, observant, witty, fun, organized, straightforward and punctual. Negative points? Not a single one! Do not hesitate to book a tour with Jamie; you will come away saying, "wow, that was a lot of fun and I learned so much!"

Great for both first timers and third timers. If the Hop On Hop Off bus is not for you, I recommend a day with Jamie. There were four of us, two had never been to Hong Kong before and my husband and I had been twice before. We all enjoyed the day. Part of the fun is the travel on public transportation, including the subway and a double decker bus. We were only in HK for one full day after 2 1/2 weeks in mainland China and were a bit tired. But Jamie is an engaging guy and he not only took us to see the sights but was able to anwwer our questions about the cultural differences between Hong Kongers and the mainland Chinese. All in all a very interesting day.

Private Tour Hong Kong. We had an EXCELLENT experience with Mr. Jamie in a two -parts Tour .He knows Hong Kong very well and a walking tour is the way to go.We HIGHLY recomend this tour and this GUIDE Mr. Jamie Lloyd. S.& Yami Hoyos, Tampa , Florida

Hands down the best guide. I felt liked hit the jackpot by booking Jamie to show us Hong Kong for 8 hours. This was by far the best tour. My group consisted of 7 people with a age span from in the 40's to the70's. We travelled like a local which made this tour such a stand out..by ferry, bus and train. A must see is Victoria peek. Jamie's wealth of knowledge, patience and sense of humour made this tour extra special. I can only hope that I can find someone like this in every city I tour. After the tour Jamie sent me detailed instructions on how to see other sites while in Hong Kong. Thanks again Jamie. You can't go wrong by booking with Jamie

Wonderful 4 hours with Jamie/. First time in Hong Kong and we spent four hours on our first day with Jamie. What a wonderful tour guide. We learned a great deal in a short time about the culture, saw some really important sites and felt like we could handle the MTR system after our time with Jamie. He's knowledgable, pleasant and makes you feel right at home.As a great bonus, after our tour, Jamie emailed us DETAILED information on all the sites in Hong Kong that we might want to visit. Very much appreciated. A great way to start our stay in Hong Kong!

The BEST Hong Kong guide! Really!. We spent 7 hours with Jamie on our first full day - he set the stage for a memorable visit to a fascinating city and region. We received an excellent education in all things Hong Kong - history, culture, politics, and most importantly - how to get around like a "local". We stayed 5 more days exploring on our own and utilizing the insider information Jamie provided. You simply MUST avail yourself of his unique expertise. A huge THANK YOU for making our trip spectacular!

Great Hong Kong Tour!!!. I selected J3 tours becasue of the many positive reviews. We were not dissapointed, not easy when traveling with a teenager. This was our first time visiting Hong Kong I booked a half day tour, Jamie had us traveling like locals using the subways and the ferrry. We went to the sik sik yuen wong tai sin temple - facinating. Jamie was informative, entertaining, and charming. He answered all questions including all the other areas we were interested in seeing. He even followed up with suggestions for the rest of our stay. I strongly reccomend J3 private tours and will book again next time we are in Hong Kong.

Hard to imagine a better tour guide. We selected Jamie based on Trip Advisor reviews for a 5 hour tour on our only day in Hong Kong. It is hard to imagine a better tour guide. We saw all the most important sites, learned about the culture, the "real religion" of the people, their education system, their attitude toward mainland Chinese, and much of the recent history of Hong Kong. We took and learned about every form of local mass transit, and even prevailed upon Jamie to take us to a local non-tourist restaurant for an excellent lunch. All in all, this may have been the best single tour we have ever experienced.

Our best 6 hours in Hong Kong. Loved our time with Jamie. We told him we were interested in learning about the culture and history in Hong Kong....no shopping! Jamie did just that, and we had such a wonderful time. For a first-time visitor, he just took us by the hand and did everything we had asked. We highly recommend him. It will make you time in HK so much more worthwhile.

Cultural Intro on Our Last Day. Was recently vacationing with my brother in Hong Kong on a company reward trip he earned. Because we had filled our days with pre-booked excursions, we weren't available until the last day of our trip in order to book with Jamie. Luckily it worked out with his schedule! We asked Jamie to show us some HK culture, and he absolutely delivered! He is witty, knowledgeable, and I highly recommend him if you're thinking about getting a guide. It would've been incredibly useful had we had time at the beginning of our trip to book him.

Hong Kong w/ Jamie. We spent a day and 1/2 with Jamie. He showed us the sights, but more importantly helped us understand the culture, attitudes and day to day life in Hong Kong. He also taught us how to get around on our own on the mass transit system - AND provided us with detailed information on what to see on our own w/ directions and comments. He made our time in Hong Kong, both with him and on our own, productive, informative and fun. Highly recommend touring Hong Kong w/ Jamie.

Great time in Hong Kong. We booked Jamie well in advance and it was well worth it. We had quite the variety of people but he was able to tailor a great trip! Taking the metro added to the experience. In hindseight i would recomend two days to cover everything. He is also very cautious of your eating and dietery needs! Be ready for some british humor too. Thanks Jamie nice work!

Really great time!. We had a great tour with Jamie who introduced us to places we never could have found on our own. He has a wealth of knowledge on the island and local customs and told them in a really engaging way for our family. Would definitely recommend you try him out. I've provided a couple of pictures to give you a sense of our experience. Thanks Jamie!

Perfect!. We toured Hong Kong with Jamie in early December, and it couldn't have been more perfect! Jamie was very punctual, knowledgeable, accommodating to our preferences, and very upbeat. Not only did we get to see and experience Hong Kong with Jamie, but he made great suggestions as to where to stay and where to eat dinner with very clear directions.I highly recommend Jamie for anyone who wants to see and enjoy Hong Kong. Thank you Jamie!Barbara

Safe, Fun, Friendly, Informative!!!!. Jamie took me to the Ten Thousand Buddha Monastry. He was punctual and met me in my Hotel Lobby to begin our journey. Jamie is a gentleman and as a single female traveller I felt safe and comfortable with him. Jamie was a delight to chat to and very informative. He definately know's his way around Hong Kong. Would highly recommend Jamie for any solo female traveller's or anyone else what wants a tour of Hong Kong! Thankyou Jamie had a a great day which I will remember forever!!!

Highly recommended. Jamie was a great tour guide on a one day stayover in Hong Kong at the end of our honeymoon. He was punctual, well prepared (itinerary, transportation tickets, etc) and was very personable. As he has lived in Hong kong for many years, he knows it really well as a true local. We only had a few hours to spend and Jamie managed to show us very different sides of Hong Kong. We went from Wanchai market and the Pak Tai Template to The Peak with its amazing views back down to the HSBC Lions and the Cheung Kong Centre, amongst others. We really felt we managed to get a grasp of what Hong Kong is like in a very short time without feeling rushed.We would highly recommend Jamie to anyone that is looking for a local guide who really knows the place and enjoys showing visitors around HK. Thanks Jamie!

Wonderful day.. I'm absolutley delighted we decided to choose Jamie to show us around Hong Kong,it was a wonderful informative day from start to finish.Nothing was too much trouble for Jamie, apart from the wonderful tour he will advise you on many many other things to do and places to see during your stay in Hong Kong, providing very detailed instructions on how to get there and things to do.He also arranged tickets on the Aqua Luna when the Symphony of Lights was on which was just wonderful.We had a wonderful stay in Hong Kong largely due to Jamie.I can reccommend his tour 100% simply fantastic.Thanks a Million

Thankful For Jamie. I m so thankful for the tour we had with Jamie. Hong Kong is a huge city & much less intimidating to get introduced to with Jamie. I thought our tour wasn't going to happen due to a trolley injury that Jamie had, but he managed to take us out anyway which I am very thankful for! The tour was fantastic! We covered a lot of ground in 6 hours, saw a lot & figured out how to navigate our way around the city, which all of a sudden became much less intimidating. We gave Jamie an idea of what our interests were & he set up an itinerary that we couldn't have designed better ourselves. We also ate at his "greasy spoon" restaurant which ended up being our favorite meal in Hong Kong! Jamie sent many emails of suggestions for things to do during the rest of our stay in Hong Kong which was incredibly helpful! I am so grateful to Jamie for spending the day with us & introducing us to such a beautiful city! It definitely MADE our trip! Don't think about booking this trip...... Just do it! You won't regret it.

He's the Man. Four 65 yr young lady friends spent two 4hr tours, one in Kowloon(12/31), one on Hong Kong Island(1/1) with Jamie, who I found through the Trip Advisor site. It was a wise choice. Jamie was very personable, informative and helpful with suggestions. He helped us get the senior Octopus card(used for different transportation modes) which saved us money, and also allowed us to experience how the residents get around Hong Kong. We felt like we got the feel and sites of Hong Kong, but not at a hurried pace, which was great. Having done some tour guiding in the U.S myself, I can definitely say that Jamie is the man you want to take you around the environs of Hong Kong. He really enjoys the service he provides! Go Jamie! Kerry H.

6 hours of info. I decided that the best way to get an overview of Hong Kong was to hire a guide. I contacted Jamie and he arranged everything. Our 6 hour tour covered everything I had hoped to experience. Jamie is a fantastic guide as he really gives you a feel for the people and the place. Get a bit of money to catch the train and pay for a meal, everything else Jamie looks after. It was a pleasure walking around and not having to fumble for tickets to get on to all the transportation that we took. Not having to worry if we had enough time to get from one place to another. Thanks Jamie for a very enjoyable day. I would highly recommend you. Take care fat GC, from DL.

A rainy but enjoyable evening in Hong Kong. Jamie was punctual, informative, friendly, knowledgable, and gracious. We had a very short window, and what I probably appreciated most was Jamie's responsiveness to emails before we actually made the trip. I had a lot of questions about the plan, and in particular Jamie was very good about suggesting things to do and sights to see on the days we were not going to be with him. He has very detailed and accurate plans for finding and enjoying different sights in Hong Kong, which made our subsequent days there without his company organized and stress-free.

Good guide Hongkong!. Jamie is a very pleasant guide. He listened carefully to what we said and took us round in Hongkong for 4 hours in between two flights. Besides that he showed us the things we asked, he showed us much much more. What is really of value is what he told us about life in Hongkong, about the people, the buildings and lots of small things we wouldn't have noticed had we visited Hongkong on our own. If we had to choose again, we'd definitely choose Jamie again.A&A - Holland

Well worth it!. I hired Jamie for a 5hour tour of Hong Kong, I wished I had booked all day. Jamie is very insightful, and you get a great sense of Hong Kong. I had a fascinating time - Jamie says no tour is ever the same.Jamie kindly emailed suggestions for the rest of my stay which included directions & top tips - which was so useful, included are even photo's with directions - so you never get lost, this was better than any guide book!Booking was very easy and you can see Jamie's availability on his website. Highly recommend.

Really great!. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Jamie! We were completely unprepared and had hardly even read our tour book but Jamie didn't mind at all and just asked us a few questions and then gave us a great tour of Hong Kong! We did our tour on the first day we were there and throughout the tour, Jamie gave us great ideas on what we should see while we were in town. I definitely recommend booking with him.

a true gentleman!. I had a one day layover and had booked J3 for a private tour on Xmas Day 2013. Unfortunately, my plane was rerouted due to technical issues (terrible, over 24 h flight) and there was insufficient time to conduct the tour. Jamie, of J3, instead of being upset about the tour cancellation sent me tips and directions and information so I could conduct my own tour. He seemed genuinely apologetic that my flight was delayed and tour was cancelled and did all he could to help. A great guide - who is in it to ensure the traveller has a great experience, highly recommended.

Hong Kong without the Hassle!. Having visited HK many times, and wanting to let two business associates see the city on their jet-lag-recovery day, I considered just "taking them around," before investigating whether a "tour guide" might be available. I made an initial inquiry to another guide, he was booked on the specified date, and he was kind enough to refer me to Jamie who proved wonderful. Purposefully leaving all the planning up for a 9-5 daytime tour up to him, we met in the lobby of the Kowloon Hotel and walked to the water front harborside walkway, then took the Star Ferry to HK, a regular speed ferry to Cheung Chau Island for a very interesting journey back in time, the high speed ferry back (40 and 30 min respectively), a taxi to the peak (skipping lunch in a Vietnamese restaurant because we wanted to see more), the tram down, a stop in St. John's Cathedral, a double-decker bus ride, and a walk through the remarkably diverse (from handbags to goats' heads) street market in Wanchai, the area of Suzy Wong fame. All along the way, Jamie provides insights, stories, and answers to questions. We had a marvelous time, and would repeat on another visit, letting him show us more of Hong Kong. Communicating with Jamie is easy, and he responds promptly. Highly recommend.

Informality is a key. One of the reviewers below expressed an opinion: "What's the point in taking a guide? Any taxi driver will take you to all local landmarks, and it will be cheaper!"Highly disputable. Of course, you can surf on the Internet, scrutinise couple of guidebooks and then tick all necessary boxes. And what will you learn about one of the most remarkable world's megalopolises? Acting this way, can you really feel its character? Especially, when your time is very limited? Informal approach is what makes Jamie's guidance different from similar product offered by the overwhelming majority of his colleges. He certainly provides all historical facts and statistic data, but he also convey heaps of amazing stories and gives you a general idea of the way people live and think in Hong Kong turning your guided stroll in somewhat of behind the scenes tour. In my view, it's definitely worth your both time and money.All in all, we really enjoyed these several hours and do appreciate Jamie's undoubted professionalism. Highly recommended.

OUR OWN PRIVATE TOUR GUIDE. Having never been to Hong Kong before,we didn't want to waste time wondering around trying to figure out where to go, what to see and how to navigate the public transportation system. Having Jamie as our tour guide was the perfect solution. We spent most of the day with Jamie, saw a large area of the city and the outlying area of Stanley and used all the various modes of public transportation. He met us at our hotel promptly at the agreed time. Jamie was very personable and someone who I would enjoy being friends with if I lived in Hong Kong. Highly recommended.

Fantastic way to see the city!. I really didn't have any preconceived expectations of Hong Kong other than it was a shopping haven! We decided to book a tour before we left Sydney. What we experienced was more than i could ever have imagined. Jamie asked us if we had any specific requests or desires to see certain areas. As first time visitors, we asked Jamie to show us 'his city'. The areas that we would not normally see with ordinary tours. Off we went on an adventure. We travelled to parts of Hong Kong that were both touristy (The Peak, Wong Tai Sin Temple, the Markets) however we also experienced the local areas. Jamie's historical and local knowledge is outstanding. As a first time visitor to Hong Kong, i would highly recommend doing a walking tour with Jamie. Thank you Jamie for a memorable holiday!
Walk in Hong Kong. We had an enjoyable and insightful guided tour of Hong Kong. Engage Jamie if you are traveling to Hong Kong.

Hong Kong Trip. If any one of you plan to visit Hong Kong for the first time, you must do the private walking tour with Jamie. I did this few days ago and Jamie showed me the right places to visit, especially if you are in HK for the first time and have no idea about the city. I had booked for an evening tour; although it was a short one, we captured the night view of HK island from Victoria peak. It was an unhurried tour and we went at our own pace. I highly recommend Jamie to folks who have no clue about HK. Apart from being a reliable tour operator (one man show), Jamie has a good sense of humour. You would really enjoy conversing with him. Thanks, Jamie! You made my trip, a success.

Fantastic Tour of Hong Kong's Hidden Gems. Our family was in Hong Kong for seven days recently and we booked a walking tour with Jamie, based purely on the Trip Advisor reviews.We had an excellent day with Jamie and saw parts of Hong Kong we would otherwise not have seen. We were travelling with three generations, including my parents, my husband and my two daughters (5 & 7). Jamie developed an excellent and friendly rapport with us quickly, and took us on a tour that kept everyone’s interest, whilst ensuring it was manageable for both the children and the grandparents.We started with a the tour of the Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple was fascinating, and entertaining. We then had a great time travelling to the island and up to the peak via underground, ferry and finally taxi. Great views of the city from the trail that Jamie took us on.Finally we spent some time in Central before heading back to TST.In addition to the tour, Jamie was able to provide excellent advice and recommendations on shopping (jewelry, bags, watches and cameras) and dining. We had an excellent day, and I am confident that our trip to Hong Kong was greatly improved as a result of both the tour and the insights to the city provided by Jamie.Highly recommended.

Unique perspective indeed!. First of all, Jamie gave us a short list of hotels that would be ideal for us based on our wants, needs and budget-We stayed at the Hotel Icon, and it exceeded our expectations. Jamie also recommended taking a taxi from the Airport to our hotel which after a 16 hour flight from Toronto was the best move ($50).We did an evening (4hr) tour, the highlight by far was heading up to Victoria Peak, for an unforgetable view of Kowloon, HK and Harbour view.The following day we did a daytime tour of Kowloon, the highlight for me was visiting the neighborhood of Mong Kok. As someone who last visited HK 32 years ago this is how I remebered the city to be. Thousands of locals and tourists in a working class neighborhood, neon signs, outdoor cooking stalls, shopping in the ladies market...Jamie has lived here for most of his adult life, and so his perspective on HK life, knowledge of this unique area of China , provided us with far more than we could have gleaned from a Hop on Hop off type bus tour.If you are coming this far, perhaps once in your life, let him give you a tailor made tour of HK/Kowloon

Best Day in Hong Kong. I booked a 5 hour tour with Jamie before leaving Canada for my trip to Hong Kong using Jamie's website and checking his calendar to see what dates he still had available. I knew that I was going to be on my own and I wanted to make the most of my time in a big unfamiliar city. Jamie was right on time and picked me up at the hotel. Using an Octopus card we took the subway to the Sik Sik Yuen temple, visited a street market and Statue Square as well. Jamie's extensive knowledge of the city, the history of the local sights, and his attention to detail made for such an enjoyable tour! By the end of the tour you really do feel like you have spent the time with a good friend. You can trust Jamie to take you on the best tour ever of Hong Kong. I am so pleased that I found J3Private Tours on Tripadvisor and did not end up taking a group tour. Don't miss out on seeing the best of Hong Kong with a private tour. You won't be disappointed!

Long Walk with an Old Friend. We spent a full day exploring Hong Kong on our first day & visit to Hong Kong. Jamie was a fantastic resource for getting us organized for a great 8 day stay in the city. He helped us get acquainted with the transport system - helped us get Octopus cards etc. We loved his point of view on the city, and all his additional suggestions for things to do and how to do them avoiding long lines & getting the best view etc. Thanks Jamie for a wonderful intro to your beautiful city.

J3 (Jamie) Private Day Tour of Hong Kong. Two of us stopped in Hong Kong after a business trip to mainland China and had just two days available. Found Jamie on Tripadvisor and booked him for our second day. He very graciously provided detailed information on how we could do somed self-guided sightseeing on our first day. Met Jamie on our second day and spent eight hours exploring highlights of Hong Kong. We found Jamie to be easygoing, knowledgeable and, most important of all, flexible. His fee, which was reasonable for a private tour, did not include incidentals such as public transportation, snacks and admission fees but these did not add significantly to the cost. I would not hesitate to recommend Jamie for private or group tours of Hong Kong. He is not just a guide but a friend that you can contact about any information that you require and he responds promptly.

J3 (Jamie) private tours of Hong Kong. As per reviewing the comments on "Trip Advisor" I decided to get in touch with Jamie and request his services for a private 8 hours tour of Hong Kong.We found Jamie, knowledgeable on many issues related to Hong Kong and the fact of having a guide available to answer all your questions and take you to places of interest in Hong Kong, makes the experience very rewarding.I highly recommend Jamie's services.Nela NY

J3 Private Tours Hong Kong, the best. Two seniors on their first trip to SE Asia. We never take tours but this time we decided that a local guide might be the perfect way to get a true feel for the culture, history and people of Hong Kong, our first stop. I found J3 Tours and Jamie Lloyd online and easily booked our 4-hour private tour for our second morning. He was wonderful. Did I say knowledgeable and interesting, too? I didn't want museums. Nothing inside. Instead we wanted to see the non-tourist side of HK Island. Back streets and interesting alleys, out of the way shops that only locals went to. Having lived in HK for 37 years, Jamie is an Englishman from Yorkshire who knows Hong Kong inside and out. He picked us up at our Kowloon hotel and off we went. On foot. First the Star Ferry and then the little nooks and crannies that have so many fascinating stories to tell. Chinese medicine shops. Store fronts along Hollywood Road and Cat Street each crammed with antiques. The Graham Street Market. The tiny shop selling egg custard tarts. Even before our trip, Jamie provided countless details and photos: where to go on our own and the best way to get there. Jamie suggested places ordinary tourists hardly ever see such as Cheung Chau Island. Easy to get to, hard to forget. Jamie, we can't thank you enough for such a memorable time.

Perfect HK Intro and Great Company. I was travelling by myself on business and decided to take a few vacation days for a stopover in Hong Kong. I had 3 full days and booked a 12 hour tour with Jamie for my first day from 9am to 9pm. His choice of things to see and do based on my input were perfect and he provided plenty of interesting info and advice that you would not get if touring on your own or with a large tour group. After a full day with Jamie, I felt pretty well oriented and quite comfortable venturing out on my own for the 2 days that I had left.If you have limited time in Hong Kong or just want to get off to a good start, I highly recommend you try J3 Private Tours Hong Kong. It is well worth the money spent in my opinion.I've added some of my favorite photos. The quality is not great because all I had was a basic camera phone but it will give you and idea of the unique and interesting sights.THANKS JAMIE!!!

Jamie was excellent! Highly recommend.. As with others, saw Jamie's review on Trip Advisor and was very happy to use his services. In advance of our trip, Jamie send wonderful relevant information, customized for our particular interests and schedule. He made our 5 hours with him fly by. We found him to be extremely personable, knowledgeable and a wonderful guide through the mazes of Hong Kong city life. I would highly recommend his personalized approach. There is no comparison between his tour and other larger more organized (and much more commercial) tours. Do yourself and others a great favor and take his tour(s)...you will see more in a few hours than you could possibly see or do in two days by yourself!

J3 private tours Hong Kong. Jamie met us and kindly waited as our docking was far out of the original harbour. He took us walking through areas in HK I am sure on a bus trip you would have missed. His knowledge and stories of the superstitions and religions of the Chinese population were fascinating. We had given Jamie an idea of our tastes and preferences and he structured the tour to fit the four of us. We travelled on the trains and really experienced a side of the city I am sure many day tourists don't see. A day in HK is limiting but Jamie gave us a wonderful tour and filled our day with as many aspects as was possible. We saw temples, shops, hotels, trains and spectacular views and left HK without any regrets other than limited time. I can highly recommend Jamie and wish him well.

A great way to see Hong Kong!. Found Jamie on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed with our choice! We booked 2 half day tours, which covered all the places we fancied seeing in HK, plus more chosen by Jamie - was great walking through the food market and seeing the fish head moving without it's body or still pulsing heart in a chopped up fish, amazing to see how the locals really live. Jamie had great knowledge of all areas and the history of HK and we enjoyed the added bonus of his car spotting hobby! We travelled by bus, train, tube and ferry, using our 'Octopus' cards purchased via Jamie, all good fun and the restaurant he recommended at the Peak was fab! A great guy and very flexible so would highly recommend.

Hong Kong with a local's perspective. I found Jamie through Trip Advisor and was impressed from the first time we were in contact by email.I used Jamie twice during my stay in Hong Kong, once for an evening tour and once for a morning tour.Jamie is a great character, full of life and interesting stories. Maybe it helped that we are both from Yorkshire!! I saw so much in my two 1/2 day tours, including the peak at night (and Jamie's secret spot away from the mass crowds), the lobbies of the Pennisula and Mandarin Oriental hotels, Temple Street night market and the ladies that frequent it! You just couldn't get more opposite sights in Hong Kong.....Star Ferry ride. Can't believe we fit all this in 4 1/2 hours!On my day tour we went to a temple in Kowloon. It was fascinating to watch all the mainland Chinese tourists and their rituals. I also found out I am very lucky, being born in 1968Then we went to Stanley on the bus, which was such a contrast from Central Hong Kong, quieter with beaches. We had a nice cream and walked along the boardwalk, it was almost like being in England! I met a couple of great kids on the bus, who amused me and saw some beautiful houses. I know I would never have come down to Stanley on my own. There is much more to it than just the market!I would definitely recommend Jamie. You will see and learn so much from him. He also emailed me suggestions for the free day I had, which helped me to decide where to go! You wouldn't get service like this from a bus company tour!

Great Orientation to an incredible City!!. When we decided at the last minute to add 5 days in Hong Kong on to our trip it became a rather daunting challenge to figure out how to navigate this massive city (with little time to do much research). We decided early on that our best chance to enjoy this was to see if we could find a tour guide who would provide us with all the shortcuts and insights we would need to enjoy our stay. Finding Jamie was the answer to what we needed! He turned out to be a friendly, helpful, funny and very knowledgable tour guide. He began the day with helping us straighten out our banking access...which I am sure is not in his job description! We continued to some incredibly interesting sights...some he choose and some we did. At all of them he made sure to tailor the tours to what my family was interested in which made it all very personal for us. During our eight hour tour Jamie was very focused on us and what we needed to enjoy our stay. This concern and focus continued after the tour ended as Jamie sent us a series of emails that helped with the rest of our stay!! That was greatly appreciated...and did make our stay productive, easy and fun. I have used guides before but Jamie seemed more like a good friend showing us a City he knows incredibly well!

Great way to see HK. We had 3 separate tours with Jamie, doing different things. This was money very well spent - it helped us get the most out of HK by cutting through the challenge of local travel and so on. Jamie knows his way around the place and knows the good spots to get to. He is prompt, polite, and knowledgable. I think Jamie would agree that although he has lived in HK for almost 40 years, he cannot provide you a "local's perspective" and he will give you an "expat perspective", which is fine. Very enjoyable - thanks

Amazing tour guide!. My husband and I had just one day to spend in Hong Kong amd we were ao lucky to have found Jaime on tripadvisor. He met us at the hotel and took us to some highlights of the city. More special than seeing the sights was the vast amount of historical and cultural insight and information Jaime had to share. He was able to customize the trip to make the most of one day, and at the end we could not have imagined that we could have gotten more from just one day. Hong kong is full of interesting facts and itself is such a fascinating city - you would lose out if you did not venture out with a tour guide like Jaime. Jaime is honest, easy to talk to, and is eager to share this city he knows inside and out. I hope you pick him to share your time in Hong Kong rather than go with a pre processed tour group. I promise you won't be disappointed.
Saturday afternoon in Hong Kong !. Great fun with a knowledgable, informative and relaxed guide. Learned a lot and really enjoyed our afternoon ! Mark and Christine, UK

You will not be disappointed. Jamie is just terrific. November 1 2013Hi Jamie. We are back home now and want you to know what a great time we had with you in Hong Kong. With you at the helm, we learned so much about Hong Kong. We enjoyed your sense of humour while you led us around your beautiful and interesting city. Your enthusiasm is infectious. Your one of a kind Jamie and thank you so much for our wonderful tour. Barb D Canada

Well worth the spend.. Didnt quite know what to expect for a four hr tour. We are delighted with our tour with Jamie. He took us on a guided tour that showed us so much of Hong Kong and a understanding of the life of Hong Kongers. This magical tour took us from the spiritual rituals n beliefs of locals to markets places n the heights n views of the peak. Jamie taught us how to get around on the various transportation n saved us time avoiding long queues. He was a delight to spend time with n has a great sense of humour.He has continued to be an invaluable source of info sending me emails with other places to see n instructions. As well as sending us some fabulous pics he took on our tour. I would thoroughly recommend his tours

Great start to our Hong Kong visit!. We had a few days stopover in Hong Kong on our way to France and we really wanted to make the most of our time as we knew it may not happen again. We booked Jamie's tour on our first day, and it was the best decision. Not only did he help us with emails weeks before we arrived, but introducing us to the public transport system and showing us how easy it is to use was invaluable for the rest of our stay. We left the tour itinerary up to him as he knew what we planned to see later in the week and we wanted a bit of a surprise tour! It was exactly what we wanted and we did get to experience things we wouldn't have gotten to, plus it was great to get local insight into things that happened around us. Aside from a great tour, Jamie was super helpful and friendly and we really enjoyed spending the afternoon with him. Would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting, no matter how long your stay.

J3 Private Tours Hong Kong. We did an 8 hour walking/public transportation tour with Jamie and found it a very efficient way to see Hong Kong. He assisted us in purchasing our octopus cards and in learning how to use all means of transportation. We saw many sights on Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and he provided many interesting details about them. This was a long but fascinating day filled with stories and personal insights on the workings of Hong Kong based on his experiences of living in this community for many years. We stopped midway for a tasty lunch. We found the full day tour to be the best way to go. Jamie then provided us with detailed instructions on how to visit the Big Buddha on our own the following day. This saved us from purchasing a group tour for this 5-6 hour excursion. He was correct that visiting this site was easily done independently and that saved us the cost of an additional tour.

A great view of Hong Kong in a day tour. As a family of 4 from the UK and only in Hong Kong for the weekend it was important to spend time wisely and we were not disapointed. Jamie knew exactly what we were interested in and constructed the days tour to match. His background was perfect to be able to provide informed comments and his local knowledge is firat rate, not to mention his knowledge of local spiders, flora, people and cars. Highly recommended.

Authentic Hong Kong Experience. I was in Hong Kong for a few days this September and wanted to get to know the city. I tried a few other options but none really impressed me. Lucky me that I was able to make a last minute booking with Jamie for 5 hours the next day - this tour was going to be the highlight of my trip ! It was my good luck that the day I booked was a sunny and bright Sunday - the best day to be out in the city because its a weekend and people are soaking up the good weather and the atmosphere is great. We met at my hotel near the IFC mall and then made our way to the markets, with Jamie providing interesting and useful facts about the area, the products sold, and its residents. We made our way to the top of the peak tram area but we took a special route to the top and a short 15 minute hike later and we had a great view of Kowloon, the Victoria harbor, that had only locals and almost no tourists around ! Most people head over to the peak mall and take in the view from there but Jamie knows best as someone who has been in HK for over 30 years. We visited the Peninsula hotel next and were surprised by ballroom dancing in the middle of the hotel during the tea hour. We then got metro passes and he explained how the system works and we went to the Sik Sik Yuen shrine. This was a real learning point which Jamie explained the cultures and traditions of the temple and how superstition is ingrained into the mindsets of ordinary citizens. Jamie really made sure that I saw the important monuments, buildings, learned the customs and traditions, and gave advice on where to head next in HK. This was a completely fantastic trip and one I would repeat and recommend to all looking to understand what Hong Kong is all about !

Great Hong Kong Experience in 8 hours. I booked a tour with Jamie months ago for my son & I. It was worth every single cent of the cost. Prior to leaving Australia Jamie forwarded an Email advising usof best place to change money at a good rate & advised to purchase an Octapus pass....saving us both money & hassles of sorting out the cost of public transport. Jamie met us in out hotel lobby & we were off to experience parts of Hong Kong that were different & to suit our own special requests. The Bruce Lee exhibition was absolutely fantastic....Anthony Loved it. When in Stanley visited places I didn't realize were there. Ate at a fantastic restaurant. Jamie's knowledge & sense of humour kept. us entertained for the entire tour. Sad when the tour finally finished. Today received a few emails from Jamie giving us information on how to get to different places we may wish to visit. None of that usual "got your money & now forgotten" with Jamie. He's helped us heaps since. Thank you Jamie . Keep in good health as we'll want you to.guide us on tour next trip to Hong Kong.

The best of Hong Kong in 8 hours!. We booked an 8 hour tour with Jamie and it was very well worth it. He met us at our hotel (which was a little bit out of the way). We travelled by subway, bus, taxi and the island ferry. He took us to some unique places and his knowledge of Hong Kong is incredible. On our journey we saw hisnumber "1" car and he took us to his 'secret' spot on The Peak...totally awesome. We had to change our plans a little bit because of the airport closure in Bali and he was very accommodating. Thanks Jamie, we had a great day and learned so much about the culture and even the cab driver was impressed!!
Excellent night tour. Booked evening tour with Jamie in August 2013. and it was excellent start to my short stay in Hong Kong. great tour. great guide.
Very fun experience. Insiders view of HK with the perspective of someone who has lived there most of his life. I saw and learned things I would not have otherwise. Excellent

Memorable Experience. Booked a day with Jamie via TripAdvisor and his website to help us acclimatise to Hong Kong. He was good enough to start the walking tour from our hotel and then designed the day with old, new, scenic, nature, food and real Hong Kong in mind. Something for everyone.He added some great insight into the traditions of this great city including Chinese superstitions and beliefs - something we would not have known if we had ambled around during our stay.The pace of our day was also unhurried - coupled with very efficient public transport - underground and ferry. Met some lovely locals too.Would genuinely recommend to friends and family with no hesitation whatsoever. Thank you, Jamie from the Wilson family.

Excellent walking tour of central Hong Kong. When my wife told me of the cost of one of these private tours I was initially put off, but she brought me round to the idea and I must say I am very glad she did! Definitely worth the money :)Jamie is a Brit (Yorkshireman originally) who has lived in Hong Kong most of his life and knows all the sights and people, with a sense of humour that was right up our street. He met us in the lobby of our hotel and took us on a tour of not only the major attractions (such as the Peak, Wong Tai Sin Temple, Peninsula Hotel [which we returned to on another day for afternoon tea] and the HSBC headquarters) which were within walking/short metro trip distance of the centre but also those areas and buildings that, while not 'attractions' in the tourist sense, definitely give you an idea of how different it is to the UK and what living in Hong Kong is actually *like*.I only wish we'd had more time. As it was Jamie stayed with us a little longer than we had actually paid for to ensure that we got the correct bus for the area we were going to next, and his local knowledge regarding which attractions to avoid, which were worth visiting, and what times and days were best to visit them to avoid massive crowds and long waits, was a Godsend for our later days when we were fending for ourselves in the city. He is also a keen photographer and found some good spots for me to get some shots myself, as I am just getting into the hobby.We already had an idea of the places we wanted to visit over our 3 day stay, but knew we wouldn't have time to get round them all. Jamie was able to help us hone our list down to the best ones, and decide where to go on which day. If you've already got an idea of the sort of tour you want, the sort of places you'd like to see, he can tailor the tour to hit up those things but he is also capable of dealing with people who (as we did) say "Er, I don't know really, we just want to get a feel for the city and see what it's like here" when asked what their aims/goals during the stay are.

Hong Kong with a difference. We found J3 on TripAdvisor and exchanged a few emails with Jamie to set up an 'alternative' walking tour of Hong Kong. Jamie is a ex-pat Brit with a dry sense of humour who has lived in Hong Kong for many years now. He will tailor make your tour to suit your requirements. We asked for something a little different that the average tourist or guide book would not experience or recommend. His local knowledge was great, the tour was fascinating and his dry humour was right up our street. We felt we experienced a bit of the raw, real underbelly of Hong Kong rather than just scratching the surface. If you are looking for something interesting, personalised and quirky, then I highly recommend Jamie.

Excellent Day!. After finding J3 here on TripAdvisor we exchanged a few emails and than Jamie set up a day and time that would work best for us while we were in Hong Kong. This was our first time visiting and we were really looking forward to getting some history, sights, sounds and interesting tid-bits about Hong Kong before we set off on our own for the next 3 days. A guide-book is fine for the sights but I feel you really don't get to dig in and know a place including the people, politics and way of life without a local to share their experiences. We started our day with Jamie by meeting in the lobby of our hotel and then spent a few minutes getting to know each other and what our group of 3 wanted to get out of the day. We picked up our Octopus cards and began our adventure. We spent the next 7 hours learning about HK, seeing some of the popular tourist spots and enjoying some of the more obscure sights that I doubt most visitors would get to. Having Jamie as your guide is a comfortable and fun experience. He is very witty and has a knowledge to keep you entertained while you are on your feet. I can't say enough good things about our day except that when we come back I assure you we will book another tour with J3 which hopefully says it all.

A day to remember!. Recently visited HK with my son and for the first time ever I booked a walking tour. Opting for an English speaking guide I choose Jamie using feedback from Trip Advisor. What a find, we had such a wonderful day and his knowledge of the sights and culture beats any guide book.Prior to our visit, Jamie emailed me to ask if there was anything specific we wanted to see. Bruce Lee being my son's hero was our only request, so Jamie incorporated a visit to the Bruce Lee exhibition which was excellent. The local market was also a fascinating experience and likewise the temple and other famous landmarks were all amazing. One of the benefits of using a guide is that you don't have to think about how you get to places, you just follow and hopping on and off the MTR is a breeze.Jamie is great company and has a good sense of humour, so it felt like we had spent the day with a friend. He also took the time after the tour to email me lots of useful info on other places to visit during our stay.In summary, we had a great day and it was good value for money. I would certainly recommend using the services of Jamie if you are looking for a guide in Hong Kong.

Can't rate this highly enough!. We were recommended Jamie by a friend, and he was right! Jamie's tours are fantastic.His in-depth and insightful knowledge about Hong Kong is brilliant. He took us through the wet meat markets, side streets, we went up to the peak, and he took us to a better vantage point for photographs, then down to the old Mandarin Hotel, through the fancy fashion shops, past marks and Spencer's!!!!! and then up the travelator to the European restaurants and bars.We worth the money, and we can not recommend Jamie highly enough!

shipscontainersplanes!!. Thank goodness we booked with Jamie at the start of our stay in Hong Kong. We learnt so much, did so much and he zoomed in on what we were after. We learnt the rail system giving us confidence to continue using it the next two days and Jamie giving us information and directions for further attractions the next day. So much appreciated. His knowledge of Hong Kong was fantastic and very interesting. The four of us highly recommend J3 Private Tours. Thanks Jamie.

Great Introduction to Hong Kong. Our first full day in Hong Kong we took a tour with Jaime. It was an excellent tour that hit all the highlights as well as giving us insight into the city that we would have never discovered on our own. We visited a shrine, changed money and walked around Chung King mansion, Stopped at the Peninsula hotel, rode the star ferry, visited the peak and so much more. We learned a lot about Hong Kong history, culture, the people, the food, and so much more. A truly wonderful introduction to a truly wonderful city by a truly wonderful guide. My wife and I both highly recommend J3 Private tours. With Jaime you will not go wrong.

Amazing tour a must to do. Thanks for providing a easy and amazing tour. Jamie is friendly ,courteous and punctual which makes for a good start. Then his knowledge of Hong Kong will amaze you, to the small details of the buildings around you to the back market streets that you would not experience otherwise. If you want to learn the rail system in easy steps the Jamie is the one. Our tour with Jamie left us with a good knowledge of Hong Kong to navigate ourselves for the rest of our holiday.THIS IS A MUST,YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED.

The highlight of my Hong Kong trip!. Jamie's tour was without a doubt the highlight of my Hong Kong trip! I actually wish that I could have spent my whole trip on one of his tours. I heard about Jamie's tours through trip advisor and am so glad that I did - it really is easy to see how he has won awards for his tours! Jamie is full of knowledge and shares information that you just wouldn't get on a bus tour. He is also super friendly and gave me advice on what to see during the rest of my trip prior to the tour which was much appreciated (his website is also full of handy tips). I really loved that I could choose the places that I wanted to go to and loved seeing places that were a little off the normal tourist path. I enjoyed my tour so much that the time just flew by, yet nothing on the tour felt rushed and I could spend as little or as long as I wanted at places. You will not regret booking one of Jamie's tours and I would definantly do it again should I visit Hong Kong again. Thanks Jamie!

Visiting Kowloon and Hong Kong through Jamie's eyes. Thanks for this wonderful experience. Loved the Nunnery, although it was raining, it was still amazing, even got to see a nun! Then on to the Buda Temple, happy that we all left there "lucky"! Jamie took us to an amazing restaurant for lunch, and then took the ferry to Hong Kong Island where we went up to the Peak. What a breathtaking view! Can't wait to see all those pictures.Jamie is a wealth of information and really shows you a different way to visit Hong Kong.We highly recommend Jamie, you will not be disappointed, we weren't.René and Norma from Montreal/St. Maarten.

Fantastic Tour!. Could not have asked for a better guide to Hong Kong. It is not just the sights that he shows you (including the breathtaking walk at the top of the Peaks where incredibly we seemed to be by ourselves for a good part part of the walk!); it is the insights into what it is like to live in this exciting city that he conveys so well thanks in great part to his 30 plus years of living in HK. All this conveyed with a wonderfully dry sense of humor which only an Englishman can provide. My 19 year old son who is at the best of times hard to impress was bowled over and asked whether we could have another tour with him the next day (which we would have done if only we had an extra day in HK!). Highly recommended!

Great spontaneous tour and guide!. True to form, with less than 24 hours' notice my colleague and I decided to go to Hong Kong on a Saturday and found Jamie's top rating on this site very impressive. He is all that and more in person! We left the destinations up to him, finding him a quick study of what we would enjoy. It was great...more like spending the day with a familiar friend who loves showing off his worldclass hometown. Jamie was meant to be a tour guide. I recommended him to a well-traveled colleague for the very next weekend and she was equally as pleased with his all-day tour. Jamie, can we take you with us everywhere we go in the future??

Jamie Knows His Stuff!. We were lucky enough to get Jamie at very short notice and our tour with him was one of the highlights of our trip to Hong Kong.As his bio says, Jamie has lived in Hong Kong for a long time. More importantly he keeps himself informed of all of the comings and goings in Hong Kong and was happy to answer any question we could think of.A good tip is to let him know where you are thinking of going on the rest of your trip because he has plenty of tips that will make your time more enjoyable because he has either saved you money or saved you from having to queue for hours.For anyone considering going to Hong Kong (even those that might have been there before) make sure that you book a tour with Jamie early in your stay.

Fabulous Hong Kong Tour!. A business colleague and I spent a fabulous day touring with Jamie. I would highly recommend his 8 hour tour. He is knowledgable, fun, professional, prompt, and all of those other adjectives too! Great day...well worth the money. I would highly recommend Jamie to any visitor to Hong Kong.

Outstanding tour guide for Hong Kong!. We booked a one day tour with Jamie for shortly after we arrived in HK for a 2 week stay, to get a feel for the place. From the first contact, we found his services to be prompt, professional and most of all friendly. The actual tour itself was outstanding - we covered so much ground seeing various tourist attractions, as well as Jamie assisting us with understanding the public transport system, answering our numerous queries and sharing humorous stories and interesting facts from his 30 years in Hong Kong. He was so helpful and reassured us we could contact him again at any time during our stay, with queries. Jamie is a very skilled and knowledgeable tour guide for Hong Kong, and we are glad we decided to book his services (after seeing other reviews on Trip Advisor). We could not recommend Jamie more!!

Fantastic Day Tour. We arrived in Hong Kong at 7am from London and had a connecting flight back to Australia that night. Jamie met us at the airport and took us on an eight hour day tour of Hong Kong. He showed us the highlights of the city accompanied by very knowledgable information about the history, lifestyle and culture in Hong Kong.
