We had an excellent day and would highly recommend Jamie to anyone looking to do private touring in Hong Kong.

A great introduction to Hong Kong. We only had a few days in Hong Kong, so touring with Jamie the first day was great. He showed us all the big sights as well as anything we were interested in and in a very personal and knowing way as he has lived in Hong Kong for more than 30 years. He could answer all our questions and gave us great ideas for what to the rest of our time there. As soon as he was back home from our tour he sent us descriptions, routes etc for our next adventures and we knew we could contact him if we needed more. We can certainly recommend Jamie.

The best tour guide ever!. We were in Hong Kong during the last days of June. We booked 3days tour with Jaimie and we had such a great time. Jaimie is a professional tour guide with a lot of experience and knowledge. He showed us a lot of beautiful places and told very interesting things about people, life and culture in Hong Kong. When we finished visiting with Jaimie he gave us a plan of places where we can go or where we can spent our free time. He was so helpful.We are recommended tour with him.Thank you Jaimie to make our trip so unforgettable.

Recommended A++. Touring with Jamie allowed us to see things we never would've done on our own. He was very punctual meeting us at our hotel and giving us a fantastic insight into Hong Kong. I would recommend Jamie to anyone: business or pleasure traveller. You are able to customise your experience to desires, time limitations and the weather. We ended up having a very wet day but it only added to the experience with Jamie. :) Thanks

Great tour !. My wife and I visited HK for the first time in March and took an evening tour with Jamie. He is very knowledge of the city and really gives you a feeling that your "a local". Also, his "inside" knowledge of the Peak is worth the tour! If you are visiting HK for the first time touring with Jamie is a must! He is best.

Repeat customer. Hong Kong isn't very hard to get around especially if you stick to the MTR and taxis.  Despite that, getting around anywhere new takes effort. Last year my boyfriend and I visited and decided to hire Jamie for a day so we could  take a day off from organizing and figuring everything out ourselves.  It was great to have someone answer questions and give us guidance that would help us with our plans for the rest of the stay.  We also just enjoyed getting to know Jamie. He was easy to spend the day with and it almost felt like we had rediscovered a long lost friend who lived in town and happened to be a professional tour guide.Just last week I was back in HK for a week with a friend. We spent two days on tour with Jamie.  We probably could have managed to see everything on our list on our own (especially with the help of sites like this one) but after having such a good experience last year I knew I’d feel like I was missing something if I didn’t spend part of the trip touring with Jamie. Plus, I knew we could accomplish a lot more in a day with him in charge. And since we were in town an entire week with plenty of time to do the usual things, I asked Jamie to take us to some places a bit more remote and more difficult to get to.  Despite some really wet weather, we had a great time.One last thing to mention... booking Jamie is really, really easy. You look at his website, pick a day/time he’s open and then just email him. He gets back to you right away with all the info you need and you set a meeting place and time. You don’t even have to come up with an itinerary ahead of time if you don’t want to. Last year I was on the fence regarding booking a private tour as to some extent it just seemed like one more thing I had to organize before the trip. Obviously, based on the review above, I’m really happy I did but I also appreciated that the booking process was easy and the person I was corresponding with was going to be the person I toured with in Hong Kong.

Top notch Hong Kong tour, just perfect!!. Don´t look anymore for a tour, do yourself a favor and book with Jamie! His private tour is just perfect from the very beginning when you e-mail scheduling the tour ´till the end. I recommend you take the tour as early as you can during your stay in Hong Kong.Our tour begun at 9 AM when he met us at the hotel and ended 8 hours later. With him we learn how to use public transportation, covered main tourist landmarks and got knowledge about cantonese culture. With him we visited the following places: Wanchai Market, St John´s Cathedral, HSBC Bank, Chi Lin Nunnery, Nan Lian Garden, Din Tai Fung restaurant, Nathan Road, Peninsula Hotel, Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple and Apple Store. The restaurant chosen by Jamie is Tripadvisor´s #4; the food was spetacular!After the tour he sent around ten e-mails suggesting other places to visit and how to get there. I went on my own to the following places and had no difficulties after learning how to use transportation system with him: Avenue of Stars, Big Buddha, Stanley Market, Ladies Market, and Repulse Bay.We had a wonderful day with Jamie! I was very fortunate to fnd a private guide like him and can´t recommend Jamie highly enough!!! 8:-)

2 1/2 days in Hong Kong with Jamie. We had laid out a bucket list of things we wanted to see and do while in Hong Kong. Besides hitting all the top 10 attractions, we wanted to see the 'real' Hong Kong. Jamie was very accommodating and we got a richer perspective on the city than had we tried to see it on our own.We NEVER would have found some of the places we visited, We explored for two full days and then an evening tour of the night markets. Afterwards, we were confident enough (with Jamie's email guidance) to venture into other areas on our own.Bottom line, touring with Jamie was enriching and saved us a TON of time floundering on our own.

Fantastic Day in Hong Kong!. We were a group of four with only one day to spend in Hong Kong. Jamie provided us with a fantastic introduction to the city in that short amount of time. Within the course of eight hours, we visited the Chi Lin Buddhist nunnery, the Wong Tai Sin temple, some of the city’s most famous hotels, crossed the harbor, walked on the Peak, and strolled past some of the city’s historic colonial buildings. What’s more, we did all of that using public transportation! Overall it was an excellent and informative day out with a knowledgeable and friendly guide. Thank you!

Hong Kong in 6 hours. Hello everyone, Jamie was my tour guide for a whirlwind 5 hour tour of Hong Kong during a long layover; on my way to Kota Kinabala. Absolutely wonderful and more than I expected!!! I am a solo traveler and was hesitant to venture out alone; Jamie was the perfect guide. Our tour started at 7am, and Jamie was promptly waiting for me ahead of schedule in the hotel lobby. We took public transportation everywhere and Jamie was very conscious of the time so I would not be late getting back to the hotel so I would not miss my afternoon flight. We visited a large temple; Jamie was very knowledgeable (I even had time to purchase a few good luck charms). We went to the Peak, and despite a cloudy day, we managed to get in some very good views; with Jamie's expert knowledge of where to be and when. I highly recommend Jamie for anyone travelling to Hong Kong. I only wish I could have stayed longer. Thank you Jamie!!

"Wow, what a fantastic day we had with our guide Jamie". My sister and I visited Hong Kong for the first time in early April 2013. We first emailed Jamie to let him know what we were interested in seeing while in Honk Kong. Jamie met us at our hotel on the morning of our tour, very prompt he was and away we went. We had already purchased our Octopus card the day before (you must get one of these if you intend to explore Hong Kong by yourself. Use it for all the public transport ,ferry, bus and trains). From the very begining we felt very comforable with Jamie and he sure does know how to put a tour together. We hopped from bus to ferry to train on our day tour and that certainly introduced us to the public transport system in Hong Kong. We visited many points of interest during our tour, Jamie just seemed to know the places we would be interested in. We can not praise Jamie enough, he went above and beyond what we expected. Even after our tour ended Jamie emailed us other information on places that we may like to visit while in Hong Kong. How great was he to do that. We would recommend Jamie's tours to anyone who is going to Hong for the first time and also to those that have been before and would like a personalised tour with a great guide. We intend to visit Hong Kong again and will again book a tour with our friend Jamie. Thanks heaps Jamie.

Great tour guide. This was a great choice I got to see amazing views and even things that I didnt know i wanted to see. This was by far the best part of my trip to Hong Kong. I went alone and had no worries and Jamie even gave me tips to avoid scams. Jamie went even further than just being a tour guide once my tour was over there were things i wanted to do the rest of my trip and Jamie sent me step by step guides to go explore on my own. That was amazing!!! Jamie responded to my emails very quickly and with all the information that i needed for the tour and after the tour. My main goal was to see the the skyline but it was very foggy Jamie took the risk and it paid off his spot at the Peak was very clear and beautiful. I was very impressed and happy to get great service. I highly recommend Jamie as a tour guide to any one who wants to see HK..

What A Fun & Unique Tour. Jamie provided us one of the most unique and wonderful walking tours of Hong Kong and we can't say enough about the experience.His email correspondence was excellent prior to as well as after our tour and his knowledge and local experience are not to be missed.We did an evening tour, where he was on time picking us up from our hotel. He help us get an Octopus (transit) pass and for exactly the right amount for our 3 day stay and off we went on our adventure.The only thing we told Jamie in advance was no shopping and he certainly listened. We saw so many places that we never expected to see, all by foot or public transportation. We left the itinerary up to him and were not disappointed. We did get to visit the Peak and be sure to include this on any tour. Outstanding views and worth the walk.Well done Jamie & Thank you again.

Jamie Provides Real Insight to Hong Kong. Many tour guides take you to the popular sites and are knowledgable about history. Jamie goes beyond that to provide you with real insight into the Hong Kong people, and lifestyle. He is a great choice for English speaking tourists. He shows up right on time and is a fabulous communicator by email before and after the visit. There were a few times we would have liked to move a little faster and packed more into our 2 days, but all in all we were very pleased.

Jamie's the best. I did a private evening tour with Jamie and saw wonderful sites that I would never have ventured into alone. We also experienced the skyline on a perfectly clear evening. How Jamie arranged that is still a mystery. Wonderful tour guide who really knows the ins and outs of HK.

Outstanding Foot Fall. Jamie gave a walking tour that is unforgettable. Just Outstanding! I cant say enough kind words to express my delight over this walking tour. I'm 70 years old and my days of glory are all but memory's now but Jamie understood my situation and kept a slow but steady pace that was comfortable. We defiantly had a Mystery Tour going to places that I would have never though of but I enjoyed every minuet. Jamie's ability to answer questions that directed attention off of the track we were on was remarkable. Example, we were overlooking Lockhart Rd. and instead of staying on the subject I turn and asked questions about specific business, and with out skipping a beat Jamie answered the questions and added useful information. I would highly recommend that if your in Hong Kong for a while contact Jamie and sign up for a day trip. You will not regret it.

the perfect day. As 4 of us were going to be in hong kong for a few days, we booked a tour with Jamie via email. From the first email, through many queries till the day we met he was available and responded to our queries. We independently went through his blog for ideas of what we'd like to do/or not! that was very helpful. I would recommend that all visitors go through his articles.On the day of the tour he was on time and took into consideration our interests and planned his tour around that. We had 8 hours of going around Hong kong. We travelled by foot, on the tram, on the train by cab and ferry !!!! we saw many many sights in Hong kong and Kowloon as well. along the way we had an enjoyable lunch at the peak as well. The best part was the walk to "jamies spot" at victorias peak where we got great photos of Hong Kong as it was a bright and suny day. All along jamie kept us interested and amused with information and anecdotes about Hong Kong and its culture. I was a good tired at the end of the day and had a good feel for how to get around hong kong by the end of the tour. After the tour Jamie continued to assist us by emailing us information for places we wanted to go to on our own (ladies market etc) and his directions were perfect. Jamie is a warm, friendly, kind trustworthy and friendly person. i would recommend him without any reservations.

One Day Tour. Jamie met us at our hotel promptly on the scheduled morning. After introductions we wasted no time in beginning the tour. Jamie provided great commentary and answered all of our questions. He was very accommodating to our requests during the tour and kept us entertained even though bad weather limited our tour to some extent. The evening after our tour Jamie sent us several emails giving us step by step details on how to see many of the sites we missed during our tour.Our group included 4 adults and two college juniors and we would highly recommend Jamie.

Great one day intro to Hong Kong. We took a one day tour with Jamie when we arrived in Hong Kong for the first time. We had an absolutely super day and saw an amazing amount which we would never have got round on our own. We only had three days in Hong Kong and we did more in one day with Jamie than we did in the following two. The tour is not the cheapest thing you might do but is definitely worth it. We saw a lot and learnt a huge amount on our day out with Jamie. I would recommend this tour!

You will thank yourself for booking Jamie.. Four of us spent a very full day with Jamie while on an Oceania cruise. He introduced us to a wide variety of Hong Kong highlights as we hopped on and off of buses, trains, ferries, and cabs traveling from the dock to mountaintop and one side of Hong Kong to another. Jamie's tour introduced us to some of the sub-culture of the city. We learned a lot but had great fun. Jamie has quite a sense of humor, and his own perspective on the city made the day very enjoyable. You will finish the day with a good overview of Hong Kong and likely will pat yourself on the back for booking a tour with Jamie. I know we did.

An ideal introduction to Hong Kong. My friends, husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our 8 hour tour with Jamie. The tour was relaxed and extremely informative. Thanks to Jamie we covered the "must-do" sights quickly and in doing so we learnt how to use the various transport systems which set us up for the rest of our stay. Jamie also provided us with detailed directions to other attractions after our tour. There is so much to see and do in Hong Kong, don't waste time, start your holiday with a J3 private tour.

Great resource for a first timer. If you are coming from the States and have never been to Hong Kong before, take one day to (semi) recover from the long trip, and then book the 8 hour J3 Tour the next. Jamie will begin by introducing you to the city's very efficient and inexpensive public transportation system. Easy to navigate after his tutorial, not so simple if you had to figure it out on your own. You will then accompany Jamie by foot, subway, tram, bus, and/or ferry to sites you have selected, ones he thinks you would enjoy, or some combination of the two. We chose to leave our itinerary entirely in his hands and we were not disappointed - a nice combination of the places every tourist visits and a few off the beaten track locations that westerners rarely see. Jamie is an engaging and affable host. He has a deep love and knowledge of Hong Kong, but as a non-native ( he's Welsh and came to Hong Kong as a young man/teenager ), he has a somewhat detached outsiders view of Hong Kong and Chinese culture in general that makes for some interesting perspectives. After our tour was over, Jamie sent us a dozen e-mails containing very detailed instructions regarding attractions and restaurants we had inquired about or ones he thought would be of interest to us. Using this information and our new found knowledge of public transportation, we were well equipped to explore other parts of the city on our own over the next four days. The all day J3 Tour is expensive compared to a standard couch tour, but it is a great introduction to one of the world's most complex and fascinating cities.

Full day tour of Hong Kong. My husband and I were on a Princess tour. We had one day to spend in Hong Kong. Jamie had the entire day planned and we missed nothing. We experienced every type of transportation available and blended in with the locals. He was extremely informative and made his tour one of the highlights of our vacation.

Relaxing tour of Hong Kong area. We had just come off an extensive and exhausting tour of China when we hooked up with Jamie. We had started in Beijing and 3 weeks later landed in Hong Kong. Jamie recognized that we needed a tour that was both informative and relaxing. We ended up going out of the city to Chi Lin Nunnery and Nan Liam Gardens. We also went to a very interesting temple area that included several Chinese religions. Our tour was thoughtfully adjusted to meet our interests as well as our physical needs-which was to go slow and be relaxed. Thank you Jamie. We had a great time with you. Jo Ann and Dick

Mark and James in HK. I initially found Jamie on trip advisor and was impressed by his outstanding reviews. I found our email conversation prior to the tour very reassuring as he seemed to take a genuine interest into customizing the tour for us(best mates in our late twenties). Jamie used the excellent public transport system as part of the tour which gave us a good grounding for the rest of our holiday. His local knowledge and insight is invaluable and I would recommend anyone of various ages and fitness levels to start there holiday with Jamie. Highlights for the tour for me were: Temple, underground train system and SOHO/Lan Kai Fong. Thanks Jamie, hope to keep in touch next visit. Kind Regards Mark and James

You deserve better in Hong Kong. where should i start? I took this tour way back and it seems like a dream come true right at the start. during booking, jamie got back to me very quickly and was very prompt in meeting me and my partner at our hotel. he was very pleasant and friendly. the reviews seem to suggest that we will all have a great time with him. True, we saved a lot of time (as we may take more time figuring how to go around), but the tour seems to be too expensive for the value he provides. As the tour goes, i started wondering if the tour was worth the money as the attractions he showed me could have been easily visited by ourselves and i wonder if his interpretation as well as rude pokes at the locals' dressing was worth couple of hundreds (in usd). I understand it may be his style of humour but I would have expect a greater appreciation and acceptance of the locals since he has been in hk for many years and he claims to like it. What tipped us over was that the food selection was lousy, we were brought to a old chinese dingy restauant in Kowloon at our request for "local food". But it turned out to be orders of westernized chinese food like "sweet and sour pork", the likes. Being great foodies and extremely into chinese cuisine, it was miserable for us as the cooking was clearly catered to the western palate and was hardly authenic cantonese cuisine. I wish he can listen to all these feedback and more effort can be put into selection of food .it seems to be a recurring complain if you see read his reviews. What he thinks is hk food may not be hk. so if you are into food, you may want to skip his tours. (By the way, he recommends Din Tai Fung, but it is a taiwanese place, not hk! we had awesome soup dumplings from the original Din Tai Fung when we visited Taiwan previously. ) If you want to claim yourself to be a local guide for 30+ years, you got to be recommending the hk stuff, isnt it?

Hong Kong was a pleasure, thanks to Jamie. Hong Kong can be dizzying. We took two 5-6 hour tours with Jamie Lloyd, one during the day alnd one in the evening, and he was the best possible guide for us. He’s extremely knowledgeable, and is great fun to spend a day with. Jamie sets a good pace; we were able to cover a lot of ground, but did so at a comfortable pace. His tours are flexible; when we were suddenly in need of a snack he switched gears and took us to a lovely place for a bite. And even though we went to some of the usual sites—Temple Street Night Market, the Peak—Jamie’s knowledge of the ins and outs of Hong Kong meant that we took remote paths or went at slightly off times, avoiding the crowds. He also took us to beautiful gardens and sites, such as Nan Lian Garden and Chi Lin Nunnery, which are not often noted in guidebooks. He gave us in-depth information about each site we visited—the history, the culture, and his own anecdotes. He was always able to measure just how much we could absorb. Most importantly, he emailed us great tips andn amazingly detailed instructions (including photographs) for travelling to places on our own. My husband and I travel quite a bit, and Jamie Lloyd’s knowledge, convivial nature and love of Hong Kong make him an exemplary guide.

How to keep from getting lost in Hong Kong. My friend and I recently arrived in Hong Kong for a four day stay. My friend had researched Trip Advisor in July and found Jamie's tour and based on reviews booked him right then. What a great decision! He not only shared his extensive knowledge of Hong Kong with us, he taught us how to use the Metro, bus, trolley, and ferry so we could get around by ourselves. He took us all around and told us what would be the best use of our time based on our requirements. He took us to the largest temple in HK and explained all of the many rituals going on there. It was really exciting knowing just what people were doing and why - fortune sticks etc. He packed so much into the time we had with him and we never had to "catch up" as we so often had to do with our tour guides on excursions on our cruise. He answered all of our questions and had many interesting antecdotes to share. On the way to one of our stops Jamie introduced us to "egg waffles" which were amazing and the best treat I had in HK. He also was able to tell us where to find Western toilets (a real plus for us). I would highly recommend Jamie to anyone who will be spending time in HK, he is definately worth it and made our trip to HK incredible. I'd rate him a ten if were available!!!..0..

An entertaining informative tour that even the kids will enjoy!. We had a great private tour with Jamie! He was full of information that he delivered in a funny and informative way. I felt like we really got to know Hong Kong through his eyes. He answered all our questions and made us understand how people live here. We brought along 3 kids ages 7,11&15 and they all thoroughly enjoyed the tour. He even made visiting the temple fun for the kids! I love how Jamie took us on the tour via the public transportation system. That is really the way to go. He taught us how to navigate it and we felt comfortable taking the train ourselves afterwards. We also rode on the bus and the ferry. We booked a 5 hour tour and by the end, we were all exhausted from all the walking, especially the younger kids. I had to change our tour time and length several times before our appointed date and Jamie was very flexible and easy with the changes. He was also flexible with the tour as we went along. This was my only complaint- during the middle of our tour, I realized lunch is not factored in the tour and my kids were starving. Jamie led us to a pizza shop near the stock exchange and it was actually pretty good. However, I would have appreciated eating some pork buns or other authentic Cantonese food. He made up for it though when he showed us the best egg custard bakery in Hong Kong island. Yummy!We asked about tour guide prices through the hotel and apparently Jamie's is the going rate. But not sure who we would have gotten through the hotel. I am so glad we chose Jamie! He has a great personality and talks to you like an old friend. Since we were only in Hong Kong for 3 days, we really appreciated the private tour. Thank you so much Jamie!!

Highlight of our trip..made all things possible. My friend and I arrived in Hong Kong following a trip to Japan plus a 14-day Asian cruise which ended in HK. Eight months prior to our arrival, I searched Trip Advisor about tours in HK and after I read 10 reviews for Jamie's tour, I booked our spot immediately...especially after reading that one couple wanted him for a full day tour with Jamie and had to settle for an evening tour because his day tours were all booked up by the time they contacted him. After coming from a cruise ship and 7 different group tours on shore excursions - where we usually had to run to keep up with the tour guide because unless you were in the front of the group, you couldn't hear the tour - we were looking for a different kind of tour and Jamie's tours are exactly that...very personal and designed to what YOU want to do in HK. Neither of us had been to HK before and Jamie showed us where to buy the Octopus Card that would let us ride the Metro, the bus, the cable car and the ferry. He took us to many places in HK all the while telling us about the history and the culture. Jamie's been to these sights many times and has an "in" with the people who work there so you get to go to places not everyone else does. While we were at the largest temple in HK, he made sure we got to observe and participate in all the rituals (learning about the fortune sticks was fun). He has a wealth of information about HK; when we mentioned at the beginning that we prefer Western toilets (no holes in the ground) he told us where to find them (hotels and malls) and took us to one halfway through our tour. By the end of our tour, we had been on the Metro, the ferry, the bus and a cable car and felt we could navigate them and would be able to go anywhere during the rest of our time in HK without Jamie...but that's not all. When Jamie got home that night, he emailed me exact directions to everything we had wanted to see (including photos) - 10 different destinations in all. I took my iPad with me the next day when we took the Metro, changed trains, got off and went to the street, hailed a cab and showed the cab driver - who did not speak English - my iPad with the photo Jamie had emailed of the Chinese street sign outside the Jade Market and he was able to take us straight there...no miscommunication. We saved a lot of money on cabs by taking the Metro as much as we could and using cabs or buses when there were no Metro stops near our destination. Had a backpack so it was easy to carry my iPad around to refer to when we were using Jamie's directions (he should write a book). By the end of Day 3, we were zipping around with our Octopus cards like HK natives. They say, "Give a man a fish and he eats for a day; teach a man to fish and he eats for a lifetime." In addition to taking us to some amazing sights and sharing funny stories, Jamie taught us to fish (aka use the public transportation around HK) and now I can find my way easily in what used to be a strange city. He's the best!

Everything you need to know +. Jamie seems to know every niche and corner of this city. Ask him the most obscure fact, for sure he has the answer!We did several tours with him, all excellent, however his value extends beyond that, since he's happy to extend his knowledge to things you might want to to do beyond those places he's taking you to.For us it was our first Hong Kong experience and Jamie set us on the path to having a very full HK agenda and even found for us some of the best food we've had in ages. Thoroughly enjoyable, great to be with and a real font of HK knowledge, use him - both you and he'll love it!

Outstanding!. I have you to thank for making my time in Hong Kong so amazing, Jamie-I can't thank you enough. I know how busy you are with just keeping up with your business details, so taking all that extra time to take/send me the photos is truly "over and beyond", as they say. It was so very, very kind of you to do it and I am just thrilled that I will have some photos to remember my Hong Kong visit by. All the pics are terrific, but I have to say, there's something special about that chicken!! Thanks again for everything, after my three month tour of South East Asia, your tour of Hong Kong was by far my favourite experience!

Jamie's city tour of Hong Kong. I recently had a city tour of Hong Kong with a friend of mine. Jamie came highly recommended to me by another friend. When I wrote to Jamie I mentioned things that were of interest to me, and Jamie did his best to incorporate the things I wanted to see into our tailor made tour. Its obvious that Jamie loves Hong Kong, and loves his job, there's not much he doesn't know about this exciting city, he is the font of all knowledge !!!!By best thing about the tour was that we had a good laugh! he is really funny, we shared the same sense of humour, as we are both from Blighty! Would recommend anyone going to Hong Kong for the first time to book a tour with Jamie.

A great way to tour of Hong Kong. Sorry for the delay, Jamie! My husband and I had a fabulous day with Jamie from J3 Tours in July last year during a stopover in Hong Kong on our way to Europe. We arrived in HK very early on a Sunday morning and arranged to meet Jamie in the foyer of our hotel to begin our walk. I had never been to HK before so everything was new for me and we both wanted a general overview as well as the ability to move around at our own pace, stopping as our need and interest required. Jamie provided all this and more with loads of interesting information. It was like visiting with a friend who had all the inside information about the city and the people. Our 4 hours stretched out to more and we learned so much more than had we just walked around aimlessly ourselves. Thank you, Jamie. We shall recommend your walking tours, and, remarkably, our youngest son is on his way to Hong Kong later this year , so expect an email.

Hong Kong Day Tour. My wife and I along with another couple travel to Hong Kong to take a cruise starting in Hong Kong and ending in Beijing. We decided to go three days early to tour Hong Kong and booked with Jamie for a full day tour and also a Hong Kong by night tour. Luckily, we chose Jamie to be our guide and he was excellent. The first day we toured the highlights from a Temple in Kowloon to the Peak on Hong Kong Island. It was a full day and he kept us moving and also led us to areas that most tourists or not aware of to get a better views of Hong Kong from the Peak, excellent. He taught us how to use the MTA system and we were able to use it to tour on our own the following day, a big timesaver. The night tour was also excellent with tours of The Peak at night and the Temple Street Night Market. I would recommend Jamie very highly, he is personable and knowledgeable.Bill C
Great Day. We had a 4 hour tour with Jamie and thoroughly enjoyed it. He was a pleasure to spend time with and his knowledge of the city was exceptional. Highly recommend.

Knowledge is key and Jamie knows how to turn it!!. We travelled to HK not fully knowing what to expect. Five UK based lads without a clue on what we should look out for. But a little research on trip advisor and an informed choice in asking J3 tours for advice, proved invaluable. We arranged a tour with Jamie during the day and hit massively lucky with the turn of the Hong Kong spring, beautiful. A quick chat and Jamie picked up that we were in his hands and interpreted our comments on what we thought we would like perfectly. Views, local travel and local eateries thrown in with a touch of questions a plenty and answers soundly given. A great day and valued memories, thanks Jamie, much appreciated.

Started with A guide ended with A friend.. Myself and four friends were visiting Hong Kong for the first time .After checking on trip advisor Jamie at j3 tours stood out as the top walking tour guide.We arranged for the five of us to meet Jamie for a four hour tour with no set agenda ,Jamie arrived promply at 10 oclock as arranged (one of our party had unfortunately succumed to the delights of lan kwai fong the previous night and could not make the 10am start).Jamie ever the gentleman understood the situation and quite sincereley insisted on us contacting our friend during the course of the tour to arrange for him to meet up with us ,so as not to miss out on the best bits of HK.The tour started with us purchasing a octopus card (essential) a trip up the peak via bus with a return trip on the tram ,a short hop on a trolley bus visit to the local fruit veg market , a very delicious custard tart.A trip across to kowloon on the star ferry with numerous photos taken a long the way then lunch at a restaurant in kowloon .Jamies tour set us up for the rest of our stay ,filled us with the confidence to use numerous modes of public transport as previously mentioned are friend did eventually arrive for the remainder of the tour with Jamie very generously dedicating an extra four hours on to the time we had organised .Top man Top Place .Jamie contacted us regularly through out are stay via email with information maps & photos on the sites we were going to visit (big budha temple market etc ).

Couldn't Ask For More. My wife and I had just completed a 33 day cruise from Australia through Indonesia and Vietnam. To say the least by the time we hit Hong Kong we had seen the sights and heard the stories.Having never been to Hong Kong though we couldn't simply get off the ship and onto an airplane. No way. We had to see Hong Kong. After checking prior reviews on Tripadvisr and reviewing his website we selected Jamie Lloyd for our introduction to Hong Kong.We could not have been more pleased. Jamie showed us the highlights, gave us the history and brought the city to life for us. He is a pleasure with which to spend a day and we would highly recommend him to anyone wanting to get up close and personal with the city.

Excellent introduction to Hong Kong!. We highly recommend Jamie's private tour of HK. We enjoyed a fast-paced walking tour that was well planned. Jamie is quite interestong and you are certain to enjoy your own tour as well.

The best layover ever -- 7 exciting hours!. I had a choice of a two hour layover in Hong Kong or 9 hours... I took the longer layover as I was determined to see some of Hong Kong besides the airport and booked Jamie. It was a great decision!. Jamie met my husband and I at the airport and we were off on Hong Kong's very efficient public transportation. Jamie was very personable, informative and helped us make great use of our limited time. We throughly enjoyed every minute, the sights were amazing and I know that we would have never been able to find some of the wonderful locations that Jaime shared with us by ourselves.Worth every penny. Created some very fond memories.

Great fun during chinese new year. It was the 3rd day of chinese new year so all major attractions were very busy with queues up up to 3 hours for the peak. Jamie knows not only a way to bypass the queues and get up the peak really fast, but also showed a better place than the visitor centre with stunning views of Hong Kong harbour. After that we wondered through Wan Chai and get a taste of a neighbourhood Hong Kong market. After that it was the Pak Tai temple. Another little diamond of the beaten track. Jamie's inside knowledge of the chinese culture was a blast and really put things in perspective. The peninsula hotel was great as well. The cherry on the cake was the Wong Tai Sin temple in Kowloon. Since it was chinese new year the place was packed. Jamie got us in pretty easely and we were in the middle of a crowd of chinese worshippers trying to get the gods on their sides. Thanks to Jamie it's now clear to me that tying the knot to Confucius the wrong way, you might not end up with the spouse of your dreams! In short: the 7 hrs went way to fast!

Good Fun. Thanks Jamie we had a great day. My wife, you and i wandering around HK looking at Red Bridges (whatever you say!!), funny signs, bullet holes, giant teddy bears, invisible nuns, praying chinese people and drinking very large beers. What more could one ask for. We had a ball.

Fantastic stuff. I couldn't recommend this tour enough. Jamie gave me a tour of Hong Kong on a very wet and miserable afternoon in November, yet despite the inclement weather, he made the day fly by. The best thing about Jamie's knowledge of Hong Kong is how extensive and personalised it is. The observations, recommendations and facts aren't out of a guide book or second hand, they're from personal experience and exploration. It's rare to meet someone who takes so much pride in their work and it;s clear from the tour that Jamie loves Hong Kong. Because of the fog we couldn't do a few of the more 'obvious' attractions but because of his extensive knowledge, the places we did go were just as, if not more fascinating. Worth every penny

Fascinating night tour. My husband and I booked Jamie for a night tour during our 2 day stay in HK. We had hoped to book him for a day tour for the earlier part of our stay in order to get a good overview of the city, but he is so booked up, he could only squeeze us in for a night tour the evening before we left. Prior to our arrival in Hong Kong, he was kind enough to email us information on some of the more popular sights and extremely accurate and detailed instructions on how to take public transportation (HK has an excellent and clean public transport system) to get to these locations. He even includes pictures of subway exits and landmarks to use in navigating your way around! Using his excellent instructions as our guide, we spent our first day exploring the city on our own. He met up with us as planned on the second night. He gave us a tour that truly gave us a real feel for the many facets that make Hong Kong such an interesting city. We went to places from the historic and elegant Peninsula Hotel to the somewhat less elegant and infamous Chunking Mansion - which we might have never dared ventured to on our own. We had a great and fun time and covered a lot of ground in the few hours we spent with Jamie. Myadvice to you is to book him as early a possible if you can, or else you may miss out!

Night Tour of Hong Kong. My family and I had a wonderful tour of Hong Kong at night with Jaime. He was very patient with the kids and it was great being able to customize our tour to fit our needs and interest. He was very knowledgable and was able to answer our questions. As it was our first day in Hong Kong, we were very thankful that he spent time showing us how to navigate the city. It helped us for the remainder of our tour. We would have never been able to see all the things on our own and deal with our two small children. I think he makes a great tour guide!

Jamie of J3 Tours - The best tour guide in Hong Kong!!. I had a daunting task of planning a trip for our family of 12 to Hong Kong over Christmas/New Years. We were a group of 5 parents, and 7 'young adults', ages 21 - 27. Different ages and different interests. I was completely overwhelmed with the amount of things there were to do and see in Hong Kong and with my complete lack of knowledge of HK and the idea of planning for such a large, diverse group! I was very lucky to find Jamie from J3 tours and he helped make the whole thing doableHe worked with me via email to figure out what we all should see an do. Unfortunately Jamie only had one day available for us but he coordinated with another tour guide we had and made it all work. He provided me with so much information and advice before our trip that by the time we got there everything just fell into place. He made the brilliant recommendation to buy an Octopus Card for everyone. A simple suggestion from him made moving 12 people through a very busy Hong Kong and Kowloon a breeze. If he hadn't given me this very simple suggestions we would have had a very different experience of Hong Kong. But Jamie had many suggestions for me while I was planning the trip. And he sent me very detailed information on many of Hong Kong's attractions and sites - like mini travel guides - including step-by-step directions with photos, on how to use the Public Transit to get to each of these places. Wow! So, we only were going to have Jamie for one day, but he provided me with enough information and precise directions for a month! Once we used the Hong Kong transit system once, we were very good at getting around Hong Kong on our own! Thanks to Jamie's pre-trip information and planning!So, I was very concerned about how I was going to plan for 12 people of different ages and interests. But once I found Jamie, my planning became much easier and I was confident we were going to have a great trip!When we got to Hong Kong and met Jamie I was amazed again. As you can imagine moving 12 people through a crowded metro system and keeping the interest of everyone over 8 hours is a big task!Jamie did not disappoint. Everyone was mesmerized with the places we saw and Jamies's vast knowledge. He divide his time very well, almost seamlessly between the 12 of us as we travelled from one site to another. He could answer any and all questions. He was extremely knowledgable on everything we asked, whether past or present culture, religion, history, politics. Oh, and he had a great sense of humour. It was like spending a day with a very knowledgable good friend. The adults and the 20 somethings all related to Jamie and all had a great day.Although we actually only spent one day with Jamie, he helped me plan our trip before and after we met him. I used his detailed instructions for getting around HK for the rest of the week. We took his suggestions for restaurants and night life for the kids'. Obviously, I can't say enough about Jamie. He was invaluable in planning our entire trip. The day we spent with him was incredible. He made our trip memorable.Thank you Jamie!

Excellent!. We had a wonderful day with Jamie in Hong Kong this January. There were 10 of us in our group, and he kept us all together, informed and entertained. His knowledge of HK is impressive, he answered any questions we had and explained so much. We so saw soo much more than we would on our own, plus we had the history and the context of everything explained. He even emailed us helpful directions and tips for a trip we were doing ourselves the next day.Would highly recommend Jamie's Tours. Thanks for a great day.

A very satisfactory experience with a private tour guide. From the moment I contacted Jamie via emails I got the impression I was dealing with a very responsible and experienced person. Jamie was full of advices about hotels to book in HK and things to do and visit. When my wife and I actually took the 8 hour tour with him, we were very much impressed by his knowledge of HK and his way of communicating it to us. We left to Jamie to tailor the tour for us. We only told him that we were not interested in spending time in shopping but rather to go off the beaten tracks. That's where he took us:MTR to Diamond HillNan Lian GardenChi Lin NunnerySik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin TempleMTR to TSTNathan RoadPeninsula Hotel1881 HeritageStarbucks stop for a coffeeStar FerryBus to Repulse BayRepulse Bay beach + Lifeguards ClubhouseTaxi to the PeakPeak Tower - very cloudyTaxi to the HotelTime went by very fast and at the end of the tour we did not feel any tired, as we were afraid when we booked the tour. The conversation with Jamie was always very interesting as he gave us lots of information about different aspects of the local culture and people of HK.Again, overall a very satisfactory experience. Very well done Jamie.

Excelent in all aspects. Jaime was excelent in all aspects. He took us to places we would have never gone if it wasnt for him.Very easy guy to hang out with. Me and my wife really enjoyed his company. He is also very knowledgeble of everything Hong Kong and would answer anu questions we had.Would definetly recommend to anyone coming to HK.Thanks Jamie

A Great day in Hong Kong. We had a great day with Jamie and he took us all over Hong Kong. I had been before but did not want to be stuck on a tour where we only had little time at each place. Jamie asked us what we would like to do and then tailored the day accordingly. He even emailed us itineraries of how to get to many of the sites around the HK with step by step instructions on getting there. Having living in HK most of his life Jamie was very knew the history and could answer pretty much any question we had about the city.For his personal service and help i would recommend Jamie’s tours to anyone who would like a tailored tour of the city. We went back to some of the places he showed us which we would have never found if it was not for him.Jamie i thank you.

Amazing Day in Hong Kong!. I had an absolutely fabulous time going around Hong Kong w/ Jamie last Wednesday. He showed me far more than I would have thought possible in the 6-hr tour, and it was amazing to experience such a great city in a stress-free environment, with someone who knows all of the ins and outs of Hong Kong. Many people think they can get to know a city on their own w/ a map and some looks around the internet, but this is simply not true. It's not just about seeing a location in a city; it's about the smaller details....details you might never learn about a certain building, for example, or that 5 minutes from a major tourist spot lies a hidden gem no one else would direct you toward. Oh yea, and not to mention that to see all the sights you would on a 6-hr tour with Jamie would take you several days, and those days would be stressful and utterly miserable. Just trust me, it's an absolute no-brainer - you want to go on this tour. It's for those little details and the comfort of being around someone whose love for what he does will imbue even the most lackluster tourist with real excitement about Hong Kong. I cannot recommend Jamie highly enough; it was a true pleasure to get to know him and the great city he clearly loves. I will be doing my utmost to book myself onto his schedule next time I'm fortunate enough to be in HK.Tom Price

Hong Kong Private Guide. Jamie of J3 Private Tours Hong Kong (www.j3tourshk.com) is Great!!!. We were a family of 4 (myself and my wife along with our 29 year old son and 25 year old daughter) and hired Jamie for a full day. This was our first time in Hong Kong and we wanted to have a private guide on our first day so as to get the feel for the city. Jamie met us at our hotel at 10 AM and we were on the go until 6 PM. You could tell that he loves this city but he wasn't simply a walking chamber of commerce. When he had critical things to say, he said them. But that just added to our sense of getting a better understanding of the city.Basically, he tried to understand our interests before setting out for the day and in turn, we not only visited some of the main attractions, but also some of the unique places that we wouldn't have seen on our own. In addition, he was very personable and we were comfortable with him from the minute we met.All in all -- a great day. Highly recommended!!

Our Guiding star!! *. We visited Hong Kong on our way to a longer stay in New Zealand to meet up with family. My husband is always keen to get a true insiders view of cities or attractions so we used Tripadvisor to help with our planning. Jamies tours were very well reviewed and he was very 'on the ball' with answers to our questions on his message page. We were travelling with our 26 year old daughter and thought that Jamie could set us on the right track for our four day visit. We were right! Jamie met us as agreed in our hotel and discussed with us what we would like to do and planned a perfect tour. He introduced us to the transport system, encouraging us to but the octopus style card which we used for our stay in Hong Kong. It was great to meet Jamie and find he was born not very far from our home town and had a shared interest in our local football team! He has lived in Hong Kong for many years and educated us on the cultural aspects of Hong Kong and the people who live there. We packed so much into the four hour tour and Jamie very kindly carried on the tour way past the time we were supposed to finish as he educated us in so many ways. We say parts of Hong Kong we would never has visited and Jamie did offer to pass on other areas via my internet but it did go slighly wrong and we did not receive his message. This however did not cause any problems as we remembered his advice whoch resulted in a fabulous fun filled action packed holiday. Thank you Jamie!

A great introduction to Hong Kong. My wife and I booked Jamie for an 8 hour trip on our first day after reading various reviews on Tripadvisor as this was our first visit to the Far East. What a great decision this turned out to be. Jamie introduced us to the transport system and Octopus card which is an essential purchase for your visit. At our request he packed in as much as he could in the eight hours and followed this up on the same day with further suggestions for trips for the rest off our stay.We were in Hong Kong for six days and having Jamie on the first day was ideal as he gave us more than enough information to keep us fully occupied with trips and visits for the remainder of our stay.A big thank you JamiePaul & Valerie

Great introduction to Hong Kong. My son and I enlisted Jamie to show us around Hong Kong on day 2 of a 5 day visit. Actually, my wife was suppose to come along too but was with our daughter who was in a Hong Kong hospital having picked up food poisoning in Hanoi. When Jamie heard of what had happened he immediately offered us the option of cancelling the tour. We are glad we didn't because we were not only shown around Hong Kong but were shown how to get around Hong Kong on the excellent public transport system there. Jamie also educated us on many of the cultural aspects of the people of Hong Kong throughout the tour. We visited places of cultural significance, local food markets, and shown grand hotels and other prominent buildings with some interesting history. Jamie gave us advice on personal security travelling around Hong Kong and when and where to be extra vigilant. We always felt quite safe in Hong Kong but it helps to know where and when there are higher risks of coming across pick pockets and the like. If you want a personalised tour from someone with a good knowledge of the history and culture of Hong Kong, a good sense of humour and can show you how to get around on your own with ease, then choose Jamie. Not only did my son and I have a memorable 4 hours travelling around Hong Kong with Jamie, he also followed up with emails on how to get to other interesting places and offered to answer any questions we had during our stay in Hong Kong or provide assistance if needed. That adds up to a great service.

A Must Do !!!. Have just read the previous reviews of J3 tours and can't agree enough with all the previous positive comments. My husband, son & I were planning a 4 day stopover in Hong Kong. A few people had said not to spend so much time there as all there was to do in Hong Kong was shop, so I googled what to do and came across Jamie's tour. It was the best decision to do a tour on our first day. As he explains on his website he talked to us when we met him and then he planned an itinerary to suit our needs. We had a great (busy) day and then that night he emailed all the details of things we said we wanted to do on our remaining days, plus restaurants we might like etc. Every recommendation was spot-on ! (thanks Jamie). Our 20 year old son even said how sad it was that our friends who hadn't enjoyed Hong Kong hadn't experienced the advice of Jamie.

"HIGHLY RECOMMENDED PRIVATE TOUR OF HONG KONG". My wife had never been to Hong Kong and I was there once for a pre-cruise stay 32 years ago, so I thought the best thing would be to take a tour shortly after our arrival. I searched and read the tours for Hong Kong on Tripadvisor and decided to book J3 Private Tours Hong Kong based on all the consistent highly rated reviews. It was a choice I do not regret. When I booked the tour several months prior to our arrival I summarized the types of things we wanted to see on our tour. Jamie, our fantastic English tour guide, met us at our hotel exactly on time and for the next 6 hours showed us the sights of Hong Kong, focusing the entire time on exactly the types of things we wanted to see in and around the Hong Kong area. Jamie does not drive so we used only public transportation which I can describe as only fantastic. We stopped for lunch about halfway through the tour so you never felt like you were on a marathon tour. If you really want to see Hong Kong your way and I don't mean sitting on a tour bus then you will thoroughly enjoy your tour with Jamie.

Insightful first day in Hong Kong. We arrived in Hong Kong after a 15 hour flight and within hours met up with Jamie for a tour of Hong Kong. This was our first time in Hong Kong and I believe the tour was a fantastic introduction to this wonderful city. Jamie got us oriented to the local transit mrt and had us cruising over to Hong Kong island on the star ferry. He had interesting insights regarding Hong Kong life and culture..the gathering of nannies on Sunday in the square, mainland chinese shoppers travelling with their luggage full of goods. We also saw some interesting tourist sights, the nunnery and adjacent gardens, a Taoist temple and the ladies market. Overall a great first day. Well worth the money. Afterwards, he emailed us many directions accompanied by pictures of many of the popular tourist sights so we could find ourselves in the following days. Ps. Jamie the Victoria peak lookout spot was fantastic, thanks!

Take the tour as early as you can during your stay.. We were unsure of what we wanted to see in Hong Kong so managed to book Jamie early on in our stay. By the end of our tour we had seen a lot, got the hang of traveling around and had some excellent ideas for further trips during the rest of our stay, plus emails with further information to help us when we explored these options. We saw parts of Hong Kong that I am sure we would not have found on our own away from the main shopping areas and really appreciated the quieter more out of the way places. We would definately use Jamie as a guide if we visited again.

One Amazing Day. My adult daughter and I had one full day to experience Hong Kong. We booked 8 hours with Jamie and spent 13. It felt like 5 minutes. I am amazed by his knowledge, enthusiasm and how easy he made it all seem. We began at a contemplative Monastery, toured lavish coves, experienced many good luck, life lengthening charms and tasks, ate delicious food, laughed, and got the breadth and feel of this interesting City. Don't try this alone. Call Jamie!

The right kind of person to show people around Hong Kong. The right kind of person is someone who lives in town and knows it well. Jamie is that kind of person. Give him the time and he will give you the knowledge and detail to get under the skin of Hong Kong- a bit. He was great company for eight hours and made it very easy to see around town.

Excellent!. Everything you would want to see.When my husband and I planned our New Years holiday to Hong Kong, we had reservations about getting a tour guide, as we had in previous holidays simply done it ourselves. However looking back I can say without reservation that it was the best decision to get Jamie to show us the sights. He showed us everything we wanted to see and more. Jamie is very knowledgable about Hong Kong's history and current news and political climate, and can fill you in on the happenings past and present. He also has a lovely collection of photos of old and new HK. Definitely puts things into perspective. We travelled around by using public transportation which allowed us to get a local view of Hong Kong and which was also a very economic way to get around. It was fantastic not only to see Hong Kong with a local, as you get to experience it in a less touristy manner, but you save time in not getting duped into going to pointless places which, but for his advice, you would have wasted valuable time at. We have found that coach tours get kick backs from various places if they take foreigners to shop at certain stores, but Jamie was quite professional and didn't take us to any place where we could be "prayed on". Also a pleasant surprise were his emails giving suggestions of additional places to see, which we weren't able to cover with him, once our tour with him had ended. And also a very special thanks for taking the time to research our quirk of "vow-renewal" and taking us to the temple for the 'lovers ceremony'. Wonderful memory! Thoroughly enjoyed it, and looking back we have been able to take the most amazing photos! If we visit HK again, we will definitely use Jamie again to see even more of this amazing city!

You start the day with a guide and end up with a friend. Congratulations to Jamie who has worked hard to provide a personalised Hong Kong experience for overseas visitors.He does everything to ensure you have a memorable day.Jamie's depth of local knowledge was evident and we gained a great insight into Hong Kong's history and heritage.Jamie has many stories to share with you about Hong Kong during his laid back and entertaining tour.Highly recommended!Extra bonus: Jamie also supplied us with additional helpful information to assist us with our remaining time in Hong Kong..

Fantastic tour guide providing a wonderful Hong Kong experience.. I had the great pleasure of having Jamie as my personal tour guide in Hong Kong on December 29, 2012. It was my first time in Hong Kong, I only had 12 hours and I was a solo female traveller so decided it would be a good idea to get a tour guide for the day. Jamie was quick to respond to emails before the tour which provided me with a lot of confidence in the lead up to the tour. Jamie picked me up as agreed at the airport at 8am and we took in some wonderful sites including the linan nunnery, the lucky temple, stanley market and many other places. He was extremely knowledgable about all the places we went which added an extra dimension to the tour. We also went to famous hotels and to the ladies market for shopping. Being a solo female traveller safety was top of mind and I always felt safe with Jamie and I knew that he wouldn't take me to unsafe areas. Thank you so much Jamie for the wonderful experience. I cannot recommend you highly enough!!

Jam packed day of fun!. My husband planned a trip to Asia for us and being that we are from America we decided we definitely needed a tour guide in our destinations especially because we like to get see the non tourist spots. After searching Trip Advisor my husband found Jamie and decided he was the right guy for the job. After meeting up with Jamie at our hotel we were off for the day and it really was jam packed. Jamie took us to quite a few places we probably wouldn't have found on our own, the street that the maids lounge around on their one day off, the market where the locals buy their food (i would never buy fish off the street), we took a drive out to Repulse Bay walked on the beach and of course did all the quirky good luck "traditions". Jamie had us throwing money into a fish statue, turning in circles, rubbing statues, rather silly things but why not. When the day was winding down we took a taxi up to "Jamie's spot" on the peak, I can't begin to tell you how amazing the view of Hong Kong is from The Peak. I am not a fan of heights and I was a little nervous about going up but it was worth it, I have never seen a view so spectacular before.Jamie really made our one day stay in Hong Kong an enjoyable one, he has a great sense of humor and a passion for his tours. I would highly recommend him and would seek him out again if we decide to go back.

Rat on a stick. Among his many talents, Jamie does an extraordinary impression of a Vietnamese rat on a stick headed for the BBQ. He took my sons, wife and me on an amazing day-long tour that involved a trip to one of the outer islands, a bus ride to Repulse Bay, a walk around TST (including the Peninsula Hotel) and the best lunch we had in HKG. Having lived in HKG for 30+ years, Jamie is able to bring unique perspective and insights that you're never going to get on one of those big tourist buses. He was a great guide and he adapted the itinerary to suit our tastes and to counterbalance many of the sites we'd already seen. For example, he can explain why:- there are women wearing high heels on the beach at Repulse Bay- the license plates in HKG are so unusual- you'll never/rarely see a 14th floor in an elevator- that unusual building is referred to as "Building of 1,000 A-holes"- etcTo receive praise from a couple of jet-lagged, cranky teenage boys is pretty extraordinary. Jamie received lots of kudos from my two sons. I highly recommend you book a tour with Jamie as he will take you places and expose you to things that you'd never see/experience on your own.

A Tour that really is 'The Best of The Best' - AMAZING!. This review has been a long time coming and I do wish that I had done this sooner so that I could remember the names of all the amazing places that Jamie took us to.My boyfriend and I visited HK last Christmas for 5 days. As this holiday was over the Christmas period we were quite aware that we wanted to try see as much as possible, as well as have time to relax. Which is why we booked J3 Private Tours - I must say purely on the back of all of the outstanding reviews on here. As daunting as it sounds we opted for the 8-10 hour tour and WOW I can honestly say that the sights, experiences, tastes and smells that we experienced during that time were simply amazing.From memory we visited Chi Lin Nunnery, Nan Lian Garden, Victoria Harbour taking the star ferry across to HK island (as we were staying at Kowloon). Victoria Peak, Tsim Sha Tsui and much more. We strolled through the bustling streets at night, got a taste for the renowned markets and experienced what I believe was the best dim sum restaurant in HK - Din Tai Fung. Its places like this that we would have never have gone to without Jamie. He ordered a whole array of different dishes including a special pudding know as Sesame buns/glutinous sesame rice balls which my boyfriend became addicted to throughout the remainder of our stay.Jamie as a person has a fantastic sense of humour and was great fun to be with during the tour.Not only did Jamie’s tour provide us with a complete insight to HK it also gave us the confidence to travel around (feeling like we knew what we were doing and where we were going) for the rest of our stay – also visiting Ngong Pint 300, Lanteau island and the Big Buddha. As we visited a private spot at Victoria Peak during the day we also decided to take the Peak tram at night which will always hold a special place for me – a proposal at the top over the Hong Kong sparkling skyline.Thank you Jamie for making our trip so great (nearly a year ago)!

Super guided tour by Jamie. My wife and I had not arranged any activities in HK in advance but we contacted Jamie (J3) on our first day here to see if he had any availability. Thanks to a late cancellation, we were with him on our second day on a 4 hour tour of the Island, seeing parts of HK we would not have seen on our own. The extra added value was the local insights Jamie could give us on what we were seeing and the relevance to HK's history and distinct culture. Nothing too arduous. Jamie was also very helpful in suggesting other places we could visit during the rest of our stay.We would recommend Jamie to any visitors who need either a whistle stop tour or a longer tour to see more of HK.
J3 private tours Hong Kong. Great Tours...we used Jamie twice...one evening one morning..they wewe super! You do get what you pay foe! Would use him again in a heart beat.

Great Hong Kong Tour. We had never booked a private tour before and were a bit apprehensive about it, but Jamie was great. We didn't know what we wanted to see and we only had one day, so Jamie was able to get us from place to place easily and show us the sites. He even took us to a local restaurant for lunch that he had been going to for 20 years (we highly recommend you go to this local resturant instead of the more Americanized restaurant option).

Jamie Lloyd knows Hong Kong!. My wife and I had made arrangements to spend the day with Jamie Lloyd, J3 Tours Hong Kong, when we were in town on, Saturday, 17 November. We had corresponded with him prior to our arrival in HKG regarding sites we would like to visit that day. I had been to HKG about 20 years ago on business but did not have the opportunity to “be a tourist”Everyone raves about the tours by Jamie and we are in total agreement! We had a magnificent day!The next day, Sunday, we would be on our own to tour and discussed our ideas with Jamie. He e-mailed to us that Saturday evening with detailed instructions, including photos, on how to reach the sites we were planning to visit on our own. The instructions were spot on. We highly recommend J3 Tours.

Excellent private tour!. We spent a day with Jamie and the beautiful Hong Kong. All the positive reviews below are true, so I won't go over everything again. If you're in HK and want an excellent private tour, Jamie is your man. He has exceptional HK skyline viewing spot ;-) Would highly recommend his services!

Time and money well spent. We had a great time with Jamie. He has a wealth of knowledge about Hong Kong and a great sense of humor. He took us to very interesting places and we learned a lot about Hong Kong culture. He was responsive and easy to deal with, and gave us lots of very specific extra info as follow up,

Hong Kong Overview. My husband and I were in transit from Seattle to Kathmandu, and had a one day layover in Hong Kong. Some friends had recommended Tours by Locals, which led us to Jamie and his tour of the city. Jamie took us several interesting places, and had extensive knowledge of the area. We visited temples and gardens, learned about the chinese culture both in Hong Kong and in mainland China, and ended the day with a yummy lunch at a local restaurant. Jamie took excellent care of us and we enjoyed his sense of humor. And he gets around by foot or mass transit - an terrific way to see a city.

Phenomenal tour of Hong Kong--Worth every penny!. My wife Liz and cousins did a full-day tour with Jamie last month, covering more of Hong Kong than they ever imagined possible. Starting in the morning meeting us at our hotel, Jamie showed them around multiple sights in Kowloon, helped them navigate the MTR and the Star Ferries and use the Octopus card, all the while dispensing his special understandings and insights from decades of life as a resident of Hong Kong. We had just finished with 11 days in Hong Kong, so Jamie was also able to place much of history, economics, popular culture, etc into better perspective for us. For you high-end car fanatics, Jamie is the go-to guy for spotting and admiring the best on 4 wheels! In the afternoon, he showed us his most favorite walk at the Peak and then led them through the wet markets and back to TST. Breath-taking day, and Jamie's the biggest reason why. He also gave us perfect step-by-step instructions and recommendations for other sights to see the rest of our time in HK. Do not hesitate, you will not regret your time with Jamie, and also check out his web-site and/or his blog in advance, too!

The only way to see HK. Recommended by friends this was the first time I had hired a guide. If all guides were like Jamie (and I know they are not) I would not hesitate to hire guides whenever I travel. Jamie is friendly, interesting and extremely knowledgeable. A lifetime in HK certianly shows. We had a wonderful day exploring the city viewing hidden gems I did not know existsted and facinating anecdotes as we walked. He also found some shopping items I had requested and a spur of the moment item result that was perfect (thanks Jamie, the floral walking sticks were a great success) I would not hesitate to recommend Jamie to anyone visiting HK whether your first visit or the 50th. I will certainly contact Jamie when next in HK. Thankyou for a wonderful day Jamie and good luck on spotting more super cars.

Jet lagged but had a good time!. During our time spent in Hong Kong we booked two tours with Jamie. Although our stay was short, Jamie was able to show us all the highlights of Hong Kong! We found it very informative and fascinating. Hong Kong is a beautiful city and Jamie's knowledge of it is very impressive. He took us to an authentic Chinese restaurant which allowed us to get a taste of the real Hong Kong, also made us realize how much we need to work on our chopstick skills! If you're looking for a fun and informative experience we highly recommend Jamie as a guide! He showed us so much in the limited time we had and provided us with lots of laughs (sorry Jamie did not meet a yak in Nepal!). Thanks!

Good Tour; Unique and Informative. Wanted to rate Jame’s tour as Good, but Trip advisor only has Average and Very Good ratings. Took a 5-hour night tour for two (as he was fully booked in the day). A friendly and helpful guide; went the extra mile to find out and enquire about some noodles that I was looking for (which was only available in Macau).Although time was “tight”, we covered quite a number of sites, some of which I would have never gone to if I was to go with the ‘generic tour groups’ (like Chungking Mansion), and also walking down a “dark dangerous lane”. We also had the experience their public transports – namely the MTR, Ferry & Public Bus.All in all, Jamie’s very knowledgeable about the city, and had no problems in answering all of our questions; although some were not answered in depth (like about the Fengshui hole at the building at Repulse Bay… yes, the hole is for Fengshui for the people but… … [got this from another site: “the local residents believe a dragon lives on the mountain behind the apartment block. In China, dragons are a good thing, a protective force, good karma, whatever you like. They need to be protected and aided. The residents were worried that the proximity of the fire-breathing dragon would pose a fire risk. They didn't want the dragon going through their building on its way down the mountain and inadvertantly setting the place on fire. So they had the developer allow for a big hole to be left in the building, one which the dragon could pass through.”]Also, some of the places where we “landed”/ended up in, we weren’t told where we were (like we had to ask where were when we got off the ferry, after walking some distance (when we asked, we were then told we were at Tsim Sha Tsui; I believed we also passed by the Clock Tower, but weren’t introduced about it).
THE Tour to do!. Really good tour, see all the best bits of Hong Kong without the tacky bits! Jamie is a really nice and interesting guy.

Definitely Recommended. Mr Lloyd was my tour guide for 13 hours one day, and for 5 hours the next day.He was very accommodating and flexible as I had my girlfriend join me in both tours at the last minute.My girlfriend was born and raised in Hong Kong, while I was a first time visitor to Hong Kong. Mr Lloyd was able to tailor both tours to suit us - keeping both of us interested at the various places we visited. He is certainly a very knowledgeable tour guide.Mr Lloyd is definitely to be recommended for any tourist [whether a first timer to Hong Kong or a local].

Teriffic first day in Hong Kong. It was our first trip to Hong Kong and luckily I was able to book a tour with Jamie. He met my husband and I in our hotel lobby and we gave him an idea of our interests, but other than telling him that we wanted to see the Peak, we left the details to him. Per his instructions when we booked the tour, we purchased our Octopus cards at the airport upon arrival the night before so we were ready to go. It was great to have Jamie as a navigator. It always takes a bit of time to feel comfortable and have a feel of a new place, but we were off and running with him and we got to see many sights that we otherwise would never have found by ourselves. He was very knowledgeable of Hong Kong history, culture and politics and it was great to have a local view of these things. We also enjoyed his sense of humor. He went out of his way to get us to a bus that would take us to Stanley after our tour was finished. He also provided detailed directions by email for places that we mentioned that we would like to visit on later days in Hong Kong. The next day we used these directions and they were so very helpful. It was almost as though he was along with us guiding the way. He went above and beyond the expected to try to make us feel comfortable. All in all, a very enjoyable tour. We highly recommend him.

Wonderful tour. First time and day in a big and beautiful city like Hong Kong deserves a good guide so you´ll see the best of the city. I highly recommed Jamie for some hours. He is a very pleasant british man who has been living in Hong Kong for more than 30 years so he knows every piece of the city and will take you to the best sights by taxi or metro wich can be quite confusing if you dont know your way. Worth the money.

A different perspective of HK :). I'm Jamie's first ever HK local client. It's my boyfriend's first visit to HK and he arranged the tour with Jamie, and I joined in pretty much at the last minute. Jamie is very flexible with the places he takes his clients. After exchanging some words about our background at the hotel lobby we were on our way. We did a 12 hour tour on one day and a 4 hour one the next, and Jamie definitely accommodated both our needs, one being a first time visitor, and a person who has grown up here. What I enjoyed a lot was Jamie's insight into the city and his interpretation of the sites we visited. He keeps himself updated with what goes on daily in the city, so we were able to discuss policy, politics.....and having lived here for so long I learned a lot about the history of my city. The collection of photos on his iphone are also very impressive. We got a good cross section of HK. Religious/cultural/heritage sites, good views, hotels, beach...chocolate shop...and even got some shopping done. Jamie's English humour will also keep you smiling throughout. :) I will not look at numbers, Chow Tai Fook jewellers and certain signs the same way in HK again. Thanks Jamie!! :)

Excellent experience. The tour was a very good balance between small crowded markets and nice quiet gardens, between luxurious hotels or shopping malls and more common streets, between walking time and public transportation time.And the dumplings restaurant was really good...After a four hours tour with Jamie, we were confident enough the next day to go wherever we wished around the city, using public transportation.Very precious.

Where's the checkerboard?. This was a challenge that only a truly dedicated guide with a passion for providing great tours could deliver! With a keen plane enthusiast heading to Hong Kong it was only natural that a request to see the famous Kai Tak airport and checkerboard hill would certainly be asked. Our trip to Hong Kong was a bit of a last minute decision so not only was Jamie given the challenge of finding a perfect viewing spot so we could see both the (closed) airport and checkerboard hill but we gave him only a few days to organise it. But he did it! A unique spot and one I would not have considered but it was perfect. Even the 300+ stairs up and down to get there surrounded us by the spirit of this amazing location! Thanks Jamie we can now put another tick on the bucket list! Oh and those egg tarts will be forever etched into my taste buds! Love your work! Kind regards Dianne and David

Excellent Hong Kong guide. My wife and I stopped in Hong Kong as the first stop on our honeymoon tour of Asia. I set up a tour with Jamie a few months in advance -- e-mail communication was very efficient and we had no problem working out arrangements. Jamie promptly met us at our arranged meeting place. We spent a full day touring Hong Kong / Kowloon / New Territories and had a great time. We saw places we definitely would not have seen on our own, learned a tremendous amount about Hong Kong, and truly enjoyed Jamie's company. His reputation as the best tour guide in Hong Kong is well deserved. We highly recommend Jamie and will definitely contact him next time we are in Hong Kong.

Great Guide. Jamie is great, book early and you won't be disappointed. From his first emails it was clear you were dealing with a professional. All communication was clear and concise, even sending his picture so we could find him in the hotel lobby. Tour was all day, tailored to our requests. First day on my first trip to HK, it was a great introduction. Nice pace, nice variety. Fantastic overview of the City.The best suprise, after wrapping up our tour I mentioned we'd be sightseeing again the next day. Within an hour I had five emails from Jamie with recommendations. Okay, nice enough, but his emails inlcuded step by step directions with pictures of small landmarks so we'd know which subway exit to take or which corner to turn at. Over the top perfect. We paid for one day (which by the way isn't cheap but very much worth it) but I felt like with his pictures and instructions he was guiding us on day two as well.

Visit to Hong Kong October 2012. We had booked both a night and day tour with Jamie after reading the many positive reviews about J3 tours. Unfortunately, due to an error on my part we had to cancel the evening tour as I had not taken into account the time difference, in the sense that we arrived a day later than I had thought. After realising my mistake I contacted Jamie, explained and cancelled the night tour, much to my suprise I received a lovely reply, saying not to worry and even an easy to follow itinerary on what to see on our own.
