This was the start of the amazing and hassle FREE service that Jamie provides.We met Jamie at 9am in the lobby of our hotel, and immediately felt at ease, he first took us to get our Octopus card, explained how they worked, and where they took us and what we could purchase with them . He asked if there was anything in particular we wanted to do/see, and once we told him we were off, covered everything we had asked plus so much more, the day was pleasant from start to finish, in both what we saw/did and his great local knowledge and wicked sense of humor. It will be a day that will stay with us for a long time !The cost was unbelievable, well worth every penny and MORE ! Lunch was YUMMY,so many dishes,all equally delicious ! Thank you Jamie for a great day, and your humour even though my mum insisted on calling you Nigel !Natalie,Audrey & Bradley x

Visit to Hong Kong on Sunday Oct. 13, 2012. There were 2 young adults, 2 children 1 1/2 and 3 1/2 plus 2 grandparents. Our tour with Jamie J3 - was absolutely perfect. He put a tour together that was flexible, and was enjoyable for the children as well as the adults. We used various modes of transportation which allowed us to see more than we would have if we were on a big tour bus. We wish it had been a clearer day but Jamie did ensure that it did not rain. We would recommend Jamie and J3 to everyone. The price for this tour was very reasonable. He also had sent us additional information to help us plan our trip. Do not hesitate to use Jamie and J3 Tours.

J3 Private Tours Hong Kong. This was our first trip to Hong Kong. Day one we spend 6 hours with Jamie and his walking tour. The tour was prepared after our wishes and it was realy fantastic. Jaimie intoduced us to Hong Kong in a way that should be inpossible for anybody who has not been living in Hong Kong for a very long time. It was worth every dollar and we realy recomend this tour. As a bonus he gave us specific information on what we could do by ourself the day after and we followed the instructions and had a very nice second day in Hong Kong. If you are there, contact J3 tours and you will never regret it :-)

"Hong Kong with Jamie". My daughter and I did a tour with Jamie this past October. It was time well spent and so enjoyable.We really enjoyed Jamie's knowledge of Hong Kong and charming wit. I really enjoyed seeing the Chi Lin Nunnery and gardens. It was just beautiful and great for pictures. We saw more in 6 hours than I would have seen in 2 days. Jamie also gave us good advice and directions for other areas to see. He dropped us off at the Jade market, which I would have never found, for some fun jade gift shopping. I had never been to HK and Jamie made this a wonderful breath taking experience.I highly recommend Jamie's tour. You get what you pay for.Thank you Jamie, Judy and Cory(pink haired girl!)

A day of great adventures around Hong Kong. What a fantastic way to see Hong Kong...Jamie very knowledgeable on Hong Kong history and little stories along the way.Myself and two adult sons went exploring for six hours with Jamie, we travelled by tram, bus, train and walked miles. Covered the produce markets, temples etc. We had an exciting day, even travelling to Sai Kung which is a wonderful little fishing town, pity we didn't have longer to explore. And we did go to his special spot up on the Peak to take photos of Hong Kong in our own time. We highly recommend Jamie's tour to everyone wanting to get the most out of your Hong Kong visit.

Excellent tour. My husband and I decided to book Jamie for our first day in Hong Kong on a 4 day stop there on our way to Bali. We had never been to HK and Jamie did a great job of orienting us to the city. Our first stop was the metro station where he helped us buy our octopus cards and explained the metro system to us. We then went to a temple and he explained the unique religion of HK he then took us to his favorite look out at the Peak. Jamie gave us so many fun and interesting facts about the city and it's history, he was so entertaining there was never a dull moment. We talked about the other things we planned to see and do on our trip and the next morning Jamie had sent us very detailed directions and tips for each place we wanted to see! Amazing! This saved us so much time and got us exactly where we wanted to be. We had many "Thanks Jamie" moments over the next couple of days when we used his directions and suggestions. We wished we could have taken him to Bali with us, worth every penny a great experience, we highly recommend Jamie!

A stop off that became a memorable holiday highlight!. As our teenage daughter was desperate to visit Hong Kong we arranged a 2 day stop off on our way to Borneo and booked a tour with Jamie after reading Trip Advisor reviews. We are so glad that we did! We booked a private tour for just the four of us which took I think about 5/6 hours. It wasn't cheap, but well worth it as we were given a real taster of Hong Kong, didn't have to worry about getting lost and saw some amazing sites that we would never have seen on our own. When we booked the tour, and at the start of it we were asked if there was anything in particular that we would like to see, but as first time visitors we left the itinerary to Jamie, with the exception of asking to go on the world's longest escalator that my daughter had asked to see. We weren't swamped with dry information - it was a bit like visiting a friend in a new city - no fumbling about with maps - jumping on and off ferries, buses, trains etc like a local, taking short cuts, seeing the old and new and the less salubrious areas that you wouldn't feel safe visiting alone. We covered a huge area, seeing traditional markets, chinese temples, parks, upmarket shops, backstreets, star ferries, etc etc and looking back feel as though our stay was much longer than it really was.Jamie gives a locals point of view and his own opinion on many things in Hong Kong that would be impossible to get from a guide book and has left a lasting memory. We also thoroughly enjoyed the meal later that evening at the restaurant that Jamie recommended.We were delighted to have spent our only full day in Hong Kong on this tour and would have no hesitation in recommending this tour to family and friends.

A Great Adventure in Hong Kong. My wife and I had a fun filled evening with Jamie in Hong Kong. We arrived in port aboard the Diamond Princess cruise ship. We have got to the point with cruise ships that we don't like their excursions because they end up being 10 buses of people all heading for the same stops. So we typically arrange for private shore excursions. We sourced out Jamie from Tripadvisor, and he was well rated. Prior to our date in Hong Kong we had exchanged emails to confirm a meeting place and cell phone numbers. Jamie has spent most of him life in Hong Kong and is very knowledgeable on the history and present day happenings. He's quite a humorous person so be prepared to laugh a lot. He also knows a lot of short cuts on the various modes of transportation so while other tourists are waiting in line to get somewhere, you are already at the attraction. Thanks Jamie for a wonderful tour.

Hong Kong stop over tour with Jamie. I had the pleasure of having a 6 hour evening tour with Jamie early in September 2012. What Jamie doesn't know about Hong Kong is not worth knowing. Jamie picked me up at the airport when I had a 9 hour stop over on my way to Italy for a holiday and from that minute I felt comfortable and at ease in a city I have never been in before. We went from fish markets in back alleys to upmarket shopping centres and beautiful hotel lobbeys to catching a ferry across to Kowloon to see the lights of the city. His knowlege of Hong Kong's architecure is immense and we travelled on the metro with ease. At the end of the tour Jamie took me back to the airport right up to the customs check in counter. I thoroughly enjoyed his company and would and have recommended him to other travellers to Hong Kong.

Great Intro to hong Kong. Gives great insight to Hong Kong from a locals point of view. Very accomodating. Jamie met us in our hotel lobby at the ICON and started our day off with a tour of the Central District and then to Stanley Park. The weather in the afternoon of our visit turned rainy and Jamie accomodated us by changing our trip to the peak to later in week. Very nice and great with our group. He knows how to make the tour accomodate the group. Thanks Jamie to a great time in Hong Kong.

Great Day!!!!!. We spent the day with Jamie when our cruise ship stopped in Hong Kong. We loved traveling the city like a native. Using the subway and buses was a great way to see Hong Kong. We visited many places that we would not have seen on an organized shore excursion. Jamie was very prompt in answering my emails in planning my trip and was very flexible even making changes to our itinerary during the day of our tour. Our day with Jamie was one of the highlights of our trip.

Fantastic Tour. We had a tour with Jamie and all we can say is WOW. We were looking forward to our tour with Jamie by the reviews we had read but it was even more. We would recommend Jamie to any first time visitors to Hong Kong. We learnt how to use the MTR with ease. We were taken to a wonderful little shop for lunch that we returned to twice after our tour. Jamie’s insight and sense of humour was great fun, especially the "Red" bridge.We ask for directions to Stanley Market, he not only told us but also emailed pictures step by step for us to get there.To Jamie thank you for a wonderful day.

Spending a day with Jamie. We are an elderly couple, both in our eary 70s and probably a little lacking in confidence these days. We found Jamie to be a very likeable laid back individual who gave us a very good insight and a feel for Hong Kong so that for the rest of our time there we had kind of learnt the ropes and with Jamie's email later where he gave us a blow by blow description of how to manouvere ourselves to the correct bus stop, which was pretty interesting in itself. We spent a pleasant day at Kennedy Point which we also enjoyed. We think Jamie's tour was interesting and that he helped us to understand the train ad bus system. We later found our way to Causeway Bay and were confident enough to brave the ferry system, as when we first met Jamie he helped us buy a seniors Octopus (I think that is what it was called) which could be used on all transport services. Overall a very pleasant experience, thank you Jamie for being you.

"There's a reason Jamie's #1 on tripadvisor!". I've managed a Marriott hotel that was also in the top 10% of trip advisor.com's reviews, I can attest that Jamie richly deserves his #1 rating here on tripadvisor.com!He met my son and I in the lobby of the JW Marriott (best hotel in Hong Kong!) and took us on a full day tour..leading the way through back streets, and markets (even he was surprised to see a pigs head being roasted by a man with a blow-torch), up to the Peak, through temples, on and off subways and ferries...and throughout the day he was kind, fun, entertaining, considerate, and very knowledgeable! It was like touring the city with an old lost friend! His sense of humor is second to none...I don't care what he charges you (you will know that in advance however)...take my word for it (and my sons') it will be worth every penny and then some. Having worked in several 5 star, 5 diamond resorts, I can easily give Jamie 5 stars!

Good tour. This tour was interesting from someone with an outsider's view of Hong Kong. I would probably have preferred an insider's view. Thought this was expensive for one person and did not find the places visited that fascinating. (I was not really given a choice of where to go). That said the guide is personable and it does get you oriented.

A day out with J3 Private Tours. As we only had one full day to explore Honk Kong we engaged Jamie to make the most of our time. I had previously,taken a one day guided tour in Paris and been really impressed with the experience.Even if time is plentiful, I would highly recommend using Jamie at the start of your stay to get a comprehensive overview of life in Hong Kong, and many invaluable tips . Using public transport gives a real feel for the city and Jamies tour gives an interesting perspective of Hong Kong customs and culture. We had a really fun day out and he happily responded to a barrage of questions about HK life. Highly recommended! Lissy Annie

WORTH EVERY PENNY!!. Our group of 6 loved our personalized tour with Jamie. The trip to Hong Kong would not have been the same with out the informative tour. Jamie has a wonderful personality and is so knowledgable regarding the area and traditions of the region. Our custom 8 hour tour included:MTR to Diamond HillChi Lin Nunnery / Nan Lian GardenSik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin TempleMTR to Tsim Sha TsuiChungKing Mansions Peninsula Hotel / 1881 Heritage + Hullit House HotelTST Promenade for views of the IslandStar Ferry to the IslandLunch at Maxims Palace Restaurant - traditional Dim Sum mealStatue Square / MTR to WanchaiWanchai MarketTaxi to the PeakThe Peak - my spot (fabulous crystal clear view)Taxi to the HotelJamie was even willing to answer additional questions and provide detailed instructions on how to get to other trip locations :) You will not be disappointed! It is like having a personal friend in Hong Kong you can email and/or call with any questions about the area. Thanks fo making our trip perfect!

Book this personal tour now in case he is fully booked!. I can't rate Jamie highly enough. Jamie guided us around Hong Kong and we saw more in one day with him them we would have done in four days on our own. He sorted out our MRT (underground) tickets showed us how to get around bus stops etc. He gave us an excellent and humerous insight into life in Hong Kong. What I really liked about Jamie was he listened to us and about our interests and showed us things he thought would be of interest to us. Jamie took us to a a fntastic restaurant and we had real chinese food ..fantasic! After the tour he also kept sending us tips and directions for thing we might be interested in. So basicaly we booked him for the day but each evening we found more advice and tips on things we had either mentioned to him or he thought we would like. The tips were not just what to see but photos of the route you have to take and photos of the signs etc so it was very difficult to get lost, so a pic may show a sign post then a picture of the ramp out of the subway next the sign at the top of the ramp then a foto of the path leading off the ramp...ingenious!Don't delay booking him just do it now before he is booked by someone else and you regret it!

Awesome personalised tour. Jamie is quite an amazing, personable host who is very family friendly and flexible. He is the oracle of all things HK and provides a fascinating, humorous perspective on the place, sharing a wealth of knowledge and awesome stories of his life in HK. He definetly knows his way around the city and all the best - and unusual - spots, avoiding all the standard tourist trap crap. The sites we didn't manage to fit in in our 12 hours with Jamie (although we did fit in *heaps*) he sent through detailed information on how, when and where so that we could continue exploring on our own. We are travelers (not tourists) with a 19month old son who hitches a ride with mum in a sling and have good fitness levels. The pace of the tour was perfect, medium - certinaly not slow, but included all the extra stops that come with having a little potty trained bladder, and little legs that wanted to explore on their own. This has to be one of the best personal tours we have taken so far, and we cannot recommend Jamie highly enough! Forget the bus tour groups and get a real first hand experience!

Outstanding. Jamie took us for a tour on September 5,2012. He took the time to explain everything to us. Showed us fascinating sites that aren't on your every day tour, his knowledge of the City and it's history is unsurpassed.We would thoroughly recommend Jamie to anyone who is thinking of touring Hong Kong.

Great way to be introduced to Hong Kong- Night Tour. We did a night tour of HK with Jamie. We are first-timers to HK and really had no idea where to start sight seeing and how to get around the city.Jamie picked us up at the time specified at our hotel. We toured the city by foot, taxi, ferry, and subway MTR.We hit all the major spots, Victoria Peak, HK Island, Kowloon. Got to see the business district, Little India, Mandarin & Penninsula Hotel, local markets, even got to enjoy some amazing dumplings and more at one of Jamie's favorite restaraunts,Jamie is a great guy, pleasant, easy to talk with, sense of humour, and very knowledgeable of his adopted city (having lived in HK for 30 plus years.) The next day he even sent us detailed emails (with photos) with instructions on how to get to other sights we didn't get to see on our tour with him that night. Arranging the tour was effortless, with emails replied to very quickly.I wouldn't hesitate to recommed Jamie to anyone who is looking for a tour guide while in HK, you will not regret it!

Something truly unique you must do. I was looking to get a somewhat 'locals' view of HK plus some tourist sites minus the trash. Jamie provided this in abundance. Both his local, and up to date knowledge on the issues and news on the area added the extra perspective that one wouldn't normally get with a 'factory' tour. I can't recommend this guy highly enough. Be sure to wear suitable walking shoes, and you'll get the most out of this tour. He doesn't push you physically, you go at your own pace, it's all up to you. He is polite, articulate and a thoroughly enjoyable character to spend time with. My friend and I spent about 9 hrs with Jamie and the time passed in flash we enjoyed it so much. As I said before I can't recommend him highly enough.

Put your confidence in Jamie, you will be pleased you did!. Jamie is an experienced, knowledgeable,amusing, versatile and reliable guide to Hong Kong. My wife and I and another couple visited H.K. at the end of July.2012. This was a first time visit for our friends, while my wife and I are former H.K. residents, having lived there for 4 years in the mid-!980s. Clearly, meeting the needs of such different customer knowledge levels would be a challenge for any guide. Jamie rose to the challenge brilliantly because he adjusts his tours to the specific needs of his clients, both in terms of their interests and existing knowledge and their physical capacities. Let's face it, this type of customer focused tour will always beat a formulaic approach. We spent a total of 8 fascinating hours with Jamie, split into two separate four hour tours, one on each of the two days we spent in H.K Jamie met us promptly at our hotel at the start of each day's tour and was able to put together a program for us that presented the current highlights of Hong Kong, while at the same time identifying for my wife and I the dramatic changes that have taken place since both of us were residents. Moreover, even though my wife and I had lived in Hong Kong, Jamie was still able to take us to places that were new to us. He was also great at steering us away from over-congested places that would have wasted our precious short time in Hong Kong in unnecessary queuing. Plus he was very helpful to us in suggesting things to do even during the time we did not spend with him. If your time in HK is limited like ours was, Jamie's services as a tour guide offer the perfect solution for maximizing it. As a tour guide, I would not hesitate to declare that Jamie offers you unbeatable personalized value, whether you are a first time tourist, a frequent H.K. visitor or even, like my wife and I, past residents!

A Hong Kong must do!. Before heading to Hong Kong we decided to take a chance on a personal tour guide. Found Jamie on www.tripadvisor.com. This guy knows his stuff! He is friendly, courteous and talkative. Living in Hong Kong for many years he knows all the little nooks and crannies, the best places to eat and have fun. Jamie personalized our tour for where we wanted to go. We, for the most part gave him free range to decide. He didn't disappoint, taking us to all sorts of out of the way and hidden places we would have never found on our own. He accepts both HK or US dollars which is super convenient, even meets you at your hotel. We all walked or took the subway/trolleys for transportation, so bring those walking shoes! Later that week he sent directions to us for the places we had talked about but didn't get a chance to hit. You can hire him for just 4 hours all the way up to 8. We had a great time and anyone who heads to Hong Kong NEEDS to find Jamie for a tour. Don't wait till last minute to book him, he fills up quick!

Great tour guide, great tour, local information and viewpoint. We visited Hong Kong on the way to Australia as a 4 day stop over (from the UK). We engaged the services of Jamie to give us an introduction to Hong Kong and to "hold our hands" as we encountered this foreign land. We chose Jamie because of the good feedback on tripadvisor and were not disappointed. After an initial flurry of emails we settled on a 5 hour tour on our first full day and a 6 hour tour the next day. The tours were mostly on foot and public transport, a really good way to build up confidence for when you come to go it alone. Jamie has no single set tour route but adjusts things to fit the needs of the group. He took us to see many things that we didn't even knew existed. I would say that it is just like being shown around a new city by an old friend. He brings the perspective of a local to the tour, not a sanitized tour bus and "official views". The pace of the tour was just right. If you look at his prices and are thinking "that's expensive" the answer is yes, it isn't cheap. However, it is good value for money, a personal tour guide isn't going to be cheap, you are paying for a personal service and getting exactly that.After two days of tour we felt we had a flavour of Hong Kong and were equipped to go off doing our own thing. Would we use Jamie's services again, definitely, next time we are in Hong Kong we'll be taking a night time tour (and we promise not to oversleep).

Best individual Citytour with fantastic Jamie. Had a 5 hours afternoon till evening tour with Jamie and it was just "amazing" - that was also my most used word during the tour ;-) I already expected as nice tour, due to so many great comments there on tripadvisor, but I didn't think that it might be such a life time experience. Thanks to Hongkong, and of course thanks to Jamie, who was just a perfect companion, I really had a nice time and I will never forget my visit to Hongkong.I only can encourage all HK visitors to book a tour with Jamie, it's a MUST!Thanks Jamie for that fantastic experience and see you soon!

Knowledgeable and Patient. This is a private tour and the effectiveness of the tour depends on how best you make use of it. There are no set boundaries and most of the tour is by public transport which is fun way to see Hong kong. We were traveling with my 2 year old and 8 year old and I must say Jamie was quite patient in answering the non stop questions of my 8 year old. In our case this tour worked out best as we wouldn't have had the discipline to lug around( especially after a long flight from US). Jamie was patient, knowledgeable and showed us around at a comfortable pace.If you have done your homework and want to visit set areas( like victoria peak..etc) and know how to navigate, then you have a choice to make; given the cost but again it is to be evaluated on a case to case basis.

Fell in love with Hong Kong. I had a 8 hours tour around Hong Kong with Jamie. It was so extraordinary experience!  Before I came I didn't know anything about this place, now I fell in love with this city and I would come as soon as I can. Jamie shown me the most interesting places in Hong Kong. Thank you for him I could understand that hong Komg is a wonderful place to live in not only for tourist tour. I drank one of the best cappuccino in the world and you can trust me, because I'm from Italy))I spent magnificent day and the only one thing I'm sorry about that I was just one day. If you have transfer in Hong Kong don't waste your time at airport lounge go and see the best city of Asia.

Everyone loves Jamie!. I was travelling by myself for the first time and had 4 days in Hong Kong, so after finding Jamie on tripadvisor, I decided to book a personalised tour with him.Booking the tour was really simple, I emailed Jamie and told him what I wanted to see and what my likes and dislikes were and left the itinerary in his very capable hands.Jamie met me in my hotel lobby at The Salisbury YMCA and we went from there, taking in the wide variety of differing sounds, smells and sights of Hong Kong. Jamie is a fountain of knowledge on all things Hong Kong and was able to answer all of my questions, but most importantly he is soooooooooooo easy going and funny, it’s just like spending the day with a mate, which was great as it was only the two of us. Being a fellow Brit, it was great to talk about the UK and compare it to HK. He’s a genuinely nice bloke who loves his family and his home...Hong Kong!The day of the tour was the day after the typhoon, so the weather wasn’t great and it was hilarious when we got to The Peak to find that we couldn’t even see through the windows because it was so misty. However, the weather didn’t really bother me as Jamie is great company and he showed me lots of interesting stuff that suited the brief from my email.The tour was great and Jamie took me on the Star ferry, MTR and buses, which really set me up for the rest of my stay and I felt confident navigating my way around. Even after the tour, Jamie emailed me that evening with directions and top tips to other things that I was interested in doing in Hong Kong, so the service continued even after the trip was over.The whole experience felt like a day out with a good friend with inside knowledge, so I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Jamie to anyone – just do it!

Fantastic Private Tour. After reading all of Jamie's wonderful reviews on tripadvisor I knew I had to book a tour for mine and my dad's upcoming trip to Hong Kong. As always, things didn't go as planned and a level 10 typhoon hit Hong Kong the night before our scheduled 8 hour day tour. Jamie emailed me immediately (3 am) to reschedule the tour. We ended up doing two half day tours. Jamie lived up to his high standard - we visited both places I had mentioned and ones he thought worthwhile. Jamie's extensive knowledge of the history/culture of Hong Kong and each place we visited made the tour not only entertaining but highly educational. Beyond learning so much more than we would have on our own or with a general tour we had a great time just hanging out with Jamie. If you are looking for the perfect Hong Kong private tour guide Jamie is a must!

Fantastic experience!!!. My wife, my two daughters (15yo and 13yo) and I had the very good fortune to spend two wonderful days touring Hong Kong with Jamie last month. Let me say that every single accolade posted on Trip Advisor about Jamie is absolutely spot on – he is knowledgeable, professional, courteous, flexible and, most importantly, will make your trip to Hong Kong so much more rewarding and interesting. My wife and I had been to Hong Kong 17 years prior to our recent trip and I had a specific itinerary in mind. After several e-mails back and forth with Jamie, he devised a final plan for our touring. This plan included all of the sights I had wanted to experience – as well as several other interesting places along the way. His humorous and insightful comments and personable demeanor kept our two daughters engaged and interested and my wife and I informed and involved. In addition, he provided valuable insights into some night-time activities we pursued on our own.Needless to say, I cannot recommend him more strongly. If you are looking for a tour guide in Hong Kong who will provide a tremendously satisfying experience, do not hesitate to utilize his services.

best of the best. My daughter and I booked an all day tour with Jamie and we could'nt have asked for more.Because this was our first time in Hong Kong we didn't know where we wanted to go or what we wanted to do, so we left it in Jamie's hands .We were not disappointed.We didn't think you could cover so much in 8 hrs.His ability to making the tour factual as well as entertaining,is truly a gift .He answered all our questions and we asked him lots too!! I wouldn't hesitate recommending Jamie to anyone who is visiting Hong Kong you won't go wrong .Were already planning next year trip .

5 hrs with Jamie!. Jamie's tour was just fantastic, and I have to say Jamie the sights and your company and knowledge were one of my highlights of my weekend in Hong Kong! I am still laughing about the little frog that made it's way downtown on my leg from the Peak... I wonder if it ever found it's way home... Jamie has a lovely easy manner. He works out your tour based on what interests you and really makes the most of your time. I had a fab time taking photos and getting my bearings, starting at 5pm and finishing, well, I don't know when but I know it was late when I got back to my hotel. Best of both worlds, Hong Kong in the daylight, dusk and night! I thank you Jamie, and I enclose for you a couple of photos, my favourite one of you and 'The Shoe Bath!' All the best, Susie

Simply the best. Yesterday we spent the whole day with Jamie. We had no idea what we wanted to see or do so we let Jamie lead the way.We couldn't have wished for a better experience.His knowledge and entertaining nature made our tour something my daughter and I will never forget.I wouldn't hesitate recommending his tour to anyone who is heading to Hongkong, you won't regret it. See you next year Jamie, its a promise!!!!!!

Excellent Tour Guide. My partner and I as recently as this week had the pleasure of joining one of Jamie's tours on parts of Hong Kong. I found him to be informative, keen and sincere, a trait lacking in many parts of society these days. He is quite enthused in what he does and this is displayed in his manner. He has the ability to fulfil your agenda or if you don't have one like us, then he will create one for you. Tip. If you tour in summer you will experience extreme humidity like us. 91% is not pleasant. I said to Jamie, "What do you do when you are not guiding tours.". His reply was "I research Hong Kong." That tells you a lot about the man. He took us to some pretty interesting places and we had lunch at his favourite eatery.

Faultless....perfect way to see Hong Kong. My wife and I booked Jamie some months prior to visiting Hong Kong in April this year; I had been looking for someone who could provide a private tour that would encompass the "real" Hong Kong. My research led me to Jamie from J3 Private Tours and the reviews of his work on here. No one had a bad word to say about him and so I made contact via email. Jamie was quick to reply and provided thorough answers to all my queries. Jamie takes no prepayment regardless of how long in advance you book his services, and he will question you as to your interests etc to try and tailor his tour to your best advantage. If you have no idea he will simply come up with a tried and tested tour for you. Being a private tour this means you travel at your pace and have exclusive access to Jamie's knowledge bank...Our trip started at 10:00 in the morning when Jamie met us as promised in the reception of our hotel. After introductions we were off...first stop the local MTR station to obtain Octopus cards (www.octopuss.com.hk). This is a prepaid travel card of sorts - for those familiar with London its the same as an oyster card but a lot more...These are invaluable and you will use them on the tour with Jamie for all your travel, you can even buy an ice cream with them from the ice cream man if you want!..Once we had collected our cards we set off on foot to Victoria park where we viewed the Statue that the park is named after...then off again on foot to the Diamond hill MTR station where we headed off to the Chi Lin Nunnery, a pleasant time was spent here viewing the artefacts and gorgeous gardens..Jamie provides you with constant chat and commentary and his style is extremely relaxing, he is a very funny guy who tells it as it is..no messing around here!...our morning was taken up visiting various sites around HK including Nan Lian Garden and Wong Tai Sin Temple again all accompanied by a fascinating talk from Jamie. At lunch time we headed off to TST on the metro once more and took in a fantastic Chinese lunch at Din Tai Fung a very busy and extremely popular restaurant serving dim sum amongst the many many other Chinese delicacies. after a 15 minute wait for a table we were seated and Jamie ordered the meal for us all to share - thank god as the method for ordering was not one i was familiar with, plus it ensured we tried things we would ordinarily not order ourselves... the price for this was more than reasonable..after lunch we were off again down the Canton Road taking in the views of the mega label shops etc....we then headed into the Peninsula hotel and the 1881 Heritage area, Located on Canton Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, 1881 Heritage features a shopping mall, a heritage hotel, and an exhibition hall. The original site of 1881 Heritage was the headquarters of the Hong Kong Marine Police from the 1880s to 1996. This was fascinating - from here it was out to the Kowloon Promenade and on to the famous Star Ferry..a trip across the water led us to the new promenade on HK island - and a short walk to the old Royal Navy barracks HMS TAMAR - Jamie had specifically included this in the tour at my request - being Ex Royal Navy I was interested to see what had happened to the place. We completed the afternoon some 7 - 8 hours later heading back to the hotel where Jamie joined us for drinks and some more excellent conversation. This was a fantastic way to see HK for us on our first trip here, and it set us up for the rest of the stay as we had become totally familiar with the ways of the public transport etc.., and with Jamie making more suggestions for the rest of the stay we were able to take full advantage of our short stay. If you are off to HK and want a tour that doesn't involve a coach and a man with an umbrella herding you about then book Jamie - you wont regret it...Jamie thanks a million....Can you read up on Vietnam and Cambodia because we are off their next year and could do with a good guide!

Wonderful time in HK!. Jamie led an excellent tour! He was prompt, polite, answered our questions about every aspect of life in Hong Komg and recommended great places for us to go (excellent food, a great place for my husband to get a suit, etc). If you are going to be in HK, look Jamie up!

2nd Time Back with Jamie. What can we say other than its been a wonderful 2 days spent touring Hong Kong with Jamie. We first met Jamie back in July 2011, the 1 day tour with him was so good, that we booked him again for 2 days and 1 night tour of HK this time around and Jamie did not disappoint us.We had a thorough tour of Central on HK Island, really enjoyed the snappy view from the 102nd floor of the Ritz Carlton in the ICC building located at western Kowloon. My partner also enjoyed the shopping at Elements located at the same venue. Our 2nd day was spent touring the Big Buddha and the Po Lin monastry, the cable car ride is something to experience, whilst the monastry is definitely worth seeing. How the wild dogs on the island got there is a mystery. Jamie as always was very informative wherever we went not to mention time conscious in utilising the MTR metro to get around HK (make sure you get yourself a Octopus Card $150 HK).Finally, we spent a night tour with Jamie, touring the Temple St Market and Ladies Market. Again we enjoyed Jamies knowledge of the local area, what to look out for and where the best place was to enjoy some of the local food.Jamie is well organised and very pleasant company. We found Jamie very attentive and he listened to what we wanted to achieve and made his recommendations as to how to go about it. We can't fault Jamie, his knowledge, pleasant manner and ability to get people around HK is first class, we'll be back for a 3rd tour with Jamie.

Simply excellent!!. We booked Jamie after reading a lot of positive reviews about him and his tours. Let's say that it was a really good idea and the best way to start our 4 day stay in Hong Kong. Jamie brought us right into this fantastic city and we saw some things we probably would not have seen on our own. All his comments about traditions, culture, history, etc.. and some curiosities were very interesting!!We would definitely recommend Jamie to anybody who wants to discover Hong Kong in a special way!

High praise for our tour!. Jamie was super! He collected us at our hotel early on a Sunday morning and after a brief review of our interests, we were off! We traveled by bus, taxi, tram, boat, and subway all over! Love the Octopus Card! Simply stated: Jamie knows HK and is very eager to share his wealth of knowledge with his clients. He adapted to our particular interests and we were able to cover a lot of ground during our time together. I especially appreciated his tips on how to organize our remaining days. Also, Jamie offered to show us Kowloon and the "Ladies Market" on a day when he had a free morning, at no extra charge. He was very helpful in selecting restaurants, planning shopping trips, and advice on the best transportation. We also really enjoyed his perspective on the the current events, the culture, history, and of course the real estate market. He is a wonderful resource and a great ambassador. We had a very memorable trip and value our time spent with Jamie.

Cost beneficial outstanding personal tour. I had the great pleasure of spending a full day/night with Jamie taking me to unique and special sights throughout Hong Kong, Kowloon, and the New Territories. I had read the reviews here on Trip Advisor and made a spur of the moment decision to email Jamie to see if I could fit in to his schedule. I knew that I did not want to do the standard city bus tour but rather wanted to get a special tour of the sights that a local experiences. The day was outstanding! As an accountant, I found that the value that I received was worth the investment! I strongly recommend Jamie for those who value their time and want to maximize the benefit that they receive from the investment in getting a personal walking/ public transport tour. I went for the full 8 hour tour. I expected that I would find this to be too much time. Boy was I wrong, the time flew by as we talked about all sorts of topics and received insights about the various locations that one would not find in a guidebook. I will definitely use him again on my future trips. I have had many people recommend the benefit of a personal tour guide, this was my first time taking the plunge. I say it is money well spent if you value your time and want to receive true insights.Thank you Jamie for an outstanding day.

Good tour, but expected more. My husband and I liked the tour and can recommend Jamie as a tour guide if you're looking for a Hong Kong Tour - you get much more than you would from a general bus tour, of course. His knowledge is very solid, especially on history and hard facts.We expected a bit more though, especially more 'insider information': the stories behind the scenes, discoveries, anecdotes when you wander around the city - in short, the things I won't read in a guide book. We also felt we constantly had to ask questions, to get information.I'd say, take this tour if you want to know the facts, like the history, and if you are looking for general information, not so much if you like stories about people, the city and it's neighborhoods, the food and lifestyle etc.

Wonderful tour, we highly recommend Jamie!. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we knew that Jamie was the tour guide for us. We had the pleasure of having a thorough tour of Hong Kong with Jamie. We were travelling with my 80 year old parents ( my mother uses a walker) and my 12 year old son. It was amazing how much we saw in 6 hours. We had the opportunity to ride the ferry, taxi, double decker bus, subway and tram on our tour. We also walked quite a bit. Jamie was very attentive with my mother and patient as well. He was very informative and tailored his explanations appropriately depending on who he was talking to. We gave him some ideas of what we wanted to see and he took that information and also added other sights that he knew we would enjoy. Having a local guide to explain customs, local facts and other information about Hong Kong was invaluable. He also recommended other things for us to do on our own in the evening. He was a wealth of information and our impression of Hong Kong would not have been the same without him.In our tour we saw the following:Walk to the Star Ferry / Peninsula HotelStar FerryTaxi to the PeakThe Peak TowerPeak TramSt. Johns Cathedral, Battery Path, HSBC, Statue SquareBus 66 to StanleyStanley with Starbucks stopBus 260 to CentralMTR to Wong Tai SinWong Tai Sin TempleMTR back to TSTBack to the HotelIt was a fantastic day! Thank you Jamie!

Jamie,a wonderful Guide. My wife and I were in Hongkong for 4 days. Normally wie don't like organized tours but since more than 30 years I had been in Hongkong I thought, it would be a good idea to have someone with you, who knows what is worth to Look for. So we booked Jamie, because what he offered sounded very pleasant to us. We made a 8 hours tour through Kowloon and Hongkong Island . It was marvelous!Jamie is a wonderful and friendly companion. In this tour we learned a lot about the history and the culture of Hongkong as well as how their culture and policy contrasts to the mainland China.If you have a Guide like Jamie you can relax, you don't have to to Figure out where you are, where you are going etc.Shown below some highlights of our tour:Chin Lin Nunnery, Nan Lian Garden, Sik Sik Yun Wong Tai Sin Temple, Lunch at the very nice Din Tai Fung Restaurant, Tea Time at the Peninsula, Canton Road, Star Ferry Trip to HK island, Taxi Drive to the Peak, a very Nice footwalk around the Peak to get a wonderful view of the Harbour and Kowloon, a pleasant Break at the Mandarin Hotel and then Way back to Kowloon to our Hotel.Due to this Tour with Jamie we knew where to pick up the busses , the ferries and the MTR we were going to use the rest of our stay.If you Want to experience this extraordinary City Hongkong in a unique and very Special way you should book this tour.

Walking Tour of Hong Kong. Jamie was an informative British expatriate who had lived in Hong Kong for many years. The visit to the Nunnery and gardens was thoroughly enjoyed by my wife and I. He provided a contrast to the serenity of the garden with a visit to the Taoist/Confuscious Chinese Temple at the end of the Chinese New Year, where smokey incense and throngs of people were evident.The walking tour and use of the subway system was efficient and a good way to see aspects of HK in a short time.He adjusted the tour to meet our time constraints in a very professional and efficient manner, ensuring we would meet our cruise departure on time.Don and Leslie Prior

Jamie was a great guide. I had a great half-day tour with Jamie. I really appreciate that he agreed to start our tour early (7 a.m.!) so I could see some of Hong Kong before leaving. He was a wonderful and friendly companion and showed me so much in a short period of time. He also was a great source of information on the culture in Hong Kong as well as how their culture compares and contrasts to the mainland Chinese. I would recommend his tour highly to anyone wanting to see Hong Kong in a unique and special way.

Added value to the rest of our stay. My boyfriend and I were in Hong Kong last week and booked Jamie for a day tour. I discovered him through this site and then read more about what he offers on his website and in these reviews. I'm the last person on earth to take an organized tour but since I'd never been in Asia I felt like some local help would be nice. I ended up booking Jamie because what he offered sounded more like hanging out with a knowledgable local friend than a tour. Ends up, we couldn't have been more pleased and we had a fabulous time. Here are some reasons why: - We relaxed! The previous two days we were in town one of us had a map or our phone out (with a GPS aided map… if you have an unlocked phone and want to use data get a local sim card.. they are so cheap!) the whole time trying to figure out where we were/ where we were going etc. During our day with Jamie we relaxed and let him do the thinking. We spent our energy asking him questions and learning. - He helped us plan the rest our our week. We had a vague idea what we wanted to do so I asked Jamie to help us prioritize and figure out how to get to each place. By the end of our day together we knew where to pick up the busses and ferries we were going to use the rest of the week. It made the rest of our trip a lot more enjoyable. Although during our stay we never had trouble eventually finding our way about the city, having specific info from Jamie really helped "de-stress" our other day trips.- We went by, through, over, under and around (in HK there are hidden and not so hidden paths everywhere!) buildings, parks, statues, markets, etc. we would have never found on our own. - He's just a nice guy and is enjoyable to get to know.Bottom line, although we weren't really having trouble navigating the city on our own Jamie added value to our trip. I'd even book him again on a return trip just to be able to hang out with a local for a day and see what more he could help us discover.

Great and Kind Tour Guide. Jamie is an British expat that has been living in HK most of his adult life. Now retired he decided to offer tours and he does it in an excellent way. He is very knowledgeable and provided that insight in this former British colony, that only a British subject can do. Also, he is a very kind person. During our tour, our 14 year old daughter became ill. He had no problem rescheduling for a following day. When I asked him how much we owe him for this trouble, he declined any extra payment for his lost time on the first day.

Hong Kong Tailored to Fit. My husband and I had limited time for sightseeing in Hong Kong, tacking just three days on to the end of a work event outside the city. I scheduled our first evening in the city with Jamie and though I'd been a bit reluctant to spend the money on a private tour, we really agreed that we'd gotten our dollars worth. I had told Jamie that what we wanted to see most was what was left of "old Hong Kong" and although it is fast disappearing, he knew where it all was and so much about it! He had a great feel for what would interest us and we ended up visiting places I'm sure we never would have without him. We covered LOTS of ground in our five hrs.,which was exactly what I wanted. If I had wanted to slow down he would have done that, too. He also filled us in on so much about the rest of the city, how to use the transportation, what else we might like best to do in the next two days when we didn't have him leading us about and what wasn't worth spending our time on, that it was really Value Added. I highly recommend a tour with him in the beginning of your time there as it will make the rest of it that much better. He was also quite accommodating about scheduling and I was very impressed with his immediate response to emails. He is a man who knows and loves his city and has an opinion about all of it which made for some lively conversation along the way!

Jamie's Walking Tours. A tour with Jamie as your guide is really a 'must do' when in Hong Kong. He is flexible, extremely knowledgeable, and a very nice person who provides a unique insight and experience of Hong Kong for the visitor.My wife and I were newly married in Hong Kong and it was also our first visit. We thoroughly enjoyed being with Jamie and intend to do other tours with him whenever we visit Hong Kong again.A unique and wonderful experience.Big thanks Jamie for everything.

Excellent walking tour. I went to Hongkong with my friends and we had a great day with Jamie. He helped us explore the real Hongkong and explained to us the things that we need to know. He is very nice, welcoming and he even shared to us some stories of his personal life. It was definitely worth the money that we spent for the tour and I think that my whole Hongkong trip will not be the same if Jamie isn't part of it. Will definitely have a tour with him again when I come back to Hongkong with my parents. Thanks a lot Jamie (also on the ice cream)!

Getting the lay of the land.... My family and I had a great day with Jamie. He demystified the subway and currency system, and showed us attractions that were suited to what we were looking for. He brought a comfortable approach and helped set our expectations for the rest of the trip. He also recommended a fabulous restaurant, and was available to answer questions that came up days after the tour. Thank you!

A great tour. On a 4 day visit to Hong Kong I wanted to spend a day with a tour guide to see some of the sights I would not see just by following a guidebook, to get some first-hand knowledge of life and culture in Hong Kong, and to acclimated to the city and see how people who live there navigate and get around. Jamie's tour was absolutely perfect on all counts. He's full of interesting and useful information. Every place we went was well worth it. He was very happy to adapt the speed and content of the tour to my interests. He's a great guy to spend a day with, and after finishing the tour I felt like I understood Hong Kong much, much better than I would have just navigating on my own or sightseeing as part of a big group tour. It also made my remaining solo sightseeing a lot more successful than it would have been without the tour. Thanks, Jamie!

A Great Day with Jamie in Hong Kong. My husband and I spent a day in Hong Kong with Jamie. We were not disappointed. This was our third trip to Hong Kong but with Jamie, we saw parts of Hong Kong that we hadn't seen before. Jamie is smart and well-versed in all things Hong Kong. We ask a lot of questions and there wasn't anything he didn't know the answer to. We had a very fun day that included a lovely lunch at one of Hong Kong's most popular Chinese restaurants. The day ended with a spectacular walk around Victoria Peak to a spot that I didn't even know existed. The views were amazing. I highly recommend spending time with Jamie and seeing Hong Kong without the tour bus! Although we did a day tour, next time I plan on hiring him for one of his night tours of Hong Kong. Thanks Jamie for a great day-- Jerry and Mark.

Jos & Co In Hong Kong with Jamie. My friends and I really enjoyed our intro to Hong Kong courtesy of Jamie. We covered a lot of ground and saw an amazing variety of sights and locations. Jamie is great company, full of fascinating and often funny information about everything Hong Kong. The rest of our holiday was so much more enjoyable because we followed so many of Jamie's suggestions. Great fun all round!

Great walking tour to get you up to speed with HK. I have come to realize that one of the best things you can do when getting off the plane in a new city is to hit the streets with a local guide...on foot or bike, its a great way to get your bearings and a look at things from a local perspective.So, came across Jamie's tour and is great. Jamie very personable, and will build a tour to meet your needs. Lots of good info, and was very easy to organize and arrange. So if heading to HK, plan a walking tour to get your feet wet and the blood circulating again after your long flight! Cheers.

Mystery Tour. What a marvellous mystery tour Jamie took me on, great day for walking, beautiful sights and scenery, also interesting sights tourist don't get to see. A far better way to see and hear facts about Hongkong than going on a group bus tour. Great value and a most enjoyable memorable time- thanks heaps Jamie- Beryl
Day Tour with Jamie. We spent a day with Jamie touring Hong Kong and felt that we had covered a lot of territory and had a good feel for the city. Definitely worth the money.

Hongkong visit. We really enjoyed our HK trip. We spent our first day with Jamie. Jamie is very professional and friendly. He was patient (we had two young, jetlagged kids with us) and went along with our pace, showing us interesting things and answering our questions. Thanks for the great time, Jamie

If you are seeking a boring commercial tour - DON'T read this. Wow what a tour. We certainly had a magical mystery tour! I have taken the commercial tours before and never again. Jamie showed us so many amazing areas of HK and the best way to get around HK. Jamie is such a professional and really knows his stuff. We learnt so much, laughed a lot and yes hit the pavement. I would highly recommend Jamie to anyone wanting to see the real HK without the tour buses and cheap souvenirs.

Perfect Holiday. We really enjoyed our time in Hong Kong with Jamie! We spent 2 days walking all over Hong Kong with him and he made every effort to make our time in Hong Kong as enjoyable and strees free as possible.Highly recommended!

Jamie's Day Tour of Hong kong. We were on a cruise and had 2 days in Hong Kong. I had read about Jamie's tours on Trip Advisor but I was worried in case there was too much walking for us as we are not in the first flush of youth. We need not have worried as he assured me that he would tailor the tour to our requirements and this is what he did. He was bang on time when he met us where our shuttle bus had dropped us off. He bought us Seniors' Octopus cards and we used these for all our travel over that day and the next + entrance for the Peak . We got a refund on the unused part of the card so in the end it all only cost about £6.To start with he took us on the MTR subway from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and we made a few changes ( so easy with someone who knows where to go) and we ended up at Diamond Hill. We went to visit the Chi Lin Nunnery and Gardens. Now this was a huge coincidence as it was where I had wanted to go but I had said nothing about it because I had thought that it was right out on a limb. It was a beautiful, peaceful place with a few visitors. The whole place was immaculate and really well looked after. Outside the gardens were well laid out and well planted and inside the temples were magnificent. Everything gleamed, even the fruit in bowls which had been placed by the nuns as offerings to the Gods gleamed. It was a lovely place to visit and even after seeing lots of temples in different counties during the previous weeks we were really impressed by the huge golden Buddhas beneath a canopy of gold.Jamie then took us on the Metro again to visit a completely different temple, SIk Sik Yuen Wongtai Sing, which the local Chinese use only at New year. It was full of mainland Chinese. They came to visit the fortune tellers there, to seek messages from the Gods by shaking special sticks out of boxes and to visit the matrimony God where they tied red strings to a rope.We had lunch in the Tsimshatsui shopping district at a restaurant used by the local families. Jamie ordered for us and we had a superb meal.We took the Star Ferry back Hong Kong and then a bus up to the Peak. This in itself was quite hair raising as we had an F1 driver and we sat in the front seat upstairs. Jamie pointed out places of interest which included the McClaren shop complete with sports car and F1 car in the window next to a Rolls Royce shop. The whole of the time Jamie was pointing things out or answering our questions. He was a mine of information. He told us about life in Hong Kong, the houses, the jobs, the people and so on. Yes. We could have done all this by ourselves. But no, we could not have done it all in one day without an awful lot of research beforehand into bus numbers and train stations etc. We certainly would not have had all the interesting background information he gave us. We should have missed an awful lot without his help. He showed us where we could get the bus to Stanley Market the next day and we then led the way for a group of other passengers.He did not rush us but we crammed a lot in besides the main things I have listed.He is a very helpful and personable person and I would recommend him to friends. It was not cheap for just the two of us for 8 hours but it was money well spent and we have so many memories of that day.

J3 Private Tours Hong Kong. We recently had the pleasure of taking this tour with Jamie. We were 4 adults and 2 children, ages 10 and 12. The tour was excellent and comprehensive and Jamie is delightful. He took us on buses, subways,ferry and walks through areas of Hong Kong that we would have missed on a bus tour. We had a limited amount of time in Hong Kong and we felt that this was an excellent way to see as much as possible in the time alotted.....and we were right. I highly recommend this tour to anyone coming to Hong Kong .....Jamie really knows his city......Thank You Jamie.Linda and Dennis West,New York, USA

Great Tour at night in Hong Kong. My husband are just back from 4 days in Hong Kong. We thought it would be great to start out with an evening tour. We read Trip Advisor months before our trips and we cam upon Jamie with J3 Private Tours . We arranged a 6 hour night tour the first night we were in Hong Kong. Jamie picked us up at our hotel and off we went on foot. He advised us to have our Octopus card and some small bills and coins. We took the subway, the ferry and taxis. We were staying on Hong Kong island, so we visited Kowloon and also went to top of the peak. The night was crystal clear so everyone with a camera was at the top of the peak. A storm was brewing, so we got great pictures of all the lights of Hong Kong. Unfortunatly, my husband was sick and we wore him out before the 6 hours was up. We felt like we were locals after all the tips Jamie gave us that night. I can say that Jamie made a great start to our short time in Hong Kong.

Hong Kong Guide. We booked an 8 hour tour of Hong Kong with Jamie of J3 Private tours. It turned out to be the hottest day of the year which may have slowed us down a bit. We were pleased with what Jamie was able to show us of the city in the time we had. He was knowledgeable and very accommodating. The conversations we were able to have with just the guide and the two of us helped to expand the over all view we got of Hong Kong and its history.

Three cheers for J3 tours.. First of all, sorry for taking so long to write a review.We hired Jamie for an 8 hour tour in February 2012. To be honest we were slightly apprehensive being two relative youngsters ( 35 and 42) regarding value for money; how wrong we were!Jamie was brilliant, the tour was worth every HKD. Jamie took us totally off the beaten track, let us experience the real HK. We even went to the Peak at 9pm, which was an awesome experience.Do not hesitate to book, it is SO worth it.

Memorable trip - around Hongkong with Jamie. Jamie was informative, fun and very accommodating.we took our time and enjoyed commuting on foot, the tramp, MTR and the Ferry.The Nunnery was gorgeous, peaceful. The view at the Peak was breathtaking.Had lunch at a very nice restaurant suggested by Jamie.We booked Jamies services for 8 hours but he stayed with us longer. we (myself, my daughter and a friend) laughed alot, learnt alot and overall had a wonderful time.Will definitely recommend Jamie to friends and family visiting HKG.-- Thank you Jamie --

Relaxed and informative. I booked Jamie after finding him via Tripadvisor. We were just in HK for one day en route from London to Auckland so we wanted to make the most of our time there. He checked before we arrived what we were interested in and was at the airport waiting for us. The day was perfect - we saw everything we had wanted to see and more. He went just at the right pace and gave just the right sort of information. Felt relaxed and at the end of the day he took us back to the airport. My 15-year old daugter also enjoyed the day - what more can I say..........

More fun than Disney! More informative than Google!. My two children (11 and 8) and I had two tours with Jamie, one of 8 hours and one which ended up being 12 hours. After a wonderful holiday that had included the Venetian, Disney and Ocean Park, it says a lot that this was the absolute highlight of our trip (and the kids even spontaneously thanked me for booking the tours)! While the kids and I were all ready to move on after 6 hours at the theme parks, there was still high energy levels and a reluctance for the day to end after 12 hours with Jamie! (again, with kids, that says a lot!) For both tours Jamie met us promptly at our hotel. We then travelled around by walking, on MTR, buses, and ferry, covering Kowloon on the first day, and Hong Kong Island on the second. The days flowed very smoothly and were perfectly in line with our interests. Jamie had information and observations about everything, which made the experience so much richer, and we learnt so much and enjoyed so much that we never could've alone, on a bus tour, or even with many private tour guides (more on this below). It was also great to have questions answered on everything I saw (on everything from the patterns of other tourists we saw to rents, houses, school, culture, people and places and anything else you can think of). It really did make the difference between ticking the boxes of places seen and having a truly satisfying travel experience.We did have another highly rated private tour guide one night earlier on as Jamie was booked up, and while a pleasant experience there was a huge difference between the two. While with the other all the information I had seen on a travel show, with Jamie it was the sort of information that really does take both a long time living in Hong Kong and a keen sense of observation to come by. He was also amazing with the kids, and in tailoring the tour to suit them - while with the other I was embarrassed by how often the question 'how much longer' was asked by them, with Jamie they were happy and interested the entire day, and reluctant for the day to end!Jamie was kind enough to write about our tour on his website at the request of my kids (they are the 'angelic she-devils), and that shows just a handful of the highlights. We saw many of the mainstream sights such as the nunnery and gardens and market, and many that we would not have thought to see on our own but absolutely loved. With everything we saw, thanks to Jamie we could gain an understanding of what was going on which made it so much more interesting. As well as being knowledgeable and planning a great day, Jamie is also great company. I can be quite antisocial and generally want to escape people after a few hours, but in the case of Jamie he was very comfortable to be around and such great company that we would've rather had him with us every day. The kids just loved him, and are still talking about how great he is, and that it was 'epic' and 'the best'.I will definitely tour with Jamie again next time I am in Hong Kong, whether with kids or alone, and would recommend it to anyone (and will arrange it myself for my mum when she visits if she doesn't herself).

Please ignore that one terrible review, here I'd like to say... First, I'm a travel agent and being a female solo traveller sometimes. Normally, I don't write any review, but I'd like to do it for Jamie and share it on TripAdvisor.I contacted Jamie after reading reviews from TripAdvisor. Though, it'd be my 9th trip in Hong Kong. I was very keen to know how excellent he was and learn things from him. I can say without any hesitation that Jamie's a KIND, SINCERE and EASY GOING person. I enjoy walking and taking time to look around. Unfortunately, I had sore legs from another walking tour (not with Jamie) a day before. Jamie could customise the tour which was suitable for me, a 5 hour easy relaxing walking tour. It's very pleasant and fun to spend time with Jamie, for examples, he showed me the best viewpoint of The Peak which's a stunning spot with memorable story related to his childhood. Thank you for taking me there, I totally forgot I'd sore legs and actually did a walking tour as I planned.He accompanied me to buy Tiger Balm for my sore legs (as my request) and also walked with me to The Peninsula Hong Kong to make sure I could buy its special tea back home. I wish he is always being my teacher for being an excellent private tour guide.From my experience, you can ignore that one terrible review. It's a fraud. You can book Jamie's private tour with confidence. Enjoy spending your time in Hong Kong with people there.

Wonderful Tour of Hong Kong. We found Jamie on Trip Advisor and had an amazing time on our tour. Booking the tour with Jamie was very easy, and he was always responsive to our emails. Our walking tour with Jamie was on our third day in Hong Kong, so we had already done some sightseeing on our own. Jamie worked out an itinerary that was tailored to our interests and would ensure we saw different parts of the city that we had not already seen. The Peak was amazing at night and a highlight of the tour! Would highly recommend Jamie to anyone wanting a knowledgealble, personable guide for Hong Kong.

The only way to see Hong Kong. I found Jamie on trip advisor and I am glad I decided to use him for our tour it was our first trip to Hong Kong and it was over welming with out Jamie we would have sat in a pub and not moved far from our hotel Jamie gave us a great tour and I would highly recomend him. you will feel safe with JamieD Bennett

The way Hong Kong should be experienced!. I had the good fortune to find Jamie on Trip Advisor and I am grateful that I did, what a great experience!I was travelling through Hong Kong on business and decided to stay an extra couple of days to get a sense for the city. Being somewhat pressed for time, I decided that a guided tour was the best way to get the greatest amount of value from my short time in Hong Kong. I tend to do my own walking tours when time permits, so I knew that a commercial "big bus" type tour just wasn't going to do it. I wanted to experience Hong Kong the way it should be experienced... and that is EXACTLY what I got.My contact with Jamie started by e-mail and it was a very pleasant experience. E-mails were returned promptly, there was no pressure, and advice was dispensed freely. Great for planning your trip. I chose a 5 hour private evening tour. Unfortunatley, the weather on the day we were scheduled to go out was frightful. Jamie showed up at my hotel at the appointed time and offered to cancel or re-schedule if I didn't want to deal with the monsoon like conditions. I took him up on his offer and we decided to go out the following evening (great choice!).The tour on the following day was fabulous. It is worth mentioning that while Jamie is British, he has been living in Hong Kong since 1972. He knows the city the way only a native would and that, makes a huge difference! We visited local markets; made the customary pilgrimage to "The Peak" (more on that later) where we enjoyed amazing night time views; explored the nightlife that Hong Kong offers its local citizens, and; took a trip into the seedier side of the city (all very safe, but a great part of the experience). I really feel I saw Hong Kong the way it should be seen!I said I would say a few more words about the visit to The Peak. Frankly, this part of the tour exemplifies why choosing Jamie is the only way to go. To appreciate why, consider that every year, more than 40 Million visitors come to Hong Kong and just about every one of them finds their way to The Peak (Victoria Peak as it is known to tourists). Most visitors take the Peak Tram which involves long line ups each way. Once you reach the top, you fight your way through the crowds in the "shopping centre / viewing platform" to get a 90 degree view of the light filled city below. That's the way 99.9% of visitors see it. With Jamie, we took a taxi to the top (elapsed time about 10-15 minutes) once we got there, we took a short walk down a very pleasant street lined with US$40-60 million mansions which led us to a spot where we had the world's most spectacular view of the city below - less time to get there, spectacular view (180 degrees), zero crowds. You won't get that from a guidebook!I left the city feeling like I experienced the real Hong Kong, something I could not have done without Jamie.Jamie, thanks for an amazing experience! Maybe next time around I'll rent a 911 Turbo and we can experience the city from a different point of view! ;-)Martin

A Wonderful Intro to Hong Kong. I would highly recommend anyone new to Hong Kong take a walking tour with Jamie. He tailored the day to my interests and had lots of information about the people and places we visited. I really appreciated learning how to use the MTR and learning exactly where to go for the best view of the harbour lights. We covered lots of ground but always at my pace which I also really appreciated. Thanks for a great day Jamie

Two thumbs up for this great tour!. Jamie took on a tough assignment with our family of two adults and three small, noisy and very energetic children - and came up trumps!We had 4 days in Hong Kong but wanted to spend a day away from the normal tourist trail and theme parks. Jamie was able to tailor our full day out, off the cuff, after meeting us and having a quick chat.His tour was humourous, interesting and a perfect fit for our family. Jamie managed to blend in history, culture and some of the bizarre and fantastic along the way! Although we were always on the move, Jamie was able to weave in rest spots, down-time and also some wonderful food (our kids are still talking about the Chinese fortune sticks and those amazing dumplings!) He was great with the children and lent a watchful eye when moving between crowds and on the MTR. We really enjoyed Jamie's great anecdotes and appreciated his recommendations on how to spend the rest of our stay. Our family all enjoyed our day out very much and would recommend his tour highly. Thanks very much Jamie - I hope we see you again!

like a good friend showing you round. My wife and I visited Hong Kong in March and booked a one day tour with Jamie.We were having a stopover between flights and wanted to get an overview of the sights, shopping, dining, etc so we could plan future return trips and have some idea how and where to get around ourselves. Jamie is so easy going, and was excellent company as we used train, ferry, and taxi to give us a great overview of Hong Kong. We left the itinerary up to Jamie but as we travelled about we mentioned things we would like to see or do if possible, including local food for lunch, some shops and hotels, and Jamie worked all this in to our day.We were quite unfamiliar with the public transport system so Jamie made sure we understood how it works and by the end of the day we were confident enough to make our own way around via the train. The tour was exactly what we were looking for. If you are looking for a friendly knowledgeable guide that knows Hong Kong inside out you could not do better than booking Jamie for a tour.

Fantastic Way To See The Best Hong Kong Has to Offer. Had a great day out with Jamie. Booking a tour with Jamie is a great way to see Hong Kong at its best and to see some of the customs which are so very different to what we have in the UK. From the peace & quite of the nunnery to the crazy fish/meat markets and the amazing views, it really is the best way to see Hong Kong. I wish there was a Jamie in all cities around the world! I had a limited time in Hong Kong and probably saw within 6 hours what would have taken me two days to see by myself and even then I am not conviniced that I would have found some of the amazing places Jamie took me to. The mixture of walking and using public transport worked very well and the pace was just right. The tour was excellent value for money and I would recommend it to anyone.

A great day out with Jamie. Being a tourist is not all about checking off ‘must visit’ places. It is more about the people one meets and the comments they make about their patch that adds another layer of texture to the travel experience. With limited time (we were in Hong Kong for the Rugby Sevens) getting a different perspective and visiting less traveled attractions was for us the way to go. Getting out and walking the streets of Hong Kong was another objective. One day with Jamie, hearing his insights into his home town of many years was a day well spent. Jamie’s knowledge of Hong Kong is remarkable, as too is his ability to negotiate public transport systems to ensure that you experience Hong Kong as a local does. As with anything you pay for what you get. In this instance the views of an expatriate Hong Kong lifer whose love of Hong Kong and real gift of sharing anecdotes about its past, present and future transcends that of a day alone with a guide book and a map.

Hong Kong Second Time Around. We visited Hong Kong almost 30 years ago and this time took an all day walking tour with Jamie. It was a great way to cover a lot of ground without having to do a lot of advance planning or constantly consulting maps for directions. Jamie took us to worthwhile stops that we would not have visited on our own. In addition to his "surprises" he was flexible and incorporated what we wanted to add. Good exercise, good information and good company, his extensive knowledge of the city saved us time and we were not disappointed in our very full day.

Buyer's Remorse. Overpriced and over-promised. After reading all the positive reviews I signed up, thankful Jamie could fit me in to his busy schedule. However, after the tour was complete I felt I had only seen locations and heard information I could have obtained from any basic guidebook. I was hoping to visit a Hong Kong I couldn't find in a guidebook, but did not, we even ate at the most popular Dim Sum chain restaurant in the city! Save your $3000 HK and spend a few dollars on a city map and see the sights on your own. Huge disappointment :-(

An honest insight into Hong Kong. This tour was definitely a highlight of our trip. Jamie showed us a Hong Kong that no guide books can show you - it was from the perspective of a local who re Hong Kong for all its quirks, which was extremely refreshing. We visited temples and gardens, where Jamie highlighted the seemingly ridiculous and hilarious aspects of Hong Kong culture. We were in fits of laughter!The restaurant he recommended was absolutely delicious - we ate there twice afterwards!The tour ended with a taxi ride to “the peak”, where Jamie took us to his favourite look out spot, where no other tourist was present. We had a personal view of the entire city of Hong Kong. It was simply extraordinary.Jamie’s personal and jovial demeanor, and his intimate knowledge of the city proved to be an absolute winning combination. In the 9 hours we spent with him, we gained an honest insight into this seemingly superficial city. All in all, Jamie was fantastic, and we could have spent the entire week with him.

HONG KONG WALKABOUT.. So easy to arrange via internet our 5 hour walkabout,Jamie was a most pleasant and informative guide,very responsive to our requests for areas/locations to visit,his knowledge of Hong Kong was impressive.Jamie was very easy to get on with,we enjoyed his company as well as his chatty commentary.His love of his job and that of Hong Kong was obvious.This was a highlight of our trip.Must pencil in a repeat for next trip to Hong Kong.

Easy and relaxing. Its super easy to book a guided tour with Jamie was just a with email exchange. Although, we have been to HK many times but always as a tourist visiting touristy place, this time we wanted to experience where 'real' people live. Jamie took us exactly to those place. Graveyards, nunnery, back alleys, momuements ...etc. thank you Jamie for a enjoyable 8hrs!

Seemed like this tour was designed just for us!. My teenage son and I met Jamie promptly as we had organized via brief emails and had a fantastic whirlwind full day tour of Honk Kong. Jamie was very intuitive and took us to a variety of spots that were exactly matched to both our interests. We are a hard act to please, as I am in the art business and we also have very high standards for food - coming from New York City. Jamie never disappointed us as we followed him across the entire city from temples to the beach, hopping on every possible mode of transportation (apart from taxis!). The day flew by and we felt not only had we a good grasp on the city but an excellent day seeing sites we never would have found on our own. Jamie is easy to get along with - entertaining, opinionated, knowledgeable and intuitive. I will recommend him him to anyone I know going to Hong Kong. Thanks Jamie!

Top class tour with an excellent guide!. Our private tour with J3 Private Tours was the highlight of our first visit to Hong Kong back in January 2012. The guide Jammie Lloyd is very interesting guy, a gentleman and a scholar. He has a great depth of knowledge of everything Hong Kong. Jamie has lived in Hong Kong for 36 years and so has a broad prespective of the city and how it has developed. He is also up to date on everything going on in the city both socially and politically. Jamie gives detailed answers to questions that the average bus tour guide would brush over or change the subject when asked. My wife and I enjoyed the 10 hour tour a lot and the time passed very quickly as we went from place to place and got a real feel for Hong Kong. Jamie is very easy to get along with and we could instantly see why his tours get great reviews as he can relate to his clients no matter what their status or background. He took us lots of places both on the Hong Kong and the Kowloon sides as well as on a bus ride to Aberdeen and Stanley (at our request) on the south coast of the island. We also went to the Peak with him in the rain and saw the lights of the city from above. It was great to see the back streets of Hong Kong and go to places we would probably never have venture into if going alone. For lunch Jamie took us to Din Tai Fung which is an excellent, clean and inexpensive resturant that is highly rated on Tripadvisor. One of the great advantages of going on the tour with Jame is that he knows exactly what to do and where to go and more importantly how to get there. Simple things like the best place to catch the taxis with shortest wait or what side of the street to catch the bus on can be so important and make the day much more enjoyable. If you go it alone sure you can do it but it will take you days to figure it out. Jamie does not take tour guests to stores or outlets and in no way pushes you to buy or do anything. He is more than happy to suggest the best place to buy something and help you if you so request.
