On the tour you have Jamie's full and undivided attention unlike some tour guides who are on their phone half of the tour. We have very high standards when it comes to tours and guides (we hate bus tours and their bad comedy show tour guides) and Jamie really impressed us and we enjoyed the tour a lot. We celebrated his birthday at the end of our tour with a cocktail back at the bar of our hotel, the Shangri-la.So if you are in Hong Kong for days or just a few hours and want to get a real feel for the city we could suggest no better way to do it than to book a tour with J3 Tours and Jamie Lloyd. Another tour with Jamie will be top of our "to do list" next time we stop in Hong Kong.

An easy paced day exploring.. We had a wonderful day out with Jamie. What we appreciated the most about our tour with Jamie was experiencing parts of Hong Kong we hadn't considered or known about. Taking us to Wong Tai Sin Temple where he was able to explain the religious culture of the area which proved to us how valuable it was to have own tour guide rather than roaming around aimlessly. Another highlight for us was lunch, we ate at Din Tai Fung, oh yum! It was delicious, clean and great value for money. We ate their a couple more times during our stay in Hong Kong. I highly recommend a day out with Jamie, his advice was invaluable the four remaining days in Hong Kong. He gave us confidence to use the MTR at any time of night or day. It was a pleasure for us to meet Jamie. ( if you read this Jamie, change your profile picture as you look younger in real life!)

A great introduction to a bustling city...... I had a great time with Jamie. I was taken to out of the way places that I wouldn't have found for myself and got the flavour of a vibrant and potentially overwhelming city. Jamie's introduction to HK life, travel tips and recommendations set the platform for what was to be an amazingly enjoyable three day stay. Many thanks!

A very special and super way to experience Hong Kong. If you are looking to spend a few hours in Hong Kong and don't want to do the regular bus thing, this tour is the best! It was especially great after spending 20 hours on a plane the previous day to get out on foot and see the city as the locals see it. Jamie was GREAT - we saw sights that we would have never found nor did we know about; even had time to ride the Star Ferry, and take in a great dim sum lunch!

FANTASTIC tour with Jamie - this is a HK must do!. We recently visited Hong Kong for my fathers 60th Birthday. There were 6 of us on the tour, some had already been to Hong Kong and for others it was their first time. Jamie met us at our hotel and from the word 'go' he was an absolute pleasure to be with. We had a truly fantastic day and saw great things that we'd have no doubt missed had we not been shown them by Jamie. He was informative and great company. The information was really interesting and it really felt like he was just another member of the group. We had a wonderful lunch together and saw so many great things. An excellent way to start our trip! We even contacted Jamie on our last day to see if he'd recommend a restaurant for us. He did and it was EXCELLENT. Can't wait to visit HK again and book another tour :)

Very Knowledgable Tour Guide. My partner and I spent a full day touring Hong Kong. Our request to Jamie was to take us to see things that we would have difficulty finding or getting to on our own and leave the easy stuff (such as going to the peak in a cab) for us to do the following day. He certainly knew his way around Hong Kong as he never missed a beat, using the subway, city buses and star ferry to take us to all the sites. He filled the day with an awesome tour. We saw interesting religious shrines, historic buildings and places, amazing scenery and had a great lunch. Jamie's knowledge of Hong Kong culture/religion/history and politics is amazing. There didn't seem to be a question he couldn't answer. We highly recommend his services for anyone visiting Hong Kong. Whether you have a specific plan in mind or just leave it up to him I have no doubt he will provide you with an amazing experience.

Fantastic way to get off the beaten path in Hong Kong!!. Hired Jamie for a 5 hour evening tour on a Sunday. Was only in Hong Kong for a day. I had walked around earlier in the day but this tour really allowed me to see how the city lives. Jamie even took me to a spot at the Peak that did not have all of the tourists. Fortunate for us it was one of the few days that was crystal clear. Walked through different neighborhoods and areas via public transport. Overall just a wonderful time and I have a new friend in Hong Kong. If you are going to be in Hong Kong make sure you hire Jamie to show you around Hong Kong!!

The Best first day experience in HK. Jamie met us at hotel and we were off to see HK. Our first stop was to get an Octopus pass that gets you on all forms of transport. We saw things and learned facts about the city and it's People that you could not possibly get with any other tour. From the rather bizzar temple to a tremendous dim sum lunch to Victoria Peak, taking the trains and riding the Star ferry......This is the best way to get acquainted with this wonderful city. When we go back to HK we will contact Jamie of another infusion of the real Hong Kong. Thanks Jamie!Roger and Judy BendetFountain Hills, Az.

A great introduction to the city. A group of business students met up with Jamie for a tour of the city yesterday. We received an excellent introduction to the city and were introduced to some interesting attractions that we would have missed otherwise. We really enjoyed stopping for Dim Sum at a great spot at lunchtime (additional cost) and ended day with a few hours of shopping - nice! We arrived safely back at the hotel after a great introduction and now have the Octopus card and will be traveling the MTR system on our own. Thanks Jamie for a great day - it was enjoyed by everyone in the group.

Best Introduction to Hong Kong. We had 1 day to see Hong Kong and were very pleased with Jamie Lloyd. My partner and parents (age 73) were given a fantastic introduction to this amazing city. Jamie met us at our hotel right on-time. We used multiple modes of transportation including the ferry, tram, MTR (subway), and taxi. Jamie delivered an exceptional experience and was kind enough to include a visit to a tailor and silk market, at our request. His knowledge of Hong Kong's history, culture, politics, religions, and mystery were appreciated. You don't get this kind of personal attention on a large group tour.Thank you, Jamie, well done! Highly recommended.

The Best Way to see Hong Kong. My Daughter and I booked a trip with Jamie to see and photograpth Kowloon. We booked a five hour morning tour. In a nut shell Jamie did a fantastic job of showing us around, getting our bearings, and had a wealth of local knowledge that you just don't get from guide books or large tour groups. Jamie sense of humor was evident in his commentry of our surrondings. If you visit Hong Kong book a tour with Jamie for the first day if possible, he will get you aquanted with the transit system, and give you lots of tips for the rest of your visit.

An adventure, an exerience and a friendship - its what travelling is all about. Ive been to Hong Kong several times but for my family it was the first visit so I wanted them to really enjoy themselves. We met Jaime on our first day in Kowloon and it was a grey and overcast day so not the ideal day for a walk about however Jaime arrived al siles and full of energy and enthusiasm to meet the group. We had an interesting mix for him to manage & to entertain 3 adults, 3 teenagres and 3 infants (triplets) and his advise to me before meeting was dont worry let me meet the group and I'll plan a perfect trip.True to his word he did from the get go Jaime made himself part of us and it became more like a family day out rather than a tour and the weather became an irrelevance. We travelled on the Star Ferry to the Island which was a big adventure for the 2 year olds as was the following hop on the bus to Stanley where everyone had a good time including my 12 year old son who we had to drag away from the electronic gadgets. Then on to a great Dim Sum lunch at Maxims Tea House after which my wife and I took the younger children back to the hotel to nap but Jaime took the older girls under his wing and headed off past Kowloon for another adventure at the Ladies Market (muchto one of the triplets disappointment as Jaime had become his new best friend and he didnt want him to go). In the end what started as simply tour became the start of a friendship I hope will continue on future visits to Hong Kong. Jaime went over and beyond my expectations as our 5 hours for my teenagers & nanny turned into a whole day of adventure as after my wife & I said farewell to him he safely guided them to new destinations and showed them how to safely get home. During the day Jaime was an encycolpaedia of knowledge on Hong Kong and shared many fascinating insights off the beaten path I couldnt recommend him more highly.

We had a fantastic visit to HK in a very short period of time. We had only two days in Hong Kong and decided to take a one-day tour to make the most of it. Jamie was an excellent tour guide and managed to adapt to our needs and make good suggestions. He was very knowledgeable and provided top quality background on the history, life and sites of HK.We highly recommend him.

Great way to see Hong Kong using excellent mass transit system.... Jamie Lloyd met us at our hotel precisely on time for our tour. He presents very well and is easy to be with. He was patient and the tour was not stressful. We proceeded to the subway station where he had me by Oyster Cards for each member of our family. This proved invaluable as it got us on the subways, bus and even some attractions. Very efficient. At the end of the tour I got a refund for the deposit and the unused balance.At lunch time he took us to the best Dim Sum restaurant I have ever been to. I picked up the tab which was my pleasure.Mr. Lloyd knows how to get around and brought us to many interesting places. My only suggestion is that he should perhaps offer a little more factual information regarding the places he brings us to. For instance, we went to the Chi Lin Nunnery in Kowloon but never mentioned that this impressive place was built without the use of any nails.Also, if you have a poodle do not mention it to Mr. Lloyd. We have two and it was kind of embarrassing because our guide had an unfortunate experience with a poodle which apparently left its mark. I would recommend Mr. Lloyd without reservation.

We highly recommend Jamie's tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong for the first time!. Overall this was a great tour and was everything we expected and more!Jamie was very prompt with his emails and arrangements for the day, we probably arranged it with about 3 weeks notice.He is genuinely friendly and easy to get along with. He arrived on time and got us organized with an octopus card and taught us the basics of the rail system. He also offered us insights into the best way to get to different locations. This alone was worth the price of the tour!He tailored the tour to suit our needs and took us to a variety of places that are not in any tourist guide.Thanks Jamie for a great day.Harley and Lisa

Day with J3 Private Tours. Jamie was a very friendly gentleman who organised and explained the Octopus Travel Card. We visited the Nunnary, Ladies Market and had a lovely Yum Cha lunch. However when we got to the Bird & Flower Markets we found these closed due to the Chinese New Year Celebrations. We had some questions which Jamie did not know the answer to but he said he would investergate this for us and get back to us via email which he did the very next day. I would recommend J3 Tours

SIMPLY THE BEST!!!. Jamie provided what I can only describe as a superb tour of Hong Kong. The day included part walking and part public transport. (buy an Octopus card from any MTR station with extra credit).We were taken to places that we would never of found on our own IE.A local fresh fish market for instance.Gruesome but necessary viewing to really get an idea of the local culture. As important it gave us the confidence to explore on our own for the rest of our time in Hong Kong.We recommend anyone visiting for the first time to book Jamie and he will take you on a tour that suits your own interests as well as throwing in a couple of surprises.

Taylor made tour. Exactly what we asked for.. For many years we have said that we should get ourselves a private tour guide when we are on our travels. This time we were visiting Hong Kong so we thought we really ought to as our knowledge of this destination was basically zero. We found Jamie online and after answering all our questions fully and promptly we booked him. We were in HK for 5 days so we booked Jamie for day one as a get to know HK tour. How to get about, where to eat and not to eat and most importantly to us we wanted see HK off the well beaten tourist routes, after all any tourist can find the major tourist destinations. Jamie was fantastic!Picking us up at our hotel, bang on time, he showed us how to get on the local mini buses, how to get our octopus card, how to use the MTR, even better how to find the MTR stations, cause that's not as easy as you would think.He took us to a couple of temples and nunneries that only warranted a line in our rough guide book but were an absolute joy to see.We ate at a great restaurant again we'd have never found without him. But best of all the back street food markets. Not the tourist trapping ones selling mountains of tat but the live fish and chicken type street markets. An amazing city made all the more amazing by Jamie.He was friendly, polite, funny and a joy to be with all day.If you want to see Hong Kong and you should! Book Jamie for a day. It will make the whole place easier to visit and really bring the place alive for you.Thank you Jamie for a wonderful day. Martin and Denise.

Great tour of one of the world's best cities!. I really can't recommend this trip enough& I've recommended it to all of my friends who are planning on visiting HK in the coming months!Although we had guide books, we would never have seen the amount that we did....esp. not in 6 hours! Nothing was too much trouble for Jamie, he even emailed me a planned schedule for the next day which happened to be New Year's Day! (without any extra charge)  Jamie was friendly and very informative. I don't think that there was a question that he couldn't answer. You really got the feeling that he loves his job - and why wouldn't he!  The Peak was a particular highlight for us and again, we would never have got there without his tips! (very obvious when you've been, upon reflection!) we would have queued along with the masses waiting for the tram!! Instead we followed his advice and saw it both day & night so got some excellent photographs!We loved every minute of the trip from the Chi Lin Nunnery to Wanchai market and of course after using the local transport, felt very confident to use it ourselves around the city. I strongly recommend that you take this trip if you want to make the most of your stay in Hong Kong.

Enjoyable and informative tour. My friend and I very much enjoyed our tour with Jaime. He showed us things we would not have found on our own and gave interesting commentary on the many buildings and sights. The highlights were the Buddhist nunnery and the local Hong Kong religion temple. It was a very unique and informative tour. Highly recommended.

Very Informative and Great Way to See HK. Firstly we have some restrictions due to our age/health but it was all taken into account and our private tour worked out to be a great way to see HK. Jamie was adaptable , friendly and a wealth of knowledge.

A great tour--tailored to my needs and interests. Jamie was all he claims to be and more. He met me at my hotel as scheduled, sized up my interests, and off we went. His commentary along the way is based on his long years as a Westerner living in Hong Kong and raising his family there. This was far more meaningful to me than any coach tour, with its scripted narrative, could have been.

an outstanding authentic experience of hong kong. For anyone wanting a genuine look at the culture and lifestyle of Hong Kong we could highly recommend sharing a day or two with Jamie. Not only does he present a knowledgeable tour tailored to his guests but he shares his advice on places to see, thing s to do and how to get around without the need for formal tour operators. We had a great day seeing the sights on Kowloon and Hong Kong island, tried most forms of public transport and had a likeable and engaging guide to share our experiences with. We would recommend this tour and Jamie in particular to anyone wishing to see Hong Kong

Just do it!!!. Jamie is a born guide: knowledgable, kind, responsive and intuitive. This was a splurge for us but well worth it. He went above and beyond to customize an itinerary for us and to show us a lovely time in Hong Kong. He gave us recommendations for the next day and after a day with him, we were much better equipped to go out on our own. The experiences were great and we had conversations that we felt privileged to have with someone who has lived in HK over 30 years. He really got us as a couple and the kind of day we needed. Well, it was perfect! I would trust him completely to build an itinerary for you. If you are considering or on the fence, I would say "Go for it!!" He really went above and beyond for us and we are grateful and so glad we booked him.

Great Market Experience!. Jamie was fantastic! He took me to all the great places to go in the markets- He was enthusiastic and engaged. I wanted to take some side adventures, and he completely adapted! Such a great time! I highly recommend!

Jamie helped us experience Hong Kong in a way that tourists rarely get to enjoy.. Jamie is the real deal and a guide we highly recommend and definitely would hire again. We traversed Hong Kong on public transportation with him for 10 hours and enjoyed every minute. I asked Jamie to show us the real Hong Kong. We traveled some distance to see and walk through two totally different kinds of towns in suburban Hong Kong - far removed from the glitz and wealth of the designer stores where people queue all day to spend money extravagantly. We had the best dim sum I've ever tasted and visited a fascinating nunnery that doesn't appear in any guidebooks. I rarely visit foreign cities twice, and so I had to totally educate myself during my two days there. While visiting several extraordinary sites, he educated us about politics, banking, the legal system, the economy, the school system and other topics as I peppered him with questions all day. While 10 hours can seem like a long time, Jamie paced our day nicely - that we enjoyed every experience and returned to our hotel with enough energy to enjoy a wonderful evening.

Honeymoon in Hong Kong. Excellent tour.The tour that Jamie gave us was an all day tour. Starting early in the morning we took the subway to go sightseeing.We had incredible views, we visited monasteries and visited all the important places in Hong Kong.A positive aspect about the tour was that we walked a lot, got to see the Kong Kong from a local perspective. He took us to the local places, places that mos tourists don´t go.Really recommend it!

Tours for the insecure. This trip was our first to Asia and to Hong Kong and we were going by ourselves. We wanted to start our visit with some help both on becoming more familiar with the city and its transportation system as well as possible places to visit, both "touristy" and not. After reading previous reviews about Jamie in this forum, we decided to spend our first day in this city with him. This turned out to be a wise decision.What was nice about having your own tour guide is that there is no set schedule. He did have plans for places to see and we did get to see them, but what was more valuable was the other information he provided. This included when to go to Macau and to the Giant Buddha, all of which was spot on. We became familiar with the transport system and ferries, and the use of the Oyster card (he did learn that they sold these cards now at the airport along with the Airport Express ticket). We were able to see the city from the standpoint of someone who had lived there for decades. All in all, the money spent was well worth it, especially for newbies such as ourselves. I imagine the biggest problem people will have is trying to book him.

Excellent Private Tour of Hong Kong. I booked the 8 hour tour with Jamie as it was my first time in HK. Jamie is an excellent tour guide, very knowledgeable and obviously knows his way around the city like no one else! He is very accommodating and you can ask him almost any number of questions that you have about HK. I did not request a specific itinerary so Jamie planned out a very organised day visiting the must-see places, with plenty of time to check out each place and get a few snaps. The best part for me was the view from The Peak that Jamie showed me. It was fantastic!I think that booking a tour with Jamie is a MUST for every first timer to HK. Thanks to Jamie, I was easily able to get around the city the next few days that I was there.

Very accommodating tour guide!!!. This is a review of an 8-hour personal tour that my mother and I took while visiting my brother in Hong Kong.Jamie is a very knowledgeable and friendly tour guide. He can literally tell you anything about Hong Kong. We loved his low key nature, and could not believe how accommodating he was. We had booked him for an 8-hour tour of the city and had planned on going to the top of Victoria Peak. The weather was just god awful, so instead of dragging us up there just to get it done, Jamie offered to meet with us the following day, after another tour he had scheduled, to take us up there. We ended up doing it on our own because we had an absolutely beautiful morning and nothing else planned, but we were very impressed with his offer. Even though we found Jamie to be an awesome tour guide, I think an 8-hour tour of Hong Kong may have been a bit of overkill. We had just come from spending two weeks in Beijing, Shanghai, and Xi'an, where having a tour guide is ESSENTIAL since no one in China speaks English, there is so much to see, and everyone is trying to take advantage of Americans so you need someone to look out for you. Hong Kong is completely different- almost everyone speaks English, there are not as many cultural sites as in China (we personally had been templed-out), and it's just easier to get around on your own. So I would definitely recommend booking with Jamie, but maybe not for the ENTIRE day. Five or six hours would have been perfect for us, but we were also there for another three days and had a family member living in Hong Kong to meet up with for the weekend.

Fell in love with everything Hong Kong. I was looking at things to do on Trip Advisor and saw the great reviews that Jamie had. I booked us in for an 8 hour tour with Jamie on our 2nd day in HK. I was concerned about the time and almost changed to a lesser time thinking that what could we possibly do for all that time. I have to say that the 8 hours absolutely flew by, and my partner and I had the best time with Jamie. Picking his brain about things, and getting hints and tips for the rest of our trip when we were left on our own. One conversation went to we wanted to see if we could get a good deal on a motor cycle helmet, thinking maybe Jamie might know a shop. He knew a store immediately and took us there to purchse. If anyone hasn't been to HK before and is looking for some insight at the start of their trip, I definitely recommend Jamie's tour, and you need 8 hours!

Interesting and fun day in Hong Kong. We ended up with a very short stop in Hong Kong and I'm glad that we had booked an 8-hour tour with Jamie. We saw some great sights, took some beautiful photos, and even though the time passed quickly, we got a lot out of our time there. I appreciated being able to ask questions and have discussions with a private guide, as opposed to being in a large group. Jamie was easy to talk to and had lots of insights to share. I recommend this as a good way to see Hong Kong!

Wonderful tour with knowledgeable guide. Jamie was an excellent tour guide. He arrived promptly and ready to go. He knew his way around the streets and metro of Hong Kong and provided us with just the right amount of time at each interesting stop. He also was full of information about the history of each place as well as the culture of the city today. He was able to speak not just to the adults but to the kids as well. It was comfortable to have him join our family for the day.

The best way to See Hong Kong - Period. Jamie's tour of Hong Kong was phenomenal. We got to see a lot of the parts of Hong kong that we may not have seen otherwise. We also got to sample some great food! My wife and I took a 6 hour tour with Jamie and he was able to create an literary for us that was perfect. We would totally recommend this as the best way to see the sights and sounds of Hong Kong, with a local touch.

What a difference. During our 5 day stay in Hong Kong we did some organized tours in a group. Sometimes we felt like we were on an assembly line. In a way this type of routine, impersonal service was very stressful. With Jamie this was completely different: personal service, very relaxing. Most enjoyable way to explore Hong Kong.

Such a great way to see Hong Kong. We are a family of 5, with teenage children, and we had the best day today. Jamie made our Hong Kong experience truly memorable. From the ease of use of the subways, to his wealth of knowledge about Hong Kong, we all enjoyed our 8 hour tour. The time seriously flew by, as we were not rushed and actually had a really relaxing day. When the organising and researching is put in someone elses hands, there is nothing to worry about. Just follow Jamie. He was very aware of all of us at all times, especially in busy areas. My 11 year old thought he was "awesome" and was not far from Jamies side at all times, asking questions & soaking up any interesting facts Jamie had to share. We have walked away with a very different opinion of Hong Kong, to what we thought of it yesterday.Thanks JamieThe Stallman Family (Australia)

Voted by My Family as Best Tour of our China Holiday and Best Tour Guide Ever!. My husband, two teenage children aged 16 and 15 and I spent a fantastic day with Jamie on an eight hour walking tour of Hong Kong last month that we will remember always! When I first told the kids I had booked an eight hour walking tour they were horrified - firstly at having to walk around all day and secondly at having to listen to someone they thought would be a boring tour guide like the ones they have had on other tours. They were so wrong and they were very happy to admit they were wrong after our day out with Jamie. Jamie took us to some of the well-known tourist attractions and also some less well-known that we would not have found by ourselves. He gave us the confidence to go anywhere in Hong Kong on public transport and made excellent suggestions for other places to visit during our stay, emailing us detailed information on how to get there. He gave us a great insight into everyday life in Hong Kong, based on his own experiences and this was certainly different from anything you would read in a guide book. We enjoyed a delicious lunch together eating his second most favourite food, steamed dumplings, and he went out of his way to assist us in resolving a shopping problem we had, where I had been duped into paying more for camera equipment than I should have done. He accomplished all this in just eight hours that raced by so quickly, we were sorry when it came to an end. Jamie is the perfect tour guide, knowledgeable, flexible, easy-going and with a wicked sense of humour that appealed to all of us and kept us laughing all day. At the end of each holiday we go on, we vote on different things, best food, best hotel, best purchase etc. Jamie scored top marks in two categories - best tour guide and best day out!! A pretty good performance when two of the voters are hard to please teenagers. I would have no hesitation in recommending J3 Tours with Jamie to anyone looking for a great day out, with a difference, in Hong Kong and I would also say that Jamie's website is a must-read for all visitors to the city. Thank you again Jamie for a most memorable day, we would love to catch up with you again in the future.

Highly recommended. My partner and I recently went on a all day private tour of Hong Kong (HK) with Jamie and found it to be excellent, truly added a lot of value to our trip.Jamie is genuinely great guy and we really enjoyed our day out with him.Jamie has a great sense of humour and we felt very comfortable the whole time. His passion for HK comes through in the tour and we learned a lot about this fascinating city.He loves what he does and he's very good at it. As Jamie is a local, he knows where the hidden gems are (and they were great!).We felt we got to experience the "real" HK during our tour.If you want to get the most out of your trip, I strongly suggest getting a tour with Jamie.

Great guide with great personality. Four of us spent a day on walking tour guided by Jamie.It was a fantastic experience.Jamie prepared great itinerary, took us to many different places (the peak, Nunnery, market etc.). We walked a lot (this is what we wanted) and we used metro and bus for transportation. Along the way he answered lots of general questions about Hong Kong, population, culture, economy. Besides Jamie has great personality with a good sense of humor.He took us to a great place for lunch and before we ended our day, Jamie gave us lots of advises and maps (which were very helpful and useful) for our next two days of staying in Hong Kong.

Jamie provides a very efficient and enjoyable way of seeing the important stuff if you only have a short time in HK.. Jamie was a great tour-guide. He is obviously very knowledgeable about HK, having spent most of his life there, and provides lots of interesting perspective on the city's geoagraphy, culture and recent history. In addition, he was personally very engaging, In short, we were thoroughly enriched and entertained during our day with him, and have no reservations in recommending him heartily if you are considering his services.

Money can't buy your experience with Jamie!. I usually book a private tour guide when traveling in Southeast Asia with my spouse. I was shocked to see the prices of the private guides in Hong Kong but other prices are just as high in this vertical city. I looked carefully at each guide or tour service I found in my research before booking with Jamie. It was really hard for a teacher to spend this much on a guide for one day but I took the chance that it would be worth it in the long run. Jamie made sure that I knew the booking fee before I committed for the date. He was able to adjust to my spouse's health conditions as he planned our day. As it turns out, we had to drop my spouse off at the hotel to rest while I continued the rest of the tour with Jamie. Jamie knew that I had specific things to buy for my children and he was able to take me to a fabric market that I would not have found on my own. The fabric market was overpowering with colors and different fabrics but I walked away with gorgeous fabric loved by my children! The best part was that Jamie offered his advice in purchasing and seemed to enjoy the market. It was a wonderful afternoon of experiences that I will always remember. My spouse loved hearing my stories of the afternoon and so did my children. Money can't buy the experience that Jamie gives you including the hunt for Diet Dr. Pepper in Hong Kong!

Go with Jamie - you won´t regret it!! Not an ordinay tour!! Much better!!. We went with Jamie one day in Hongkong. What a great day!! He is very nice and easygoing! He gave us a glance of Honkong which we never have found by ourselfs or by another tourcompany. Jamie is very flexible and that is why he is able to give you the little extra in the tour. Go with Jamie to get an introduction of Hongkong - you won´t regret it !!

Hong Kong comes to life. An excellent way of seeing - and hearing about- the real Hong Kong. As a guide Jamie was a huge source of facts, observations, comments and opinions and a pleasure to spend the day with. Generous and flexible and able to listen to and 'read' your interests and adjust the day to suit plus very easy company, I'd highly recommend any tour with Jamie.

Great sense of humor, smart, knowledgeable. Jamie showed me around town in the evening. It was very memorable - the views, the places, and most of all, great conversations with a man who made HKG home many years ago, and still loves the city. A perfect mix of Western perspective, and knowledge about the East. Many surprising facts and insides delivered with the British sense of humor. Highly recommended!

Crash course in Hong Kong. A collegue of mine and I recently travelled to Hong Kong on business. This was my third visit and I have to admit that I'd seen a vast amount of HK on foot and via tourbus.This was unlike any of my previous experiences and I was impressed with a number of aspects of our tour.Firstly Jaimie is a genuinely nice guy. He'd knowledgabele and experienced in getting around HK. This is part and parcel of his more than 30 years of residing in HK.He arrived promply and we were soon on the MTR at TST making our way to Chi Lin Nunnery. A spot that even the locals don't frequent. The serenity of the gardens in the stark contrast of the metroolis sprawling out behind it was very appealing.We zipped left end ducked right and Jaimie had us bouncing from corner to corner in Hong Kong, including the most delectable Michellin star Dim Sum, views from the Peak and the Blue house in Wanchai.The entire experience was fantastic and I wish we could have done it again for a couple of days in succession!I will certainly be back. Thanks Jaimie.

Great Tour Guide...Nice Guy As Well. Admittedly, this was the most expensive private tour...by far, that I have ever paid for. Wherever I travel, I always hire a private guide for one day. It optimizes my time and I learn a lot. So, I had high expectaions for this tour. The weather wasn't ideal...A little cool and it drizzled. But, we found plenty to do and to see. Even though we weren't with him the second day, he took his own time and wrote me up a suggested itinerary. I could go on about where we visited, but other reviewers have recapped the places that are most frequently visited. I just want to say that Jamie is a really nice and 'regular' guy. He gets to tour with all types, I am sure, and his manner is relaxed and casual. I really support Jamie and hope that he has great success in this business. My only suggestion, is that maybe he prints up a map and circles or at least deliniates the route that he takes his clients on for a momento. After our tour, I had no idea where we really went, since so much of it was on subways. It would have made a nice memory, to have something like that.

Hong Kong - all you'd want to see and more. Spent the day with Jamie as our guide visiting the places we'd wanted to visit but probably wouldn't have if we'd been left to our own devices. Had great craic; great company; great food; great places and and all round great time. Best way to get it all in.

The best possible introduction to Hong Kong; made the rest of our stay easy.. I've been to Hong Kong three times, '69, '92 and now 2011. Previous visitsdid not prepare me for this city. This was my wife's first visit.After 27 hours of travel we arrived at our hotel at about 1 am. We got about five hours of sleep before we met Jamie in the lobby of our hotel. He immediately recognized that we were reallly tired and based our tour on this observation. It started as a walking tour but he made maximum use of public transport. This taught us how to ride the bus and the MRT train system including the use of the Octopus card and its relationship to 7-11 stores (very important knowledge). If you're going to Hong Kong for the first time or for the fifth time, a tour with Jamie will make the rest of your stay so much easier. I can't recommend Jamie highly enough.

A fantastic way to spend your first afternoon/evening in Hong Kong!. I don't think you could of fitted in more than we did in the 8hrs we had available ! I would suggest that you buy an octopus card before you set off to save time,as we were introduced to the many forms of travel in Hong Kong, MTR, Star Ferry and the famous Trams . We started from our hotel in Kowloon, Throughout the tour we were provided with advice, regarding shopping and other places of interest which we could not possibly cover in our limited time on tour. However we managed to cover both Kowloon and the Island and we had a fantastic meal, in Wan Chai. Our trip included the night markets , the Peak and a beautiful water garden a real cross section of the old and the new. ( too many attractions to mention) . We gave Jamie a very open card of the sights we wished to see and he ticked every box. I think what was really nice was the insight from a person who loves his job, nothing was too much trouble and his local knowledge and stories we second to non.A walking tour with Jamie will give you a great outlook to Hong Kong, and you will then be able to re visit when you have more time. Be prepared to cover a lot of miles and take on board a lot of information which is not in the guide books.I hope to return to HK in March and I am already planning doing one of Jamie's new special tours of the "The war years in Hong Kong". It covered all our needs for a fantastic introduction to Hong Kong, a must for anyone on their first visit, and also for a special insight to a wonderful city!Thank you !

Awesome!!. We spent all day with Jamie and he did not disappoint. He took use to the all the popular tourist spots and a few of the local hangouts. Loved the private attention and customization. We finished the day extremely satisfied. I would definately recommend Jamie's services to anyone heading to Hong Kong.

The best way to see Hong Kong. We booked our tour with Jamie after reading all of the positive reviews and we are so glad that we did. Jamie was quick to respond and answered all of our questions prior to our booking. We are a family of four, our boys are 8 and 10, and he really made the tour fun for them as well. He really knows and loves Hong Kong and all of his insider knowledge made sure that we had the best experience. We never would have seen everything that we did if we tried to explore hong Kong on our own. We also enjoyed talking with Jamie about the local schools, different neighborhoods, etc.

Great tour guide - really knows Hong Kong.. We have used Trip Adviser and CruiseCritic for planning trips for years and have asked lots of questions but this is our first review. We got so much help from others that we will post a complete review on our entire trip to China but Jamie - the guide we used in Hong Kong was so great, we are writing this first.Just some background. We are an older couple with mobility issues. We have traveled extensively and always by ourselves but usually retain guides independently in cities where getting around is not easy because of distance and time. We planned a 3 week trip to China using China Highlight's because it seemed easier than trying to get individual guides in all the cities we were going to visit. We were flying through Hong Kong and figured we could do HK ourselves as it seemed like an easy city to do on our own and it wasn't part of our package with China Highlights. But we really only had one day there - flying in late on Thursday and leaving early Saturday morning so we just had Friday. After spending lots of time trying to plan our day there I realized we'd never get to most on our own and didn't want to do a big bus tour. So rather than spending time figuring out how to get to everything, we decided to hire a guide. I found Jamie Lloyd (J3 Private Tours) on Tours by Locals and then read all the great reviews on TA. He also has a thorough website that covers everything. We exchanged a few emails and booked.Jamie met us at our hotel at the agreed time. My husband has a hard time with much walking so Jamie altered our itinerary to accommodate us. He was so friendly and knowledgeable and made it easy for my husband to get around. He had originally planned for us to use buses and the subway but after one subway ride we quickly decided taxis would allow us to see more.We went to the Chi Lin Nunnery first and it is an impressive garden. We then took the Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island (we were staying in Kowloon) where we had a quick lunch and then caught the public double decker bus to Stanley Market. Jamie got us there just in time to be first on the bus so we had the first row upstairs seats and wow - what views! And the traffic! We were so glad we didn't try to do this all on our own. At the Stanley Market Jamie walked slowly with my husband and let him rest so I could do some shopping - which I really appreciated. We then went to the Victoria Peak and Jamie walked me out to a special spot he has found to take the best pictures of the Hong Kong skyline. That took all day so we missed a few things I had really wanted to see - like the mid-level elevators but we just couldn't move any faster. Jamie even got us back to our hotel.The best thing about Jamie is his knowledge about all things Hong Kong. He is interesting, can answer every question and really likes his job so he makes you feel like a friend showing you around their hometown. He was definitely the best guide we had during the 3 weeks and I would highly recommend him to anyone. He was so adaptable and attentive to our mobility issues. In fact he was one of the best guides we've had all over the world. We'd love to go back and spend days with Jamie.Just looking through his website will make you feel like you have seen HK. Being there with his expertise made it even better. Thanks Jamie for a great day.

Fantastic. Well informed. Outstanding places. Well done!. Thank you Jamie for this fantastic tour! Hong Kong from all kind of views. The heritages and the modern parts. The people and the birds and the Peak from an outstanding place. We never would have seen and "smelled" this 7.2 Mio. city like this without you!What a grand job! Thanks again and all the best for you and your family!Carola with Bine&Basti

An excellent introduction to Hong Kong.. Jamie has a great enthusiasm for his home city, which he transfers into his tour; making it informative, really interesting, and allowing the visitor to experience the stunning sights and sounds of Hong Kong. He delivers on personality, consideration and a good awareness of what individuals want to see, tailoring his tours to your interests.A thoroughly enjoyable tour.

Great way to experience Hong Kong. The best part of the day may have been feeling like we were touring the city with a friend we were in town visiting. We wanted to see a different side of Hong Kong in addition to the usual attractions. Jamie provided those experiences and answered questions for us all day. He will customize your day around what you want to accomplish or let him put the day together for you. We used all forms of public transportation to get around - subway, bus, tram, ferry - which we thoroughly enjoyed. He'll meet you (if you are on a cruise ship being transported from the port meeting at the clock tower at the Star Ferry on the Kowloon side is a great spot). We really felt like we got the most out of our time in Hong Kong.

Terrific Day Out in Hong Kong. We (4 adults) had a great 8 hour tour with Jamie. He was friendly, outgoing, flexible and incredibly competent. Personalized a tour for us and took us places we would not otherwise have seen, in half the time it would have taken us to get there on our own could we have actually found them. Also found us a super place for lunch! Would definitely spend another day with him if our trip were longer. Money very well spent!!

The finishing touch to our HongKong trip. Did the night tour followed by the day tour; We would have missed so much in HongKong if we didn't have Jamie to guide us around.A real pleasure as person aswel as guide. We truely enjoyed it!

Fun night tour. Booked a solo night tour with Jamie and it was a great way to spend an evening. In a few hours (this is a walking tour so plenty of walking and public transport) we visited The Peak (from the best viewing point), travelled on the Star Ferry to Kowloon and made our way to the night markets. I had a great time and jamie was good fun throughout. Just be warned: no food so come prepared. Warmly recommended.

Like touring the city with a good friend who knows the best ways to go.. We visited Hong Kong recently and had Jamie as our guide for a day tour visiting a Chinese market,temple and The Peak and other sights. We negotiated the subways andferries and this added to the experience,much better than being on a tour bus also by not doing the tourist thing we avoided line ups. We did an evening tour the next day and saw the lights from the Kowloon side and visited the Peak at night which is a must see but the highlight for us was a beautiful garden belonging to a Buddhist nunnery. We saw this at dusk and it was almost surreal in atmosphere. I would highly recommend using Jamie as a guide, he is personable and if you do not mindwalking it is a great way to see Hong Kong. Mairead and Keith. Toronto Canada

Hong Kong by night. What a delight!. I recently took my parents on a birthday trip to Hong Kong. Poking around tripadvisor, I stumbled upon Jamie of J3 Private Tours. He was highly recommended, and for sure, tripadvisor never disappoints.Jamie picked us up at our hotel and we were off for an evening tour of beautiful Hong Kong. My mom has some mobility issues and I checked in advance that Jamie could handle this. He was superb. From guiding us down interesting market streets (some with scary sites) to seeing the most beautiful view of HK for free! Quite honestly, the best thing about Jamie is the extra time he took with us. He made sure we got back safely to our hotel (even though it was a bit over our time because of my mom's slow walking). That kind of going out of your way to help people is rare.We took the tour early in our trip and it was invaluable to navigating the city for the remainder of the week. Book him fast because he's super busy. I had to try three dates just to get him! If I am ever back in HK I hope to meet up with him for a diet coke!

Pleasant Day. I reserved an 8 hours tour with Jamie during my trip in November 2011 and we went to Cheung Chau Island, Nan Lin Garden-Chi Lin Nunnery and The Peak. He has lived in Hong Kong for a long time and is familiar with the country. He is also safe for solo travellers.

Brilliant tour and company. Went with Jamie with J3 tours who tailored made the tour to our needs. The banter lightened the mood of sightseeing as husband not a great fan. The tout was evenly balanced and looking forward to our return in December.

Hong Kong as the locals see it.. We spent 3 full days touring Hong Kong with Jamie Lloyd as our private guide. We asked to see the "real" Hong Kong instead of just the glitz and glamour. He started by showing us a good place to change money. We also learned to get around the city with an Octopus Card that enables you to ride all the trains, buses, and ferries (the senior card really saved us money). It was tiring because we walked to most of the attractions but this allowed us to see the local neighborhoods. We did most of the "must sees" like The Peak, the Chi Lin Nunnery (although he didn't want to stop there for tea or a vegetarian lunch), Che Kung Temple, and Giant Buddha on Lantau Island. He accompanied us to several good restaurants popular with locals. We're not big shoppers but managed to do a little with Jamie and on our own in Stanley. Perhaps we spent too much time on local color because we never got to any museums, Aberdeen fishing village (which was requested by my husband), or local markets like the bird and goldfish markets. On our own we went to the Stanley market (but didn't know what stop to get off the bus for Abderdeen), Heritage Museum, Temple of 10,000 Buddhas, Light Show on the Aqua Luna, and the Walk of Stars. We would definitely recommend Jamie to others touring Hong Kong. It's best to let him know exactly what you would like to do ahead of time so he can plan the time. There is really so much to see and do that you have to set priorities, especially if you are limited in time.

a very full day! we now know HK so much better. Five stars for Jamie - we booked 8 hours with him, and he spent 9 hours with us. Bring your energy - we were go, go, go! Very enlightening day in HK to see how locals of all types live. We did the big touristy items (e.g., The Peak), but always with his own take that made it better (e.g., "secret" viewing point at the Peak that is far better than the "corporate" view that they herd you to). We also did a lot of non-touristy things (e.g., visited his local hospital and learned a bit about the state of health care in HK). I recommend booking Jamie for your first day in HK to get oriented to the city and its transportation. After a day with him, we felt like educated locals ourselves! And his humor and personality is a delight. Fee seemed quite reasonable and was easy/clear to book.

The highlight of our Hong Kong trip. What a great decision it was booking a tour with Jamie. Although I only booked it the week before - I wouldnt advise leaving it that late - Jamie managed to fit us in for a 6 hour tour during our weeks stay and I have to say it was a great choice.He is a kind and considerate man who listens carefully to where you wish to go and what he thinks may be of interest based on what you discuss. He is very knowledgeable on Hong Kong and I dont recall him having to refer any question thrown at him by either my wife and I or the children.Very worthwhile and I would advise anyone thinking about booking a tour with Jamie to go ahead and do it - I dont think you will be disappointed.Thanks Jamie, The Mawer family

excellent day. Just loved the 5 hr tour with Jamie. We checked out the Kowloon side and saw where the Art Centre and Galleries were, to see on another day. Stepped inside a magnificent hotel which we would have never seen on our own. Saw the maritime building and learnt about its history . We also visited the Nan Lian Gardens which was really enjoyable. Enjoyed the ferry trip on the way over. Caught up with some local HK markets where HK people shop. Then went to the Peak to get an amazing 180' view of HK from Jamies private vantage point. We enjoyed Jamies' sense of humour and his dry wit. A really great personal tour which showed you the real Hong Kong.

Very worthwhile, informative and enjoyable day. We chose to do this tour on our second day in Hong Kong. As this was our first visit we found it valuable to do so early in our stay. We had no idea where to go and left it up to Jamie. Consequently we had a great day, saw and experienced things we would never had on our own, used the metro and star ferry to get to places which gave us confidence to do so on our own. Jamie answered all our questions and we were therefore able to plan the rest of our stay most effectively. Thanks so much.
It was great.. If your in HK for a day or a week I highly recommend doing a tour with Jamie.

Insightful and very memorable ex-pat perspective on Hong Kong. Jamie is well deserving of his #1 status on Trip Advisor. He goes above and beyond to make sure your group will enjoy Hong Kong. He definitely has some off-the-beaten-path sites up his sleeve that make it well worth his tour that you would never find yourself. What separates him, is that if you are a Westerner, he knows our needs and what we will find most interesting. He has lived in Hong Kong most of his life, so it's just a unique perspective that you are not going to get else where. Highly recommend.

Perfect introduction for the newcomer to Hong Kong giving insight to making the most of the rest of your trip.. Another area to think about would be a "gourmet tour" concentrating on the local cuisines. We did a similar tour in Lisbon Portugal and found it to be most interesting and fun.

WHAT A FANTASTIC DAY. Where do I start, Jenni and myself and close friends Len and Lizzy Petch had 3 days in Hong Kong on the way back to Australia after visiting England,Greece and Turkey.We booked a day tour with Jamie who operates J3 Private Tours.WOW what a day we had .We walked ,took trains,buses ferries,trams and visited so many of the wonderfull spots of Hong Kong,I would have to say Jamie's special spot [marked with an x] at the peak was one of the standouts of our entire trip, what about the markets a real eye opener.One of Jamies's greatest assets is his wealth of knowledge not only of the tourist sights but also the history and current political staus of Hong Kong.All this knowledge and information he was so willing to pass onto us.Jamie even stayed with us for a couple of hours after the tour finished and we enjoyed this social time together.Anyone looking to do a tour whilst in Hong Kong Jamie's tour is a MUST DO.We felt we got to know Jamie that well we have invited him to stay with us when he visits Australia.We couldn't recommend him highly enough.

Let a local help you see exciting Hong Kong - don't worry about a map!. We had been to Hong Kong before, we'd seen the major sites, but knew there had to be more. We booked a tour with Jamie - my husband and I and our 11yr old son. Jamie collected us from our hotel and we immediately purchased the octopus cards and were on our way. It was so much fun for all of us. We saw various markets, peaceful temples, amazing views - you name it. We used every type of public transport - but since Jamie knows the system like the back of his hand - no time was wasted. We would never have seen as much if we had tried this ourselves. Jamie has a good sense of humour and is easy to talk to. The tour was a highlight of our stopover in Hong Kong which I do not hesitate to recommend!

Hong Kong Best kept secrets. Over the years, we have been many times to HK, however it was the first time for my son, his wife and 14 years old grand daughter.Jamie was great and manage to amaze us by taking us to places we never knew existed. even in places, my husband and I had visited many time, such as Victoria peak, Jamie tooks us to his secret hidden viewing post , a spectacular breath taking panoramic view , all to ourselves much better than the conventional and crowded tourist "look out". We experienced the old and the new HK, with traditional wet market, spectacular garden and temples, quiet refuge hidden in the middle of the city.Jamie is a fun and knowlegable tour guide able to make our grandaughter laugh and keept her entertain.Thank you Jamie for a great and wonderful day!We hope to see you again in the near future.Danielle ( Quebec, Canada)

The real Hong Kong. We booked Jaime for an 8 hour tour and had a wonderful time. The time just flew by, and before we knew it our tour was over. We saw parts of the city we would have never found on our own. Just go with the flow, and Jaime will create your own personalized tour with a few surprises thrown in. Be sure to get your Octopus card before embarking on your tour as you will be using a lot of public transportation.If you want a great tour to see the "real" Hong Kong, book with Jaime and you won't be disappointed.

We learned the city in 5 hours. Jamee, took us through the city in the most unusual way, by navigating through the city by walking and public transportation. It was so great to learn the city in a very effective way. We used all the knowledge we gained from Jamee to continue the exploration on our own the next day.

Great tour - highly reccomended. We called Jamie fairly last minute and he was able to squeeze us in for a 5 hour tour beginning at 5pm on day of arrival into HK- call ahead because he is a busy guide and I see why. He took us through HK from dusk into the night and although I was a bit disappointed in not being able to book a day tour originally, this was dispelled immediately as we dove into the vibrant and beautiful night ambience of Hong Kong. He showed us how to use the subway system which was surprisingly easy and convenient for getting around town and showed us things that we would never have found or seen without his guidance. It was a great introduction into the heart of HK and told through the eyes of an inveterate expat with a wealth of knowledge and street smarts. You could use Abercrombie and such but I truly believe that this was as close to a city as you are likely to experience in a brief time, much more soulful then a guided tour filled with droll facts recited by a disinterested party - thumbs up!

Great personalized walking tour of Hong Kong. I arranged a day-long tour of Hong Kong with Jamie and am very pleased. I saw the "must see" spots but I especially enjoyed seeing some of the "off the beaten path" spots.Since Jamie has lived in Hong Kong is whole life, he is very familiar with the history, which is great. Also, Jamie has a great sense of humor and an immediately likable personality.I liked the flexibility of a one-on-one tour, and enjoyed taking advantage of the excellent public transportation and walking around the city. I would definitely suggest Jamie as a guide.

Knows the city, makes everyone feel comfortable and enjoys what he does.. We had one day to try to see Hong Kong with two couples and two adult children. Jamie did a superb job of keeping us all happy. His knowledge of the city allowed us to see many sites we would never have made it to in the amount of time we had. In addition, we had the bonus of seeing places from the advantage of his experience. He is easygoing and has a good sense of humor. We highly recommend his services.

Not your average tour! Much more interesting!. Jamie was great. He is an affable, friendly man and it was fun spending time chatting with him and learning about life in Hong Kong from his perspective. His personal connection to the city adds much to the experience. There were two of us and Jamie and it seemed like the perfect sized group for our tour. We had a whole week in Hong Kong and wanted to be able to get from A to B as needed, so an orientation was what we were seeking and Jamie delivered! He tailored a 2 Day tour for us and we felt very comfortable setting out the rest of the week on our own. We spent one whole day going everywhere via the public transit systems along with many fun and interesting sites along the way--both expected and totally unexpected. The second day was mostly walking and we hit many more terrific spots. All the while, Jamie gave us all sorts of tips on how to get where we wanted to go, where to avoid, and many more suggestions for a terrific week! As he advertised, there were lots of surprises along the way. He always got us to the sites we were most interested in, but it is well worth it to keep an open mind and follow along. Don't be afraid to suggest some stops for photos, etc--he is most accommodating. Also, given the harsh summer climate in that part of the world, he made sure we had several well-timed AC breaks and stops for water, etc. We were exhausted by the end of each day, but it was time and energy well spent, and with a great guide!

Island Adventure. We have been to Hong Kong many times before so were looking for something a little bit different. We decided to explore Cheng Chau. Jamie was great and he seemed to enjoy the trip too. We explored the little laneways of the town, visited a couple of temples, caught the little island ferry and saw a real life helicopter evacaution too.

Class A Tour With excellent value. Jamie toured me around the HK area on Aug 30. All the information I gave him previously was I wanted to see mostly non tourist locations and see what the regular person in HK did on a regular day.He gave me a one on one tour which more than lived up to my expectations. All of our touring was done on buses and the MRT, which was efficient and cost effective. We definitely left being the coach tours we saw plenty of.Jamie is also very flexible in that as our day progressed, he found out I was a bit of a war history buff. I was very touched when he brought me to a WW II Canadian bunker in HK.Jamie is very friendly and flexible which made the tour that much more special. Hope to see you again Jamie.I

Well worth it.. We had only three days in HK and spending 5 hours of it with Jamie was one of our best decisions. Jamie is a genuinely nice chap with excellent knowledge of the city he lives in. We covered the "usual" suspects on a tour, along with the not so usual ones which gave us an insight into the real Hong Kong. He's very easy to talk to and so we asked questions that in any other situation, you'd think could be a little silly. I can honestly say we came away knowing more about Hong Kong than we would have done from any guide book or group tour.Without Jamie, we would have never used all the different types of public transport, and seen the off the beaten track sights of HK. Highly recommended. We cannot thank Jamie enough for his honest, engaging and informative 5 hours.

Highlight of my trip to Hong Kong. Jamie gave me a great full day tour of Hong Kong. He is a friendly guy who really knows the city inside out. Spending the day seeing the city with him was the highlight of my trip. He made up our route on the fly based on what I was interested in seeing and took me way off the beaten tourist path, which is just what I was looking for. I can't recommend him highly enough if you're looking for a bespoke tour or just want to see the city beyond the obvious highlights (though I'm sure he'd do that also).

Go for it...... I had my first visit to Hong Kong recently and, as a first worldwide trip AND first solo trip abroad, was delighted to find Jamie of J3 Tours HK. I had a great couple of days with him showing me how to get around and taking me to places that I had been on my personal 'wish list' as well as places that he thought I would be interested in seeing. He knows all the shortcuts - helped me track down my ticket to a local music event no problem...It gave me an insight into Hong Kong and the confidence to 'survive' the following time independently.I would say to all those anxious about a first time trip to HK - especially solo travellers - speak to Jamie and get him to show you around. I loved my fist visit and can't wait to return and I am sure this is thanks to the 'settling in' period with Jamie's tours.

Exceptional appreciation for detail. I returned to Jamie a second time after a visit to China. Jamie was aware of my interest in history and had on his own initiative researched Hong Kong's World War Two history. As a result Jamie took me on a fantastic trip around Hong Kong. We even sourced WWI soldiers. Subsequent to the tour Jamie by email followed up some interesting aspects. Jamie is courteous, attentive to detail and understands exactly what is needed to make a trip extremely memorable. Use him, he is a great resource.

Be a local for the day. Jamie gave us a great tour St very short notice, he knows HK very well and managed to tailor his tour to suit the attractions that we were interested in and we felt like locals for the day. Highly recommended, he's a very nice man who worked hard to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. Two tips though - book him in well advance as he gets busy, and book his tour early in your stay as his advice was invaluable in enjoying the rest of our stay. I would definitely use him again and recommend Jamie wholeheartedly.

I had a great day seeing selected slices of life in Hong Kong.. My walking tour of Hong Kong with jamie was a great day out. Jamie managed to weave in a collection of must sees, with my personal requests, to tailor a tour that matched the things I like to do. Clever use of public transport gave me an insight into daily life. A few of Jamie's insider tips also made me feel quite smug about how I was having a better time than the bulk-buy tourists we passed along the way. This was all topped off with a cracking lunch at a great local venue.

Fantastic 1 Day Hong Kong Tour with Jamie. What can we say other than FANTASTIC!!!!! Jamie took us to a couple of places that were simply amazing and would not have been thought of possible given their locations by any tourist. Jamie also made my partner Deb very happy with a 100% strike rate on shopping items that Deb wanted but had not located in the usual shopping malls of Hong Kong. Jamie made for an extremely informative and wonderful day traveling all over Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. He proved very adept at getting us from one place to another in the quickest most efficient way possible, whilst ensuring we enjoyed the local scene of people going about their daily lives. Thanks so much Jamie for a wonderful day, that could easily be 2, 3 or 4 days of solid private touring both Jamie and Hong Kong offer any tourist so much!!!!!!

Your Tour Guide: An Englishman's View of Hong Kong. We spent two days with Jamie as our private tour guide around Hong Kong and Kowloon. Our tour was about as down to earth as you can get; one minute we were walking the backstreets looking for a particular temple nowhere near the tourist's mainstream, or strolling the beach at Recluse Bay, or being personally dropped off for high tea at the Peninsula Hotel in Kowloon. Jamie was on time, polite, informative, friendly, flexible and had his own take on this wonderful city. Although Jamie was English speaking, his lack of Chinese did not seem to hinder us in any way, and we thoroughly enjoyed our short stay.

A Hidden Jewel of Hong Kong. Every visitor coming to Hong Kong needs a person like Jamie who can give them intimate knowledge of day to day informative and interesting things about Hong Kong. Jamie is a sensitive and caring person, who caters for your specific needs. He clearly keeps up to date on everything which is happening in Hong Kong, but is also conscious of a great deal of Hong Kong's features. Jamie took the 3 of us around Hong Kong in one day, we had different interests and were different ages, but all enjoyed Jamie's tour. Jamie was able to balance everybody's interests out, so that everybody had a terrific day!Jamie is a "walking book of knowledge" and is very personable. We will catch up with Jamie when we return to Hong Kong because he was one of the highlights of our trip, and we would recommend him to anybody visiting Hong Kong. We strongly suggest you use him and not TOURIST BUSES, you will see why when you are in Hong Kong!!

A Tour of Hong Kong with a Difference. Jamie Lloyd of J3 Tours has really separated himself from the pack when it comes to showing off Hong Kong's attractions with a more eclectic approach and well researched approach..This tour is not designed for people who want to be treated like cattle in a mind numbing race around the island seeing how many souvenir shops in the classic tourist traps can be covered in 2hours.This tour is designed for people who want to understand the history, culture and nuances of this fantastic city in a calm yet highly efficient process that clearly demonstrates an intimate understanding of the key drivers and likely future of this metroplois from 35yrs of experience.We thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience (6.5hrs!!!) and firmly believe that Jamie made us much more "functional" in a very short space of time with respect to the use of City's the amazing public transport system - the gifts that keeps on giving.Well done Jamie and we thoroughy recommend your services to the more decerning travellers who arrive in Hong Kong

Fantastic day in Hong Kong!. My fiance' and I were in Hong Kong for a few days and booked a full day tour with Jamie of J3 Private Tours and could not have been happier. Jamie planned the whole day based on only a few ideas from me and we were off to see Hong Kong! Jamie is a long time Hong Kong resident that knows the past and the present of Hong Kong, how to get where, and plenty of facts and information about each place and it's surroundings. I highly recommend Jamie if you want a personal tour in Hong Kong. No feelings of being herded like cattle, no rush, no unwanted high pressure sales of any kind......just a personal tour of an amazing city! Awesome views with a very personable friendly funny knowledgable guide.....and in clear English! I am confident Jamie will not dissappoint you with his personal tour!

Real Hong Kong. I booked Jamie for my first day (4 day trip) in HK knowing that I would be completely overwhelmed by the crowds and seeming chaos, and not knowing where to start. Well, having Jamie as a guide was the perfect thing. I couldn't believe, knowing a bit of HK's history, how all those people who write off the place as a 2 day shopping trip could be right. I had no specific "must do's" for Jamie. I just wanted to get a feel for HK (one that didn't involve shopping). I won't give away what we did as it will spoil it for others, but I can say that I had the most extraordinary day - seeing everything from colonial history, to everyday living, to wonderful gardens and breathtaking views. I also feel confident about getting around on the MTR now. My only problem for the next few days is prioritising what I'm going to do, as I've been left with so many ideas. I suspect it will require another visit to HK.....! I can highly recommend Jamie. He's your guide, so he can do it at your pace. And he's good company.

Brilliant. If you are looking to see HK on foot, out of a bus, with a friendly local and for a very reasonable price, then I would suggest you contact Jamie.My only reservation in writing this piece is that my secret will out and he'll be too busy to help me next time I am in Honk Kong.I can't say much more -- you'll have to experience it for yourself. In one day and one night we got see experience and get the flavour of HK. I would have liked to have a little more time, but we only had a short stopover.Jamie includes of the beaten track food stops and you can choose to be as "touristy" or non "toursity" as you wish.Stay strong Jamie -- HK needs you!!

Knowledgable, Friendly Hong Kong Tour Guide J3 Tours is Great. Jamie is great! My wife and I travelled to Hong Kong in July. This was our first trip there and two Asia in general and we happened upon Jamie from his website. Jamie gave us a two day tour of the area and we experienced it like locals. I highly recommend his tours. The night market tour was great (my wife loved it). Growing up in Hong Kong, Jamie really knows all of the interesting sites to see while avoiding the tourist traps. My wife and I have travelled extensively throughout Europe and Jamie's tours are by far the best we have experienced (not to mention much cheaper). Jamie was very gracious as my wife recently had surgery and he offered to take on a 1/2 day trip to the 10,000 Buddhas for free as we did not manage to see it with him. We did not take him up on this as we had a personal issue to deal with back home, but we can not wait to come back to Hong Kong and meet up with Jamie again. He is really a nice guy and I recommend him without reservation.

THE Best Guide in Hong Kong. Period.. Jamie is in a league of his own. If you are looking for the ultimate insider's guide to Hong Kong, look no further. His flexibility, knowledge and good nature are his greatest assets, and I can not recommend him highly enough. He is brilliant with impossible-to-please, spoiled teenagers.

We had a personalised tour of Kowloon and Hong Kong with the emphasis on local cultures and avoiding the "big " attracti. The tour fulfilled our requirements perfectly. Ben is an educated, highly intelligent and extremely knowledgeable guide with fantastic communication skills and a very easy, laid back style; we got on immediately with him and thoroughly enjoyed his company as well as the huge amount of local and historical knowledge he shared with us-what a lovely fella he is!! Our tour embraced the following highlights:From our hotel we went by MTR to Wong Tai Sin. We talked about religion (namely Taoism), astrology, fortune telling and mythology. We met Yau Lau (the Chinese god of love and marriage).By MTR to Sham Shui Po the poorest of the 18 districts of Hong Kong where we looked at the illegal housing structures and urban decay. We talked about the illegal housing structures, cage apartments, government housing and income levels in HK.To the She Wong Sin snake shop.Down the alley past the hole in the wall barbers shop.To the very old Kung Wo Soybean Products shop where we had freshly made fried tofu. To Kwan Kee bakery where we looked at the homemade Chinese deserts.Through the electronics market and jade market. To the large indoor fish and meat (wet market).By taxi to the Bird Market and Flower Market in Prince Edward. By MTR to Chungking Mansions and then the Peninsula where we talked a little about the history of the building, the Kadoorie family and the Japanese and attack and occupation of Hong Kong during the second world war. We looked at the old Marine Police Headquarters (Hullett House) with the Noon Day Gun and Time Ball Tower.We discussed the clock tower / old railway station.By Star Ferry from TST to Central. In summary, a very comprehensive 5 hours during which time we learned much more than we could in a month on our own. We recommend this tour to all newcomers to Hong Kong-it's a must!

Small group food tour. Fantastic tour with Niya. Great way to experience Cantonese cuisine, especially if a newcomer. Niya was friendly and enthusiastic and great fun. The food was awesome and although many strange and exotic items are displayed and explained during the tour, we didn't have to eat any of them! (Fish swim bladder anyone?)Highly recommended for first time visitor. ThanksDavid

Superb and Fun!. What a wonderful tour. Now if you REALLY want to experience Hong Kong food and culture, and want to do it like the locals do, then do this tour!!!!!!!The places, the food, the people, and the markets are so terrific when you are experiencing them all not as tourists, but as locals. And when you have a guide who knows the answer for EVERY question, you are in for a real treat!

Hello Hong Kong walking tour. We had a wonderful time with Richard! We wanted to know as much as possible about life in Hong Kong, how the city evolved and how the people live here. Richard took us on a walk through the city, he showed us the dried seafood market and explained things about the dried stuff over there. Then he took us to people's lodges and to other landmarks over the city. He came with pictures and articles and stuff to answer our questions and curiosity about the city.We definitely recommend him!

8 hour private tour. We (4 of us) arrived in Hong Kong at the Kai Tak Cruise Terminal aboard Celebrity Millennium on 10/29/16 and only a day to see Hong Kong. We took an easy cab ride to meet our Hello Hong Kong tour guide - Michael - at the Tsim Sha Tsui Ferry Pier Clock Tower. Prior to the tour, Hello Hong Kong had asked what we wanted to do. It was our first time in the city and asked for a general overview. Michael did an excellent job at putting together a great itinerary making sure we saw ALL the highlights. He knew all the ins and outs of the city. Fun getting around town using all modes of transportation: lots of walking, taxi, tram, street car, subway, and ferry. Great Dim Sum Lunch with Michael explaining local customs and foods. We had fun experiencing the "new" and the "old" of Hong Kong. Very receptive to our personal needs and what we wanted to see more or less of. Michael also did a great job at explaining what we were seeing in the context of Hong Kong history. Highly recommend this tour. Can't wait to return to Hong Kong.
Hello Hog Kong. Had a wonderful time. Our guide was fantastic and very informative. I had some walking issues and he was always checking to dee if I was ok or if he was going to fast.

Hello Hong Kong walking tour. This was a very good walking tour. We walked for almost 5 hours. We learn te get around by all the transports that were available. Learn about the history try very local food in a very very local restaurant. That was amazing. Jess were very thoughtful with my 8 year old girl. I recommend this tour to everyone. Jess keep doing what you are doing and thank you once again for your time spend with us. Greetings from Aruba!

Delicious and informative way to see Hong Kong. Nicole was a great tour guide who provided us with lots of information about the history of Hong Kong, both food-related and otherwise. She took us to authentic restaurants we wouldn't have found on our own and ordered the right combination of delicious food at each. Definitely the best meal(s) I had in Hong Kong. Nicole was enjoyable to spend 4 hours with and I would certainly recommend her and her tours to others.

Hello Hong Kong Food Tour. Our food tour with Nathan was excellent. We sampled delicious foods and really felt like we learned a lot about Hong Kong in the process. Loved the fact that we were able to move from one venue to another very easily. Nathan was an excellent guide and we would highly recommend this tour.

Family fun on the 7-hour Lantau Island Tour. Our extended family (mum, dad, sister, husband and our family of four) had a great one day tour of Lantau Island. Our guide, Laura, was enthusiastic and knowledgeable about Hong Kong and brimming with endless facts and fascinating stories.We started the day meeting Laura at Tung Chung Station, where we set off on a short walk to the 5.7km cable car, which goes through Lantau Country Park to Ngong Ping. Unfortunately, the weather was not great to us and we couldn’t see much except the mist, but we still enjoyed the ride.We visited Tian Tan Big Buddha which was beautiful, and some of us climbed the 268 steps to the top. (And some of us did not.) From the top we took a look at the views and the Offering of the Six Devas statues symbolising the six perfections of generosity, morality, patience, zeal, meditation and wisdom.We also visited the Po Lin Monastery and the Hall of 10,000 Buddha and then took a local bus to the village of Tai O, a historic squatter town with all manner of interesting buildings built out over the water. After a short boat ride – where we did see the 42km bridge being built between Hong Kong and Macau in the distance, but unfortunately we did not get to see any pink dolphins – we stopped for lunch at the Tai O Heritage Hotel, the old police station.The highlight of the day for us was certainly Tai O village. After lunch we wandered through the town, stopping at the Lee family ship paste shop and the Mo Tai temple.
