It was hot and humid so we then enjoyed a beer at a local café jutting out over the water, before beginning our return trip to Tung Chung Station.It was a full day and most enjoyable, and at the end of our tour Laura even gave us recommendations for Dim Sum restaurants. I’m generally not a fan of big tour groups but I would absolutely recommend Hello Hong Kong’s small tours for a more personalised and fun approach.

Very educational and TASTY food tour!. Nicole (AKA "Cookie") really knows her stuff. She gave us a great deal of good food with appropriate explanations . . . and more. We learned about the "medicinal" uses of certain foods and near foods. We also learned numerous interesting facts about local life and the neighborhoods we traveled through. Brava, Nicole!

Perfect 5 Hour Private City Tour. We took a 5 hour private city tour with Nathan as our guide. Nathan was awesome! He really gave us a "locals" view of Hong Kong as we had requested. He was fun, super informative, and flexible! Highlights from our tour included - visiting Wong Tai Sin temple, wet market, HSBC building and walked around Central district, and ate Dim Sum at very local restaurant. Nathan provided us with a great sense for the city and even added a few "tips" of the trade that made the rest of our Hong Kong experience that much easier. I would highly recommend Hello Hong Kong tours to anyone interested in getting their "feet wet" in the city quickly.

Delicious and fascinating food tour!. We loved our food tour with Jess at Hello Hong Kong Tours! Here for 3 days on our honeymoon, we wanted to try local foods in a fun and stress free way. And this tour was perfect for that - amazing food, Hong Kong specialties, all with an informative and lively guide who have insight into local culture and history. Cannot recommend highly enough!

Food Tour with Nicole. Wonderful trip led by Nicole. Informative and delicious, a fantastic 4 hours. A group of just 6 made the tour all the more enjoyable. Noodles, Dim Sum, roast meat, milk tea and egg tarts.

Really enjoyed the food tour!. I had a great time on the food tour earlier this year! Our guide Michael was SUPER knowledgable, having lived in Hong Kong for over 20 years. We got to ask him tons of questions and he took us to little restaurants that I never in a million years would have known to go to on my own, and some that I may not have wanted to go to on my own, and certainly wouldn't have known what to order! I was traveling solo so this was especially appreciated. Highly recommend Hello Hong Kong!

Amazing Local Food Tour. This food walking tour was amazing. Nicole (Cookie) was fantastic. She was so knowledgeable and showed us the local culture including chinese medicines. The food was awesome and we even tried dishes that we have not had before. Would recommend this tour if in HK.

Nicole (aka cookie) was a fantastic guide!. Nicole from Australia was an amazing host for our group of Aussies travelling in Hong Kong. We learnt all about traditional foods & medicines. My favourite would have to. E the yin yang milk tea!

Great way to see Lantau Island. Richard was amazing. Meet us at our hotel and we went by cab to the sky way station. He scheduled our tickets so we didn't have to wait in the long line. Very knowledgeable and informative. Will definitely book with them again when we return, this time take the food tour, yum!

Amazing food, interesting background, and a feel for the locals!. We had a wonderful time on this tour with our guide, Michael. I high recommend on your first morning in town - add the hotel pick up and get right into learning how to find your way around Hong Kong. Then you're off to some amazing eateries. Our family of four, with two teenagers, loved the experience. Michael was even great to follow up with some useful tips for our remaining time. Thank you, Hello Hong Kong!!

Best Food Tour Ever!. The food tour I took with Hello Hong Kong was one of the best tours I have ever taken in my many years of extensive traveling. One of my co-workers highly recommended that I take the tour and I’m glad I followed his advice. It was indeed the highlight of my four-day stay in Hong Kong. Our tour guide, Michael, was incredibly knowledgeable about the city, not only about its food and restaurants but also about its general history, urban landscape, and the social interactions between its inhabitants. I learned a great deal about Hong Kong and ate some great food at restaurants I would not have known about on my own, and at the same time I had so much fun. I got to know the fabulous Michael but also the other people on the tour. We were one happy giggly group, following our tour guide around like little ducklings, enjoying the beautiful city of Hong Kong and each other’s company. I highly recommend you take the food tour with Hello Hong Kong. It will make your tummy, your brain, and your soul smile!

This tour is a MUST for any food lover. Richard our guide was very informative. The food outlets we visited were outstanding and we learned a lot more about Hong Kong and its food than we had expected. The programmed visits were all outstanding. This tour is a MUST for any food lover.

weird and wonderful foods of hong kong!. Richard took us on an intimate and informative food tour of Hong Kong. Richard was very personable and knowledgable, we learned about aphrodisiacs and other foods that hold back the aging process as well as the reasons behind why many foods are held in such high regard by the Chinese. I love taking these tours because they give you the opportunity to ask lots of questions and Richard was a fountain of knowledge. The food tour was a great way to learn about the food but also about the city. Highly recommended.

Awesome Fun Tour with Richard. Richard was on time and patiently waited for us downstairs as we were late in start . His first activity blew our mind ( secret surprise , I don't want to spoil it by leaking here :) He was extremely sincere in checking out the list to make sure we did not miss anything . He spoke with Passion and took us to a point near Peak for a stunning view of Hongkong skyline . He also advised us for the street shopping and took us to a really good Indian Vegetarian restaurant as per our choice . He was full of energy and humour and we had a great great fun tour with him !!

Soggy Hong Kong . My adult son and I scheduled a private tour of Hong Kong. While I had visited Hong Kong many times, this was his first visit. Unfortunately, we toured during a category 3 typhoon. It rained heavily throughout our tour, but our guide Richard was so interesting and flexible that we had a marvelous time in spite of poor weather . Richard was knowledgeable and supplied us with interesting information about Chung King Mansion, the Peninsula Hotel and the old fire station during the Japanese occupation. He took us for a delicious dim sum lunch in Central. We expressed an interest in Chinese medicine so he included that in our tour. He really gave us,an good overview of Hong Kong. Both my son and I were impressed with the tour.

Epic Historical and Food Tour. What an introduction to Hong Kong. Greeted by a vivacious tour guide with an obvious love for Hong Kong, it's history and culture. Niya is knowledgeable and insightful & a great conversationalist. A good balance of history and culture, exposing us to local hangouts that tourists are likely to miss. A must for all first time visitors. Would even recommend it to people who've been there before and wants to get to know more about Hong Kong.

Public Foodie Walking Tour - Awesome Tour!. Absolutely brilliant tour with the lovely Jess, we tasted some delicious food, walked through some interesting neighbourhoods, got heaps of insight into the dried fish, went inside a traditional Chinese medicine pharmacy, walked the wet market, rode the ding ding tram & even watched the Villian Hating Grannies at work Jess's knowledge is to be applauded...best tour we've done in a long time. We booked from Australia directly with Hello Hong Kong process nice & easy & quick email responses to our questions before committing to the tour + only a deposit taken with balance just a few days prior to the tour.

Highly recommend!. Did the fabulous 4 hour food walking tour with a wonderful guide Jess. The food we tried at each stop was amazing and very authentic! Loved all the things we learned along the way and having a small insight into the food shops the locals visit. My advice is do not eat any breakfast before you start as tempting as your hotel breakfast probably is!! It is also a great way to see part of the island!
Awesome private tour. Best tour that I've been on. Michael was AWESOME !!!! Full of so much information and very attentive.

Excellent food tour. Our family (couple and our 18 year old son) had a weekend in Hong Kong and we booked the small group Hong Kong Island Food Tour. It was an outstanding tour and is the first thing we mention when people ask us about our visit to Hong Kong. We loved the different food stops - and the fact that we were encouraged to try different types of food (not a set menu at each stop!). Our son really enjoyed it too. There were 10 people on our tour and sitting at small round tables is a great way to get to know other travelers. My favorite part (other than the food!) was learning about Chinese medicine as we walked past the stores selling remedies. It was a fascinating morning, we walked, we took a ride on the Ding Ding, ate at restaurants where we were the only tourists and learned a lot about the history/culture of the area. There is no way that we could have done any of this without the tour. Finally, Laura answered many of our questions on how to get around for the rest of the weekend and gave us great tips on where best to see the fireworks. A fabulous morning, I really recommend this. Thank you, Laura - great memories and thanks for emailing us photos!

My best tour. Hello Hong Kong thanks so much for the most memorable tour I have experienced in my life time and believe you me I have travelled extensively and this has been one off my most thanks to Naya. The perfect host and guide. Loved learning about your food and city and culture simply amazing. Juanita

Great boat tour!. We were a party of eight, all mixed ages, and Laura was our guide. We had such a wonderful morning in the boat seeing the sights and listening to the history of Hong Kong. Laura was an enthusiastic, lovely, welcoming host and the tour was brilliant throughout. Thoroughly recommend this trip to any visitors or locals in Hong Kong. Thank you Hello Hong Kong!

Great Food Tour. It was really a amazing tour with our guide Nathan-he is humorous, knowledgeable and full of enthusiasm, We enjoyed lovely hongkong local food and also the unique culture here . It was our best time in Hong Kong and I still miss the Dim Sum so much! Definitely recommend this tour to everybody who travel to HK and you can't go wrong booking this. Thank you Nathan~

Hello Hong Kong Tours Don't Disappoint!. I visited Hong Kong with my mother this past August. We did two tours with Laura, one led by her around the city proper, and one led by Richard, one of her enthusiastic and knowledgeable guides, in Lantau.Laura and my mother met last year, when Mom visited Hong Kong solo. She enjoyed Laura's personalized tour so much, we signed up to do two tours with her this trip. On our first daylong trip, Laura took us all around the city, tailoring our itinerary to sights we were interested in seeing. I thoroughly enjoyed our day. She's very knowledgeable about Hong Kong and has clearly done a lot of research so that she's prepared to answer almost any question you might ask. Laura is also a good tour guide because she has a good sense of humor and a robust interest in her clients.On our second daylong tour to Lantau, we had Richard as our guide. He is full of all sorts of facts and trivia, adding to the interest of the trip. He is extremely accommodating and, just like Laura, takes a keen interest in his clients. We couldn't have asked for better guides both days. And the great thing was, on our tour with Richard, Laura came along as our friend, rather than our guide. Both days were favorites of my week spent in Hong Kong.As a caveat, we went on another tour the day before Laura's city tour, and our experiences were miles apart. The other tour cost far more money and we saw and learned far less. In fact, we weren't even sure why the places and sights we visited were remarkable enough to have been on our tour. Not so with Hello Hong Kong. Worth every penny and happy to have spent it!

Great food and even better company!. The tour was great! Laura did a phenomenal job of guiding us through historic foot stops in Hong Kong. From eating in a a traditional tea house in the morning to grabbing popular Hong Kong barbecue with the lunchtime crowd, Laura was able to provide us with insight into both the history and the food we were enjoying.

Hello Hong Kong Food Tour. We had a lovely tour with Niya- she is bubbly, full of enthusiasm and very knowledgeable about the food and city. The food we tasted was great and we had great fun hopping on and off trams and walking around diverse parts of Hong Kong. We would highly recommend this tour for foodies and those wanting to explore the city. Thank you Niya!

Great Way to Start a Hong Kong Getway . We just returned from Hong Kong where we spent two days with Laura and her team. Absolutely loved our boat tour with Laura. It was a different way to see this huge city. Not only my was it lovely to be out on the water but Laura's depth of knowledge was awesome. We learned about everything from shipping to Chinese pirates. I highly recommend Laura and Hello Hong Kong.

Lantou tour with Hello hongkong tours. Had done the 7 hour lantou island tour with Hello hongkong.The entire process from booking,to specific requirement identification and reminders for the tour were excellent. our tour guide Ben was there right on the appointed time. Ben's a fabulous tour guide with lots of local insights on culture,history etc.. we had a great tour of Lantou!!!!

Boat tour with Laura - a new view on Hong Kong. From start to finish, this is a great way to get to know other facets of Hong Kong. The famous skyline seen from within the harbour, the surrounding islands and harbours and beaches. And the container port! All this, comfortably settled on a boat and entertained as well as educated by the ebullient Laura. A great time!

Great boat tour with Laura. We went in the four hour group tour and we were about 10 people participating. Laura did a fantastic job making all comfortable and she was an excellent guide throughout the tour. She explained about the sights, the history of Hong Kong and about every thing else. She knows a lot and deliver her messages in a great way and also uses large photographs of old Hong Kong. Free drinks on board (water, soda, beer and wine).Highly recommendable.

Food Tour and Lantau tours are excellent. Right from the beginning of the booking process, it was easy and helpful and I felt confident that I was dealing with a reputable company. Along the way we made changes to our booking and this was handled promptly and with care. Our family did two tours, a food tour with Richard on a Saturday morning and a Private Lantau tour on Monday. The Food Tour was a wonderful combination of trying different foods and seeing where the locals buy their food. Our first restaurant was a fabulous old restaurant filled with locals having dim sum, where Richard chose different options that he thought we would enjoy. He also gave us insights into traditions and rituals. Our second stop was another tiny eatery that tourists would never find, where we tried noodle dishes. Third stop was to have the famous milk tea and our fourth place was a famous michelin star restaurant, again tiny and busy with delicious food. Our final treat was a Portuguese tart. Between all these stops we visited many stores, dry markets and wet markets where we learnt about the different ingredients, traditional Chinese Medicine and saw many out of the way places in the city. Richard was an enthusiastic and knowledgeable guide. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong. Richard followed up with an email recapping what we had done and seen and providing a link to photos he had taken. This was great.The private Lantau tour was definitely worth doing. Laura was engaging, passionate and interesting to listen to. We were able to skip the queue to go on to the cable cars (extra money is worth it to have the glass bottom crystal cars), which was a fabulous 25 minutes. We arrived in Ngong Ping Village and walked through to the Big Buddha, it really is big and then on to Po Lin Monastery. Whilst all of this you can easily do by yourself (but with queues), it made so much difference having someone explain the significance of things. We then caught the local bus to the fishing village of Tai O and went on a boat ride searching for pink dolphins, didn't see any. Lunch was at the Lookout Restaurant which had a good view. We then walked around Tai O which is very poor and traditional and fascinating. Throughout all of this, Laura gave us interesting information in an entertaining way. Thoroughly enjoyed our day with Laura and really glad we did this as a tour. Again, Laura followed up with an email summarising the places we had been, very helpful. Would highly recommend this company.
Great 4 hours. We did a small group tour around central Hong Kong with Ben. It was a great experience learning about the various shops and local customs. Great food locations

Hello Hong Kong tour led by Olivia. An excellent 3-hour walking tour through the Central and Mid-Level of Hong Kong. This tour showed me how little I knew about the place where I was born. Olivia is an excellent tour guide, mixing interesting historical knowledge with great sense of humour. The three hours went by too quickly! Will join her other tours if available, and definitely recommend anyone who wants to know more about Hong Kong.

Amazing amazing amazing!. Went on a 3 day tour with Jess, Ben and Laura. In Day 1, Jess showed us the different areas of Hong Kong, where the locals live and where the expats live and the different temples in and around HK. On Day 2, Ben took us to see HK from a different vantage point at Victoria's Peak. We enjoyed lunch at an authentic Dim Sum all you can eat restaurant on HK Island. Laura took us to the Big Buddha, and shows us HK's Venice in Tai Oh. We had lunch at the old police station in Tai Oh. We had an amazing three day tour and walked almost 10 miles daily! The tour catered to our dietary needs and Hello Hong Kong went out of its way to ensure we were take care of. The tour guides were friendly and filled with knowledge. They were energetic and perfect for our group! I would highly recommend Hello Hong Kong for anyone looking to find out the history of HK and the gems within it!

Amazing trip. We spent 3 days with Hello Hong Kong. Our tour guides were Jess, Ben, and Lara. All were ex-pats living in Hong Kong so communication was not an issue at all. They were able to show us the true flavor of Hong Kong. Not just the main tourist spots though we hit all of those as well. But they showed us the other side of Hong Kong so we were able to get a feel for the real Hong Kong. All 3 of them knew a lot of history and were able to go into a lot of detail about the history and culture of Hong Kong.

Take 2 Tours!. We did both the 5 hour city tour with Laura and the 4 hour food tour with Richard on back to back days and they were both amazing! There is so much to see and experience in Hong Kong and there was no overlap between the tours. Each tour was customized to what we were interested in and the food was amazing both days. We enjoyed a Michelin starred dim sum restaurant that fantastic and the BBQ pork and milk tea stops were big hits as well. Richard has an extensive background on food and its beneficial medicinal aspects. Laura was an absolute delight and made the day super fun for all 4 of us. We are so glad we chose Hello Hong Kong Tours and highly recommend it!

Wonderful food tour. We did the Hello Hong Kong Food Tour with Richard and found it excellent. He took his time to explain the cultural and historical background and made excellent choices, including a few "extras" in experiencing the neighborhood.

Me. Excellent day - great information from Laura on the boat tour and such relaxed surrounds away from the hustle and bustle of HK! I would recommend this as a not to be missed experience whether you are here for work and pleasure.

HK vaca. My wife and I along with another couple booked a private tour with Hello Hong Kong. They assigned Nathan to be our guide and we could not be more pleased. He was great! We had already seen a bit of HK on our own but Nathan's tour was icing on the cake. This activity is very well worth the money and if you book...ask for Nathan. I promise that you'll be pleased.

Amazing food tour, a must-do!. My wife and I always do a food tour whenever we visit a new city and this is one of the best food tours we have ever done. Our guide was Nathan who was excellent, highly knowledgeable and really helpful. He went above and beyond and we very much appreciate it (Many thanks Nathan!)The visits take in a variety of the local cuisines with options for vegetarian or meat-based food, all of which is highly delicious!The most valuable thing for us is that we would never have been able to discover these local gems on our own, so this tour really is useful, particularly if you are a foodie.Highly recommended, we cannot contemplate the thought of coming to HK without doing this food tour and it gave us a good grounding to explore other places throughout the course of our stay.

Must do, hyper local tour. The tour was amazing! Our guide, Nicole, took us to so many great food places and along the way taught us so much about local culture surrounding food, and she answered all our questions about everything else the group had to ask. Frankly, I was lost in the sea of Hong Kong, and Nicole gave me enough knowledge to put me on solid footing for the rest of the trip. The food can't be missed, it was nothing short of amazing, but the tour itself, as presented by Nicole, was so much more than what I thought I had paid for. Simply amazing.

First class private tour. We booked a private walking tour with Laura on the recommendation of friends. We were not disappointed. There was nothing we particularly wanted to do, we wanted to follow the recommendations of someone who knew the options. We would not have managed so many places on our own and even if we had, we would not have learned what Laura told us. She also took us to an authentic Dim Sum restaurant where we learned the background, as well as enjoying some good food. We will be recommending Laura to anyone we know who is going to Hong Kong.Laura. Very many thanks. You absolutely made our stay in Hong Kong so memorable.In the questions below, one is whether the attraction is exciting YES, unusual, YES or risky to visit NO. Hence using the Not Sure option.

Hong Kong private tour with Nathan. It was exactly what we were looking for! There was no way to see the different things we were interested in on a public tour - we were all over the place :) From traditional markets to chinese designer outlets, from the buzz of the city to the quiet of the monasteries, and from tourist hot spots to the back-streets. All in 5 hours. Thank you Nathan and Hello Hong Kong!

Tour. Jess was a true professional. She obviously devoted a great deal of time to learning local folklore and culture. Her perspectives as a globetrotter added depth to our experience and I loved witnessing her respect and admiration for the humanity and culture of the people amongst whom she lives. You can't go wrong.

A must for any food lover visiting Hong Kong!. We spent a great 4 hours or so with Nicole walking through the streets of Hong Kong Island learning all about local foods, delicacies and oddities. We were a group of two couples only and so the tour was very personalised. The food and experience were A1 and I would highly recommended the walking tour for anyone who enjoys learning about local food, history and culture.

Our guide Nicole, the food and the tour were great!. Nicole gave us a great tour and kept us entertained as we strolled around the streets of Hong Kong eating some fantastic food and learning quite a bit about Cantonese food, traditions and the British influence on the city. Dress comfortably, don't eat beforehand and enjoy the tour. There is plenty of food to eat with plenty of choices to choose from. The directions to the meeting point and all the specifics of the tour are emailed to you ahead of time making it very easy to be ready for the tour. We had 9 people in our group and we all had a great time talking and enjoying ourselves along the way. At the end of tour, Nicole gave us some great recommendations on where else to eat and what to do for the rest of our time in Hong Kong.

Hong Kong foodie tour. Our tour itineraries:Dim Sum / Yum Cha ... Very traditional by serving in push carts. Hardly seen these days in HK. Along Wing Lok Street and Des Voeux Road West where we saw the dried seafoods, sharks fins, birds nests and Chinese medicinal goods.Wonton Noodle Soup / Beef Brisket Noodle Soup ... So so tasty. Along Wellington Street with the Tong Lau tenement block (or what is left of it)Through Graham Street wet market to the fishmonger and the butcher on Gage Street.Milk Tea / Yuen Yeung .. Perfect match to quench your thirst in a sunny autumn heat. One of the best Yuen Yeung drink I have ever tasted.. Experienced The world's longest Escalator consisting of 23 continuous nos up the slope..By tram (ding ding) to Wan Chai.. Good HK island city tour .Roasted Meat - Char Siu (BBQ Pork), best ever and it's Michelin guided restaurant. Egg Tart - quality as comparable to those In MACAU. What we like best was that we get to try a bit of everything in such short time and yet feeling not over eating ..Further more, we get to know new friends. Highly recommended and Nicole is such a bubbly guide.

Awesome HK Day Tour . My husband, MIL, mom and I met Laura for a day tour around HK today and had an amazing time. She was an extremely knowledgeable and friendly guide. I understand how important it is to have a great person to lead you around and I would highly recommend Laura if you're in the market to get to know HK. She even went out of her way and offered to help us figure out the train system for our next destination after the tour. A+ service.

Great food and culture tour!. This tour was a last minute decision but turned out to be a highlight of our trip to Hong Kong! Nicole is a fantastic guide. She gave us so many great food experiences all in one day, presented to us with such enthusiasm and local knowledge. Thanks Nicole and thanks for the great photos and tips for other things to see while we're here.Mark & Anna

A Hong Kong MUST. the boat tour with Laura was everything it promised & more. Lively commentary about HK history, the harbour, great story telling! I'll be taking all my visitors on this tour - seeing HK from the harbour gives you a terrific perspective on HKG history, growth & visuals. Worth every dollar.

Great 4 Hours!. My wife and I booked a food tour with Hello Hong Kong for one of our 6 days in the city. What we experienced was much more than just a food tour. Nathan is the gentleman who guided us on this tour and was able to provide us with many insights, recommendations and general knowledge than simply food and restaurant related things. While my wife is very much in to the food, and this tour was primarily intended for her enjoyment, I found myself having as good or better of a time than she was! Nathan was flexible with exactly what we were wanting to do and seemed to very much enjoy his work. Very personable and spoke highly of the company as well, this tells me that there is a high likelihood that other tour guides/employees will enjoy their work as well which in turn of course means a consistent experience regardless of who performs the tour. Overall we got a good sampling of the local cuisine and culture to pair with it for my wife, and I was able to learn many other historical aspects of the city and culture throughout the entire morning and afternoon. NOTE** when booking this tour, make sure to give them your contact information. One couple was late and although Nathan tried and we waited an acceptable length of time, he was unable to reach them as the medium through which they booked the tour did not relay their info. So if you use a middle booking system, make sure to contact them directly and give your info. We highly recommend this company, it was a very memorable part of our Hong Kong experience!

The Queen of Hong Kong Tours. What started off as a wet and grey morning promising nothing but another unfortunate seafaring fiasco turned out to be quite the opposite. Laura is lively, articulate, engaging and super informative in her passion of the Hong Kong harbour history via the aquatic perspective.The tour is a 'must do' for those with little or no knowledge on the history or growth of the city/territory, and seeing it from the harbour is a fantastic shorthand method to cover a lot of ground. Having enjoyed this immensely on a wet day, being photographically challenged, I can only imagine how much better it would be when the weather is favorable. 10/10.

Don't miss this tour!!!. An unforgettable experience. One of the highlights of my stay. It may looks expensive, but it is worth every penny. Ask for Nicole - she is an amazing guide. We had great time with her. She took us to very unique places, were only local go. It is a must for foodies.

Lantau island day trip. This has to be the best guided tour we have ever done. We were lucky enough to have Laura, the owner of Hello Hong Kong, as our guide, and she ensures that all her guides are keen, interested, highly personable (as she is) and very knowledgeable. We spent all day with Laura starting on Lantau at Tung Chung station (an easy train trip from anywhere in Hong Kong) with the spectacular cable car ride to the peak where Big Buddha resides opposite the most magnificent monastery and temple I've seen yet. Then local bus to Tai O, a wonderful little fishing village to explore on foot and by boat, which we did. And we got to see at close range the rare and endangered Pink Dolphins out beyond the river mouth! Lunch at the Heritage hotel (once a a police station) all included in a very reasonably priced and "must-do" day trip. Laura has a range of interesting and exciting tours to offer and we will definitely seek her out for one of these next time we're there.

An excellent tour. Hello Hong Kong was recommended to me by friends who had had a brilliant tour a few months ago. I wanted a tour that would introduced me to Hong Kong and give me some history, information on where to go and see some of the key sights and my tour with Laura totally exceeded my expectations.It couldn't be easier to arrange. I did the Private 4 hour Tour. I was picked up from my hotel and Laura took me on an amazing tour of famous places, markets, iconic buildings and restaurants. She was brimming with amazing facts and stories and she had lots of pictures and diagrams to explain the history, geography and information on Old Hong Kong. We finished with some Dim Sum in a great restaurant.Laura is professional, knowledgable and fun. I am now full of information and have a good understanding of the background to this city to enable me to get the most out of the rest of my trip. She has given me lots of useful pointers with regards to travelling and getting the most out of my stay.I couldn't recommend this tour enough. If you book direct rather than through tripadvisor you can ask for a 5% discount so I would advise doing this but whether you are in HK for a few hours, days or weeks, this is a superb way to be introduced to the city.

All the good stuff!. It was really good hearing a local's take on Hong Kong. I was very impressed with Michael's knowledge not only of where the good places are to eat, but also of the history of each place and putting it all into a flowing culinary and historical narrative. Having been exposed to much of the food in Australia it was very interesting to compare and note the variations. The won ton noodles were a highlight for me.

Public group boat tour. A 4 hour tour that included not only beauty spots but also the fascinating Aberdeen harbour and the container port. Highly enjoyable but also educational as plenty of background information provided about the history and development of Hong Kong.

A Tasty Tour. A superb range of food to try in places a tourist would never have found. Jess's knowledge of Hong Kong and the food was really interesting and you really feel that you get to know a little of what the locals eat.

HK food tour. I went on a tour with a friend of mine (who is a local) and we were both very impressed with the vast amount of knowledge she had of the area. She seemed very enthusiastic and attentive to our needs and was overall a great tour guide. I would definitely recommend!

HK Food Tour - am. This was a really well put together tour, very well delivered by our guide, Jess. The tour is an excellent way to visit a range of great, authentic restaurants and outlets without having to go through the hit-and-miss process of researching individual establishments yourself.

Great tour. I left HK when I was a teenager, totally is a foreigner except I still speak the language. I have never been to the places that Jess took us. I would have never found the places. I went to the Dim Sum place when I was a kid, totally forgot about it. The wonderful part was I walked by the building where my father was a attendant and he worked there for 30 years! I also found the small noodle stall behind the building where he used to get me lunch. It was magical. HK changes so much , but one piece of my childhood is still here.

Ecellent food tour. The Hello Hong Kong experience is great. From booking to instruction emails to the tour itself, all worked perfectly. I did the morning food tour in a small group and it was ideal. The tour guide, Jess, was perfect. Knowledgeable, thoughtful, responsive to suggestions, patient and with a good sense of humor. We visited half a dozen places, mainly restaurants and cafes we wouldn't know existed, or would have been a bit intimidated by the crowds and language barrier. Jess helped us navigate it all with ease. Much more than a food tour, it was a cultural introduction to HK and its food, as well as a great history lesson. If you are visiting Hong Kong I strongly recommend you book this tour early in your stay.

Tasty and really informative!. I attended the food tasting tour today, with Jess. We tried a range of food and it was delicious. However what added to the experience was Jess- she was the perfect guide. Knowledgable, helpful and really clear in the information she was imparting. She went out of her way to answer questions and was really interesting to speak to, too. It was great to see authentic Hong Kong dining. But also to connect and get bearings on a very busy city. I would definitely recommend this trip.

Food your with Laura... Absolutely top day out on HK trying amazing food with Laura. Her knowledge was second to none and it was the best thing we did in all our time in HK. Value you for money is guaranteed as you learn so much! I'm now addicted to chai Sui pork however! Thanks again, we will be back.

Fantastic guided food tour. After not knowing what to expect, Michael kindly met us at our hotel lobby and went over briefly what was to be covered. Next we headed off in Central and caught the subway to the Sai Ying Poon station where we tasted our first food selection of the tour- Dim Sum at a traditional restaurant where I felt we were the only foreigners in a crowded place. This was a great experience.Next along Des Voeux road we saw many dried seafood stores with many fascinating uses and picked up a bottle of table wine. We next had another Cantonese culinary fixture -Wonton noodle soup at Mak's. delicious.We went over some ice milk tea and iced milk coffee before taking the cable car to our next destination- for some BBQ pork and rice followed by small walk over for an egg tart in a playground, which concluded the food aspect of the tour.The tour was devised very well but the highlight by far, was Michael, who answered all of our questions we had and was very personable.

Food Tour. Our guide, Michael made the 5-hour experience unforgettable. We ate dim sum and drank tea with locals, toured through the dried seafood and medicinal herb district, and gained an intimate understanding of the history of Hong Kong. Living here for 40 years and speaking fluent Cantonese and English made Michael the perfect guide's He was fantastic and I enjoyed the experience immensely.

Great food tour. We were lucky enough to book on to a tour with Niya who was so engaging and animated throughout the day. Not only did we get to sample some really interesting HK cuisine (wonton soup, dim sum, milk tea, char sui pork - some we liked a great deal more than others but still a good experience as it helped us know what to avoid when we were let lose on our own) but we learned a great deal about Hong Kong traditions and culture which was very informative and really helped improve out understanding of the city for the rest of our trip. We did our tour in the Central and Wan Chai areas on a rainy day but it was a great thing to do at the start of our time in the city and the weather wasn't an issue at all. What was so nice is that after our trip, we received a load of information from Niya about other things to do whilst we were in HK with her own personal thoughts about the best views from the Peak, times and ways to do things and other ideas that may not come up on things like Trip Advisor - we were so grateful for this.

Food tour. Had a morning with Jess and it was fantastic!! Lots of information about the town and so much yummy food. The dim sum, won ton, milk tea, and oh the bbq pork were incredible, and in places we never would have found. Loved the back alleys and the walk, it was an easy pace and kept us all fascinated. Jess followed up with lots of other ideas as well and really made us feel like we should explore the entire island. Would gladly do this tour again!
Guided tour. Laura can tell very enthousiastic about HK. She is well informed and has lots of humour. Although it was a rainy day we had a nice guided tour and learned a lot about this city.
Fun for foodies!. We had a great time with Richard learning about and tasting all kinds of Chinese specialties - and some we would rather not taste! Great way to spend a rainy morning!

Good boat tour. Went on this boat tour a little while ago and had a great time. Although I've been on a few junks in Hong Kong this one gave us unique access to places I've never been. The history was was also very interesting, and the company was great!

Delicious!. My wife and I really enjoyed this tour. We went past several very different places, mostly frequented by locals. Delicious dim sum, barbequed pork... Yum! Hong Kong is famous for its diverse cuisine and the tour captures that really well. Jess, our guide, was very nice and knowledgeable. We especially liked that we also explored and got to know the city a bit more. Totally recommend it!

Really appreciated the insights to Hong Kong. Our tour guide was Jess. Jess was wonderful. We arrived having no knowledge of Hong Kong history but we came away so much more the wiser. Jess was fabulous. Our first experience was the Ding Ding. We had arrived late the pervious night and had no small money for the ride, Jess didn't make a fuss, just simply offered to pay for it for us. We learnt much more than what was expected. We learnt about the colour-coded weather warnings and what the weather app was to use. Jess provided us information about etiquette for eating dim sum and put us at ease during our first Asian food experience. We even got very detailed instructions about how to reach The Peak's best view point, and how to determine if it was worth heading up (depending on weather conditions). Jess was very open and happy to answer all of our questions, even the nosey ones about how it was living in Hong Kong as an ex-pat.At the completion of the tour Jess said she would send details recapping what we had seen and where we had been and she was true to her word.We left Jess feeling confident we could tackle the MTR and find our way to other restaurants and shopping areas.Thanks so much Jess, it was a great tour which we really enjoyed.

Foodie Tour. I throughly enjoyed this tour. The guide Nathan was very informative and the restaurants were well chosen. My only slight disappointment was that food choices at dim sum were very unadventurous. Of course I could have requested more adventurous choices. Nathan's knowledge of the history and culture of Hong Kong were very insightful.

Excellent Food Tour. I did this tour and was very excited! My guide was Laura who also happened to be the founder of the company which I really loved. The tour was really excellent, Laura was so informative and keen and interested in everyone on the tour. She took photos along the way which was great and has already emailed them to us. We had 5 different and very distinctive stops along the way and everything was really tasty and different.After the tour, Laura stayed and chatted for a bit and gave us lots of tips for places we could go or things to do.She also sent us 3 emails the same day (as well as the photos) for restaurant and bar recommendations; day trip and hiking options and other tours on offer as some people had expressed an interest and there was a spot open on a trip!Overall this is one of the best tours I have done - and I've done a lot! Couldn't recommend more highly.

Excellent food tour!. I booked this tour for myself and a friend who was visiting from Australia. I live in HK and am adventurous eater, my friend, slightly less so and this tour was perfect for us both. Nathan was our guide and he was fantastic - very knowledgable, friendly and accommodating of our small group. I highly recommend this tour. The walking between food stops is not arduous, even on a hot day and is a great way to see authentic HK neighbourhoods, try traditional local cuisine and balance out the eating! No doubt I will be back with my next visitors.

Great food tour!!. I booked the Hong Kong food tour for the day after I arrived in the hope it would give me the confidence to go and enjoy the local restaurants and food stalls opposed to the "safe" tourist spots. It didn't disappoint, our tour guide Ben was very knowledgable as we spent 4 hrs trying out the local cuisine as well a nice tram ride. Highly recommend this tour, it is the right pace and gives you great insight to the food and way of life, don't fill up at the first food stop!

Unique, educational food tour. One of the best tours we've been on given the past 4 months of travel. Michael was our guide and we are very glad he was! He knows so much about Hong Kong from its history to socioeconomic, culture, and of course, food! Michael knows Cantonese and is really an expert on Hong Kong. We had such a great day with our small group learning from him via 4-5 restaurants. He took us through the working class neighborhoods and markets and we: learned how to enjoy dim sum/ yum cha in the traditional HK way, learned about all the various kinds of dried food, ate at a Michelin-starred noodle place, had some great milk tea. We also had THE BEST cha siu and it was a small place frequented only by locals, tucked into a tiny room. We went to an expensive restaurant the night after and it just didn't compare. Even though it was inexpensive, being able to know about such a place and having Michael treat us to it felt like a luxury. Afterwards we had such a great experience we took him out for a beer and learned even more!! He is a walking encyclopedia :D He also helped us catch a cab to go to the peak. Then we got a bunch of recipes from him via email AND got tips on other places to go to in Hong Kong. Definitely he went above and beyond his tour duties. I highly recommend this tour for anyone that loves food and wants to learn more about Hong Kong in a unique, down to earth way.

Remarkable tour. My two adult children and I took this wonderful walking tour with Michael on our last day in Hong Kong. I only wish we had done it the first day as we learned so much and explored so many things. Michael has an excellent knowledge of the city as well as the many specialty foods. I was worried about feeling stuffed from four different restaurants, especially as the dim sum at the first place was extensive. However the tour was well paced and we had time to digest between stops. It was a hot summer day, but Michael made time for water breaks and we had as many shady moments as he could find. My children and I enjoyed the variety of food we sampled and ate every bite. Some of it was familiar to us and some was totally novel. We enjoyed hearing the interesting cultural stories about the food. This tour was a highlight of our Hong Kong stay and we highly recommend the tour with Michael.

This is worth a break from shoppiong in HK. Great tour, very interesting, funny and lots of (non-boring) facts. We added some places of interest, some history as well as some food. Laura had great knowledge and a lovely way of dealing with our group of 8.

Fantastic walking/food tour of Hong Kong. We thoroughly enjoyed the 4 hours we spent with Laura. She customised a walking tour to meet our requirements of a mix of food, culture and history. Engaging and informative Laura ensured we experienced aspects of Hong Kong that we wouldn't have discovered ourselves. The yum cha in a traditional restaurant was the prefect way to start our tour after a late evening out the night before. Laura was incredibly knowledgeable and in addition to the places we visited on the tour she e-mailed later that day with specific recommendations ( including photos and transport directions) for other activities we were interested in doing. Thank you Laura for a fantastic morning.

Great food tour in Hong Kong. I absolutely loved the food tour of Hong Kong. It was one of my favorite things I did! Our guide, Richard, was particularly wonderful with all of the interesting facts and details he shared as we walked through the city. Of course, the food was incredible. I'd highly recommend this!

Great food tour in Hong Kong. I did this great tour several months ago (in May 2016) and want to thank Hello hongkong agency for such a great experience. Our guide Ben provided us a lot of details regarding local food and culture. We had a nice walk from teahouse in Sheung Wan to the next point , visiting dry seafood stores and local market. Also we tried Hong Kong style BBQ pork and duck, noodles and hong kong style milk tea. I really enjoyed this tour and highly recommend it to everybody who wants not just to try something local and authentic, but also get some information on local culture.

Great Food Tour. We did the 4 hour public food tour a couple of months ago and really enjoyed the whole experience. Top Tip: although we were in plenty of time to begin with ... we got lost trying to navigate from Central ourselves and ended up being quite late. As my wife pointed out several times ... we'd recommend you take the advice given by Hello Hong Kong and get a taxi to the meeting point!Our guide, Niya, was fantastic - very upbeat and full of interesting stories. Although we were late she had waited for us at the meeting point and carefully adjusted to first part of the tour to feed the others and ensure that the intro was covered after breakfast. As other reviewers have said, its best to go hungry and you will benefit most from the experience.It was great to do this in a small group (there were four of us in total) and we got lots of time with the guide. Its well worth doing this type of tour at the start of your visit to HK. Niya also made sure that everyone was comfortable to get back to their hotels / next sightseeing spot.We would highly recommend this to anyone on a first visit to HK.

Fantastic private tour with Richard to Lantau Island!. Explored Lantau Island and Tai O Fishing Village. Richard took me to some places where only the locals go. He knew exactly where to go and was very efficient with time and crowds. He shares his knowledge of the area and was extremely helpful every step of this tour. I wouldn't have done this tour any other way. Thank you Richard, for a memorable experience.

Fantastic tour - highlight of the trip. If you're looking for a food tour that is perfectly blended with a cultural and historical tour of the city, look no further. On my end, I wasn't sure, as a vegetarian/pescatarian, that I'd have much to eat on the tour but I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed the tastings even at the meat centric spaces. This is one of the best tours we've taken anywhere - Ben is a fantastic guide to what the city has to offer in food and in so much more. It felt like meeting up with a new friend. We would recommend this tour to anyone who visits the city. A+.

Nathan was incredible!!. Our food tour was not only a food tour - Nathan provided great insight into the history of Hong Kong and at the end helped anyone out that needed suggestions on where to go and what to see in Hong Kong. The food tour was fantastic! Each stop was authentic and very traditional. I love going on these food tours because you go into places you would never be game to on your own. Walking the city was also super fun and the food was spaced out well! Favourites were definitely the yum cha and Egg tart! We both Highly recommend Nathan as he was so welcoming, knowledgable and lots of fun!

Hong Kong Food Tour & Private 4 Hour Hong Kong Tour. We had the pleasure of taking 2 tours with Hello Hong Kong while my son and I were visiting earlier this month. The Hong Kong Food tour was with Niya and she was just awesome. While we are very well versed in food, we had the opportunity to try a couple things we had never had like the steamed sponge cake. We also had some of the best wonton noodle soup and char siu I have ever tasted. It was truly a fun and informative tour and would highly recommend it and Niya!We also did a private 4 hour tour with Jess and also have nothing but high praise for her. We enjoyed traveling around the city with her and getting to know her. She is very knowledgeable and personable and I would highly recommend her. The highlights for me was the views from Victoria Peak, the Peninsula Hotel and riding the Star Ferry to HK Island and of course, all the history we learned while chatting and walking. If you don't have a lot of time to spend in Hong Kong, this is a must!

Great Travel experience. I accompanied 2 friends from US to tour in HK for one day. Richard is a good Tourist guide, ethusiasm, and very familiar with HK history. He tried to arrange the full day for us, we did make a good use of every mins, even though tired, but still worth it.

Fantastic way to explore the city!. We did the four hour food tour and were lucky to have the very knowledgeable Jess as our guide! The tour was fantastic going to a range of different places within the Hong Kong and Wan Chai districts! It was excellent to do at the front-end of our trip as it allowed us to get excellent tips from Jess and to have a better understanding of the layout of the city. The food stops were excellent, just make sure you are hungry!

Charming and well-informed. Rarely in my world travels have I encountered a guide as engaging, knowledgeable, sweet-tempered and charming as Jess from Hello Hong Kong. While her itinerary encompassed a very thoughtful and well-conceived overview of the city, our discussions frequently swerved away from Hong Kong's history into surrounding countries upon which, due to her extensive international guide activities, she was astonishingly well-versed. My wife and I happen to be divers - no problem for Jess! As a certified dive master she can give advice on Sipodan or the Philipines or the Great Barrier Reef with equal expertise. There seemed to be no topic related to Hong Kong on which she could not add a good-humored and information-packed insight. All delivered in a breezy, warm, and cheerful manner. This woman is a gem. Heartily recommend!

Great Tour. Plesant fun and safe. NIcely done.. I traveled to Hong Kong with a colleague for a business meeting. We made sure we had a couple days for touring. And we connected with Hello Hong Kong via Trip Advisor. The tour groups know each other and recommend each other and we found HHK through another tour operator.Laura was prompt to respond. She helped us set up a tour with her group. Richard led the tour. He learned in advance what we wanted to see. He met us at our hotel. And he showed us a great day.We went to the Big Buddha. The gondola ride was awesome. We went to the Taoist village of Tai O where we had lunch and walked around.It was a full day tour. Richard was patient and taught us alot of history. Hong Kong has nice sites to see but you need guides who can teach and explain the amazing culture. Richard did a fabulous job.We had lunch at the old police station in Tai O, (UNESCO site). I didnt think the lunch was very good and it took 1.5hrs. Hong Kong has pretty poor service in the restaurants. Waitresses and waiters dont work for tips and some just dont care how long or if you get the right food or what you ordered. That said, we didnt need to waste 90 minutes for a below average meal.The Big Buddha was awesome. Great Time overall. Remember it can be hot. Buy some of those rechargeable portable fans at the Temple Street Market. You will be glad you did!!!

A Foodies dream!. We did the 4 hour private food tour. (Only because we only had a few hours in Hong Kong on a layover and our flight times didn't quite coincide with one of the group tours). Although it wasn't cheap, we certainly didn't regret it. We were lucky enough to have the lovely Richard who was very knowledgeable and entertaining.We learnt a lot from him not just about food but also culture, medicine and life in general in Hong Kong. Make sure that you don't have anything to eat before you go on this tour as there is enough food to satisfy he biggest of appetites.We stopped off at various places on the tour. A dim sum/yum cha place, a wonton noodle soup restaurant, a barbecued meat restaurant(amazing roast pork!),a milk tea stall, a bakery(the best custard tart ever! - and i don't even have a sweet tooth!), markets and various 'dried offering' shops.We got taken to places that we would have never even found if we had been left to our own devices.If you have limited time in Hong Kong and/or love food, this tour is for you! A great way to see and quite literally get a 'flavour of Hong Kong'. Couldn't recommend this enough!!

Excellent tour. We were lucky to have Richard as our guide. He was really friendly and very knowlegdable and flexible with tour plans. We covered everything we wanted to see as well a beautiful temple with fortune tellers and a nunnery with beautiful gardens we otherwise would have missed. He showed our teenage daughters how to use the MTR and took us on the Star Ferry and up to a great lookout a short walk from the Peak. I would definitely recommend using Hello Hong Kong especially if it's your first trip and you want to get a great overview of the sights and history.
Great overview of Hong Kong. Highly recommend. Our tour guide was Laura, a Brit now living in Hong Kong, shared her passion for "real life" in the city.

Best part of HK, especially if you love food!. What an fantastic experience, not only did Micheal our tour guide deliver exactly what was advertised, but he went above and beyond. With an insight to how the locals live and dabbling in the local food and culture this tour is the best I have ever been on. If you plan on visiting HK then this tour is a must and should be the first thing you do.

Wonderful. This tour was a lot of fun, even on a rainy day it was so worthwhile. We got to see quite a bit of Hong Kong, at a comfortable pace. The food was delicious and plentiful, please don't eat before the tour !We met some lovely people and our guide Nathan was exceptional, very interesting and knowledgeable. I highly recommend this experience.

Great tour of Hong Kong!. We were lucky enough to get Nathan as our guide when we visited there in May. He is so interesting and charming that we told people he was our son. We visited the Peak by taking a taxi to the top and riding the tram down and were able to avoid huge lines of people. Nathan took us to a great Dim Sum restaurant were we learned how to eat like a local and enjoyed sharing a table with some of them. We spent 5 hours exploring the town and he got us to a cab at the end of the tour which delivered us back to our ship.
Fun foodie morning in Hong Kong. I wouldn't normally go on tours but I'm really glad I did. We had a really fun group and the guide (Michael) was great also. Great tour. Book today.

The one absolute must do in Hong Kong. I can not rate this trip enough. It was by far the best experience of Hong Kong you can get. Not only do you get to eat some amazing food you get to experience the real life of the locals. You get to tour around some amazing areas and out of the usual tourist traps. Our guide Michael was brilliant and extremely knowledgable. If I go back to Hong Kong the first thing on my list would be to do this tour again. If you only have one day in Hong Kong this is the must tour for you!!

Fantastic 5 hour private tour with Michael!. My partner and I were in Hong Kong for a week and decided we wanted to get to know as much as possible on our first day there so we could make the most of the rest of our trip.We booked a 5 hour private tour and had a truly fantastic day out!We went to places we would never have known about on our own and felt really comfortable navigating around the city on our own for the rest of our trip...Michael, our tour guide, was an ex-pat Englishman who blew us away with his knowledge and enthusiasm about all things Hong Kong!We'd been to Hong Kong a few times before but this tour left us feeling like we're starting to get to know this amazing city.Book your tour now!

Fantastic and Delicious Food Tour. Thank goodness we decided to do a tour with Laura. We had the best dim sum of our entire trip. Our favorite was the bbq pork - the tour was the perfect way to experience Hong Kong specialities.Laura is a terrific guide -very knowledgable and detail oriented. She does private tours but the other people you tour with make it so much fun.Don't hesitate to book with Hello Hong Kong!
Great way to experience Hong Kong's cuisine. We loved our tour with Nathan.He was very informative and each food stop tasted amazingly good. Especially the BBQ pork and custard tart.

Best day tour!. Laura designed a great tour for me and my family. She was also really great about giving us advice for other parts of our trip. I can say undoubtedly that she was the best tour guide I've ever had due to her outgoing personality and drive to improve our trip. Best of all, she sent me a full guide for Tokyo when I told her I'd be going there next month. It was super helpful!

Great way to experience Hong Kong. We took a food tour with Jess and she taught us so much more than about food. We were so happy to have found her. It was a great way to see and learn about the city, the culture and the delicious food.

Food tour that came with so much more. This was the first food tour I'd been on it and from this experience I have done several more. Jess, our guide, was friendly, informative, patient and obviously passionate about Hong Kong. We went places, heard about the places and experienced a part of Hong Kong I'd never have got any other way. The whole tour was a fantastic opportunity to experience both the history and current environment of Hong Kong. Thank you for showing me Hong Kong that I'd never have experienced without your help. I'd do it again.

5hr Bespoke Tour with Jess. I fully recommend the tour with Jess – we left with a far greater knowledge of the area and its rich history than we possibly could have imagined. On a hot and very humid day, our guide spaced out the stop points perfectly and imparted some fantastic cultural and historical information that really let us view the city in a completely different light. She took us to areas that we wouldn’t normally have visited (let alone known about) and really set us up for the rest of our trip. I cannot rate Jess our guide highly enough. It felt more like spending time with a good friend rather than someone we’d only met that morning. Very easy going, a great communicator and it was obvious that she loved what she was doing.

Wonderful Experience, Great Guide, and Delicious Food. My husband and I had a stop in HK as part of our SE Asia cruise in April. I was looking for a tour that would allow us to see HK at the "street level" and to experience HK food. The Public Group Food tour looked perfect so I booked. We trusted our host, the fabulous Richard Dias, and that trust wasn't betrayed! Our experience of HK was positively impacted as a result of the tour. This tour is usually the first thing we tell people about when we relate the 3 weeks we spent in SE Asia. We pretty much recount the entire tour route to them and each dish we ate! Richard took us to places that we would NEVER have found on our own nor likely been brave enough to try. I say brave just because these were local places and we would not have known how to navigate the ordering process. Richard did a nice job explaining the dishes. Richard also took us through the wet and dry markets of HK where his knowledge and passion really came through on this part of the tour. He has a wealth of information and you will have to work hard not to learn something from Richard. And the surprise bonus for me was riding the tram - I loved it especially because I was in the front seat on the top level. Richard's love of HK really shines and he wants to share that love with you. It rained slightly on us but I don't think that should deter you from doing the tour if rain is in the forecast. The tour was a casual, easy going experience. Just a reminder that elbow room is a premium in HK, so prepare yourself for tight places. For us, this just added to the overall experience. Do I recommend this tour - heck yes. Would I do the tour again - absolutely.

Amazing Boat tour. Absolutely awesome day spent on the boat around Hong Kong bays, shorelines and various island. Really knowledgeable and approachable, happy to answer any questions and or have a joke around with. Laura was the best, couldnt ask for a better host. 11/10 would recommend.

Hong Kong by Sea - Great Tour!!!. This tour was a definitely a great experience! It makes so much sense to do this tour by boat…I got to enjoy HK from a different perspective while learning some interesting facts about its rich history.I thought the tour was done very well. Laura, our wonderful tour guide, did a great job talking us thru some history before each of stop. She gave us key dates, events and even had visuals to help us understand. We heard just enough information to spark our interest and help us appreciate this island at a deeper level.The boat was very nice and had a great front deck where we could enjoy the scenery. I really enjoyed taking photos that I wouldn’t be able to otherwise. Seeing the container port up-close was a highlight for me as well as cruising by the floating village. The last stop of the tour is Stanley, which is a great place to have lunch and do some market shopping. If you are visiting or live in HK, I definitely recommend this tour to everyone!

Wonderful Day in Hong Kong with Jess. Hong Kong was our first stop on a 3 week tour in Asia. We met Jess on our first morning after traveling for over 24 hours. I was a little nervous about having the energy for the tour, but Jess was SO GREAT we had such a blast with her touring the city. She even kept our 4 year-old engaged. We had a wonderful day and really enjoyed the way Jess showed us the city. It was a really easy pace, but we covered so much ground. The highlight was our dim sum lunch. We weren't able to get to the peak on the tour because it was really overcast. After the tour Jess sent us an email with instructions on how to get a lesser known place to get a view of the city. Oh boy was it an amazing view! We loved touring with Jess. We only wish we had more time to spend in Hong Kong.

A Great Introduction to HK Food and Street Life. Our guide Michael was very pleasant and knowledgeable. The meeting place was easy to find and the route took us through the older western part of Hong Kong and also the more modern central and eastern parts of the city. The tour lasted for over 4 hours and there were plenty of opportunities for rehydration on a hot steamy day. The food stops were for Dim Sum/Yum Cha at a tea house in Sheung Wan (tasty food and interesting contact with locals), Wonton Noodle Soup in Central (interesting story about the restaurant but the food did not live up to its reputation) , Milk Tea in Central (tasted better than I expected), Roasted Meats in Wan Chai (great food in a bustling restaurant frequented by locals) and Egg Tart in Wan Chai (a tasty Hong Kong creation). The tour included stops at shops selling dried seafoods, gold and jewellery, fruit stalls, a wet market and a ride on the Ding Ding tram to Wan Chai. The tour is a great introduction to a range of Hong Kong foods and an insight into the workings of Hong Kong. It will provide you with an interesting tour and background on Honk Kong that you could not hope to achieve without a knowledgeable local guide. This is a walking tour so a reasonable level of fitness and comfortable shoes are required.

Absolutely amazing food tour!. Jess was an excellent host, friendly, funny and extremely knowledgeable - not just about food but Hong Kong in general! She really went the extra mile and everyone (a group of 6) had a great time. We got to experience the real food of Hong Kong, that we definitely would have missed out on if we hadn't done this tour. The food itself was incredible and catered to everyone's different tastes. I really can't recommend the tour and Jess enough!

Incredible Experience. We have never taken any type of tour and booked this tour on a whim. We had the best day EVER!!! Niya did a fabulous job on our 5 hour tour. We went all over the city and she took us to fun little holes in the walls- one where my husband ate turtle soup! We rode the subway, took a ferry and even a double decker bus. Niya was full of fun and interesting facts, we were completely at ease with her during our day together, she even bought us a little gift when we were browsing through some shops! If you are in Hong Kong you MUST take this tour.

Do this FIRST!. My husband and I were in HK for two weeks and we took a food tour after having been there for 6 days. When visiting HK, you DEFINITELY want to do a tour with Hello Hong Kong FIRST. The knowledge and confidence we gained from this tour was invaluable. Our tour guide Michael took the mystery and apprehension out of finding places to eat, walking down unfamiliar alleyways, and using the public transportation system. Not only did he take us to restaurants that we would have never found on our own, he shared fascinating facts about HK and its culture and customs. Despite the torrential rains (which could make just about anything miserable), my husband and I both had a fantastic time. Michael was professional, interesting, and knowledgeable. The following week, my husband and I followed the path of our tour so we could revisit some of the stops. We had the pleasure of running into Michael and another tour he was giving. It was nice to say “hello.” If we even have the pleasure of being in HK again, we will book another tour through Hello Hong Kong.
Excellent foodie tour. Our foodie tour of HK was excellent, with our guide Richard being very knowledgeable in the local food as well as Chinese Traditional Medicine, which was a real eye-opener.

Great fun, great food & a great guide!. It was our 15 year old visitors first trip to Hong Kong and despite the wet weather, she had an amazing time on the food tour. Richard was terrific and went out of his way to make the tour a great success. We covered an enormous amount of HK island but it was never rushed and the food stops were all excellent. Richard is very knowledgeable about HK and eager to share his passion for food with visitors to this amazing city. Highly recommend this tour group.

what a great trip. we had a great trip, we had one day to fit everything in and Michel was a great guide. we felt really looked after and covered so much ground. Below is an outline of what we did. From the hotel by taxi to The Peak via Stubbs Road and Peak Road, with some nice views across Happy Valley and out towards the south side of Hong Kong Island with Aberdeen Harbour in the distance. The history of The Peak and the way in which house prices, even to-day, climb the higher one lives up the mountain was discussed! At The Peak Galleria, we avoided the tourist areas and went for a local tour along Lugard Road ,around the base of Victoria Peak, to a point with a nice vista out over Victoria Harbour, taking in the north shore of Hong Kong Island and the Kowloon Peninsula. The prominent buildings were pointed out, including Government House. The Colonial history of Hong Kong and the situation since the handover was discussed. We then walked back to the Peak Tram Terminus and were able to catch a fairly empty tram right away on the descent into Central.Once at the Garden Road Peak Tram Terminal, we walked down to St. John's Cathedral - dating from 1849, it is the oldest Anglican cathedral in Asia. We then walked along Battery Path and the history and uses of the Former French Mission Building were explained.To the HSBC building to look at the architecture and talk about the feng shui in the building and the development of the shore line and land reclamation. To the HSBC Bronze Lions with the shrapnel bomb damage from the second world war. The discovery and return of both lions from Japan at the close of World War II was explained.To Statue Square Park where we talked a little about the domestic helpers in Hong Kong and admired the old Supreme Court building. The unimpeded view from the HSBC Headquaters across to the harbour was also pointed out as was the only statue in the park- that of a former Chairman of HSBC!! The Japanese Army did steal the rest during the War! We then walked via the GPO and the elevated walkway to the Star Ferry Pier, observing a number of prominent landmarks and the extent of land reclamation in this area. We caught the Satr Ferry across to Tsim Sha Tsui at the tip of the Kowloon Peninsula. The history of the Star Ferry and the development of means of crossing the Harbour were also discussed. Various features of the Hong Kong skyline were pointed out during the crossing. At Tsim Sha Tsui, we first went to the skyline viewing area and the Clock Tower / Old Railway Station. The Canton Road luxury shopping area and the Hong Kong Cultural Centre were both pointed out. To Hullet House / the old Marine Police Headquarters with the Noon Day Gun, Time Ball Tower and the Typhoon Signal Mast. To The Peninsula where we talked not only about the history of the building but about the Battle of Hong Kong and the Japanese occupation. Don't forget about the afternoon tea - it you have time its a lovely way to spend an afternoon!  We then walked to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR Station on Nathan Road from where we caught the underground to Sai Ying Poon Station on the western end of the north shore of Hong Kong Island. We then went for Yam Cha (Tea) at the Lin Heung Restaurant on Des Voeux Road West. This is a very traditional Chinese tea-house with a Michelin mention.After tea, we walked along Des Voeux Road West, Wing Lok Street and Bonham Strand where we saw all of the dried seafood, Chinese medicinal products, sharks fins, fish maws, sea cucumbers, jelly fish, abalone and, of course, The Gecko!! We then cut through Morrison Street to view the renovated Western Market from wher we caught a tram (ding ding) across town to Canal Road West, with various notable features being pointed out along the way. We then walked along Canal Road West and Morrison Hill Road back to your hotel.

Awesome Idea for HK Visitors. We had some family in town who aren't physically fit enough to hike or really walk around the Hong Kong terrain, so this was a great way for them to get out and about to see the city. People always say that there isn't much else to do in HK besides eating, drinking, and shopping but this was a great alternative. I'm a HK resident and found the tour equally as exciting as the people who were visiting for the first time. Our tour group was a good mix of Australians, Americans, Hong Kongers, and English people. Would recommend this tour for those looking for some historical/educational fun. The tour also ends at the Stanley Boardwalk which is great if you're looking for some outdoor lunch options or afternoon drinks.

Unique tour of Hong Kong! Loved It!. The HK by Sea tour was a truly unique way to see Hong Kong. I've lived in Hong Kong for a few years, but all of my exploring and learning about Hong Kong has been on my own. I decided to take the tour with friends that were in town visiting, and I'm so glad that I did. Learning about the history of the HK skyline was by far my favorite part. It's something that I see every day but never knew all that has happened in the last few decades. Going through the container port was also very interesting, and our tour guide, Laura, provided some really unique and interesting information during this part of the tour. Laura's bubbly personality and cheerful attitude was also refreshing because I could tell she really enjoyed and appreciated all of the sites that she was taking us through.I would recommend this tour to tourists and HK locals/expats alike. The staff is friendly, very knowledgeable about HK history, and the tour ran perfectly as scheduled. Not to be forgotten... They provide free wine ;)

Fantastic food tour!. We had Laura as our amazing guide for a four hour food tour on Hong Kong Island. It was fantastic from start to finish. It was a small group of 8 of us, none of that huge group tour thing. We were staying in Kowloon, so we spent the whole day on Hong Kong Island. We spent the time at some small food shops with history and great food. We loved the dim sum, the noodle shop, the milk tea, egg tarts and the bbq meat. Laura was energetic, friendly and full of information. We found the whole dried food industry of particular interest. We did a lot of walking, saw both old and new on Hong Kong Island, and after the tour gave us great suggestions for going to Victoria Peak immediately following. She even followed up with an email with some other sightseeing suggestions. This was a highlight of our time in Hong Kong. Highly recommended!!

Totally Unique Experience!. I went on this boat tour with some good friends not knowing what to expect and it was wonderful! The boat was beautiful, the tour was a good mix between enjoying the views and educational and it made for a great day! The tour was 4 hours and we saw so much that couldn't be seen from traveling by land. We started in Causeway Bay and went through the container port, down the coast, through the Aberdeen Channel, Deep Water Bay and ended in Stanley Markets. My favorite part was the container port, we sailed right in and got to see everything! You can't get that kind of experience anywhere else. The guide was so friendly and knowledgeable. We talked about the architecture, Opium Wars, pirates and sunken boats, houses of the rich and famous - it was very interesting! When the tour ended, it was nice to end in Stanley, where we had a nice lunch by the water after the boat left and could enjoy the Stanley Markets which are the nicest markets I've been to in Hong Kong. If you want to experience a different side of Hong Kong this tour is a great choice!

GREAT public foodie tour!. I went on a 4-hour public foodie tour with Jess as our tour guide, and it was wonderful. The day started out with dim sum, at one of the few places where they still bring carts around to pick from. We were the only westerners in the place, which told me the place was legit! From there we went to different markets, including a traditional Chinese medicine market, and to other off-the-beaten-path places that I wouldn't have found on my own. The places we ate at were excellent, and we also got to ride the Ding-Ding and walk along the mid-levels. I had my first experience with milk tea on this tour, which I had been told is a quintessential HK experience. All in all it was a wonderful experience, and I had an opportunity to eat wonderful food and to learn more about HK. I would recommend this tour to anyone, especially those new to Hong Kong and its food.

Walking food tour-interesting & delicious tour with a great guide(Michael). Super half day small group tour with Michael. Got to visit places which we would never have found on our own and learnt a lot about food, the city and its history along the way. Michael was very up-beat and informative and took great care of each group member along the way.Would definitely recommend this. Top tip- don't eat too much at the first stop (difficult as wonderful dim sum)- and arrive very hungry!
Half day tour. Great company. Guides were professional and friendly. Tour was customized and personalized! Nathan was spectacular and full of knowledge.

Fantastic public food tour. We had a wonderful time on this tour. Laura was a great tour guide. We went to some good food places including a traditional tea house with yummy dim sum, really good BBQ pork and my favour egg tarts. She also included some interesting information and customs and as a follow up sent us photos, the names and addresses of all the places we visited plus other suggestions of good restaurants and sights. Along with all that we also met some lovely people from other countries as well as a few people from Australia. Overall recommend this tour for anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Last Day in Asia and one of the best things we did. With time before our late night flight back to the USA we got lucky to get a couple of spots on this great food tour. Laura toured us through various parts of HK to let us try some of the best BBQ Pork, Egg Tart, and much more. At each place she details on history of why a food became popular, what makes it great and why the store or restaurant has become the star provider for the food you are eating. Don't panic this is not just a history tour. Laura is open, interesting and fun to be around. She is fabulous.
Great Food and HK Experience. Appreciate Michael for sharing with us the hidden food gems of HK plus his decades experience. Truly an "Insider"
