Hello Hong Kong Bespoke Tour. We are expats living in Hong Kong but when we had guests from the UK in town we got a bunch of friends together to do one of Laura's excellent Hong Kong tours. It was brilliant for both people completely new to Hong Kong and those who think they know it. We enjoyed the excellent traditional trolley-served dim some in a place round the corner from our flat that we'd have never found ourselves, learnt more about traditional markets and went to a fascinating temple where fortunes were told and wishes sealed. Exploring Sham Shui Po was a great addition to the tour as it showed a totally different dimension to the city. Highly recommended.
Hello Hong Kong One Day Tour. Fab tour with Laura. Even having lived in HK for two years I still learnt loads. Thoroughly recommend it. Lots of fun and very interesting.

Hong Kong - Private 5 hour tour. I found Hello Hong Kong on Trip Advisor, I booked online with them for a five hour private tour for my daughter and I. I submitted points of interest in advance. Our guide Nathan arrived on time at our hotel lobby prepared to discuss the itinerary for the day based on our advance requests. Nathan is an American, so his English is perfect. He has several years living in Hong Kong and is well versed in the history. He has a lively upbeat personality and we thoroughly enjoyed our day with him. By the end or our day with Nathan we were well equipped to show ourselves around for the next two days. The itinerary that we designed together...From our hotel we took a taxi to Victoria PeakWalked along Luggard Road for the good view of the cityTook the PeakTram down into the cityTo the HSBC building to look at the architecture and talk about the feng shui in the building and the development of the shore line and land reclamation. To the HSBC Bronze Lions with the shrapnel bomb damage from the second world war.We rode a double decker tram to Sheung WanWe had a fabulous and fun lunch at a local restaurant. (Dim Sum / Yum Cha - Lin Heung Kui Tea House - Des Voeux Road West, Sheung Wan)We walked along Wing Lok Street and Des Voeux Road West where we saw the dried seafoods, birds nests and Chinese medicinal goods.We went by MTR to Prince EdwardWe strolled through the Bird Garden and finished up at the Flower Market
Amazing Food and HK experience. Today I had a great day with Nathan as our guide. Food was fantastic and the company was awesome. Couldn't have asked for a better experience.Thanks.

Great way to see and taste Hong Kong. Nathan was an engaging host who shared his stories and experiences of Hong Kong that made it a really enjoyable tour. 5 different lots of food plus a stroll through various parts of the city made this much more than a foodie tour. Would definitely do it again when I next visit.

Enthusiastic guide makes for a great tour. Our tour guide, Jess, was very knowledgeable. Her enthusiasm for Hong Kong bubbled over. She has done a lot of research and is able to share interesting tidbits with her customers. But she is also well grounded in the big picture - the history, the economy, the demograhics. This is exactly what we look for in a guide.

Awesome way to spend a day in Hong Kong!. We spent the day traveling around Hong Kong with Nathan, and we had an absolute blast! We let Nathan know we wouldn't be eating breakfast and would definitely want to stop somewhere local, and he took us to an awesome dim sum place, where we were able to try some of the local foods. We traveled by foot and walked through several markets, hopped on the MTR and explored different parts HK, rode the tram (awesome way to see HK) and took the Star Ferry as well. We got great views of HK at the clock tower and learned about the history of HK at the Peninsula Hotel (and had a chance to cool off, too!). We also took a tour of the indoor fish and meat markets, which was really cool to see. Nathan was extremely knowledgeable and answered all our questions about a range of topics. We had a lot of fun exploring, and taking so many modes of transportation really allowed us to experience Hong Kong for what it is! We highly recommend Hello Hong Kong!

Great tour with Ben in January. My husband and I had the most fantastic tour with Ben. it was our favorite part of Hong Kong. He took us from one end to the other on the subway, the Ding Ding, walking, etc. Ben gave us so much interesting information on history, culture, architecture, life style, etc. We told him we wanted to see as much as possible and he made sure that we did with temples, markets, the escalator, parks, hotels, etc. This was definitely money well spent. Thanks so much to Ben!

Chilled and educative boat tour of Hong Kong!. As a local citizen living in Hong Kong for 16 years now, this was a pretty amazing tour. I was a bit skeptical about this boat tour but I tagged along with my friend anyways. It turned out to be a very fun and relaxing tour! Laura (the tour guide) was well equipped with fun facts about Hong Kong's history. I learned things that I never knew before and it was pretty interesting.It was also very nice to see Hong Kong by sea on a very comfortable boat, there are nice seating areas on the deck of the boat and it is also a nice way to meet other people touring in Hong Kong. The boat captain is also very experienced and the boat ride was very smooth throughout the whole way. I have to say, my favourite part of the tour was seeing Jumbo the floating restaurant, I had never in my 16 years in Hong Kong seen a floating restaurant and it was so amazing to see the most famous one. I would definitely recommend this to tourists in Hong Kong and also local citizens! You'll be surprised by how awesome Hong Kong looks in the perspective of the sea and how many things you didn't know about Hong Kong.Thanks Laura and Captain Donald for an awesome tour!!

Fabulous food tour - great way to see Hong Kong. The Hello Hong Kong public food tour was fantastic! A lovely way to get familiar with Hong Kong and a great way to try all the amazing food. Laura was a great guide - friendly and knowledgeable with lots of added helpful information to help all the members of the tour continue to enjoy their Hong Kong experience. The dim sum restaurant was a lovely insight into real Hong Kong heritage and the char siu pork was the star of the tour (apart from the finishing custard tart!) I'd highly recommend anyone going to Hong Kong to do this tour!

No better way to see the harbours of Hong Kong. My friends had family had a wonderful time on board this tour with Laura! Very relaxed environment on the boat with nice food and drinks. I have lived in Hong Kong for only 2 years and I have learnt more about the history in this one tour than my time on the island! I highly recommend the boat tour to whoever thinks they have seen everything there is to see and also those who want to see a lot without taking forever! It was a lovely day and I will be coming back in the near future!

The best thing I did on this trip to HK!!. Hello Hong Kong food tour was a great experience! My tour guide was Jess, she is a real professional tour guide and had so much knowledge of all kinds of little things. She made conversations with everyone in the group.Our tour started with some dim sum, then we moved on to check out all the stuff the little stores sell on the streets. We popped in at a oriental medicine store before trying out the popular noodle place (I had the shrimp wonton soup), this place was visited and rated by Anthony Bourdain.Tour continued to a milk tea place, to a meat/fish and wet market, then by a trolley to another location for some authentic local hole-in-the wall (very popular) BBQ pork and duck restaurant. The tour ended with a dessert. Duration was about 3-4 hours, it was easy walking and part of the tour was taken in a trolley when we changed locations. (make sure to have your octopus bus card and comfy shoes on).Although the food places were already set in advance, the tour guide was open to show us places we wanted to try (i.e snake soup place). It was nice that the group was only 8 people, as these places are very tiny and barely were able to accommodate us together. But it sure was authentic, safe and most importantly, it was delicious!!! And worth every penny I paid.

Fantastic! Great with teens/kids. . My family of 6 (mom/dad in 40's, 17, 16, 10, 9 year olds) really enjoyed this tour with HelloHongKong tours. Laura, our tour guide, was excellent. My understanding is that all of the guides are first language English speakers, now living in Hong Kong. So for us it was great to have a guide my kids could understand fluently. We learned a lot and had a lot of fun. High energy, she gave history with laminated maps and photos. Quick paced. We did a private food tour and also did a second tour exploring the city. Food tour we had dim sum (small dishes), egg tarts, noodle soups, etc. photos in the kitchen. When laura shows up the owners all know her and make room in the restaurant!!! Treated excellent. Great way to see the city and taste some new dishes. Places I never would have found on my own. Was a great highlight.

"BEST HONG KONG FOOD TOUR !". This was my first time in Hong Kong and I was eagerly looking forward to this tour. I was NOT disappointed ! Laura was an absolute gem and as well as taking us to eat at some of the best local family run eateries on Hong Kong Island ( best egg tarts I have ever eaten!) she also gave an interesting and informative commentary on some of the local areas and points of interest . I can highly recommend this tour to anyone looking to sample some iconic Hong Kong cuisine with a wonderful and knowledgable guide. Thanks Laura!

Great Taste of Hong Kong!. I was visiting Hong Kong for a few days and wanted a quick tour to see the city and experience the culture. I did the group food tour with Laura and absolutely loved the experience! I was able to book the tour easily online (even last minute) and without any hassle. During the tour, we visited 5 different places on Hong Kong Island. In addition to being able to experience typical Hong Kong cuisine, Laura also gave us a mini tour of central Hong Kong and explained fun cultural facts along the way. Afterwards, Laura was happy to give us advice on other tour activities in the area. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Hong Kong!
Temple tour. Jessie did a very good job of preparing for the tour and led us around town quite effectively. Her knowledge of the places was good and I highly recommend.

Great tour with Ben. My husband has never been to Hong Kong, so I thought the best way to show him my former home was to go on a tour. He specifically requested to go to a temple and The Peak.We went on a chilly day and met up with Ben and we went to Man Mo Temple. Ben was friendly and knowledgeable and told some fascinating stories and anecdotes.When we went to The Peak and Ben showed us the secret vantage point to take pictures and avoid the throngs of tourists.During the tour we were never bored or felt that it was overwhelming with all the facts and stories that Ben told us, and we enjoyed every minute of it.I highly recommend Hello Hong Kong tours, it was easy to book online and our guide Ben made our private tour very enjoyable. We will be back next year to take the Food Tour!

Hong Kong Tour with Ben. My son and I booked a private tour with Hello Hong Kong. Ben met us at our hotel and showed us the city, took us to amazing restaurants and educated/entertained us. It was incredible!
Great tour. Nathan was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Tour was really good. I would definitely recommend to others.

Good food tour of Central Hong Kong. Our guide Michael was wonderful and well versed in the whole Hong Kong area. He gave a very informative tour and the food was great. We especially loved the roasted meats and dim sum restaurants. Micheal went above and beyond by helping us all plan continuing parts of our HK visit and personally setting us all off to our next destinations.

Amazing tour of Hong Kong by Boat!!. We went with Hello Hong Kong on the Container Port tour which was great. The weather really came out for us and Laura and Donald the Captain were both very welcoming. We started our tour from Causeway Bay and sailed through Victoria Harbour talking about the evolving skyline and Hong Kong's development over the years. We then reached and entered into the Container Port. The size and scale of the operation was seen up close and personal and it was fascinating to learn about containerisation the boats involved with it, and HK's role as a shipping hub. We then sailed to the South Cost of HK Island through to Aberdeen past the Floating Restaurants onto Deep Water Bay and Repulse Bay ending up in Stanley.The trip was very well organised and very informative without becoming information overload. Laura is a very passionate tour guide and I would totally recommend this tour to anyone looking to find out more about Hong Kong by sea. The boat and facilities on board including refreshments and snacks were great.Thanks again Laura..

This was an AMAZING way to see so many different parts and aspects of Hong Kong!. This boat tour was absolutely brilliant- Laura packed in so much fascinating information about the history and story of Hong Kong and put it all into context as we travelled around such a variety of locations on the boat. She did this in an extremely engaging and fun way, really giving a great overview of the many stages of HK history, really entertaining us for the entire 4 hours. The boat sailing itself is also an absolute pleasure- with comfortable seating both in the front and back of the boat and there's a perfect combination of information/ discussion time and time for you to enjoy the boat ride at leisure on any part of the boat you wish. The Captain is also a total legend and is more than happy to share some of his stories with you!I can't recommend this tour highly enough!!!

Amazing Hong Kong boat tour!. Did you know that Hong Kong is an island? I know, exactly - and that is why you have to go on this tour if you visit Hong Kong. You will see and learn about everything from the history of the island going all the way back to the times of 'Canton' to the modern shipping ports and container industry. This of course includes buildings that have 'dragon flyways', the wealthiest neighborhood in the world, a sunken British liner, and old pirating hideaway caves. And on this tour you get to do it from the sea (which, again, makes a lot of sense given that it is an island) aboard a luxurious yacht. the refreshments are plenty (including beer - you are on a boat after all) and the company was fun, but what really brought it all together was Laura. Her enthusiasm was contagious and her knowledge impressive. The fact is that when you want to see and do something new you want to do it with a person like Laura leading the way. Can't recommend this one enough. Oh, by the way, we were dropped off in Stanley bay - site of the dragon boat races (so on a weekend leading up to the races everyone seems to be carrying around their custom paddles). What is more Hong Kong than that?

Highlight of our China trip. We went to China for the 2 weeks of kids' spring break in March. The Hello Hong Kong private tour with Laura was the highlight of our entire trip. Laura is a very professional, friendly and funny guide. It was such a fun and at the same time very informative tour! My teenage children, who don't like to do tours in general, really enjoyed it. Before the tour Laura asked us if we wanted to see anything in particular. She would include our requests into her tour. We saw a lot for 5 hours!!! Local architecture, fish market, Wong Tai Sin temple, street food vendors, Financial district, the famous Peninsula hotel. We walked, rode subway, took a boat. I highly recommend the tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong! I am so happy I found Hello Hong Kong in tripadvisor.com.

Girls stop over in Hong Kong. What an absolute win !! 6 ladies travelling together on route to Vietnam with a stop over in Hong Kong. We booked a 5 hr bespoke private tour with Laura. The Best !!! we were able to have input in our itinerary expressing interest in photography, cuisine and doing the "non-tourist" side of viewing a city. Laura made sure all boxes were ticked. From the local poor neighbourhoods, complete with street food and a fish market, to the edgy Financial district and the expat Soho. From having our fortunes read at a temple to eating a Michelin star eatery. We experienced all modes of transport which was so nice if we ever stop in HK again. Laura went the extra mile in giving us extra info and suggestions of what to do on our last day and probably more importantly when to go and how to get there. The entire tour was worth every dollar and would gladly recommend to anyone ! Our experience was definitely a 5+ rating.

A trip highlight. We were traveling for 20 days and the Hong Kong food tour was one of the most memorable experiences of our entire vacation. Richard was a fantastic guide and showed us a part of the city we would have never seen. My wife and I loved the food!

Great Tour With Laura!. We took a private tour with Laura on our first day in Hong Kong, and it could not have been better! We hit all of the highlights as requested, had a great lunch, learned our way around the city and how to use the public transit. She even researched some craft beer spots for us to check out over the next few days. Within a couple of hours of the trip we received several emails recapping our day, and about some of the things we had asked about doing in HK with perfect detail. I cannot recommend a private tour with Laura enough. We loved it. Hong Kong is an amazing city and this is a great way to get to know it! Thanks Laura!

Hong Kong by Sea Tour. Having had so much fun on the food tour we signed up for the Sea Tour. We were not disappointed. A very comfy 55foot cruiser took us out through Victoria Harbour, cruised straight into the container port -thought I was back playing with my lego -just fabulous to watch. Up past Aberdeen, Repulse Bay and then drop off at Stanley which was great as we then got to have a leisurely lunch there and do the shops -just a great relaxing day out. I really like how Laura would give us some information first and then we would cruise through the area and just enjoy -of course Laura was nearby to answer any questions. Hong Kong is all about the Sea and this is a unique way of understanding this! Love it! And importantly Value for Money!

If you only do one thing in HK, this is it.. This tour exceeded all my expectations and I wish I could give it a higher rating than allowed. The food was fabulous and was made even better by our guide Niya, whose knowledge and personality added so much to the day. From the first meal, through the markets and other tastes, this tour really gives a great depth to the Cantonese food as it is eaten in Hong Kong. Niya was careful about food allergies and at the end offered so many additional recommendations about visiting Hong Kong, this is the perfect way to start any visit to the city.

Incredible day out on the sea in Hong Kong!. I joined Hello Hong Kong's Hong Kong by Sea Tour on 23 April. Although I am a long-time Hong Kong resident, the tour was an incredible way to get a very different perspective on the city. Laura, the guide for our tour, and her able pilot, Captain Donald, really took great care of us. From a slow cruise past HK's gorgeous skyline, to a run around the guts of the bustling container port (where we got up close to megaships being loaded and unloaded), to even seeing Hong Kong's famous floating restaurant, Jumbo, being towed back to its mooring (a unique experience, it only leaves for a cleaning every few years!), the day was jam packed with great scenery and interesting insights. The information provided by Laura about what we were seeing from the boat, Hong Kong's history, and the important role the ocean plays and has played in Hong Kong's development was just right. Funny, interesting, and just enough to give you background on what you were seeing to add to your enjoyment as the boat chugged past the topic of the discussion, without taking too much time away from your friends and the beautiful views.I would wholeheartedly recommend the Hong Kong by Sea Tour, it would be a fantastic way to send a day in Hong Kong, and from what I can tell, is really a unique experience.
Amazing Tour . Amazing tour of the real Hongkong Can't recommend enoughGuide was greatA last minute booking from a friend was no problemGo with empty stomach Loved it
authentic food with a wonderful guide!. Truly enjoyed the food tour with Jess. Really great intro to the local food, restaurants were authentic and food was tasty. This was time well spent!

Wonderful private tour of Hong Kong. My husband and I spent a fun and very informative day with Jess touring Hong Kong. This was the end of our 5 1/2 week trip and we were pretty brain fogged so really appreciated having Jess to guide us through the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. We loved taking the local transportation including the Star Ferry, the tram and MTR, none of which we could have negotiated without her help! The local dim sum restaurant was great fun and yummy. We learned about the history and architecture of the city. Taking the MTR to Sham Shui Po to see the local markets and how people live in the 'real' Hong Kong was a highlight and definitely something we would not have done without Jess. A perfect way to end a wonderful trip.

Great introduction to Hong Kong. We loved the tour we took with Jess! We only had a day and a half to spend in Hong Kong so our 4 hour tour was a great way to see the get familiar with the area as well as hit some of the major highlights. We visited not only some of the major tourist attractions, but also to some of the less-traveled neighborhoods to get an idea of how most of people in HK live. She was very well-informed on all of the areas we visited and we really enjoyed walking around with her. For the rest of our time in HK after the tour, she emailed us recommendations for restaurants, other sites to visit, places to see great views, and tips on getting around. We spent the rest of our trip following her advice and we had a great time! I would definitely recommend them to anyone visiting Hong Kong for the first time.

Hong Kong Food Tour. Really excellent experience and good value.Visited several restaurants and eating places that as a normal tourist I wouldn't have dreamt of entering. Marvellous Dim Sum breakfast. The group was small (7) led by Jess and she was knowledgeable and helpful. Tour also included some of the back street food and medicine shops.

Fabulous introduction to Hong Kong food scene. Richard was a wonderful tour guide! Very informative and friendly. Even went the extra lengths give recommendations for after the tour. Highly recommend.

Local places. It was great visiting and tasting were locals actually eat. Would have never thought of stopping in any of those if not for the experience of the local guide. It was much more satisfying to have a guide to appreciate the food, the place and the history. Our guide Richard was knowledgeable and easy going - both made the tour a pleasure.

An Insight into Hong Kong Everyday Life. Jill, my wife, and I had a great time visiting places with Nathan that we would never have found on our own ... particularly liked the dim sum (restaurant) and the visit to the wet market. Due to a bad back I can't walk for long periods but this was no problem as Nathan made sure there were plenty of opportunities for me to sit before moving on. We would certainly recommend this tour to people who want to see beyond the usual "big" sights.

Good authentic experience and food. The food tour was a good way to get a glimpse of the local cuisine (mostly the popular bit, there is surely another million strands to it) but also the local customs, some history and cultural differences. Our guide Richard was able to explain many of these in an interesting, capturing way. While the tour is not cheap by any standard on balance it was well worth the money invested and I would recommend it to any of my friends visiting Hong Kong.
Pleasant time. This was a pleasant way to spend some time. It catered to the curious but uninformed about Chinese cuisine. The guide was excellent and knowledgeable. An enjoyable afternoon.

Hello Hong Kong day tour. My wife and I toured with Ben during the Lunar New Year festivities, he took us to the Che Kung temple as well as many other "local" spots. Ben was very knowledgeable and it felt as if we were exploring HK with a friend. Well worth it.
Great way to discover local food in Hong Kong. Laura was a great guide! Brought us to five delicious food stops. It was also a great education tour.

Layover Tour. My colleagues and I had a seven hour layover in HK, and made the most of it by meeting Jess for a four hour tour of the city. Had no issue meeting her, getting all around town, learning about history, sampling the food and visiting top sites, followed by easy return to airport on train. Highly recommend.

Hello hong kong food tour with Jess! Feb 2016. This tour is not only a foodies dream (Starting with the dim sum) but educational. Our 14 year old son enjoyed the food, the walk through the chinese medicine store and the ride on the tram! We ended our tour with yummy donut type treats and egg tart while watching a pick up soccer game. Highly recommend on your first day to get oriented to the city - would do it again.

Small-Group Hong Kong Island Food Tour . What great start to our holiday in Hong KongEach of my three boys 13,11,10 all enjoyed different aspects of this tour.Our guide Richard explained and talk us through various points of interest as we travelled around. This was a great accompaniment to the food we also got to try. We would have never done any of these things even on our own if we were in HK for a month. Well worth it. A great day out.

A delicious way of discoverng Hong Kong. Richard, our guide for the tour, took us around amazing food places - classic Chinese restaurants serving absolutely delicious samples of the specialitites we were there to discover. A fine gourmet himself, he had tons to say about each thing we ate. But also about all the dried foods that were on our way from one place to the next. Definitely a most delicious way of discovering Hong Kong. One piece of advice, though : go hungry! there is so much good food being offered during the visit!

Really really really goid. It is my first time ever I use any private tour so I was afraid I am doing good or not. Today I am sure it was good decision. I had only two days off during my business visit in HK. I decided ( even it is expensive like everything in HK ) to use them for faster sightseeing and learning HK. First of all they keep really good contact with you by phone and email !!! No problem even your English is not too strong. After booking using their reservation website I was waiting day when they pick me up from hotel. I booked 5 hours tours and it is good. Morning 9:15 Micheal called me from lobby hotel to my room that he is already and waiting. Michel is older guide but he is Irish guy who live here since 1977.He has really lot of news about HK places and also politic and how people live here. When we met him morning we sat in lobby and spoke about what we wanted to see. We have set our target ( more fun than museum and street food ). We got what we wanted. Michael had lot of knowledge about HK and history of HK. I want to say Thank you for him again and say Good luck for Hello Hong Kong !!! Keep your job !!!

Excellent tour!. We had such an amazingly informative fun tour with Laura. Out of group of friends, 3 of us had been to HK before on a number of occasions and felt we had seen most of its highlights, and some in our group were pessimistic about the idea of a "tour" , but Laura made this experience so much fun and enjoyable by they soon were won over. She took us to places we have never seen before, and would never have found on our own. The background information she provided on the local way of life, rituals and food was really informative and interesting. The food part was fun! Snake soup We had requested to see the everyday life of Hong Kong people, culture, food and architecture and all points were covered. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for such a great day out, won't ever forget it. If we end up in Hong Kong we will for sure book again.

Wonderful Orientation to Hong Kong!. If you have ever wanted to try real dim sum, or learn why dried gecko on a stick may be good for your health, then you absolutely need to take this tour when you are in Hong Kong! We took the 5 hour walking tour in February with Jess and had a fabulous time! We learned so much about the food and culture of Hong Kong. Of course, we ate our way through various neighborhoods, but we also had a chance to ride the Ding Dings and experienced Hong Kong through the eyes of a local. After the tour, Jess took the time to distribute group photos via email. She also sent us detailed instructions for visiting the Big Buddha and the Tai O fishing village on our own.Absolutely worth your time and money for this tour!

The best guide we could have asked for!. Jess was the best guide I could have asked for. I was traveling with my husband and our parents who had much different interests and physical capabilities than us. My mom had trouble with lots of walking but Jess new all of the short cuts and ways we could see/do what everyone wanted without having to cut anything out of the itinerary. She was wonderful and even gave us a few extra local food stops to go to after the tour was over!

A great way to get introduced to the city. My family had never been to HK before, so we thought a local guide would be a great way to start our trip. We booked a 5-hour customized tour. Our guide was Nathan and he was really helpful! Not only did he walk us around some of the better known sites, he also took us down the back alleys. He explained some points about the language that helped us really make sense of the place. Finally, of course, he introduced us to good food and how the MTR worked. Totally worth it, especially for a first day.

Fantastic Food Tour of Hong Kong. I could write a lot but it wouldn't make this tour any better as it was simply fantastic. Jess knows her stuff about Cantonese food from breakfast fluffy rice buns to Char Sui BBQ'D pork. You just wouldn't know where to find the restaurants and if you did what to choose - who would have thought that chickens feet were so good! We had dim sum, BBQ'D pork, milk tea and a strange concoction that was part tea, part coffee and part evaporated milk. The best in my view was beef brisket in a very tasty broth with noodles. We went through numerous small areas each different In terms of food and culture, Jess's encyclopaedic knowledge made each new area seem familiar. Just book and enjoy a fantastic trip.
Laura was great!. The tour was great! Laura was super knowledgeable about the city and its food, and made everything approachable and fun. I highly recommend the tour and Laura specifically.

Can't think of a better way to see Hong Kong!. A fantastic food tour with a really informative guide. Having visited Hong Kong several times I wasn't sure there was much I'd not seen but Laura guided us round some of the best foodie heaven of Hong Kong, including the most amazing dim sum I have ever eaten - served the traditional way from a trolley :) Definitely can't think of a better way to see Hong Kong!

Great group tour!. We were able to cover a lot of amazing spots with Jess. She was super excited, friendly, and accommodating to all of our needs! She catered the tour to our needs and was able to provide us with a fantastic experience. Would definitely recommend this tour to everyone visiting!

Great boat tour to Sai Kung beaches!. We chartered the WildKat boat for a private half-day tour to Sai Kung beaches. The experience was great and James, our captain, was very hospitable. The WildKat was able to pull up to the beach and we had the beach to ourselves. Highly recommended as a way to get out of the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong!

Incredibly good tour with brilliant guide. I am sure all Hello Hong Kong's guides are great and we are fortunate enough to be meeting Jess for the food tour tomorrow BUT Nathan on today's private walking tour was quite simply brilliant - humorous , knowledgable, full of energy and s pleasure to be with. We got to see markets - flowers, birds, electrical, clothes, meat and fish that were where the localPeople shop not simply tourist markets. The itinerary included:Chungking Mansions where we talked about ‘suitcase entrepreneurs’ and how the building has become a central hub of very low end globalisation. We talked about the history of Hong Kong from the arrival of the Brits through to the handover of Hong Kong back to China To The Peninsula where we talked not only about the history of the building but about the Battle of Hong Kong and the Japanese To Hullet House / the old Marine Police Headquarters with the Noon Day Gun, Time Ball Tower and the bar with the prison cells!To the skyline viewing area and the Clock Tower / Old Railway Station / we talked about the feng shui in the buildings and the development of the skyline. By MTR to Wong Tai Sin to see the council housing and the temple. We talked about some of the social issues and conditions in Hong Kong, religion (namely Taoism), astrology, fortune telling and mythology. We met Yau Lau (the Chinese god of love and marriage). By MTR to Sham Shui Po the poorest of the 18 districts of Hong Kong where we looked at the illegal housing structures and urban decay.To the She Wong Sin snake shop where we tried the medicinal snake and mushroom soup.Past the hole in the wall barbers shop.To the very old Kung Wo Soybean Products shop To the electronics market, through the jade market, the hawker markets and to the indoor fish and meat (wet) market.By MTR to Prince EdwardTo the Yuen Po Street Bird Garden & Flower MarketYou can't do this tour on your own you would not know what you were looking at. The tour was customised to what we wanted to see - no shopping malls or skyscrapers but Chinese people doing what they do.Nathan thank you so much for a marvellous day. Bit of advice - just book and go -for all you healthy types with an iPhone or Fitbit its 13340 steps plus 11 flights of stairs! Have fun - we did.

Great tour with Jess. We had an amazing 5 hour walking tour with Jess. Dim Sum was awesome went back this morning again was only steps from our hotel. Jess was s wonderful tour guide, throughly enjoyed our tour would highly recommend!

Outstanding Tour!. Everything about this tour was wonderful! We visited some really interesting locales and sampled fantastic food and drink from a great variety of establishments. In addition, our guide, Laura, knew so many fascinating things about the neighborhoods we walked through--her knowledge and presentation made the experience genuinely unforgettable. To top it off, the group of people on the tour were great fun. If I were asked what to do while visiting Hong Kong, I would not merely recommend this tour, I would insist upon it!

Great private tour. We had a wonderful private tour led by Jess. She was knowledgeable and enthusiastic. She catered the tour to us and changed it around based on the weather that day. We had a lot of fun and she took us to a great out of the way dim sum restaurant. Also visited a temple, wet market and many interesting shops. Well worth the cost and would highly recommend Jess and Hello Hong Kong.

Hello Hong Kong Food Tour. Niya was a fantastic tour guide , we thoroughly enjoy every aspect of this tour . It was exactly what we wanted . We visited places that the real people of Hong Kong (the locals ) go to eat . Authentic Cantonese food at its best . Niya was very knowledgeable about Hong Kongs history and the background of all the places we visited . We enjoyed the quality and variety of food . This tour is a must if you are visiting Hong Kong for the first time . We consider ourselves foodies from Melbourne and know good food when we taste it . Loved it !! Thanks Niya for the experience !! It's so nice to relax and let you show us the real Hong Kong !!

Hong Kong Food Tour. Nathan our guide was excellent!! Along with the opportunities to sample 5 different local cuisines, Nathan provided local history about Hong Kong and the neighborhoods we visited. For a first time visitor to Hong Kong, Nathan provided further details on areas to explore, how to get there and sights to see on a short visit. The tour exceeded our expectations!

Fantastic tour. My wife and I had the pleasure of being guided by Niya for a morning of delishishness. What we really enjoy about food tours besides the food is understanding the history and culture of the places we visit. Niya delivered that in abundance. From great tips on bars and restaurants on our side of the river in Kowloon as well as the culture of the people living in Hong Kong. We hit the ground running at a wonderful dim sum breakfast where we were just blown away by the assorted buns and it didn't stop for the next 4+ hours. I can't overstate how good the Hello Hong Kong Food Tour and particularly how enjoyable Niya was. Thanks again!!

Jess's walkin tour of Hong Kong. Jess was a fantastic guide who was able to blend contemporary information about living in Hong Kong,history and most important of all food.I have visited Hong Kong many times but after this tour I feel that for the first time I'm starting to see and understand the real Hong Kong.Jess's food recommendations are not to be missed.

Delightful Tour with Stunning Views and Yummy Dim Sum!!. We met our guide, Jess, at 8:00 at the Clock Tower in the Tsim Sha Tsui shopping center to begin our 4 hour walking tour of Hong Kong. She was just delightful and immediately we formed a bond. We looked at the sights and then walked around Kowloon a bit before we took a ferry to the business center of Hong Kong. Once there, we took a taxi ride to the top of Victoria Peak. But instead of taking the touristy elevator and paying to go to the top to the observation tower, Jess suggested we walk a short path to an outstanding viewpoint. The day was gorgeous and the walk was an easy one. What sights we saw - all of Hong Kong was ours for the viewing! Jess explained what we were looking at and we just soaked in the atmosphere. From here we took the cable car DOWN the peak instead of the usual tourist idea to take the ride UP the peak. By doing it in reverse, we avoided the crowds. By the time we got to the bottom, the line to go up in the cable car was at least 45 minutes long. We were SO thankful that Jess knew her way around and was able to use her tricks of the trade to make our trip so easy and yet to get the full effect. From the cable car area, we walked by St. Johns Cathedral and saw the architecture of the HSBC and the bullet-pocked lions there. We then took a tram up Queens Road Central to the Lin Heung Kui Tea House where we sampled simply heavenly dim sum with Jess's expert giudance. We ate and ate and loved it all, sampling pork and shrimp dumplings, shrimp dumplings, steamed BBQ pork bun, steamed garlic shrimp, spring roll, crispy shrimp wonton and a few others. We were stuffed but it was incredibly delicious. This is definitely a place where we would have never ventured on our own since it is frequented by locals. It was most definitely a highlight of the day. Yum!! We then walked down the Medicine Street and Jess took us to the Cat Street Market and showed us how to get to the Man Mo Temple. Our tour was over at the market and we said a fond farewell to Jess. Hong Kong was our first stop on a 3 week adventure in Southeast Asia and she put the perfect start to our trip. We can highly recommend Hello Hong Kong and Jess - just an incredible company and an incredible guide. I am sure they are all excellent but we felt like we had hit the jackpot with Jess. She was amazing and so sweet and courteous as well. We loved our time with her and marveled at her knowledge, having lived in Hong Kong a relatively short period of time. She is an experienced guide, though, having been a guide in other parts of SE Asia.You are in good hands with Hello Hong Kong and Jess!

Fascinating!. Spent a really great morning with Jess; made us much braver to try the local food and she went into really interesting detail on many of the items for sale at the library local markets.....not in a hurry to try dried yin and yang gecko but it's supposed to be an aphrodisiac if you're interested!

Food places off the beaten path. Great experience of seeing Hong Kong life "behind the scenes", local everyday life. We had excellent food and visited the kind of places I wouldn't never come up going on my own (in a good sense). Our guide, was a great storyteller and very knowledgeable.

Excellent and fun tour of Hong Kong's local food scene. I was in HK for just a few days and wanted to try some authentic local food. This tour was a splurge for me but worth it -- it was a small group and we went places I never would have found or had the courage to try on my own. Michael was an excellent, knowledgable, and informative guide with a good attitude and lots of stories to share. I had a great time and highly recommend this experience!

Food Tour - Hong Kong (Jess). So brilliant. Great way to learn about the food in Hong Kong, we had been looking at the foods for sale & the markets and had no idea what most of the foods were. It was great to learn about the foods and the culture behind the foods. Jess was really knowledgeable, she gave us heaps of information but not too much. The food we ate was sensational & great variety of new & old styles.

Nathan excellent guide.... Used tour services on first full day in Hong Kong. Good way to get your feet wet in City. Nathan very solid company, with good insights on local venues. He was right to go slow at beginning of tour, there will be plenty to eat. Recommend.

Best Tour Ever!. I booked a tour for the one day off we had during a business trip and am so happy I booked with Hello Hong Kong! Laura our tour guide was so amazingly knowledgeable and personable. I didn't detail too much about what I wanted to see I just told Laura that I wanted to understand and see the real Hong Kong not just the tourist part. She took that small amount of detail and somehow customized the best Tour! We started with a ferry ride in which Laura explained architecture and history. We went everywhere from the rich peninsula hotel to the poorest part of the island as well. We went to the real fish market and to a temple as well! We had authentic food like fish balls and the best Tofu I've ever eaten! All in 4 hours. Throughout the day Laura explained everywhere we went and did it in a cool fun way not a boring tour guide way. I am so thankful to Hello Hong Kong because I feel like I got to know the island the culture and the people: it's exactly what I wanted in a tour. I highly recommend Laura and consider her a friend next time I'm in Hong Kong! Cheers everyone and safe travels!!

Outstanding Private Walking Tour with Nathan. Definitely lived up to the high expectation set by previous Trip Advisor reviews. We spent 4 hours walking and engaging in great conversation with our guide Nathan. We visited a fascinating temple, traditional neighbourhoods, introduced to a range of local secrets, learned how to confidently use the MTR system and ended with a delicious Dim Sum lunch. Thank you Nathan. Your personal insights into Hong Kong life were a definite highlight.

Hello Hong Kong. Recently, I spent a few days in Hong Kong on a solo journey and wanted a local guide to show me areas of my choosing rather than following a tour group. Fortunately I found Hello Hong Kong and booked a solo tour. Firstly, the company was very attentive to my needs when booking and very timely in responding to questions. Secondly, my tour guide, Jess, made the tour fun, interesting, and customizable. She showed me areas that represented real life in Hong Kong. She was patient with my requests and very knowledgable about the places visited. In addition, she didn't overwhelm me with trivial information but made it specific and memorable. After the tour she also provided suggestions to help with my remaining time. I'd strongly recommend using Hello Hong Kong and Jess as your guide.

Best tour to take on the first morning. . My family and I took this tour with Jess with an extra hour for us to meet us at our hotel which was perfect since we had just arrived the evening before and didn't know our way around. She was very informative about Hong Kong and the foods and history of them. Being a foodie I wasn't excited that this tour really hit spots I wouldn't have been able to find. The dim sum spot Lin Heung Kui I never would have found but be sure we found it again the next morning because it was so good. Jess's information and suggestions were great. I would recommend it to anyone.

very knowledgeable guide & ONLY HK Island best places. To put it simply: this food tour with Sean on HK-Island was the highlight of our second trip to Hong Kong!Sean, our guide, took his time to get to know each of the participants. We were 8 in total. He took us to selected places that amazed us not only because of the quality of their dishes but also because of their vibrant atmosphere! Only places that are well established, renowned for their tradition. But almost hermetical to tourists.On the way from one place to the other, Sean answered all of the questions we had. I particularly appreciate his great knowledge of the food traditions and life in HK.

Hello Hong Kong Public Food Tour. As a young traveler on a modest budget, I hesitated to book this tour as it was a bit of a splurge, but I'm really glad I did! It was a great value for the price. All the food was great, and most of the places we visited would have been a little daunting to dine at solo. The walking tour was also great - it was a great chance to learn more about Hong Kong, and its history and culture. The cost of this tour might deter some budget travelers, but if you can swing it? I highly recommend this tour!

Hong Kong food tour with Jess. The food tour with Jess was fantastic- we tried various dishes, learned a lot of interesting things about the food habits, the origin and diversity of the Hong Kong cuisine. Jess is not only knowledgeable, very helpful with tips, but also fun to be around. In this food tour I absolutely loved the char siu, the wonton noodle soup and the shrimp dumplings. I totally recommend this 4h tour for all the foodies out there who happen to be in Hong Kong.

A must do trip when visiting Hong Kong!. We spent a fantastic few hours with Laura on our private walking tour. We got used to travelling the MTR, took the Star ferry & even rode on the old tram (ding ding).We visited food markets, a temple, The Peninsula hotel & travelled all over both Kowloon & Hong Kong island.Laura is very knowledgable on all things Hong Kong, but delivers the facts in a fun way & she is a pleasure to be around. I can't recommend this tour enough, especially near to the start of your visit, as you are given lots of great ideas for the rest of your visit.

Fantastic Guide to Hong Kong. If you want to see a bit more to Hong Kong this was fantastic. Plenty of history and culture and specialty food. The guide was wonderful full of information and fun. Calibrated our tour as our needs progressed. Absolutely worth it.

Food tour covered neighborhoods, local flavor, and delicious foods.. I've been on many big-city food tours, and have 3 criteria for a good tour: Introduction to new neighborhoods, contact with a local (usually an english-speaking ex-pat), and samples of exemplars of the native cuisine. This tour exceeded all three criteria. Mike, a Liverpudlian who lived most of his adulthood in HK, guided us through vast territory, on foot and by "ding ding". His knowledge of HK culture made us feel like we were on a walk with a friend who happens to live in HK. My only reservation about the tour: the food was good, not great, but perhaps I'm jaded (live in San Francisco CA and have access to great Chinese food at home) BTW: bit of advice- TIP YOUR TOUR GUIDES! These people work hard to share their city with visitors; please show some gratitude.

Monday Food Tour. Excellent tour. My guide was Nathan. The food stops were interesting and the tidbits of history as we walked around were a nice touch. I recommend this tour towards the beginning of your trip because Hello Hong Kong and their guides are a wealth of knowledge to answer questions about Hong Kong and can make recommendations to streamline the other events you have planned e.g. taxi/bus up to Victoria Peak and tram down, saved an 1hr+ queue on the way up. I have a mild shellfish allergy and there were enough food options that I did not feel hungry in the slightest leaving the tour.

Excellent private walking tour in Hong Kong customized to our interests. Nathan is an excellent guide. He really knows Hong Kong, and customized the tour to our interests.He met us in the lobby of our hotel in Kowloon, and we were off to the MTR to by Octopus cards and a get short lesson on using the train system. It was incredibly easy.We visited the Sham Shui Po neighborhood to see how some of the poorest folks live, with interesting stops to sample the breads and tofu (we passed on the snake soup). The wet market and the ally barber shop were great views of understanding local life, as were all the shops and stalls we passed while walking through the area. A stop at the local temple led to interesting discussions about the local religions and beliefs, as well as the public housing that surrounded the temple. It was Chinese new year when we visited, so the temple was just an amazing place.Back to the TST area via the MRT to see a more modern view of Hong Kong, including the Chungking Mansion, the Peninsula Hotel, the Old Marine Police Headquarters, and the Clock Tower area.A quick ride over the Star Ferry included discussions on feng shui and modern building design, as well as how the Hong Kong skyline is developing and the process for business creation.We took the tram to Sheung Wan and walked along Wing Lok Street to see all the Chinese medicine shops and dried goods... and incredible sight.And finally, we had Dim Sum at a very local place... the Lin Heung Kui Tea House. Very much off the tourist path.As agreed, we ended the tour on Hong Kong island, and Nathan pointed us towards more temples and the antiques market. We made our way back to our hotel easily without any difficulty, using the navigating tips Nathan taught us along the way (he also gave us a map!).Hello Hong Kong is a first class company, and Nathan was an excellent guide.

AWESOME CNY DAY 2016. From the very beginning the process was flawless. I inquired by email and had a response within 24 hours and had continuous communication thru email. I also knew ahead of time who our tour guide was going to be, Ben, and a photo of what he looked like. We took the private “Bespoke” tour and it was worth every penny.Ben met us at our hotel at our designated time of 9:30 am on Chinese New Year Day 2016 (perfect day for touring Hong Kong, thanks for working that day Ben). We had arrived the evening before for our first trip to Asia and wanted to experience the many forms of transportation and how to use them easily. We started off by walking to the nearby MTR. We had purchased the Octopus card at the airport when we arrived so moved quickly thru just like everyone around us. Ben explained how the MTR worked and pointed out other important stops that we might want to do on our own during our week stay in Hong Kong. Our first stop was to Wong Tai Sin to see the council housing and the temple. As it was CNY it was packed with many and Ben explained the different types of offerings that were being made and the importance. He took several pictures of us. The people were priceless and very sincere in their offerings.When then took the MTR back to the Chungking Mansions and did a quick walk thru, with Eric showing and explaining so many things. We went to The Peninsula where we talked about the Battle of Hong Kong and the Japanese occupation. We were not staying at the Peninsula but did go back to the bar on the 28th floor, Felix, our last night in Hong Kong. They have a beautiful view of the harbor and it is quiet and not crowded. Then to the Hullet House, the old Marine Police Headquarters with the Noon Day Gun, Time Ball Town and the bar with the prison cells.Next, just a short walk to the Star Ferry to Central. Wow, went back there later in our trip and went to the escalators, unbelievable. Now for a taxi ride to the Peak. Beautiful views and our photographer took some great photos (thanks Ben). We then took a taxi to Aberdeen to have a late lunch at the Jumbo Kingdom restaurant. Our tour with Ben ended here, as with all of his suggestions we were confident we could get back to our hotel on our own. He also shared with us best tips for our additional days in Hong Kong. It was perfect start two our two stay in Hong Kong and Thailand. Thank you Laura and Ben!

Perfect day spent exploring the streets of Sheung wan and surrounding areas... Early morning walk starting with a meetup in Sheung wan. Hello Hong Kong Tour led by Nathan was exceptional. So knowledgeable about the culture and traditions it was wonderful to be exploring with someone who could answer all our questions and show us some extras.Started with Dim Sum / Yum Cha - Lin Heung Kui Tea House - Des Voeux Road West, Sheung Wan.Along Des Voeux Road West ,Wing Lok Street and Bonham Strand  where we saw the dried seafoods, fish maws, sharks fins, birds nests, ginseng, and Chinese medicinal goods; not forgetting the Dried Gecko!!.Wonton Noodle Soup/ Beef Brisket Soup  - Mak's - Wellington Street, Central.Through Graham Street wet market to the fishmonger and the butcher on Gage Street. Seeing all the meat hanging from the walls was definitely interesting. Milk Tea / Yuen Yeung - Lan Fong Yuen - Gage Street - Central . Lovely and refreshing drink topped up with ice. Next we went by tram (ding ding) to Wan Chai. Great way to explore on the tram. Second last stop was the roasted meat - BBQ Pork (Char Siu and Siu Yuk) with some green vegetables (Choi Sum)- Joy Hing - Hennessy Road/ Stewart Road, Wan Chai. HONESTLY the best pork I have ever had!!!!Egg Tart - Honolulu Cafe (a genuine Cha Chaan Teng)  Hennessy Road - Wan Chai By the end of the your we were all stuffed and smiling. Plenty of food on this tour and I'd highly recommend it to anyone who had the morning free in HK.

Excellent walking tour. This was a first-class experience. We walked between various venues (apart from the time we took a tram). We were introduced to a number of inexpensive eating places where we would probably never have gone without being introduced by the tour. The food was very good at each of them. We also had the opportunity to have some very interesting discussions on food and other Hong Kong related topics with Michael the guide (an expat who has lived in Hong Kong for decades). I think this is a much better way to get a small taste of Hong Kong life than from the top of a bus.

A highlight of Hong Kong. Loved experiencing Hong Kong and its food on this small walking tour. Our guide was informative, kind and great with our kids (8, 10). Especially loved the authentic dim sum spot. We would never have found or experienced this slice of Hong Kong without this tour, and it was the perfect warm up of Central Hong Kong for our first morning. I highly recommend taking this tour

Fun! Fun! Fun!. Niya was such a fun guide! She made us feel so comfortable in "locals only" places. We ate at places that we normally would not have visited on our own. The dim sum was delish, the noodle/wonton soup was perfect, the milk tea (had never had before) is now a must have, char siu and ended it all with an egg tart. That being said, without Niya we would not have found out that the best char siu was just down the street from our hotel! She also helped us figure out how to get around using the Hong Kong Trolly. We have been to Hong Kong before but gained local insight from this tour. Overall we had a very fun time and Niya's smile and personality made our day!

Kong Kong Layover tour. My husband and I had a 10 hour layover in Hong Kong. Ben met us at the downtown Hong Kong train station and showed us around for the day. He efficiently got us from place to place seeing all the important tourist sites in a short amount of time. It was a great way for us to be introduced to Hong Kong. Ben really knew his way around and we greatly enjoyed our day.

Interesting and funny!. Had a great experience with Laura who gave us the experience we expected. So not a full download of history etc. but provided more interesting, cool, funny facts about various things in Hong Kong. She was really genuinely friendly, and also wanted to provide the experience of daily life in HK. So can warmly recommend her, you will not regret the time spent with her. Big cheers from a happy family in Serbia. :)

Interesting, tasty and informative. Great introduction to Hong Kong and its food. We took the tour with Ben and not only tasted food we would not have tried, but also learnt about old and recent history. Gentle walk - which was needed as the food was generous, and delicious, especially the roast pork at the end. You have to try the " milk tea" only to say you have tried it. Recomended

Nathan made HK a magical place!. Nathan far exceeded our expectations of our foodie tour in HK! Clever, witty, interesting, Nathan quickly translated casual chatter into insights to make sure the basic foodie tour covered all our interests. We had the best time, learned a lot about HK (and this was our third visit!), and enjoyed the tour immensely!

Delicious Hong Kong Orientation. What is the best way to start your time in Hong Kong? On a food tour with Michael. We met him after flying in that morning. Michael is such a personable and friendly guide, who was very generous with his knowledge with what seemed like our endless questions. We were worried at the first destination that perhaps we didn't have the appetite to eat our way around Hong Kong that day, after dish after delicious dish of Dim Sum was ordered, but we paced ourselves and completed the day with a full stomach of delicious cuisine and a list of places we wanted to visit again. Some of the locations had us wondering, but Michael was right in saying unless you were in the know you'd probably have walked right past - even if there was a line down the road of punters waiting to get in. We were grateful to have him with us and speaking the lingo, otherwise I doubt we would've had the experience we did.If we were in Hong Kong again with some time up our sleeves, we'd definitely look at another Hello Hong Kong tour. Michael true to his character sent us through a few things we should do the following days we were in Hong Kong, with clear directions tailored from the front door of our hotel. We took his recommendation and managed a few of them flying out. Just a little extra added value. Thoroughly recommended! Thank you!

Great way to try out Cantonese food in Hong Kong. I booked the food tour last minute the night before and was easily accommodated. I even used the online chat option to make sure it was ok for me to book so late. Our tour guide was Nathan and he was at the meeting point perfectly on time. During our tour he was able to answer all the questions the group had and gave us a large amount of information. The food was great - the bbq pork was my favourite dish. After the tour Nathan sent us information on all the things we had mentioned we would be interested in doing around Hong Kong as well as a summary of all the things we had seen. It was an excellent tour and I would be happy to recommend it.

Memorable tour in HongKong. Had a great private foodie tour (four people) with Nathan today. He is very personable, engaging and knowledgeable about the food and the city. The food stops gave us an opportunity to explore the tastes of Cantonese food. In addition, we made a trip to the Man Mo Temple and a ride on the ding ding. We learned so much and had good food at the same time. We would highly recommend Nathan to all who venture to HongKong.

Highly recommended for all visitors to Hong Kong!. An excellent introduction to Cantonese cuisine, with a very informed guide - thanks to Ben, we sampled dishes that we would probably not have tried on our own. A good range of different foods, all at a gentle pace, and with plenty of time for many questions. Ben was happy to share his passion for HK with us, and we thoroughly enjoyed our tour.

Truly Tip Top. Ben took us on a walking food tour of Sheung Wan, Central and Wanchai - we experienced local food such as dim sum, wonton noodle soup, BBQ pork, milk tea and custard tarts. Ben was knowledgeable and enthusiastic about all things Hong Kong, not just food. He is also sensitive to local people and their customs. It was a great experience and to be recommended.

FANTASTIC TWO DAYS. We booked two tours with Hello Hong Kong. Before our tour, Laura was in touch with us and even gave us restaurant suggestions. I felt like we had a friend in Hong Kong. The first tour was a food tour of the Hong Kong side and the next day we toured the Kowloon side. Our guides were Nathan and Ben and both were knowledgeable, young and fun to be with. We never would have found the restaurants on the food tour on our own. They were very local and in fact the dim sum place still has trolleys; only one of two left in Hong Kong. Food was plentiful and included in the price. We took every mode of transportation and walked quite a bit touring neighborhoods and feeling like a local versus a tourist. The second day we opted to do more touristy things...the Peak, the Flower market, Bird market, electronic market, etc...Could we have done this on our own...yes, but our time was limited and we saved lots of time going with a local. For example, tourists take the tram up to the Peak waiting in line. Not us, we took a taxi up and the tram back with no lines. While at the Peak we did a walk that we never would have found on our own. Brilliant and worth every penny that we spent. Having a private tour allows you to do what you want and move at your own pace. Thank you Hello Hong Kong for making our stay so memorable.

Wonderful experience. We did the Hong Kong food tour with Shawn on 6th January. Shawn was really knowledgeable and a fun tour guide. We got to sample some amazing Hong Kong food and see places that we never would have found (or dared go into) on our own. I'd highly recommend this tour.

Professional and friendly. We booked 2 private tours: a food tour with Ben and a Shenzen tour with Kim.They have been both perfect!Ben took us around markets and local restaurants where we tasted the real local food. It has been absolutely delicious and so interesting! Ben is very professional, kind, helpful and so friendly!We enjoyed a lot the experience and we reccomend to spend this lovely half day in HK!The Shenzen day with Kim has been amazing!It's a long day so be ready to come back very tired but also very satisfied!Kim knows perfectly where to go and the right places.She helped me a lot with my specific requests and try to find the best for me!I'm very very happy about this tour and it has been lovely to meet Kim. Very professional and so kind!I recommend Hello Hong Kong as one of the best private tour company in HK: perfectly on time, right price, professional guides and, last but not least, very friendly!Thank you!

Taste of the East. Had a fantastic time with Sean and the other tasting travellers on this tour. A great way to experience the great range of food and sights available in the city. Thouroughly recommended for all foodies with half a day to spare!

HIGHLIGHT OF HONG KONG!!!!. If you do only one thing on your visit to Hong Kong, make sure it is a tour with Hello Hong Kong Food and City Tours!I have travelled to many countries and participated in dozens of tours and this is definitely one of the best overall experiences I have had with an organized tour company. My companions and I booked a private 4 hour food tour with an additional 2 hour walking tour through some of the less touristy areas. We trusted Laura to organize the day based on our interests and we were not disappointed! She is very professional, knowledgeable, punctual and accommodating.Some highlights of our day included: Dim Sum in Sheung Wan, Wonton Noodle Soup and Milk Tea in Central, Roasted Meat in Wan Chai and an Egg Tart on Lyndhurst Terrace; Walking around some of the back streets where we saw many traditional Chinese medicinal goods, a local wet market, Fish Monger and Butcher; Shopping and bargaining at the Cat Street Market, Man Mo temple and a street festival in Lan Kwai Fong; Travelling the escalators through SoHo and by tram (ding ding) to Wan Chai. The tour format afforded us the opportunity to experience many diverse neighbourhoods.At each stop, Laura provided some history and information about the destination and food items. She also followed up by email after our excursion with some much appreciated restaurant suggestions and very detailed walking tours for us to enjoy during the rest of our stay in HK. The tour was well planned and well-paced. I would not hesitate to book with Hello Hong Kong again or recommend to others.Thanks, Laura!!

Fantastic private tour of Hong Kong. We took a five hour private tour of Hong Kong with Nathan as our first excursion on our trip to Hong Kong. We had a terrific time and truly enjoyed learning about the city and the contrast between the shiny office buildings and the public housing towers where so many people live. Nathan easily accommodated our request to get off the beaten path by taking us through a tour of a local neighborhood, before journeying downtown near Central for some fabulous dim sum. I highly recommend this tour as an introduction to Hong Kong!

Food and walking tour of Hong Kong. We spent a fantastic half day walking the streets of Hong Kong island (Central, Admiralty and Sheung Wan mainly) with Nathan our guide. Nathan was knowledgeable, unassuming, good company, and flexible to our needs. He took us to fabulous restaurants that we would never have found or known about on our own. This is an absolute must do if in Hong Kong. Could not recommend it more highly.

One of the Must Do in HK. We booked from home having been referred to this company by another guide and we are extremely happy of the service. Our guide, an american named Ben, walked us through HK streets and showing us, apart from food, several other aspects of the city. We ate great food and had a lot of fun. Highly recommended

Fantastic Time - Highly Recommned. Highly Recommended by my Niece , My Wife and I decided to try this tour as our introduction to Hong Kong . Laura was our Tour Guide and what a fantastic , interesting , informative , well organized and fun time it was !!! From the Dim Sum upstairs in a old traditional restaurant , walking the streets viewing the seafood and traditional medicines , 1 Star Michilin noodles , great barbeque pork and awesome egg tarts. This was combined with the walking tour of parts of Hong Kong Island that gave us a great insight into the older areas .The small group of 10 made it easy to interact with Laura as well as socialise with the Others on the tour . If that was not enough , at the end of the tour Laura asked us all what our other plans were and she then gave us hints/recommendations of places to go and bars/restaurants to visit. This was followed up by email that same day. Cannot have thanked Laura enough for a fantastic time.

Best of the trip. We just finished a 21 day tour of Southeast Asia in Hong Kong with Nate. Of all the tour guides we experienced during our trip -Nate was by far the best! Very knowledgable, flexible and showed us a lot of Hong Kong in an afternoon. In addition to a great tour, he showed us how to best get around and navigate our remaining three days in HK. I would strongly recommend Nate!

Great Informative Tour. Our tour guide Ben was highly informative. He took us to local places we would never have found or gone to on our own and answered all our questions, not just about food but local customs and politics as well. We highly recommend it.

Excellent Tour. Nate met us at our hotel and we talked about what to see. He took us on an outstanding tour of Hong Kong...probably the best private tour we have ever had anywhere! Not only did we have an excellent walking tour of Hong Kong and Kawloon, he taught us how to use the metro, bus and train systems. He was very knowledgeable and knew a lot of the locals. Nate took us to a local dim som restaurant for lunch was was outstanding both in food and ambiance. Highly recommend!!!

Great day. Jess was our guide and she was wonderful. Very informative and covered a lot of ground. Really enjoyed our unique dining experience at a popular neighborhood dim sum restaurant. We would highly recommend this tour service. Aloha to Jess, thanks.

A Walking Tour and Food Tour with Hello HK. After reading a number of great reviews on tripadvisor, I contacted Hello HK about booking a bespoke and food tour. The next day I received an email from Laura indicating the tours were available on the dates that I requested. After a couple of emails to go over what I wanted to see during my bespoke tour, the tours were booked.Originally, I had one guide assigned for the bespoke tour, Laura indicated that the guide was not available, rather than trying to rebook or cancel the tour, Laura step in to conduct the tour herself. Laura met me at my hotel lobby and after a quick introduction and to make sure I had an octopus card my non-stop tour of HK started. From the business area and shops of HK Island to the back streets and residential areas of Kowloon, I was shown a great mixer of the historic and culture parts of HK. Laura’s passion for her adopted city HK was very clear by her desire to share all the wonders that HK has to offer. During my tour, there were a couple of items that I wanted to purchase, Laura took several steps to try and make sure I could get those items. During the tour, Laura made several suggestions for other sites and places that I should also check out. As my tour came to an end, Laura gave me detailed and easy directions to get to another location to check out.For my food tour, my guide’s was Nathan and Shawn. After a quick introduction and a check to make sure everyone had an octopus card, we were on our way. From the Chinese medicine and seafood shops, dim sum, barbeque pork and egg tarts, you are taken on tour of some of the hidden treasures of HK Island that most visitors or residents do not know about. During the tour, the guides were very helpful answering questions about the food and sites we visited. Another nice touch is they were also answering questions and giving advice on other sites and places around HK. This was confirm at the end of the tour when the guides asked every person what their plans were for rest of the day and giving them easy directions to get them to their next stop.If you are looking for a very professional, informative and friendly tour company, I would recommend HK tours.

Excellent tour!. A fantastic way to see more of Hong Kong. Michael was an excellent guide, very knowledgeable about Hong Kong and, most importantly, its food! Delicious dim sum, noodle soup, roast meat, and egg tart. Recommend the coffee/tea - strange but tasty!

Food tour. Great start, frustrating end. I took this tour and was excited to try local cuisine. The food stops were excellent and any other day I may give this five stars. However, one member of our tour obviously didn't read the description that this was a walking tour and was not physically fit to participate. Through the whole day, we had to stop, take breaks, wait around etc. At one point we waited about 20 minutes while the guide and this woman took an alternate route to find an escalator, even needing to call the guide to follow me them. The tour ended up two hours over, eating into the very little time my husband and I had to visit Hong Kong. The guide should have intervened realizing how disruptive the stops were to the rest of the group. The guide then spent the last 20 minutes of the tour trying to find the woman a cab, which was not only not his responsibility, but continued to disrupt the tour, turning it into a wild cab goose chase. The woman should have never have come or quit the tour early, even as others complained. The guide (Michael) handled this very badly. One person missed two stops on the tour as were running so far over. Very frustrating day.

A really fun way to get a sense of Hong Kong. We were on a business trip (5 of us) and had a day to ourselves before work so booked with this tour to see some sights, eat some food and learn some history. Laura was our guide and was fabulous. Took us to see some great sites and great food. Loved the yum Cha, not so much the snake soup but it was an experience. Great history and culture lesson too with being lectured. Laura right steered us to the Stanley markets instead of the Mongkok markets we had suggested, and she also followed up with emails of ideas on where else to go if we had more time. You really should do this tour. Thanks Laura.

Walking Tour with Lunch. I enjoyed this tour. It provided a good overview of Hong Kong, and good orientation for touring Hong Kong independently after this tour. Lunch was okay--noodle soup restaurant that provided nourishment to keep us going. We used public transport as well as walking. This tour requires one to be in good walking condition, too.

Excellent food tour with Jess. We were a group of 6 with 2 adults, 2 children (9 and 12 yrs old) and 2 grandparents. Jess was very friendly and personable and gave us a great tour. We loved the dim sum and would definitely not found that place on our own. A great tour that highlights the must eat foods while visiting Hong Kong. Thanks Jess!

Unforgetable trip in Hong Kong. I have never been in Hong Kong before. But Nathan and Hello Hong Kong made my first trip in Hong Kong unforgetable!After a long flight from Amsterdam, sleepless and jet lag, I didn't expected that I could enjoy my five hours tour in Hong Kong at all.BUT after the first minute that Nathan picked me up at Hong Kong International Airport, I realized that there must be a very interesting trip!I didn't felt that Nathan was my guide, nor I was a sleepy tourist. I felt like Nathan is my good old friend who took me around and showed me the best of Hong Kong. We catched The Peak, walked along Luggard road, visited HSBC building and Nathan told me about the feng shui and the bronze lions. We took star ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui and with my special request sat we on "the bus" to Prince Edward. We also walked through the flower market and saw how back streets in Hong Kong look like. It was very interesting. Hong Kong is a big city, many people and busy traffic. But there is very tidy and clean!!Finally ate we Dim Sum at One Dim Sum. A tiny place with plenty of good taste!Five hours went really fast. I couldn't make it alone to experience Hong Kong that much without Nathan and Hello Hong Kong. Nathan is absolutely my kindly and friendly tourmate!I had a very great time and couldn't find any words to say more, but next time I will visit Hong Kong I surely will ask Nathan and Hello Hong Kong to be my tourmate again!!!

Highly recommended food tour. We've booked this food tour very short-noticed and everything was perfectly organised. Very interesting and amazingly tasty walking tour around Hong Kong. We ate at eateries you would normally not detect or visit. Our guide Michael was very insightful and did a great job explaining us HK and its food. Would do it again and can highly recommend it.

"Hello Hong Kong with Kim Collett in Shenzhen.". In January 2015 as a birthday present from my husband he booked a day trip to Shenzhen. We literally jumped off a cruise ship and meet Kim at Hung Hom station for a trip to Shenzhen. Kim was very through in her prebooking emails so it was a fabulous day.We had so much fun my husband who normally is impatience with this exercise invited friends to do the same again in January 2016.We all live in Australia and meet up with our friends for NYE followed by a ......."Kim Collett trip to Shenzhen. "She is highly efficient, well organized, great notigatier , reseaches her contacts to deliver quality for price products.Highly recommend..............Kim from Hello Hong Kong.

Great food tour. Definitely worth doing this tour!We met in the morning and even though we booked last minute everything worked out great. This is a walking tour, so you get a better feeling of the city. Michael our guide answered all of our questions and organised this incredible food for us. The dim sum were incredible, try the coffeetea as weird as it sounds. NO funky stuff (like chicken feet) but if you really want that I am sure Michael can make it happen.Highly recommended!

Good way to spend a day. Nathan did a fantastic job of showing us around HK and introducing us to the cuisine. The small group setting is nice as it allows you to interact with others throughout the day. The stops included a traditional dim sum restaurant (average), a bbq pork spot (very good), a noodle shop (ok), a milk tea vendor (ok), and ended with an egg tart (worth skipping). I actually didn't feel like I ate very much on the tour. The dim sum spot offered the best chance to fill up but it was first and we were advised to pace ourselves. My advice would be, order lots of pork at the bbq place and don't be shy about what you want at the dim sum spot. Food wise I don't feel you get a great value on your tour but you do get your money's worth from the guide. Nathan's emails after the tour were a huge help in planning the rest of our trip. He provided lots of recommendations for bars, restaurants, day trips, etc. During the tour he was very informative and I learned a lot.

Most informative and delicious. The tour guide was highly informed about eating out in Hong Kong. He was also a very amiable and entertaining host. The places we visited appeared to be authentic (i.e. not just set up for tourists) and so we got a 'real' taste of the local food in Hong Kong. The only thing I would say about the choice of food is that if you're a vegetarian this is probably not the tour for you as there was quite a bit of meat on the menu.

Great mix of food and Hong Kong fun facts.. I wanted to try out the more genuine Hong Kong food during a short stop over. Our guide Michael provided just that and a as bonus also provided a lot of Hong Kong history and other facts during the stroll through the streets of Hong Kong.

Great tour. Delicious food. Good value! Highly recommended!. My friend and I were in town for a long weekend but wanted to experience some of the local cuisine. This tour took you to five different places and you got to walk and experience the city and learn some history along the way.
