It was very well organized and well planned with walking and a trolley ride. Michael was our tour guide and we enjoyed him very much. The tour was very informational but laid back - I didn't feel like I was being talked at for five hours. The food was delicious and nothing crazy that you didn't even want to try. The amount of food was good for each stop; you were still able to eat or drink at each place but left the tour with a full stomach. Very professional with the information provided before the tour and the company was very responsive to any questions before as well. Highly recommended!! Mary and Kaseryn

Amazing Food & Fun Facts. Niya was an AMAZING tour guide. She showed us the real Hong Kong and brought us to several food and drink spots that I would have never thought to stop at if I were on my own. Her food and drink recommendations were spot on as well. She gave us all kinds of facts on the local culture, the history, Chinese medicine, and backgrounds of all the places we visited. She also followed up with emails of our great photo moments and lots of info on spots to visit and nightlife in HK. If I didn't know better, I would have thought she lived her whole life here!! It was a pleasure spending the day with her eating, drinking, and running around the city. I'd recommend this tour to everyone with a few hours to spare while in HK - it's something you'll never experience on your own.

Food tour hongkong. We had a great food tour. Niyati, our guide, had wonderfull information about everything we saw. She was verry good informed. The places we went to have the different kinds of food, as described in the tour where places we would generally not think of visiting. The places are authentic and the food was great. The tour is a great way to get to know something of hongkong and the food. We reccomend this tour.Cheers wim and corné

A great introduction to Hong Kong. As a solo traveller I went on two tours with Hello Hong Kong- the first was a private tour with Laura, and the second a group food tour with Shawn. I was staying in Hong Kong for a week, and was looking for an introduction to the city- public transport, local/cultural spots and a taste of local food. I couldn't be happier with both tours- Laura is a great, friendly guide and tailored the private tour to match my interests, all the while giving useful travel tips, and great cultural, historical and local insight into the various areas we visited. I'm shocked at how much she fit in 5 hours considering the tour felt relaxed, and never rushed. After the tour, she dropped me off in an area I was keen to explore and followed up with several emails detailing everything we had done, as well as more areas of interest, food stops to explore and useful walking directions to try on my own. The follow up information and tips were SO useful- I used them constantly throughout the week! I had a great time in Hong Kong, and it wouldn't have been the same without Laura's guidance.I took a food tour with Shawn the next day- and it was also great! I ate some of the best food of my whole 6 weeks abroad- the BBQ pork is amazing. Shawn was a really friendly guide and happy to answer and questions from the group. We went to restaurants and food stops filled with locals, which is a great sign. There was plenty of food and variety throughout the tour, as well as some walking throughout various market districts. Again, the follow up emails were great- detailing everywhere we went, and suggestions for the rest of our trips. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend both tours- thanks again!

Great food tour with Ben.. Ben took 7 of us all over Hong Kong to a variety of restaurants and food outposts. He paid careful attention to make sure everyone had whatever they needed or wanted to try. Ben knows a lot about life in Hong Kong having lived here for several years and was very happy to share his impressions and experiences and answer our questions.

Great Tour!. Went on a tour by myself an Nathan made me and the rest of the group feel very welcomed. Saw alot, ate a lot and had a GREAT TIME! Nathan is a hell of a guide and an hour later I'm still stuffed!

Not just about the food. While travelling through Asia with my boyfriend and having a bit of a passion for food, we went on quite a few food tours in Japan, Hong Kong, Thailand and Vietnam. I can hands down say this one was the best. I loved that it wasn't just a matter of going from stop A to B - Laura included stories about the history of Hong Kong throughout. The food was great, I wish I could eat that BBQ pork everyday!

Fantastic food & walking tour. We were on a 17 day Grand Asia cruise in November and Laura's tour was our favourite tour of the trip. Time is short on a cruise and we benefited so much from all of the research she put into this city walking tour with stops at some of the best local eateries in the city and information about the city that she shared as we made our way through the streets.  Our day started with a breakfast of authentic dim sum at Lin Heung Kui Tea House where the locals dine. She explained Chinese medicine as we walked along Wing Lok Street and Des Voeux Road West. We visited the Taoist Man Mo Temple. The wonton soup at the world's cheapest one Michelin starred restaurant (Mak's on Wellington Street) was amazing! Milk tea from Lan Fong Yuen was a cool afternoon treat on a hot day. We got to use the Escalator to tour Soho and took the tram to Wan Chai to Joy Hing on Hennessy Road where we enjoyed the best roasted pork. Laura even e-mailed me the recipe for the delicious egg tarts we had at Tai Cheong Bakery, as well as the method for making milk tea. She sent me a complete list of the places we visited and a some great pictures she took of us on tour--a scrapbooker's dream! I would recommend this tour and Laura to anyone visiting Hong Kong and I hope to have the pleasure of spending a day or more with her again, in Hong Kong, or wherever she plans to expand her business.

The perfect day in Hong Kong. What a treat my friend and I had on our recent trip to Hong Kong. Laura's food tour was everything we could have asked for. All of the stops were carefully chosen for both authenticity and great food. At every stop, we were surrounded by the people of Hong Kong--no tourists in sight, except for our group. The food was delicious with the occasional exotic offering (anyone for a chicken foot?). Laura shared with us many of the local eating traditions as well as interesting cultural tidbits. We saw some of the fun sights of Hong Kong along the way. My only complaint was that I was so stuffed with delicious food, I shouldn't have eaten for a week. But, I managed to continue the culinary adventure in a great city. I highly recommend Hello Hong Kong as a highlight of your visit.

low-key, casual and very interesting. Laura was great. She met us at our hotel, helped us understand and use local transportation, and then we walked through several areas away from tourists to eat dim sum, eat noodles, drink the local specialty coffees, and then feast on pork until we nearly fell over...all the while, we were never rushed, even spending extra time at a small temple that caught our eye. We also spent time in some markets and herbal pharmacy learning what people buy, how they use various remedies, etc.This tour is perfect for 2-4 people; you want to be fit enough to walk a few miles, but no need to be an athlete. I am confident she'd fit your envisioned experience into her array of options. We tour a lot, and have used a number of private guides; Laura is at the top of that list, and I'd recommend her to anyone visiting HK that wants to eat local.

Hello Hong Kong Food and City Tours. I thought this tour was simply magnificent. Our guide, Laura, was charming and knowledgeable. The restaurants she selected were fantastic, the food was fantastic, and I learned a lot about Hong Kong, it's people, and it's culture. I took two food tours in Hong Kong. The other on- not Laura's was abysmal. I learned nothing, the guide taught us nothing, it was a flop. I recommend this tour so highly. Five stars. I would actually take it again, as I enjoyed it so much. Three cheers for Hello Hong Kong!

Personalised, comprehensive and interesting.. We did a half day walking tour of Hong Kong which focussed on food, Our guide Michael was excellent. A long-time resident of Hong Kong, Michael was able to provide us with a broad-ranging and interesting selection of food sights, tastes and venues. We spent time in various parts of the city, and saw Hong Kong through the eyes of a local. We appreciated Michael's considered responses to all our questions. We would recommend this tour to anyone who is interested in an authentic Hong Kong food experience.

Best day in Hong Kong. We spent five days in Hong Kong - trying everything from horse race betting to three start restaurants. The best day we spent with Hello Hong Kong Foor & City Tours, visiting back streets, authentic shops, cool places. And tasting fantastic food in restaurants that we would neither have found ourselves nor understood how to order and eat in. Charming and knowable guide made us feel at home from the first second. If you have only one day for leisure in Hong Kong - spend it with Hello Hong Kong Food & City Tours. Skip breakfast even if you are going on a post-lunch tour - there is so much to taste - and you will want to try everything. Twice.

4 hour walking tour of HK. We did a bespoke 4 hour walking tour of HK with Jess. Since we did not have much time to tour around HK (limited in days and we were travelling with two small kids) the tour with Jess gave us a good flavor for HK, its history and she showed us streets/markets which we would not have been able to discover on our own. She was particular about the time we had to finish the tour as we had to meet up with our kids and also gave us good tips on things to do with the children.I would highly recommend Hello Hong Kong as well as Jess as a tour guide.

Perfect English Speaking Tour - Hellllllllo Hong Kong!. My trip to Hong Kong would not have been the same without the wonderful tour from Jess at Hello Hong Kong. During our university trip, we spent 2 days with Hello Hong Kong, and I wouldn't have changed a thing. Our first day was a Food Tour, where we had full meals at eat location including dished like Dim Sum, Noodles, Egg Tarts, Milk Tea and more! The chosen spots were anything from touristy - we were immersed with locals, and I never would have found those locations on my own. Our second day was spent exploring various neighborhoods of Hong Kong, getting an comprehensive cultural immersion. Our tour guide, Jess, was upbeat, extremely knowledgable, and attentive to our interests. It was great to have a someone who is a native english speaker, but still give a tour from an extremely local perspective. Thank you Hello Hong Kong for a wonderful couple of days!!

Made us see and enjoy Hong Kong differently. Our family of 6 took Laura's 4-hour bespoke tour on 29Dec. Having been to Hong Kong many times, but always just for food and shopping, we asked to see backstreet and cultural sights. Laura led us through a dried seafood street, wet market, snake shop and Sham Shui Po, poorest of Hong Kong's 18 districts. Along the way, we stopped for the best dim sum, yummy soya bean delicacies and traditional snacks before finishing at Wong Tai Sin. She's a treasure trove of information, sharing with us valuable insights on social issues, housing, religions, .. All in, a fantastic and rewarding experience, kudos to our most enthusiastic 5-star guide!

Awesome Food Tour in Hong Kong!. I took the 4 hour group tour with a friend and we had a spectacular experience! The guides (normally theres just one but one was in training on our tour) were really engaging and friendly. The food/drink places that they took us were really authentic and delicious. If I was on my own, I'd be intimidated to try the places we went, so taking the tour was perfect because we had some background info and someone who took the lead on ordering. Highly recommended!

Yummy Street Food, Hidden Treasures and the Best Guide Ever!. Laura met us at our hotel in Sham Sui Po and we were instantly taken by her infectious enthusiasm for Hong Kong. Within metres of our hotel, we were inside a temple that we had passed multiple times without realising. She introduced us to street food that we had seen previously, but had no idea what it was, or how to order. Her friendly nature with the locals opened up a whole new world for us. She taught us a few simple phrases to help us interact with the gentle Hong Kong people. We enjoyed Yum Cha (even the chicken feet!), and fell in love with the Ying Yang 'icey' (local drink of iced tea and iced coffee combined into one). Laura also imparted so much information on so many aspects of Hong Kong life that we walked away at the end of our five hours with a heightened respect and love of Hong Kong, and its people. If you are contemplating taking a tour, don't hesitate - it is more than worth it.

Hello Hong Kong Tours. As soon as we arrived we had scheduled a private tour. We were lucky enough to get Laura, who I believe is the owner. She was happily waiting for us in the lobby of our hotel. She quickly got us started with a Octopus card. This is a public transit card good for all public transportation as well as use in some store. Laura was a wealth of information on current as well as past Hong Kong. She took us on the Star Ferry, street shopping as well as for some egg waffles and snake soup. What was also helpful is she provided us detailed itineraries for other things to do while in Hong Kong like Big Budda, the Peak and Stanley. Her instructions included details with pictures so we knew exactly where to go. We can't thank you enough Laura.

Awesome Tour with Jess!!. My husband and I had a terrific time with Jess. She picked us up at our hotel lobby and we were at ease straight away. We covered a lot of our interests. A couple of my top interests were the Won Tai Sin Temple as well as the Chi Lin Nunnery. One of the highlights for me though was the Nan Lian Garden that actually led to the nunnery. Jess also took us to a market where she had us tried a snake and mushroom soup...which I thought was pretty good! We ended our tour in a restaurant that Jess suggested and again it was one of the best dim sum we had. Thank you Jess for showing us Hong Kong and making it interesting and fun!

Hong Kong Highlight. My girlfriend and I booked the food tour before arriving in Hong Kong - based on the tripadvisor reviews - and were not disappointed. It really is the best way to sample some of the local delicacies and find out where the locals eat. We had Michael for the day, who was great, a very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful guide. Highly recommend to anyone travelling to Hong Kong.

A must do tour in Hong Kong. We were delighted not only by the food we experienced on this tour, but most importantly by our guide Shawn.Even though he is not from Hong Kong (his parents are), he has gathered the needed knowledge to tell us a lot about the HK experience and food we had.A very well organised tour, prior, while and after the tour with excellent explanations of all the places, habits and tips to complete our visit afterwards. One sees that the tour company cares about its customers.We will for sure try the other tours this company offers as soon as we are back to HK and this tour made it very clear we will come back!

Eating Like the Locals. My friend and I had an excellent time touring the back streets of Hong Kong tasting the local dishes with Laura of Hello Hong Kong. Laura was so knowledgeable about Hong Kong and the food was outstanding. All of the places visited had mainly local clientele so we knew we were getting the authentic Hong Kong food. Laura was a delight and we felt that we visiting with an old friend! This tour is a must if you are visiting Hong Kong! From snake soup and snake wine to those delicious egg custard tarts - worth returning just for those..... Thanks Laura

Perfect for solo travelers, couples and families.. I was in Hong Kong on my own and decided to take the Hello Hong Kong Food Tour to get myself acclimated to the city. I'm so glad I did! Michael was FANTASTIC. We learned so much not only about the delicious food, but all the rich culture and history in Hong Kong. Most of what I spoke about to my friends and family when I got back, I learned from Michael. I highly recommend this for anyone - solo travelers, couples and families - we had all three on our tour.

Great tour of Central and Kowloon. The 5-hour tour of Central and Kowloon with Laura was one of the highlights of our trip to HK. She gave us a fascinating overview of the city, combining the cultural and the culinary, spiced with her own blend of humor and charm. Thanks, Laura, for all the additional tips and candid photos!Warmly recommended.

Brilliant food tour of Hong Kong. We spent a delicious, enlightening, and sometimes hilarious 5 hours with Laura as she guided us effortlessly around yum cha, various shops and markets, a famous wanton noodle soup shop, the "best barbecue pork you've ever eaten", a sample of icy coffee/tea, and finished with egg tart like no other. Laura was an exceptional guide. She shared her time well between all the group, ensured everyone was included and that their particular interests were looked after. She is very knowledgeable, but also entertaining and great fun. We had a great day.

Laura is the BEST!!!. As part of a school group (11), Laura led us around Hong Kong and tried some of the best food ever. As a native of the UK, Laura speaks perfect English which is helpful when learning about the food, culture, etc. Had we used a Chinese guide, some of the humor/sarcasm/accents could have been a little difficult between the group and the guide. She got to know all of us and was super personable. If you're going to use the tour, ask for Laura!As for the tour itself, we spend two mornings/afternoon together and got to see so many amazing sights and tastes while learning about their traditions. Taking the MTR and having group discussions made the experience so authentic, as well.

Jess took us on a fantastic tour. Thanks to Jess for taking our family on a great food tour. We visited great authentic places that we would never had found ourselves and Jess shared so many interesting things that we completely forgot about time. We took our son on 3 years and that was not a problem

Perfect Introduction to Hong Kong. I recommend that you do the private 5 hour tour on your very first day in Hong Kong. Jess met us at our hotel and she escorted us on the Star ferry, showed us how to use the public transport and then we walked to so many iconic sights of Hong Kong. She is so knowledgeable about the history, the people, the place. You will see famous places and not so famous places which you would never get to without an experienced guide. Our tour took us over lunch and she took us to a traditional tea house where we were the only western faces, but it was OK because Jess could help us get food, and very good it was too. This is your private tour and Hello Hong Kong have very good communications leading up to the day of the tour to make sure they know what you want to get out of the experience. Not only that, when we said there were certain things we would do on our own subsequently, Jess followed up with very detailed instructions of how to do those things and included a few more suggestions as well. Thank you Jess, without your tour our visit to Hong Kong would have been nowhere near as successful and interesting as it was.

Great day!. I had a walking/eating tour with Jess. It was a great day, she took me everywhere. We walked all over and saw so many neighborhoods. Had great dim sum and egg custard tarts. Jess also taught me about the subway system so that I was prepared for the next when I was on my own. It was a big help for me when I was alone. Overall it was a great day and it was more like hanging out with a friend than a guide.

HK Food Tour Highlight of Trip!. I was only in Hong Kong for a few days, however I still managed to see a lot. The food tour was the highlight of my trip for sure! Jess was very knowledgeable. While walking through the city, we were given interesting stories and information about the city, culture and history. The best part is that we went to try great food, at places we would have probably not entered if alone. I would highly recommend this tour!

A visit as bright as her ginger hair. Laura was an absolute delight as our tour guide! She gave us two tours on two separate days, and both were enjoyable as well as educational. She did a remarkable job reading the interests of the group and giving us options within the tour of what we did and did not want to see. I would recommend going on her tour to anyone visiting or moving to Hong Kong, or even a local looking to learn more about the city!

Excellent intro to HK food. My fiance and I took a small group tour in October with Michael and had a wonderful time. Michael was very informative about the history and culture of Hong Kong. We loved the Dim Sum at Lin Heung Tea House and the delicious meat at Joy Hing. This tour was definitely the highlight of our quick 3 day stay in Hong Kong. I kind of wish we could have done one tour each day! To top if off Michael sent us a lovely follow-up e-mail that even included a recipe for the egg tart we ate at the end of the tour.

Great Food Tour with Hello Hong Kong!. We loved the Food Tour we took with Hello Hong Kong in November, 2015. The food was great and we loved trying food from places off the beaten bath that we would never have found on our own. Nathan was a great guide. We also loved the Hong Kong history we learned on the tour. Would highly recommend this tour!!

Great value for the money!. Laura was an excellent tour guide, with a thorough knowledge of Hong Kong. This is not your ordinary tour. We took a variety of modes of transportation and traveled to several Hong Kong neighborhoods. We got a real flavor for the city, but did not see a lot of the "traditional" tourist sites. It was great to see the way people live in Hong Kong, and this tour provided us with that experience. Laura was very responsive to our needs and was very flexible. It was a great tour.

Private tour. Jess was an outstanding guide. She a wide ranging audience to cater for in that I am in my late-20s and already am living in Hong Kong and my parents are in their 60s and it was one of their first times in Asia – but she pitched the tour at the perfect level. She tailored the tour to our needs – skipping over things we have done already and leaving the easier things for me to do with my parents later on. She did great in giving us enough of the basic history of Hong Kong (which I loved) to providing interesting cultural stories and taking us to an off-the-beaten track neighbourhood that I would never had gone to otherwise. She also provided us with ideas for other day trips and sent us a very comprehensive guide afterwards. I couldn’t recommend her enough – thanks very much Jess!!

Brilliant start to our Hong Kong adventure . We arrived on Sunday night and had this tour booked for the Monday morning. So so pleased we timed it like this as we got a great introduction to Hong Kong and didn't have to make tricky decisions about where to eat and we were certainly well fed!Laura, our guide, was friendly and informative and showed us some great places to eat and pointed out some brilliant things we would never have seen. Also gave us great advice on future things to do, and even sent an email with photos of our tour and information on what we had eaten and seen. Can't recommend this highly enough- never ever thought of doing a tour like this before, but now I've done one- I hope I can find others as good in other cities around the world.
Well worth it!. Laura was a fantastic guide through the city. Had fun, learned a little along the way and was introduced to some great food and restaurants. Highly recommended.

The Highlight of our Trip. We did a Food Tour with Jessica. We got to see lots of Hong Kong neighborhoods, learn a little history, and eat lots of delicious food! This tour was so much fun and was the highlight of our trip!

Food Tour. A fabulous tour - eating at and viewing some of HK's hidden treasure outlets. Made thoroughly enjoyable by our informative and entertaining guide Shawn. Recommend it to anyone - visitor or resident - looking to enjoy an authentic taste of Hong Kong!

Good start in Hong Kong. We started our visit in Hong Kong with a 4h food and city walk from Hello Hong Kong. We tried local Cantonese dishes such as dim sum, bbq duck, nudles, milk tea and much more. We also visited a temple, markets and a mammoth store, yes you read correct. Nathan who was our guide was very well-informed and friendly even though we were tired after a long flight from London. We can really recommend this, especially as a start of your Hong Kong visit.

History, Culture & Foodie Tour. The private bespoke tour was excellent value for a morning of history, culture & tasty yum cha. Ben has experience working with kids and my two little ones adore him. My younger son was especially thrilled to hold a dried gecko at the dried seafood market in Sheung Wan. Ben was a wealth of information about the bronze lions at HSBC building. And his anecdote about his own experience seeking romance at Wong Tai Sin temple was pretty amusing. For anyone joining the tour, wear comfortable walking shoes (lots of walking), drinking water and a camera to capture the memories. Have fun!
Hello Hong Kong Food Tour. Was the most fantastic day. Tried some amazing food and had the most brilliant tour guide, Sean. Would recommend this tour to tourist and expats living in HK alike.

Fun & friendly way to see Hong Kong. Did two tours with Jess, one was a food tour, the other was a walking tour near Tsim Sha Tsui. The both tours were so much fun. Jess took us to try dim sum, milk tea, noodles, and char sui. She had lots of interesting facts for us along the way, and couldn't be more friendly. Our second tour was equally as interesting. We went to places like the Wong Tai Sin Temple and got to see the Yau Lau statue. Would book another tour with this group again for sure!

Informative and fun tour!. We booked 2 tours with Hello Hong Kong and loved them both. I was traveling with my mom over Thanksgiving and we didn't have a lot of time to do sightseeing on our own so we booked the small group food tour with Michael and a private bespoke walking tour with Jess. Both experiences were fun and informative. Both guides were friendly, fun, and really knowledgeable. Our small group food tour with Michael ended up with a great mix of interesting people and we made a lot of new friends and had so much fun trying all the local food spots. Michael speaks Cantonese which has some obvious perks. Jess got along great with my mom and I during our private bespoke walking tour and was really flexible with making a change to stop in at the Peninsula hotel for tea (a treat in itself) as we were walking by and then adjusting the structure of the tour thereafter. We would hang out with Jess any day! She's so nice and fun.Would absolutely recommend Hello Hong Kong to anyone visiting who wants to see the city with a local insider perspective.

Best way to see Hong Kong. Ben was our guide and he was amazing. He was very knowledgeable about the city and took us to the places off of the usual tourist route that we wanted to see. The trip to the Dim Sum restaurant will stay with us forever! Great way to see the city even if you are there for a brief time. Highly recommended!!!

Fantastic group food tour. We booked at the last minute and managed to get a spot on the group food tour with Jess as our tour guide. We (myself, husband and 2 1/2 year old daughter) had a great time, exploring the city via a variety of local and very authentic food stops on foot and using the tram. Jess was very friendly and knowledgeable, and gave us interesting information about local sites as well as the food stops we visited. We would highly recommend anyone wanting to see the real Hong Kong to take this tour, the food is just a bonus. Thank you Jess, you made our trip!

Interesting tour with great food!. Very interesting selection of food on the tour, but just as interesting is the background information and walking tour of the area. Had a great day out. Highly recommended!

Excellent tour, tailored to our interests. Laura was a wonderful guide, very friendly and informative. We were traveling as a group of friends and she tailored the tour so that we could see parts of the city that would interest us. I would definitely recommend a tour with Laura.

Best way to eat your way through Hong Kong!!!. Jess was our guide and she was awesome! Very knowledgeable about all the cuisine & traditions and showed us not only the best food & dishes in HK but also some very cool sights and local spots, markets, the escalators, etc.. Great way to get acquainted with the city even if you are there for a brief time. Highly recommended!!!

Fun for the whole family!. We had an awesome time with Laura while visiting Hong Kong this summer. We were a group of 10 and of all ages. She was so much fun. It felt like you were visiting the city with a girlfriend. She showed us all the places we would never get to see unless we lived there. She showed us a city full of contrasts. She was well educated in the culture and history but she made it fun and not boring for the kids. She also gave us a list of attractions and restaurants to visit on subsequent days. She was fabulous. We would definitely utilize her on our next visit!

Excellent 5 hour walking tour with Nathan. We have just returned from a three night stopover in Hong Kong and our tour by Nathan gave us a great insight into the city. He was punctual ,knowledgeable and good company. Nathan tailored our tour to fit our previously gathered requests and took us to the main sites and places we would never have seen. If you do one tour in Hong Kong, make it with this highly professional company.

Lovely day in spite of rain!. We had an amazimg day traveling through HK with Laura. All the different food we tried was excellent and we were so full after. Laura was extremely knowledgeable about food and all things HK. Highly recommend.

Absolutely FABULOUS tour of Hong Kong by a seasoned professional!. Laura was truly awesome! She met us at the airport and took us all over Hong Kong and showed us so much you'd never be able to see doing it on your own. We rode on so many forms of transportation - the Star Ferry, subway, double decker tram, the escalators up the hills, my 12 year old son just loved it! Such an interesting commentary also! Laura then goes the extra mile and e-mails you all of the pictures she takes along your custom journey! She took us to an off the beaten path authentic restaurant and ordered for us - we enjoyed everything she chose. We only had a 9 hour layover at the airport and she took us around for about 5 hours - just a spectacular way to see Hong Kong. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Back streets tour of Hong Kong Island. We met Ben and seven others early. First stop a bakery for breakfast, Yum Cha with Dim Sum. Then as we walked all over HK island we were tempted with prawn noodles, ying yang tea, roast pork & duck and Hong Kong custard tarts. We walked for miles. Saw wet markets, ancient buildings, Man Mo Temple. Walked the elevated stairs, rode the ding ding tram. Came across both legal and illegal food imports. We had a great time and saw and enjoyed things we would never of found on our own. Ben was a great host and a good ambassador for Laura's tours. He gave us some suggestions on how to get around and our best options for going up to The Peak. I do apologise for taking so long to write about our experience. We not only enjoyed the food but also the tour we had on the way. Ben gave us lots of information and history about HK Island as we walked around. Happy to recommend this tour company.

Private Tour of HK. My wife and I were on our honeymoon and had a long lay over in HK prior to heading home. We took our tour in October (sorry for the delay in our review). Prior to starting our trip, I reached out to Laura regarding the possibilities of a private walking tour that would match up with our time frame. Laura and her team were incredible to work with and extremely attentive and we were able to sketch out a general overview of what we wanted to see and do. We were matched up with Nathan, who met us at the train station. We then had a quick chat about what some of the things we wanted to see were. Nathan was incredible attentive to what we did / did not want to see, was very honest in his suggestions in what we should / should not see and was very engaging throughout the entire tour. Nathan was able to take us on a tour that I don't believe a lot of people get to see and provided a ton of cool behind the scenes commentary. I would highly recommend anyone who has the time to seriously consider taking this tour.

Highly recommended, wonderful food, knowledgeable guide and comprehensive tour!. We went on a private food tour with two extra hours added. Laura was a fantastic guide. We were a group of three and that made it very relaxed and easy to talk to Laura throughout the tour and ask her any question that came to us. She is well researched and knew the answer to any question we asked, as well as in depth details about the food we ate, traditions, history, etc. The pace was leisurely, but we covered a lot of ground. When we did a bus tour the next day, I realized how many places we had already been. She also took us to a real local market that you don't hear about in the guide books and it was interesting to see the real way most people of Hong Kong live. Laura gave a very comprehensive tour, fantastic value for the money. If you only have one day, this is the tour you should do. FYI, this is the first review I have ever written... Take from that what you will.

Very enjoyable. This was a great way to start our trip in HK. It gave us a real understanding for not only the food and how to get it but the history of HK and how to travel around it.We chose the group food tasting tour. Breakfast was amazing at a local place...what an experience. We when back for breakfast two more times after the tour. The other places were great too and they were in different areas which made for an interesting trip.Our guide was knowledgable and entertaining.Highly recommended

Fantastic tour!. We did a private food tour for 3 people. We chose to do it privately so that we could go at our own pace and also because we don't normally do tours or group activities when we travel and prefer exploring independently. We also tend not to like using guides, so it is a big compliment to our guide Jess from Hello Hong Kong that we enjoyed our tour so much.We chose to do a food tour as it's a good chance to get off the beaten track of restaurants listed in guide books and trip advisor and get to get some inside knowledge from somebody living in Hong Kong. That turned out to be a good decision since we would probably not have found most of the places we visited on the tour by ourselves. All the places were fantastic - the dim sum was amazing and the restaurant so atmospheric: big and bustling with locals. Not a tourist in sight! It was fun choosing food from the cart and that was where it was useful to be with a guide as it's a challenge with no menu and no language skills! The roasted meat stop was really good too - the barbecued pork so delicious that we almost went back the next day. I am dreaming about how good it was and hope I can make it back there on my next visit.Jess kindly emailed me details of all the places we visited so that we can find them again by ourselves as well as other tips we had talked about. She was very good company - knowledgable but not blinding us with information and statistic overload as some guides are wont to do. She also let us move at our own pace, never hurrying us, even when I stopped to buy stuff at the market and to take loads of photos everywhere. She never made us feel like we were on a schedule and we did end up finishing about 15 mins late and even then she was not in a hurry to wind up. The whole day felt very relaxed.The organisation and communication from Hello Hong Kong was smooth and efficient throughout. As we did a private tour we were able to make a date change to accommodate our schedule and they were really flexible. Doing the tour privately is of course a lot more pricey, and it's hard to say if it's worth it. But if it's within your budget I would highly recommend it. Incidentally, I did look into booking with another company that also had good reviews, and although the tour price was a bit lower, the food was not included. With Hello Hong Kong all the food we had on the tour was included in the cost.

Awesome! Superb! Exceptional!. One word, AWESOME! You will not be disappointed. Punctual and considerate on that what we wanted to do. We were very lucky to have Laura and she knew Hong Kong like the back of her hands. She mixed in our tour with a short history lesson, local foods, and also the contrast of old versus new Hong Kong. We were having so much fun that we were saddened to find out that the tour was over. She gave us suggestions on what to see with the rest of our day and also took into consideration our energy levels. At the end of the tour, she placed us on a bus to Stanley where we had lunch and enjoyed a great afternoon by the seaside.

Couldn't ask for a better introduction to Hong Kong!!. Due to some last-minute scheduling changes, ended up booking a morning food tour w/ Hello Hong Kong and couldn't have been happier with that decision!!Took the morning tour on my first full day in Hong Kong after arriving the night before via a 16 hour flight. The tour, led by Nathan, was the perfect way to fight the jet lag!Food stops included dim sum in the central part of Hong Kong island, homemade wonton noodle soup, bbq pork, iced "yin-yang" milk tea, and egg tart. Nathan was an excellent guide and did a great job navigating for the group, ordering for us, and explaining the local culinary traditions. I also appreciated how much history and culture were mixed into this tour, including a walk through the Chinese medicinal goods market, a tour through the wet market, and a ride on the tram.As a first time visitor to Hong Kong, I couldn't have asked for a better introduction to the sights, smells, and tastes of the city. It was also a really nice touch that Nathan sent everyone a post-tour email with photos of the group, a break-down of what and where we ate, and tips (including directions) for other things each of us planned to do and see.Thanks again Nathan and Hello Hong Kong!!

Fun Tour!. We had 1 day in Hong Kong did a 4 hour tour with Hello Hong Kong. I had lots of questions on what to do and where to go and Laura always responded to my emails promptly and set up the itinerary. We had Nathan as our guide. He was very personable and knowledgeable and took us to some of the back streets of Hong Kong. We saw a temple, snake shop, electronics market and indoor fish and wet meat market. We took the Star Ferry and went to the Cat Street Market. Laura advised us to go to Victoria Peak on our own time since our tour was short and Nathan directed us how to get there when our tour with him was over. Wish we had had more time in Hong Kong with Hello Hong Kong tours!
Get Ready to Eat!. Meeting Nathan was a breeze and he was a great guide. We learned a lot and got to eat some great food. The pork at the end was AMAZING!

Fun tour. The Hello Hong Kong Foodie tour with Nathan was fantastic! It began with him taking time to learn our names well and continued with fun facts, great food, a variety of neighborhoods and ended with his notes for recommendations for other activities, restaurants and sites he emailed to us later. Well worth your time. Julie

Fun & worthwhile experience. Just completed a food tour with Hello Hong Kong and it was well worth it. Our guide Jess particularly made it special with her knowledge, good humor and insights. Would recommend both the company and Jess as a means of getting a welcoming lay of the land for the traditional HK food scene and history.

GREAT FUN & FABULOUS FOOD!!!. This was SO MUCH FUN! Jess did a great job and it was so much more informative and interesting than we expected! We cruised the neighborhoods, visiting dried seafood shops, an apothecary, outdoor markets and so much more, getting a real feel for the traditional culture as well as the changing world they live in.I'M SO GLAD WE TOOK THIS TOUR!!!!!

Hong Kong Food Tour. This food tour is a good starter if this is your first visit to Hong Kong. It serves as a great introduction to the type of food local people eat. The area covered is also very central in Hong Kong. The guide Jess is extremely informative and helpful. She gave great insights into the history of each place we visited. My personal favorite was the second last shop where we had the prok BBQ char siew.

Great insights by knowledgeable Jess. Jess took me to places, I would never have discovered on my own and gave me detailed background information as well as a very knowledgeable discourse in Hongkongs history.It was an amazing tour!

Time well spent in Hong Kong. We probably learnt more about Hong Kong in the four hours with Laura than the rest of the week. She made it really interesting and fun. A must for any first time visitor to this great

AWESOME Company! Nathan is an AWESOME Tour Guide!. My husband and I recently visited Hong Kong for the second time. We wanted to hire a guide for a day to do a few things that we had done before (and wanted to revisit), as well as a number of new things that we missed out on last time. Nathan was our tour guide and he is fantastic!! He is originally from the Boston area if I remember correctly, and moved to Hong Kong some time ago so his English is perfect and he gets the kind of things that Americans would like to see and do while there. That being said, he is a personable, charismatic young man that is extremely knowledgeable about Honk Kong history and life. He is an excellent choice for a traveler from any country, not just from the USA. He is very flexible and will do research in advance of your booking if there is something special you would like him to do or to show you that may be a little less run of the mill. He will also do research after your day with him is over and will email you answers to any further questions you might have. My husband and I hire a guide most times when traveling in Asia because we usually don't have much time and want to expedite accomplishing the things we wish to do or see. He will take you to (and navigate your way through) his favorite local restaurant where you may be the only people who speak English, if you ask. Nathan is a great tour guide and an all around cool young man! Our experience with Hello Hong Kong was top rate! While gratuity was never suggested or requested, we tipped him for a job well done, as we tip all excellent tour guides on our travels.

Amazing Tour! Highly recommend!. I could not have asked for a better introduction to Hong Kong. Jess was an amazing tour guide. She recognized the fine balance of showing many relevant and interesting pieces of history and culture interspersed with interesting anecdotes and facts while not overwhelming us with too much information or seeing too much of the same. I highly recommend starting your visit to Hong Kong with a Hello Hong Kong tour. It gave us the best overview of the city and helped shape the rest of our trip.
Excellent. Nathan was excellent! Went above and beyond and suggested customized recommendations via email even after the tour was over. A great first step!

So much more than food. I had a brief stay-over in Hong Kong 27 years ago as a teenager, and was overwhelmed by the vast food scene. For my last trip to China with another short layover, I wanted a more in-depth experience. I chose the "Hello Hong Kong small group public food tour" based on the time (Saturday morning), location (two blocks from my hotel), and its excellent reviews. It did not disappoint. Michael was an outstanding guide, and an expat that speaks Cantonese. Being a Chinese American who does not speak Cantonese, it was very interesting for me to watch him interact with the shop owners, etc. We ate at the most authentic places where there were few foreign visitors, walked through fascinating shops and store fronts, soaked in all the senses (tastes, smells, noises, and heat), and learned about all kinds of interesting facts about Hong Kong. The tour was well-organized, but with flexibility. We all had a grand time! Thank you!

Authentic, informative, fun, creative and personal approach so warm and inviting!. Our guide was very friendly and welcoming. The tour kicked off positively and we as strangers soon became part of a group of friends. We enjoyed a variety of local food and coffee and teas. The walk throughout the tour was fabulous, we learnt about the language and other aspects of diet and nutrition, custom and practices. The sights and sounds were delightful, wherever we went people stopped to talk or to observe, us! I felt free and happy. It was authentic because we dined with the locals. Such an awesome yet simple way to learn about Hong Kong. Food and friends to share it. Words cannot fully express my thanks and pleasure to be a part of this experience. Thanks Laura, once, twice, thrice!

A Tour to Remember!. What a fabulous day we had! If you have limited time in Hong Kong, I highly recommend Hello Hong Kong Tours. Laura was outstanding and she catered our day to exactly what we wanted to see and do and them some. A pleasant sunny personality and wealth of knowledge aided us to truly get a feel of every day life in Hong Kong.

Private tour with a great overview of Hong Kong. We booked a 5 hour private tour with Jess and we were blown away by the amount of sites, experiences and history learned during our 5 hour tour. The tour exceeded our expectations. Very friendly, knowledgeable and flexible to our interests.Following our tour Jess emailed me information on the places we visited as well as information on other sites we would like to visit on our own which was appreciated.

Walking Tours of Hong Kong. My son (22) and I (49) were going to be in Hong Kong for 3 days and we wanted to make the best use of our time discovering Hong Kong while we were there. I turned to the internet to find tours and came upon Hello Hong Kong and after a few email exchanges I booked two tours with them. We arrived to Hong Kong late on a Saturday and had a personal walking tour scheduled for 9 AM the next day. We were to meet our tour guide Nathan at a train station and we had no trouble finding our way to him with plenty of time to spare. Nathan took us to several different locations and shared a lot of good information that I know I wouldn't have discovered on my own. One of the biggest themes I discovered during the tour was how much superstition the Chinese have in their culture. That day we walked somewhere between 8 and 10 miles but it didn't seem like it as my mind was occupied listening to Nathan the entire time. Needless to say, we were tired after day one and slept well that night.Day two we again took the train and then a taxi to get to our meeting point with Nathan. This time it wasn't just Nathan, my son and me but we joined Nathan and 5 more people for a food tour. During this tour Nathan took us to several different locations where we sat and tried different foods of Hong Kong. Both tours were well worth the time and money and I'd highly recommend Hong Kong tours. In addition to the tours themselves, Nathan followed up each tour with an email recap of what we did each day and provided suggestions on things to do and see on our own.

Highly recommend. We were not disappointed to join in this our. it took only 4 hours to be finished but worth for your time and money. We left the hotel without having breakfast as advice from the leader, keeping our stomach empty before the tour. We ate a lot of local food coming to some places serving delicious local food where we could not find by ourselves. Highly recommend this tour

Great Tour and Delicious Food. I really enjoyed this tour. Our guide, Jess, was knowledgeable and friendly. We made five different food stops which included dim sum, noodle soups, milk tea, roasted meats, and dessert. Food was quite filling and delicious.We explored a few streets and a wet market during the tour. We also walked by the Mid-Levels Escalators, the longest covered escalators in the world, and we got to ride a ding ding (tram).I highly recommend this tour.

Great tour, enjoyed by everyone in family. This 4-hour food tour headed by our tour guide Jess was one of the highlights of the week. Everyone in the family (with two teens) enjoyed the food and drinks (our new favorite is now the 50/50!) as well as the information on all the dried seafood - also got answers to a lot of other non-food related questions on Hong-Kong. Highly appreciated that this tour is done in a small group, and the excellent service before, during and after the tour (we followed your advice Jess and had a great dinner at One Dim Sum!)

Great local tour . Being this is the first time I've been to Hong Kong, I wanted to be immersed into local food. Thankfully, I booked through Hello HK. Logistically from the start, it was a smooth operation, especially since your tour guides photo is on the info email. Michael was our guide and he was great. Sat in eateries with the locals, Michael ordered the dishes for us, explained the history of HK, medicinal purposes of items we walked past, an extremely knowledgable person. Just hands down, a great tour. If your looking for a tour and don't know which one to do, this should be the one you choose. The best part of the tour is when you walk into some of the restaurants, the people's heads turn wondering why westerners are there.

Shenzhen Shopping Sensation!. Let me start by saying that I didn't even go to Shenzhen and yet this was the best tour ever! My mother was visiting me in Hong Kong and really wanted to go shopping in Shenzhen after a day trip that we did together on her last visit to Hong Kong. While acknowledging that shopping really isn't my thing and that I wasn't able to take more time off work, I booked her on a personal shopping tour through Hello Hong Kong, as I didn't want my mother to go on her own.Once I booked the tour, Kim who hosted the day tour was in touch by e-mail with some very detailed instructions about the day, including some of the essentials of what to bring along. I had some questions for Kim and she was very thorough and prompt in her response. She has thought of everything!Kim was very patient and helpful, going out of her way to meet mum at a more convenient location and making sure that she was well looked after during the day. On meeting in the morning, they had a shopping pre-consultation about what she wanted to buy before they departed for Shenzhen. Kim offered to help mum with all the formalities, including the visa-on-arrival process, guiding her through every step of the way. Given the day trip that we did to Shenzhen on our own last year and coming back mostly empty handed, I wasn't sure what to expect. However Kim certainly didn't disappoint! My mother returned back from her day trip with a suitcase of purchases (including the suitcase!) and a very nice designer handbag, all at fantastic prices.Mum said that Kim was very knowledgeable and knew many of the suppliers well, so she was able to source products at different price points to suit all budgets. Most importantly, my mum returned with a huge smile on her face and just loved her day in Shenzhen! She is still raving about the trip, saying it was one of the best days that she's ever had shopping. For a seasoned shopper, that's certainly saying something!I can highly recommend this tour for anyone interested in shopping in Shenzhen while in Hong Kong. A wonderful and patient host that went above and beyond, providing personalised recommendations, demonstrating excellent knowledge of products and suppliers, this tour will delight even the most fastidious of shoppers.

Awesome group tour. Our tour guide, Jess, was very informative and just a nice person all around. We ate some (too much) awesome food and learned a lot about Hong Kong culture along the way. The people on our tour were really nice and we actually ended up running into a couple at a bar that Jess recommended and had a beer with them. I've already recommended the tour to friends.

Private Bespoke Walking Tour. We have done quite a lot of walking tours on our travels but this was definitely the best by far. Our guide Jess met us at our hotel and was extremely knowledgeable and took us to some fantastic food places as well as historical and cultural points of interest in Hong Kong. The Dim Sum lunch was fantastic so much so that we will never look at Yum Cha the same again. Food was at your own cost so you can have as much or as little as you want. Even though we had been to Hong Kong before we learned so much that we never knew about despite having done city tours there before? Hello Hong Kong is great value for money, is easy to book and pay for with their online booking system. We would definitely use Hello Hong Kong again.

Fun way to explore Hong Kong. We spend a wonderful day eating our way through Hong Kong with Nathan. Nathan was an excellent guide. He was very knowledgeable and friendly. We did our tour early in our stay allowing us to return to the dim sum restaurant to enjoy even more food! Before leaving the group, Nathan took time to answer any questions people had about other activities. This was a very nice touch and greatly appreciated. I also want to add that the directions. given for the meeting place were very well explained. In all, it was a very well organized day with a wonderful host.Thanks Nathan.

Great day tour with Nathan!. The perfect way to start your stay in HK.Have day tour with Nathan was amazing! Very personalized service and custom made tours. Nathan took us to amazing places while explaining about HK. Great lunch!!After the tour was finished he pointed other interesting highlights and send us all the information! Highly recommended!!

Excellent three days of tours in Hong Kong. I was in Hong Kong for a week with my girlfriend and elderly parents. Hello Hong Kong booked three days of tours for us: a walking food tour with Jess, a custom private tour with Ben, and a sailing trip with Captain Ryan on Local Hero. All our tours were interesting and exotic, well executed, and safe/comfortable (important for my parents). Laura (the owner of the tour company?) also gave us useful, detailed instructions for how to best experience Victoria Peak and where else in the city we might spend some of our free time. I highly recommend this vendor.

Wonderful food tour!. This was a really enjoyable food tour and a great way to explore the city. We were lucky that there were only 3 of us on a rainy day and Nathan our guide. This made it a really intimate tour which felt more like hanging out with friends and eating lots of amazing food.Nathan was very knowledgeable and we wouldn't have been able to experience all the wonderful places we visited without a local guide. The food was really sensational from the yum cha for breakfast through to the best prawn won ton noodles ever and those amazing custard tarts! Nathan followed up with an email listing the places we visited so that we could find our way back. Highly recommend this tour!

Fantastic half day in HK - highly recommended. I went in the foodie walking tour yesterday and it has really been a highlight of a my visit so far. I've seen quite a lot of Hong Kong before as this is my third visit, but the tour takes you to areas you wouldn't normally see as a tourist, and the food is sensational!The group I joined was 8 people, plus Jess our guide, who is just great - really friendly, knowledgeable, fun and loves food, so she conducts the your with a real passion and enthusiasm. The group was a mix of ages and nationalities, but everyone got along really well and I enjoyed meeting everyone and spending a few hours with some new and interesting people.I would highly recommend this tour to anyone, even if you're not a food fanatic. As I mentioned, the food is fantastic and is certainly worth joining the tour for, but you also get a bit of history, geography, religion and culture thrown in, so I learned a lot about Hong Kong, as well as now feeling very comfortable in the local restaurants.Thank you Jess for a really excellent experience.

A Fun and Authentic Food Tour of HK!. I had a great time doing a food tour around Hong Kong with folks from around the world and our awesome and super knowledgeable guide, Nathan. We tried a lot of delicious food, covered a good amount of ground on Hong Kong Island, and discovered spots that I probably never would have found or been confident enough to try on my own. I would do this tour again, and would love to see other food itineraries from Hello Hong Kong! Nathan also provided helpful information and tips on seeing other sights in and around Hong Kong -- he was a great resource! I would definitely recommend this for anyone who wants to have a fun day and get an authentic taste for this unique city.

Great way to start HK stay. Arrived the previous day but not enough daylight hours to get bearings, so this foodie tour brilliant in many ways. Introduced to culture, cooking, history and travel all in half day. Jess was excellent and able to point us all in directions for rest of our stay in HK. Great to see restaurants that we would never ever have ventured into if left to our own devices. Food was delicious and well spaced out. Full by the end but walked off some of the calories! It was a great tour and got to meet lots nice travellers. Thoroughly recommend this.Tip: careful coming out MTR stations as very easy to lose bearings. Compass would be good!

Great tour - Do it, you won't be disappointed!. What a great tour! We met our group of 8 plus 2 tour guides and were on our way. The first stop was only a few doors away...a stop for Dim Sum - carts of deliciousness were brought past the table and our guide Jess (who was absolutely wonderful!!!) would pick out things that she thought we would like to try. She even taught us about "washing our tea cup" before pouring the hot tea into it :). Jess then guided us through the neighborhood stopping at specialty shops and explaining all of the different items - birds nests for soup, dried seafood, shark fin, and medicinal items. We then made a stop for a wonderful Wonton Noodle Soup / beef brisket noodle soup! Then onward it went through a wet market, then a stop for milk tea or the YingYang variety (go for that one, it was SO good! We then headed to a different neighborhood - Wan Chai where we visited a delicious roasted meat shop, and finally onward to a store for dessert - egg tart. What a great experience with 2 wonderful tour guides! A word of advice - do NOT eat any breakfast before going on this tour! The food was more than plentiful and we had a wonderful time.

Great way to see the city !. My boyfriend and I went on this tour as a way to eat our way through a day in HK. It didn't disappoint! I had been in HK for a few months before we took this tour and all the food places we visited were new to me and didn't disappoint! Food was fantastic and in places we never would have visited on our own as we would've been too intimidated by there only being locals inside. A side note- there was a 'Debbie downer' type on our tour who didn't eat fish or pork or any meat. If you are a vegan or a vegetarian, this isn't the tour for you. Only so many accommodations can be made on a food tour of locale foods that include those specific foods. The tour guides did everything they could and ordered special food for her, but it became a joke amongst the others in the group about what this poor girl would t be able to eat at the next stop on the tour. It's really not worth the money of the tour for a vegan or a vegetarian. Can't wait to go back to some of those restaurants!

Yummy Food Tour. We did a great food tour with Michael. As one of our group commented, it let you go into areas of the city and shops you might not otherwise feel comfortable going in. None of the food was new to me, but the experience of walking the streets and hearing Michael's stories about the history of Hong Kong and what all the various mecicinal items were used for was unbeatable. All the food was delicious and interesting. Went with my 15 year old son and we had a ball!

Hong Kong walking tour. Our guide was really great, she seemed to really, really, like Hong Kong! We started at Victoria Peak and continued down hill towards the main highlights of downtown Hong Kong. Jess shared with us details about the local food and customs, she knew her way around quite well. The four hours were well balanced and at a good pace.

food tour with nathan. wanted to see a different side of hong kong,so took this tour and it was brilliant,our guide for the 4 hour tour was nathan and he took our group to places you would not normally find on your own.we ate in places the locals ate dim sum,noodles,roast pork and milky tea,nathan incredibily knowledgable about hong kong he obviously loves his adopted city(he is american)overall a great tour well worth doing.

Experience a part of old Hong Kong before it disappears.. Wonderfully way to see a part of old Hong Kong before it changes. Nathan was a very knowledgeable easy going guide who clearly loves his work. The food stops were great (do not eat breakfast) experiencing a variety of dishes in original premises. I would highly recommend Hello Hong Kong and it's food tours.
What a great way to explore Hong Kong. Had a great time touring with Jess and exploring different parts of Hong Kong. Rich and pour, old and new.

Hello Hong Kong Food Tour. We had an amazing time on the tour with Nathan. He was very knowledgable about the areas we visited and the cuisine we tried. The food was incredible and we went to places we never would have gone into on our own!

Hello Hong Kong food tour. My best friend and I did this tour in September 2015 with Jess as our tour guide. She was absolutely lovely and so friendly. I would highly recommend booking the food tour with hello Hong Kong!

Great introduction to Hong Kong. Loved the tour. It was a great introduction to Hong Kong history and culture and of course the food. The food was incredible, in fact I returned to a few of the stops during my time in HK. Laura also provide us with some great tips that came in handy during my travels.

History and Food. Loved our walking food tour with Nathan. He showed us around, we ate delicious authentic chinese food, even visited an antique market. Nathan was very knowledgeable and professional, he even looked up some information for us after the tour and emailed it to us. Best Dim Sum and Roast Pork ever!
Fantastic. A fantastic and brilliant tour. Jess was an awesome host. Lots of lovely food and we learned a fair bit about the different types as well. Bravo!

Absolutely interesting and funny experience!. Thank you Jess!!! My Parents and I have been absolutely excited about the incredible experience exploring Hong Kong with you! The individual destinations with all the background stories showed us a lot about the city and the culture of Hong Kong. Additionally we also went to a local place getting to know dumplings and the adorable gesture of washing your dishes before eating. Jess was incredibly nice, super pleasant and funny which made the tour just more special. Altogether we had an excellent personalized half a day tour which was a great adventure. My next stay will definitely start again with a Hello Hong Kong tour - absolutely interesting and funny experience!

Hello Hong Kong Hong Kong private one day tour. We had an absolutely wonderful 5 hour tour. We were able to see sights that we never would have seen without Nathan as our terrific guide. It was perfect!

Hong Kong Bespoke Tour. My family (myself, husband, brother, and adult son) were in Hong Kong for a couple days prior to a cruise. I wanted to get the most of our time there and didn't want to stumble around just seeing the main attractions and getting lost. I researched and found that hiring a guide would be a good choice for us. After emailing a couple guides, (some who never responded) Lauria was very prompt in responding back. She asked our interest, how long we wanted to go and if there was anything definite we wanted to see. Not knowing much myself I kind of left it up to Lauria. I did ask for a 5 hour tour which was plenty long enough. She meet us at out hotel in Kowloon and from there we went all over the place, and I mean everywhere. Absolutely amazing!! We seen some main attractions and some places that we never would of visited on our own, we ate at a tiny bbq restaurant that I would not have looked twice at in passing if on our own. She showed us how to figure the train, we rode boats, trams, trolleys and walked. Then she suggest options for us of things to do on our second day and wrote out complete details of how to do them....trains to take, buses to ride, stops to get on and off. We actually got around very easily and didn't get too lost which is something to be said for 4 people from Idaho in a city of over 7 million people. I highly recommend Lauria and Hello Hong Kong. An awesome way to acquaint yourself with the city and area. We all loved our tour.....thank you Lauria.

Shopping Tour. This was just a great Day out for my Wife and I from the Start at Hong Kong to China and Return with our Guide Kim who advised us on what was a good Deal and walk away and Meeting the Local people was just as a Highlight to the Trip Home Highly Recommend to Anyone

Fabulous food tour!. I took the morning public food tour on Sat 26th September with Nathan. What a brilliant way to spend some time in Hong Kong! Nathan was a great guide, knowledgeable and friendly, even sending on additional info by email after the tour about recommended sights to see.The food stops on the tour were great, places I would never have found by myself and the food was absolutely delicious - do not eat breakfast before going on this tour! I didn't eat anything after it until the next day!This is a great way to get familiar with the city and the various modes of transport - and how to buy stuff not just transport fares with an octopus card - particularly useful for me who had had a currency conversion 'incident' and loaded mine with far too much money! I'd recommend the tour early into your trip.

#1 way to taste the food and lifestyle of Hong Kong. I took the public food tour. Extremely impressed. Small group allowed for great interaction with guide (Ben). Also,meant this was not your typical grab a bite while standing outside food tour. We were able to sit and enjoy full portions of delicious items Add in walking, taking the tram, visiting several markets, and viewing the central escalators, and the tour is the perfect introduction to life in Hong Kong. The amoun tplaces.

Great trip - even if you live in Hong Kong. We've lived in Hong Kong for nearly two years but had some visitors from the UK who had visited before so were looking for something a little more off the beaten track. We did a private tour with Laura which covered most of the things that others have reviewed but she also took us up to Sham Shui Po to visit an old Tofu shop. That place was amazing - I didn't think I liked Tofu that much but this place changed my mind! Laura left us to explore on our own but suggested a great bar to finish off our day. As others have said, going out with Laura was not like most guided tours I have done before, more like a day out with a friend. Would recommend this to anyone and I expect we will do more trips with her soon.

Best thing to do in Hong Kong. Laura's tour is an absolutely must! The best thing we did in HK by FAR! Food, history, stats, and stories are all on point. Seriously - do not leave Hong Kong without doing this. You'll have a better understanding of the city, culture and life in the city as well as very full belly:)

Fantastic food and travel tour of Hong Kong. My wife and I went on a tour today with Ben as our leader. Five if us in total so very personalized. Ben was great, friendly and extremely knowledgable. First stop dim sum restaurant. Then walk through dried food area in central and other other sorts of interesting medicinal shops. Then deeper into central for won won noodle soup, the tastiest in Hong Kong. Then a walk through a couple of traditional food markets. Then a taste of some Chinese milky tea. On to a tram along to Wan Chai for lunch at a fabulous bbq pork hole in the wall. Then onto one of Hong Kongs best tart shops, so tasty. All in all great value and super interesting led by ever so friendly Ben. Book in now.

Wonderful introductory food tour of Hong Kong. Our guide, Jess, was a transplanted Australian who could not have been more pleasant and charming. She was extremely knowledgeable and informative about the culture and the neighborhoods in Hong Kong that we visited. And we did visit the heart of Hong Kong Island. The visits to the various restaurants and explanations of the food culture of Hong Kong was certainly a highlight. These were restaurants that tourists could not find on their own, but were multi generational family-run restaurants very popular with the local population. Definitely, do not eat breakfast before the tour! Not only did Jess give us a great introduction to Hong Kong, but she helped us plan the rest of our stay in Hong Kong (suggesting Hong Kong attractions and giving us directions). I can't imagine a better guide. She really couldn't have done more.Ron G

Amazing Trip to Shenzhen and Hong Kong Food Tour. Our shopping ship to Shenzhen was the highlight of our trip. Our guide, Kim, was a master negotiator. Her negotiation skills combined with her strong personal connections to vendors (purse, clothing, fabric, belt, scarf, electronics) at the market led us to getting deals at least three times as good as we could have gotten for ourselves. Our food tour and walking tours with the owner Laura the following day were also absolutely incredible. She took us to the most authentic places to eat, including an amazing michelin star restaurant, that we never could have discovered ourselves and made sure we got the best tour and taste of the city. Her personal connections to the vendors were really invaluable to our experience, something we could not have found elsewhere or on our own. We cannot wait to come back and try her brand new boat tours!

Hong Kong tour. Had a great tour with Laura, got the full, personally tailored Hong Kong experience. She met me at my hotel, on time, and ready to go. She quickly explained the ins and outs of getting around the city and we were off exploring. Got to visit about 7-8 different spots taking in the history, food, and culture of the city. She is a wealth of knowledge on the city's history and current events and happenings. Tour was well worth the time and money.After we finished our tour she suggested a few sights I could visit on my own that did not require a guide. That night she e-mailed me 4 different self guided tours I could do over the next couple of days in the city. I was able to do 3 out of the four and had a great time.Great tour, I highly recommend if you are visiting Hong Kong!

Great Food and Culture Tour. Jess, our delightful tour guide tour guide for the HK food and city tour on Oct 3rd, gave us a good overview of the food culture as we wound our way through the back streets of HK. The 7 or more stops along the way were filled with locals enjoying a Saturday morning brunch or out shopping for the weekend. We sampled multiple local Him Sum, Duck, Pork and egg custard dishes as well as stopped in several markets and tried a local favorite, milk coffee. Most of the tour was on foot as we traversed through the small streets leading to wet markets, fruit and vegetable stands and small businesses. Sitting elbo to elbo with locals enjoying a Saturday meal amidst the hustle and bustle provided a try sense or at least a piece of the culture.

Food tour. Michael took us on a great walk through some interesting areas of Hong Kong that I wouldn't have found on my own. Each food stop was better than the last. Michael has lived in Hong Kong for ages and could answer all our questions so you could get a real sense of the place. He also helped us learn a few basic words of Cantonese. I would have liked a bit more walking but that's just me. I highly recommend this tour as it brings Hong Kong to life!

Eat your way through Hong Kong!. Experienced the food tour with Jess. She was excellent, and the tour was equally satisfying.Morning Dim-Sum in a unique, very local restaurant sets the tone for the entire day. The meal included samplings of shrimp & pork dumplings, fried shrimp wonton, spring rolls, pork spare ribs with black bean, steamed buns, flat rice noodle with shrimp & bbq pork. A huge feast in a very characteristic location!After some outdoor touring around of markets and various districts, we arrived at the next location where we enjoyed traditional Wonton Noodle Soup. Again, a unique location with an interesting back story - and delicious shrimp or beef version of the meal.A quick stop at a Milk Tea shop is truly a treat, and then it was a trolley ride (bring small change, 2.30HKD for the trolley) to the next stop on the tour where we enjoyed Roast Pork and Duck.The final food stop included a traditional egg tart. Delicious.A great day, great tour and value for the money. Highly endorse this tour to anyone wanting to explore Hong Kong and it's flavors!

Very interesting history and back street tour!. Our tour guide Jess was great. She showed us old HK architecture and taught us some of the HK history. She took us to the very local dim sum restaurant. It was very good.She also took us to the old streets of HK and antique street. At the end of the tour we were pretty tired (5hours), but we enjoyed every bit of it. It was well worth the money.

A taste of the "real" Hong Kong. I recently moved to Hong Kong with my husband and my parents are here for a visit. Laura's Public Food Tour was a fantastic way of seeing and tasting the real Hong Kong. Because we live here, we haven't been on any tours as we would do if visiting another city. So participating on the tour today was not only fascinating for my parents, but also for me! We covered so much ground at a perfect pace ... even though my parents are 82 and 77! They kept up. There was the perfect balance of eating, walking, and factual information. Laura was wonderful ... so friendly and welcoming and remembered everyone's name! She has done all the research and took us to the best of the best in terms of local haunts - places most of us would walk past and be scared to venture in!All in all, I would thoroughly recommend this tour to expats and visitors to Hong Kong! I learnt so much today! Thanks Laura! You'll be seeing more of me and my friends and family on trips in the future!

Great Time. Wow. This place takes you to places you can't find....literally. If you are not a local you will walk right by. Good thing we had Ben with us. We went to about 6 places and they could have left me at every single one thats how good the food was. It's a walking tour that takes you into the heart of the city and markets. If you have only one day and love food take this tour.

Wonderful Day in Hong Kong. I booked with Hello Hong Kong based on other TripAdvisor reviews and my high expectations were exceeded The email exchanges with Laura were timely, responsive and most helpful. The day spent with Nathan could not have been better. Both Laura and Nathan inquired as to what we wanted to see and do. They listened and responded on a personal basis, not in some cookie-cutter, one-size-fits all manner. We leaned about and saw aspects of a very big city that we never would have experienced on our own. We learned how to ride the Hong Kong subway system and the Star Ferry, how to use the Octopus Card and how to order dim sum. Nathan's follow up was great because he suggested things to see and how to get around on our subsequent days in Hong Kong. Thank you very much.

Fantastic foodie walky. A fantastic experience with an excellent guide. Visited local restaurants with each of them having a bit of history. The tour gives you an insight into small places that you as a tourist would just walk pass. The food was great from breakfast to lunch. The guide was excellent and very knowledgeable about the food and history of the area. I would highly recommend this to anybody visiting HK especially if you are short of time.

Awesome Locals Foodie Tour. Very authentic local Hong Kong foodie tour with exceptional quality and overall great experience. Nathan knew his way around with limited vocabulary and was a great guy to hang out with for a few hours. Its a great way to experience some "off the track" dining experiences with the locals, and also some fascinating stops along the way. This was a highlight for me and a great experience for the adventurous foodie.

An efficient way to see authentic Hong Kong. My tour guide Jess has been in HK for about a year but knows the city and history very well. She was full of great information and incredibly accommodating - willing to rescope our route whenever my tastes changes. From Dim Sum at a local tea house to a tour of a wet market outside of HK proper, we engaged in several activities I wouldn't have done on my own. The tour was reasonably priced relative to other private tour companies and if you're in town on business or for a short while, there's no better way to see a city quickly!

Delicious!. Although I have been to Hong Kong before for three weeks, today I was able to have a piece of Hong Kong that I haven't before! Thanks to Jess!!! Such a friendly and informative tour, the best if you are new in town! Easy to reach and a beautiful tour for a foodie, even if it is raining! A must do for any tourist in town for a short or long period of time.

Precious Jess :-). We had a great tour w/ Jess. We weed a group of 3 friends and had a total of 5 on our tour, and Jess was wonderful. I warned her from the get-go that I was the "world's pickiest eater" (or so my husband calls me) and that I was there to enjoy the experience ... but not necessarily the food :-).Sure enough, I loved learning about the history and culture of the places we visited and foods (everyone else ate). We had a fantastic time, and I am happy to report that I finally found something I loved : ying-yang drink. Well worth it for serious foodies or picky eaters like me! Thanks, Jess!

Great food tour of Hong Kong!. Yesterday I had the wonderful experience of taking a food tour of Hong Kong with our great guide Jess. I have ben to Hong Kong many times, but never had the opportunity to do a tour such as this.
