Jess took us to many local favorites - the types of places I never would have found on my own, nor ones that I had gone to for business on previous trips. Great local food, and many other shops and sights that Jess showed us. Highly recommended!!!

Amazing food tour! Whole heartedly recommend!. This food tour was brilliant! Nathan was knowledgable, friendly and fun, taking us to lots of different places to try the local cuisine. The places we visited were not places we'd ordinarily visit but the food was incredible! Personal favourites were the pork, followed by the lemon tart. Yum! Loved strolling round the streets and getting local insight, as well as meeting people from different places around the world. Would thoroughly recommend this tour!

Great Tour!. I did the Hello Hong Kong food tour on my first day in HK with Jess and it was amazing! Bring a solo traveler, doing the tour on my first day really helped to orientate myself with the city, but it was also so much fun! Jess was great, super friendly and welcoming which made it felt less like a tour and more of a fun outing with friends! Of course the food was also fantastic and offered a great variety for everyone and a true taste of HK; in places I may not have visited without the tour! I definitely recommend Hello Hong Kong tours to anyone visiting HK, they were great with communication and very professional. In addition, Jess provided me with really thorough directions with pictures to other points of interest that really helped me during my stay!

Best part of our holiday. Was great to eat and learn about traditional Cantonese food, Chinese medicine and tour around Hong Kong Island. Have to try the egg tart. Laura our tour guide was amazing and very knowledgable!! This tour is a must!!

Brilliant - book it now!. We had 3 days in HK at the start of our honeymoon and were unsure where to start so booked this for our first day there, and were SO glad we did. Laura, the tour guide, is lovely - warm, informed, and genuinely excited to be showing us (a small group) around HK and introducing us all to interesting, local eateries and delicious food. There are NO tourist traps here, which is exactly what we wanted. Reasons to book - small groups; awesome and informed guide; every food you'll try is delicious (husband is still talking about the char sui); and none of it you'll be able to find on your own. Laura also gave us tips on where to visit during the rest of our stay, which we ended up using. Everyone else seemed to love tour also. Book this tour right away!

Great way to get to know your way around with lots of helpful tips. From the minute we contacted "Hello Hong Kong" they could not have been more helpful and that was before we had even booked. Nathan was prompt in his arrival and was really informative without being boring. Really nice guy to spend the time with. The tour was tailored to what we wanted and we finished with a visit to a great Dim Sum restraunt which we will be going back to. Even after the tour finished Nathan still sent us extra information so we could find our own way to things. Would highly reccomend. Thanks Nathan for a great day.

Amazing Tour! If you like to eat do it!. Awesome tour through Sheung Wan, Central and Wan Chai. The restaurants and spots showed to us were really delicious and Jess (our tour guide) was more than helpful for food, tips, help...The tour itself was worth it and the 4 hours passed by like seconds! In addition you get plenty of really detailed information about Hong Kongs other Sightseeing spots, with places you won't discover yourself (or only with lots of effort)!

Excellent. Walking through parts of HK that we would not have found alone with interesting description of all the foods in the shops we walked past and point of interest. Food eaten was deliciouse and fun to eat in the little back street places that we would not have dared to enter alone

Food in Restaurants with the locals. We had the unfortunate experience of a huge amount of rain during our tour. It was amber? and if it turned red?, the tour would have been cancelled. I must admit we got very wet but that did not deter the 10 or so intrepid searchers following their guide for food into places we did not know existed. There is a world of life and food behind the façade that us visitors think is Hong Kong. Restaurants full of locals in places where restaurants should not exist. Up tiny lifts to the 8th floor of a building in the back streets of Hong Kong. Absolutely fabulous. For the life of me I cannot remember the name of our guide. He was American from memory and had a good rapport with the locals. We could not have asked for better. A word of advice, just do it, don't think about it, book it and do it. You wont be sorry.

Amazing Day and more - if you do one thing in Hong Kong, do this!. We pre booked our private tour with Laura before travelling for the first time to Hong Kong, where we stayed for three days. The tour is an amazing way to see some of the most interesting areas of the city,which otherwise we would never have known about let alone found! We bolted on an extra 2 hours to make it a 6 hour food, culture and sightseeing tour, which might have been hard work in the heat and humidity but it was not. Laura has an easy going manner and is a fountain of knowledge which was really excellent, and whilst we did cover some miles, it was interspersed with food stops, shade and stopping to talk about where we were and the local culture.For anyone who wants not just to see the usual tourist trap places, but also to get to feel the culture, this is a brilliant way to do it. You get to see the contrasts of the architecture, the contrasts of the rich and poor districts, and the contrasts of the old and of the new.Oh, and you also get to try out some amazing food in great local spots that you would otherwise never have experienced.At the end of the tour when we explained that we wanted to go up to The Peak the following day for the great views of the city and bay below, Laura also gave us some great advice on the best way to get there, and not only that but also how to see the BEST view, which is not where most tourists go!And the great thing was, she e mailed us all the details of what to do and where to go, which was not even part of the tour we had paid for.Thanks Laura, and we know you make many tourists really appreciate the city with your expert guidance!

Hello Hong Kong private tour for Foodies. So much fun eating a variety of foods while learning about the history of the businesses and origins of the foods. Perfect group size. Wonderful tour guide! Go, you don't want to miss this one. 9:30 - 1:30

Great Walking Tour. We had Nathan as our tour guide. He was great, full of energy and gave us a look at Hong Kong we would have otherwise not seen. Going to the temple was a real treat and thoroughly enjoyed it. The noodle house we went to was excellent----get the beef brisket! Loved seeing the old buildings and structures. Laura was also helpful and gave us great advice on how to navigate the rest of our weekend trip to Hong Kong. Definitely worth it, great value and a wonderful tour!

1st stop in HK. We took the tour hosted by Nathan last week and the tour was excellent. The variety and quality of the food was great and the tour included much more as we toured markets and learned about the local culture. There was also great follow up with advice and pictures.

wonderful trip to Shenzhen with Kim Collett - everything accomplished and more!. This was my first time to Hong Kong - so thankful to have Kim Collett with Hello Hong Kong as a personal tour and shopping guide. Kim went to extra effort to arrange the tour in advance via email and met us at a prearranged meeting spot. Kim was so pleasant and thoughtful. We had arranged a tour of both the art village and Lu Wo shopping center - and had a wonderful time at both. We were able to purchase original art at very reasonable prices in the art village. The Lu Wo center would have been very confusing if it weren't for Kim's expertise. We were able to purchase all our "wish fors" on our shopping lists. Kim was very patient with us carefully choosing within our budgets, and we had a fantastic time browsing for gifts for friends and family. Would definitely recommend Kim, and looking forward to touring with Kim again in the future - it is definitely worth Kim's expertise to purchase quality goods at reasonable prices. My fellas were beyond impressed with the designer watches they received as gifts. I highly recommend Kim Collett as a personal designer shopper.

Transformed our HK Experience. We had a day and a half in Hong Kong and arranged a 5 hour tour with Laura. so we could make the most of the time. She really exceeded our expectations with a trip that covered one of the poorest areas in HK; a tofu kitchen, fish market (amazing), Peninsula Hotel, Star Ferry, Tram, dim sum (yum cha), Cat Street Market and the mid-levels escalator, with lots in between.What really exceeded our expectations was that Laura also set us up for the rest of our time, recommending where to go and what to do - even seeing us on to the bus to Stanley. Then as icing on the cake, Laura sent photos she had taken on the tour.We highly recommend Laura and Hello Hong Kong.

Great tour. We had a tour arranged with Laura for 5 hours with two young children. The tour was great and Laura was enthusiastic and informative and managed to engage the children. I would highly recommend them and would suggest that you try and book on your first day to help familiarise yourself with the city, if you new to Hong Kong.

Food Tour with Laura Blackwell at Hello Hong Kong Tours. Fantastic!! Laura is passionate and very knowledgeable. We had a great time and learned so much. We ate way too much delicious cantonese food and learned a lot about the culture. I highly recommend this tour! It's fun, it's interesting, it's delicious! Come hungry!

Delightful and interesting Hong Kong tour. The several hours I spent touring Hong Kong with Laura and Nathan were a highlight of my visit. Via subway, the Star Ferry, and taxi, we visited a variety of neighborhoods and specific destinations such as the Jade Market, which I asked to see. We went, as well, to working-class Sham Shui Po, with its fascinating squatters' shacks atop multistoried apartment buildings; to the electronics market, where Laura astutely but pleasantly bargained for toy drones for me to take home as gifts; to Lin Heung Kui tea house for yum cha--tea and dumplings from wheeled trolleys; and to window shop for antiques on Hollywood Road. Laura and Nathan were both well informed and wonderfully congenial, so the day was successful in every way. I'm already looking forward to my next visit with them.

FOOD TOUR WOOOOHOOO!. This tour was fantastic! Takes you through the ins and outs of Hong Kong to the best foodie spots on Hong Kong. Ben was knowledgeable of Hong Kong's history in terms of buildings, people, food and culture. He also took the time to offer extra advice, send out emails with recommendations and check in to see how we were all going.Laura the tour organiser was very helpful and professional. When a possible cancellation came up she did her best to fit me into another tour and provided great service. Thanks to you both!!Really enjoyed this experience 10/10

Lovely guide and great food!. We recently went on a food tour with Laura, and despite the unbearable heat, it was a really fun morning! She had lots of great insights about the city and restaurants we visited. It was a great way to see several parts of the city without the risk of getting lost. She also had great suggestions for what to do the rest of our trip. This was the highlight of our visit!
Hong Kong Food Tour. Absolutely fabulous time eating our way through Hong Kong. Truly authentic experience learning about the culture in many many ways!

Hong Kong Food Tour. Had a really excellent time with a very cosmopolitan group. Laura, our leader was really great and helpful. Of course, the food was the main attraction and we were not disappointed. Especially the dim sum! I can really recommend this tour, as it takes you a little bit off the beaten track and allows you to experience some gems of Hong Kong!

Great Tour, loads of food!. We done the 4 hour tour today with Jess and had a great time, she took us to some places that we would never have found on our own and we ate so much food so no breakfast before you go is a great rule!I enjoyed the dim sum restaurant the most although I am also a fan now of the milk tea!4 hrs is a great length of time and ok it was hot but what do you expect in Hong Kong, wear sensible training shoes as you are going to do dome walking and take plenty of water as well,A great morning thanks guys!

Lovely food and very knowledgeable guide. A very enjoyable food tour on a very hot an humid day in Hong Kong. Our guide was Ben, a young American actor who'd been living in the city for three years. He was very well-informed, answering all questions from whether the fruit in the markets was locally grown (courtesy of my 9 year old son - the answer is no, by the way), to whether all words in written chinese can be equally understood by mandarin or cantonese speakers, and so on. It is suitable for children aged 9 and up, I'd say, any younger kids would struggle with walking in the heat (it was around 30 degrees, the day we went). You do walk for about a mile and a half at a leisurely pace through the central district, then hop onto one of the Hong Kong trams through the centre of the city for the final two food stops (beware, these only take exact change, but are insanely cheap - the journey cost HK$7 for four of us, about 57p UK or 90 cents US) Ben did have plenty of change for those scrabbling around for coins. Bear in mind that the tour features cantonese cuisine - mild, savoury with lots of prawn, pork and sweet dishes. If you're expecting spicy food, you may be disappointed, but there is something for everyone on this tour. So, those food stops *The Dim Sum place- old school. Chinese ladies with trollies piled high with steaming baskets. Ben was kind enough to run round and find some dim sum doughnuts for my son, who was being fussy and wouldn't eat anything. My daughter loved the sticky rice and the dumplings. We also got to try dim sum we would never have tried otherwise - like the sweet one made from lotus. Laura also popped in to say hello. * The Won Ton soup place- I liked this, my family less so. A subtly-flavoured broth with a prawn wonton dumpling covered in thin rice noodles. Again, son no1 wouldn't eat it. (sigh). * The Milk tea place. Sounds revolting. Tea + condensed milk brewed to within an inch of it's life, filtered through tights (yes, pantyhose, american friends). We drank it over ice. Whoa, what a caffeine hit. Mega strong. It has to be tried once. * The Roast pork place. The place was packed, fantastic, the staff gave Ben (and us) a very warm welcome and a huge portion of chinese roast pork was brought to the table. Son no.1 came into his own here. It was wolfed down. Lovely veg with oyster sauce too. * The custard tarts place. Meh. Kinda like the custard tarts you get at Greggs (an English bakery chain), except a bit more eggy. All in all, a really good tour - the good thing about these is that you go to restaurants you would never normally find, and you learn a lot about the city you're in (example: why abalone is regarded as lucky by chinese people), and a little bit about the customs and the culture of the place you're visiting. Very good value for money. The only thing I'd change is the final stop at the custard tart shop - could this be replaced by something more interesting?

Real flavour of Hong kong. Ben worked really hard to ensure that we saw and tasted the classically Hong Kong style of eating, and learnt a lot about the culture and life of the locals. It really doesn't matter too much if you aren't a 'foodie', the whole experience is fun regardless.

An insider's guide to eating in Hong Kong. This food tour was amazing. Not only did Laura let me into Hong Kong's secret restaurants, she pointed out attractions, told me about history and culture. I tasted the best dim sum and char siu pork in restaurants I would never have known about. I learnt about Chinese herbs and medicine, walked through the wet markets and drank ying yang icy for the first time! This is highly recommended - it will change your view of Hong Kong forever.

Very interesting visit to Hong Kong. Returning from Aus/Fiji to Europe we made a stop over in Hong Kong.We had only one full day in Hong Kong and decided to ask Hello Hong Kong for some guidance and thanks to Ben we had all (family with two teenagers) a wonderful stay in Hong Kong....wauw...what a cityThe only recommendation to our guide was to avoid the biggest tourist traps....we could see this on our own...The tour we didFrom YMCA we went by MTR to Wong Tai Sin to see the council housing and the temple and to meet Yau Lau (the Chinese god of love and marriage).By MTR to Sham Shui Po the poorest of the 18 districts of Hong Kong where we looked at the illegal housing structures and urban decay.Surprisingly they accept these big differences between rich and poor....difficult to understand as european....Past the hole in the wall barbers shop and from there we went to the very old Kung Wo Soybean Products shop where we enjoyed the Deep Fried Tofu mix.....this is real Gem...After this we visited the electronics market and the fish and meat market. The latter was a real eye-opener to the teenagers....By MTR we went to Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) to the Chung King Mansions....passing some of the expensive international brands we went to the Peninsula, the Medicine Shop, the old Marine Police Headquarters with the Noon Day Gun, Time Ball Tower.In the afternoon we went on our own to the Island...But thanks to Ben we had a wonderful visit to Hong Kong...we did all really enjoy this visitBest..Cecilie, Frederikke, Lene & Rene

chubby laughing buddha's..... I had wanted to share 'my Hong Kong' with my family so when the doors of the lift opened onto our first (yum cha) eatery, I knew we had chosen our Food Tour well. We were immediately transported back to the Hong Kong of my childhood. Then it was down the street to the dried seafood, birds nests and medicines...through a locals wet market lane to perfect prawn dumplings and noodles. Winding our way through back streets for milk tea or ying yang ( with ice was the winner) before a chance to cool down on a ride upstairs in a HK tram. 'Hope you're hungry', Laura challenges our already burgeoning waistlines... as we sit down ( technically sqeeze onto a table) to amazing roasted pork, rice and pak choy... and a cold beer! Laura is obviously well known and respected at all these eateries as the owners are all so welcoming and accommodating of our photo requests. Last bite.... egg custard tarts... we are all now the epitome of chubby laughing buddha's. Book directly now through the website... much more that just a taste of Honkers..

Love to haggle? This is your tour!! :). What a fantastic day! We had a day tour planned in Shenzhen and Kim was the tour guide to be. First I was apprehensive about getting another tour guide who shows you only shops where they get commission from. BUT: Kim did none of that! :)She did a fantastic job showing me different shops for the things I wanted to buy.Being a somewhat unusual customer (I did not buy shoes or bags or watches) I was totally satisfied by the choice of shops I had for my list of things to buy. (It makes sense to think about what you want to buy beforehand as otherwise you'll drown in what you are offered in Shenzhen...)Having had Kim at my side saved me LOTS of money, she knows exactly what price is acceptable and what is totally ridiculous. It was amazing to watch her haggle, and by the end of the day I too was really good at that! So if you like to bargain you'll definitely LOVE LOVE LOVE the day with Kim!Kim even took pictures and send them to me afterwards, which was a nice add on as I never take pictures when I go somewhere. :)If I would ever go to China again Kim would be the first one I would call to organise another trip.And one thing I really like thinking back: all the time I didn't have the feeling Kim was a tour guide, but more a friend who went shopping with me. :)So, thank you Kim for giving me an awesome shopping experience, for saving me lots of money and for standing patiently by while I was looking at all the goods that were on offer.

Awesome tour with Nathan! . Nathan helped me learn how to use the transportation around the city. He showed us the markets and good places to eat. The day after the tour, my friend and I got to certain spots very quickly. It was like we have been there for a month. Nathan was great and was always talking about something interesting about Hong Kong. Awesome experience. Would recommend this tour to anyone wanting to learn the city.

Tour of Hong Kong. I rarely write reviews, but wanted to say how much we enjoyed our tour with Laura. We were a family of 5 with 3 'hard to please' boys aged 16, 14 and 11. Laura expertly showed us the hidden, less touristy parts of Hong Kong for 5 hours with endless knowledge, enthusiasm and humour. We discovered the star ferry, the MRT, the electrics, antiques and fish markets, a hidden Yum Cha restaurant for lunch, Hollywood Road, SoHo and Stanley! If you are looking for a way to be introduced to the city by someone that feels like a long lost friend rather than a guide Laura is the best!We made a note of returning once Laura has her boat! Thanks for a great day.Kevin, Claire, Kai, Noah and Finn.

Walking Food Tour with Laura. What a fantastic few hours we had ! We started off at 9.30 am & went for a breakfast of various dim sum in a traditional restaurant . From there we walked around the streets tried some ginseng tea , followed by Mr Macks noodle soup in the Michelin star restaurant ! Continued through the city to a tea shack to try their speciality . We then took a tram to Wanchai to eat Barbecued Pork & Duck , followed by a traditional egg tart eaten in the sports park . Laura is lovely to be with , very knowledgable , friendly & helpful . She followed up our trip with various emails of places we may be interested in & checked our itinerary & made suggestions . I highly recommend this trip . Just a note we booked the private party tour and had Laura to ourselves.

Walking tour of hong kong with Laura. I would highly recommend going on this walking tour. We saw so many things that we either would have missed, or didn't appreciate the significance of, Our guide Laura was very informative, very knowledgeable, and really good company. Our trip didn't end when the walking tour finished. We have received photos of the day which are great memories for us, and we have also received plenty of ideas to explore further. We had a great time. ! Thankyou!

very positive experience. Our guide Nathan was excellent. very good knowledge, nice guy and great personality. was professional but engaging. It felt like quite a high price for what it was - ie a nice walk around, some interesting snippets of info and stopping at a few cheap local eateries. however, to be fair, the price seems to be local market standard. I would definitely recommend doing this early in your stay so you have the double benefit of some great food and local knowledge. we did not return to any of the restaurants we visited but we definitely took on board the other tips given and out trip was all the better for it . good job. thank you

Perfect Overview of the City. My wife and I usually book a walking tour anytime we visit a new city and Lauren definitely did not disappoint with her full-day city and food tour. I think my wife and I originally planned to have more like a history and cultural tour but we just couldn't pass up on Lauren's amazing food recommendations along the way and the tour ended up being a perfect mix of history, culture and food! Book this tour. You won't regret it.

Fantastic tour of Hong Kong and its foodie delights!. Hello Hong Kong was an exceptional experience for my first few days in this exciting city.For me the idea of strolling around a new place, learning new things about the culture and eating my way through the day was an enticing prospect, so I booked the tour before my arrival. We met our guide Laura in the morning and proceeded to spend most of the day exploring a mixture of the old and the new parts of the city, tasting local delicacies along the way. A highlight was visiting the legendary Lin Heung, a classic yum cha spot with ladies serving brilliant dim sum from their wooden trolleys. This place was excellent with copious amounts of food for the table. We visited a bustling BBQ meat place full of locals on their lunch break and had some of the best char sui and other roasted meats I've tasted, visited a number of markets (some specialising in dried seafood and medicinal herbs), drank traditional HK tea and ate Michelin-starred wonton noodle soup.Laura was our charming guide and was super attentive and friendly. What I really appreciated was that as well as focusing in on the food as advertised, Laura gave us a really insightful view of HK culture along the way and I feel like I learn a lot about the place. If you're new to the city and like food, this tour comes highly recommended.

Great food and excellent tour guide!. Great food and I can't imagine a better tour guide than Laura was. Definitely highly recommended, if you're interested to eat through the different food of Hong Kong!

Fun Informative Foodie Adventure. I had already been in Hong Kong for a few days when I realized that I was still missing out on some of the best food in Hong Kong. A google search brought up this tour. A late email and 24 hours later, I was in Sheung Wan bright and early for the food tour!Laura was absolutely amazing. Throughout the entire tour, she was willing to answer any question we had about Hong Kong even if it wasn't related to the tour or the food. There was rarely a moment where I did not learn a new fact about Hong Kong. Not only that, she was friendly and made sure that everyone in the tour group feel involved and not left out. The food was magnificent. I won't spoil too much so that there's still some surprise left in the tour. With that said, the char siu I had was the absolute best I've ever tasted. I've yet to find any place that's anywhere close to the awesome char siu I had on this tour. Now could one replicate the tour without Laura? Yes. But would it be anywhere near as fun, efficient (in the best of ways I mean), or great as a tour with Laura? That's a resounding no! This tour is definitely one to take if you want a quick crash course in Hong Kong and Hong Kong food.

Fun and Excellent Food Tour. Myself and 2 children(ages 10, 18) recently went on food tour with Laura in Hong Kong and we had a great time. My 10 year old who started out skeptical of the whole thing was delighted at the end of the tour. Not only did he have a good time but he actually ate and tried a number of things at the restaurants we were taken to.This is a must if you are visiting Hong Kong because we also learned about the culture, history of the island and we even got to ride the double tram bus!!We all had a great time. It is also important to note that Laura is a very friendly and outgoing person and keeps the tour group small so we felt like we were on our own personalized tour.

Great Tour guide!!. Laura was fabulous! She took my family on a general walking tour of Hong Kong and it was great! She gave us a general overview of the city as well as some hidden gems we wouldn't have found on our own. Her love of Hong Kong was obvious and helped us fall in love with it as well. After the tour she followed up with the pictures she took as well as multiple itineraries for the rest of our stay, complete with directions and pictures. She is the best!!!

Shenzhen shopping day.... Where 1 day just isn't long enough!!!. This tour is a must for all shopaholic's, be it gadgets or bags, bags,bags!! Kim our guide was great company and we had a lot of smiles during the day. My husband and I took our 13 year old son and we all loved the trip. ( would have been better if I could have spent all day for me) Be advised you will probably need to buy another suitcase. Kim arranged a driver so we were able to do the trip in comfort, although I believe the train is far cheaper which is also optional. Kim had reliable contacts which meant the day ran smoothly, and moments that we will never forget. The day is totally flexible and you are taken to different shopping centres depending on what you want to see and buy. Our guide had the patience of a Saint and very calm when put to the test

Do this tour if you want to see the real Hong Kong!. Having found out about Hello Hong Kong via Tripadvisor, we booked a bespoke 5 hour walking tour before we left the UK.What can I say! Laura was the perfect tour guide and took us to places we would never have gone to without her. Her enthusiasm for Hong Kong is obvious and it was a real pleasure to spend time with her! We went on the ferry, MTR and the trams and covered everything from Chinese medicine shops to the fish market, temples to the antique district. We ate in a tiny backstreet café and saw the real Hong Kong. The 5 hours went by very quickly and Laura was very considerate and gave us choices along the way. Her anecdotes and information were both useful and funny and her advice about what to do for the rest of our time in HK was very helpful. She sent numerous emails with hints and tips and suggested routes.Laura is very likable and we parted as friends. If you have limited time in Hong Kong then book a tour with Hello Tours and let Laura or her colleagues show you round!

Fantastic Foodie tour in Hong Kong. This tour is a must do in Hong Kong. We thoroughly enjoyed it and it was the highlight of visiting Hong Kong. Nathan, our guide, was excellent and very knowledgeable about the local people and their culture. Our highlight was visiting Lin Heung Kui Tea House. Was very interesting to see what the locals have for breakfast. Thanks Nathan for the egg tart recipe. I couldn't get enough of them while in Hong Kong and am delighted that Ill be able to make them at home.

A great way to see the real Hong Kong. My family and I decided to book a 4 hr Private walking tour through Hello Hong Kong after reading excellent reviews.This tour is a must if you want to see the real HK. When we booked our tour, they asked what things we where interested in seeing. This enabled them to customise a tour to suit our needs and interests.Our tour guide Ben met us at our hotel to begin the tour. Ben was very pleasent and knowledgeable throughout our tour and always took the time to answer any questions we had. Ben took us to some wonderful places based on what our interests were. We were able to see the real HK and things we wouldn't have seen exploring HK ourselves.The tour was very interesting and informative and Ben delivered the tour in a fun, relaxed and enjoyable way. He was very knowledgeable and had plenty of information to share.Before our tour ended, we told Ben about a few other places we were going to explore over the next few days. Later that night, Ben very kindly sent a detailed email outlining how to get there, other things to see and do and even the best way to do this to avoid queues etc. This was a huge help.If visiting HK, booking this tour is a must to enjoy seeing and experiencing the real HK with excellent tour guides.Gail Ogilvie

Fantastic way to see the "real" Hong Kong!. We had the pleasure of taking a 5 hour tour with Laura. We booked the tour before we left for HK, and decided on a Bespoke tour. We were traveling with our two daughters, ages 16 and 8. I was born in HK, but had not been back in 20 years. It was a first time visit for my husband and two daughters. Laura was excellent! She was super personable, friendly, and even made the tour fun and interesting for our youngest. Five hours seemed like a long time, but it flew by quickly. The best part of the tour was visiting neighborhoods that we might not have ventured into on our own. The day we scheduled the tour was one of the hottest in HK. It could have easily become pretty miserable with everyone melting in the heat. Laura made sure we had plenty of water stops, and ducked into places with AC when it was possible. At the end of the tour we didn't get any complaints from the kids. Everyone had a great time! After the tour, Laura was kind enough to send us some extensive emails with suggestions on other areas to visit, and some family pictures she had snapped during our tour. Our entire family thought it was one of the highlights of our trip and we would not hesitate to book another tour the next time we are in HK. Thank you Laura!!!

Don't miss doing this tour!. This is a brilliant way to spend half a day out in Hong Kong. The food was absolutely delicious and there was plenty of it (we had our 2 teenage "hollow legged" sons with us). Unless you went on this trip you wouldn't know these eateries existed, the atmosphere, service and food was excellent. The tour was definitely made all the better by our guide, Nathan, who had a fabulous sense of humour and was extremely knowledgeable and helpful with all things food and Hong Kong. It was nice that he genuinely seemed to enjoy his job and the walk down through all the Chinese medicine and old style shops, along with the "ding ding" ride were added bonuses. If we are ever back in Hong Kong we would definitely do this again....

Amazing Food Tours. We were on the Food tour with Ben and it was perfect. Laura let us know all the information before hand giving us easy directions to meet our group.Ben was a terrific guide, so knowledgeable and the history of the food and the sites around us. The wet market was especially interesting; although it is sad that the next time I return to Hong Kong it will no longer be there.The food was beautiful, the quantities were great. I would have preferred more wontons in my wonton noodle soup, but the taste was amazing. It was so pleasant to go to genuine family owned places.I am so glad I found out about this tour here and I would recommend it wholeheartedly.

Well worth doing, even if you are Chinese and even if you've eaten the kind of food on the tour before. Hey, I'm Cantonese and so the food on this tour was not anything new to me, but I thought this would be a different way to see Hong Kong. Let me tell you, that this tour is totally worth doing. The commentary from our guide Ben made everywhere we went way more interesting than if I had just walked and went to these places myself. We got to ride on the double decker bus, which was way cool and fun, I would not have attempted to do it on my own. The food was all good and Ben was flexible to accommodate everyone's tastes and preferences, so you weren't left out if you, for example, like me, didn't want to eat an egg custard tart, I got to try something else from the bakery. I really liked walking to see the produce mart, the stories about the history of the places we ate at and it was nice to feel like someone had done all the research so that we didn't have to, we could eat and enjoy knowing it was some of Hong Kong's best. My boyfriend totally loved the char sieu (roasted pork) and he is a great fan of it, so he would know good char sieu!You really get to see a lot of Hong Kong on the tour, you will totally be stuffed from all the food and it really felt like an insider's tour. Don't miss this tour!

Fantastic!. Nathan took us on a tour all through out Honk Kong Island and Kowloon. He was very knowledgable and easy to talk to. Showed us how to maneuver throughout all the public transportation. Helped us barter for items at the markets. Also after the tour was over he sent us a list of things we could do with our remaining days in Hong Kong

Great way to explore Hong Kong. We were lucky enough to spend a full day with Ben from Hello Hong Kong on our revet visit. Even though we had spend two day on our own, Ben was able to show us parts of Hong Kong we were not able to see on our own. He introduced us to the subway system..the tram...the escalators...and walked us all over town as well The neighborhood tours were especially informative. Ben knew the answers to all the questions we asked and gave us insights we had missed while touring on our own. He had us stop for two delicious food adventures...Snake Soup at one stop and Roasted Pork and Duck at another. Both spots were clearly not the usual tourist stops and were a real treat from traditional Chinese food. Laura did a great job of communicating in a timely manner and gave us all kinds of information and ideas for seeing Hong Kong before our day with Ben. We especially enjoyed the insights for visiting Victoria Peak. Ben also followed up our day with additional information we requested. All in all, Hello Hong Kong was a very professional and enjoyable way to experience Hong Kong.

Walking food tour. Just spent a wonderfully fun and informative walking and eating tour of Hong Kong Island. As we walked we talked and sampled the delights of Hong Kong cuisine whilst learning a bit about the background of the places we visited. Nathan our guide was both informative, enthusiastic and all round nice guy who did a great job in keeping us all engaged and full! We were taken thru neighbourhoods we would not ordinarily adventure to ourselves and Nathan answered any questions about what we encountered on the way. Would be very happy to recommend this tour to anyone.

Some food places we would never have found by ourselves. Nathan was our guide. and what a fantastic time we had. Nathan knew most of the answers to questions we had and even explained many other things about Hong Kong that we found very interesting.I would have to say the bbq pork was so yummy, and probably my favorite of the day.Overall a very enjoyable 4 hour tour and the walking is actually great so you can see more of Hong Kong, as you walk off the last food you have juste aten.

CULTURAL AND CULINARY DELIGHT!. If you want a tour where you're in amongst the action I certainly reccomend this one. Laura did a fantastic job of taking us to fantastic resturaunts and also explained the cultural significance of what we were experiencing in a fun and entertaining way. When it comes to food you can be as adventurous or conservative as you like- there's something for everyone. By the end of the tour I'd been to a number of restaurants, had milk tea, been on a tram, walked through a wet market and had egg tart- I really found I got a great insight into this fascinating city. Thanks very much Laura- thoroughly enjoyed it!

Excellent tour both on and off the beaten path. Ben took us on a tour around a number of neighborhoods in Hong Kong, including a number of local neighborhoods and markets designed to give a more intimate understanding of how people live in the city. While he also took us to some well-known points of interest, he was able to show us hidden little nuances of these places that we otherwise wouldn't be aware of. His guidance also helped us gain familiarity with the MTR, which we put to good use in subsequent trips of our own.Throughout the tour, Ben combined the detailed knowledge of a local with an ability to clearly communicate in-depth stories and descriptions to us along our tour, which is not something that we got in other private tours we took in our trip to Asia. He showed an ability to customize our itinerary on the fly, and even helped us find some additional attractions to visit after the tour ended.

One of the best things we did in Hong Kong. Ben was really knowledgeable and friendly and the opportunity to go to places which we might not otherwise have found or been brave enough to try without Cantonese was fantastic. Would definitely recommend!

Tour of Hong Kong Highlights. Ben did a wonderful job showing us Hong Kong. We got a great overview of the city, and traveled with Ben on the metro to parts of Hong Kong we never would have found on our own. The highlight was the trip to Victoria Peak. We took the Star Ferry over from Kowloon and to save time, took a taxi up to the Peak. Ben took us on a nature trail for some awesome views. We had lunch at an excellent noodle restaurant and then took the cable car down.
Good fun. Great way to spend a morning, we had some time to kill on a business trip and didn't want the usual tourist destinations.Saw some new things, and ate some new things!

A quick tour 'round the city. I only had a few hours in Hong Kong (layover) to see the city and Laura worked with me ahead of time to decide on which attractions would be feasible and of greatest interest to me. We went to the Wong Tai Sin temple and a jade market, ate traditional dim sum and egg custard, and visited 2 distinct districts of the city. Laura was very knowledgeable on Hong Kong history and culture and I felt like I was spending the day with an old friend. I highly recommend Hello Hong Kong Tours and would absolutely book another tour through the company. Happy traveling!

Hong Kong food tour. My husband and I did this tour on our honeymoon it was by far one of the best day we had whilst we were in HongKong. We visited many places and saw and tasted so many great things. We would have never have been able to see and do what we did if it weren't for the tour.Highly recommend the tour to anyone of any ageAnd Laura is such a fantastic tour guide she is so helpful and full of knowledge. We couldn't have asked for a better day and will definitely do it again and have recommended it to all of our family and friends

Mrs Rose Scott. Really enjoyed the Foodie Tour with Laura would not have done it without her. She was very knowledgeable and new the area's we visited so well. Could not thank Laura enough i had such a wonderful day and got to see and taste so much and i would recommend this tour 5 star's.

Fun, interesting and tasty!. The Hello Hong Kong Food Tour absolutely exceeded our expectations.Friends invited us to come along and, being opportunistic people, we gladly accepted. We love to try new things, especially food! Our first surprise was having a native-English speaking tour guide. Laura really made the tour enjoyable. She told us what to expect, made sure we knew what we were tasting, gave us a history of the restaurants, foods and local areas and was a delightful lady to spend the day with. She really knew her stuff.The price was good value for money - it covered food in five different places plus Laura's time and knowledge. Most of all, we enjoyed the food! We went on the tour as part of a friend's birthday celebration. We recommend it to anyone looking for a different way to try local foods and learn a bit about Hong Kong.

HK Food tour. Really great way to explore areas around Sheung Wan, Central and Mid Levels, with some fantastic food along the way, very knoelwdgeable guide (Nathan) provided great commentary and was very accommodating. Some fantastic local restaurants and shops that you may not typically have gone into without the local knowledge. Amazing Pork Char Sui - and be brave and try the chicken feet!

Great tour!. A BIG thumbs up for this tour, it was great. Having recently moved to Hong Kong and still finding out feet around the city, it was great to be shown around Sheung Wan, Central and Wan Chai, and some of the best eating spots. Laura was a great guide, and I highly recommend the tour.A special thanks for Laura; having some candles ready to celebrate a birthday was a nice special touch :)

THE REAL HONG KONG WE ALWAYS WANTED TO EXPERIENCE. This tour is a must if you visit Hong Kong.Dont go with the big travel companies,go with someone like Laura who will give you all the information,time and knowledge that you need to see a small part of the real Hong Kong.This was a 4 hour "foodie" tour,It was the best time we had in Hong Kong.We were shown so much by Laura in such a small amount of time,and it was so much fun to be in her company.We went to several restaurants to sample the local food,with the locals.We just would not have done this on our own.We ate Dim Sum,in a totally chaotic Restuarant ,but so much fun to see.We saw shops selling dried sea food,Sharks fins,birds nest and different types of Chinese medicines .We stopped at a Won Ton noodle Restuarant to sample this,then to Graham St wet market.Then it was a Milk Tea shop to sample this.Next to the Mid Level escalators and on to Wan Chai by Ding Ding...brilliant!Next visit was a roasted meat Restuarant and BBQ pork....beautiful!To finish off,we visited an Egg Tart bakery,and ate sitting in the local parkWe then said our goodbyes,and 2 days later,we were sent all the photos from our trip,and loads of recipes and loads of information of places to visit,with maps and photos so we didn't get lost....where else could you get this service.Have a look at the web site for other options,next time we go to Hong Kong,we will do it all again.Well Done Laura,a brilliant day,and a happy one.Rob and SharonWales UK

Fantastic Food and Service. I've just gotten back from a wonderful afternoon with Laura! We are a group of expats who have just moved to Hong Kong so arranged a private group tour. In the lead up Laura was easy to reach by e-mail and responded quickly to organise the booking. She even suggested the best time of day to make the most of the experience for us- we started at 11am and our tour took us through to 3pm so it was brunch and lunch all rolled into one. First stop was Yum Cha and we were definitely the only westerns in the restaurant- there was no way we would have found this place on our own. Laura ordered a selection of must try dishes and we grabbed a few extras as we went past. Next we wandered through Sheung Wan and looked at all the different dried seafoods and Chinese medicines before reaching Central for a bowl of wanton noodle soup. We had a look through the wet markets, tried some milk tea and jumped on a tram to Wan Chai for some AMAZING BBQ Pork and Peking Duck. Last but not least was dessert of egg tarts. Laura was so knowledgable about Hong Kong food, culture and life. She clearly knows her stuff and you could see she has a great relationship with the restaurant staff by how she was greeted at every stop. I would recommend this tour to anyone- whether they are just visiting HK for a few days as you get to see so much in just a short amount of time or if you are like us and living here it was great to try some excellent food right on our doorstep!

Really enjoyed. I was surprised by how much I really enjoyed the food tour, as I live in HK I thought I knew it all but quickly found out how wrong I was! The morning went really quickly and the food stops were really good, will definitely be revisiting a few of them.I took my 3 month old along with me, was slightly nervous it would not work for her but it was not a problem having her in the carrier, would not have been suitable for a buggy though. Nathan took my tour and was great, really friendly and thoughtful with regards to the needs of my little one. Would recommend to anyone as a slightly different way to explore the city.

Delicious food with a knowledgeable host. My husband and joined a food tour with Laura. She promptly replied to all of our questions and gave us detailed directions to our meeting location. All the food we ate was delicious! We could have never tried all the BBQ pork places to find the "best one" and the "secret" dim sum place that Laura took us was definitely outside of our radar. The egg tarts that ended our trip were amazing! Laura knew lots of history and took us to various places throughout the city. We ate so much during the tour that we ended up skipping dinner, so definitely pace yourself!

Excellent!. We only had 2 days in Hong Kong and wanted to make the most of our time there so we decided to book onto the group food tour which lasts around 4 hours, but goes by so fast! Every element to the tour is well researched, relevant and so interesting. There wasn't a single part we didn't enjoy or would have skipped, we would have never gone to the places we visited or understood what we were looking at by ourselves. Laura is a fountain of knowledge and we went out that evening to a bar and restaurant based on her recommendations. If you want great food while learning about this fascinating city, you have to do this tour! You won't regret it!!

See HK in a day. My wife and I toured with Laura for 6 hours. We wanted 4 hours of food touring and 2 hours on misc. touring. She did a great job! As she said, we ate our way through Hong Kong Island. We were only in HK for 2 days so this was a great way to see HK with someone knowledgeable. She's fun, she's cool, she is 100% attentive during the tour. Worth the money. Highly recommend.

Hello Hong Kong Made Our Trip. While still in the US, we scheduled 2 tours - not knowing what to expect. The first was with another highly rated company (top 10 on trip advisor). It was a negative experience for a number of reasons. As a dad, I was truly afraid that the initial three hour tour (not from Hello Hong Kong) had the potential to spoil our family's first trip to Hong Kong.The next day, we met Laura from Hello Hong Kong. She was simply the greatest. She understood our family and tailored things so that everyone was extatic - and learned a few things, too. I would highly suggest anyone visiting Hong Kong make time with Hello Hong Kong. One month later, it remains one of the most memorable parts of a very special vacation. She has a gift!

Superb afternoon tour of Hong Kong. We wanted a private guided tour that took us to "non tourist" places in Hong Kong. Laura was super. She was professional, highly knowledgeable, and customized the tour to suit our needs and preferences. I would highly recommend Laura and her company for anyone looking for a customized tour. Her rates are reasonable and well worth it.

The best local tour operator in Hong Kong - FACT!. Laura is brilliant. Our group used HHK for a tram party (great fun, well organised), a day trip to a surf school on an outlying island (weather atrocious but great fun) and a shopping trip to China. She's responsive and informative as well as full of local knowledge and ideas.Thoroughly recommend Hello Hong Kong and Laura.

Fantastic Day Shopping in Shenzhen. When my husband & I expressed our interest in doing some shopping in Shenzhen to another tour guide in Kong Kong Hello Hong Kong Tours was highly recommended to us. So we made contact with Kim and from the very beginning Kim was extremely professional, friendly & well prepared to make our shopping in Shenzhen an experience of a life time. We felt extremely safe and the day was stress free and totally enjoyable plus our amazing purchases would not have been possible without Kim contacts & experience with the shop owners. This tour is well worth every cent you pay as you will save so much more on great bargains and you will only be surprised at what you could possibly buy. We are still buzzing with our awesome buys. Thank you Kim for a fabulous day shopping.

Food tour of Hong Kong like no other.. We alone could never have unearthed the real food places that Laura took us to. Neither would we have had the benefit of her vast insider knowledge. We went to some well reviewed high end restaurants whilst in Hong Kong (some not worth the money) but the individual dishes we tasted on this food tour were examples of the best of their kind. The most memorable 4 hours of our 6 days in Hong Kong. Thanks, Laura. Di & Rod

Great food tour with Ben. We did a 6 hour food and sightseeing tour with Ben and had a great day. Started off with one of the best dim sum meals I have ever had surrounded by locals chatting and reading their papers. Ben was very informative and was able to answer all our questions. We covered several areas and went to places we would not have found on our own. Finished off the day with excellent roast pork and duck and egg tarts. Ben also helped us with suggestions for the rest of our stay and followed up with an email.

The Best Way to Experience the Food of Hong Kong. Our tour guide, Ben, led us and another couple on an incredible tour of Hong Kong's authentic food locations. The tour lasted from 9:30am - 1:30pm and was worth every minute. There were five stops on the tour including a dim sum restaurant where the food comes around on carts, a milk tea stand, and a roasted meat eatery. Every location was packed with locals. Between stops, Ben shared lots of stories about the history and culinary scene in Hong Kong. This tour is an absolute must for travelers who seek a local, authentic food experience.

Outstanding!. We did a 4 hours guided tour with Laura and had a fabulous time! The tour was fun, interesting and we visited places that we would have never found on our own. Laura loves people and she loves Hong Kong -a perfect combination for a guide. And after 4 hours of walking in the sweltering heat, she still had energy left. Laura is incredibly knowledgeable about HK, tells lots of stories and showed us numerous markets, a temple and the poorer and more interesting parts of HK. She also sent us numerous emails after our tour with pictures and lots of suggestions how to spend the rest of our time in HK. We followed her trip notes religiously and felt blessed to have another 2 days of guided experiences. Thank you Laura!

Great Day Out with Laura. We hadn't been to HK for over 25 years, and weren't sure what to see or do in the two days we had. Found Hello Kong on Trip Advisor and booked a walking tour with Laura for the first of the two days, which turned out to be an excellent decision. From the first email query until after the tour, Laura was efficient, friendly and informative. A private tour for two people is always going to be expensive, but Laura was able to provide advice on what to do on our second day, how to get from the airport to the hotel, where to eat etc, etc. So all up, pretty good value.We let Laura decide on the itinerary for the tour itself, but could have chosen to go to some specific places if we had wanted to. Our only requirement was that it included some good local food. We had an amazing yum cha breakfast at a place full of locals that we never would have found ourselves and a delicious lunch of roast meats. In between, we walked (a lot) and caught trains, trams and the ferry so covered a lot of ground and saw many different neighbourhoods. Laura knows a lot about HK's history and culture and was very informative as well as friendly and engaging. It was a tour of real contrasts – old and new, east and west, rich and poor, local and touristy. All in all, a great day out and a fabulous introduction to Hong Kong. Her advice for our second day, including detailed instructions for local transport, also turned out to be spot on.

An outstanding day with Laura in Hong Kong. We had an excellent day with her as she showed us more of Hong Kong than we could have ever done or hoped to do on our own. She even took us for a dim sum lunch at a very local establishment filled with the locals enjoying their day with families. I had arranged with her via email months before we went and, everything came off as she had said it would. I just wish we had more time as 6 hours was a full day (lots of walking so wear comfy shoes) but there is so much to see. She left us with instructions to the taxi driver in his native language to get us to Victoria Peak for dinner and directions back to our hotel via a photo of her cell phone with native language instructions for the return taxi driver. She was an awesome guide and the tour was great!

Fantastic tour guide. A big thankyou to Laura for a very informative tour.we saw everything we wanted and ate some delicious food (breakfast with the locals and lunch too) it was just amazing.We had only been with Laura for half hour and already we felt like she was a good friend very easy to talk to.She should be at the top of the list on trip advisor as far as we are concerned.Thankyou very much Laura and sorry it's took so long to do this :) x

Excellent tour, excellent guide, must try!. My husband and I went on Laura's Hello Hong Kong food tour in December 2014 and it was an excellent experience--one that made our trip to HK richer overall. Highly recommend! Laura was incredibly well informed and interesting to listen to as we walked around Central. She was also very clear with communicating around where to meet for the tour and answering questions. The best part was getting to try a number of delicious places that we wouldn't have found on our own and getting to "ask the expert" on etiquette and tips for later in our trip when we dined out and went around HK. If you have the opportunity, try this tour.

Great Intro to Hong Kong!. Laura was a delightful guide to my first visit to Hong Kong. Nothing but good things to say. Informative, varied, friendly, good food and company. Just what I wanted...not too touristy. Thank you, Laura.

Well thought out tour - Highly recommended. Many thanks to Laura (for organising) and Ben (our guide) for our walking tour of Hong Kong. I have a dodgy leg, so the heading "Walking Tour" was a little daunting but Laura reassured me that, as this was a private tour, it could be designed around us. Ben was a really nice guy and knew a lot about the 'non-tourist' parts of Hong Kong that we wanted to see. The tour is well worth the cost and a great way to acclimatise and get your bearings in an amazing city !

Great immersion into HK culture and food. This tour was spectacular - I learned so much about the people and ate delicious and well chosen food in places I never would have experienced. We walked streets visiting various markets inbetween food stops. It was perfect and memorable.

Hello Hong Kong Food Tour with Laura. A food tour with a difference, a must do experience. Laura's overall knowledge of the Hong Kong food business is amazing and makes this tour a complete educational package, plus it is done in a friendly "make yourself at home" manner with all tastes considered. The food presented to us is what is sought after in Hong Kong but is rarely found. It was the highlight of an 18 day tour of China and Hong Kong.

Shenzhen shopping at its best!. Kim was a excellent guide to navigate the Shenzhen shopping experience ! She prepared me well and made the trip a easy and fun way to see the Chinese shopping world! A great day!

Hello Hong Kong. My friends and I decided to do a food tor for something different on a recent trip to Hong Kong, we had a great time, Ben was friendly and had a great knowledge of HK and its food history, we all had a really great time and wold not hesitate to recommend Hello HK to friends and family!! Thanks Ben!

Eating your way through the city! . Had a short stay in HKG and wanted to eat everything I could. Ben was our guide for the day. He really knew a lot about Hong Kong. He's lived her for 3+ years. We ate 5 times throughout the day. (So come prepared to eat - A LOT!) Started with trolley cart food at a local place, you'd never find on your own. Drank fresh milk tea, ate at the famous Mak's Noodle, Peking duck, mouthwatering pork, and a custard egg tart. Yum. I was let down a bit by the Peking since the skin wasn't not crispy at all and it was only served with rice. No pancake with sauce and veggies to make true Peking duck wraps. Walked a bit through the city learned about different neighborhoods, Chinese medicines, culture, architecture and a few more city highlights. The cost is very reasonable too. Highly recommended

Outstanding Day Tour with Laura. Fabulous tour with Laura!! She was the best. I had a list of things I wanted to see and we covered them all. She showed us everything from the Meat Market to the back alleys. We saw them chopping fish at the fish market, watched the men walk their birds in the Bird Market, rode the Star Ferry, the escalator -- we did it all!! She was cheerful and had lots of fun facts that made the tour go by quickly. When I asked for non-Asian food for lunch, she happily took us to an area where we could have our pick of a number of places. I would highly recommend using Laura. She is one of the best guides we have ever had.

Amazing private tour. My husband and I recently returned from a week in Hong Kong. We agreed that the most memorable part of our trip was the private tour with Laura from Hello Hong Kong. Laura, a very sweet, personable and extremely knowledgeable British young lady, met us at our hotel and proceeded to take us on a spectacular 6 hour walking tour of the areas of Hong Kong that most tourists do not see. We started with a ride on the MTR to Sham Shui Po, the poorest district in Hong Kong. We visited the electronics market, jade market, wet market and snake shop. Be sure to try the famous Hong Kong egg tart! We then went by Star Ferry to Central, by taxi to Sheung Wan, had delicious lunch at tea house, walked through the Cat Street Market, and took a tram (ding ding). Laura was extremely informative about the history, economic situation, political issues, and just about anything you could imagine about Hong Kong. We never felt rushed (as you sometimes do on a group tour), and the cost of the tour was very reasonable. You do need to pay a nominal amount for extras, such as Octopus card (MTR) and food. Also be sure to wear comfortable walking shoes, as there is ALOT of walking including up and down stairs. Laura will customize the tour to include any special areas that you wish to see. We did not choose to see the "tourist spots" because we had seen those attractions during our previous trip to Hong Kong. We highly recommend this tour--Laura is truly amazing!

Great service from Hello Hong Kong. Ben our guide was excellent. He was both informative, extremely helpful and fun to be with. Prior to attending the tour we had concise details regarding what to wear, timing from airport to meeting venue and a full description of the proposed meeting point, all of which assisted greatly. When we met with our guide Ben, he was happy to chat about what he had planned and whether that suited our requirements and to change any of the route if we required. We had an informative tour around HK seeing the old and new, rich and poor areas with plenty of info along the way.

Great Day With Laura. After much research my wife and I choose Hello Hong Kong Tours with Laura. We arrived in Hong Kong on a cruise that docked at the Ocean Terminal which is the terminal basically in Hong Kong harbor. Larger ships dock further away. The pre coordination was seamless and Laura met us promptly at 0900 at the dock. This was our second day in Hong Kong and Laura provided us with extensive ideas and directions with what to do on day one. We set off on a six hour journey thru Hong Kong, not just tourist sights but a good look at the "real Hong Kong". We watched local merchants make Tofu,we went to the wet market and watched fresh fish being prepared for the locals. The Merchants see Laura so often that the know her and give a wave and hello. My wife and I loved this perspective of Hong Kong. Laura will tailor your tour to your desires. She was a delight to talk with, has an extensive knowledge of Hong Kong and provided us with an amazing and fun day.I can't recommend Laura and Hong Kong Day Tours enough!

Very Impressed on Hello Hong Kong Laura. I am very very impressed by Hello Hong Kong by providing valuable information to Lantau Island though she do no Lantau tours. Thank you very much, Laura from Hello Hong Kong

Excellent food tour- really interesting in every way.. I booked on the food tour with my parents, as they were visiting from the UK. Even as a HK (ex-pat) resident this tour was absolutely fascinating and really worthwhile doing. We experienced several different local restaurants/ tea houses, which I wouldn't have had a clue about ordering in or finding, as well as finding out lots of interesting things about Hong Kong history and architecture which I didn't know. Our guide Ben was really friendly and knowledgable throughout. I would highly recommend this tour and will be sending future visitors on it for sure!

A fantastic way to start our trip!. We were recommended hello Hong Kong tours by a friend, and I must say we are so pleased we started our trip with one.The pre-organisation by Laura was impeccable, we knew exactly what we would be doing and where with exact details of where to meet our guide.We specified they we'd been to HK once before so wanted something off the beaten track and she recommended the 4 hour morning walking food tour. We were not disappointed.Our guide Ben was friendly, extremely knowledgeable and very personable and made the whole tour absolutely fantastic; always willing to answer as many questions as we had and offering information and stories to add a personal feel to the tour. All the restaurants, stalls and areas we visited were carefully selected and we loved every moment of it.Thank you for a fantastic tour. We will recommended this to everyone who visits HK.- Alex Fisher

Expectations exceeded!. My husband and I booked a private 4 hour tour with Laura for the morning of our first day in Hong Kong. And we are so pleased we did! We specifically asked for one temple, some culture, some history, some architecture and a little bit of food. We got all that and so much more. What we got was the super-friendly Laura with her enthusiasm and love of Hong Kong shining through everything she shared with us. We got endless tips and ideas for how to spend the rest of the week....we're already thinking we need to plan a return trip to see everything she has recommended. When you book a private tour there's a always a little bit of risk involved...you may feel you are paying a premium for a customised experience and sometimes you feel that the end result is not worth the extra cost. Not with Laura. We felt we got tremendous value for money as well our expectations being more than met. Spending a few hours on one of Laura's expeditions is the best possible way to kickstart your visit to Hong Kong - do it!!!!
Well worth doing . Booked over Internet before our visit for our first day. Great way to start our trip Ben our guide was very knowledgeable and helpful and we all enjoyed the experience.

Awesome Tour, sights off the beaten track!. Laura Blackhall is the real deal, Intuitive, Friendly, Brilliant! Laura has a deep understanding of local culture and the sights that go along with them. The tour itself was awesome, exactly what we were looking for, And that is what sets Hello Hong Kong Tours apart from the ordinary, the intuitive ability to design a tour to the interest and abilities of the patrons. My family and I heartily endorse Hello Hong Kong Tours. Cheers Laura!

Guided tour of Hong Kong. We went to Hong Kong primarily for the rugby 7's but also to experience the city,culture and explore HK . We did thisvery well indeed by employing Laura who seemingly knows everythingabout this fascinating City and the surrounding areas . She is polite , enthusiastic and well worth the money .Although our feet were as thoughwe had walked for days it was because we had packedin the same volume of information as if we had blindly led ourselves......for days.Laura was good enough also to give us follow up information and promptlye mailed us copies of pictures she had taken on our trip. I hope her businesscontinues to flourish as it deserves to ! Don't be scared to tell Laura whatyou want from your trip as she is very bright and can think on her feet , Robert .

Food Heaven!. Laura was a very enthusiastic guide, very knowledgeable on local food and history. We went to this tour quite hungry and we certainly ate ourselves into a food coma! All of the food was delicious and there was plenty of it! At the end of the tour, Laura was very accommodating. She sent us information for another attraction that we were planning to see which was very useful. If you enjoy experiencing local food and wandering through a city, I highly recommend this tour! :)

Fabulous day with Laura!. My sister and I had one day together in Hong Kong and decided to hire a personal tour guide to make the most of our time. We had such an incredibly fun time traveling around with Laura... hearing about the history and culture and also tasting delicious local food. Laura expertly guided us along making the best use of our time but we were never rushed. She combined our interests with her suggestions to make a perfect day. My only regret is we only had one day. If I ever find myself in HK again, the first thing I'll do is schedule another Hello Hong Kong tour!

Excellent food tour!. Laura took us to several local food stops, most of which we never would have visited on our own. She was very knowledgeable both about the food as well as the areas we were visiting. She allowed us to be as adventurous (or conservative) as we wanted to be, but it was very comforting having someone who could explain what we were about to eat. It was a GREAT way to get to know Hong Kong and we highly recommend Laura to anyone visiting. It was our favorite experience in Hong Kong!

Great Experience. Having just a short time in Hong Kong we wanted something that would enable us to maximise the time we had. Laura successfully managed to do this in the 4+ hours that we spent in her company. She shared with us some of the history of HK along with some fascinating culinary experiences. Laura also went out of her way to give us ideas for what we could do for the rest of our stay. We would wholeheartedly recommend this trip to anyone.John and Jan

Tasty tour!. My wife and I along with a small group, had the opportunity to explore a little of Hong Kong with our food tour guide Laura, who led us on a mouth watering food journey of some of the rich food history and culture of Hong Kong, that the everyday tourist may not see or be aware of. I really enjoyed the opportunity to explore the little narrow lanes and backstreets which hold some of the real gems of eateries which appear as unassuming facades but that are rich in family history,with food that is simple in nature but each mouthful is an experience of beautiful tastes and textures that leaves you wanting more. So I can highly recommend this food tour and in particular our guide Laura who made this a really enjoyable highlight of our time in Hong Kong. We awarded and presented our guide with the gold Kangaroo badge for her outstanding contribution to Hong Kong tourism.

Amazing Hong Kong City Tour. With only one day to explore Hong Kong, we were extremely pleased that we made the right choice in choosing Hello Hong Kong Tour Company. Laura's wealth of information provided us a better understanding of Hong Kong's history, it's people and their culture. Our 5 hour tour gave us the opportunity to experience the subway, ferry and walking the streets of Hong Kong to explore a temple, several markets, different neighborhoods and the best wonton noodle soup. Thanks Laura for an encredible experience!

Good but a bit basic. Host was engaging and interesting, but didn't speak chinese, so there is a feeling of perhaps only getting the surface impression in a few places. Food stops were yummy and certainly filling. But there were also a few stretches of just walking reasonable distances without learning much about the things all around us. Overall an interesting tour, but perhaps lacking a deeper level of insight or experience.

Excellent one day experience. We had a one day stop over on the way home and wanted to get as much of an insight into Hong Kong as we could.Laura was great to work with in organizing the trip, using her local knowledge to ensure we got as much in as we could (While also ensuring it didn't feel like a rush)On the tour itself she is was a great guide and was flexible and knowledgeable (and took better pictures of ourselves than we did)Highly recommended and thank you Laura

Hong Kong walking tour. We had a great 4 hour walking tour of Hong Kong with Laura last week and thoroughly enjoyed it. She is very enthusiastic and certainly knows her stuff. We went straight down to the Metro where she introduced us to the underground system which was very useful and our Octopus card lasted for 2 days after. We saw some lovely sights which we wouldn't have found by ourselves and she even had us eating snake soup which tasted like chicken, as she said it would. We saw a lovely temple, a beautiful Japanese style garden and bought some great souvenirs in the market. She showed us a very vibrant Hong Kong and the fish market was outstanding and very colourful. After all that walking we went for a great foot massage recommended by Laura which was wonderful. Laura's tour is a must if you want to see the real Hong Kong and would thoroughly recommend her.

Perfect Introduction to Hong Kong. We thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour with Laura! She was happy to accommodate our request to wander "off the beaten path" and helped us to experience a Hong Kong we would not otherwise have found on our own including having fortunes read at the amazing temple in Wong Tai Sin, and eating the most delicious noodles in HK. Our two daughters instantly bonded with Laura and her easy-going, enthusiastic personality. We appreciated her insightful knowledge of the city, it's people, food, and culture. After the tour we were significantly more confident navigating the local transportation and neighborhoods.Thank you for an incredible 5 hours, truly the highlight of our trip!

Hello Hong Kong food tour with Laura. Today we had an excellent experience doing the Hello Hong Kong food tour. Laura was not only very knowledgeable about the Cantonese food we sampled but also incorporated some interesting historical facts. She has obviously built up a great relationship with the local restaurant owners who were very pleased to see her and welcomed all members of her tour. I would thoroughly recommend folk to do this tour. Make sure you really go hungry as the food offered is of a great standard, variety and masses of it.

Tour Guide: Laura Blackhall / AN EXCEPTIONAL EXPERIENCE. Tour Guide: LAURA BLACKHALL www.hellohongkong.com.hkOur trip to Honk Kong in February 2015 was the front end of a 17 day Crystal Cruise from HK to Singapore. We arrived several days early, in part to recover from jet lag (the 16 hour time zone difference from Los Angeles to HK), and also to wander and do some shopping.We decided to hire a private tour guide for our first day. We found Laura Blackhall via recommendations on TripAdvisor. Ahead of arrival she asked, via email, about our interests (tourist sites, shopping, wandering back alleys, etc.) and them presented us several options.Laura met us at Mr. Sams on Nathan Road, following a morning tailoring appointment. We spent five hours with Laura wandering Central and Kowloon by foot, ferry boat, trams, and the metro. Based on the email correspondence prior to arrival, she mapped out a tour for us that offered a taste and the backstories for many parts of Hong Kong, from the High Tea Service at the Peninsula Hotel to the entrepreneurial street markets in Central and the “Mansions” that provide low cost retail stalls and hostel beds for recent immigrants to HK. Our deem sum lunch in Central was at a second floor venue populated by locals: we seemed to be the only (Western) tourists in the place. Laura was exceptional: warm, engaging, and informative. The five hours with Laura was an easy conversation with a new, local friend as opposed to a stiff and formal presentation on a bus or limo tour. She asked questions about us in order to tailor to the continuing conversation to our interests, in and beyond our HK trip. Additionally, she sent us extensive follow-up notes with detailed directions and photos for other places for us to visit during our remaining time in HK. She left us well-informed and well-prepared for wandering HK on our own.So should you be thinking about a tour guide for your first (or next) trip to HK, we would absolutely recommend Laura Blackhall. ENJOY!

An Outstanding Food Tour With Laura. Visited HK for the second time in Jan 2015. Went on Laura's foodie tour with 5 or 6 other people. Even though there was quite a lot of walking between food stops, the stops themselves were well worth the walk. Laura is an extremely engaging guide, and did an excellent job of putting HK's best loved foods into a cultural context. She's funny too. This tour will definitely take you to places that you would never just stumble upon.

Wonderful Day with Laura. On a business trip and had one day available to see Hong Kong and I wanted to take advantage of the day best I could. Laura, Hello Hong Kong, was available and she agreed to help me with some shopping and touring the city. I booked 5 hours with Laura. Co-worker in tow, Laura took us to the Jade Market to buy pearls and helped me find a watch in the Ladies market. But most of all, we saw the backdoor and the front door sides of Kowloon and Hong Kong. We saw temples, small parks, food markets, quaint alleyways and learned some history. There was so much to see and so little time! Laura maximized our time because she knows the area well and helped us use the MTR subway to quickly move through the city. Laura is quick witted, charismatic, engaging and fun. You will certainly enjoy your day with Laura and if I ever go to Hong Kong again, without a second thought, would book with Laura a second time. I highly suggest a 6 hour tour or a bit more. My skeptical co-worker who initially didn't want to participate in a walking tour LOVED it and told everyone about Laura and Hello Hong Kong at each business we met with during our trip! Thank you Laura for a wonderful day!!Sheila (and Tim)

Simply the Best. Laura has a huge love for Hong Kong, its people and their culture. This is evident through her enthusiasm and enhanced by her personality. We had a great day with her, pounding the city’s streets, riding its trams, buses, ferries and trains. A must if you want to have a true Hong Kong experience - Nigel & Celia Phoenix

The best part of my HK trip!. I visited Hong Kong alone in January and booked this tour on the strength of the reviews here and I must say I wasn't disappointed. The tour takes you to a number of places that you wouldn't notice as a tourist and all the food is wonderful as well as varied. Laura is a brilliant guide and as a solo traveller she made me feel extremely welcome. The tour also walks through a number of areas where Laura explains local history and tips. You never feel rushed and Laura makes you feel like a good friend showing you her town. This was the best thing I did in HK and I have been raving about it to friends since so don't miss out!

Hong Kong Food Tour. Having just moved to Hong Kong I was keen to learn more about the city and having a keen interest in food this was the perfect combination. Laura was an excellent and informative guide and took us to places I wouldn't have found on my own. She is very natural and you didn't feel rushed at any point. The small group size worked really well and enabled Laura to take us to places where we were the only tourists. The food was all interesting and delicious.
