There was a really good mixture of different foods to try and also visits to food shops and markets where Laura's knowledge of the strange products for sale was excellent. I will definitely recommend the tour to my friends.

Foodie Find Fabulous.. The tour was amazing a real insight into the different foods and the people the culture i would not have tried this by myself. Laura had so much knowledge which was excellent would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Great Tour Guide for Hong Kong. We were picked up at our Hotel by Laura,she is English so no problem with Language or accents.We started by walking from our Hotel and she is vey impormative and certainly knows the History of Hong Kong.She is fun to be with and very outward going which is great for a guide.We had 4 hours sightseeing on the Kowloon side of HK and came back by the Star Ferry.We saw tofu being made and we tried eating fried tofu with sweet chilli sauce which was good.We visited a temple and saw people praying and making offering to the the Wong Tai Sin.All in all we had a great day in Hong Kong and saw a lot of things we would not have seen on our own.We would throughly recommend using Laura while staying in HK

Hello Hong Kong delivers. My client suggested she was going to take a walking/MRT tour of HKG and do "some shopping". Having been to HKG numerous times since 1987 and having an aversion to shopping, this guy thought "nope", especially since we arrived at our hotel at 22:00 hrs the previous evening from the States.Best day (5 hours) I ever spent in HKG; with my client and Laura of Hello HKG I felt like one of the ladies; Laura knows the city and interesting tidbits of HKG's colorful history which she weaves into her walking tour.If you are going to HKG and wish to get a real feel of the wonderful city and its people - Hello Hong Kong is the perfect fit.tim

wow!!. add us to the list of satisfied tourists. this was one of the best food tours we have ever been on and we have taken many. not only was there great food and selection of food, a necessity for any good food tour, but laura also provided a wealth of historical and anecdotal information. i won't go into detail about where we ate since this is clearly laid out on the website, but i do want to address the variety of these options and quality of food. clearly this tour is on the high end price-wise. but unlike the inexpensive tours, laura's tour allows the traveler the opportunity to choose some of the food and how much. after we left the dim-sum restaurant, we were already almost full as we and laura kept seeing more items to try and continued to order. the food was the best dim-sum we ever had and in a restaurant that was a throwback to days gone by.the other restaurants and stops added to the variety in not only the food but also the venues. bravo laura on a great program!

Best Hong Kong Tour - Hello Hong Kong Tour (food tour). This tour is amazing - Laura is a great English speaking tour guide. I would highly recommend anyone to go on this small, intimate, tour. Laura has clearly done her research on her chosen locations. The small group - our day was 5 - allows everyone to clearly hear what is going on and some one-on-one time with her. Feel comfortable going as a single or with a group. Her honestly and openness is extremely refreshing. Great variety and quality of food, great directions to find the start location, unbelievable post tour info was supplied to the group after also. Seriously amazing!!!This girl is pastionate, knowledgable and a real people person . You must do this tour when in Hong Kong - ideally on your first day as it will give you a great overview and info for the remainder of your tripThank you Laura, Love Eva and Lilly Sydney, Australia

Excellent 1st Day Hong Kong Activity. Good overview tour of Hong Kong's food and history. Perfect for Hong Kong rookies. Here are some tips:Make sure you save room for the BBQ pork. Simply amazing.I recommend the ying yang drink during the tea with milk stop.Pick Laura's brain on Hong Kong. She gives great information, advice and recommendations.The only thing I didn't really care for was the part about the dehydrated food, bird's nests, and Chinese medicine, but that might just be my personal taste.

Best tour and best guide we could have asked for!!!!. We went of a personalized six- hour walking tour with the most amazing guide, Laura. She made every moment count, for she was passionate and went out of her way to show us the real, authentic culture in Hong Kong. I strongly recommend you contact her before planning a trip to Hong Kong. Her attention to details is truly unparalleled and she made our tour one to remember with her sense of humor and her knowledge of the lifestyle and culture. Laura, we cannot thank you enough for this amazing day.

The BEST Tour EVER!. Our family of five had a short two day stay in Hong Kong.Thankfully Laura was available to guide us through the city.First day we did the CITY tour and the second day the FOOD TOUR!OH my.. I dont know what we would have done with out her. When traveling with the entirefamily I have figured out these tours are the only way to go.( found through Trip Advisor)We had such a great knowledge of the culture, people and food of Hong Kong by the time we sadly said goodbye to Laura.We will never forget the day spent eating the most delicious BBQ pork and rice from a sweet family shop we never would have found on our own.DIM SUM!!!! NEver would have found that place!!! The BEST DAY EVER !!BOOK early, she fills up!From shopping in the markets, to tasting the local food , to hiking up the hills, thank you Laura.WE hope to continue our tour on another day.

Fantastic day tour of Hong Kong!. We joined Laura for a 6 hour day tour of Hong Kong. We only had two days in this vibrant city and Laura was a perfect choice for seeing all the city's highlights. We chose her company from all the great reviews on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. Laura showed us how to get around the city and took us to places we would never have found on our own - in addition to trying foods that were spectacular. She is very knowledgable about the city and is a great story teller.. Thanks Laura for making our trip to Hong Kong a great memorable experience.

A Day in the City of Hong Kong - One Day Stop Over Tour. We were very much impressed with our Day tour with Laura, her knowledge and passion for Hong Kong comes through in her presentation of both sites and history of this enchanting City. We travelled around the City with the opportunity to capture a City of contrasts. we very much hope to revisit the Hong Kong and enjoy a more in depth appreciation of the environs of both the city and surrounding area.We would very much recommend this Tour to any perspective visitor.johnangela

Laura is the Best!. I went with my family to Hong Kong for the first time and I wanted this to be an unforgettable experience, as it is unlikely we will all go together again, as they are grown adults and my oldest is getting married this year. I decided to book with Laura based on TripAdvisor reviews and I was not disappointed at all, if anything, the reviews are not complimentary enough of the professionalism of Laura. She loves Hong Kong and is able to transmit that love to you with stories, knowledge of the city and its culture and just as importantly, of its cuisine! My family was very happy with the experience, I had been to HK several times before and I never learned of the inside story of the place as much as with Laura. Your will go to see the extremes of HK, from the very rich and fancy to the not-so-rich areas of the city, all in the company of a lovely lady. One of the highlights of the tour was lunch at this very local bbq place, one of the best meals we have ever had! I highly recommend you to book with Laura, I am sure you will not be disappointed!

Excellent Food Tour!!. I recently went on Laura's food tour with 2 other couples and cannot recommend this highly enough - think a combination of trying authentic local food and a personalized tour of several areas of Hong Kong. Our group size was perfect and we could visit our stops without looking like a "tour". We first met at a local coffee shop to meet each other and Laura provided a welcoming orientation about our day. Minutes later we were off to a local tea house for Dim Sum. Immediately realized that this was the real deal! This was a a very popular restaurant with regular patrons and obviously not a tourist destination. No problem for us as Laura had arranged a table for us and the Dim Sum carts were circulating and we were able to sample several local delicacies. Afterwards, back out on the streets and we visited some local markets to view many different exotic type of food such as mushrooms, abalone and many that I didn't know existed! I just want to give a glimpse of the tour here so that I do not give away the many surprises that you will enjoy as I did throughout the day that included tea, noodle soup and tarts. The pace of the tour was perfect and you will not be overwhelmed by the amount of tastings so that you can truly enjoy each stop. Laura was enthusiastic and this is a great way to see one aspect of Hong Kong!

A really good Tour. After reading some of the earlier reviews, I have to say that I agree with all of them. I and my family did the private food tour with Laura, and we simply had a great time. She was outstanding in helping new visitors to Hong Kong find their way around and even helped us navigate around Hong Kong on the MTR. What can I say, the food tour was great and very informative. Laura also helped us finish off the rest of our stay in Hong Kong by giving us directions and suggestions for over activities. I feel that we had a better trip to Hong Kong, because we took the food tour on day one. If you’re ever in Hong Kong, you should send her an email. It will be worth it.

Excellent Overview of Hong Kong. My wife, two young adult children and I recently visited Hong Kong on a cruise stopover. My wife and I had been to Hong Kong previously but it was a first for our children. We booked Laura of Hello Hong Kong for a 6 hour tour of the city. We recognized from our previous visit that a guide would be the best way of maximizing our short time in the city to see all of the highlights. This proved to be the right decision. Laura was very well organized and very efficient in getting us around both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island to see all of the major sites, using mostly public transportation. Laura was very friendly, professional and knowladgable about the city and it's history. I would definitely recommend Hello Hong Kong to anyone visiting the Hong Kong area.

A Splendid Day with Laura!. What a great way to spend my time in Hong Kong! Laura is a very knowledgeable guide that uses the perfect mixture of out of the way places and the must-see tourist places. We used the subway, ferry, taxi, boat and a good deal of walking. My day was custom tailored to my requests and I felt that I spent the day with a friend making my experience in Hong Kong even more special. Thank you Laura for an outstanding experience!

Awesome!! A Hong Kong highlight!!. Laura was charming, organized, very knowledgable and thorough, and took our nicely sized small group to great local places I never would've found on my own! Yum!! Bring a full appetite and pace yourself- you're in for a treat! I'd suggest doing this towards the beginning of your trip to HK, as Laura gives great suggestions for other things to see and eat for the rest of your trip.

If that's your first time in HK, this tour has it all. The tour was interesting and the food delicious.. Laura did a great job designing this tour. Great local places. Delicious food. She has many interesting facts about Hong Kong. Simply the highlight of our trip.Thanks, Laura! :)

A wonderful experience!. We visited restaurants we would never have found on our own...all were wonderful. Laura's extensive knowledge and the opportunity to ask all our questions about life in Hong Kong made the tour invaluable.

Hong Kong Tour. We booked a six hour afternoon Hong Kong tour with Laura as our guide and we enjoyed every informative minute of it .Laura is a mine of information having the answer to every question we asked. We used the local buses and taxis, the underground and ferries. A great way to see Hong Kong. We would recommend Laura to anyone who wants to see the real Hong Kong Thank you for a great afternoon.

Essential tour. Essential tour for first timers and return visitors! Laura took us to restaurants that we would never have found or considered going in but which proved to have delicious food. Combine this with an in depth knowledge of Hong Kong past and present and you will feel that you have seen and learned more about Hong Kong in one tour than tour books could provide. We did the tour on day 1 and added on 2 hours to the 4 hour food tour. The day flew by and was well paced. Laura is great, knowledgeable about HK and has a great sense of humor. She provided us with additional detailed information for the remainder of our stay. The tour exceeded our expectations and heightened our comfort level to do further exploration of this city of contrasts. Don't miss your chance to do this tour (book early)! Thanks Laura.

Fun facts and faboulus Food with Laura. After beeing in China for 3 Weeks, unfortunatly we ended our Trip with the Food Tour in Hongkong. I wish we would have started with it!!! The tour was fun and delicious, this beeing said by somebody who is very picky about food. Getting some insights about the Hongkong food culture and entering restaurants, we would have never seen/found by our selfes, ordering food nobody ever imagined to try or order, simply for the lack of mandarine reading! The Food Laura ordered gets explained, nobody has to eat things without knowing what is in them. The only surprise is the taste! Inbetween the Foodstops you will get facts and info about Hongkong, Our group had a faboulus time and Laura was an awesomes hostess, so thanks again for making our last day in Hongkong so rememberable!!

a taste of home away from home. laura was amazing. i've been abroad for a while now and being taken to all the best foods of hong kong reminded me of home. it was personal and fun and a great way to explore the huge city. i needed the pick me up of a homey feeling and the places and sounds and foods from this tour were perfect. definitely worth it.

A Must for Foodies!. My husband and I did this tour about 2 months after moving to Hong Kong from NYC. It was more fun and informative than we anticipated - Laura really exceeded our expectations! The tour took us to several local places that we wouldn't have ever gone to because we don't speak or read Chinese - but now we'll definitely be back to all of them on our own! We also learned a lot about Hong Kong's history and culture, which made us feel more connected to the city. I highly recommend this tour for foodies, those interested in learning about the history of Hong Kong and it's cuisine, and even expats who are new or relatively new to the city.

An insight into Hong Kong Island's food, culture and history. You must do this tour. Not only will you be taken to some of Hong Kong's hidden gems, Laura goes out of her way to make sure you have a great time in Hong Kong. She'll give you tips on where to go and what to do for the remainder of your stay. Do this tour at the start of your trip and you'll be set. And really don't eat breakfast beforehand!

A fun way to learn about, and eat, your way through Hong Kong. If you come to Hong Kong with food on your mind you will be assaulted by the mind boggling number and array of choices to eat traditional Chinese food and every other type of cuisine - in a single block. Extend that to a whole city of 7 million people, and about the same number of places to eat, and you might be tempted to throw up your hands in resignation and take the first place you see. Or settle for Pizza Hut. Well....No. Instead, simply book a tour with Laura at Hello Hong Kong Food Tours and put your stomach in her hands. Or something like that. She will take you to the Best places in town for all the traditional basics like wonton noodle soup, yum cha, milk tea, etc. Ever been to a Michelin star restaurant, for instance? Laura is an outstanding tour guide. She has done the "hard work" of uncovering the truly best places out of an impossibly huge range of options, all of which can look alike to the uninitiated. She really knows Hong Kong so she can put the food culture into an historical and social context, explain variations of traditional foods, and keep you entertained along the way. She has developed good relationships with the restaurants and cafes you visit so you always feel welcome. In fact, this tour is like having a good friend showing you around her favorite city. The tour takes in some street markets, too, which can be eye-opening to say the least, but this IS the real Hong Kong, and you will want to go back to all the places she takes you. A word of warning, though. DO NOT EAT BREAKFAST before you take this tour. You will be well fed, take my word for it. This is a five star tour and I recommend it unconditionally. And say "ni hao" to Laura for me.

Great insight into the soul of Hong Kong . Thx to the team and especially Ben, who gave us a thorough tour into the soul and belly of HK. He fed our minds and appetites with the most memorable sights and tastesThx so much

Fantastic Tour. I had a 10 hour layover in Hong Kong and I was traveling by myself and unsure of what I wanted to do. I knew I did not want a big mass tour but wanted to see as much as I could. I saw Laura's webpage and contacted her to discuss possibilities. She replied immediately and gave me a list of suggestions as to what we could do on her tour. Laura met me at the airport and helped me exchange money and get my octopus card. From there we went on an amazing walking tour through many different parts of the city. She was very informative and took me to areas that would not be on a regular group tour. We had a fantastic local dim sum lunch and I felt like we covered everything that I wanted to see and more. She also gave me suggestions as to other things I could do by myself for later in the day or if I can back again. She was easy and friendly and it was such a nice way to spend the day with a new friend. I would highly recommend her tour. I just need to go back so I can do the foodie tour next . Thanks for a wonderful Hong Kong experience Laura! Sincerely, Michelle C. Canada

Very Good Tour. Laura is quite knowledgeable and is an excellent tour guide. The tour was a walking tour only, no transportation provided. A little too much walking for our group. Although the tour was one day onl Laura gave us the information needed to enjoy the rest of our stay Hong Kong. Would definitely recommend this tour.
Sailing on luxury yacht. Thanks Laura for getting me and my friends on Captain Ryans sailboat. It was a perfect start of our day! Also loved the pictures that you sent me.

fun insider tour of Hong Kong. this was a perfect introduction for our first visit. Laura quickly replied to our enquiry and met us at our hotel. we learned some history, saw some very interesting aspects of the city that are not common tourist attractions, and learned about the public transit. Laura is a charming and enthusiastic guide. A highlight was delicious traditional dim sum and other local specialties such as milk tea and roast pork!

Best Way to Discover Hong Kong. We were very lucky to find Laura via tripadvisor before our October 2014 trip to Hong Kong. Although I had been to Hong Kong several times, my wife had not. Truth be told, it was as if I had never been in the city, for I learned so much. Laura was super responsive in booking, and met us at the hotel right on time. She helped us get octopus cards to navigate Hong Kong, and we were off. Our trip was gastronomically focused, and we saw some unique -and tasty- locales. I was worried that the food might be too strange for my pedestrian tastes. Not at all. We enjoyed our tour with Laura, and we look forward to doing it again.

Best way to learn about HK and China. I strongly recommend this foodtour at the beginning of your HK-Trip, its the best way to learn about the food, the city, the people. Great experience! I´ve took the solo-tour, its was worth every penny!

Great Introduction to Hong Kong. My private guided tour with Laura was a great introduction to Hong Kong. Going with Laura on the first day of my trip was a great way to learn how to get around Hong Kong on my own and her advice and information on many things I wanted to do subsequent to the tour were invaluable. Laura was great company and very well informed about the sights she took me to see. I gave her a rough outline of what I wanted to see and let her decide the itinerary which I was very satisfied with. I thoroughly recommend using Laura for a private guided tour when you are in Hong Kong. Thanks Laura :)

Hello Hong Kong Tour. We booked a 6 hr tour of Hong Kong, on Sunday, Nov. 2, with Laura, the Owner and Principal Guide with Hello Hong Kong Limited. As we were going to be in Hong Kong for 3 more days, I wanted to get a good initial city tour, so we would feel more comfortable to go out on our own, on the following 3 days. After HK, we were heading on to China for a couple of weeks.Laura is a transplanted Brit, who met us promptly as prearranged, in our hotel lobby. We left the itinerary up to Laura, but asked to see some of the places and sites, that the typical tourist tours don't hit. We visited everything using the fantastic HK subway system, and by walking. Our tour included a visit to to Wong Tai Sin by MTR to see the council housing and the temple complex. Then by MTR to Sham Shui Po, the poorest of the 18 districts of Hong Kong. Lowest average monthly household income. Highest % of elderly of all districts. Laura took us to the She Wong Sin snake shop to try snake soup. Tasted like Chicken!Then stopped at the very old Kung Wo Soybean Products shop (yummy!), and visited the electronics market and the indoor wet-market. Then back on the MTR back to Tsim Sha Tsui (TST), and a stop at the famous Peninsula Hotel.We saw the old Marine Police Headquarters (Hullett House) with the noon day gun and Time Ball Tower to the old Clock Tower.Then took the famously cheap Star Ferry to Central, and went through the IFC building and down onto the streetcar tram. By tram to Sheung Wan, and walked around the back streets to look at the dried seafood and sharks fins. Had a quick visit to the old Chinese medicine shop on Wing Lok Street.Up to the Cat Street market on Upper Lascar Row to see the mammoth ivory on Hollywood RoadThen along Hollywood Road past the PMQ (Police Married Quarters) and up onto the Escalator at SoHo. (Why don't more cities implement these free escalators?).Walked down and around the back of the old Victoria Prison, and down onto Wyndham Street (art galleries and bars), then through Lan Kwai Fong (LKF) to Central Station and then back to our hotel by MTR.Laura had a lot of background and facts for all the places we visited. Very impressive.After our tour, Laura sent me a few emails, with detailed suggestions, and directions for other things we could do and see. Using her suggestions, we ended up going to see the Giant Buddha and Po Lin Monestary via the Ngong Ping 360 sky tram. We then went to see the old fishing village of Tai O.Again, using detailed directions that Laura provided, we went to Stanley Village and Repulse Bay, and Deep Water Bay. Ended up in Aberdeen to go to the Jumbo Floating restaurant.Laura can customize your tour based on your interests and available time and budget. Highly recommended.

Fun and very helpful!. My family and I went on a shopping tour to Shenzen this summer. Although we could have technically gone ourselves, Hello Hong Kong more than the right choice for the following reasons: 1-nice to have expert advice planning and thoughts about obtaining our Visa's 2-they started with asking about our shopping objectives and planned accordingly 3-we were taken to places that we might not otherwise have found 4-we had a lot of help bargaining 5-we had a lot of advice on quality of goods and what was NOT worth the price 6-shopkeepers seemed to be more inclined to bargain and help us as we had a guide which provided some authority to the whole experience.

Great Tour & Super Nice People Too!. Laura and her team know HK inside and out and since we only had a very brief time during our stay they really helped us to maximize our adventure. Got to see the old and the new, boat ride, milk tea and even drinks on a skyscraper balcony! Highly recommended!!
A must do tour!. The food was great. Ben was even better.We had a great time. It was one of the best tours we have ever done.Make this the top of your list when you visit Hong Kong.

Fabulous. Just been on this tour with tour guide Ben and loved it! The destinations and food were great and Ben's local and historical knowledge were a great addition. I couldn't recommend this highly enough! One warning though, it's not for a vegetarian.

Great layouver activity. While on a layover in Hong Kong on a trip with my parents, we decided to go on a tour during the day before our flight. The 4 hour food tour was a great use of our time that day. Laura was a fun and engaging guide, and took us to 5 amazing places to get a taste of HK. While walking to each destination, we also got a city tour and even checked out a wet market. The food choices were great and Laura was very knowledgeable about the city, the food and history of the area. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants a nice intro to the city as well as to eat some amazing food along the way.

Six Stars - Highlight of our Trip. We spent 4 hours with Laura on a private food tour. We also added on a two hour private walking tour. We were on our honeymoon in HK and Bali and this was the number one highlight. Laura was fantastic and knowledgable right from the start. Her services go beyond the tour. She was timely in responding before the trip and provided other travel itineraries for our days to follow. She brought her camera and took pictures of us. They were emailed within hours. We would recommend her to anyone. And yes, the food was amazing and plentiful.

Wonderful day in Hong Kong. Our daughter booked this tour as a surprise gift for our 40th wedding anniversary, we were a little apprehensive, but we needn't have worried. Laura was a delight to spend time with, so friendly, enthusiastic and informative with an obvious love and respect of Hong Kong. We started our food and sightseeing tour with Yum Cha/Dim Sum, which unknown to Laura was high on our To Do list, we thoroughly enjoyed that, and returned for more on our own later in the holiday. The day was packed with other wonderful foodie and sightseeing treats, and the time just flew by. We know that on our own we would not have experienced many of the things we did and saw. Laura also gave us comprehensive email tips and advice to enhance our stay. We enjoyed a pleasant evening in a Roof top bar in Wan Chai. We highly recommend the tours to anyone.

See it all !!!. Laura was the best. She is the only way to see Hong Kong. Her passion and knowledge of Hong Kong is evident from the first few minutes and she was great at showing us what we wanted to see, but also, what we needed to see. If you are doing Hong Kong for it's history, sight-seeing , shopping and/or a gastronomical tour of the area, she's your girl. Don't do Hong Kong without her.

Must Do! Your tastebuds will thank you!. I'm not usually one for organized tours, so this was the only organized activity I had planned for my HK visit. I didn't know what to expect & was pleasantly surprised! Ben, our guide was right on time at our designated meeting spot & we headed off to our first stop, traditional Chinese Dim Sum. I am a massive Dim Sum fan, and wasn't disappointed!Next we walked through the streets of Shueng Wan past the many Chinese Medcine shops. Such an eye opener! Ben knew his stuff when it came to what they were all selling, and even helped one of the other tour guests make a purchase. Mak's noodles was up next for the BEST Dumpling Noodle Soup. All others Soups are now ruined for me as they wont ever compare! I will return before I leave HK.Short stroll through the wet markets and then some famous HK milk tea. I must say I wasn't looking forward to this as its not usually my thing, but I think I have a new Fav drink. Had the Yin Yang (1/2 tea 1/2 coffee). Will be back here also.Jumped on a tram next off to Wan Chai. Roast meat was on the menu at a tiny, extremely crowded restaurant. Luckily we got priority seating! I am a massive fan of Char Sui (Pork) back home. This eclipsed anything I have ever had. The flavor was amazing and the garlic sauce that it was served with was divine.Short walk to the last stop for an Egg Tart. I was also surprised by this. The pastry was flaky and the Filling just sweet enough. Such a great few hours. Ben was extremely knowledgable about Hong Kong and answered every question the group threw at him. The tour had a really great atmosphere, and I think this was down to Ben being extremely personable & genuinely interested in the group enjoying their time.Ben also sent a follow up e mail with some tips on the things I had mentioned I was doing on the rest of my stay. Very much appreciated! Highly recommended to all visitors to HK (even those that don't usually 'Do' tours)

If you only have one day in HK.... Make sure you spend it with Laura!She is full of interesting information about the city, and was very helpful in giving us tips and tricks for getting around. We loved the photos she referenced throughout our tour to show how much Hong Kong has evolved over the years. She also gave great advice on things to do after our tour was complete. She conducts her tours with professionalism and charm, and is generally a delight to talk to. It is obvious Laura genuinely loves what she does, and her passion for Hong Kong is infectious. Highly recommend!

Brilliant discovery walk in Hong Kong. I have travelled many times to Hong Kong for business, but never really managed to go "deeper" than the usual sightseeing. The 5-hour discovery walk with Laura was an eye-opener, going many layers deeper in this bustling and fascinating society. And what a true pleasure to absorb so much information in a pleasant and humorous way (religion, social, economical and political backgrounds, culinary - "the works"). It provide a lot of great pictures for my personal travel blog too. Highly recommendable and worth every penny. Thank you Laura. Eddy Wouters from Belgium

Effective and Efficient. With my wife and I visiting Hong Kong for the 1st time, a booked guided tour with Laura was the most efficient way to not only tour key attractions, but just as importantly, to familiarise oneself with the details of travel around this bustling place. Laura's pleasant manner in guiding and informing was the highlight. This tour on our first day was the perfect introduction to Hong Kong. A standout was Laura's ability to structure the tour to our requirements including the pace at which we wanted to cover attractions in the period available. If visiting Hong Kong again we would certainly take another tour with Laura to different attractions and places. No hesitation in recommending Laura for a pleasant and informed tour.

One word " AWSOME". We booked on October 7th a private tour with Laura. We only had one day in Hong Kong and we knew it was in possible for us alone to get a fair impression of Hong Kong. Taking the Tour with Laura was a absolute pleasure. She went with us around the city, the island, let us use every transportation (subway, ferry ect), went for lunch with us s a typical Hong Kong food place, showed us markets and so on. Places we never had found. I think one of the best atributes on Laura is, that she adapted to you. Your speed, your interest and your personalty. On top she is funny and takes pictures from your your and emails them to you. I could go on and one. If I ever visit Hong Kong again I would book with Laura again. A++++

At One with Hong Kong. I holidayed in Hong Kong a fortnight ago with my fiance and her mother, visiting my future sister-in-law who lives there. Both had previously visited the city though I had not before even left the continent (Europe). This did leave me feeling a little apprehensive about the trip, given their wealth of knowledge and experience of having already been.We had ourselves a city-tour booked with Laura a week into our trip and due to already having seen the major 'touristy' attractions and sites, we opted for a less than usual tour, which Laura was very happy to cater for.Starting in the Wong Tai Sin temple, Laura told us of the stark differences between the lives of those living in Hong Kong. We took part in Kau Cim and had our fortunes told based on this, something I certainly wouldn't have had the confidence to do had Laura not been there to guide us. Me and my fiance were also able to 'tie the red string of fate', another Chinese tradition involving 'tying onself' to their hopeful future partner, (here's hoping our strings were already bound!) We moved on to compare the differences between the Peninsula Hotel and Chunking Mansions, (two vastly different places, so close in proximity to one another). A short star ferry across the harbor followed where we would stop in Central to get some food; delicious Dim Sum at a fantastic price, in a place that I feel only those local to Hong Kong would know about. To finish up, Laura walked us through the markets and pointed out to us the best spice and tea shops on the island.Laura's knowledge and delivery was perfect, keeping a solid balance of enthusiasm and pace so as to keep us interested at all times. To say that I felt at one with Hong Kong is an understatement. All of us, with our differing levels of experience with the city learned a great deal and thoroughly enjoyed our tour. I would wholeheartedly recommend a tour with Laura and when we return, I hope that we can re-book another route around the city.

Stop looking and book now. There is no reason to look further if you are comparing or pondering where or who to book with. With Laura's knowledge and personal manner she is an excellent host. On my return to HK I will be booking another tour with her and would strongly recommend her to anyone.

Time well spent!. Laura hosted me on a full day tour of Hong Kong. Her friendly, welcoming demeanour set the tone for the tour. Given her vast world travels, she has a good sense of what other travellers expect and want to see in a new city. We explored off-the-beaten path back alleys, demonstration areas, gardens, snake shops, wet markets, stilt villages and temples. Laura may also be the best haggler in the city so be sure to have her accompany you to one of the many markets. No attraction seemed too far to visit and the agenda was flexible. I concluded the tour very satisfied with the knowledge, photos and friendship gained from my short time in Hong Kong.

Learning a city - bite by bite. I have been visiting Hong Kong for many years - mainly for business - but never got to know the city intimately. This time I resolved to learn a little more of this city and after reading the glowing reviews of Laura decided to learn more about the culture of this city through it's food.The tour was wonderfully conducted by Laura, who took us through the by lanes of Sheung Wan and Central - giving us a glimpse of the side that most of us would miss. From the dried seafood stalls, to the hole-in-wall teashops, we were led by our intrepid guide who infused us with enthusiasm and regaled us with the wonderful back stories of the places we visited. And all along the way we were gorging ourselves on the wonderful local delicacies of Hong Kong, made all the more wonderful through the back stories and nostalgia associated with it. All in all it was a wonderful tour and only did I realise that we had spent 5 hours touring as I accidentally glimpsed my watch whilst stuffing my face with egg-tarts. ;-) I would highly recommend anyone visiting Hong Kong to take a tour with Laura. She is truly passionate about what she does and delivers much more than expected and what better way to learn about a place than through it's food bite by bite.

Only 6 hours in Hong Kong ? Spend them with Laura!. Excellent tour. From temples to antiques, elegant buildings to simple stalls, tradition, myths and legends (fortune telling .... dragon holes...ghosts..) to an overview of more recent political and economic changes and of course, food and laughter. All providing an insight into the contrasts of the melting pot of contemporary Hong Kong and its people. A fun filled day was had by all 3 of us on the tour with plenty of photo opportunities and information all delivered with great pacing and lots of fun.Laura is engaging and a pleasure to be around. If you are not sure what to do with a day in Hong Kong - book Laura , problem solved.!

Wonderful Day. I booked Laura for the day as I had not visited HK before and was traverling solo and only had 3 days to see the city. I had the most wonderful day with Laura showing me the sights and experiencing places I would not of found on my own. Taking me to great Dim Sum restaurant.It was like sharing a day with a friend. Laura also went out of her way to help me plan the rest of my stay in HK with suggestions for places to visit.Hoping to return to HK and will be looking forward to seeing Laura again

Eating our way through Hong Kong. This was my first time travelling to Hong Kong and I am so glad we went on a group tour with Laura. The day was filled with many different experiences (not just food), but Laura provided us with history to the local area. I really enjoyed my time and wished the tour never ended. It beats your traditional sitting on a bus tour by 100 times over. It was really hands on and Laura was just like a friend showing us around her city. I highly recommend this tour especially if you have a short amount of time in Hong Kong and love food!

Laura the Explorer. We had only three days in Hong Kong and wanted to cover as much territory as possible. As we are not fans of tour groups, we went in search of a ‘local’ who could show us the city on foot. As it turns out, we also covered it by tram, train and boat. Spending the day with Laura was like exploring with an old friend. We wandered really interesting alley ways with Laura sharing her extensive knowledge of buildings, shops, markets and food that we would have otherwise walked right by. As an expat living in Hong Kong, she clearly loves the city and has educated herself well on every nook and cranny. We allowed Laura to design the day for us (7 hours) and she was completely flexible even on the day, when we proclaimed early on we were hungry and in search of the best Yum Cha the city had to offer. Laura – and the Yum Cha – did not disappoint. We were keen, too, when she asked if we wanted to swing by the protest area in Admiralty. It was then across to Kowloon, drinks at the Eyebar rooftop bar and a ferry ride back to Central. Not only did she arrange our Oyster card for us, but she sent through detailed information after the tour on other bars, restaurants and things to do and see.Because we covered so much on the first day, we felt we had a really good grasp of the city layout, making our next two days quite relaxed. We recommend Laura highly if you are seeking a personalised way to see the city. Unfortunately, her food tour was booked out on the Saturday, but we’re pretty sure that would also be quite fabulous!

Great food - awesome company. My partner and I took a group tour with laura in October. Well worth the time and money. It was a great snap shot of the beautiful food in hk and we were well and truly stuffed by the end. Laura is a great guide and it never felt like you were being herded from place to place. Very knowledgeable and friendly.Recommended for both those new to hk food and those who want to be reintroduced to itMitchell houten

Cantonese delights with a bit of history and culture.. I have lived with my family in HK for nearly a year and when we had visitors recently who had little time and share our passion for food and out of the way parts of the city we booked the foodies tour with Hello. Laura was not only an informative guide she has a natural talent for sharing her secrets of Sheung Wan, an older part of HK not often visited by tourists. HK has more restaurants than any city we have visited or lived in before and to be able to find just the right ones to highlight the best of a range of Cantonese cuisine takes a lot of trial and effort. The blend of foods was excellent starting with Yum Cha at a traditional Tea House, then Wonton Noodle Soup, Milk Tea (we had a mix of iced tea and coffee) which helped with the heat, Roasted Meats and finally an Egg Tart. Laura was a wonderful guide who was well informed and able to get immediate seating in busy restaurants.I would highly recommend the tour for foodies and those wishing to see an older part of HK.

Hong Kong Surprises. I live in HK and won a tour with Laura in a charity auction where she had kindly donated her time and skills to the fund. I booked in when i had a couple of friends visiting from out of town and we had had the best day out! Laura took us not only to some brilliant sights but also to parts of HK that I had never even heard of let alone visited and we had such a great day. Lunch was a really local experience but by far the highlight for me was walking around the temple and having it all explained to me. I cannot recommend the experience highly enough and will definitely book in with her again next time I have visitors because more than anything else she made the day such fun.

Brilliant tour, we had a lot of fun.... We had such a great tour with Laura. She is well informed, knows a lot of good stories, is funny, up for every question and so on. Also we saw a lot of things, we probably would have never seen without Laura! Thx a lot Laura, we are definitely recommend your tours and also gonna come back to Hong Kong.

Fun tour in hong kong. Laura took us for a great day tour in Hong Kong. She took us jade shopping which my wife loved. We also visited numerous sites throughout different parts of the city. Laura was an excellent guide and very knowledgable. After the tour she followed up with detailed emails about ideas for the rest of our trip. Very professional

Thank you Laura!. Many thanks to Laura for a great day in Hong Kong! My daugther and I spent a wonderful, informative and interesting day exploring the city and we highly reccommend Laura as your guide!Not only did we have a great day, we also received super tips for the rest of our days in Hong Kong.Thanks again Laura!Best regardsCecilie & Benedicthe (Benny).

If you're going to see Hong Kong, See it With Laura!. We had SUCH a great time touring Hong Kong with Laura! She was also training another guide at the time and both women were very knowledgeable about the area. They helped us get our Octopus cards to navigate the city and knew a lot of ins and outs of the city. Laura also showed us not one, but TWO Michelin starred restaurants to check out! Laura even helped us plan the rest of our day and next day in Hong Kong by email! She could not have been nicer and more enthusiastic.

Hello HK food tour is excellent!. Laura is an excellent guide that was able to take the group through a very informative, fun and delicious morning/early afternoon. I am very familiar with cantonese food having grown up in Vancouver and had been to HK several times - this tour was still worth it! I learned a lot about the food that i already love and learned some new and fabulous places to have these favourite dishes, including dimsum, wonton soup, milk tea, BBQ meat and egg tarts. It was interesting to learn the history of the food and how it evolved to how we know it today. I learned not only about the food, history and secret ingredients that i never knew about as well as information regarding the various parts of town we ventured throughout the tour - it was a food with a bit of city tour rolled into one. You could even order as much as you wanted of anything along the way - though you do have to be careful to pace yourself - you will most definitely be full by teh end of the tour! Laura made this very enjoyable with her knowledge and carefully selected restaurants along the way, all supporting local businesses. I would recommend this tour to any of my friends that like to try new food as well as those that are already very familiar with cantonese food.

Wonderful tour. Laura is very knowledgable, friendly guide with good sense of humor. We spent 6 hours with her and were very happy. I have been in Honk Kong before, but still learned a lot of new things. Highly recommend for people who are in Honk Kong the first time and who wants to learn more about this wonderful city

The Best Way to do shopping in Shenhzen. Thank you to Kim Collett for organising our shopping day in Shenhzen. I liked the idea of having some there with you who can speak the language and help you with the barttering. Kim is an amazing helpful person, even though she was unable to take the tour with us, she organised one of her colleagues to take us. She also provided other advice prior to us arriving in Hong Kong i.e what is the best way in regards to what transport to take out of the airport. If you are heading to Hong Kong and want a personal tour guide then I would absolutely recommend Hello Hong Kong Tours. Thank you Kim for organising our shopping trip and the travel advice.

wonderful tour. Laura is doing a wonderful job. I had two sons with me 14 and 17 yo. Laura kept the tour very interesting and my kids were engaged all the time. It was very interesting day during big hurricane, but we still spent 6+ hours outside. It was very informative even for me who have been in HK few times before.

Awesome culinary tour. Laura was at our hotel on time. She is a very cheerful guide with an infectious enthusiasm for the local cuisine. My wife and I absolutely enjoyed her selection of establishments. Starting with the Dim sum for breakfast (like the locals!!), the short walks between the eateries, visiting quaint shops selling a lot of local food, things that are seldom seen in the West, like dried abalone, and the carefully planned intervals between restaurants, all fit perfectly into a great morning. Laura went out of her way to help us providing information about little known places to visit during our visit to Hong Kong. All in all a very enjoyable experience.

Wonderful Tour of the City. Laura is friendly, knowledgeable about Hong Kong, and incredibly fun. We did a 6 hour tour walking all over Hong Kong.Laura gives you a sense of what its like to move to the city. She also helps out with recommendations around other things to do in the city after you're done.

Great way to see Hong Kong. Laura knows her Hong Kong, and brings lots of enthusiasm to the task just as others mentioned. Even in a short rainstorm we managed to enjoy this tour. The food selections were very good, as was the information provided. She is also flexible to allow agenda changes. You won't go wrong using Laura whether you are newbie or experienced HK visitor...

Fantastic Food Tour. My husband and I took Laura's food tour on our recent (and first ever) trip to Hong Kong. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip! The tour is so well thought out - it makes great use of the time, you get to try a wide variety of Hong Kong specialties and learn about Hong Kong's history and culture on the way. The food stop choices were all fantastic and you get to visit some great hole-in-the-wall places that you probably would not venture into if you were a tourist on your own (let alone know what to order). The yin-yang tea stop especially surprised us! Laura also provided us with some great tips and recommendations for the rest of our stay. I would definitely recommend this fun, first class tour as a must-do while you're in Hong Kong. Thanks again Laura :)
Great places to see in Hong Kong. Very helpful and bubbly guide. Great way to see the foodie hot spots that Hong Kong has to offer. Great tips too.

Our "Amazing" Hong Kong Bespoke Tour for our first outing in HK. Where do I start!!!!..... I took a random search of Hong Kong tours and came across this website for www.hellohongkong.com.hk. Let me start by telling you from first contact, Laura was flooding me with "what to do' info whilst we were in HK and that's without any money transacted. Laura enquired about who we were and what we wanted to get out of our tour. Armed with that info she set about an amazing 'bespoke' tour for Angela and I taking in the old part of Hong Kong and places to eat (we are foodies) where we would never had gone....food was amazing. Laura was amazing...she is so knowledgeable about HK and delivers it with such passion. She also booked us into a restaurant for Dinner for Angela's birthday (Aqua) which was truly amazing experience.From the moment Laura met us in the lobby at The Mira, she organised us with our Octopus cards for travelling on the MTR and within minutes she was our new best friend. I would state to anyone considering HK as a holiday that you make contact with this company (Laura) to explore HK, by an absolute mile the best tour guide we had hoped for and more....thankyou Laura you made Angela's day a truly special one and we have already recommended to you to a couple of our friends soon travelling!!!

Best thing I did in Hong Kong!. The most charming, as well as delicious, sojourn through the streets of Sheung Wen, Central, and Wan Chai, getting a sense of each area's cultural atmosphere, and having a taste of its cuisine in a variety of notable Hong Kong eateries. Laura is a delightfully upbeat and knowledgeable young woman who has taken on this endeavour with infectious enthusiasm. She just makes you feel like you are her favourite guests ever, and that she's sad the tour is coming to an end! Can't recommend this enough!

Fabulous Foodies Tour!. Anyone who enjoys understanding the cultural dimension behind speciality dishes of a country - this is the tour for you! Laura provides a comprehensive guide to some of Hong Kong's favourite dishes and has clearly spent time researching the restaurants/shops that provide the most delicious examples of these dishes. The places you visit on this tour are authentic, local food providers - off the tourist track - so you are able to experience some of the delights of Hong Kong's fascinating food culture. Not only is the food delicious but Laura's relaxed and friendly personality made me feel very comfortable and her professional approach to the service she provides filled me with confidence about the genuine nature of this tour. Laura provided clear instructions about where to meet her, the nature of the tour, what to bring etc. You do need to be able to walk in the heat (in summer) but there are ample stopping points in air conditioned eateries to make the trip comfortable. The personalised nature of Laura's tour made it more enjoyable than a large group tour, as it gave ample opportunity to ask questions and Laura was able to accommodate certain interests we had e.g. my wish to buy genuine Chinese tea and Moon cakes.I thoroughly recommend this tour. This is not a high end gourmet dining experience but more an everyday, local eateries one. It is worth the cost (gets cheaper the more people in your group - we had two and it was HK$1400 each) because Laura is able to provide such a succinct, culturally authentic snapshot of delicious Hong Kong cuisine.

Wonderful Day in Shenzhen. What a day we had with Cath- a trip for two shopping. Neither of us will ever forget our day. From the time we met at Hung Hon until our return it was full on. Whatever we wanted Cath knew where to find it or how to get there. She could not do enough for us and within moments it felt like we had another close girlfriend on the shopping spree with us. And when it all got a bit full on, she stepped up and took control. I could not recommend this tour group enough. They are professional, knowledgeable and fun to be with. Do not hesitate, do not shop around, these guys are the best!

Don't miss this food tour!. Laura's knowlegeable, amusing and charming. You'll go a long way to find a better tour or guide. Don't eat too much at the first food stop or you'll struggle at the others, unless you're a piggy like me! You get a bit of history, a bit of culture and a bit of religious insight as well as the food. Laura sent us all some photos and her thanks by email within hours of the tour. She also sent me individually a very accurate and comprehensive suggested itinerary for the next day, as I'd chatted with her about having nothing planned. How good's that? But that pretty much sums up her character and approach to her customers, always looking to do more than one could reasonably expect.

A perfect introduction to Hong Kong with a friendly, helpful guide!. We had never been to Hong Kong before and wanted an insight into transport, culture, sights and shopping before exploring more on our own. Laura accommodated us at short notice and met us at our accommodation. Her tour was comprehensive and balanced; and her commentary was well researched and interesting. Laura helped us understand the various means of transport in Hong Kong and social conventions we needed to be aware of. She also established an excellent rapport with my wife and I, making for a very enjoyable day! I am confident that we would not have discovered half the things Laura showed us in the time we had, without her tour. Laura also specialises in food tours and we hope to do one of those next time we visit.

A great way to see hkg. Laura helped customize my limited time in Hong Kong so I could see the most important sites based on my preferences. She was a great guide and had a lot of useful information about each site and the city in general. Would recommend her highly.

Brilliant food tour. Absolutely loved this tour. Not only were we completely satiated with food but loved the temple and historical facts along the way. The host was wonderful and displayed the perfect mix of knowledge, humuor and know how. Would highly recommend this business to fellow travellers.

Great Tour, Very Knowledgable. My wife and I had a great time with Laura. We had two full days in Hong Kong. One we spent with Laura, the other we decided to go to the beach since we felt we saw all the things we wanted too with Laura. Great job, highly recommended!

Fantastic intro to Hong Kong. Laura's Hong Kong food tour was the very first thing we did on arriving in Hong Kong, and what a great decision that was. She showed us all around, took us to a dim sum place and to get Ying Yang, which is iced coffee mixed with tea and that is awesome, and gave us some background on a few different neighborhoods. For the rest of our trip we felt like we knew how to find great food wherever we were; we did dim sum all by ourselves, and had some more great char su. The tour was spectacularly well-organized: we really felt like Laura knew exactly what she was doing. She had arrangements with all the places we visited, so it ran perfectly smoothly. This was one of our favorite experiences on this vacation. Not only do I recommend it for you, but I recommend that you do it first thing if you're new to Hong Kong.

Brilliant. We did a tour with Laura for 5 hours through Hong Kong. She managed to show us so many beautiful sides of Hong Kong in such a short time. Stunning. She had a great plan and when we requested to see an extra temple, she just adapted het plan and fit it in. We wanted to try some real Hong Kong food but nothing too adventurous and she took us to a great place where only Hong Kong people ate and we had the best meal of our holiday. During the time we also took local public transport which harpy costs anything and gives you a great sense of Hong Kong.I would advices everyone to go on a tour with Hello Hong Kong! They are totally in love with this very special city and will do anything to show you as much beautiful sides of it as possible!

A FASCINATING PERSONALISED WALKING TOUR OF HK!. At the beginning of our few days in Hong Kong we decided to do a four-hour walking tour with Laura Blackhall of Hello Hong Kong Private Tours to see what HK is all about and what to re-visit and visit. Laura is a lively passionate, very friendly and warm tour guide, who loves what she does and thoroughly enjoys living in Hong Kong. Before even taking the walk, Laura was very helpful giving lots of information, taking time to tailor our walking tour to suit our personal interests (culture, history, local living, arts, cats, foods, etc) and giving exact prices with regards to transport. We had a wonderful four and a half hour walking tour through all the back streets of Hong Kong, taking in the culture and discovering how the local people of Hong Kong live. We explored the fascinating dried foods’ areas, (amongst others shark fins, birds nests, abalone!! the wet market, which was colourful and interesting, the tea-shop (we even tried a panty-hose evaporated milk tea, which was refreshing and a pick-me-up during the humid day), through the shopping districts, temples, taking escalators, trams, taxis, ferries and meeting some streets artists. We took the ferry with the locals to visit Kowloon: amongst others we visited the Peninsula Hotel and went to the Chungking Mansions (from the sublime to the ridiculous!!!), saw the old Marine Police Headquarters Police building and back on the ferry. At the end of the tour, Laura took us right to the Number 6 bus to take ourselves to Stanley, even adding which side of the bus to sit for the best view for photographs! Throughout the walk Laura was always very concise with her information, adding loads of fascinating history tidbits and observations and giving a thorough overall fascinating impression of what it is like to live in Hong Kong. Laura is also very keen to get to know her guests so one is immediately put at ease and having Laura as a guide, is like a good friend showing you around Hong Kong!By the end of the day we felt we had really explored Hong Kong and discovered how both wealthy alongside poor live. For the rest of our stay, Laura gave us lots of tips of where else to go, what to see and how to get there. Additional emails were sent with all the necessary information as well as an email giving a list of what we had done and seen in the four hours to go with our photographs. It was an interesting and very knowledgeable walk; one we wouldn’t have been able to do on our own in that amount of time. We learnt so much. Thank you Laura!

Hong Kong Shopping Tour. In April we visited Hong Kong - not our first trip to this amazing place. We wanted to take a trip into China and do some shopping and decided to contact Hello Hong Kong Private tours. As we were going over easter they were fully booked but to our delight they found a tour guide named Cath who was just delightful.We had an amazing day and Cath was just a fabulous guide and person to spend the day with. Cath's knowledge of the area where we visited was outstanding and it was a fun filled day shopping and generally having a laugh.I was very impressed with how easy it was to arrange and meet Cath and the cost for the day was very reasonable.We felt so comfortable after spending a day with Cath going into China that we went back again on our own and had another great experience.I have no hesitation recommending this great company and the great people who take you on these tours. I will be certainly using them again on our next visit to Hong Kong.

Hello Hong Kong: Shopping in Shenzen. I had one day at the end of a work trip and I booked a shopping trip to Shenzhen to buy presents for friends and family. From the first email, I was pleased with how much information and advice that was sent through to me – from specific instructions on where I would meet Kim (my guide for the day) to a reminder to bring tissues and hand gel for a stress-free visit to the washroom!The shopping mall itself was pretty big and I was pleased to have Kim to show me all of the best places to buy jewellery and bags. Kim was much better at negotiating a good price than I was – without her, I would have bought a lot less (too much choice and quite overwhelming) at a much higher price and a great deal more stress for items of a lesser quality! The cost of the shopping trip was definitely worth it, I didn’t have to stress about visas, how to get there, dealing with the many people all trying to get you to come in to their shops for the ‘best price’. And, best of all, at the end of the day when my feet were aching from all of the walking around, Kim knew a great place for a foot massage. I honestly don’t think I could have asked for more!Kim – thank you so much for a great day. I had so much fun and I can’t wait for my next trip to Hong Kong – I’m definitely going to try out the tailors that you recommended!

Outstanding Tour guide!!. I highly recommend getting a private or group tour with Hello Hong Kong. Laura is knowledgeable, very friendly, upbeat and will tailor your tour to your needs. She is an outstanding guide. She knows lots of tidbits and facts about Hong Kong's culture and history. She's wonderful company! I purchased a four hour tour on the last day of a four day visit. I had already seen many sites already, but Laura's tour added so much more flavor and background to my experience in Hong Kong. I learned about the various dried foods and Chinese medicinal goods, went through Graham street wet market, St. John's cathedral, tried a drink called ying yang, a special Hong Kong delight that is a mixture of coffee, tea and milk, zipped through the escalators in central, visited Wang Tai temple in Kowloon and Chunking mansions. Thank you, Laura, for a very special day!!!

Best way to get a local perspective in Hong Kong. My wife and I took Laura's tour in June and learned so much so quickly about the history and culture of Hong Kong. Laura was a wonderful guide who was punctual, prepared, well informed and very helpful. I recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Action-packed day. Laura was the best: extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and chill. I had a one-day, six-hour private tour. Saw so much. Taxis, boats, walking, etc. Multiple, memorable photos (she had a camera and sent photos right after the tour). Accommodated my vegetarian diet. Told me how to get around on my own via the Octopus card. Sent me multiple emails on ideas for entertainment/tours/events/sights to attend to during my remaining time in Hong Kong. Highly, highly recommended!!!

A Foodies Tour of Hong Kong. Food tourism is a major part of my travels. I have never been to Hong Kong and had very limited time to visit markets, food stalls, food streets, shops, and of course restaurants. Laura did an amazing job for me one on one.... She is very knowledgable about many areas of food as it pertains to Hong Kong's history, cultures and foods. We dashed through Tea Houses, markets, street vendors, and bakeries! I only wish that I had been able to follow her to Aberdeen and the early morning fish market. Next trip. Thank you Laura, A delight to meet you.  Dr. Nancy

Nice walk in Hong Kong. I had only a limited time and booked 4 hours with Laura, we covered quite a lot of ground and could also get more info about Hong Kong. It is definetelly an experience to remember and quite effective for 4 hours walk.

Food and Walking. Laura was very informative, kind, and fun. She made sure that everyone got what they wanted out the tour and got to try/eat whatever it was they there were most curious about. I especially enjoyed the dim sun breakfast at the start of the tour, not sure I could have figured that one out on my own.

Hong Kong for the beginner. Laura's tour was the perfect way to get introduced to this amazing city. I'd never been there before and wanted to experience the parts of the city I was unlikely to find on my own. Laura did a great job of showing me some of the temples, traditions, markets, back streets, local eateries etc that was tailored to what I wanted to see and do. She even gave me a long list of the things I could do in my own time with detailed instructions - invaluable. Thanks again Laura

Discovering Hong Kong with a Fun Host. We enjoyed our tour with Laura of Hello Hong Kong. Her tour is a great introduction to newcomers to Hong Kong, as it addresses many rudimentary cultural and food topics. Plus, we loved her friendly, energetic style.

Great introduction to Hong Kong. We took some visiting friends along on this tour, but even for us locals it was really enjoyable. Laura was knowledgable about the food and areas we visited, and the food stops were perfect, you get to see another side to Hong Kong which you wouldn't as a tourist without a local guide. Highly recommended.

Excellent Tour Guide!. I booked a 6-hour tour with Laura after my business trip ended as I was going to be staying in Hong Kong for a couple of days to vacation. The tour was amazing and Laura's level of service was excellent! Not only did she show me some of Hong Kong's fantastic sites and attractions, she also provided information on their backgrounds and histories as well. Laura definitely opened my eyes to a remarkable side of Hong Kong I never knew existed! She is an excellent tour guide, extremely knowledgeable, and I'm so glad I booked her for this fantastic journey through the cities and districts of Hong Kong! I will definitely be back again, but this time with my parents and brother so they get to soak in the amazing experience Hong Kong has to offer!

The Highlight of our time in Hong Kong!. I enquired to 5 Tour Operators in Hong Kong regarding private tours prior to our trip. From the initial point of contact we knew that we would choose Hello Hong Kong. Laura’s response was so friendly and helpful and more importantly she assured us that the tours could be flexible to accommodate our specific requests. This was not the case with some of the other Tour companies (some didn’t even reply and one was even quite rude with his reply to us!). She advised us that getting around Hong Kong is so easy and that it would be beneficial and more financially efficient for us to do the big tourist attractions on our own. We took her advice and arranged to do a 4 hour tour and asked to incorporate some of the lesser-known attractions to see the local side of Hong Kong and some authentic food places. When we met Laura in person she was so bubbly and friendly. Her knowledge of Hong Kong history and facts was very impressive and she managed to pass on information in an interesting way rather than in a boring and mind-numbing manner like some tours we have done in the past. We enjoyed Dim-Sum (Yum-Cha) in a restaurant where we were the only westerners. She showed us some of the local traditions such as washing all crockery and eating utensils with the tea provided. Not only did she introduce us to some other local delicacies such as Won Ton Noodle Soup, Milk Tea and Egg Tarts but she also incorporated a visit to a Wet Market near to where she lives which is where the locals go to buy all their food supplies (no such thing as a Woollies or Coles in this area!). We also visited a Temple that was so beautiful and yet we had not read about in any of our research. Our 4 hours was so enjoyable and we gained so much appreciation and knowledge about Hong Kong. Laura was also able to advise us on other places to visit during our time in the exciting city and she took the time to send us emails containing valuable information on the best way to get there and any special points to consider and help us to get the most out of our visit. We also asked her where to go to get a great massage and we concluded our tour with her taking us to a very authentic Chinese Massage Therapy Clinic (Gao’s Foot Massage) where we enjoyed amazing full body massages and reflexology for such an affordable price. Do not hesitate to book a tour with Laura – you will gain so much from your time with her. When we return to Hong Kong we will book another tour with Laura to explore the city even more!

The best intro to Hong Kong!. We had a one day stop-over in HK & decided to do Laura's food walking tour. We have done a number of walking tours in other countries and were very impressed with Laura's tour. She was well researched and included lots of background & extra stops giving us a great overview of life in HK. The places we ate at were excellent and the best of their kind, with plenty of time at each spot to enjoy the food, never feeling rushed at all.Thank you Laura for a great experience, we will be recommending you to our friends and would have no heistation booking another tour with you if we return!

The most amazing tour, we loved it!. We recently joined Laura on an extended food tour that went for 6 hours and included parts of her Bestoke tour, this was a special request by us and Laura was more than happy to accommodate our needs including a 1pm start to fit in with our arrival time from Shenzhen so we didn't waste any of our time in Hong Kong.We all throughly enjoyed ourselves, it was the prefect mix of food, sights and general knowledge of Hong Kong which made the rest of our time there a pleasure and so easy as we now knew what to eat and also how to get around! On the day Laura showed us how to use the subway, trams, ferries, buses and taxi so we felt like locals tripping out the ladies markets and other sights. She also provided us with indepth guides on how to get to many places of interests.The food was so good we went back for egg tarts each night for the rest of our trip and went back to the roast meat place for dinner another night! If you do one of Laura's tours make sure you take her advice and visit the roof top bar for cocktails we went for 1 and stayed for 4, the views were amazing!Thanks again Laura for the most amazing tour, we loved it!

A sunny day in Hong Kong (in spite of the clouds!). To make a long story short, there is something magic visiting Hong Kong in the company of Laura Blackhall. She even manages to make you forget the grey sky while showing you the hidden beauty of this unique city.A scooter accident in the Taroko Gorge in Taiwan left me with a twisted ankle and limited capacity to walk around. Not really the best condition to start a busy trip around Asia. A day before arriving in Hong Kong I imagined myself depressed in my hotel room unable to do anything. This was before finding Hello Hong Kong Tour. Less than 24 hours before arriving at destination, I dropped a message explaining my situation and my wish to visit Hong Kong in any case. Quickly I received a warm reply, asking me questions on my main points of interest and what I was less motivated to do and see. As I saw the day after, this was not a marketing trick, Laura organized a tour that was above my expectations, demonstrating a real pleasure in sharing her experience of the city with a professional commitment to quality service.Laura came to pick me up at the hotel, ready to face the challenge of a walking tour with someone hardly moving with crutches. Pragmatically, we decided to take a wheelchair so I could survive the longer distances. She adapted the visit to my ability always trying to show me the most interesting and unexpected aspects of Hong Kong.We moved around Sheung Wan and along Wing Lok street through Cat Street (the market area) and then up onto Hollywood road to the Man Mo temple on Hollywood Road. After we took a taxi to Aberdeen where we went through the wholesale fish market and took a boat ride to Jumbo, the floating restaurant in the Jackie Chan films. Last but not least we grabbed another taxi to TST (Tsim Sha Tsui) from where we enjoyed the amazing skyscrapers view taking the ferry back, definitely a must in Hong Kong. Not bad for a wheelchair tour, all this with a smile and detailed explanations that gave me the impression of becoming an Hong Kong’s insider.In summary, if you want to have a contrasted and lively vision of the city, if you want to discover unusual views and learn more about what makes Hong Kong so special, if you are ready to take your time to see more than just postcard views, you can trust Hello Hong Kong Tour to meet the challenge of responding to your wishes.

Getting Intimate w/ Hong Kong. Thank you for the incredible tour. Laura is incredibly knowledgable of Hong Kong showing all of the "Ins and Outs" of the area. Her wide array of knowledge made this tour very educational and fun! She has been doing tours for a while and yet her excitement and love for Hong Kong made us feel as if it were her first time. Passionate for Hong Kong and all it has to offer, I would strongly suggest and consider Laura for a future tour of Hong Kong! Thank you Laura.

A Very Enjoyable Hong Kong Experience!. I had been to Hong Kong once before this trip and sort of wandered around on my own rather terrified. I really had no desire to return after that trip, although I knew I would have to for work in the future. My boss booked this tour for us as a treat after a long work trip and It completely changed my view of Hong Kong! Laura was absolutely phenomenal! She wasn't bland or stuffy as some tour guides I have experienced in the past can be. She was friendly and energetic and very knowledgeable about the area. She took our small group to some tourist spots, but also through some very interesting, lesser known areas. Places I will definitely return to in the future! She was very helpful in providing suggestions on additional places to visit as well as all of the great food/drink spots. Overall it was a great trip and even though I'm a little more familiar with Hong Kong now, I wouldn't hesitate to book another tour with Laura to continue my guided exploration!

I've been on several HK tours in the past and this was far and away the best!. We had such a great day with Laura as our tour guide of HK. I was looking for a tour guide who would be good for our group of 4 people -- 2 of us who have been to HK several times and 2 who have never been. The whole experience was easy and pleasant from setting up the itinerary via email to meeting Laura in our hotel lobby to getting around HK to seeing both the common touristy sites as well as off-the-beaten path places that I had never been to before. It was great for us to get the tour from a British expat with years of experience living in and loving HK. Laura has such great knowledge of HK's history, its people, what life is like to live there, and what the best sites are to see (and which ones are a waste of time and money). A five-star tour and tour guide. Thank you, Laura!

Great Hong Kong walking tour with brilliant food and knowledgeable tour guide. My friend and I took part in Laura's walking tour last week and had a great time. She knew lots of interestig facts and stories about the history of Hong Kong and she was friendly and accommodating. I will be going back to all of the food stops as they were delicious! It's a great introduction to the city and Laura has clearly done her research - I'd definitely recommend it!

A foodie's treat!. I was really excited to find a foodie's tour of Hong Kong and eagerly signed up with Hello Hong Kong Tours.Right from the start, Laura's attention to detail and customer focus was fantastic. The welcome email Hello Hong Kong Tours sent me had all the necessary background and it was easy to find the meeting place.Laura has clearly spent a lot of time researching her tour, explaining the background of the regional cuisine and had selected a variety of places that gave the best examples of Cantonese food.Apart from being very informative and passionate on the subject, she's a great tour guide and really engages with the whole group and takes the time to get to know everyone and their interests and tastes in the food.Thanks to her, I've discovered some great places for good Cantonese food; the types of places that tourists just wouldn't know about.Having recently relocated to Hong Kong and with circa 20 colleagues to follow this year, I will be recommending they go on Laura's tours as part of their induction to Hong Kong life and culture!

The best way to see Hong Kong. Myself and my sister booked a tour with Laura, we have friends and family that live in HK but wanted to see a side of it that we would normally just walk past in search of a fancy restaurant! We got to experience some great food with Laura and loved all the information she had on each destination. We tasted some of the best food and got to travel on a somewhat cramped tram, we loved every minute and wouldn't hesitate to book again. The price was also very reasonable, especially considering how much you eat! If you book the food tour - skip breakfast before you go!

Fantastic tour of HK. Found and booked Laura after reading reviews online and our private 4 hour tour turned out to be even better than I was expecting!This was a first time trip to HK for my wife and I and, staying in Mongkok, we were amazed at how crowded and frantic that part of the city was. Despite that, Laura met us at our hotel reception, showed us how to buy and use our Octopus cards at the MTR and we were off to a superb mix of places, some essential for any tour, like the Star Ferry and the 'ding ding' and others off the tourist beaten track, such as the Wong Tai Sin temple and the fortune tellers. We packed in a lot of sights in Kowloon and HK Island and Laura gave us really helpful advice and tips on other places to go and how to travel during our remaining time in the city.The tour wasn't cheap, but the insights and advice we got from Laura were worth it and the confidence her tour gave us to travel on the fantastic public transport system probably saved us a small fortune during the week.Our trip overall was wonderful and Laura's tour, which was tailored to suit us, was a fantastic introduction to HK. However, more than that, Laura is very friendly guide, with a great sense of humour (which she needed with us) and immensely knowledgeable about the city, its culture and its people. I can't recommend her highly enough.

HK in 4hrs!. My husband and I had only 3 days to see Hong Kong so we decided a private tour would be the best way to get right in there and see some of the more hidden sights. Our tour didn't disappoint! Laura met us at our hotel and we set out on foot. We were prepared for a lot of walking, but with plenty of stops for amazing dumplings, and noodles and custard tarts we didn't even think of out feet! We saw some amazing sights and witnessed some interesting things that without Laura we just wouldn't have seen.Her knowledge of the different areas and history was fascinating and thorough.We had a fantastic four hours (rain and all) and I would certainly recommend her tour.It was a little pricey, however the personal touch made it worth while - Laura assisted me in the lead up to out trip as well which I found very helpful.

Lovely Laura. Thanks Laura for the tour of 4 hours in HK.
