Despite the cloudy and rainy weather, I enjoyed spending the afternoon with her from Tsim Sha Tsui to The Peninsula and Chung King Mansions.She knows very well the city, its history and the right places for great local food (dim sum, milk tea, egg tart, …)I’d recommend her without hesitation!

A Great Day Of Eating!. We were recently in HK on business and had a spare day up our sleeve, we decided to organise a food tour with Laura after reading several reviews online and I'm glad we did. Laura is a wonderful guide and the information she passed on regarding the culture and of course the food was amazing. We visited some incredible restaurants and food stalls as well as some ad-hoc stops at a temple and street markets which topped everything off. If you’re a food lover and have a spare day to spend being guided through the food history of HK then I would highly recommended using Laura’s services to ensure you don’t miss these hidden treasures!!

Great Cantonese food.... We do not consider ourselves foodies, but we can appreciate great food. Recently had a tour with Laura - it was like being shown around the busy city of Hong Kong by a friend - explored Sheung Wan, Central, and Wan Chai in half a day by foot and public transpo. The dim sum breakfast was our favorite - yummy! The places she takes you to are not the fancy touristy places, but places which are where the locals eat. We unfortunately only had 2 and half days to spend in Hong Kong, and it would have been a shame if we missed the great and best local (cantonese) food that this city has to offer. Spending the time with Laura was well worth it and was one of the highlights of our short trip. Thanks Laura.

Yummy and informative food tour. I've lived in Hong Kong for 7 years and had my parents in town so thought I'd book us all on Laura's food tour. She took us to local places I'd never been before and introduced me to a few HK delicacies I'd never tried! All the while, Laura chated to us about Hong Kong and gave informative answers to our many questions! For those who are literally wanting a taste of HK, this is a fabulous tour. My parents and I loved everything about it!

Seeing the city with Laura is a Treat. I was in Hong Kong for a very long 8 day business trip. I had reserved a couple of days to do some sightseeing before going home. I booked a private walking tour with Laura for the last day. Though I had seen a lot of the city on my own by the last day and was frankly pretty ready to head home, I was still happy that I decided to have a tour with Laura. I am a woman and was traveling alone so it was nice to have a woman for a private tour guide. More than that, Laura is so lovely that it more felt that a friend of a friend was showing me around her city than a formal tour. She was very flexible regarding what to see and managed to explain some of the things I'd been seeing and wondering about while I had been traveling around on my own. We went to the oldest Dim Sum and Tea house in HK which is actually Michelin rated (!) which was very good, visited an ancient Temple where people still worship, and she even indulged me in going to spots to finish my shopping for friends and family. I would highly recommend Laura to anyone who wants a non-touristy tour with someone who is knowledgeable and easy to spend the day with. Thanks Laura!!

A fun, friendly, and delicious food tour. I went on a food tour with Laura earlier this week, and it was fantastic. We stopped at three restaurants: one for dim sum, one for noodle soup, and one for roast pork and duck. We also tried Hong Kong specialties like milk tea and egg tarts, and visited a market in the heart of the Central district. Laura selected these places from dozens of different restaurants that she tried herself, and her selections were all perfect. The food was outstanding, and they weren't places I would have ever found myself. All of the restaurants were packed with local residents, but I don't recall seeing any other obvious foreigners at any of them.Laura's very knowledgable about Hong Kong, so within the context of food we also learned a lot about the city. We walked through a number of different neighborhoods and took a crowded tram through the financial district Admiralty.Laura was incredibly friendly and our whole group had a great time on the tour. If I ever get back to Hong Kong, I'd love to take another Hello Hong Kong tour!

Fantastic Tour of Hong Kong. Laura gave us a fantastic tour of Hong Kong. We saw tons of sights, some typical and others totally off beat. A great combination. She is extremely knowledeable abut the history of HK and gave us tons of great information throughout the tour. She customized our walking tour based on things we told her we wanted to see in advance and things she learned about us during the day. She took us to am amazing local Dim Sum place for lunch, guided us to the shopping spots we wanted to go to and took us to many great places throughout Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Our fitness bracelets told us that we walked over 6 miles with her and it was a wonderful way to see and learn about Hong Kong!We learned how to navigate the public transport system and she gave us tons of tips for the duration of our stay. She also gave us detailed instructions on how to get to other spots we want to visit while here.She was easy to communicate with via email before our arrival, was very responsive and gave us lots of options. She even took photos of us that she sent us after the tour which was a great benefit and sent us more detailed instructions on other sights we discussed while with her to help us see them on our own, which we will do, but only because she was booked on the additional days we tried to schedule with her after our first one!I HIGHLY recommend her - it was a 100% positive experience!

Delicious meats. We did Laura's food tour starting out in Sheung Wan, moving through Central and finally ending up in Causeway Bay and Wanchai via the tram. We were introduced to a number of historically important and delicious eateries and snack spots while we walked along at a comfortable place. The food we tried was delicious and very affordable. None of the places on the tour are exclusive or expensive, they just represent the best of what HK has to offer for foodies and those interested in the culinary scene. The food was magnificent and Laura was a gracious host with a deep knowledge of the people and families that make these places possible. The tour includes some interesting stops at medicine shops and other points of interest and is easily adapted to your schedule. We were able to comfortably complete the day even with a two-year old in tow. The walking is not onerous and there are plenty of food and drink stops. There is also plenty of opportunity to buy water and other necessities at any point. The stop at a crowded BBQ joint in Causeway Bay was a highlight as we jockeyed for plates among the hordes of shoppers and luxury cars dropping people into the lineup on the street. Even if you are a local these family-run business are a great find in Hong Kong's vibrant street scene.

First time but not the last. Had a fantastic shopping spree organised by Kim, who was able to direct me to all the traders with the best quality products at the Lo Wu shopping centre. There were so many stalls and eager sellers that without Kim's help I would have been lost at sea. No request was too much and her opinion on either price or quality was always right. Whether you're looking for gifts or something special for yourself, I would definitely go with Kim on my next trip there. Thanks Kim!

Like having a friend give you a tour (and great with kids). Laura was our tour guide for the day earlier this month. She was fantastic. I highly recommend her. We are a family with a 2 year old and 7 year old and chose the 6 hour walking tour. We debated on using a car service tour due to our children's ages since we had never been to Hong Kong and did not know which was best with children, especially with a stroller. The walking tour was perfect. I have zero regrets on choosing that method. Hong Kong has so many forms of transportation (ferry, cable car, taxi, bus) that it made the tour easy. But what really made it enjoyable was having Laura as our guide. She just made everything easy and hassle-free. She is a positive person with a smile who was so helpful and comfortable to be around. We saw much more of Hong Kong with her as our guide than we could have ever seen by ourselves in a day. Since we only had one full day in the city, there was no waiting and deciding or map reading and frustration which would have occurred if we had done it ourselves, especially with kids. I booked her a few days ahead and she asked what our goals were and created an itinerary that ran smoothly and perfectly timed. She met us in our hotel lobby and escorted us everywhere. She even attempted to escort us all the way back to the hotel on the Kowloon side despite being over the 6 hour tour. We declined since it was an easy commute, but she was very willing to help us in anyway she could and ensure we had a wonderful experience. She doesn't make it feel like a business but rather like she's giving a friend a tour. I have to add that she's not overly familiar just very personable, friendly and easy to be around.Our day was overcast so Victoria Peak was not an option. However, for our 6 hour tour, we saw the following: Kowloon historic sites, took the Star Ferry to the Hong Kong side and walked some streets (Wing Lok and Cat street) to see the local culture. We went to the Man Mo temple on Hollywood Road and rode some of the midlevel escalators. Then we boarded a bus to Stanley Plaza which I highly recommend. It was fantastic bus trip to see the hills and beach (Repulse Bay) on the other side of Hong Kong. We saw the Blake Pier and Murray House. We then took a taxi to Aberdeen fish market and then a boat to have lunch at the Jumbo Restaurant (surprisingly good for a tourist spot). After lunch, we took a taxi through the tunnel back to the city center to board the Star Ferry to the hotel. We had a great day. The kids both had a great day too. (very important) Laura is very knowledgeable about Hong Kong history and answered all our questions with confidence. I highly recommend her service.

Hello Laura!. We learned about Laura on Trip Advisor and after much research we decided she was the tour guide for us. First let me say that she was accomodating to our needs. One of us fell ill enroute to Hong Kong from Cebu City, Philippines and Laura was able to re-schedule for us. We were glad she could and did, but we are sure her schedule may soon be so full that may not be so accomodating!She met us at the Intercontinental Grand Stafford in Kowloon and we taxied to the Wong Tai Sin temple in the area of Hong Kong with the same name. (We were impressed that she had enough Cantonese at her disposial to get the cab to the correct place!). There she explained the meaning of the temple and for whom it was named. She had fluent understanding of the deities and the worship we observed, She also was able to put the neighbor in context (it is the site of numerous public housing high rises) and helped us understand the socioeconomic and political situation of the neighborhood in which we were.We then jumped on the MTR (metro) to the TST area of Kowloon where we saw the spectacular Peninsula Hotel where she explained the important events that occurred there. She nicely contrasted this with the neighborting Cheung King Mansions, a vertiable ghetto nicely contained in the city and home of immigrants from many nations who come to Hong Kong to buy cheap goods to sell at profit in their home countries. They also live in very small rooms here. The patchwork of jerryrigged utilites to serve the inhabitants is frightening! Contrast indeed--but helped it us understand the many faces of trade in Hong Kong.From there we tookk the storied Star Ferry to Central where we taxied to Sheung Wan where we had Dim Sum (not the best but not bad and served in a realistic and authentic setting) at the historical Lin Heung Kui teahouse on Des Veoux Road West.On Wing Lok street we viewed the shops selling dried fungus, dired seafood, and chinese herbal products including bird's nests and shark fins. Interestingly, she had a workable understanding of these products and their uses (not bad for a woman from Chester, England!). She even had a nice enough relationship with one of the shop owneres to arrange for a book in English and Cantonese of the various remedies and their uses. I particulay appreciated that. We continued to wander through the neighborhood viewing antique stores, seafood (wet) markets, and the like. We visited the Man Mo temple; we also had milk tea and ying-yang (ask her)We visited the escalators to the mid levels of Hong Kong. She led us back to the Central Piers where continued out tour on the Big Bus Green line to Abderdeen and Stanley (the best of the three lines n our opinion. We then took a taxi to Vicotria Peak (much easier than the long line for the trams (thank you Laura!).Laura is engaged, knowledgable, personable and prices her tours fairly. We absolutely enjoyed our time with her and can confidently recommend her to you. She is a knowledgable British ex-pat who knows and loves this city.

Amazing. I found Laura on TripAdvisor and was able to book a tour within a few days of my arrival. I had never been to Hong Kong and was traveling alone. She was so responsive from the beginning and created a custom tour based on my preferences and my limited time in HK. The tour and Laura exceeded my expectations-- she's very friendly and easy to be with. It was great to see Hong Kong through the eyes of someone who lives there and knows so much about the city, culture and food! We started with a fantastic dim sum and traveled to different parts of HK. I saw some beautiful temples, luxury hotels, took a ferry ride, explored different neighborhoods and markets. I went on to do some shopping after the tour and she was so professional and well organized that she provided me with very detailed directions and tips on where to go and what to do. I enjoyed myself so much that I booked another tour for my return trip through Hong Kong. We spent another fantastic afternoon seeing some beautiful and non-touristy sites and eating fantastic food. I would highly recommend Laura and can't wait to go back and see her again!

My Hong Kong Adventure. Am in Hong Kong for 10 days on business. Don't usually have this much time so it was a treat to be able to be a bit of a "tourist". That being said as an American whose first time in HK it was very overwhelming....Never fear...Laura to the rescue! I found her via Trip Advisor and she promptly responded to my email and had an opening for a 5 hour personal tour on one of my days off. She was over-communicative (not a bad thing at all) and was through in terms of ensuring everything I wanted to accomplish was being handled. In the days leading up to the tour I had actually done quite a bit of sightseeing on my own and she was very good about changing the tour around to accommodate where I had already been. She arrived promptly on time at my hotel and we were off for 5 hours of what turned out to be the best day of my time in HK. Laura is highly engaging and knowledgable. We went into the "very non-tourist areas" (per my request and she was an expert on so many different tidbits of information is was amazing. She knows the streets of HK like there is a GPS implanted in her head and everywhere we went she was a wealth of information. She also was kind enough to send me some additional detailed itineraries of things to do on my own if time allowed. Can't wait to come back with my family and introduce them to HK via Laura's expert guidance. If you want THE best tour guide in Hong Kong than there is only one choice...Hello Hong-Kong and Laura!!!

Tram party - great way to see the city. The Tram Party is a really fun way to see the city, with a glass of chilled wine in your hand taking in all the cities sights from Sheung Wan to Happy Valley. With no shortage of drinks & a bus arranged to take us to LKF afterwards it made for a very fun night, although a slightly sore head in the morning. Thanks Laura for arranging it all for us, was great fun.

Highlight of Hong Kong Visit. I really enjoyed my tour of Hong Kong with Laura. It was my first time in Hong Kong and I only had a short amount of time to see the city. I had spent time exploring the city earlier in the day on my own and on a bus tour but felt overwhelmed of the many sites to see in such a short time. Laura's tour was the highlight of my visit to Hong Kong, she brought me to places I would've never discovered on my own as well as gave me a great overall tour of the city. After the tour with Laura, I had a great impression of Hong Kong and it's many interesting attractions.

Beyond Brilliant - a must do. If I could stand on a soap box and rave about this tour I would. It was fantastic.I was accompanying a group of 7 blokes aged between 30 - 55 on a sales trip to Hong Kong and i wanted to show them the real Hong Kong, not the tourist edited version. We were not disappointed, actually the guys couldn't stop raving about what a great guide she was for the rest of the 7 day trip.The food was amazing and in places we never would have looked and Laura was very informative about the city and its culture. Furthermore it's the little things, she helped me to find a restaurant to eat at that night and sent through heaps of instructions of where else to go. She also changed the tour slightly so we could look at some markets for costumes to the 7s the following day.Laura - I hope that your business continues to blossoms. You are an amazing guide and it was a great tour. I will def. be recommending it to everyone!

EXCELLENT. Having a friend in town who was a big foodie i was recommended Laura's food tour through a friend and having been in Hong Kong for 2 years I thought i'd better experience some of the historical eateries that were of the beaten expat pat!The tour was excellent taking in all the sights of Sheung Wan, Central and Wan Chai along with all of the excellent restaurants! Laura's knowledge of HK and the history behind the restaurants / dried fish shops and medicine shops as well as all the buidling's gave a excellent background and history to every where we visited.Highly recommend the tour and would recommend it to anyone visiting HK.

Hong Kong - superb tailor-made tour. 100% recommended. Having seen many HK attractions on previous visits we asked Laura to provide a tour which gave us an insight into local culture and life-styles. Laura's specifically designed tour covered our requests exactly and included some lesser known attractions. Laura was a charming, interesting and friendly companion for every step of the way.I am delighted to give a 100% recommendation to anyone considering a guided tour of HK.

Fabulous tour! Hong Kong style!. Wow, what a great tour! We booked the food tour a couple of days prior to arriving in HK and Laura was quick to respond to our email and confirm availability. We found the tour very informative, fun and enjoyed tasting all the yummy food. This tour definitely exceeded expectations. Laura is very passionate about HK and happily answered any questions we had. It felt like spending the morning with an old buddy showing us the city. We got to venture inside some of HK local eateries that we had previously walked passed not knowing they were there. Laura also kindly gave us other recommendations for the duration of our trip, and showed us to a great foot massage place after the tour.We highly recommend you choose Laura as your tour guide.

Great fun in the tram while u see awesome Hong Kong. I've been to HK for a short time, and took the day tour of hello HK which was awesome!! Cos of that I also joined hello Hong Kong's tram party!I had such a great time, lots of cool ppl, drink as much as u can alcohol, and the tram was really cool- had a balcony and with the music going on- everyone on the street looked at us and wanted to join! Tnx for the experience, will def come back next time I'll n in HK

Food walk tour. Had a great day on the Hello Hong Kong food walk. We saw some amazing things, ate at some really traditional Chinese places having a great variety of different foods at them all. On the walk we visited places you would usually never go to. This is my 6th time in Hong Kong and this was a great tour to go on, had a really great and fantastic time, thanks Laura you were brilliant.

Great way to get to know Hong Kong's cuisine!. Thank you Laura for making my birthday very special. Your food tour was excellent. You've showed us Hong Kong in a very special way. We had a chance to taste delicious real Hong Kong food and experience restaurants we probably just walked by. We enjoyed your stories about the places we visited and Hong Kong in general. Keep on going and if we visit HK again we certainly book your tour again! We really advise HK-visitors to experience your tour.

Fabulous. The food tour was fantastic and more than we could have expected! Laura makes an interesting tour of Hong Kong Islands and visit special restaurants where you often are the only westerner. The food is of a high quality and Laura knows a lot of Cantonese food and knows the local people. On the way from restaurant to restaurant Laura tells interesting facts about the city, people and circumstances. The tour has enriched our visit to Hong Kong, thank you Laura!

Local experience and super friendly guidance!. I had such an incredible experience with Hello Hong Kong. Booking was so easy and their organization was impeccable. They dealt with me DIRECTLY through email. I booked a private food tour for my boyfriend and I. The food was delicious and we learned so much about the history of the restaurants! All of the restaurant staff was VERY welcoming and friendly, a big concern, especially when we were the only non-Asian customers in many of the places! We ate at places we never would have gone to on our own. If you want to get real insight into LOCAL Hong Kong and not the obnoxious tourist areas or boring hotel restaurants, then book with this guide!! My most favorite part was when we even stopped off at some of the local businesses along the way, memorably, the old Chinese medicine shop where the owners were playing mahjong!!!

Only way to see real Hong Kong. Hi laura, thanks again for an amazing food tour, so many places I'd have just walked by. Would recommend it to tourists or people that live here. I'll be back to try another tour soon.

Hong Kong tour - ideal for cruise passengers. Thanks Laura for a great tour. This was an ideal way for us to see a taster of HK sights and history and has certainly left us wanting more as this unique country is fascinating. To those who are interested is maximising your time this is the ideal way to do so. Especially good for those arriving at Kai Tak cruise terminal as transport from the new terminal is not always easy.Laura was attentive and open to suggestions and we will certainly contact her when we are visiting again.Mark & Mary ( Manchester )

'An Amazing Tour'. "What an amazing food tour we had with Laura! She is a truly fantastic guide, professional, very knowledgable, friendly and paced the tour to suit our needs brilliantly. We loved all the places Laura took us to and the quality of food was exceptional, we even managed a cup of Ginseng tea as well as traditional Chinese Milk tea / Yin Yang.A tour with Laura is highly recommended and in our opinion, 'Is a day that you wrap in memory paper and treasure'. Thank you Laura, we loved it."Caz and Norm UK

Wonderful Food Tour. My brother and I had a fantastic time with Laura. She's knowledgeable, easy to talk to and seems to be willing to adapt the tour to anyone's palate. The only thing I'd change about our tour was I wish we had done it sooner so that we could go back and have more food at some of her culinary gems. Thanks Laura for a great day!

Great tour of Hong Kong.. I would definitely recommend this tour for a great insight into all the areas of Hong Kong you are most interested to see and find out more about. The tour was hosted by the lovely English Laura, a really friendly, informative tour guide. She tailors the tour around what you would like to see and responded really promptly to all my emails about the tour and my requirements. This also included being picked up straight from my hotel, which is a really nice touch. My favourite parts were seeing the other side of Hong Kong that I wasn't aware of such as council estates so I could get a real feel for the place. Also the bird and flower market where Laura took us was great finding out about the origins of Feng Sui.At the end of the tour Laura took me back to my hotel and sent a nice email saying what we had seen. If your thinking of a tour I would definitely recommend this, really great, thanks Laura!

Great way to spend a day!!. My wife and I were looking for a way to see the sights of Hong Kong when we were recommended to Laura by a friend. Upon getting in touch with Laura via email we received an email back within minutes with a suggestions pack and from there we arranged to be picked up at our hotel.We found Laura to be a fantastic tour guide and it was like we were being shown round a city by an old friend. It really helped that she was English. We visited the Chi Lian Nunnery and gardens which were beautiful as well as taking a stroll down to the Kowloon waterfront area which was stunning. We then took a ride on the star ferry across the harbor which gave my wife and I some fantastic photo opportunities with Laura taking on the role of photographer. We also found Laura to be very knowledgable on religion on Hong Kong during a trip to a temple.After a wonderful tour we were dropped off back at our hotel and were later sent an email thanking us and listing everywhere we had been that day, which I thought was a nice touch. Thank you again Laura for brightening up our day on a cold damp Hong Kong afternoon!

Hello Hong Kong from Sydney Australia. Hi Laura,Thank you so much for the Private One-on-One tour today. I had a great time. Who would have thought Hong Kong has so much to offer.I found you very friendly and informative and knowledgeable. It was like hanging out with an old buddy for the day rather than a tour guide. I hope I can return the favour when you are next in Sydney, Until then, keep up the great work in HK.All the best,Brett

Excellent time with Laura!. Laura is excellent. First off I should say I called her with about 2 hours notice for our tour. My other guide had cancelled and I was scrambling. Laura re-arranged her personal life so she could help me out. Wonderful!I spent 4 hours with her on my first day in Hong Kong but got SO much more than just the time we spent together. She helped me plan (in detail) the other 3 days I have in town. They have been great suggestions and I'm seeing and doing so much more with the plans.Its clear Laura is passionate and extremely knowledgeable about Hong Kong. She knew the answers to all of my questions. Where Laura goes above and beyond is in taking me to see the sights but then showing/telling me something that I would never get without her.She is a very genuine and caring person. I would not hesitate to book with her. I understand she also does some other interesting tours!
Totally awesome way to see Hong Kong. Even for a local this is a great experience, so much fun to have a few drinks, meet some great people and see the sihjts of hk in a very cool tram!

HK Tram party. We did a tram party with Laura, and what a great way to see the city! Everything was organized so well, and Laura made it easy for us, so we could just relax and enjoy the music and the amazing views from our private tram. She also arranged a drop-off at Rula Bula nightclub, with shots on arrival. Now that's a good hostess! Would definitely recommend this with a group of friends! Lindsay (Hong Kong)

Great personalised service with an experienced guide. Laura is a wonderful guide, easy-going, friendly and relaxed with a great deal of knowledge and experience. The places that she took me to were carefully considered and she has a good rapport with the restaurants and eateries, as well as a good understanding of their history. This tour is perfect for those who are recently settled in HK, or are just visiting the city and want to know more about typical Cantonese cuisine but may not know where to go. I think it is fantastic value for money and a morning well spent! Thank you Laura, it was a lot of fun!

Great Guide!. With only one day in Hong Kong, Laura helped save my trip after my original guide cancelled only hours before my tour due to illness. With no preparation time, Laura did a great job, hitting my main points of interest, as well as providing great insight into the city and introducing us to some local cuisine as well. My wife and I have traveled the world and have had many guides, and Laura is definitely a very good one. Thank you!

Seeing the "Real" Hong Kong. Hong Kong is not an easy nut to crack. I have been there several times, mostly on business; but would try to see something new each time I visited there. Despite my attempts, I never felt that I had seen the place because it is not particularly tourist friendly.Laura made Hong Kong accessible for me. We took her Sunday morning food tour. She's done quite a bit of homework and legwork and has put together a wonderful event that is lots of fun. She was able to show us places that we would most likely never find ourselves or if we did, would not be able to navigate due to language and customs barriers. Her post tour follow up was very much appreciated as well. I will certainly book another tour with Laura the next time I'm in Hong Kong in order to see more of the "real" face of this facinating city.
energetic guide. Laura was a good host on our tour. Food recommended was reasonable good, especially the roast pork. Next time we will go on her tram party ! thanks laura !

OMG GREAT. Laura was fantastic, she knew of all of the best local places for great food, interesting people and great service. She took us to a secret roof top deck enjoy the most incredible egg tart at the end of the tour. Not only did she know the best food places and Hong Kong culture, but also went out of her planned tour, with no concerns of her time to show us things we were very curious and uneducated about. Laura is the absolute best. If you are looking for great food, a good time, outgoing personality and just a very pleasant learning experience, in Hong Kong, Laura is your person.

Highly Recommended!. What a fantastic trip! The food on the tour was definitely not the usual Chinese fare that I am used to in the UK so I was a bit reluctant at first but the tour guide was really helpful and after she exlained what everything was I relaxed and started tucking in. The dim sum turnip cakes (who knew turnips could be that tasty!?) and the wonton noodles soup (yum!) at Mak's were the food highlights of the day for me. In between food stops the tour guide took us along to traditional Chinese medicine shops and an old Chinese food market. We also went on a ride on one of Hong Kong's trams - make sure you bring your camera as the view of the city from the tram is fantastic. Before the tour was over, the guide left us with quite a few tips and recommendations for the rest of the trip which I really appreciated. Overall, I'd say the food tour was a great eyeopener to Hong Kong life and it was great value for money (I was stuffed by the end!). I highly recommend it!

Fantastic!. What a great trip we had with the laughing and lovely Laura! Although I live in HK- I decided to take some visitors on the food tour and am grateful we chose hello Hong Kong to guide us through the wonderful array of tasty treats on offer. My favourite was the wonton noodle soup stop but my friends adored the egg tarts even more :)It was informative as well as exciting and I loved learning more about the HK culture as well as sampling numerous delicacies!

Fantastic introduction to Hong Kong and its Food. This was our first time in Hong Kong and first real intro to Cantonese food. We are both vegetarian and while we enjoy trying new foods, we don't have a hard-core adventurous palate. That said, we felt right at home with the food that Laura introduced us to while on this tour. We appreciate that there is not a set menu at each restaurant/food stop, so you can pick and choose what suits you best. The restaurants/locations she took us to were a great cross-section of HK food (neither too high brow nor street food). Our personal highlight was eating the best bowl of won ton soup we have ever had (from a Michelin-rated hole-in-the-wall noodle shop).While on the tour, Laura does a great job of providing context--the history of different dining customs, the history of the restaurant and shop owners, the neighborhoods in which we walked, etc. The tour itself is well-paced, not too meandering or too hurried/strenuous. Laura really knows her stuff and clearly loves what she does. Her energy is infectious, and at the end of the trip, we felt much more connected to and comfortable in HK than we would have if we had not taken this tour.

A full belly and a great experience.. Coming to Hong Kong for the first time, I didn't know what to expect and where to start. My fiance and I decided to take this food tour to get familiar with the local area. We were really impressed with the Guide's knowledge and recommendations for us. She took us to many amazing restaurants. Our stop for dim sum at the Lin Heung Tea House was by far my favorite. Reasonably priced and a good laugh, we decided to book the Tram party too! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Fun Times in HK. Well the Tour Started at 9:30 ad it was pretty cool, we tried all sorts of local food, also stopped by this amazing old Chinese medicinal shop, and seafood shop, where we learned how to cook some awesome Chinese food

All aboard the party tram!!. This is one of the best nights i had in Hong Kong. I thought this was going to be a relatively tame touristy sort of way to see the city. Boy was i wrong! Myself and two friends were amongst about 20 other people, tourists and residents, some of whom have since remained friends. The vintage, open top tram navigates its way through the electric city as the lovely ladies keep you topped up with drinks. The music was thumping and they played a great variety, there's definately something for everyone. The stops along the way get you tasting a huge variety of food which is needed. You get to have a real taste of everything the city can throw at you. After the 3 hour trip, everyone knew everyone. I saw the organiser making sure even the people who were there on their own were having a great time. When it came to a stop a private bus picked us up and dropped us into Hong Kong's party land. The clubs were great, girls were in for free and got free vodka drinks and the guys got buy one get one free. This is a class night and i will definately do it again on my return to HK!

Great Fun!. Having visited Hong Kong many times and seeing all the sights, taking in a food tour was probably the last thing we would have thought about doing. We were a little doubtful to start as my husband is fussy on what and where he eats! We gave it a go. Wow, what a great time we had, and it has helped my husband on being more adventurous when trying new types of foods..this a walking tour with a short tram ride thrown in. The dim sum breakfast was great start to the tour, off to the dried fish markets then Sheung Wan medicinal market, I found this very interesting and learnt a lot. The tour continued with different stops sampling meats, Milk tea and noodle soup! To my husbands delight we finished with Egg tarts!I would highly recommend this tour even if ( like us) you have visited Hong Kong many times before.Our tour guide Laura was excellent and made every step on the way a knowledgable one!

Awesome Time!!. Awesome time in HK and this tour topped my visit for things to do.The guide definitely makes you feel very welcome in HK and knows her stuff!!I had a taste of some amazing things on offer!!Highly Recommend :)

Like a food rally through Hong Kong!. I have to admit I'm not normally one to take a tour, I'm usually working my way through the darkest little corners in search of some adventure but I decided instead to try a tour, and it was well worth it! Normally in foreign climbs we tend to wonder around the most obvious and accessible places but in Laura's capable navigation I sampled many delights in some of the most unusual of places, the wet market being a particularly good memory of the experience! I cannot recommend strongly enough that if you find yourself in Hong Kong with some time on your hands you treat yourself to meeting Laura and a cacophony of food that you would otherwise be none the wiser to!

A selection of tours put together by a tour guide who clearly loves HK. In the run up to Christmas I was looking for cool things to do to entertain my parents who were visiting from the UK. My mum is a HK native who emigrated to the UK, my dad is a true Brit through and through. We tried the food tour, put on by our wonderful tour guide Laura. Laura is originally from the UK, having moved to HK several years ago. She LOVES HK, and her passion and knowledge for the city has resulted in the most fabulous tour. It was fun, interesting, and not only revealed some off the beaten track foodie hotspots, but managed to satisfy my mums more adventurous local palette, and my dads rather more British and 'safe' palette! Both parents wanted to go again!I've been raving about the tour ever since, and have some some friends visiting from Manchester this weekend, who I'm scheduling in a tram tour and foodie tour for. If you want to see HK through the eyes of a local, experience some AMAZING food, and discover parts of HK you'd not usually stumble across, then I'd urge you to try one of Laura's tours. You will not find a better tour guide.

Excellent! Very informative, great food, authentic Hong Kong. This was a great tour! It was well planned and executed. The tour started with an authentic Hong Kong dim sum breakfast followed by an insightful and interesting tour of the dried fish and medicinal markets of sheung wan. We then went on to the amazing wet markets in Central where we tasted wonton noodle soup and Hong kong's famous milk tea. After a short tram ride we ate lunch at an extremely popular and delicious BBQ meat restaurant after which we finished with some traditional Hong Kong egg tarts.The whole experience was amazing! Even for my slightly western taste buds the food was just authentic enough without being outside my comfort zone. Delicious! I recommend this to anyone who wishes to experience the food and history that Hong Kong has to offer.

Great experience even for an Expat!. Even though I live in Hong Kong I had some last minute friends visiting and didn't have the time to plan a tour in. On a friends recommendation I decided to try Hello Hong Kong and I was really please that I did. I found the food tour was really well planned, it gave my visitors a real insight into the local cuisine, people and culture and wasn't overly priced either, I even learned some local knowledge and new places to eat myself! Top Marks to the girls running it. They also gave us some great recommendations on where to go afterwards for drinks.

Great experience even for an Expat!. Even though I live in Hong Kong I had some last minute friends visiting and didn't have the time to plan a tour in. On a friends recommendation I decided to try Hello Hong Kong and I was really please that I did. I found the food tour was really well planned, it gave my visitors a real insight into the local cuisine, people and culture and wasn't overly priced either, I even learned some local knowledge and new places to eat myself! Top Marks to the girls running it. They also gave us some great recommendations on where to go afterwards for drinks.

Hello Hong Kong Tour. The Hello Hong Kong Tour is a gastronomic and cultural experience that is not to be missed! My wife and I have sampled many different kinds of Chinese and Pan Asian cuisine. From Chinatown in New York City to the Asian neighborhoods in San Francisco and Montreal, we felt that we had tried many of the signature dishes that make this food so enjoyable. During our recent trip to Hong Kong, we had the good fortune to go on the Hello Hong Kong Tour, and it was a real eye opener. At First, my wife and I were a bit reluctant to try some of the local dishes, but our guide was very patient, and she told us where we were going and what they would serve, so we always felt comfortable and there were no disappointments. Some of the places we visited were coffee shops and bakeries, but the owners and waiters took pride in what they offered and they couldn’t have been more welcoming, encouraging us to sample their specialties. In addition to the restaurants, we visited a traditional Chinese medicine shop where we observed the dispensing of many natural products including herbs and roots that have been in use for thousands of years. Many of these treatments have just begun to gain acceptance in the West, and it was interesting to observe how ailments are treated using one of the world’s oldest forms of alternative medicine. We also spent some time visiting a few different parts of the city, and our guide was very knowledgeable, explaining the history of Hong Kong and pointing out how the old city and the new metropolis coexist while the city is continually reinventing itself. I would recommend Laura’s service to anyone who wants to experience a truly amazing cultural immersion.

Food Tour. Fantastic trip which allowed me to sample some of HK's finest cuisine... The historical part of the tour which focused on medicinal food in Hong Kong's culture was a personal highlight, as was Dim Sum in the Lin Heung Tea House. Would totally recommend this for any tourist or group but it was particularly helpful for me because, as a newcomer, I definitely needed a helping hand with what to do/see in this fantastic place.

"Party Tour with a difference". I frequent Hong Kong from London often and found this trip to be absolutely brilliant. It's a must do. I went with a friend and we loved the fact that we could take in some of the sights and sounds of the city whilst in a party mood. Drinks, music and good company made for an awesome night. Cost was never an issue, Laura the guide was brilliantly keen to make sure everyone was having a good time. If you want to enjoy HK by night, and want the party to come to you jump on the Tram Party.

Fun and delicious way of getting to know Hong Kong. If you like food and sightseeing off the beaten path this is the perfect tour. I was in Hong Kong for only three days and got it recommended by a friend and it was just everything I could have wished for. Laura the tour guide is originally from the UK but was extremely knowledgeable about Hong Kong, its culture and history. What was really nice was that it felt more like a friend showing us their favourite sights and food spots in their city than some tired tour guide who did this thousands of times and just told us what they had learned by heart and told so many times.The sightseeing was a lot of fun and all the food was just amazing. I was especially amazed by the egg tarts we got for dessert. I have never been a big fan of asian egg custards (or any egg custards for that matter), but this one was simply heavenly and we even got the recipe for this famous hong kong dish. Can't wait to try this one out at home!

Food tour. The food tour was the high light of my trip here so far. The food sampled was really great...tastes which I have never experienced before and the nice thing was we were explained about every thing we were going to eat.Laura has a very good knowledge and even when asked about different foods she explained their originality which was really great. Very well organized and very informative. I would recommend anyone who is looking for a different experience then try this .Also on route we were told about many of the cultures and saw some brilliant sights.Thank you for a very special day memories I will take away with me.

Friendly and lovely tour guide:). I got a long weekend so we decided to fly to Hongkong. We wanted to improve our English and we found this tour!!!! The guide was really kind and explained us really slowly and clearly. Even she taught us some vocaburalies :) We tried Dim Sum, Jasmin Tea,Steamed chicken and mushroom wrapped in bean curd,Rice noodle rolls with BBQ pork,Steamed sticky rice wrapped in Lotus Leaf with minced meat etc etc and Egg tart was my favorite!!!! We could get a recipe of the tart too!!! We are gonna try to bake it in Japan !! We also went to an old chinese medicinal shop and it was first time for us to know about traditional medicine. It was interesting. The city view was great. It was different from Tokyo. We are really surprised that the guide knows a lot about history and the great place to go!!! We were very satisfied with this tour and we highly recommended to people who wants to learn English :) The guide will help you to explain with easy words and easy expression!!!

Friendly expert guide, fabulous food and fascinating facts.. We were so lucky to have found Hello Hong Kong, and to have booked today's food tour. We can't thank you enough. We now have a great all round experience of traditional local cuisine and a lot of information along the way about local culture and history. We started with breakfast in a dim sum restaurant in Sheung Wan, tasting and trying several types of dim sum, both savoury and sweet, pastry, dumplings and crispy sweetness,all so interesting and contrasting. Between tastes of food and drink we visited markets, Chinese medicine stores, old and new, sitting down again for a wanton noodle soup taste combination, delicious. A little more walking and then came the surprising experience of milk tea and yin yang - I couldn't have imagined the tea tasting so good, but it did, lovely and strong and hot. The coffee and tea mix was also good, just very different. A short tram ride away and our next foodie treat was roast meat, quickly turned around in a noisy and crowded ground floor street cafe, ushered in by smiling faces and a very warm welcome, the barbecue meat just melted in the mouth and had so many delicious flavours my brain couldn't keep up. An experience in itself not to be missed. Coming to the end of the tour we went into the popular Tai Cheong bakery for the famous warm egg custard tart, which we ate in the sunshine on a roof top of a restored tenement block now called the Pawn. Every step of the tour was full of cultural and historical information, all absolutely fascinating. This is a tour for anyone who wants to experience unabridged Hong Kong living, rather than a tourist edit.

Hong Kong tram tour/party. I recently visited Hong Kong for a holiday with some friends to visit my older brother who's living out there. He couldn't put us all up but the hostel we stayed in was ok and had some posters up advertising this tour. 3 hours music & free flow booze, old tram ride around Hong Kong. A bit different!So one night when he was stuck at work us boys decided to give it a go. It seemed a bit expensive at first (590 HKD, about 45-50 quid) as we were all on a budget, but unless you manage to hit all the happy hour bars in a row then drinking in Hong Kong isn't exactly cheap anyway, so we figured we would get our money's worth! Plus it was a different way to see all the buildings lit up (the tour was an evening thing, 7-10pm) which we never would have done otherwise but was very cool. It's a really crazy city at night! Also we got discounts at a bar in Lang Kwai Fong after it all finished so it was actually really good value in the end.The two girls that ran it were really nice, had lots of booze (beers, wines, spirits etc.) and there was a good bunch of people on board. Good way to meet people actually.... we had a great night out after with a few of them!!I'd definitely recommend this if you're visiting Hong Kong and have a free night. One thing to mention, no toilet on board but we stopped a couple of times so no real issue

Tram Party!!. During our tour around Asia - we stopped off in Hong Kong for 5 nights and wanted to make the most of it and see and do as much as possible. We went on a Tram Party last week - what a great way to experience HK at night! The party was so much fun - with cool people to party with. We had as much booze as we could handle and the music was pumping! The other party in LKF was so much fun too - we partied into the early hours. Very well organised, our guide was great fun too. All round good night and value for money. We would recommend to anyone who is in town for a few nights and wants to see and make the most of the nightlife. Thanks Hello Hong Kong!!

Tram Party. I'm visiting HK with some mates and we went on the Hello Hong Kong tram party last night (Thursday). It was a good laugh, lots of booze on the 3 hour ride and the club after was good as well.It was easy to book through the website, and although it wasn't cheap it was value for money.I'd definiately reccommend it to anyone visiting HK, as it's a good way to meet new people and see some sights.

Great way to see Hong Kong. We have lived in HK for 3 years but had never done a Night Bus/Tour, as it was a bit cold for Junk season and as we had friends in town we decided to it would be a good way to show them HK (and have a few drinks in the process).Tour was great, our mates were really impressed. It started just before 7, our hosts (Laura I think and another girl), was great fun, pointed out things that we didn't know about HKDrinks were free flowing and a really good selection (as it was cold, stuck mainly to wine and spirits).After about 3hrs ended back at the starting point in the Western District. Minibus took as all to LKF, had work the next day unfortunately, grabbed my free drink and then had to head home.We actually left our friends out, i think they crawled in about 5, so i reckon they had a pretty good time
